column1: translation

{'en': 'When Şītā, having a husband although seeming as if she had none, was putting on the ascetic guise, the people got into a wrath and exclaimed, “O Dasaratha, fie on you!"', 'sn': 'तस्यां चीरं वसानायां नाथवत्यामनाथवत्। प्रचुक्रोश जनः सर्वो धिक् त्वां दशरथं त्विति ॥'}

{'en': 'Aggrieved at the uproar that arose there in consequence, the lord of earth banished from his heart all regard for life, virtue, and fame. And sighing hot, that descendant of Ikşvāku spoke to that wife of his, saying, O Kaikeyi, Sītā deserves not to go in a Kuća dress.', 'sn': 'तेन तत्र प्रणादेन दुःखितः स महीपतिः। चिच्छेद जीविते श्रद्धां धर्मे यशसि चात्मनः॥ स निःश्वस्योष्णमैक्ष्वाकस्तां भार्यामिदमब्रवीत्। कैकेयि कुशचीरेण न सीता गन्तुमर्हति॥'}

{'en': 'Tender, and youthful, and worthy of happiness, she is by no means capable of living in the forest. My spiritual guide has spoken the truth.', 'sn': 'सुकुमारी च बाला च सततं च सुखोचिता। नेयं वनस्य योग्येति सत्यमाह गुरुर्मम ॥'}

{'en': 'Whom has this one injured that, being the daughter of the foremost of kings, she like a female ascetic, wearing a meagre garb in the presence of all, will (repair to the woods and) remain there like a beggar destitute of everything?', 'sn': 'इयं हि कस्यापि करोति किंचित् तपस्विनी राजवरस्य पुत्री। या चीरमासाद्य वनस्य मध्ये जाता विसंज्ञा श्रमणीव काचित्॥'}

{'en': "Let Janaka's daughter leave off her ascetic guise. This is not the promise that I had made to you before. Let the princess go to the forest in comfort, furnished with all sorts of gems.", 'sn': 'चीराण्यपास्याज्जनकस्य कन्या नेयं प्रतिज्ञा मम दत्तपूर्वा। यथासुखं गच्छतु राजपुत्री वनं समग्रा सह सर्वरत्नैः॥'}

{'en': 'My sands run out; by me has this cruel promise been made with an oath. But this (exile of Sītä) has been thought of by you through your ignorance. Let it not, however, consume you like a bamboo flower destroying the bamboo.', 'sn': 'अजीवनाहेण मया नृशंसा कृता प्रतिज्ञा नियमेन तावत्। त्वया हि बाल्यात् प्रतिपन्नमेतत् तन्मा दहेद् वेणुमिवात्मपुष्पम्॥'}

{'en': 'If, O wicked woman, Rāma has happened to do you something unbeautiful, what wrong, O base wretch, has Vaidehi done you in the world?', 'sn': 'रामेण यदि ते पापे किंचित्कृतमशोभनम्। अपकारः क इह ते वैदेह्या दर्शितोऽधमे॥'}

{'en': "Of eyes expanded like those of a doe, endued with a mild temperament, and virtuous, what harm has Janaka's daughter done you.", 'sn': 'मृगीवोत्फुल्लनयना मृदुशीला मनस्विनी। अपकारं कमिव ते करोति जनकात्मजा॥'}

{'en': 'Surely, O nefarious one, the banishment of Ráma is enough for you. Why then do you bend your mind to perpetrate these atrocious sins?', 'sn': 'ननु पर्याप्तमेवं ते पापे रामविवासनम्। किमेभिः कृपणैर्भूयः पातकैरपि ते कृतैः॥'}

{'en': 'O noble dame, having heard you asking for the banishment of Rāma, who had at first been intended by me for being installed, and who came here afterwards, I had promised you (his exile alone.)', 'sn': 'प्रतिज्ञातं मया तावत् त्वयोक्तं देवि शृण्वता। रामं यदभिषेकाय त्वमिहागतमब्रवीः॥'}

{'en': "But since, going beyond that promise of mine, you behold Mithala's daughter dressed in mendicant garb, surely you wish to find your way to hell.", 'sn': 'तत्त्वेतत् समतिक्रम्य निरयं गन्तुमिच्छसि। मैथिलीमपि या हि त्वमीक्षसे चीरवासिनीम्॥'}
{'en': 'Thus commissioned to the forest, Räma who was seated sealing his lips, said.', 'sn': 'एवं ब्रुवन्तं पितरं रामः सम्प्रस्थितो वनम्। अवाक्शिरसमासीनमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'O righteous one, this my mother is aged and famous and of lofty spirit. May she not meet with improper treatment at your hands! It behoves you, O bestower of boons, to show greater honour to her when she shall be deprived of me and be plunged into a sea of grief and afflicted with unprecedented woe.', 'sn': 'इयं धार्मिक कौसल्या मम माता यशस्विनी। वृद्धा चाक्षुद्रशीला च न च त्वां देव गर्हते॥ मया विहीनां वरद प्रपन्नां शोकसागरम्। अदृष्टपूर्वव्यसनां भूयः सम्मन्तुमर्हसि ॥'}

{'en': 'O you comparable to the mighty Indra, you should so behove with my mother smitten with my separation, that exercised by grief in consequence of my residence in the forest, she may not, renouncing life, repair to the mansions of Yama.', 'sn': 'पुत्रशोकं यथा नछेत् त्वया पूज्येन पूजिता। मां हि संचिन्तयन्ती सा त्वयि जीवेत् तपस्विनी॥ इमां महेन्द्रोपम जातगर्धिनी तथा विधातुं जननी ममार्हसि। यथा वनस्थे मयि शोककर्शिता न जीवितं न्यस्य यमक्षयं व्रजेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing those bold words of the ascetic, the son of that foremost of men, Rāghava firm in his vows, with clasped hands answered.', 'sn': 'मुनेर्वचनमक्लीबं श्रुत्वा नरवरात्मजः। राघवः प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा प्रत्युवाच दृढव्रतः॥'}

{'en': "In accordance with the desire of my sire, and in order to glorify it, I ought fearlessly to do even as Kusika's son says. And having been desired to that end while at Ayodhyā by that high-souled one, my father Dasaratha, in the midst of the spiritual guides, I ought not to pass by your words.", 'sn': 'पितुर्वचननिर्देशात् पितुर्वचनगौरवात्। वचनं कौशिकस्येति कर्तव्यमविशङ्कया॥ अनुशिष्टोऽस्म्ययोध्यायां गुरुमध्ये महात्मना। पित्रा दशरथेनाहं नावज्ञेयं हि तद्वचः॥'}

{'en': "Therefore, commanded by that upholder of the Veda, I, agreeably to my father's mandate, will, without doubt, bring about that welcome event-the death of Tataka.", 'sn': 'सोऽहं पितुर्वचः श्रुत्वा शासनाद् ब्रह्मवादिनः। करिष्यामि न संदेहस्ताटकावधमुत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'And in the interests of Brāhmaṇas, kine, and celestials, I am ready to act as desired by you of immeasurable energy.', 'sn': 'गोब्राह्मणहितार्थाय देशस्य च हिताय च। तव चैवाप्रमेयस्य वचनं कर्तुमुद्यतः॥'}

{'en': "Having said this, that repressor of foes, with clenched fist, twanged his bow-string, filling the ten cardinal points with the sounds. And at those sounds, the dwellers in Tāțakā's forest were filled with perturbation, and Tātakā also amazed at those sounds, became exceedingly wroth.", 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा धनुर्मध्ये बद्ध्वा मुष्टिमरिंदमः। ज्याघोषमकरोत् तीव्र दिशः शब्देन नादयन् ॥ तेन शब्देन विवस्तास्ताटकावनवासिनः। ताटका च सुसंक्रुद्धा तेन शब्देन मोहिता॥'}

{'en': 'And rendered almost insensible by anger, that Räksasī furiously rushed in a main towards the spot whence had come the report.', 'sn': 'तं शब्दमभिनिध्याय राक्षसी क्रोधमूर्छिता। श्रुत्वा चाभ्यद्रवत् क्रुद्धा यत्र शब्दो विनिःसृतः॥'}

{'en': "And beholding that frightful one of hideous visage and colossal proportions, transported with rage, Raghu's descendant spoke to Laksmana,9", 'sn': 'तां दृष्ट्वा राघवः क्रुद्धां विकृतां विकृताननाम्। प्रमामेनातिवृद्धां च लक्ष्मणं सोऽभ्यभाषत॥'}

{'en': 'Behold, O Laksmana, the terrible and hideous body of yonder Yakṣiṇī! The sight of her strike terror into the hearts of even the brave.', 'sn': 'पश्य लक्ष्मण यक्षिण्या भैरवं दारुणं वपुः। भिद्येरन् दर्शनादस्या भीरूणां हृदयानि च॥'}

{'en': 'Mark! This irrepressible one, possessing all the resources of illusion, will I oppose, and deprive her of ears and nose.', 'sn': 'एतां पश्य दुराधर्षां मायाबलसमन्विताम्। विनिवृत्तां करोम्यद्य हृतकर्णाननासिकाम्॥'}

{'en': 'But I dare not slay her, she being protected by virtue of her feminineness. I intend only to oppose her course, and deprive her of her prowess.', 'sn': 'न ह्येनामुत्सहे हन्तुं स्त्रीस्वभावेन रक्षिताम्। वीर्यं चास्या गतिं चैव हन्यामिति हि मे मतिः॥'}

{'en': 'As Rāma was speaking thus, Tāțakā, deprived of sense through ire, uttering roars, with uplifted arms rushed against him.', 'sn': 'एवं ब्रुवाणे रामे तु ताटका क्रोधमूर्च्छिता। उद्यम्य बाहुं गर्जन्ती राममेवाभ्यधावत॥'}

{'en': 'And thereat the Brahmarsi, Visvāmitra, uttering a roar, upbraided her, and said, Svasti!* May victory attend the descendants of Raghu! *A particle of benediction, indeclinable.', 'sn': 'विश्वामित्रस्तु ब्रह्मर्षिहुँकारेणाभिभय॑ ताम्। स्वस्ति राघवयोरस्तु जयं चैवाभ्यभाषत॥'}
{'en': 'And raising thick clouds of dust, Tāțakā instantly bewildered both the descendants of Raghu.', 'sn': 'उद्धन्वाना रजो घोरं ताटका राघवावुभौ। रजोमेघेन महता मुहूर्तं सा व्यमोहयत्॥'}

{'en': "And then by help of illusion, she began to pour upon them a mighty shower of crags. And thereat Raghu's descendant was wroth.", 'sn': 'ततो मायां समांस्थाय शिलावर्षेण राघवौ। अवाकिरत् सुमहतां ततश्चक्रोध राघवः॥'}

{'en': 'And resisting that mighty shower of crags by vollies of shafts, Rāghava with arrows cut off her hands.', 'sn': 'शिलावर्षं महत् तस्याः शरवर्षेण राघवः। प्रतिवार्योपधावन्त्याः करौ चिच्छेद पत्रिभिः॥'}

{'en': "And with the fore-parts of her arms lopped off, as she was roaring before them, Sumitra's son waxing wroth deprived her of her ears and nose.", 'sn': 'ततश्छिन्नभुजां श्रान्तामभ्याशे परिगर्जतीम्। सौमित्रिरकरोत् क्रोधाद्धतकर्णाग्रनासिकाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon that one capable of assuming forms at will, began to assume various shapes; and to vanish from sight, bewildering her antagonists with her illusory displays.', 'sn': 'कामरूपधरा सा तु कृत्वा रूपाण्यनेकशः। अन्तर्धानं गता यक्षी मोहयन्ती स्वमायया॥'}

{'en': 'Terribly ranging the field, the Yakṣī showered crags upon her antagonists. And beholding them enveloped on all sides by that craggy downpour, the auspicious son of Gadhi spoke these words-O Rāma, renounce your antipathy. This one of wicked ways is exceedingly impious. And this sacrifice-disturbing Yakși will, by virtue of her power of illusion, come to increase more and more in energy. Do you, therefore, against the arrival of dusk, slay her! The Rākṣasas are incapable of being controlled when evening sets in.', 'sn': 'अश्मवर्षं विमुञ्चन्ती भैरवं विचचार सा। ततस्तावश्मवर्षेण कीर्यमाणौ समन्ततः॥ दृष्ट्वा गाधिसुतः श्रीमानिदं वचनमब्रवीत्। अलं ते घृणया राम पापैषा दुष्ट्वारिणी॥ यज्ञविघ्नकरी यक्षी पुरा वर्धेत मायया। वध्यतां तावदेवैषा पुरा संध्या प्रवर्तते॥ रक्षांसि संध्याकाले तु दुर्धर्षाणि भवन्ति हि।'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed, Rāma, displaying his skill in aiming by sounds, enveloped with arrows that Yakṣī showering crags.', 'sn': 'इत्युक्तः स तु तां यक्षीमश्मवृष्टयाभिवर्षिणीम् ॥ दर्शयशब्दवेधित्वं तां रुरोध स सायकैः।'}

{'en': 'Being thus hemmed in with a network of shafts, she possessed of the powers of illusion, rushed against Kākutstha and Lakşmaņa, uttering terrible roars. And as that Yaksi, in prowess like to a thunder-bolt, was rushing on, Rāma pierced her chest with arrows, and thereat she dropped down and died.', 'sn': 'सा रुद्धा बाणजालेन मायाबलसमन्विता॥ अभिदुद्राव काकुत्स्थं लक्ष्मणं च विनेदुषी। तामापतन्ती वेगेन विक्रान्तामशनीमिव ॥ शरेणोरसि विव्याध सा पपात ममार च।'}

{'en': 'Upon seeing that grim-visaged one slain, the lord of the celestials together with the celestials themselves honouring Kākutstha, exclaimed Well, Well!.', 'sn': 'तां हतां भीमसंकाशां दृष्ट्वा सुरपतिस्तदा॥ साधु साध्विति काकुत्स्थं सुराश्चाप्यभिपूजयन्।'}

{'en': 'And exceedingly pleased, the thousand-eyed Purandara, together with the delighted deities, said to Viśvāmitra.', 'sn': 'उवाच परमप्रीतः सहस्राक्षः पुरन्दरः॥ सुराश्च सर्वे संहृष्टा विश्वामित्रमथाब्रुवन्।'}

{'en': "O ascetic, O Kusika's son, good betide you! all the Maruts with Indra at their head, have been gratified with this act (of Rāma's). Do you, O Brāhmaṇa, confer upon Raghu's descendant the sons of Prajāpati Kțśāśva, of true prowess, and charged with ascetic energy.", 'sn': 'मुने कौशिक भद्रं ते सेन्द्राः सर्वे मरुद्गणाः॥ तोषिताः कर्मणानेन स्नेहं दर्शय राघवे। प्रजापतेः कृशाश्वस्य पुत्रान् सत्यपराक्रमान्॥ तपोबलभृतो ब्रह्मन् राघवाय निवेदय।'}

{'en': 'And ever following you, he, O Brāhmaṇa, is fit to receive them of you. And this son of the king is to accomplish a mighty task in the interests of the celestials.', 'sn': 'पात्रभूतश्च ते ब्रह्मस्तवानुगमने रतः॥ कर्तव्यं सुमहत् कर्म सुराणां राजसूनुना।'}

{'en': 'Saying this, the deities, having paid homage to Viśvāmitra, joyfully entered the celestial regions.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा सुराः सर्वे जग्मुर्हष्टा विहायसम्॥ विश्वामित्रं पूजयन्तस्ततः संध्या प्रवर्तते।'}

{'en': "And now came evening on, when that best of ascetics, gratified at the destruction of Tāțakā, smelt Rāma's crown and said these words,", 'sn': 'ततो मुनिवरः प्रीतस्ताटकावधतोषितः।३२।। मूर्ध्नि राममुपाघ्राय इदं वचनमब्रवीत्।'}

{'en': 'Here, O Rāma of gracious presence, shall we pass the night; and morrow morning, went to that hermitage of mine.', 'sn': 'इहाद्य रजनी राम वसाम शुभदर्शन ॥ श्वः प्रभाते गमिष्यामस्तदाश्रमपदं मम।'}

{'en': "Hearing Visvāmitra's words, Dasaratha's son, glad at heart, happily passed that night in the forest of Tāțakā.", 'sn': 'विश्वामित्रवचः श्रुत्वा हृष्टो दशरथात्मजः॥ उवास रजनी तत्र ताटकाया वने सुखम्।'}

{'en': 'And being thus freed from all disturbances, from that day forth that forest appeared charming, even like to the forest of Caitraratha.', 'sn': 'मुक्तशापं वनं तच्च तस्मिन्नेव तदाहनि। रमणीयं विबभ्राज यथा चैत्ररथं वनम्॥'}

{'en': "Having thus slain the Yakşa's daughter, Rāma, eulogised by celestials and Siddhas, spent there that night with the saint, being awakened by the latter at the break of day.", 'sn': 'निहत्य तो यक्षसुतां स रामः प्रशस्यमानः सुरसिद्धसंघैः। उवास तस्मिन् मुनिना सहैव प्रभातवेलां प्रतिबोध्यमानः॥'}

{'en': "Thereupon the high-souled Rāma, along with Sugrīva, proceeded from the mount Rșyamuka to Kiskindha, maintained by Vali's prowess, raising up his gold crested mighty bow and taking his battle arrows like to Aditya.", 'sn': 'ऋष्यमूकात् स धर्मात्मा किष्किन्धां लक्ष्मणाग्रजः। जगाम सह सुग्रीवो वालिविक्रमपालिताम्॥ समुद्यम्य महच्चापं रामः काञ्चनभूषितम्। शरांश्चादित्यसंकाशान् गृहीत्वा रणसाधकान्॥'}
{'en': 'The mighty Sugrīva, bending low, proceeded before the high-souled Rama and Laksmana.', 'sn': 'अग्रतस्तु ययौ तस्य राघवस्य महात्मनः। सुग्रीवः संहतग्रीवो लक्ष्मणस्य महाबलः॥'}

{'en': 'They were followed by the heroic Hanumān, the mighty Nala and Neela, and the highly powerful Tārā, the leader of the monkey herd.', 'sn': 'पृष्ठतो हनुमान् वीरो नलो नीलश्च वीर्यवान्। तारश्चैव महातेजा हरियूथपयूथपः॥'}

{'en': 'They beheld as they proceeded, trees, lowered down with the weight of flowers, rivers of clear water flowing to the ocean, mountain hollows, hills, caves, cavities, and principal peaks and charming rills.', 'sn': 'ते वीक्षमाणा वृक्षांश्च पुष्पभारावलम्बिनः। प्रसन्नाम्बुवहाश्चैव सरितः सागरंगमाः॥ कन्दराणि च शैलांश्च निर्दराणि गुहास्तथा। शिखराणि च मुख्यानि दरीश्च प्रियदर्शनाः॥'}

{'en': 'They. beheld on their way, pools filled with water clear as Baidurya and beautified with lotuses-full blown and buds, and resounded with the cries of Kārandhabas, swans, geese, Banculas, water-fowls, Cakravākas, and various other birds.', 'sn': 'वैदूर्यविमलैस्तोयैः पद्यैश्चाकोशकुड्मलैः। शोभितान् सजलान् मार्गे तटाकांश्चावलोकयन्॥ कारण्डैः सारसैहँसैर्वञ्जुलैर्जलकुक्कुटैः। चक्रवाकैस्तथा चान्यैः शकुनैः प्रतिनादितान्॥'}

{'en': 'They surveyed all around in the forest-land, deer ranging fearlessly at large and grazing on tender grass.', 'sn': 'मृदुशष्पाङ्कुराहारान्निर्भयान् वनगोचरान्। चरतः सर्वतः पश्यन् स्थलीषु हरिणान् स्थितान्॥'}

{'en': 'They beheld frightful wild elephants having white teeth, ranging alone-the destroyers of river banks and enemies of pools. And observing many an infuriated monkey like to elephants, resembling so many moveable mountains riving the mountainous expanses crusted with dust, and many other wild beasts and birds the followers of Sugrīva wended their way.', 'sn': 'तटाकवैरिणश्चापि शुक्लदन्तविभूषितान्। घोरानेकचरान्वन्यान् द्विरदान् कूलघातिनः॥ मत्तान् गिरितटोत्कृष्टान् पर्वतानिव जङ्गमान्। वानरान् द्विरदप्रख्यान् महीरेणुसमुक्षितान् ॥ वने वनचरांश्चान्यान् खेचरांश्च विहंगमान्। पश्यन्तस्त्वरिता जग्मुः सुग्रीववशवर्तिनः॥'}

{'en': 'They proceeding quickly, Rama, the descendant of Raghu, beholding the forest filled with trees, spoke to Sugrīva, saying.', 'sn': 'तेषां तु गच्छतां तत्र त्वरितं रघुनन्दनः। दुमषण्डवनं दृष्ट्वा रामः सुग्रीवमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': "These trees skirted by plantain groves, dense as a collection of clouds, appear as clouds in the sky. Great is my curiosity, O friend, to learn what are these. 'And I wish to have my curiosity removed by you.", 'sn': 'एष मेघ इवाकाशे वृक्षषण्डः प्रकाशते। मेघसंघातविपुलः पर्यन्तकदलीवृतः॥ किमेतज्ज्ञातुमिच्छामि सखे कौतूहलं मम। कौतूहलापनयनं कर्तुमिच्छाम्यहं त्वया॥'}
{'en': 'Hearing the words of the high-souled Rāghava, Sugrīva began to describe that great forest.', 'sn': 'तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राघवस्य महात्मनः। गच्छन्नेवाचचक्षेऽथ सुग्रीवस्तन्महद् वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'In this extensive asylum, O Rāghava, removing the toil (of the travellers) filled with gardens and trees and abounding in delicious fruits, roots and water, dwelt seven Saints, having control over their senses. Those seven Saints, dwelling on the mountain, passed days and nights in water with their heads down and after seven nights used to live upon air. In this wise, passing seven hundred years they repaired bodily to heaven.', 'sn': 'एतद् राघव विस्तीर्णमाश्रमं श्रमनाशनम्। उद्यानवनसम्पन्नं स्वादुमूलफलोदकम्॥ अत्र सप्तजना नाम मुनयः संशितव्रताः। सप्तवासन्नधःशीर्षा नियतं जलशायिनः॥ सप्तरात्रे कृताहारा वायुनाचलवासिनः। दिवं वर्षशतैर्याताः सप्तभिः सकलेवराः॥'}

{'en': 'By virtue of their asceticism, this asylum is walled by trees and incapable of being conquered even by Indra, the celestials and the Asuras.', 'sn': 'तेषामेतत्प्रभावेण दुमप्राकारसंवृतम्। आश्रमं सुदुराधर्षमपि सेन्द्रैः सुरासुरैः॥'}

{'en': 'Birds or other wild animals do not enter this asylum; whoever entereth this by mistake never returneth.', 'sn': 'पक्षिणो वर्जयन्त्येतत् तथान्ये वनचारिणः। विशन्ति मोहाद् येऽप्यत्र न निवर्तन्ति ते पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'There is audible, O Rāghava, the sound of the dressing of Apsarās, their sweet-winged accents and that of their music and drums; and herçin pervadeth the celestial fragrance.', 'sn': 'विभूषणरवाश्चात्र श्रूयन्ते सकलाक्षराः। तूर्यगीतस्वनश्चापि गन्धो दिव्यश्च राघव ॥'}

{'en': 'Here burneth the fire Tretā; and the smoke and cloud sable like to the wings of a pigeon envelope the tops of the trees.', 'sn': 'त्रेताग्नयोऽपि दीप्यन्ते धूमो ह्येष प्रदृश्यते। वेष्टयन्निव वृक्षाग्रान् कपोताङ्गारुणो घनः॥'}

{'en': 'And there appear the trees, having their tops saturated with smoke and cloaked with clouds, like to so many Baidurya hills.', 'sn': 'एते वृक्षाः प्रकाशन्ते धूमसंसक्तमस्तकाः। मेघजालप्रतिच्छन्ना वैदूर्यगिरयो यथा ॥'}

{'en': 'Do you, O Rāghava, O virtuous-souled one, make obeisance to them along with your brother Lakṣmaṇa, with concentrated heart and folded palms.', 'sn': 'कुरु प्रणामं धर्मात्मस्तेषामुद्दिश्य राघव। लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा प्रयतः संहताञ्जलिः॥'}
{'en': 'There resteth no sin in their persons, O Rāma, who bow to those self-controlled Saints.', 'sn': 'प्रणमन्ति हि ये तेषामृषीणां भावितात्मनाम्। न तेषामशुभं किंचिच्छरीरे राम विद्यते॥'}
{'en': 'Thereupon Rāma, along with his younger brother Lakşmaņa, made obeisance to those high-souled ones.', 'sn': 'ततो रामः सह भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणेन कृताञ्जलिः। समुद्दिश्य महात्मानस्तानृषीनभ्यवादयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Having paid homage (to the sacred memory of those great ones) the virtuous-souled Rāma his (younger) brother Laksmana, Sugriva and other monkeys, proceeded with delighted hearts.', 'sn': 'अभिवाद्य च धर्मात्मा रामो भ्राता च लक्ष्मणः। सुग्रीवो वानराश्चैव जग्मुः संहष्टमानसाः॥'}

{'en': 'And wending a distant way from that hermitage of the seven great ones, they beheld Kişkindhä, hard to conquer and occupied by Vali.', 'sn': 'ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं तस्मात् सप्तजनाश्रमात्। दद्दशुस्तां दुराधर्षां किष्किन्धां वालिपालिताम्॥'}

{'en': "Thereupon, Rāma, his younger brother and the monkeys taking their weapons, entered, to encompass the destruction of their enemies, the city (of Kişkindhā) reared by the prowess of Indra's son.", 'sn': 'ततस्तु रामानुजरामवानराः प्रगृह्य शस्त्राण्युदितोग्रतेजसः। पुरी सुरेशात्मजवीर्यपालितां वधाय शत्रोः पुनरागतास्त्विह॥'}

{'en': 'Having been thus addressed, Vaidehī unaffected by fear, although exercised with grief, placing a blade of grass between herself and Rāvana, answered him.', 'sn': 'सा तथोक्ता तु वैदेही निर्भया शोककर्शिता। तृणमन्तरतः कृत्वा रावणं प्रत्यभाषत॥'}

{'en': 'There was a king named Dasaratha, the bridge of righteousness, like to a mountain, ever bearing regard towards the truth, and renowned among men, whose son is Rāghava. He is named Rāma, and is righteous-souled and celebrated over the three worlds. he is long-armed, of expansive eyes, like to a celestial—he is my husband.', 'sn': 'राजा दशरथो नाम धर्मसेतुरिवाचलः। सत्यसंधः परिज्ञातो यस्य पुत्रः स राघवः॥ नामो नाम स धर्मात्मा त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः। दीर्घबाहुर्विशालाक्षो दैवतं स पतिर्मम ॥'}

{'en': 'Born in the race of the Ikşvākus, the has the shoulders of a lion and is possessed of exceeding effulgence-the same that along with his brother, Laksmana, shall take your life. If you had wronged me forcibly in his presence, you would have slain in battle in Janasthāna even as Khara.', 'sn': 'इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले जातः सिंहस्कन्धो महाद्युतिः। लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा यस्ते प्राणान् वधिष्यति॥ प्रत्यक्षं यद्यहं तस्य त्वया वै धर्षिता बलात्। शयिता त्वं हतः संख्ये जनस्थाने यथा खरः॥'}

{'en': 'All the mighty Rākşasas of grim visages, whom you have extolled (before me), shall be deprived of their venom before Rāma, as serpents are before Suparna,', 'sn': 'य एते राक्षसाः प्रोक्ता घोररूपा महाबलाः। राघवे निर्विषाः सर्वे सुपर्णे पन्नगा यथा॥'}

{'en': 'The shafts decorated with gold shot by the bow-string of Rāghava, shall pierce their bodies, as the waves of the Ganga (beat against) her banks.', 'sn': 'तस्य ज्याविप्रमुक्तास्ते खराः काञ्चनभूषणाः। शरीरं विधमिष्यन्ति गङ्गाकूलमिवोर्मयः।७।।'}

{'en': 'Although, O Rāvana, you may be incapable of being slain either by the gods or the Asuras, yet having roused the high hostility of Rāghava, you will not be able to liberate your life.', 'sn': 'असुरैर्वा सुरैर्वा त्वं यद्यवध्योऽसि रावण। उत्पाद्य सुमहद् वैरं जीवंस्तस्य न मोक्ष्यसे ॥'}

{'en': 'The strong Rāghava will compass the end of what remains of your life. Like the life of a beast tied to the sacrificial stake, your own is incapable of being reclaimed.', 'sn': 'स ते जीवितशेषस्य राघवोऽन्तकरो बली। पशोडूंपगतस्येव जीवितं तव दुर्लभम्॥'}

{'en': 'Should Rāma look at you with eyes aglow with anger, you, O Raksasa, would be consumed even as Manmatha was by, Rudra.', 'sn': 'यदि पश्येत् स रामस्त्वं रोषदीप्तेन चक्षुषा। रक्षस्त्वमद्य निर्दग्धो यथा रुद्रेण मन्मथः॥'}

{'en': 'He who is able to bring down the Moon or destroy him, and to drink up the ocean dry, will surely liberate Sītā from here.', 'sn': 'यश्चन्द्रं नभसो भूमौ पातयेन्नाशयेत वा। सागरं शोषयेद् वापि स सीतां मोचयेदिह॥'}

{'en': 'Your days are numbered, and auspiciousness has bidden you adieu. You are shorn of strength, and your senses have been dulled. And it is owing to you that Larkā shall be subject to widowhood.', 'sn': 'गतासुस्त्वं गतश्रीको गतसत्त्वो गतेन्द्रियः। लङ्का वैधव्यसंयुक्ता त्वत्कृतेन भविष्यति ॥'}

{'en': 'That you by force have for naught carried me away from the side of my husband-this sinful act can never conduce to your felicity.', 'sn': 'न ते पापमिदं कर्म सुखोदकं भविष्यति। याहं नीता विनाभावं पतिपार्ध्वात् त्वया बलात्॥'}

{'en': "That exceedingly effulgent lord of mine along with my husband's younger brother, summoning up their energy, is fearlessly dwelling in the vacant Dandaka.", 'sn': 'स हि देवरसंयुक्तो मम भर्ता महाद्युतिः। निर्भयो वीर्यमाश्रित्य शून्ये वसति दण्डके॥'}

{'en': 'By means of an arrowy shower in conflict, he will take your prowess and strength, your hauteur and wickedness out of your person,', 'sn': 'स ते वीर्यं बलं दर्पमुत्सेकं च तथाविधम्। व्यपनेष्यति गात्रेभ्यः शरवर्षेण संयुगे॥'}

{'en': 'When urged by the Destroyer, the destruction of creatures is perceptible, then, coming under the sway of the Destroyer, men become careless in their actions.', 'sn': 'यदा विनाशो भूतानां दृश्यते कालचोदितः। तदा कार्ये प्रमाद्यन्ति नराः कालवशं गताः॥'}

{'en': 'Having outraged me, you, O worst of Rāks asas your time come; for compassing your own destruction as well as that of the Rākşasas and those dwelling in your inner apartment.', 'sn': 'मां प्रधृष्य स ते कालः प्राप्तोऽयं राक्षसाधम। आत्मनो राक्षसानां च वधायान्तःपुरस्य च॥'}

{'en': 'A Candāla cannot tread the dais reared the midst of a sacrifice beauteous with ladies, and vessels, and sanctified by the twice-born ones.', 'sn': 'न शक्या यज्ञमध्यस्था वेदिः स्रुग्भाण्डमण्डिता। द्विजातिमन्त्रसम्पूता चण्डालेनावमर्दितुम्॥'}

{'en': 'So I, the religiously wedded wife of that one, ever intent on virtue, and (always) firm in my vows, is incapable, you vilest of Raksasas, of being touched by you, a sinner.', 'sn': 'तथाहं धर्मनित्यस्य धर्मपत्नी दृढव्रता। त्वया स्प्रष्टुं न शक्याहं राक्षसाधम पापिना॥'}

{'en': 'How can the female that has always ‘sported with her mate amidst lotuses, cast her eyes on a shag staying among rushes.', 'sn': 'क्रीडन्ती राजहंसेन पद्मषण्डेषु नित्यशः। हंसी सा तृणमध्यस्थं कथं द्रक्ष्येत मद्गुकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Do you either bind or destroy this body deprived of sensation. This body will I not protect, nor yet this life, O Rāvana;', 'sn': 'इदं शरीरं नि:संज्ञं बन्ध वा घातयस्व वा। नेदं शरीरं रक्ष्यं मे जीवितं वापि राक्षस ॥'}

{'en': "And I shall not be able to bring blame on myself in this world. having said these harsh words in wrath, Videha's daughter, Janaki, did not there again say anything to Rāvaņa.", 'sn': 'न तु शक्यमपक्रोशं पृथिव्यां दातुमात्मनः। एवमुक्त्वा तु वैदेही क्रोधात् सुपरुषं वचः॥'}

{'en': "Hearing Sita's words, harsh and calculated to make one's down stand on end, Rāvana answered her in words tending to excite one's apprehension,", 'sn': 'रावणं जानकी तत्र पुनर्नोवाच किंचन। सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा परुषं रोमहर्षणम्॥ प्रत्युवाच ततः सीतां भयसंदर्शनं वचः।'}

{'en': 'Hear, O Maithili, my words. O damsel if, O you of sweet smiles, within this time you do not turn yourself to me, the cooks shall cut you off in pieces to serve my morning mcal.', 'sn': 'शृणुमैथिलि मद्वाक्यं मासान् द्वादश भामिनि ॥ कालेनानेन नाभ्येषि यदि मां चारुहासिनि। ततस्त्वां प्रातराशार्थं सूदाश्छेत्स्यन्ति लेशशः॥'}

{'en': 'Having herself spoken thus, Ravana-challenger of foes-growing exceedingly wroth, addressed the Rākşasis in these words,', 'sn': 'इत्युक्त्वा परुषं वाक्यं रावणः शत्रुरावणः। राक्षसीश्च ततः क्रुद्ध इदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'You frightful Rākşasīs terrible to behold, subsisting on flesh and gore, do you at once crush her pride.', 'sn': 'शीघ्रमेव हि राक्षस्यो विरूपा घोरदर्शनाः। दर्पमस्यापनेष्यन्तु मांसशोणितभोजनाः॥'}
{'en': 'As soon as he had said this, those frightful and terrible Rākṣasīs with joined hands encircled Maithili.', 'sn': 'वचनादेव तास्तस्य सुघोरा घोरदर्शनाः। कृतप्राञ्जलयो भूत्वा मैथिली पर्यवारयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Then the grim-visaged king Ravana, as if riving the earth by his tread, proceeding a pace or two, said,', 'sn': 'स ताः प्रोवाच राजासौ रावणो घोरदर्शनाः। प्रचल्य चरणोत्कर्षैर्दारयन्निव मेदिनीम्॥'}

{'en': "Do you take Maithilī to the wood of Asokas. There surrounding her, do you secretly guard her; and there (sometimes) by storming, and (at other) by means of soft speech, do you all strive to bring Mithila's daughter, like a wild female elephant, under your sway.", 'sn': 'अशोकवनिकामध्ये मैथिली नीयतामिति। तत्रेयं रक्ष्यतां गूढं युष्माभिः परिवारिता॥ तत्रैनां तर्जनैोरैः पुनः सान्त्वैश्च मैथिलीम्। आनयध्वं वशं सर्वा वन्यां गजवधूमिव ॥'}

{'en': 'Thus commanded by Rāvana, those Rākşasis taking Maithili along with them, went to the Asoka wood, abounding with trees granting every desire, and filled with various kinds of fruits and flowers, and frequented by fowls fraught with juices at all seasons.', 'sn': 'इति प्रतिसमादिष्टा राक्षस्यो रावणेन ताः। अशोकवनिकां जग्मुर्मैथिली परिगृह्य तु॥ सर्वकामफलैर्वृक्षैर्नानापुष्पफलैर्वृताम्। सर्वकालमदैश्चापि द्विजैः समुपसेविताम्॥'}

{'en': "And as a doe comes under the subjection of tigresses, Janaka's daughter, Maithili, her frame worked up with grief, came under the sway of the Raksasis.", 'sn': 'सा तु शोकपरिताङ्गी मैथिली जनकात्मजा। राक्षसीवशमापन्ना व्याघ्रीणां हरिणी यथा॥'}

{'en': "And like a female deer fast bound by a trap, Janaka's timid daughter Maithilī, agitated by the mighty grief, did not attain respite.", 'sn': 'शोकेन महता त्रस्ता मैथिली जनकात्मजा। न शर्म लभते भीरुः पाशबद्धा मृगी यथा॥'}

{'en': 'And greatly up-braided by the fierce eyes (of the Raksasis), Maithili did not know repose; and, afflicted with grief and fear, she, remembering her beloved lord along with Lakşmaņa swooned away.', 'sn': 'न विन्दते तत्र तु शर्म मैथिली विरूपनेत्राभिरतीव तर्जिता। पतिं स्मरन्ती दयितं च देवरं विचेतनाभूद् भयशोकपीडिता ॥'}

{'en': 'Having been thus addressed, Vaidehi unaffected by fear, although exercised with grief, placing a blade of grass between herself and Ravana, answered him.', 'sn': 'इतः परं प्रक्षिप्तोऽयं सर्गः।। प्रवेशितायां सीतायां लङ्कां प्रति पितामह। तदा प्रोवाच देवेन्द्र परितुष्टं शतक्रतुम्॥'}

{'en': 'On Sītā having entered Lankā, the great father addressed the gratified Devendra of an hundred sacrifices, For bringing about the weal of the three worlds, and the woe of the Rākşasas, Sītā has been taken into Lankā by the wickedminded, Rāvaņa.', 'sn': 'त्रैलोक्यस्य हितार्थाय रक्षसामहिताय च। लङ्कां प्रवेशिता सीता रावणेन दुरात्मना ॥'}

{'en': 'Devoted to her husband, the exalted lady always brought up in happiness, not seeing her husband, and seeing (on the other hand) environed by numbers of Räkşasīs,-is hungering after the sight of her lord.', 'sn': 'पतिव्रता महाभागा नित्यं चैव सुस्त्रैधिता। अपश्यन्ती च भतौरं पश्यन्ती राक्षसीजनम्॥ राक्षसीभिः परिवृता भर्तृदर्शनलालसा।'}

{'en': 'The city of Lankā is situated on the shores of the lord of rivers and streams. How can Rāma get a knowledge of that blameless one, staying there?', 'sn': 'निविष्टा हि पुरी लङ्का तीरे नदनदीपतेः॥ कथं ज्ञास्यति तां रामस्तत्रस्थां तामनिन्दिताम्।'}

{'en': 'Brooding over the various ills she has undergone, that exceedingly rare damsel is passing her days. Surely she will resign her existence. Great is the doubt that has arisen as to Sītā putting a period to her existence.', 'sn': 'दुःशं संचिन्तयनिती सा बहुशः परिदुर्लभा ॥ प्राणयात्रामकुर्राणा प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यत्यसंशयम्। स भूयः संशयो जातः सीतायाः प्राणसंक्षये॥'}

{'en': 'Having yourself from here, do you see the fair-faced Sītā. having entered the city of Lankā, Offer excellent clarified butter.', 'sn': 'स त्वं शीघ्रमितो गत्वा सीतां पश्य शुभाननाम्। प्रविश्य नगरी लङ्कां प्रयच्छ हविरुत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed by the reverend chastiser of Pāka, Devendra in company with sleep, approached the city ruled by Rāvana.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तोऽथ देवेन्द्रः पुरी रावणपालिताम्। आगच्छन्निद्रया सार्ध भगवान् पाकशासनः॥'}

{'en': 'He then addressed sleep, saying. Go you; and stupefy the Räksasas. Thus accosted by Maghavat, that goddess, exceedingly delighted, for securing success to the work of the celestials, covered the Rākşasas with stupor.', 'sn': 'निद्रां चोवाच गच्छ त्वं राक्षसान् सम्प्रमोहय। सा तथोक्ता मघवता देवी परमहर्षिता॥ देवकार्यार्थसिद्धयर्थं प्रामोहयत राक्षसान् ।'}

{'en': 'In the meanwhile, that god, the thousand-eyed lord of Śacī went to (Sītā) staying in the woods, and spoke to her these words,', 'sn': 'एतस्मिन्नन्तरे देवः सहस्राक्षः शचीपतिः॥ आसमाद वनस्थां तां वचनं चेदमब्रवीत् ।'}

{'en': 'I am the sovereign of the celestials. Good betide you! I am here, O you of luminous smiles! For securing success to the work of the magnanimous Rāghava, I will lend my aid to you. Do not, Odaughter of Janaka, grieve.', 'sn': 'देवराजोऽस्मि भद्रं ते इह चास्मि शुचिस्मिते॥ अहं त्वां कार्यनिद्दध्यर्थं राघवस्य महात्मनः। साहाय्यं कल्पयिष्यामि मा शुचो जनकात्मजे ॥'}

{'en': 'Through my grace, he shall along with his forces cross over the ocean. And, O excellent wench, I have by my supernal power, stupified the Raksasis.', 'sn': 'मत्प्रसादात् समुद्रं स तरिष्यति बलैः सह। मयैवेह च राक्षस्यो मायाय मोहिताः शुभे॥'}

{'en': 'And, O Sita, for this reason, I along with sleep, taking these rice, rice boiled in clarified butter, have, O Vaidehi, corne to you.', 'sn': 'तस्मादन्नमिदं सीते हविष्यान्नहं स्वयम्। स त्वां संगृह्य वैदेहि आगतः सह निद्रया।१४।।'}

{'en': 'If you partake of these from my hand, you shall never O beauteous one, be afflicted either with hunger or thirst, O you of thighs resembling rambhā (trunks), for years.', 'sn': 'एतदत्स्यसि मद्धस्तान्न त्वां वाधिष्यते शुभे। क्षुधा तृषा च रम्भोरु वर्षाणामयुतैरपि॥'}

{'en': "Thus addressed, Sītā, alarmed, said, How can I know you for Devendra, Saci's husband, staying here?", 'sn': 'एवमुक्ता तु देवेन्द्रमुवाच परिशङ्किता। कथं जानामि देवेन्द्रं त्वामिहस्थं खजापतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'By the side of Rāma and Lakşmaņa, I had beheld the signs of the celestials. If, O Devendra, you are yourself the sovereign of the celestials, show those to me.', 'sn': 'देवलिङ्गानि दृष्टानि रामलक्ष्मणसंनिधौ। तानि दर्शय देवेन्द्र यदि त्वं देवराट् स्वयम्॥'}

{'en': "Hearing Sītā's words, the lord of Saçī did accordingly. he did not touch the earth with his feet, and his eyes remained winkless. he bloomed in youth, and the blossoms did not fade on his attire. Thereupon knowing him for Vāsava, Sītā was overjoyed.", 'sn': 'सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा तथा चक्रे शचीपतिः। गृथिवीं नास्पृशत् पद्भ्यामनिमेषेक्षणानि च॥ अरजोऽम्बरधारी च नम्लीनकुसुमस्तथा। तं ज्ञात्वा लक्ष्णैः सीता वासवं परिहर्षिता ॥'}

{'en': 'And weeping, she spoke regarding Rāghava, By luck it is that I had heard of that mightyarmed one along with his brother.', 'sn': 'उवाच वाक्यं रुदती भगवन् राघवं प्रति। कह भ्रात्रा महाबाहुर्दिष्टयः मे श्रुतिमागतः॥'}

{'en': 'As is my father-in-law, the king, as is the master of Mithilā, so are you (to me), you whom I behold to-day; my husband has now found a protector.', 'sn': 'यथा मे श्वशुरो राजा यथा च मिथिलाधिपः। सथा त्वमद्य पश्यामि सनाथो मे पतिस्त्वया॥'}

{'en': 'And by your command, O Devendra, will I partake of this pāyasa cooked with milk, which has been offered to me, and which shall enhance (the prosperity) of our race.', 'sn': 'तवाज्ञया च देवेन्द्र पयोभूतमिदं हविः। अशिष्यामि त्वया दत्तं रघूणां कुलवर्घनम्॥'}

{'en': "Thereupon taking the pāyasa from Indra's hands, that Maithilī of luminous smiles (mentally) offered it to her husband as well as Laksmana.", 'sn': 'इन्द्रहस्ताद् गृहीत्वा तत् पायसं सा शुचिस्मिता। न्यवेदयत भर्ने सा लक्ष्मणाय च मैथिली॥'}

{'en': 'If my mighty lord live along with his brother, let this through my reverence for them, be theirs. She then partook of the pāyasa herself.', 'sn': 'यदि जीवति मे भर्ता सह भ्रात्रा महाबलः। इदमस्तु तयोर्भक्त्या तदाश्नात् स्वयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having thus eaten it, that one of excellent countenance, had her hunger and rising sorrow removed; and attaining a mental tendency from Indra, Janaki grew glad with reference to the Kakutsthas.', 'sn': 'इतीव तत् प्राश्य हविर्वरानना जहौ क्षुधादुःखसमुद्भवं च तम्। इन्द्रात् प्रवृत्तिमुपलभ्य जानकी काकुत्स्थयोः प्रीतमना बभूव ॥'}

{'en': "And Sakra also for bringing about the success of Rāghava's work, with a pleased mind, went to the abode of celestials. And greeting Sītā again and again, that high-souled celestial, in company with sleep went back to his own abode.", 'sn': 'स चापि शक्रस्त्रिदिवालयं तदा प्रीतो ययौ राघवकार्यसिद्धये। आमन्त्र्य सीतां स ततो महात्मा जगाम निद्रासहितः स्वमालयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing Śūrpanakhā speak harsh words in the midst of the courtiers, Ravana, being enraged, asked her.', 'sn': 'ततः शूर्पणखां दृष्ट्वा ब्रुवन्ती परुषं वचः। अमात्यमध्ये संक्रुद्धः परिपप्रच्छ रावणः॥'}

{'en': 'Who is Rāma? And what is his prowess? And what his form? And what his power? And why had he entered the forest of Dandaka, difficult to range?', 'sn': 'कश्च रामः कथंवीर्यः किंरूपः किंपराक्रमः। किमर्थे दण्डकारण्यं प्रविष्टश्च सुदुस्तरम्॥'}

{'en': "And what Rāma's weapons, by means of which he had slain the Rākşasas?. And Khara has been slain in battle, and Dūşaņa and Trisirā.", 'sn': 'आयुघं किं च रामस्य येन ते राक्षसा हताः। खरश्च निहतः संख्ये दूषणस्त्रिशिरास्तथा॥'}
{'en': 'Do you, O you of a pleasing person, tell me the truth. And who had deformed you?', 'sn': 'तत्त्वं ब्रूहि मनोज्ञाङ्गि केन त्वं च विरूपिता । इत्युक्ता राक्षसेन्द्रेण राक्षसी क्रोधमूर्छिता ॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed by the lord of the Rākṣasas, the Raksasi, transported with rage, commenced to duly narrate all about Rāma. Rāma the son of Dasaratha is long-armed, of expansive eyes, clad in bark and dark deer-skin, and like Kandarpa in grace.', 'sn': 'ततो रामं यथान्यायमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे। दीर्घबाहुर्विशालाक्षश्चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरः॥ कन्दर्पसमरूपश्च रामो दशरथात्मजः।'}

{'en': 'And drawing a bow resembling that of Sakra, decked with golden rings, he discharges blazing nāracas, like to serpents of virulent poison.', 'sn': 'शक्रचापनिभं चापं विकृष्य कनकाङ्गदम्॥ दीप्तान् त्रिपति नाराचान् सनिव महाविषान् ।'}

{'en': 'I do not see in the field, Rāma drawing his bow: I only see the host being slaughtered by a shower of shafts. And as Indra destroys (a field of) goodly crops, by pouring down hail stones, fourteen thousand Räksasas of dreadful prowess, as well as Khara and Duşaņa were in a little over a moment slain with sharp shafts by Rāma alone fighting on foot. And he had reassured the saints, and after having been deformed, I alone from fear of slaying a woman, have been let off by the high-souled Rāma knowing self.', 'sn': 'नाददानं शरान् घोरान् विमुञ्चन्तं महाबलम्।७।। न कार्मुकं विकर्षन्तं रामं पश्यामि संयुगे। हन्यमानं तु तत्सैन्यं पश्यामि शरवृष्टिभिः॥ इन्द्रेणेवोत्तमं सस्यमाहतं त्वश्मवृष्टिभिः। रक्षसां भीमवीर्याणां सहस्राणि चतुर्दश॥ निहतानि शरैस्तीक्ष्णैस्तेनैकेन पदातिना। अर्धाधिकमुहूर्तेन खरश्च सहदूषणः॥ ऋषीणामभयं दत्तं कृतक्षेमाश्च दण्डकाः॥ एका कथंचित्मुक्ताहं परिभूय महात्मना । स्त्रीवधं शङ्कमानेन रामेण विदितात्मना॥ भ्राता चास्य महातेजा गुणतस्तुल्यविक्रमः।'}

{'en': "His brother is endued with mighty energy, and in merit, is of equal prowess, and he is devoted to his brother, and bear him regard; the puissant one is named Laksmana. And wrathful and invincible and victorious, and powerful, and intelligent and mighty, (he) is Rāma's right-arı-his life ranging externally.", 'sn': 'अनुरक्तश्च भक्तश्च लक्ष्मणो नाम वीर्यवान्॥ अमर्षी दुर्जयो जेता विक्रान्तो बुद्धिमान् बली। रामस्य दक्षिणो बाहुनित्यं प्राणो बहिश्चरः॥'}

{'en': "And Rāma's virtuously wedded beloved wife having expansive eyes, and a face resembling the full-moon, is ever to the welfare of her lord.", 'sn': 'रामस्य तु विशालाक्षी पूर्णेन्दुसदृशानना। धर्मपत्नी प्रिया नित्यं भर्तुः प्रियहिते रता॥'}

{'en': 'And that fair-haired, fair-nosed, and fairthighed illustrious one possessed of beauty, grace the forest like a goddess, as if a goddess of wealth herself.', 'sn': 'सा सुकेशी सुनासोरू: सुरूपा च यशस्विनी। देवतेव वनस्यास्य राजते श्रीरिवापरा॥'}

{'en': 'Of the lustre of burnished gold, with her finger nails reddish and projecting, and graceful, that surpassingly lovely wench is named Sītā—the slender-waisted daughter of Videha.', 'sn': 'तप्तकाञ्चनवर्णाभा रक्ततुङ्गनखी शुभा। सीता नाम वरारोहा वैदेही तनुमध्यमा॥'}

{'en': 'And neither a goddess, nor a Gandharvi, nor a Yaksi, nor a Kinnari, had I seen before on earth, possessed of such beauty.', 'sn': 'नैव देवी न गन्धर्वी न यक्षी न च किंनरी। तथारूपा मया नारी दृष्टपूर्वा महीतले॥'}

{'en': 'He that shall have Sītā for his spouse, and who shall be warmly embraced by her, shall live longer in the world than the Lord of celestials himself.', 'sn': 'यस्य सीता भवेद् भार्या यं च हृष्टा परिष्वजेत्। अभिजीवेत् स सर्वेषु लोकेष्वपि पुरंदरात्॥'}

{'en': 'That good-natured girl, unparalleled on earth in loveliness, who can well pride herself on her person, is a worthy wife for you, and you too are a fit husband for her.', 'sn': 'सा सुशीला वपुःश्लाध्या रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि। तवानुरूपा भार्या सा त्वं च तस्याः पतिर्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'It is to bring over for you that one of spacious hips, and a high and well-developed bust, that I had put forth my endeavours. But, O mightyarmed one I have been disfigured by the wicked Laksmana.', 'sn': 'तां तु विस्तीर्णजघनां पीनोत्तुङ्गपयोधराम्। भार्यार्थे तु तवानेतुमुद्यताहं वराननाम्॥ विरूपितास्मि क्रूरेण लक्ष्मणेन महाभुज।'}

{'en': 'As soon as you have seen Vaidehi having a countenance resembling the full moon, you shall be afflicted with the shafts of Cupid.', 'sn': 'तां तु दृष्ट्वाद्य वैदेही पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम्॥ मन्मथस्य शराणां च त्वं विधेयो भविष्यसि।'}

{'en': 'If it is your purpose to have her for your wife, at once stretch forth your right leg. for attaining success.', 'sn': 'यदि तस्यामभिप्रायो भार्यात्वे तव जायते। शीघ्रमुद्भियतां पादो जयार्थमिह दक्षिणः॥'}
{'en': 'If, O lord of Raksasas, you relish my speech, do you then, O Ravana, without fear, do as I tell you.', 'sn': 'रोचते यति ते वाक्यं ममैतद् राक्षसेश्वर। क्रियतां निर्विशङ्केन वचनं मम रावण ॥'}

{'en': 'Understanding their incapacity, do you, O lord of Rākṣasas, for making her your wife, by force carry away the frail Sītā of a blameless person.', 'sn': 'विज्ञायैषामशक्तिं च क्रियतां च महाबल। सीता तवानवद्याङ्गी भार्यात्वे राक्षसेश्वर॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing that Rāma by means of straight coursing shafts, has slain the Rākşasas that had gone to Janasthāna, and seeing Khara and Düşaņa, killed, do you ascertaining your course, adopt it.', 'sn': 'हताञ्जनस्थानगतान् निशाचरान्। खरं च दृष्ट्वा निहतं च दूषणं त्वमद्य कृत्यं प्रतिपत्तुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing the king had ascended heaven, like to a fire that has cooled, or an ocean deprived of its waters, or the sun shorn of his splendour, Kausalyā afflicted with woe, taking on her lap the head of the king, with tears in her eyes, said.', 'sn': 'तमग्निमिव संशान्तमम्बुहीनमिवार्णवम्। गतप्रभमिवादित्यं स्वर्गस्थं प्रेक्ष्य भूमिपम्॥ कौसल्या बाष्पपूर्णाक्षी विविधं शोककर्शिता। उपगृह्य शिरो राज्ञः कैकेयी प्रत्यभाषत ॥'}

{'en': 'O Kaikeyī, attain you your wished: do you enjoy this kingdom rid of your thorn. O cruel one, O you of wicked ways, you that forsaking the king had set your heart (on having your son crowned), Rāma had gone away, forsaking me; and now my lord has ascended heaven. I can no longer bear to live, like one left lone in a wilderness by her companions.', 'sn': 'सकामा भव कैकेयि भुक्ष्व राज्यमकण्टकम्। त्यक्त्वा राजानमेकाना नृशंसे दुष्टचारिणि ॥ विहाय मां गतो रामो भर्ता च स्वर्गतो मम। विपथे सार्थहीनेव नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे॥'}

{'en': "What other woman except Kaikeyi lost to righteousness, having lost her deity, her lord, wishes to carry on existence in another's kingdom?", 'sn': 'भर्तारं तु परित्यज्य का स्त्री दैवतमात्मनः। इच्छेज्जीवितुमन्यत्र कैकेय्यास्त्यक्तधर्मणः॥'}

{'en': "As a covetous person taking poison (through anger or some other passion), does not consider himself guilty, (so Kaikeyī) having done this evil through Manthara's incitement, does not bring her guilt home to her mind. It is through the instrumentality of the humpbacked woman that this race of the Rāghavas has been destroyed by Kaikeyi. Hearing that the king being made to do an unrighteous action, has banished Rāma together with his wife, king Janaka will be filled with grief as I have been.", 'sn': 'न लुब्धो बुध्यते दोषान् किंपाकमिव भक्षयन्। कुब्जानिमित्तं कैकेय्या राघवाणां कुलं हतम्॥ अनियोगे नियुक्तेन राज्ञा रामं विवासितम्। सभार्य जनकः श्रुत्वा परितप्स्यत्यहं यथा।७।।'}

{'en': 'That virtuous one does not know that to-day I have become helpless and been widowed. Răma of eyes resembling lotus-petals has living been removed from my sight.', 'sn': 'स मामनाथां विधवां नाद्य जानाति धार्मिकः। रामः कमलपत्राक्षो जीवनाशमितो गतः॥'}

{'en': "The fair daughter of Videha's king unworthy of hardship, in ascetic guise is leading a life of trouble and terror in the woods.", 'sn': 'विदेहराजस्य सुता तथा चारुतपस्विनी। दुःखस्यानुचिता दुःखं वने पर्युद्विजिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing at night the dreadful roars of birds and beasts crying, she exceedingly frightened takes shelter with Rāghava.', 'sn': 'नदतां भीमघोषाणां निशासु मृगपक्षिणाम्। निशम्यमाना संत्रस्ता राघवं संश्रयिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Old and having an only daughter, he revolving in his mind thoughts of Vaidehi, shall, smitten with grief, surely renounce his life. I ever faithful to my lord will die this very day, embracing this body; I will enter fire.', 'sn': 'वृद्धश्चैवाल्पपुत्रश्च वेदेहीमनुचिन्तयन्। सोऽपि शोकसमाविष्टो नूनं त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम्॥ साहमचैव दिष्टान्तं गमिष्यामि पतिव्रता। इदं शरीरमालिङ्गय प्रवेक्ष्यामि हुताशनम्॥'}

{'en': 'As embracing the (dead) body, that unfortunate lady was bewailing, the courtiers had the distressed (queen) removed from there.', 'sn': 'तां ततः सम्परिष्वज्य विलपन्ती तपस्विनीम्। व्यपनिन्युः सुदुःखाता कौसल्यां व्यावहारिकाः॥'}

{'en': 'Then placing the corpse of the king in a (capacious) pan with oil, the courtiers performed the mourning rites of the monarch.', 'sn': 'तैलद्रोण्यां तदामात्याः संवेश्य जगतीपतिम्। राज्ञः सर्वाण्यथादिष्टाश्चक्रुः कर्माण्यनन्तरम्॥'}

{'en': 'But well versed in everything, the counsellors, in the absence of his son, did not perform the funeral obsequies of the king; and therefore they placed his body stretched in the pan of oil. Alas! at length concluding it for certain that the king was dead, the ladies burst out into lamentaions.', 'sn': 'न तु संकालनं राज्ञो विना पुत्रेण मन्त्रिणः। सर्वज्ञाः कर्तुमीषुस्ते ततो रक्षन्ति भूमिपम्॥ तैलद्रोण्यां शायितं तं सचिवैस्तु नराधिपम्। हा मृतोऽयमिति ज्ञात्वा स्त्रियस्ताः पर्यदेवयन्॥'}

{'en': 'And raising their arms, with tears trickling down their faces, they in dire affliction and extremely exercised with grief, lamented.', 'sn': 'बाहूनुच्छ्रित्य कृपणा नेत्रप्रस्रवणैर्मुखैः। रुदत्यः शोकसंतप्ताः कृपणं पर्यदेवयन्॥'}

{'en': 'O monarch, why do you forsake us, who have been already deprived of Rāma ever speaking fair and firm in promise?', 'sn': 'हा महाराज रामेण संततं प्रियवादिना। विहीनाः सत्यसंधेन किमर्थं विजहासि नः॥'}
{'en': 'Renounced by Rāma, how shall we, rendered widows, stay with the wicked Kaikeyi, co-wife with us?', 'sn': 'कैकेय्या दुष्टभावाया राघवेण विवर्जिताः। कथं सपत्न्या वत्स्यामः समीपे विधवा वयम्॥'}

{'en': 'That one of free soul is our master, as he is the lord of yourself. Rāma has gone to the woods, forsaking regal dignity.', 'sn': 'स हि नाथः स चास्माकं तव च प्रभुरात्मवान्। वनं रामो गतः श्रीमान् विहाय नृपतिश्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'Deprived of you as well as that hero, and overwhelmed with misfortune, how shall we live reprimanded by Kaikeyi?', 'sn': 'त्वया तेन च वीरेण विना व्यसनमोहिताः। कथं वयं निवत्स्यामः कैकेय्या च विदूषिताः॥'}

{'en': 'She that has renounced the king, Rāma, and Lakşmaņa along with Sītā, whom can such a one not renounce?', 'sn': 'यया च राजा रामश्च लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः। सीतया सह संत्यक्ताः सा कमन्यं न हास्यति ॥'}

{'en': 'Thus with tears in their eyes, the wives of that descendant of Raghu, joyless and convulsed with a huge passion, displayed signs of sorrow.', 'sn': 'ता बाष्पेण च संवीताः शोकेन विपुलेन च। व्यचेष्टन्त निरानन्दा राघवस्य वरस्त्रियः॥'}

{'en': 'Like a night without stars, like a fair one forsaken by her husband, the city of Ayodhyā without the magnanimous monarch did not appear delightful as it had done before, with the populace filled with tears, the ladies uttering exclamations of distress, and the terraces and courts deserted.', 'sn': 'निशा नक्षत्रहीनेव स्त्रीव भर्तृविवर्जिता। पुरी नाराजतायोध्या हीना राज्ञा महात्मना॥ बाष्पपर्याकुलजना हाहाभूतकुलाङ्गना। शून्यचत्वरवेश्मान्ता न बभ्राज यथापुरम्॥'}

{'en': 'On the lord of men having ascended heaven from grief, and the wives of the king remaining on the earth, the sun, his journey done, set, and the night began her course.', 'sn': 'गते तु शोकात् त्रिदिवं नराधिपे महीतलस्थासु नृपाङ्गनासु च। निवृत्तचारः सहसा गतो रविः प्रवृत्तचारा रजनी ह्युपस्थिता॥'}

{'en': "The idea of consuming the king's corpse in the absence of his son did not recommended itself to the assembled. adherents (of the departed). Thinking this, they in that way laid the king endowed with an inconceivably dignified presence.", 'sn': 'नारोचयस्ते सुहृदः समागताः। इतीव तस्मिशयने न्यवेशयन् विचिन्त्य राजानमचिन्त्यदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'And with her terraces overflowing with tears that flooded the throats of the mourners, the city appeared like the welkin without its splendour in the absence of the sun, or the night with the stars enveloped.', 'sn': 'गतप्रभा द्यौरिव भास्करं विना व्यपेतनक्षत्रगणेव शर्वरी। पुरी बभासे रहिता महात्मना कण्ठास्रकण्ठाकुलमार्गचत्वरा ॥'}

{'en': "And on on the demise of that illustrious personage, in the city men and women in multitudes, censuring Bharata's mother, became extremely distressed, and did not attain peace of mind.", 'sn': 'नराश्च नार्यश्च समेत्य संघशो विगर्हमाणा भरतस्य मातरम्। तदा नगाँ नरदेवसंक्षये बभूवुरार्ता न च शर्म लेभिरे॥'}

{'en': "That lover of virtue, thinking of the miseries of the forest, resolved no to take Sītā with him, who was versed in religious lore's and had spoken thus.", 'sn': 'स एवं ब्रुवती सीतां धर्मज्ञा धर्मवत्सलः। न नेतुं कुरुते बुद्धिं वने दुःखानि चिन्तयन्॥'}

{'en': 'And consoling her whose eyes were stained with tears, that virtuous-souled one spoke to her the following words with a view to prevent her from going.', 'sn': 'सान्त्वयित्वा ततस्तां तु बाष्पदूषितलोचनाम्। निवर्तनार्थे धर्मात्मा वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह॥'}

{'en': 'Oh Sītā, you are born of an illustrious family and ever intent on the performance of religious deeds; do you practise virtue here as it may conduce to the happiness of my mind.', 'sn': 'सीते महाकुलीनासि धर्मे च निरता सदा। इहाचरस्व धर्मं त्वं यथा मे मनसः सुखम्॥'}

{'en': 'Oh Sītā, Oh you of the weaker sex, Do you act up to my counsels; there are evils enough in the forest, do you learn them from me who am about to dwell in it.', 'sn': 'सीते यथा त्वां वक्ष्यामि तथा कार्यं त्वयाबले। वने दोषा हि बहवो वसतस्तान् निबोध मे॥'}

{'en': 'Renounce therefore, Oh Sītă, your intention of flying as an exile to the forest, which for its impenetrableness is said to abound in evils.', 'sn': 'सीते विमुच्यतामेषा वनवासकृता मतिः। बहुदोषं हि कान्तारं वनमित्यभिधीयते॥'}

{'en': 'It is for your welfare that I give utterance to these words; happiness there is none, it is always covered with miseries.', 'sn': 'हितबुद्ध्या खलु वचो मयैतदभिधीयते। सदा सुखं न जानामि दुःखमेव सदा वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'The roarings of the lions living in the caves of mountains, swelling with the sounds of the water-falls, produce a very painful impression upon the ears; so the wood is full of misery.', 'sn': 'गिरिनिर्झरसम्भूता गिरिनिर्दरिवासिनाम्। सिंहानां निनदा दुःखाः श्रोतुं दुःखमतोवनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Animals, all maddened, sporting in solitude, seeing (man), approach to attack him; so the wood is full of misery.', 'sn': 'क्रीडमानाश्च विस्रब्धामत्ताः शून्ये तथा मृगाः। दृष्ट्वा समभिवर्तन्ते सीते दुःखमतो वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'The rivers are full of crocodiles, sharks, and other fearful animals, muddy and impassable and always infested with infuriated elephants; so the wood is full of misery.', 'sn': 'सग्राहाः सरितश्चैव पङ्कवत्यस्तु दुस्तराः। मत्तैरपि गजैर्नित्यमतो दुःखतरं वनम् ॥'}

{'en': 'There the wayfarers are covered with creepers and thorns they are void of drinking water ever resounded with the noise of the wild fowls, so the wood is full of misery.', 'sn': 'लताकण्टकसंकीर्णाः कृकवाकूपनादिताः। निरपाश्च सुदुःखाश्च मार्गा दुःखमतो वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Being exhausted with the toil of the day, the dwellers of the wood have to sleep in night on the bed made of leaves fallen from the trees on the surface of the ground; so the wood is full of misery.', 'sn': 'सुप्यते पर्णशय्यासु स्वयंभग्नासु भूतले। रात्रिषु श्रमखिन्नेन तस्माद् दुःखमतो वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'With the (supply of) fruits that have fallen from the trees man of self discipline must content himself morning and evening; so the wood, O Sītă, is full of misery.', 'sn': 'अहोरात्रं च संतोषः कर्तव्यो नियतात्मना। फलैर्वृक्षावपतितैः सीते दुःखमतो वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'One has to fast, O Maithili, according to his might, to wear matted hair and bark, to adore the deities and his ancestors according to due rites, every day to serve the guests that come to him, and observing the rules of asceticism, to bathe every day thrice, namely, in the morning, in the mid-day and in the evening; so the wood is full of misery.', 'sn': 'उपवासश्च कर्तव्यो यथा प्राणेन मैथिलि। जटाभारश्च कर्तव्यो वल्कलाम्बरधारणम्॥ देवतानां पितृणां च कर्तव्यं विधिपूर्वकम्। प्राप्तानामतिथीनां च नित्यशः प्रतिपूजनम्॥ कार्यस्त्रिरभिषेकश्च काले काले च नित्यशः। चरतां नियमेनैव तस्माद् दुःखतरं वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'One has to offer presents of flowers collected by his ownself to the altars, O Sītā, according to the rites of the ascetics; so the wood is full of misery.', 'sn': 'उपहारश्च कर्तव्यः कुसुमैः स्वयमाहतैः। आर्षेण विधिना वेद्यां सीते दुःखमतो वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Those that dwell in the forest will have to remain content, having practised moderation in food, O Maithill, with whatever edibles are attainable in the forest; so the wood is full of misery.', 'sn': 'यथालब्धेन कर्तव्यः संतोषस्तेन मैथिलि। यताहारैर्वनचरैः सीते दुःखमतो वनम्॥'}
{'en': 'There are always violent winds, darkness hunger, and great fear; so the wood is full of misery.', 'sn': 'अतीव वातस्तिमिरं बुभुक्षा चास्ति नित्यशः। भयानि च महान्त्यत्र अतो दु:खतरं वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Reptiles, many and of various kinds, creep there on the path, O excellent lady, with haughtiness; so the wood is full of misery.', 'sn': 'सरीसृपाश्च बहवो बहुरूपाश्च भामिनि। चरन्ति पथि ते दात्ततो दुःखतरं वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'And snakes living in the rivers and of crooked course like them, always await the wayfarers, hindering the passers-by: so the wood is full of misery.', 'sn': 'नदीनिलयनाः सर्पा नदीकुटिलगामिनः। तिष्ठन्त्यावृत्य पन्थानमतो दुःखतरं वनम्॥'}

{'en': "Birds, scorpions, insects mosquito's and wild gnats, always disturb the dwellers, O fair one' of the weaker sex; so the wood is full misery.", 'sn': 'पतङ्गा वृश्चिकाः कीटा दंशाश्च मशकैः सह। बाधन्ते नित्यमबले सर्वं दुःखमतो वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'There are trees full of thorns, having their branches moving to and fro, and the kusa and kāsa grasses with thorny blades constantly undulating; so the wood is full misery.', 'sn': 'दुमाः कण्टकिनश्चैव कुशाः काशाश्च भामिनि। वने व्याकुलशाखाग्रास्तेन दुःखमतो वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'There are various physical afflictions and divers fears and great misery consequent upon living in the forest. Anger and desires are to be renounced, the heart is to be set on ascetic austerities, fear in the fearful objects is to be cast off; so the wood is full of misery.', 'sn': 'कायक्लेशाश्च बहवो भयानि विविधानि च। अरण्यवासे वसतो दुःखमेव सदा वनम्॥ क्रोधलोभौ विमोक्तव्यौ कर्तव्या तपसे मतिः। न भेतव्यं च भेतव्ये दुःखं नित्यमतो वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'You should not therefore go to the forest, it forebodes no good to you. Weighing well, have I concluded that the forest abounds in innumerable evils.', 'sn': 'तदलं ते वनं गत्वा क्षेमं नहि वनं तव। विमृशनिव पश्यामि बहुदोषकरं वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'While the high-souled Rāma, resolved thus not to take Sītā with him to the forest, she, greatly sorry, did not accept his words and spoke to him in the following way.', 'sn': 'वनं तु नेतुं न कृता मतिर्यदा बभूव रामेण तदा महात्मना। न तस्य सीता वचनं चकार तं ततोऽब्रवीद् राममिदं सुदुःखिता॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding Sumali slain and reduced to ashes by Vasu and being assailed by the deities the Räksasa host fled into diverse directions. And collecting all the Rākşasas stood there the highly powerful Meghanāda, enraged, the son of Ravana.', 'sn': 'सुमालिनं हतं दृष्ट्वा वसुना भस्मसात्कृतम्। स्वसैन्यं विद्रुतं चापि लक्षयित्वादितं सुरैः॥ ततः स बलवान्क्रुद्धो रावणस्य सुतस्तदा। निवर्त्य राक्षसान्सन्मेिघनादो व्यवस्थितः॥'}

{'en': 'Like to flaming fire approaching towards forest that great car-warrior encountered the enemies in a precious car coursing at will.', 'sn': 'स रथेन महार्हेण कामगेन महारथः। अभिदुद्राव सेनां तां वनान्यग्निरिव ज्वलन्॥'}

{'en': 'As soon as he, armed with various weapons, entered the field the celestials, at his very sight. And away to all directions.', 'sn': 'ततः प्रविशतस्तस्य विविधायुधधारिणः। विदुद्रुवुर्दिशः सर्वा दर्शनादेव देवताः॥'}

{'en': 'None could stand before him, well-versed in war-fare. Thereupon beholding the deities terrified and pierced with shafts, Indra, the king of gods, said.', 'sn': 'न बभूव तदा कश्चिद्युयुत्सोरस्य संमुखे। सर्वानाविद्ध्य वित्रस्तांस्ततः शक्रोऽब्रवीत्सुरान्।।५'}

{'en': 'Be not afraid, O you celestials; do not fly away; come back to the battle; this my son, who has never been vanquished, goes to battle.', 'sn': 'न भेतव्यं न गन्तव्यं निवर्तध्वं रणे सुराः। एष गच्छति पुत्रो मे युद्धार्थमपराजितः॥'}

{'en': "Thereupon Sakra's son, known as divine Jayanta, proceeded towards the field of action by a wondrous car.", 'sn': 'ततः शक्रसुतो देवो जयन्त इति विश्रुतः। रथेनाद्भुतकल्पेन सङ्ग्रामे सोऽभ्यवर्तत।७।।'}
{'en': "Having encircled Saci's son and encountered Rāvana's son, the deities began to assail him.", 'sn': 'ततस्ते त्रिदशाः सर्वे परिवार्य शचीसुतम्। रावणस्य सुतं युद्धे समासाद्य प्रजनिरे।।।।।'}

{'en': "The encounter between Mahendra's son Jayanta and Rāvana's son Meghanāda was like one between gods and demons.", 'sn': 'तेषां युद्धं समभवत्सदृशं देवरक्षसाम्। महेन्द्रस्य च पुत्रस्य राक्षसेन्द्रसुतस्य च ॥'}

{'en': "Thereupon Rāvana's son began to assail, with shafts feathered in gold, his (Jayanta's) charioteer Gomukha, Mātali's son.", 'sn': 'ततो मातलिपुत्रस्य गोमुखस्य स रावणिः। सारथेः पातयामास शरान्कनकभूषणान्॥'}

{'en': "Sacīs son too, enraged, assailed on all sides, Rāvana's son and his charioteer. And the powerful Rāvani, stricken with ire and with eyes expanded, covered Sakra's son with arrows.", 'sn': 'शचीसुतश्चापि तथा जयन्तस्तस्य सारथिम्। तं चापि रावणिः क्रुद्धः समन्तात्प्रत्यविध्यता ॥ स हि क्रोधसमाविष्टो बली विस्फारितेक्षणः। रावणिः शक्रतनयं शरवर्षैरवाकिरत्॥'}

{'en': "Thereupon Rāvana's son struck the celestial host with thousands of huge mountain summits, Śataghnīs, maces, Prāsas, Prāsas, clubs, daggers, Paraśus and various other sharp pointed weapons.", 'sn': 'ततो नानाप्रहरणाञ्छितधारान्सहस्रशः। पातयामास संक्रुद्धः सुरसैन्येषु रावणिः॥ शतघ्नीमुसलप्रासगदाखङ्गपरश्वधान्। महान्ति गिरिशृङ्गाणि पातयामास रावणिः॥'}

{'en': "Rāvana's son thus striking Indra's army the quarters were enshrouded with darkness by his illusory power.", 'sn': 'ततः प्रव्यथिता लोकाः संजज्ञे च तमस्ततः। तस्य रावणपुत्रस्य शत्रुसैन्यानि निघ्नतः॥'}
{'en': 'Being overpowered with arrows on all sides the celestial army, leaving aside Jayanta, became restless.', 'sn': 'ततस्तदैवतबलं समन्तात्तं शचीसुतम्। बहुप्रकारमस्वस्थमभवच्छरपीडितम्॥'}

{'en': 'The deities or the Rākşasas, they could not recognise one another. And being distressed they ran about on all sides.', 'sn': 'नाभ्यजानन्त चान्योन्यं रक्षो वा देवताथवा। तत्र तत्र विपर्यस्तं समन्तात्परिधावत ॥'}

{'en': 'Being enveloped with darkness and having their senses bewildered the celestials killed their own kith and the Rākṣasas their own men, and others fled away.', 'sn': 'देवा देवानिजघ्नुस्ते राक्षसान्राक्षसास्तथा। संमूढास्तमसा छन्ना व्यद्रवनपरे तथा॥'}

{'en': "In the interim a heroic and powerful Daityachief, Pulomā, be name, taking ſacī's son disappeared.", 'sn': 'एतस्मिन्नन्तरे वीरः पुलोमा नाम वीर्यवान्। दैत्येन्द्रस्तेन संगृह्य शचीपुत्रोऽपवाहितः॥'}

{'en': 'Taking his own grand-son he entered into the ocean, Puloma was his grand-father for by him Śaci was begotten.', 'sn': 'संगृह्य तं तु दौहित्रं प्रविष्टः सागरं तदा। आर्यकः स हि तस्यासीत्पुलोमा येन सा शची।।२०'}

{'en': 'Thinking that Jayanta was slain all the deities greatly sorry and distressed fled away on all sides.', 'sn': 'ज्ञात्वा प्रणाशं तु तदा जयन्तस्याथ देवताः। अप्रहृष्टास्ततः सर्वा व्यथिताः संप्रदुद्रुवुः॥'}

{'en': "Thereupon Rāvana's son, enraged and encircled by his own powerful followers, pursued the celestials emitting loud cries.", 'sn': 'रावणिस्त्वथ संक्रुद्धो बलैः परिवृतः स्वकैः। अभ्यधावत देवांस्तान्मुमोच च महास्वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Not beholding his son and observing the flight of the deities the king of the celestials said to Mātali, “Bring the car."', 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वा प्रणाशं पुत्रस्य दैवतेषु च विद्वतन्। मातलिं चाह देवेशो रथः समुपनीयताम्॥'}
{'en': 'By Mātali was brought, the celestial, highly dreadful, huge and quick-coursing chariot, that was ready.', 'sn': 'स तु दिव्या महाभीमः सज्ज एव महारथः। उपस्थितो मातलिना बाह्यमानो महाजवः॥'}

{'en': '(And he having) ascended the car, the huge clouds, with lightening, being driven by winds, began to emit forth loud mutterings before the chariot.', 'sn': 'ततो मेघा रथे तस्मिंस्तडित्त्वन्तो महाबलाः। अग्रतो वायुचपला नेदुः परमनिःस्वनाः॥'}
{'en': 'The Gandharvas began to play on various instruments and the Apsarās began to dance.', 'sn': 'नानावाद्यानि वाद्यन्त गन्धर्वाश्च समाहिताः। ननृतुश्चाप्सरःसङ्घा निर्याते त्रिदशेश्वरे॥'}

{'en': 'Taking up various weapons, Indra, the king of divinities, set out for the field of action, in the company of Rudras, Vasus, Adityas, the two Asvins and Maruts.', 'sn': 'रुद्रैर्वसुभिरादित्यैरश्विभ्यां समरुद्गणैः। वृतो नानाप्रहरणैर्निर्ययौ त्रिदशाधिपः॥'}

{'en': 'He, having set out for battle, the winds began to blow high, the sun was divested of its brilliance and the huge fire-brands began to send out flames.', 'sn': 'निर्गच्छतस्तु शक्रस्य परुषः पवनो ववौ। भास्करो निष्प्रभश्चैव महोल्काश्च प्रपेदिरे॥'}

{'en': 'In the interval the heroic and the highly powerful Daśagrīva ascended the celestial car, constructed by the Architect of the deities, encircled by the huge-bodied serpents capable of making down erect and by whose breath the battle-field was ablaze.', 'sn': 'एतस्मिन्नन्तरे शूरो दशग्रीवः प्रतापवान्। आरुरोह रथं दिव्यं निर्मितं विश्वकर्मणा।२९।। पन्नगैः सुमहाकायैर्वेष्टितं लोमहर्षणैः। येषां निःश्वासवातेन प्रदीप्तमिव संयुगे॥'}

{'en': 'Surrounded by demons and night-rangers and with the celestial car he encountered Mahendra in the battle-field.', 'sn': 'दैत्यैनिशाचरैश्चैव स रथः परिवारितः। समराभिमुखो दिव्यो महेन्द्रं सोऽभ्यवर्तत॥'}

{'en': "Having desisted his son he himself stood there. And having coming out from the field of action Ravana's son too stood silent.", 'sn': 'पुत्रं तं वारयित्वा तु स्वयमेव व्यवस्थितः। सोऽपि युद्धाद्विनिष्क्रम्य रावणिः समुपाविशत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon there arose an encounter between the Räkşasas and the deities and there began a downpour of weapons in the conflict like clouds.', 'sn': 'ततो युद्धं प्रवृत्तं तु सुराणां राक्षसैः सह। शस्त्राणि वर्षतां तेषां मेघनामिव संयुगे॥'}

{'en': 'The vicious-souled Kumbhakarņa armed with various weapons came you, but he did not know,* O king, with whom the conflict was going on. *For he was asleep till then so he was not acquainted with the particulars war-fare. He used to sleep for six months at a time.', 'sn': 'कुम्भकर्णस्तु दुष्टात्मा नानाप्रहरणोद्यतः। नाज्ञायत तदा राजन्युद्धं केनाभ्यपद्यत॥'}

{'en': 'And by him enraged, the celestials were assailed with his teeth, feet, arms, hands, Saktis, Tomaras and clubs or any weapon whatsoever.', 'sn': 'दन्तैः पादैर्भुजैर्हस्तैः शक्तितोमरमुद्गरैः। येन तेनैव संक्रुद्धस्ताडयामास देवताः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the night-ranger engaged with the highly powerful Rudra and was wounded, in the conflict, with incessant strokes of weapons.', 'sn': 'स तु रुदैर्महाघोरैः संगम्याथ निशाचरः। प्रयुद्धस्तैश्च संग्रामे क्षतः शस्त्रैर्निरन्तरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the Rākşasas army began to fight with Maruts and they were overwhelmed in the encounter with the stroke of various weapons.', 'sn': 'ततस्तद्राक्षसं सैन्यं प्रयुद्धं समरुद्गणैः। रणे विद्रावितं सर्वं नानाप्रहरणैस्तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Some fell down on earth of their carriers in the battle. And they all stood there in a halfsensible mood, some holding the car, some elephants, some asses, some boars, some Piśācamouthed animals and some embracing the Pannagas. And other night-rangers, having their bodies sundered by the deities gave up their being. The Rakşasas being slain and lying down on earth the action appeared wondrous like a painting.', 'sn': 'केचिद्विनिहताः कृत्ताश्चेष्टन्ति स्म महीतले। वाहनेष्ववसक्ताश्च स्थिता एवपारे रणे॥ रथानागान्खराष्ट्रान्पन्नगांस्तुरगांस्तथा। शिशुमारान्वराहांश्च पिशाचवदनानपि॥ तान्समालिङ्गय बाहुभ्यां विष्टब्धाः केचिदुत्थिताः। देवैस्तु शस्त्रसंभिन्ना मनिरे च निशाचराः॥ चित्रकर्म इवाभाति सर्वेषां रणसंप्लवः। निहतानां प्रसुप्तानां राक्षसानां महीबले॥'}

{'en': 'There issued out in the battle-field a river from weapons, having blood for its silent waters and infested with crows and vultures.', 'sn': 'शोणितोदकनिष्पन्दा काकगृध्रसमाकुला। प्रवृत्ता संयुगमुखे शस्त्रग्राहवती नदी॥'}

{'en': 'Having beheld his own army slain by the deities the highly powerful Daśänana, enraged beholding the army slain by gods, entered the ocean of celestial army and slaying the deities in the conflict confronted Sakra.', 'sn': 'एतस्मिन्नन्तरे क्रुद्धो दशग्रीवः प्रतापवान्। निरीक्ष्य तु बलं सर्वं दैवतैर्विनिपातितम्॥ स तं प्रतिविगाह्याशु प्रवृद्धं सैन्यसागरम्। त्रिदशान्समरे निघ्नशक्रमेवाभ्यवर्तत॥'}
{'en': 'Thereupon Śakra took up his huge bow by the twang where-of the ten quarters were filled.', 'sn': 'ततः शक्रो महच्चापं विस्फार्य सुमहास्वनम्। यस्य विस्फारनिर्घोषैः स्तनन्ति स्म दिशो दश।।४५'}

{'en': 'Having unstrung his huge bow Indra struck Răvaņa, on his head, with arrows resembling the flame of fire and the rays of the sun.', 'sn': 'तद्विकृष्य महच्चापमिन्द्रो रावणमूर्धनि। पातयामास स शरान्पावकादित्यवर्चसः॥'}

{'en': 'And the Rākşasa-chief Daśānana, having long arms, also assailed Indra with hundreds of shafts discharged off his bow.', 'sn': 'तथैव च महाबाहुर्दशग्रीवो निशाचरः। शक्रं कार्मुकविभ्रष्टैः शरवर्षैरवाकिरत्॥'}

{'en': 'They having been thus engaged with each other with the downpour of dreadful shafts, all the quarters were filled with darkness and in consequence thereof nothing was visible.', 'sn': 'प्रयुध्यतोरथ तयोर्बाणवषैः समन्ततः। नाज्ञायत तदा किंचित्सर्वं हि तमसा वृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then as the mighty king was lying down in this unbeseeming and improper guise, like Yayāti dropped from the celestial, that lady, personating the ruin of the race, not fearing public odium, who had discerned danger from Rāma to Bharata, not having attained her wish, again addressed the monarch, concerning the boon he had promised to her.', 'sn': 'अतदर्ह महाराजं शयानमतथोचितम्। ययातिमिव पुण्यान्ते देवलोकात् परिच्युतम्॥ अनर्थरूपासिद्धार्था ह्यभीता भयदर्शिनी। पुनराकारयामास तमेव वरमङ्गना॥'}

{'en': 'You describe yourself, O mighty monarch, as speaking the truth and firm in vow. Why then do you hesitate to confer this boon on me?', 'sn': 'त्वं कत्थसे महाराज सत्यवादी दृढव्रतः। मम चेदं वरं कस्माद् विधारयितुमिच्छसि॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed by Kaikeyi king Dasaratha, remaining stupefied for a while thus answered her in wrath.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तस्तु कैकेय्या राजा दशरथस्तदा। प्रत्युवाच ततः क्रुद्धो मुहूर्तं विह्वलनिव॥'}

{'en': 'O ignoble one! O enemy of mine! On my being dead and that chief of men, Rāma, repairing to the woods, do you, yours wish attained, become happy.', 'sn': 'मृते मयि गते रामे वनं मनुजपुङ्गवे। हन्तानार्ये ममामित्रे सकामा सुखिनी भव॥'}

{'en': "When in heaven, questioning me as to Rāma's welfare, the celestials, learning of his banishment to the woods, will tax me on this score, how shall I also bear that reproach of theirs?", 'sn': 'स्वर्गेऽपि खलु रामस्य कुशलं दैवतैरहम्। प्रत्यादेशादभिहितं धारयिष्ये कथं बत॥'}

{'en': "If I shall truthfully say I have sent Rāma to the woods for compassing Kaikeyi's pleasure, that will count for a falsehood.", 'sn': 'कैकेय्याः प्रियकामेन रामः प्रव्राजितो वनम्। यदि सत्यं ब्रवीम्येतत् तदसत्यं भविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Sonless first, I have obtained the exceedingly energetic and mighty Rāma by great pain, how can I then renounce him?', 'sn': 'अपुत्रेण मया पुत्रः श्रमेण महता महान्। रामो लब्धो महातेजाः स कथं त्यज्यते मया॥'}

{'en': "How shall I banish Rāma having eyes resembling lotus' petals, who is heroic, and accomplished and of subdued anger, and forgiving.", 'sn': 'शूरश्च कृतविद्यश्च जितक्रोधः क्षमापरः। कथं कमलपत्राक्षो मया रामो विवास्यते।।।।'}

{'en': 'How shall I dismiss to Dandaka the charming Rāma of dark blue hue like that of a blue lotus, possessed of mighty arms, and having great strength?', 'sn': 'कथमिन्दीवरश्यामं दीर्घबाहुं महाबलम्। अभिराममहं रामं स्थापयिष्यामि दण्डकान्॥'}

{'en': 'How shall I behold the intelligent Rāma in evil plight, who has never known suffering, and has always enjoyed felicity?', 'sn': 'सुखानामुचितस्यैव दुःखैरनुचितस्य च। दुःखं नामानुपश्येयं कथं रामस्य धीमतः॥'}
{'en': 'If without inflicting injury upon Rāma, I meet with death, I shall then attain happiness.', 'sn': 'यदि दुःखमकृत्वा तु मम संक्रमणं भवेत्। अदुःखार्हस्य रामस्य ततः सुखमवाप्नुयाम्॥'}

{'en': 'O cruel Kaikeyi, O you of evil purpose, why do you do this wrong to my beloved Rāma having truth for prowess? If I banish Rāma, an unparalleled obloquy will surely darken (my fair fame).', 'sn': 'नृशंसे पापसंकल्पे रामं सत्यपराक्रमम्। किं विप्रियेण कैकेयि प्रियं योजयसे मम॥'}

{'en': 'As king Dasaratha was bewailing thus with a heart wrought up with grief, the sun set and night came on.', 'sn': 'अकीर्तिरतुला लोके ध्रुवं परिभविष्यति। तथा विलपतस्तस्य परिभ्रमितचेतसः॥ अस्तमभ्यागमत् सूर्यो रजनी चाभ्यवर्तत।'}

{'en': 'But although crested with the lunar disc, the night failed to bring comfort to the king, distressed, and indulging in grief.', 'sn': 'सा त्रियामा तदार्तस्य चन्द्रमण्डलमण्डिता॥ राज्ञो विलपमानस्य न व्यभापत शर्वरी।'}
{'en': 'Then the old king Dasaratha, with his eyes fixed at the sky, sighing hot, lamented in this strain.', 'sn': 'सदैवोष्णं विनिःश्वस्य वृद्धो दशरथो नृपः॥ विललापाविद् दुःखं गगनासक्तलोचनः।'}

{'en': 'O night studded with stars, I beseech you, let not the morning appear. Do you, O gentle one, do me this kindness. I do thus clasp my hands (by way of supplication.)', 'sn': 'ततो राजा न प्रभातं त्वयेच्छामि निशे नक्षत्रभूषिते॥ क्रियतां मे दया भद्रे मयायं रचितोऽञ्जलिः।'}

{'en': 'Or do you speedily repair for I do not wish to see the hated and relentless Kaikeyi, who has brought this calamity upon me.', 'sn': 'अथवा गम्यतां शीघ्रं नाहमिच्छामि निघृणाम्॥ नृशंसां केकयों द्रष्टुं यत्कृते व्यसनं मम ।'}

{'en': 'Having spoken thus, the kind conversant with the duties of Sovereigns again endeavoured to propitiate Kaikeyī, saying.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा कैकेयीं संयताञ्जलिः॥ प्रसादयामास पुनः कैकेयी राजधर्मवित्।'}

{'en': 'O noble dame, do you show favour to me, who am of honest ways, who am distressed, who have made myself yours, who have finished his life, and who, in especial, am your king.', 'sn': 'साधुवृत्तस्य दीनस्य त्वद्गतस्य गतायुषः॥ प्रसादः क्रियतां भद्रे देवि राज्ञो विशेषतः।'}

{'en': 'That I have spoken you thus was because, O you of shapely hips, I had been deprived of my senses (through grief). O girl, do you show your favour to me, be generous, be propitious.', 'sn': 'शून्ये न खलु सुश्रोणि मयेदं समुदाहृतम्॥ कुरु साधुप्रसादं मे बाले सहृदया ह्यसि।'}

{'en': 'Let my Rāma obtain the kingdom in fact conferred by you. Thereupon, O you having the outer corner of your eyes of dark blue hue, you will attain high fame (among men.)', 'sn': 'प्रसीद देवी रामो मे त्वद्दत्तं राज्यमव्ययम्॥ लभतामसितापाने यशः परमवाप्स्यसि।'}

{'en': 'O you of well-developed hips, do you do this act of benefit to me and Ráma and the people and the superiors, and Bharata.', 'sn': 'मम रामस्य लोकस्य गुरुणां भरतस्य च। प्रियमेतद् गुरुश्रोणि कुरु चारुमुखेक्षणे॥'}

{'en': 'Having heard the exceedingly piteous words of her husband, the king of pure sentiment, who was distressed, with his eye rendered coppery and flowing with tears, that wicked minded and merciless woman spoke not.', 'sn': 'विशुद्धभावस्य हि दुष्टभावा दीनस्य ताम्राश्रुकलस्य राज्ञः। श्रुत्वा विचित्रं करुणं विलापं भर्तुर्नुशंसा न चकार वाक्यम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereat seeing that his favourite dissatisfied wife persisted in urging the banishment of his son, the king struck with grief, again fell down to the earth, senseless.', 'sn': 'ततः स राजा पुनरेव मूर्च्छितः प्रियामतुष्टां प्रतिकूलभाषिणीम्। समीक्ष्य पुत्रस्य विवासनं प्रति क्षितौ विसंज्ञो निपपात दुःखितः॥'}

{'en': 'As the wise king afflicted with sorrow was sighing hot and hard, the night passed away Then as the eulogists attempted to sung his praises for awakening him, he prohibited them to do so.', 'sn': 'इतीव राज्ञो व्यथितस्य सा निशा जगाम घोरं श्वसतो मनस्विनः। विबोध्यमानः प्रतिबोधनं तदा निवारयामास स राजसत्तमः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing those sorrowful words of the Brāhmaṇa, Rāma was greatly sorry and sent for Vasistha, Vamadeva, his brothers, citizens and councillors.', 'sn': 'तथा तु करुणं तस्य द्विजस्य परिदेवनम्। शुश्राव राघवः सर्वं दुःखशोकसमन्वितम्॥ स दुःखेन च संतप्तो मन्त्रिणस्तानुपाह्वयत्। वसिष्ठं वामदेवं च भ्रातृ॑श्च सह नैगमान्॥'}

{'en': "There upon having entered the apartment in the company of Vasiştha, eight Brāhmaṇas blessed the king Rāma, resembling a celestial, saying 'may victory crown you.'", 'sn': 'ततो द्विजा वसिष्ठेन सार्धमष्टौ प्रवेशिताः। राजानं देवसंकाशं वर्धस्वेति ततोऽब्रुवन्॥'}

{'en': 'Markandeya, Maudgalya, Vamadeva, Kashyapa, Katyayana, Javali, Gautama, and Nārada, these eight leading Brāhmaṇas having takes their seats, Rāma with folded hands, saluted them. And he showed due civilities towards his minister, citizens, Rșis and all others. There upon all the highly effulgent Rșis being accommodated with seats Råma narrated duly before them the account of the Brāhmaṇa and said. This Brāhmaṇa is waiting at the Palace-gate.', 'sn': 'मार्कण्डेयोऽथ मौद्गल्यो वामदेवश्च काश्यपः। कात्यायनोऽथ जाबालिगौतमो नारदस्तथा॥ एते द्विजर्षभाः सर्वे आसनेषूपवेशिताः। महर्षीन्समनुप्राप्तानभिवाद्य कृताञ्जलिः॥ मन्त्रिणो नैगमाश्चैव यथार्हमनुकूलिताः। तेषां समुपविष्टानां सर्वेषां दीप्ततेजसाम्॥ राघवः सर्वमाचष्टे द्विजोऽयमुपरोधति।'}
{'en': 'Hearing those words of the poorly king, Narada, in the presence of all other Rsis, replied.', 'sn': 'तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राज्ञो दीनस्य नारदः॥ प्रत्युवाच शुभं वाक्यमृषीणां संनिधौ स्वयम्।'}

{'en': 'Hear, o king, why this boy has met with untimely death. And hearing this, O descendant or Raghu, do you settle what you think proper.', 'sn': 'शृणु राजन्यथाकाले प्राप्तो बालस्य संक्षयः॥ श्रुत्वा कर्तव्यतां राजन्कुरुष्वरघुनन्दन।'}

{'en': 'O king, in the golden age, only the Brahmanas used to engage in asceticism. At that age save the Brāhmaṇas no other caste used to lead the life of an anchoret.', 'sn': 'पुरा कृतयुगे राजन्ब्राह्मणा वै तपस्विनः।।।। अब्राह्मणस्तदा राजन्न तपस्वी कथंचन।'}

{'en': 'And for this, the Brāhmaṇas were the highest caste, effulgent in asceticism, asceticism, shorn shorn of ignorance, above death and conversant with three ages.', 'sn': 'तस्मिन्युगे प्रज्वलिते ब्रह्मभूते त्वनावृते॥ अमृत्यवस्तदा सर्वे जज्ञिरे दीर्घदर्शिनः।'}

{'en': "There upon at the end of the golden age, Brāhmaṇa's understanding became loose and the Tretā Yuga set in. At this age Kşatriyas, gifted with the power acquired by pristine asceticism, were born. And those men, intent upon austere penances, that were born in the Tretā age, were more powerful and greater devotees than those in the former age.", 'sn': 'ततस्त्रेतायुगं नाम मानवानां वपुष्मताम्॥ क्षत्रिया यत्र जायन्ते पूर्वेण तपसान्विताः। वीर्येण तपसा चैव तेऽधिकाः पूर्वजन्मनि॥ मानवा ये महात्मानस्तत्र त्रेतायुगे युगे।'}

{'en': 'In the golden age the Brāhmaṇas were more powerful than the Kșatriyas. But in the Tretā age the Brāhmaṇas and the Ksatriyas were equally powerful.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्म क्षत्रं च तत्सर्वं यत्पूर्वमवरं च यत्॥ युगयोरुभयोरासीत्समवीर्यसमन्वितम्।'}

{'en': 'Thus in the Tretā age, not beholding prominence of the Brāhmaṇas greater than that of the Kşatriyas, Manu and other religious leaders of the time composed the Sastra describing and setting in the four divisions of castes.', 'sn': 'अपश्यन्तस्तु ते सर्वे विशेषमधिकं ततः॥ स्थापनं चक्रिरे तत्र चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य संमतम्।'}

{'en': 'In this wise the Tretā age was prolific with virtues of the four Varņas, and many pious sacrifices and was shorn of iniquities. But being attacked a little with iniquity, one portion of sin appeared on earth. And growing impious people of sin appeared on earth. And growing impious people lost their strength.', 'sn': 'तस्मिन्युगे प्रज्वलिते धर्मभूते ह्यनावृते॥ अधर्मः पादमेकं तु पातयत्पृथिवीतले। अधर्मेण हि संयुक्तस्तेजो मन्दं भविष्यति।।१६'}

{'en': "And for houses and farms that were the property of the former age, people of the Tretā Yuga were possessed by envy, the outcome of the quality of darkness. And with the treading of impiety on earth during Tretā, the soiled sin of untruth appeared. And this iniquity stretching one footstep, the lease of people's lives, for sins, became limited.", 'sn': 'आमिषं यच्च पूर्वेषां राजसं च मलं भृशम्। अनृतं नाम तद्भूतं क्षिप्तेन पृथिवीतले॥ अनृतं पातयित्वा तु पादमेकमधर्मतः। ततः प्रादुष्कृतं पूर्वमायुषः परिनिष्ठितम्॥'}

{'en': 'And the sin of untruth descending on earth, people, to a void the extinction of life in consequence thereof, became truthful and engaged in many pious observances.', 'sn': 'पातिते त्वनृते तस्मिनधर्मेण महीतले। शुभान्येवाचरैल्लोकः सत्यधर्मपरायणः॥'}

{'en': 'During the Tretă age the Brāhmaṇas and Kș atriyas engaged in austere penances and the Vaiśyas and Sūdras engaged in serving them.', 'sn': 'त्रेतायुगे च वर्तन्ते ब्राह्मणाः क्षत्रियाश्च ये। तपोऽतप्यन्त ते सर्वे शुश्रूषामपरे जनाः॥'}

{'en': 'And the greatest piety of the Vaiśyas and Śūdras at that time consisted of serving the Brāhmaṇas and Ksatriyas and specially for the Śūdras the highest religion was to serve people of all Varnas.', 'sn': 'स्वधर्मः परमस्तेषां वैश्यशूद्रं तदागमत्। पूजां च सर्ववर्णानां शूद्राश्चनुर्विशेषतः॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of kings, at the end of the Tretă age, Vaiśyas and Śūdras being fully overpowered by the sin of untruth, the Brāhmaṇas and the Kșatriyas also grew feeble.', 'sn': 'एतस्मिन्नन्तरे तेषामधर्मे चानृते च ह। ततः पूर्वे पुनर्वासमगमन्नृपसत्तम॥'}
{'en': 'And the second foot of impiety being ushered into the world the Dvāpara age set in.', 'sn': 'ततः पादमधर्मस्य द्वितीयमवतारयत्। ततो द्वापरसंख्या सा युगस्य समजायत॥'}
{'en': 'O foremost of men, during this age two legs of piety being cut off, impiety and untruth multiplies.', 'sn': 'तस्मिन्द्वापरसंख्ये तु वर्तमाने युगक्षये। अधर्मश्चानृतं चैव ववृधे पुरुषर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'And in Yuga named Dvāpara the Vaisyas engaged in devout penances. In this wise in three ages the three Varnas gradually engaged in ascetic performances.', 'sn': 'अस्मिन्द्वापरसंख्याने तपो वैश्यान्समाविशत्। त्रिभ्यो युगेभ्यस्त्रीन्वर्णान्क्रमाद्वै तप आविशत्॥'}

{'en': 'The piety of asceticism by Yugas gradually became established in three Varmas, But, O foremost of men, in these three Yugas the Sūdras were not entitled to the virtues of devout penances.', 'sn': 'त्रिभ्यो युगेभ्यस्त्रीन्वर्णान्धर्मश्च परिनिष्ठितः। न शूद्रो लभते धर्म युगतस्तु नरर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of men, the degraded caste, the Śūdras, during your rege me, have engaged in austere penances. And in the Kali Yuga asceticism shall be established in the Sūdras.', 'sn': 'हीनवर्णो नृपश्रेष्ठ तप्यते सुमहत्तपः। भविष्यच्छूद्रयोन्यां हि तपश्चर्या कलौ युगे॥'}

{'en': 'O king, even in Davāpara, devout penances for Śūdras were considered as impiety, what to speak of the Tretāage. O king, one Śūdras, under the influence of vicious understanding, has begun devout penances within your kingdom. And for that reason this boy has met with death.', 'sn': 'अधर्मः परमो राजन्द्वापरे शूद्रजन्मनः। स वै विषयपर्यन्ते तव राजन्महातपाः॥ अद्य तप्यति दुर्बुद्धिस्तेन बालवधो ह्ययम्। यो ह्यधर्ममकार्य वा विषये पार्थिवस्य तु॥'}

{'en': 'Calamity sets in that kingdom where a vicious-minded person commits an iniquity and that vicious wight and the king forsooth speedily repair to hell.', 'sn': 'करोति चाश्रीमूलं तत्पुरे वा दुर्मतिर्नरः। क्षिप्रं च नरकं याति स च राजा न संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'The king, who piously govern his subjects, receive the sixth portion of there study asceticism and good actions.', 'sn': 'अधीतस्य च तप्तस्य कर्मणः सुकृतस्य च। षष्ठं भजति भागं तु प्रजा धर्मेण पालयन्॥'}

{'en': 'While the king is entitled to the sixth portion of everything why should he not fully protect his subjects? Therefore, O chief of men, do you bring all informations of your kingdom. And be then studious to repress vices wherever you shall find them.', 'sn': 'षड्भागस्य च भोक्तासौ रक्षते न प्रजाः कथम्। स त्वं पुरुषशार्दूल मार्गस्व विषयं स्वकम्॥ दुष्कृतं यत्र पश्येथास्तत्र यत्नं समाचर।'}

{'en': 'And by that, O foremost of men, the piety of the subjects shall be increased, the lease of their life shall be prolonged and this boy shall regain his life.', 'sn': 'एवं चेद्धर्मवृद्धिश्च नृणां चायुर्विवर्धनम्। भविष्यति नरश्रेष्ठ बालस्यास्य च जीवितम्॥'}

{'en': "Then the spies communicated to Lankā's lord news concerning Rāghava and his host stationed at the mount Suvela.", 'sn': 'ततस्तमक्षोभ्यबलं लङ्काधिपतये चराः। सुवेले राघवं शैले निविष्टं प्रत्यवेदयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing the words of the spies, that Rama, accompanied by a mighty army, had arrived (there), Rāvana was a little agitated and spoke to Sardula.', 'sn': 'चाराणां रावणः श्रुत्वा प्राप्तं रामं महाबलम्। जातोद्वेगोऽभवत्किचिच्छार्दूलं वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥'}
