{'en': 'Your colour has changed its natural aspect, and O ranger of the night, you look poorly. Did not come under the control of the wrathful foes?', 'sn': 'अयथावच्च ते वर्णो दीनश्चासि निशाचर। नासि कच्चिदमित्राणां क्रुद्धानां वशमागतः॥'}
{'en': 'Thus ordered by him, then (Sārdula), bewildered by fear, addressed that tiger of a Raksasa, saying.', 'sn': 'इति ते नानुशिष्टस्तु वाचं मन्दमुदीरयन्। तदा राक्षसशार्दूलं शार्दूलो भयविक्लवः॥'}

{'en': 'Those powerful monkeys, o king, puissant, strong, and protected by Rāghava, are incapable of being ranged (by us). or', 'sn': 'न ते चारयितुं शक्या राजन्वानरपुंगवाः। विक्रान्ता बलवन्तश्च राघवेण च रक्षिताः॥'}

{'en': 'They cannot be conversed with interrogated. All around, the courses are kept by monkeys resembling hills.', 'sn': 'नापि संभाषितुं शक्याः संप्रश्नोऽत्र न लभ्यते। सर्वतो रक्ष्यते पन्था वानरैः पर्वतोपमैः॥'}

{'en': 'As soon as I entered, and was scanning that host, I was discovered. And forcibly taken by the Rākşasa, I was pulled by them hither and thither.', 'sn': 'प्रविष्टमात्रे ज्ञातोऽहं बले तस्मिन्विचारिते। बलादृहीतो रक्षोभिर्बहुधास्मि विचारितः॥'}

{'en': 'And furiously assailed by the monkeys with thighs, clenched fists, teeth, and palms, I was dragged in the midst of the army by the enraged monkeys.', 'sn': 'जानुभिर्मुष्टिभिर्दन्तैस्तलैश्चाभिहतो भृशम्। परिणीतोऽस्मि हरिभिर्बलमध्ये अमर्षणैः॥'}

{'en': 'And, after having been taken all about, I was (at length) taken before Rāma, bleeding, with my limbs showing sorry work, and my senses swimming and paralysed.', 'sn': 'परिणीय च सर्वत्र नीतोऽहं रामसंसदि। रुधिरस्राविदीनाङ्गो विह्वलश्चलितेन्द्रियः॥'}

{'en': "And, having been belaboured by the monkeys, I, on craving his kindness with joined hands, was, at his pleasure, rescued by Rāghava, with, Don't, don't!", 'sn': 'हरिभिर्वध्यमानश्च याचमानः कृताञ्जलिः। राघवेण परित्रातो मामेति च यदृच्छया॥'}

{'en': 'Having filled up the deep with rocks and crags, Rāma equipped with weapons, stay, occupying the gate of Lanka.', 'sn': 'एष शैलशिलाभिस्तु पूरयित्वा महार्णवम्। द्वारमाश्रित्य लङ्काया रामस्तिष्ठति सायुधः।।११'}

{'en': 'And, letting me off, that one of suspassing vigour, surrounded by monkeys, and, arranging his forces in the Garuda fashion, advance upon Lanka.', 'sn': 'गरुडव्यूहमास्थाय सर्वतो हरिभिर्वृतः। मां विसृज्य महातेजा लङ्कामेवातिवर्तते॥'}

{'en': 'He draw nigh to the wall. Therefore, do one of these things in preference to the other, either render back Sītā, or give him battle.', 'sn': 'पुरा प्राकारमायाति क्षिप्रमेकतरं कुरु। सीतां वापि प्रयच्छाशु युद्धं वापि प्रदीयताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing this, Ravana, lord of Raksasas, then reflecting in his mind, spoke to Sārdula these pregnant words.', 'sn': 'मनसा तत्तदा प्रेक्ष्य तच्छुत्वा राक्षसाधिपः। शार्दूलं सुमहद्वाक्यमथोवाच स रावणः॥'}

{'en': 'Even if the gods, Gandharvas, and Dānavas should array themselves against me, Sītā I shall not give, from fear of all creatures.', 'sn': 'यदि मां प्रतियुद्ध्यन्ते देवगन्धर्वदानवाः। नैव सीता प्रदास्यामि सर्वलोकभयादपि॥'}

{'en': 'Having said this, that exceedingly energetic one again said,You have ranged this army. Who here among the monkeys are heroic?', 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा रावणः पुनरब्रवीत्। चरिता भवता सेना केऽत्र शूराः प्लवंगमाः॥'}

{'en': 'O amiable one, what is their potency? And what are those monkeys that are hard to approach, like? And, O you of fair vows, whose sons and grandsons are they? Truly relate all this (to me).', 'sn': 'किंप्रभाः कीदृशाः सौम्य वानरा ये दुरासदाः। कस्य पुत्राश्च पौत्राश्च तत्त्वमाख्याहि सुव्रत॥'}

{'en': 'Having ascertained their strength and weakness, I shall in this matter adopt my course. Those who wish for fight, certainly take account of all this.', 'sn': 'तथात्र प्रतिपत्स्यापि ज्ञात्वा तेषां बलाबलम्। अवश्यं खलु संख्यानं कर्तव्यं युद्धमिच्छता।।१८'}
{'en': 'Thus addressed by Rāvana, Sārdula—best of spies-thus began to speak in the presence of Ravana.', 'sn': 'अथैवमुक्तः शार्दूलो रावणेनोत्तमश्चरः। इदं वचनमारेभे वक्तुं रावणसंनिधौ॥'}

{'en': 'O king, that unconquerable one in fight, Jāmbavān, is well known as the son Gadgada, king of bears.', 'sn': 'अथर्भरजसः पुत्रो युधि राजन्सुदुर्जयः। गद्गदस्याथ पुत्रोऽत्र जाम्बवानिति विश्रुतः॥'}

{'en': "The other son of Gadgada is the son of Śakra's preceptor. By which son, single-handed, was done immense oppression to the Rākṣasa.", 'sn': 'गद्गदस्याथ पुत्रोऽन्यो गुरुपुत्रः शतक्रतोः। कदनं यस्य पुत्रेण कृतमेकेन रक्षसाम्॥'}

{'en': 'The righteous and puissant Sușeņa is the son of Dharma. And the mild monkey, Dadhimukha, O king, is the son of Soma. 1. Righteousness. 2. Moon.', 'sn': 'सुषेणश्चात्र धर्मात्मा पुत्रो धर्मस्य वीर्यवान्। सौम्यः सोमात्मजश्चात्र राजन्दधिमुखः कपिः॥'}

{'en': 'And Sumukha, Durmukha and the monkey, vegadarcin (resembling) Death himself, were for certain begot by the Self-create in the shape of a monkey.* *Another meaning is, “The monkey, Vegadarsi who is death himself in the shape of a monkey." But I give the acceptable sense.', 'sn': 'सुमुखो दुर्मुखश्चात्र वेगदर्शी च वानरः। मृत्युर्वानररूपेण नूनं सृष्टः स्वयंभुवा॥'}

{'en': 'Nīla himself is the son of the bearer of sacrificial oblations;* and Hanumán is famed as the son of the Wind-god. * Fire.', 'sn': 'पुत्रो हुतवहस्यात्र नीलः सेनापतिः स्वयम्। अनिलस्य तु पुत्रोऽत्र हनूमानिति विश्रुतः॥'}

{'en': 'The irrepressible and youthful Angada is the grandson of Śakra. And the lusty Mainda and Dvivida are sprung from Aśvi.', 'sn': 'नप्ता शक्रस्य दुर्धर्षो बलवानङ्गदो युवा। मैन्दश्च द्विविदश्चोभौ बलिनावश्विसंभवौ॥'}

{'en': 'And five are the sons of Vaivasvata, resembling the Reaper himself, Gaya, Gavāks a, gavaya, Sarabha and Gandhamādana.', 'sn': 'पुत्रा वैवस्वतस्याथ पञ्च कालान्तकोपमाः। गजो गवाक्षो गवयः शरभो गन्धमादनः॥'}

{'en': 'But I can not enumerate the rest, ten koțis of heroic monkeys-all sons of deities—burning for battle.', 'sn': 'दश वानरकोट्यश्च शूराणां युद्धकाक्षिणाम्। श्रीमतां देवपुत्राणां शेष नाख्यातुमुत्सहे॥'}
{'en': "And this is Dasaratha's son—this you resembling a lion, who slew Düşana and Khara and Triſiras.", 'sn': 'पुत्रो दशरथस्यैष सिंहसंहननो युवा। दूषणो निहतो येन स्वरश्च त्रिशिरास्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'There breathes none on Earth that is like to Rāma in prowess, by whom was slain Virādha and Kabandha, resembling the Destroyer.', 'sn': 'नास्ति रामस्य सदृशो विक्रमे भुवि कश्चन। विराधो निहतो येन कबन्धश्चान्तकोपमः॥'}

{'en': 'No person can on earth describe the virtues of Rāma; by whom have been slain all those Rākşasas that had gone to Janasthāna.', 'sn': 'वक्तुं न शक्तो रामस्य गुणान्कश्चिन्नरः क्षितौ। जनस्थानगता येन तावन्तो राक्षसा हताः॥'}

{'en': 'Here also is the virtuous Lakşmaņa, like to the foremost of elephants, coming in the way of whose shafts, even Vasava does not live.', 'sn': 'लक्ष्मणश्चात्र धर्मात्मा मातङ्गानामिवर्षभः। यस्य बाणपथं प्राप्य न जीवेदपि वासवः॥'}

{'en': "And here are ſveta and Jyotirmukha, sprung from Vāskara's self; and the monkey Hemakūta is the son of Varuna.", 'sn': 'श्वेतो ज्योतिर्मुखश्चात्र भास्करस्यात्मसंभवौ। वरुणस्याथ पुत्रोऽथ हेमकूटः प्लवंगमः॥'}

{'en': 'The heroic Nalabest of monkeys, is the son of Viśvakarmă. And powerful and impetuous, Durdhara is the son of Vasu.', 'sn': 'विश्वकर्मसुतो वीरो नलः प्लवगसत्तमः। विक्रान्तो वेगवानत्र वसुपुत्रः स दुर्धरः॥'}

{'en': 'That foremost of Rāksasas, Vibhisana, your brother, engaged in the welfare of Raghava, has laid seige to Lankā.', 'sn': 'राक्षसानां वरिष्ठश्च तव भ्राता विभीषणः। प्रतिगृह्य पुरीं लङ्कां राघवस्य हिते रतः॥'}

{'en': 'Thus have I described to you the entire monkey host stationed in mount Suvela. As for what remain to be done, you are the master.', 'sn': 'इति सर्वं समाख्यातं तथा वै वानरं बलम्। सुवेलेऽधिष्ठितं शैले शेषकार्ये भवान्गतिः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing those words of the intelligent Kusanābha, his hundred daughters touching his feet with their heads, said,', 'sn': 'तस्य तद् वचनं श्रुत्वा कुशनाभस्य धीमतः। शिरोभिश्चरणो स्पृष्ट्वा कन्याशतमभाषत॥'}

{'en': 'O king, that life of all, the Air, was desirous of overcoming us, having recourse to an improper way; nor did he regard morality.', 'sn': 'वायुः सर्वात्मको राजन् प्रधर्षयितुमिच्छति। अशुभं मार्गमास्थाय न धर्मं प्रत्यवेक्षते॥'}

{'en': 'We have a father, good betide you; and we live at ease. Do you ask our father about it, if he consent conferring us on you.', 'sn': 'पितृमत्यः स्म भद्रं ते स्वच्छन्दे न वयं स्थिताः। पितरं नो वृणीष्व त्वं यदि नो दास्यते तव॥'}

{'en': "But that wicked wight did not listen to our words; and as we were saying this, were we roughly handled by him.'", 'sn': 'तेन पापानुबन्धेन वचनं न प्रतीच्छता। एवं ब्रुवन्त्यः सर्वाः स्म वायुनाभिहता भृशम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing those words of theirs, the highly pious and puissant king addressed his hundred beautiful daughters, saying', 'sn': 'तासां तु वचनं श्रुत्वा राजा परमधार्मिकः। प्रत्युवाच महातेजाः कन्याशतमनुत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'You have displayed a signal example of that forgiveness which is fit to be followed by the forbearing; and that you have unanimously regarded the honour of my house, also conduces to your praise.', 'sn': 'क्षान्तं क्षमावतां पुत्र्यः कर्तव्यं सुमहत् कृतम्। ऐकमत्यमुपागम्य कुलं चावेक्षितं मम॥'}

{'en': 'Alike to men and women, forbearance is an ornament. And difficult it is for one to exercise that forbearance, specially in respect of the celestials. And may every descendant of mine possess forbearance like to yours!', 'sn': 'अलंकारो हि नारीणां क्षमा तु पुरुषस्य वा। दुष्करं तच्च वै क्षान्तं त्रिदशेषु विशेषतः॥ यादृशी वः क्षमा पुत्र्यः सर्वासामविशेषतः।'}

{'en': 'Forbearance is charity; forbearance is truth; forbearance, O daughters, is sacrifice; forbearance is fame; forbearance is virtue, you, the universe is established in forbearance;', 'sn': 'क्षमा दानं क्षमा सत्यं क्षमा यज्ञाश्च पुत्रिकाः। क्षमा यशः क्षमा धर्मः क्षमायां विष्ठितं जगत्।'}

{'en': 'Then dismissing his daughters, the king endowed with the prowess of celestials, and versed in counsel, began to consult with his counsellors about the bestowal of his daughters, in respect of time and place and person and equability of lineage.', 'sn': 'विसृज्य कन्याः काकुत्स्थ राजा त्रिदशविक्रमः॥ मन्त्रज्ञो मन्त्रयामास प्रदानं सह मन्त्रिभिः। देशे काले च कर्तव्यं सदृशे प्रतिपादनम्॥'}

{'en': 'It came to pass that at this time, an ascetic named Culi, highly effulgent, with his vital fluid under control, and of pure practices, was performing Brāhma austerities.', 'sn': 'एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु चूली नाम महाद्युतिः। ऊर्ध्वरेताः शुभाचारो ब्राह्मं तप उपागमत्॥'}

{'en': "And as the saint was engaged in austerities, good betide you, Urmila's daughter named Somada-a Gandharvi-ministered to him.", 'sn': 'तपस्यन्तमृषिं तत्र गन्धर्वी पर्युपासते। सोमदा नाम भद्रं ते ऊर्मिलातनया तदा ॥'}

{'en': 'And in all humility that virtuous one for a definite period was engaged in ministering to him. And thereat, her spiritual guide was gratified with her.', 'sn': 'सा च तं प्रणता भूत्वा शुश्रूषणपरायणा। उवास काले धर्मिष्ठा तस्यास्तुष्टोऽभवद् गुरुः॥'}

{'en': 'And, O descendant of Raghu, once he said to her, I am gratified, good betide you! What good shall I render you?', 'sn': 'स च तां कालयोगेन प्रोवाच रघुनन्दन। परितुष्टोऽस्मि भद्रं ते किं कमि तव प्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, concluding that the ascetic was gratified, the Gandharvi, cognizant of words, exceedingly delighted, sweetly addressed that one versed in speech.', 'sn': 'परितुष्टं मुनिं ज्ञात्वा गन्धर्वी मधुरस्वरम्। उवाच परमप्रीता वाक्यज्ञा वाक्यकोविदम्॥'}

{'en': 'You are furnished with the Brāhma marks, art sprung from Brahmă, and art of mighty austerities. I desire of you a righteous son endowed with the Brāhma ascetic virtues.', 'sn': 'लक्ष्म्या समुदितो ब्राह्मया ब्रह्मभूतो महातपाः। ब्राह्मण तपसा युक्तं पुत्रमिच्छामि धार्मिकम्॥'}

{'en': "I am without a husband, good betide you, and I am no one's wife. Upon me who is your servant you should confer such a son by help of Brāhma means.", 'sn': 'अपतिश्चास्मि भद्रं ते भार्या चास्मि न कस्यचित्। ब्राह्मणोपगतायाश्च दातुमर्हसि मे सुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, well pleased with her, Cūlina conferred upon her an excellent Brāhma mindbegotten son, named Brahmadatta,', 'sn': 'तस्याः प्रसन्नो ब्रह्मर्षिर्ददौ ब्राह्ममनुत्तमम्। ब्रह्मदत्त इति ख्यातं मानसं चूलिनः सुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'And that king, Brahmadatta, founded the flourishing city of Kampilya, even as the sovereign of the celestials founded the celestial regions.', 'sn': 'स राजा ब्रह्मदत्तस्तु पुरीमध्यवसत् तदा। काम्पिल्यां परया लक्ष्म्या देवराजो यथा दिवम्॥'}

{'en': 'And, O Kākutstha, the righteous king Kusanābha finally decided on conferring his hundred daughters upon Brahmadatta.', 'sn': 'स बुद्धिं कृतवान् राजा कुशनाभः सुधार्मिकः। ब्रह्मदत्ताय काकुत्स्थ दातुं कन्याशतं तदा॥'}

{'en': 'And inviting Brahmadatta, that highly energetic lord of earth, with a glad heart conferred his hundred daughters upon him.', 'sn': 'तमाहूय महातेजा ब्रह्मदत्तं महीपतिः। ददौ कन्याशतं राजा सुग्रीवेनान्तरात्मना ॥'}

{'en': 'And O descendant of Raghu, king Brahmadatta resembling the lord himself of the celestials, by turns received their hands in marriage.', 'sn': 'यथाक्रमं तदा पाणिं जग्राह रघुनन्दन। ब्रह्मदत्तो महीपालस्तासां देवपतिर्यथा ॥'}

{'en': 'And as soon as he touched them, the hundred daughters were cured of their crookedness, and became free from anguish, and were endowed with pre-eminent beauty.', 'sn': 'स्पृष्टमात्रे तदा पाणौ विकुब्जा विगतज्वराः। युक्तं परमया लक्ष्म्या बभौ कन्याशतं तदा॥'}

{'en': 'And upon beholding them delivered from (the tyranny of) the Air, the monarch Kušanābha became exceedingly delighted, and rejoiced again and again.', 'sn': 'स दृष्ट्वा वायुना मुक्ताः कुशनाभो महीपतिः। बभूव परमप्रीतो हर्षं लेभे पुनः पुनः॥'}
{'en': 'And he dismissed that lord of earth, king Brahmadatta, in company with his consorts and the priests.', 'sn': 'कृतोद्वाहं तु राजानं ब्रह्मदत्तं महीपतिम्। सदारं प्रेषयामास सोपाध्यायगणं तदा॥'}

{'en': 'And the Gandharvī Somadā rejoiced exceedingly at the completion of the nuptials of her son; and embracing her daughters-in-law again and again, and extolling her son, she expressed the fullness of her joy. And he dismissed that lord of earth, king Brahmadatta, in company with his consorts and the priests.', 'sn': 'सोमदापि सुतं दृष्ट्वा पुत्रस्य सदृशीं क्रियाम्। यथान्यायं च गन्धवीं स्नुषास्ताः प्रत्यनन्दत। स्पृष्ट्वा च ताः कन्याः कुशनाभं प्रशस्य च॥'}

{'en': 'And the Gandharvī Somadā rejoiced exceedingly at the completion of the nuptials of her son; and embracing her daughters-in-law again and again, and extolling her son, she expressed the fullness of her joy.', 'sn': 'सोमदापि सुतं दृष्ट्वा पुत्रस्य सदृशीं क्रियाम्। यथान्यायं च गन्धवीं स्नुषास्ताः प्रत्यनन्दत। स्पृष्ट्वा च ताः कन्याः कुशनाभं प्रशस्य च॥'}
{'en': 'Those heroes, Rāma and Laksmana, their interest secured, with glad hearts passed that night there.', 'sn': 'अथ तां रजनीं तत्र कृतार्थों रामलक्ष्मणौ। उषतुर्मुदितौ वीरौ प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना॥'}

{'en': 'And when the night had passed away and the morning come, they together appeared before the saint, Visvāmitra, and the rest.', 'sn': 'प्रभातायां तु शर्वर्यां कृतपौर्वाह्निकक्रियौ। विश्वामित्रमृषींश्चान्यान् सहितावभिजग्मतुः॥'}

{'en': 'And having saluted that foremost of ascetics resembling flaming fire, your addressed him in gentle and honied accents.', 'sn': 'अभिवाद्य मुनिश्रेष्ठं ज्वलन्तमिव पावकम्। ऊचतुः परमोदारं वाक्यं मधुरभाषिणौ॥'}

{'en': 'These servants of yours, O best of ascetics, have come before you. Do you command, O chief of anchorites, what command of your are we to execute', 'sn': 'इमौ स्म मुनिशार्दूल किंकरौ समुपागतौ। आज्ञापय मुनिश्रेष्ठ शासनं करवाव किम्॥'}
{'en': 'Thus addressed by them the Maharșis with Viśvāmitra at their head spoke to Rāma, saying,', 'sn': 'एवमुक्ते तयोर्वाक्ये सर्वं एक महर्षयः। विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य रामं वचनमब्रुवन्।५।।'}

{'en': "A highly meritorious sacrifice, O foremost of men, is to be celebrated by Mithila's lord, Janaka. Thither shall we repair.", 'sn': 'मैथिलस्य नरश्रेष्ठ जनकस्य भविष्यति। यज्ञः परमधर्मिष्ठस्तत्र यास्यामहे वयम्॥'}

{'en': 'And you, O tiger among men, men, must accompany us, and there behold a wonderful jewel of a bow.', 'sn': 'त्वं चैव नरशार्दूल सहास्माभिर्गमिष्यसि। अद्भुतं च धनूरत्नं तत्र त्वं द्रष्टुमर्हसि ॥'}

{'en': 'And formerly this bow of immeasurable energy, and dreadful, and exceedingly effulgent at the sacrifice, had been conferred in court by the celestials (on king Devarata.)8', 'sn': 'तद्धि पूर्वं नरश्रेष्ठ दत्तं सदसि दैवतैः। अप्रमेयबलं घोरं मखे परमभास्वरम्॥'}
{'en': 'And neither gods nor Gandharvas, neither Asuras nor Rākşasas nor men, can fix the string upon it.', 'sn': 'नास्य देवा न गन्धर्वा नासुरा न च राक्षसाः। कर्तुमारोपणं शक्ता न कथंचन मानुषाः॥'}

{'en': 'And desirous of being acquainted with the prowess of this bow, many kings and princes came; but they in spite of their mighty strength, failed in stringing it.', 'sn': 'धनुषस्तस्य वीर्यं हि जिज्ञासन्तो महीक्षितः। न शेकुरारोपयितुं राजपुत्रा महाबलाः॥'}

{'en': 'There, O Kākutstha, you will behold that bow belonging to the high-souled king of Mithila, as well as his exceedingly wonderful sacrifice..', 'sn': 'तद्धनुर्नरशार्दूल मैथिलस्य महात्मनः। तत्र द्रक्ष्यसि काकुत्स्थ यज्ञं च परमाद्भुतम्॥'}

{'en': "That rare bow, O foremost of men, furnished with an excellent device for griping it, had been solicited by Mithila's lord as the fruit of his sacrifice; and the celestials conferred it upon him.", 'sn': 'तद्धि यज्ञफलं तेन मैथिलेनोत्तमं धनुः। याचितं नरशार्दूल सुनाभं सर्वदैवतैः॥'}

{'en': 'Now, O descendant of Raghu, in the residence of the king, the bow is worshipped like a deity with agaru dhüpa, and various other incenses.', 'sn': 'आयागभूतं नृपतेस्तस्य वेश्मनि राघव। अर्चितं विविधैर्गन्धैधूपैश्चागुरुगन्धिभिः॥'}

{'en': 'This having been said, that foremost of ascetics, in company with Kākutstha and the saints, departed.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा मुनिवरः प्रस्थानमकरोत् तदा। सर्षिसङ्घः सकाकुत्स्थ आमन्त्र्य वनदेवताः॥'}

{'en': 'And on the eve of setting out, he addressed the sylvan deities, saying, Luck! I will, with my desire obtained, go from forth this Siddhāśrama to the Himavat mountain on the north of the Jahnavi.', 'sn': 'स्वस्ति वोऽस्तु गमिष्यामि सिद्धः सिद्धाश्रमादहम्। उत्तरे जाह्नवीतीरे हिमवन्तं शिलोच्चयम्॥'}

{'en': "Having said this, that tiger-like ascetic, Kusika's son, along with other anchorets having asceticism for their wealth, set out in a northerly direction.", 'sn': 'इत्युक्त्वा मुनिशार्दूलः कौशिकः स तपोधनः। उत्तरां दिशमुद्दिश्य प्रस्थातुमुपचक्रमे॥'}

{'en': 'And as that best of ascetics proceeded, he was followed by Brāhmaṇas, unholding the Veda, carrying the sacrificial necessaries on an hundred cars.', 'sn': 'तं व्रजन्तं मुनिवरमन्वगादनुसारिणाम्। शकटीशतमात्रं तु प्रयाणे ब्रह्मवादिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'And birds and beasts dwelling in Siddhāśrama followed the high-souled Viśvāmitra having asceticism for wealth.', 'sn': 'मृगपक्षिगणाश्चैव सिद्धाश्रमनिवासिनः। अनुजग्मुर्महात्मानं विश्वामित्रं तपोधनम्॥'}

{'en': "Having proceeded a long way, when the sun was sioping down, the ascetics rested on the banks of the Soņa. And when the maker of day had set, having bathed and offered oblations to the fire those ascetics of immeasurable energy, placing Viśvāmitra in their front, sat them down. And Rāma also together with Sumitrā's son, having paid homage to those ascetics, sat him down before the intelligent Viśvāmitra.", 'sn': 'निवर्तयामास ततः सर्षिसङ्घः स पक्षिणः। ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं लम्बमाने दिवाकरे॥ वासं चक्रुर्मुनिगणाः शोणाकूले समाहिताः। तेऽस्तं गते दिनकरे स्नात्वा हुतहुताशनाः॥ विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य निषेदुरमितौजसः। रामोऽपि सहसौमित्रिर्मुनीस्तानभिपूज्य च॥ जग्रतो निषसादाथ विश्वामित्रस्य धीमतः।'}

{'en': "Then Rama of exceeding energy, influenced by curiosity, asked that foremost of ascetics, Viśvāmitra, having asceticism for his wealth, saying, 'O worshipful one, what country is this, graced with luxuriant woods? I am desirous of hearing this Good betide you, it behove you to tell me this truly.", 'sn': 'अथ रामो महातेजा विश्वामित्रं तपोधनम्॥ पप्रच्छ मुनिशार्दूलं कौतूहलसमन्वितम्। भगवन् को न्वयं देशः समृद्धवनशोभितः॥ श्रोतुमिच्छामि भद्रं ते वक्तुमर्हसि तत्त्वतः।'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed by Rāma, that one of high austerities and excellent vows began in the midst of the saints to describe the opulence of that region.', 'sn': 'नोदितो रामवाक्येन कथयामास सुव्रतः। तस्य देशस्य निखिलमृषिमध्ये महातपाः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing these unpleasant words like to death, Rama, the destroyer of foes, was not pained, and spoke thus to Kaikeyī.', 'sn': 'तदप्रियममित्रघ्नो वचनं मरणोपमम्। श्रुत्वा न विव्यथे रामः कैकेयी चेदमब्रवीत्।।।'}

{'en': 'Be it what you say; carrying out the promise of the king, I shall repair to the forest from this place wearing bark and matted hair.', 'sn': 'एवमस्तु गमिष्यामि वनं वस्तुमहं त्वितः। जटाचीरधरो राज्ञः प्रतिज्ञामनुपालयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Now I want to know only why that lord of the earth, invincible and the conqueror of foes, does not receive me in the same way as he used to do on previous occasions.', 'sn': 'इदं तु ज्ञातुमिच्छामि किमर्थं मां महीपतिः। नाभिनन्दति दुर्धर्षो यथापूर्वभरिंदमः॥'}

{'en': 'be not angry, Oh worshipful one, I speak before you, be you propitiated well, and I shall go to the forest wearing bark and matted hair.', 'sn': 'मन्युर्न च त्वया कार्यो देवि ब्रूमि तवाग्रतः। यास्यामि भव सुप्रीता वनं चीरजटाधरः॥'}

{'en': "What is there that I cannot perform, considering it good without suspicion, if I am ordered so by my well-wisher, spiritual leader, father and king, who acknowledges your service (rendered in time of danger).* *The epithet Krtajñena may as well as be rendered into general terms; such as 'who acknowledges services rendered to him.' Here in translation I have followed the commentator who has restricted it to the special sense suitable to the occasion.", 'sn': 'हितेन गुरुणा पित्रा कृतज्ञेन नृपेण च। नियुज्यमानो विस्रब्धः किं न कुर्यााहं प्रियम्॥'}
{'en': 'But this one sorrow burns my heart, why king did not tell me personally of the installation of Bharata.', 'sn': 'अलीकं मानसं त्वेकं हृदयं दहते मम। स्वयं यन्नाह मां राजा भरतस्याभिषेचनम्॥'}

{'en': 'What of the command of the king, my father, I shall even at your mandate joyfully make over to Bharata, my kingdom, Sītā, wealth and even my life, thereby satisfying you, and fulfilling my promise.', 'sn': 'अहं हि सीतां राज्यं च प्राणानिष्टान् धनानि च । हृष्टो भ्रात्रे स्वयं दद्यां भरताय प्रचोदितः॥ किं पुनर्मनुजेन्द्रेण स्वयं पित्रा प्रचोदितः। तव च प्रियकामार्थं प्रतिज्ञामनुपालयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Do you now console the bashful king; why has he, with his eyes steadily fixed on the ground, been shedding tears slowly?', 'sn': 'तथाश्वासय ह्रीमन्तं किंत्विदं यन्महीपतिः। वसुधासक्तनयनो मन्दमश्रूणि मुञ्चति ॥'}

{'en': "Let messengers, with fast going steeds go today at the command of the king to fetch Bharata from his maternal uncle's house.", 'sn': 'गच्छन्तु चैवानयितुं दूताः शीघ्रजवैर्हयैः। भरतं मातुलकुलादद्यैव नृपशासनात्॥'}

{'en': "I shall, not even judging the propriety of my father's words, speedily repair to the forest of Dandaka for fourteen years.", 'sn': 'दण्डकारण्यमेषोऽहं गच्छाम्येव हि सत्वरः। अविचार्य पितुर्वाक्यं समा वस्तुं चतुर्दश॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing those words of Rāma, Kaikeyi was pleased, and being certain about his departure, hurried on Raghava.', 'sn': 'सा हृष्टा तस्य तद् वाक्यं श्रुत्वा रामस्य कैकयी। प्रस्थानं श्रद्दधाना सा त्वरयामास राघवम्॥'}
{'en': "Let it be that messengers with fast going steeds shall go to bring Bharata from his maternal uncle's residence.", 'sn': 'यास्यन्ति दूताः शीघ्रजवैर्हयैः। भरतं मातुलकुलादिहावर्तयुतं नराः॥'}

{'en': 'I do not think it proper for you, O Rāma, to delay, when you are so anxious; it behoves you therefore to depart from this place speedily to the forest.', 'sn': 'एवं भवतु तव त्वहं क्षमं मन्ये नोत्सुकस्य विलम्बनम्। राम तस्मादितः शीघ्रं वनं त्वं गन्तुमर्हसि ॥'}

{'en': 'The king being abashed, does not himself address you, there is nothing else than this. Do you, Oh best of men, dispel this wretchedness of his.', 'sn': 'व्रीडान्वितः स्वयं यच्च नृपस्त्वां नाभिभाषते। नैतत् किंचिन्नरश्रेष्ठ मन्युरेषोऽपनीयताम्॥'}

{'en': 'As long as you shall not hurriedly depart from his presence, Oh Rāma, your father shall not bathe, or eat anything.', 'sn': 'यावत्त्वं न वनं यातः पुरादस्मादतित्वरम्। पिता तावन्नते राम स्नास्यते भोक्ष्यतेऽपि वा॥'}

{'en': "'Oh fie!' 'what affliction' sobbing hard with these words, the monarch, filled with sorrow, swooned away and fell down upon the sofa, embellished with gold.", 'sn': 'धिक्कष्टमिति निःश्वस्य राजा शोकपरिप्लुतः। मूर्च्छितो न्यपतत् तस्मिन् पर्यङ्के हेमभूषिते॥'}

{'en': 'Raising the king up, Rāma, being directed by Kaikeyī, began to hurry on his departure to the forest, like to a steed struck sharp with a whip.', 'sn': 'रामोऽप्युत्थाप्प राजानं कैकेय्याभिप्रचोदितः। कशयेव हतो वाजी वनं गन्तुं कृतत्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing those cruel and unpleasant words of the wicked Kaikeyi, Rama, not being distressed, began to address her with the following words.', 'sn': 'तदप्रियमनाया वचनं दारुणोदयम्। श्रुत्वा गतव्यथो रामः कैकेयीं वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Oh worshipful one, being addicted to wealth do I not long for living in this world; like to Rșis, know me, to be well established in pure religion.', 'sn': 'नाहमर्थपरो देवि लोकमावस्तुमुत्सहे। विद्धि मामृषिभिस्तुल्यं विमलं धर्ममास्थितम् ॥'}

{'en': 'If I can, even at the sacrifice of my own life, satisfy my worshipful father, rest assured it is to be done first in all manner.', 'sn': 'यत् तत्र भवतः किंचिच्छक्यं कर्तुं प्रियं मया। प्राणानपि परित्यज्य सर्वथा कृतमेव तत्॥'}
{'en': 'There is no virtue greater than the serving of the father and carrying out his words.', 'sn': 'न ह्यतो धर्मचरणं किंचिदस्ति महत्तरम्। यथा पितरि शुश्रूषा तस्य वा वचनक्रिया॥'}
{'en': 'Even though not commanded by him, I shall, for your words, live in a solitary forest for fourteen years.', 'sn': 'अनुक्तोऽप्यत्रभवता भवत्या वचनादहम्। वने वत्स्यामि विजने वर्षाणीह चतुर्दश॥'}

{'en': 'Oh Kaikeyī, certain it is that you are not acquainted with my foremost virtues, inasmuch as possessing full authority to rule me, you have requested the monarch for this.', 'sn': 'न न्यूनं मयि कैकेयि किंचिदाशंससे गुणान् । यद् राजानमवोचस्त्वं ममेश्वरतरा सती ॥'}

{'en': 'Excuse me until I ask my mother, and comfort Sītā; even this very day shall I wend my way to the great forest of Dandaka.', 'sn': 'यावन्मातरमापृच्छे सीतां जानुनयाम्यहम्। ततोऽद्यैव गमिष्यामि दण्डकानां महद् वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'If behoves you to do that by which Bharata may govern the kingdom and tend our father, for this is the virtue eternal.', 'sn': 'भरतः पालयेद् राज्यं शुश्रूषेच्च पितुर्यथा। तथा भवत्या कर्तव्यं स हि धर्मः सनातनः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing these words of Rāma, his father, greatly afflicted and incapable of speaking anything on account of sorrow, began to cry aloud.', 'sn': 'रामस्य तु वचः श्रुत्वा भृशं दुःखगतः पिता। शोकादशक्नुवन् वक्तुं प्ररुरोद महास्वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Worshipping the feet of the king lying insensible, and those of vicious Kaikeyi, that greatly effulgent one went out.', 'sn': 'वन्दित्वा चरणौ राज्ञो विसंज्ञस्य पितुस्तदा। कैकेय्याश्चाप्यना या निष्पपात महाद्युतिः॥'}

{'en': 'And reverentially going round his father and Kaikeyi, and issuing out of the female apartment, Rāma saw his own friends and relatives.', 'sn': 'स रामः पितरं कृत्वा कैकेयीं च प्रदक्षिणम्। निष्क्रम्यान्तःपुरात् तस्मात् स्वं ददर्श सुहज्जनम्॥'}

{'en': "Then followed him Lakşmaņa, the enhance of Sumitra's joy, greatly angry and with his eyes full of tears.", 'sn': 'तं बाष्पपरिपूर्णाक्षः पृष्ठतोऽनुजगाम ह। लक्ष्मणः परमक्रुद्धः सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः॥'}

{'en': 'Going round with reverence the house of installation full of necessary articles, not turning away from it his wistful look, Rāma began to proceed slowly.', 'sn': 'आभिषेचनिकं भाण्डं कृत्वा रामः प्रदक्षिणम्। शनैर्जगाम सापेक्षो दृष्टिं तत्राविचालयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Loss of kingdom could not diminish the great beauty of that beloved of the people on account of its everlasting pleasantness, like to the wane of the moon.', 'sn': 'न चास्य महतीं लक्ष्मी राज्यनाशोऽपकर्षति। लोककान्तस्य कान्तत्वाच्छीतरश्मेरिव क्षयः॥'}

{'en': 'There was manifest in his no change of mind, who was about to fly as an exile to the forest and leave the world, like to one emancipated while yet living.', 'sn': 'न वनं गन्तुकामस्य त्यजतश्च वसुंधराम्। सर्वलोकातिगस्येव लक्ष्यते चित्तविक्रिया॥'}

{'en': 'Leaving aside the excellent umbrella and well adorned chowries, forsaking his relatives, chariot, citizens and other people, calmly bearing the affliction in mind and not manifesting the outward signs of sorrow, Rāma, with a view to communicate this unpleasant news to his mother, entered her abode.', 'sn': 'प्रतिषिध्य शुभं छत्रं व्यजने च स्वलंकृते। विसर्जयित्वा स्वजनं रथं पौरांस्तथा जनान्॥ धारयन् मनसा दु:खमिन्द्रियाणि निगृह्य च। प्रविवेशात्मवान् वेश्म मातुरप्रियशंसिवान्॥'}

{'en': 'All persons, who were present there and who adorned themselves on account of the installation, did not perceive any sign of mental agony on the face of Rāma.', 'sn': 'सर्वोऽप्यभिजनः श्रीमाञ्श्रीमतः सत्यवादिनः। नालक्षयत रामस्य कंचिदाकारमानने॥'}

{'en': 'Like to the rays of the fully brilliant autumnal moon, that hero of mighty arms, having control over himself, did not forsake his native cheerfulness.', 'sn': 'उचितं च महाबाहुर्न जहौ हर्षमात्मवान्। शारदः समुदीर्णांशुश्चन्द्रस्तेज इवात्मजम्॥'}

{'en': 'The pious Rāma, having high fame, entered into the presence of his mother, manifesting great regards for the people with sweet speech.', 'sn': 'वाचा मधुरया रामः सर्वं सम्मानयञ्जनम्। मातुः समीपं धर्मात्मा प्रविवेश महायशाः॥'}

{'en': 'Then followed him, the son of Sumitrā, of mighty prowess, of equal accomplishments with his brother, and bearing the mental sorrow. Rāma, entering the abode of his mother.', 'sn': 'तं गुणैः समतां प्राप्तो भ्राता विपुलविक्रमः। सौमित्रिरनुवव्राज धारयन् दुःखमात्मजम्॥'}

{'en': 'Saw it filled with all sorts of amusements; and even though his mind was not agitated with any mental disturbance seeing the impending calamity of loss of wealth, he was anxious lest the lives of his dear relatives mighty be in danger.', 'sn': 'प्रविश्य वेश्मातिभृशं मुदा युतं समीक्ष्य तां चार्थविपत्तिमागताम्। न चैव रामोऽत्र जगाम विक्रियां सुहृज्जनस्यात्मविपत्तिशङ्कया॥'}

{'en': 'And to Khara deprived of his car standing with a mace in his hand, that exceedingly energetic one, Rāma, precluding his speech with mildness, spoke.', 'sn': 'खरं तु विरथं रामो गदापाणिमवस्थितम्। मृदुपूर्वं महातेजाः परुषं वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Backed by this mighty host abounding in elephants and horses and cars, you have done an exceedingly wicked deed, execrated by all the worlds. Even if one happen to be the lord of the three worlds, one given to troubling creatures, and who is cruel and engaged in wicked acts, can not exist. All persons destroy, like a snake that has intruded itself, him that dose cruel deeds, hostile to the interests of every one.', 'sn': 'गजाश्वरथसम्बाधे बले महति तिष्ठता। कृतं ते दारुणं कर्म सर्वलोकजुगुप्सितम्॥ उद्वेजनीयो भूतानां नृशंसः पापकर्मकृत्। त्रयाणामपि लोकानामीश्वरोऽपि स तिष्ठति ॥ कर्म लोकविरुद्धं तु कुर्वाणं क्षणदाचर। तीक्ष्णं सर्वजनो हन्ति सष दुष्टमिवागतम्॥'}

{'en': 'People delightedly behold the end of him that doing an action either from covetousness or desire, dose not like a Brāhmaṇi swallowing a Karakā, see the consequence thereof.', 'sn': 'लोभात् पापानि कुर्वाणः कामाद् वा यो न बुध्यते। हृष्टः पश्यति तस्यान्तं ब्राह्मणी करकादिव॥'}

{'en': 'What, O Rākṣasa, do you gain by slaughtering exceedingly pious ascetics engaged in righteous acts, living in the forest of Dandaka?', 'sn': 'वसतो दण्डकारण्ये तापसान् धर्मचारिणः। किं नु हत्वा महाभागान् फलं प्राप्स्यसि राक्षस॥'}

{'en': 'Like to trees whose roots have been reduced, cruel persons, execrated of men, who perpetrate iniquitous acts, do not exist long.', 'sn': 'न चिरं पापकर्माणः क्रूरा लोकजुगुप्सिताः। ऐश्वर्यं प्राप्य तिष्ठन्ति शीर्णमूला इव द्रुमाः।७।।'}

{'en': 'As a tree puts forth blossoms in season, the doer of sinful deeds, at the hour (of repentance) inevitably reaps their fruit in the shape of dreadful anguish (of the spirit).', 'sn': 'अवश्यं लभते कर्ता फलं पापस्य कर्मणः। घोरं पर्यागते काले द्रुमः पुष्पमिवार्तवम् ॥'}

{'en': 'O ranger of night, as the effect of having taken rice mixed with poison, appears without delay, even so also people readily reap the fruit of their own acts.', 'sn': 'न चिरात् प्राप्यते लोके पापानां कर्मणां फलम्। सविषाणामिवान्नानां भुक्तानां क्षणदाचर॥'}

{'en': 'O ranger of the night, it is to take the lives of the perpetrators of dreadful sins, who wish ill to men, that I the king have come.', 'sn': 'पापमाचरतां घोरं लोकस्याप्रियमिच्छताम्। अहमासादितो राज्ञा प्राणान् हन्तुं निशाचर ॥'}

{'en': 'Today the gold-decked arrows discharged by ine, piercing (your body), shall enter into the carth, cleaving it, like serpents falling into an ant-hill.', 'sn': 'अद्य भित्वा मया मुक्ताः शराः काञ्चनभूषणाः। विदार्यातिपतिष्यन्ति वल्मीकमिव पन्नगाः॥'}

{'en': 'Slain in battle, you shall in company with your army, follow those people practising piety, whom you have devoured in the Dandaka forest.', 'sn': 'ये त्वया दण्डकारण्ये भक्षिता धर्मचारिणः। तानद्य निहतः संख्ये ससैन्योऽनुगमिष्यसि ॥'}

{'en': 'Today let those great saints, who had formerly been slain by you, stationed in the sky, behold you slain (in turn) with my arrows, and inhabiting hell.', 'sn': 'अद्य त्वां निहतं बाणैः पश्यन्तु परमर्षयः। निरयस्थं विमानस्था ये त्वया निहताः पुरा॥'}

{'en': 'Do you strike as you like. And youl that are of an odious race, do you put forth your energy. Today I will bring down your head, even as a palm falls to the ground.', 'sn': 'प्रहरस्व यथाकामं कुरु यत्नं कुलाधम। अद्य ते पातयिष्यामि शिरस्तालफलं यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed by Rāma, Khara enraged and beyond himself with passion, with eyes reddened, replied.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण क्रुद्धः संरक्तलोचनः। प्रत्युवाच ततो रामं प्रहसन् क्रोधमूच्छितः॥'}

{'en': 'O son of Dasaratha, why having slain inferior Rākṣasas in battle, do you praise yourself without reason?', 'sn': 'प्राकृतान् राक्षसान् हत्वा युद्धे दशरथात्मज। आत्मना कथमात्मानमप्रशस्यं प्रशंससि॥'}

{'en': 'Those foremost of men that are puissant and powerful, do not, inflated with their energy, mouth (their own consequence).', 'sn': 'विक्रान्ता बलवन्तो वा ये भवन्ति नरर्षभाः। कथयन्ति न ते किंचित् तेजसा चातिगर्विताः॥'}

{'en': 'It is the mean-minded Kșatriyas of impure hearts that magnify themselves among men, even as you, O Rama,do.', 'sn': 'प्राकृतास्त्वकृतात्मानो लोके क्षत्रियपांसनाः। निरर्थकं विकत्थन्ते यथा राम विकत्थसे ॥'}

{'en': 'What hero, when the hour of his death has approached, publishes in the field his own lofty lineage and sings his own hymn.', 'sn': 'कुलं वपदिशन् वीरः समरे कोऽभिधास्यति। मृत्युकाले तु सम्प्राप्ते स्वयमप्रस्तवे स्तवम्॥'}

{'en': 'As brass wearing the semblance of gold, displays its own defect on being heated*, with a fire lit with Kusa, so you have betrayed your own lightness by this speech of yours. i.c. becomes dusky, (Ramanuja).', 'sn': 'सर्वथा तु लघुत्वं ते कत्थनेन विदर्शितम्। सुवर्णप्रतिरूपेण तप्तेनेव कुशाग्निना॥'}

{'en': 'You do not see me staying here mace in hand, like a moveless mountain dyed in metals, bearing mobile and immobile things.', 'sn': 'न तु मामिह तिष्ठन्तं पश्यसि त्वं गदाधरम्। धराधरमिवाकम्प्यं पर्वतं धातुभिश्चितम्॥'}

{'en': 'I can, mace in hand, deprive you and the three worlds to boot clean of your lives, like the very Destroyer with the noose in his hand.', 'sn': 'पर्याप्तोऽहं गदापाणिर्हन्तुं प्राणान् रणे तव। त्रयाणामपि लोकानां पाशहस्त इवान्तकः॥'}

{'en': 'But I will not parley much with you as much as I could wish: the sun is going to set, and our fight shall be interrupted.', 'sn': 'कामं बह्वपि वक्तव्यं त्वयि वक्ष्यामि न त्वहम्। अस्तं प्राप्नोति सविता युद्धविघ्नस्ततो भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Fourteen thousand Räksasas have been slaughtered by you. I will for their deaths wipe their tears to-day.', 'sn': 'चतुर्दश सहस्राणि राक्षसानां हतानि ते। त्वद्विनाशात् करोम्यद्य तेषामथुप्रमार्जनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Saying this Khara, highly enraged, hurled his mace+ provided with golden rings at Rāma, like to the blazing thunderbolt. Another reading is, plaited with gold.', 'sn': 'इत्युक्त्वा परमक्रुद्धः स गदां परमाङ्गदाम्। खरश्चिक्षेप रामाय प्रदीप्तामशनि यथा ॥'}

{'en': "Thereat, reducing to ashes trees and shrubs, that mighty flaming mace, discharged by Khara's arm, fell before Rama.", 'sn': 'खरबाहुप्रमुक्ता सा प्रदीप्ता महती गदा। भस्मवृक्षांश्च गुल्मांश्च कृत्वागात् तत्समीपतः॥'}

{'en': 'And Rāma severed in many fragments that mighty mace, resembling the noose of Death, as ascending the welkin, it was coming down.', 'sn': 'तामापतन्ती महती मृत्युपाशोपमां गदाम्। अन्तरिक्षगती रामश्चिच्छेद बहुधा शरैः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, like a she-serpent brought down by force of incantations, the mace fell to the earth shattered and riven.', 'sn': 'सा विशीर्णा शरैर्भिन्ना पपात धरणीतले। गदा मन्त्रौषधिबलैालीव विनिपातिता॥'}

{'en': 'Having thus directed his brother, the highly energetic son of Raghu equipped himself with his gold-hilted scimitar.', 'sn': 'तथा तु तं समादिश्य भ्रातरं रघुनन्दनः। बबन्धासिं महातेजा जाम्बूनदमयत्सरुम्॥'}

{'en': 'And girding himself with his bow bent at three places, which served him ornament,—as well as a couple of quivers, that one of fierce energy sallied out.', 'sn': 'ततस्त्रिविनतं चापमादायात्मविभूषणम्। आबध्य च कपालौ द्वौ जगामोदग्रविक्रमः॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing that foremost of monarchs approach, that best of beasts from fear disappeared; and then again showed himself. as an', 'sn': 'तं वन्यराजो राजेन्द्रमापतन्तं निरीक्ष्य वै। बभूवान्तर्हितस्त्रासात् पुनः संदर्शनेऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereat girt with the bow and sword, (Rāma) rushed where the deer was; and beheld him illumining all before him with his beauty, and bow in hand (Rāma beheld) him in that vast forest, darting away after gazing at him,-and sometimes seeming to have got beyond arrow range, and at others tempting Rāma (by his vicinity). And sometimes influenced by fear and bewildered, (the deer) seemed to course the welkin; and in the forest now he became visible and now vanished from sight. And like the autumual lunar disc enveloped by indented clouds, he momentarily showed himself, and anon discovered himself at a distance.', 'sn': 'बद्धासिर्धनुरादाय प्रदुद्राव यतो मृगः। तं स्म पश्यति रूपेण द्योतयन्तमिवाग्रतः॥ अवेक्ष्यावेक्ष्य धावन्तं धनुष्पाणिर्महावने। अतिवृत्तमिवोत्पाताल्लोभयानं कदाचन॥ शङ्कितं तु समुद्मास्तमुत्पतन्तमिवाम्बरम्। दृश्यमानमदृश्यं च वनोद्देशेषु केषुचित्॥ छिन्नाभैरिव संवीतं शारदं चन्द्रमण्डलम्। मुहूर्तादेव ददृशे मुहुर्दूरात् प्रकाशते॥'}

{'en': 'And Mārica wearing the shape of a deer, showing himself and disappearing from sight, drew Rāghava a long way from the hermitage.', 'sn': 'दर्शनादर्शनेनैव सोऽपाकर्षत राघवम्। स दूरमाश्रमस्यास्य मारीचो मृगतां गतः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereat Rāma, eagerly anxious to secure the deer, being foiled by the deer, and in consequence growing enraged, wearied out, rested under a shadow, on a sward.', 'sn': 'आसीत् क्रुद्धस्तु काकुत्स्थो विवशस्तेन मोहितः। अथावतस्थे सुश्रान्तश्छायामाश्रित्य शाबले॥'}

{'en': 'And that ranger of the night, wearing the form of a deer, maddening Rāma, discovered himself (again) at a distance surrounded by (other) deer,', 'sn': 'स तमुन्मादयामास मृगरूपो निशाचरः। मृगैः परिवृतोऽथान्यैरदूरात् प्रत्यदृश्यत॥'}

{'en': 'And Rama desirous of taking (the beast), seeing him again, set off at speed. At the very moment the deer disappeared from fear,', 'sn': 'ग्रहीतुकामं दृष्ट्वा तं पुनरेवाभ्यधावत। तत्क्षणादेव संत्रासात् पुनरन्तर्हितोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'And again showed himself at a distance behind a tree. And seeing him, the exceedingly energetic and strong Rāghava, determined to slay him, growing wroth, taking out a flaming shaft, resembling the rays of the sun, powerfully drew his bow, and firmly setting the shaft, and aiming it at the deer, let go the blazing and burning weapon forged by Brahmā, resembling a flaiming serpent.', 'sn': 'पुनरेव ततो दूराद् वृक्षखण्डाद् विनिःसृतः। दृष्ट्वा रामो महातेजास्तं हन्तुं कृतनिश्चयः॥ भूयस्तु शरमुद्धत्य कुपितस्तत्र राघवः। सूर्यरश्मिप्रतीकाशं ज्वलन्तमरिमर्दनम् ॥ संधाय सुदृढे चापे विकृष्य बलवदबली। तमेव मृगमुद्दिश्य श्वसन्तमिव पन्नगम्॥ मुमोच ज्वलितं दीप्तमस्त्रं ब्रह्मविनिर्मितम्।'}

{'en': 'And that best of arrows, like to a thunderbolt, deeply pierced the breast of Mārīca, wearing the shape of a deer.', 'sn': 'शरीरं मृगरूपस्य विनिर्भिद्य शरोत्तमः॥ मारीचस्यैव हृदयं बिभेदाशनिसंनिभः।'}

{'en': 'Thereat bounding up high as a palmyra palm, that one whose saws had almost run out, uttered terrible sounds, lying on the earth.', 'sn': 'तालमीत्रमथोत्प्लुत्य न्यपतत् स भृशातुरः॥ व्यनदद् भैरवं नादं धरण्यामल्पजीवितः।'}

{'en': 'And while on the point of death, Mārīca renounced his counterfeit shape. And remembering the words of Rāvana, the Rākşasa reflected, by what means can Sītā send away Lakşmaņa, and Rāvana carry off Sītā staying in solitude?', 'sn': 'म्रियमाणस्तु मारीचो जहौ तां कृत्रिमा तनुम्॥ स्मृत्वा तद्वचनं रक्षो दध्यौ केन तु लक्ष्मणम्। इह प्रस्थापयेत् सीता तां शून्ये रावणो हरेत्॥'}

{'en': 'And pierced to the marrow by that peerless shaft, Marica, renouncing his deer form, resumed his Rākşasa lineaments; and giving up his life attaining a huge person, considering the time had come (for availing himself of the advice tendered by Rāvana), began to cry with the voice of Rāghava, Ah Sita! Ah Laksmana!', 'sn': 'स प्राप्तकालमाज्ञाय चकार च ततः स्वनम्। सदृशं राघवस्येव हा सीते लक्ष्मणेति च ॥ तेन मर्मणि निर्विद्धं शरेणानुपमेन हि। मृगरूपं तु तत् त्यक्त्वा राक्षसं रूपमास्थितः॥'}

{'en': "And seeing that grim-visaged Rākşasa lying low on the ground, with his person bathed in blood, and rolling hither and thither, Rāma proceeded towards the asylum thinking of Sītā and revolving within himself Laksmana's words.", 'sn': 'चक्रे स सुमहाकायो मारीचो जीवितं त्यजन्। तं दृष्ट्वा पतितं भूमौ राक्षसं भीमदर्शनम्॥ रामो रुधिरसिक्ताङ्ग चेष्टमानं महीतले। जगाम मनसा सीतां लक्ष्मणस्य वचः स्मरन् ॥'}

{'en': "While returning he thought Mārīca aside Lakş mana said before that this was Mārica's illusion! His words have been verified now. Truly have I killed Mārīca.", 'sn': 'मारीचस्य तु मायैषा पूर्वोक्तं लक्ष्मणेन तु। तत् तथा ह्यभवच्चाद्य मारीचोऽयं मया हतः॥'}

{'en': 'Mārīca has given up his ghost exclaiming aloud Ah! Sītā, Ah! Laksmana. I do not know what shall Sītā do hearing the cry? And what shall the mighty-armed Laksmana do?', 'sn': 'हा सीते लक्ष्मणेत्येवमाक्रुश्य तु महास्वनम्। ममार राक्षसः सोऽयं श्रुत्वा सीता कथं भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'While pondering thus the hairs of the virtuous-souled Rāma stood on their end. Killing that Räkşasa assuming the shape of a deer and hearing his terrible cry Rāma was overwhelmed with fear arising out of sorrow.', 'sn': 'लक्ष्मणश्च महाबाहुः कामवस्थां गमिष्यति। इति संचिन्त्य धर्मात्मा रामो हृष्टतनूरूहः॥ तत्र रामं भयं तीव्रमाविवेश विषादजम्। राक्षसं मृगरूपं तं हत्वा श्रुत्वा च तत्स्वनम्॥'}
{'en': 'Thereupon killing a deer and taking its flesh he hastened towards Janasthāna.', 'sn': 'निहत्य पृषतं चान्यं मांसमादाय राघवः। त्वरमाणो जनस्थानं ससाराभिसुखं तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding Maithili standing humbly by him, Räma began to give vent to his pent-up feelings.', 'sn': 'तां तु पार्श्वे स्थितां प्रह्वां रामः संमेक्ष्य मैथिलीम्। हृदयान्तर्गतं भावं व्याहर्तुमुपचक्रमे॥'}

{'en': 'O gentle one, destroying all the enemies in the arena of battle I have subdued your enemy-I have done all that can be accomplished by manliness.', 'sn': 'एषासि निर्जिता भद्रे शत्रु जित्वा रणाजिरे। पौरुषात् यदनुष्ठेयं मयैतदुपपादितम्॥'}

{'en': 'I have reached the other end of my anger, rubbed off (the insult) for my spouse being taken away by the enemy and have killed simultaneously my disgrace and enemy.', 'sn': 'गतोऽस्म्यन्तममर्षस्य धर्षणा संप्रमार्जिता। अवमानश्च शत्रुश्च युगपत्रिहतौ मया॥'}

{'en': 'My manliness has been displayed today, my laboúr has been crowned with success and today I have fulfilled my promise by my own prowess.', 'sn': 'अद्य मे पौरुषं दृष्टमद्य मे सफलः श्रमः। अद्य तीर्णप्रतिज्ञोऽहं प्रभवाम्यद्य चात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'That accidental misfortune, under the influence where of you were carried away by the fickle-minded Räksasa in my absence, has been subdued today by me, a man.', 'sn': 'या त्वं विरहिता नीता चलचित्तेन रक्षसा। दैवसंपादितो दोषो मानुषेण मया जितः॥'}

{'en': 'What is the use of his manliness, who when insulted, cannot remove it? Even if he be a great man he may be called mean.', 'sn': 'संप्राप्तमवमानं यस्तेजसा न प्रमार्जति। कस्तस्य पौरुषेणार्थो महताप्यल्पचेतसः॥'}

{'en': 'The praise-worthy works of Hanumān-the crossing of the deep and the devastation of Lankā, have been crowned with success today.', 'sn': 'लङ्घनं च समुद्रस्य लङ्कायाश्चापि मर्दनम्। सफलं तस्य च श्लाघ्यमद्य कर्म हनूमतः॥'}

{'en': 'The labour of Sugrīva with his army, who displayed valour in the encounter and gave me good counsels, has borne fruit today.', 'sn': 'युद्धे विक्रमतश्चैव हितं मन्त्रयतस्तया। सुग्रीवस्य ससैन्यस्य सफलोऽद्य परिश्रमः॥'}

{'en': 'Today also the labour of Vibhişaņa has borne fruit-who renouncing his brother, devoid of all good Qualities, came to my side.', 'sn': 'विभीषणस्य च तथा सफलोऽद्य परिश्रमः। विगुणं भ्रातरं त्यक्त्वा यो मां स्वयमुपस्थितः।।।।'}
{'en': 'Hearing those words of Rāma, Sītā began to look wistfully like a hind, with eyes full of tears.', 'sn': 'इत्येवं वदतः श्रुत्वा सीता रामस्य तद्वचः। मृगीवोत्फुल्लनयना बभूवाश्रुपरिप्लुता ॥'}
{'en': 'Beholding his beloved spouse near him and afraid of popular ignominy his heart was broken into two.', 'sn': 'पश्यतस्तां तु रामस्य समीपे हृदयप्रियाम्। जनवादभयाद्राज्ञो बभूव हृदयं द्विधा ॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon he spoke to the exquisitely beautiful Sītā, in the midst of the monkeys and Räkşasas, having eyes resembling lotus petals and black and curling hairs, saying.', 'sn': 'सीतामुत्पलपत्राक्षी नीलकुञ्चितमूर्धजाम्। अवदद्वै वरारोहां मध्ये वानररक्षसाम्॥'}

{'en': 'As the southern quarter, incapable of being got at by the people, was conquered by the selfcontrolled great ascetic Agasty, so for you slaying Ravana, I (always) anxious to have honour, have removed my insult-as is the duty of a man.', 'sn': 'यत्कर्तव्यं मनुष्येण धर्षणां प्रतिमार्जता। तत्कृतं रावणं हत्वा मयेदं मानकाङ्क्षिणा॥ निर्जिता जीवलोकस्य तपसा भावितात्मना। अगस्त्येन दुराधर्षा मुनिना दक्षिणेव दिक् ॥'}

{'en': 'May good betide you-do you know that all my labour in the battle-field, backed by the prowess of my friends, is for you.', 'sn': 'विदितश्चास्तु भद्रं ते योऽयं रणपरिश्रमः। सुतीर्णः सुहृदां वीर्यान्न त्वदर्थं मया कृतः॥'}

{'en': 'To uphold the dignity of my well-known family, to remove the ignominy consequent upon your being stolen away as well as to wipe off my own insult I have encompassed this.', 'sn': 'रक्षता तु मया वृत्तमपवादं च सर्वतः। प्रख्यातस्यात्मवंशस्य न्यङ्गं च परिमार्जता॥'}

{'en': 'I have suspected your character; you, (Therefore) standing before me, are distressing me like to a lamp before one who is subject to an eye-desease.', 'sn': 'प्राप्तचारित्रसंदेहा मम प्रतिमुखे स्थिता। दीपो नेत्रातुरस्येव प्रतिकूलासि मे दृढा ॥'}

{'en': 'Do you therefore proceed, O daughter of king Janaka, wherever you like to one of these ten quarters. I permit you, O gentle one. I have nothing to do with you.', 'sn': 'तद्गच्छ त्वानुजानेऽद्य यथेष्टं जनकात्मजे। एता दश दिशो भद्रे कार्यमस्ति न मे त्वया॥'}

{'en': "What powerful man, born in a high family, take back his wife considering her as friend out of lust, who has lived long in another's house?", 'sn': 'कः पुमांस्तु कुले जातः स्त्रियं परगृहोषिताम्। तेजस्वी पुनरादद्यात्सुहृल्लोभेन चेतसा ॥'}

{'en': 'You were taken by Rāvana on his lap, beheld by him with sinful eyes; how can I, taking you back, bring disgrace upon my great family?', 'sn': 'रावणाङ्कपरिक्लिष्टां दृष्टां दुष्टेन चक्षुषा। कथं त्वां पुनरादद्यां कुलं व्यपदिशन्महत्॥'}

{'en': 'The object, with which I have gained you back, has been accomplished. I have got no attachment for you-do you go wherever you wish, O gentle one.', 'sn': 'यदर्थ निर्जिता मे त्वं सोऽयमासादितो मया। नास्ति मे त्वय्यभिष्वङ्गो यथेष्टं गम्यतामिति ॥'}

{'en': 'I speak these to you impelled by my sense of duty. If you wish you may live with Laksmana, Bharatga or Satrughna or with Sugrīva or Räkş asa Vibhisana. Do you settle, O Sita, where you may find your own pleasure.', 'sn': 'तदद्य व्याहृतं भद्रे मयैतत्कृतबुद्धिना। लक्ष्मणे वाथ भरते कुरु बुद्धिं यथासुखम्॥ शत्रुघ्ने वाथ सुग्रीवे राक्षसे वा विभीषणे। निवेशय मनः सीते यथा वा सुखमात्मना॥'}

{'en': 'O Sita, (I do not think) Ravana has overlooked you, who lived in his house, beholding you so graceful and beautiful.', 'sn': 'नहि त्वां रावणो दृष्ट्वा दिव्यरूपां मनोरमाम्। मर्षयत्यचिरं सीते स्वगृहे पर्यवस्थिताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon hearing those unpleasant words from her beloved (husband) Sītā, always sensitive and who had never heard such unpleasant words, trembling like a creeper torn by the trunk of an elephant, began to weep shedding tears profusely.', 'sn': 'ततः प्रियाहश्रवणा तदप्रियं प्रियादुपश्रुत्य चिरस्य मानिनी। मुमोच बाष्पं रुदती तदा भृशं गजेन्द्रहस्ताभिहतेव वल्लरी॥'}

{'en': "Having thus described at length and finished the story of Vſtra's destruction Lakşmaņa said:-The mighty Vţtra, the terror of the deities, being slain, and the slayer Indra being assailed by the sin of Brahmanicide, was bewildered and at a loss to ascertain his duty.", 'sn': 'तदा वृत्रवधं सर्वमखिलेन स लक्ष्मणः। कथयित्वा नरश्रेष्ठः कथाशेष प्रचक्रमे॥ ततो हते महावीर्ये वृत्रे देवभयंकरे। ब्रह्महत्यावृतः शक्रः संज्ञां लेभे न वृत्रहा॥'}

{'en': "Being at his wit's end he repaired to the other side of the Lokāloka mountain and remained there for some time like a coiled serpent.", 'sn': 'सोऽन्तमाश्रित्य लोकानां नष्टसंज्ञो विचेतनः। कालं तत्रावसत्कंचिद्वेष्टमान इवोरगः॥'}

{'en': "And again in consequence of Indra's separation, the whole world was agitated, the forests grew dried and the earth was devoid of water. On account of the rivers being dried up and want of rain all creatures grew impatient.", 'sn': 'अथ नष्टे सहस्राक्षे उद्विग्नमभवज्जगत्। भूमिश्च ध्वस्तसंकाशा निःस्नेहा शुष्ककानना॥ निःस्रोतसस्ते सर्वे तु हृदाश्च सरितस्तथा। संक्षोभश्चैव सत्त्वानामनावृष्टिकृतोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'In this wise, the celestials being stricken with anxiety, according to the previous command of Visnu, engaged in celebrating the sacrifice.', 'sn': 'क्षीयमाणे तु लोकेऽस्मिन्संभ्रान्तनसः सुराः। यदुक्तं विष्णुना पूर्वं तं यज्ञं समुपानयन्॥'}

{'en': 'With Rșis and Rtvikas they fearfully approached Purandra; and beholding him assailed by the sin of Brahmanicide, they with him, at their head, engaged in celebrating a horse-sacrifice.', 'sn': 'ततः सर्वे सुरगणाः सोपाध्यायाः सहर्षिभिः। तं देशं समुपाजग्मुर्यवेन्द्रो भयमोहितः॥ ते तु दृष्ट्वा सहस्राक्षमावृतं ब्रह्महत्यया। तं पुरस्कृत्य देवेशमश्वमेधं प्रचक्रिरे॥'}

{'en': "After the sacrifice the sin issued out of Indra's person and addressing the high-souled deities said: Do you all ascertain, where I shall go now. There upon highly pleased the deities replied: Do you divide yourself into four portions.", 'sn': 'ततोऽश्वमेधः सुहान्महेन्द्रस्य महात्मनः। ववृते ब्रह्महत्यायाः पावनार्थं नरेश्वर ॥ ततो यज्ञे समाप्ते तु ब्रह्महत्या महात्मनः। अभिगम्याब्रवीद्वाक्यं क्व मे स्थानं विधास्यथ॥ ते तामूचुस्ततो देवास्तुष्टाः प्रीतिसमन्विताः। चतुर्धा विभजात्मानमात्मनैव दुरासदे॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing the words of the high-souled celestials she divided herself into four parts and wishing for a separate habitation said:-By one portion, I shall at my pleasure, live in rivers full of water during rains and shall obstruct people from going there.', 'sn': 'देवानां भाषितं श्रुत्वा ब्रह्महत्या महात्मनाम्। संदधौ स्थानमन्यत्र वरयामास दुर्वसा ॥ एकेनांशेन वत्स्यामि पूर्णोदासु नदीषु वै। चतुरो वार्षिकान्मासान्दर्पघ्नी कामचारिणी॥'}

{'en': 'By my second portion I shall live perpetually on lands as Uşara;* I tell you the truth. By my third portion I shall for three nights every month live in youthful women proud of their youth-So that men might not live with them. And by my fourth portion I shall enter into the persons of those who shall slay innocent Bråhmaņas. *(A spot with saline soil.)', 'sn': 'भूम्यामहं सर्वकालमेकेनांशेन सर्वदा। वसिष्यामि न संदेहः सत्येनैतद्ब्रवीमि वः॥ । योऽयमंशस्तृतीयो मे स्त्रीषु यौवनशालिषु। त्रिरात्रं दर्पपूर्णासु वसिष्ये दर्पघातिनी॥ हन्तारो ब्राह्मणान्ये तु मृषापूर्वमदूषकान्। तांश्चतुर्थेन भागेन संश्रयिष्ये सरुर्षभाः॥'}
{'en': 'Hearing those words the deities said What you have said shall be carried out. Do what you wish.', 'sn': 'प्रत्यूचुस्तां ततो देवा यथा वदसि दुर्वसे। तथा भवतु तत्सर्वं साधयस्व यदीप्सितम्॥'}

{'en': 'There upon the celestials, delighted, adored their Chief divested of sins and crowned with victory.', 'sn': 'ततः प्रीत्यान्विता देवाः सहस्राक्षं ववन्दिरे। विज्वरः पूतपाप्मा च वासवः समपद्यत ॥'}

{'en': 'And Väsava being installed again on the throne, the whole universe was at rest. There upon Indra worshipped Vişnu in the shape of that wonderful sacrifice.', 'sn': 'प्रशान्तं च जगत्सर्वं सहस्राक्षे प्रतिष्ठिते। यज्ञं चाद्भुतसंकाशं तदा शक्रोऽभ्यपूजयत्॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Raghu, such is the power of a horse-sacrifice. O honourable king, therefore, you may perform this sacrifice.', 'sn': 'ईदृशो ह्यश्वमेधस्य प्रसादो रघुनन्दन। यजस्व सुमहाभाग हयमेधेन पार्थिव ॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing the charming words of Lakşmaņa, the energetic and high-souled king, Rāma, powerful like Indra, was greatly delighted.', 'sn': 'इति लक्ष्मणवाक्यमुत्तमं नृपतिरतीव मनोहरं महात्मा। परितोषमवाप हृष्टचेताः स निशम्येन्द्रसमानविक्रमौजाः।।'}

{'en': 'Having accepted those weapons with purity, Käkutstha while proceeding, with a complacent countenance spoke these words to sage Visvāmitra,-', 'sn': 'प्रतिगृह्य ततोऽस्त्राणि प्रहृष्टवदनः शुचिः। गच्छन्नेव च काकुत्स्थो विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'O adorable one, I have received these weapons, incapable of being repressed even by the celestials themselves. Now, O best of ascetics, I would acquire a knowledge of with drawing them.', 'sn': 'गृहीतास्त्रोऽस्मि भगवन् दुराधर्षः सुरैरपि। अस्त्राणां त्वहमिच्छामि संहारान् मुनिपुङ्गव॥'}

{'en': "Upon Kākutstha's representing this, Viśvāmitra of high austerities, endowed with patience, of excellent vows, and pure in spirit, communicated to him the mantras for restraining the weapons.", 'sn': 'एवं ब्रुवति काकुत्स्थे विश्वामित्रो महातपाः। संहारान् व्याजहाराथ धृतिमान् सुव्रतः शुचिः॥'}

{'en': 'Do you, O Rāma, accept Satyavat, and Satyakirti, Dhrsta, Rabhasa, Pratihāratara, Paranmukha, Avanmukha, and also Laksya, a Alakṣya, Dędhanabha, Sunābha, Sunabha, Dasaksa, Satavaktra, Dasasirsa, Satodara, Padmanabha, Mahanabha, Indunābha, Svanābha, Jyotisa, Sakuna, Nairasya, Vimala, Yaugandhara, Vinidra, and the two Daityapramathanas, and Śucibāhu, Mahābāhu, Niskali, Viruca, Arcimāli, Dhrtimali, Vrttimān, Rucira, Pitrya, Saumansa, Vidhuta, Makara, Karavīra, Rati, Dhana, and Dhānya, O Rāghava, and Kāmarūpa, Kāmaruci, Moha, Avarana and Jrmbhaka, Sarpanātha, Panthāna, and Varuņa-these sons of Kļśāśva, O Rāma, effulgent, and assuming shapes at will. And, good betide you, O descendant of Raghu, you are worthy to receive these weapons.', 'sn': 'सत्यवन्तं सत्यकीर्तिं धृष्टं रभसमेव च। प्रतिहारतरं नाम पराङ्मुखमवाङ्मुखम्॥ लक्ष्यालक्ष्याविमौ चैव दृढनाभसुनाभको। दशाक्षशतवक्त्रौ च दशशीर्षशतोदरौ॥ पद्मनाभमहानाभौ दुन्दुनाभस्वनाभको। ज्योतिष शकुनं चैव नैरास्यविमलावुभौ ॥ यौगंधरविनिद्रौ च दैत्यप्रमथनौ तथा। शुचिबाहुर्महाबाहुनिष्कलिविरुचस्तथा। सार्चिमाली धृतिमाली वृत्तिमान् रुचिरस्तथा॥ पित्र्यः सौमनसश्चैव विधूतमकरावुभौ। परवीरं रतिं चैव धनधान्यौ च राघव॥ कामरूपं कामरुचिं मोहमावरणं तथा। जृम्भकं सर्पनाथं च पन्थानवरुणौ तथा॥ कृशाश्वतनयान् राम भास्वरान् कामरूपिणः। प्रतीच्छ मम भद्रं ते पात्रभूतोऽसि राघव॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, Kākutstha with heart overflowing with delight, said,-So be it! And those weapons were furnished with celestial and shining persons, and endowed with visible shapes, and capable of conferring happiness. And some of them were like (live) coals; and some comparable to smoke; and some were like to the Sun or the Moon. And with folded hands, they spoke to Rāma in honied accents; O chief of men, here we are! Do you command as to what we are to do on your behalf.', 'sn': 'बाढमित्येव काकुत्स्थः प्रहष्टेनान्तरात्मना । दिव्यभास्वरदेहाश्च मूर्तिमन्तः सुखप्रदाः॥ केचिदङ्गारसदृशाः केचित् धूमोपमास्तथा। चन्द्रार्कसदृशाः केचित् प्रह्वाञ्जलिपुटास्तथा॥ रामं प्राञ्जलयो भूत्वाब्रुवन् मधुरभाषिणः। इमे स्म नरशार्दूल शाधि किं करवाम ते॥'}

{'en': 'Then the descendant of Raghu answered, saying, Repair whither soever you will! Recurring to my memory, do you in time of need, render me assistance!', 'sn': 'गम्यतामिति तानाह यथेयं रघुनन्दनः। मानसाः कार्यकालेषु साहाय्यं मे करिष्यथ ॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon paying homage to Rāma, and having gone round him, they replied to Kākutstha, What is yonder wood hard by the hill, appearing like clouds? Great is my curiosity.', 'sn': 'अथ ते रामामन्त्र्य कृत्वा चापि प्रदक्षिणम्। एवमस्त्विति काकुत्स्थमुक्त्वा जग्मुर्यथागतम्॥ स च तान् राघवो ज्ञात्वा विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम्। गच्छन्नेवाथ मधुरं श्लक्ष्णं वचनमब्रवीत्॥ किमेतन्मेघसंकाशं पर्वतस्याविदूरतः। वृक्षखण्डमितो भाति परं कौतूहलं हि मे॥'}

{'en': 'It is pleasing to the sight, and abounds in beasts, and is exceedingly romantic, and is adorned with various birds singing sweetly.', 'sn': 'दर्शनीयं मृगाकीर्णं मनोहरमतीव च। नानाप्रकारैः शकुनैर्वल्गुभाषैरलंकृतम्॥'}

{'en': "Now, O foremost of ascetics, we have come out of a wilderness capable of making one's hair stand on end. And from the pleasantness attaching to this place, I have come to a conclusion.", 'sn': 'निःसृताः स्मो मुनिश्रेष्ठ कान्ताराद् रोमहर्षणात्। अनया त्ववगच्छामि देशस्य सुखवत्तया॥'}

{'en': 'Tell me, O reverend sir, whose hermitage is this? Have we, O eminent ascetic, reached that spot where dwell those wicked minded wretches of impious deeds, given to slaughtering Brāhmaṇas, who disturb your sacrifice? Where, O adorable one, is that hermitage, repairing to which, O Brahmana, I am to protect your sacrificial rites, and to slay the Raksasas? All this, O foremost of ascetics, I desire to hear, O lord.', 'sn': 'सर्वं मे शंस भगवन् कस्याश्रमपदं त्विदम्। सम्प्राप्ता यत्र ते पापा ब्रह्मघ्ना दुष्टचारिणः॥ तव यज्ञस्य विघ्नाय दुरात्मानो महामुने। भगवंस्तस्य को देश: सा यत्र तव याज्ञिकी॥ रक्षितव्या क्रिया ब्रह्मन् मया वध्याश्च राक्षसाः। एतत् सर्वं मुनिश्रेष्ठ श्रोतुमिच्छाम्यहं प्रभो॥'}

{'en': 'Having sent away his friends and determined what to do, Rāma, the delight of the Råghus, commanded the warder, who was seated hard by, saying.', 'sn': 'विसृज्य तु सुहृद्वर्ग बुद्ध्या निश्चित्य राघवः। समीपे द्वा:स्थमासीनमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Do you bring in no time, Lakşmaņa, a son of Sumitrā, gifted with auspicious marks, alongwith great Bharata and the irrepressible Šatrughna.', 'sn': 'शीघ्रमानय सौमित्रि लक्ष्मणं शुभलक्षणम्। भरतं च महाभागं शत्रुघ्नमपराजितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing the words of Rāma and placing his folded palms on his head the warder reached house of Lakşmaņa and unobstructed entered therein.', 'sn': 'रामस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा द्वा:स्थो मूर्ध्नि कृताञ्जलिः। लक्ष्मणस्य गृहं गत्वा प्रविवेशानिवारितः॥'}

{'en': 'And having saluted him, with folded palms he said to the high-souled Laksmana and:-"The King wishes to behold you-do you soon go there.', 'sn': 'उवाच सुमहात्मानं वर्धयित्वा कृताञ्जलिः। द्रष्टुमिच्छति राजा त्वां गम्यतां तत्र मा चिरम्॥'}

{'en': "Thereupon being apprised of Rāghava's command and saying 'so be it.' Saumitri ascended his car and went speedily towards Rāma's abode.", 'sn': 'बाढमित्येव सौमित्रिः कृत्वा राघवशासनम्। प्राद्रवद्रथमारुह्य राघवस्य निवेशनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having beheld Lakşmana\'s departure the warder humbly went to Bharata and having blessed him with folded hands said: “The King wishes to see you."', 'sn': 'प्रयान्तं लक्ष्मणं दृष्ट्वा द्वा:स्थो भरतमन्तिकात्। उवाच भरतं तत्र वर्धयित्वा कृताञ्जलिः॥ विनयावनतो भूत्वा राजा त्वां द्रष्टुमिच्छति।'}

{'en': 'Hearing of the command of Rāma from the warder, the highly powerful Bharata at once got up from his seat and proceeded on foot.', 'sn': 'भरतस्तु वचः श्रुत्वा द्वाःस्थाद्रामसमीरितम्॥ उत्पपातासनात्तूर्णं पद्भ्यामेव महाबलः।'}

{'en': "Seeing Bharata's departure the warder speedily went to the mansion of Satrughna and with folded hands said.", 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वा प्रयान्तं भरतं त्वरमाणः कृताञ्जलिः॥ शत्रुघ्नभवनं गत्वा ततो वाक्यमुवाच ह।'}

{'en': '"Do you come, O foremost Raghus, the King wish to behold you.” Lakşmaņa and Bharata are also there.', 'sn': 'एह्यागच्छ रघुश्रेष्ठ राजा त्वां द्रष्टुमिच्छति॥ गतो हि लक्ष्मणः पूर्वं भरतश्च महायशाः।'}
{'en': 'Hearing the words of the warder Satrughna lowered his head and rising up speedily proceeded to Rama.', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तस्य शत्रुघ्नः परमासनात्॥ शिरसा वन्द्य धरणी प्रययौ यत्र राघवः।'}

{'en': 'Thereupon returning, the warder, with folded। hands, communicated to Rama, the arrivals of his brothers.', 'sn': 'द्वाःस्थस्त्वागम्य रामाय सर्वानेव कृताञ्जलिः॥ निवेदयामास तथा भ्रातृन्स्वान्समुपस्थितान्।'}

{'en': "So long Rāma was engaged poorly in anxious meditation with his crown bent downwards. Informed of the princes' arrival he commanded the warder, “Do you soon bring the princes here. My life depends upon them. They are my dearest life.", 'sn': 'कुमारानागताञ्छ्रुत्वा चिन्ताव्याकुलितेन्द्रियः॥ अवाङ्मुखो दीनमना द्वाःस्थं वचनमब्रवीत्। प्रवेशय कुमारांस्त्वं मत्समीपं त्वरान्वितः॥ एतेषु जीवितं मह्यमेते प्राणाः प्रिया मम।'}

{'en': "Having obtained Rāma's command, the princes, clothed in white raiment, entered there, with folded palms and quiescent mind.", 'sn': 'आज्ञप्तास्तु नरेन्द्रेण कुमाराः शुक्लवाससः॥ प्रह्वाः प्राञ्जलयो भूत्वा विविशुस्ते समाहिताः।'}

{'en': "Having entered there they saw that Rāma's countenance was shorn of beauty like to the moon possessed by Rāhu, the setting sun and the withered lotus and his eyes were full of tears.", 'sn': 'ते तु दृष्ट्वा मुखं तस्य सग्रहं शशिनं यथा॥ संध्यागतमिवादित्यं प्रभया परिवर्जितम्। वाष्पपूर्णे च नयने दृष्ट्वा रामस्य धीमतः। हतशोभं यथा पद्मं मुखं वीक्ष्य च तस्य ते॥'}

{'en': 'Then having approached him quickly, and saluted his feet they all anxiously sat there. Rāma also wiped off his tears.', 'sn': 'ततोऽभिवाद्य त्वरिताः पादौ रामस्य मूर्धभिः। तस्थुः समाहिताः सर्वे रामस्त्वश्रूण्यवर्तयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon having embraced them with his arms he raised up the princes and pressed them to take their seats. Then he said.', 'sn': 'तान्परिष्वज्य बाहुभ्यामुत्थाप्य च महाबलः। आसनेष्वासतेत्युक्त्वा ततो वाक्यं जगाद ह॥'}

{'en': '"You are mine all; you constitute my life; O princes, I am governing the kingdom gained by you; you are all learned, pious and intelligent. Do you follow the duties I point out."', 'sn': 'भवन्तो मम सर्वस्वं भवन्तो जीवितं मम। भवद्भिश्च कृतं राज्यं पालयामि नरेश्वराः॥ भवन्तः कृतशास्त्रार्था बुद्ध्या च परिनिष्ठिताः। संभूय च मदर्थोऽयमन्वेष्टव्यो नरेश्वराः॥'}

{'en': 'Rāma, the descendant of Kakutstha having said this, they, with anxiety and attention, awaited the orders of the king.', 'sn': 'तथा वदति काकुत्स्थे अवधानपरायणाः। उद्विग्नमनसः सर्वे किं नु राजाभिधास्यति॥'}

{'en': "Having been well entertained by Sutīksna, Rāma in company with Sumitrā's son, having passed away the night there, awoke in the morning.", 'sn': 'रामस्तु सहसौमित्रिः सुतीक्ष्णेनाभिपूजितः। परिणाम्य निशां तत्र प्रभाते प्रत्यबुध्यत ॥'}

{'en': "And arising in due time, Rāma along with Sītā, bathed in cool waters odorous with the aroma of lotuses; and having in proper time duly worshipped Fire as well as the deities, in that forest containing abodes of ascetics, Rāma, Lakṣmaṇa and Videha's daughter, their sins purged off, seeing the sun risen, approached Sutīksna and spoke to him these mild words.", 'sn': 'उत्थाय च यथाकालं राघवः सह सीतया। उपस्पृश्य सुशीतेन तोयेनोत्पलगन्धिना॥ अथ तेऽग्नि सुरांश्चैव वैदेही रामलक्ष्मणौ। काल्यं विधिवदभ्यर्च्य तपस्विशरणे वने॥ उदयन्तं दिनकरं दृष्ट्वा विगतकल्मषाः। सुतीक्ष्णमभिगम्येदं श्लक्ष्णं वचनमब्रुवन्॥'}

{'en': 'O Reverend sir, we we have stayed here pleasantly, being excellently ministered to by you. We greet you, and go away. The ascetics urge speed upon us.', 'sn': 'सुखोषिताः स्म भगवंस्त्वया पूज्येन पूजिताः। आपृच्छामः प्रयास्यामो मुनयस्त्वरयन्ति नः॥'}

{'en': 'We hasten to view the collections of asylums that belong to the holy sages inhabiting the forest of Dandaka.', 'sn': 'त्वरामहे वयं द्रष्टुं कृत्स्नमाश्रममण्डलम्। ऋषीणां पुण्यशीलानां दण्डकारण्यवासिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Now we crave your permission along with that of these foremost of anchorites, steady in virtue, crowned with asceticism and selfcontrolled, resembling smokeless flames.', 'sn': 'अभ्यनुज्ञातुमिच्छामः सहैभिर्मुनिपुंगवैः। धर्मनित्यैस्तपोदान्तैर्विशिखैरिव पावकैः॥'}

{'en': 'And we intend to set out ere the sun like to a low-sprung one that has attained to auspicious fortune through evil ways, with rays incapable of being borne, shines too fiercely.', 'sn': 'अविषह्यातपो यावत् सूर्यो नातिविराजते। अमार्गेणागतां लक्ष्मी प्राप्येवान्वयवर्जितः॥ तावदिच्छामहे गन्तुमित्युक्त्वा चरणौ मुनेः। ववन्दे सहसौमित्रिः सीतया सह राघवः॥'}
{'en': "Having said this, Rāghava along with Sītā and Sumitrā's son bowed down to the ascetic's feet.", 'sn': 'तौ सोस्पृशन्तौ चरणावुत्थाप्य मुनिपुंगवः। गाढमाश्लिष्य सस्नेहमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': "And as they touched his feet, that best of ascetics, raising Rāma and Lakşmaņa up, embraced them closely and said, O Rāma, go your way safely, in company with Sumitrā's son and this Sītā that follows you like a shadow.", 'sn': 'अरिष्टं गच्छ पन्थानं राम सौमित्रिणा सह। सीतया चानया सार्धं छाययेवानुवृत्तया॥'}

{'en': 'Behold the beauteous asylums, O hero. of these pure-spirited ascetics inhabiting the forest of Dandaka.', 'sn': 'पश्याश्रमपदं रम्यं दण्डकारण्यवासिनाम्। एषां तपस्विनां वीर तपसा भावितात्मनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'You will see blossoming woods garnished with fruits and roots, containing goodly deer, and mild feathered tribes; tanks and pools laughing with blown lotuses, containing pleasant waters, and abounding in Kārandavas; charming mountain-springs; and romantic forests picturesque with peacocks.', 'sn': 'सुप्राज्यफलमूलानि पुष्पितानि वनानि च। प्रशस्तमृगयूथानि शान्तपक्षिगणानि च॥ फुल्लपङ्कजखण्डानि प्रसन्नसलिलानि च। कारण्डवविकीर्णानि तटाकानि सरांसि च॥ द्रक्ष्यसे दृष्टिरम्याणि गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च । रमणीयान्यरण्यानि मयूराभिरुतानि च॥'}

{'en': "Go, O child; and go you also, O Sumitra's son. And come again to my asylum after having seen these.", 'sn': 'गम्यतां वत्स सौमित्रे भवानपि च गच्छतु। आगन्तव्यं च ते दृष्ट्वा पुनरेवाश्रमं प्रति ॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed, Kākutstha along with Laks maņa, having gone round the ascetic, prepared for departing.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तस्तथेत्युक्त्वा काकुत्स्थः सहलक्ष्मणः। प्रदक्षिणं मुनिं कृत्वा प्रस्थातुमुपचक्रमे॥'}
{'en': 'Then Sīlā of expansive eyes handed to the brothers excellent quivers bows and shining swords.', 'sn': 'ततः शुभतरे तूणी धनुषी चायतेक्षणाः। ददौ सीता तयोर्धात्रोः खङ्गौ च विमलौ ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Then fastening the graceful quivers, and taking the sweet-sounding bows, both Rāma and Lakşmaņa issued from the hermitage.', 'sn': 'आबध्य च शुभे तूणी चापे चादाय सस्वने। निष्क्रान्तावाश्रमाद् गन्तुमुभौ तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ॥'}

{'en': 'And permitted by the Maharşi, the Rāghavas furnished with grace, equipped with bows and scimitars, swiftly set out along with Sītā.', 'sn': 'शीघ्रं तौ रूपसम्पन्नावनुज्ञातौ महर्षिणा। प्रस्थितौ धृतचापासी सीतया सह राघवौ॥'}

{'en': 'There upon the great saint said:-Hear, O king, O you gifted with great energy, for what I have come here. O you of great strength, the great Patriarch has sent me to you.', 'sn': 'शृणु राजन्महासत्व यदर्थमहमागतः। पितामहेन देवेन प्रेषितोऽस्मि महाबल॥'}
{'en': 'O hero, I am your son. You did, in your pristine birth, beget me on Maya-I am Kala, the destroyer of all.', 'sn': 'तवाहं पूर्वके भावे पुत्रः परपुरंजय। मायासंभावितो वीर काल: सर्वसमाहरः॥'}
{'en': 'Lord Brahmā, the father of all creatures, has said that you did promise to preserve the three worlds.', 'sn': 'पितामहश्च भगवानाह लोकपतिः प्रभुः। समयस्ते कृतः सौम्य लोकान्संपरिरक्षितुम्॥'}

{'en': 'Formerly when having slain all animals by your Māyā you went asleep in the waters of the mighty deep I was born.', 'sn': 'सक्षिप्य हि पुरा लोकान्मायया स्वयमेव हि। महार्णवे शयानोऽप्सु मां त्वं पूर्वमजीजनः॥'}

{'en': 'There after you did create the huge-bodied Ananta, living in the waters as the king of serpents. Then you did create two highly powerful Asuras named Madhu and Kaitabha. At that time the bones of those two Asuras having been scattered far and wide this earth containing many mountains was named Medini.', 'sn': 'भोगवन्तं ततो नागमनन्तमुदकेशयम्। मायया जनयित्वा त्वं द्वौ च सत्त्वौ महाबलौ॥ मधुं च कैटभं चैव ययोरस्थिचयैर्वता। इयं पर्वतसंबाधा मेदिनी चाभवत्तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Having procreated me in your lotus navel, dazzling in celestial brilliance you did employ me in the work of generation.', 'sn': 'पद्म दिव्येऽर्कसंकाशे नाभ्यामुत्पाद्य मामपि। प्राजापत्यं त्वया कर्म मयि सर्व निवेशितम्॥'}

{'en': 'I took the charge and procreated men; but finding no other means to preserve them I worshipped you, the lord of the universe and said:-0 lord, you should protect the creatures, for you are my father and giver of energy and therefore irrepressible.', 'sn': 'सोऽहं संन्यस्तभारो हि त्वामुपास्य जगत्पतिम्। रक्षां विधत्स्व भूतेषु मम तेजस्करो भवान्।।।।'}

{'en': 'Thereupon for concerning means for the preservation of creatures, you did renounce your irrepressible shape and assume Vişņu form.', 'sn': 'ततस्त्वमसि दुर्धर्षात्तस्माद्भावात्सनातनात्। रक्षां विधास्यन्भूतानां विष्णुत्वमुफ्जग्मिवान्॥'}

{'en': "And taking your birth from Aditi's powerful son, you went engaged in enhancing the delight of my brothers. You did use to protect the deities whenever they were assailed by any calamity.", 'sn': 'अदित्यां वीर्यवान्पुत्रो भ्रातॄणां वीर्यवर्धनः। समुत्पन्नेषु कृत्येषु तेषां साह्याय कल्पसे॥'}

{'en': 'O lord of the universe, it is for that reason, on beholding the destruction of creatures you went born on earth to slay the Ten-necked demon.', 'sn': 'स त्वमुज्जास्यमानासु प्रजासु जगतोवर। रावणस्य वधाकाङ्क्षी मानुषेषु मनोऽदधाः॥'}
{'en': 'And at that time you did promise that you would live in the land of mortals for eleven thousand years.', 'sn': 'दशवर्षसहस्राणि दशवर्षशतानि च। कृत्वा वासस्य नियमं स्वयमेवात्मना पुरा॥'}

{'en': 'There upon you did assume a human form to carry out your desire. Now that period is ripe and this is the proper time to inform you of it.', 'sn': 'स त्वं मनोमयः पुत्रः पूर्णायुर्मानुषेष्विह। कालो नरवरश्रेष्ठ समीपमुपवर्तितुम्॥'}

{'en': 'O great king, do you wait in this land of mortals if do you wish to govern people for some time more. And if did you wish to repair to the region of immortals, do you again lord over the deities in your Vişņu form and let them be freed from anxiety. O Hero, the Patriarch has sent this intelligence to you.', 'sn': 'यदि भूयो महाराज प्रजा इच्छस्युपासितुम्। वस वा वीर भद्रं ते एवमाह पितामहः॥ अथ वा विजिगीषा ते सुरलोकाय राघव। सनाथा विष्णुना देवा भवन्तु विगतज्वराः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing those unequalled words of the Patriarch from the mouth of Kala, the destroyer of all, Rama smiling said.', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा पितामहेनोक्तं वाक्यं कालसमीरितम्। राघवः प्रहसन्वाक्यं सर्वसंहारमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'I have been greatly pleased and happy for your coming here O my son, I descended on earth to bring about the well-being of the three worlds. May good betide you. I shall now repair to from where I have come here.', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा मे देवदेवस्य वाक्यं परममद्भुतम्। प्रीतिर्हि महती जाता तवागमनसंभवा॥ त्रयाणामपि लोकानां कार्यार्थ मम संभवः। भद्रं तेऽस्तु गमिष्यामि यत एवाहमागतः॥'}

{'en': 'I was thinking of this when you did come here. Therefore, I have no doubt in this. O lord of destruction, the immortals are dependent on me, so I shall be with them in all works. The Great Patriarch has said the truth.', 'sn': 'हृद्गतो ह्यसि संप्राप्तो न मे तत्र विचारणा। मया हि सर्वकृत्येषु देवानां वशवर्तिनाम्। स्थातव्यं सर्वसंहार यथा ह्याह पितामहः॥'}

{'en': 'As you look on, I shall describe to you those leaders who shall put forth their prowess for Rāghava, and lay down their lives in his behalf.)', 'sn': 'तांस्तु ते संप्रवक्ष्यामि प्रेक्षमाणस्य यूथपान । राघवार्थे पराक्रान्ता ये न रक्षन्ति जीवितम्॥'}

{'en': 'That one of dreadful deeds the long hairs on whose long tail, coppery, and yellow, and black, and white, thrown up, look like the rays of the Sun, and are trailing over the ground, is the monkey, named Hara; whom follow hundreds and thousands (of monkeys) desperately upraising trees, intent upon (scaling) Lankā-the leaders of the monkey-king and his servants present (in this conflict.)', 'sn': 'स्निग्धा यस्य बहुव्यामा दीर्घलांगूलमाश्रिताः। ताम्राः पीताः श्वेताः प्रकीर्णा घोरकर्मणः॥ प्रगृहीताः प्रकाशन्ते सूर्यस्येव मरीचयः। पृथिव्यां चानुकृष्यन्ते हरो नामैष वानरः॥ यं पृष्ठतोऽनुगच्छन्ति शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः। वृक्षानुद्यम्य सहसा लङ्कारोहणतत्पराः॥ यूथपा हरिराजस्य किंकराः समुपस्थिताः।'}

{'en': 'These whom you behold present, resembling mighty masses of sable clouds, like to black collyrium, of genuine prowess, countless and incapable of enumeration, dwelling in mountains, provinces, and rivers, terrible bears-approach you, O king. In their amidst is their king, grimeyed and of fierce appearance, like to Parjanya* encompassed by clouds, who dwell in that best of mountains, Rikkhavān, drinking of the Narmadā. *Indra', 'sn': 'नीलानिव महामेघांस्तिष्ठतो यांस्तु पश्यसि ॥ असिताञ्जनसंकाशान्युद्धे सत्यपराक्रमान्। असंख्येयाननिर्देश्यान्परं पारमिवोदधेः॥ पर्वतेषु च ये केचिद्विषयेषु नदीषु च। एते त्वामभिवर्तन्ते राजनृक्षाः सुदारुणाः॥ एषां मध्ये स्थितो राजा भीमाक्षो भीमदर्शनः। पर्जन्य इव जीमूतैः समन्तात्परिवारितः॥ ऋक्षवन्तं गिरिश्रेष्ठमध्यास्ते नर्मदां पिबन्।'}

{'en': 'Behold this one resembling a hill-younger brother of Dhūmra, lord of all the bears. He is equal to this brother in beauty, and of superior prowess. This leader of redoubtable leaders is named Jämbavān. He is mild, obedient to his superiors and fierce in fight.', 'sn': 'सर्वाणामधिपतिधूम्रो नामैष यूथपः॥ यवीयानस्य तु भ्राता पश्यैनं पर्वतोपमम्। भ्रात्रा समानो रूपेण विशिष्टश्च पराक्रमे॥ स एष जाम्बवानाम महायूथपयूथपः। प्रशान्तो गुरुवर्ती च संप्रहारेष्वमर्षणः॥'}

{'en': 'The intelligent Jāmbavan assisted Sakra signally in the war of the gods and Asuras, and he has won many boons (in consequence).', 'sn': 'एतेन साह्यं तु महत्त्कृतं शक्रस्य धीमता। देवासुरे जाम्बवता लब्धाश्च बहवो वराः॥'}

{'en': 'Ascending the tops of mountains, these hurl down gigantic crags huge as colossal clouds, for does (the fear of)-death (ever) disquiet them. And their bodies covered with hair, they resemble Raksasas and ghosts (in their conduct).', 'sn': 'आरुह्य पर्वताग्रेभ्यो महाभ्रविपुलाः शिलाः। मुश्चन्ति विपुलाकारा न मृत्योरुद्विजन्ति च॥ राक्षसानां च सदृशाः पिशाचानां च रोमशाः। एतस्य सैन्या बहवो विचरन्त्यमितौजसः॥'}

{'en': 'This one one of immeasurable energy has innumerable troops going about, who behold this leader of leaders under unusual excitement leaping and resting (by turns). This lord of monkeys dwell near the thousand-eyed Deity; and this leader of hands, gifted with strength, is named Rambha.', 'sn': 'य एनमभिसंरब्धं प्लवमानमवस्थितम् । प्रेक्षन्ते वानराः सर्वे स्थितं यूथपयूथपम्॥ एष राजन्सहस्राक्षं पर्युपास्ते हरीश्वरः। बलेन बलसंयुक्तो रम्भो नामैष यूथपः॥'}

{'en': 'He that going touch with his side a mountain situated at the distance of a Yojana, and, rising up, measurə the same length, and whose beauty is surpassed by none among quadrupeds, is known under the name of Sannādana, the grand father of the monkeys; this intelligent one battlºd did he meet with discomfiture. This is that general of the forces. *There is a word, rane, in battle-in this line, left out on the ground of pleonasm.', 'sn': 'यः स्थितं योजने शैलं गच्छन्पार्श्वेन सेवते। ऊर्ध्वं तथैव कायेन गतः प्राप्नोति योजनम्॥ यस्मात्तु परमं रूपं चतुष्पात्सु न विद्यते। श्रुतः संनादनो नाम वानराणां पितामहः॥ येन युद्धं तदा दत्तं रणे शक्रस्य धीमता। पराजयश्च न प्राप्तः सोऽयं यूथपयूथपः॥'}

{'en': "He whose prowess is like that of Śakra, is this one begot by Fire on a Gandharva's daughter, for assisting the celestials on the occasion of the nor war of the gods and the Asuras. And this graceful and powerful one-best of monkeys-disport in that sovereign of mountains inhabited by numbers of Kinnaras, where king Vaiśravaņa eate rose apples, and which, O lord of Raksasa, ever conduce to the pleasure of your brother. And this one who never , extoll himself in battle, is named Krathana-leader of hosts. Surrounded by a thousand Koti (of troops), and stationed in the midst of the monkeys, he hope to subjugate Lankā with his own troops alone.", 'sn': 'यस्य विक्रममाणस्य शक्रस्येव पराक्रमः। एष गन्धर्वकन्यायामुत्पन्नः कृष्णवर्त्मना॥ तदा देवासुरे युद्धे साह्याथ त्रिदिवौकसाम्। यत्र वैश्रवणो राजा जम्बूमुपनिषेवते॥ यो राजा पर्वतेन्द्राणां बहुकिंनरसेविनाम्। विहारसुखदो नित्यं भ्रातुस्ते राक्षसाधिप॥ तत्रैष रमते श्रीमान्बलवान्वानरोत्तमः। युद्धेष्वकत्थनो नित्यं क्रथनो नाम यूथपः॥ वृतः कोटिसहस्रेण हरीणां समवस्थितः। एषैवाशंसते लङ्का स्वेनानीकेन मर्दितुम्॥'}

{'en': 'And he that roam about the Gangā, terrifying leaders of elephant-herds, remembering the former hostility of the monkeys and the elephants, is this leader of bands, who, roaring, oppose wild elephants in mountain-caverns and crush trees, and forernost of monkeys, and chief of the monkey-forces like Sakra himself in heaven, sport, resorting to Uciravija pertaining to Mandara, best of mountains, on the golden river.* A thousand lacs of monkeys, elated with vigour and prowess, setting up roars and furnished with (long) arms follow him; and this one is the leader of those high-souled monkeys. And, o king, he whom you see resembling clouds uplifted by the winds, is a leader named Pramāthi. And his fleet-coursing soldiery are fiery, and volumes of red-hued dust are scattered about him profusely on all sides. *Ganga.', 'sn': 'यो गङ्गामनुपर्येति त्रासयन्गजयूथपान्। हस्तिनां वानराणां च पूर्ववैरमनुस्मरन्॥ एष यूथपतिर्नेता गर्जनिगरिगुहाशयः। गजान्रोधयते वन्यानारुजंश्च महीरुहान्॥ हरीणां वाहिनीमुख्यो नदीं हैमवतीमनु। उशीरबीजमाश्रित्य मन्दरं पर्वतोत्तमम्॥ रमते वानरश्रेष्ठो दिवि शक्र इव स्वयम्। एनं शतसहस्राणां सहस्रमभिवर्तते।२८।। वीर्यविक्रमदृप्तानां नर्दतां बाहुशालिनाम्। स एष नेता चैतेषां वानराणां महात्मनाम्।२९।। स एष दुर्धरो राजन्प्रमाथी नाम यूथपः। वातेनेवोद्धतं मेघं यमेनमनुपश्यसि॥ अनीकमपि संरब्धं वानराणां तरस्विनाम्। उद्भूतमरुणाभासं पवनेन समन्ततः॥ विवर्तमानं बहुशो य तद्बहुलं रजः।'}

{'en': 'These wondrous strong and dreadful Golāngülas* numbering hundreds and hundred thousands, seeing the building of the bridge, surrounding, O mighty monarch, the leader named Gavākṣa—a Golāngūla-set up shouts, intending to demolish Lankā with their prowess. *Vide anti.', 'sn': 'एते सितमुखा घोरा गोलाङ्गला महाबलाः॥ शतं शतसहस्राणि दृष्ट्वा वै सेतुबन्धनम्। गोलाङ्गुलं महाराज गवाक्षं नाम यूथपम्॥ परिवार्याभिनर्दन्ते लङ्कां मर्दितुमोजसा।'}

{'en': 'Where the trees bring forth fruits of every season and the black bees resort, in the mountain furnished with solar splendour, which the Sun circumambulates, by whose radiance ever beam beasts and birds with like hue, whose table-lands are never forsaken by magnanimous Maharșis; where the trees yield every object of desire and all are fraught with fruits; in which best of mountains excellent honey is founds, there in the charming Golden hill, O king, sport this one—the foremost of the principal monkeys, Kaśarī by name, a leader of bands.', 'sn': 'भ्रमराचरिता यत्र सर्वकालफलद्रुमाः॥ यं सूर्यस्तुल्यवर्णाभमनुपर्येति पर्वतम्। यस्य भासा सदा भान्ति तद्वर्णा मृगपक्षिणः॥ यस्य प्रस्थं महात्मानो न त्यजन्ति महर्षयः। सर्वकामफला वृक्षाः सर्वे फलसमन्विताः॥ मधूनि च महार्हाणि यस्मिन्पर्वतसत्तमे। तत्रैष रमते राजनम्ये काञ्चनपर्वते॥ मुख्यो वानरमुख्यानां केसरी नाम यूथपः।'}

{'en': 'There are sixty thousand charming Golden hills. In their midst is that best of mountains,* even as you, O sinless one, are among the Raksasa. *Savarni Meru.', 'sn': 'षष्टिर्गिरिसहस्राणि रम्याः काञ्चनपर्वताः॥ तेषां मध्ये गिरिवरस्त्वमिवानघ रक्षसाम्।'}
