{'en': 'There in the inmost hill dwell (monkeys) tawny-hued; and white, with coppery faces; yellowish like honey; sharp-toothed; having nails for their weapons, and four teeth like lions; irresistible like tigers all equal to Vaicawānara, and resembling flaming venomous snakes; furnished with long tails; like to mad elephants; seeming like gigantic hills; roaring like mighty clouds; with eyes tawny and round; of terrific mien; and emitting sounds, and these are gazing at Lankā, as if devastating her.', 'sn': 'तत्रैके कपिलाः श्वेतास्ताम्रास्या मधुपिङ्गलाः॥ निवसन्त्यन्तिमगिरौ तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रा नखायुधाः। सिंहा इव चतुर्दष्ट्रा व्याघ्रा इव दुरासदाः॥ सर्वे वैश्वानरसमा ज्वलदाशीविषोपमाः। सुदीर्घाञ्चितलाफूला मत्तमातंगसंनिभाः॥ महापर्वतसंकाशा महाजीमूतनिःस्वनाः। वृत्तपिङ्गलनेत्रा हि महाभीमगतिस्वनाः।॥ मर्दयन्तीव ते सर्वे तस्थुर्लङ्कां समीक्ष्य ते।'}

{'en': 'This powerful one staying in their midst, is their leader, eager for victory; and the puissant (monkey) always look like the Sun himself; and this one, o king, is famed on earth by the name of Satabalr.', 'sn': 'एष चैषामधिपतिर्मध्ये तिष्ठति वीर्यवान्॥ जयार्थी नित्यमादित्यमुपतिष्ठति वीर्यवान्। नाम्ना पृथिव्यां विख्यातो राजशतबलीति यः॥'}

{'en': "This heroic one, powerful and mighty, established in his own prowess, hope to devastate Lankā with his own forces. And for compassing Rāma's desire, the monkeys does not cherish and kindness for his life.", 'sn': 'एषैवाशंसते लङ्कां स्वेनानीकेन मर्दितुम्। विक्रान्तो बलराञ्छूरः पौरुषे स्वे व्यवस्थितः।।४५ रामप्रियार्थं प्राणानां दयां न कुरुते हरिः।'}
{'en': 'Gaya, Gavākşa, Nala, and the monkey Nīlaeach of these is encompassed by ten koțis of warriors.', 'sn': 'गजो गवाक्षो गवयो नलो नीलश्च वानरः॥ एकैकमेव योधानां कोटिभिर्दशभिर्वृतः।'}

{'en': '(Besides these), there are other choice monkeys dwelling in the Vindhya mountain, but I cannot enumerate these (monkeys) possessed of fleet vigour, in consequence of their vast number.', 'sn': 'तथान्ये व. रश्रेष्ठा विन्ध्यपर्वतवासिनः। न शक्यन्ते बहुत्वात्तु संख्यातुं लघुविक्रमाः॥'}

{'en': 'All these, O mighty monarch, are of exceeding prowess, all possess persons resembling mighty mountains; and all are competent in a moment to remove and scatter the Earth with them.', 'sn': 'सर्वे महाराज महाप्रभावाः सर्वे महाशैलनिकाशकायाः। सर्वे समर्थाः पृथिवीं क्षणेन कर्तुं प्रविध्वस्तविकीर्णशैलाम् ॥'}
{'en': 'Then Akampana bestirring himself, speedily issuing out of Janasthāna, spoke to Rāvana,', 'sn': 'त्वरमाणस्ततो गत्वा जनस्थानादकम्पनः। प्रविश्य लङ्कां वेगेन रावणं वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, a great many Rākşasa living in Janasthāna, have been slain, and Khara also had been slain in battle. I alone have with much difficulty managed to come here.', 'sn': 'जनस्थानस्थिता राजन् राक्षसा बहवो हताः! खरश्च निहतः संख्ये कथंचिदहमागतः॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed, the ten-necked one, flaming up in energy, with his eyes reddened in wrath, said this to Akampana,', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तो दशग्रीवः क्रुद्धः संरक्तलोचनः। अकम्पनमुवाचेदं निर्दहन्निव तेजसा॥'}

{'en': 'Who, having his days numbered, had ravaged the dreadful Janasthāna? Who shall no more wend the way of all beings?', 'sn': 'केन भीमं जनस्थानं हतं मम परासुना। को हि सर्वेषु लोकेषु गति नाधिगमिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Doing me a bad turn, Maghavan himself, or Vaiśravana, or Yama, or Vişnu, cannot attain happiness.', 'sn': 'स हि मे विप्रियं कृत्वा शक्यं मघवता सुखम्। प्राप्तुं वैश्रवणेनापि न यमेन च विष्णुना ॥'}

{'en': 'I am the destroyer of the Destroyer himself; and I burn even very Fire. And I can bring Death itself to mortality.', 'sn': 'कालस्य चाप्यहं कालो दहेयमपि पावकम्। मृत्यु मरणधर्मेण संयोजयितुमुत्सहे॥'}

{'en': 'I can by my impetus resist the force of the wind. And when enraged, I can by my energy consume the Sun and Fire.', 'sn': 'वातस्य तरसा वेगं निहन्तुमपि चोत्सहे। दहेयमपि संक्रुद्धस्तेजसाऽऽदित्यपावकौ॥'}

{'en': 'Thereat, Akampana, with joined hands, from fear replied to the ten-necked Rāvana, in faltering words, beseeching courage.', 'sn': 'तथा क्रुद्धं दशग्रीवं कृताञ्जलिरकम्पनः। भयात् संदिग्धया वाचा रावणं याचतेऽभयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereat that foremost of Raksasas, the tennecked one, granted him courage. Then inspired with confidence, Akampana without fear spoke,', 'sn': 'दशग्रीवोऽभयं तस्मै प्रददौ रक्षसां वरः। स विस्रब्धोऽब्रवीद् वाक्यमसंदिग्धमकम्पनः॥'}

{'en': 'There is a son of Dasaratha, youthful, resembling a lion*, named Rāma. of broad shoulders, and possessed of excellent beauty of long and mighty-arms. (he) is sable-hued, of high fame, and of matchless prowess and vigour. It is he that in Janasthāna has slain Khara with Dusana. Another reading is Virunga: i upopetu: possessed of handsome person.-', 'sn': 'पुत्रो दशरथस्यास्ते सिंहसंहननो युवा। रामो नाम महास्कन्धो वृत्तायतमहाभुजः॥ श्यामः पृथुयशाः श्रीमानतुल्यबलविक्रमः। हतस्तेन जनस्थाने खरश्च सहदूषणः॥'}

{'en': "Hearing Akampana's words, that lord of the Rākşasas, Rāvana, breathing like a mighty serpent, said these words,", 'sn': 'अकम्पनवचः श्रुत्वा रावणो राक्षसाधिपः। नागेन्द्र इव निःश्वस्य इदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Tell me, O Akampana, has Rāma come to Janasthāna, accompanied with the sovereign of the celestials and the body of the immortals?', 'sn': 'स सुरेन्द्रेण संयुक्तो रामः सर्वामरैः सह। उपयातो जनस्थानं ब्रूहि कच्चिदकम्पन ॥'}
{'en': "Again hearing Rāvana's words, Akampana described the strength and energy of that highsouled one.", 'sn': 'रावणस्य पुनर्वाक्यं निशम्य तदकम्पनः। आचचक्षे बलं तस्य विक्रमं च महात्मनः॥'}

{'en': '(He) is named Rama, and is exceedingly energetic; the foremost of al bowmenfurnished with celestial panoply; and is possessed of pre-eminent prowess in warfare.', 'sn': 'रामो नाम महातेजाः श्रेष्ठः सर्वधनुष्मताम्। दिव्यास्त्रगुणसम्पन्नः परं धर्मं गतो युधि ॥'}

{'en': 'Like to him in strength, of red eyes, and gifted with a voice like the sound of a kettledrum, his younger brother, Laksmana has a countenance resembling the full-moon.', 'sn': 'तस्यानुरूपो बलवान् रक्ताक्षो दुन्दुभिस्वनः। कनीयाँलक्ष्मणो भ्राता राकाशशिनिभाननः॥'}

{'en': 'He has met with him (Rāma) as the wind meeteth with a flame. he is endeued with grace, and is the foremost of monarchs. It is he who has ravaged Janasthāna.', 'sn': 'स तेन सह संयुक्तः पावकेनानिलो यथा। श्रीमान् राजवरस्तेन जनस्थानं निपातितम्॥'}

{'en': 'The magnanimous gods did not come there, No doubts need be entertained on this head. The feathered shafts, plated with gold near the plumed part, becoming five-mouthed serpents at up the Raksasas.', 'sn': 'नैव देवा महात्मानो नात्र कार्या विचारणा। शरा रामेण तूत्सृष्टा रुक्मपुङ्खाः पतत्त्रिणः॥ सर्पाः पञ्चानना भूत्वा भक्षयन्ति स्म राक्षसान्।'}

{'en': 'Wherever oppressed with fear the Rākṣasas go, they see Rāma stationed before them. In this way, O sinless one, has Janasthāna been exterminated by him.', 'sn': 'येन येन च गच्छन्ति राक्षसा भयकर्षिताः॥ तेन तेन स्म पश्यन्ति राममेवाग्रतः स्थितम्। इत्थं विनाशितं तेन जनस्थानं तवानघ ॥'}
{'en': "Hearing Akmpana's words, Ravana said, “I will go to Janasthāna for slaying Rāma with Laksmana.", 'sn': 'अकम्पनवचः श्रुत्वा रावणो वाक्यमब्रवीत्। गमिष्यामि जनस्थानं रामं हन्तुं सलक्ष्मणम्॥'}
{'en': "When he had said this, Akampana said, He ar, O king, the true report of Rāma's prowess and manliness.", 'sn': 'अथैवमुक्ते वचने प्रोवाचेदमकम्पनः। शृणु राजन् यथावृत्तं रामस्य बलपौरुषम्॥'}

{'en': 'Enraged, the highly famous Rāma cannot by putting forth vigour be checked. And by means of his shafts, he can me river in full flood turn its course. And he can bring down from the sky its stars and planets, and that graceful one can recover the depressed Earth.', 'sn': 'असाध्यः कुपितो रामो विक्रमेण महायशाः। आपगायास्तु पूर्णाया वेगं परिहरेच्छरैः॥ सताराग्रहनक्षत्रं नभश्चाप्यवसादयेत् ।'}

{'en': 'That lord can sub-merge all creatures by riving the continents of the sea, and with his shafts can resist the onset of the occan, and the wind; and that illustrious one that foremost of persons by virtue of his vigour, destroying the worlds, can again create all creatures.', 'sn': 'असौरामस्तु सीदन्ती श्रीमानभ्युद्धरेन्महीम्॥ भित्वा वेलां समुद्रस्य लोकानाप्लावयेद् विभुः। वेगं वापि समुद्रस्य वायुं वा विधमेच्छरैः॥ संहत्य वा पुनर्लोकान् विक्रमेण महायशाः। शक्तः श्रेष्ठः स पुरुषः स्रष्टुं पुनरपि प्रजाः॥'}

{'en': 'O ten necked one, forsooth, Rāma cannot be subdued in conflict, either by you or the world of Rākşasas, as heaven is incapable of being attained by a sinner.', 'sn': 'नहि रामो दशग्रीव शक्यो जेतुं रणे त्वया। रक्षसां वापि लोकेन स्वर्ग: पापजनैरिव ॥'}

{'en': 'I deem him incapable of being slain by all the Gods and Asuras together. This alone is the means of slaying. Do you heedfully listen to it!', 'sn': 'न तं वध्यमहं मन्ये सर्वैर्देवासुरैरपि। अयं तस्य वधोपायस्तन्ममैकमनाः शृणु॥'}

{'en': 'He has a wife of sterling worth in the world, and that slender-waisted one is known by the name of Sītā. She is in the full bloom of youth, and has a symmetrical person-a jewel among womankind embellished with jewels.', 'sn': 'भार्या तस्योत्तमा लोके सीता नाम सुमध्यमा। श्यामा समविभक्ताङ्गी स्त्रीरत्नं रत्नभूषिता॥'}

{'en': 'And neither a goddess, nor a Gandharvī, nor yet an Apsarī, nor a. Pannagī is equal to her; and what is a human female?', 'sn': 'नैव देवी न गन्धर्वी नाप्सरा न च पन्नगी। तुल्या सीमन्तिनी तस्य मानुषी तु कुतो भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thrashing him, do you in the mighty forest, carry away his wife. Without Sītā, Rama shall cease to exist.', 'sn': 'तस्यापहर भार्यां त्वं तं प्रमथ्य महावने। सीतया रहितो रामो न चैव हि भविष्यति ॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, the lord of the Rākṣasas, Rāvaņa, happened to relish those words; and reflecting (a while), that mighty-armed one addressed Akampana.', 'sn': 'अरोचयत तद्वाक्यं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः। चिन्तयित्वा महाबाहुरकम्पनमुवाच ह॥'}

{'en': 'Excellent well. I will go there alone, accompanied by my charioteer only. I will this very morning with a glad heart bring Vaidehi to this spacious palace.', 'sn': 'बाढं कल्यं गमिष्यामि ह्येकः सारथिना सह। आनेष्यामि च वेदेहीमिमां दृष्टो महापुरीम्॥'}
{'en': 'Saying this, Ravana departed, lighting up all sides, on a sun-shiny car, yoked with mules.', 'sn': 'तदेवमुक्त्वा प्रययौ खरयुक्तेन रावणः। रथेनादित्यवर्णेन दिशः सर्वाः प्रकाशयन्॥'}

{'en': "And coursing the firmament, that mighty car of that foremost of Rākşasas looked like the Moon among clouds. And proceeding far, he, approaching the asylum (of Taraka's son), presented himself before him. And Mārīca entertained the king with meats and drinks passing human.", 'sn': 'स रथो राक्षसेन्द्रस्य नक्षत्रपथगो महान्। चञ्चूर्यमाणः शुशुभे जलदे चन्द्रमा इव॥ स दूरे चाश्रमं गत्वा ताटकेयमुपागमत्। मारीचेनार्चितो राजा भक्ष्यभोज्यैरमानुषैः ॥'}

{'en': 'Having entertained him personally with a seat and water (to wash the feet), Marica spoke these pregnant words.', 'sn': 'तं स्वयं पूजयित्वा तु आसनेनोदकेन च। अर्थोपहितया वाचा मारीचो वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, O lord of the Rākşasas, is it well with the worlds? I am filled with fear: I apprehend that all is not right, since you have come hither (alone) in such post-haste speed.', 'sn': 'कच्चित् सुकुशलं राजैल्लोकानां राक्षसाधिप। आशङ्के नाधिजाने त्वं यतस्तूर्णमुपागतः॥'}
{'en': 'Thus addressed by Mārica, the highly energetic Ravana, versed in speech, said.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तो महातेजा मारीचेन स रावणः। ततः पश्चादिदं वाक्यमब्रवीद् वाक्यकोविदः॥'}

{'en': 'My child, the guards (of Janasthāna) have been slain by Rāma of untiring energy; and all What Janasthāna, incapable of being slain, has (by him) been brought down in battle.', 'sn': 'आरक्षो मे हतस्तात रामेणाक्लिष्टकारिणा। जनस्थानमवध्यं तत् सर्वं युधि निपातितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Do you, therefore, assist me in carrying away his wife. Hearing these words of the lord of Rākş asas, Mārīca said.', 'sn': 'तस्य मे कुरु साचिव्यं तस्य भार्यापहारणे। राक्षसेन्द्रवचः : श्रुत्वा मारीचो वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'What enemy of yours in the guise of a friend, has spoken of Sītā to you? And, O foremost of monarchs, who, having been, entertained by you, dose not bear you good will?', 'sn': 'आख्याता केन वा सीता मित्ररूपेण शत्रुणा। त्वया राक्षसशार्दूल को न नन्दति नन्दितः॥'}

{'en': "Tell me, who is it that has told you, 'Bring Sītā hither?' Who is it that has set his heart on severing the summit of the entire Räksasa world?", 'sn': 'सीतामिहानयस्वेति को ब्रवीति ब्रवीहि मे। रक्षोलोकस्य सर्वस्य कः शृङ्ग छेत्तुमिच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'He must be your enemy that excites you to this. Of this there is not the least doubt. he wishes to extract through your agency the fangs of a venomous snake.', 'sn': 'प्रोत्साहयति यश्च त्वां स च शत्रुरसंशयम्। आशीविषमुखात् दंष्ट्रमुद्धर्तुं चेच्छति त्वया॥'}

{'en': 'Who (intends) to lead you astray by imposing on you such a deed? Who, O king, has struck in the head, you that was slumbering in peace?', 'sn': 'कर्मणानेन केनासि कापथं प्रतिपादितः। सुखसुप्तस्य ते राजन् प्रहृतं केन मूर्धनि॥'}

{'en': 'Rāghava in war is like a mad elephant, having unblemished ancestry for his trunk, perspiration for his temporal exudation; and arms resting well beside him for his tusks. O Rāvaņa, you are not competent even to look at an him.', 'sn': 'तेजोमदः संस्थितदोर्विषाणः। उदीक्षितुं रावण नेह युक्तः स संयुगे राघवगन्धहस्ती॥'}

{'en': 'You ought not to rouse up the slecping manlion, that slayer of skilful Rākșasas resembling deer, with his sport in the field, for his joints and down; arrows for his body and sharp scimitar for his teeth.', 'sn': 'असौ रणान्तः स्थितिसंधिवालो विदग्धरक्षोमृगहा नृसिंहः। सुप्तस्त्वया बोधयितुं न शक्यः शराङ्गपूर्णो निशितासिदंष्ट्रः॥'}

{'en': 'O Sovereign of the Räkşasas, you ought not to plunge yourself into this dreadful, and abyssless ocean, having the bow for its alligators, activity of arms for its shine, arrows for its billows, and engagement for its waters.', 'sn': 'चापापहारे भुजवेगपके शरोमिमाले सुमहाहवौघे। न रामपातालमुखेऽतिघोरे प्रस्कन्दितुं राक्षसराज युक्तम्।। ।'}

{'en': 'Be propitious, O lord of Lankā! O foremost of Rākşasas, with a contented heart, you had better go your way to Lankā. Do you ever sport with your own wives: let Rāma in company with his wife, sport in the woods.', 'sn': 'प्रसीद लङ्केश्वर राक्षसेन्द्र लङ्कां प्रसन्नो भव साधु गच्छ। त्वं स्वेषु दारेषु रमस्व नित्यं रामः सभार्यो रमतां वनेषु ॥'}
{'en': 'Thus addressed by Mārīca, the ten-throated Rāvana desisted, and entered Lankā the best of capitals.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तो दशग्रीवो मारीचेन स रावणः। न्यवर्तत पुरी लङ्कां विवेश च गृहोत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing that Akampana had been killed, the lord of Raksasas, overwhelmed with anger, with his face somewhat fallen, cast his eyes on his counsellors.', 'sn': 'अकम्पनवधं श्रुत्वा क्रुद्धो वै राक्षसेश्वरः। किंचिद्दीनमुखश्चापि सचिवांस्तानुदैक्षत॥'}

{'en': 'Then pondering and reflecting for a while, in the forenoon he went round the city of Lankā for inspecting the barracks.', 'sn': 'स तु ध्यात्वा मुहूर्तं तु मन्त्रिभिः संविचार्य च। ततस्तु रावणः पूर्वदिवसे राक्षसाधिपः।। पुरीं परिययौ लङ्कां सर्वान्गुल्मानवेक्षितुम्॥'}

{'en': 'The king surveyed the city guarded by the Rakşsasas, covered with innumerable barracks, and crowned with ensigns and standards,', 'sn': 'तां राक्षसगणैर्गुप्तां गुल्मैर्बहुभिरावृताम्। ददर्श नगरी राजा पताकाध्वजमालिनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing the city besieged, Ravana-lord of the Rākşaşas-seasonably spoke words of welfare to Prahasta skilled in fight.', 'sn': 'रुद्धां तु नगरी दृष्ट्वा रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः। उवाचात्महितं काले प्रहस्तं युद्धकोविदम्॥'}
{'en': '"Save battle, deliverance find I none for the city suddenly beleaguered and put to straits.', 'sn': 'पुरस्योपनिविष्टस्य सहसा पीडितस्य ह। नान्ययुद्धात्प्रपश्यामि मोक्षं युद्धविशारदाः॥'}

{'en': 'And this strain must be borne by these versed in warfare-me or Kumbhakarna or you-my general or Indrajit or Nikumbha.', 'sn': 'अहं वा कुम्भकर्णो वा त्वं वा सेनापतिर्यम। इन्द्रजिद्धा निकुम्भो वा वहेयुर्भारमीदृशम्॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore do you from this place, speedily taking this force, march to where the monkeys are, for securing victory (in the encounter).', 'sn': 'सत्त्वं बलमतः शीघ्रमादाय परिगृह्य च। विजयायाभिनियहि यत्र सर्वे वनौकसः॥'}

{'en': 'And as soon as you set out, the monkeyforces, hearing the roars of the foremost Rākșasas-speedily setting themselves in motionshall flee away.', 'sn': 'निर्याणादेव तूर्णं च चलिता हरिवाहिनी। नर्दतां राक्षसेन्द्राणां श्रुत्वा नादं द्रविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'And volatile and haughty and of fickle minds, the monkeys will not be able to bear your shouts; even as elephants are incapable of bearing the roaring of a lion.', 'sn': 'चपला ह्यविनाताश्च चलचित्ताश्च वानराः। न सहिष्यन्ति ते नादं सिंहनादमिव द्विषा:॥'}

{'en': 'And on that monkey-army running away, Rāma in company with Sumitrās son, deprived of his power and shorn of support, shall, O Prahasta, come under your subjection.', 'sn': 'विद्वते च बले तस्मिन्रामः सौमित्रिणा सह। अवशस्तु निरालम्बः प्रहस्तवशमेष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'In this matter, your being slain is uncertain, but victory is certain. Now do you, as you weigh out welfare, declare yourself for or against this course.', 'sn': 'आपत्संशयिता श्रेयो नात्र निःसंशयीकृता। प्रतिलोमानुलोमं वा यत्तु नो मन्यसे हितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed by Ravana, Prahasta-general of the forces-said to the Rākşaas-chief; like Uśanas addressing the lord of Asuras.', 'sn': 'रावणेनैवमुक्तस्तु प्रहस्तो वाहिनीपतिः। राक्षसेन्द्रमुवाचेदमसुरेन्द्रमिवोशना॥'}

{'en': 'O king before this we had deliberated together with wise counsellors, and then we disputed with each other in our respective views.', 'sn': 'राजन्मन्त्रितपूर्वं नः कुशलैः सह मन्त्रिभिः। विवादश्चापि नो वृत्तः समवेक्ष्य परस्परम्॥'}

{'en': 'And I had declared myself for giving up Sītā as fraught with our welfare; and we saw war involved in withholding her.', 'sn': 'प्रदानेन तु सीतायाः श्रेयो व्यवसितं मया। अप्रदाने पुनयुद्धं दृष्टमेव तथैव नः॥'}

{'en': 'I have ever been honoured by you variously with gifts and regard and soft speech. And what is your good for which I shall not be at the pains?', 'sn': 'सोऽहं दानैश्च मानैश्च सततं पूजितस्त्वया। सान्त्वैश्च विविधैः काले किं न कुर्यां हितं तव॥'}

{'en': 'My life I do not care to keep, nor yet my sons or my wife. Behold! for you will I offer up my life into the sacrificial fire of conflict.', 'sn': 'नहि मे जीवितं रक्ष्यं पुत्रदारधनानि च। त्वं पश्य मां जुहूषन्तं त्वदर्थे जीवितं युधि॥'}

{'en': 'Having said this to his master-Rävaņa-the general, Prahasta, addressed his generals staying before him, saying.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा तु भर्तारं रावणं वाहिनीपतिः। उवाचेदं बलाध्यक्षान्प्रहस्तः पुरतः स्थितान्॥'}

{'en': 'At once bring up the mighty host of Raksasas Today in the field of fight will I entertain the flesh-feeding fowls of the forest with the bodies of the foes slain with my resistless shafts.', 'sn': 'समानयत मे शीघ्रं राक्षसानां महाबलम्। मद्बाणानां तु वेगेन हतानां तु रणाजिरे॥ अद्य तृप्यन्तु मांसादाः पक्षिणः काननौकसः।'}
{'en': 'Hearing his speech, the highly powerful leaders arrayed the army in that abode of the Raksasa.', 'sn': 'तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा बलाध्यक्षा महाबलाः॥ बलमुद्योजयामासुस्तस्मिनाक्षसमन्दिरे।'}

{'en': 'In a moment Lankā swarmed with heroic and terrific Rākşasas equipped with various arms, as if with elephants, as well as with people worshipping Fire and bowing down to Brāhmaṇas. And the perfumed breeze blew, laden with the incense of sacrificial offerings.', 'sn': 'सा बभूव मुहूर्तेन भीमैर्नानाविधायुधैः॥ लङ्का राक्षसवीरैस्तैर्गजैरिव समाकुला। हुताशनं तर्पयतां ब्राह्मणांश्च नमस्यताम्॥ आज्यगन्धप्रतिवहः सुरभिर्मारुतो ववौ।'}

{'en': 'The Raksasas, inspired with martial ardour, put on diverse garlands, consecrated with scriptural formulae; and donned on their armour.', 'sn': 'सजश्च विविधाकारा जगृहुस्त्वभिमन्त्रिताः॥ संग्रामसज्जाः संहृष्टा धारयनराक्षसास्तदा।'}

{'en': 'And furnished with their boys and wearing their armour, the Rākşasas, on seeing king Ravana, leaving (their vehicles), stood, surrounding Prahasta.', 'sn': 'सधनुष्काः कवचिनो वेगादुत्सृज्य राक्षसाः॥ रावणं प्रेक्ष्य राजानं प्रहस्तं पर्यवारयन्।'}

{'en': 'The greeting the monarch, Prahasta, furnished (with all appliances of battle), winding his dreadful trumpet, ascended his car; having all sorts of weapons; yoked with wondrous fleet steeds; driven by a competent charioteer, excellently furnished; sending up sounds resembling the rumbling of mighty masses of cloud, appearing like the very sun or Moon; invincible with a serpent-standard; having a defence as well as a portion exceedingly handsome; netted with gold all round; and seeming to be laughing in grace.', 'sn': 'अथामन्त्र्य तु राजानं भेरीमाहत्य भैरवाम्।।२४ आरुरोह रथं युक्तः प्रहस्तः सज्जकल्पितम्। हयैर्महाजवैर्युक्तं सम्यक्सूतं सुसंयतम्॥ महाजलदनिर्घोषं साक्षाच्चन्द्रार्कभास्वरम्। उरगध्वजदुर्धर्षं सुवरूथं स्वपस्करम्॥ सुवर्णजालसंयुक्तं प्रहसन्तमिव श्रिया।'}

{'en': 'Then ascending this car, Prahasta, whom Rāvana had entrusted with authority, surrounded by a vast host, swiftly went out of Larkā. And then there were heard the sounds of kettledrums, resembling the roars of Parjanya, and the sounds of musical instruments, as if filling the Earth.', 'sn': 'ततस्तं रथमास्थाय रावणार्पितशासनः॥ लङ्काया निर्ययौ तूर्णं बलेन महता वृतः। ततो दुन्दुभिनिर्घोषः पर्जन्यनिनदोपमः।। वादित्राणां न निनदः पूरयन्निव मेदिनीम्॥ शुश्रुवे शङ्खशब्दश्च प्रयाते वाहिनीपतौ।'}

{'en': 'And on that general of the forces marching, sounds of conchs were heard (all around); and the Rākşasas of dreadful forms and huge bodies, going before Prahasta, advanced, emitting tremendous roars.', 'sn': 'निनदन्तः स्वरान्घोराराक्षसा जग्मुरग्रतः॥ भीमरूपा महाकायः प्रहस्तस्य पुनःसराः।'}

{'en': "Narāntaka, Kumbhahunu, Mahānāda, and Samunnata Prahasta's counsellors all of themwent on, surrounding him.", 'sn': 'नरान्तकः कुम्भहनुर्महानादः समुन्नतः।। प्रहस्तसचिवा ह्येते निर्ययुः परिवार्य तम्॥'}

{'en': 'And he went out by the Eastern entrance, environed by this exceedingly dreadful array, resembling troops of elephants.', 'sn': 'व्यूढेनैव सुघोरेण पूर्वद्वारात्स निर्ययौ। गजयूथनिकाशेन बलेन महता वृतः॥'}

{'en': 'And resembling the Destroyer-Yama himselfPrahasta in rage went out surrounded by that mighty host resembling the sea.', 'sn': 'सागरप्रतिमौधेन वृतस्तेन बलेन सः। प्रहस्तो निर्ययौ क्रुद्धः कालान्तकयमोपमः॥'}

{'en': 'And at the tumult raised by their exodus, as well as the roars of the Rākşasas, all creatures in Lankā began to cry in preternatural tones.', 'sn': 'तस्य निर्याणघोषेण राक्षसानां च नर्दताम्। लङ्कायां सर्वभूतानि विनेदुर्विकृतैः स्वरैः॥'}

{'en': 'And swarming under the cloudless welkin, birds feasting on flesh and gore began to gyrate at the right hand of the car.', 'sn': 'व्यभ्रमाकाशमाविश्य मांसशोणितभोजनाः। मण्डलान्यपसव्यानि खगाश्चक्रू रथं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'And dreadful jackals, emitting live flames from their mouths, set up cries. And stars began to shoot from the firmament; and the winds to ruffle.', 'sn': 'वमन्ति पावकज्वालाः शिवा घोरा ववाविशे। अन्तरिक्षात्पपातोल्का वायुश्च परुषं ववौ॥'}

{'en': 'And enraged at each other, the planetary bodies were shorn of their brightness. And clouds emitting sharp sounds, showered down blood upon the car, and those marching in front were washed therewith. And alighting at the top of the standard, a vulture set up cries, facing the south and began to prick both its sides, thereby depriving (Prahasta) of his grace.', 'sn': 'अन्योन्यमभिसंरब्धा ग्रहाश्च न चकाशिरे। मेघाश्च खरनिर्घोषा रथस्योपरि रक्षसः॥ ववधू रुधिरं चास्य सिषिचुश्च पुरःसरान्। केतुमूर्धनि गृध्रस्तु विलीनो दक्षिणामुखः॥ नदन्नुभयतः पार्श्व समयां श्रियमाहरन्।'}

{'en': 'And from the hands of his charioteer and his driver conducting the steeds, never given to turning away from the field the goad began to drop again and again.', 'sn': 'सारथेर्बहुशश्चात्र संग्राममानिवर्तिनः॥ प्रतोदो न्यपतद्धस्तात्सूतस्य हयसादिनः।'}

{'en': 'The auspiciousness that was bright and rare when the army set out, was clean gone in a moment, and the steeds began to stumble on even ground.', 'sn': 'निर्याणश्रीश्च या चस्याद्भास्वरा च सुदुर्लभा॥ सा ननाश मुहूर्तेन समे च स्खलिता हयाः।'}

{'en': 'And as Prahasta of renowned worth and valour marched, the monkey-army equipped with various arms, presented themselves before him.', 'sn': 'प्रहस्तं तं हि निर्यान्तं प्रख्यातगुणपौरुषम्।। युधि नानाप्रहरणा कपिसेनाभ्यवर्तत॥'}

{'en': 'And loud was the tumult that was raised by the monkeys. And mighty was the din that was heard of those, uprooting trees and taking up ponderous crags, of the Räkşasas roaring and the monkeys storming in both the exhilarated armies of Raksasa and wood-rangers, of vehement and able (warriors) eager for slaying each other, and challenging each other to fight.', 'sn': 'अथ घोषः सुतुमुलो हरीणां समजायत। वृक्षानारुजतां चैव गुर्वी गृह्णतां शिलाः॥ नदतां राक्षसानां च वानराणां च गर्जताम्। उभे प्रमुदिते सैन्ये रक्षोगणवनौकसाम्।॥ वेगितानां समर्थानामन्योन्यवधकाक्षिणाम्। परस्परं चाह्वयतां निनादः श्रूयते महान्॥'}

{'en': 'And like an insect falling into a flame, the wicked-minded Prahasta for obtaining victory, increasing his impetuosity entered into that host of the monkey-king.', 'sn': 'ततः प्रहस्तः कपिराजवाहिनीमभिप्रतस्थे विजयाय दुर्मतिः। विवृद्धवेगश्च विवेशितां चमूं यथा मुमूर्षुः शलभो विभावसुम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having bade adieu to Satrughna, Rama, the descendant of Raghu, was greatly delighted by governing his subjects piously in the company of Bharata and Laksmana.', 'sn': 'प्रस्थाप्य तु स शत्रुघ्नं भ्रातृभ्यां सह राघवः। प्रमुमोद सुखी राज्यं धर्मेण परिपालयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Some days having passed in this wise-a villager, an old Brālimaņa, arrived at the palace gate with a dead boy.', 'sn': 'ततः कतिपयाहःसु वृद्धो जानपदो द्विजः। मृतं बालमुपादाय राजद्वारमुपागमत्॥'}

{'en': 'That Brāhmaṇa, stricken with affection, again and again bewailed in various piteous accents exclaiming What heinous crime had I committed in my pristine birth that I have been constrained to witness the death of my son.', 'sn': 'किं नु मे दुष्कृतं कर्म पुरा देहान्तरे कृतम्। रुदन्बहुविधा वाचः स्नेहदुःखसमन्वितः। असकृत्पुत्र पुत्रेति वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह॥ किं नु मे दुष्कृतं कर्म पुरा देहान्तरे कृतम्। यदहं पुत्रमेकं तु पश्यामि निधनं गतम्॥'}

{'en': 'My son, you have not as yet completed fourteen years. To my misery you have met with untimely death. Forsooth, for your grief, O my son, myself and your mother shall soon be snatched away by death.', 'sn': 'अप्राप्तयौवनं बालं पञ्चवर्षसहस्रकम्। अकाले कालमापन्नं मम दुःखाय पुत्रक॥ अल्पैरहोभिनिधनं गमिष्यामि न संशयः। अहं च जननी चैव तव शोकेन पुत्रक॥'}

{'en': "I do not remember to have ever uttered a falsehood, or injured an animal or perpetrated any other crime. Therefore for some other sinful action, this boy, without performing the son's duties towards his parents, has gone to the abode of death.", 'sn': 'न स्मराम्यनृतं ह्युक्तं न च हिंसां स्मराम्यहम्। सर्वेषां प्राणिनां पापं न स्मरामि कदाचन।७।। केनाद्य दुष्कृतेनायं बाल एव ममात्मजः। अकृत्वा पितृकार्याणि गतो वैवस्वतक्षयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Save under the regime of Rama, I have never seen or heard of the dreadful death of such a boy who has not attained the age.', 'sn': 'नेदृशं दृष्टपूर्वं मे श्रुतं वा घोरदर्शनम्। मृत्युरप्राप्तकालानां रामस्य विषये ह्ययम्॥'}

{'en': 'Forsooth, Rāma has perpetrated a mighty iniquity for which boys, during his administration, have been meeting with untimely death.', 'sn': 'रामस्य दुष्कृतं किंचिन्महदस्ति न संशयः। यथा हि विषयस्थानां बालानां मृत्युरागतः॥'}

{'en': 'In other governments boys have no fear of such an untimely death. Therefore, O king confer life upon this dead child. Or else with my spouse I shall renounce my life at this gate like one having no lord. O Rāma, soiled by the sin consequent upon the destruction of a Brāhmaṇa, do you live long happily with brother.', 'sn': 'नह्यन्यविषयस्थानां बालानां मृत्युतो भयम्। स राजञ्जीवयस्वैनं बालं मृत्युवशं गतम्॥ राजद्वारि मरिष्यामि पत्न्या सार्धमनाथवत्। ब्रह्महत्यां ततो राम समुपेत्य सुखी भव॥ भ्रातृभिः सहितो राजन्दीर्घमायुरवाप्स्यसि।'}

{'en': "O you of great prowess, up to this time we have lived happily in your kingdom. And now, O Räma, under your subjection we are being troubled with the sorrow or our son's death. We have been brought under the influence of Kāla; so in your kingdom there is not the least happiness for us.", 'sn': 'उषिताः स्म सुखं राज्ये तवास्मिन्सुमहाबल॥ इदं तु पतितं तस्मात्तव राम वशे स्थितान्। कालस्य वशमापन्नाः स्वल्पं हि नहि नः सुखम्॥'}

{'en': "Having attained Rāma as its lord, the kingdom, of the high-souled Ikşvākus, has attained to the condition of one having no master, where during Rāma's regime the death of a boy has been brought about. For being impiously governed by a king, for his sin, the subjects meet with calamities. And a king following evil tracks and not governing the subjects righteously people meet with untimely death. Therefore, when a king does mot suppress the crimes committed by people either in cities, or provinces the fear, of untimely death, comes in.", 'sn': 'संप्रत्यनाथो विषय इक्ष्वाकूणां महात्मनाम्। राम नाथमिहासाद्य बालान्तकरणं ध्रुवम्॥ राजदोषैविपद्यन्ते प्रजा ह्यविधिपालिताः। असद्धृत्ते हि नृपतावकाले म्रियते जनः॥ यद्वा पुरेष्वयुक्तानि जना जनपदेषु च। कुर्वते न च रक्षास्ति तदा कालकृतं भयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Evident it is therefore that undoubtedly the sin of the king has appeared in cities and provinces. And for that reason this boy has met with death.', 'sn': 'सुव्यक्तं राजदोषो हि भविष्यति न संशयः। पुरे जनपदे चापि तथा बालवधो ह्ययम्॥'}

{'en': "Being overwhelmed with sorrow that old Brāhmaṇa again and again remonstrated with the king in these 'piteous words and afterwards covered the dead body (of his son.)", 'sn': 'एवं बहुविधैर्वाक्यैरुपरुध्य मुहुर्मुहुः। राजानं दुःखसंतप्तः सुतं तमुपगृहति॥'}
{'en': 'After Tārā, having a moon-like countenance, had spoken thus, Vāli, remonstrated with her and said.', 'sn': 'तामेवं ब्रुवतीं तारा ताराधिपनिभाननाम्। वाली निर्भर्त्सयामास वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'O you of exquisite loveliness, my brother, and specially my enemy, is roaring lowly and haughtily-and how shall I put up with it?', 'sn': 'गर्जतोऽस्य सुसंरब्धं भ्रातुः शत्रोर्विशेषतः। मर्षयिष्यामि केनापि कारणेन वरानने॥'}

{'en': 'O timid damsel, heroes, who have never been defeated and have never fled away from the battle field, had rather meet with death than put up with this ignominy.', 'sn': 'अधर्षितानां शूराणां समरेष्वनिवर्तिनाम्। धर्षणामर्षणं भीरु मरणादतिरिच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'I am incapable of bearing this proud uproar of Sugrīva, having a defective neck and desirous of entering into conflict with me.', 'sn': 'सोढुं न च समर्थोऽहं युद्धकामस्य संयुगे। सुग्रीवस्य च संरम्भं हीनग्रीवस्य गर्जितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Fearing danger from Rāghava, you needst not entertain any anxiety on my account. Why shall that virtuous-souled and grateful Rāma perpetrate iniquity?', 'sn': 'न च कार्यो विषादस्ते राघवं प्रति मत्कृते। धर्मज्ञश्च कृतज्ञश्च कथं पापं करिष्यति ॥'}

{'en': 'Do you therefore return with my other wives. Why do you follow me again? You have already shown your friendship and respect for me. I shall repairing thither, only fight with Sugrīva. I shall crush down his pride and not destroy him.', 'sn': 'निवर्तस्व सह स्त्रीभिः कथं भूयोऽनुगच्छसि। सौहृदं दर्शितं तावन्मयि भक्तिस्त्वया कृता॥ प्रतियोत्स्याम्यहं गत्वा सुग्रीवं जहि सम्भ्रमम्। दर्प चास्य विनेष्यामि न च प्राणैर्वियोक्ष्यते॥'}

{'en': 'I shall deal with him mercifully in the battle as you does wish and being struck with fists and trees he shall fly away.', 'sn': 'अहं ह्याजिस्थितस्यास्य करिष्यामि यदीप्सितम्। वृक्षैर्मुष्टिप्रहारैश्च पीडितः प्रतियास्यति ॥'}

{'en': 'Forsooth, that vicious-souled one shall not be able to withstand my pride and proficient skill in warfare. O Tārā, you had already displayed your attachment to me by giving me good counsels.', 'sn': 'न मे गर्वितमायस्तं सहिष्यति दुरात्मवान्। कृतं तारे सहायत्वं दर्शितं सौहृदं मयि॥'}

{'en': 'By my life, do you go back with the other members of my household, I shall only return after bringing about the discomfiture of my brother in the battle.', 'sn': 'शापितासि मम प्राणैर्निवर्तस्व जनेन च। अलं जित्वा निवर्तिष्ये तमहं भ्रातरं रणे॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, Tārā, dextrous and of sweet accents, embracing Väli, went round him, with tears trickling from her eyes.', 'sn': 'तं तु तारा परिष्वज्य वालिनं प्रियवादिनी। चकार रुदती मन्दं दक्षिणा सा प्रदक्षिणम्॥'}

{'en': "Having performed Sastayana or the ceremony of benediction, that one gifted with a knowledge of Mantras, and desirous of Vāli's success, went, overwhelmed with grief, to the inner-apartment in the company of other females.", 'sn': 'ततः स्वस्त्ययनं कृत्वा मन्त्रविद् विजयैषिणी। अन्तःपुरं सह स्त्रीभिः प्रविष्टा शोकमोहिता॥'}

{'en': 'After Tārā had departed to her own quarters with her female companions, he issued out of the city sighing like an enraged serpent.', 'sn': 'प्रविष्टायां तु तारायां सह स्त्रीभिः स्वमालयम्। नगर्या निर्ययौ क्रुद्धो महासर्प इव श्वसन्॥'}

{'en': 'And the quick-paced Vali, exceedingly wroth, sighing, cast his looks around with a view to behold his enemy.', 'sn': 'स निःश्वस्य महारोषो वाली परमवेगवान्। सर्वतश्चारयन् दृष्टिं शत्रुदर्शनकाझ्या॥'}

{'en': 'And that highly effulgent one espied Sugrīva, having a golden yellow hue, tightly clothed, standing firm on the earth and shining like to burning gold.', 'sn': 'स ददर्श ततः श्रीमान् सुग्रीवं हेमपिङ्गलम्। सुसंवीतमवष्टब्धं दीप्यमानमिवानलम्॥'}

{'en': 'And beholding Sugrīva stationed thus, the greatly enraged Vāli, of mighty arms, put on his clothes tightly well.', 'sn': 'तं स दृष्ट्वा महाबाहुः सुग्रीवं पर्यवस्थितम्। गाढं परिदधे वासो वाली परमकोपनः॥'}

{'en': 'Highly powerful and closely habited, he, clinching his fists, proceeded towards Sugriva, and waited for the action.', 'sn': 'स वाली गाढसंवीतो मुष्टिमुद्यम्य वीर्यवान्। सुग्रीवमेवाभिमुखो ययौ योद्धं कृतक्षणः॥'}

{'en': 'Sugrīva too, clinching his fist and exceedingly wroth, proceeded towards Vāli, wearing a golden garland.', 'sn': 'श्लिष्टं मुष्टिं समुद्यम्य संरब्धतरमागतः। सुग्रीवोऽपि समुद्दिश्य वालिनं हेममालिनम्॥'}
{'en': 'And beholding Sugrīva, adept in warfare having his eyes reddened with ire, advance quickly, Vāli spoke.', 'sn': 'तं कली क्रोधताम्राक्षं सुग्रीवं रणकोविदम्। आपतन्तं महावेगमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Behold, I have clinched this terrible fist, arranging close my fingers; and one blow from me will take away your life.', 'sn': 'एष मुष्टिर्महान् बद्धो गाढः सुनियताङ्गुलिः। मया वेगविमुक्तस्ते प्राणानादाय यास्यति ॥'}

{'en': 'Being accosted thus by Vāli, Sugrīva, exercised with wrath, spoke to him, saying,—This my fist shall strike you on your head taking away your life.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवः क्रुद्धो वालिनमब्रवीत्। तव चैष हरन् प्राणान् मुष्टिः पततु मूर्धनि ॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon being struck by Vāli, waxing worth and approaching him quickly he began to vomit out gore like to a mountain having springs.', 'sn': 'ताडितस्तेन तं क्रुद्धः समभिक्रम्य वेगतः। अभवच्छोणितोद्गारी सापीड इव पर्वतः॥'}

{'en': 'And Vāli too was struck down by Sugrīva, fearlessly taking up a Sāla tree, like to a mountain clapped by a thunderbolt.', 'sn': 'सुग्रीवेण तु निःशक़ सालमुत्पाट्य तेजसा। गात्रेष्वभिहतो वाली वज्रेणेव महागिरिः॥'}

{'en': 'Being thus smitten by the tree and overwhelmed with the strike of Sāla he was troubled like to a heavily laden boat in the midst of an ocean.', 'sn': 'स तु वृक्षण निर्भग्नः सालताडनविह्वलः। गुरुभारभराक्रान्ता नौः ससार्थेव सागरे॥'}

{'en': 'And these (two brothers) gifted with mighty strength and prowess and motion of Suparna, and having huge persons fought with each other like to the Sun and Moon on the sky.', 'sn': 'तौ भीमबलविक्रान्तौ सुपर्णसमवेगितौ। प्रयुद्धौ घोरवपुषौ चन्द्रसूर्याविवाम्बरे॥'}

{'en': 'They were inimical to each other and intent on finding their mutual dark sides. And Vāli, gifted with strength and prowess, fared better in the conflict, and that highly powerful son of Sun-Sugrīva, was worsted.', 'sn': 'परस्परममित्रघ्नौ छिद्रान्वेषणतत्परौ। ततोऽवर्धत वाली तु बलवीर्यसमन्वितः॥ सूर्यपुत्रो महावीर्यः सुग्रीवः परिहीयतः।'}

{'en': 'And having his pride crushed down by Väli and strength greatly reduced, Sugrīva in anger pointed him out to Rāma.', 'sn': 'वालिना भग्नदर्पस्तु सुग्रीवो मन्दविक्रमः॥ वालिनं प्रति सामर्षो दर्शयामास राघवम्।'}

{'en': 'Thereupon there took place a mighty conflict between them like to Vitra and Vāsava by means of trees with branches, hills, nails, hard as thunderbolts, fists, knees, legs and arms.', 'sn': 'वृक्षैः सशाखैः शिखरैर्वज्रकोटिनिभै खैः॥ मुष्टिभिर्जानुभिः पद्भिर्बाहुभिश्च पुनः पुनः। तयोर्युद्धमभूद्घोरं वृत्रवासवयोरिव ॥'}

{'en': 'And these two monkeys ranging in the forest, fought with each other, having their persons bathed in blood, and roaring like to clouds.', 'sn': 'तौ शोणिताक्तौ युध्येतां वानरौ वनचारिणौ। मेघाविव महाशब्देस्त मानौ परस्परम्॥'}

{'en': 'Rāghava again and again beheld the weak points of that monkey chief Sugrīva, losing his strength by and by.', 'sn': 'हीयमानमथापश्यत् सुग्रीवं वानरेश्वरम्। प्रेक्षमाणं दिशश्चैव राघवः स मुहुर्मुहुः॥'}

{'en': 'And beholding that chief of monkeys greatly distressed, the highly powerful and heroic Rāma cast his looks upon his shaft, having the destruction of Väli in view.', 'sn': 'ततो रामो महातेजा आतं दृष्ट्वा हरीश्वरम्। स शरं वीक्षते वीरो वालिनो वधकाझ्या॥'}
{'en': 'And fixing on his bow an arrow resembling a serpent, he stretched it like to Death drawing out his cycle of time.', 'sn': 'ततो धनुषि संधाय शरमाशीविषोपमम्। पूरयामास तच्चापं कालचक्रमिवान्तकः॥'}

{'en': 'Being terrified by the sound of his stringing of the bow the birds and beasts, dismayed as on the eve of dissolution, fied away into different quarters.', 'sn': 'तस्य ज्यातलघोषेण त्रस्ताः पत्ररथेश्वराः। प्रदुद्रुवुर्मंगाश्चैव युगान्त इव मोहिताः॥'}

{'en': 'And a mighty shaft, like to thunderbolt and resembling flaming fire, being hurled by Rāma, alighted on the breast of Väli.', 'sn': 'मुक्तस्तु वज्रनिर्घोषः प्रदीप्ताशनिसंनिभः। राघवेण महाबाणो वालिवक्षसि पातितः॥'}
{'en': 'Being wounded by that shaft that highly powerful chief of monkeys, gifted with prowess fell down on the earth.', 'sn': 'ततस्तेन महातेजा वीर्ययुक्तः कपीश्वरः। वेगेनाभिहतो वाली निपपात महीतले॥'}

{'en': "Like to ſakra's banner in the full-moon of Asvin, Vali, with his throat choked with vapour, losing all sense and sighing hard, fell dead down to the ground.", 'sn': 'इन्द्रध्वज इवोद्भूतः पौर्णमास्यां महीतले। आश्वयुक्समये मासि गतसत्वो विचेतनः। वाष्पसंरुद्धकण्ठस्तु वाली चार्तस्वरः शनैः॥'}

{'en': 'As the great God Hara emitted forth fire with smoke from his mouth, so that best of men like to Death hurled an excellent, flaming and foedestroying shaft, resembling gold and death itself.', 'sn': 'नरोत्तमः कालयुगान्तकोपमं शरोत्तमं काञ्चनरूपभाषितम्। ससर्ज दीप्तं तममित्रमर्दनं सधूममग्निं मुखतो यथा हरः॥'}

{'en': "Thereupon being bathed in blood that son of Vasava, fell senseless on the ground, in the conflict like to a blossoming Asoka growing on a hill and Sakra's banner struck down on the earth.", 'sn': 'अथोक्षितः शोणिततोयविस्त्रवैः सुपुष्पिताशोक इवाचलोद्गतः। विचेतनो वासवसूनुराहवे प्रभ्रंशितेन्द्रध्वजवत् क्षितिं गतः॥'}

{'en': "That high-souled one of Ikşvāku's line had competent counsellors, capable of administering business, of diving into the motives of others, and ever intent upon the good of the monarch. And that heroic king had eight famous Counsellors, pure and devoted to the royal service.", 'sn': 'तस्यामात्या गुणैरासत्रिक्ष्वाकोः सुमहात्मनः। मन्त्रज्ञाश्चेङ्गितज्ञाश्च नित्यं प्रियहिते रताः॥ अष्टौ बभूवुर्वीरस्य तस्यामात्या यशस्विनः। शुचयश्चानुरक्ताश्च राजकृत्येषु नित्यशः॥'}

{'en': 'They were, Dhrsti, Jayanta, and Vijaya, and Surăştra, and Răstravardhana, and Akopa and Dharmapala, and Sumantra the cight, conversant with profit.', 'sn': 'धृष्टिर्जयन्तो विजयः सुराष्ट्रो राष्ट्रवर्धनः। अकोपो धर्मपालश्च सुमन्त्रश्चाष्टमोऽर्थवित्॥'}
{'en': 'And he had two family priests beloved to him; viz., those foremost of saints. Vasistha and Vamadeva.', 'sn': 'ऋत्विजौ द्वावभिमतौ तस्यास्तामृषिसत्तमौ। वसिष्ठो वामदेवश्च मन्त्रिणश्च तथापरे॥'}

{'en': 'And he had other counsellors besides, viz; Suyajna, and Javali, and Kasyapa, and Gautama, and the long-lived Markandeya, and the regenerate Katyayana.', 'sn': 'सुयज्ञोऽप्यथ जाबालिः काश्यपोऽप्यथ गौतमः। मार्कण्डेयस्तु दीर्घायुस्तथा का.यायनो द्विजः॥'}

{'en': 'Ever associated in counsel with these Brahmarsis, his priests and counsellors serving the dynasty from father to son, were learned yet modest. and bashful, and conversant with policy, and of subdued-sense, and auspicious, and highsouled, and accomplished in the art of arms, and of high renown, and cautious, and acting according to their word, and possessing energy, forgiveness and fame and ever precluding their speech with a smile, and never committing themselves to a lie either from anger or interest or desire.', 'sn': 'एतैर्ब्रह्मर्षिभिनित्यमृत्विजस्तस्य पौर्वकाः। विद्याविनीता हीमन्तः कुशला नियतेन्द्रियाः॥ श्रीमन्तश्च महात्मानः शस्त्रज्ञा दृढविक्रमाः। कीर्तिमन्तः प्रगिहिता यथावचनकारिणः।७।। तेजः क्षमायशः प्राप्ताः स्मितपूर्वाभिभाषिणः। क्रोधात् कामार्थहेतोर्वा न ब्रुयुरनृतं वचः।८।।'}

{'en': 'And they were not unknown to what was done or sought to be done in the midst of their own or a hostile party. And they were adept in intercourse with people, and well-tried in friendship by the monarch.', 'sn': 'तेषामविदितं किंचित् स्वेषु नास्ति परेषु वा। क्रियमाणं कृतं वापि चारेणापि चिकीर्षितम्॥ कुशला व्यवहारेषु सौहृदेषु परीक्षिताः। प्राप्तकालं यथा दण्डं धारयेयुः सुतेष्वपि॥'}

{'en': 'And they were ever busy in replenishing the exchequer and in levying troops. And they did not cherish ill will even towards enemies, when innocent.', 'sn': 'कोशसंग्रहणे युक्ता बलस्य च परिग्रहे। अहितं चापि पुरुषं न हिंस्युरविदूषकम्॥'}

{'en': 'And they were heroic, and ever high-spirited, following policy, and protecting those citizens that were pure.', 'sn': 'वीराश्च नियतोत्साहा राजशास्त्रमनुष्ठिताः। शुचीनां रक्षितारश्च नित्यं विषयवासिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'And not bearing ill will towards Brahmaņas and Khatriyas, and filling the treasury, by inflicting punishments according lo the offences of the persons guilty.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मक्षत्रमहिंसन्तस्ते कोशं समपूरयन्। सुतीक्ष्णदण्डाः सम्प्रेक्ष्य पुरुषस्य बलाबलम्॥'}

{'en': "And during the time when those pure ones of one mind presided over the justice of the kingdom, there was neither in the city nor the provinces any that was a liar, or 'wicked, or going after others' wives. And peace reigned all around the city and the provinces.", 'sn': 'शुचीनामेकबुद्धीनां सर्वेषां सम्पजानताम्। नासीत्पुरे वा राष्ट्रे वा मृषावादी नरः क्वचित्॥ क्वचिन्न दुष्टस्तत्रासीत् परटाररतिर्नरः। प्रशान्तं सर्वमेवासीद् राष्ट्र पुरवरं च तत्॥'}

{'en': 'And the ministers wore excellent raiment, and ornaments, and were engaged in observing pure Vows, and ever kept their eye of policy open in the interest of the monarch.', 'sn': 'सुवाससः सुवेषाश्च ते च सर्वे शुचिव्रताः। हितार्थाश्च नरेन्द्रस्य जाग्रतो नयचक्षुषा॥'}

{'en': 'And the king considered them as crowned with virtues, and they were famed on account of their prowess, concluding unerringly in consequence of their intelligence of other countries. And in all climes and times they could manifest their noble qualities.', 'sn': 'गुरोर्गुणगृहीताश्च प्रख्याताश्च पराक्रमैः। विदेशेष्वपि विज्ञाताः सर्वतो बुद्धिनिश्चयाः॥'}

{'en': 'They inculcated noble qualities in all aspects and were not devoid of virtues. And they were cognizant of war and peace, and possessed of goodness, passion and ignorance.', 'sn': 'अभितो गुणवन्तश्च न चासन् गुणवर्जिताः। संधिविग्रहतत्त्वज्ञाः प्रकृत्या सम्पदान्विताः॥'}

{'en': 'And they could keep their counsel and judge of things finely, and were well-versed in the art of policy, and ever fair-spoken.', 'sn': 'मन्त्रसंवरणे शक्ताः शक्ताः सूक्ष्मासु बुद्धिषु। नीतिशास्त्रविशेषज्ञाः सततं प्रियवादिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Surrounded by such counseliors endowed with various qualities, the faultless king Dasaratha ruled the earth.', 'sn': 'ईदृशैस्तैरमात्यैश्च राजा दशरथोऽनघः। उपपन्नो गुणोपेतैरन्वशासत् वसुन्धराम्॥'}

{'en': 'And gathering intelligence by means of spies, and righteously protecting the subjects, and preserving the people, and not sacrificing his duties.', 'sn': 'अवेक्ष्यमाणश्चारेण प्रजा धर्मेण रक्षयन्। प्रजानां पालनं कुर्वनधर्म परिवर्जयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Famed over the three worlds, and munificent, and linn in promise in battle, the tiger among men ruled over this earth.', 'sn': 'विश्रुतस्त्रिषु लोकेषु वदान्यः सत्यसंगरः। स तत्र पुरुषव्याघ्रः शशास पृथिवीमिमाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Nor did he ever meet with a foe that was either his equal or superior. And possessed of friends, and having obedient commanders, and extricating his thorns by his might, that king ruled the earth, even as the lord of celestials rules heaven.', 'sn': 'नाध्यगच्छद्विशिष्टं वा तुल्यं वा शत्रुमात्मनः। मित्रवानतसामन्तः प्रतापहतकण्टकः। स शशास जगत् राजा दिवि देवपतिर्यथा॥'}

{'en': 'And surrounded by those counsellors studious of his welfare, and bearing affection towards him, and clever, and competent, that king, by virtue of his prowess in subduing others, resembled the sun surrounded by his rays.', 'sn': 'तैर्मन्त्रिभिर्मन्त्रिहितोनिविष्ठैर्वुतोऽनुरक्तैः कुशलैः समर्थैः। स पार्थिवो दीप्तिमवाप युक्तस्तेजोमयैर्गोभिरिवोदितोऽर्कः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing the words of Guha, exceedingly unpleasant, Bharata as soon as he heard them, became plunged in thought.', 'sn': 'गुहस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा भरतो भृशमप्रियम्। ध्यानं जगाम तत्रैव यत्र तच्छ्रुतमप्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'And then taking heart for a while, that tenderfamed one possessed of immense strength, gifted with leonine shoulders and length of arms, having expansive eyes resembling white lotuses, young in years, and endowed with a handsome presence, afflicted with great grief, was overpowered, like an elephant wounded in the heart with a goad.', 'sn': 'सुकुमारो महासत्त्वः सिंहस्कन्धो महाभुजः। पुण्डरीकविशालाक्षस्तरुणः प्रियदर्शनः॥ प्रत्याश्वस्य मुहूर्तं तु कालं परमदुर्मनाः। ससाद सहसा तोत्रैर्हदि विद्ध इव द्विपः॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing Bharata deprived of his senses with his countenance covered with pallor, Guha became exceedingly agitated, like a tree during an earth quake.', 'sn': 'भरतं मूर्च्छितं दृष्ट्वा विवर्णवदनो गुहः। बभूव व्यथितस्तत्र भूमिकम्पे यथा द्रुमः॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing Bharata in that condition, ſatrughna who was near, taking the former on his lap, began to cry, almost deprived of his senses and oppressed with grief.', 'sn': 'तदवस्थं तु भरतं शत्रुघ्नोऽनन्तरस्थितः। परिष्वज्य रुरोदोच्चैर्विसंज्ञः शोककर्शितः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereat, all the mothers of Bharata, fasting, undergoing distress, and afflicted with the calamity that had befallen their lord, came forward, and surrounding Bharata, began to lament him fallen on the ground. And the distressed Kausalyā drawing nigh embraced him like a cow approaching her calf; and weeping from excess of grief, spoke to Bharata, saying.', 'sn': 'ततः सर्वाः समापेतुर्मातरो भरतस्य ताः। उपवासकृशा दीना भर्तृव्यसनकर्शिताः॥ ताश्च तं पतितं भूमौ रुदत्यः पर्यवारयन्। कौसल्या त्वनुसृत्यैनं दुर्मनाः परिषस्वजे॥ वत्सला स्वं यथा वत्समुपगुह्य तपस्विनी। परिपप्रच्छ भरतं रुदती शोकलालसा॥'}

{'en': 'My son, does any malady afflict your body? Now the life of this royal race is, without doubt, in your hands.', 'sn': 'पुत्र व्याधिर्न ते कच्चिच्छरीरं प्रति बाधते। अस्य राजकुलस्याद्य त्वदधीनं हि जीवितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Ráma having gone away along with his brother, I shall, O son, live, seeing you. King Dasaratha having departed this life, you alone are our lord.', 'sn': 'त्वां दृष्ट्वा पुत्र जीवामि रामे सभ्रातृके गते। वृत्ते दशरथे राज्ञि नाथ एकस्त्वमद्य नः॥'}

{'en': 'Have you, my son, heard anything unpleasant concerning Lakṣmaṇa; or the son of that one having an only son,* who has gone to the forest along with his wife? *Meaning herself.', 'sn': 'कच्चिन्न लक्ष्मणे पुत्र श्रुतं ते किंचिदप्रियम्। पुत्रे वा ह्येकपुत्रायाः सहभार्ये वनं गते॥'}

{'en': 'Having taken comfort for a while, that one of high fame weeping, and solacing Kausalya, spoke to Guha, saying.', 'sn': 'स मुहूर्तं समाश्वस्य रुदन्नेव महायशाः। कौसल्यां परिसान्त्व्येदं गुहं वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Where did my brother pass the night? And where did Sītā? And where did, again, Laks maņa? And in what bed did he sleep, and what did he previously partake of? Do you, O Guha, tell me this.', 'sn': 'भ्राता मे क्वावसद् रात्रौ क्व सीता क्व च लक्ष्मणः। अस्वपच्छयने कस्मिन् किं भुक्त्वा गुह शंस मे॥'}

{'en': 'Thereat, well pleased, Gulha, the lord of Nişādas, related to Bharata how he had acted in respect of Rāma, his dear guest, studious of his welfare.', 'sn': 'सोऽब्रवीद् भरतं हृष्टो निषादाधिपतिर्मुहः। यद्विधं प्रतिपेदे च रामे प्रियहितेऽतिथौ॥'}
{'en': "I procured for Rāma's use rice and fruits and roots and various kinds of food.", 'sn': 'अन्नमुच्चावचं भक्ष्याः फलानि विविधानि च। रामायाभ्यवहारार्थं बहुशोऽपहतं मया॥'}

{'en': 'All these Rāma having truth for his prowess accepted, but observing Ksatriya morality, he did not take them.', 'sn': 'तत् सर्वं प्रत्यनुज्ञासीद् रामः सत्यपराक्रमः। न हि तत् प्रत्यगह्नात् स क्षत्रधर्ममनुस्मरन्॥'}
{'en': "'O friend, we ought not to take anything: ours is always to give.'", 'sn': 'नह्यस्माभिः प्रतिग्राह्यं सखे देयं तु सर्वदा। इति तेन वयं सर्वे अनुनीता महात्मना॥'}

{'en': 'Thus did that magnanimous one beseech us. On the high-souled Lakşmaņa bringing water, Rāghava having drunk it, fasted along with Sītā.', 'sn': 'लक्ष्मणेन यदानीतं पीतं वारि महात्मना। औपवास्यं तदकार्षीद् राघवः सह सीतया॥'}

{'en': 'Then Lakşmaņa drank up the water that remained. Then the three with fixed minds silently performed their adorations to the Twilight.', 'sn': 'ततस्तु जलशेषेण लक्ष्मणोऽप्यकरोत् तदा। वाग्यतास्ते त्रयः संध्यां समुपासन्त संहिताः॥'}
{'en': "After that, Sumitrā's son prepared a goodly bed for Rāghava, himself bringing Kuća grass.", 'sn': 'सौमित्रिस्तु ततः पश्चादकरोत् स्वास्तरं शुभम्। स्वयमानीय बींषि क्षिप्रं राघवकारणात्॥'}

{'en': 'And in that bed lay down Rāma in company with Sītā. Next washing their feet, Lakşmaņa turned away.', 'sn': 'तस्मिन् समाविशद् रामः स्वास्तरे सहसीतया। प्रक्षाल्य च तयोः पादौ व्यपाक्रामत् सलक्ष्मणः॥'}
{'en': 'This is the foot of the Ingudī, and this that grass. On it both Rāma and Sītā lay down that night.', 'sn': 'एतत् तदिगुदीमूलमिदमेव च तत् तृणम्। यस्मिन् रामश्च सीता च रात्रिं तां शयितावुभौ ॥'}

{'en': 'Fastening on his back a pair of quivers filled with arrows furnished with finger-fences, and taking his mighty bow, Lakşmaņa all night kept watch around.', 'sn': 'शरैः सुपूर्णाविषुधी परंतपः। महद्धनुः सज्जमुपोह्य लक्ष्मणो निशामतिष्ठत् परितोऽस्य केवलम्॥'}

{'en': 'I also taking an excellent bow, remained where remained Lakṣmaṇa, and surrounded by my kindred who stayed there vigilantly, equipped with bows, guarded him that resembled the mighty Indra.', 'sn': 'ततस्त्वहं चोत्तमबाणचापभृत् स्थितोऽभवं तत्र स यत्र लक्ष्मणः। महेन्द्रकल्पं परिपालयंस्तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing of the arrival of the Bharata with the army Gargya and Yudhajit, the king of Kekayas, were greatly delighted.', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा सेनापति प्राप्तं भरतं केकयाधिपः। युधाजिद्गर्गसहितं परां प्रीतिमुपागमत्॥'}
{'en': 'He, the king of Kekaya, with a huge army they speedily went out for conquering the Gandharvas.', 'sn': 'स निर्ययौ जनौघेन महता केकयाधिपः। त्वरमाणोऽभिचक्राम गन्धर्वान्केकयाधिपः।२।।'}

{'en': 'There upon the highly powerful and lightarmed Bharata and Yudhājit, with the soldiers and followers, arrived at the city of Gandharvas.', 'sn': 'भरतश्च युधांजिच्च समेतौ लघुविक्रमैः। गन्धर्वनगरं प्राप्तौ सबलौ सपदानुगौ॥'}

{'en': 'Having heard of the coming of Bharata the highly powerful Gandharvas gathered round and sent up leonine roars.', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा तु भरतं प्राप्तं गन्धर्वास्ते समागताः। योद्धकामा महावीर्या व्यनदस्ते समन्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'There upon began the battle capable of making down erect and continued for a week. On neither side there was victory or defeat.', 'sn': 'ततः समभवद्युद्धं तुमुलं लोमहर्षणम्। सप्तरात्रं महाभीमं न चान्यतरयोर्जयः॥'}

{'en': 'On all sides there flowed streams of blood and there were afloat human bodies. Daggers, Saktis and bows were like the banks of the river.', 'sn': 'खङ्गशक्तिधनुाहा नद्यः शोणितसंस्रवाः। नृकलेवरवाहिन्यः प्रवृत्ताः सर्वतोदिशम्॥'}

{'en': "There upon enraged Bharata, Rāma's younger brother, discharged a dreadful arrow named Samvarata resembling the fire of dissolution against Gandharvas.", 'sn': 'ततो रामानुजः क्रुद्धः कालस्यास्र सुदारुणम्। संवत नाम भरतो गन्धर्वेष्वभ्यचोदयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Having bound them all with the noose of death and sundered them with Sangharata, Bharata despatched all the Gandharvas to the abode of death.', 'sn': 'ते बद्धाः कालपाशेन संवर्तेन विदारिताः। क्षणेनाभिहतास्तेन तिस्त्र: कोट्यो महात्मना॥'}

{'en': "Even the celestials could not recollect if such a dreadful encounter had happened before. In a moment the huge Gandharva host was slain. After the destruction of the Gandharvas, Kaikeyi's son Bharata set up two excellent and prosperous cities in the province of Gandharva.", 'sn': 'तयुद्धं तादृशं घोरं न स्मरन्ति दिवौकसः। निमेषान्तरमात्रेण तादृशानां महात्मनाम्।।। हतेषु तेषु सर्वेषु भरतः केकयीसुतः। निवेशयामास तदा समृद्ध द्वे पुरोत्तमे॥'}

{'en': 'And he placed Takṣa in Takşasilā, the beautiful city of Gandharvas and Puşkala in Puşkalāvati of Gāndhāra province.', 'sn': 'तक्षं तक्षशिलायां तु पुष्कलं पुष्कलावते। गन्धर्वदेशे रुचिरे गान्धारविषये च सः॥'}

{'en': 'Both the cities were filled with profuse riches and jewels and covered with various gardens. As for many ornaments both of them as if vied with one another.', 'sn': 'धमरत्नौघसंकीर्णे काननैरुपशोभिते। अन्योन्यसंघर्षकृते स्पर्धया गुणविस्तरैः॥'}

{'en': 'By just purchases and sales, and by the conduct of the people the cities grew highly charming. Both of them were filled with gardens and conveyances. Rows of shops were well arranged by the streets in both the cities.', 'sn': 'उभे सुरुचिरप्रख्ये व्यवहारैरकिल्बिषैः। उद्यानयानसंपूर्णे सुविभक्तान्तरापणे॥'}

{'en': 'Both of them were adorned with many excellent fancy articles, picturesque houses, charming palaces and many beautiful and high Tala, Tamāla, Tilaka and Vakula trees.', 'sn': 'उभे पुरवरे रम्ये विस्तरैरुपशोभिते। गृहमुख्यैः सुरुचिरैर्विमानैर्बहुभिर्वृते॥ शोभिते शोभनीयैश्च देवायतनविस्तरैः। तालैस्तमालैस्तिलकैर्बकुलैरुपशोभिते॥'}

{'en': "Having reared up those two cities within five years, Rāma's younger brother, the mighty armed Bharata, son of Kaikeyl, returned to Ayodhyā. ?", 'sn': 'निवेश्य पञ्चभिर्वर्भरतो राघवानुजः। पुनरायान्महाबाहुरयोध्या केकयीसुतः॥'}

{'en': 'Like to Vasava saluting Brahmå he adored the high-souled Raghava the very personation of virtue and communicated to him duly the destruction of the Gandharvas and the establishment of the two cities. And hearing the words of Bharata, Råma attained to an excess of delight. are', 'sn': 'सोऽभिवाद्य महात्मानं साक्षाद्धर्ममिवापरम्। राघवं भरतः श्रीमान्ब्रह्माणमिव वासवः॥ शशंस च यथावृवं गन्धर्ववधमुत्तमम्। निवेशनं च देशस्य श्रुत्वा प्रीतोऽस्य राघवः॥'}

{'en': 'Alighting from the car, Hanumān possessed of vigorous activity, leader of monkeybands-nearing the wall, looked like lightning within a mass of clouds.', 'sn': 'विमानात् तु स संक्रम्य प्राकारं हरियूथपः। हनूमान् वेगवानासीद् यथा विद्युद् घनान्तरे॥'}
{'en': 'And having gone round the mansions of Ravana, and not seeing Janaki, the monkey Hanuman said,', 'sn': 'सम्परिक्रम्य हनुमानरावणस्य निवेशनान्। अदृष्ट्वा जानकी सीतामब्रवीद् वचनं कपिः॥'}

{'en': "Striving after Rāma's welfare, I have again searched through Lankā; but I do not see Vaidehi's daughter, Janaki, having all her limbs endeued with loveliness.", 'sn': 'भूयिष्ठं लोलिता लङ्का रामस्य चरता प्रियम्। नहि पश्यामि वैदेहीं सीतां सर्वाङ्गशोभनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'And I have explored pools, and watery expanses, and tanks, and rivers, and streams, and marshes, and and woods, and citadels, and mountains, yea, all this earth; but Janaki I do not fimd.', 'sn': 'पल्वलानि तटाकानि सरांसि सरितस्तथा। नद्योऽनूपवनान्ताश्च दुर्गाश्च धरणीधराः॥ लोलिता वसुधा सर्वा न च पश्यामि जानकीम्।'}

{'en': 'The vulture-king Sampati had told that Sītā was in the mansion of Rāvaņa. But why do I not see her (here)?', 'sn': 'इह सम्पातिना सीता रावणस्य निवेशने। आख्याता गृध्रराजेन न च सा दृश्यते न किम्॥'}

{'en': 'Or dose Maithili Sītā, daughter to Janaka, sprung in the Vaidehī line, forcibly carried off (by Rāvaņa), and completely in his power, abide by the mandate (of that monarch)?', 'sn': 'किं तु सीताथ वैदेही मैथिली जनकात्मजा। उपतिष्ठेत विवशा रावणेन हृता बलात्॥'}

{'en': "I conceive that while taking Sītā, the Rākşasa darted upward, he being influenced by fear of Rāma's shafts; (and accordingly losing control over his movements), she fell off by the way.", 'sn': 'क्षिप्रमुत्पततो मन्ये सीतामादाय रक्षसः। बिभ्यतो रामबाणानामन्तरा पतिता भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Or I fancy that while that noble lady was being carried away along the way ranged by Siddhas, she lost her life on beholding the ocean.', 'sn': 'अथवा ह्रियमाणायाः पथि सिद्धनिषेविते। मन्ये पतितमाया हृदयं प्रेक्ष्य सागरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Or I think that on account of the vehement spced assumed by Rāvana, and also oppressed with his arms, that large-eyed noble lady has been bereft of her life.', 'sn': 'रावणस्योरुवेगेन भुजाभ्यां पीडितेन च। तया मन्ये विशालाक्ष्या त्यक्तं जीवितमार्यया॥'}

{'en': "For certain, while (Ravana) was soaring higher and higher, Janaka's daughter, rolling (on the car), dropped down into the sea.", 'sn': 'उपर्युपरि सा नूनं सागरं क्रमतस्तदा। विचेष्टमाना पतिता समुद्रे जनकात्मजा॥'}

{'en': 'Alas! trying to preserve her chastity, the forlorn Sītā, practising self-mortification, has been devoured by this abject-minded Rāvana. Or that darkeyed innocent one, has been eaten up by the wives of the Rākşasa chief, actuated by wicked motives.* *Jealously, according to the commentator.', 'sn': 'आहो क्षुद्रेण चानेन रक्षन्ती शीलमात्मनः। अबन्धुभक्षिता सीता रावणेन तपस्विनी॥ अथवा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य पत्नीभिरसितेक्षणा। अदुष्टा दुष्टभावाभिर्भक्षिता सा भविष्यति॥'}

{'en': "(Ever) contemplating Rāma's countenance, resembling the full Moon, with eyes like lotusleaves, she, exercised with sorrow, has breathed her last.", 'sn': '(सम्पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतिमं पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम्। रामस्य ध्यायती वक्त्रं पञ्चत्वं कृपणा गता।।'}

{'en': "Bewailing much with exclamations of 'Oh Rama and Laksmana!' 'Ah Ayodhya!' that lady Vaidehi has renounced her body.", 'sn': 'हा राम लक्ष्मणेत्येवं हाऽयोध्ये चेति मैथिली। विलप्य बहु वैदेही न्यस्तदेहा भविष्यति।।)'}
{'en': "Or secretly kept in Rāvana's mansion, that girl, like a female parrot in a cage, is weeping bitterly.", 'sn': 'अथवा निहिता मन्ये रावणस्य निवेशने। भृशं लालप्यते बाला पञ्जरस्थेव सारिका॥'}

{'en': 'How can the slender-waisted wife of Rāma, born in the race of Janaka, furnished with eyes resembling lotus petals, come under the sway of Ravana?', 'sn': 'जनकस्य कुले जाता रामपत्नी सुमध्यमा। कथमुत्पलपत्राक्षी रावणस्य वशं व्रजेत्॥'}

{'en': "I shall not be able to say of Rāma's beloved wife that she has been sullied, or that I have seen her, or yet that she is dead. To say this is censurable; not to say it is also such. *This is evidently the sense, having regard to the preceding sloku, although the commentator gives the apparent meaning of vinastha perished.", 'sn': 'विनष्टा वा प्रणष्टा वा मृता वा जनकात्मजा। रामस्य प्रियभार्यस्य न निवेदयितुं क्षमम्॥'}

{'en': "What is my course? I find myself in a false position. Things having drifted to this pass, what should I say, now that the time has come?'", 'sn': 'निवेद्यमाने दोषः स्याद् दोषः स्यादनिवेदने। कथं न खलु कर्तव्यं विषमं प्रतिभाति मे॥'}

{'en': 'Thus thinking, Hanumān again reflected, "If without seeing Sītā, I repair to the abode of the lord of monkeys, what then shall I gain as the object of my exertions?', 'sn': 'अस्मिन्नेवंगते कार्ये प्राप्तकालं क्षमं च किम्। भवेदिति मतिं भूयो हनुमान् प्रविचारयन्॥ यदि सीतामदृष्ट्वाहं वानरेन्द्रपुरीमितः। गमिष्यामि ततः को मे पुरुषार्थो भविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'This my bounding over the main comes to nought; as also my entry into Lank, and the sight of the Rākşasas.', 'sn': 'ममेदं लङ्घनं व्यर्थं सागरस्य भविष्यति। प्रवेशश्चैव लङ्कायां राक्षसानां च दर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'And what shall Sugrīva say? Or the assembled monkeys; or those twin sons of Dasaratha; to me when I shall have come to Kiskindhā?', 'sn': 'किं वा वक्ष्यति सुग्रीवो हरयो वापि संगताः। किष्किन्धामनुसंप्राप्तं तौ वा दशरथात्मौ ॥'}

{'en': "If going there, I should say a harsh speech to Kākutstha-'I have not seen Sitā'-he shall renounce his life.", 'sn': 'गत्वा तु यदि काकुत्स्थं वक्ष्यामि परुषं वचः। न दृष्टेति मया सीता ततस्त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing harsh, terrible, unsufferable, fierce and foul words concerning Sītă, calculated to set the senses on fire, he shall not exist.', 'sn': 'परुषं दारुणं तीक्ष्णं क्रूरमिन्द्रियतापनम्। सीतानिमित्तं दुर्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा स न भविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing him come under misery, with his mind expiring, the intelligent Laksmana, firmly attached (to Rāma), shall also cease to exist.', 'sn': 'तं तु कृच्छ्रगतं दृष्ट्वा पञ्चत्वगतमानसम्। भृशानुरक्तमेधावी न भविष्यति लक्ष्मणः॥'}

{'en': 'And hearing that his two brothers are dead, Bharata also shall give up existence. And seeing Bharata dead, Śatrughna shall also renounce his life.', 'sn': 'विनष्टौ भ्रातरौ श्रुत्वा भरतोऽपि मरिष्यति। भरतं च मृतं दृष्ट्वा शत्रुघ्नो न भविष्यति ॥'}

{'en': 'And beholding their sons dead, their mothers, Kausalya, Sumitra and kaikayi, shall, certainly, resign their lives,', 'sn': 'पुत्रान् मृतान् समीक्ष्याथ न भविष्यन्ति मातरः। कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च कैकेयी च न संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing Rāma in that plight, the lord of the monkeys, Sugrīva, grateful and having his heart fast fixed in truth, shall give up his life.', 'sn': 'कृतज्ञः सत्यसंधश्च सुग्रीवः प्लवगाधिपः। रामं तथागतं दृष्ट्वा ततस्त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Rumā, aggrieved, heart-wrung, distressed and bereft of happiness and assuming the garb of a female ascetic, because of grief for her husband, shall resign her existence.', 'sn': 'दुर्मना व्यथिता दीना निरानन्दा तपस्विनी। पीडिता भर्तुशोकेन रुमा त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम्॥'}

{'en': 'And oppressed with grief arising from Vāli, and weighed down by sorrow, the queen Tārā, also, resolving on death shall cease to exist.', 'sn': 'वालिजेन तु दुःखेन पीडिता शोककर्शिता। पञ्चत्वमागता राज्ञी तारापि न भविष्यति ॥'}

{'en': 'In consequence of the death of his father and mother and the calamity befalling Sugrīva, the prince Angada also shall next forego his existence.', 'sn': 'मातापित्रोविनाशेन सुग्रीवव्यसनेन च। कुमारोऽप्यङ्गदस्तस्माद् विजहिष्यति जीवितम्॥'}

{'en': 'The dwellers of the woods overwhelmed with grief got of (the decease of) their master, shall strike at their heads with their clenched fists and hands. And the monkeys affectionately cherished by the famous lord of the monkeys with soothing words gifts and regard, shall resign there lives.', 'sn': 'भर्तृजेन तु दुःखेन अभिभूता वनौकसः। शिरांस्यभिहनिष्यन्ति तलैर्मुष्टिभिरेव च॥ सान्त्वेनानुप्रदानेन मानेन च यशस्विना। लालिता: कपिनाथेन प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यन्ति वानराः॥'}

{'en': 'No more in woods, and rocks, or secret spots, shall the foremost monkeys, assembled together, indulge in sports.', 'sn': 'न वनेषु न शैलेषु न निरोधेषु वा पुनः। क्रीडामनुभविष्यन्ति समेत्य कपिकुञ्जराः॥'}

{'en': 'They, along with their sons and wives, and counsellors, distressed on account the disaster that has overtaken their master, shall fall from the tops of mountains down to places even or uneven.', 'sn': 'सपुत्रदाराः सामात्या भर्तृव्यसनपीडिताः। शैलाग्रेभ्यः पतिष्यन्ति समेषु विषमेषु च॥'}

{'en': 'The monkeys shall take poison, or hang themselves, or enter into flaming fire, or fast, or fall on their own weapons.', 'sn': 'विषमुद्बन्धनं वापि प्रवेशं ज्वलनस्य वा। उपवासमथो शस्त्रं प्रचरिष्यन्ति वानराः॥'}

{'en': 'I fancy that a loud wailing shall arise on my return (to that place); and the race of Iksvāku as well as the rangets of the woods shall meet with destruction.', 'sn': 'घोरमारोदनं मन्ये गते मयि भविष्यति। इक्ष्वाकुकुलनाशश्च नाशश्चैव वनौकसाम्॥'}

{'en': "Therefore I will not repair hence to the city of Kiskindhā; nor can I see Sugrīva without Mithila's daughter.", 'sn': 'सोऽहं नैव गमिष्यामि किष्किन्धां नगरीमितः। नहि शक्ष्याम्यहं द्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं मैथिली विना॥'}

{'en': "On my not going there and staying here, those righteous-souled Maharathas as well as the fastfleeting monkeys, shall preserve their lives through hope (of hearing tidings concerning Sītā). And not having seen Janaka's daughter, I will lead the Vānaprastha mode of life, partaking (of fruits) falling into my hands or mouth, restraining my senses, and staying at the foot of trees.", 'sn': 'मय्यगच्छति चेहस्थे धर्मात्मानौ महारथौ। आशया तौ धरिष्येते वानराश्च तरस्विनः॥ हस्तादानो मुखादानो नियतो वृक्षमूलिकः। वानप्रस्थो भविष्यामि अदृष्ट्वा जनकात्मजाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Preparing a funereal pile on a tract bordering on the sea, abounding in fruits, and flowers, and water, I will enter into flaming fire.', 'sn': 'सागरानूपजे देशे बहुमूलफलोदके। चितिं कृत्वा प्रवेक्ष्यामि समिद्धमरणीसुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'As I sit to fast, and for effecting the separation of self from my body and centring my identity in the spirit crows and beasts of prey shall feed on my body.', 'sn': 'उपविष्टस्य वा सम्यग् लिङ्गिनं साधयिष्यतः। शरीरं भक्षयिष्यन्ति वायसाः श्वापदानि च॥'}

{'en': 'I think the sages have enjoyed another way of exit. I shall, failing to see Janaki, enter into water.', 'sn': 'इदमप्यृषिभिर्दृष्टं निर्याणमिति मे मतिः। सम्यगापः प्रवक्ष्यामि न चेत्पश्यामि जानकीम्॥'}

{'en': 'My illustrious and exalted garland of fame, begot of excellent acts, has perished for good in consequence of my not seeing Sītā.* *Tirtha reads chiraratriyam for chiraratrya. Then the sense is. This illustrious live-long fairrooted and auspicious night crowned with a garland of fame, has borne no fruit, in consequence of my not seeing Sītă. The commentator, I presume, refines a little too much.', 'sn': 'सुजातमूला सुभगा कीर्तिमाला यशस्विनी। प्रभग्ना चिररात्राय मम सीतामपश्यतः॥'}

{'en': 'Or restraining myself, I shall become an ascetic living underneath trees; but return I will not, without obtaining a sight of that dark-eyed damsel.', 'sn': 'तापसो वा भविष्यामि नियतो वृक्षमूलिकः। नेतः प्रतिगमिष्यामि तामदृष्ट्वासितेक्षणाम्।।४३'}
{'en': 'If I return without seeing Sītā, all the monkeys with Angada shall cease to exist.', 'sn': 'यदि तु प्रतिगच्छामि सीतामनधिगम्य ताम्। अङ्गदः सहितः सर्वैर्वानरैर्न भविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Incalculable are the ills of my putting a period to my existence; (on the other hand) if I live, I imay come by good. Therefore my life I will maintain. If I live, it may conduce to happiness."', 'sn': 'विनाशे बहवो दोषा जीवन् प्राप्नोति भद्रकम्। तस्मात् प्राणान् धरिष्यामि ध्रुवो जीवति संगमः॥'}

{'en': 'Having thus indulged in a variety of harassing thoughts in his mind, that foremost of monkeys could not cross over to the other shore (of the sea of distress).', 'sn': 'एवं बहुविधं दुःखं मनसा धारयन् बहु। नाध्यगच्छत् तदा पारं शोकस्य कपिकुञ्जरः॥'}

{'en': 'Then summoning energy, that elephantine monkey endued with fortitude reflected, Or I shall slay the Ten-necked Rāvaņa possessed of great strength. Sītā has been carried off; but by this I shall avenge myself.', 'sn': 'ततो विक्रममासाद्य धैर्यवान् कपिकुञ्जरः। रावणं वा वधिष्यामि दशग्रीवं महाबलम्। काममस्तु हृता सीता प्रत्याचीर्णं भविष्यति ॥'}

{'en': 'Or throwing him repeatedly into the sea, I (shall take him) and present him to Rāma, even as one presents a beast to Pasupat." \'An appellation of Siva-lit. lord of beasts-in allusion to animal sacrifices to Śiva.', 'sn': 'अथवैनं समुत्क्षिप्य उपर्युपरि सागरम्। रामायोपहरिष्यामि पशुं पशुपतेरिव॥'}
{'en': 'Reflecting thus, the monkey, not finding Sītā, agitated with sorrow and anxiety, thought.', 'sn': 'इति चिन्तासमापन्नः सीतामनधिगम्य ताम्। ध्यानशोकपरीतात्मा चिन्तयामास वानरः॥'}

{'en': 'So long as I do not find the illustrious spouse of Rāma, Sītā, I will explore the city of Lankā again and again.', 'sn': 'यावत् सीतां न पश्यामि रामपत्नी यशस्विनीम्। तावदेतां पुरीं लङ्कां विचिनोमि पुनः पुनः॥'}

{'en': "If in consonance with Sampat's speech, I bring Rāma hither, Rāghava, not seeing his wife, shall burn all the monkeys.", 'sn': 'सम्पातिवचनाच्चापि रामं यद्यानयाम्यहम्। अपश्यन् राघवो भार्यां निर्दहेत्सर्ववानरान्॥'}

{'en': '(Therefore) even here I shall stay, restraining my fare and mortifying my senses. All those principal monkeys ought not to lose their lives because of any act to which I may commit myself.', 'sn': 'इहैव नियताहारो वत्स्यामि नियतेन्द्रियः। न मत्कृते विनश्येयुः सर्वे ते नरवानराः॥'}

{'en': 'This is the Asoka wood, extensive and containing mighty trees. This I shall explore, as it has not yet been searched by me.', 'sn': 'अशोकवनिका चापि महतीयं महादुमा। इमामधिगमिष्यामि नहीयं विचिता मया।५३ ।।'}

{'en': 'And saluting the Vasus, the Rudras, the Aditya, the twin Asvins, (and Rāma and Laks mana), I enhancing the sorrow of the Raksas, shall go into it.', 'sn': 'वसून् रुद्रांस्तथाऽऽदित्यानश्विनौ मरुतोऽपि च। नमस्कृत्वा गमिष्यामि रक्षसां शोकवर्धनः॥'}

{'en': 'Having vanquished the Rākşas, I will bestow on Rāma the lady of the Ikşvāku race like the fruit of asceticism conferred on an ascetic.', 'sn': 'जित्वा तु राक्षसान् देवीमिक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दिनीम्। सम्प्रदास्यामि रामाय सिद्धीमिव तपस्विने॥'}

{'en': 'Having thus reflected for a space, the mightyarmed offspring of the Wind-god, his senses agitated with anxiety, arose. “I bow to Rāma with Lakşmaņa, and to the revered daughter of Janaka, I bow to Rudra, and Indra, and Yama, and Wind-god, and I bow to the Moon, to Fire and to the Maruts."', 'sn': 'स मुहूर्तमिव ध्यात्वा चिन्ताविग्रथितेन्द्रियः। उदतिष्ठन् महाबाहुर्हनूमान् मारुतात्मजः॥ नमोऽस्तु रामाय सलक्ष्मणाय देव्यै च तस्यै जनकात्मजायै। नमोऽस्तु रुद्रेन्द्रयमानिलेभ्यो नमोऽस्तु चन्द्राग्निमरुद्गणेभ्यः॥'}

{'en': 'Having bowed to them all, as also to Sugrīva, the offspring of the Wind-god, surveying all he cardinal points, mentally entered the Asoka wood.', 'sn': 'स तेभ्यस्तु नमस्कृत्वा सुग्रीवाय च मारुतिः। दिशः सर्वाः समालोक्य सोऽशोकवनिका प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'Having mentally entered the Asoka wood, that monkey, son to the Wind-god, reflected as to what he should do next.', 'sn': 'स गत्वा मनसा पूर्वमशोकवनिकां शुभाम्। उत्तरं चिन्तयामास वानरो मारुतात्मजः॥'}

{'en': 'The sacred Asoka wood, sanctified with every purifying rite and abounding in woods, needs must be full of Rāksas.', 'sn': 'ध्रुवं तु रक्षोबहुला भविष्यति वनाकुला। अशोकवनिका पुण्या सर्वसंस्कारसंस्कृता ॥'}

{'en': 'And warders, directed there to, forsooth, protect the trees, and that worshipful Soul of the universe does not breathe here vigorously.', 'sn': 'रक्षिणश्चात्र विहिता नूनं रक्षन्ति पादपान्। भगवानपि विश्वात्मा नातिक्षोभं प्रवायति॥'}

{'en': 'I contract my person in the interests of Rāma, and in order that Rāvana may not see me. May all the deities along with the saints confer success on me.', 'sn': 'स क्षिप्तोऽयं मयाऽऽत्मा च रामार्थे रावणस्य च। सिद्धिं दिशन्तु मे सर्वे देवाः सर्षिगणास्त्विह॥'}

{'en': 'May the revered self-create Brahınā, and the deities, and the ascetics, and Fire, and wind, and the much invoked bearer of the Vajra,* and the noose-handed Varuna, and the Moon and the Sun, the high-souled Aśvnis, and all the Maruts—(confer) success (on me). And all beings, and the lord of them all," and others that, albeit not specified in the scriptures, are yet visible in the way, will confer success on me. *Indra. +Prajapati.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मा स्वयम्भूर्भगवान् देवाश्चैव तपस्विनः। सिद्धिमग्निश्च वायुश्च पुरुहूतश्च वज्रभृत्॥ वरुणः पाशहस्तश्च सोमादित्यौ तथैव च। अश्विनौ च महात्मानौ मरुतः सर्व एव च॥ सिद्धिं सर्वाणि भूतानि भूतानां चैव यः प्रभुः। दास्यन्ति मम ये चान्येऽप्यदृष्टाः पथि गोचराः॥'}

{'en': 'When shall I behold the blameless face of that noble lady, with its protruding nose; having luminous smiles, having eyes resembling lotuspetals; and bright as the complacent lord of stars?', 'sn': 'तदुनसं पाण्डुरदन्तमव्रणं शुचिस्मितं पद्मपलाशलोचनम्। द्रक्ष्ये तदार्यावदनं कदा न्वहं प्रसन्नताराधिपतुल्यवर्चसम्॥'}

{'en': 'Ah! today how shall feeble forlorn one that has been borne down by the force of the mean, abject and grim-visaged (Ravana), fierce yet wearing (at the time of the rape), a dress tending to inspire confidence, come in my sight?', 'sn': 'क्षुद्रेण हीनेन नृशंसमूर्तिना सुदारुणालंकृतवेषधारिणा। बलाभिभूता ह्यबला तपस्विनी कथं नु मे दृष्टिपथेऽद्य सा भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing the words of Laksmana, Rama, the slayer of enemies, said:-0 you of firm vows, do you at length, describe the destruction of Vrtra.', 'sn': 'लक्ष्मणस्य तु तद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा शत्रुनिबर्हणः। वृत्रघातमशेषेण कथयेत्याह सुव्रत॥'}
{'en': "Hearing the words of Rāghava, Lakşmaņa, the enhancer of Sumitra's delight, again took up that theme.", 'sn': 'राघवेणैवमुक्तस्तु सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः। भूय एव कथां दिव्यां कथयामास सुव्रतः॥'}
{'en': 'Hearing the words of Indra and other deities Visnu replied.', 'sn': 'सहस्राक्षवचः श्रुत्वा सर्वेषां च दिवौकसाम्। विष्णुर्देवानुवाचेदं सवानिन्द्रपुरोगमान्॥'}

{'en': 'From before I am bound with the high-souled Vrtra by the ties of friendship. For this, even for your satisfaction, I shall not (myself) slay him.', 'sn': 'पूर्व सौहृदबद्धोऽस्मि वृत्रस्येह महात्मनः। तेन युष्मत्प्रियार्थं हि नाहं हन्मि महासुरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Again I am to afford excellent felicity to you. I shall say the solution by which Indra will able to slay him.', 'sn': 'अवश्यं करणीयं च भवतां सुखमुत्तमम्। तस्मादुपायमाख्यास्ये सहस्राक्षो वधिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'I shall myself divide you into three classes and then forsooth your king shall be able to destroy Vrtra.', 'sn': 'वेधाभूतं करिष्यामि आत्मानं सुरसत्तमाः। तेन वृत्रं सहस्राक्षो वधिष्यति न संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'Of those three portions the first will stay in Indra, second into thunderbolt and the third one into the earth, then he will be able to slay him.', 'sn': 'एकांशो वासवं यातु द्वितीयो वज्रमेव तु। तृतीयो भूतलं यातु तदा वृत्रं हनिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Visnu, the god of gods, having said this, the deities, replied, saying: O slayer of demons, undoubtedly, what you have said, shall prove true; may victory crown you; we proceed now to slay Vſtra. O highly generous deity, do you now make Våsava powerfully by infusing your own energy.', 'sn': 'तथा ब्रुवति देवेशे देवा वाक्यमथाब्रुवन्।। एवमेतत्र संदेहो यथा वदसि दैत्यहन्॥ भद्रं तेऽस्तु गमिष्यामो वृत्रासुरवधैषिणः। भजस्व परमोदार वासवं स्वेन तेजसा।।।।'}

{'en': 'There upon the highly powerful immortals headed by Indra entered the forest where the great Asura Vſtra was performing austerities.', 'sn': 'ततः सर्वे महात्मानः सहस्राक्षपुरोगमाः। तदारण्यमुपाक्रामन्यत्र वृत्रो महासुरः॥'}

{'en': 'Arriving there they observed that the leading Asura was spreading rays all over, the outcome of his own effulgence, as if devouring the three worlds and burning down the quarters.', 'sn': 'तेऽपश्यंस्तेजसा भूतं तपन्तमसुरोत्तमम्। पिबन्तमिव लोकास्त्रीनिर्दहन्तमिवाम्बरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding that foremost of Asuras, the deities were greatly terrified and began to thing of plans by which they would be able to slay him and not be defeated.', 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वैव चासुरश्रेष्ठं देवास्त्रासमुपागमन्। कथमेनं वधिष्यामः कथं न स्यात्पराजयः॥'}

{'en': "While they were thus thinking, Indra, of thousand eyes, taking up a thunderbolt, hurled it against Vrtra's head.", 'sn': 'तेषां चिन्तयतां तत्र सहस्राक्षः पुरंदरः। वज्रं प्रगृह्य पाणिभ्यां प्राहिणोत्रमूर्धनि ॥'}

{'en': "That dreadful burning thunderbolt, like to the fire of dissolution, falling on Vrtra's head, the three worlds were agitated.", 'sn': 'कालाग्निनेव घोरेण दीप्तेनेव महार्चिषा। पतता वृत्रशिरसा जगत्त्रासमुपागमत्॥'}

{'en': 'There upon thinking that he has perpetrated an iniquity by slaying Vịtra engaged in asceticism, Indra, out of fear, fled to the other side of Lokāloka mountain, perpetually enshrouded with darkness.', 'sn': 'असंभाव्यं वधं तस्य वृत्रस्य विबुधाधिपः। चिन्तयानो जगामाशु लोकस्यान्तं महायशाः॥'}

{'en': 'And the sin, consequent upon the destruction of a Brahmana, pursuing him vehemently, entered into his person. In this wise Indra became subject to dreadful afflictions.', 'sn': 'तमिन्द्रं ब्रह्महत्याशु गच्छन्तमनुगच्छति। अपतच्चास्य गात्रेषु तमिन्द्रं दुःखमाविशत्॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding the enemy slain and Indra fled, the deities headed by fire again and again chanted the glories of Vişņu —the lord of three worlds saying: O great god, you are the refuge of the three worlds. You are the first-born and the father of the universe. For protecting all creatures you have assumed this Vişnu from. You have slain this Vặtra but the sin of slaying a Brahmana has visited Indra. Therefore, O excellent Puruşa, do you so arrange that he may i be freed from sins.', 'sn': 'हतारयः प्रनष्टेन्द्रा देवाः साग्निपुरोगमा:। विष्णुं त्रिभुवनेशानं मुहुर्मुहुरपूजयन्॥ त्वं गतिः परमेशान पूर्वजो जगतः पिता। रक्षार्थं सर्वभूतानां विष्णुत्वमुपजग्मिवान् ॥ हतश्चायं त्वया वृत्रो ब्रह्महत्या च वासवम्। बाधते सुरशार्दूल मोक्षं तस्य विनिर्दिश॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing the words of the celestials Vişņu said, Let your Chief celebrate a sacrifice in my honour, and by that he shall be cleansed off the sin.', 'sn': 'तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा देवानां विष्णुरब्रवीत्। मामेव यजतां शक्रः पावयिष्यामि वज्रिणम्॥'}

{'en': 'If the slayer of Pāka celebrates a horse sacrifice, he shall again fearlessly be installed as the chief of deities.', 'sn': 'पुण्येन हयमेधेन मामिष्ट्वा पाकशासनः। पुनरेष्यति देवानामिन्द्रत्वमकुतोभयः॥'}

{'en': 'Having addressed these nectar-like words to the deities and being glorified by them, Visnu, the god of gods, returned to his abode.', 'sn': 'एवं संदिश्य तां वाणी देवानां चामृतोपमाम्। जगाम विष्णुर्देवेशः स्तूयमानस्त्रिविष्टपम्॥'}
{'en': 'Rising with the morrow, Bharata anxious to behold Rāma, speedily set out ascending an excellent car.', 'sn': 'ततः समुत्थितः कल्यमास्थाय स्यन्दनोत्तमम्। प्रययौ भरतः शीघ्रं रामदर्शनकाम्यया॥'}

{'en': 'Before him went the councillors and priests, ascending cars resembling that of the Sun yoked with steeds.', 'sn': 'अग्रतः प्रययुस्तस्य सर्वे मन्त्रिपुरोहिताः। अधिरुह्य हयैर्युक्तान् रथान् सूर्यरथोपमान्॥'}

{'en': 'And a thousand elephants duly consecrated went in the wake of that son of the Ikşvāku line as he was proceeding.', 'sn': 'नवनागसहस्राणि कल्पितानि यथाविधिः। अन्वयुर्भरतं यान्तमिक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनम्॥'}

{'en': 'And six thousand with bow-men furnished with various weapons followed the illustrious prince Bharata as he was proceeding.', 'sn': 'षष्टी रथसहस्राणि धन्विनो विविधायुधाः। अन्वयुर्भरतं यान्तं राजपुत्रं यशस्विनम् ॥'}

{'en': 'And a hundred thousand horses mounted (by riders) went in the wake of that descendant of Raghu intent upon truth and having his senses under control.', 'sn': 'शतं सहस्राण्यश्वानां समारूढानि राघवम्। अन्वयुर्भरतं यान्तं राजपुत्रं यशस्विनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Kaikeyi and Sumitrā and the highly famous Kausalyā rejoicing at the prospect of the bringing of Rāma, went in an effulgent car. cars', 'sn': 'कैकेयी च सुमित्रा च कौसल्या च यशस्विनी। रामानयनसंतुष्टा ययुर्यानेन भास्वता॥'}

{'en': 'And the honourable persons (belonging to all the three orders) went with the object of beholding Rāma in company with Lakşmaņa.', 'sn': 'प्रयाताश्चार्यसंघाता रामं द्रष्टुं सलक्ष्मणम्। तस्यैव च कथाश्चित्राः कुर्वाणा हृष्टमानसाः॥'}

{'en': "They with glad hearts variously conversed with each other, “When shall we see the mighty armed Rāma sable like to a cloud, of steady strength, firm in vows, the remover of the world's grief?", 'sn': 'मेघश्याम महाबाहुं स्थिरसत्त्वं दृढव्रतम्। कदा द्रक्ष्यामहे रामं जगतः शोकनाशनम्॥'}

{'en': 'As soon as we shall see him, Rāghava will remove our sorrow; even as the Sun arising dispels the darkness of the entire world.', 'sn': 'दृष्ट एव हि नः शोकमपनेष्यति राघवः। तमः सर्वस्य लोकस्य समुद्यन्निव भास्करः॥'}
{'en': 'Thus cheerfully carrying on an auspicious talk, the citizens embracing each other went along.', 'sn': 'इत्येवं कथयन्तस्ते सम्प्रहृष्टाः कथाः शुभाः। परिष्वजानाश्चान्योन्यं ययुर्नागरिकास्तदा॥'}

{'en': 'And all other, and the foremost merchants as well as all the principal classes, joyfully went in quest of Rāma.', 'sn': 'ये च तत्रापरे सर्वे सम्मता ये च नैगमाः। रामं प्रतिययुर्हृष्टाः सर्वाः प्रकृतयः शुभाः॥'}
