{'en': 'Having offered his obeisance to Räma and Lakşmaņa the powerful Hanumān, greatly delighted in seeing Sītā, remained there hidden.', 'sn': 'नमस्कृत्वाथ रामाय लक्ष्मणाय च वीर्यवान्। सीतादर्शनसंहष्टो हनुमान् संवृतोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding those two high-souled brothers Rāma and Lakşmaņa, heroic and with great scimitars in their hands, Sugrīva became terrified.', 'sn': 'तौ तु दृष्ट्वा महात्मानौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ। वरायुधधरौ वीरौ सुग्रीवः शङ्कितोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'That best of monkeys, of a disturbed mind, cast his looks around and could not stand (patiently) at any place.', 'sn': 'उद्विग्नहृदयः सर्वा दिशः समवलोकयन्। न व्यतिष्ठत कस्मिंश्चिद् देशे वानरपुंगवः॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding those two of great prowess he could not make up his mind to remain there and the heart of that terrified monkey, sank.', 'sn': 'नैव चक्रे मनः स्थातुं वीक्षमाणौ महाबलौ। कपेः परमभीतस्य चित्तं व्यवससाद ह ॥'}

{'en': 'Pondering over what is more and what is less important the virtuous-souled Sugrīva became highly anxious along with that monkey-herd.', 'sn': 'चिन्तयित्वा स धर्मात्मा विमृश्य गुरुलाघवम्। सुग्रीवः परमोद्विग्नः सर्वैस्तैर्वानरैः सह ॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding Rāma and Laksmana, Sugriva, the king of monkeys, greatly exercised with anxiety spoke to his counsellors, saying.', 'sn': 'ततः स सचिवेभ्यस्तु सुग्रीवः प्लवगाधिपः। शशंस परमोद्विग्नः पश्यंस्तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ॥'}

{'en': 'Forsooth, these two heroes, in false guises and wearing bark, despatched by Vāli, have come here traversing the forest stronghold.', 'sn': 'एतौ वनमिदं दुर्ग वालिप्रणिहितौ ध्रुवम्। छद्मना चीरवसनौ प्रचरन्ताविहागतौ॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding these two mighty archers the counsellors of Sugriva, quitting that mountainous expanse proceeded to another best of hills.', 'sn': 'ततः सुग्रीवसचिवा दृष्ट्वा परमधन्विनौ। जन्मुर्गिरितटा तस्मादन्यच्छिखरमुत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon proceeding quickly the commanders of various monkey herds stood encircling the king of monkeys and the chief of · leaders.', 'sn': 'ते क्षिप्रमभिगम्याथ यूथपा यूथपर्षभम्। हरयो वानरश्रेष्ठं परिवार्योपतस्थिरे॥'}

{'en': 'The monkeys thus sharing in the misery and happiness (of their chief) proceeded jumping from hill to hill shaking the summits thereof, with the velocity (of their persons). Thereupon those mighty monkeys, jumping, broke down the flowery trees of that stronghold.', 'sn': 'एवमेकायनगताः प्लवमाना गिरेगिरिम्। प्रकम्पयन्तो वेगेन गिरीणां शिखराणि च॥ ततः शाखामृगाः सर्वे प्लवमाना महाबलाः। बभञ्जुश्च नगांस्तत्र पुष्पितान् दुर्गमाश्रितान्॥'}

{'en': 'Those best of monkeys, springing all around that mighty hill, proceeded terrifying the deer, the wild cats and the tigers.', 'sn': 'आप्लवन्तो हरिवराः सर्वतस्तं महागिरिम्। मृगमार्जारशार्दूलांस्त्रासयन्तो ययुस्तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Stationed on that best of mountains the ministers of Sugrīva, coming in the front of that monkey-chief, stood with clasped palms.', 'sn': 'ततः सुग्रीवसचिवाः पर्वतेन्द्रे समाहिताः। संगम्य कपिमुख्येन सर्वे प्राञ्जलयः स्थिताः॥'}

{'en': "Thereupon Hanumān, skilled in speech, spoke to Sugrīva, terrified and afraid of Vāli's wicked wiles.", 'sn': 'ततस्तु भयसंत्रस्तं वालिकिल्विषशङ्कितम्। उवाच हनुमान् वाक्यं सुग्रीवं वाक्यकोविदः॥'}

{'en': "Let all the monkeys renounce Vāli's fear; in this best of mountains, Malaya-there is no fear of him.", 'sn': 'सम्भ्रमस्त्यज्यतामेष सर्वैर्वालिकृते महान्। मलयोऽयं गिरिवरो भयं नेहास्ति वालिनः॥'}

{'en': 'I do not behold, O best of monkeys, that wicked Vāli of terrible looks, afraid of whom you had fled away and for whom you are anxious.', 'sn': 'यस्मादुद्विग्नचेतास्त्वं विद्रुतो हरिपुङ्गव। तं क्रूरदर्शनं क्रूरं नेह पश्यामि वालिनम्॥'}

{'en': 'I do not observe here, O gentle one, the wicked-souled Väli your elder brother of impious actions and whom you do fear and I do not perceive any terror proceeding from him.', 'sn': 'यस्मात् तव भयं सौम्यं पूर्वजात् पापकर्मणः। स नेह वाली दुष्टात्मा न ते पश्याम्यहं भयम्॥'}

{'en': 'O monkey-chief, truly manifest is your monkey-hood and it is through your lightheartedness that you are incapable of fixing your soul.', 'sn': 'अहो शाखामृगत्वं ते व्यक्तमेव प्लवङ्गम। लघुचित्ततयात्मानं न स्थापयसि यो मतौ।। ।॥'}

{'en': 'Gifted with intellect and knowledge do you perforin all by means of gestures. A king void of sense cannot govern all creatures.', 'sn': 'बुद्धिविज्ञानसम्पन्न इङ्गितैः सर्वमाचर। नह्यबुद्धिं गतो राजा सर्वभूतानि शास्ति हि ॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing those pregnant words of Hanumār in its entirety, Sugrīva addressed to Hanumān in better accents.', 'sn': 'सुग्रीवस्तु शुभं वाक्यं श्रुत्वा सर्वं हनूमतः। ततः शुभतरं वाक्यं हनूमन्तमुवाच ह ॥'}

{'en': 'Who is not terrified beholding those two mighty armed heroes, having expansive eyes, with bows, arrow, and daggers in their hands like to two sons of a celestial?', 'sn': 'दीर्घबाहू विशालाक्षौ शरश्चापासिधारिणौ। कस्य स स्याद् भयं दृष्ट्वा ह्येतौ सुरसुतोपमौ ॥'}

{'en': 'Methinks these two best of men have been despatched by Vali. Kings have many friends. And it is not proper for me to place confidence in them.', 'sn': 'वालिप्रणिहितावेव शङ्केऽहं पुरुषोत्तमौ। राजानो बहुमित्राश्च विश्वासो नात्र हि क्षमः॥'}

{'en': 'People should know that enemies, always treacherous by nature, range under false guises. And those foes, availing of their credulity, bring about their destruction whenever opportunity presents itself.', 'sn': 'अरयश्च मनुष्येण विज्ञेयाश्छद्मचारिणः। विश्वस्तानामविश्वस्ताश्छिद्रेषु प्रहरन्त्यपि॥'}

{'en': "Vāli is eminently expert in despatching business. Monarchs, cognizant of many a wily expedient, bring about others' destruction. It is proper to discern them by means of disguised spies.", 'sn': 'कृत्येषु वाली मेधावी राजानो बहुदर्शिनः। भवन्ति परहन्तारस्ते ज्ञेयाः प्राकृतैनरैः॥'}

{'en': 'O monkey, do you proceed under a false guise and come by their intentions, examining them aright by their countenances, gestures and words.', 'sn': 'तौ त्वया प्राकृतेनेव गत्वा ज्ञेयौ प्लवङ्गम। इङ्गितानां प्रकारैश्च रूपव्याभाषणेन च॥'}

{'en': 'Do you ascertain their intention. If do you find them delighted, secure their confidence in my favour by eulogising me again and again and giving out to them my views.', 'sn': 'लक्षयस्व तयोर्भावं प्रहृष्टमनसौ यदि। विश्वासयन् प्रशंसाभिरिङ्गितैश्च पुनः पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'O best of monkeys, do you ask them why they have entered this forest, if you do perceive that these two archers are pure souled.', 'sn': 'ममैवाभिमुखं स्थित्वा पृच्छ त्वं हरिपुङ्गव। प्रयोजनं प्रवेशस्य वनस्यास्य धनुर्धरौ॥'}

{'en': 'O monkey, if you determine the fairness and unfairness of their purpose, their wickedness should be discovered by means of their gestures and conversation.', 'sn': 'शुद्धात्मानौ यदि त्वेतौ जानीहि त्वं प्लवङ्गम। व्याभाषितैर्वा रूपैर्वा विज्ञेया दुष्टताऽनयोः॥'}
{'en': 'Being commanded by that chief of monkeys, the son of Maruta purposed to approach Rāma and Laksmana.', 'sn': 'इत्येवं कपिराजेन संदिष्टो मारुतात्मजः। चकार गमने बुद्धिं यत्र तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ॥'}

{'en': "Assenting to the words of the terrified and unconquerable Sugriva and saying 'Be it so, Hanumān, the high-souled monkey proceeded where the heroic Râma was with Lakşmaņa.", 'sn': 'तथेति सम्पूज्य वचस्तु तस्य कपेः सुभीतस्य दुरासदस्य। महानुभावो हनुमान् ययौ तदा स यत्र रामोऽतिबली सलक्ष्मणः॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said When that Atiratha, viz., Drona had been slain by the son of Prisata, O Sanjaya, did my troops and those of the Pandavas do afterwards?', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच तस्मिन्नतिरथे द्रोणे निहते पार्षतेन वै। मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वन्नतः परम्॥'}
{'en': 'were son', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच'}

{'en': "Sanjaya said When that Atiratha Drona had been slain by the son of Prisata and when the Kaurava ranks broken and routed, Kunti's Dhananjaya.", 'sn': 'तस्मिन्नतिरथे द्रोणे निहते पार्षतेन वै। कौरवेषु च भग्नेषु कुन्तीपुत्रो धनंजयः॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding a wonderful sight indicative of his victory, questioned, O foremost of the Bharatas, the mighty sage Vyasa who had gone there at his own pleasure.', 'sn': 'दृष्टवा सुमहदाश्चर्यमात्मनो विजयावहम्। यदृच्छयाऽऽगतं व्यासं पप्रच्छ भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'Arjuna said When slaying my foes in battle with myriads of resplendent darts, I saw a male being of the effulgence of fire proceeding before me.', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच संग्रामे न्यहनं शत्रूशरौधैर्विमलैरहम्। अग्रता लक्षये यान्तं पुरुषं पावकप्रभम्॥'}

{'en': 'Raising his blazing trident wherever he turned, my foes in that direction, O mighty sage, he routed and scorched.', 'sn': 'ज्वलन्तं शूलमुद्यम्य यां दिशं प्रतिपद्यते। तस्यां दिशि विदीर्यन्ते शत्रवो मे महामुने॥'}

{'en': 'People think that I rout my foes whereas they are really routed by him. I only pursue from behind the troops already broken and routed by him.', 'sn': 'तेन भग्नानरीन् सर्वान् मद्भग्नान् मन्यते जनः। तेन भग्नानि सैन्यानि पृष्ठतोऽनुव्रजाम्यहम्॥'}

{'en': 'O illustrious possessor of the six qualities the Bhagas, tell me who is that excellent of all male beings, whom I see armed with the trident and who resembles the Sun himself in effulgence.', 'sn': 'भगवंस्तन्ममाचक्ष्व को वै स पुरुषोत्तमः। शूलपाणिर्मया हृष्टतेजसा सूर्यसंनिभः॥'}

{'en': 'He never touches the earth with his feet nor does he hurled his trident; but in consequence of his energy, thousands of arrows issue out of that trident of his.', 'sn': 'न पद्भ्यां स्पृशते भूमिं न च शूलं विमुञ्चति। शूलाच्छूलसहस्राणि निष्पेतुस्तस्य तेजसा॥'}

{'en': 'Vyasa said O son of Pritha, you have seen Sankara, that first of all the creators of the world, that lord of all energies, primary male being, he that is the embodiment of heaven, earth and sky, the divine Lord, the saviour of the universe, the paramount master, the bestower of boons, also called Ishana. O, do you seek the refuge of that boon-giving deity, that lord of the universe.', 'sn': 'व्यास उवाच प्रजापतीनां प्रथमं तैजसं पुरुषं प्रभुम्। भुवनं भूर्भुवं देवं सर्वलोकेश्वरं प्रभुम्॥ ईशानं वरदं पार्थ दृष्टवानसि शङ्करम्! तं गच्छ शरणं देव वरदं भुवनेश्वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'He was the Paramount Divinity, of illustrious soul, also called Ishana, the wearer of matted locks and the origin of all auspiciousness. He possesses three eyes and mighty arms and fierce energy; and his locks are tied as a crown of his head and he clad in deer skin.', 'sn': 'महादेवं महात्मानमीशानं जटिलं विभुम्। त्र्यक्षं महाभुजं रुद्रं शिखिनं चीरवाससम्॥'}

{'en': 'That supreme god, called Hara or Sthanu, is the lord of the universe and the giver of boons. He is the foremost of all beings in the universe and incapable of beings vanquished. He is the afforder of joy to the universe and it its paramount ruler.', 'sn': 'महादेवं हरं स्थाणुं वरदं भुवनेश्वरम्। जगत्प्रधानमजितं जगत्प्रीतिमधीश्वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'The origin, the light and the refuge of the universe, he is ever attended with victory. He is the soul and the creator of the universe; and the universe is his from and he is ever-glorious.', 'sn': 'जगद्योनि जगद्वीजं जयिनं जगतो गतिम्। विश्वात्मानं विश्वसृजं विश्वमूर्तिं यशस्विनम्॥'}

{'en': 'That Lord of the universe and its ruler, that great one is the lord of all action. Known by the name of Shambhu he is self-born, he is the lord of all creatures and the origin of the past, present and future.', 'sn': 'विश्वेश्वरं विश्वनरं कर्मणामीश्वरं प्रभुम्। शम्भुं स्वयम्भुं भूतेशुं भूतभव्यभवोद्भवम्॥'}

{'en': 'He is the Yoga and the lord of Yoga. He is called Sarva and is the lord of the lords of the world. He is superior to everything. He is the most excellent of all things in the universe and the highest of all and is called Paramesthin.', 'sn': 'योगं योगेश्वरं सर्वं सर्वलोकेश्वरेश्वरम्। सर्वश्रेष्ठं जगच्छ्रेष्ठं वरिष्ठं परमेष्ठिनम्॥'}

{'en': 'He is the ordainer of the three worlds and the sole refuge of them all. He is pure souled, universe himself, dreadful, holder of moon on head, eternal, the protector of the universe, the forernost of all deities among the gods of speeches, incapable of being vanquished, lord of world and is beyond the reach of birth, decline and death.', 'sn': 'लोकत्रयविधातारमेकं लोकत्रयाश्रयम्। शुद्धात्मानं भवं भीमं शशाङ्ककृतशेखरम्॥ शाश्वतं भूधरं देवं सर्ववागीश्वरेश्वरम्। । सुदुर्जयं जगन्नाथं जन्ममृत्युजरातिगम्॥'}

{'en': 'The essence of knowledge and incapable of being comprehended by the understanding and the best of all knowledge, he is unknowable. Out of his grace he gives to his worshippers the boons they desire.', 'sn': 'ज्ञानात्मानं ज्ञानगम्यं ज्ञानश्रेष्ठं सुदुर्विदम्। दातारं चैव भक्तानां प्रसादविहितान् वरान्॥'}

{'en': 'That great one has for his companions, celestial beings of various forms, some of whom are dwarfs, some with matted locks, some with bald heads, some with short necks, some with large stomachs.', 'sn': 'तस्य पारिषदा दिव्या रूपैर्नानाविधैर्विभोः। वामना जटिला मुण्डा ह्रस्वग्रीवा महोदराः॥'}

{'en': 'Some with huge bodies, some endued with great mighty and some with long ears. All of them have, O son of Pritha, distorted faces, mouths and legs and strange dresses.', 'sn': 'महाकाया महोत्साहा महाकर्णास्तथापरे। आननैविकृतैः पादैः पार्थ वेषैश्च वैकृतैः॥'}

{'en': 'That great lord Mahadeva, O Partha, is adored by even these kinds of followers. That Siva, O son, possessed of energy, goes in advance of you through kindness only.', 'sn': 'ईदृशैः स महादेवः पूज्यमानो महेश्वरः। स शिवस्तात तेजस्वी प्रसादाद् याति तेऽग्रतः॥'}

{'en': 'In that dreadful battle, O son of Pritha, capable of causing the hair to stand erect, who else, O Arjuna, except the divine Maheshvara, that foremost of all bowmen, could even in his mind, dare defeat that host that was protected by those great smiters and bowmen, viz., Ashvatthaman, Karna and Kripa.', 'sn': 'तस्मिन् घोरे सदा पार्थ संग्रामे रोमहर्षणे। द्रौणिकर्णकृपैर्गुप्तां महेष्वासैः प्रहारिभिः॥ कस्तां सेनां तदा पार्थ मनसापि प्रधर्षयेत्। ऋते देवान्महेष्वासाद् बहुरूपान्महेश्वरात्॥'}

{'en': 'Nobody can venture to withstand the fighter, in whose front walks Mahadeva himself. There is no creature in the triune worlds who is a match for him.', 'sn': 'स्थातुमुत्सहते कश्चिन्न तस्मिन्नग्रतः स्थिते। न हि भूतं समं तेन त्रिषु लोकेषु विद्यते॥'}

{'en': 'At the very smell of the enraged Mahadeva, the enemy trembles and drops down senseless in large numbers in battle.', 'sn': 'गन्धेनापि हि संग्रामे तस्य क्रुद्धस्य शत्रवः। विसंज्ञा हतभूयिष्ठा वेपन्ति च पतन्ति च॥'}

{'en': 'For this reason the gods in heaven ever adore and bow down to him. The men of this world as also others that have attained to heaven.', 'sn': 'तस्मै नमस्तु कुर्वन्तो देवास्तिष्ठन्ति वै दिवि। ये चान्ये मानवा लोके ते च स्वर्गजितो नराः॥'}

{'en': 'If they devoutly worship the boon-giving, auspicious and divine Rudra, the lord of Uma, obtain happiness here and the highest felicity hereafter.', 'sn': 'ये भक्ता वरदं देवं शिवं रुद्रमुमापतिम्। अनन्यभावेन सदा सर्वेशं समुपासते॥ इहलोके सुखं प्राप्य ते यान्ति परमां गतिम्।'}

{'en': 'O son of Kunti, bow down to him who is peace incarnate, to him called Rudra (of the fierce), who is of blue throat, exceedingly subtle and of great effulgence.', 'sn': 'नमस्कुरुष्व कौन्तेय तस्मै शान्ताय वै सदा॥ रुद्राय शितिकण्ठाय कनिष्ठाय सुवर्चसे।'}

{'en': 'To himn known as Kapardin, him that is dreadful, him who possesses twany eyes, him that is boon giving; to that great ordainer or red locks and righteous conduct, to him who is ever-engaged in the performance of auspicious acts. to him who is an object of desire with all beings; to him who is of tawny eyes; him that is called Sthanu; him that is called Purusha; to him of tawny hair; him that is bald and him that is extremely subtle and of great splendour, to him that is the giver of light, him that is the embodiment of all holy waters, him that is the god of gods, him that is possessed of great impetuosity; him that is of various forms; him who is called Sarva and is vested in pleasant garments.', 'sn': 'कपर्दिने करालाय हर्यक्षवरदाय च॥ याम्यायाव्यक्तकेशाय सद्वृत्ते शङ्कराय च। काम्याय हरिनेत्राय स्थाणवे पुरुषाय च॥ हरिकेशाय मुण्डाय कृशायोत्तारणाय च। भास्कराय सुतीर्थाय देवदेवाय रंहसे॥ बहुरूपाय शर्वाय प्रियाय प्रियवाससे।'}

{'en': 'To him that possesses an excellent turban, a handsome face and a thousand eyes; him that is the giver of rain, him that has the mountains for his habitation; him that is peace, him that is the protector, him that has the barks of trees for his cloth.', 'sn': 'उष्णीषिणे सुवक्त्राय सहस्राक्षाय मीढुषे॥ गिरिशाय प्रशान्ताय यतये चीरवाससे।'}

{'en': 'To him whose arms are adorned with ornaments of gold, him who is furious; him who is the lord of all the different quarters; him who is the master of clouds and of all created beings.', 'sn': 'हिरण्यबाहवे राज्ञे उग्राय पतये दिशाम्॥ पर्जन्ययतये चैव भूतानां पतये नमः।'}

{'en': 'To hiin who is the lord of all trees and of kine; him that has his body covered with trees; him who is the general of the celestial armies; him who is the inspirer of all thoughts.', 'sn': 'वृक्षाणां पतये चैव गवां च पतये नमः॥ वृक्षरावृतकायाय सेनान्ये मध्यमाय च।'}

{'en': "To him who has the sacrificial ladle in his hands; him who is effulgent, him who wields the bow; him who is Rama himself, him who has numerous semblance's; him who is the lord of the universe; him who has the Munja grass for his attire;", 'sn': 'स्रुवहस्ताय देवाय धन्विने भार्गवाय च॥ बहुरूपाय विश्वस्य पतये मुञ्जवाससे।'}
{'en': 'To him who has a thousand heads; him who has a thousand eyes; and him who has a thousand arms and a thousand legs.', 'sn': 'सहस्रशिरसे चैव सहस्रनयनाय च॥ सहस्रबाहवे चैव सहस्रचरणाय च।'}

{'en': "O son of Kunti, seek the refuge of at lord of the universe, who bestows boons, who is the lord of Uma, who possesses three-eyes and who is the destroyer of Daksha's sacrifice;", 'sn': 'शरणं गच्छ कौन्तेय वरदं भुवनेश्वरम्॥ उमापतिं विरूपाक्षं दक्षयज्ञनिबर्हणम्।'}

{'en': 'Who is the protector of all created beings; who is ever-cheerful; who is the faviour of all; who is undeteriorating in his glory; who is called Kaparddin and those gait is like that of the bull; whose lavel is like that of the bull and whose emblem is the bull.', 'sn': 'प्रजानां पतिमव्यग्रं भूतानां पतिमव्ययम्॥ कपर्दिनं वृषावर्तं वृषनाभं वृषध्वजम्।'}

{'en': 'Who is proud like the bull, who is the lord of the bull, who is known by the horns of the bull and who is the bull of bulls, whose bannerdevise is the bull; who is generous like the bull; who has eyes like those of the bull;', 'sn': 'वृषदष वृषपतिं वृषशृङ्गं वृषर्षभम्॥ वृषाङ्क वृषभोदारं वृषभं वृषभेक्षणम्।'}

{'en': "Whose weapons are all of superior make; whose arrows is the Vrisha (Krishna) and who is righteousness incarnate; who is called the Great Lord, whose seat is the leopard's skin.", 'sn': 'वृषायुधं वृषशरं वृषभूतं वृषेश्वरम्॥ महोदरं महाकायं द्वीपिचर्मनिवासिनम्।'}

{'en': 'Who is the lord of the words, who is the giver of boons, who is bald, who is devoted to the Brahmanas and who behoves the Brahmanas, who is armed with the trident, who is boon-giving; who wields the sword and the buckles; and who is the lightly auspicious one:', 'sn': 'लोकेशं वरदं मुण्डं ब्रह्मण्यं ब्राह्मणप्रियम्॥ त्रिशूलपाणिं वरदं खगचर्मधरं प्रभुम्।'}

{'en': "Who use the bow Pinaka, who is shorn of his battle-axe and who is the sovereign and the saviour of the universe. I totally consign myself to the care of that divine lord, that giver of protection, that god versed in deer's skin; salutation to that lord of the gods who has Vaisravana for his friend, salutation to him of illustrious vows, to him whose companions are all best bow-men.", 'sn': 'पिनाकिनं खड्गधरं लोकानां पतिमीश्वरम्॥ प्रपद्ये शरणं देवं शरण्यं चीरवाससम्। नमस्तस्मै सुरेशाय यस्य वैश्रवणः सखा॥ सुवाससे नमस्तुभ्यं सुव्रताय सुधन्विने।'}

{'en': 'To him who himself wields the bow, to that great Divinity with whom the bow is a favourite weapon; who is himself the arrow hurled by the bow; who is the bow-string and the bow and the preceptor instructing others in the use of the bow.', 'sn': 'धनुर्धराय देवाय प्रियधन्वाय धन्विने॥ धन्वन्तराय धनुषे धन्वाचार्याय ते नमः।'}

{'en': 'Salutations to that deity whose weapons are terrible and who himself is the foremost of all gods, salutations to him whose semblances are various and who has got diverse bowmen as his attendants.', 'sn': 'उग्रायुधाय देवाय नमः सुरवराय च॥ नमोऽस्तु बहुरूपाय नमोऽस्तु बहुधन्विने।'}

{'en': "Salutations to Sthanu, to that best of all wielders of bow, salutations even to the destroyer of 'Tripura,' and the slayer of Bhaga.", 'sn': 'नमोऽस्तु स्थाणवे नित्यं नमस्तस्मै तपस्विने॥ नमोऽस्तु त्रिपुरनाय भगनाय च वै नमः।'}

{'en': 'Salutations to the lord of the Vanaspatis (Trees & c) and to the lord of men; salutations to the lord of the celestial mothers and to the lord of the Ganas.', 'sn': 'वनस्पतीनां पतये नराणां पतये नमः॥ मातृणां पतये चैव गणानां पतये नमः।'}

{'en': 'Salutations ever to him who is the lord of kine and the master of all sacrifices. Salutations to the lord of waters and of the celestials;', 'sn': 'गवां च पतये नित्यं यज्ञानां पतये नमः॥ अपां च पतये नित्यं देवानां पतये नमः।'}

{'en': "Salutations to him who is the destroyer of Surya's teeth, who is of three eyes, who is the giver of boons, who is called Hara, who is blue-throated and who is of golden locks.", 'sn': 'पूष्णो दन्तविनाशाय त्र्यक्षाय वरदाय च॥ नीलकण्ठाय पिङ्गाय स्वर्णकेशाय वै नमः।'}

{'en': 'I shall now relate to you, according to my knowledge and as I have heard them related, all the divine deeds of the supremely wise Mahadeva.', 'sn': 'कर्माणि यानि दिव्यानि महादेवस्य धीमतः॥ तानि ते कीर्तयिष्यामि यथाप्रज्ञं यथाश्रुतम्।'}

{'en': 'If Mahadeva is worked up with rage, neither the gods, nor the Asuras, neither the Gandharvas, nor the Rakshasas, even if they conceal themselves in deep caves, can enjoy any peace.', 'sn': 'न सुरा नासुरा लोके न गन्धर्वा न राक्षसाः॥ सुखमेधन्ति कुपिते तस्मिन्नपि गुहागताः।'}

{'en': 'In days of yore when Daksha had collected all the necessary objects for the celebration of his sacrifice, Mahadeva excited with rage destroyed them all; indeed then he became unusually stern.', 'sn': 'दक्षस्य यजमानस्य विधिवत् सम्भृतं पुरा॥ विव्याध कुपितो यज्ञं निर्दयस्त्वभवत् तदा।'}

{'en': 'Shooting an arrow with his bow then, he uttered a tremendous roar. The celestials, who always perform acts beneficial to the world, the were filled with anxiety.', 'sn': 'धनुषा बाणमुत्सृज्य सघोषं विननाद च॥ ते न शर्म कुतः शान्ति लेभिरे स्म सुरास्तदा।'}

{'en': 'When the sacrifice was destroyed and when Maheshvara was enraged, the gods were greatly frightened at the sound produced by his twanging bow and his palm-strokes.', 'sn': 'विद्रुते सहसा यज्ञे कुपिते च महेश्वरे॥ तेन ज्यातलघोषेण सर्वे लोकाः समाकुलाः।'}

{'en': 'The gods and the Asuras all succumbed and fell down and O son of Pritha, the waters were agitated and the earth trembled with everything on it.', 'sn': 'बभूवुर्वशगाः पार्थ निपेतुश्च सुरासुराः॥ आपश्चुक्षुभिरे सर्वाश्चकम्पे च वसुंधरा।'}

{'en': 'The mountains split and the quarters of heaven and the Nagas became stupefied. Enveloped in a pall of gloom the universe was lost to view.', 'sn': 'पर्वताश्च व्यशीर्यन्त दिशो नागाश्च मोहिताः॥ अन्धेन तमसा लोका न प्राक्राशन्त संवृताः।'}

{'en': 'The splendour of the luminaries as also of the Sun was destroyed. The Rishis filled with fear became agitated and desirous of their own good and that of all other creatures, performed propitiatory rites. Then Sankara, smilingly rushed upon Pushana.', 'sn': 'जनिवान् सह सूर्येण सर्वेषां ज्योतिषां प्रभाः॥ चुक्षुभुर्भयभीताश्च शान्तिं चक्रुस्तथैव च। ऋषयः सर्वभूतानामात्मनश्च सुखैषिणः॥ पूषाणमभ्यद्रवत शंकरः प्रहसन्निव।'}

{'en': 'Who was eating the sacrificial oblations and the tore out his teeth. The gods then, bowing down to him, fled away trembling.', 'sn': 'पुरोडाशं भक्षयतो दशनान् वै व्यशातयत्॥ ततो निश्चक्रमुर्देवा वेपमाना नताः स्म ते।'}

{'en': 'Once more Mahadeva aimed ai the gods a shower of burning and sharp resembling tongues of fire mixed with smoke or clouds with lightning.', 'sn': 'पुनश्च संदधे दीप्तान् देवानां निशिताशरान्॥ सधूमान् सस्फुलिङ्गांश्च विद्युत्तोयदसंनिभान्।'}

{'en': 'Beholding that arrowy shower, all the gods, bowing down to Maheshvara, assigned to Rudra a substantial share in sacrifices.', 'sn': 'तं दृष्ट्वा तु सुराः सर्वे प्रणिपत्य महेश्वरम्॥ रुद्रस्य यज्ञभागं च विशिष्टं ते त्वकल्पयन्।'}

{'en': 'Afraid, the gods sought his protection, O prince. His anger having subsided the great god re-established the sacrifice. arrows', 'sn': 'भयेन त्रिदशा राजञ्छरणं च प्रपेदिरे॥ तेन चैवातिकोपेन स यज्ञः संधितस्तदा।'}

{'en': 'The gods that had fled away returned. Indeed they are afraid of Maheshvara even to this day. Formerly the puissant Asuras had three cities in heaven.', 'sn': 'रुद्रं जग्मुः भग्नाश्चापि सुरा आसन भीताश्चाद्यापि तं प्रति॥ असुराणां पुराण्यासंस्रीणि वीर्यवतां दिवि।'}

{'en': 'One was made of gold, another of silver and the third of iron; each of them was excellent and large. The golden city belonged to Kamalaksha, the silver city to Taraksksha.', 'sn': 'आयसं राजतं चैव सौवर्णं परमं महत्॥ सौवर्ण कमलाक्षस्य तारकाक्षस्य राजतम्।'}

{'en': 'The third, made of iron, belonged to Vidyutmalin. Using all his weapons, failed to capture those cities.', 'sn': 'तृतीयं तु पुरं तेषां विद्युन्मालिन आयसम्॥ न शक्तस्तानि मघवान् भेत्तुं सर्वायुधैरपि।'}

{'en': 'Thereupon all the celestials, afflicted as they were, sought the refuge of Rudra. The gods then, with Vasava at their head, said these words to that high-souled one.', 'sn': 'अथ सर्वे पुरा शरणमर्दिताः॥ ते तमूचुर्महात्मानं सर्वे देवाः सवासवाः।'}

{'en': 'The denizens of the three cities, having obtained boons from Brahma and proud in consequence of those boons, are excessively oppressing the worlds.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मदत्तवरा ह्येते घोरास्त्रिपुरवासिनः॥ पीडयन्त्यधिकं लोकं यस्मात् ते वरदर्पिताः।'}

{'en': 'O Lord of the gods, O supreme Divinity, save yourself, there is none capable of slaying the Daityas. Do you slay those injurers of the gods.', 'sn': 'त्वदृते देवदेवेश नान्यः शक्तः कथंचन॥ हन्तुं दैत्यान् महादेव जहि तांस्त्वं सुरद्विषः।'}

{'en': 'O Rudra, then creatures immolated in every sacrifice will be yours. Do you therefore, O lord of the universe, over-throw those Asuras.', 'sn': 'रुद्र रौद्रा भविष्यन्ति पशवः सर्वकर्मसु॥ निपातयिष्यसे चैतानसुरान् भुवनेश्वर।'}

{'en': "Thus addressed by the gods and moved by the desire for benefiting them, Mahadeva said 'yea' to their proposals. Then he made the two mountains, viz., Gandhamadan and Vindhya the two bamboo poles of his car.", 'sn': 'स तथोक्तस्तथेत्युक्त्वा देवानां हितकाम्यया॥ गन्धमादनविन्ध्यौ च कृत्वा वंशध्वजौ हरः।'}

{'en': 'And the earth with all the oceans and the forests his chariot and the snake Sesa the Aksha of his chariot.', 'sn': 'पृथ्वी ससागरवनां रथं कृत्वा तु शङ्करः॥ अक्षं कृत्वा तु नागेन्द्रं शेषं नाम त्रिलोचनः।'}

{'en': 'The Sun and the Moon then became the wheels of the car of that god of gods, that wielder of the Pinaka bow. The three eyed Divinity then made Elapatra and Puspadanta the pins of his car.', 'sn': 'चक्रे कृत्वा तु चन्द्रार्को देवदेवः पिनाकधृक्॥ अणी कृत्वैलपत्रं च पुष्पदन्तं च त्र्यम्बकेः।'}

{'en': 'The puissant Mahadeva then made the Malaya mountains the yoke and the great Takshaka the chord for fastening the yoke to the poles and the other creatures about him the bounds of his steeds.', 'sn': 'यूपं कृत्वा तु मलयमवनाहं च तक्षकम्॥ योक्त्राङ्गानि च सत्त्वानि कृत्वा'}

{'en': 'The mighty god then made the four Vedas the four steeds of his chariot; the lord of the three worlds made the auxiliaries of the Vedas the bridle-bits of his steeds.', 'sn': 'वेदान् कृत्वाऽथ चतुरश्चतुरश्वान् महेश्वरः॥ उपवेदान् खलीनांश्च कृत्वा लोकत्रयेश्वरः।'}

{'en': 'Mahadeva then made Gayatri and Savitri the reins, the mystic monosyllable in the whip and Brahmana the driver.', 'sn': 'गायत्री प्रग्रहं कृत्वा सावित्री च महेश्वरः॥ कृत्वोङ्कारं प्रतोदं च ब्रह्माणं चैव सारथिम्।'}

{'en': 'Then making the Mandar mountains the bow, Vasuki its string, Vishnu its excellent arrows, Fire the arrow-head.', 'sn': 'गाण्डीवं मन्दरं कृत्वा गुणं कृत्वा तु वासुकिम्॥ विष्णुं शरोत्तमं कृत्वा शल्यमग्निं तथैव च।'}

{'en': 'And Vayu the two wings of that arrows, Yama the feathers in its tail lightning the whetstone and Meru his standard.', 'sn': 'शर्वः प्रतापवान्। वायुकृत्वाथ वाजाभ्यां पुढे वैवस्वतं यमम्॥ विद्युत् कृत्वाथ निश्राणं मेलं कृत्वाथ वै ध्वजम्।'}

{'en': 'The god Siva, riding on that wonderful car composed of all the excellent celestial forces proceeded for the destruction of the tripple city. Indeed Sthanu, that foremost of Smiters, that destroyer of Asuras, that most beautifullooking warrior of infinite energy, adored by the gods and Rishis, possessed of the wealth of asceticism, O Partha.', 'sn': 'आरुह्य स रथं दिव्यं सर्वदेवमयं शिवः॥ त्रिपुरस्य वधार्थाय स्थाणुः प्रहरतां वरः। असुराणामन्तकरः श्रीमानतुलविक्रमः॥ स्तूयमानः सुरैः पार्थ ऋषिभिश्च तपोधनैः।'}

{'en': 'Created an excellent and unequaled array called after his own name and then stood firm for a thousand years.', 'sn': 'स्थानं माहेश्वरं कृत्वा दिव्यमप्रतिमं प्रभुः॥ अतिष्ठत् स्थाणुभूतः स सहस्रं परिवत्सरान्।'}

{'en': 'Then when the three cities came together on the firmameni, he pierced them with that shaft of his having three knots.', 'sn': 'यदा त्रीणि समेतानि अन्तरिक्षे पुराणि च॥ त्रिपर्वणा त्रिशल्येन तदा तानि बिभेद सः।'}

{'en': 'The denizens of those cities, the Danavas, then could not look at that arrow composed of the Fire of Dissolution and of Vishnu and Soma.', 'sn': 'पुराणि न च तं शेकुर्दानवाः प्रतिवीक्षितुम्॥ शरं कालाग्निसंयुक्तं विष्णुसोमसमायुतम्।'}

{'en': 'When the tripple city began to burn, the goddess Durga went to see the sight, with a child on her lap having only five clumps of hair on its head.', 'sn': 'पुराणि दग्धवन्तं तं देवी याता प्रवीक्षितुम्॥ बालमङ्कगतं कृत्वा स्वयं पञ्चशिखं पुनः।'}

{'en': 'Uma then asked the gods who that child was. The malevolent Indra then tried to strike him with the thunder bolt.', 'sn': 'उमा जिज्ञासमाना वै कोऽयमित्यब्रवीत् सुरान्॥ असूयतश्च शक्रस्य वज्रेण प्रहरिष्यतः।'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the all-powerful Lord of all the worlds, possessed of the six excellent qualities the Bhagas, smilingly paralysed the arm of the enraged Indra wielding the thunder bolt.', 'sn': 'बाहुं सवजं तं तस्य क्रुद्धस्यास्तमभयत् प्रभुः॥ प्रहस्य भगवांस्तूर्णं सर्वलोकेश्वरो विभुः।'}

{'en': 'Then with his arm paralysed Shakra, surrounded by the celestials, quickly proceeded to the undeteriorating Brahma.', 'sn': 'तत: स स्तम्भितभुजः शक्रो देवगणैर्वृतः॥ जगाम ससुरस्तूर्णं ब्रह्माणं प्रभुमव्ययम्।'}

{'en': 'Then the gods bowing their heads down to Brahma addressed him, with folded arms, thus-"O Brahma, what wonderful creature is now lying on the lap of Parvati?', 'sn': 'ते तं प्रणम्य शिरसा प्रोचुः प्राञ्जलयस्तदा॥ किमप्यङ्कगतं ब्रह्मन् पार्वत्या भूतमद्भुतम्।'}

{'en': 'As he appeared to be a mere boy we did not offer salutations to him. But we have been defeated totally by him. It is therefore that we want to ask you about him.', 'sn': 'बालरूपधरं दृष्ट्वा नास्माभिरभिलक्षितः॥ तस्मात् त्वां प्रष्टुमिच्छामो निर्जिता येन वै वयम्।'}

{'en': 'With Purandra to head us, we were easily defeated by that boy though he did not at all fight with us." Hearing those words of theirs, that foremost of all conversant with Brahma\'s viz., Brahma.', 'sn': 'अयुध्यता हि बालेन लीलया सपुरंदराः॥ तेषां तद् वचनं श्रुत्वा ब्रह्मा ब्रह्मविदां वरः।'}

{'en': 'Reflected for a while and then decided that boy of infinite prowess to be a manifestation of Shambhu himself, that possessor of the six illustrious qualities, the Bhagas. The almighty Brahman addressing Shakra and other foremost', 'sn': 'ध्यात्वा स शम्भुं भगवान् बालं चामिततेजसम्॥ उवाच भगवान् ब्रह्मा शादींश्च सुरोत्तमान्।'}

{'en': 'He is the almighty lord Hara, the Masterruler of the mobile and immobile creation. There is nothing superior to that foremost of gods known by the name of Maheshvara.', 'sn': 'चराचरस्य जगतः प्रभुः स भगवान् हरः॥ तस्मात् परतरं नान्यत् किंचिदस्ति महेश्वरात्।'}

{'en': 'That boy of immeasurable effulgence whom you have seen with the goddess, is Siva himself, assuming the boy-like appearance for gratifying Parvati.', 'sn': 'यो दृष्टो ह्युमया सार्धं युष्माभिरमितद्युतिः॥ स पार्वत्याः कृते शर्वः कृतवान् बालरूपताम्।'}

{'en': 'Let therefore yourselves with me seek his refuge, that god who is the ruler of all the worlds and the possessor of the six illustrious qualities, the Bhagas.', 'sn': 'ते मया सहिता यूयं प्रापयध्वं तमेव हि॥ स एष भगवान् देवः सर्वलोकेश्वरः प्रभुः।'}

{'en': 'O gods, you could not recognise that lord of the worlds. Thereafter the celestials with the Prajapati approached that boy of the radiance of the rising Sun. Then Brahma behclding the mighty lord and the grandsire knowing him to be the paramount master, began to adore him', 'sn': 'न सम्बुबुधिरे चैनं देवास्तं भुवनेश्वरम्॥ सप्रजापतयः सर्वे बालार्कसदृशप्रभम्। अथाभ्येत्य ततो ब्रह्मा दृष्ट्वा स च महेश्वरम्॥ अयं श्रेष्ठ इति ज्ञात्वा ववन्दे तं पितामहः।'}

{'en': 'Brahma said You are the sacrifice, you are the refuge of this world and you are its sole stay. You are Bhava, you are Mahadeva, you are the abode of all things and you are the most supreme of all things.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मोवाच त्वं यज्ञो भुवनस्यास्य त्वं गतिस्त्वं परायणम्॥ त्वं भवस्त्वं महादेवस्त्वं धाम परमं पदम्।'}

{'en': 'Yourself pervade the whole universe with its mobile and immobile creatures. O lord of the past and the future, O lord of the Lokas, O master of the universe, be propitious on Shakra afflicted as he is with your wrath.', 'sn': 'त्वया सर्वमिदं व्याप्तं जगत् स्थावरजङ्गमम्॥ भगवन् भूतभव्येश लोकनाथ जगत्पते। प्रसादं कुरु शक्रस्य त्वया क्रोधार्दितस्य वै॥'}

{'en': 'Vyasa said Hearing the words of the lotus-sprung Divinity, Maheswara then became propitiated and desirous of showering his grace, he then laughed aloud.', 'sn': 'व्यास उवाच पद्मयोनिवचः श्रुत्वा ततः प्रीतो महेश्वरः। प्रसादाभिमुखो भूत्वा अट्टहासमथाकरोत्॥'}

{'en': 'Then the celestials gratified both Uma and Maheswara with eulogies. Then the arm of the wielder of the thunderbolt once more regained its natural state.', 'sn': 'ततः प्रसादयामासुरुमां रुद्रं च ते सुराः। अभवच पुनर्बाहुर्यथाप्रकृति वज्रिणः॥'}

{'en': 'Then that illustrious Divinity whose emblem is the bull and who had destroyed the sacrifice of Daksha, together with his batter half, became gracious on the gods.', 'sn': 'तेषां प्रसन्नो भगवान् सपत्नीको वृषध्वजः। देवानां त्रिदशश्रेष्ठो दक्षयज्ञविनाशनः॥'}

{'en': 'He is Rudra, he is Siva, he is Agni, he is all and the knower of all. He is Indra, he is Vayu, he is the twin Asvins and he is lightning.', 'sn': 'स वै रुद्रः स च शिवः सोऽग्निः सर्वश्च सर्ववित्। स चेन्द्रश्चैव वायुश्च सोऽश्विनौ च स विद्युतः॥'}

{'en': 'He is Bhava, he is Parjanya, he is Mahadeva and he is sinless. He is the Moon, he is Ishana, he is the Sun and he is Varuna.', 'sn': 'स भव: स च पर्जन्यो महादेवः सनातनः। स चन्द्रमाः स चेशानः स सूर्यो वरुणश्च सः॥'}

{'en': "He is Time, he is Destroyer, he is death, he is Yama and day and night; He is a month, a fortnight, as well as the seasons, the twilight's and the complete year.", 'sn': 'स. काल: सोऽन्तको मृत्युः स यमो राज्यहानि तु। मासार्धमासा ऋतवः संध्ये संवत्सरश्च सः॥'}

{'en': 'He is Dhata and Vidhata, the soul of the universe and the doer of all acts of the universe. Himself formless, he is thousand and he is hundreds of thousands.', 'sn': 'द्वे धाता च स विधाता च विश्वात्मा विश्वकर्मकृत्। सर्वासां देवतानां च धारयत्यवपुर्वपुः॥'}

{'en': 'He is eulogised by all the gods. He is one and many. He is hundred, he is thousand and he is hundreds of thousands.', 'sn': 'सर्वदेवैः स्तुतो देवः सैकधा बहुधा च सः। शतधा सहस्रधा चैव भूयः शतसहस्रधा॥'}

{'en': 'Brahmanas versed in the Vedas, say that he two forms, one is dreadful and the other peaceful-These two again are divided in numerous portions.', 'sn': 'तनू तस्य देवस्य वेदज्ञा ब्राह्मणा विदुः। घोरा चान्या शिवा चान्या ते तनू बहुधा पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'His terrible forms are Fire, Vishnu and Bhaskara (the Sun); and his peaceful forms are, water, the luminaries and the moon.', 'sn': 'घोरा तु या तनुस्तस्य सोऽग्निर्विष्णुः स भास्करः। सौम्या तु पुनरेवास्य आपो ज्योतींषि चन्द्रमाः॥'}

{'en': 'Whatever there is highly mysterious in the Vedas, their auxiliaries, in the Upanishads, in the Puranas and in Metaphysics, is identical with the god Maheshvara.', 'sn': 'वेदा साङ्गोपनिषदः पुराणाध्यात्मनिश्चयाः। यदत्र परमं गुह्यं स वै देवो महेश्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'Such is the Lord Mahadeva, that Divinity without birth and that possessor of the six illustrious qualities the Bhagas. It is beyond my power to enumerate all the qualities of that lord.', 'sn': 'ईदृशश्च महादेवो भूयांश्च भगवानजः। न हि सर्वे मया शक्या वक्तुं भगवतो गुणाः॥'}

{'en': 'Even, if, O son of Pandu, I were to recount them for a thousand years. On those who are under the malicious influence of evil stars, on those who are stained with every sin.', 'sn': 'अपि वर्षसहस्रेण सततं पाण्डुनन्दना सर्वैर्ग्रहैर्गृहीतान् वै सर्वपापसमन्वितान्॥'}

{'en': 'That great protector is pleased and grants them salvation, if indeed they seek refuge in him. He grants and takes away, life, health, prosperity, wealth and all other kinds of desirable objects. The prosperity seen in Indra and other gods is really his.', 'sn': 'स मोचयति सुप्रीतः शरण्यः शरणागतान्। आयुरारोग्यमैश्वर्यं वित्तं कामांश्च पुष्कलान्। ११२॥ स ददाति मनुष्येभ्यः स चैवाक्षिपते पुनः। सेन्द्रादिषु च देवेषु तस्य चैश्वर्यमुच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'He is present in both the evils and good that exercise influence over the human kind. He gets by a flat of his will whatever prosperity he desired. Therefore, is he called the Lord Paramount.', 'sn': 'स चैव व्यापृतो लोके मनुष्याणां शुभाशुभे। ऐश्वर्याच्चैव कामानामीश्वरश्च स उच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'He is called Maheshvara and he is the supreme lord superior creatures. In multifarious forms of many kinds, he pervades the universe.', 'sn': 'महेश्वरच महतां भूतानातीश्वरश्च सः। बहुभिर्बहुधा रूपैर्विश्वं व्याप्नोति वै जगत्॥'}

{'en': 'What is known as the mouth of that god is the ocean; and it is well-known that assuming the form of the sea-fire it drinks the libations in the shape of water.', 'sn': 'तस्य देवस्य यद् वक्त्रं समुद्रे तदधिष्ठितम्। वडवामुखेति विक्ष्यातं पिबत् तोयमयं हविः॥'}

{'en': 'This Divinity ever dwells in the places of cremation. Men worship this god there where only the braves can go.', 'sn': 'एष चैव श्मशानेषु देवो वसति नित्यशः। यजन्त्येनं जनास्तत्र वीरस्थान इतीश्वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'The effulgent forms of this lord are many and marvellous; those forms are worshipped in the worlds and are praised and spoken of by men.', 'sn': 'अस्य दीप्तानि रूपाणि घोराणि च बहूनि च। लोके यान्यस्य पूज्यन्ते मनुष्याः प्रवदन्ति च॥'}

{'en': 'Many also are the names of truthful import of the this Divinity. Known in the worlds. Those. names are all founded upon his supremacy, omnipotence and his acts.', 'sn': 'नामधेयानि लोकेषु बहून्यस्य यथार्थवत्। निरुच्यन्ते महत्त्वाच विभुत्वात् कर्मणस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'In the Vedas, the excellent hymn called Shatarudriya has been sung in his praise, he who is the great Lord called the infinite Rudra.', 'sn': 'वेदे चास्य समाम्नातं शतरुद्रियमुत्तमम्। नाम्ना चानन्तरुद्रेति ह्युपस्थानं महात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'That divinity is the Lord of all wishes both human and heavenly. He is the Lord Paramount and the supreme ruler and pervades this extensive universe.', 'sn': 'स कामानां प्रभुर्देवो ये दिव्या ये च मानुषाः। स विभुः स प्रभुर्देवो विश्वं व्याप्नोति वै महत्॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmanas and the sages call him the most ancient of beings. He is the first-born of all the gods and fire came out from his mouth.', 'sn': 'ज्येष्ठं भूतं वदन्त्येनं ब्राह्मणा मुनयस्तथा। प्रथमो ह्येष देवानां मुखादस्यानलोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'As he always and by every means protects the creature of the universe and always find pleasure in their company and as he is the lord of them all, he is truly called Pasupati.', 'sn': 'सर्वथा यत् पशून् पाति तैश्च यद् रमते पुनः। तेषामधिपतिर्यच तस्मात् पशुपतिः स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'As his Phallic form is ever present in the observance of the Brahmacharya vow and as it adds to the glory of the world, he is called Maheshvara.', 'sn': 'दिव्यं च ब्रह्मचर्येण लिङ्गमस्य यथा स्थितम्। महयत्येष लोकांश्च महेश्वर इति स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'The Rishis, the celestials, the Gandharvas and the Apsaras, worship the Phallic emblem of this god, that ever remains erect.', 'sn': 'ऋषयश्चैव देवाश्च गन्धर्वाप्सरसस्तथा। लिङ्गमस्यार्चयन्ति स्म तच्चाप्यूक्समास्थितम्॥'}

{'en': 'When his Phallic unblem is worshipped Maheshvara becomes glad and is pleased and delighted and transported with joy.', 'sn': 'पूज्यमाने ततस्तस्मिन् मोदते च महेश्वरः। सुखी प्रीतश्च भवति प्रहृष्टश्चैव शङ्करः॥'}

{'en': 'As in the past, the present and the future, the god has many forms, both mobile and immobile, he is truly called Vahurupa.', 'sn': 'यदस्य बहुधा रूपं भूतभव्यभवस्थितम्। स्थावरं जङ्गमं चैवं बहुरूपस्ततः स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'With one of his eyes blazing forth, he appears to have eyes on all sides of his body; and as in his wrath, he possesses the worlds, he is called Sarva.', 'sn': 'एकाक्षो जाज्वलनास्ते सर्वतोऽक्षिमयोऽपि वा। क्रोधाद् यश्चाविशल्लोकांस्तस्मात् सर्व इति स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'As his form is like that of smoke he is called Dhurjati; and as the Devas in the world are present in him he is called Vishvarupa.', 'sn': 'धूम्ररूपं च यत् तस्य धूर्जटिस्तेन चोच्यते। विश्वेदेवाश्च यत् तस्मिन् विश्वरूपस्ततः स्मृतः॥१२९'}

{'en': 'As three goddesses viz., the sky, the firmament and the water, ever worship that lord of the worlds, therefore he is truly calied Tryambaka.', 'sn': 'तिस्रो देवीर्यदा चैव भजते भुवनेश्वरः। द्यामपः पृथिवीं चैव त्र्यम्बकश्च ततः स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'As he ever helps in the accomplishment of all acts and increased the wealth of men and is engaged in doing good to them, therefore he is called Siva.', 'sn': 'समेधयति यन्नित्यं सर्वार्थान् सर्वकर्मसु। शिवमिच्छन् मनुष्याणां तस्मादेष शिवः स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'Possessed of thousand or ten thousand eyes or eyes on all sides of his body, as he ever protects the universe, he is called Mahadeva.', 'sn': 'सहस्राक्षोऽयुताक्षो वा सर्वतोऽक्षिमयोऽपि वा। यच विश्वं महत् पाति महादेवस्ततः स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'As he is Great and Ancient and is the fountain of life and the cause of its continuance and as his Phallic from is eternal, he is called Sthanu.', 'sn': 'महत् पूर्वं स्थितो यच प्राणोत्पत्तिस्थितश्च यत्। स्थितलिङ्गश्च यन्नित्यं तस्मात् स्थाणुरिति स्मृतः॥१३३'}

{'en': 'They rays of light that proceeding from the Sun and Moon, are seen in the worlds, are said to be the hair of his head and therefore is he called Vyomakesa.', 'sn': 'सूर्याचन्द्रमसोलोके प्रकाशन्ते रुचश्च याः। ताः केशसंज्ञितास्त्र्यक्षे व्योमकेशस्ततः स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'Since he is the Past, the Future and the Present and in fact, everything in the universe and since he is the origin of the past, the future and the present, he is for that reason called Bhava.', 'sn': 'भूतं भव्यं भविष्यं च सर्वं जगदशेषतः। भव एव ततो यस्माद् भूतभव्यभवोद्भवः॥'}

{'en': 'The word Kapi is said to mean supreme and Vrisha to mean righteousness; therefore that god of gods, the possessor of the illustrious qualities the Bhagas, is called Vrisha Kapi.', 'sn': 'कपिः श्रेष्ठ इति प्रोक्तो धर्मश्च वृष उच्यते। स देवदेवो भगवान् कीर्त्यतेऽतो वृषाकपिः॥'}

{'en': 'As he destroys Brahma, Indra, Varuna, Kubera and Yama, after having afflicted them greatly, therefore he is called Hara.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्माणमिन्द्रं वरुणं यमं धनदमेव च। निगृह्य हरते यस्मात् तस्माद्धर इति स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'Shutting his two, eyes, that Potent Lord created a third on his forehead by sheer force; and therefore is he called the Three-eyed.', 'sn': 'निमीलिताभ्यां नेत्राभ्यां बलाद् देवो महेश्वरः। ललाटे नेत्रमसृजत् तेन त्र्यक्षः स उच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Whatever of soundness or unsoundness there is in the bodies of men, is said to be his manifestation. He is the Pana and Apana breaths in embodied creatures.', 'sn': 'विषमस्थः शरीरेषु समश्च प्राणिनामिह। स वायुर्विषमस्थेषु प्राणोऽपानः शरीरिषु॥'}

{'en': 'He that ever worships the Phallic emblem of that illustrious god, attains great prosperity even by such worship of his.', 'sn': 'पूजयेद् विग्रहं यस्तु लिङ्गं चापि महात्मनः। लिङ्गं पूजयिता नित्यं महतीं श्रियमश्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'Below his two thighs the forms are fiery, the other half of his soul is fire and half the moon.', 'sn': 'ऊरुभ्यामर्धमाग्नेयं सोमार्धं च शिवा तनुः। . आत्मनोऽर्धं तथा चाग्निः सोमोऽर्धं पुनरुच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'His auspicious form surcharged with energy is more blazing than all the forms of the other gods. Amongst men his blazing and dreadful form is called Fire.', 'sn': 'तैजसी महती दीप्ता देवेभ्योऽस्य शिवा तनुः। भास्वती मानुषेष्वस्य तनु?राग्निरुच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'With his auspicious form he practices the vow Brahmacharya, whereas with the dreadful form he has, he devours everything.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मचर्यं चरत्येष शिवा यास्य तनुस्तया। यास्य घोरतरा मूर्तिः सर्वानत्ति तयेश्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'As he burns, as he is keen and fierce and endued with the great prowess and as he devours flesh, blood and marrow, he is called Rudra.', 'sn': 'यनिर्दहति यत् तीक्ष्णो यदुग्रो यत् प्रतापवान्। मांसशोणितमज्जादो यत् ततो रुद्र उच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'It is this god of gods, the paramount lord, the wielder of the Pinaka bow, O Partha, whom you have seen go before you slaying your enemies.', 'sn': 'एष देवो महादेवो योऽसौ पार्थ तवाग्रतः। संग्रामे शात्रवान् निघ्नंस्त्वया हृष्टः पिनाकधुक्॥'}

{'en': 'After you had vowed to slay the ruler of the Sindhus, O sinless one, Krishna showed your this god, in your deam, seated on the top of that best of mountains.', 'sn': 'सिन्धुराजवधार्थाय प्रतिज्ञाते त्वयानघ। कृष्णेन दर्शितः स्वप्ने यस्तु शैलेन्द्रमूर्धनि॥'}

{'en': 'He is that illustrious god, who comes first in the battle field, who provided all weapons by which the Danavas were slain by you.', 'sn': 'एष वै भगवान् देवः संग्रामे याति तेऽग्रतः। येन दत्तानि तेऽस्त्राणि यैस्त्वया दानवा हताः॥'}

{'en': 'O Partha, thus the hymn approved of Vedas and called Sata-rudriya in honour of that god of gods has been explained to thee which is excellent glorious, life-enhancing and sacred.', 'sn': 'धन्यं यशस्यमायुष्यं पुण्यं वेदैश्च सम्मितम्। देवदेवस्य ते पार्थ व्याख्यातं शतरुद्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'The hymn of four divisions capable of accomplishing all desired object, destructive of all sins, sacred and able to drive away all stains and to undo all sorrow and all fears. He who listen to this hymn always is succeeds in defeating all his enemies and is highly respected in the region of Rudra.', 'sn': 'सर्वार्थसाधनं पुण्यं सर्वकिल्बिषनाशनम्। सर्वपापप्रशमनं सर्वदुःखभयापहम्॥ चतुर्विधमिदं स्तोत्रं यः शृणोति नरः सदा। विजित्य शत्रून् सर्वान् स रुद्रलोके महीयते॥'}

{'en': 'A man who always attentively reads or heard the recitation of this account (Satarudriya) belonging to war of this great deity and who worships devotionally that illustrious lord of universe (Vishveshvara) obtaineth all excellency objects of desire, in consequence of the three-eyed God being gratified with him.', 'sn': 'चरितं महात्मनो नित्यं सांग्रामिकमिदं स्मृतम्। पठन् वै शतरुद्रीयं शृण्वंश्च सततोत्थितः॥ भक्तो विश्वेश्वरं देव मानुषेषु च यः सदा। वरान् कामान् स लभते प्रसन्ने त्र्यम्बके नरः॥'}

{'en': 'O son of Kunti, Go and fight, defeat is not for thee that hast Janardana on your side for thy adviser and protector.', 'sn': 'गच्छ युद्ध्यस्व कौन्तेय न तवास्ति पराजयः। यस्य मन्त्री च गोप्ता च पार्श्वस्थो हि जनार्दनः।।१५३'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said 0 best of Bharata! 0 chastiser of foes! Having addressed Arjuna in these words, the son of Parasara (Vyasa) went away to the place he had come from.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच एवमुक्त्वार्जुनं संख्ये पराशरसुतस्तदा। जगाम भरतश्रेष्ठ यथागतमरिन्दम॥'}

{'en': 'O king, having warred savagely for five days, the Brahmana (Drona) endued with great strength, fell and repaired to the region of Brahma.', 'sn': 'युद्धं कृत्वा महद् घोरं पञ्चाहानि महाबलः। ब्राह्मणो निहतो राजन् ब्रह्मलोकमवाप्तवान्॥'}

{'en': 'The fruits that arise from a study of the Vedas, arise from the reading of this Parvan also. The great achievements of brave Kshatriyas have bee described here.', 'sn': 'स्वधीते यत् फलं वेदे तदस्मिन्नपि पर्वणि। क्षत्रियाणामभीरूणां युक्तमत्र महद् यशः॥'}

{'en': 'He, who reads or hears the recitation of this Parvan everyday is released from a great sins and the most wicked acts of his life.', 'sn': 'य इदं पठते पर्व शृणुयाद् वापि नित्यशः। स मुच्यते महापापैः कृतैोरैश्च कर्मभिः॥'}

{'en': 'By reading it a Brahmana reaps the fruits of sacrifice, a Kshatriya obtains victory in fierce battle. The other orders (Vaishyas and Sudras) attain desirable sons and grandsons and all wishful objects. O king, having warred savagely for five days, the Brahmana (Drona) endued with great strength, fell and repaired to the region of Brahma.', 'sn': 'यज्ञावाप्तिाह्मणस्येह नित्यं घोरे युद्धे क्षत्रियाणां यश्चा शेषौ वर्णी काममिष्टं लभेते पुत्रान् पौत्रान् नित्यमिष्टांस्तथैव॥'}

{'en': 'The fruits that arise from a study of the Vedas, arise from the reading of this Parvan also. The great achievements of brave Kshatriyas have bee described here.', 'sn': 'स्वधीते यत् फलं वेदे तदस्मिन्नपि पर्वणि। क्षत्रियाणामभीरूणां युक्तमत्र महद् यशः॥'}

{'en': 'He, who reads or hears the recitation of this Parvan everyday is released from a great sins and the most wicked acts of his life.', 'sn': 'य इदं पठते पर्व शृणुयाद् वापि नित्यशः। स मुच्यते महापापैः कृतैोरैश्च कर्मभिः॥'}

{'en': 'By reading it a Brahmana reaps the fruits of sacrifice, a Kshatriya obtains victory in fierce battle. The other orders (Vaishyas and Sudras) attain desirable sons and grandsons and all wishful objects.', 'sn': 'यज्ञावाप्तिाह्मणस्येह नित्यं घोरे युद्धे क्षत्रियाणां यश्चा शेषौ वर्णी काममिष्टं लभेते पुत्रान् पौत्रान् नित्यमिष्टांस्तथैव॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said O Yudhishthira, are you in peace and happiness, with all your brothers and the dwellers of the city and the provinces?', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच युधिष्ठिर महाबाहो कच्चित् त्वं कुशली ह्यसि। सहितो भ्रातृभिः सर्वैः पौरजानपदैस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'Are they who depend on you also happy? Are your ministers, and servitors, and all your seniors and preceptors also, happy?', 'sn': 'ये च त्वामनुजीवन्ति कच्चित् तेऽपि निरामयाः। सचिवा भृत्यवर्गाश्च गुरवश्चैव ते नृप॥'}

{'en': 'Are those also who live in your kingdom frce from fear? Do you follow the old and traditional conduct of kings?', 'sn': 'कच्चित् तेऽपि निरातङ्का वसन्ति विषये तव। कच्चिद् वर्तसि पौराणी वृत्तिं राजर्षिसेविताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Is your treasury filled without disregarding the restraints imposed by justice and equity? Do you behave as you should towards foes, neutrals, and allies?', 'sn': 'कच्चिन्यायाननुच्छिद्य कोशस्तेऽभिप्रपूर्यते। अरिमध्यस्थमित्रेषु वर्तसे चानुरूपतः॥'}

{'en': "Do you duly look after the Brahmanas, always making them the first gifts? What need I say of the citizens, and your servants, and kinsmen, are your foes, O chief of Bharata's race pleased with your conduct? Do you, O king of kings, adore with devotion the Pitris and the deities?", 'sn': 'ब्राह्मणानग्रहारैर्वा यथावदनुपश्यसि। कच्चित् ते परितुष्यन्ति शीलेन भरतर्षभ।॥ शत्रवोऽपि कुतः पौरा भृत्या वा स्वजनोऽपि वा। कच्चिद् यजसि राजेन्द्र श्रद्धावान् पितृदेवताः॥'}

{'en': 'Do you adore guests with food and drink, O Bharata? Do the Brahmanas in your kingdom perforin the duties of their order, walk along the path of virtue?', 'sn': 'अतिथीनन्नपानेन कच्चिदर्चसि भारत। कच्चिन्नयपथे विप्राः स्वकर्मनिरतास्तव।॥'}

{'en': 'Do the Kshatriyas and Vaishyas and Shudras also within your kingdom and all your relatives, perform their respective duties? I hope the women, the children, and the old, among your subjects, do not grieve (under distress) and not beg (the necessaries of life).', 'sn': 'क्षत्रिया वैश्यवर्गा वा शूद्रा वापि कुटुम्बिनः। कच्चित् स्त्रीबालवृद्धं ते न शोचति न याचते॥ जामयः पूजिताः कच्चित् तव गेहे नरर्षभ।'}

{'en': 'Are the ladies of your households duly honoured in your house, O best of men? I hope, O king. that this race of royal sages, having to you for their king, have not fallen away from fame and glory?', 'sn': 'कच्चिद् राजर्षिवंशोऽयं त्वामासाद्य महीपतिम्॥ यथोचितं महाराज यशसा नावसीदति। इत्येवंवादिनं तं स न्यायवित् प्रत्यभाषत॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said To the old king who said so, Yudhishthira, knowing morality and justice and well-skilled in acts and speech, spoke as follows, putting some questions about his well-being.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच कुशलप्रश्नसंयुक्तं कुशलो वाक्यकर्मणि। कच्चित् ते वर्धते राजस्तपो दमशमौ च ते॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said Does your peace, O king, your self-control, your tranquility of heart, grow? Is this my mother able to serve you without fatigue and trouble.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच अपि मे जननी चेयं शुश्रूषुर्विगतक्लमा। अथास्याः सफलो राजन् वनवासो भविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Will, O king, her residence in the forest yield fruit? I hope this queen, who is my eldest mother, who is emaciated with (exposure to cold and wind and the toil of walking, and who is now given to the practice of serve austerities, no longer yields to grief for her children of great energy, of all whoin performing the duties of the Kshatriyas, have been killed on the field of battle.', 'sn': 'इयं च माता ज्येष्ठा मे शीतवातावकर्शिता। घोरेण तपसा युक्ता देवी कच्चिन्न शोचति॥ हतान् पुत्रान् महावीर्यान् क्षत्रधर्मपरायणान्। नापध्यापति वा कच्चिदस्मान् पापकृतः सदा॥'}

{'en': 'Does she accuse us. sinful wretches, who are responsible for their destruction? Where is Vidura, O king? We do not see him here. I hope this Sanjaya, performing penances, is in peace and happiness.', 'sn': 'क्व चासौ विदुरो राजन् नेमं पश्यामहे वयम्। सञ्जयः कुशली चायं कच्चिन्नु तपसि स्थिरः॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed, Dhritarashtra, answered king Yudhishthira, saying, O son, Vidura is well. He is practising austere penances living on air alone, for he abstains from all other food. He is emaciated and his arteries and nerves have become visible. Sometimes he is seen in this empty forest by Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच इत्युक्तः प्रत्युवाचेदं धृतराष्ट्रो जनाधिपम्। कुशली विदुरः पुत्र तपो घोरं समाश्रितः॥ वायुभक्षो निराहारः कृशो धमनिसन्ततः। कदाचिद् दृश्यते विप्रैः शून्येऽस्मिन् कानने क्वचित्॥'}

{'en': "While Dhritarashtra was saying this. Vidura was seen at a distance. He had matted locks on his head, and gravel's in his mouth, and was greatly emaciated. He was perfectly naked. his body was besmeared all over with fifth, and with the dust of various wild flowers,", 'sn': 'इत्येवं ब्रुवतस्तस्य जटी वीटामुखः कृशः। दिग्वासा मलदिग्धाङ्गो वनरेणुसमुक्षितः॥'}

{'en': 'When Kshatta, was seen from a distance, the fact was communicated to Yudhishthira. Vidura suddenly stopped, O king, loO king towards the retreat.', 'sn': 'दूरादालक्षितः क्षत्ता तत्राख्यातो महीपतेः। निवर्तमानः सहसा राजन् दृष्ट्वाऽऽश्रमं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'King Yudhishthira pursued him alone, as he ran and entered the deep forest, sometimes seen and sometimes not seen by the pursuer.', 'sn': 'तमन्वधावन्नृपतिरेक एव युधिष्ठिरः। प्रविशन्तं वनं घोरं लक्ष्यालक्ष्यं क्वचित् क्वचित् ।।'}

{'en': "He said aloud, 'O Vidura, O Vidura, I am king Yudhishthira, your favourite-Exclaiming thus, Yudhishthira, with great exertion, followed Vidura.", 'sn': 'भो भो विदुर राजाहं दयितस्ते युधिष्ठिरः। इति ब्रुवन्नरपतिस्तं यत्नादभ्यधावत॥'}

{'en': 'Having reached a solitary spot in the forest that foremost of intelligent men, viz., Vidura, stood still, learning against a tree.', 'sn': 'ततो विविक्त एकान्ते तस्थौ बुद्धिमतां वरः। विदुरो वृक्षमाश्रित्य कच्चितत्र वनान्तरे॥'}

{'en': 'He was greatly emaciated. He retained only the shape of a human being. Yudhishthira of great intelligence recognised him, however.', 'sn': 'तं राजा क्षीणभूयिष्ठमाकृतीमात्रसूचितम्। अभिजज्ञे महाबुद्धिं महाबुद्धियुधिष्ठिरः॥'}

{'en': "Standing before him, Yudhishthira addressed him saying, 'I am Yudhishthira.' Indeed, adoring Vidura properly., Yudhishthira said these words in the hearing of Vidura.", 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिरोऽहमस्मीति वाक्यमुक्त्वाग्रतः स्थितः। विदुरस्य श्रवे राजा तं च प्रत्यभ्यपूजयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Meanwhile Vidura looked at the king steadfastly. Casting his look thus on the king, he stood motionless in Yoga.', 'sn': 'ततः सोऽनिमिषो भूत्वा राजानं तमुदैक्षत। संयोज्य विदुरस्तस्मिन् दृष्टिं दृष्ट्या समाहितः॥'}

{'en': "Endued with great intelligence, he then (by his Yoga-power) entered the body of Yudhishthira, limb by limb. He united his vital airs with those of the king, and his senses with the king's senses.", 'sn': 'विवेश विदुरो धीमान् गात्रैर्गात्राणि चैव ह। प्राणान् प्राणेषु च दधदिन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियेषु च॥'}

{'en': 'Indeed, with the help of Yoga-power, Vidura, burning with energy, thus entered the body of king Yudhishthira the just.', 'sn': 'स योगबलमास्थाय विवेश नृपतेस्तनुम्। विदुरो धर्मराजस्य तेजसा प्रज्वलन्निव॥'}

{'en': 'Meanwhile the body of Vidura continued to lean against the tree with eyes fixed. The king soon saw that life had fled out of it.', 'sn': 'विदुरस्य शरीरं तु तथैव स्तब्धलोचनम्। वृक्षाश्रितं तदा राजा ददर्श गतचेतनम्॥'}

{'en': "At the same time, he felt that he himself had become stronger than before and that he had gained many additional virtues and accomplishments. Gifted with great learning and energy, O monarch, Pandu's son, king Yudhishthira the just, then recollected his own state before his birth among men, Possessed of mighty energy, he had heard of Yoga practice from Vyasa.", 'sn': 'बलवन्तं तथाऽऽत्मानं मेने बहुगुणं तदा। धर्मराजो महातेजास्तच्च सस्मार पाण्डवः॥ पौराणामात्मनः सर्वं विद्यावान् स विशाम्पते। योगधर्मं महातेजा व्यासेन कथितं यथा॥'}

{'en': "King Yudhishthira the just, endued with great learning, became desirous of doing the last rites to the body of Vidura, and wished to cremate it duly. An invisible voice was then heard, saying, 'O king, this body which belonged to him called Vidura should not be cremated. In him is your body also. He is the eternal deity of Virtue.", 'sn': 'धर्मराजश्च तत्रैव संचस्कारयिषुस्तदा। दग्धुकामोऽभवद् विद्वानथ वागभ्यभाषत॥ भो भो राजन्न दग्धव्यमेतद् विदुरसंज्ञकम्। कलेवरमिहैवं ते धर्म एष सनातनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those happy regions which pass by the name of Santanika will be his, O Bharata. he performed the duties of Yatis. You should not, O scorcher of enemies, grieve for him at all.', 'sn': 'लोकाः सान्तानिका नाम भविष्यन्त्यस्य भारत। यतिधर्ममवाप्तोऽसौ नैष शोच्यः परंतप॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed, king Yudhishthira the just returned from the place, and represented everything to the royal son of Vichitravirya.', 'sn': 'इत्युक्तो धर्मराज: स विनिवृत्य ततः पुनः। राज्ञो वैचित्रवीर्यस्य तत् सर्वं प्रत्यवेदयत्॥'}
{'en': 'At this, that effulgent king, all those men, and Bhimasena and others, became filled with wonder.', 'sn': 'ततः स राजा द्युतिमान् स च सर्वो जनस्तदा। भीमसेनादयश्चैव परं विस्मयमागताः॥'}

{'en': "Hearing what had taken place, king Dhritarashtra became pleased and then, addressing the son of Dharma, said, 'Do you accept from me these gifts of water and roots and fruits! It has been said, O king, that one's guest should take what one takes himself.'", 'sn': 'तच्छ्रुत्वा प्रीतिमान् राजा भूत्वा धर्मजमब्रवीत्। आपो मूलं फलं चैव ममेदं प्रतिगृह्यताम्॥ यदर्थो हि नरो राजस्तदर्थोऽस्यातिथिः स्मृतः।'}
{'en': "Thus addressed, Dharma's son answered armed king ate the fruits and roots which he gave.", 'sn': 'इत्युक्तः स तथेत्येवं प्राह धर्मात्मजो नृपम्॥ फलं मूलं च बुभुजे राज्ञा दत्तं सहानुजः।'}

{'en': 'Then they all spread their beds under a tree and passed that night thus having eaten fruits and roots and drunk the water that the old monarch had given them.', 'sn': 'ततस्ते वृक्षमूलेषु कृतवासपरिग्रहाः। तां रात्रिमवसन् सर्वे फलमूलजलाशनाः॥'}

{'en': 'Narada said Being thus addressed by Suparna in excellent words conducive to his benefit and think calmly on these words and considering them again and again,', 'sn': 'नारद उवाच एवमुक्तः सुपर्णेन तथ्यं वचनमुत्तमम्। विमृश्यावहितो राजा निश्चित्य च पुनः पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'The performer of a thousand sacrifices and the lord who, in gifts, was the prince of givers, Yayati, the ruler of all the Kashis said these words,', 'sn': 'यष्टा क्रतुसहस्राणां दाता दानपतिः प्रभुः। ययातिः सर्वकाशीश इदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'With his eye on his dear friend Tarkshya, as also on the best among the twice-born, Galava, and considering the alms asked for by a devotee as described to him as a highly praiseworthy example,', 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वा प्रियसखं टायं गालवं च द्विजर्षभम्। निदर्शनं च तपसा भिक्षा श्लाघ्यां च कीर्तिताम्॥'}
{'en': 'And especial considering that they had come to him passing over the kings born in the solar race.', 'sn': 'अतीत्य च नृपानन्यानादित्यकुलसम्भवान्। मत्सकाशमनुप्राप्तावेतां बुद्धिमवेक्ष्य च॥'}

{'en': 'To-day is my birth blessed and my race absolved from sins; to-day is this country, over which I rule, freed from sins by you, O Tarkshya, who are sinless.', 'sn': 'अद्य मे सफलं जन्म तारितं चाद्य मे कुलम्। अद्यायं तारितो देशो मम तार्क्ष्य त्वयानघ।॥'}

{'en': 'O friend, I want to tell you however that I am not the same wealthy man that you knew me to be in days of old. O friend, my wealth has been diminished', 'sn': 'वक्तुमिच्छामि तु सखे यथा जानासि मां पुरा। न तथा वित्तवानस्मि क्षीणं वित्तं च मे सखे।॥'}

{'en': 'But at the same time I am unable to make your coming here useless, 0 wanderer of the heavens; nor do I dare frustrate the hopes entertained by the regenerate Rishi; I shall therefore give that which will accomplish this purposes of his.', 'sn': 'न च शक्तोऽस्मि ते कर्तुं मोघमागमनं खग। न चाशामस्य विप्रर्षेवितथीकर्तुमुत्सहे॥ तत् तु दास्यामि यत् कार्यमिदं सम्पादयिष्यति। अभिगम्य हताशो हि निवृत्तो दहते कुलम्॥'}

{'en': 'A man, who having come to another with a hope and returns with that hope frustrated, consumes the entire race; and O son of Vinata, it is said that nothing is more', 'sn': 'नातः परं वैनतेय किंचित् पापिष्ठमुच्यते। यथाशानाशनाल्लोके देहि नास्तीति वा वचः॥'}

{'en': 'Capable than the saying of a man, in this world "I have not got it" to a man who comes to him entertaining a hope in him. The man, who is unsuccessful in his suit and whose hopes are frustrated,', 'sn': 'हताशो ह्यकृतार्थः सन् हतः सम्भावितो नरः। हिनस्ति तस्य पुत्रांश्च पौत्रांश्चाकुर्वतो हितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Slays the sons and grandsons of the man who dose not do him good. Therefore this daughter of mine, who will be perpetuator of four races,', 'sn': 'तस्माच्चतुर्णां वंशानां स्थापयित्री सुता मम। इयं सुरसुतप्रख्या सर्वधर्मोपचायिनी॥'}

{'en': 'This one resembling the daughter of a god and the promoter of every virtue and who is ever solicited by the gods, human beings and Asuras, O Galava,', 'sn': 'प्रदास्यन्ति नृपा सदा देवमनुष्याणामसुराणां च गालव। कादिक्षता रूपतो बाला सुता मे प्रतिगृह्यताम्॥'}
{'en': 'For her beauty do you accept. Rulers of men will surely you even their kingdom as her dowry,', 'sn': 'अस्याः शुल्कं राज्यमपि ध्रुवम्। किं पुनः श्यामकर्णानां हयानां द्वे चतुः शते॥'}

{'en': 'Not to speak of twice four hundred horses each with a black ear; therefore do you accept this daughter of mine, Madhvi.', 'sn': 'स भवान् प्रतिगृह्णातु ममैतां माधवीं सुताम्। अहं दौहित्रवान् स्यां वै वर एष मम प्रभो॥'}

{'en': 'The only boon that I ask for, O lord, is that I may have a grandson by her.” Having taken that girl with them Galava with the bird,', 'sn': 'प्रतिगृह्य च तां कन्यां गालवः सह पक्षिणा। पुनर्द्रक्ष्याव इत्युक्त्वा प्रतस्थे सह कन्यया॥'}

{'en': 'And saying "we see you again” went away. Saying: “The means for obtaining the horses has now been gained," the one born of an egg too', 'sn': 'उपलब्धमिदं द्वारमश्वानामिति चाण्डजः। उक्त्वा गालवमापृच्छ्य जगाम भवनं स्वकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Went away, after for the permission of Galava, to his own place. And the king of birds having gone away Galava along with that maiden,', 'sn': 'गते पतगराजे तु गालवः सह कन्यया। चिन्तयानः क्षमं दाने राज्ञां वै शुल्कतोऽगमत्॥'}

{'en': 'Began to think about the king who could offer suitable dowry for her and in his mind decided to go to that best among the kingsHaryashva, of the race of Ikshvaku.', 'sn': 'सोऽगच्छन्मनसेक्ष्वाकुं हर्यश्वं राजसत्तमम्। अयोध्यायां महावीर्यं चतुरङ्गबलान्वितम्॥'}

{'en': 'He ruled over Ayodhya, was endued with great over Ayodhya, was endued with great prowess and had an army with four divisions and had also in his possession enough of treasures and coins, who was dear to his subject and to whom the twice born were also dear,', 'sn': 'कोशधान्यबलोपेतं प्रियपौरं द्विजप्रियम्। प्रजाभिकामं शाम्यन्तं कुर्वाणं तप उत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'Who desirous of the peace of his subjects was practicing excellent austerities. The regenerate Rishi Galava, Having approached him, Haryashva, said to him:', 'sn': 'तमुवागम्य विप्रः स हर्यश्वं गालवोऽब्रवीत्। कन्येयं मम राजेन्द्र प्रसवैः कुलवर्धिनी॥'}

{'en': '"This girl in my possession, O chief among kings, increases a race by bringing forth children, O Haryashva; accept her by offering a dowry. I shall describe to you what dowry, to offer and hearing that you decide it."', 'sn': 'इयं शुल्केन भार्यार्थं हर्यश्व प्रतिगृह्यताम्। शुल्कं ते कीर्तयिष्यामि तच्छ्रुत्वा सम्प्रधार्यताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said : There is no limit to misfortunes and neither their effects nor their causes can be ascertained. It is Dharma who distributes the fruits of both virtue and sin.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच नापदामस्ति मर्यादा न निमित्तं न कारणम्। धर्मस्तु विभजत्यर्थमुभयोः पुण्यपापयोः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhima said: We have met with this disaster, because I did not slay Pratikami when he dragge Krishna into the assembly hall like a slave.', 'sn': 'भीम उवाच प्रातिकाम्यनयत् कृष्णां सभायां प्रेष्यवत् तदा। न मया निहतस्तत्र तेन प्राप्ताः स्म संशयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Arjuna said: As I did not present those very sharp and biting words, piercing the very bones, uttered by the son of Suta, so we have met with this calamity.', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच वाचस्तीक्ष्णास्थिभेदिन्यः सूतपुत्रेण भाषिताः। अतितीव्रा मया क्षान्तास्तेन प्राप्ताः स्म संशयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sahadeva said : This calamity, O Bharata, has overtaken us because I did not kill Shakuni when he defeated you at the game of dice.', 'sn': 'सहदेव उवाच शकुनिस्त्वां यदाजैषीदक्षद्यूतेन भारत। स मया न हतस्तत्र तेन प्राप्ताः स्म संशयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Then, king Yudhishthira said to Nakula "O son of Madri, climbing this tree look around the ten points.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा नकुलं वाक्यमब्रवीत्। आरुह्य वृक्षं माद्रेय निरीक्षस्व दिशो दश॥'}

{'en': 'O affectionate one, as these your brothers are fatigued and thirsty, so see whether any water or trees growing by water-side, are near.”', 'sn': 'पानीयमन्तिके पश्य वृक्षांश्चाप्युदकाश्रितान्। एते हि भ्रातरः श्रान्तास्तव तात पिपासिताः॥'}

{'en': 'Nakula too saying “be it so" soon ascended a tree. And casting his looks around said to his eldest brother thus,', 'sn': 'नकुलस्तु तथेत्युक्त्वा शीघ्रमारुह्य पादपम्। अब्रवीद् भ्रातरं ज्येष्ठमभिवीक्ष्य समन्ततः॥'}

{'en': '"O king, I see numerous trees growing near water and also hear the cries of the Sarasas. Therefore, surely water must be somewhere here."', 'sn': 'पश्यामि बहुलान् राजन् वृक्षानुदकसंश्रयान्। सारसानां च निदिमत्रोदकमसंशयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, firm in truth, said "O beautiful one, do go (there) and soon bring water in the quivers."', 'sn': 'ततोऽब्रवीत् सत्यधृतिः कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः। गच्छ सौम्य ततः शीघ्रं तूणैः पानीयमानय॥'}

{'en': 'Saying “be it so" Nakula, at the command of his eldest brother, quickly, proceeded towards the spot where the water was and soon reached it.', 'sn': 'नकुलस्तु तथेत्युक्त्वा भ्रातुर्येष्ठस्य शासनात्। प्राद्रवद् यत्र पानीयं शीघ्रं चैवान्वपद्यत॥'}

{'en': 'And seeing the transparent water surrounded by cranes, as he was desirous of drinking of it, he heard these words from the firmament.', 'sn': 'स दृष्ट्वा विमलं तोयं सारसैः परिवारितम्। पातुकामस्ततो वाचमन्तरिक्षात् स शुश्रुवे॥'}

{'en': 'The Yaksha said: O child, do not venture to do this. I have got possession of it before. O son of Madri, first answer my questions and then drink of it and carry it away.', 'sn': 'यक्ष उवाच मा तात साहसं कार्मिम पूर्वपरिग्रहः। प्रश्नानुक्त्वा तु माद्रेय ततः पिब हरस्व च॥'}

{'en': 'Nakula, (however), who was very thirsty, disregarding these words, drank the cool water. But as (soon) as he drank it he fell dead.', 'sn': 'अनादृत्य तु तद् वाक्यं नकुलः सुपिपासितः। अपिबच्छीतलं तोयं पीत्वा च निपपात ह॥'}

{'en': "Seeing Nakula's delay, Yudhishthira the son of Kunti, said to his heroic brother Sahadeva, the tormentor of his foes,", 'sn': 'चिरायमाणे नकुले कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः। अब्रवीद् भ्रातरं वीरं सहदेवमरिंदमम्॥'}

{'en': '“O Sahadeva, our brother (Nakula) who was born (just) before you, has been long out. Go and bring him and also water.', 'sn': 'भ्राता हि चिरयातो नः सहदेव तवाचजः। तथैवानय सोदर्यं पानीयं च त्वमानय॥'}

{'en': 'Saying “be it so,” Sahadeva proceeded towards that direction and he then beheld his brother Nakula lying dead on the ground.', 'sn': 'सहदेवस्तथेत्युक्त्वा तां दिशं प्रत्यपद्यत। ददर्श च हतं भूमौ भ्रातरं नकुलं तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Sorely afflicted at the death of his brother and oppressed with thirst, as he made for the water he heard these words.', 'sn': 'भ्रातृशोकाभिसंतप्तस्तृषया च प्रपीडितः। अभिदुद्राव पानीयं ततो वागभ्यभाषत॥'}

{'en': '"O child, do not venture this. It has been before obtained possession by me. First answer my questions and then drink water and carry it away.”', 'sn': 'मा तात साहसं कार्मिम पूर्वपरिग्रहः। प्रश्नानुक्त्वा यथाकामं पिवस्व च हरस्व च॥'}
{'en': 'Sahadeva, as he was thirsty, despising those words drank the cool water and as he drank he fell dead.', 'sn': 'अनाहृत्य तु तद् वाक्यं सहदेवः पिपासितः। अपिबच्छीतलं तोयं पीत्वा च निपपात ह॥'}

{'en': 'Then Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, said to Vijaya (Arjuna) “O Vivatsu, O tormentor of foes, your brothers (Nakula and Sahadeva) have been long out.', 'sn': 'अथाब्रवीत् स विजयं कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः। भ्रातरौ ते चिरगतौ बीभत्सो शत्रुकर्शन॥'}

{'en': 'May you be in peace. Go and bring them and also water. O affectionate one, you are the refuge of all of us when in distress."', 'sn': 'तौ चैवानय भद्रं ते पानीयं च त्वमानय। त्वं हि नस्तात सर्वेषां दुःखितानामपाश्रयः॥'}

{'en': 'Thus spoken to, the intellectual Gudakesha taking up his bow together with arrows and his naked sword soon proceeded towards that lake.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तो गुडाकेशः प्रगृह्य सशरं धनुः। आमुक्तखङ्गो मेधावी तत् सरः प्रत्यपद्यत॥'}

{'en': '(Having arrived at that lake), Shvetavahana beheld his two brothers, those most valiant of men, who came to fetch water, lying dead.', 'sn': 'ततः पुरुषशार्दूलो पानीयहरणे गतौ। तौ ददर्श हतौ तत्र भ्रातरौ श्वेतवाहनः॥'}

{'en': 'And that lion amongst men, beholding them as if buried in slumber, became very afflicted, And then the son of Kunti upraising his bow looked around that forest.', 'sn': 'प्रसुप्ताविव तौ दृष्ट्वा नरसिंहः सुदुःखितः। धनुरुद्यम्य कौन्तेयो व्यलोकयत् तद् वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'But he beheld no creature in that great forest. And oppressed with fatigue, Savyasachi made for the water.', 'sn': 'नापश्यत् तत्र किञ्चित् स भूतमस्मिन् महावने। सव्यसाची ततः श्रान्तः पानीयं सोऽभ्यधावत॥'}

{'en': 'And as he rushed (towards the water) he heard these words from the firmament “Why are you coming towards the water You will not। be able to drink of it forcibly.', 'sn': 'अभिधावंस्ततो वाक्यमन्तरिक्षात् स शुश्रुवे। किमासीदसि पानीयं तच्छक्यं बलात् त्वया।॥'}

{'en': 'O son of Kunti, O Bharata, if you can answer the questions put by me, then you may drink of the water and take it away.”', 'sn': 'कौन्तेय यदि प्रश्नांस्तान् मयोक्तान् प्रतिपत्स्यसे। ततः पास्यसि पानीयं हरिष्यसि च भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Thus forbidden, Partha said "come to my presence and then prevent me. You will not speak again in this strain when I will rive you with darts."', 'sn': 'वारितस्त्वब्रवीत् पार्थो दृश्यमानो निवारय। यावद् बाणैर्विनिर्भिन्नः पुन:वं वदिष्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'Saying this, Partha displaying his skill in hitting at an invisible object by sound alone, entirely covered all the sides by discharges of arrows inspired with the mantras,', 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा ततः पार्थः शरैरस्त्रानुमन्त्रितैः। प्रववर्ष दिशः कृत्स्ना: शब्दवेधं च दर्शयन्॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharatas, oppressed with thirst, he began to hurl barbed darts, javelins, Narachas and numerous infallible arrows.', 'sn': 'कर्णिनालीकनाराचानुत्सृजन् भरतर्षभ। स त्वमोघानिषून मुक्त्वा तृष्णायाभिप्रपीडितः॥'}
{'en': 'And he discharged at the firmament innumerable darts.', 'sn': 'अनेकैरिषुसङ्घातैरन्तरिक्षे ववर्ष ह।'}
{'en': 'The Yaksha said: Partha, your exertions are to no purpose, (First) answer my questions and then drink', 'sn': 'यक्ष उवाच किं विघातेन ते पार्थ प्रश्नानुक्त्वा ततः पिब॥'}

{'en': 'If however you drink before answering my questions, you will die as soon as you will drink. Thus addressed, the son of Pritha, Dhananjaya who could draw his bow by his left hand. Disregarding those words, as he drank, fell dead.', 'sn': 'अनुक्त्वा च पिबन् प्रश्नान् पीत्वैव न भविष्यसि। एवमुक्तस्ततः पार्थः सव्यसाची धनंजयः॥ अवज्ञायैव तां वाचं पीत्वैव निपपात ह।'}

{'en': 'Then, Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti spoke to Bhimsena, “O tormentor of foes, O Bhimasena Nakula, Sahadeva and Vivatsu have been long out to fetch water and they have not come as yet. You are to bring them as well as water.', 'sn': 'अथाब्रवीद् भीमसेनं कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिः॥ नकुलः सहदेवश्च बीभत्सुश्च परंतप! चिरं गतास्तोयहेतोर्न चागच्छन्ति भारत॥ तांश्चैवानय भद्रं ते पानीयं च त्वमानय।'}

{'en': 'May you be blessed.” Saying “be it so" Bhimasena proceeded towards that place, where his brothers, those most valiant of men, lay dead. Afflicted at seeing them (dead) and oppressed with thirst.', 'sn': 'भीमसेनस्तथेत्युक्त्वा तं देशं प्रत्यपद्यत॥ यत्र ते पुरुषव्याघ्रा भ्रातरोऽस्य निपातिताः। तान् दृष्ट्वा दुःखितो भीमस्तृषया च प्रपीडितः॥'}

{'en': 'That mighty-armed one considered (within himself). “This act must have been done by some Yaksha or Rakshasa." And he thought (further) “I will have surely to fight today.', 'sn': 'अमन्यत महाबाहुः कर्म तद् यक्षरक्षसाम्। स चिन्तयामास तदा योद्धव्यं ध्रुवमद्य वै॥'}

{'en': 'Let me therefore, (first) drink water.” Then, Vrikodara, the son of Pritha and the best of the Bharatas, desirous of drinking, rushed towards the water.', 'sn': 'पास्यामि तावत् पानीयमिति पार्थो वृकोदरः। ततोऽभ्यधावत् पानीयं पिपासुः पुरुषर्षभः॥'}

{'en': 'The Yaksha said: O child, do not attempt it. It has already been in my possession, (first) answer my questions and then drink water and carry it away (for your brother).', 'sn': 'यक्ष उवाच मा तात साहसं कार्मिम पूर्वपरिग्रहः। प्रश्नानुक्त्वा तु कौन्तेय ततः पिब हरस्व च॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed by that Yaksha of unrivalled energy, soon as Bhima without answering his questions, drank of it, he fell down dead.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तस्तदा भीमो यक्षेणामिततेजसा। अनुक्त्वैव तु तान् प्रश्नान् पीत्वैव निपपात ह॥'}

{'en': 'Then that best of men, the royal son of Kunti of mighty arms, whose heart was burning in grief, after much deliberation rose up and entered that mighty forest where no sound of human voice could be heard. It was inhabited by rurus, boars and birds.', 'sn': 'ततः कुन्तीसुतो राजा प्रचिन्त्य पुरुषर्षभः। समुत्थाय महाबाहुर्दह्यमानेन चेतमा॥ व्यपेतजननिर्घोषं प्रविवेश महावनम्। रुरुभिश्च वराहैश्च पक्षिभिश्च निषेवितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Adorned with trees of blue and bright colours and ringing with the hum of bees and warbling of birds. And that highly renowned.', 'sn': 'नीलभास्वरवर्णश्च पादैपरुपशोभितम्। भ्रमरैरुपगीतं च पक्षिभिश्च महायशाः॥'}

{'en': 'And illustrious one, entering into the forest saw that lake beautified with gold-coloured filaments, looking as if it had been made by the Architect of the universe.', 'sn': 'स गच्छन् कानने तस्मिन् हेमजालपरिष्कृतम्। ददर्श तत् सरः श्रीमान् विश्वकर्मकृतं यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Adorned with rows of lotuses, Sindhuvara flowers together with cane trees and covered all over with Ketakas, Karaviras and Pippalas. Oppressed with fatigue, he approached that lake and was wonder-struck at what he saw.', 'sn': 'उपेतं नलिनीजालैः सिन्धुवारैः सवेतसैः। केतकैः करवीरैश्च पिप्पलैश्चैव संवृतम्। श्रमार्तस्तदुपागम्य सरो दृष्ट्वाथ विस्मितः॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said Tell me, O grandfather, how should a king treat a mild foe, one who is fierce, and one who has many allies and a large army.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच कथं मृदौ कथं तीक्ष्णे महापक्षे च पार्थिव। आदौ वर्तेत नृपतिस्तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह॥'}
{'en': "'Regarding it is cited, O Yudhishthira the old discourse between Brihaspati and Indra.", 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। बृहस्पतेश्च संवादमिन्द्रस्य च युधिष्ठिर॥'}

{'en': 'Once on a time, that destroyer of hostile heroes, viz., Vasava, the king of the gods, joining his hands, approached Brihaspati, and saluting him, said these words.', 'sn': 'बृहस्पति देवपतिरभिवाद्य कृताञ्जलिः। उपसंगम्य पप्रच्छ वासवः परवीरहा।॥'}

{'en': 'Indra said How, O twice-born one, should I treat my enemies? How should I subdue them by various contrivances, without rooting them out?', 'sn': 'इन्द्र उवाच अहितेषु कथं ब्रह्मन् प्रवर्तेयमतन्द्रितः। असमुच्छिद्य चैवैतान् नियच्छेयमुपायतः॥'}

{'en': 'In a collision between two arinies, victory may be achieved by either side. In what way should I behave so that this shining prosperity that I have acquired and that scorches all my enemies, may not leave me?', 'sn': 'सेनयोर्व्यतिषङ्गेण जयः साधारणो भवेत्। किंकुर्वाणं न मां जह्याज्ज्वलिता श्रीः प्रतापिनी॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed, Brihaspati, skilled in Virtue, Profit, and Pleasure, endued with a knowledge of royal duties, and great intelligence, answered Indra as follows.', 'sn': 'ततो धर्मार्थकामानां कुशलः प्रतिभानवान्। राजधर्मविधानज्ञः प्रत्युवाच पुरंदरम्॥'}

{'en': 'One should never wish to vanquish his enemies by quarrel. Worked up with anger and shom of forgiveness, boys only seek quarrel.', 'sn': 'बृहस्पतिरुवाच न जातु कलहेनेच्छेन्नियन्तुमपकारिणः। बालैरासेवितं ह्येतद् यदम! यदक्षमा॥'}

{'en': "One who wishes for the destruction of a foe, should not make that foe careful. On the other hand, one should never display one's anger or fear or joy. He should conceal these within his own heart.", 'sn': 'न शत्रुर्विवृतः कार्यो वधमस्याभिकाङ्गता। क्रोधं भयं च हर्षं च नियम्य स्वयमात्मनि॥'}

{'en': "Without trusting one's foe in reality, one should treat him in such a way as if he trusted him completely. One should always speak sweet words to one's enemies and never do anything that is disagreeable.", 'sn': 'अमित्रमुपसेवेत विश्वस्तवदविश्वसन्। प्रियमेव वदेन्नित्यं नाप्रियं किंचिदाचरेत्॥'}

{'en': 'One should avoid useless acts of hostility as also insolent speech. As a fowler, carefully uttering cries like those of the birds he wishes to catch, or destroy, captures and brings them under his control, even so should a king, O Purandara, bring his enemies under subjection and then kill them if he likes.', 'sn': 'विरमेच्छुष्कवैरेभ्यः कण्ठायासांश्च वर्जयेत्। यथा वैतंसिको युक्तो द्विजानां सदृशस्वनः॥ तान् द्विजान् कुरुते वश्यांस्तथा युक्तो महीपतिः। वशं चोपनयेच्छन् निहन्याच्च पुरंदर॥'}

{'en': "Having defeated one's enemies, one should not sleep at ease. A wicked enemy rises up against like a fire carelessly extinguished reappearing itself.", 'sn': 'न नित्यं परिभूयारीन् सुखं स्वपिति वासव। जागर्येव हि दुष्टात्मा संकरेऽग्निरिवोत्थितः॥'}

{'en': "When victory may be achieved by either side, a hostile collision of arms should be avoided. Having made an enemy feel security, one should subdue him and active one's end.", 'sn': 'न संनिपातः कर्तव्यः सामान्ये विजये सति। विश्वास्यैवोपसन्नार्थो वशे कृत्वा रिपुः प्रभो॥'}

{'en': "Having consulted his ministers and intelligent persons conversant with policy, an enemy that is disregarded and neglected, never owning submission at heart, strikes the disregarder at the proper season, especially when the latter takes a false step. By engaging trustworthy agents of his own, such an enemy would also make the other's forces inefficient by creating disunion.", 'sn': 'सम्प्रधार्य सहामात्यैर्मन्त्रविद्भिर्महात्मभिः। उपेक्ष्यमाणोऽवज्ञातो हृदयेनापराजितः॥ अथास्य प्रहरेत् काले किंचिद्विचलिते पदे। दण्डं च दूषयेदस्य पुरुषैराप्तकारिभिः॥'}

{'en': 'Knowing the beginning, the middle, and the end of his enemy, a king should secretly entertain feelings of hostility towards them. He should corrupt the forces of his enemy, determine everything by positive evidence, creating disunion, making gifts, and administering poison. A king should never live with his foes.', 'sn': 'आदिमध्यावसानज्ञः प्रच्छन्नं च विधारयेत्। बलानि दूषयेदस्य जानन्नेव प्रमाणतः॥ भेदेनोपप्रदानेन संसृजेदौषधैस्तथा। न त्वेवं खलु संसर्गं रोचयेदरिभिः सह॥'}

{'en': "A king should wait long and then kill his enemies. Indeed, he should wait, for the opportunity, so that he might attack his enemy at a time when the latter would not expect him in the least.
