{'en': 'A river was formed on the field o, battle, flowing towards the other world. Blood formed its waters and cars its eddies, Standards were its trees, the bones its pebbles.', 'sn': 'संजज्ञे रणभूमौ तु परलोकवहा नदी। शोणितोदा रथावर्ता ध्वजवृक्षास्थिशर्करा॥'}

{'en': 'The arms were its alligators, bows its current, elephants its large rocks and its smaller ones. Fat and marrow constituted its mire, umbrellas its swans and maces its rafts.', 'sn': 'भुजनक्रा धनुःस्रोता हस्तिशैला हयोपला। मेदोमजाकर्दमिनी छत्रहंसा गदोडुपा॥'}

{'en': 'Abounding with armour and head-gears, banners formed its beautiful trees. Wheels formed its swarms of Chakravakas and it was covered with Trivenus and Dandas.', 'sn': 'कवचोष्णीषसंच्छन्ना पताकारुचिरदुमा। चक्रचक्रावलीजुष्टा त्रिवेणूरगसंवृता॥'}

{'en': 'Filling the brave with joy and increasing the fears of the timid, that fierce river flowed the shores of which were filled with Kurus and Srinjayas.', 'sn': 'शूराणां हर्षजननी भीरूणां भयवर्धनी। प्रावर्तत नदी रौद्रा कुरुसृञ्जयसंकुला॥'}

{'en': 'Those brave warriors, with arms resembling bludgeons, by the aid of their cars and animals, acting as rafts and boats crossed that dreadful river which flowed towards the region of the deed.', 'sn': 'तां नदी परलोकाय वहन्तीमतिभैस्वाम्। तेरुहिननौभिस्तैः : शूराः परिधबाहवः॥'}

{'en': 'During the course of that battle, O king, in which no consideration was showed by any body for any one and which with awful destruction of the four fold forces, resembled the battle between the celestials and the Asuras in the days of yore.', 'sn': 'वर्तमाने तदा युद्धे निर्मयादे विशाम्पते। चतुरङ्गक्षये घोरे पूर्वदेवासुरोपमे॥'}

{'en': 'Some warriors, O scorcher of foes, loudly called upon their kinsmen and friends. Some, called upon by crying kinsmen, returned stricken with fear,', 'sn': 'व्याक्रोशन् बान्धवानन्ये तत्र तत्र परंतप। क्रोशाद्भिर्दयितैरन्ये भयार्ता न निवतिरे।॥'}
{'en': 'During the course of that fierce and dreadful battle, Arjuna and Bhimasena stupefied their foes.', 'sn': 'निर्मर्यादे तथा युद्धे वर्तमाने भयानके। अर्जुनो भीमसेनश्च मोहयांचक्रतुः परान्॥'}
{'en': 'Your army, O king thus destroyed, swooned away on the field, like a woman under the influence of liquor.', 'sn': 'सा वध्यमाना महती सेना तव नराधिप। अमुह्यत्तत्र तत्रैव योषिन्मदवशादिव॥'}
{'en': 'Having stupefied that army, Bhimasena and Dhananjaya blew their conchs and sent forth leonine roars.', 'sn': 'मोहयित्वा च तां सेनां भीमसेनधनञ्जयौ। दध्मतुर्वारिजौ तत्र सिंहनादांश्च चक्रतुः॥'}

{'en': 'On hearing that loud sound Dhristadyumna and Shikhandin, placing king Yudhishthira at their head, rushed against the king of the Madras.', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वैव तु महाशब्दं धृष्टद्युम्नशिखण्डीनौ। धर्मराजं पुरस्कृत्य मद्रराजमभिद्रुतौ॥'}

{'en': 'Highly wonderful and terrible, O monarch, was the manner in which those heroes, in a body and separately, fought with Shalya.', 'sn': 'तत्राश्चर्यमपश्याम घोररूपं विशाम्पते। शल्येन सङ्गताः शूरा यदयुध्यन्त भागशः॥'}

{'en': 'The two energetic sons of Madri, masters of weapons and invincible in battle, proceeded quickly against your army worked up with the desire of victory.', 'sn': 'माद्रीपुत्रौ तु रभसौ कृतास्त्रौ युद्धदुर्मदौ। अभ्ययातां त्वरायुक्तौ जिगीषन्तौ परंतप॥'}

{'en': "Then your army, O best of Bharata's race, wounded greatly with arrows by the Pandavas eager for victory, took to their heels in the battle.", 'sn': 'ततो न्यवर्तत बलं तावकं भरतर्षभ। शरैः प्रणुन्नं बहुधा पाण्डवैर्जितकाशिभिः॥'}

{'en': 'Thus struck and dispersed by strong bowmen, O king, that army fled away on all sides in the presence of your sons.', 'sn': 'वध्यमाना चमूः सा तु पुत्राणां प्रेक्षतां तव। भेजे दिशो महाराज प्रणुन्ना शरवृष्टिभिः॥'}

{'en': 'Exclamations of Oh and Alas, O Bharata, arose from among your warriors while some illustrious Kshatriyas among the dispersed combatants, desirous of victory, cried out, saying-stop, stop.', 'sn': 'हाहाकारो महाञ्जज्ञे योधानां तव भारत। तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाप्यासीद् द्रावितानां महात्मनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Despite it, your troops routed by the Pandavas, fled away leaving behind on the field, their dear sons and brothers and maternal uncles and sisters and relatives by marriage and other kinsmen.', 'sn': 'क्षत्रियाणां सहान्योन्यं संयुगे जयमिच्छताम्। प्राद्रवन्नेव सम्भग्नाः पाण्डवैस्तव सैनिकाः॥ त्यक्त्वा युद्धे प्रियान् पुत्रान् भ्रातृनथ पितामहान्। मातुलान् भागिनेयांश्च वयस्यानपि भारत॥'}

{'en': "Driving their horses and elephants to a great speed, thousands of warriors fled away O foremost of Bharata's race, anxious to secure their personal safety only.", 'sn': 'हयान् द्विपांस्त्वरयन्तो योधा जग्मुः समन्ततः। आत्मत्राणकृतोत्साहास्तावका भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'From the unmanifest first originated the Great Soul, gifted with great intelligence, the source of all the qualities. That is said to be the first creation.', 'sn': 'अव्यक्तात् पूर्वमुत्पन्नो महानात्मा महामतिः। आदिर्गुणानां सर्वेषां प्रथमः सर्ग उच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'The Great Soul has these synonymous words, the Great Soul, Intelligence, Vishnu, Jishnu, Shambhu of great valour, the Understanding, the means of acquiring knowledge, the means of perception, as also fame, courage, and memory. Knowing this, a learned Brahmana has never to meet with delusion.', 'sn': 'महानात्मा मतिर्विष्णुर्जिष्णुः शम्भुश्च वीर्यवान्। बुद्धिः प्रज्ञोपलब्धिश्च तथा ख्यातिधृतिः स्मृतिः॥ पर्यायवाचकैः शब्दैर्महानात्मा विभाव्यते। तं जानन् ब्राह्मणो विद्वान् प्रमोहं नाधिगच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'It has hands and feet on every side. It has ears on every side. It pervades every thing in the universe.', 'sn': 'सर्वत:पाणिपादश्च सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखः। सर्वत:श्रुतिमाँल्लोके सर्वं व्याप्य स तिष्ठति॥'}

{'en': 'Of great power, that Being is stationed in the heart of all. Minuteness. Lightness, and Affluence, are his. His is the hard of all, and at one with effulgence, and knows not decay.', 'sn': 'महाप्रभावः पुरुषः सर्वस्य हृदि निश्चितः। अणिमा लघिमा प्राप्तिरीशानो ज्योतिरव्ययः॥'}

{'en': 'In Him are all those who comprehend the nature of the understanding, all those who are devoted to goodness of disposition, all those who practise meditation, who are always devoted to Yoga, who are firm in truth. who have governed their senses, who are gifted with knowledge, who are freed from cupidity, who have conquered anger, who are of cheerful hcarts, who are gifted with wisdom, who are liberated from ideas of mine and thine, and who are devoid of cgoism.', 'sn': 'तत्र बुद्धिविदो लोकाः सद्भावनिरताश्च ये। ध्यानिनो नित्ययोगाश्च सत्वसंधा जितेन्द्रियाः॥ ज्ञानवन्तश्च ये केचिदलुब्धा जितमन्यवः। प्रसन्नमनसो धीरा निर्ममा निरहंकृताः॥'}

{'en': 'All these, shorn of all attachments attain to the status of Greatness. That, person who understands that holy and high goal, viz., the Great Soul becomes freed from delusion.', 'sn': 'विमुक्ताः सर्व एवैते महत्त्वमुपयान्त्युत। आत्मनो महतो वेद यः पुण्यां गतिमुत्तमाम्॥'}

{'en': 'From Egoison were, indeed, born the five great elements. They are earth, air, ether, water and light numbering the fifth.', 'sn': 'अहंकारात् प्रसूतानि पहाभूतानि पञ्च वै। पृथिवी वायुराकाशमायो ज्योतिश्च पञ्चमम्॥'}

{'en': 'In these five great elements, in the matter of the operations of sound, touch, colour, taste, and smell, all creatures become deluded.', 'sn': 'तेषु भूतानि युज्यन्ते महाभूतेषु पञ्चसु। ते शब्दस्पर्शरूपेषु रसगन्धक्रियासु च॥'}

{'en': 'When at the close of the destruction of the grcat elements, the dissolution of the universe comes, O wisemen, a great fear possesses all living creatures. However, the man with self realisation and bold enough remains undeviated to that circumstances.', 'sn': 'महाभूतविनाशान्ते प्रलये प्रत्युपस्थिते। सर्वप्राणभृतां धीरा महदुत्पद्यते भयम्॥ स धीरः सर्वलोकेषु न मोहमधिगच्छति।'}

{'en': 'The self-create Vishnu becomes the Lord in the primary creations. He who thus knows the Lord lying in the cave, the Supreme, Ancient Being, of universal form, the golded one, the highest goal of all persons gifted with understanding, that intelligent man lives, transcending the understanding.', 'sn': 'विष्णुरेवादिसर्गेषु स्वयम्भूर्भवति प्रभुः॥ एवं हि यो वेद गुहाशय प्रभु परं पुराणं पुरुष विश्वरूपम्। हिरण्मयं बुद्धिमतां परां गतिं स बुद्धिमान् बुद्धिमतीत्य तिष्ठति॥'}

{'en': 'The self-create Vishnu becomes the Lord in the primary creations. He who thus knows the Lord lying in the cave, the Supreme, Ancient Being, of universal form, the golded one, the highest goal of all persons gifted with understanding, that intelligent man lives, transcending the understanding.', 'sn': 'हिरण्मयं बुद्धिमतां परां गतिं स बुद्धिमान् बुद्धिमतीत्य तिष्ठति॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : The best of the Bhrigu race, the son of Kavi (Shukra) himself became angry. Coming to the place where Vrishaparva was seated he fearlessly addressed him thus-', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततः काव्यो भृगुश्रेष्ठ समन्युरुपगम्य हा वृषपर्वाणमासीनमित्युवाचाविचारयन्॥'}

{'en': '"O king, the sinful acts like the earth immediately do not bear fruit. But they do gradually and secretly cut away the roots of their doer.', 'sn': 'नाधर्मश्चरितो राजन् सद्यः फलति गौरिव। शनैरावय॑मानो हि कर्तुर्मूलानि कृन्तति॥'}

{'en': "Such fruits, are seen, either in one's ownself, or in one's son, or in one's grandson. Sin must bear fruits, like rich food they cannot be digested.", 'sn': 'पुत्रेषु वा नतृषु वा न चेदात्मनि पश्यति। फलत्येव ध्रुवं पापं गुरुभुक्तमिवोदरे॥'}

{'en': 'As you killed the grandson of Rishi Angirasa, the Brahmana Kacha, who was virtuous, learned in religious precepts and attentive to duties, when he lived with me.', 'sn': 'यदधात यथा विप्रं कचमाङ्गिरसं तदा। अपापशीलं धर्मज्ञं शुश्रूषं मद्गृहे रतम्॥'}

{'en': 'As you have mal-treated my daughter who did not deserve it, O Vrishaparva, know, I shall leave you and all your race. O king, for this reason I can no longer stay with you.', 'sn': 'वधादनहतस्तस्य वधाच दुहितुर्मम। वृषपर्वन् निबोधेदं त्यक्ष्यामि त्वां सबान्धवम्। स्थातुं त्वद्विषये राजन् न शक्ष्यामि त्वया सह॥'}

{'en': 'Do not think, O Danava, that I am raving or I am a liar. You think very little of your faults and do not try to correct them.', 'sn': 'अहो मामभिजानासि दैत्य मिथ्याप्रलपिनम्। यथेममात्मनो दोषं न नियच्छस्युपेक्षसे॥'}

{'en': 'Vrishaparva said : O son of Bhrigu, never I attributed to you falsehood or impiety. Virtue and truth ever dwell in you. Be gracious to me. O son of Bhrigu, if you really leave me and go away (from this place), we shall have then to go into the deep bottom of the ocean. There is no other alternative for us.', 'sn': 'वृषपर्वोवाच नाधर्मं न मृषावादं त्वयि जानामि भार्गव। त्वयि धर्मश्च सत्यं च तत् प्रसीदतु नो भवान्॥ यद्यस्मानपहाय त्वमितो गच्छसि भार्गव। समुद्रं सम्प्रवेक्ष्यामो नान्यदस्ति परायणम्॥'}

{'en': "Shukra said: O Asura, I care very little whether you go into the bottom of the sea, of fly away to all directions, I am incapable of bearing my daughter's grief.", 'sn': 'शुक्र उवाच समुद्रं प्रविशध्वं वा दिशो वा द्रवतासुराः। दुहितु प्रियं सोढुं शक्तोऽहं दयिता हि मे॥'}

{'en': 'My life depends on her. Seek, O Asuras, to please her. As Brihaspati always seeks the good of Indra, so I seek your good with my ascetic powers.', 'sn': 'प्रसाद्यतां देवयानी जीवितं यत्र मे स्थितम्। योगक्षेमकरस्तेऽहमिन्द्रस्येव बृहस्पतिः॥'}

{'en': 'Vrishaparva said : O son of Bhrigu, you are the absolute master of everything that belongs to the Asura chief in this world these elephants, kine and horses, nay even myself.', 'sn': 'वृषपर्वोवाच यत् किंचिदसुरेन्द्राणां विद्यते वसु भार्गव। भुवि हस्तिगवाश्वं च तस्य त्वं मम चेश्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'Shukra said: Ogreat Asura, if it is (really) true that I am the lord over all the wealth of the Asuras, then go and try to please Devayani.', 'sn': 'शुक्र उवाच यत् किंचिदस्ति द्रविणं दैत्येन्द्राणां महासुर। तस्येश्वरोऽस्मि यद्येषा देवयानी प्रसाद्यताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : When the great son of Kavi (Shukra) was thus addressed by Vrishaparva, he went to Devayani and the son of Bhrigu told her all.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्तस्तथेत्याह वृषपर्वा महाकविः। देवयान्यन्तिकं गत्वा तमर्थ प्राह भार्गवः॥'}

{'en': 'Devayani said : O son of Bhrigu, O father, if you are really the lord over the Asura king and all his wealth, then let the king come personally to me and speak it in my presence.', 'sn': 'देवयान्युवाच यदि त्वमीश्वरस्तात राज्ञो वित्तस्य भार्गव नाभिजानामि तत् तेऽहं राजा तु वदतु स्वयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vrishaparva said : O Devayani, O lady of sweet smiles, whatever you desire to possess, however difficult it may be to get, I am willing to give you.', 'sn': 'वृषपर्वोवाच यं काममभिकामासि देवयानि शुचिस्मिते। तत् तेऽहं सम्प्रदास्यामि यदि वापि हि दुर्लभम्॥'}

{'en': 'Devayani said : I desire to have Sharmishtha as my maidservant one thousand other damsels. She must also follow me to the house of him on whom my father will bestow me.', 'sn': 'देवयान्युवाच दासी कन्यासहस्रेण शर्मिष्ठामभिकामये। अनु मां तत्र गच्छेत् सा यत्र दद्याच मे पिता॥'}

{'en': 'Vrishaparva said : O nurse, go and bring quickly Sharmishtha here. Let her also act according to the desire of Devayani.', 'sn': 'वृषपर्वोवाच उत्तिष्ठ त्वं गच्छ धात्रि शर्मिष्ठां शीघ्रमानय। यं च कामयते कामं देवयानी करोतु तम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : The nurse then went to Sharmishtha and told her, “O amiable Sharmishtha, rise and follow me.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततो धात्री तत्र गत्वा शर्मिष्ठां वाक्यमब्रवीत्। उत्तिष्ठ भद्रे शर्मिष्ठे ज्ञातीनां सुखमावह॥'}

{'en': 'Accomplish the good of your race. Urged by Devayani, the Brahmana (Shukra) is about to leave his disciples (the Asuras). O sinless lady, you must do as Devayani desires."', 'sn': 'त्यजति ब्राह्मण: शिष्यान् देवयान्या प्रचोदितः। सायं कामयते कामं स कार्योऽद्य त्वयानघे॥'}

{'en': 'Sharmishtha said : I shall cheerfully do as Devayani desires. Both Shukra and Devayani, must not leave the Asuras through any fault of mine.', 'sn': 'शर्मिष्ठोवाच यं सा कामयते कामं करवाण्यहमद्य तम्। यद्येवमाह्वयेच्छुक्रो देवयानीकृते हि माम्। मद्दोषान्मा गमच्छुक्रो देवयानी च मत्कृते॥'}

{'en': "Vaishampayana said : Having been commanded by her father, Sharmishtha with one thousand maidens came out of her father's excellent palace.", 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततः कन्यासहस्रेण वृता शिबिकया तदा। पितुर्नियोगात् त्वरिता निश्चक्राम पुरोत्तमात्॥'}

{'en': 'Sharmishtha said : I am your maid-servant, with my one thousand maids. I shall follow you where your father will bestow you.', 'sn': 'शर्मिष्ठोवाच अहं दासीसहस्रेण दासी ते परिचारिका। अनु त्वां तत्र यास्यामि यत्र दास्यति ते पिता॥'}

{'en': 'Devayani said: I am the daughter of one who is a hired chanter of praise, who asks for alms and accepts them, whereas you are the daughter of one who is adored. Why should you become my maid-servant?', 'sn': 'देवयान्युवाच स्तुवतो दुहिताहं ते याचतः प्रतिगृह्णतः । स्तूयमानस्य दुहिता कथं दासी भविष्यसि॥'}

{'en': "Sharmishtha said : One must try to do good to one's affected relatives. Therefore, I shall follow you where your father will bestow you.", 'sn': 'शर्मिष्ठोवाच येन केनचिदार्तानां ज्ञातीनां सुखमावहेत्। अतस्त्वामनुयास्यामि यत्र दास्यति ते पिता॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : O best of kings, when Sharmishtha thus promised to be the maid-servant of Devayani, she then thus spoke to her father.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच प्रतिश्रुते दासभावे दुहित्रा वृषपर्वणः। देवयानी नृपश्रेष्ठ पितरं वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Devayani said : () best of Brahmanas, O father, I am satisfied. I shall now enter the Asura capital. I know your science and power of knowledge is not futile.', 'sn': 'देवयान्युवाच प्रविशामि पुरं तात तुष्टास्मि द्विजसत्तम। अमोघं तव विज्ञानमस्ति विद्याबलं च ते॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Having been thus addressed by his daughter, that best of Brahmanas, that illustrious man entered the capital with all happiness, sand he was worshipped by all the Danavas.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्तो दुहित्रा स द्विजश्रेष्ठो महायशाः। प्रविवेश पुरं हृष्टः पूजितः सर्वदानवैः॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said: When the illustrious Pandavas had gone only two miles, Draupadi unaccustomed to walk, sat down.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच क्रोशमानं प्रयातेषु पाण्डवेषु महात्मसु। पद्भ्यामनुचिता गन्तुं द्रौपदी समुपाविशत्॥'}

{'en': 'Fatigued and miserable as she was, the Panchala princess became faint on account of the storin and rain.', 'sn': 'श्रान्ता दुःखपरीता च वातवर्षेण तेन च। सौकुमार्याच्च पाञ्चाली सम्मुमोह तपस्विनी॥'}

{'en': 'Trembling with faintness, the black-eyed lady supported her with her thighs and with her plump and becoming arms.', 'sn': 'सा कम्पमाना मोहेन बाहुभ्यामसितेक्षणा। वृत्ताभ्यामनुरूपाभ्यामूरू समवलम्बत॥'}

{'en': 'Thus trying to support herself with her thighs which were like the trunk of an elephant, she suddenly fell down on the ground, trembling like a plantain tree stirred (by wind).', 'sn': 'आलम्बमाना सहितावूरू गजकरोपमौ। पपात सहसा भूमौ वेपन्ती कदली यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing that foremost of women falling down like a twisted creeper, the greatly strong Nakula ran forward and supported her.', 'sn': 'तां पतन्तीं वरारोहां भज्यमानां लतामिव। नकुलः समभिद्रुत्य परिजग्राह वीर्यवान्॥'}

{'en': 'Nakula said: O king, O descendant of Bharata, behold, the daughter of the Panchala king, this blackeyed lady has fallen on the ground out of fatigue.', 'sn': 'नकुल उवाच राजन् पञ्चालराजस्य सुतेयमसितेक्षणा। श्रान्ता निपतिता भूमौ तामवेक्षस्व भारत॥'}

{'en': 'O great king, this lady of slow gait, though she does not deserve misery, suffers great afflictions. She is worn out with fatigue. Therefore comfort her.', 'sn': 'अदुःखार्हा परं दुःखं प्राप्तेयं मृदुगामिनी। आश्वासय महाराज तामिमां श्रमकर्शिताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said: Having heard his these words, the king, Bhima and Sahadeva became greatly afflicted and they soon ran towards her.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच राजा तु वचनात् तस्य भृशं दुःखसमन्वितः। भीमश्च सहदेवश्च सहसा समुपाद्रवन्॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing her weak and also seeing her pale face, the high-souled son of Kunti, taking her up on his lap, began to lament (in grief).', 'sn': 'तामवेक्ष्य तु कौन्तेयो विवर्णवदनां कृशाम्। अङ्कमानीयधर्मात्मा पर्यदेवयदातुरः॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said: How can, this beautiful lady accustomed to a life of case (and accustomed) to live in the private rooms and on beds spread over with sheets, sleep on the ground?', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच कथं वेश्मसु गुप्तेषु स्वास्तीर्णशयनोचिता। भूमौ निपतिता शेते सुखार्दा वरवर्णिनी॥'}

{'en': 'The delicate hands and the lotus-like feet of this lady who deserve all excellent things have become dark blue in colour on my account.', 'sn': 'सुकुमारौ कथं पादौ मुखं च कमलप्रभम्। मत्कृतेऽद्य वरार्हायाः श्यामतां समुपागतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having been addicted to dice what have I done foolishly. I am with Krishna (Draupadi) wandering in the forest full of wild animals!', 'sn': 'किमिदं द्यूतकामेन मया कृतमबुद्धिना। आदाय कृष्णां चरता वने मृगगणायुते॥'}

{'en': 'This large-eyed lady was bestowed on us by her father, the king of Drupada, in the hope that this blessed damsel would be happy by obtaining the Pandavas as her husbands.', 'sn': 'सुखं प्राप्स्यसि कल्याणि पाण्डवान् प्राप्य वै पतीन्। इति दुपदराजेन पित्रा दत्ताऽऽयतेक्षणा॥'}

{'en': 'Afflicted with hardship, sorrow and travel, it is on account of my wretched act, she (now) lies prostrate on the ground without having obtained any thing hoped for.', 'sn': 'तत् सर्वमनवाप्येयं श्रमशोकाध्वकर्शिता। शेते निपतिता भूमौ पापस्य मम कर्मभिः॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : When Dharmaraja Yudhishthira was thus lamenting, Dhaumya and other foremost of Brahmanas all came there.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच तथा लालप्यमाने तुधर्मराजे युधिष्ठिरे। धौम्यप्रभृतयः सर्वे तत्राजग्मुर्द्विजोत्तमाः॥'}

{'en': 'They comforted and consoled him and they honoured him with blessings. They uttered mantras capable of destroying Rakshasas and they also performed (some) religious rites.', 'sn': 'ते समाश्वासयामासुराशीर्भिश्चाप्यपूजयन्। रक्षोघ्नांश्च तथा मन्त्राओपुश्चक्रुश्च ते क्रियाः॥'}

{'en': 'On the Mantras being recited by the great Rishis in order to restore her and on the repeated touch of the cool hands of the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'पठ्यमानेषु मन्त्रेषु शान्त्यर्थं परमर्षिभिः। स्पृश्यमाना करैः शीतैः पाण्डवैश्च मुहुर्मुहुः॥'}

{'en': 'And also on being fanned by the cool breeze surcharged with water, the Panchala princess felt ease and slowly regained her consciousness.', 'sn': 'सेव्यमाना च शीतेन जलमिश्रेण वायुना। पाञ्चाली सुखमासाद्य लेभे चेतः शनैः शनैः॥'}

{'en': 'Placing the poor exhausted lady who had then regained her consciousness on a deer-skin, the sons of Pritha made her take rest.', 'sn': 'परिगृह्य च तां दीनां कृष्णामजितनसंस्तरे। पार्था विश्रामयामासुर्लब्धसंज्ञां तपस्विनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'The twins, taking up her red-soled feet with auspicious marks, began to press them gently with their hands which were scared by the bow-strings.', 'sn': 'तस्या यमौ रक्ततलौ पादौ पूजितलक्षणौ। कराभ्यां किणजाताभ्यां शनकैः संववाहतुः॥'}
{'en': 'Dharmaraja Yudhishthira also comforted her. That foremost of the Kurus thus spoke to Bhimasena.', 'sn': 'पर्याश्वासयदप्येनांधर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः। उवाच च कुरश्रेष्ठो भीमसेनमिदं वचः॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said: "O Bhima, many rugged and snowy bound mountains are (before us); O mighty-armed hero, how will Krishna (Draupadi) be able to pass them?', 'sn': 'बहवः पर्वता भीम विषमः हिमदुर्गमाः। तेषु कृष्णा महाबाहो कथं नु विचंरिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Bhima said: O king, I myself will carry the princess and also these two foremost of men, the twins and yourself; therefore O king of kings, do not allow anxiety to come to your mind.', 'sn': 'भीमसेन उवाच त्वां राजन् राजपुत्रीं च यमौ च पुरुषर्षभ। स्वयं नेष्यामि राजेन्द्र मा विषादे मनः कृथाः॥'}

{'en': 'O sinless one, at your command, the son of Hidimba, Ghatotkacha, who can range the skies and who is as strong as myself will carry us all.', 'sn': 'हैडिम्बाश्च महावीर्यो विहगो मद्बलोपमः। वहेदनघ सर्वान्नो वचनात् ते घटोत्कचः॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Having been ordered by Dharmaraja (Yudhishthira) he remembered his Rakshasa son. As soon as remembered the high-souled Ghatotkacha appeared before his father.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच अनुज्ञातोधर्मराज्ञा पुत्रं सस्मार राक्षसम्। घटोत्कचस्तुधर्मात्मा स्मृतमात्रः पितुस्तदा॥'}

{'en': 'The mighty armed hero, after saluting the Pandavas and the Brahmanas, stood before them with joined hands. They too welcomed him in return.', 'sn': 'कृताञ्जलिरुपातिष्ठदभिवाद्याथ पाण्डवान्। ब्राह्मणांश्च महाबाहुः स च तैरभिनन्दितः॥'}

{'en': 'He then thus spoke to his greatly powerful father Bhimasena, "Having been remembered by you. I have speedily come here to serve you.', 'sn': 'उवाच भीमसेनं स पितरं भीमविक्रमम्। स्मृतोऽस्मि भवता शीघ्रं शुश्रूषुरहमागतः॥'}

{'en': 'O mighty-armed hero, command me. I shall certainly be able to perform whatever you will order me to do.” Having heard this, Bhimasena embraced the Rakshasa.', 'sn': 'आज्ञापय महाबाहो सर्वं कर्तास्म्यसंशयम्। तच्छ्रुत्वा भीमसेनस्तु राक्षसं परिषस्वजे॥'}

{'en': "'Protection of the subjects, O Yudhishthira, is the quintessence of duties. the divine Brihaspati does not speak so highly of any other duty.", 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच एतत् ते राजधर्माणां नवनीतं युधिष्ठिर। बृहस्पतिर्हि भगवान् न्याय्यं धर्मं प्रशंसति॥'}

{'en': 'The divine Kavi (Ushanas) of large eyes and austere penances, the thousand-eyed Indra, and Manu, the son of Prachetas, the divine Bharadwaja, and the sage Gaurasiras all devoted to Brahma and utterers of Brahma, have composed works on the duties of kings.', 'sn': 'विशालाक्षश्च भगवान् काव्यश्चैव महातपाः। सहस्राक्षो महेन्द्रश्च तथा प्राचेतसो मनुः॥ भरद्वाजश्च भगवांस्तथा गौरशिरा मुनिः। राजशास्त्रप्रणेतारो ब्रह्मण्या ब्रह्मवादिनः॥'}

{'en': 'All of them speak highly of the duty of protection, O foremost of virtuous persons regarding the kings. O you having eyes like lotus petals and copper-coloured, listen to the means by which protection may be obtained.', 'sn': 'रक्षामेव प्रशंसन्ति धर्मं धर्मभृतां वर। राज्ञां राजीवताम्राक्ष साधनं चात्र मे शृणु॥'}

{'en': "They consist of the employment of spies and servants, paying them their just dues without pride, the realisation of taxes with mercy, never taking anything whimsically and unjustifiably. O Yudhishthira, the selection of honest men, heroism, skill and cleverness, truth, seeking the good of the people, creating discord and disunion among the enemy by fair or unfair means, the repair of old and dilapedated buildings, the infliction of corporal punishments and imposition of just fines, never abandoning the honest, giving employment and protection to respectable persons, the keeping in reserve of what should be kept, living in the company of intelligent persons, always gratifying the soldiers, supervision over the subjects, steadiness in the transaction of business, filling the treasury, absence of blind confidence on the guards of the city, creating disloyalty among the citizens of a hostile town, carefully looking after the friends and allies living in the midst of the enemy's country, keeping a strict eye on the servants and officers of the state, personal supervision of the city, distrust of servants, comforting the enemy with assurance, steadily following the settled policy, readiness for action, never disregarding an enemy, and driving away the wicked.", 'sn': 'चारश्च प्रणिधिश्चैव काले दानममत्सरात्। युक्त्यादानं न चादानमयोगेन युधिष्ठिर॥ सतां संग्रहणं शौर्यं दाक्ष्यं सत्यं प्रजाहितम्। अनार्जवैरार्जवैश्च शत्रुपक्षस्य भेदनम्॥ केतनानां च जीर्णानामवेक्षा चैव सीदताम्। द्विविधस्य च दण्डस्य प्रयोगः कालचोदितः॥ साधूनामपरित्यागः कुलीनानां च धारणम्। निचयश्च निचेयानां सेवा बुद्धिमतामपि॥ बलानां हर्षणं नित्यं प्रजानामन्ववेक्षणम्। कार्येष्वखेदः कोशस्य तथैव च विवर्धनम्॥ पुरगुप्तिरविश्वास: पौरसंघातभेदनम्। अरिमध्यस्थमित्राणां यथावच्चान्ववेक्षणम्॥ उपजापश्च भृत्यानामात्मनः पुरदर्शनम्। अविश्वासः स्वयं चैव परस्याश्वासनं तथा।॥ नीतिधर्मानुसरणं नित्यमुत्थानमेव च। रिपूणामनवज्ञानं नित्यं चानार्यवर्जनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Readiness for action in kings is the root of royal duties. This has been said by Brihaspati. Listen to the verses recited by him.', 'sn': 'उत्थानं हि नरेन्द्राणां बृहस्पतिरभाषत। राजधर्मस्य तन्मूलं श्लोकांश्चात्र निबोध मे॥'}

{'en': 'By exertion the ambrosia was obtained; by exertion the Asuras were killed; by exertion Indra himself acquired sovereignty in heaven and on earth.', 'sn': 'उत्थानेनामृतं लब्धमुत्थानेनासुरा हताः। उत्थानेन महन्द्रेण श्रेष्ठ्यं प्राप्तं दिवीह च॥'}

{'en': 'The hero who works is superior to one who speaks. The heroes who speak, gratify and worship the heroes who work.', 'sn': 'उत्थानवीरः पुरुषो वाग्वीरानधितिष्ठति। उत्थानवीरान् वाग्वीरा रमयन्त उपासते॥'}

{'en': 'The king, who is shorn of exertion, even if endued with intelligence, is always defeated by foes like a snake that is shorn of poison.', 'sn': 'उत्थानहीनो राजा हि बुद्धिमानपि नित्यशः। प्रधर्षणीयः शत्रूणां भुजङ्ग इव निर्विषः॥'}

{'en': 'The king, even if very powerful, should not neglect a foe however weak. A scintillation of fire can produce a conflagration and a particle of Poison can kill.', 'sn': 'न च शत्रुरवज्ञेयो दुर्बलोऽपि बलीयसा। अल्पोऽपि हि दहत्यग्निविषमल्पं हिनस्ति च॥'}

{'en': 'With only one kind of force, an enemy, from within a fort, can assail the whole country of even a powerful and prosperous king.', 'sn': 'एकाङ्गेनापि सम्भूतः शत्रुर्दुर्गमुपाश्रितः। सर्वं तापयते देशमपि राज्ञः समृद्धिनः॥'}

{'en': 'The secret speeches of a king, the collecting of troops for the purposes of victory, the wily purposes in his heart, desires for accomplishing particular objects, and the wrong acts he does or intends to do, should be concealed by assuming a bold appearance. He should act righteously for keeping his people under control.', 'sn': 'राज्ञो रहस्यं यद् वाक्यं जयार्थं लोकसंग्रहः। हृदि यच्चास्य जिह्यं स्यात्कारणेन च यद् भवेत्॥ यच्चास्य कार्यं वृजिनमार्जवेनैव धारयेत्। दम्भनार्थं च लोकस्य धर्मिष्ठामाचरेत् क्रियाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Wily persons can not govern an extensive empire, A king who is mild cannot acquire superior rank the acquisition of which depends upon exertion.', 'sn': 'राज्यं हि सुमहत् तन्त्रं धार्यते नाकृतात्मभिः। न शक्यं मृदुना वोढुमायासस्थानमुत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'A kingdom, which is sought for by all like meat can never be protected by candour and simplicity. A king, O Yudhishthira, should, therefore, always resort to both candour and wiliness.', 'sn': 'राज्यं सर्वामिषं नित्यमार्जवेनेह धार्यते। तस्मान्मिश्रेण सततं वर्तितव्यं युधिष्ठिर॥'}

{'en': 'Even while protecting his subjects a king is beset with danger, he earns great merit. Such should be the conduct of kings.', 'sn': 'यद्यप्यस्य विपत्तिः स्याद् रक्षमाणस्य वै प्रजाः। सोऽप्यस्य विपुलो धर्म एवंवृत्ता हि भूमिपाः॥'}

{'en': 'I have now told you a part only of the duties of kings. Tell me, O best of Kurus, what more you wish to know.', 'sn': 'एष ते राजधर्माणां लेशः समनुवर्णितः। भूयस्ते यत्र संदेहस्तद् ब्रूहि कुरुसत्तम॥'}

{'en': "Vaishampayana said The illustrious Vyasa, Devasthana, Ashva, Vasudeva, Kripa, Satyaki and Sanjaya, filled with joy, and with faces resembling full-blown flowers, said,-Excellent! Excellent!' and sang the praises of that best of men, viz., Bhishma, that foremost of virtuous persons.", 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततो व्यासश्च भगवान् देवस्थानोऽश्म एव च। वासुदेवः कृपश्चैव सात्यकिः संजयस्तथा॥ साधु साध्विति संहृष्टाः पुष्ष्यमाणैरिवाननैः। अस्तुवंश्च नरव्याघ्रं भीष्मं धर्मभृतां वरम्॥'}

{'en': "Then Yudhishthira, that chief of Kuru's race, with a depressed heart and eyes bathed in tears, gently touched Bhishma's feet and said,—'O grandsire, I shall tomorrow enquire after those points about which I have my doubts, for today the sun, having sucked the moisture of the earth, is about to set.", 'sn': 'ततो दीनमना भीष्ममुवाच कुरुसत्तमः। नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्यां पादौ तस्य शनैः स्पृशन्॥ श्व इदानीं स्वसन्देहं प्रक्ष्यामि त्वां पितामह। उपैति सविता शस्तं रसमापीय पार्थिवम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then Keshava, Kripa, Yudhishthira and others, saluting the Brahmanas and circumambulating Bhishma, gladly got on their cars.', 'sn': 'ततो द्विजातीनभिवाद्य केशवः कृपश्व ते चैव युधिष्ठिरादयः। प्रदक्षिणीकृत्य महानदीसुतं ततो रथानारुरुहुर्मुदान्विताः॥'}

{'en': 'All of them, observant of excellent vows, then bathed in the river Drishadvati-Having offered oblations of water to their departed manes and silently recited the sacred mantras and performed other auspicious rites, and having adored the evening twilight with due rites, those scorchers of enemies entered the city of Hastinapur.', 'sn': 'दृषद्वतीं चाप्यवगाह्य सुव्रताः कृतोदकार्थाः कृतजष्यमङ्गलाः। उपास्य संध्यां विधिवत् परंतर्पा स्तत: पुरं ते विविशुर्गजाह्वयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Beholding the great bowmen bowmen Karna stationed for battle all the Kurus began to utter loud cries of joy from all sides.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच दृष्ट्वा कर्ण महेष्वासं युयुत्सुं समवस्थितम्। चुक्रुशः कुरवः सर्वे हृष्टरूपाः समन्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon with the beatings of cymbals and drums, the sound of all sorts of weapons and the war-cries of the greatly active heroes all your soldiers proceeded to the battle-field, making death the final point of stoppage.', 'sn': 'ततो दुन्दुभिनिर्घोषैर्भेरीणां निनदेन च। बाणशब्दैश्च विविधैर्गर्जितैश्च तरस्विनाम्॥ निर्ययुस्तावका युद्धे मृत्युं कृत्वा निवर्तनम्।'}

{'en': 'When Karna went all the soldiers, were filled with joy. The earth, O king, trembled and created a loud noise.', 'sn': 'प्रयाते तु ततः कर्णे योधेषु मुदितेषु च।॥ चचाल पृथिवी राजन् ववाश च सुविस्तरम्।'}

{'en': 'All the great planets including the sun seemed moving about. And the meteors were seen blazing up all the quarters. Cloudless thunders fell and fierce winds blew.', 'sn': 'निःसरन्तौ व्यद्दश्यन्त सूर्यात् सप्त महाग्रहाः॥ उल्कापाताश्च संजजुदिशां दाहास्तथैव च। शुष्काशन्यश्च सम्पेतुर्ववुर्वाताश्च भैरवाः॥'}

{'en': 'A large number of animals and birds, kept to the right of your army and emitted noise foreboding a dreadful calamity.', 'sn': 'मृगपक्षिगणाश्चैव पृतनां बहुशस्तव। अपसव्यं तदा चक्रुर्वेदयन्तो महाभयम्॥'}

{'en': 'After the departure of Karna his horses trembled down on earth. And a dreadful shower of bones fell from the sky.', 'sn': 'प्रथितस्य च कर्णस्य निपेतुस्तुरगा भुवि। अस्थिवर्षं च पतितमन्तरिक्षाद् भयानकम्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, their weapons were as if burning and the flags were trembling. And the horses shed tears.', 'sn': 'जज्वलुश्चैव शस्त्राणि ध्वजाश्चैव चकम्पिरे। अश्रूणि च व्यमुञ्चन्त वाहनानि विशाम्पते॥'}

{'en': 'Those and other dreadful portends appeared there presaging the destruction of the Kauravas. Stupefied by Destiny they paid no attention of them.', 'sn': 'एते चान्ये च बहव उत्पातास्तत्र दारुणाः। समुत्येतुर्विनाशाय कौरवाणां सुदारुणाः॥'}

{'en': "Seeing the departure of the charioteer's son all the king cried out victory. The Kauravas then thought that the Pandavas had been defeated.", 'sn': 'न च तान् गणयामासुः सर्वे दैवेन मोहिताः। प्रस्थितं सूतपुत्रं च जयेत्यूचुर्नराधिपाः। निर्जितान् पाण्डवाश्चैव मेनिरे तत्र कौरवाः॥'}

{'en': 'The king Vikartana, the subduer of hostile heroes and the foremost of car-warriors, stood on the car, thinking of the death of Bhishma and Drona. He shone there like the sun of fire.', 'sn': 'ततो रथस्थः परवीरहन्ता भीष्मद्रोणावस्तवीर्यो समीक्ष्य। समज्ज्वलन् भास्करपावकाभो वैकर्तनोऽसौ रथकुञ्जरो नृप॥'}

{'en': 'Thinking of the powerful feats of Arjuna, elated with self conceit and pride, worked up with anger and breathing hot and hard, said to Shalya-', 'sn': 'स शल्यमाभाष्य वाक्यं पार्थस्य कर्मातिशयं विचिन्त्य। मानेन दर्पण विदह्यमानः क्रोधेन दीप्यनिव निःश्वसंश्च॥'}

{'en': 'When I am with my bow I do not fear even the angry Mahendra with thunder-bolt in his hand. Beholding Bhishma and other leading heroes lying on the battle field I do not feel the least anxiety.', 'sn': 'नाहं महेन्द्रादपि वज्रपाणे: क्रुद्धाद् बिभेम्यायुधवान् रथस्थः। नतीव मां ह्यस्थिरता जहाति॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing the immaculate Bhishma and Drona equal to Indra and Vishnu, the grinders of the best of cars, elephants and horses and who are not to be killed by any, slain by the enemy I do not feel any fear in battle today.', 'sn': 'महेन्द्रविष्णुप्रतिमावनिन्दतौ रथाश्वनागप्रवरप्रमाथिनौ। स्ततो न मेऽप्यस्ति रणे साध्वसम्॥'}

{'en': 'Well-versed in the use of powerful weapons and himself the foremost of Brahmanas why did not the preceptor kill in battle all the enemies who killed the most powerful of our hero with their drivers, elephants and chariots?', 'sn': 'समीक्ष्य संख्येऽतिबलान् नराधिपान् ससूतमातङ्गरथान् परैर्हतान्। कथं न सर्वानहितान् रणेऽवधीद् महास्त्रविद् ब्राह्मणपुङ्गवो गुरुः॥'}

{'en': 'Listen to me, O Karna, I tell you the truth, thinking of this Drona in battle that there is none amongst you excepting myself who can withstand the advancing Arjuna the heroes who resembled the most dreadful Regent of Death.', 'sn': 'स संस्मरन् द्रोणमहं महाहवे ब्रवीमि सत्यं कुरवो निबोधत। न वा मदन्यः प्रसहेद् रणेऽर्जुनं समागतं मृत्युमिवोग्ररूपिणम्॥'}

{'en': 'In Drona were skill, practice, strength, patience, the greatest of weapons and policy. While that high-souled one has come by death I think all others, shorn of strength, on the point of death.', 'sn': 'शिक्षाप्रमादश्च बलं धृतिश्च द्रोणे महास्त्राणि च संनतिश्च। स चेदगान्मृत्युवशं महात्मा सर्वानन्यानातुरानद्य मन्ये॥'}

{'en': "Even on reflection I do not find any thing perinanent in this world on account of the eternal connection of acts. When the preceptor himself is no more who can expect that he will surely live till even today's sun-rise.", 'sn': 'नेह ध्रुवं किंचिदपि प्रचिन्तयन् विद्यां लोके कर्मणो नित्ययोगात्। सूर्योदये को हि विमुक्तसंशयो भावं कुर्वीताद्य गुरौ निपातिते॥'}

{'en': 'While preceptor has been slain in battle by the enemies, weapons, strength, prowess, actions and wise policy cannot forsooth conduce to the happiness of a man.', 'sn': 'न नूनमस्त्राणि बलं पराक्रमः क्रियाः सुनीतं परमायुधानि वा। अलं मनुष्यस्य सुखाय वर्तितुं तथा हि युद्धे निहतः परैर्गुरुः॥'}

{'en': 'In energy Drona equaled the sun or firc; in prowess he was like Vishnu or Indra, in policy he was like Vrihaspati or Ushanas; invincible though he was even weapons could not protect him.', 'sn': 'हुताशनदित्यसमानतेजसं पराक्रमे विष्णुपुरन्दरोपमम्। नये बृहस्पत्युशनोः सदा समं न चैनमस्त्रं तदुपास्त दुःसहम्॥'}

{'en': 'Our women and children are weeping and bewailing, the manliness of the sons of Dhritarashtra has been defeated. I know therefore, O Shalya, that it is I who am to fight; proceed therefore against the array of our enemies.', 'sn': 'सम्प्राक्रुष्टे रुदितस्त्रीकुमारे पराभूते पौरुषे धार्तराष्ट्र। मया कृत्यमिति जानामि शल्य प्रयाहि तस्माद् द्विषतामनीकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Save me who can withstand the army in the midst of which in the truthful Pandavas king Bhimasena, Arjuna, Vasudeva, Satyaki, Srinjaya and the twins.', 'sn': 'यत्र राजा पाण्डवः सत्यसंधो व्यवस्थितो भीमसेनार्जुनौ चा वासुदेवः सात्यकिः सृजायाश्च यमौ च कस्तान् विषहेन्मदन्यः॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore, O king of Madra, move on quickly in this battle towards the Panchalas, Pandavas and Srinjayas. Encountering them either I will kill them or will myself go to the abode of death by the road followed by Drona.', 'sn': 'तस्मात् क्षिप्रं मद्रपते प्रयाहि रणे पञ्चालान् पाण्डवान् सृञ्जयांश्च। तान् वा हनिष्यामि समेत्य संख्ये यास्यामि वा द्रोणपथा यमाय॥'}

{'en': "Do not think, O Shalya, that I will not enter into the heart of their army. I cannot tolerate such dissension's amongst the kith and kin. I will even follow Drona, renouncing my life.", 'sn': 'न त्वेवाहं न गमिष्यामि मध्ये तेषां शूराणामिति मां शल्य विद्धि। मित्रद्रोहो मर्षणीयो न मेऽयं त्यक्त्वा प्राणाननुयास्यामि द्रोणम्॥'}

{'en': 'A wise man or an ignorant person, none can escape death, when the lease of his life expires. Therefore, O learned one. I shall proceed against Partha. I cannot transgress my destiny.', 'sn': 'प्राज्ञस्य मूढस्य च जीवितान्ते नास्ति प्रमोक्षोऽन्तकसत्कृतस्य। अतो विद्वन्नभियास्यामि पार्थान् दिष्टं न शक्यं व्यतिवर्तितुं वै॥'}

{'en': "O king, the son of Chitravirya's son always does me good. For the accomplishment of his object I will give up this dear life which it is very difficult to renounce.", 'sn': 'कल्याणवृत्तः सततं हि राजा वैचित्रवीर्यस्य सुतो ममासीत्। तस्यार्थसिद्ध्यर्थमहं त्यजामि प्रियान भोगान् दुस्त्यजं जीवितं च॥'}

{'en': 'Rama conferred upon me this best of cars covered with tiger-skins, with axle producing no sound, equipped with a golden seat, having trivenu made of silver and drawn by best of horses.', 'sn': 'वैयाघ्रचर्माणमकूजनाक्षं हैमत्रिकोषं रजतत्रिवेणुम्। युक्तं प्रादान्मह्यमिमं हि रामः॥'}

{'en': 'Behold, O Shalya, these beautiful bows, these, flags, these maces, these dreadful arrows, this shinning sword, this powerful weapon this white conch of dreadful and loud blare.', 'sn': 'धनूंषि चित्राणि निरीक्ष्य शल्य ध्वजान् गदाः सायकांचोग्ररूपान्। असिं च दीप्तं परमायुधं च शङ्ख च शुभं स्वनवन्तमुग्रम्॥'}

{'en': 'Mounted upon this chariot with banners, its wheels producing a sound like that of a thunderbolt drawn by white horses and adorned with beautiful quivers I shall, with all my mighty, destroy that best of car-warriors, Arjuna.', 'sn': 'पताकिनं वज्रनिपातनि:स्वनं सिताश्वयुक्तं शुभतूणशोभितम्। इमं समास्थाय रथं स्थर्षभं रणे हनिष्याम्यहमर्जुनं बलात्॥'}

{'en': 'Even if death himself the destroyer of all, protects vigilantly the son of Pandu, in battle I will either kill him or go myself to the abode of death following Bhishma.', 'sn': 'तं चेन्मृत्युः सर्वहरोऽभिरक्षेत् सदाप्रमत्तः समरे पाण्डुपुत्रम्। तं वा हनिष्यामि रणे समेत्य यास्यामि वा भीष्ममुखो यमाय॥'}

{'en': 'If Yama, Varuna, Kubera and Vasava with all their followers come here and unitedly protect the son of Pandu in battle, I will even then defeat himn with them all. What is the use of speaking more?', 'sn': 'यमवरुणकुबेरवासवा वा यदि युगपत्सगणा महाहवे। जुगुपिषव इहैत्य पाण्डवं किमु बहुना सह तैर्जयामि तम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Hearing those words of Karna who was delighted at the prospect of the battle, the powerful king of Madras laughed him and said the following to check him.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच स्तदुत निशम्यवचः स मद्रराट्। अवहमदवपन्य वीर्यवान् प्रतिषिषिधे च जगाद चोत्तरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Do not brag thus, do not brag thus, O Karna; you are so much transported with joy that you are speaking what you should not do. Who is that Dhananjaya, the best of men and who again are you the vilest of men?', 'sn': 'शल्य उवाच दतिरभसोऽप्यतिवाचमुक्तवान्। क्व च हि नरवरो धनंजयः क्व पनरहो पुरुषाधमो भवान्॥'}

{'en': 'Who else save him the foremost of men (Arjuna) could carry away by force the younger sister of Keshava, having made a confusion in the capital of Yadus that was protected by the younger brother of Indra and that resembled the celestial region protected by the king of gods.', 'sn': 'यदुसदनमुपेन्द्रपालितं त्रिधशमिवामरराजरक्षितम्। प्रसभमतिरिलोड्य को हरेत् पुरुषवरावरजामृतेऽर्जुनात्॥'}

{'en': 'Who else save, Arjuna, powerful like the king of gods, could on the occasion of a quarrel brought about by the slaughter of an animal summon Bhaba, the lord of lords, the creator of the worlds, to battle?', 'sn': 'त्रिभुवनविभुमीश्वरं क इह पुमान भवमाह्वयेद् युधि। मृगवधकलहे ऋतेऽर्जुनात् सुरपतिवीर्यसमप्रभावतः॥'}

{'en': 'To honor the god of fire Jaya, (Arjuna) vanquished the Asuras, gods, great snakes, men, birds, Pishacas, Yakshas and Rakshasas with his arrow and gave him the food he wanted.', 'sn': 'असुरसुरमहोरगान् नरान् गरुडपिशाचसयक्षराक्षसान्। इषुभिरजयदग्निगौरवात् स्वभिलषितं च हविर्ददौ जयः॥'}

{'en': 'Do you remember, O Karna, the occasion when killing the large nuinber of enemies with this arrows effulgent like the sun Arjuna liberated the son of Dhritarashtra himself among the Kurus?', 'sn': 'स्मरसि ननु यदा परैर्हतः स च धृतराष्ट्रसुतोऽपि मोक्षितः। दिनकरसदृशैः शरोत्तमैर्युधा कुरुषु बहून् विनिहत्य तानरीन्॥'}

{'en': 'Do you remember the occasion when you yourself were the first to take to your heels and the Pandavas, having defeated the Gandharvas headed by Chitraratha, liberated the quarrelsome sons of Dhritarashtra?', 'sn': 'प्रथममपि पलायिते त्वयि प्रियकलहा धृतराष्ट्रसूनवः। स्मरसि ननु यदा प्रमोचिताः खचरगणानवजित्य पाण्डवैः॥'}

{'en': "When Virata's kine were seized by them, the Kauravas, overwhelining in number both as regards men and animals and having the preceptor, the preceptor's son and Bhishma amongst them, were defeated by that foremost of men. Why did you not defeat Arjuna then?", 'sn': 'समुदितबलवाहनाः पुनः पुरुषवरेण जिताः स्थ गोग्रहे। सगुरुगुरुसुताः सभीष्मकाः किमु न जितः स तदा त्वयाऽर्जुनः॥'}

{'en': "Another battle has presented itself today for your destruction. If you do not fly from the battle in fear of your enemies you will be killed, O charioteer's son, as soon as you will go to the battle.", 'sn': 'स्तव निधनाय सुयुद्धमद्य वै। यदि न रिपुभयात् पलायसे समरगतोऽद्य हतोऽसि सूतज॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said When the king of Madra was thus, in all sincerity, addressing these harsh words to him and singing the glories of his enemy, that slayer of foes, the commander of the Kuru army, excited with anger, said.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच इति बहु परुषं प्रभाषति प्रमनसि मद्रपती रिपुस्तवम्। भृशमभिरुषितः परंतपः कुरुपृतनापतिराह मद्रपम्॥'}

{'en': 'Karna said Let it be so. Why do you praise Arjuna so much. A battle will soon take place between him and me. If he defeats me in battle then your praises will be considered as well said.', 'sn': 'कर्ण उवाच भवतु भवतु कि विकत्यसे ननु मम तस्य हि युद्धमुद्यतम्। यदि स जयति मानिहाहवे तत इदमस्तु सुकस्थितं तव॥'}

{'en': "Sanjaya said The king of Madra said-'let it be so,' and gave no reply, when Karna desirous of fighting, said to Shalya 'go'. Then that carwarrior, having white horses and Shalya as his driver, dashed against his enemies killing a number of enemies in battle like the sun destroying darkness.", 'sn': 'संजय उवाच एवमस्त्विति मद्रेश उक्त्वा नोत्तरमुक्तवान्। याहि शल्येति चाप्येनं कर्णः प्राह युयुत्सया॥ स रथः प्रययौ शत्रूश्वेताश्वः शल्यसारथिः। निघ्नन्नमित्रान् समरे तमो घ्नन् सविता यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Then in that car covered with tiger-skins and white horses yoked to it, Karna went on cheerfully. And seeing the armies of the Pandavas he immediately inquired after Arjuna.', 'sn': 'ततः प्रायात् प्रीतिमान् वै रथेन वैया ण श्वेतयुजाथ कर्णः। स चालोक्य ध्वजिनी पाण्डवानां धनंजयं त्वरया पर्यपृच्छत्॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said I have heard, O Sanjaya as you have discoursed on, of the numerous and wonderful single combats fought between my warriors and those of the sons of Pandu.', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच बहूनि हि विचित्राणि द्वैस्थानि स्म संजय। पाण्डूनां मामकैः सार्धमश्रौषं तव जल्पतः॥'}

{'en': 'But, O Sanjaya, you never speak of my soldiers being delightful (on such occasion). You always speak of the warriors of the Pandavas as cheerful and never routed.', 'sn': 'न चैव मामकं किंचित् हृष्टं शंससि संजय। नित्यं पाण्डुसुतान् हृष्टानभग्नान् सम्प्रशंससि॥'}

{'en': 'You always speak of my warriors as depressed in mind, vanquished and shorn of energy in battle. O Suta, indubitably all this is brought about by Destiny.', 'sn': 'वै जीयमानान् विमनसो मामकान् विगतौजसः। वदसे संयुगे सूत दिष्टमेतन्न संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Your warriors strive in battle to the best of their strength and ardour, displaying, 0 foremost of the Bharatas, their manliness as much as possible.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच यथाशक्तिं यथोत्साहं युद्धे चेष्टन्ति तावकाः। दर्शयानाः परं शक्त्या पौरुषं पुरुषर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'Even as the very tasteful water of the celestial river Ganga flowing into that of the mighty main, aitains saline properties.', 'sn': 'गङ्गायाः सुरनद्या स्वादु भूत्वा यथोदकम्। महोदधेर्गुणाभ्यासाल्लवणत्वं निगच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'So also, O monarch, the mainlines of the illustrious warriors of your army opposed by that of the heroic sons of Pandu becomes baffled in battle.', 'sn': 'तथा तत् पौरुषं राजंस्तावकानां परंतप। प्राप्य पाण्डुसुतान् वीरान् व्यर्थं भवति संयुगे॥'}

{'en': 'It behaves you not, O foremost of the Kurus, to attribute blame to your own warriors, who exert themselves to the best of their inighty and achieve feats that are difficult of being done so.', 'sn': 'घटमानान् यथाशक्ति कुर्वाणान् कर्म दुष्करम्। न दोषेण कुरुश्रेष्ठ कौरवान् गन्तुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': "From your own fault, and from that of your son, ruler of men, this great and dreadful destruction ( of the creature of) the earth has come to pass, adding considerably to the population of Death's kingdom.", 'sn': 'तवापराधात् सुमहान् सपुत्रस्य विशाम्पते। पृथिव्याः प्रक्षयो घोरो यमराष्ट्रविवर्धनः॥'}

{'en': 'It behooves your not. O king, to grieve for what has come to pass in consequence of your own faults. The kings do not pay any the least regard to their lives in this battle.', 'sn': 'आत्मदोषात् समुत्पन्नं शोचितुं नार्हसे नृप। न हि रक्षन्ति राजान: सर्वथाऽत्रापि जीवितम्॥'}

{'en': 'The rulers of men (assembled on the filed), desire to attain to the regions of those that perform pious acts. always cherishing a desire for attaining paradise, they are fighting agitating the hostile army.', 'sn': 'युद्धे सुकृतिनां लोकानिच्छन्तो वसुधाधिपाः। चमू विगाह्य युध्यन्ते नित्यं स्वर्गपरायणाः॥'}

{'en': 'That afternoon, O mighty monarch a great destruction of creatures took place. Hear of me, with singleness of attention of that battle that ras.', 'sn': 'पूर्वाह्ने तु महाराज प्रावर्तत जनक्षयः। तं त्वमेकमना भूत्वा शृणु देवासुरोपमम्॥'}

{'en': 'The two (royal) brothers from Avanti, both mighty bow-men, possessed of great might, and exceeding effulgence, and both formidable in battle, beholding Iravat, rushed at him.', 'sn': 'आवन्त्यौ तु महेष्वासौ महासेनौ महाबलौ। इरावन्तमभिप्रेक्ष्य समेयातां रणोत्कटौ॥'}

{'en': 'Then the combat that was fought between them was dreadful and horripilating. thereupon Iravat waxing wrath, quickly pierced those two brothers of godly presence, with straight knotted shafts of exceeding sharpness. those two warriors versed in diverse odes of warfare pierced Iravat in return, in that battle,', 'sn': 'तेषां प्रववृते युद्धं सुमहल्लोमहर्षणम्। इरावांस्तु सुसंक्रुद्धो भ्रातरौ देवरूपिणौ॥ विव्याध निशितैस्तूर्णं शरैःसंनतपर्वभिः। तावेनं प्रत्यविध्येतां समरे चित्रयोधिनौ॥'}

{'en': 'As thcy fought on. O king, striking their best to slay their mutual foes and desirous of avenging what is done to one another, there could be found no distinction between them.', 'sn': 'युध्यतां हि तथा राजन् विशेषो न व्यदृश्यत। यततां शत्रुनाशाय कृतप्रतिकृतैषिणाम्॥'}

{'en': "Then in that conflict, Iravat, O king's with four arrows, dispatched the four steeds of Anuvinda to the regions of Death.", 'sn': 'इरावांस्तु ततो राजन्ननुविन्दस्य सायकैः। चतुरभिश्चतुरो वाहाननयद् यमसादनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Also, O sire, with a couple of keen-aged broad-headed arrows, the former cut off the standard and bow of the latter in that battle. all this, O king, seemed to be wonderful.', 'sn': 'भल्लाभ्यां च सुतीक्ष्णाभ्यां धनुः केतुं च मारिष। चिच्छेद समरे राजस्तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon Anuvinda leaving his own car, ascended that of Vinda; thereafter he grasped an excellent bow of great toughness and capable of bearing a great strain.', 'sn': 'त्यक्त्वानुविन्दोऽथ रथं विन्दस्य रथमास्थितः। धनुर्गृहीत्वा परमं भारसाधनमुत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then those two foremost of car-warriors endued with heroism and riding on one and the same car, both belonging to the country of Avanti, began to shower incessantly arrows on the high-souled Iravat.', 'sn': 'तावेकस्थो रणे वीरावावन्त्यौ रथिनां वरौ। शरान् मुमुग्रतुस्तूर्णमिरावति महात्मनि॥'}

{'en': 'Shot by them both, swift-fiying arrows decked with gold, intercepting the rays of the orb of the day, (literally) covered the sky.', 'sn': 'ताभ्यां मुक्ता महावेगाः शराः काञ्चनभूषणाः। दिवाकरपथं प्राप्य च्छादयामासुरम्बरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, inflamed with wrath, Iravat poured an arrow downpour on the two brothers both mighty car-warriors; and he felled their charioteer.', 'sn': 'इरावांस्तु रणे क्रुद्धो भ्रातरौ तौ महारथौ। ववर्ष शरवर्षेण सारथिं चाप्यपातयत्॥'}

{'en': 'When deprived of life, the charioteer fell down on the earth, the chariot was dragged in all directions in consequence of its horses being unrestrained.', 'sn': 'तस्मिंस्तु पतिते भूमौ गतसत्त्वे तु सारथौ! रथः प्रदुद्राव दिशः समुद्घान्तहयस्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Obtaining victory, O monarch, over the two brothers, the son of the daughter of the king of the Nagas displaying his inanliness, began speedily to spread havoc among your soldiers.', 'sn': 'तौ स जित्वा महाराज नागराजसुतासुतः। पौरुषं ख्यापयंस्तूर्णं व्यधमत् तव वाहिनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'This slaughtered in battle, the mighty army of the sons of Dhritarashtra performed various movements like a man reeling through the effects of poisoning.', 'sn': 'सा वध्यमाना समरे धार्तराष्ट्री महाचमूः। वेगान् बहुविधांश्चक्रे विषं पीत्वेव मानवः॥'}

{'en': 'Then the on of Hidimba, the foremost of the Rakshasas endued with great strength, riding on his chariot of solar has and furnished with a standard, rushed against Bhagadatta.', 'sn': 'हैडिम्बो राक्षसेन्द्रस्तु भगदत्तं समाद्रवत्। रथेनादित्यवर्णेन सध्वजेन महाबलः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the ruler of the Pragjyotishas mounted on his princes of elephants like the wielder of the thunder bolt mounting on his Airavat in the days of yore at the time of the battle caused by the insult offered by Taraka.', 'sn': 'ततः प्राग्ज्योतिषो राजा नागराज समास्थितः। यथा वज्रधरः पूर्वं संग्रामे तारकामये॥'}

{'en': 'Then there came the celestial along with the Gandharvas and the sages. They were unable to find out any destruction between the son of Hidimba and Bhagadatta.', 'sn': 'तत्र देवाः सगन्धर्वा ऋषयश्च समागताः। विशेषं न स्म विविदुईडिम्बभगदत्तयोः॥'}

{'en': 'As the lord of the celestial (Indra) waxing worth had struck terror into the hearts of the Danavas, so did also the ruler of the Pragjyotishas, O king, in that battle frighten and crush the Pandava troops.', 'sn': 'यथा सुरपतिः शक्रस्त्रासयामास दानवान्। तथैव समरे राजा द्रावयामास पाण्डवान्॥'}

{'en': 'Thus routed by hiin on all directions, the Pandava troops, O Bharata, did not find, in their whole host, an one competent to save them.', 'sn': 'तेन विद्राव्यमाणास्ते पाण्डवाः सर्वतो दिशम्। त्रातारं नाभ्यगच्छन्तः स्वेष्वनीकेषु भारत॥'}

{'en': 'We then only beheld the son of Bhimasena (Ghatotkacha), O Bharata riding on his car the rest of the car-warriors, with minds distracted (with fear) had fled (in all directions.', 'sn': 'भैमसेनि रथस्थं तु तत्रापश्याम भारत। शेषा विमनसो भूत्वा प्राद्रवन्त महारथाः॥'}

{'en': 'Then, O Bharata, when the Pandava forces rallied, a dreadful and fierce roar was sent up by your troops in that battle.', 'sn': 'निवृत्तेषु तु पाण्डूनां पुनः सैन्येषु भारत। आसीनिष्ठानका घोरस्तत सैन्यस्य संयुगे॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, O mighty monarch, in the fierce engagement that commenced Ghatotkacha covered Bhagadatta with a shower of arrows, like a rain cloud covering the Meru mountain with a downpour of rain.', 'sn': 'घटोत्कचस्ततो राजन् भगदत्त महारणे। शरैः प्रच्छादयामास मेरुं गिरिमिवाम्बुदः॥'}

{'en': 'Then king Bhagadatta, severing those arrows shot from the bow of the Rakshasas, in that combat quickly pierced the son of Bhimasena in all his vital parts.', 'sn': 'निहत्य ताशरान् राजा राक्षसस्य धनुश्च्युतान्। भैमसेनि रणे तूर्णं सर्वमर्मस्वताडयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Wounded with innumerable this straight jointed shafts, that foremost of the Rakshusas did not fight, (but stood firm) like a mountain though cleft open.', 'sn': 'स ताड्यमानो बहुभिः शरैः संनतपर्वभिः। न विव्यथे राक्षसेन्द्रो भिद्यमान इवाचलः॥'}

{'en': 'The ruler of the Pragjyotishas inflamed with rage, in that battle sped fourteen Tomaras against the Rakshasas, who (easily) cut them off.', 'sn': 'तस्य प्राग्ज्योतिषः क्रुद्धस्तोमरांश्च चतुर्दश। प्रेषयामास समरे ताश्चिच्छेद स राक्षसः॥'}

{'en': 'Then that Rakshasa of mighty arms cutting off those Tomaras, pierced Bhagadatta with seventy shafts of exceeding sharpness, all resembling the thunderbolt of Heaven.', 'sn': 'स तांश्छित्त्वा महाबाहुस्तोमरान् निशितैः शरैः। भगदत्तं च विव्याध सप्तत्या कङ्कपत्रिभिः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the king of the Pragjyotishas, in that combat, as if smiling, dispatched, O Bharata, to death the four horses of the Rakshasas.', 'sn': 'ततः प्राग्ज्योतिषो राजा प्रहसन्निव भारत। तस्याश्वांश्चतुरः संख्ये पातयामास सायकैः॥'}

{'en': 'Standing on his car of which the steeds were slain, that foremost of the Rakshasas endued with prowess hurled at the elephants of Bhagadatta, s Shakti, with great force.', 'sn': 'स हताश्वे रथे तिष्ठन् राक्षसेन्द्रः प्रतापवान्। शक्तिं चिक्षेप वेगेन प्राग्ज्योतिषगजं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'Then the ruler of the Pragjyotishas cut off that Shakti falling with great veheinence and furnished with a golden staff, into three splinters and the Shakti fell shattered on the ground.', 'sn': 'तामापतन्ती सहसा हेमदण्डां सुवेगिनीम्। त्रिधा चिच्छेद नृपतिः सा व्यकीर्यत मेदिनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'seeing his Shakti splintered into pieces, the son of Hidimba fled out of fear like Namuchi the foremost of the Daityas flying, in the days of yore, from the fight with Indra.', 'sn': 'शक्तिं विनिहतां दृष्ट्वा हैडिम्बः प्राद्रवद् भयात्। यथेन्द्रस्य रणात् पूर्वं नमुचिर्दैत्यसत्तमः॥'}

{'en': 'Obtaining victory, O king, in battle over that heroic and highly powerful Rakshasa of illustrious renown who is incapable of being vanquished evü by the god of Death and Varuna themselves.', 'sn': 'तं विजित्य रणे शूरं विक्रान्तं ख्यातपौरुषम्। अजेयं समरे वीरं यमेन वरुणेन च॥'}

{'en': 'Bhagadatta riding on his elephants crushed in that battle, the troops of the Pandavas, even like a wild elephants, that roves, O king, trampling lotus stems (underneath its huge feet).', 'sn': 'पाण्डवीं समरे सेनां सम्ममर्द स कुञ्जरः। यथा वनगजो राजन् मृनश्चरति पद्मिनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'The ruler of the Madra encountered in battle the twins (Nakula and Sahadeva. He covered his two nephews, both sons of Pandu, with an arrow down pour.', 'sn': 'मद्रेश्वरस्तु समरे यमाभ्यां समसज्जत। स्वस्त्रीयौ छादयांचक्रे शरौः पाण्डुनन्दनौ॥'}

{'en': 'Sahadeva finding himself encountered by his uncle in battle, shrouded him with a network of arrows, like clouds shrouding the solar orb.', 'sn': 'सहदेवस्तु समरे मातुलं दृश्य संगतम्। अवारयच्छरौघेण मेघो यद्वद् दिवाकरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Shrouded by that net-work of shafts the Madra king wore an appearance indicative of joy the twins also were greatly delighted for the sake of their mother.', 'sn': 'छाद्यमानः शरौघेण हृष्टरूपतरोऽभवत्। तयोश्चाप्यभवत् प्रीतिरतुला मातृकारणात्॥'}

{'en': "Thereafter in that combat, that mighty carwarriors the Madra king, O king, with four excellent arrows dispatched smilingly Nakula's four steeds to the monsoon of Death. Then that mighty car-warrior Nakula jumping down from his car of which the horses were slain.", 'sn': 'ततः प्रहस्य समरे नकुलस्य महारथः। अश्वांश्च चतुरो रांजश्चतुर्भिः सायकोत्तमैः॥ प्रेषयामास समरे यमस्य सदनं प्रति। हताश्वात् तु रथात् तूर्णमवप्लुत्य महारथः॥'}

{'en': 'Ascended the vehicle of his illustrious brother. Then in that battle the heroic, mounted on the same car, stretching their touch bows,', 'sn': 'आरुरोह ततो यानं भ्रातुरेव यशस्विनः। एकस्थौ तु रणे शूरो दृढे विक्षिप्य कार्मुकौ॥'}

{'en': 'Waxing irascible and becoming formidable in battle, covered the king of the Madras (with shafts). Covered with innumerable straightjointed arrows.', 'sn': 'मद्रराजरथं तूर्णं छादयामासतुः क्षणात्। स छाद्यमानो बहुभिः शरैः संनतपर्वभिः॥'}

{'en': 'Shot by his nephews, that foremost of men (the Madra king) moved not, but stood still even like a mountain; then as if smiling, he baffled that shower of arrows.', 'sn': 'स्वस्त्रीयाभ्यां नरव्याघ्रो नाकम्पत यथाऽचलः। प्रहसन्निव तां चापि शस्त्रवृष्टिं जघान ह॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the highly powerful Sahadeva, inflamed with wrath, grasping a dare, rushed at the ruler of Madras and then hurled it at him, O Bharata.', 'sn': 'सहदेवस्ततः क्रुद्धः शरमुद्गृह्य वीर्यवान्। पद्रराजमभिप्रेक्ष्य प्रेषयामास भारत।॥'}

{'en': 'That dare shot by him and coursing swiftly like the Garuda himself, penetrating through the body of the Madra king, fell down on earth.', 'sn': 'स शरः प्रेषितस्तेन गरुडानिलवेगवान्। मद्रराजं विनिर्भिद्य निपपात महीतले॥'}

{'en': 'Thus deeply pierced, and smarting with pain, that mighty car-warrior squatted down on the terrace of his car, and O mighty monarch he was overwhelmed with a swoon.', 'sn': 'स गाढविद्धो व्यथितो रथोपस्थे महारथः। निषसाद महाराज कश्मलं च जगाम ह॥'}

{'en': 'In that battle, seeing him (the Madra king) i senseless and fallen on the car and afflicted by the twins, his charioteer drove him on his vehicle away from the field of battle.', 'sn': 'तं विसंज्ञं निपतितं सूतः सम्प्रेक्ष्य संयुगे। अपोवाह रथेनाजौ यमाभ्यामभिपीडितम्॥'}

{'en': 'The sons of Dhritarashtra beholding the car of the ruler of the Madras turn away from the field, were all depressed in mind and thought that he was no longer alive.', 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वा मद्रेश्वररथं धार्तराष्ट्राः पराङ्मुखम्। सर्वे विमनसो भूत्वा नेदमस्तीत्यचिन्तयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Obtaining victory in battle, over their uncle, the sons of Madri, greatly delighted blew their conchs and roared out their war cries.', 'sn': 'निर्जित्य मातुलं संख्ये माद्रीपुत्रौ महारथौ। दध्मतुर्मुदितौ शङ्खौ सिंहनादं च नेदतुः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereafter filled with delight, they rushed against your host, O ruler of men, like the immortals Indra and Upendra, O king, rushing against the host of the Daityas.', 'sn': 'अभिदुद्रुवतुर्हष्टौ तव सैन्यं विशाम्पते। यथा दैत्यचमूं राजन्निन्द्रोपेन्द्राविवामरौ॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said Having fed thousands of Brahmanas with sweetened milk mixed with rice, honey and Ghee, with fruits and roots and with the meat of boar and deer the ruler of men king Yudhishthira entered into it (the palace). With food seasoned with sesame, with Tabanti (a sort of vegetable), with rice mixed with Ghee.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततः प्रवेशनं तस्यां चक्रे राजा युधिष्ठिरः। अयुतं भोजयित्वा तु ब्राह्मणानां नराधिपः॥ साज्येन पयसेनैव मधुना मिश्रितेन च। कृसरेणाथ जीवन्त्या हविष्येण च सर्वशः॥'}

{'en': 'With the various preparations of meat, with various kinds of other food, with various suckable and drinkable viands, with unused robes and clothes, and with excellent garlands, the king gratified the superior Brahmanas that had assembled there from various directions.', 'sn': 'भक्ष्यप्रकारैर्विविधैः फलैश्चापि तथा नृप। चोष्यैश्च विविधै राजन् पेयैश्च बहुविस्तरैः॥ अहतैश्चैव वासोभिर्माल्यैरुच्चावचैरपि। तर्पयामास विप्रेन्द्रान् नानादिग्भ्यः समागतान्॥'}

{'en': 'He also gave them each one thousand kine. O descendant of Bharata, their cry of “What an auspicious day" rose to the sky.', 'sn': 'ददौ तेभ्यः सहस्राणि गवां प्रत्येकशः पुनः। पुण्याहघोषस्तत्रासीद दिवस्पृगिव भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Having worshipped the gods with various kinds of music and with numerous sorts of costly perfumes, that best of the Kurus (Yudhishthira) entered (the hall).', 'sn': 'वादित्रैर्विविधैर्दिव्यैर्गन्धैरुच्चावचैरपि। पूजयित्वा कुरुश्रेष्ठो दैवतानि निवेश्य च॥'}

{'en': 'The athletes, actors, prize-fighter bards and praise-singers exhibited their skill to amuse the illustrious son of Dharma (Yudhishthira).', 'sn': 'तत्र मल्ला नटा झल्ला: सूता वैतालिकास्तथा। उपतस्थुर्महात्मानं धर्मपुत्रं युधिष्ठिरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having thus performed many ceremonies, the Pandava (Yudhishthira) with his brothers sported in that charming assembly hall as Shakra (Indra) in heaven.', 'sn': 'तथा स कृत्वा पूजां तां भ्रातृभिः सह पाण्डवः। तस्यां सभायां रम्यायां रेमे शक्रो यथा दिवि॥'}

{'en': 'On the seats in that assembly-hall sat with the Pandavas the Rishis and the kings that came from various countries.', 'sn': 'सभायामृषयस्तस्यां पाण्डवैः सह आसते। आसांचक्रुनरेन्द्राश्च नानादेशसमागताः॥'}

{'en': 'Asita, Devala, Satya, Sarpamali, Mahashira, Arvavasa, Sumitra, Maitreya, Shunaka, Bali, Baka, Dalbhya, Sthulashira, Krishna Dvaipayana, Shuka, Sumanta, Gemini, Paila, the pupils of Vyasa, namely ourselves, Tittri, Yajnavalkya, Lomaharsana with his on, Apsuhomya, Dhaumya, Animandavya, Kaushika, Damoshnisha, Traibali, Parnada, Varajanuka, Maunjayana, Vayubhaksha, Parasarya, Sarika, Balivaka, Sinivaka, Satyapala, Kritashrama, Jatukarna, Shikhavana, Alamba, Parijataka, the high-souled Parvata, the great Rishi Markandeya, Pavitrapani, Savarma, Bhaluki, Galava, Janghabandhu, Raibhya, Kopavega, Bhrigu, Haribabhru, Kaundinya, Babhrumali, Sanatana, Kakshivana, Aushija, Nachiketa, Gautama, Painga, Varaha, greatly ascetic Shandilya, Kukkura, Venujangha, Kalapa and Katha. All were Rishis of great virtue and learning with their souls under complete control and passions under complete subjugation.', 'sn': 'असितो देवलः सत्यः सर्पिर्माली महाशिराः। अर्वावसुः सुमित्रश्च मैत्रेयः शुनको बलिः॥ बको दाल्भ्यः स्थूलशिराः कृष्णद्वैपायनः शुकः। सुमन्तुजैमिनिः पैलो व्यासशिष्यास्तथा वयम्॥ तित्तिरिर्याज्ञवल्क्यश्च ससुतो लोमहर्षणः। अप्सुहोम्यश्च धौम्यश्च अणीमाण्डव्यकौशिकौ॥ दामोष्णीषस्त्रैबलिश्च पर्णादो घटजानुकः। मौञ्जायनो वायुभक्षः पाराशर्यश्च सारिकः॥ बलिवाकः सिनीवाकः सत्यपालः कृतश्रमः। जातूकर्ण: शिखावांश्च आलम्बः पारिजातकः॥ पर्वतश्च महाभागो मार्कण्डेयो महामुनिः। पवित्रपाणि: सावर्णो भालुकिर्गालवस्तथा॥ जङ्घाबन्धुश्च रैभ्यश्च कोपवेगस्तथा भृगुः। हरिबभ्रुश्च कौण्डिन्यो बभ्रुमाली सनातनः॥ काक्षीवानौशिजश्चैव नाचिकेतोऽथ गौतमः। पैङ्गयो वराहः शुनकः शाण्डिल्यश्च महातपाः॥ कुक्कुरो वेणुजङ्घोऽथ कालापः कद्द एव च। मुनयो धर्मविद्वांसो धृतात्मानो जितेन्द्रियाः॥'}

{'en': 'These and many others, as numerous as the above, all learned in the Vedas and the Vedangas, conversant with all moralities, all pure and spotless in conduct, waited upon the illustrious (king) and pleased him with their sacred discourses. Many chief Kshatriyas also waited upon Dharmaraja (Yudhishthira).', 'sn': 'एते चान्ये च बहवो वेदवेदाङ्गपारगाः। उपासते महात्मानं सभायामृषिसत्तमाः॥ कथयन्तः कथाः पुण्या धर्मज्ञा शुचयोऽमलाः। तथैव क्षत्रियश्रेष्ठा धर्मराजमुपासते॥'}

{'en': 'The fortunate and virtuous Munjaketu, Vivardhana Sangramjit Durmukha, the powerful Ugrasena, Kakshasena, the lord of the Earth, the invincible Kshemaka, the king of Kamboja, Kamatha the mighty Kampana who made the javanas tremble at his name as the wielder of thunder Indra made the Asuras Kalkeyas tremble at his name.', 'sn': 'श्रीमान् महात्मा धर्मात्मा मुञ्जकेतुर्विवर्धनः। संग्रामजिद् दुमुखश्च उग्रसेनश्च वीर्यवान्॥ कक्षसेनः क्षितिपतिः क्षेमकश्चापराजितः। कम्बोजराजः कमद्दः कम्पनश्च महाबलः॥ सततं कम्पयामास यवनानेक एव यः। बलपौरुषसम्पन्नान् कृतास्त्रानमितौजसः। यथासुरान् कालकेयान् देवो वज्रधरास्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'Jatasura, the king of the Madrakas, Kunti, the king of the Kiratas, Pulinda, the kings of Anga and Banga, Pundraka and Pandya, the king of Udhara and Andhaka, Sumitra, the slayer of foes Shaivya, the king of the Kiratas, Sumana, the king of the Yavanas Chanur, Devarata, Bhoja, Bhimaratha, the king of Kalinga, Shrutayudha, the king of Magadha, Jayasena, Sukarman, Chekitana, that slayer of foes Puru, Ketumana, Vasudana, Videha, Kritakshana, Sudharma, Aniruddha, the greatly strong Shrutayu, the invincible Anuparaja, the handsome Kramajit, Sisupala with his son, the king of Karusha, the invincible and celestialslike young heroes of the Vrishni race, namely Ahuka, Viprithu, Gada, Sarana, Akrura, Kritavarman, the son of Sini, Satyaka, Bhishmaka, Akriti, the powerful Dyumtsena, those chiefs of bow men, the Kaikeyas and Yajnasena of the Somaka race.', 'sn': 'जटासुरो मद्रकाणां च राजा कुन्तिः पुलिन्दश्च किरातराजः। तथाऽऽङ्गवाङ्गौ सह पुण्ड्रकेण पाण्ड्योड्रराजौ च सहान्ध्रकेण॥ अङ्गो वङ्गः सुमित्रश्च शैब्यश्चामित्रकर्शनः। किरातराजः सुमना यवनाधिपतिस्तथा॥ चाणूरो देवरातश्च भोजो भीमरथश्च यः। श्रुतायुधश्च कालिङ्गो जयसेनश्च मागधः॥ सुकर्मा चेकितानश्च पुस्श्वामित्रकर्शनः। केतुमान् वसुदानश्च वैदेहोऽथ कृतक्षणः॥ सुधर्मा चानिरुद्धश्च श्रुतायुश्च महाबलः। अनूपराजो दुर्धर्षः क्रमजिच्च सुदर्शनः॥ शिशुपालः सहसुत: करूषाधिपतिस्तथा। वृष्णीनां चैव दुर्धर्षाः कुमारा देवरूपिणः॥ आहुको विपृथुश्चैव गदः सारण एव च। अक्रूरः कृतवर्मा च सत्यकश्च शिनेः सुतः॥ भीष्मकोऽथाकृतिश्चैव धुमत्सेनश्च वीर्यवान्। केकयाश्च महेष्वासा यज्ञसेनश्च सौमकिः॥'}

{'en': 'These greatly powerful and all well-armed and wealthy, Ketuman and Vasumana and many other Kshatriya, as numerous as the above, and all considered to be the foremost (men among the Kshatriyas waited on that assembly-hall upon the son of Kunti Yudhishthira. O king, those powerful princes that learnt science of arms from Arjuna, dressing themselves in deer skins, and those princes of the Vrishni race,', 'sn': 'केतुमान् वसुमांश्चैव कृतास्त्रश्च महाबलः। एते चान्ये च बहवः क्षत्रिया मुख्यसम्मताः॥ उपासते सभायां स्म कुन्तीपुत्रं युधिष्ठिरम्। अर्जुनं ये च संश्रित्य राजपुत्रा महाबलाः॥ अशिक्षन्त धनुर्वेदं रौरवाजिनवाससः। तत्रैव शिक्षिता राजन् कुमारा वृष्णिनन्दनाः॥'}

{'en': 'Namely, the son of Rukmani (Pradyumna), Samba, Yuyudhana, the son of Satyaka (Satyaki), Sudharmana, Anirudha, Shaivya, these foremost of men (all waited upon Yudhishthira).', 'sn': 'रौक्मिणेयश्च साम्बश्च युयुधानश्च सात्यकिः। सुधर्मा चानिरुद्धश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुङ्गवः॥'}

{'en': 'O lord of the earth, these and many other kings, (waited upon Yudhishthira) the friend of Dhananjaya (Arjuna) Tumbaru, Chitrasena with his ministers, and many other Gandharvas and Apsaras, all well-skilled in singing and playing music, and expert in cadence, and also the Kinnaras, well-skilled in measures and motions, all at the command of Tumbaru waited upon and amused the sons of Pandu and so did also the Rishis (that were present there) by singing celestials songs in proper and charming voice. Those best of men, those best of men, those men of rigid vows, those men with heart devoted to truth all waited upon Yudhishthira, as the celestials wait upon Brahma in heaven.', 'sn': 'एते चान्ये च बहवो राजानः पृथिवीपते। धनंजयसखा चात्र नित्यमास्ते स्म तुम्बुरुः॥ उपासते महात्मानमासीनं सप्तविंशतिः। चित्रसेनः सहामात्यो गन्धर्वाप्सरसस्तथा॥ गीतवादित्रकुशलाः साम्यतालविशारदाः। प्रमाणेऽथ लये स्थाने किन्नराः कृतनिश्रमाः॥ संचोदितास्तुम्बुरुणा गन्धर्वसहितास्तदा। गायन्ति दिव्यतानैस्ते यथान्यायं मनस्विनः। पाण्डुपुत्रानृषींश्चैव रमयन्त उपासते॥ तस्यां सभायामासीनाः सुव्रताः सत्यसंगराः। दिवीव देवा ब्रह्माणं युधिष्ठिरमुपासते॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said Seeing my sons, so many in number, slain by one, what, O Sanjaya, did, Bhishma, Drona, and Kripa do?', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच दृष्ट्वा मे निहतान् पुत्रान् बहूनेकेन संजय। भीष्मो द्रोणः कृपश्चैव किमकुर्वत संयुगे।।।'}

{'en': 'Day by day, O Sanjaya, my sons are being destroyed. Indeed 0 Suta, I consider them to be completely struck down by (Evil) Destiny. are', 'sn': 'अहन्यहनि मे पुत्राः क्षयं गच्छन्ति संजय। मन्येऽहं सर्वथा सूत दैवेनोपहता भृशम्॥'}

{'en': 'In as much as, my sons are never victorious and are ever vanquished in battle, in as much as my sons remaining amidst, Drona, Bhishma, the illustrious Kripa, and the heroic son of Somadatta, and Bhagadatta, and O son, Ashvathama, and many other heroic and valiant warriors of high-soul, still slaughtered in battle, what can it be but (adverse) Fate?', 'sn': 'यत्र मे तनया: जीयन्ते न जयनत्युत। यत्र भीष्मस्य द्रोणस्य कृपस्य च महात्मनः॥ सौमदत्तेश्च वीरस्य भगदत्तस्य चोभयोः। अश्वत्थाम्नस्तथा तात शूराणामनिवर्तिनाम्॥ अन्येषां चैव शूराणां मध्यगास्तनया मम। यदहन्यन्त संग्रामे किमन्यद् भागधेयतः॥'}

{'en': 'The wicked Duryodhana did not listen to our advise before. Forbidden, O son by myself, by Bhishma, by Vidura,', 'sn': 'न हि दुर्योधनो मन्दः पुरा प्रोक्तमबुध्यत। वार्यमाणो मया तात भीष्मेण विदुरेण च॥'}

{'en': 'By his mother Gandhari ever anxious to compass his good, that perverse Duryodhana did not comprehend our words before through his folly. Now he reaps the fruits of his own actions,', 'sn': 'गान्धार्या चैव दुर्मेधाः सततं हितकाम्यया। नाबुध्यत पुरा मोहात् तस्य प्राप्तमिदं फलम्॥'}
{'en': 'In as much as, day by day, waxing worth in battle, Bhimasena is dispatching my sons to the abode of death.', 'sn': 'यद् भीमसेनः समरे पुत्रान् मम विचेतसः। अहन्यहनि संक्रुद्धो नयते यमसादनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Those excellent words of Khattva have now been verified, which, O lord, uttered as they were for your good, you did not pay any heed to before.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच इदं तत् समनुप्राप्तं क्षत्तुर्वचनमुत्तमम्। न बुद्धवानसि विभो प्रोच्यमानं हितं तदा॥'}

{'en': "'Withhold your sons from the dice, do not persecute the sons of Pandu', these words, spoken by your well-wishing friends,", 'sn': 'निवारय सुतान् द्यूतात् पाण्डवान् मा दुहेति च। सुहृदां हितकामानां ब्रुवतां तत् तदेव च॥'}

{'en': 'You did not listen to, like one on death-bed neglecting wholesome medicine. It is now that you relies those words spoken by the righteous.', 'sn': 'न शुश्रूषसि तद् वाक्यं मर्त्यः पथ्यमिवौषधम्। तदेव त्वामनुप्राप्तं वचनं साधुभाषितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Disregarding the salutary advice offered by well-wishing friends like Bhishma, Drona, Vidura and others, the descendants of the Kuru race are reaping destruction.', 'sn': 'विदुरद्रोणभीष्माणां तथान्येषां हितैषिणाम्। अकृत्वा वचनं पथ्यं क्षयं गच्छन्ति कौरवाः॥'}

{'en': 'Now, O monarch, the inevitable consequence of all that has arrived. Listen now from me as to how the battle was fought.', 'sn': 'तदेतत् समनुप्राप्तं पूर्वमेव विशाम्पते। तस्मात् त्वं शृणु तत्त्वेन यथा युद्धमवर्तत॥'}

{'en': 'At mid-day, O king, the battle regard fiercely and the carnage that took place was exceedingly terrible. Hear me narrate it.', 'sn': 'मध्याह्ने सुमहारौद्रः संग्रामः समपद्यत। लोकक्षयकरो राजस्तन्मे निगदतः शृणु।॥'}

{'en': 'Then at the command of the son of Dharma (Yudhishthira), all the troops of the Pandava host inflamed with rage, rushed against Bhishma, out of a desire for slaying him.', 'sn': 'ततः सर्वाणि सैन्यानि धर्मपुत्रस्य शासनात्। संरब्धान्यभ्यवर्तन्त भीष्ममेव जिघांसया॥'}

{'en': 'Dhrishtadyumna, Shikhandin and the mighty car-warriors Satyaki, uniting together their divisions, rushed, O mighty monarch, against Bhishma.', 'sn': 'धृष्टद्युम्नः शिखण्डी च सात्यकिश्च महारथतः। युक्तानीका महाराज भीष्ममेव समभ्ययुः॥'}

{'en': 'Then the mighty car-warriors Virata and Drupada accompanied by all the Somakas rushed even against Bhishma himself.', 'sn': 'विराटो द्रुपदश्चैव सहिताः सर्वसोमकैः। अभ्यद्रवन्त संग्रामे भीष्ममेव महारथम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Kaikeyas, and Dhrishtaketu, and Kuntibhoja, clad in mail and supported by their armies, rushed, O monarch, against Bhishma himself.', 'sn': 'केकया धृष्टकेतुश्च कुन्तिभोजश्च दंशितः। युक्तानीका महाराज भीष्ममेव समभ्ययुः॥'}

{'en': 'Arjuna, the son of Draupadi, and the highly powerful Chekitana, rushed against the kings commanded by Duryodhana himself.', 'sn': 'अर्जुनो द्रौपदेयाश्च चेकितानश्च वीर्यवान्। दुर्योधनसमादिष्टान् राज्ञः सर्वान् समभ्ययुः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereafter, the valiant Abhimanyu, that mighty car-warrior, the son of Hidimba, and Bhimasena himself, all wrought up with wrath, assaulted the Kauravas.', 'sn': 'अभिमन्युस्तथा शूरो हैडिम्बश्च महारथः। भीमसेनश्च संक्रुद्धस्तेऽभ्यधावन्त कौरवान्॥'}

{'en': 'Thus were the Kauravas slain in battle by the Pandavas divided in two divisions, so also, O monarch, the Pandavas were slaughtered by the Kauravas in that fight.', 'sn': 'त्रिधाभूतैरवध्यन्त पाण्डवैः कौरवा युधि। तथैव कौरवै राजन्नवध्यन्त परे रणे॥'}

{'en': "Then that foremost of car-warriors namely Drona, excited with rage, rushed against the 'Somakas and the Srinjayas, dispatching them to the mansion of death.", 'sn': 'द्रोणस्तु रथिनः श्रेष्ठान् सोमकान् संजयैः सह। अभ्यधावत संक्रुद्धः प्रेषयिष्यन् यमक्षयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then the high-souled Srinjaya, set up a loud and distressful cry when, o king they were thus being slaughtered in battle by that great bowman the son of Bharadvaja.', 'sn': 'तत्राक्रन्दो महानासीत् सुंजयानां महात्मनाम्। वध्यतां समरे राजन् भारद्वाजेन धन्विना॥'}

{'en': 'Innumerable Kshatriya warriors, smitten by Drona were seen to conclusive like persons suffering from agonising ailments.', 'sn': 'द्रोणेन निहतास्तत्र क्षत्रिया बहवो रणे। विचेष्टन्तो ह्यदृश्यन्त व्याधिक्लिष्टा नरा इव॥'}

{'en': 'They gleaned and moaned and cries and uttered cries of agony in consequence of which a confused noise was heard, resembling that produced by men struck with famine.', 'sn': 'कूजतां क्रन्दतां चैव रस्तनतां चैव भारत। अनिशं शुश्रुवै शब्दः क्षुत्क्लिष्टानां नृणामिव॥'}

{'en': 'On the other hand, the highly puissant Bhimasena, waxing worth, caused a dreadful carnage among the Kaurava ranks like another god of Death himself.', 'sn': 'तथैव कौरवेयाणां भीमसेनो महाबलः। चकार कदनं घोरं क्रुद्धः काल इवापरः॥'}

{'en': 'In that fierce fight, as the troops slew one another, a terrible river started up into existence on the field of battle, of which the waves and currents were formed of blood.', 'sn': 'वध्यतां तत्र सैन्यानामन्योन्येन महारणे। प्रावर्तत नदी घोरा रुधिरौघप्रवाहिनी॥'}

{'en': "That great battle, O mighty monarch, between the Kurus and the Pandavas, was indeed very dreadful in its aspect; and it considerably swelled the population of Death's domain.", 'sn': 'स संग्रामो महाराज घोररूपोऽभवन्महान्। कुरूणां पाण्डवानां च यमराष्ट्रविवर्धनः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereafter Bhima inflamed with rage, fell with impetuosity upon the elephant-division of the Kurus, and many were the beasts that he sent to the regions of Death.', 'sn': 'ततो भीमो रणे क्रुद्धो रभसश्च विशेषतः। गजानीकं समासाद्य प्रेषयामास मृत्यवे॥'}

{'en': 'There, in that battle, O Bharata, many were the elephants that pierced with Nacharas by Bhima, fell and were confounded and shrieked and careered in all directions.', 'sn': 'तत्र भारत भीमेन नाराजाभिहता गजाः। पेतुर्नेदुश्च सेदुश्च दिसश्च परिबभ्रमुः॥'}

{'en': 'Huge elephants, with their trucks cut off, and their bodies mangled, fell down on the earth, O sire, screaming like cranes.', 'sn': 'छिन्नहस्ता महानागाश्छिन्नगात्राश्च मारिष। क्रौञ्चवद् व्यनदन् भीताः पृथिवीमधिशेरते॥'}

{'en': 'Nakula and Sahadeva, both together, charged the cavalry-division. Those horses decked with golden chains and caparisons of the same metal.', 'sn': 'नकुलः सहदेवश्च हयानीकमभिद्रुतौ। ते हयाः काञ्चनापीडा रुक्मभाण्डपरिच्छदाः॥'}

{'en': 'Were scen to be slain by hundreds and by thousands; and O monarch, the earth was strewn over with falling horses.', 'sn': 'वध्यमाना व्यदृश्यन्त शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः। पतिद्भिस्तुरगै राजन् समास्तीर्यत मेदिनी॥'}

{'en': 'The earth looked awful, O foremost of men, being covered over with horses of diverse appearance, some of which, again were breathing hard, some meaning and some deprived of their lives.', 'sn': 'निर्जिकैश्च श्वसद्धिश्च कूजद्भिश्च गतासुभिः। हयैर्बभौ नरश्रेष्ठ नानारूपधरैर्धरा॥'}

{'en': 'The earth also, O Bharata, appeared lawfully beautiful being over strewn with kings slain by Arjuna in the encounter.', 'sn': 'अर्जुनेन हतैः संख्ये तथा भारत राजभिः। प्रबभौ वसुधा घोरा तत्र तत्र विशाम्पते॥'}

{'en': 'With shattered chariots, and torn flags and umbrellas of great effulgence, with rent Chamaras and fans, and with mighty weapons splintered into pierces,', 'sn': 'स्थैर्भग्नैर्ध्वजैश्छिन्नैनिकृत्तैश्च महायुधैः। चामरैर्व्यजनैश्चैव छत्रैश्च सुमहाप्रभैः॥'}

{'en': 'With garlands and necklaces of gold, with heads graced with ear-rings, with bracelets, with head-gears fallen off from the heads, and with streamers,', 'sn': 'हारैर्निष्कैः सकेयूरैः शिरोभिश्च सकुण्डलैः। उष्णीषैरपविद्धैश्च पताकाभिश्च सर्वशः॥'}

{'en': 'With well-made car-bottoms, and O king, with reins and riggings-covered with all these things, the earth appeared as beautiful as she appears during the spring being strewn over with blossoms.', 'sn': 'अनुकषैः शुभै राजन् योक्त्रैश्चैव सरश्मिभिः। संकीर्णा वसुधा भाति वसन्ते कुसुमैरिव॥'}

{'en': 'Such also was the carnage caused in the Pandava host, О Bharata, when the son of Shantanu, and Drona that foremost of carwarriors were enraged;', 'sn': 'एवमेष क्षयो वृत्तः पाण्डूनामपि भारत। क्रुद्ध शान्तनवे भीष्मे द्रोणे च रथसत्तमे॥'}

{'en': 'As also when Ashvathama, and Kripa and Kritavarma (were wrought up with rage). So also your troops under went destruction when the other side was inflamed with wrath.', 'sn': 'अश्वत्थाम्नि कृपे चैव तथैव कृतवर्मणि। तथेतरेषु क्रुद्धेषु तावकानामपि क्षयः॥'}

{'en': 'Vyasa said: O greatly wise Dhritarashtra, hear my words. I shall tell you what will be the great good of all the Kurus.', 'sn': 'व्यास उवाच धृतराष्ट्र महाप्राज्ञ निबोध वचनं मम। वक्ष्यामि त्वां कौरवाणां सर्वेषां हितमुत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'O mighty-armed hero, it has not pleased me that the Pandavas have gone to the forest, having been dishonestly defeated by Duryodhana and others.', 'sn': 'न मे प्रियं महाबाहो यद् गताः पाण्डवा वनम्। निकृत्या निकृताश्चैव दुर्योधनपुरोगमैः॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, on the expiration of the thirteenth year, recollecting all their woes, they may shower virulent poisons on the Kurus.', 'sn': 'ते स्मरन्तः परिक्लेशान् वर्षे पूर्णे त्रयोदशे। विमोक्ष्यन्ति विषं क्रुद्धाः कौरवेयेषु भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Why does your wicked-minded and sinful son angrily want to kill the Pandavas for the sake of the kingdom?', 'sn': 'तदयं किं नु पापात्मा तव पुत्रः सुमन्दधी। पाण्डवान् नित्यसंक्रुद्धो राज्यहेतोर्जिघांसति॥'}

{'en': 'Let the fool be checked; let your son remain quiet. In attempting to kill them (the Pandavas) now living in the forest, he will loose his own life.', 'sn': 'वार्यतां साध्वयं मूढः शमं गच्छतु ते सुतः। वनस्थांस्तानयं हन्तुमिच्छन् प्राणान् विमोक्ष्यति॥'}
{'en': 'You are as pious as the wise Vidura, Bhishma, myself, Kripa or Drona.', 'sn': 'यथा हि विदुर: प्राज्ञो यथा भीष्मो यथा वयम्। यथा कृपश्च द्रोणश्च तथा साधुर्भवानपि॥'}

{'en': 'O greatly intelligent man, dissension with relatives is improper. It is sinful and reprehensible. O king, you should desist from it.', 'sn': 'विग्रहो हि महाप्राज्ञ स्वजनेन विगर्हितः। अधर्म्यमयशस्यं च मा राजन् प्रतिपद्यताम्॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, he (Duryodhana) looks towards the Pandavas with such jealousy that unless you interfere, great harm will be the consequence.', 'sn': 'समीक्षा यादृशी ह्यस्य पाण्डवान् प्रति भारत। उपेक्ष्यमाणा स राजन् महान्तमनयं स्पृशेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Or let this wicked son of yours go to the forest alone and unaccompanied. O king, O lord of men, if the Pandavas, from association with him, feel an attachment for your son, then good fortune will be yours.', 'sn': 'अथवायं सुमन्दात्मा वनं गच्छतु ते सुतः। पाण्डैवः सहितो राजन्नेक एवासहायवान्॥ ततः संसर्गजः स्नेहः पुत्रस्य तव पाण्डवैः। यदि स्यात् कृतकार्योऽद्य भवेस्त्वं मनुजेश्वर।॥'}

{'en': "O great king, it has been heard that a man's nature derived from his birth does not leave him till death. What do Bhishma, Drona and Vidura think? What do you think? What id proper should be done at once, else your purpose will ever remain unrealised.", 'sn': 'अथवा जायमानस्य यच्छीलमनुजायते। श्रूयते तन्महाराज नामृतस्यापसर्पति॥ कथं वा मन्यते भीष्मो द्रोणोऽथ विदुरोऽपि वा। भवान् वात्र क्षमं कार्य पुरा वोऽर्थोऽभिवर्धते॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : O foremost of men, having heard the words of Bhima, that chastiser of foes, the son of Kunti, Yudhishthira, sighed and reflected in silence. (He thought in his mind) “I have heard the duties of king recited to me. I have heard also the duties of the different orders.
