He sees truly who sees how to regulate his conduct both in the present and in the future.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच भीमसेनवचः श्रुत्वा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः। निःश्वस्य पुरुषव्याघ्रः सम्प्रदध्यौ परंतपः॥ श्रुता मे राजधर्माश्च वर्णानां च विनिश्चयाः। आयत्यां च तदात्वे च यः पश्यति स पश्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Knowing as I do the true course of Dharma, which is so difficult to be known, how can I forcibly grind it, which would be like my grinding the Meru (mountain)."', 'sn': 'धर्मस्य जानमानोऽहं गतिमवयां सुदुर्विदाम्। कथं बलात् करिष्यामि मेरोरिव विमर्दनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having thus reflected for a moment and having also settled in his mind) what he should do, he thus spoke to Bhimasena without allowing him to say anything.', 'sn': 'स मुहूर्तमिवध्यात्वा विनिश्चत्येतिकृत्यताम्। भीमसेनमिदं वाक्यमपदान्तरमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said: O descendant of Bharata, O mighty-armed hero, what you say is true. O best of speakers, listen (also) to what I say.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच एवमेतन्महाबाहो यथा वदसि भारत। इदमन्यत् समादत्स्व वाच्यं मे वाक्यकोविद॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, O Bhimasena, the greatly sinful deeds that one wants to perforin depending only on his courage become a source of pain to him.', 'sn': 'महापापानि कर्माणि यानि केवलसाहसात्। आरभ्यन्ते भीमसेन व्यथन्ते तानि भारत॥'}

{'en': 'But, O mighty-armed hero, whatever is performed with (due) deliberation, with welldirected prowess, with all (necessary) appliances and with much previous thought, is (always) seen to be successful (at the end.) The celestials themselves favour such acts.', 'sn': 'समुन्त्रिते सुविक्रान्ते सुकृते सुविचारिते। सिध्यन्त्यर्था महाबाहो दैवं चात्र प्रदक्षिणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hear something about the act which you think should be at once done from your pride of strength and restlessness of mind.', 'sn': 'यत् तु केवचापल्याद् बलदपोत्थितः स्वयम्। आरब्धव्यमिदं कार्यं मन्यसे शृणु तत्र मे॥'}

{'en': 'Bhurishrava, Shalva, the powerful Jarasandha, Bhishma, Drona, Karna, the mighty son of Drona (Ashvathama). The invincible sons of Dhritarashtra Duryodhana and others, all are accomplished in arms and ever ready for battle. Those kings and the rulers of the world, who have been injured by us, have all taken the side of the Kurus; and their affection has grown towards them.', 'sn': 'भूरिश्रवाः शलश्चैव जलसंधश्च वीर्यवान्। भीष्मो द्रोणश्च कर्णश्च द्रोणपुत्रश्च वीर्यवान्॥ धार्तराष्ट्रा दुराधर्षा दुर्योधनपुरोगमाः। सर्व एव कृतास्त्राश्च सततं चाततायिनः॥ राजानः पार्थिवाश्चैव येऽस्माभिरुपतापिताः। संश्रिताः कौरवं पक्षं जातस्नेहाश्च तं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, they are engaged in seeking to do good to Duryodhana and not to us. With their treasury full and large army, they will try their best in the war (to defeat us).', 'sn': 'दुर्योधनहिते युक्ता न तथास्मासु भारत। पूर्णकोशा बलोपेताः प्रयतिष्यन्ति संगरे॥'}

{'en': 'All the officers of the Kuru army with their sons and relatives have been honoured by Duryodhana with the presentation of wealth according to proper divisions.', 'sn': 'सर्वे कौरवसैन्यस्य सपुत्रामात्यसैनिकाः। संविभक्ता हि मात्राभिर्भोगैरपि च सर्वशः॥'}

{'en': 'These heroes have been much honored by Duryodhana. My firm conviction is that they will give their lives in battle for him,', 'sn': 'दुर्योधनेन ते वीरा मानिताश्च विशेषतः। प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यन्ति संग्रामे इति मे निश्चिता मतिः॥'}

{'en': 'O mighty-armed hero, though the behaviour of Bhishma, Drona and the high-souled Kripa is the same (to both parties). Yet it is my firin conviction that they would sacrifice in battle their lives, then which there is nothing dearer in this world, so that they might pay off (their debt) in the shape of royal favours which they enjoy.', 'sn': 'समा यद्यपि भीष्मस्य वृत्तिरस्मासु तेषु च। द्रोणस्य च महाबाहो कृपस्य च महात्मनः॥ अवश्यं राजपिण्डस्तैर्निर्वेश्य इति मे मतिः। तस्मात् त्यक्ष्यन्ति संग्रामे प्राणानपि सुदुस्त्यजान्॥'}

{'en': 'They are all masters in celestials weapons and they are all devoted to virtue. My opinion is that they cannot be vanquished even by the celestials with Vasava (Indra) at their head.', 'sn': 'सर्वे दिव्यास्त्रविद्वांसः सर्वेधर्मपरायणाः। अजेयाश्चेति मे बुद्धिरपि देवैः सवासवैः॥'}

{'en': 'There is Karna, the great car-warrior, who is impetuous. ever angry, invincible, accomplished in all weapons and encased in impenetrable armour.', 'sn': 'अमर्षी नित्यसंरब्धस्तत्र कर्णो महारथः। सर्वास्त्रविदनाधृष्यो ह्यभेद्यकवचावृतः॥'}

{'en': 'Without first defeating in battle all these foremost of men, you cannot, unaided as you are, kill Duryodhana.', 'sn': 'अनिर्जित्य रणे सर्वानेतान् पुरुषसत्तमान्। अशक्यो ह्यसहायेन हन्तुं दुर्योधनस्त्वया॥'}

{'en': "O Vrikodara, I cannot sleep as I ponder upon the lightness of hand that the Suta's son (Karna) possesses. I consider him to be the foremost of all wielders of bows.", 'sn': 'न निद्रामधिगच्छामि चिन्तयानो वृकोदर। अतिसर्वान्धनुाहान् सूतपुत्रस्य लाघवम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Having heard these words, the impetuous Bhimasena became alarmed and pensive; and he did not utter a word.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एतद् वचनमाज्ञाय भीमसेनोऽत्यमर्षणः। बभूव विमनास्त्रस्तो न चैवोवाच किंचन॥'}

{'en': 'When the Pandavas were talking one another, there came to that place the great ascetic Vyasa, the son of Satyavati.', 'sn': 'तयोः संवदतोरेवं तदा पाण्डवयोर्द्वयोः। आजगाम महायोगी व्यास: सत्यवतीसुतः॥'}

{'en': 'When he arrived, he was duly worshipped by the sons of Pandu. That best of speakers then thus spoke to Yudhishthira.', 'sn': 'सोऽभिगम्य यथान्यायं पाण्डवैः प्रतिपूजितः। युधिष्ठिरमिदं वाक्यमुवाच वदतां वरः॥'}

{'en': 'Vyasa said : O mighty-armed Yudhishthira, O best of men, knowing by my intelligence what is passing in your mind, I have speedily come to this place.', 'sn': 'व्यास उवाच युधिष्ठिर महाबाहो वेद्मि ते हृदयस्थितम्। मनीषया ततः क्षिप्रमागतोऽस्मि नरर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, O slayer of foes, I shall destroy the fever that is in your mind and I shall tell you, by means of what act according to the ordinance you will be able to kill Bhishma, Kripa, Karna, Drona, the son of Drona, Duryodhana and the other princes and Dushasana.', 'sn': 'भीष्माद् द्रोणात् कृपात् कर्णाद् द्रोण पुत्राच्च भारत। दुर्योधनान्नृपसुतात् तथा दुःशासनादपि॥ यत् ते भयममित्रघ्न हृदि सम्परिवर्तते। तत् तेऽहं नाशयिष्यामि विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा॥'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, hearing it from me, accomplish the act with patience. Having accomplished it, soon destroy your this (mental) fever.', 'sn': 'तच्छुत्वाधृतिमास्थाय कर्मणा प्रतिपादय। प्रतिपाद्य तु राजेन्द्र ततः क्षिप्रं ज्वरं जहि॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : That foremost of all eloquent men, the son of Parasara (Vyasa), taking him aside thus spoke to Yudhishthira in words of deep import.', 'sn': 'तत एकान्तमुन्नीय पाराशर्यो युधिष्ठिरम। अब्रवीदुपपन्नार्थमिदं वाक्यविशारदः॥'}

{'en': 'Vyasa said: O best of the Bharatas, that prosperous time has come when the son of Pritha, Dhananjaya (Arjuna), will kill your enemies in battle.', 'sn': 'श्रेयसस्ते परः कालः प्राप्तो भरतसत्तम। येनाभिभविता शत्रून् रणे पार्थोधनुर्धरः॥'}

{'en': 'Accept from me this knowledge, called Pratismriti. Uttered by me it is like success personified. You are capable of accepting it; I shall tell it to you.', 'sn': 'गृहाणेमां मया प्रोक्तां सिद्धिं मूर्तिमतीमिव। विद्यां प्रतिस्मृति नाम प्रपन्नाय ब्रवीमि ते॥'}

{'en': 'Receiving it, the mighty-armed Arjuna will be able to accomplish his desire. O son of Pandu, let him go for the acquisition of weapons to Mahendra. Rudra, Varuna, Kubera and Yama. He is competent to see the celestials on account of his asceticism and prowess.', 'sn': 'यामवाप्य महाबाहुरर्जुनः साधयिष्यति। अस्त्रहेतोर्महेन्द्रं च रुद्रं चैवाभिगच्छतु॥ वरुणं च कुबेरं चधर्मराजं च पाण्डव। शक्तो ह्येष सुरान् द्रष्टुं तपसा विक्रमेण च॥'}

{'en': 'He is a Rishi of great effulgence; he is the friend of Narayana (Krishna); he is ancient, eternal celestials, invincible, ever successful and undeteriorating. O mighty-armed hero, he will achieve great deeds by receiving weapons from Indra, Rudra and the Lokapalas.', 'sn': 'ऋषिरेष महातेजा नारायणसहायवान्। पुराणः शाश्वतो देवस्त्वजेयी जिष्णुरच्युतः॥ अस्त्राणीन्द्राच्च रुद्राच्च लोकपालेभ्य एव च। समादाय महाबाहुर्महत् कर्म करिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'O son of Kunti, O ruler of the world, think of going from this forest to another (forest) that may be fit for your abode.', 'sn': 'वनादस्माच्च कौन्तेय वनमन्यद् विचिन्त्यताम्। निवासार्थाय यद् युक्तं भवेद् वः पृथिवीपते॥'}
{'en': 'To reside in one place for a length of time is never pleasant. It might produce anxieties to the ascetics.', 'sn': 'एकत्र चिरवासो हि न प्रीतिजननो भवेत्। तापसानां च सर्वेषां भवेदुद्वेगकारकः॥'}

{'en': 'As you support numerous Brahmanas, learned in the Vedas, your continued residence here (in this forest) may exhaust the deer of the forest and may be destructive of the creepers and plant.', 'sn': 'मृगाणामुपयोगश्च वीरुदोषधिसंक्षयः। बिभर्षि च बहून् विप्रान् वेदवेदाङ्गपारगान्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said: Having thus addressed by that illustrious lord, the ascetic of great wisdom, the intelligent Vyasa, the son of Satyavati, learned in the mysteries of the world, then imported that foremost of knowledge to the willing Dharmaraja (Yudhishthira) who had meanwhile purified himself. Bidding farewell to the son of Kunti, he then disappeared.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्त्वा प्रपन्नाय शुचये भगवान् प्रभुः। प्रोवाच लोकतत्त्वज्ञो योगी विद्यामनुत्तमाम्॥ धर्मराजायधीमान् स व्यासः सत्यवतीसुतः। अनुज्ञाय च कौन्तेयं तत्रैवान्तरधीयत॥'}

{'en': 'Having received that knowledge, the virtuous-minded and the intelligent Yudhishthira carefully retained it in his memory and always repeated it at the proper times.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिरस्तुधर्मात्मा तद् ब्रह्म मनसा यतः। धारयामास मेधावी काले काले सदाभ्यसन्॥'}

{'en': 'Being glad at the words of Vyasa, he, leaving the Dvaiytavana, went to the forest of Kamyaka on the banks of the Sarasvati.', 'sn': 'स व्यासवाक्यमुदितो बनाद् द्वैतवनात् ततः। ययौ सरस्वतीकूले काम्यकं नाम काननम्॥'}

{'en': 'O great king, the Brahmanas, possessing ascetic merits and versed in the science of ortheopy and orthography, followed him, as the Rishis follow the king of the celestials (Indra).', 'sn': 'तमन्वयुर्महाराज शिक्षाक्षरविशारदाः। ब्राह्मणास्तपसा युक्ता देवेन्द्रमृषयो यथा॥'}

{'en': "Thereupon arriving at Kamyaka, those highsouled chief's of the Bharata race took up their residence there with their friends and followers.", 'sn': 'ततः काम्यकमासाद्य पुनस्ते भरतर्षभ। न्यविशन्त महात्मानः सामात्याः सपरिच्छदाः॥'}

{'en': 'O king, those intelligent heroes then lived there for some time, devoting themselves to the science of archery and hearing the excellent Vedas.', 'sn': 'तत्र ते न्यवसन् राजन् किंचित् कालं मनस्विनः। धनुर्वेदपरा वीराः शृण्वन्तो वेदमुत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'They went about the forest every day with non-poisoned arrows in search of deer. They duly performed all the rites in honour of the Pitris, the celestials and the Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'चरन्तो मृगयां नित्यं शुद्धैर्बाणैर्मृगार्थिनः। पितृदैवतविप्रेभ्यो निर्वपन्तो यथाविधि॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana said About it is cited the ancient story O lady, of the discourse between Kartavirya and the Ocean.', 'sn': 'ब्राहाण उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। कार्तवीर्यस्य संवादं समुद्रस्य च भाविनि॥'}

{'en': 'There was a king named Kartavirya-Arjuna who had a thousand arms. He conquered, with his bow, the Earth extending to the ocean.', 'sn': 'कार्तवीर्यार्जुनो नाम राजा बाहुसहस्रवान्। येन सागरपर्यन्ता धनुषा निर्जिता मही॥'}

{'en': 'We have heard that, once on a time, as he was walking on the shores of the sea, proud of his power, he showered hundreds of arrows on thal vast receptacle of water.', 'sn': 'स कदाचित् समुद्रान्ते विचरन् बलदर्पितः। अवाकिरशरशतैः समुद्रमिति नः श्रुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Ocean, bowing down to him, said, with joined hands, Do not, O hero. discharged your arrows (at me)! Say, what shall I do to you.', 'sn': 'तं समुद्रो नमस्कृत्य कृताञ्जलिरुवाच हा मा मुञ्च वीर नाराचान् ब्रूहि किं करवाणि ते॥'}

{'en': 'With these strong arrows shot by you, those creatures which have taken shelter in me are being killed, O foremost of kings! Do you, O lord, grant them security.', 'sn': 'मदाश्रयाणि भूतानि त्वद्विसृष्टैर्महेषुभिः। वध्यन्ते राजशार्दूल तेभ्यो देह्यभयं विभो॥'}

{'en': 'If any holder of the bow exists that is equal to me in battle, and that would stand against mc in the field, do you name him to me.', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच मत्समो यदि संग्रामे शरासनधरः क्वचित्। विद्यते तं समाचक्ष्व यः समासीत मां मृधे॥'}

{'en': 'The Ocean said If you have heard, O king, of the great Rishi Jamadagni, his son is competent to duly receive you as a guest.', 'sn': 'समुद्र उवाच महर्षिर्जमदग्निस्ते यदि राजन् परिश्रुतः। तस्य पुत्रस्तवातिथ्यं यथावत् कर्तुमर्हति।॥'}
{'en': 'Then that king proceeded, becoming highly irate. Arrived at that hermitage, he found Rama himself.', 'sn': 'ततः स राजा प्रययौ क्रोधेन महता वृतः। स तमाश्रममागम्य राममेवान्वपद्यत॥'}

{'en': 'With his kinsmen he began to do many deeds while were hostile to Rama, and caused much trouble to that grcat hero.', 'sn': 'स रामप्रतिकूलानि चकार सह बन्धुभिः। आयासं जनयामास रामस्य च महात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'Then the energy, which was immeasurable, of Rama shone forth, burning the troops of the enemy, O lotus-eyed one.', 'sn': 'ततस्तेजः प्रजज्वाल रामस्यामिततेजसः। प्रदहन् रिपुसैन्यानि तदा कमललोचने।॥'}

{'en': 'Taking up his battle-axe, Rama suddenly displayed his power, and hacked that thousandarmed hero, like a tree of many branches.', 'sn': 'ततः परशुमादाय स तं बाहुसहस्रिणम्। चिच्छेद सहसा रामो बहुशाखमिव दुमम्॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing him killed and laid low on the earth, all his kinsmen, collected in a body, and taking up their darts rushed at Rama, who was then scated, from all sides.', 'sn': 'तं हतं पतितं दृष्ट्वा समेताः सर्वबान्धवाः। असीनादाय शक्तीश्च भार्गवं पर्यधावयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Rama also, taking up his bow and quickly getting on his car, discharged showers of arrows and punished the army of the king.', 'sn': 'रामोऽपि धनुरादाय रथमारुह्य सत्वरः। विसृजशरवर्षाणि व्यधमत् पार्थिवं बलम्॥'}

{'en': "Then, some of the Kshatriyas, stricken with the terror of Jamadagni's son, entered mountain fastnesses, like deer afflicted by the lion.", 'sn': 'ततस्तु क्षत्रियाः केचिज्जामदग्न्यभयार्दिताः। विविशुर्गिरिदुर्गाणि मृगाः सिंहार्दिता इव॥'}

{'en': 'Of them that were unable, through feat of Rama, lo perform the duties ordained for their order, the progeny became Vrishalas owing to their inability to find Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'तेषां स्वविहितं कर्म तद्भयान्नानुतिष्ठताम्। प्रजा वृषलता प्राप्ता ब्राह्मणानामदर्शनात्॥'}

{'en': 'Thus the Dravidas and Adhiras and Pundars together with the Shavaras, became Vrishalas through those men who had Kshatriya duties assigned to them, following away (from them).', 'sn': 'एवं ते द्रविडाऽऽभीरा: पुण्ड्राश्च शबरैः सह। वृषलत्वं परिगता व्युत्थानात् क्षत्रधर्मिणः॥'}

{'en': "Then the Kshatriyas that were begotten by the Brahmanas upon Kshatriya women who had lost their heroic children, were repeatedly destroyed by Jamadagni's son.", 'sn': 'ततश्च हतवीरासु क्षत्रियासु पुनः पुनः। द्विजैरुत्पादितं क्षत्रं जामदग्न्यो न्यकृन्तत॥'}

{'en': 'The destruction proceeded one and twenty times. At its conclusion a bodiless voice, sweet and coming from the celestial region, and which was heard by all people, spoke to Rama, O Rama, O Rama, stop! What merit do you see, O son, in thus destroying repeatedly these inferior Kshatriyas?', 'sn': 'एकविंशतिमेधान्ते रामं वागशरीरिणी। दिव्या प्रोवाच मधुरा सर्वलोकपरिश्रुता॥ राम राम निवर्तस्व के गुणं तात पश्यसि। क्षत्रबधूनिमान् प्राणैर्विप्रयोज्य पुनः पुनः॥'}
{'en': 'Thus, O blessed dame, his grandsires, headed by Richika, addressed that great one, saying, Do you, desist.', 'sn': 'तथैव तं महात्मानमृचीकप्रमुखास्तदा। पितामहा महाभाग निवर्तस्वेत्यथाब्रुवन्॥'}

{'en': 'Rama, however, unable to forgive the destruction of his father, replied to those Rishis, saying, you should not forbid me.', 'sn': 'पितुर्वधममृष्यंस्तु रामः प्रोवाच तानृषीन्। नार्हन्तीह भवन्तो मां निवारयितुमित्युत॥'}

{'en': 'The departed manes then said, O foremost of all victorious men, you should not kill these inferior Kshatriyas! It is not proper that your self, being a Brahmanas should kill these kings.', 'sn': 'पितर ऊचुः नार्हसे क्षत्रबन्धुंस्त्वं निहन्तुं जयतां वरा नेह युक्तं त्वया हन्तुं ब्राह्मणेन सता नृपान्॥'}

{'en': 'Janamejaya said How did that gambling take place, the play which was full of such evils to the brothers and which plunged my grandsires into such sorrow?', 'sn': 'जनमेजय उवाच कथं समभवद् द्यूतं भ्रातृणां तन्महात्ययम्। यत्र तद् व्यसनं प्राप्तं पाण्डवैर्म पितामहैः॥'}

{'en': 'O best of all Veda-knowing men, who were the kings that were present in that Sabha and who amongst them approved of the play and who forbade it?', 'sn': 'के च तत्र सभास्तारा राजानो ब्रह्मवित्तम। के चैनमन्वमोदन्त के चैनं प्रत्यषेधयन्॥'}

{'en': 'O sinless one, O foremost of the twice borne. I desire to hear narrated by you in detail all this which became the cause of the destruction of all the world.', 'sn': 'विस्तरेणैतदिच्छामि कथ्यमानं त्वया द्विजा मूलं ह्येतद् विनाशस्य पृथिव्या द्विजसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Sauti said Having been thus addressed by the king, the powerful disciple of Vyasa, (Vaishampayana), learned in all the Vedas, narrated every thing as it happened.', 'sn': 'सौतिरुवाच एवमुक्तस्ततो राजा व्यासशिष्यः प्रतापवान्। आचचक्षेऽथ यद् वृत्तं तत् सर्वं वेदतत्त्ववित्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said O best of the Bharata race, O great king, if you desire to hear it, listen to it. I narrate all this in detail.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच शृणु मे विस्तरेणेमां कथां भारतसत्तम। भूय एव महाराज यदि ते श्रवणे मतिः॥'}

{'en': 'Knowing the opinion of Vidura, the son of Ambika, Dhritarashtra, thus spoke to Duryodhana in private.', 'sn': 'विदुरस्य मतिं ज्ञात्वा धृतराष्ट्रोऽम्बिकासुतः। दुर्योधनमिदं वाक्यमुवाच विजने पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said O son of Gandhara, there is no need of playing dice. Vidura does not praise it. That greatly intelligent man will never give me advice that is not good for me.', 'sn': 'अलं द्यूतेन गान्धारे विदुरो न प्रशंसति। न ह्यसौ सुमहाबुद्धिरहितं नो वदिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'I consider that what Vidura said is greatly beneficial to me. O son, do it; for I consider it to be for your good also.', 'sn': 'हितं हि परमं मन्ये विदुरो यत् प्रभाषते। क्रियतां पुत्र तत् सर्वमेतन्मन्ये हितं तव॥'}

{'en': 'The greatly learned man, Vidura, knows all the sciences with their mysteries which the illustrious, learned and wise Brihaspati, the great Rishi who is the preceptor of Vasava (Indra), taught to the intelligent king of the immortals.', 'sn': 'देवर्षिर्वासवगुरुर्देवराजाय धीमते। यत् प्राह शास्त्रं भगवान् बृहस्पतिरुदारधीः। तद् वेद विदुरः सर्वं सरहस्यं महाकविः॥'}

{'en': 'O son, I always follow his counsel. The greatly wise Vidura is considered to be the foremost of the Kurus.', 'sn': 'स्थितस्तु वचने तस्य सदाहमपि पुत्रका विदुरो वापि मेधावी कुरूणां प्रवरो मतः॥'}

{'en': 'As the greatly intelligent Udhava (is considered to be the foremost) of the Vrishnis. O son, O prince, have nothing with gambling. Dissension is the evident result of gambling.', 'sn': 'उद्धवो वा महाबुद्धिवृष्णीनामर्चितो नृप। तदलं पुत्र द्यूतेन छूते भेदो हि दृश्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Dissension causes ruin to a kingdom. O son, therefore, abandon (the idea of gambling). O son, you have obtained all that is hard to be obtained from the father and the mother. You have obtained the rank and the possessions of your ancestors, you are taught, you are made learned in the Shastras, you were carefully brought up in the house.', 'sn': 'भेदे विनाशो राज्यस्य तत् पुत्र परिवर्जय। पित्रा मात्रा च पुत्रस्य यद् वै कार्यं परं स्मृतम्॥ प्राप्तस्त्वमसि तन्नाम पितृपैतामहं पदम्। अधीतवान् कृती शास्त्रे लालितः सततं गृहे॥'}

{'en': 'You are the eldest amongst all your brothers, you are placed over the kingdom; why do you not consider yourself fortunate and happy? You get the very best kind of food and robes, unobtainable by ordinary men.', 'sn': 'भ्रातृज्येष्ठः स्थितो राज्ये विन्दसे किं न शोभनम्। पृथग्जनैरलभ्यं यद् भोजनाच्छादनं परम्॥'}

{'en': 'O mighty armed hero, O son, having obtained all this, why do you grieve? O mighty armed hero, ruling over your large ancestral kingdom swelling with people and wealth, you shine as splendidly as the chief of the celestials in heaven. O possessor of knowledge, you should tell me what can be the root of your grief which has made you so melancholy.', 'sn': 'तत् प्राप्तोऽसि महाबाहो कस्माच्छोचसि पुत्रका स्फीतं राष्ट्रं महाबाहो पितृपैतामहं महत्॥ नित्यमाज्ञापयन् भासि दिवि देवेश्वरो यथा। तस्य ते विदितप्रज्ञ शोकमूलमिदं कथम्। समुत्थितं दुःखकरं यन्मे शंसितुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': "Duryodhana said I am a sinful wretch that I eat and dress, though see the prosperity of the enemy. It has been said that a man is a wretch who does not feel jealousy at the sight of his enemy's prosperity.", 'sn': 'दुर्योधन उवाच अश्नाम्याच्छादयामीति प्रपश्यन् पापपूरुषः। नामर्षं कुरुते यस्तु पुरुषः सोऽधमः स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, O lord, this ordinary prosperity does not please me. I am greatly pained on seeing the burning prosperity of the son of Kunti.', 'sn': 'न मां प्रीणाति राजेन्द्र लक्ष्मी: साधारणी विभो। ज्वलितामेव कौन्तेये श्रियं दृष्ट्वा च विव्यथे॥'}

{'en': 'I tell you, my life must be very hard to be parted with from my body, and therefore I am still alive after seeing all the kings of the world enduring the sway of Yudhishthira.', 'sn': 'सर्वां च पृथिवीं चैव युधिष्ठिरवशानुगाम्। स्थिरोऽस्मि योऽहं जीवामि दुःखादेतद् ब्रवीमि ते।।'}

{'en': "The Nipas, the Chitrakas, the Kukuras, the Karaskaras and the Lohajanghas are living in the Yudhishthira's palace like bondsmen.", 'sn': 'आवर्जिता इवाभान्ति नीपाश्चित्रककौकुराः। कारस्कारा लोहजङ्घा युधिष्ठिरनिवेशने॥'}

{'en': 'The Himalayas, the ocean, the regions on the sea-shore and the numberless other regions that yield gems and jewels have all acknowledged their inferiority to the palace of Yudhishthira.', 'sn': 'हिमवत्सागरानूपाः सर्वे रत्नाकरास्तथा। अन्त्याः सर्वे पर्युदस्ता युधिष्ठिरनिवेशने॥'}

{'en': 'O king, on consideration of my being the eldest and the foremost. I was engaged in receiving the gems and jewels (brought as tribute by the kings).', 'sn': 'ज्येष्ठोऽयमिति मां मत्वा श्रेष्ठश्चेति विशाम्पते। युधिष्ठिरेण सत्कृत्य युक्तो रत्नपरिग्रहे॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, the limit and the like of the excellent and the invaluable jewels that were brought there have never been seen.', 'sn': 'उपस्थितानां रत्नानां श्रेष्ठानामर्घहारिणाम्। नादृश्यत परः पारो नापरस्तत्र भारत॥'}

{'en': 'O king, my hands were tired to receive that wealth. When I became tired they that brought that wealth from distant places waited (till I could resume my task).', 'sn': 'न मे हस्तः समभवद् वसु तत् प्रतिगृहणतः। अतिष्ठन्त मयि श्रान्ते गृह्य दूराहृतं वसु॥'}

{'en': 'Having brought jewels from Bindu lake, Maya built a lake-like ground made of crystal. O descendant of Bharata, seeing the place full of lotuses, I mistook it for waster.', 'sn': 'कृतां विन्दुसरोरत्नैर्मयेन स्फाटिकच्छदाम्। अपश्यं नलिनी पूर्णामुदकस्येव भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing me draw up my clothes, Vrikodara (Bhima) laughed at me, considering me as destitute of jewels and deprived of my reason at the affluence of the enemy.', 'sn': 'वस्त्रमुत्कर्षति मयि प्राहसत् स वृकोदरः। शत्रोर्ऋद्धिविशेषेण विमूढं रत्नवर्जितम्॥'}

{'en': '"O king, if I had the ability, I would have instantly killed Vrikodara (for his laughter), O king, if we now try to kill Bhima.', 'sn': 'तत्र स्म यदि शक्तः स्यां पातयेऽहं वृकोदरम्। यदि कुर्यां समारम्भं भीमं हन्तुं नराधिप।॥'}

{'en': 'Our fate will be certainly as that of Shishupala. O descendant of Bharata, that insult by the enemy burns me.', 'sn': 'शिशुपाल इवास्माकं गतिः स्यान्नात्र संशयः। सपनेनावहासो मे स मां दहति भारत॥'}
{'en': 'O king, again seeing a similar lake full of water, I mistook it for a crystal surface, and I fell into it.', 'sn': 'पुनश्च तादृशीमेव वापी जलजशालिनीम्। मत्वा शिलासमां तोये पतितोऽस्मि नराधिप॥'}

{'en': 'At this Bhima with Partha (Arjuna) laughed aloud, and Draupadi with other females laughed also. This greatly pains my heart.', 'sn': 'तत्र मां प्राहसत् कृष्णः पार्थेन सह सुस्वरम्। द्रौपदी च सह स्त्रीभिर्व्यथयन्ती मनो मम॥'}

{'en': 'My robes having been wet, the servants gave me other clothes at the command of the king (Yudhishthira). That also is my great sorrow.', 'sn': 'क्लिन्नवस्त्रस्य तु जले किंकरा राजनोदिताः। ददुर्वासांसि मेऽन्यानि तच्च दुःखं परं मम॥'}

{'en': 'O king, listen to another mistake (I made) which I speak of. In attempting to pass through what was exactly of the shape of a door, but which was not really a door, I struck my forehead against it and injured myself. Thereupon the twins (Nakula and Sahadeva), seeing from a distance that I was struck, came and supported me in their arms, and expressed great concern (for my injury).', 'sn': 'प्रलम्भं च शृणुष्वान्यद् वदतो मे नराधिप। अद्वारेण विनिर्गच्छन् द्वारसंस्थानरूपिणा। अभिहत्य शिलां भूयो ललाटेनास्मि विक्षतः॥ तत्र मां यमजौ दूरादालोक्याभिहतं तदा। बाहुभिः परिगृह्णीतां शोचन्तौ सहितावुभौ॥'}
{'en': 'Sahadeva then again and again told me with smiles, “O king, this is the door, Go this way.”', 'sn': 'उवाच सहदेवस्तु तत्र मां विस्मयन्निव। इदं द्वारमितो गच्छ राजनिति पुनः पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'O king, Bhimasena laughed aloud, and addressing me, he spoke thus to me. "O son of Dhritarashtra, this is the doer".', 'sn': 'भीमसेनेन तत्रोक्तो धृतराष्टात्मजेति च। सम्बोध्य प्रहसित्वा च इतो द्वारं नराधिप॥'}

{'en': 'I had not even heard the names of the gems that I saw in that palace. It is for this reason my heart is so much burning.', 'sn': 'नामधेयानि रत्नानां पुरस्तान्न श्रुतानि मे। यानि दृष्टानि मे तस्यां मनस्तपति तच्च मे॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : O great king, having heard from the highsouled Markandeya the account of the attainment of heaven by the royal sage Indradhyumna, that foremost of the Bharatas, Yudhishthira, again thus asked that sinless great ascetic and long-lived Markandeya.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच श्रुत्वा तु राजा राजर्षेरिन्द्रद्युम्नस्य तत् तथा। मार्कण्डेयान्महाभागात् स्वर्गस्य प्रतिपादनम्॥ युधिष्ठिरो महाराज पप्रच्छ भरतर्षभ। मार्कण्डेयं तपोवृद्धं दीर्घायुषमकल्मषम्॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said : O virtuous one, you know all the celestials and the Danavas, the Rakshasas, also various royal dynasties and many everlasting dynasties of the Rishis.', 'sn': 'विदितास्तव धर्मज्ञ देवदानवराक्षसाः। राजवंशाश्च विविधा ऋषिवंशाश्च शाश्वतः॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of Brahmanas, there is nothing in this world which you do not know. O Rishis, you know also excellent stories of men, of the Nagas, of the Rakshasas, of the celestials, the Gandharvas, the Yakshas, the Kinnaras and the Apsaras.', 'sn': 'न तेऽस्त्यविदितं किञ्चिदस्मॅिल्लोके द्विजोत्तम् कथां वेत्सि मुने दिव्यां मनुष्योरगरक्षसाम्॥ देवगन्धर्वयक्षाणां किन्नराप्सरसां तथा।'}

{'en': 'O foremost of Brahmanas, I desire to hear from you all these accounts. Why did that invincible descendant of Ikshvaku, known by the name of Kuvalashva change and assume another, namely Dhundhumara?', 'sn': 'इदमिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं तत्त्वेन द्विजसत्तम॥ कुवलाश्व इति ख्यात इक्ष्वाकुरपराजितः। कथं नामविपर्यासाद् धुन्धुमारत्वमागतः॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bhrigu race, I desire to know in detail why the name of the highly intelligent Kuvalashva underwent a change.', 'sn': 'एतदिच्छामि तत्त्वेन ज्ञातुं भार्गवसत्तम। विपर्यस्तं यथा नाम कुवलाश्वस्य धीमतः॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, having been thus addressed by Yudhishthira, the great Rishi Markandeya narrated the story of Dhundhumara.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच युधिष्ठिरेणैवमुक्तो मार्कण्डेयो महामुनिः। धौन्धुमारमुपाख्यानं कथयामास भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Markandeya said : O king Yudhishthira, I shall tell you all. Listen to me. The story of Dhundhumara is a moral story, hear it.', 'sn': 'मार्कण्डेय उवाच हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि शृणु राजन् युधिष्ठिर। धर्मिष्ठमिदमाख्यानं धुन्धुमारस्य तच्छृणु॥'}

{'en': 'O ruler of earth, hear why the royal sage Kuvalashva of the race of Ikshvaku came to be known as Dhundhumara.', 'sn': 'यथा स राजा इक्ष्वाकुः कुवलाश्वो महीपतिः। धुन्धुमारत्वमगमत् तच्छृणुष्व महीपते॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, O child, there was a celebrated great Rishi named Uttanka. He had his hermitage in a charming forest.', 'sn': 'महर्षिर्विश्रुतस्तात उत्तङ्क इति भारत। मरुधन्वसु रम्येषु आश्रमस्तस्य कौरव॥'}

{'en': 'O great king, Uttanka performed serverest asceticism. In order to secure the grace of Vishnu that lord (Uttanka) performed that severest penance for many hundreds of years.', 'sn': 'उत्तङ्कस्तु महाराज तपोऽतप्यत् सुदुश्चरम्। आरिराधयिषुर्विष्णुं बहून् वर्षगणान् विभुः॥'}

{'en': 'Being gratified with him that exalted deity (Vishnu) appeared before him in his embodied form. As soon as the Rishi saw him, he gratified him in all humility and with many hymns.', 'sn': 'तस्य प्रीतः स भगवान् साक्षाद् दर्शनमेयिवान्। दृष्ट्वैव चर्षिः प्रह्वस्तं तुष्टाव विविधैः स्तवैः॥'}

{'en': 'Uttanka said: O god, all mobile and immobile creatures with the celestial, the Asuras and the humanbeings have been all created by you.', 'sn': 'उत्तङ्कं उवाच त्वया देवा प्रजाः सर्वाः ससुरासुरमानवाः। स्थावराणि च भूतानि जङ्गमानि तथैव च।॥'}

{'en': 'O greatly effulgent one, Brahma himself, the Vedas and all things that are capable of being known, have been all created by you. O lord, the sky is your head and the sun and the moon are your eyes.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्म वेदाश्च वेद्यं च त्वया सृष्टं महाद्युते। शिरस्ते गगनं देव नेत्रे शशिदिवाकरौ॥'}

{'en': 'O undeteriorating one, the winds are your breaths, the fire is your splendour, the directions are your arms and the great ocean is your stomach.', 'sn': 'निःश्वासः पवनश्चापि तेजोऽग्निश्च तवाच्युत। बाहवस्ते दिशः सर्वाः कुक्षिश्चापि महार्णवः॥'}

{'en': 'O god, O slayer of Madhu, the hills and the mountains are your thighs, the atmosphere is your hips, the goddess earth is your feet and the plants are the down of your body.', 'sn': 'ऊरू ते पर्वता देव खं नाभिर्मधुसूदन। पादौ ते पृथिवी देवी रोमाण्योषधयस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'Indra, Soma, Agni and Varuna, the celestial, the Asuras and the great Nagas, all wait upon you and adore you with various hymns.', 'sn': 'इन्द्रसोमाग्निवरुणा देवासुरमहोरगाः। प्रह्वास्त्वामुपतिष्ठन्ति स्तुवन्तो विविधैः स्तवैः॥'}

{'en': 'O lord of earth all created things are pervaded by you. The great Rishis and the greatly effulgent Yogis all adore you with hymns.', 'sn': 'त्वया व्याप्तानि सर्वाणि भूतानि भुवनेश्वर। योगिनः सुमहावीर्याः स्तुवन्ति त्वां महर्षयः॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of men, when you are pleased the universe enjoys peace; when you are angry, a great fear pervades all. You are the only great dispeller of all fears; you are the supreme one.', 'sn': 'त्वयि तुष्टे जगत् स्वास्थ्यं त्वयि क्रुद्ध महद् भयम्। भयानामपनेतासि त्वमेकः पुरुषोत्तम।॥'}

{'en': 'O god, you are the cause of happiness of both the celestials and the human beings. By your three steps you covered all the three worlds.', 'sn': 'देवानां मानुषाणां च सर्वभूतसुखावहः। त्रिभिर्विक्रमणैर्देव त्रयो लोकास्त्वया हृताः॥'}

{'en': 'It was you who destroyed the Asuras when they were in their great affluence. Through your prowess the celestials obtained peace and happiness.', 'sn': 'असुराणां समृद्धानां विनाशश्च त्वया कृतः। तव विक्रमणैर्देवा निर्वाणमगमन् परम्॥'}

{'en': 'O greatly effulgent one, it was your anger that vanquished the great Daitya chiefs. You are the creator, you are the destroyer of all the creatures of this world. Adoring you, the celestials have obtained happiness and bliss.”', 'sn': 'पराभूताश्च दैत्येन्द्रास्त्वयि क्रुद्धे महाद्युते। त्वं हि कर्ता विकर्ता च भूतानामिह सर्वशः॥ आराधयित्वा त्वां देवाः सुखमेधन्ति सर्वशः।'}

{'en': 'There was Hrishikesha (Vishnu) praised by the high-souled Uttanka. Vishnu then thus spoke to Uttanka, “I am gratified, Ask for a boon."', 'sn': 'एवं स्तुतो हृषीकेश उत्तङ्केन महात्मना॥ उत्तङ्कमब्रवीद् विष्णुः प्रीतस्तेऽहं वरं वृणु।'}

{'en': '(Uttanka said), “It is (already) a great boon to me that you have become visible to me, you who are Hari, the eternal being, the celestials creator, the lord of the universe."', 'sn': 'उत्तङ्क उवाच पर्याप्तो मे वरो ह्येष यदहं दृष्टवान् हरिम्॥ पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यं स्रष्टारं जगतः प्रभुम्।'}

{'en': 'Vishnu said, "O excellent one. I am pleased with your this littleness of desire and great devotion. O Brahmana, O twice-born one, you should certainly accept some boon from me."', 'sn': 'विष्णुरुवाच प्रीतस्तेऽहमलौल्येन भक्त्या तव च सत्तम॥ अवश्यं हि त्वया ब्रह्मन् मत्तो चाह्यो वरो द्विज।'}

{'en': 'Thus requested by Hari to ask for a boon, O best of the Bharata race, Uttanka with joined hands asked for a boon.', 'sn': 'मार्कण्डेय उवाच एवं स छन्द्यमानस्तु वरेण हरिणा तदा॥ उत्तङ्कः प्राञ्जलिर्ववे वरं भरतसत्तम।'}

{'en': '"O lotus-eyed deity, if your exalted self is pleased with me, O lord, then let my heart be always devoted to virtue, truth and contentment. Let my mind be always devoted to you."', 'sn': 'यदि मे भगवन् प्रीतः पुण्डरीकनिभेक्षण॥ धर्मे सत्ये दमे चैव बुद्धिर्भवतु मे सदा। अभ्यासश्च भवेद् भक्त्या त्वयि नित्यं ममेश्वर॥'}

{'en': '(The deity replied), “O Brahmana, all this will happen to you through my favour. A Yoga will be manifest in you. Through its power you will perform a great act for the dwellers of heaven as also for the three worlds.', 'sn': 'श्रीभगवानुवाच सर्वमेतद्धि भविता मत्प्रसादात् तव द्विज। प्रतिभास्यति योगश्च येन युक्तो दिवौकसाम्॥ त्रयाणामपि लोकानां महत् कार्यं करिष्यसि।'}

{'en': 'A great Asura, named Dhundhu, is now undergoing severe austerities in order to destroy the world. Hear who will kill him.', 'sn': 'उत्सादनार्थं लोकानां धुन्धुर्नाम महासुरः॥ तपस्यति तपो घोरं शृणु यस्तं हनिष्यति।'}

{'en': 'O child, a mighty and invincible king of the race of Ikshvaku, known by the name of Brihadashva, will be the ruler over earth. His son will be very illustrious, self-controlled and holy; he will be known by the name of Kuvalashva.', 'sn': 'राजा हि वीर्यवांस्तात इक्ष्वाकुरपराजितः॥ बृहदश्व इति ख्यातो भविष्यति महीपतिः। तस्य पुत्रः शुचिर्दान्तः कुवलाश्व इति श्रुतः॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of Brahmanas, that best of kings will be endued with Yoga power derived from me. Commanded by you he will be the slayer of Dhundhu.” Having said this to that Brahmana Vishnu disappeared.', 'sn': 'स योगबलमास्थाय मामकं पार्थिवोत्तमः। शासनात् तव विप्रर्षे धुन्धुमारो भविष्यति। एवमुक्त्वा तु तं विप्रं विष्णुरन्तरधीयत॥'}

{'en': 'Markandeya said : O descendant of Bharata, having been thus addressed by that Brahmana, the virtuous fowler again began to speak (on things) so pleasing to the mind.', 'sn': 'मार्कण्डेय उवाच एवमुक्तः स विप्रस्तु धर्मव्याधेन भारत। कथामकथयद् भूयो मनसः प्रीतिवधनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana said : O foremost of all virtuous men, it is said that there are five great elements. Will you describe to me in detail the properties of those five (elements)?', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण उवाच महाभूतानि यान्याहुः पञ्च धर्मभृतां वर। एकैकस्य गुणान् सम्यक् पञ्चानामपि मे वद॥'}

{'en': 'The Fowler said: The earth, water, fire, air and sky, all have properties enter-lapping each other. I shall describe them to you.', 'sn': 'व्याध उवाच भूमिरापस्तथा ज्योतिर्वायुराकाशमेव च। गुणोत्तराणि सर्वाणि तेषां वक्ष्यामि ते गुणान्॥'}

{'en': 'O Brahmana, the earth has five qualities, water four, fire three and the air and the sky together three.', 'sn': 'भूमिः पञ्चगुणा ब्रह्मन्नुदकं च चतुर्गुणम्। गुणास्त्रयस्तेजसि च त्रयश्चाकाशवातयोः॥'}
{'en': 'Sound, touch, form, flavour and taste, these five qualities belong to earth.', 'sn': 'शब्दः स्पर्शश्च रूपं च रसो गन्धश्च पञ्चमः। एते गुणाः पञ्च भूमेः सर्वेभ्यो गुणवत्तरा॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of Brahmanas, O twice-borm one, O vow-observing Rishi, sound, touch, form and taste have been described to you as the properties of water.', 'sn': 'शब्दः स्पर्शश्च रूपं च रसश्चापि द्विजोत्तम। अपामेते गुणा ब्रह्मन् कीर्तितास्तव सुव्रत॥'}

{'en': 'Sound, touch and form are the three properties of fire; sound and touch are the two properties of the air; and sound is the property of the sky.', 'sn': 'शब्दः स्पर्शश्च रूपं च तेजसोऽथ गुणास्त्रयः। शब्दः स्पर्शश्च वायौ तु शब्दश्चाकाश एव तु॥'}

{'en': 'O Brahmana, these fifteen fifteen properties inherent in five elements, exist in all substances of which this universe is composed.', 'sn': 'एते पञ्चदश ब्रह्मन् गुणा भूतेषु पञ्चसु। वर्तन्ते सर्वभूतेषु येषु लोकाः प्रतिष्ठिताः॥'}

{'en': 'O Brahmana, they are not opposed to one another; they exist in proper combination. When this universe is thrown into a state of chaos then every corporeal being in proper time assumes another body. It perishes also in due order.', 'sn': 'अन्योन्यं नातिवर्तन्ते सम्यक् च भवति द्विजा यदा तु विषमं भावमाचरन्ति चराचराः॥ तदा देही देहमन्यं व्यतिरोहति कालतः। आनुपूर्व्या विनश्यन्ति जायन्ते चानुपूर्वशः॥'}

{'en': 'There (everlastingly) exist the five elementary substances of which all the mobile and immobile world is composed. Whatever is perceptible by the senses is called Vyakta (manifest) and whatever is not perceptible by the senses is called Avyakta (not manifest).', 'sn': 'तत्र तत्र हि दृश्यन्ते धातवः पाञ्चभौतिकाः। यैरावृतमिदं सर्वं जगत् स्थावरजङ्गमम्॥ इन्द्रियैः सृज्यते यद् यत् तत् तद् व्यक्तमिति स्मृतम्। तदव्यक्तमिति ज्ञेयं लिङ्गचाह्यमतीन्द्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'When a person engages in Tapa after having duly subdued his senses which have their own proper objective play in the external conditions of sound, form, then he sees that his own spirit pervades the whole universe and the universe is also reflected in him.', 'sn': 'यथास्वं चाहकाण्येषां शब्दादीनामिमानि तु। इन्द्रियाणि यदा देही धारयन्निव तप्यते॥ लोके विततमात्मानं लोकं चात्मनि पश्यति। परावरज्ञो यः शक्तः स तु भूतानि पश्यति॥'}

{'en': "He who is bound to the bonds of his previous Karma, although learned in the highest spiritual wisdom, is cognizant only of his own soul's objective existence, but the person whose soul is never affected by the objective conditions around is never subject to ills, owing to its absorption in the primal spirit of Brahma. When a person has overcome illusion, his manly virtues consisting the essence of spiritual wisdom turn to spiritual enlightenment which illuminates the intelligence of all beings. Such a being is called by the omnipotent, the intelligent one who is without beginning and without end, selfexistence, immutable, incorporeal and incomparable.", 'sn': 'पश्यतः सर्वभूतानि सर्वावस्थासु सर्वदा। ब्रह्मभूतस्य संयोगो नाशुभेनोपपद्यते॥ अज्ञानमूलं तं क्लेशमतिवृत्तस्य पौरुषम्। लोकवृत्तिप्रकाशेन ज्ञानमार्गेण गम्यते॥ अनादिनिधनं जन्तुमात्मयोनिं सदाव्ययम्। अनौपम्यममूर्तं च भगवानाह बुद्धिमान्॥'}

{'en': 'O Brahmana, what you have enquired of me is the result of self-discipline. This selfdiscipline can only be acquired by subduing the senses. It can not be acquired by any other means.', 'sn': 'तपोमूलमिदं सर्वं यन्मां विप्रानुपृच्छसि। इन्द्रियाण्येव संयम्य तपो भवति नान्यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Heaven and hell both are dependent on our senses. When subdued, they lead us to heaven and when indulged in, they lead us to hell.', 'sn': 'इन्द्रियाण्येव तत् सर्वं यत् स्वर्गनरकावुभौ। निगृहीतविसृष्टानि स्वर्गाय नरकाय च॥'}

{'en': 'This subjugation of the senses is the highest means of attaining spiritual advancement; it is also at the root of all our spiritual degradation.', 'sn': 'एष योगविधिः कृत्स्नो यावदिन्द्रियधारणम्। एतन्मूलं हि तपसः कृत्स्नस्य नरकस्य च।॥'}

{'en': 'By indulging in them, a person contracts vices and by bringing them under control, he attains salvation.', 'sn': 'इन्द्रियाणां प्रसङ्केन दोषमार्छन्त्यसंशयम। संनियम्य तु तान्येव ततः सिद्धिं समाप्नुयात्॥'}

{'en': 'The self-controlled man who acquires over his six senses is never tainted with win; and consequently evil has no power over him.', 'sn': 'घण्णामात्मनि नित्यानामैश्वर्यं योऽधिगच्छति। न स पापैः कुतोऽनर्थैर्युज्यते विजितेन्द्रियः॥'}

{'en': "Man's body has been compared with a chariot, his soul with a charioteer and his senses with the horses. A skillful man drives about without confusion, like an able charioteer with well-broken horses.", 'sn': 'मात्मा नियन्तेन्द्रियाण्याहुरश्वान्। र्दान्तः सुखं याति रथीव धीरः॥'}

{'en': 'That man is an excellent driver who knows how to patiently wield the reins of these and horses, namely the six senses inherent in our nature.', 'sn': 'षण्णामात्मनि युक्तानामिन्द्रियाणां प्रमाथिनाम्। यो धीरो धारयेद् रश्मीन् स स्यात् परमसारथिः॥'}

{'en': 'When our senses become ungovernable like horses on the road, we must patiently rein them in, for with patience we are sure to get the better of them.', 'sn': 'इन्द्रियाणां प्रसृष्टानां हयानामिव वर्त्मसु। धृतिं कुर्वीत सारथ्ये धृत्या तानि जयेद् ध्रुवम्॥'}

{'en': "When man's mind is overpowered by any one of these senses running wild, he loses his reason and becomes like a ship tossed by the tempest in the sea.", 'sn': 'इन्द्रियाणां विचरतां यन्मनोऽनु विधीयते। तदस्य हरते बुद्धिं नावं वायुरिवाम्भसि॥'}

{'en': 'Men are deceived by illusion in hoping to reap the fruit of those six things the effects of which are studied by persons of spiritual insight who thereby reap the fruits of their clear perception.', 'sn': 'येषु विप्रतिपद्यन्ते षट्सु मोहात् फलागमम्। तेष्वध्यवसिताध्यायी विन्दते ध्यानजं फलम्॥'}

{'en': 'The God of wind said Hear, O deluded man, what the attributes are of Brahmanas who have all high souls. The Brahmana is superior to all those which, O king, you have named.', 'sn': 'श्रीमहेश्वर उवाच शृणु मूढ गुणान् कांश्चिद् ब्राह्मणानां महात्मनाम्। ये त्वया कीर्तिता राजंस्तेभ्योऽथ ब्राह्मणो वरः।।।।'}

{'en': 'Formerly, the Earth, indulging in a spirit of rivalry with the king of the Angas, forsook her character as Earth. The regenerate Kashyapa caused destruction to befall her by actually paralysing her.', 'sn': 'त्यक्त्वा महीत्वं भूमिस्तु स्पर्धयाङ्गनृपस्य ह। नाश जगाम तां विप्रो व्यस्तम्भयत कश्यपः॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmanas are always unconquerable, O king, in Heaven as also on Earth. Formerly, the great Rishi Angirasa, through his energy, drank off all the water.', 'sn': 'अजेया ब्राह्मणा राजन् दिवि चेह च नित्यदा। अपिबत् तेजसा ह्यापः स्वयमेवाङ्गिराः पुरा॥'}

{'en': 'Having drunk off all the waters as if they were milk, the great Rishi did not feel yet his thirst to be satisfied. He, therefore, once more caused the Earth to be filled with water by raising a mighty wave.', 'sn': 'स ताः पिबन् क्षीरमिव नातृप्यत महामनाः। अपूरयन्महौघेन महीं सर्वां च पार्थिव॥'}

{'en': 'On another occasion, when Angirasa became enraged with me, I fled away, leaving the world, and lived for a long time concealed in the Agnihotra of the Brahmanas, through fear of that Rishi.', 'sn': 'तस्मिन्नहं च क्रुद्ध वै जगत् त्यक्त्वा ततो गतः। व्यतिष्ठमग्निहोत्रे च चिरमङ्गिरसो भयात्॥'}

{'en': 'The illustrious Purandara, an account of his having coveted the body of Ahalya, was cursed by Gautama, yet for the sake of Virtue and wealth, the Rishi did not destroy outright the king of the celestials.', 'sn': 'अथ शप्तश्च भगवान् गौतमेन पुरन्दरः। अहल्यां कामयानो वै धर्मार्थं च न हिंसितः॥'}

{'en': 'The Ocean, O king, that was full in former days of crystal water, cursed by the Brahmanas, become saline in taste.', 'sn': 'तथा समुद्रो नृपते पूर्णो मृष्टस्य वारिणः। ब्राह्मणैरभिशप्तश्च बभूव लवणोदकः॥'}

{'en': 'Even Agni who is goldhued, and who blazes with cffulgence when destitute of smoke, and whose flames uniting together, burn upwards, when cursed by the angry Angiras, became divested of all these qualities.', 'sn': 'सुवर्णवर्णो निर्धूमः सङ्गतोर्ध्वशिखः कविः। क्रुद्धेनाङ्गिरसा शप्तो गुणैरेतैर्विवर्जितः॥'}

{'en': 'See, the sixty thousand sons of Sagara, who came here to worship the Ocean, have all been pulverised by the Brahmana Kapila of golden hue.', 'sn': 'महतश्चूर्णितान् पश्य ये हासन्त महोदधिम्। सुवर्णधारिणा नित्यमवशप्ता द्विजातिना॥'}

{'en': "You are not equal to the Brahmanas. Do you, O king, seek your own good. The Kshatriya of even great power bows to Brahmana children who are still in their mothers' wombs.", 'sn': 'समो न त्वं द्विजातिभ्यः श्रेयो विद्धि नराधिप। गर्भस्थान् ब्राह्मणान् सम्यङ् नमस्यति किल प्रभुः।।१०'}

{'en': 'The large kingdom of the Dandakas was destroyed by a Brahmana. The powerful Kshatriya Talajangha was destroyed by a single Brahmana, viz., Aurva.', 'sn': 'दण्डकानां महद् राज्यं ब्राह्मणेन विनाशितम्। तालजंघं महाक्षत्रमौर्वेणैकेन नाशितम्॥'}

{'en': 'You, too, have acquired a large kingdom, great might, religious merit, and learning, which are all difficult of acquirement, through the grace of Dattatreya.', 'sn': 'त्वया च विपुलं राज्यं बलं धर्मे श्रुतं तथा। दत्तात्रेयप्रसादेन प्राप्तं परमदुर्लभम्॥'}

{'en': 'Why do yu, O Arjuna, adore Agni everyday who is a Brahmana? He is the bearer of sacrificial libations from every part of the universe. Are you ignorant of this fact.', 'sn': 'अग्निं त्वं यजसे नित्यं कस्माद् ब्राह्मणमर्जुन। स हि सर्वस्य लोकस्य हव्यवाट् किं न वेत्सि तम्।।'}

{'en': 'Why, indeed, do you allow yourself to be stupefied by folly when you are not ignorant of the fact that a superior Brahmana is the protector of all creatures in the world and is, indeed, the creator of the living world?', 'sn': 'अथवा ब्राह्मणश्रेष्ठमनुभूतानुपालकम्। कर्तारं जीवलोकस्य कस्माज्जानन् विमुह्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'The Lord of all creatures, Brahman, unmanifest, gifted with power, and of unfading glory, who created this vast universe with its mobile and immobile creatures, (is Brahmana).', 'sn': 'तथा प्रजापतिर्ब्रह्मा अव्यक्तः प्रभुरव्ययः। येनेदं निखिलं विश्वं जनितं स्थावरं चरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Some ignorant persons there are, who say that Brahman was born of an Egg. From the original Egg, when it opened, mountains and the cardinal points and the waters and the Earth and the Heavens all came into existence.', 'sn': 'अण्डजातं तु ब्रह्माणं केचिदिच्छन्त्यपण्डिताः। अण्डाद् भिन्नाद् बभुः शैला दिशोऽम्भ:पृथिवी दिवम्'}

{'en': 'No one had seen this birth of the creation. How then can Brahman be said to to have taken his birth from thc original Egg, when especially he is said to be Unborn? It is said that vast increate Space is the original Egg. It was from this in create Space that the Grandfather was born. If you', 'sn': 'द्रष्टव्यं नैतदेवं हि कथं जायेदजो हि सः। स्मृतमाकाशमण्डं तु तस्माज्जातः पितामहः॥'}

{'en': 'ask, Whereon would the Grandfather, after his birth from increate Space, rest for there was then nothing else? The answer may be given thus. There is an existent Being of the name of Consciousness. That mighty Being is gifted with great energy.', 'sn': 'तिष्ठेत् कथमिति ब्रूहि न किंचिद्धि तदा भवेत्। अहङ्कार इति प्रोक्तः सर्वतेजोगतः प्रभुः॥'}

{'en': 'There is no Egg. Brahman, however, is existent. He is the Creator of the universe and is its King! Thus addressed by the god of wind, king Arjuna remained silent.', 'sn': 'नास्त्यण्डमस्ति तु ब्रह्मा स राजा लोकभावनः। इत्युक्तः स तदा तूष्णीमभूद् वायुस्ततोऽब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said Then the king Duryodhana said in the battle field to Bhishma, Drona, the foremost of warriors and as also to the mighty car-warrior Kripa.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच अथ दुर्योधनो राजा समरे भीष्ममब्रवीत्। द्रोणं च रथशार्दूलं कृपं च सुमहारथम्॥'}

{'en': 'Both myself and Karna had said this to the preceptor. I mention it again for I am not satisfied with speaking (once).', 'sn': 'उक्तोऽयमर्थ आचार्यो मया कर्णेन चासकृत्। पुनरेव प्रवक्ष्यामि न हि तृष्यामि तं ब्रुवन्॥'}

{'en': 'This was the condition that if defeated at dice the Pandavas will live in woods and countries for twelve years unknown to us.', 'sn': 'पराभूतैर्हि वस्तव्यं तैश्च द्वादश वत्सरान्। वने जनपदे ज्ञातैरेप एव पणो हि नः॥'}

{'en': 'The thirteenth year is still going on and not yet complete. Bibhatsu, who is living in disguise, has come to us.', 'sn': 'तेषां न तावन्निर्वृत्तं वर्तते तु त्रयोदशम्। अज्ञातवासो बीभत्सुरथास्माभिः समागतः॥'}

{'en': 'Now if Bibhatsu comes before the term of exile is over, the Pandavas shall have to pass another twelve years in the forest.', 'sn': 'अनिवृत्ते तु निर्वासे यदि बीभत्सुरागतः। पुनादश वर्षाणि वने वत्स्यन्ति पाण्डवाः॥'}

{'en': 'Whether by covetousness they have forgotten it or whether it is a mistake on our part, it is proper that Bhishma should calculate the shortness or excess (of the fixed period).', 'sn': 'लोभाद् वा ते न जानीयुरस्मान् वा मोह आविशत्। हीनातिरिक्तमेतेषां भीष्मो वेदितुमर्हति॥'}

{'en': "Doubt always exists in one of the alternatives of an object; an object, thought of in one way, becomes another (in the end). Even persons, conversant with morality, are confounded in their own acts; (we have come) to fight with the Matsya's stationed in the north.", 'sn': 'अर्थानां च पुनद्वैध नित्यं भवति संशयः। अन्यथा चिन्तितो ह्यर्थः पुनर्भवति सोऽन्यथा।॥'}

{'en': "If however Bibhatsu has come what fault is ours? We have here to fight with the Matsya's on behalf of the Trigartas.", 'sn': 'उत्तरं मार्गमाणानां मत्स्यानां च युयुत्सताम्। यदि बीभत्सुरायातस्तदा कस्यापरानुमः॥ त्रिगर्तानां वयं हेतोर्मत्स्यान् योद्भुमिहागताः।'}

{'en': "Various were the oppressions of the Matsya's described to us-and we promised them help, assailed with fear as they were. And the arrangement with them was that they should first, on the afternoon of the seventh lunar day, seize the great collection of the precious kine of the Matsya's.", 'sn': 'मत्स्यानां विप्रकारांस्ते बहूनस्मानकीर्तयन्॥ तेषां भयाभिभूतानां तदस्माभिः प्रतिश्रुतम्। प्रथमं तैर्ग्रहीतव्यं मत्स्यानां गोधनं महत्। सप्तम्यामपराठे वै तथा तैस्तु समाहितम्॥'}

{'en': "And at sun-rise of the eighth lunar day we should seize these kine when the king of Matsya's would be pursuing those seized first,", 'sn': 'अष्टम्यां पुनरस्माभिरादित्यस्योदयं प्रति। इमा गावो ग्रहीतव्या गते मत्स्ये गवां पदम्॥'}

{'en': "It may be that they are bringing the kine, or being defeated are coming to us for negotiating peace with the Matsya's.", 'sn': 'ते वा गाश्चानयिष्यन्ति यदि वा स्युः पराजिताः। अस्मान् वा [पसंधाय कुर्युर्मत्स्येन संगतम्॥'}

{'en': "Or it may be that having driven them off, the king of Matsya's, leading his people and his army of fierce warriors, income to make upon us night attacks. Perhaps someone powerful amongst them or even the king of Matsya's himself is coming to defeat us. Be he the king of Matsya's or Bibhatsu, we must all fight with him. This is our condition. Why are all these leading car-warriors Bhishma, Drona, Kripa, Vikarana and Drona's son now sitting panic-stricken on their cars?", 'sn': 'अथवा तानपाहाय मत्स्यो जानपदैः सह। सर्वया सेनया साधु संवृतो भीमरूपया। आयातः केवलं रात्रिमस्मान् योद्भुमिहागतः॥ तेषामेव महावीर्यः कश्चिदेष पुरःसरः। असमाढोतुमिहायातो मत्स्यो वापि स्वयं भवेत्॥ यद्येष राजा मत्स्यानां यदि बीभत्सुरागतः। सर्योद्धव्यमस्माभिरिति नः समयः कृतः॥ अथ कस्मात् स्थिता ह्येते रथेषु रथसत्तमाः। भीष्मो द्रोणः कृपश्चैव विकर्णो द्रौणिरेव च॥ सम्भ्रान्तमनसः सर्वे काले ह्यस्मिन् महारथाः।'}

{'en': 'There is no other help but fighting now. Make up your minds, therefore, Even, for seizing these precious kine, we have got to fight with the Divine holder of thunder-bolt or with Yama. Who is there that will be able to go to Hastinapur? Pierced by my shafts, when running away from the battle field through the woods, who amongst the infantry shall be able to escape with his life, while that of the cavalry is so doubtful? Keeping, the preceptor behind, do you make all arrangements.', 'sn': 'नान्यत्र युद्धाच्छ्रेयोऽस्ति तथाऽऽत्मा प्रणिधीयताम्॥१७ आच्छिन्ने गोधनेऽस्माकमपि देवेन वज्रिणा। यमेन वापि संग्रामे को हास्तिनपुरं व्रजेत्॥ शरैरेभिः प्रणुनानां भग्नानां गहने वने। को हि जीवेत् पदातीनां भवेदश्वेषु संशयः॥ दुर्योधनवचः श्रुत्वा राधेयस्त्वब्रवीद् वचः। आचार्य पृष्ठतः कृत्वा तथा नीतिर्विधीयताम्॥'}

{'en': 'He knows their views and strikes terror into our minds. I perceive his affection for Arjuna is very great.', 'sn': 'जानाति हि मतं तेषामतस्त्रासयतीह नः। अर्जुने चास्य सम्प्रीतिमधिकामुपलक्षये।॥'}

{'en': "Seeing him only come he sings the praises of Bibhatsu. Make such arrangements that our army may not break up. Every thing has been confused for Drona's having heard of his horses' neighs.", 'sn': 'तथा हि दृष्ट्वा बीभत्सुमुपायान्तं प्रशंसति। यथा सेना न भज्येत तथा नीतिर्विधीयताम्॥ हृषितं ह्यपशृण्वाने द्रोणे सर्वं विघदृितम्।'}

{'en': 'Make such arrangement that these soldiers, coming to a distant country in the summer, and in the midst of this huge forest, may not be routed and vanquished by the enemy.', 'sn': 'अदेशिका महारण्ये ग्रीष्मे शत्रु वशं गताः। यथा न विभ्रमेत् सेना तथा नीतिविधीयताम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandavas are always the favourites of the preceptor. He betrays by his words that he is for others.', 'sn': 'इष्टा हि पाण्डवा नित्यमाचार्यस्य विशेषतः आसयनपरार्थाश्च कथ्यते स्म स्वयं तथा॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing only the neighs of horses who would ever praise a man? Whether walking or standing the horses neigh.', 'sn': 'अश्वानां हृषितं श्रुत्वा कः प्रशंसापरो भवेत्। स्थाने वापि व्रजन्तो वा सदा द्वेषन्ति वाजिनः।२५॥'}

{'en': 'The winds always blow and Indra always showers rain and the roar of the clouds may be heard many times.', 'sn': 'सदा च वायवो वान्ति नित्यं वर्षति वासवः। स्तनयित्नोश्च निर्घोषः श्रूयते बहुशस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'What has Partha to do with these and why should he be praised? It is so either for the desire of doing good to him or for hatred and anger towards us.', 'sn': 'किमत्र कार्यं पार्थस्य कथं वा स प्रशस्यते। अन्यत्र कामाद् द्वेषाद् वा रोषादस्मासु केवलात्॥'}

{'en': 'Preceptors are wise, virtuous and very kind to all creatures but they should not be consulted in hours of danger.', 'sn': 'आचार्या वै कारुणिकाः प्राज्ञाश्चापापदर्शिनः। नैते महाभये प्राप्ते सम्प्रष्टव्याः कथंचन॥'}

{'en': 'It is in beautiful places, assemblies and gardens where beautiful speeches are to be made that the learned men seem to be in their proper places.', 'sn': 'प्रासादेषु विचित्रेषु गोष्ठीषूपवनेषु च। कथा विचित्राः कुर्वाणाः पण्डितास्तत्र शोभनाः।।२९।'}

{'en': 'The learned shine in the concourse of men, where they perform many wonderful things and there where sacrificial vessels and their uses are necessary.', 'sn': 'बहून्याश्चर्यरूपाणि कुर्वाणा जनसंसदि। इज्यास्त्रे चोपसंधाने पण्डितास्तत्र शोभनाः॥'}

{'en': 'In the knowledge of learning the weak points of others, in studying the characters of men, in the science of horses, elephants and cars, in treating the diseases of asses, camels, goats, sheep and kine, in making plans of buildings and gates, in pointing out the defects of food and drink the learned are truly in their elements.', 'sn': 'परेषां विवरज्ञाने मनुष्यचरितेषु च। हस्त्यश्वरथचर्यासु खरोष्ट्राजाविकर्मणि।॥ गोधनेषु प्रतोलीषु वरद्वारमुखेषु च। अन्नसंस्कारदोषेषु पण्डितास्तत्र शोभनाः॥'}

{'en': 'Leaving behind the learned who speak highly of the heroism of the enemy, do you so arrange that the enemy may be killed.', 'sn': 'पण्डितान् पृष्ठतः कृत्वा परेषां गुणवादिनः। विधीयतां तता नीतिर्यथा वध्यो भवेत् परः॥'}

{'en': 'Keeping the kine secure arrange the army in battle array. Keep guards in proper places so that we may fight with the enemy.', 'sn': 'गावश्च सम्प्रतिष्ठाप्य सेनां व्यूह्य समन्ततः। आरक्षाश्च विधीयन्तां यत्र योत्स्यामहे परान्॥'}

{'en': 'Narada said O Srinjaya, we also heard of the death of king Gaya, the son of Amurtarajas, who for hundred years lived only upon remnants of the libations offered on fire.', 'sn': '। नारद उवाच गयं चामूर्तरयसं मृतं सृञ्जय शुश्रुम। यो वै वर्षशतं राजा हुतशिष्टाशनोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereat Agni offered to bestow boon on him; and thereupon Gaya asked for this boon saying, "I desire to acquaint myself with the contents of the Vedas, through ascetic penances, observance of Brahmacharya rites, vows and rules and also through the grace of my preceptors. I also desire to acquire inexhaustible wealth without transgressing the duties of the order which I belong to and without any injury to any one else.', 'sn': 'तस्मै ह्यग्निर्वरं प्रदात् ततो ववे वरं गयः। तपसा ब्रह्मचर्येण व्रतेन नियमेन च॥ गुरूणां च प्रसादेन वेदानिच्छामि वेदितुम्। स्वधर्मेणाविहिंस्यान्यान् धनमिच्छामि चाक्षयम्॥'}

{'en': 'I desire also the boon, that everyday I may give away devoutly my wealth to the Brahmanas. I wish also to beget sons upon females of my own order and not upon others.', 'sn': 'विप्रेषु ददतश्चैव श्रद्धा भवतु नित्यशः। अनन्यासु सवर्णासु पुत्रजन्म च मे भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Let devotion be the ruling feeling of my heart when I shall give away edibles; let also my mind delight in the fountain of righteousness. Let, O Agni, no difficulty overtake me when I engage myself in the performance of pious deeds."', 'sn': 'अन्नं मे ददतः श्रद्धा धर्मे मे रमतां मनः। अविनं चास्तु मे नित्यं धर्मकार्येषु पावक॥'}

{'en': '"It shall be so", saying this, the God of Fire, disappeared even there. Then Gaya realising all those boons sought, began to obtain righteous victories over all his enemies.', 'sn': 'तथा भविष्यतीत्युक्त्वा तत्रैवान्तरधीयत। गयो ह्यवाप्य तत् सर्वे धर्मेणारीनजीजयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Then king Gaya celebrated for a full hundred years, various kinds of sacrifices with profuse Dakshinas, as also many other vows as Chaturmasya.', 'sn': 'स दर्शपौर्णमासाभ्यां कालेष्वाग्रयणेन च। चातुर्मास्यैश्च विविधैर्यज्ञैश्चावाप्तदक्षिणैः॥'}

{'en': 'Every year, in a century, the king gave unto the Brahmanas, with due devotion, hundred thousand kine, ten thousand horses.', 'sn': 'अयजच्छ्रद्धया राजा परिसंवत्सरान् शतम्। गवां शतसहस्राणि शतमश्वशतानि च॥'}

{'en': 'And for several successive centuries he gave to the Brahmanas hundred thousand Nishkas and sixty-thousand kine, at the time of his rising.', 'sn': 'शतं निष्कसहस्राणि गवां चाप्ययुतानि षट्। उत्थायोत्थाय स प्रादात् परिसंवत्सरान् शतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Under every (auspicious) conjunction of the constellations, he gave away presents specified for those occasions. Verily the monarch performed various sacrifices like another Soma or another Angirasa.', 'sn': 'नक्षत्रेषु च सर्वेषु ददनक्षत्रदक्षिणा:। ईजे च विविधैर्यज्ञैर्यथा सोमोऽङ्गिरा यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Making the earth covered with gold and with pebbles constituted by gems, he gave her away as a present to the Brahmanas during the celebration of his great Horse-sacrifice.', 'sn': 'सौवर्णां पृथिवीं कृत्वा य इमां मणिशर्कराम्। विप्रेभ्यः प्राददद् राजा सोऽश्वमेधे महामखे॥'}

{'en': 'In the sacrifices of Gaya, the stakes were made of gold; and embossed with jewels and precious, they delighted the hearts of all.', 'sn': 'जाम्बूनदमया यूपाः सर्वे रत्नपरिच्छदाः। गयस्यासन् समृद्धास्तु सर्वभूतमनोहराः॥'}

{'en': 'Then Gaya gave to the delighted Brahmanas and other creatures, those stakes and many other precious objects of desire.', 'sn': 'सर्वकामसमृद्धं च प्रादादनं गयस्तदा। ब्राह्मणेभ्यः प्रहृष्टेभ्यः सर्वभूतेभ्य एव च॥'}

{'en': 'The various species of creatures inhabiting the oceans, the islands, the rivers male and female, the woods, forests, towns, kingdoms, the paradise and the sky and diverse other beings were gratified with the wealth and riches distributed at Gaya\'s sacrifice. They then said, "There was no sacrifice like that celebrated by Gaya."', 'sn': 'स समुद्रवनद्वीपनदीनदवनेषु च। नगरेषु च राष्ट्रषु दिवि व्योम्नि च येऽवसन्॥ भूतग्रामाश्च विविधाः संतृप्ता यज्ञसम्पदा। गयस्य सदृशो यज्ञो नास्त्यन्य इतितेऽब्रुवन्॥'}

{'en': 'The sacrificial altar of Gaya was thirty yojanas long, twenty-six yojanas high; and it was covered with gold and strewn over with pearls and gems. He gave away this altar and inany garments and ornaments to the Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'षट्त्रिंशद् योजनायामा त्रिंशद् योजनमायता। पश्चात् पुस्चतुर्विशद् वेदी ह्यासीद्धिरण्मयी॥ गयस्य यजमानस्य मुक्तावज्रमणिस्तृता। प्रादात् स ब्राह्मणेभ्योऽथ वासांस्याभरणानि च॥'}

{'en': 'That liberal-handed monarch gave to the Brahmanas other presents specified in the scriptures. When the sacrifice was completed, their remained twenty-five mountains of edibles and foods, (untouched).', 'sn': 'यथोक्ता दक्षिणाश्चान्या विप्रेभ्यो भूरिदक्षिणः। यत्र भोजनशिष्टस्य पर्वताः पञ्जविंशतिः॥'}

{'en': 'And there also remained many lakes of potions and several stream of juicy drinks flowing charmingly and many garments and rnaments, perfumes and many princes (who were intended to be given away as presents).', 'sn': 'कुल्याः कुशलवाहिन्यो रसानामभवंस्तदा। वस्त्राभरणगन्धानां राशयश्च पृथग्विधाः॥'}

{'en': 'Through that great sacrifice of his, Gaya became well-known in the three worlds; and the eternal Banian tree and the holy Brahmalake, owe their origin to that sacrifice.', 'sn': 'यस्य प्रभावाच्च गयस्त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः। वटचाक्षय्यकरणः पुण्यं ब्रह्मसरश्च तत्॥'}

{'en': "O Srinjaya, when even such a king, who was far superior in respect of the four cardinal virtues to you and consequently to your son, had to undergo death, you should not lament for your son who performed no sacrifice and made no sacrificial gifts-saying 'O Shvaitya.'", 'sn': 'स चेन्ममार सृञ्जय चतुर्भद्रतरस्त्वया। पुत्रात् पुण्यतरस्तुभ्यं मा पुत्रमनुतप्यथाः। अयज्वानमदाक्षिण्यमभि श्वैत्येत्युदाहरत्॥'}

{'en': 'Janaka said O holy one, it has been said that the relation between male and female is like that which exists between the Indestructible and the Destructible.', 'sn': 'जनक उवाच अक्षरक्षरयोरेष द्वयोः सम्बन्ध इष्यते। स्त्रीपुंसोऽपि भगवन् सम्बन्धस्तद्वदुच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Without a male, a female can never conceive. Without a female, a male also can never create a form.', 'sn': 'ऋते तु पुरुषं नेह स्त्री गर्भ धारयत्युत। ऋते स्त्रियं न पुरुषो रूपं निवर्तयेत् तथा॥'}

{'en': 'On account of their union with each other, and each depending upon the qualities of the other, forms are seen to spring up. This is the case with all orders of being.', 'sn': 'अन्योन्यस्याभिसम्बन्धादन्योन्यगुणसंश्रयात्। रूपं निर्वर्तयत्येतदेवं सर्वासु योनिषु॥ ये'}

{'en': "Through each other's union for purposes of (sexual) intercourse, and through each depending upon the qualities of the other, forms (of living creatures) flow in seasons. I shall tell you the indications thereof.", 'sn': 'रत्यर्थमभिसम्बन्धादन्योन्यगुणसंश्रयात्। ऋतौ निर्वय॑ते रूपं तद् वक्ष्यामि निदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hear what the qualities are which belong to the father and what those are which belong to mother. Bones, sinews, and marrow, O twiceborn one, we know, originate from the father.', 'sn': 'गुणाः पुरुषस्येह ये च मातृगुणास्तथा। अस्थि स्नायुश्च मज्जा च जानीम: पितृणो गुणाः॥'}

{'en': 'Skin, flesh, and blood, we hear, originate from the mother. Even this, O foremost of twice-born ones, is what may be read of in the Veda and other scriptures.', 'sn': 'त्वङ्मांसं शोणितं चेति मातृजान्यपि शुश्रुम। एवमेतद् द्विजश्रेष्ठ वेदे शास्त्रे च पठ्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Whatever is read as said in the Vedas and in other scriptures is considered as authority. The authority, again, of the Vedas and other scriptures, is eternal.', 'sn': 'प्रमाणं यत् स्ववेदोक्तं शास्त्रोक्तं यच्च पठ्यते। वेदशास्त्रद्वयं चैव प्रमाणं तत् सनातनम्॥'}

{'en': "If Nature and Soul be always united together in this way by each opposing and cach depending on the other's qualities, I see, O holy one, that Liberation cannot exist. You, O holy one, are gifted with spiritual vision so that you see all things as if they are present before your eyes. If, therefore, there be any direct evidence of the existence of Liberation, do speak of it to me.", 'sn': 'अन्योन्यगुणसंरोधादन्योन्यगुणसंश्रयात्। एवमेवाभिसम्बद्धौ नित्यं प्रकृतिपूरुषो॥ पश्यामि भगवंस्तस्मान्मोक्षधर्मो न विद्यते। अथवानन्तरकृतं किंचिदेव निदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'We are desirous of acquiring Liberation. Indeed, we wish to acquire That which is auspicious, bodiless, not subject to decrepitude, eternal, beyond the perception of the senses, and having nothing superior to it.', 'sn': 'तन्ममाचक्ष्व तत्त्वेन प्रत्यक्षो ह्यसि सर्वदा। मोक्षकामा वयं चापि काङ्क्षामो यदनामयम्। अदेहमजरं नित्यमतीन्द्रियमनीश्वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vashishtha said What you say about the characteristics of the Vedas and the other scriptures is even so. You understand those marks in the way in which they should be understood.', 'sn': 'वसिष्ठ उवाच यदेतदुक्तं भवता वेदशास्त्रनिदर्शनम्। एवमेतद् यथा चैतन्निगृह्णाति तथा भवान्॥'}

{'en': 'O lord of kings, you only understand aright the texts of the Vedas and other scriptures without understanding the true senses or meaning of those texts, remembering them fruitlessly.', 'sn': 'धार्यते हि त्वया ग्रन्थ उभयोर्वेदशास्त्रयोः। न च ग्रन्थस्य तत्त्वज्ञो यथातत्त्वं नरेश्वर॥'}

{'en': 'Indeed, one who remembers a work without understanding their meaning, is said to carry an useless load. He, however, who understands the true meaning of a treatise, is said to have studied that work to purpose.', 'sn': 'यो हि वेदे च शास्त्रे च ग्रन्थधारणतत्परः। न च ग्रन्थार्थतत्त्वज्ञस्तस्य तद्धारणं वृथा॥ भारं स वहते तस्य ग्रन्थस्यार्थं न वेत्ति यः। यस्तु ग्रन्थार्थतत्त्वज्ञो नास्य ग्रन्थागमो वृथा॥'}

{'en': 'Asked about the meaning of a text, one should communicate that meaning which he has understood by a careful study.', 'sn': 'ग्रन्थस्यार्थस्य पृष्टः संस्तादृशो वक्तुमर्हति। यथा तत्त्वाभिगमनादर्थं तस्य स विन्दति॥'}

{'en': 'That person of dull intelligence who refuses to explain the meanings of text in the midst of an assemblage of the learned, that person of foolish understanding, never succeeds in explaining the meaning aright.', 'sn': 'न यः संसत्सु कथयेद् ग्रन्थार्थं स्थूलबुद्धिमान्। स कथं मन्दविज्ञानो ग्रन्थं वक्ष्यति निर्णयात्॥'}

{'en': 'An ignorant wight, going to explain the true meaning of treatises, incurs ridicule. Even those endued with a knowledge of the Soul have to incurs ridicule on such occasions.', 'sn': 'निर्णयं चापि छिद्रात्मा न तं वक्ष्यति तत्त्वतः। सोपहासात्मतामेति यस्माच्चैवात्मवानपि॥'}

{'en': 'Listen now to me, O king, as to how the subject of Liberation has been explained among the great persons conversant with the Sankhya and the Yoga Systems of Philosophy.', 'sn': 'तस्मात् त्वं शृणु राजेन्द्र यथैतदनुदृश्यते। याथातथ्ये सांख्येषु योगेषु च महात्मसु॥'}

{'en': 'That which the Yogins behold is exactly what the Sankhyas strive after to attain. He who sees the Sankhya and the Yoga Systems to be one and the same is said to be gifted with intelligence.', 'sn': 'यदेव योगाः पश्यन्ति सांख्यैस्तदनुगम्यते। एकं सांख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स बुद्धिमान्॥'}

{'en': 'Skin, flesh, blood, fat, bile, marrow, and sinews, and these senses, which you were speaking to me, exist.', 'sn': 'त्वङ्मांसं रुधिरं मेदः पित्तं मज्जा च स्नायु च। अथ चैन्द्रियकं तात तद् भवानिदमाह माम्॥'}

{'en': 'Objects originate from objects; the senses from the senses. From body one acquires a body, as a seed is obtained from seed.', 'sn': 'द्रव्याद् द्रव्यस्य निर्वृत्तिरिन्द्रियादिन्द्रियं तथा। देहाद् देहमवाप्नोति बीजाद् बीजं तथैव च॥'}

{'en': 'When the Supreme Being is without senses, without seed, without matter, without body, He must be divested of all qualities; and on account of His being so, how, indeed, can He have qualities of any kind?', 'sn': 'निरिन्द्रियस्याबीजस्य निर्द्रव्यस्याप्यदेहिनः। कथं गुणा भविष्यन्ति निर्गुणत्वान्महात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'Ether and other qualities originate from the qualities of Goodness, Darkness, and Ignorance, and disappear in the end in them. Thus the qualities arise from Nature and disappear in Nature.', 'sn': 'गुणा गुणेषु जायन्ते तत्रैव निविशन्ति च। एवं गुणा: प्रकृतितो जायन्ते निविशन्ति च।॥'}

{'en': 'Skin, flesh, blood, fat, bile, marrow, bones, and sinews,-these eight, that are made of Nature, know, O king, may sometimes be produced by the vital seed alone (of the male).', 'sn': 'त्वमांसं रुधिरं मेदः पित्तं मज्जास्थि स्नायु च। अष्टौ तान्यथ शुक्रेण जानीहि प्राकृतानि वै॥'}

{'en': 'The Individual Soul and the universe are said to both partake of Nature characterised by the three qualities of Goodness, Darkness, and Ignorance. The Supreme Soul is different from both the Individual Soul and the universe.', 'sn': 'पुमांश्चैवापुमांश्चैव त्रैलिङ्गचं प्राकृतं स्मृतम्। न वापुमान् पुमांश्चैव स लिङ्गीत्यभिधीयते॥'}

{'en': 'As the seasons, though having no forms, are nevertheless inferred from the appearance of particular fruits and flowers, similarly, Nature, though formless, is inferred from the Principles of Greatness and the rest that originate from it.', 'sn': 'अलिङ्गात् प्रकृतिर्लिङ्गैरुपालभ्यति सात्मजैः। यथा पुष्पफलैर्नित्यमृतवोऽमूर्तयस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'Thus, from the existence of Consciousness in body, the Supreme Soul, shorn of all qualities whatever and perfectly stainless, is inferred.', 'sn': 'एवमप्यनुमानेन ह्यलिङ्गमुपलभ्यते। पञ्चविंशतिमस्तात लिङ्गेषु नियतात्मकः॥'}

{'en': 'Without beginning and destruction, without end, the seer of all things, and auspicious, that Soul, only on account of its Oneness with the body and other qualities, comes to be taken as invested with qualities.', 'sn': 'अनादिनिधनोऽनन्तः सर्वदर्शी निरामयः। केवलं त्वभिमानित्वाद् गुणेषु गुण उच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Those persons who are truly conversant with qualities know that only objects endued with qualities can have attributes but that That which is above all qualities can have none.', 'sn': 'गुणा गुणवतः सन्ति निर्गुणस्य कुतो गुणाः। तस्मादेवं विजानन्ति ये जना गुणदर्शिनः॥'}

{'en': 'When the Individual Soul conquers all qualities born of Nature and which it assumes under mistake, only then does it see the Supreme Soul.', 'sn': 'यदा त्वेष गुणानेतान् प्राकृतानभिमन्यते। तदा स गुणहान्य तं परमेवानुपश्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Only the highest Rishis conversant with the Sankhya and the Yoga Systems know that Supreme Soul which Sankhyas and Yogins and believers in all other Systems say is beyond the Understanding, which is considered as Knower and endued with the highest wisdom on account of its renouncing all consciousness of identi-fication with nature, which is above the attribute of Ignorance or Error, which is Unmanifest, which is beyond all attributes, which is called the Supreme, which is dissociated from all attributes, which ordains all things, which is Eternal and Immutable, which overrules Nature and all her attributes, and which, getting over twenty-four topics of enquiry, forms the twenty-fifth.', 'sn': 'यत् तद् बुद्धेः परं प्राहुः सांख्या योगाश्च सर्वशः। बुद्ध्यमानं महाप्राज्ञमबुद्धपरिवर्जनात्॥ अप्रबुद्धमथाव्यक्तं सगुणं प्राहुरीश्वरम्। निर्गुणं चेश्वरं नित्यमधिष्ठातारमेव च॥ प्रकृतेश्च गुणानां च पञ्चविंशतिकं बुधाः। सांख्ययोगे च कुशला बुध्यन्ते परमैषिणः॥'}

{'en': 'When men of knowledge, who stand in fear of birth, of the several states of living consciousness, and of death, succeed in knowing the Unmanifest, they succeed in understanding the Supreme Soul at the same time.', 'sn': 'यदा प्रबुद्धा ह्यव्यक्तमवस्थाजन्मभीरवः। बुध्यमानं प्रबुध्यन्ति गमयन्ति समं तदा॥'}

{'en': 'An intelligent man considers the unity of the Individual Soul with the Supreme Soul as consistent with the scriptures and as perfectly correct; while the man shorn of intelligence considers the two as different from each other. This forms the distinction between the man of intelligence and the man that is shorn of it.', 'sn': 'एतन्निदर्शनं सम्यगसम्यगनिदर्शनम्। बुध्यमानाप्रबुद्धानां पृथपृथगरिंदम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Characteristics of both the Destructible and Indestructible have now been said to you. The indestructible is Oneness or Unity, while multiplicity or variety is said to be the Destructible.', 'sn': 'परस्परेणैतदुक्तं क्षराक्षरनिदर्शनम्। एकत्वमक्षरं प्राहुर्नानात्वं क्षरमुच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'When one begins to study and understand property the twenty-five topics of enquiry, one then understands that the oneness of the Soul is consistent with the scriptures and its multiplicity is what is opposed to them.', 'sn': 'पञ्चविंशतिनिष्ठोऽयं यदा सम्यक् प्रवर्तते। एकत्वं दर्शनं चास्य नानात्वं चाप्यदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'These are the several characteristics of what is included in the list of topics is beyond that number and forms and twenty-sixth. The study or comprehension of created things according to their aggregates (of five) is the study and comprehension of topics. Above these is That which is eternal.', 'sn': 'तत्त्वनिस्तत्त्वयोरेतत् पृथगेव निदर्शनम्। पञ्चविंशतिसगं तु तत्त्वमाहुर्मनीषिणः॥ निस्तत्त्वं पञ्चविंशस्य परमाहुर्निदर्शनम्। सर्गस्य वर्गमाधारं तत्त्वं तत्त्वात् सनातनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said These are the notable Rathas and Atirathas on your side, O ruler of men, and these, o king, are semi-Rathas; listen now to those of the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच एते रथास्तवाख्यातास्तथैवातिरथा नृप। ये चाप्यर्धरथा राजन् पाण्डवानामत: शृणु।॥'}

{'en': 'If you have now any curiosity to learn of the strength of the Pandavas, O ruler of men, then listen to the list of their Rathas along with these rulers of the earth.', 'sn': 'यदि कौतूहलं तेऽद्य पाण्डवानां बले नृप। रथसंख्यां शृणुष्व त्वं सहैभिर्वसुधाधिपः॥'}

{'en': 'The king, the son of Pandu and the delight of Kunti, is himself a mighty Ratha; and my dear son, he will roam about in the battle like fire itself; there in no doubt.', 'sn': 'स्वयं राजा रथोदारः पाण्डवः कुन्तिनन्दनः। अग्निवत् समरे तात चरिष्यति न संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhimasena, O chief among kings, is held to be eight times a Ratha and in a fight with the mace or arrows he has no equal.', 'sn': 'भीमसेनस्तु राजेन्द्र रथोऽष्टगुणसम्मितः। न तस्यास्ति समो युद्धे गदया सायकैरपि।॥'}

{'en': 'Filled with pride and endued with the strength of ten thousand elephants he is not human is energy; the two foremost among men, the sons of Madri, are two Rathas.', 'sn': 'नागायुतबलो मानी तेजसा न स मानुषः। माद्रीपुत्रौ च रथिनौ द्वावेष पुरुषर्षभौ॥'}

{'en': 'Like the Ashvins in beauty and endued also with energy these two will fight in the very van on their army remembering their hard sufferings.', 'sn': 'अश्विनाविव रूपेण तेजसा च समन्वितौ। एते चमूमुपगताः स्मरन्तः क्लेशमुत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'They will roam about like so many Rudras, of that there is no doubt. All of them are great-souled and tall as the trunks of Shala trees.', 'sn': 'रुद्रवत् प्रचरिष्यन्ति तत्र मे नास्ति संशयः। सर्व एव महात्मानः शालस्तम्भा इवोद्गताः॥'}

{'en': 'Measuring a span more than other males, all the sons of Pandu, capable of killing lions, are endued with great strength.', 'sn': 'प्रादेशेनाधिकाः पुम्भिरन्यैस्ते च प्रमाणतः। सिंहसंहननाः सर्वे पाण्डुपुत्रा महाबलाः॥'}

{'en': 'All of them are devotees, my dear son, and Brahmacharyya vows have been practised by all of them; endued with modesty, those foremost among men are of fierce strength as the tigers.', 'sn': 'चरितब्रह्मचर्याश्च सर्वे तात तपस्विनः। ह्रीमन्तः पुरुषव्याघ्रा व्याघ्रा इव बलोत्कटाः॥'}

{'en': 'In impetuosity, in striking and crushing all of them are superhuman and by them by all the rulers of the earth had been vanquished at the time of the universal conquest.', 'sn': 'जवे प्रहारे सम्म सर्व एवातिमानुषाः। सर्वैर्जिता महीपाला दिग्जये भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'No human being can bear their weapons, maces and arrows, none can even adjust the string at the time of using the bow, O son of Kuru.', 'sn': 'न चैषां पुरुषाः केचिदायुधानि गदाः शरान्। विषहन्ति सदा कर्तुमधिज्यान्यपि कौरव॥'}

{'en': 'In uplifting maces, in shooting arrows, in hitting the target, in eating and in sporting in the dust,', 'sn': 'उद्यन्तं वा गदा गुर्वीः शरान् वा क्षेप्तुमाहवे। जवे लक्ष्यस्य हरणे भोज्ये पांसुविकर्षणे॥'}

{'en': 'Even as children there was great difference between yourself and them. They, all of whom are endued with fierce strength, meeting this army,', 'sn': 'बालैरपि भवन्तस्तैः सर्व एव विशेषिताः। एतत् सैन्यं समासाद्य सर्व एव बलोत्कटाः॥'}

{'en': 'Will destroy them in battle; let there therefore be no encounter with them. In the press of battle, each of them can alone slay the entire universe.', 'sn': 'विध्वंसयिष्यन्ति रणे मा स्म तैः सह सङ्गमः। एकैकशस्ते सम्पर्दे हन्युः सर्वान् महीक्षितः॥'}

{'en': 'It was in your presence, O chief among kings, namely what happened in the Rajasuya. The sufferings of Draupadi and the harsh words at the game of vice,', 'sn': 'प्रत्यक्षं तव राजेन्द्र राजसूये यथाऽभवत्। द्रौपद्याश्च परिक्लेश द्युते च परुषा गिरः॥'}

{'en': 'Remembering these they will wander about in the battle like Rudra. Regarding Gudakesha (curling hair) of copper eyes having Narayana for his ally,', 'sn': 'ते स्मरन्तश्च संग्रामे चरिष्यन्ति च रुद्रवत्। लोहिताक्षो गुडाकेशो नारायणसहायवान्॥'}

{'en': 'There is no brave car-warrior who can equal him in both the armies; nor is there any among the gods, human beings or serpents;', 'sn': 'उभयोः सेनयोर्वीरो रथो नास्तीति तादृशः। न हि देवेषु वा पूर्वं मनुष्ये पूरगेषु च॥'}

{'en': 'Nor even among Rakshasas and Yakshas, how can there then be any among men? Nor have I heard of any that has been or that will be.', 'sn': 'राक्षसेष्वथ यक्षेषु नरेषु कुत एव तु। भूतोऽथवा भविष्यो वा रथः कश्चिन्मया श्रुतः॥'}

{'en': 'O great king, the wise son of Pritha has a chariot which has Vasudeva for its driver and Dhananjaya as the soldier.', 'sn': 'समायुक्तो महाराज स्थः पार्थस्य धीमतः। वासुदेवश्च संयन्ता योद्धा चैव धनंजयः॥'}

{'en': 'He has the celestial bow Gandiva and horses that have the speed of wind, celestial coat of mail which is impenetrable and great arrow holders which are inexhaustible;', 'sn': 'गाण्डीवं च धनुर्दिव्यं ते चाश्वा वातरंहसः। अभेद्यं कवचं दिव्यमक्षय्यौ च महेषुधी॥'}

{'en': 'Groups of arms presented by the great Indra and Rudra and Kuvera and Yama and Varuna and a mace which is fierce to look at,', 'sn': 'अस्त्रग्रामश्च माहेन्द्रो रौद्रः कौबेर एव च। याम्यश्च वारुणश्चैव गदाचोग्रप्रदर्शनाः॥'}
{'en': 'And several foremost weapons for attack, the thunderbolt. Thousands of Danavas living in Hiranyapura,', 'sn': 'वज्रादीनि च मुख्यानि नानाप्रहरणानि च। दानवानां सहस्राणि हिरण्यपुरवासिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Where slain by him riding on a single chariot. What car-warrior is there who can be equal to him? Endued with wrath, strong and of true prowess the one of long arms will slay,', 'sn': 'हतान्येकरथेनाजौ कस्तस्य सदृशो रथः। एष हन्याद्धि संरम्भी बलवान् सत्यविक्रमः॥'}
{'en': 'Your army, protecting his own. Myself or the preceptor can advance against this Dhananjaya.', 'sn': 'तव सेनां महाबाहुः स्वां चैव परिपालयन्। अहं चैनं प्रत्युदियामाचार्यो वा धनंजयम्॥'}

{'en': 'There is no third car-warrior, O chief among kings, in both these armies who can advance against him while he pours showers of amrows.', 'sn': 'न तृतीयोऽस्ति राजेन्द्र सेनयोरुभयोरपि। य एनं शरवर्षाणि वर्षन्तमुदियाद् रथी।॥'}

{'en': 'Showing arrows like clouds at the close of the hot season urged by mighty winds the son of Kunti, having Vasudeva for his ally, is waiting for battle. He is young and experienced while both of us are worn out.', 'sn': 'जीमूत इव धर्मान्ते महावातसमीरितः। समायुक्तस्तु कौन्तेयो वासुदेवसहायवान्। तरुणश्च कृती चैव जीर्णावावामुभावपि॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said Hearing these words of Bhishma and at the time recollecting with their trembling hearts the old might of the sons of Pandu they had themselves witnessed, the fleshly arms, of those kings pasted with sandal, hang down shorn of prowess.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु भीष्मस्य राज्ञां दध्वंसिरे तदा। काञ्चनाङ्गदिन: पीना भुजाश्चन्दनरूषिताः॥ मनोभिः सह संवेगैः संस्मृत्य च पुरातनम्। सामर्थ्यं पाण्डवेयानां यथा प्रत्यक्षदर्शनात्॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said O you endued with divine prosperity, it is as you say O Narada, and I too wish the same thing, but you endued with heavenly prosperity, I am not the master.', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच भगवन्नेवमेवैतद् यथा वदसि नारद। इच्छामि चाहमप्येवं न त्वीशो भगवन्नहम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said Saying this the descendant of Kurus said to Krishna "O Keshava, you have said to me what leads to (the attainment of) heaven, to the benefit of the world and which is virtuous and just.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्त्वा ततः कृष्णमभ्यभाषत कौरवः। स्वयं लोक्यं च मामात्य धर्म्यं न्याय्यं च केशव॥'}

{'en': 'But I am not my own master, O you of long arms; O best of men, try persuade, O Krishna, my wicked son Duryodhana, who disregards injunctions of the scriptures who never dose what is pleasing to me and never listens to good words.', 'sn': 'न त्वहं स्ववशस्तात क्रियमाणं न मे प्रियम्। अङ्ग दुर्योधनं कृष्ण मन्दं शास्त्रातिगं मम॥ अनुनेतुं महाबाहो यतस्व पुरुषोत्तम। न शृणोति महाबाहो वचनं साधुभाषितम्॥'}

{'en': 'The son of Gandhari ( does not listen to the advice of) the wise Vidura, O Hrishikesha, as also to that of other friends and of such well wishers as Bhishma and others.', 'sn': 'गान्धार्याश्च हृषीकेश विदुरस्य च धीमतः। अन्येषां चैव सुहृदां भीष्मादीनां हितैषिणाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore do yourself instruct the ruler of men, Duryodhana, of wicked soul crooked of evil intellect, of sinful heart and senseless.', 'sn': 'स त्वं पापमति क्रूरं पापचित्तमचेतनम्। अनुशाधि दुरात्मानं स्वयं दुर्योधनं नृपम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then will a very great duty of a friend have been done by you, O Janardana.” Then did the son of Vrishni addressing the wrathful Duryodhana,', 'sn': 'सुहृत्कार्यं तु सुमहत् कृतं ते स्याज्जनार्दन। ततोऽभ्यावृत्य वार्ष्णेयो दुर्योधनममर्षणम्॥'}
