{'en': 'Say these sweet words, conversant as he was with all virtues and worldly profit: “O Duryodhana, listen to this speech of mine, O you best among the Kurus,', 'sn': 'अब्रवीन्मधुरां वाचं सर्वधर्मार्थतत्त्ववित्। दुर्योधन निबोधेदं मद्वाक्यं कुरुसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Especially for the benefit of yourself and of your followers, O Bharata. Born as you are in a family of very wise men. it is indeed proper that you should do this honorable act.', 'sn': 'शर्मार्थं ते विशेषण सानुबन्धस्य भारत। महाप्राज्ञकुले जातः साध्वेतत् कर्तुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'You are endue with learning and with good habits of life. Whereas these that are born in low families are wicked souled, Inhuman and shameless.', 'sn': 'श्रुतवृत्तोपसम्पन्नः सर्वैः समुदितो गुणैः। दौष्कुलेया दुरात्मानो नृशंसा निरपत्रपाः॥'}

{'en': 'These latter alone act in the way that you are contemplating; in this world the inclination of honest men seems to lie towards and virtue and worldly profit.', 'sn': 'त एतदीदृशं कुर्युर्यथा त्वं तात मन्यसे। धर्मार्थयुक्ता लोकेऽस्मिन् प्रवृत्तिर्लक्ष्यते सताम्॥'}

{'en': 'And the inclination of bad men seems to lie towards the opposite direction, o best among the Bharatas, this contemplated action of yours seems to lie in this opposite direction.', 'sn': 'असतां विपरीता तु लक्ष्यते भरतर्षभ। विपरीता त्वियं वृत्तिरसकृल्लक्ष्यते त्वयि॥'}

{'en': 'In this case, the obstinacy shown by you is vicious, frightful and greatly destructive of life; it will lead to your harm, it is without reason, and is unworthy of being pursued by you long, OBharata.', 'sn': 'अधर्मश्चानुबन्धोऽत्र घोरः प्राणहरो महान्। अनिष्टश्चानिमित्तश्च न च शक्यश्च भारत।॥'}

{'en': 'Abandoning what is injurious to yourself you should do what is for your benefit and that of your brothers, followers and friends, O you chastiser of your foes.', 'sn': 'तमनर्थं परिहरन्नात्मश्रेयः करिष्यसि। भ्रातॄणामथ भृत्यानां मित्राणां च परंतप॥'}

{'en': 'You will escape the blame of an act which is opposed to virtue and which will lead to notoriety. With the sons of Pandu who are wise, heroic, of great energy, of noble souls and very much conversant with our holy books,', 'sn': 'अधादयशस्याच्च कर्मणस्त्वं प्रमोक्ष्यसे। प्राज्ञैः शूरैर्महोत्साहैरात्मवद्भिर्बहुश्रुतैः॥'}
{'en': 'O foremost among men, make peace-it is beneficial to the wise Dhritarashtra and also pleasing to him,', 'sn': 'संधत्स्व पुरुषव्याघ्र पाण्डवैर्भरतर्षभ। तद्धितं च प्रियं चैव धृतराष्ट्रस्य'}

{'en': 'As also to your grandfather and Drona and Vidura of great intelligence and to Kripa and Somadatta and to the wise Balhika,', 'sn': 'पितामहस्य द्रोणस्य विदुरस्य महामतेः। कृपस्य सोमदत्तस्य बाह्रीकस्य च धीमतः॥'}

{'en': 'And to Ashvathama, and Vikarna, and Sanjaya and Vivingshati and very much so to your cousins and also to your friends, O chastiser of foes.', 'sn': 'अश्वत्थाम्नो विकर्णस्य संजस्य विविंशतेः। ज्ञातीनां चैव भूयिष्ठं मित्राणां च परंतप॥'}

{'en': 'In peace, there will be your benefit, my dear friend, as also that of the entire world; be endued with modesty, for you are born in a noble family, and be learned and human; therefore, my dear friend, do you follow the commands of your father and mother. O best among the Bharatas.', 'sn': 'शमे शर्म भवेत् तात सर्वस्य जगतस्तथा। ह्रीमानसि कुले जातः श्रुतवाननृशंसवान्। धीमतः॥ तिष्ठ तात पितुः शास्त्रे मातुश्च भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'People consider that to be conducive to his good which a father commands, O Bharata, and a good man, when meeting with a danger, remembers all the commands of his father.', 'sn': 'एतच्छ्रेयो हि मन्यन्ते पिता यच्छास्ति भारत। उत्तमापद्गतः सर्वः पितुः स्मरति शासनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Peace, my dear friend, with the sons of Pandu is pleasing to your father and you foremost among the Kurus, may it prove pleasing to yourself along with your advisers.', 'sn': 'रोचते ते पितुस्तात पाण्डवैः सह संगमः। सामात्यस्य कुरुश्रेष्ठ तत् तुभ्यं तात रोचताम्॥'}

{'en': 'That man, who hearing the advice of his friends, does not act according to it, in the end is consumed like one who has eaten the Kimpaka fruit.', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा यः सुहृदां शास्त्रं मर्यो न प्रतिपद्यते। विपाकान्ते दहत्येनं किम्पाकमिव भक्षितम्॥'}

{'en': 'He, who out of folly, does not act according to the advice, than which nothing is more beneficial, is visited by the effects of procrastination, does not gain his object and is afterwards struck with remorse.', 'sn': 'यस्तु निःश्रेयसं वाक्यं मोहान्न प्रतिपद्यते। स दीर्घसूत्रो हीनार्थः पश्चात्तापेन युज्यते॥'}

{'en': 'He, who having heard that, than which nothing is more beneficial, acts up to it abandoning his own opinions, gets happiness in this world.', 'sn': 'यस्तु निःश्रेयसं श्रुत्वा प्राक् तदेवाभिपद्यते। आत्मनो मतमुत्सृज्य स लोके सुखमेधते॥'}

{'en': 'He, who does not act to the advice of one who desires his good thinking it to be against his interests and listens to what is really so (against his interests), comes under the power of his enemies.', 'sn': 'योऽर्थकामस्य वचनं प्रातिकूल्यान मृष्यते। शृणोति प्रतिकूलानि द्विषतां वशमेति सः॥'}

{'en': 'The friends of him, who disregarding the opinions of the honest, follows that of dishonest men, soon grave at his distress,', 'sn': 'सतां मतमतिक्रम्य योऽसतां वर्तते मते। शोचन्ते व्यसने तस्य सुहृदो न चिरादिव॥'}

{'en': 'He, who abandoning his principal advisers according to the injunctions of inferior ones, meets with grave dangers and does not come out of them safe.', 'sn': 'मुख्यानमात्यानुत्सृज्य यो निहीनान् निषेवते। स घोरामापदं प्राप्य नोत्तारमधिगच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'He, who acts according to the advice of dishonest men, who behaves falsely and does not listen to the advice of good friends and prefers others to those who are his own, is cast off by the earth, O Bharata.', 'sn': 'योऽसत्सेवीवृथाचारो न श्रोता सुहृदां सताम्। परान् वृणीते स्वान् द्वेष्टि तं गौस्त्यजति भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Yourself, being opposed to those heroes, desire to be served by those who are strangers to you, and who are dishonest, incompetent and fools, O best among the Bharatas.', 'sn': 'स त्वं विरुध्य तैवीरैरन्येभ्यस्त्राणमिच्छसि। अशिष्टेभ्योऽसमर्थेभ्यो मूढेभ्यो भरतर्षभ।॥'}

{'en': 'What man, besides yourself in this world, abandoning kinsmen who are mighty carwarriors and each equal to Shakra himself, expects safely with the help of others.', 'sn': 'को हि शक्रसमान् ज्ञातीनतिक्रम्य महारथान्। अन्येभ्यस्त्राणमाशंसेत् त्वदन्यो भुवि मानवः॥'}

{'en': 'Ever since their birth, have the sons of Kunti been persecuted by you but those virtuous-souled sons of Pandu are not vindictive at your conduct.', 'sn': 'जन्मप्रभृति कौन्तेया नित्यं विनिकृतास्त्वया। न च ते जातु कुप्यन्ति धर्मात्मानो हि पाण्डवा॥'}

{'en': 'O friend, ever since birth the sons of Pandu have been treated with deception but those renowned men, O you of long arms, have treated you generously.', 'sn': 'मिथ्योपचरितास्तात जन्मप्रभृति बान्धवाः। त्वयि सम्यङ्महाबाहो प्रतिपन्ना यशस्विनः॥'}

{'en': 'By you too should they be treated in the same way, O you best among the race of Bharata; do not show anger towards your own kinsmen.', 'sn': 'त्वयापि प्रतिपत्तव्यं तथैव भरतर्षभ। स्वेषु बन्धुषु मुख्येषु मा मन्युवशमन्वगाः॥'}

{'en': 'The energy of wise men follows all the three objects (virtue, profit and desire) O best among the race of Bharata and in the event of it being impossible to follow all the three objects people choose virtue and profit.', 'sn': 'त्रिवर्गयुक्तः प्राज्ञानामारम्भो भतर्षभ। धर्मार्थावनुरुध्यन्ते त्रिवर्गासम्भवे नराः॥'}

{'en': 'If these three are to be pursued separately a wise inan chooses virtue; an indifferent man (i.e. neither wise nor a fool) chooses worldly good, while a boy chooses desire.', 'sn': 'पृथक् च विनिविष्टानां धर्मं धीरोऽनुरुध्यते। मध्यमोऽर्थं कलिं बालः काममेवानुरुध्यते॥'}

{'en': 'The fool, who out of avarice and desire for sexual pleasure, abandons virtue and desires to gain his desire and profit by improper means, is ruined.', 'sn': 'इन्द्रियैः प्राकृतो लोभाद् धर्मं विप्रजहाति यः। कामार्थावनुपायेन लिप्समानो विनश्यति॥'}

{'en': 'The man, who is desirous of gaining the object of desire or worldly profit, must first of all practice virtue; desire or profit is seldom detached from virtue.', 'sn': 'कामार्थों लिप्समानस्तु धर्ममेवादितश्चरेत्। न हि धर्मादपैत्यर्थः कामो वाऽपि कदाचन॥'}

{'en': 'It is said that virtue is the means of gaining the three objects, O lord of the universe; and he, who is desirous of getting them by this means increases in prosperity as fire in a heap of dry grass.', 'sn': 'उपायं धर्ममेवाहुस्त्रिवर्गस्य विशाम्पते। लिप्समानो हि तेनाशु कक्षेऽग्निरिव वर्धते॥'}

{'en': 'You however, my dear friend, desire to get by improper means a greatly extensive kingdom well known among all the kings.', 'sn': 'स त्वं तातानुपायेन लिप्ससे भरतर्षभ। आधिराज्यं महद् दापितं प्रथितं सर्वराजसु॥'}

{'en': 'He, who behaves deceitfully towards those following the right path, O king, cuts himself down as the forest by an axe; one does not cut off the intellect of another whose defeat he does not desire.', 'sn': 'आत्मानं तक्षति ह्येष वनं परशुना यथा। यः सम्यग्वर्तमानेषु मिथ्या राजन् प्रवर्तते॥'}

{'en': 'For one, whose intellect has been clouded, cannot direct his attention to what is conducive to his good. One who keeps his soul under proper control does not think lightly of anything in the three worlds, O Bharata,', 'sn': 'न तस्य हि मतिं छिन्द्याद् यस्य नेच्छेत् पराभवम्। अविच्छिन्नमतेरस्य कल्याणे धीयते मतिः। आत्मवान् नावमन्येत त्रिषु लोकेषु भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Not even an ordinary creature-not to speak to those foremost among men, those sons of Pandu; a man, who is under the influence of wrath, can not discern anything.', 'sn': 'अप्यन्यं प्राकृतं किंचित् किमु तान् पाण्डवर्षभान्। अमर्षवशमापन्नो न किंचिद् बुध्यते जनः॥'}

{'en': 'All the rank growth must be cut off; O Bharata, look at the proofs; peace with the sons of Pandu is more to your interest than union with wicked people.', 'sn': 'छिद्यते ह्याततं सर्वं प्रमाणं पश्य भारत। श्रेयस्ते दुर्जनात् तात पाण्डवैः सह संगतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Living in peace with them you will succeed in all your objects enjoying the territories built up by the sons of Pandu, O best among kings,', 'sn': 'तैर्हि सम्प्रीयमाणस्त्वं सर्वान् कामानवाप्स्यसि। पाण्डवैनिर्मितां भूमि भुञ्जानो राजसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Keeping the sons of Pandu behind you, you repose your hopes for safety on other sources, namely on Dushasana, Durvisha, Karna and the son of Subala.', 'sn': 'पाण्डवान् पृष्ठतः कृत्वा त्राणमाशंससेऽन्यतः। दुःशासने दुर्विषहे कर्णे चापि ससौबले॥'}

{'en': 'Reposing your kingly prosperity on them you wish for prosperity, O Bharata; but these friends of yours have not sufficient knowledge of virtue of worldly profit.', 'sn': 'एतेष्वैश्वर्यमाधाय भूतिमिच्छसि भारत। न चैते तव पर्याप्ता ज्ञाने धर्मार्थयोस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'They are not competent too in prowess or in strength, to be a match against the sons of Pandu; nor are all these kings united with you competent,', 'sn': 'विक्रमे चाप्यपर्याप्ताः पाण्डवान् प्रति भारत। न हीमे सर्ववराजानः पर्याप्ताः सहितास्त्वया॥'}

{'en': 'To look at the face of Bhimasena when exercised by anger in battle field. This entire assembled army of the earth is at your elbow.', 'sn': 'क्रुद्धस्य भीमसेनस्य प्रेक्षितुं मुखमाहवे। इदं संनिहितं तात समग्रं पार्थिवं बलम्॥'}

{'en': 'This Bhishma, Drona, as also this Karna, Kripa as also Bhurishravas, Ashvathama, the son of Somadatta and Janardana,', 'sn': 'अयं भीष्मस्तथा द्रोणः कर्णश्चायं तथा कृपः। भूरिश्रवाः सौमदत्तिरश्वत्थामा जयद्रथः॥'}

{'en': 'All these are incapable of fighting against Dhananjaya. This Arjuna is invincible in battle by all the Gods and Asuras and by all human beings and Gandharvas. Do not fix your mind on battle.', 'sn': 'अशक्ताः सर्वं एवैते प्रतियोद्धं धनंजयम्। अजेयो ह्यर्जुनः संख्ये सर्वैरपि सुरासुरैः। मानुषैरिप गन्धर्वैर्मा युद्धे चेत आधिथाः॥'}

{'en': 'Do you see any man in this entire army who, having met Arjuna face to face in battle, has returned home safe?', 'sn': 'दृश्यतां वा पुमान् कश्चितं समग्रे पार्थिवे बले। योऽर्जुनं समरे प्राप्य स्वस्तिमानाव्रजेद् गृहान्॥'}

{'en': 'Of what advantage will a massacre of men be to you, O best among the Bharatas. Show me the man who will defeat the one whose defeat will mean victory to you,', 'sn': 'किं ते जनक्षयेणेह कृतेन भरतर्षभ। यस्मिञ्जिते जितं तत् स्यात् पुमानेकः स दृश्यताम्॥५२'}

{'en': 'Him who vanquished the gods along with the Gandharvas and Yakshas, and Asuras and Serpents in Khandava Prastha-who will fight against that son of Pandavas?', 'sn': 'यः स देवान् सगन्धर्वान् सयक्षासुरपन्नगान्। अजयत् खाण्डवप्रस्थे कस्तं युध्येत मानवः॥'}

{'en': 'In the same way in the city of Virata is heard a very strange tale in the fight of one against many; that is a sufficient proof.', 'sn': 'तथा विराटनगरे श्रूयते महदद्भुतम्। एकस्य च बहूनां च पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Do you wish to defeat that unconquerable, irrepressible and undetoriating Jishnu, the heroic Arjuna when enraged in battle, by whom in an encounter even Mahadeva was gratified?', 'sn': 'युद्धे येन महादेवः साक्षात् संतोषितः शिवः। तमजेयमनाधृष्यं विजेतुं जिष्णुमच्युतम्। आशंससीह समरे वीरमर्जुनमूर्जितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Who can wish to defeat him having me as his help when he goes to the battle field like Indra (himself)?', 'sn': 'मद् द्वितीयं पुनः पार्थं कः प्रार्थयितुमर्हति। युद्धे प्रतीपमायान्तमपि साक्षात् पुरंदरः॥'}

{'en': 'He, who would defeat Arjuna in battle, could bear the earth with his arms and being excited with wrath could burn up all earthy creatures, and could hurl down the gods from heaven.', 'sn': 'बाहुभ्यामुद्वहेद् भूमि दहेत् क्रुद्ध इमाः प्रजाः। पातयेत् त्रिदिवाद् देवान् योऽर्जुनं समरे जयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Look at your sons and at your brothers and at your kinsmen and other relations; let them not be destroyed by an act done by you, O you best among the race of Bharata.', 'sn': 'पश्य पुत्रांस्तथा भ्रातृज्ञातीन् सम्बन्धिनस्तथा। त्वत्कृते न विनश्येयुरिमे भरतसत्तमाः॥'}

{'en': 'Let not this race of Kurus be exterminated ard let not yourself be spoken of as the destroyer of the race and be of great notoriety, O lord of men.', 'sn': 'अस्तु शेषं कौरवाणां मा पराभूदिदं कुलम्। कुलन इति नोच्येथा नष्टकीर्तिनराधिप॥'}

{'en': 'Those mighty car warriors will establish yourself as the viceroy and your father Dhritarashtra, the lord of men, as the emperor.', 'sn': 'त्वामेव स्थापयिष्यन्ति यौवराज्ये महारथाः। महाराज्येऽपि पितरं धृतराष्ट्रं जनेश्वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Do you not, my dear friend, disregard this prosperity which has appeared in the horizon and is about to come to you; having given half to the sons of Pritha attain to great prosperity.', 'sn': 'मा तात श्रियमायान्तीमवमंस्थाः समुद्यताम्। अर्धं प्रदाय पार्थेभ्यो महतीं श्रियमाप्नुहि॥'}

{'en': 'Having effected peace with the sons of Pandu and listening to the advice to your friends and living in peace with your friends will you ever attain to blessing.', 'sn': 'पाण्डवैः संशमं कृत्वा कृत्वा च सुहृदां वचः। सम्प्रीयमाणोमित्रैश्च चिरं भद्राण्यवाप्सस्यसि॥'}

{'en': "Sanjaya said Beholding the Kuru army afflicted with the fear of Pandu's son sinking like a boat foundered in the ocean, Kritavarma, Kripa, Drona's son, Suta's son, Ulaka, Subala's son Shakuni and the king himself with his brother, came to their rescue.", 'sn': 'संजय उवाच कृतवर्मा कृपो द्रौणिः सूतपुत्रश्च मारिष। उलूकः सौबलश्चैव राजा च सह सोदरैः॥ सीदमानां चमूं दृष्ट्वा पाण्डुपुत्रभयार्दिताम्। समुहुः स्म वेगेन भिन्नां नावमिवार्णवे॥'}

{'en': 'Then there took place an encounter for the time being capable of striking terror unto the timid and increasing the delight of the heroes.', 'sn': 'ततो युद्धमतीवासीन्मुहूर्तमिव भारत। भीरूणां त्रासजननं शूराणां हर्षवर्धनम्॥'}
{'en': 'The downpour of arrows made by Kripa in the battle covered the Srinjayas like a swarm of locusts.', 'sn': 'कृपेण शरवर्षाणि प्रतिमुक्तानि संयुगे। सृञ्जयांश्छादयामासुः शलभानां व्रजा इव॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon Shikhandin, worked up with anger, speedily approached the son of Gautaina and discharged a shower of arrows upon that best of men.', 'sn': 'शिखण्डी च ततः क्रुद्धो गौतमं त्वरितो ययौ। ववर्ष शरवर्षाणि समन्ताद् द्विजपुङ्गवम्॥'}

{'en': 'And checking that downpour of arrows Kripa, conversant with the use of mighty weapons and filled with anger, struck in that encounter Shikhandin with ten arrows.', 'sn': 'कृपस्तु शरवर्षं तद् विनिहत्य महास्त्रवित्। शिखण्डिनं रणे क्रद्धो विव्याध दशभिः शरैः॥'}
{'en': 'Then Shikhandin, worked up with anger, pierced Kripa and seven straight Kankafeathered arrows.', 'sn': 'ततः शिखण्डी कुपितः शरैः सप्तभिराहवे। कृपं विव्याध कुपितं कङ्कपत्रैरजिह्मगैः॥'}

{'en': 'Then the Brahmana Kripa, a mighty carwarrior, piercing heavily with sharp arrows, deprived Shikhandin of his horses, charioteer and car.', 'sn': 'ततः कृपः शरैस्तीक्ष्णैः सोऽतिविद्धो महारथः। व्यश्वसूतरथं चक्रे शिखण्डिनमथो द्विजः॥'}

{'en': 'Then jumping down from the car, the heroes of which were slain, the mighty carwarrior speedily took up his sword and armour and approached the Brahmana.', 'sn': 'हताश्चात् तु ततो यानादवप्लुत्य महारथः। खङ्गं चर्म तथा गृह्य सत्वं ब्राह्मणं ययौ॥'}

{'en': 'Then he covered him suddenly who was approaching with straight arrows. This was indeed wonderful. We then, O king, beheld a wonderful spectacle like the flying of rocks. And Shikhandin remained inactive in that battle.', 'sn': 'तमापतन्तं सहसा शरैः संनतपर्वभिः। छादयामास समरे तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्॥ तत्राद्भुतमपश्याम शिलानां प्लवनं यथा। निश्चेष्टस्तद् रणे राजञ्छिखण्डी समतिष्ठत॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding Shikhandin covered with arrows by Kripa, O foremost of kings, the mighty carwarrior Dhristadyumna speedily approached him.', 'sn': 'कृपेणच्छादितं दृष्ट्वा नृपोत्तम शिखण्डिनम्। प्रत्युद्यायौ कृपं तूर्णं धृष्टद्युम्नो महारथः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the mighty car-warrior Kritavarma vehemently resisted Dhristadyumna who was advancing towards the son of Sharadvata.', 'sn': 'धृष्टद्युम्नं ततो यान्तं शारद्वतरथं प्रति। प्रतिजग्राह वेगेन कृतवर्मा महारथः॥'}

{'en': "Drona's son then resisted Yudhishthira who was advancing with his own son and arms against the son of Sharadvata.", 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिरमथायान्तं शारद्वतरथं प्रति। सपुत्रं सहसैन्यं च द्रौणपुत्रो न्यवारयत्॥'}
{'en': 'Your son then impeded with a downpour of arrows the approach of the two car-warriors Nakula and Sahadeva.', 'sn': 'नकुलं सहदेवं च त्वरमाणौ महारथौ। प्रतिजग्राह ते पुत्रः शरवर्षेण वारयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Karna, the son of Vikartana, O descendant of Bharata, then resisted in battle Bhimasena, Karushas, Kaikeyas and Srinjayas.', 'sn': 'भीमसेन करूषांश्च केकयान् सह संजयैः। कर्णो वैकर्तनो युद्धे वारयामास भारत॥'}
{'en': 'Then in the battle, O Sire, Kripa quickly hurled arrows at Shikhandin as to burn him down.', 'sn': 'शिखण्डिनस्ततौ बाणान् कृपः शारद्वतो युधि। प्राहिणोत् त्वरया युक्तो दिधक्षुरिव मारिष।॥'}

{'en': 'Whirling his sword repeatedly (Shikhandin) then with his sword cut-off all those golddecked arrows that were discharged at him.', 'sn': 'ताञ्छरान् प्रेषितास्तेन समन्तात् स्वर्णभूषितान्। चिच्छदेन खङ्गमाविध्य भ्रामयंश्च पुनः पुनः॥'}

{'en': "The son of Gautama then quickly cut-off with his arrows the shield of Prishata's son that was adorned with a hundred moons. At this his people made a loud uproar.", 'sn': 'शतचन्द्रं च तचर्म गौतमस्तस्य भारत। व्यधमत् सायकैस्तूर्णं तत उचुक्रुशुर्जनाः॥'}

{'en': 'Deprived of his shield, O monarch and brought under the influence of Kripa, he, with his sword, advanced like a sick man advancing towards death.', 'sn': 'स विचर्मा महाराज खङ्गपाणिरुपाद्रवत्। कृपस्य वशमापन्नो मृत्योरास्यमिवातुरः॥'}

{'en': "O king, Chitraketu's son Suketu quickly proceeded towards the highly powerful (Shikhandin) who was thus distressed and assailed by the son of Sharadvata.", 'sn': 'शारद्वतशरैर्ग्रस्तं विश्यमानं महाबलः। चित्रकेतुसुतो राजन् सुकेतुस्त्वरितो ययौ॥'}

{'en': "Having covered in battle the Brahmana with sharp arrows, that one of immeasurable energy, advanced towards the car of Gautama's son.", 'sn': 'विकिरन् ब्राह्मणं युद्धे बहुभिर्निशितैः शरै। अभ्यापतदमेयात्मा गौतमस्य रथं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding that Brahmana, observant of vows thus engaged in battle, Shikhandin, O king, quickly proceeded there.', 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वा च युक्तं त युद्धे ब्राह्मणं चरितव्रतम्। अपयातस्तस्तूर्णं शिखण्डी राजसत्तम।॥'}

{'en': 'O king, having pierced the son of Gautama with nine arrows Suketu once more pierced him with seventy and again with three.', 'sn': 'सुकेतुस्तु ततो राजन् गौतमं नवभिः शरैः। विद्ध्वा विव्याध सप्तत्या पुनश्चैनं त्रिभिः शरैः॥'}
{'en': 'He then cut-off his bow and arrows; then with another he pierced greatly his driver to the very vitals.', 'sn': 'अथास्य सशरं चापं पुनश्चिच्छेद मारिष। सारथिं च शरेणास्य भृशं मर्मस्वताडयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon worked up with anger Gautama took up a fresh and strong bow and cut-off Suketu to the very vital part with thirty arrows.', 'sn': 'गौतमस्तु ततः क्रुद्धो धनुर्गृह्य नवं दृढम्। सुकेतुं त्रिंशता बाणैः सर्वमर्मस्वताडयत्॥'}

{'en': 'All his limbs were weakened and he shook on that best of cars as a tree trembles greatly during an earth quake.', 'sn': 'स विह्वलितसर्वाङ्गः प्रचचाल रथोत्तमे। भूमिकम्पे यथा वृक्षश्चचाल कम्पितो भृशम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then with a razor-sharpened arrow he sundered from body his head still trembling with shining ear-rings, crown and headprotector.', 'sn': 'चलतस्तस्य कायात् तु शिरो ज्वलितकुण्डलम्। सोष्णीयं सशिरस्त्राणं क्षुरप्रेण त्वपातयद्॥'}

{'en': 'His head fell down on the earth like a piece of meant stolen away by a hawk, afterwards his body, O Eternal one, fell down on the earth.', 'sn': 'तच्छिरंः प्रापतद् भूमौ श्येनाहतमिवामिषम्। ततोऽस्य कायो वसुधां पश्चात् प्रापतदच्युत॥'}

{'en': 'O Emperor, when he was slain, all his followers, leaving behind the son of Gautama in the battle-field fled, away in ten directions.', 'sn': 'तस्मिन् हते महाराज त्रस्तास्तस्य पुरोगमाः। गौतमं हरे त्यक्त्वा दुदुवुस्ते दिशो दश॥'}

{'en': 'Encircling the highly powerful Dhristadyumna in the battle-field Kritavarma said to him-"Wait! wait!"', 'sn': 'धृष्टद्युम्नं तु समरे संनिवार्य महारथः। कृतवर्माब्रवीद्धृष्टस्तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Then there took place a terrible and wonderful encounter between the Vrishnis and Parsatas like that of two angry hawks, O king, for a piece of meat.', 'sn': 'तदभूत् तुमुलं युद्धं वृष्णिपार्षतयो रणे। आमिषार्थे यथा युद्धं श्येनयोः क्रुद्धयोप॥'}

{'en': "Worked up with anger, Dhristadyumna, in that battle, assailed Hridika's son violently and struck him on the chest with nine arrows.", 'sn': 'धृष्टद्युम्नस्तु समरे हार्दिक्य नवभिः शरैः। आजधानोरसि क्रुद्धः पीडयन् हृदिकात्मजम्॥'}
{'en': 'Thus Assailed by a Parohata in battle Kritavarma covered him, his chariot and horses with arrows.', 'sn': 'कृतवर्मा तु समरे पार्षतेन दृढाहतः। पार्षतं सरथं छादयामास सायकैः॥'}

{'en': 'O king, thus covered along with his car Dhristadyumna became invisible like the sun enshrouded by clouds surcharged with water.', 'sn': 'सरथश्छादितो राजन् धृष्टद्युम्नो न दृश्यते। मेधैरिव परिच्छन्नो भास्करो जलधारिभिः॥'}
{'en': 'Withstanding him with gold feathered arrows, O king, Dhristadyumna appeared in battle with wounds.', 'sn': 'विधूय तं बाणगणं शरैः कनकभूषणैः। व्यरोचत रणे राजन् धृष्टद्युम्नः कृतव्रणः॥'}

{'en': 'Obtaining Kritavarma, Parsata, the commander of the forces, worked up with anger, made a terrible downpour of arrows.', 'sn': 'ततस्तु पार्षतः क्रुद्धः शस्त्रवृष्टिं सुदारुणाम्। कृतवर्माणमासाद्य व्यसृजत् पृतनापतिः॥'}

{'en': "In that battle Hridika's son with many thousand arrows, all on a sudden, dispelled that highly dreadful shower of arrows that was about to fall on him.", 'sn': 'तामापतन्तीं सहसा शस्त्रवृष्टिं सुदारुणाम्। शरैरनेकसाहस्त्रैर्हार्दिक्योऽवारयद् युधि॥'}

{'en': "Beholding in that battle that fearful downpour of arrows thus dispelled by him Prishata's son, approaching Kritavarma, withstood him.", 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वा तु वारितां युद्धे शस्त्रवृष्टिं दुरासदाम्। कृतवर्माणमासाद्य वारयामास पार्षतः॥'}

{'en': 'With a sharpened spike he dispatched his charioteer to the abode of Death. Slain he fell down from the chariot.', 'sn': 'सारथिं चास्य तरसा प्राहिणोद् यमसादनम्। भल्लेन शितधारेण स हतः प्रापतद् रथात्॥'}

{'en': 'Having vanquished his highly powerful enemy, the mighty Dhristadyumna speedily withstood the Kauravas in battle with arrows.', 'sn': 'धृष्टद्युम्नस्तु बलवाञ्जित्वा शत्रु महाबलम्। कौरवान् समरे तूर्णं वारयामास सायकैः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon emitting leonine roars your warriors ran towards Dhristadyumna and again an encounter took place.', 'sn': 'ततस्ते तावका योधा धृष्टद्युम्नमुपाद्रवन्। सिंहनादरवं कृत्वा ततो युद्धमवर्तत॥'}

{'en': 'Manu said When the five attributes are united with the five senses and the mind, then is Brahma seen by the individual like a thread passing through a gem.', 'sn': 'मनुरुवाच यदा तैः पञ्चभिः पञ्च युक्तानि मनसा सह। अथ तद् रक्ष्यते ब्रह्म मणौ सूत्रमिवापितम्॥'}

{'en': "As a thread may lie within gold or a pearl or a coral or any earthen object, so one's soul, for his own acts, may live within a cow, a horse, a man, an elephant or any other animal, or with a worm or an insect.", 'sn': 'तदेव च यथा सूत्रं सुवर्णे वर्तते पुनः। मुक्तास्वथ प्रवालेषु मृन्मये राजते तथा॥ तद्वद् गोऽश्वमनुष्येषु तद्वद्धस्तिमृगादिषु। तद्वत् कीटपतङ्गेषु प्रसक्तात्मा स्वकर्मभिः॥'}

{'en': 'The good deeds with a person performs in a particular body yield rewards that the individual enjoys in that particular body.', 'sn': 'येन येन शरीरेण यद्यत्कर्म करोत्ययम्। तेन तेन शरीरेण तत् तत् फलमुपाश्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'A soil, seemingly drenched with one particular kind of liquid, supplies to each different sort of Herb or plant that grows on it the sort of juice it requires for itself. Similarly, the Understanding, whose course is witnessed by the Soul, is obliged to follow the path marked out by pristine deeds.', 'sn': 'यथा ह्येकरसा भूमिरोषध्यर्थानुसारिणी। तथा कर्मानुगा बुद्धिरन्तरात्मानुदर्शिनी॥'}

{'en': 'From knowledge originates desire. From desire originates resolution. From resolution proceeds action. From action proceed fruits.', 'sn': 'ज्ञानपूर्वा भवेल्लिप्सा लिप्सापूर्वाभिसंधिता। अभिसधिपूर्वकं कर्म कर्ममूलं ततः फलम्॥'}

{'en': 'Fruits, therefore, have actions as their cause. Actions have the understanding for their root. The understanding has knowledge for its ot, and knowledge has the Soul for its cause.', 'sn': 'फलं कर्मात्मकं विद्यात् कर्म ज्ञेयात्मकं तथा। ज्ञेयं ज्ञानात्मकं विद्याजानं सदसदात्मकम्॥'}

{'en': 'That excellent outcome which is gained by the destruction of knowledge, of fruits, of the understanding, and of acts is called knowledge of Brahma.', 'sn': 'ज्ञानानां च फलानां च ज्ञेयानां कर्मणां तथा। क्षयान्ते यत् फलं विद्याज्ज्ञानं ज्ञेयप्रतिष्ठितम्॥'}

{'en': 'High indeed is that self-existent Essence which Yogins witness. They who are devoid of wisdom, and whose understandings are addicted to worldly objects never see that which exists in the soul itself.', 'sn': 'महद्धि परमं भूतं यत् प्रपश्यन्ति योगिनः। अबुधास्तं न पश्यन्ति ह्यात्मस्थं गुणबुद्धयः॥'}
{'en': 'Water is superior to the Earth; Light is superior to Water; Wind is superior to Light.', 'sn': 'पृथिवीरूपतो रूपमपामिह महत्तरम्। अद्भयो महत्तरं तेजस्तेजसः पवनो महान्॥'}

{'en': 'Space is superior to Wind; Mind is superior 10 Space; Understanding is superior to Mind; Time is superior to Understanding.', 'sn': 'पवनाच्च महद् व्योम तस्मात् परतरं मनः। मनसो महती बुद्धिर्बुद्धेः कालो महान् स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'The Divine Vishnu, who is identical with this universe, is superior to Time. That god is without beginning, middle, and end.', 'sn': 'कालात् स भगवान् विष्णुर्यस्य सर्वमिदं जगत्। नादिर्न मध्यं नैवान्तस्तस्य देवस्य विद्यते॥'}

{'en': 'For his being without beginning, iniddle, and cnd, he is Unchangeable. He is above all Sorrow, for Sorrow has limits.', 'sn': 'अनादित्वादमध्यत्वादनन्तत्वाच्च सोऽव्ययः। अत्येति सर्वदुःखानि दुःखं ह्यन्तवदुच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'That Vishnu is called the Supreme Brahma. He is the refuge or object of what is called the Highest. Knowing Him, they who are wise, freed from everything which is under the influence of Time, acquire liberation.', 'sn': 'तद् ब्रह्म परमं प्रोक्तं तद्धाम परमं पदम्। तद् गत्वा कालविषयाद् विमुक्ता मोक्षमाश्रिताः॥'}

{'en': 'What we perceive is displayed in attributes. That which is called Brahma, being without attributes, is superior to these. Abstention from acts constitutes the greatest religion. That religion is sure to bring on deathlessness.', 'sn': 'गुणेष्वेते प्रकाशन्ते निर्गुणत्वात् ततः परम्। निवृत्तिलक्षणो धर्मस्तथाऽऽनन्त्याय कल्पते॥'}

{'en': 'The Richs, the yajuses and the Samans depend on the body. They flow from the end of the tongue. They cannot be acquired without exertion and are subject to destruction.', 'sn': 'ऋचो यजूंषि सामानि शरीराणि व्यपाश्रिताः। जिह्वाग्रेषु प्रवर्तन्ते यत्नसाध्या विनाशिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Brahma, however, cannot be acquired in this way, for it depends upon that (Soul) which has the body for its refuge. Without beginning, middle, or end, Brahma cannot be acquired by effort.', 'sn': 'न चैवमिष्यते ब्रह्म शरीराश्रयसम्भवम्। न यत्नसाध्यं तद् ब्रह्म नादिमध्यं न चान्तवत्॥ ।'}

{'en': 'The Richs, the Samans, the Yajuses, have each a beginning. Those that have a beginning have also an end. But Brahma is said to be without beginning.', 'sn': 'ऋचामादिस्तथा साम्नां यजुषामादिरुच्यते। अन्तश्चादिमतां दृष्टो न त्वादिब्रह्मणः स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'And because Brahma has neither beginning nor end, it is said to be infinite and unchangeable. On account of unchangeableness, Brahma transcends all sorrow as also pairs of opposites.', 'sn': 'अनादिन्वादनन्तत्वात्तदन्तमथाव्ययम्। अव्ययत्वाच्च निर्दुःखं द्वन्द्वाभावस्ततः परम्॥'}

{'en': 'Through unfavourable destiny, through inability to find out the proper expedient, and through the obstacles put in by acts, men cannot see the path by which Brahına may be reached.', 'sn': 'अदृष्टतोऽनुपायाच्च प्रतिसंधेश्च कर्मणः। न तेन माः पश्यन्ति येन गच्छन्ति तत् पदम्॥'}

{'en': 'On account of attachment to worldly objects, in view of the joys of the highest heaven, and for seeking something other than Brahma, men do not attain to the Supremc.', 'sn': 'विषयेषु च संसर्गाच्छाश्वतस्य च दर्शनात्। मनसा चान्यदाकाङ्क्षन् परं न प्रतिपद्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Others seeing worldly objects seek their possession. When they hanker after such objects, they do not see Brahma inasmuch as it is shorn of all attributes.', 'sn': 'गुणान् यदिह पश्यन्ति तदिच्छन्त्यपरे जनाः। परं नैवाभिकाङ्क्षन्ति निर्गुणत्वाद् गुणार्थिनः॥'}

{'en': 'How can one who is endued with inferior qualities, acquire a knowledge of him who is possessed of superior qualities? It is by inference that one can arrive at a knowledge of Him who transcends all things in attributes and form.', 'sn': 'गुणैर्यस्त्ववरैर्युक्तः कथं विद्यात् परान् गुणान्। अनुमानाद्धि गन्तव्यं गुणैरवयवैः परम्॥'}

{'en': 'We can know him only. By subtile intelligence, we cannot describe Him in words. The mind is caught by the mind, the eye by the eye.', 'sn': 'सूक्ष्मेण मनसा विद्यो वाचा वक्तुं न शक्नुमः। मनो हि मनसा ग्राह्यं दर्शनेन च दर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'By knowledge the understanding can be purged off of its impurities The understanding may be engaged for purifying the mind. The senses should be restrained by the mind. Performing all this, one may attain to the Unchangeable.', 'sn': 'ज्ञानेन निर्मलीकृत्य बुद्धिं बुद्ध्या मनस्तथा। मनसा चेन्द्रियग्राममक्षरं प्रतिपद्यते॥'}

{'en': 'One who has, by contemplation, become freed from attachments, and who has the wealth of a discerning mind, succeeds in attaining to Brahma which is without desire and above all attributes. As the wind does not touch the fire that lies within a piece of wood, so persons, who are moved (by desire for worldly objects stand aloof from that which is Supreme).', 'sn': 'बुद्धिप्रवीणो मनसा समृद्धो निराशिषं निर्गुणमभ्युपैति। परं त्यजन्तीह विलोड्यमाना हुताशनं वायुरिवेन्धनस्थम्॥'}

{'en': 'When all earthly objects are destroyed, the mind always attains to That which is higher than the Understanding; while upon their separation the mind always acquires that which is below the Understanding. Therefore, a person, who, according to the method already described, becomes engaged in destroying carthly objects, becomes immersed in Brahma.', 'sn': 'गुणादाने विप्रयोगे च तेषां मनः सदा बुद्धिपरावराभ्याम्। अनेनैव विधिना सम्प्रवृत्तो गुणापाये ब्रह्म शरीर मेति॥'}

{'en': 'Though the Soul is unmanifest, yet when endued with qualities, its acts become manifest. When dissolution sets in it once more becomes unmanifest. The Soul is really inactive. Its exists, endued with the senses which create either happiness or misery.', 'sn': 'अव्यक्तात्मा पुरुषो व्यक्तकर्मा सोऽव्यक्तत्वं गच्छति दन्तकाले। ग्लायद्भिर्वाऽऽवर्ततेऽकामरूपः॥'}

{'en': 'United with all the senses and body, it takes refuge in the five primal elements. It cannot, however, act through want of power, however, when it is deprived of force by the Supreme and Unchangeable.', 'sn': 'सर्वैरयं चेन्द्रियैः सम्प्रयुक्तो देहं प्राप्तः पञ्चभूताश्रयः स्यात्। नासामर्थ्याद् गच्छति कर्मणेह हीनस्तेन परमेणाव्ययेन॥'}

{'en': "No man sees the end of this earth, but know this, viz., that the Earth's end will surely come. Man moved here (by attachments) is surely led to his last resort like the wind leading a vessel, tossed on the sea to a safe harbour at last.", 'sn': 'पृथ्व्यां नरः पश्यति नान्तमस्या ह्यन्तश्चास्या भविता चेति विद्धि। परं नयन्तीह विलोड्यमानं यथा प्लवं वायुरिवार्णवस्थम्॥'}

{'en': 'Diffusing his rays the sun becomes the possessor of an attribute, withdrawing his rays he once more becomes an object shorn of attributes, Similarly a person casting off all distinctions and practising penances, at last enters the indestructible Brahma which is shorn of all attributes.', 'sn': 'दिवाकरो गुणमुपलभ्य निर्गुणो यथा भवेदपगतरश्मिमण्डलः। तथा ह्यसौ मुनिरिह निर्विशेषवान् स निर्गुणं प्रविशति ब्रह्म चाव्ययम्॥'}

{'en': "By knowing Him who is without birth, who is the highest refuge of all pious men, who is self-create, from whom everything originates and whom everything returns, who is unchangeable, who is without beginning, middle, and end, and who is self and supreme, a person attains to immortality.'", 'sn': 'अनागतं सुकृतवतां परां गति स्वयम्भुवं प्रभवनिधानमव्ययम्। सनातनं यदमृतमव्ययं ध्रुवं निचाय्य तत् परममृतत्वमश्नुते॥'}

{'en': "By knowing Him who is without birth, who is the highest refuge of all pious men, who is self-create, from whom everything originates and whom everything returns, who is unchangeable, who is without beginning, middle, and end, and who is self and supreme, a person attains to immortality.'", 'sn': 'अनागतं सुकृतवतां परां गति स्वयम्भुवं प्रभवनिधानमव्ययम्। सनातनं यदमृतमव्ययं ध्रुवं निचाय्य तत् परममृतत्वमश्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said Of what nature, of what conduct, of what form, how clad, and how armed should the warriors be in order that they may be competent for battle?', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच किंशीला: किंसमाचाराः कथंरूपाश्च भारत। किंसन्नाहाः कथंशस्त्रा जनाः स्युः संगरे क्षमाः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said The soldier should use those weapons and cars with which they have become familiar by use. Taking those weapons and vehicles, brave soldiers, engage in battle.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच यथाऽऽचरितमेवात्र शस्त्रं पत्रं विधीयते। आचाराद् वीरपुरुषस्तथा कर्मसु वर्तते॥'}

{'en': 'The Gandharas, the Sindhus, and the Sauviras fight best with their nails and lances. They are brave and very strong. Their armies are capable of defeating all forces.', 'sn': 'गान्धाराः सिन्धुसौवीरा नखर प्रासयोधिनः। अभीरवः सुबलिनस्तद्वलं सर्वपारगम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Ushinaras are endued with great strength and skilled in all sorts of weapons. The Easterners are skilled in fighting from the backs of elephants and are masters of all the ways of unfair fight.', 'sn': 'सर्वशस्त्रेषु कुशलाः सत्त्ववन्तो ह्यशीनराः। प्राच्या मातङ्गयुद्धेषु कुशलाः कूटयोधिनः॥'}

{'en': 'The Yavanas, the Kamvojas, and those that live around Mathura are well skilled in fighting with bare arms. The Southerners are expert in fighting with bare arms. Southerners are expert in fighting swords in hand.', 'sn': 'तथा यवनकाम्बोजा मथुरामभितश्च ये। एते नियुद्धकुशला दाक्षिणात्यासिपाणयः॥'}

{'en': 'It is well known that persons endued with great strength and great courage are born in almost every country. Listen to me as I describe their characteristics.', 'sn': 'सर्वत्र शूरा जायन्ते महासत्त्वा महाबलाः। प्राय एव समुद्दिष्टा लक्षणानि तु मे शृणु॥'}

{'en': 'Those, who have voices and eyes like those of the lion or the tiger, those who have a gait like that of the lion and the tiger, and those who have eyes like those of the pigeon or of the snake, are all heroes capable of grinding the enemies.', 'sn': 'सिंहशार्दूलवाड्नेत्राः सिंहशार्दूलगामिनः। पारावतकुलिङ्क्षाक्षाः सर्वे शूराः प्रमाथिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those, who have a voice like a deer, and eyes like those of the leopard or the bull, are highly active. Those, whose voice is like that of bells, are excitable, wicked, and wrathful.', 'sn': 'मृगस्वरा द्वीपिनेत्रा ऋषभाक्षास्तरस्विनः। प्रमादिनश्च मन्दाश्च क्रोधनाः किङ्किणीस्वनाः॥'}

{'en': 'Those, who have a voice deep like the muttering of the clouds, who have angry faces or faces like those of camels, those who have hooked noses and tongues, are gifted with great speed and can shoot or hurl their weapons to a great distance.', 'sn': 'मेघस्वनाः क्रोधमुखाः केचित् करभसंनिभाः। जिह्मनासाग्रजिह्वाश्च दूरगा दूरपातिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those, who have bodies curved like that of the cat, and thin hair and thin skin are gifted with great speed and restlessness, and are almost invincible in battle.', 'sn': 'शीघ्राश्चपलवृत्ताश्च ते भवन्ति दुरासदाः॥'}

{'en': "Some who have eyes closed like those of iguana, a mild disposition and speed and voice like the horse's are capable to fight all enemies,", 'sn': 'गोधानिमीलिताः केचिन्मृदुप्रकृतयस्तथा। तरङ्गगतिनि?षास्ते नरा: पारयिष्णवः॥'}

{'en': "Those, who have well-formed, and symmetrical and beautiful bodies, and broad chests, who are irate upon hearing the enemy's drum or trumpet, who take delight in fights of every kind, who have eyes indicative of gravity, or eyes which seem to shoot out, or eyes which are green, those who have frowning faces, or eyes like those of the mongoose, are all brave and capable of sacrificing their lives in battle.", 'sn': 'सुसंहताः सुतनवो व्यूढोरस्काः सुसंस्थिताः। प्रवादितेषु कुप्यन्ति हृष्यन्ति कलहेषु च॥ गम्भीराक्षा निःसृताक्षाः पिङ्गाक्षा भृकुटीमुखाः। नकुलाक्षास्तथा चैव सर्वे शूरास्तनुत्यजः॥'}

{'en': 'Those, who have crooked eyes, and broad foreheads, and check-bones not fleshy, and arms strong as thunderbolts, and fingers bearing circular marks, and who are sparely built, and whose arteries and nerves are visible, rush with great impetuosity when the collision of battle takes place. Resembling angry elephants, they become irresistible.', 'sn': 'जिह्माक्षाः प्रललाटाश्च निर्मांसहनवोऽपि च। वज्रबाहङ्गुलीचक्राः कृशा धमनिसंतताः॥ प्रविशन्ति च वेगेन साम्पराये छुपस्थिते। वारणा इव सम्मत्तास्ते भवन्ति दुरासदाः॥'}

{'en': 'They who have greenish and curling hairs, who have flanks, cheeks, and faces fat and fleshy, who have elevated shoulders and broad necks, who have fearful faces and fat calves, who are fiery like the horse Sugriva or like the son of Garuda the son of Vinata, who have round heads, large mouths, faces like those of cats, shrill voice and angry temper, who rush to battle, impelled by its din, who are wicked and full of arrogance, who are of dreadful countenances, and who live in the outlying districts never care for their lives and do rever fly away from battle. Such troops should always be planted in the van. They always kill their foes in fight and suffer themselves to be killed without flying.', 'sn': 'दीप्तस्फुटितकेशान्ता: स्थूलपार्श्वहनूमुखाः। उन्नतांसाः पृथुग्रीवा विकटाः स्थूलपिण्डिकाः॥ उद्धता इव सुग्रीवा विनताविहगा इव।। पिण्डशीर्षातिवक्त्राश्च वृषदंशमुखास्तथा॥ उग्रस्वरा मन्युमन्तो युद्धेष्वारावसरिणः। अधर्मज्ञावलिप्ताश्च घोरा रौद्रप्रदर्शनाः॥ त्यक्तात्मानः सर्व एते अन्त्यजा ह्यनिवर्तिनः। पुरस्कार्याः सदा सैन्ये हन्यन्ते मन्ति चापि ये॥'}

{'en': 'Of wicked conduct and foreign manners, they consider soft speeches as marks of defeat. If treated leniently, they always show anger against their sovereign.', 'sn': 'अधार्मिका भिन्नवृत्ताः सान्त्वेनैषां पराभवः। एवमेव प्रकुप्यन्ति राज्ञोऽप्येते ह्यभीक्ष्णशः॥'}

{'en': 'Having saluted Narayana and Nara the best of male beings as also Sarasvati, the goddess of learning let us cry success.', 'sn': 'नारायणं नमस्कृत्य नरं चैव नरोत्तमम्। देवी सरस्वती व्यासं ततो जयमुदीरयेत्।।'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said O grandfather, peace of mind has been described to be subtile and of various forms. I have heard all your discourses, but have not still been able to acquire tranquillity of mind.', 'sn': 'युष्ठिर उवाच शमो बहुविधाकारः सूक्ष्म उक्तः पितामह। न च मे हृदये शान्तिरस्ति श्रुत्वेदमीदृशम्॥'}

{'en': 'Various means of quieting the mind have been described by you, O sire, but how can peace of mind be acquired from only a knowledge of the different sorts of tranquillity, when I myself have been the means of bringing all this about?', 'sn': 'अस्मिन्नर्थे बहुविधा शान्तिरुक्ता पितामह। स्वकृते का नु शान्तिः स्याच्छमाद् बहुविधादपि॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing your body covered with arrows and bad sores, I cannot get, O hero, any peace of mind. thinking of the evils I have done.', 'sn': 'शराचितशरीरं हि तीव्रव्रणमुदीक्ष्य च। शर्म नोपलभे वीर दुष्कृतान्येव चिन्तयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing your body, O bravest of the brave, covered with blood, like a hill covered with water from its springs, I am perishing with grief as the lotus in the rainy season.', 'sn': 'रुधिरेणावसिक्ताङ्गं प्रस्रवन्तं यथाचलम्। त्वां दृष्ट्वा पुरुषव्याघ्र सीदे वर्षास्विवाम्बुजम्॥'}

{'en': 'What can be more painful than this, that, for me, you, O grandfather have been reduced to this condition by my people fighting against their enemies on the battlefield.', 'sn': 'अतः कष्टतरं किं नु मत्कृते यत् पितामहः। इमामवस्थां गमितः प्रत्यमित्रै रणाजिरे॥'}

{'en': 'Other princes also, with their sons and kinsmen, have been killed on my account. Alas, what can be more painful than this?', 'sn': 'तथा चान्ये नृपतयः सहपुत्राः सबान्धवाः। मत्कृते निधनं प्राप्ताः किं नु कष्टतरं ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Tell us, O prince, what will befall us and the sons of Dhritarashtra, who, impelled by fate and anger, have done this hateful act.', 'sn': 'वयं हि धार्तराष्ट्राश्च कालमन्युवंशगताः। कृत्वेदं निन्दितं कर्म प्राप्स्यामः कां गतिं नृप।॥'}

{'en': 'O king, I think the son of Dhritarashtra is fortunate, because he does not see you in this condition.', 'sn': 'इदं तु धार्तराष्ट्रस्य श्रेयो मन्ये जनाधिप। इमामवस्थां सम्प्राप्तं यदसौ त्वां न पश्यति॥'}

{'en': 'But I, who am the cause of your death as well as of that of our friends, am denied all peace of mind by seeing you on the naked earth in this miserable plight.', 'sn': 'सोऽहं तव ह्यन्तकरः सुहृद्वधकरस्तथा। न शान्तिमधिगच्छामि पश्यंस्त्वां दुःखितं क्षितौ॥'}

{'en': 'The wicked Duryodhana, the most infamous of his family has, with all his soldiers and his brothers, died in battle, performing Kshatriya duties.', 'sn': 'दुर्योधनो हि समरे सहसैन्यः सहानुजः। निहतः क्षत्रधर्मेऽस्मिन् दुरात्मा कुलपांसनः॥'}

{'en': 'That wicked man does not see you lying on the ground! Verily, for this reason, I would prefer death to life.', 'sn': 'न स पश्यति दुष्टात्मा त्वामद्य पतितं क्षितौ। अतः श्रेयो मृतं मन्ये नेह जीवितमात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'O hero, who never forsook virtue, had I with my brothers met with death before this at the hands of our enemies on the battlefield, I would not have seen you in this pitiful condition, so pierced with arrows! Surely, O prince, the Maker had created us to commit evil deeds.', 'sn': 'अहं हि समरे वीर गमितः शत्रुभिः क्षयम्। अभविष्यं यदि पुरा सह भ्रातृभिरच्युत॥ न त्वामेवं सुदुःखार्तमद्राक्षं सायकार्दितम्। नूनं हि पापकर्माणो धात्रा सृष्टाः स्म हे नृप॥'}

{'en': 'O king, if you wish to do me good, do you then instruct me in such a way that I may be purged of this sin in even another world.', 'sn': 'अन्यस्मिन्नपि लोके वै यथा मुच्येम किल्बिषात्। तथा प्रशाधि मां राजन् मम चेदिच्छसि प्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Why, O fortunate one, do you regard your soul, which is dependent, to be the cause of your deeds? Its inaction is subtle and imperceptible to the senses.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच परतन्त्रं कथं हेतुमात्मानमनुपश्यसि। कर्मणां हि महाभाग सूक्ष्मं ह्येतदतान्द्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'Regarding it is cited the old story of the conversation between Mrityu and Gautami with Kala and the Fowler and the serpent.', 'sn': 'अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। संवादं मृत्युगौतम्योः काललुब्धकपन्नगैः॥'}

{'en': 'There was, O son of Kunti, an old lady named Gautami, who was endued with great patience and peace of mind. One day she found her son dead on account of having been bitten by a serpent.', 'sn': 'गौतमी नाम कौन्तेय स्थविरा शमसंयुता। सर्पण दष्टं स्वं पुत्रमपश्यद्गतचेतनम्॥'}
{'en': 'An angry fowler, named Arjunaka, bound the serpent with a string and brought it before Gautami.', 'sn': 'अथ तं स्नायुपाशेन बद्ध्वा सर्पममर्षितः। लुब्धकोऽर्जुनको नाम गौतम्याः समुपानयत्॥'}

{'en': "He then said to her. This wretched serpent has been the cause of your son's death. O blessed lady! Tell me quickly how this wretch is to be killed!", 'sn': 'स चाब्रवीदयं ते स पुत्रहा पन्नगाधमः। ब्रूहि क्षिप्रं महाभागे वध्यतां केन हेतुना॥'}

{'en': 'Shall I throw it into the fire or shall I cut it into pieces? This infamous killer of a child should not live longer!', 'sn': 'अग्नौ प्रक्षिप्यतामेष च्छिद्यतां खण्डशोऽपि वा। न ह्ययं बालहा पापश्चिरं जीवितुमर्हति॥'}

{'en': 'Gautami replied Do you, O Arjunaka of little understanding, set free this serpent! It should not be killed by you. Who is so foolish as not to care for the inevitable destiny that awaits him and make himself heavy for sinking into sin?', 'sn': 'गौतम्युवाच विसृजैनमबुद्धिस्त्वमवध्योऽर्जुनक त्वया। को ह्यात्मानं गुरुं कुर्यात् प्राप्तव्यमविचिन्तयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Those who have made themselves light by performing virtuous deeds, manage to cross the sea of the world as a ship crosses the ocean. But those who have loaded themselves with sin sink into the bottom, as an arrow thrown into the water.', 'sn': 'प्लवन्ते धर्मलघवो लोकऽम्भसि यथा प्लवाः। मज्जन्ति पापगुरवः शस्त्रं स्कन्नमिवोदके॥'}

{'en': 'By killing this serpent, this my boy will not revive, and by letting it live, no harm will be caused to you. Who would go to the endless regions of Death by killing this living creature?', 'sn': 'हत्वा चैनं नामृत: स्यादयं मे जीवत्यस्मिन् कोऽत्ययः स्यादयं ते। अस्योत्सर्गे प्राणयुक्तस्य जन्तोर्मृत्योर्लोकं को नु गच्छेदनन्तम्॥'}

{'en': 'The fowler said I know, O lady, who know the difference between, right and wrong that great persons are pained at the miseries of all creatures. But these words which you have uttered carry instruction for only a selfcontained person. Therefore, I must kill this serpent.', 'sn': 'लुब्धक उवाच जानाम्यहं देवि गुणागुणज्ञे सर्वार्तियुक्ता गुरवो भवन्ति। स्वस्थस्यैते तूपदेशा भवन्ति तस्मात् क्षुद्रं सर्पमेनं हनिष्ये।॥'}

{'en': 'Those who value peace of mind, attribute everything to the course of Time as the cause, but practical men soon pacify their grief. People, through perpetual error, fear loss of beatitude. Therefore, O lady, remove your grief by having this serpent killed (by me).', 'sn': 'शमार्थिनः कालगतिं वदन्ति सद्यः शुचं त्वर्थविदस्त्यजन्ति। श्रेयःक्षयं शोचति नित्यमोहात् तस्माच्छुचं मुञ्च हते भुजङ्गे॥'}

{'en': 'Gautami replied People like us are never pained. Good men have their souls always bent on virtue. The death of the boy was predestined: therefore, I cannot approve of the destruction of this serpent.', 'sn': 'गौतम्युवाच आतिनैवं विद्यतेऽस्मद्विधानां धर्मात्मानः सर्वदा सज्जना हि। दीशे नाहं पन्नगस्य प्रमाथे॥'}

{'en': 'Brahmanas do not cherish resentment, because resentment leads to pain. Do you, O Goodman, forgive and set free this serpent out of mercy.', 'sn': 'न ब्राह्मणानां कोपोऽस्ति कुतः कोपाच्च यातनाम्। मार्दवारक्षम्यतां साधो मुच्यतामेष पन्नगः॥'}

{'en': 'The fowler replied Let us acquire great and inexhaustible merit in the next worlds by destroying (this creature), as a man gains great merit, and confers it on his victim as well, by sacrifice upon the altar! Merit is won by killing an enemy: by killing this despicable creature, you will acquire great and true merit in the next world.', 'sn': 'लुब्धक उवाच ल्लभ्यो लाभ्यः स्याद् बलिभ्यः प्रशस्तः। कालाल्लाभो यस्तु सत्यो भवेत श्रेयोलाभः कुत्सितेऽस्मिन्न ते स्यात्॥'}

{'en': 'Gautami replied What good is there in torturing and destroying an enemy, and what good is acquired by not setting free an enemy in our power? Therefore. O you of kind face, why should we not forgive this serpent and try to acquire merit by setting it free.', 'sn': 'गौतम्युवाच का नु प्राप्तिर्गृह्य शत्रु निहत्य का कामाप्तिः प्राप्य शत्रु न मुक्त्वा। कस्मात् सौम्याहं न क्षमे नो भुजङ्गे मोक्षार्थं वा कस्य हेतोर्न कुर्याम्॥'}

{'en': 'The fowler replied A great number (of creatures)should be safeguarded against this one, instead of this single creature being protected. Virtuous men quit the vicious: do you, therefore, destroy the wicked creature.', 'sn': 'लुब्धक उवाच अस्मादेकाद् बहवो रक्षितव्या नैको बहुभ्यो गौतमि रक्षितव्यः। कृतागसं धर्मविदस्त्यजन्ति सरीसृपं पापमिमं जहि त्वम्॥'}

{'en': 'Gautami replied By killing this serpent, my son, O fowler, will not regain his life, nor do I see that any other end will be attained by its death: therefore, do you, O fowler, set this living serpent free.', 'sn': 'गौतम्युवाच नास्मिन् हते पन्नगे पुत्रको मे सम्प्राप्स्यते लुब्धक जीवितं वै। गुणं चान्यं नास्य वधे प्रपश्ये तस्मात् सर्प लुब्धक मुञ्च जीवम्॥'}

{'en': 'The fowler said By destroying Vritra, Indra got the best portion (of sacrificial offerings), and by destroying a sacrifice Mahadeva secured his share of sacrificial offerings: do you, therefore, kill this serpent forthwith without any misgivings whatsoever.', 'sn': 'लुब्धक उवाच वृत्रं हत्वा देवराट् श्रेष्ठभाग वै यज्ञं हुत्वा भागमवाप चैव। शूली देवो देववृत्तं चर त्वं क्षिप्रं सर्प जहि मा भूत्ते विशङ्का॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Although repeatedly urged on by the fowler for the destruction of the serpent, the great Gautami did nor bend her mind to that sinful deed. Painfully fettered with the cord, sighing a little and keeping up its composure with great difficulty, the serpent then uttered these words slowly, in a human voice.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच असकृत् प्रोच्यमानापि गौतमी भुजगं प्रति। लुब्धकेन महाभागा पापे नैवाकरोन्मतिम्॥ ईषदुच्छ्वसमानस्तु कृच्छ्रात् संस्तभ्य पन्नगः। उत्ससर्ज गिरं मन्दां मानुषीं पाशपीडितः॥'}

{'en': 'The serpent said O foolish Arjunaka, what is my fanlt? I have no will of my own, and am not independent! Death sent me on this work.', 'sn': 'सर्प उवाच कोन्वर्जुनक दोषोऽत्र विद्यते मम बालिश। अस्वतन्त्रं हि मां मृत्युर्विवशं यदचूचुदत्॥'}

{'en': 'By his order have I bitten this child, and not out of any anger or option an my part. Therefore, if there be any sin in this, O fowler, the sin is his.', 'sn': 'तस्यायं वचनाद् दष्टो न कोपेन न काम्यया। तस्य तत्किल्बिषं लुब्ध विद्यते यदि किल्बिषम्॥'}

{'en': 'The fowler said If you have committed this evil, urged thereto by another, the sin is your also as you are an instrument in the act.', 'sn': 'लुब्धक उवाच यद्यन्यवशगेनेदं कृतं ते पन्नगाशुभम्। कारणं वै त्वमप्यत्र तस्मात् किल्बिषी॥'}

{'en': "As in the making of an earthen pot the potter's wheel and rod and other things are all considered as causes, so are you, O serpent.", 'sn': 'मृत्पात्रस्य क्रियायां हि दण्डचक्रादयो यथा। कारणत्वे प्रकल्प्यन्ते तथा त्वमपि पन्नग॥'}

{'en': "The serpent said He who is guilty should be killed by me, You, O serpent, are guilty! Indeed you confess it. As all these, vis., the porter's wheel, rod, and other things, are not independent causes, so I am not an independent cause! Therefore, this is no fault of mine, you should admit it.", 'sn': 'सर्प उवाच किल्विषी चापि मे वध्यः किल्बिषी चासि पन्नग। आत्मानं कारणं ह्यत्र त्वमाख्यासि भुजङ्गम॥ सर्व एते ह्यस्ववशा दण्डचक्रादयो यथा। तथाऽहमपि तस्मान्मे नैष दोषो मतस्तव॥'}

{'en': 'If you hold otherwise, then these are to be considered as causes working with one another. For thus working with one other, a doubt springs up about their relation as cause and effect.', 'sn': 'अथवा मतमेतत्ते तेऽप्यन्योन्यप्रयोजकाः। कार्यकारणसन्देहो भवत्यन्योन्यचोदनात्॥'}

{'en': 'Such being the case, it is no fault of mine, nor should I be killed on this account, nor am I guilty of any sin! Or, if you think that there is sin, the sin lies in the aggregate of causes.', 'sn': 'एवं सति न दोषो मे नास्मि वध्यो न किल्बिषी। किल्विषं समवाये स्यान्मन्यसे यदि किल्विषम्॥'}

{'en': 'The fowler said If you are neither the principal cause nor the agent in this matter: you are still the cause of the death. Therefore, I think you should be killed.', 'sn': 'लुब्धक उवाच कारणं यदि न स्याद् वै न कर्ता स्यास्त्वमप्युत। विनाशकारणं त्वं च तस्माद् वध्योऽसि मे मतः॥'}

{'en': 'If, O serpent, you think that when an evil deed is done the doer is not implicated therein, then there can be no cause in this matter: but having done this, you should surely be killed. What more do you think?', 'sn': 'असत्यपि कृते कार्यं नेह पन्नग लिप्यते। तस्मान्नात्रैव हेतुः स्याद् वध्यः किं बहु मन्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'The serpent said Whether any prime cause exists or not, no effect is done without an (intermediate) act. Therefore, causation being of no importance in either case, my act as the cause should be considered in full.', 'sn': 'सर्प उवाच कार्याभावे क्रिया न स्यात् सत्यसत्यपि कारणे। तस्मात् समेऽस्मिन् हेतौ मे वाच्यो हेतुर्विशेषतः॥'}

{'en': 'If, O fowler, you consider me truly, to be the cause then the sin of this act of killing a living being rests on the shoulders of another who led me to do this.', 'sn': 'अन्यः प्रयोगे स्यादत्र किल्बिषी जन्तुनाशने।॥ यद्यहं कारणत्वेन मतो लुब्धक तत्त्वतः।'}

{'en': "The fowler said You don't deserve life, O foolish one, why do you then exchange so many words, O wretched serpent? You should be killed by me. You have done a heinous crime by killing this infant.", 'sn': 'लुब्धक उवाच वध्यस्त्वं मम दुर्बुद्धे बालघाती नृशंसकृत्। भाषसे किं बहु पुनर्वध्यः सन् पन्नगाधम॥'}

{'en': 'The serpent said O fowler, as the priests officiating at a sacrifice do not gain the merit of the act by offering oblations of clarified butter to the fire, so should I be considered in this matter.', 'sn': 'सर्प उवाच यथा हवींषि जुह्वाना मखे वै लुब्धकर्विजः। न फलं प्राप्नुवन्त्यत्र फलयोगे तथा ह्यहम्॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma continued The serpent directed by Death having said this, Death himself appeared there and addressing the serpent said:', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच तथा ब्रुवति तस्मिंस्तु पन्नगे मृत्युचोदिते। आजगाम ततो मृत्युः पन्नगं चाब्रवीदिदम्॥'}

{'en': "Mrityu said Guided by Kala, I, O serpent, sent you on this mission, and neither are you nor am I the cause of this child's death.", 'sn': 'मृत्युरुवाच प्रचोदितोऽहं कालेन पन्नग त्वामचूचुदम्। विनाशहेतुर्नास्य तमहं न प्राणिनः शिशोः॥'}
{'en': 'As the clouds are driven hither and thither by the wind I, am, O serpent, moved by Kala.', 'sn': 'यथा वायुर्जलधरान् विकर्षति ततस्ततः। तद्वज्जलदवत् सर्प कालस्याहं वशानुगः॥'}

{'en': 'All influences of Sattwa, or Rajas, or Tamas, originate from Kala as they work in all creatures.', 'sn': 'सात्त्विका राजसाश्चैव तामसा ये च केचन। भावाः कालात्मकाः सर्वे प्रवर्तन्ते ह जन्तुषु॥'}

{'en': 'All creatures, mobile and immobile, in heaven, or earth, are pervaded by the influence of Kala. The whole universe, O serpent, is permeated by this same influence of Kala.', 'sn': 'जङ्गमाः स्थावराश्चैव दिवि वा यदि वा भुवि। सर्वे कालात्मकाः सर्प कालात्मकमिदं जगत्॥'}

{'en': 'All acts in this world and all abstentions, as also all their changes, are owing to be influenced by Kala.', 'sn': 'प्रवृत्तयश्च लोकेऽस्मिंस्तथैव च निवृत्तयः। तासां विकृतयो याश्च सर्वं कालात्मकं स्मृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Sun, Soma, Vishnu, Water, Wind, the god of a hundred sacrifices, Fire, Sky, Earth, Mitra and Parjanaya, Aditi, and the Vasus, Rivers and Oceans, all existent and nonexistent objects, are created and destroyed by Kala.', 'sn': 'आदित्यश्चन्द्रमा विष्णुरापो वायुः शतक्रतुः। अग्नि: स्वं पृथिवी मित्रः पर्जन्यो वसवोऽदितिः।।५५'}

{'en': 'Knowing this, why do you, O serpent, consider me blameable? If I am to be blamed for this, you are also blameable.', 'sn': 'सरितः सागराचैव भावाभावौ च पन्नग। सर्व कालेन सृज्यन्ते ह्रियन्ते च पुनः पुनः॥ एवं ज्ञात्वा कथं मां त्वं सदोषं सर्प मन्यसे। अथ चैवंगते दोघे मयि त्वमपि दोषवान्॥'}

{'en': 'The serpent said I do not, O Mrityu, blame you, nor do I set you free from all blame. I only say that I am directed and influenced by you.', 'sn': 'सर्प उवाच निर्दोषं दोषवन्तं वा न त्वां मृत्यो ब्रवीम्यहम्। त्वयाहं चोदित इति ब्रवीम्येतावदेव तु॥'}
{'en': 'If Kala is to be blamed, or, it is not for me to find the fault. We have nor right to do so.', 'sn': 'यदि काले तु दोषोऽस्ति यदि तत्रापि नेष्यते। दोषो नैव परीक्ष्यो मे न ह्यत्राधिकृता वयम्॥'}

{'en': 'As it is my duty to absolve myself from this blame, so it is my duty to see that Mrityu is not blamed.', 'sn': 'निर्मोक्षस्त्वस्य दोषस्य मया कार्या यथा तथा। मृत्योरपि न दोषः स्यादिति मेऽत्र प्रयोजनम्॥'}

{'en': "Bhishma continued Then the serpent, addressing Arjunaka said, 'You have heard what Mrityu has said. Therefore, it is not proper for you to torment me, who am innocent, by fettering me with this rope", 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच सर्पोऽथार्जुनकं प्राह श्रुतं ते मृत्युभाषितम्। नानागसं मां पाशेन संतापयितुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'The fowler said I have heard, you, O serpent, as well as the words of Mrityu, but these, O serpent, do not set you free from all blame.', 'sn': 'लुब्धक उवाच मृत्योः श्रुतं मे वचनं तव चैव भुजङ्गम। नैव तावददोषत्वं भवति त्वयि पन्नग॥'}

{'en': "Mrityu and you are the causes of this child's death. I regard both of you to be the cause and I do not call that to be the cause which is not truly so.", 'sn': 'मृत्युस्त्वं चैव हेतुर्हि बालस्यास्य विनाशने। उभयं कारणं मन्ये न कारणमकारणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Accursed be the wicked and vengeful Death that causes misery to the good! I shall also kill you who are sinful and engaged in sinful deeds.', 'sn': 'धिमृत्युं च दुरात्मानं क्रूरं दुःखकरं सताम्। त्वां चैवाहं वधिष्यामि पापं पापस्य कारणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Mrityu said We both are not free, but are dependent on Kala, and are ordained to do our appointed work. You will not blame us if you do consider this matter thoroughly.', 'sn': 'मृत्युरुवाच विवशौ कालवशगावावां निर्दिष्टकारिणौ। नावां दोषेण गन्तव्यौ यदि सम्यक् प्रपश्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'The fowler said If you both, O serpent and Mrityu, depend on Kala. I am curious to know how pleasure and anger are caused.', 'sn': 'लुब्धक उवाच युवामुभौ कालवशौ यदि मे मृत्युपन्नगौ। हर्षक्रोधौ यथा स्यातामेतदिच्छामि वेदितुम्॥'}

{'en': 'Mrityu said Everything is done under the influence of Kala. I have said it before, O fowler, that Kala is the cause of all and therefore we both, acting under the influence of Kala, do our appointed work and, therefore, O fowler, we two should not be blamed by you.', 'sn': 'मृत्युरुवाच या काचिदेव चेष्टा स्यात् सर्वा कालप्रचोदिता। पूर्वमेवैतदुक्तं हि मया लुब्धक कालतः॥ तस्मादुभौ कालवशावावां निर्दिष्टकारिणौ। नावां दोषेण गन्तव्यौ त्वया लुब्धक कर्हिचित्॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Then Kala arrived there where ethics were being discussed, and spoke thus to the serpent and Mrityu and the fowler Arjunaka assembled together.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अथोपगम्य कालस्तु तस्मिन् धर्मार्थसंशये। अब्रवीत् पन्नगं मृत्यु लुब्धं चार्जुनकं तथा॥'}

{'en': 'Kala said Neither Mrityu, nor this serpent, nor I, O fowler, am guilty of the death of any creature. We are merely the immediate causes of the event. O Arjunaka, the Karma of this child was the exciting cause of our action in this matter.', 'sn': 'काल उवाच न ह्यहं नाप्ययं मृत्यु यं लुब्धक पन्नगः। किल्बिषी जन्तुमरणे न वयं हि प्रयोजकाः॥'}

{'en': 'There was no other cause by which this child met its death. It was killed by the result of its own Karma.', 'sn': 'अकरोद् यदयं कर्म तन्नोऽर्जुनक चोदकम्। विनाशहेतुर्नान्योऽस्य वध्यतेऽयं स्वकर्मणा॥'}

{'en': "It has met 'with death as the result of its pristine Karma. Its Karma has been the root of its destruction. We all are subject to our respective Karma.", 'sn': 'यदनेन कृतं कर्म तेनायं निधनं गतः। विनाशहेतुः कर्मास्य सर्वे कर्मवशा वयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Karma is a help to salvation as sons are and Karma also expresses virtue and vice in man. We impell one another even acts urge one another.', 'sn': 'कर्मदायादवाँल्लोकः कर्मसम्बन्धलक्षणः। कर्माणि चोदयन्तीह यथान्योन्यं तथा वयम्॥'}

{'en': 'As men make from a lump of clay whatever they wish to make, so do men come by various results out of Karma.', 'sn': 'यथा मृत्पिण्डतः कर्ता कुरुते यद् यदिच्छति। एवमात्मकृतं कर्म मानवः प्रतिपद्यते॥'}

{'en': 'As light and shadow are connected with each other, so are men related to Karma through their own deeds.', 'sn': 'यथाच्छायातयौ नित्यं सुसम्बद्धौ निरन्तरम्। तथा कर्म च कर्ता च सम्बद्धावात्मकर्मभिः॥'}

{'en': "Therefore, neither are you, nor am I, nor Mrityu, nor the serpent, nor this old Brahmana lady, is the cause of this child's death.", 'sn': 'एवं नाहं न वै मृत्यु सर्पो न तथा भवान्। न चेयं ब्राह्मणी वृद्धा शिशुरेवात्र कारणम्॥'}

{'en': 'He himself is the cause here. Upon Kala, O king, explaining the matter thus, Gautami, convinced in her mind that men suffer according to their actions, spoke thus to Arjunaka.', 'sn': 'तस्मिंस्तथा ब्रुवाणे तु ब्राह्मणी गौतमी नृप। स्वकर्मप्रत्ययाँल्लोकान् मत्वाऽर्जुनकमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Gautami said Neither Kala, nor Mrityu, nor the serpent, is the cause here. This child has met with death as the result of its own Karma,', 'sn': 'गौतमी उवाच नैव कालो न भुजगो न मृत्युरिह कारणम्। स्वकर्मभिरयं बालः कालेन निधनं गतः॥'}

{'en': 'I too have so acted that my son has died. Let now Kala and Mrityu retire from there, and do you too, O Arjunaka, set this serpent free.', 'sn': 'मया च तत् कृतं कर्म येनायं मे मृतः सुतः। यातु कालस्तथा मृत्युर्मुञ्चार्जुनक पन्नगम्॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma continued Then Kala and Mrityu and the serpent returned to their respective places, and Gautami became consoled in mind as also the fowler.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच ततो यथागतं जग्मुर्मृत्युः कालोऽथ पन्नगः। अभूद् विशोकोऽर्जुनको विशोका चैव गौतमी॥'}

{'en': 'Having heard all this, O king, do you forego all grief, and acquire peace of mind! Men attain to heaven or hell as the result of their own Karma.', 'sn': 'एतच्छुत्वा शमं गच्छ मा भूः शोकपरो नृप। स्वकर्मप्रत्ययाँल्लोकान् सर्वे गच्छन्ति वै नृप॥'}

{'en': "This evil has neither been of your own creation, nor of Duryodhana's! That these king's of Earth have all been killed, is the work of Kala.", 'sn': 'नैव त्वया कृतं कर्म नापि दुर्योधनेन वै। कालेनैतत् कृतं विद्धि निहता येन पार्थिवाः॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said Having heard all this, the powerful and pious Yudhishthira became consoled in mind, and again enquired as follows.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच इत्येतद् वचनं श्रुत्वा बभूव विगतज्वरः। युधिष्ठिरो महातेजाः पप्रच्छेदं च धर्मवित्॥'}

{'en': 'I should certainly, O king, tell you everything about the circumstance for which, O monarch, I came hither for exterminating your race.', 'sn': 'अवश्यं कथनीयं मे तवैतन्नरपुङ्गव। यदर्थं त्वाहमुच्छेत्तुं सम्प्राप्तो मनुजाधिप॥'}

{'en': 'This is wellknown, o king, that the Kshatriyas should always have the help of the sons of Bhrigu in the matter of sacrifices. Through an irresistible decree of destiny, the Kshatriyas and the Bhargavas will quarrel,', 'sn': 'भृगूणां क्षत्रिया याज्या नित्यमेतज्जनाधिप। ते च भेदं गमिष्यन्ति दैवयुक्तेन हेतुना॥'}

{'en': 'The Kshatriyas, o king, will kill all the descendants of Bhrigu. By an ordinance of fate, they will root out the race of Bhrigu, not sparing even infants in their mothers wombs.', 'sn': 'क्षत्रियाश्च भृगून् सर्वान् वधिष्यन्ति नराधिप। आ गर्भादनुकृन्तन्तो दैवदण्डनिपीडिताः॥'}

{'en': "There will then be born in Bhrigu's race a Rishi of the name of Urva. Gifted with great energy, he will in splendour certainly resemble fire or the sun.", 'sn': 'तत उत्पत्स्यतेऽस्माकं कुले गोत्रविवर्धनः। उर्वो नाम महातेजा ज्वलनार्कसमद्युतिः॥'}

{'en': 'He will cherish such anger as will be sufficient to consume the three worlds. He will be competent to reduce the whole Earth with all her mountains and forests into ashes.', 'sn': 'स त्रैलोक्यविनाशाय कोपाग्निं जनयिष्यति। महीं सपर्वतवनां यः करिष्यति भस्मसात्॥'}

{'en': "For a little while he will put out the flames of that fiery rage, throwing it into the Mare's mouth that wanders through the ocean.", 'sn': 'कंचित् कालं तु वह्निं च स एव शमयिष्यति। समुद्रे वडवावको प्रक्षिप्य मुनिसत्तमः॥'}

{'en': "He will have a son of the name of Richika. The whole science of arms, O sinless one, on its embodied form, will come to him, for the extermination of the entire Kshatriya caste, through a decree of Destiny. Receiving that science by inward light, he will, by Yogapower, communicate it to his son, the highly blessed Jamadagni of purified soul. That foremost of Bhrigu's race will bear that science in his mind.", 'sn': 'पुत्रं तस्य महाराज ऋचीकं भृगुनन्दनम्। साक्षात् कृत्स्नो धनुर्वेदः समुपस्थास्यतेऽनघ।॥ क्षत्रियाणामभावाय दैवयुक्तेन हेतुना। स तु तं प्रतिगृह्मैव पुत्रे संक्रामयिष्यति॥ जमदग्नौ महाभागे तपसा भावितात्मनि। स चापि भृगुशार्दूलस्तं वेदं धारयिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'O you of righteous soul, Jamadagni will marry a girl, taking her from your race, for spreading its glory, O chief of the Bharatas.', 'sn': 'कुलात् तु तव धर्मात्मन् कन्यां सोऽधिगमिष्यति। उद्भावनार्थं भवतो वंशस्य नृपसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Having obtained for wife the daughter of Gadhi and your granddaughter, O king, that great ascetic will beget a twiceborn son gifted with Kshatriya accomplishments.', 'sn': 'गाधेर्दुहितरं प्राप्य पौत्रीं तव महातपाः। ब्राह्मणं क्षत्रधर्माणं पुत्रमुत्पादयिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'In your race will be born a son, a Kshatriya gifted with the virtues of a Brahmana. Possessed of great virtue, he will be the son of Gadhi. Known by the name of Vishvamitra, he will in energy come to be considered as the equal of Brihaspati himself, the preceptor of the celestials.', 'sn': 'क्षत्रियं विप्रकर्माणं बृहस्पतिमिवौजसा। विश्वामित्रं तव कुले गाधेः पुत्रं सुधार्मिकम्॥'}

{'en': 'The illustrious Richika will grant this son to your race, this Kshatriya who will be endued with high penances. Two women will be the cause in the matter of this exchange of sons.', 'sn': 'तपसा महता युक्तं प्रदास्यति महाद्युते। स्त्रियौ त कारणं तत्र परिवर्ते भविष्यतः॥'}

{'en': 'All this will take place at the command of the Grandfather. It will never be otherwise. The status of Brahmanahood will attach to one who is third in descent from you. You shall become a relative of the Bhargavas!', 'sn': 'पितामहनियोगाद् वै नान्यथैतद् भविष्यति। तृतीये पुरुषे तुभ्यं ब्राह्मणत्वमुपैष्यति॥ भविता त्वं च सम्बन्धी भृगूणां भावितात्मनाम्।'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Hearing these words of the great ascetic Chyavana, king Kushika became filled with joy, and answered as followएवमस्त्विति धर्मात्मा तदा भरतसत्तम॥', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच कुशिकस्तु मुनेर्वाक्यं च्यवनस्य महात्मनः॥ श्रुत्वा हृष्टोऽभवद् राजा वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह।'}

{'en': 'Indeed, O best of the Bharatas, he saidSo be it! Gifted with high energy, Chyavana once more addressed the king, and urged him to accept a boon from himself. The king replied, Very well. From you, O great ascetic, I shall obtain the fruition of my wish.', 'sn': 'पुनरेव नराधिपम्। वरार्थं चोदयामास तमुवाच स पार्थिवः॥ बाढमेवं करिष्यामि कामं त्वत्तो महामुने।'}

{'en': "Let my family become invested with the dignity of Brahmanahood, and let it always set its heart upon virtue. The ascetic Chyavana, thus solicited, granted the king's prayer, and bidding farewell to the king, started on his intended sojourn to the sacred waters. I have now told you everything, O Bharata, relating to your questions, viz., how the Bhrigus and the Kushikas became connected with each other by marriage.", 'sn': 'च्यवनस्तु महातेजाः ब्रह्मभूतं कुलं मेऽस्तु धर्मे चास्य मनो भवेत्॥ एवमुक्तस्तथेत्येवं प्रत्युक्त्वा च्यवनो मुनिः। अभ्यनुज्ञाय नृपति तीर्थयात्रा ययौ तदा॥ एतत् ते कथितं सर्वमशेषेण मया नृप। भृगूणां कुशिकानां च अभिसम्बन्धकारणम्॥'}

{'en': "Indeed, O king, everything took place as the Rishi Chyavana had said. The birth of Rama (of Bhrigu's race) and of Vishvamitra (of Kushika's race) happened in the way that Chyavana had said,", 'sn': 'यथोक्तमृषिणा चापि तदा तदभवन्नृप। जन्म रामस्य च मुनेर्विश्वामित्रस्य चैव हि॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said: (O Serpent), in this world, you are so superiority versed in the Vedas and the Vedangas, that I should like you will iell me, by what (sorts of) acts men can obtain heaven.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच भवानेतादृशो लोके वेदवेदाङ्गपारगः। ब्रूहि किं कुर्वतः कर्म भवेद् गतिरनुत्तमा॥'}

{'en': 'The Serpent said : In my opinion, O Bharata, by bestowal of alims on deserving objects, endearing words, truthfulness and unenviousness one can have access to heaven.', 'sn': 'सर्प उवाच पात्रे दत्त्वा प्रियाण्युक्त्वा सत्यमुक्त्वा च भारत। अहिंसानिरतः स्वर्ग गच्छेदिति मतिर्मम॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said: Snake, between benevolence and truthfulness, which is more praiseworthy? And tell me as regards unenviousness and good behaviour which is the more and which is the less important.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच दानाद् वा सर्प सत्याद् वा किमतो गुरु दृश्यते। अहिंसाप्रिययोश्चैव गुरुलाघवमुच्यताम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Snake replied The superiority or inferiority among charity, truthfulness, forbearance from malice and sweet speech is estimated at by the benefit which each of these tends to produce.', 'sn': 'सर्प उवाच दानं च सत्यं तत्त्वं वा अहिंसा प्रियमेव च। एषां कार्यगरीयस्त्वाद् दृश्यते गुरुलाघवम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sometimes truthfulness is considered superior to some charitable acts. And, O king of kings, sometimes charity is deemed more praiseworthy than true speech.', 'sn': 'कस्माच्चिद् दानयोगाद्धि सत्यमेव विशिष्यते। सत्यवाक्याच्च राजेन्द्र किंचिद् दानं विशिष्यते॥'}

{'en': 'And similarly, O lord of the earth, O mighty monarch, abstenance from malice is (sometimes) deemed superior to sweet speech and vice versa.', 'sn': 'एवमेव महेष्वास प्रियवाक्यान्महीपते। अहिंसा दृश्यते गुर्वी ततश्च प्रियमिष्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Thus, O monarch, (their superiority or inferiority) depends on their utility. Now if you have anything more to ask, speak out and I shall solve your doubts.', 'sn': 'एवमेतद् भवेद् राजन् कार्यापेक्षमनन्तरम्। यदभिप्रेतमन्यत् ते ब्रूहि यावद् ब्रवीम्यहम्॥'}

{'en': '(Kindly) tell me O Serpent, how the access of a disembodied being to heaven, how his enjoyment of the rewards and endurance of the punishment consequent on its acts and how its perception through the senses, be conceived. can', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच कथं स्वर्गे गति: सर्प कर्मणां च फलंध्रुवम्। अशरीरस्य दृश्येत प्रब्रूहि विषयांश्च मे॥'}

{'en': 'The Snake replied O king, on account of their own (meritorious or evil) acts men are seen to attain one of the three conditions of rebirth as men, heavenly existence or birth among the lower animals.', 'sn': 'सर्प उवाच तिगे वै गतयो राजन् परिदृष्टाः स्वकर्मभिः। मानुषं स्वर्गवासश्च तिर्यग्योनिश्च तत् त्रिधा॥'}

{'en': 'By charity, unenviousness, absence of slothfulness and by self-exertion one goes to heaven from this state of men.', 'sn': 'तत्र वै मानुषाल्लोकाद् दानादिभिरतन्द्रितः। अहिंसार्थसमायुक्तैः कारणैः स्वर्गमश्नुते॥'}

{'en': '(But) by contrary acts, O king of kings, one is either reborn among men or among lower animals. (Therefore)O child, it is particularly laid in this subject,', 'sn': 'विपरीतैश्च राजेन्द्र कारणैर्मानुषो भवेत्। तिर्यग्योनिस्तथा तात विशेषश्चात्र वक्ष्यते॥'}

{'en': 'That he who is subject to lust, anger malice and temptations, being degraded from the human state again takes his birth among the lower animals,', 'sn': 'कामक्रोधसमायुक्तो हिंसालोभसमन्वितः। मनुष्यत्वात् परिभ्रष्टस्तिर्यग्योनौ प्रसूयते॥'}

{'en': 'And as is laid down in the Vedas, gets rid of the existence among the lower animals in order to attain the human state again. And cows, cattle and horses and other animals are (even sometimes) seen to attain to divine life.', 'sn': 'तिर्यग्योन्याः पृथग्भावो मनुष्यार्थे विधीयते। गवादिभ्यस्तथाश्वेभ्यो देवत्वमपि दृश्यते॥'}

{'en': 'O child, such is the transmigration of a creature according to his (good or evil) actions. But he that is wise reposes his soul in the everlasting Spirit.', 'sn': 'सोऽयमेता गतीस्तात जन्तुश्चरति कार्यवान्। नित्ये महति चात्मानमवस्थापयते द्विजः॥'}

{'en': 'The embodied spirit enchained by Fate and enjoying the pleasure or suffering the pain consequent on its acts, takes birth repeatedly. But he that has lost touch of his action is conscious of the destiny of all born creatures.', 'sn': 'जातो जातश्च बलवद् भुङ्क्ते चात्मा स देहवान्। फलार्थस्तात निष्पृक्तः प्रजापालनभावनः॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said : Tell me, O Serpent, truly and without hurry how the spirit (parted from the corporeal frame) becomes cognisant of sound, touch, form, smell and taste.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच शब्दे स्पर्श च रूपे च तथैव रसगन्धयोः। तस्याधिष्ठानमव्यचो ब्रूहि सर्प यथातथम्॥'}

{'en': 'And, O high-minded being, do you not simultaneously feel the sensations of touch, taste, etc., by means of the senses? O best of Snakes, (kindly) answer all these questions of mine.', 'sn': 'किं न गृहणाति विषयान् युगपच्च महामते। एतावदुच्यतां चोक्तं सर्वं पन्नगसत्तम।॥'}

{'en': 'The Snake replied O long-lived being, the thing termed Atman taking refuge in a physical frame and manifesting itself through the organs of sense, enjoys properly the perceptible objects.', 'sn': 'सर्प उवाच यदात्मद्रव्यमायुष्मन् देहसंश्रयणान्वितम्। करणाधिष्ठितं भोगानुपभुङ्क्ते यथाविधि॥'}

{'en': 'O the best of the Bharatas, know that the senses, the mind and the intellect assisting the soul in its enjoyment of the perceptible objects are called Karanas.', 'sn': 'ज्ञानं चैवात्र बुद्धिश्च मनश्च भरतर्षभ। तस्य भोगाधिकरणे करणानि निबोध मे॥'}

{'en': 'O my child, the soul moving out of its proper place and assisted by the mind acting through the organs of sense-the recipients of all sensations-gradually perceives all the sensible objects.', 'sn': 'मनसा तात पर्येति क्रमशो विषयानिमान्। विषयायतनस्थो हि भूतात्मा क्षेत्रमास्थितः॥'}

{'en': 'O the most exalted of men the mind of creatures is the cause of all perceptions; and therefore it cannot at one and the same time perceive a plurality of objects,', 'sn': 'तत्र चापि नरव्याघ्र मनो जन्तोर्विधीयते। तस्माद् युगपदत्रास्य ग्रहणं नोपपद्यते॥'}

{'en': 'The Soul, O the most valiant of mortals stationing itself between the eye brows, sends the high and the low intellect to different objects (of sense).', 'sn': 'स आत्मा पुरुषव्याघ्र भ्रुवोरन्तरमाश्रितः। बुद्धिं द्रव्येषु सृजति विविधेषु परावराम्॥'}

{'en': 'O best of kings, knowledge which the yogis drive from the operation of intelligence, manifests the action of the Soul.', 'sn': 'वुद्धेश्त्तरकाला च वेदना दृश्यते बुधैः। एष वै राजशार्दूल विधिः क्षेत्रज्ञभावनः॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said : Tell me the (kindly) the prominent characteristics of the mind and the intellect (respectively); (because) the knowledge (of their functions) is said to be the principal requirements of those conversant with the Supreme being', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच मनसश्चापि बुद्धेश्च ब्रूहि मे लक्षणं परम्। एतदध्यात्मविदुषां परं कार्यं विधीयते॥'}

{'en': 'The Snake answered Through cloudiness of understanding the soul becomes subject to intellect. For this reason, though it (intellect) is known to be subordinate to the son, it guides the latter.', 'sn': 'सर्प उवाच बुद्धिरात्मानुगा तात उत्पातेन विधीयते। तदाश्रिता हि संज्ञैषा बुद्धिस्तस्यैषिणी भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'The intellect is called into existence by acts of perception; (but) the mind exists of itself; and the mind and not the intellect, has the power of causing the sensations of pleasure and pain.', 'sn': 'बुद्धिरुत्पद्यते कार्यान्मनस्तूत्पन्नमेव हि। बुद्धेर्गुणविधानेन मनस्तहगुणवद् भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'O my child, these are the points of distinction between the mind and the intellect you are also conversant with this subject. What do you say?', 'sn': 'एतद् विशेषणं तात मनोबुद्ध्योर्यदन्तरम्। त्वमप्यत्राभिसम्बुद्धः कथं वा मन्यते भवान्॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said: O the best of those endowed with intelligence, you have a superb intellect. Why (then) do you ask me this question, when you are well acquainted with all that should be known.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच अहो बुद्धिमतां श्रेष्ठ शुभा बुद्धिरियं तव। विदितं वेदितव्यं ते कस्मात् समनुपृच्छसि॥'}

{'en': 'I am at a great loss to understand how you became subject to illusion who performed excellent deeds and obtained an abode in heaven.', 'sn': 'सर्वज्ञं त्वां कथं मोह आविशत् स्वर्गवासिनम्। एवमद्भुतकर्माणमिति मे संशयो महान्॥'}

{'en': 'The Serpent said : Even a highly intellectual and wise man is inflated with prosperity. And in my opinion those that are given to luxury lose their sense.', 'sn': 'सर्प उवाच सुप्रज्ञमपि चेच्छूरमृद्धिर्मोहयते नरम्। वर्तमानः सुखे सर्वो मुह्यतीति मतिर्मम॥'}

{'en': 'So, O Yudhishthira, I too, intoxicated with the drink of prosperity, have fallen into this degraded state and then having recovered my reason am addressed you thus.', 'sn': 'सोऽहमैश्वर्यमोहेन मदाविष्टो युधिष्ठिर। पतितः प्रतिसम्बुद्धस्त्वां तु सम्बोधयाम्यहम्॥'}

{'en': 'O tormentor of foes, O mighty monarch, you have rendered me a good service. And by conversing with your pious self I have been freed from this dreadful curse.', 'sn': 'कृतं कार्य महाराज त्वया मम परंतप। क्षीण: शापः सुकृच्छ्रो मे त्वया सम्भाष्य साधुना।।'}

{'en': 'In days of yore when mounted on a celestials chariot I used to range through the heavens, elated with pride, I thought of nothing else.', 'sn': 'अहं हि दिवि दिव्येन विमानेन चरन् पुरा। अभिमानेन मत्तः सन् कंचिन्नान्यमचिन्तयम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmarshis, the celestials, the Gandharvas, the Yakshas, the Rakshasas, the Pannagas and all the inhabitants of the three worlds had to pay me taxes.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मर्षिदेवगन्धर्वयक्षराक्षसपन्नगाः। करान् मम प्रयच्छन्ति सर्वे त्रैलोक्यवासिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Such, O king, was the mysmeric power of my eyes, that all whatever creature I cast my looks, I instantly withdrew all his energy.', 'sn': 'चक्षुषा यं प्रपश्यामि प्राणिनं पृथिवीपते। तस्य तेजो हराम्याशु तद्धि दृष्टेर्बलं मम॥'}

{'en': 'Thousands of Brahmarshis were engaged in drawing my palanquin. And O king, this sin on my part brought about my fall from my exalted position.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मर्षीणां सतरं हि उवाह शिबिकां मम। स मामपनयो राजन् भ्रंशयामास वै श्रियः॥'}

{'en': 'One day when the sage Agastya was drawing my palanquin my feet touched his body. Thereupon Agastya cursed me in anger saying "ruin overtake you; do you turn into a snake."', 'sn': 'तत्र ह्यगस्त्यः पादेन वहन् स्पृष्टो मया मुनिः। अगस्तयेन ततोऽस्म्युक्तः सर्पस्त्वं च भवेति ह॥'}

{'en': 'Thus deprived of my prosperity I fell down from that conveyance. And in the course of my fall I found myself turned into a snake with my head downwards. (Then) I besought that Brahmana “Kindly free me from this curse.', 'sn': 'ततस्तस्माद् विमानावयात् प्रच्युतश्च्युतलक्षणः। प्रपतन् बुबुधेऽऽत्मानं व्यालीभूतमधोमुखम्। अन्याचं तमहं विप्रं शापस्यान्तो भवेदिति॥'}

{'en': 'O divine sage, graciously pardon me (because) I have been mad through pride. Thereupon, he, moved with pity addressed me while I was falling down, thus', 'sn': 'सर्प उवाच प्रमादात् सम्प्रमूढस्य भगवन् क्षन्तुमर्हसि। ततः स मामुवाचेदं प्रपतन्तं कृपान्वितः॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira, the best of the virtuous will liberate you from this curse. And O Monarch, when this horrible sin of pride (in you).', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिरोधर्मराजः शापात् त्वां मोक्षयिष्यति। अभिमानस्य घोरस्य पापस्य च नराधिप॥'}

{'en': 'Will come to an end, you will enjoy the fruits of your virtue." I was then lost in wonder on beholding the strength of his asceticism.', 'sn': 'फले क्षीणे महाराज फलं पुण्यमवाप्स्यसि। ततो मे विस्मयो जातस्तद् दृष्ट्वा तपसो बलम्॥'}

{'en': 'And it is for that reason that I have put to you these questions relating to Brahma and the Brahmanas. Truthfulness, self-control, asceticism, benevolence, unenviousness and adherence to virtue,', 'sn': 'ब्रह्म च ब्राह्मणत्वं च येन त्वाहमचूचुदम्। सत्यं दमस्तपो दानाहिंसाधर्मनित्यता।॥'}

{'en': 'O king and not race nor (illustrious) family, are the means by which persons must attain salvation. May your younger brother Bhimasena be all hail; and O mighty monarch, may you be happy. I shall now go to heaven again.', 'sn': 'साधकानि सदा पुंसां न जातिर्न कुलं नृप। अरिष्ट एष भ्राता भीमसेनो महाबलः। स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु महाराज गमिष्यामि दिवं पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Having said this, the king Nahusha giving up his snake shape and assuming his celestials body returned to heaven.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच इत्युक्त्वाऽऽजगरं देहं मुक्त्वा स नहुषो नृपः। दिव्यं वपुः समास्थाय गतस्त्रिदिवमेव ह॥'}
