{'en': 'And the virtuous and prosperous Yudhishthira too, accompanied by Bhima and Dhaumya came back to his hermitage.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिरोऽपिधर्मात्मा भ्रात्रा भीमेन संगतः। धौम्येन सहितः श्रीमानाश्रमं पुनरागमत्॥'}

{'en': 'Then Yudhishthira, the best of the virtuous, related, in detail, all that had happened, to the assembled Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'ते ततो द्विजेभ्यः सर्वेभ्यः समेतेभ्यो यथातथम्। कथयामास तत् सर्वधर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing all that, O king, all the Brahmanas, his three brothers and the renowned Draupadi were greatly amazed.', 'sn': 'तच्छ्रुत्वा ते द्विजाः सर्वे भ्रातश्चास्य ते त्रयः। आसन् सुव्रीडिता राजन् द्रौपदी च यशस्विनी॥'}

{'en': 'And those best of the Brahmanas desirous of the welfare of the Pandavas, condemning the rashness of Bhima, told him not to do such an act again.', 'sn': 'ते तु सर्वे द्विजश्रेष्ठाः पाण्डवानां हितेप्सया। मैवमित्यब्रुवन् भीमं गर्हयन्तोऽस्य साहसम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandavas too were greatly delighted at seeing the highly powerful Bhima out of danger and continued to dwell there happily.', 'sn': 'पाण्डवास्तु भयान्मुक्तं प्रेक्ष्य भीमं महाबलम्। हर्षमाहारयांचक्रुर्विजह्वश्च मुदा युताः॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said When the division of the two armies strong in numbers and arranged in order of battle, met one another, all the unretreating heroes, O Bharata, then rushed to battle keeping in view the regions of Brahma. In that pell-mell fight, neither similar divisions fought with their similar, not car-warriors with car-warriors, nor foot-soldier with their foot-soldiers.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच समं व्यूढेष्वनीकेषु भूयिष्ठेष्वनिवर्तिनः। ब्रह्मलोकपराः सर्वे समपद्यन्त भारत॥ न ह्यनीकमनीकेन समसज्जत संकुले। रथा न रथिभिः सार्ध पादाता न पदातिभिः॥'}

{'en': 'Horsemen then fought not with horsemen and elephant-riders fought not with other elephant-riders. But like men seized with fury, O Bharata, they indiscriminately slaughtered men one another, O monarch, in that battle. Fierce and great was the carnage that then spread itself among the ranks of the two armies, as and elephants, by hundreds, were scattered slain in all directions.', 'sn': 'अश्वा नाश्वैरयुध्यन्त गजा न गजयोधिभिः। उन्मत्तवन्महाराज युध्यन्ते तत्र भारत॥ महान् व्यतिकरो रौद्रः सेनयोः समपद्यता नरनागगणेष्वेव विकीर्णेषु च सर्वशः॥'}

{'en': 'In that fierce battle the slaughter was indiscriminate. Then, 0 Bharata, Shalya, Kripa, Chitrasena, Dushasana and Vikarna, all riding on resplendent chariots, and all mighty heroes, made the host of the Pandavas tremble in battle before them.', 'sn': 'क्षये तस्मिन् महारौद्रे निर्विशेषमजायत। ततः शल्यः कृपश्चैव चित्रसेनश्च भारत॥ दुःशासनो विकर्णश्च रथानास्थाय भास्वरान्। पाण्डवानां रणे शूरा ध्वजिनीं समकम्पयन्॥'}

{'en': 'The army of the Pandavas thus slaughtered by those high-souled warriors, was caused to wheels in various motions, like a bark tossed by the wind on the waters (of the sea).', 'sn': 'सा वध्यमाना समरे पाण्डुसेना महात्मभिः। भ्राम्यते बहुधा राजन् मारुतेनेव नौर्जले॥'}

{'en': 'Just as bleak wintry cold penetrates into the very vitals of the kine, so did then Bhishma cut the army of the sons of the Pandu to the very quick. Then many elephants of your army loO king like newly formed clouds, were felled by the high-souled son of Pritha in that battle.', 'sn': 'यता हि शैशिरः कालो गवां मर्माणि कृन्तति। तथा पाण्डुसुतानां वै भीष्मो मर्माणि कृन्तति॥ तथैव तव सैन्यस्य पार्थेन च महात्मना। नवमेघप्रतीकाशा: पातिता बहुधा गजाः॥'}

{'en': 'The leaders of hosts of combatants were then seen to be crushed and mangled by the son of Pritha with his arrows and lances shot by thousands.', 'sn': 'मृद्यमानाश्च दृश्यन्ते पार्थेन नरयूथपाः। इषुभिस्ताङ्यमानाश्च नाराचैश्च सहस्रशः॥'}

{'en': 'over Mighty elephants fell there setting up loud yells of agony and distress. The field of battle then looked beautiful being strewn withthe ornament-decked bodies of slain warriors of high soul, as also with their heads glanced with ear-rings. In that conflict, O monarch, so destructive of mighty heroes,', 'sn': 'पेतुरार्तस्वरं घोरं कृत्वा तत्र महागजाः। आनद्धाभरणैः कार्येनिहतानां महात्मनाम्॥ छन्नमायोधनं रेजे शिरोभिश्च सकुण्डलैः। तस्मिन्नेव महाराज महावीरवरक्षये॥'}

{'en': 'When both Bhishma and Dhananjaya the son of Pandu were displaying their prowess, your sons beholding the grandsire strive vigorously in battle. O king, rushed at the head all of their troops. Desirous of death in battle, and loO king upon heaven as their final goal.', 'sn': 'भीष्मे च युधि विक्रान्ते पाण्डवे च धनंजये। ते पराक्रान्तमालोक्य राजन् युधि पितामहम्॥ अभ्यवर्तन्त ते पुत्राः सर्वे सैन्यपुरस्कृताः। इच्छन्तो निधनं युद्धे स्वर्गं कृत्वा परायणम्॥'}

{'en': 'They rushed against the Pandavas in that battle destructive of many heroes. The Pandavas also, O monarch, remembering the diverse woes and hardships.', 'sn': 'पाण्डवानभ्यवर्तन्त तस्मिन् वीरवरक्षये। पाण्डवाऽपि महाराज स्मरन्तो विविधान् बहून्॥'}

{'en': 'Inflicted, O ruler of men, on them by you and your son and dismissing all fears, and desirous of attaining to the regions of Brahma,', 'sn': 'क्लेशान् कृतान् सपुत्रेण त्वया पूर्वं नराधिप। भय त्यक्त्वा रणे शूरा ब्रह्मलोकाय तत्पराः॥'}

{'en': 'Cheerfully fought on with your troops and your sons. Then that mighty car-warrior the commander of the Pandava host addressing his troops said.', 'sn': 'तावकांस्तव पुत्रांश्च योधयन्ति प्रहृष्टवत्। सेनापतिस्तु समरे प्राह सेनां महारथः॥'}

{'en': '"Rush you, O Somakas, together with the Srinjayas at the son of Ganga.” Hearing those words of their commander-in-chief, the Somakas and the Srinjayas,', 'sn': 'अभिद्रवत गाङ्गेयं सोमकाः सृञ्जयैः सह। सेनापतिवचः श्रुत्वा समोकाः सृञ्जयाश्च ते॥'}

{'en': 'Through afflicted with showers of arrows rushed at the son of Ganga. Thus assailed, O king, your father, the son of Shantanu,', 'sn': 'अभ्यद्रवन्त गाङ्गेयं शरवृष्ट्या समाहताः। वध्यमानस्ततो राजन् पिता शान्तनवस्तव॥'}

{'en': 'Influenced by wrath fought with the Srinjayas. To your highly renowned father. O sire, in the days of yore, the intelligent Rama,', 'sn': 'अमर्षवशमापन्नो योधयामास सृञ्जयान्। तस्य कीर्तिमतस्तात पुरा रामेण धीमता॥'}

{'en': 'Imparted a lesson in the use of weapons that were capable of destroying the hostile ranks. Depending upon that instruction of his and thinning the ranks of the enemy,', 'sn': 'सम्प्रदत्तास्त्रशिक्षा वै परानीकविनाशनी। स ता शिक्षामधिष्ठाय कुर्वन् परबलक्षयम्॥'}

{'en': 'The old grandsire of the Kurus, viz., Bhishma that slayer of hostile heroes day after day slaughtered ten thousand warriors belonging to the Pandava host.', 'sn': 'अहन्यहनि पार्थानां वृद्धः कुरुपितामहः। भीष्मो दश सहस्राणि जघान परवीरहा।॥'}

{'en': 'One that the tenth day of the battle, O foremost of the Bharatas, from among the Matsyas and the Panchalas, Bhishma, single handed,', 'sn': 'तस्मिंस्तु दशमे प्राप्ते दिवसे भरतर्षभ। भीष्मेणैकेन मत्स्येषु पञ्चालेषु च संयुगे॥'}

{'en': 'Having slain ten thousand elephants, slew also seven mighty car-warriors. Then the great grandsire also five thousand car-warriors.', 'sn': 'गजाश्वमिमितं हत्वा हताः सप्त महारथाः। हत्वा पञ्च सहस्राणि रथानां प्रपितामहः॥'}

{'en': 'In that fierce battle in addition to all this, fourteen thousand foot-soldiers, one thousand elephants, and ten thousand steeds.', 'sn': 'नराणां च महायुद्धे सहस्राणि चतुर्दशः। दन्तिनां च सहस्राणि हयानामयुतं पुनः॥'}
{'en': 'Were slain, O ruler of men, by your father through his superior education.', 'sn': 'शिक्षाबलेन नहितं पित्रा तव विशाम्पते। ततः सर्वमहीपनां क्षपयित्वा वरूथिनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then reducing in number all the divisions led by rulers of earth, Bhishma slew Shatanika the dear-loved brother of Virata. Having slain Shatanika in battle, the valiant Bhishma.', 'sn': 'विराटस्य प्रियो भ्राता शतानीको निपातितः। शतानीकं च समरे हत्वा भीष्मः प्रतापवान्॥'}

{'en': 'Felled thousand royal warriors with broadheaded shafts. All those Kshatriyas of the Pandava host, that followed Dhananjaya,', 'sn': 'सहस्राणि महाराज राज्ञा भल्लैरपातयत्। उद्विग्नाः समरे योधा विक्रोशन्ति धनंजयम्॥'}

{'en': "Approaching Bhishma, were dispatched to the abode of Death. Thus covering the ten points of the compass with the net-work of his arrows, as also the army of the Partha's, Bhishma remained the master of the situation.", 'sn': 'ये च केचन पार्थानामभियाता धनंजयम्। राजानो भीष्ममासाद्य गतास्ते यमसादनम्॥ एवं दश दिशो भीष्मः शरजालैः समन्ततः। अतीत्य सेनां पार्थानामवतस्थे चमूमुखे॥'}

{'en': 'On that the tenth day of the battle, achieving marvelous feats, Bhishma stayed between the two arinies, holding his bow and arrows in his hands. O king, then none of the royal warriors were able to look at him,', 'sn': 'स कृत्वा सुमहत् कर्म तस्मिन् वै दशमेऽहनि। सेनयोरन्तरे तिष्ठन् प्रगृहीतशरासनः॥ न चैनं पार्थिवाः केचिच्छक्ता राजन् निरीक्षितुम्।'}

{'en': 'Who then resembled the summer sun scorching the world from the meridian. Just as in the days of yore, Shakra afflicted the hosts of the Daityas,', 'sn': 'मध्यं प्राप्तं यथा ग्रीष्मे तपन्तं भास्करं दिवि॥ यथा दैत्यचमूं शक्तस्तापयामास संयुगे।'}

{'en': 'So did, O Bharata, Bhishma then afflict the ranks of the Pandavas. Then beholding Bhishma thus display his prowess in battle, the slayer of Madhu,', 'sn': 'तथा भीष्मः पाण्डवेयास्तापयामास भारत॥ तथा चैनं पराक्रान्तमालोक्य मधुसूदनः।'}

{'en': 'That son of Devaki, joyfully addressed Dhananjaya saying. “Yonder is Bhishma, the son of Shantanu staying between the two armies.', 'sn': 'उवाच देवकीपुत्रः प्रीयमाणो धनंजयम्॥ एष शान्तनवो भीष्मः सेनयोरन्तरे स्थितः।'}

{'en': 'Slay him by putting forth your prowess, and victory will be yours. Check him through your prowess even there where he is penetrating our ranks.', 'sn': 'संनिहत्य बलादेन विजयस्ते भविष्यति॥ बलात् संस्तम्भयस्वैनं यत्रैषा भिद्यते चमूः।'}

{'en': 'None among us, O lord, is capable of bearing the shafts of Bhishma save and except your mighty self."', 'sn': 'न हि भीष्मशरानन्यः सोढुमुत्सहते विभो॥ ततस्तस्मिन् क्षणे राजंश्चोदितो वानरध्वजः।'}

{'en': 'Then, O king, thus urged on, Dhananjaya owning a standard bearing the device of an ape, rendered Bhishma with his standard, chariots and horses, invisible by his shafts. Then that foremost of the Kuru chiefs (Bhishma) also, with the shower of his own arrows scattered the arrows discharged by that son of Pandu. Thereupon the king of the Panchalas, and the valiant Dhrishtaketu.', 'sn': 'सध्वजं सरथं साश्वं भीष्ममन्तर्दधे शरैः॥ स चापि कुरुमुख्यानमृषभः पाण्डवेरितान्।। शरव्रातैः शरव्रातान् बहुधा विदुधाव तान्॥ ततः पञ्चालराजश्च धृष्टकेतुश्च वीर्यवान्।'}

{'en': "Pandu's son Bhimasena, Prishata's son Dhrishtadyumna, the twins Nakula and Sahadeva, Chekitana, the five Kaikeya brothers,", 'sn': 'पाण्डवो भीमसेनश्च धृष्टद्युम्नश्च पार्षतः॥ यमौ च चेकितानश्च केकया: पञ्च चैव ह।'}

{'en': 'The mighty-armed Satyaki, the son of Subhadra, Ghatotkacha, the sons of Draupada, down pour Shikhandin, the highly powerful Kuntibhoja, Susharma, and Virata, these and many other mighty heroes of the Pandava host were then afflicted by the shafts of Bhishma.', 'sn': 'सात्यकिश्च महाबाहुः सौभद्रोऽथ घटोत्कचः॥ द्रौपदेयाः शिखण्डी च कुन्तिभोजश्च वीर्यवान्। सुशर्मा च विराटश्च पाण्डवेया महाबलाः॥ एते चान्ये च बहवः पीडिता भीष्मसायकैः।'}

{'en': 'Then from the ocean of grief in which they were sunk, they were rescued by Phalguna. Thereupon grasping an excellent weapon Shikhandin. Assailed Bhishma, being protected by the diadem-decked Arjuna.', 'sn': 'समुद्धृताः फाल्गुनेन निमग्नाः शोकसागरे॥ ततः शिखण्डी वेगेन प्रगृह्य परमायुधम्। भीष्ममेवाभिदुद्राव रक्ष्यमाणः किरीटिना॥'}

{'en': 'Then slaying all the followers of Bhishma, and knowing what should be done in battle after what, the unvanquished Vibhatsu rushed even at Bhishma himself. Then Satyaki, Chekitana, Dhrishtadyumna of the Prishata race,', 'sn': 'ततोऽस्यानुचरान् हत्वा सर्वान् रणविभागवित्। भीष्ममेवाभिदुद्राव बीभत्सुम्पराजितः॥ सात्यकिश्चेकितानश्च धृष्टद्युम्नश्च पार्षतः।'}

{'en': 'Virata and Draupada, the two sons of Madri begotten by Pandu, all rushed against Bhishma, their attack being covered by the firm bowman Arjuna.', 'sn': 'विराटो द्रुपदश्चैव माद्रीपुत्रौ च पाण्डवौ॥ दुद्रुवुर्भीष्ममेवाजौ रक्षिता दृढधन्वना।'}

{'en': 'Then in that battle, Abhimanyu and the five sons of Draupadi all with weapons upraised rushed against Bhishma.', 'sn': 'अभिमन्युश्च समरे द्रौपद्याः पञ्च चात्मजाः॥ दुद्रुवुः समरे भीष्मं समुद्यतमहायुधाः।'}

{'en': 'All those firm bowmen, never receding from the fight pierced Bhishma on many parts of his body with arrows steadily directed.', 'sn': 'ते सर्वे दृढधन्वानः संयुगेष्वपलायिनः॥ बहुधा भीष्ममानछुर्मार्गणैः क्षतमार्गणैः।'}

{'en': 'Then baffling all those arrows shot by those foremost rulers of earth, that warrior of unrepressed soul (Bhishma) penetrated into the ranks of the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'विधूय तान् बाणगणान् ये मुक्ताः पार्थिवोत्तमैः॥ पाण्डवानामदीनात्मा व्यगाहत वरूथिनीम्।'}

{'en': 'The grandsire then repulsed all those arrows as if in sport. He did not aim any shafts at the prince of the Panchalas, but laughingly looked at him now and then.', 'sn': 'चक्रे शरविघातं चक्रीडन्निव पितामहः॥ नाभिसंधत्त पाञ्चाल्ये स्मयमानो मुहुर्मुहः।'}

{'en': "Remembering Shikhandin's femininity Bhishma sped not a single arrow at the former. But that mighty car-warrior then slew seven of the best car-warriors of Draupada's division.", 'sn': 'स्त्रीत्वं तस्यानुसंस्मृत्य भीष्मो बाणाशिखण्डिने॥ जगान द्रुपदानीके रथान् सप्त महारथः।'}

{'en': 'Then as the Matsyas, the Panchalas and the Chedis rushed against that single-handed warrior, loud became the din and confusion that then arose.', 'sn': 'तत: किलकिलाशब्दः क्षणेन समभूत् तदा॥ मत्स्यपाञ्चालचेदीनां तमेकमभिधावताम्।'}

{'en': 'Then like clouds covering the sun, all those heroes, O afflicter of foes, covered on all sides with foot-soldiers, horse-men and car-warriors and with a network of arrows,', 'sn': 'ते नराश्वरथव्रातैर्मार्गणैश्च परंतप॥ तमेकं छादयामासुर्मेघा इव दिवाकरम्।'}

{'en': 'That single-handed son of Bhagirathi, viz., Bhishma, who was then scorching the foe in battle. Then in that battle between Bhishma on one side and all the Pandava heroes on the other-battle that resembled the one between the gods and the Asuras-Kiritin placing Shikhandin in front of him began to pierce Bhishma,', 'sn': 'भीष्मं भागीरथीपुत्रं प्रतपन्तं रणे रिपून्॥ ततस्तम्य च तेषां च युद्धे देवासुरोपमे। किरीटीभीष्ममागच्छत् पुरस्कृत्य शिखण्डिनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said O Sanjaya, the warriors of which side first advanced to the fight? Whose hearts were filled with confidence and who were spiritless from melancholy?', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच केषां प्रहृष्टास्तत्राग्रे योधा युध्यन्ति संजय। उदग्रमनसः के वा के वा दीना विचेतसः॥'}

{'en': "In the great battle that makes every one's heart tremble, who were they who struck the first blow; were they my men or did they belong to the Pandavas? O Sanjaya, tell me all this in detail.", 'sn': 'के पूर्वं प्राहरंस्तत्र युद्धे हृदयकम्पने। मामकाः पाण्डवेया वा तन्ममाचक्ष्व संजय॥'}

{'en': 'Among whose troops did the garlands of flowers and unguents emit fragrant scents? Whose troops with fearful roars uttered merciful words?', 'sn': 'कस्य सेनासमुदये गन्धमाल्यसमुद्भवः। वाचः प्रदक्षिणाश्चैव योधानामभिगर्जताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said The warriors of both the armies were cheerful in the beginning. The garlands of flowers and unguents emitted equal fragrance. O best of the Bharata race, fearful was the encounter that took place between the troops arrayed for battle.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच व्यूढानां उभयोः सेनयोस्तत्र योधा जहषिरे तदा। स्रजः समाः सुगन्धानामुभयत्र समुद्भवः॥ संहतानामनीकानां भरतर्षभ। संसर्गात् समुदीर्णानां विमर्दः सुमहानभूत्॥'}

{'en': 'The loud sounds of musical instruments, mingled with that of the conches and drums, and the shouts of brave warriors, that rose fearfully roaring at one another, were awful.', 'sn': 'वादित्रशब्दस्तुमुलः शङ्खभेरीविमिश्रितः। शूराणां रणशूराणां गर्जतामितरेतरम्। उभयोः सेनयो राजन् महान् व्यतिकरोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, dreadful was the battle fought by the troops of both parties all staring at one another and all filled with joy. The elephants uttered terrible roars.', 'sn': 'अन्योन्यं वीक्ष्यमाणानां योधानां भरतर्षभ। कुञ्जराणां च नदतां सैन्यानां च प्रहृष्यताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said In the meantime, having received the permission of Dharmaraja (Yudhishthira), the powerful Bhimasena marched towards the east.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु भीमसेनोऽपि वीर्यवान्। धर्मरजमनुप्राप्य ययौ प्राची दिशं प्रति॥'}

{'en': "That best of the Bharata race (Bhima), that hero of great velour and enhancer of the enemy's sorrow, was accompanied by a powerful army with the full compliment of elephants, horses and cars, an army well-armed and capable of grinding all hostile kingdoms, that best of men (Bhima) first went to thereat country of the Panchalas.", 'sn': 'महता बलचक्रेण परराष्ट्रावमर्दिना। हस्त्यश्वरथपूर्णेन दंशितेन प्रतापवान्॥ वृतो भरतशार्दूलो द्विषच्छोकविवर्द्धनः। स गत्वा नरशार्दूल: पञ्चालानां पुरं महत्॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandava (Bhima) began to conciliate the Panchalas by various means. Then that best of the Bharata race soon defeated the Gandakas and Videhas. The Lord (Bhima) then subjugated the Dasarnas. The king of the Dasarnas, Sudharma.', 'sn': 'पञ्चालान् विविधेपायैः सान्त्वयामास पाण्डवः। ततः स गण्डकाञ्छूरो विदेहान् भरतर्षभः॥ विजित्याल्पेन कालेन दशार्णानजयत् प्रभुः। तत्र दाशार्णको राजा सुधर्मा लोमहर्षणम्। कृतवान् भीमसेनेन महद् युद्धं निरायुधम्॥'}

{'en': 'Fought a fearful battle with Bhima without any arms. Seeing the feat of that illustrious (king), Bhimasena installed installed the mighty Sudharma as the generalissimo (of his army).', 'sn': 'भीमसेनस्तु तद् दृष्ट्वा तस्य कर्म महात्मनः। अधिसेनापतिं चक्रे सुधर्माणं महाबलम्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, causing the earth itself to tremble with the tread of the mighty army that followed him, then Bhima of fearful velour marched towards the east.', 'sn': 'ततः प्राची दिशं भीमो ययौ भीमपराक्रमः। सैन्येन महता राजन् कम्पयन्निव मेदिनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, that hero, the foremost of all mighty men, then defeated in battle Rochaman, the king of Ashvamedha, with all his troops.', 'sn': 'सोऽश्वमेधेश्वरं राजन् रोचमानं सहानुगम्। जिगाय समरे वीरो बलेन बलिनां वरः॥'}

{'en': 'Having vanquished that king by performing feats that excelled in fierceness, the greatly powerful descendant of Kuru subjugated the eastern region.', 'sn': 'स तं निर्जित्य कौन्तेयो नातितीव्रण कर्मणा॥ पूर्वदेशं महावीर्यो विजिग्ये कुरुनन्दन॥'}
{'en': 'He then went to the south in the great city of the Pulindas and subjugated Sukumara and the king Sumitra.', 'sn': 'ततो दक्षिणमागम्य पुलिन्दनगरं महत्। सुकुमारं वशे चक्रे सुमित्रं च नराधिपम्॥'}

{'en': 'O Janamejaya, then at the command of Dharmaraja Yudhishthira, that best of the Bharata race marched against the greatly powerful Shishupala.', 'sn': 'ततस्तु धर्मराजस्य शासनाद् भरतर्षभः। शिशुपालं महावीर्यमभ्यगाज्जनमेजय॥'}

{'en': 'Having heard the intentions of the Pandava (Bhima), the king of Chedi came out of his city. That chastiser of foes then received the son of Pritha with all respects.', 'sn': 'चेदिराजोऽपि तच्छ्रुत्वा पाण्डवस्य चिकीर्षितम्। उपनिष्क्रम्य नगरात् प्रत्यगृहणात् परंतप॥'}

{'en': "O great king, those two best of the Kuru and the Chedi race then met together and inquired after each other's welfare.", 'sn': 'तौ समेत्य महाराज कुरुचेदिवृषौ तदा। उभयोरात्मकुलयोः कौशल्यं पर्यपृच्छताम्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, the king of Chedi offered his kingdom to Bhima, and he smilingly said "O sinless one, what are you bent upon to do?', 'sn': 'ततो निवेद्य तद् राष्ट्र चेदिराजो विशाम्पते। उवाच भीमं प्रहसन् किमिदं कुरुषेऽनघ॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon Bhima told him all about the intentions of the king Yudhishthira. That king acted as desired (by the Pandava).', 'sn': 'तस्य भीमस्तदाऽचख्यौ धर्मराजचिकीर्षितम्। स च तं प्रतिगृह्येव तथा चक्रे नराधिपः॥'}

{'en': 'O king, having been duly entertained by Shishupala, Bhima lived there for thirty nights. He then set out from Chedi with his troops and vehicles.', 'sn': 'ततो भीमस्तत्र राजन्नुषित्वा त्रिदश क्षपाः। सत्कृत: शिशुपालेन ययौ सबलवाहनः॥'}

{'en': 'Having saluted Narayana, and Nara the foremost of all male beings, as also the goddess of learning Sarasvati, let us cry success.', 'sn': 'नारायणं नमस्कृत्य नरं चैव नरोत्तमम्। देवी सरस्वती व्यासं ततो जयमुदीरयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said “Those heroes then in a body went towards the south. At sunset they reached a spot near the (Kuru) encampment.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच ततस्ते सहिता वीराः प्रयाता दक्षिणामुखाः। उपास्तमनवेलायां शिविराभ्याशमागताः॥'}

{'en': 'Letting loose their animals, they became very much frightened. Reaching then a forest, they secretly entered it.', 'sn': 'विमुच्य वाहांस्त्वरिता भीता समभवंस्तदा। गहनं देशमासाद्य प्रच्छन्ना न्यविशन्त ते॥'}

{'en': 'They took up their quarters there near the encampment. Wounded with many keen weapons, they breathed and sighted heavily, thinking of the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'सेनानिवेशमभितो नातिदूरमवस्थिताः। निकृत्ता निशितैः शस्त्रैः समन्तात् क्षतविक्षताः॥ दीर्घमुष्णं च निःश्वस्य पाण्डवानेव चिन्तयतन्।'}

{'en': 'Hearing the loud noise set up by the victorious Pandavas, they feared a pursuit and therefore fled towards the east. were', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा च निनदं घोरं पाण्डवानां जयैषिणाम्॥ अनुसारभयाद् भीताः प्राङ्मुखाः प्राद्रवन् पुनः।'}

{'en': 'Having gone for sometime, their animals became tired and they themselves stricken with thirst. Beside themselves with anger and vindictiveness, those great bowmen could not bear what had taken place, burning as they did with grief at the slaughter of the king. They, however, rested for a while.”', 'sn': 'ते मुहूर्तात् ततो गत्वा श्रान्तवाहाः पिपासिताः॥ नामृष्यन्त महेष्वासाः क्रोधामर्षवशं गताः। राज्ञो वधेन संतप्ता मुहूर्तं समवस्थिताः॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said "The feat, O Sanjaya, that Bhima performed seems to be incredible, since my son who was struck down as endued with the strength of ten thousand elephants.', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच अश्रद्धेयमिदं कर्म कृतं भीमेन संजय। यत् स नागायुतप्राणः पुत्रो मम निपातितः॥'}

{'en': "In the prime of life and having an adamantine body, he was not capable of being slain by any creatures. Alas, even such a son of mine was struck down by the Pandavas in battle. Forsooth, O Sanjaya, my heart is made of adamant, because it does not break into a thousand pieces even after hearing of the death of my hundred sons. Alas, what will be the condition of myself and my wife, an old couple, deprive of all children. I dare, not dwell in the kingdom of Pandu's son.", 'sn': 'अवध्यः सर्वभूतानां वज्रसंहननो युवा। पाण्डवैः समरे पुत्रो निहतो मम संजय॥ न दिष्टमभ्यतिक्रान्तुं शक्यं गावल्गणे नरैः। यत् समेत्य रणे पाथैः पुत्रो मम निपातितः॥ अद्रिसारमयं नूनं हृदयं मम संजय। हतं पुत्रशतं श्रुत्वा यन्न दीर्णं सहस्रधा॥ कथं हि वृद्धमिथुनं हतपुत्रं भविष्यति। न ह्यहं पाण्डवेयस्य विषये वस्तुमुत्सहे॥'}

{'en': "Having been the father of a king and a king myself, O Sanjaya, how shall I pass my days as a slave obeying he commands of Pandu's son.", 'sn': 'कथं राज्ञः पिता भूत्वा स्वयं राजा च संजय। प्रेष्यभूतः प्रवर्तेयं पाण्डवेयस्य शासनात्॥'}

{'en': 'Having commanded once the entire Earth and having trampled over the heads of all, O Sanjaya, how shall I live now as a wretched slave.', 'sn': 'आज्ञाप्य पृथिवीं सर्वां स्थित्वा मूर्ध्नि च संजय। कथमद्य भविष्यामि प्रेष्यभूतो दुरन्तकृत्॥'}

{'en': 'How shall I be able, O Sanjaya, to endure the words of Bhima who has alone killed a full hundred sons of mine?', 'sn': 'कथं भीमस्य वाक्यानि श्रोतुं शक्ष्यामि संजय। येन पुत्रशतं पूर्णमेकेन निहतं मम॥'}
{'en': 'The words of the great Vidura are now realised. Alas, my son, O Sanjaya, did not listen to those words.', 'sn': 'कृतं सत्यं वचस्तस्य विदुरस्य महात्मनः। अकुर्वता वचस्तेन मम पुत्रेण संजय॥'}

{'en': "What, however, did Kritavarman and Kripa and Drona's son do after my son Duryodhana had been unfairly killed.”", 'sn': 'अधर्मेण हते तात पुत्रे दुर्योधने मम। कृतवर्मा कृपो द्रौणिः किमकुर्वत संजय॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said "They had not proceeded far, O king, when they stopped, On seeing a dense forest covered with trees and creepers.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच गत्वा तु तावका राजन् नातिदूरमवस्थिताः। अपश्यन्त वनं घोरं नानाद्रुमलतावृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having rested for a little while, they entered that great forest, proceeding on their cars drawn by their excellent horses whose thirst had been satisfied.', 'sn': 'ते मुहूर्तं तु विश्रम्य लब्धतोयैहयोत्तमैः। सूर्यास्तमनवेलायां समासेदुर्महद् वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'That forest abounded with various kings of species of birds. And it was covered with many trees and creepers and was filled with numerous carnivorous creatures.', 'sn': 'नानामृगगणैर्जुष्टं नानापक्षिगणावृतम्। नानाद्रुमलताच्छन्नं नानाव्यालनिषेवितम्॥'}

{'en': 'It was covered with many pools of water, adorned with various kinds of flowers, and lakes overgrown with blue lotuses.', 'sn': 'नानातोयैः समाकीर्णं नानापुष्पोपशोभितम्। पद्मिनीशतसंछन्नं नीलोत्पलसमायुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having entered that dense forest they looked about saw a gigantic banian tree with thousands of branches.', 'sn': 'प्रविश्य तद् वनं घोरं वीक्षमाणाः समन्ततः। शाखासहस्रसंछन्नं न्यग्रोधं ददृशुस्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Repairing to the shade of that banian, those great car-warriors, O king, those foremost of men, founded that to be the biggest tree in those forest.', 'sn': 'उपेत्य तु तदा राजन् न्यग्रोधं ते महारथाः। ददृशुर्द्विपदां श्रेष्ठाः श्रेष्ठं तं वै वनस्पतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'Getting down from their cars, and letting loose their animals, they washed themselves and said their evening prayers.', 'sn': 'तेऽवतीर्य रथेभ्यश्च विप्रमुच्य च वाजिनः। उपस्पृश्य यथान्यायं संध्यामन्वासत प्रभो॥'}

{'en': 'The Sun then reached the setting hill, and Night, the mother of the universe, came. The sky, be spangled with planets and stars, shone alike an ornamented piece of brocade and presented a beautiful sight.', 'sn': 'ततोऽस्तं पर्वतश्रेष्ठमनुप्राप्ते दिवाकरे। सर्वस्य जगतो धात्री शर्वरी समपद्यत॥ ग्रहनक्षत्रताराभिः सम्पूर्णाभिरलंकृतम्। नभोंऽशुकमिवाभाति प्रेक्षणीयं समन्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Creators, ranging in the night, began to howl and utter their cries at will, while they that range in the day began to sleep.', 'sn': 'इच्छया ते प्रवल्गन्ति ये सत्त्वा रात्रिचारिणः दिवाचराश्च ये सत्त्वास्ते निद्रावशमागताः॥'}

{'en': 'The night-ranging animals set up a dreadful noise. The carnivorous creatures were full of joy, and the night, as it advanced, became awful.', 'sn': 'रात्रिंचराणां सत्त्वानां निर्घोषोऽभूत् सुदारुणः। क्रव्यादाश्च प्रमुदिता घोरा प्राप्ता च शर्वरी॥'}

{'en': "At that time filled with grief and sorrow, Kritavarman and Kripa and Drona's son all sat down together.", 'sn': 'तस्मिन् रात्रिमुखे घोरे दुःखशोकसमन्विताः। कृतवर्मा कृपो द्रौणिरुपोपविविशुः समम्॥'}

{'en': 'Seated under that banian, they began to express their sorrow regarding the destruction that had taken place of both the Kurus and the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'तत्रोपविष्टाः शोचन्तो न्यग्रोधस्य समीपतः। तमेवार्थमतिक्रान्तं कुरुपाण्डवयोः क्षयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Feeling asleep they laid themselves down on the bare Earth. They had been greatly wounded with arrows.', 'sn': 'निद्रया च परीताङ्गा निषेदुर्धरणीतले। श्रमेण सुदृढं युक्ता विक्षता विविधैः शरैः॥'}

{'en': 'The two great car-warriors, Kripa and Kritavarman, began to sleep. They ever deserving of happiness and undeserving of misery, slept on the bare ground.', 'sn': 'ततो निद्रावशं प्राप्तौ कृपभोजौ महारथौ। सुखोचितावदुःखार्ही निषण्णौ धरणीतले॥'}

{'en': 'Indeed, O king, they, who had always slept on costly beds, not slept, like helpless persons, on the bare ground, worn out with fatigue and gricf.', 'sn': 'तौ तु सुप्तौ महाराज श्रमशोकसमन्वितौ। महार्हशयनोपेतौ भूमावेव ह्यनाथवत्॥'}

{'en': "Subject to wrath and revenge, Drona's son, however, O Bharata, could not sleep, but continued to breathe like a snake.", 'sn': 'क्रोधामर्षवशं प्राप्तो द्रोणपुत्रस्तु भारत। न वै स्म स जगामाथ निद्रां सर्प इव श्वसन्॥'}

{'en': 'Burning with rage he could not sleep. That mighty hero looked on all sides of that terrible forest.', 'sn': 'न लेभे स तु निद्रां वै दह्यमानो हि मन्युना। वीक्षाञ्चक्रे महाबाहुस्तद् वनं घोरदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'As he surveyed that forest filled with various kinds of creatures, the great warrior beheld large banian tree covered with crows.', 'sn': 'वीक्षमाणो वनोद्देशं नानसत्त्वैर्निषेवितम्। अपश्यत महाबाहुर्यग्रोधं वायसैर्युतम्॥'}

{'en': 'On that banian thousands of crows roosted in the night. Each perching separately from its neighbour, those crows slept easily, O Kuru Chief.', 'sn': 'तत्र काकसहस्राणि तां निशां पर्यणामयन्। सुखं स्वपन्ति कौरव्य पृथक् पृथगुपाश्रयाः॥'}

{'en': 'As, however, those birds were sleeping in security on every side, Ashvatthaman beheld a terrible owl suddenly appeared there.', 'sn': 'सुप्तेषु तेषु काकेषु विश्रव्येषु समन्ततः। सोऽपश्यत् सहसा यान्तमुलूकं घोरदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Of frightful cries an huge body, with green eyes and tawny plumage, its nose and its talons were very large. And its speed was like that of Garuda.', 'sn': 'महास्वनं महाकायं हर्यक्षं बभ्रुपिङ्गलम्। सुदीर्घघोणानखरं सुपर्णमिव वेगितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Crying softly that winged creature O Bharata, secretly approached the branches of that banian tree.', 'sn': 'सोऽथ शब्दं मृदुं कृत्वा लीयमान इवाण्डजः। न्यग्रोधस्य ततः शाखां प्रार्थयामास भारत॥'}

{'en': 'That sky-ranger, that slayer of crows, alighting on one of the branches of the banian, killed a large number of his sleeping enemies.', 'sn': 'संनिपत्य तु शाखायां न्यग्रोधस्य विहङ्गमः। सुप्ताञ्जधान सुबहून् वायसान् वायसान्तकः॥'}

{'en': 'He tore the wings of some and cut off the heads of others with his sharp talons and broke the legs of many. Highly strong as he was, he killed many that fell down before his eyes. was', 'sn': 'केषांचिदच्छिनत् पक्षाशिरांसि च चकर्त ह। चरणांश्चैव केषांचिद् बभञ्ज चरणायुधः॥ क्षणेनाहन् स बलवान् येऽस्य दृष्टिपथे स्थिताः।'}

{'en': 'With the limbs and bodies, O king, of the slain crows, the ground covered by the spreading branches of the banian, overspread on all sides.', 'sn': 'तेषां शरीरावयवैः शरीरैश्च विशाम्पते॥ न्यग्रोधमण्डलं सर्वं संछन्नं सर्वतोऽभवत्।'}

{'en': 'Having killed those crows, the owl became overjoyed like a slayer of foes after having dealt with his foes according to his pleasure.', 'sn': 'तांस्तु हत्वा ततः काकान् कौशिको मुदितोऽभवत्।।४३ प्रतिकृत्य यथाकामं शत्रूणां शत्रुसूदनः।'}

{'en': "Witnessing that deed perpetrated in the night by the owl, Drona's son began to reflect on it, desirous of guiding his own conduct after that example.", 'sn': 'तद् दृष्ट्वा सोपधं कर्म कौशिकेन कृतं निशि॥ तद्भावकृतसंकल्पो द्रोणिरेकोऽन्वचिन्तयत्।'}

{'en': 'He said to him, "This owl teaches me a lesson in battle. Bent as I am upon the destruction of the enemy, the time for action is come.', 'sn': 'उपदेशः कृतोऽनेन पक्षिणा मम संयुगे॥ शत्रूणां क्षपणे युक्तः प्राप्तः कालश्च मे मतः।'}

{'en': 'The victorious Pandavas are incapable of being killed by me! They are possessed of power and perseverance, sure of aim, and skilled in smiting.', 'sn': 'नाद्य शक्या मया हन्तुं पाण्डवा जितकाशिनः॥ बलवन्तः कृतोत्साहाः प्राप्तलक्ष्याः प्रहारिणः।'}

{'en': 'In the presence, however, of the king I have promised to destroy them. I have thus promised to perform a deed that would bring on my own destruction like an insect trying to rush into a burning fire.', 'sn': 'राज्ञः सकाशात् तेषां तु प्रतिज्ञातो वधो मया॥ पतङ्गाग्निसमां वृत्तिमास्थायात्मविनाशिनीम्।'}

{'en': 'If I were to fight fairly with them. I shall, forsooth, have to lay down my life! By deceitful act, however, I may yet get success and a great destruction may overtake my enemies.', 'sn': 'न्यायतो युध्यमानस्य प्राणत्यागो न संशयः॥ छद्मना च भवेत् सिद्धिः शत्रूणां च क्षयो महान्। तत्र संशयितादाद् योऽर्थो निःसंशयो भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'People generally, as also those well-read in the scriptures, always prefer means which are certain to those which are uncertain. Censure and bad name, which soever this act may engender, ought to be incurred by a person who leads the life of a Kshatriya. The sinful Pandavas have, at every step, perpetrated very ugly, censurable and deceitful acts.', 'sn': 'तं जना बहुः मन्यन्ते ये च शास्त्रविशारदाः। यचाप्यत्र भवेद् वाच्यं गर्हितं लोकनिन्दितम्॥ कर्तव्यं तन्मनुष्येण क्षत्रधर्मेण वर्तता। निन्दितानि च सर्वाणि कुत्सितानि पदे पदे॥ सोपधानि कृतान्येव पाण्डवैरकृतात्मभिः।'}

{'en': 'Regarding this matter, certain ancient verses, full of truth, are heard, sung by truthseeing and righteous persons.', 'sn': 'अस्मिन्नर्थे पुरा गीता श्रूयन्ते धर्मचिन्तकैः॥ श्लोका न्यायमवेक्षद्भिस्तत्त्वार्थास्तत्त्वदर्शिभिः।'}

{'en': "They are:-The enemy's force, even which fatigued, or wounded, or while eating, or when retiring, or when resting within their camp, should be beaten.", 'sn': 'परिश्रान्ते विदीर्णे वा भुञ्जाने वापि शत्रुभिः॥ प्रस्थाने वा प्रवेशे वा प्रहर्तव्यं रिपोर्बलम्।'}

{'en': "They shouid be equally treated when sleeping at dead of night, or when reft of commanders, or when routed, or when labouring under an error.'-Having thought thus, the valiant son of Drona formed the resolution of killing during the night the sleeping Pandavas and the Panchalas,", 'sn': 'निद्रार्तमर्धरात्रे च तथा नष्टप्रणायकम्॥ भिन्नयोधं बलं यच्च द्विधा युक्तं च यद् भवेत्। इत्येवं निश्चयं चक्रे सुप्तानां निशि मारणे॥ पाण्डूनां सह पञ्चालैोणपुत्रः प्रतापवान्।'}

{'en': 'Having formed this wicked resolution and promised to execute it, he awoke both his maternal uncle and the chief of the Bhojas. a', 'sn': 'स क्रूरां मतिमास्थाय विनिश्चित्य मुहुर्मुहुः॥ सुप्तौ प्राबोधयत् तौ तु मातुलं भोजमेव च।'}

{'en': "Awakened from sleep, those two illustrious and powerful persons, viz., Kripa and the Bhoja chief, heard Ashvatthaman's scheme, Filled with shame, both of them could not give a suitable reply.", 'sn': 'तौ प्रबुद्धौ महात्मानौ कृपभोजौ महाबलौ॥ नोत्तरं प्रतिपद्येतां तत्र युक्तं ह्रिया वृतौ।'}

{'en': 'Having reflected for short time Ashvatthaman said with tearful eyes,-King Duryodhana, they only hero of great might, for whose sake we were fighting with the Pandavas, has been killed. Deserted and alone through he was, the master of eleven Akshauhinis of soldiers that hero of unsullied prowess has been struck down by Bhimasena in battle.', 'sn': 'स मुहूर्तमिव ध्यात्वा बाष्यविह्वलमब्रवीत्॥ हतो दुर्योधनो राजा एकवीरो महाबलः। यस्यार्थे वैरमस्माभिरासक्तं पाण्डवैः सह॥ एकाकी बहुभिः क्षुदैराहवे शुद्धविक्रमः। पातितो भीमसेनेन एकादशचमूपतिः॥'}

{'en': 'Another wicked act has been perpetrated by the mean Vrikodara for the latter has touched with his foot the head of a crowned person.', 'sn': 'वृकोदरेण क्षुद्रेण सुनृशंसमिदं कृतम्। मूर्धाभिषिक्तस्य शिरः पादेन परिमृद्नता॥'}

{'en': 'The Panchalas are sending up loud roars and cries and loud bursts of laughter. Overjoyed, they are blowing their conchs and beating their drums.', 'sn': 'विनर्दन्ति च पञ्चाला: श्वेलन्ति च हसन्ति च। धमन्ति शङ्खाशतशो हृष्टा जन्ति च दुन्दुभीन्॥'}

{'en': 'The loud sound of their instruments, mingled with the blare of conchs, is fearful to the ear, and carried by the winds, is filling all the points of the horizon.', 'sn': 'वादित्रघोषस्तुमुलो विमिश्रः शङ्खनिःस्वनैः। अनिलेनेरितो घोरो दिशः पूरयतीव ह॥'}

{'en': 'Loud also is the neighing of their steeds and the grunting of their elephants and the roaring of their warriors.', 'sn': 'अश्वानां हेषमाणानां गजानां चैव बुंहताम्। सिंहनादश्च शूराणां श्रूयते सुमहानयम्॥'}

{'en': 'That defending noise made by the rejoicing warriors as they are going to their quarters, as also the clatter of their car-wheels, comes to us from the east.', 'sn': 'दिशं प्राची समाश्रित्य हृष्टानां गच्छतां भृशम्। रथनेमिस्वनाश्चैव श्रूयन्ते लोमहर्षणाः॥'}

{'en': 'So great has been the havoc made by the Pandavas on the Dhartarashtras that we three are the only survivors.', 'sn': 'पाण्डवैर्धार्तराष्ट्राणां यदिदं कदनं कृतम्। वयमेव त्रयः शिष्टा अस्मिन् महति वैशसे॥'}

{'en': 'Some were gifted with the strength of a hundred elephants and some were masters of all weapons. Yet they have been killed by the son of Pandu. I consider this to be an instance of the reverses caused by Destiny.', 'sn': 'केचिन्नागशतप्राणाः केचित् सर्वास्त्रकोविदाः। निहताः पाण्डवेयैस्ते मन्ये कालस्य पर्ययम्॥'}

{'en': 'Truly, this is the end of which such acts leads. Although the Pandavas have achieved such difficult feats, yet this should be the result of those feats.', 'sn': 'एवमेतेन भाव्यं हि नूनं कार्वेण तत्त्वतः। यथा ह्यस्येदृशी निष्ठा कृतकार्येऽपि दुष्करे॥'}

{'en': 'If you have not lost your wisdom out of stupefaction, then say what is proper for us to do under these circumstances.', 'sn': 'भवेतास्तु यदि प्रज्ञा न मोहादपनीयते। व्यापन्नेऽस्मिन् महत्यर्थे यन्नः श्रेयस्तदुच्यताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : When that great king was living in heaven, he was adored by the celestials, the Sadhyas, the Marutas and the Vasus.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच स्वर्गतः स तु राजेन्द्रो निवसन् देववेश्मनि। पूजितस्त्रिदशैः साध्यैर्मरुद्भिर्वसुभिस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'That doer of pious acts (Yayati) often went from the region of the celestials to the region of Brahma. It is heard that he lived in heaven for a long time.', 'sn': 'देवलोकं ब्रह्मलोकं संचरन् पुण्यकृद् वशी। अवसत् पृथिवीपालो दीर्घकालमिति श्रुतिः॥'}

{'en': 'One day the best of kings, Yayati, went to Indra and in the course of conversation the lord of earth was asked by Indra.', 'sn': 'स कदाचिनृपश्रेष्ठो ययातिः शक्रमागमत्। कथान्ते तत्र शक्रेण स पृष्टः पृथिवीपतिः।३॥'}

{'en': 'Indra said: O king, what did you say when Puru took your old age on earth and when you gave him his kingdom?', 'sn': 'शक्र उवाच यदा स पूरुस्तव रूपेण राजन् जरां गृहीत्वा प्रचचार भूमौ। तदा च राज्यं सम्प्रदायैव तस्मै त्वया किमुक्तः कथयेह सत्यम्॥'}

{'en': 'Yayati said : I told him the whole country between the rivers Ganges and the Yamuna which is in fact the central region of the earth, is yours. Your brothers will have the outlying regions.', 'sn': 'ययातिरुवाच गङ्गायमुनयोर्मध्ये कृत्स्नोऽयं विषयस्तव। मध्य पृथिव्यास्त्वं राजा भ्रातरोऽन्त्याधिपास्तव॥'}

{'en': 'I told him, the men having no anger are superior to men with anger; men having forgiveness are superior to men having no forgiveness. Man is superior to animals and the learned to the ignorant.', 'sn': 'स्तथा तितिक्षुरतितिक्षोर्विशिष्टः। अमानुषेभ्यो मानुषाश्च प्रधाना विद्वांस्तथैवाविदुषः प्रधानः॥'}

{'en': "If wronged, you should not wrong in return. One's anger, if not subdued, burns one's own self. If subdued, it procures the virtues of the doers of good acts.", 'sn': 'आक्रुश्यमानो नाक्रोशेन्मन्युरेव तितिक्षतः। आक्रोष्टारं निर्दहति सुकृतं चास्य विन्दति॥'}

{'en': 'You should never give pain to others by cruel words. Never defeat your enemies by despicable means. Never utter such sinful and burning words as may give pain to others.', 'sn': 'नारुन्तुदः स्यान्न नृशंसवादी न हीनतः परमभ्याददीत्। ययास्य वाचा पर उद्विजेत न तां वदेदुषती पापलोक्याम्॥'}

{'en': 'He who pricks another by the thorns of cruel words holds in his mouth a persecuting Rakshasa. Lakshmi (prosperity) leaves the man who casts his eyes on even such a man.', 'sn': 'अरुन्तुदं परुषं तीक्ष्णवाचं वाक्कण्टकैर्वितुदन्तं मनुष्यान्। विद्यादलक्ष्मीकतमं जनानां मुखे निबद्धां निर्ऋतिं वहन्तम्॥'}

{'en': 'You should always keep the virtuous man before you as your model. You should always compare your acts with those of the virtuous. You should always disregard the cruel words of the wicked.', 'sn': 'सद्भिः पुरस्तादभिपूजित: स्यात् सद्भिस्तथा पृष्ठतो रक्षितः स्यात्। सदासतामतिवादांस्तितिक्षेत् सतां वृत्तं चाददीतार्यवृत्तः॥'}

{'en': 'He who keeps the arrows of cruel words in his lips weeps day and night. The cruel words strike at the inmost part of the body. The wise men never fling such arrows (of cruel words) at others.', 'sn': 'वाक्सायका वदनान्निष्पतन्ति यैराहतः शोचति रात्र्यहानि। परस्य नामर्मसु ते पतन्ति तान् पण्डितो नावसृजेत् परेषु॥'}

{'en': 'There is nothing in the three worlds with which you can worship the deities as kindness, friendship, charity and sweet words.', 'sn': 'न हीदृशं संवननं त्रिषु लोकेषु विद्यते। दया मैत्री च भूतेषु दानं च मधुरा च वाक्॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore, you should always utter sweet words that give pleasure and not pain. You should always give and never beg. You should show respects to those that deserve your respect.', 'sn': 'तस्मात् सान्त्वं सदा वाच्यं न वाच्यं परुषं क्वचित्। पूज्यान् सम्पूजयेद् दद्यान्न च याचेत् कदाचन॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said O king, O descendant of Bharata, I shall now describe to you the fight of hundreds and thousands of foot-soldiers, who were in utter forgetfulness of all considerations for others.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच राजन् शतसहस्राणि तत्र तत्र पदातिनाम्। निर्मर्यादं प्रयुद्धानि तत् ते वक्ष्यामि भारत॥'}

{'en': "The son did not recognise the father and the father the son. The brother did not recognise his own brother and the sister's son did not recognise his maternal uncle.", 'sn': 'न पुत्रः पितरं जज्ञे पिता वा पुत्रमौरसम्। न भ्राता भ्रातरं तत्र स्वस्रीयं न च मातुलः॥'}

{'en': "The maternal uncle did not recognise his sister's son, and the friend did not recognise the friend. the Pandava and the Kuru forces fought as if they had been possessed by demons.", 'sn': 'न मातुलं च स्वस्रीयो न सखायं सखा तथा। आविष्टा इव युद्धयन्ते पाण्डवाः कुरुभिः सह॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of men, some warriors attacked with their cars the cars of the enemies, and crushed the yokes of those cars to pieces.', 'sn': 'स्थानीकं नरव्याघ्राः केचिदभ्यपतन रथैः। अभज्यन्त युगैरेव युगानि भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': "The shafts of cars broke dashing against shafts of other cars, the spikes of car-yokes broke against spikes of car-yokes. Some untidily attacked others that were united but all were eager to take one another's life.", 'sn': 'रथेषाश्च रथेषाभिः कूबरा रथकूबरैः। संगतैः सहिताः केचित् परस्परजिघांसवः॥'}

{'en': "Some cars were obstructed by other cars and they were unable to move. Huge elephants with rent temples fell upon other huge elephants. They angrily tore one another's body with their tusks. O king, others, again, attacking other impetuous and huge ones with huge standards on their backs, being wounded by tusks, roared in great agony.", 'sn': 'न शेकुश्चलितुं केचित् संनिपत्य स्था रथैः। प्रभिन्नास्तु महाकायः संनिपत्य गजा गजैः॥ बहुधादारयन् क्रुद्धा विषाणैरितरेतरम्। सतोरणपताकैश वारणा वरवारणैः॥ अभिसृत्य महाराज वेगवद्भिर्महागजैः। दन्तैरभिहतास्तत्र चुक्रुशुः परमातुराः॥'}

{'en': 'Disciplined by training and urged on by pikes and hooks, elephants not in rut attacked those that were in rut.', 'sn': 'अभिनीताश्च शिक्षाभिस्तोत्रांकुशसमाहताः। अप्रभिन्नाः प्रभिन्नानां सम्मुखाभिमुखा ययुः॥'}

{'en': 'Huge elephants, attacked by those that were in rut, ran away in all directions, uttering cries like those of cranes.', 'sn': 'प्रभिन्नैरपि संसक्ताः केचित् तत्र महागजाः। क्रौञ्चवन्निनदं कृत्वा दुर्दुवुः सर्वतो दिशम्॥'}

{'en': 'Many huge elephants, well trained and with juice trickling down from their rent temples and moth, having been wounded by swords, lances and arrows, shrieked aloud. Pierced in their vital parts they fell down and expired. Uttering fearful cries, some ran away in all directions.', 'sn': 'सम्यक् प्रणीता नागाश्च प्रभिन्नकरटामुखाः। ऋष्टितोमरनाराचैर्निर्विद्धा वरवारणाः॥ प्रणेदुर्भिन्नमर्माणो निपेतुश्च गतासवः। प्राद्रवन्त दिशः केचिन्नदन्तो भैरवान् रवान्।॥'}

{'en': "O king, the foot-soldiers, that protected the elephants, that possessed broad chests, that were capable of effectually striking the foe, armed with pikes, bows, bright battle-axes, maces, clubs, arrows, lances, shafts and heavy iron-mounted bludgeons and swords of the brightest polish, ran in every direction with the firm resolve of taking one another's life.", 'sn': 'गजानां पादरक्षास्तु व्यूढोरस्काः प्रहारिणः। ऋष्टिभिश्च धनुर्भिश्च विमलैश्च परश्वधैः॥ गदाभिर्मुसलैश्चैव भिन्दिपालैः सतोमरैः। आयसैः परिपैश्चैव निस्त्रिंशैविमलैः शितैः॥ प्रगृहीतैः सुसंरब्धा द्रवमाणास्ततस्ततः। व्यदृश्यन्त महाराज परस्परजिघांसवः॥'}

{'en': 'The swords of brave combatants who rushed against one another having been steeped in blood shone with great brilliancy.', 'sn': 'राजमानाश्च निस्त्रिंशाः संसिक्ता नरशोणितैः। प्रत्यदृश्यन्त शूराणामन्योन्मभिधावताम्॥'}
{'en': 'The whiling noise of the swords made by their whirling and falling by heroic arms became very loud.', 'sn': 'अवक्षिप्तावधूतानामसीनां वीरबाहुभिः। संजज्ञे तुमुलः शब्दः पततां परमर्मसु॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, crushed with maces and clubs, cut off with tempered swords pierced and grinned by the tusks of elephants, the combatants sent forth heart-rending wails as those of men doomed to hell.', 'sn': 'गदामुसलरुग्णानां भिन्नानां च वरासिभिः। दन्तिदन्तावभिन्नानां मृदितानां च दन्तिभिः॥ तत्र तत्र नरौघाणां क्रोशतामितरेतरम्। शुश्रुवुर्दारुणा वाचः प्रेतानामिव भारत॥'}
{'en': 'Horsemen on fleet horses with tails like the plumes of swans, rushed upon me another.', 'sn': 'हयैरपि हयारोहाश्चामरापीडधारिभिः। हंसैरिव महावेगैरन्योन्यमभिविद्रुताः॥'}

{'en': 'Hurled by them, long fleet and polished and sharp-pointed darts, decked with gold, fell (on all sides) like so many snakes.', 'sn': 'तैविमुक्ता महाप्रासा जाम्बूनदविभूषणाः। आशुगा विमलास्तीक्ष्णाः सम्पेतुर्भुजगोपमाः॥'}

{'en': 'Some heroic horsemen on fleet steeds leaped up and cut off the heads of car-warriors who were seated on their cars.', 'sn': 'अश्वैरच्यजवैः केचिदाप्लुत्य महतो स्थान्। शिरांस्याददिरे वीरा रथिनामश्वसादिनः॥'}

{'en': 'A car-warrior, getting a body cavalry within shooting distance, killed many with straight arrows furnished with broad heads.', 'sn': 'बहूनपि हयारोहान् भल्लैः संनतपर्वभिः। रथी जघान सम्प्राप्य बाणगोचरमागतान्॥'}

{'en': 'Many infuriated elephants adorned with gold trappings and loO king like newly-risen clouds threw down the horses and crushed them with their legs.', 'sn': 'नवमेघप्रतीकाशाश्चाक्षिप्य तुरगान् गजाः। पादैरेव विमृद्नन्ति मत्ताः कनकभूषणाः॥'}

{'en': 'Being struck on their frontal globes and flanks, and mangled by lances, many elephants roared aloud in great agony.', 'sn': 'पाट्यमानेषु कुम्भेषु पार्श्वेष्वपि च वारणाः। प्रासैर्विनिहताः केचिद् विनेदुः परमातुराः॥'}

{'en': 'In the bewildering confusion of the melee, many elephants threw steeds with their riders and crushed them down.', 'sn': 'साश्वारोहान् हयान् कांश्चिदुन्मथ्य वरवारणाः। सहसा चिक्षिपुस्तत्र संकुले भैरवे सति॥'}

{'en': 'Overthrowing with their tusks steeds and their riders, some elephants roved about and crushed cars with their standards.', 'sn': 'साश्वारोहान् विषाणाप्रैक्षिप्य तुरगान् गजाः। रथौघानभिमृद्नन्तः सध्वजानभिचक्रमुः॥'}

{'en': 'Some huge male elephants, from excess of energy and with the temporal juice gushing down from their temples in large quantities, killed horses with their riders by their trunks and legs.', 'sn': 'पुंस्त्वादतिमदत्वाच्च केचित् तत्र महागजाः। साश्वारोहान् हयाञ्जघ्नुः करैः सचरणैस्तथा॥ अश्वारोहैश्च समरे हस्तिसादिभिरेव च।'}

{'en': 'Polished, sharp-pointed and fleet arrows resembling snakes fell upon the heads, the temples and the flanks and the limbs of elephants.', 'sn': 'प्रतिमानेषु गात्रेषु पार्श्वेष्वभि च वारणान्। आशुगा विमलास्तीक्ष्णाः सम्पेतुर्भुजगोपमाः॥'}

{'en': "king, icarful, polished javelins resembling large meteoric lashes being hurled by heroic arms fell everywhere piercing through bodies of men and horses and cutting through coats of mail. Taking out their sharp swords from sheathes made of leopard's and tiger's skins, many killed their adversaries in battle.", 'sn': 'नराश्वकायान् निर्भिद्य लौहानि कवचानि च। निपेतुर्विमलाः शक्त्यो वीरबाहुभिरर्पिताः॥ महोल्काप्रतिमा घोरास्तत्र तत्र विशाम्पते। द्वीपिचर्मावनद्धैश्च व्याघ्रचर्मच्छदैरपि॥ विकोशैविमलैः खङ्गैरभिजग्मुः परान् रणे।'}

{'en': 'Many warriors, though attacked and their bodies cut open, fell upon their antagonists with swords, shields and battle-axes.', 'sn': 'अभिप्लुतमभिक्रुद्धमेकपाविदारितम्॥ विदर्शयन्तः सम्पेतुः खगचर्मपरश्वधैः।'}

{'en': 'Dragging down and overthrowing cars with their horses by their trunks, some elephants roved about in all directions, guided by the cries of those behind them.', 'sn': 'केचिदाक्षिप्य करिणः शाश्वानपि रथान् करैः॥ विकर्षन्तो दिशः सर्वाः सम्पेतुः सर्वशब्दगाः।'}

{'en': "Some pierced by javelins, some cut down by battle-axes, some crushed by elephants, some trodden down by horses, some cut by the car-wheels and some by axes, O king, loudly called for their kinsmen. Some called upon their sons, some upon their fathers, some upon their brothers some upon their relatives, some upon their maternal uncles, some upon their sister's sons, and some upon their friends and others.", 'sn': 'शङ्कुभिर्दारिताः केचित् सम्भिन्नाश्च परश्वधैः॥ हस्तिभिर्मुदिताः केचित् क्षुण्णाश्चान्ये तुरंगमैः। रथनेमिनिकृत्ताश्च निकृत्ताश्च परश्वधैः॥ व्याक्रोशन्त नरा राजंस्तत्र तत्र स्म बान्धवान्। पुत्रानन्ये पितृनन्ये भ्रातृ॑श्च सह बन्धुभिः॥ मातुलान् भागिनेयांश्च परानपि च संयुगे।'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, a large number of combatants lost their weapons, many had their thighs broken. Some were seen to cry piteously for their desire for life, with arms torn off or sides pierced or cut open.', 'sn': 'विकीर्णान्त्राः सुबहवो भग्नसक्थाश्च भारत॥ बाहुभिश्चापरे छिन्नैः पार्थेषु च विदारिताः।'}

{'en': 'O king, some having but little strength, and lying on the field of battle asked for water from excessive thirst.', 'sn': 'क्रन्दन्तः समदृश्यन्त तृषिता जीवितेप्सवः॥ तृषा परिगताः केचिदल्पसत्त्वा विशाम्पते।'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, some, sweltering in blood and becoming greatly weakened, ensured themselves and your son assembled (in that battle).', 'sn': 'भूमौ निपतिताः संख्ये मृगयांचक्रिरे जलम्॥ रुधिरौघपरिक्लिन्नाः क्लिश्यमानाश्च भारत। व्यनिन्दन भृशमात्मानं तव पुत्रांश्च संगतान्॥'}

{'en': 'O exalted one, but there were others, the brave Kshatriyas, who having wounded one another, did not abandon their weapons nor did they set up any wails,', 'sn': 'अपरे क्षत्रियाः शूराः कृतवैराः परस्परम्। नैव शस्त्रं विमुञ्चन्ति नैव क्रन्दन्ति मारिष॥'}

{'en': 'There were some, who, lying on those places where they lay, roared in joy and bitting from wrath their own lips with their teeth, looked at one another with faces rendered fearful by the contraction of their eye-brows. Others, possessing great strength and tenacity, wounded with arrow, remained perfectly silent smarting under their pains. Other brave carwarriors, deprived of their own cars in battle and thrown down and wounded by huge elephants, asked to be taken up on the cars of others. O king, many looked beautiful like blossoming Kinshukas.', 'sn': 'तर्जयन्ति च संहृष्टास्तत्र तत्र परस्परम्। आदश्य दशनैश्चापि क्रोधात् सरदनच्छदम्॥ भृकुटीकुटिलैर्वक्त्रैः प्रेक्षन्ति च परस्परम्। अपरे क्लिश्यमानास्तु शरार्ता व्रणपीडिताः॥ निष्कूजाः समपद्यन्त दृढसत्त्वा महाबलाः। अन्ये च विस्थाः शूरा स्थमन्यस्य संयुगे।॥ प्रार्थयाना निपतिताः संक्षुण्णा वरवारणैः। अशोभन्त महाराज सपुष्पा इव किंशुकाः॥'}

{'en': "In that fearful battle, destructive of heroes, the father killed the son and the son killed the father, the sister's son killed the maternal uncle, the maternal uncle killed the sister's son Friends killed friends and kinsmen killed kinsmen.", 'sn': 'सम्बभूवुरनीकेषु बहवो भैरवस्वनाः। वर्तमाने महाभीमे तस्मिन् वीरवरक्षये।॥ निजघान पिता पुत्रं पुत्रश्च पितरं रणे। स्वस्रीयो मातुलं चापि स्वस्रीयं चापि मातुलः॥'}
{'en': 'Thus took place the great slaughter in that great battle between the Kurus and the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'सखा सखायं च तथा सम्बन्धी बान्धवं तथा। एवं युयुधिरे तत्र कुरवः पाण्डवैः सह॥'}

{'en': 'In that fearful and terrible battle in which no consideration was shown, the Pandavas (at last) began to waver before Bhishma.', 'sn': 'वर्तमाने तथा तस्मिन् निर्मर्यादे भयानके। भीष्ममासाद्य पार्थानां वाहिनी समकम्पत॥'}

{'en': '0 best of the Bharata race, O king, the mighty-armed Bhishma, with his great standard made of silver and adorned with the device of a palmyra with five stars sitting upon his excellent car, shone like the moon on the Meru mountain.', 'sn': 'केतुना पञ्चतारेण तालेन भरतर्षभ। राजतेन महाबाहुरुच्छ्रितेन महारथे। बभौ भीष्मस्तदा राजश्चन्द्रमा इव मेरुणा॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said O Sanjaya, O greatly intelligent one, tell me in detail about the country on the north and the east of the Meru and also about the Malyavat mountain.', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच मेरोरथोत्तरं पार्श्व पूर्वं चाचक्ष्व संजय। निखिलेन महाबुद्धे माल्यवन्तं च पर्वतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said O king, on the south of the Nila mountain and on the north of the Meru are the sacred Northern Kurus where dwell the Siddhas,', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच दक्षिणेन तु नीलस्य मेरोः पार्श्वे तथोत्तरे। उत्तराः कुरवो राजन् पुण्याः सिद्धनिषेविताः॥'}

{'en': 'The trees there bear sweet fruits, and are always covered with flowers and fruits. All the flowers are of the sweetest fragrance and all the fruits are of the best taste.', 'sn': 'तत्र वृक्षा मधुफला नित्यपुष्पफलोपगाः। पुष्पाणि च सुगन्धीनि रसवन्ति फलानि च॥'}

{'en': 'O king, some of the trees produce fruits as one desires to cat. There are some trees that are called "Milk-yielding".', 'sn': 'सर्वकामफलास्तत्र केचिद् वृक्षा जनाधिप। अपरे क्षीरिणो नाम वृक्षास्तत्र नराधिप॥'}

{'en': 'They always produce milk and the six different kinds of food with the taste of ambrosia. They also produce cloths, and their fruits are ornaments.', 'sn': 'ये क्षरन्ति सदा क्षीरं षड्रसं चामृतोपमम्। वस्त्राणि च प्रसूयन्ते फलेष्वाभरणानि च॥'}

{'en': 'The whole ground is covered with gems and golden sands. A certain part of this region which is extremely delightful is seen to be as radiant as the ruby or the diamond or the Vaidurya gem or other jewels or of the hue of the lotus. O king, all the seasons there are charming, and no part of its ground ever for comes miry.', 'sn': 'सर्वा मणिमयी भूमिः सूक्ष्मकाञ्चनवालुका। सर्वर्तुसुखसंस्पर्शा निष्पङ्का च जनाधिप।'}

{'en': 'Its tanks are charming, delicious and full of pure water. The men born there have all come down from the land of the celestial.', 'sn': 'पुध्यकरिण्यः शुभास्तत्र सुखस्पर्शा मनोरमाः॥ देवलोकच्युताः सर्वे जायन्ते तत्र मानवाः।'}

{'en': 'All are of pure birth and all are exceedingly handsome. Husband and wife are born there and women there are like the Apsaras in beauty.', 'sn': 'शुक्लाभिजनसम्पन्नाः सर्वे सुप्रियदर्शनाः॥ मिथुनानि च जायन्ते स्त्रियश्चाप्सरसोपमाः।'}

{'en': 'They drink the milk of these “Milkyielding” trees which is as sweet as the ambrosia. The pair grow up there equally.', 'sn': 'तेषां ते क्षीरिणां क्षीरं पिबन्त्यमृतसंनिभम्॥ मिथुनं जायते काले समं तच्च प्रवर्धते।'}

{'en': 'O king, they, both possessing equal beauty, both possessing equal virtues, both wearing equal dresses, grow up in great love like a pair of Chakravakas (birds).', 'sn': 'तुल्यरूपगुणोपेतं समवेषं तथैव च॥ एकैकमनुरक्तं च चक्रवाकसमं विभो।'}

{'en': 'The dwellers of this region are free from diseases. They are ever happy. O king, they live ten thousand and ten hundred years and they never abandon one another. A kind of birds called Bharunda of sharp beaks and of great strength takes them up when dead and throws them into the mountain caves. O king, I have now described to you the northern Kuru.', 'sn': 'निरामयाश्च ते लोका नित्यं मुदितमानसाः॥ दश वर्षसहस्राणि दश वर्षशतानि च। जीवन्ति ते महाराज न चान्योन्यं जहत्युत॥ भारुण्डा नाम शकुनास्तीक्ष्णतुण्डा महाबलाः। तान् निर्हरन्तीह मृतान् दरीषु प्रक्षिपन्ति च॥ उत्तराः कुरवो राजन् व्याख्यातास्ते समासतः।'}

{'en': 'I shall now describe to you the eastern side of the mountain Meru. O king, of all the regions there, one called Bhadrashva is the foremost.', 'sn': 'मेरोः पार्श्वमहं पूर्वं वक्ष्याम्यथ यथातथम्॥ तस्य मूर्धाभिषेकस्तु भद्राश्वस्य विशाम्पते।'}

{'en': 'There is a large forest of Bhadrashva and also a very big tree called Kalamra. O king, this Kalamra is always full of fruits and flowers.', 'sn': 'भद्रसालवनं यत्र कालाम्रश्च महाद्रुमः॥ कालाम्रस्तु महाराज नित्यपुष्पफलः शुभः।'}

{'en': 'It is a Yojana in height. It is adorned by the Siddhas and the Charanas. The men there are all while. They possess great energy and great strength.', 'sn': 'दुमश्च योजनोत्सेधः सिद्धचारणसेवितः। तत्र ते पुरुषाः श्वेतास्तेजोयुक्ता महाबलाः।'}

{'en': 'The women possess the complexion like that of lillies. They are very beautiful and charming. They possess the radiance of the morn; they are as white as the morn. Their faces are like full moon.', 'sn': 'स्त्रियः कुमुदवर्णाश्च सुन्दर्यः प्रियदर्शनाः॥ चन्द्रप्रभाश्चन्द्रवर्णाः पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाः।'}

{'en': 'Their bodies are as cool as the rays of the moon, They are all highly accomplished in singing and dancing. O foremost of the Bharata race the length of life here is ten thousand years.', 'sn': 'चन्द्रशीतलगायश्च नृत्यगीतविशारदाः॥ दश वर्षसहस्राणि तत्रायुर्भरतर्षभ।'}
{'en': 'They remain young for ever by drinking the juice of the Kalamra tree. On the north of the Nishadha.', 'sn': 'कालाम्ररसपीतास्ते नित्यं संस्थितयौवनाः॥ दक्षिणेन तु नीलस्य निषधस्योत्तरेण तु।'}

{'en': 'There is a very large Jambu tree by name of Sudarshana which is eternal. When adorned by the Siddhas and Charanas, that sacred tree grants every desire.', 'sn': 'सुदर्शनो नाम महाञ्जम्बूवृक्षः सनातनः॥ सर्वकामफलः पुण्यः सिद्धचारणसेवितः।'}

{'en': 'This country has been named Jambudvipa after the name of this tree. O best of the Bharata race, O ruler of men, this tree is in height one thousand and one hundred Yojanas. It touches the very heavens. The circumference of a fruit of that free which bursts by itself when ripe is eleven thousand and five hundred cubits. In falling on the ground, they make a very loud noise.', 'sn': 'तस्य नाम्ना समाख्यातो जम्बूद्वीप: सनातनः॥ योजनानां सहस्रं च शतं च भरतर्षभ। उत्सेधो वृक्षराजस्य दिवस्पृङ्मनुजेश्वरः॥ अरत्नीनां सहस्रं च शतानि दश पञ्च च। परिणाहस्तु वृक्षस्य फलानां रसभेदिनाम्॥ पतमानानि तान्युर्वी कुर्वन्ति विपुलं स्वनम्।'}

{'en': 'O king, then they pour out a silvery juice on the ground. O king, that juice of the Jambu, becoming a river.', 'sn': 'मुञ्चन्ति च रसं राजेस्तस्मिन् रजतसंनिभम्॥ तस्या जम्ब्वाः फलरसो नदी भूत्वा जनाधिप।'}

{'en': 'Passing round the Meru mountains comes to the country of the northern Kurus. If that juice is drunk, it gives peace of mind. No thirst is ever after felt. O king, old age never comes. A kind of gold called Jambunada is also produced there. They are used in making celestial weapons. They are very shining and look like the Indragopaka insccts. The men born there possess the complexion of the morning sun.', 'sn': 'मेरुं प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा सम्प्रयात्युत्तरान् कुरून्।॥ तत्र तेषां मन:शान्तिन पिपासा जनाधिप। तस्मिन् फलरसे पीते न जरा बाधते च तान्॥ तत्र जाम्बूनदं नाम कनकं देवभूषणम्। इन्द्रगोपकसंकाशं जायते भास्वरं तु तत्॥ तरुणादित्यवर्णाश्च जायन्ते तत्र मानवाः।'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race on the summit of the Malyavan is always seen the fire called Samvartaka, the fire that blazes forth at the end of a Yoga to destroy the universe.', 'sn': 'तथा माल्यवतः शृङ्गे दृश्यते हव्यवाट् सदा॥ नाम्ना संवर्तको नाम कालग्निर्भरतर्षभ।'}
{'en': 'o summit of the Malyavat, small mountains. O king, the Malyavat measures eleven thousand Yojanas.', 'sn': 'तथा माल्यवतः शृङ्गे पूर्वपूर्वानुगण्डिका॥ योजनानां सहस्राणि पञ्चषण्माल्यवानथ।'}

{'en': 'The men born there possess complexion like gold. They have all descendent from the abode of Brahma, and thcy are all utterers of the Vedas.', 'sn': 'महारजतसंकाशा जायन्ते तत्र मानवाः॥ ब्रह्मलोकच्युताः सर्वे सर्वे सर्वेषु साधवः।'}

{'en': 'The undergo severe asceticism. They have their passions under complete control. They all enter the sun for the protection of creation.', 'sn': 'तपस्तप्यन्ति ते तीव्र भवन्ति झूर्ध्वरेतसः। रक्षणार्थं तु भूतानां प्रविशन्ते दिवाकरम्॥'}
{'en': 'They are sixty six thousand in number. They proceed in front of Aruna and surrounded the sun.', 'sn': 'षष्टिस्तानि सहस्राणि षष्टिरेव शतानि च। अरुणस्याग्रतो यान्ति परिवार्य दिवाकरम्॥'}
{'en': "Having been heated with the sun's rays for sixty six thousand years, they then enter the solar disc.", 'sn': 'षष्टि वर्षसहस्राणि षष्टिमेव शतानि च। आदित्यतापतप्तास्ते विशन्ति शशिमण्डलम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sauti said: The moment the branch of the tree was touched by the greatly powerful Garuda with his feet, it broke down. As it was about to fall, it was caught by him.', 'sn': 'सौतिरुवाच स्पृष्टमात्रा तु पद्भ्यां सा गरुडेन बलीयसा। अभज्यत तरोः शाखां भग्नां चैकामधारयत्॥'}

{'en': 'As he cast his eyes in wonder on the broken branch of the tree, he saw that the Valakhilya Rishis were hanging form it, with their heads downwards.', 'sn': 'तां भक्त्वा स महाशाखां स्मयमानो विलोकयन्। अथात्र लम्बतोऽपश्यद्वालखिल्यानधोमुखान्॥ ॥'}

{'en': 'Having seen the holy Rishis thus suspended, he said to himself, “These Rishis of great penances must not be killed.', 'sn': 'ऋषयो ह्यत्र लम्बन्ते न हन्यामिति तानृषीन्। तपोरतान्लम्बमानान्ब्रह्मर्षीनभिवीक्ष्य सः॥'}

{'en': 'If the bough fell down, the Rishis will be killed.” Reflecting thus, the mighty bird held more firmly the elephant and the tortoise.', 'sn': 'हन्यादेतान्संपतन्ती शाखेत्यथ विचिन्त्य सः। नखैदूंढतरं वीरः संगृह्य गजकच्छपौ॥'}

{'en': 'The king of birds, from the fear of killing the Rishis and from the desire of saving them held the bough in his beaks and rose on his wings.', 'sn': 'स तद्विनाशसंत्रासादभिपत्य खगाधिपः। शाखामास्येन जग्राह तेषामेवान्ववेक्षया॥'}

{'en': 'The great Rishis, seeing this act which was beyond the powers of the celestials, was filled with wonder and they gave the great bird a name.', 'sn': 'अतिदैवं तु तत्तस्य कर्म दृष्ट्वा महर्षयः। विस्मयोत्कम्पहृदया नाम चक्रुर्महाखगे॥'}

{'en': 'They said "As this great bird rises on its wings with a heavy burden, let the best of the birds, the eater of snakes, be called Garuda.”', 'sn': 'गुरुं भारं समासाद्यड्डीन एष विहंगमः। गरुडस्तु खगश्रेष्ठस्तस्मात्पन्नगभोजनः॥'}

{'en': 'Then shaking the mountains, the bird with the elephant and tortoise, slowly moved onward in the sky and when he was thus going he saw many countries underneath.', 'sn': 'ततः शनैः पर्यपतत्पक्षैः शैलाप्रकम्पयन्। एवं सोऽभ्यपतद्देशान्बहून्सगजकच्छपः॥'}

{'en': 'Wishing to save the Valakhilyas he could not find a (proper) place to sit on. At last he went to that best of mountains, called Gandhamadana.', 'sn': 'दयार्थं बालखिल्यानां न च स्थानमविन्दत। स गत्वा पर्वतश्रेष्ठं गन्धमादनमञ्जसा॥'}

{'en': 'There he saw his father, Kashyapa, engaged in ascetic devotions. His father also saw that great bird of divine form.', 'sn': 'ददर्श कश्यपं तत्र पितरं तपसि स्थितम्। ददर्श तं पिता चापि दिव्यरूपं विहंगमम्॥'}

{'en': 'And of great splendour, strength and energy, as swift as the wind or the mind, huge as a mountain peak, a ready smiter as a curse of a Brahmana,', 'sn': 'तेजोवीर्यबलोपेतं मनोमारुतरंहसम्। शैल,ङ्गप्रतीकाशं ब्रह्मदण्डमिवोद्यतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Inconceivable, indescribable, fearful to all creatures possessed of great powers, terrible, as full of splendour as Agni himself.', 'sn': 'अचिन्त्यमनभिध्येयं सर्वभूतभयंकरम्। महावीर्यधरं रौद्रं साक्षादग्निमिवोद्यतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Incapable of being overcome by the Devas and Danavas, capable of splitting mountains and of sucking the ocean,', 'sn': 'अप्रधृष्यमजेयं च देवदानवराक्षसैः। भेत्तारं गिरिशृङ्गाणां समुद्रजलशोषणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Capable of destroying the three worlds and as fierce-looking as Yama himself. The greatly illustrious Kashyapa, seeing him approach and knowing his intention, thus addressed him,', 'sn': 'लोकसंलोडनं घोरं कृतान्तसमदर्शनम्। तमागतमभिप्रेक्ष्य भगवान्कश्यपस्तदा। विदित्वा चास्य संकल्पमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Kashyapa said : My son, do not commit a rash act, for you will then have to suffer pain. The Valakhilyas, that support on the rays of the sun, if angry, can blast you.', 'sn': 'कश्यप उवाच पुत्र मा साहसं कार्षीर्मा सद्यो लप्स्यसे व्यथाम्। मा त्वां दहेयुः संक्रुद्धा वालखिल्या मरीचिपाः॥'}

{'en': 'Sauti said: Therefore, Kashyapa for the snake of his son, propitiated the very glorious, exceedingly ascetic and sinless Valakhilyas.', 'sn': 'सौतिरुवाच ततः प्रसादयामास कश्यपः पुत्रकारणात्। वालखिल्यान्महाभागांतपसा हतकल्मषान्॥'}

{'en': 'Kashyapa said : O great Rishis, the action of Garuda is for the good of all creatures. He is trying to accomplish a great act and therefore, you should give him permission.', 'sn': 'कश्यप उवाच प्रजाहितार्थमारम्भो गरुडस्य तपोधनाः। चिकीर्षति महत्कर्म तदनुज्ञातुमर्हथ॥'}

{'en': 'Sauti said: The great ascetics, having been thus addressed by the illustrious Kashyapa, quitting the bough, went to the sacred Himalayas to observe ascetic penances.', 'sn': 'सौतिरुवाच एवमुक्ता भगवता मुनयस्ते समभ्ययुः। मुक्त्वा शाखां गिरिं पुण्यं हिमवन्तंतपोऽर्थिनः॥'}

{'en': 'When the Rishis went away, the son of Vinata, his voice choked by the bough in his beaks, asked his father Kashyapa,', 'sn': 'ततस्तेष्वपयातेषु पितरं विनतासुतः। शाखाव्याक्षिप्तवदनः पर्यपृच्छत कश्यपम्॥'}

{'en': '"O illustrious one, where stall I throw this great bough of the tree? O illustrious one, point me a place free from men."', 'sn': 'भगवन्क्व विमुञ्चामि तरोः शाखामिमामहम्। वर्जितं मानुषैर्देशमाख्यातु भगवान्मम॥'}

{'en': 'Kashyapa told him of a mountain without human beings, with caves and dales, always covered with snow and inaccessible by ordinary men even in thought.', 'sn': 'ततो निःपुरुषं शैलं हिमसंरुद्धकन्दरम्। अगम्यं मनसाप्यन्यैस्तस्याचख्यौ स कश्यपः॥'}

{'en': 'The great bird, carrying the bough, the elephant and the tortoise, proceeded in great speed towards that mountain of broad waist.', 'sn': 'तं पर्वतं महाकुक्षिमुद्दिश्य स महाखगः! जवेनाभ्यपतत्तार्क्ष्य: सशाखागजकच्छपः॥'}

{'en': 'The great bough with which the huge bird flew away could be girt round with a cord made of a hundred hides.', 'sn': 'न तां वध्री परिणहेच्छतचर्मा महातनुम्। शाखिनो महतीं शाखां यां प्रगृह्य ययौ खगः॥'}
{'en': 'The king of the birds, Garuda, flew away one hundred thousand Yojanas in the shortest time.', 'sn': 'स ततः शतसाहस्रं योजनान्तरमागतः। कालेन नातिमहता गरुडः पतगेश्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'Going almost within a moment to the mountains as directed by his father, the bird let fall the great bough. And it fell with a great noise.', 'sn': 'स तं गत्वा क्षणेनैव पर्वतं वचनापितुः। अमुञ्चन्महतीं शाखां सस्वनं तत्र खेचरः॥'}

{'en': "That king of the mountains trembled, having been struck with the storm, raised by Garuda's wings. The trees thereon dropped showers of flowers.", 'sn': 'पक्षानिलहतश्चास्य प्राकम्पत स शैलराट्। मुमोच पुष्पवर्षं च समागलितपादपः॥'}

{'en': 'And the peaks of that great mountain, decked with gems and gold, were loosened and fell down on all sides.', 'sn': 'शृङ्गाणि च व्यशीर्यन्त गिरेस्तस्य समन्ततः। मणिकाञ्चनचित्राणि शोभयन्ति महागिरिम्॥'}

{'en': 'The falling bough struck down many trees, which, with golden flowers amid their dark leaves, looked like clouds charged with lightning.', 'sn': 'शाखिनो बहवश्चापि शाखायाऽभिहतास्तया। काञ्चनैः कुसुमैर्भान्त विद्युत्त्वन्त इवाम्बुदाः॥'}

{'en': 'And these trees, bright as gold, falling down upon the ground and dyed with the mountain metals, looked as if they were bathed in the rays of the sun.', 'sn': 'ते हेमविकचा भूमौ युताः पर्वतधातुभिः। व्यराजञ्छाखिनस्तत्र सूर्यांशुप्रतिरञ्जिताः॥'}
{'en': 'Then the best of birds sat on the summit of that mountain and ate both the elephant and the tortoise.', 'sn': 'ततस्तस्य गिरेः शृङ्गमास्थाय स खगोत्तमः। भक्षयामास गरुडस्तावुभौ गजकच्छपौ॥'}

{'en': 'The son of Tarkshya (Garuda), having thus eaten the elephant and the tortoise, rose on his wings from the top of that mountain summit.', 'sn': 'तावुभौ भक्षयित्वा तु स तायः कूर्मकुञ्जरौ। ततः पर्वतकूटाग्रादुत्पपात महाजवः॥'}

{'en': "Various evil omens appeared before the celestial foreboding fear. Indra's thunder-bolt blazed up in a fright.", 'sn': 'प्रावर्तन्ताथ देवानामुत्पाताभयशंसिनः। इन्द्रस्य वज्रं दयितं प्रजज्वाल भयात्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Meteors with flames and smoke, loosened from the welkin, shot down during the day; and the weapons of the Vasus, the Rudras, la Adityas, the Sadhyas, the Maruts and of all other classes of celestials began to fight among one another.', 'sn': 'सधूमा न्यपतत्सार्चिर्दिवोल्का नभसश्च्युता। तथा वसूनां रुद्राणामादित्यानां च सर्वशः॥ साध्यानां मरुतां चैव ये चान्ये देवतागणाः। स्वं स्वं प्रहरणं तेषां परस्परमुपाद्रवत्॥'}

{'en': 'Such things had never happened, not even during the war between the Devas and the Danavas. The winds blew with thunder; meteors fell in thousands;', 'sn': 'अभूतपूर्वं संग्रामे तदा देवासुरेऽपि च। वदुर्वाताः सनिर्घाता: पेतुरुल्काः सहस्रशः॥'}
{'en': 'The cloudless sky made a tremendous roar. Even he who was the god of the gods, dropped blood,', 'sn': 'निरभ्रमेव चाकाशं प्रजगर्न महास्वनम्। देवानामपि यो देवः सोऽप्यवर्षत शोणितम्॥'}

{'en': 'The garlands in the necks of the celestials grew pale and dim and their splendour was lost. And terrible masses of clouds vomited thick showers of blood.', 'sn': 'मम्लुर्माल्यानि देवानां नेशुस्तेजांसि चैव हि। उत्पातमेघा रौद्राश्च ववृषुः शोणितं बहु॥'}

{'en': 'The dust, raised by the winds, darkened the splendour of the coronets worn by the celestial. Thereupon, Indra with the other celestials, perplexed with fear on account of these evil omens, addressed Brihaspati thus.', 'sn': 'रजांसि मुकुटान्येषामुत्थिानि व्यघर्षयन्। ततस्त्राससमुद्विग्नः सह देवैः शतऋतुः। उत्पातान्दारुणान्पश्यन्नित्युवाच बृहस्पतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'Indra said : O illustrious one, why have these great disasters suddenly arisen? I do not see any enemy who will oppress us in a war.', 'sn': 'इन्द्र उवाच किमर्थं भगवन्योरा उत्पाताः सहसोस्थिताः। न च शत्रु प्रपश्यामि युधि यो नः प्रधर्षयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Brihaspati said : O king of the celestials, O Shatakratu, it is from your carelessness and from your fault and owing to the penances of the illustrious Rishi Valakhilyas,', 'sn': 'बृहस्पतिरुवाच तवापराधाद्देवेन्द्र प्रमादाच्च शतक्रतो। तपसा बालखिल्यानां महर्षीणां महात्मनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'That the son of the Rishi Kashyapa and Vinata, the great bird, capable of assuming any form at will, is coming to take away the Soma.', 'sn': 'कश्यपस्य मुनेः पुत्रो विनतायाश्च खेचरः। हर्तुं सोममभिप्राप्तो बलवान्कामरूपधृक्॥'}

{'en': 'And the strongest of all the strong, that bird is capable of taking away the Soma. Everything is possible in him. He can achieve even the unachievable.', 'sn': 'समर्थो बलिना श्रेष्ठो हर्तुं सोमं विहंगमः। सर्वं संभवायाम्यस्मिन्नसाध्यमपि साधयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Sauti said : Having heard this, Indra spoke to those that guarded the Ambrosia, "A greatly powerful bird has determined to take away the Soma;', 'sn': 'सौतिरुवाच श्रुत्वैतद्वचनं शक्रः प्रोवाचामृतरक्षिणः। महावीर्यबल: पक्षी हर्तुं सोममिहोद्यतः॥'}

{'en': 'I warn you beforehand, so that he may not succeed in taking it by force. Brihaspati has told me that his strength is matchless."', 'sn': 'युष्मान्संबोधयाम्येष यया न स हरेबलात्। अतुलं हि बलं तस्य बृहस्पतिरुवाच ह॥'}

{'en': 'The celestials, when they heard it, were astonished and they took precautions. They stood surrounding the Ambrosia and the greatly powerful Indra stood with them, thunder-bolt in hand.', 'sn': 'तच्छ्रुत्वा विबुधा वाक्यं विस्मिता यत्नमास्थिताः। परिवार्यामृतं तस्थुर्वज्री चेन्द्रः प्रतापवान्॥'}
{'en': 'The celestials wore wonderful and greatly valuable breast-plates of gold, set with gems;', 'sn': 'धारयन्तो विचित्राणि काञ्चनानि मनस्विनः। कवचानि महार्हाणि वैदूर्यविकृतानि च॥'}

{'en': 'They wore bright leather arīnours of great toughness and wielded various sharp weapons of terrible forms,', 'sn': 'चर्माण्यपि च गात्रेषु भानुमन्ति दृढानि च। विविधानि च शस्त्राणि घोररूपाण्यनेकशः॥'}
{'en': 'All emitting fire with smoke and all raised up by the best of the celestials.', 'sn': 'शिततीक्ष्णाग्रधाराणि समुद्यम्य सुरोत्तमाः। सविस्फुलिङ्गज्वालानि सधूमानि च सर्वशः॥'}

{'en': 'They were armed with many discusses, iron maces, spikes, lances, tridents, battle-axes and various other sharp-pointed missiles, polished swords and maces of terrible forms, all suited to their respective bodies.', 'sn': 'चक्राणि परिघांश्चैव त्रिशूलानि परश्वधान्। शक्तीश्च विविधास्तीक्ष्णा: करवालांश्च निर्मलान्। स्वदेहरूपाण्यादाय गदाश्चोग्रप्रदर्शनाः॥'}

{'en': 'Armed with these bright weapons and adorned with all celestial ornaments, the celestials, having their fear allayed, waited there (ready to meet Garuda).', 'sn': 'तैः शस्त्रैर्भानुमद्भिस्ते दिव्याभरणभूषिताः। भानुमन्तः सुरगणास्तस्थुर्विगतकल्मषाः॥'}

{'en': 'The celestials of matchless strength, energy and splendour, capable of splitting the cities of the Asuras, displayed themselves in forms resplendent as the blazing fire; they all resolved to protect the Ambrosia (at all hazard).', 'sn': 'अनुपमबलवीर्यतजेसो धृतमनसः परिरक्षणेऽमृतस्य। असुरपुरविदारणाः सुरा ज्वलनसमिद्धवपु:प्रकाशिनः॥'}

{'en': 'And in consequence of the celestials standing there and owing to hundreds of thousands of maces furnished with iron spokes, that battle-field looked like another firmament illuminated by the rays of the sun.', 'sn': 'इति समरवरं सुराः स्थितास्ते परिघसहस्रशतैः समाकुलम्। विगलितमिव चाम्बरान्तरं तपनमरीचिविकाशितं बभासे॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said The king Dhritarashtra, knowing the inclinations of his son and considering also that Fate was unavoidable, acted in this way.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच मतमाज्ञाय पुत्रस्य धृतराष्ट्रो नराधिपः। मत्वा च दुस्तरं दैवमेतद् राजश्चकार ह॥'}

{'en': 'The foremost of all learneu men, Vidura, did not approve the words of his brothers so unjustly uttered; and he then thus spoke to him.', 'sn': 'अन्यायेन तथोक्तस्तु विदुरो विदुषां वरः। नाभ्यनन्दद् वचो भ्रातुर्वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Vidura said O king, I do not approve of your this command. Do not act thus. I am afraid this will bring about the destruction of our race. O ruler of men, I apprehend that your sons will lose unity from this match at dice; and dissension will certainly arise amongst them.', 'sn': 'विदुर उवाच नाभिनन्दे नृपते प्रैषमेतं मैवं कृथाः कुलनाशाद् बिभेमि। देतच्छङ्के द्यूतकृते नरेन्द्र॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said O Khattwa, if fate be not unfavourable to me, this quarrel will not certainly grieve me. The whole universe moves at the will of its creator, but (it moves) under the controlling influence of Fate. It is not free.', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच नेह क्षत्तः कलहस्तप्स्यते मां न चेद् दैवं प्रतिलोमं भविष्यत्। धाग तु दिष्टस्य वशे किलेदं सर्वं जगच्चेष्टति न स्वतन्त्रतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Narada said O Yudhishthira, I shall now describe the assembly-hall of Yama, the son of Vaivasvata. O son of Pritha, it was built by Vishvakarma; hear all about it.', 'sn': 'नारद उवाच कथयिष्ये सभां याम्यां युधिष्ठिर निबोध ताम्। वैवस्वतस्य यां पार्थ विश्वकर्मा चकार ह॥'}

{'en': 'O king, that effulgent Sabha covers an area of one hundred Yojanas. O son of Pandu, it possesses the splendour of the sun; it yields every thing that one may desire to have from it. It is neither very cold nor very hot. It delights the heart.', 'sn': 'तैजसी सा सभा राजन् बभूव शतयोजना। विस्तारायामसम्पन्ना भूयसी चापि पाण्डव॥ अर्कप्रकाशा भ्राजिष्णुः सर्वतः कामरूपिणी। नातिशीता च चात्युष्णा मनसश्च प्रहर्षिणी॥'}

{'en': 'There is no grief, and no decrepitude, no hunger, no thirst; nor there was any thing disagreeable, nor there was any kind of wretchedness of distress. There can be no fatigue or any kind of evil-feelings in that Sabha.', 'sn': 'न शोको न जरा तस्यां क्षुत्पिपासे न चाप्रियम्। न च दैन्यं क्लमो वापि प्रतिकूलं न चाप्युत।।४।'}

{'en': 'O chastiser of foes, every object of desire, celestials or human, is to be found in that hall; all kinds of enjoyable articles as also sweet, juicy, agreeable and delicious things that are likeable, suckable or drinkable are all there in profusion. The garlands that are there are of the most delicious fragrance, and the trees that stand (around it) yield whatever fruits are desired.', 'sn': 'सर्वे कामाः स्थितास्तस्यां ये दिव्या ये च मानुषाः। सारवच्च प्रभूतं च भक्ष्यं भोज्यमरिंदम॥ लेह्यं चोष्यं च पेयं च हृद्यं स्वादु मनोहरम्। पुण्डगन्धाः स्रजस्तस्य नित्यं कामफला दुमाः॥'}

{'en': 'There are both cold and hot water, they are all sweet and agreeable. There sit holy royal sages and stainless Brahmana Rishis.', 'sn': 'रसवन्ति च तोयानि शीतान्युष्णानि चैव हि। तस्यां राजर्षयः पुण्यास्तथा ब्रह्मर्षयोऽमलाः॥'}

{'en': 'O child, they all cheerfully wait upon Yama, the son of Vaivasvata. Yayati, Nahusha, Puru, Mandhata, Somaka, Nriga.', 'sn': 'यमं वैवस्वतं तात प्रहृष्टाः पर्युपासते। ययातिनहुषः पूरुर्मान्धाता सोमको नृगः॥'}

{'en': 'The royal sage Trasadasyu, Kritavirya, Shrutashrava, Arishtanemi, Siddha, Kritavega, Kriti, Nimi, Pratardana, Shibi, Matsya, Prithulaksha, Brihadratha, Vartta, Marutta, Kushika, Sankashya, Sankriti, Dhruva, Chaturashva, Sadashvormi, the king Kirtavirya, Bharata, Shuratha, Sunitha, Nishatha, Nala, Devodasa, Sumana, Ambrisha, Bhagiratha, Vyashva, Sadashva, Badhyashva, Prithuvega, Prithushrava, Prishadashva, Vasumana, Kshupa, and Sumahabala, Rushadru, Vrishasena, Purukutsa, Dhvaji Rishi, Arshtishena, Dilipa, the high-souled Ushinara, Aushinari, Pundarika, Sharyati, Sharabha, Suchi, Anga, Arishta, Vena, Dushyania, Srinjaya, Jaya, Bhangasuri, Sunitha, Nishada, Vahinara, Karandhama, Valhika, Sudyumna, the powerful Madhu, Aila the powerful king of the earth Maruta, Kapotaroma, Trinaka, Sahadeva, Arjuna, Vyashva, Sashva, Krishashva, the king Shashabindu, the sons of Dasharatha Rama and Lakshmana, Pravardhana, Alarka, Kakshasena, Gaya, Gaurashva, the son of Jamadagni (Parashu) Rama, Nabhaga, Sagara, Bhuridyumna, Mahashva, Prithashva, Janaka, King Vaindhya, Varisena, Purujit, Janamejaya, Brahmadatta, Trigarta, the king Uparichara, Indradyumna, Bhimajanu, Gaurapristha, Nala, Goya, Padma, Muchukunda, Bhuridyumna, Prasenajit, Arishtanemi, Sudyumna, Prithulashva, Ashtaka, one hundred kings of the Matsya race, one hundred of the Nipa, and one hundred of the Gaya race.', 'sn': 'त्रसदस्युश्च राजर्षिः कृतवीर्यः श्रुतश्रवाः। अरिष्टनेमिः सिद्धश्च कृतवेगः कृतिर्निमिः॥ प्रतर्दनः शिबिर्मत्स्यः पृथुलाक्षो बृहद्रथः। वार्तो मरुत्तः कुशिकः सांकाश्यः सांकृतिव॒वः॥ चतुरश्वः सदश्वोर्मि: कार्तवीर्यश्च पार्थिवः। भरतः सुरथश्चैव सुनीथो निशद्दो नलः॥ दिवोदासश्च सुमना अम्बरीषो भगीरथः। व्यश्वः सदश्वो वध्यश्वः पृथुवेगः पृथुश्रवाः॥ पृषदश्वो वसुमनाः क्षुपश्च सुमहाबलः। रुषदुर्वृषसेनश्च पुरुकुत्सो ध्वजी रथी॥ आर्टिषेणो दिलीपश्च महात्मा चाप्युशीनरः। औशीनरिः पुण्डरीकः शर्यातिः शरभः शुचिः॥ अङ्गोऽरिष्टश्च वेनश्च दुष्यन्तः सृञ्जयो जयः। भाङ्गासुरिः सुनीथश्च निषधोऽथ वहीनरः॥ करन्धमो बाह्निक्श्च सुद्युम्नो बलवान् मधुः। ऐलो मरुत्तश्च तथा बलवान् पृथिवीपतिः॥ कपोतरोमा तृणकः सहदेवार्जुनौ तथा। व्यश्वः साश्वः कृशाश्वश्च शशाबिन्दुश्च पार्थिवः॥ राजा दशरथश्चैव ककुत्स्थोऽथ प्रवर्धनः। अलर्कः कक्षसेनश्च गयो गौराश्व एव च॥ जामदग्नयश्च रामश्च नाभागसगरौ तथा। भूरिद्युम्नो महाश्वश्च पृथाश्वो जनकस्तथा॥ राजा वैन्यो वारिसेनः पुरुजिज्जनमेजयः। ब्रह्मदत्तस्त्रिगर्तश्च राजोपरिचरस्तथा।॥ इन्द्रद्युम्नो भीमजानुलॊरपृष्ठोऽनघो लयः। पद्मोऽथ मुचुकन्दश्च भूरिद्युम्नः प्रसेनजित्॥ अरिष्टनेमिः सुद्युम्नः पृथुलाश्वोऽष्टकस्तथा। शतं मत्स्या नृपतयः शतं नीपाः शतं गयाः॥'}

{'en': 'One hundred kings of the name of Dhritarashtra, eighty of the name of Janamejaya, one hundred of the name of Brahmadatta, one of the name of Viri and Iri,', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्राश्चैकशतमशीतिर्जनमेजयाः। शतं च ब्रह्मदत्तानां वीरिणामीरिणां शतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Two hundred Bhishmas, one hundred Bhimas, one hundred Prativindhya, one hundred Nagas, and one hundred Hayas.', 'sn': 'भीष्माणां द्वे शतेऽप्यत्र भीमानां तु तथा शतम्। शतं च प्रतिविन्ध्यानां शतं नागाः शतं हयाः॥'}

{'en': 'One hundred Palashas, one hundred Kashas, and Kushas, the king of kings, Shantanu, your father Pandu.', 'sn': 'पलाशानां शतं ज्ञेयं शतं काशकुशादयः। शान्तनुश्चैव राजेन्द्र पाण्डुश्चैव पिता तव॥'}
{'en': 'Ushangava, Shataratha, Devaraja, Jayadratha, the wise royal sage Vrishadarbha with his ministers.', 'sn': 'उशङ्गवः शतरथो देवराजो जयद्रथः। वृषदर्भश्च राजर्षिर्बुद्धिमान् सह मन्त्रिभिः॥'}

{'en': 'One thousand others of the name of Shashabindu who have died after performing many great horse sacrifices with large Dakshinas;', 'sn': 'अथापरे सहस्राणि ये गताः शशबिन्दवः। इष्टवाश्वमेधैर्बहुभिर्महद्भिर्भूरिदक्षिणैः॥'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, these holly royal sages, all of great achievements and great knowledge of the Shastras, waited upon the of Vaivasvata, (Yama) in that assembly-hall.', 'sn': 'एते राजर्षयः पुण्याः कीर्तिमन्तो बहुश्रुताः। तस्यां सभायां राजेन्द्र वैवस्वतमुपासते॥'}

{'en': "Agastya, Matanga, Kala, Mrityu, the performers of sacrifices, the Sadhyas, Yogins, the Pitris, of the classes of Agnishvatta's Fenapa, Ushmapa, Svadhavana and Barhishada, and those other living Pitris.", 'sn': 'अगस्त्योऽथ मतङ्गश्च कालो मृत्युस्तथैव च। यज्वानश्चैव सिद्धाश्च ये च योगशरीरिणः॥ अग्निष्वात्ताश्च पितरः फेनपाश्चोष्मपाश्च ये। स्वधावन्तो बर्हिषदो मूर्तिमन्तस्तथापरे॥'}

{'en': 'The wheel of Time, the illustrious conveyor of sacrificial Ghee (Agni), all sinful men and those that died during winter solstice,', 'sn': 'कालचक्रं च साक्षाच्च भगवान् हव्यवाहनः। नरा दुष्कृतकर्माणो दक्षिणायनमृत्यवः॥'}
