{'en': 'Those officers of Yama who have been appointed to count the allotted days of every body and every thing, Shingshapalasha, Kasha, and Kusha trees and all plants in their spiritual form, o king, waited upon Dharmaraja (Yama). These and many others are the Savasadhas (members of the assembly-hall) of the king of the Pitris (Yama). am', 'sn': 'कालस्य नयने युक्ता यमस्य पुरुषाश्च ये। तस्यां शिंशपपालाशास्तथा काशकुशादयः। उपासते धर्मराजं मूर्तिमन्तो जनाधिप॥ एते चान्ये च बहवः पितृराजसभासदः। न शक्याः परिसंख्यातुं नामभिः कर्मभिस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'O son of Pritha, they are so numerous that unable to describe them, either mentioning them by their names or deeds. The Sabha is capable of going everywhere at will, it is wide of extent; it is beautiful. Vishvakarma has built it after long continued asceticism.', 'sn': 'असम्बाधा हि सा पार्थ रम्या कामगमा सभा। दीर्घकालं तपस्तत्वा निर्मिता विश्वकर्मणा॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, it is resplendent with its own effulgence. It is visited by the ascetics of severe penances, of excellent vows, of truthful speech, of pure and peaceful mind, and of heart sanctified by holy deeds, all of shining bodies and all attired in spotless robes,', 'sn': 'ज्वलन्ती भासमाना च तेजसा स्वेन भारत। तामुग्रतपसो यान्ति सुव्रताः सत्यवादिनः॥ शान्ताः संन्यासिनः शुद्धाः पूताः पुण्येन कर्मणा। सर्वे भास्वरदेहाश्च सर्वे च विरजोऽम्बराः॥'}

{'en': 'All adorned in bracelets and garlands, with ear-rings of burnished gold, and with their own holy acts and with the marks of their orders.', 'sn': 'चित्राङ्गदाचित्रमाल्याः सर्वे ज्वलितकुण्डलाः। सुकृतैः कर्मभिः पुण्यैः पारिबहेच भूषिताः॥'}

{'en': 'Many illustrious Gandharvas and many Apsaras fill all parts of it with both instrumental and vocal music, and with sounds of dances and laughter.', 'sn': 'गन्धर्वाश्च महात्मानः सङ्घशश्चाप्सरोगणाः। वादित्रं नृत्यगीतं य हास्यं लास्यं च सर्वशः॥'}

{'en': 'O son of Pritha, sacred perfumes and sweet sounds and the celestials garlands are all there in crowds.', 'sn': 'पुणायश्च गन्धाः शब्दाश्च तस्यां पार्थ समन्ततः। दिव्यानि चैव माल्यानि उपतिष्ठन्ति नित्यशः॥'}

{'en': 'Hundreds of thousand of virtuous men of celestials beauty and great wisdom always waits upon and worship the illustrious lord of all created beings.', 'sn': 'शतं शतसहस्राणि धर्मिणां तं प्रजेश्वरम्। उपासते महात्मानं रूपयुक्ता मनस्विनः॥'}

{'en': 'O king, such is the assembly-hall of the illustrious king of the Pitris (Yama). I shall now describe the Sabha of Varuna, named Pushkaramalini', 'sn': 'ईदृशी सा सभा राजन् पितृराज्ञो महात्मनः। वरुणस्यापि वक्ष्यामि सभां पुष्करमालिनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'Arjuna said What is the state, Krishna, of those that neglects the ordinance of the scriptures and perform sacrifices with faith? Is it one of Sattva, Raja or Tama?', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयाऽन्विताः। तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः॥'}

{'en': 'The great one said The faith of man is of three kinds. They are born according to his individual nature. They are also of Sattva, Raja, and Tama. Hear what they are.', 'sn': 'श्रीभगवानुवाच त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा। सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेतितां शृणु॥'}

{'en': 'The faith of man, O Bharata is according to his own nature. A man may be full of faith, and as his faith is so he will be.', 'sn': 'सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत। श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः॥'}

{'en': 'Those who are of the Sattva quality worship the celestial, those of Raja worship Yakshas and Rakshasas, and those of Tama do the same to departed spirits and ghosts.', 'sn': 'यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान् यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः। प्रेतान् भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः॥'}

{'en': 'Those who practice severe penances not ordained by the Vedas, who are full of hypocrisy and pride, desire, attachment and violence.', 'sn': 'अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः। दम्भाहंकारसंयुक्तः कामरागबलान्विताः॥'}

{'en': 'Who has no discernment, but who torture their physical organs, thereby torturing Me who seat within the body, should be known to be of demoniac nature.', 'sn': 'कर्शयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः। मां चैवान्तः शरीरस्थं तान् विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान्॥'}

{'en': 'Food which is dear to all is also of three kinds. Sacrifice, penance, and gifts are also of three kinds. Hear from Me their distinction, one', 'sn': 'आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः। यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु।॥'}

{'en': 'The food that increase longevity, energy, strength, health, and well-being and joy, and which is savoury, indigenous, and agreeable, is liked by men of Sattva nature.', 'sn': 'आयुः सत्त्ववलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः। रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः।।'}

{'en': 'The food which is bitter, sour, salted, overhot, pungent, dry and burning, and which produces pain, grief and disease, is desired by a man of Raja temperament.', 'sn': 'कट्वाललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः। आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः॥'}
{'en': 'The food which is cold, not savory, stinky, corrupt, filthy and a refuse, is liked by men of Tama.', 'sn': 'यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत्। उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sattva Sacrifice is which being prescribed by the Shastras, is performed by a man who desires no fruit from it, and who performs it by believing it to be only a duty.', 'sn': 'अफलाकाक्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते। यष्टव्यमेवेति मन: समाधाय स सात्त्विकः॥'}

{'en': 'But O chief son of Bharata, Raja Sacrifice is that which is performed in expectation of receiving fruits from it and for ostentatious show.', 'sn': 'अभिसंधाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत्। इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम्॥'}

{'en': 'And Tama sacrifice is that which is performed against the ordinances of the Shastras in which food is not distributed, Mantras are not recited, fees are not paid to the assisting priests and which is void of faith.', 'sn': 'विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम्। श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते॥'}

{'en': 'Reverence to Celestial, regenerate ones, preceptors, and learned men, and purity, uprightness, the practices of a Brahmachary, and abstention from injury, constitute the penance of body.', 'sn': 'देवदविजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम्। ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'The words that does not disturb any body and which is agreeable, true and beneficial, and the diligent study of the Vedas, is the penance of speech.', 'sn': 'अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत्। स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वारड्मयं तप उच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Serenity of mind, gentleness, taciturnity, self restraint, and purity of disposition, constitute the penance of mind.', 'sn': 'मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः। भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत् तपो मानसमुच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Now Sattva Penance is that in which this three-fold penance is performed with perfect faith, with devotion and without the desire for fruit.', 'sn': 'श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत् त्रिविधं नरैः। अफलार्काक्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते॥'}

{'en': 'Raja Penance is that which is performed with hypocrisy for gaining respect honour, and revenue, and which is unstable and transient.', 'sn': 'सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत्। क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम्॥'}

{'en': "Tama Penance is that which is performed under a deluded belief, and with torture of one's self, and for the destruction of another,", 'sn': 'मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत् पीडया क्रियते तपः। परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत् तामसमुदाहृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sattva gift is that which is given because it ought to be given; it is given to one who cannot return it in any way; it is given in a proper place, at a proper time, and to a proper person.', 'sn': 'दातव्यमिति यद् दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे। देशे काले च पात्रे च तद् दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Raja gift is that which is given reluctantly, for return of some sort of service or benefit, and with an eye to fruit.', 'sn': 'यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः। दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद् दानं राजसं स्मृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Tama gift is that which is given without respect and with contempt to an unworthy object in an improper place and at an improper time.', 'sn': 'अदेशकाले यद् दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते। श्रऊसत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत् तामसमुदाहृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Om, Tat, Sat, these are the threefold designation of Brahma. The Brahmanas, the Vedas and the Yajnas are all ordained in ancient time by Brahma.', 'sn': 'ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः। ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore, uttering the syllable, Om, all utterers of Brahma begin their sacrifices, fits and penances, as ordained in the Shastras.', 'sn': 'तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपः क्रियाः। प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Uttering TAT, the various sacrifices, gifts and penances are performed by those who desire emancipation, and who do not without expectation of fruit.', 'sn': 'तदित्यनभिसंधाय फलं यज्ञतप:क्रियाः। दानक्रियाश्च विविधा क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाक्षिभिः॥'}
{'en': 'Sat denotes existence and goodness, O Partha; it is used in any suspicious acts.', 'sn': 'सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत् प्रयुज्यते। प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते॥'}
{'en': 'Constancy in sacrifices, penances and gifts is also called SAT. For its sake an act is also called SAT.', 'sn': 'यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते। कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते॥'}

{'en': 'Whatever oblation is offered in a sacrifice, whatever is given away, whatever penance is performed, and whatever is done, if done without faith, is, O Partha the opposite of SAT. It (opposite of SAT) will do no good to the life in this world or hereafter in the next.', 'sn': 'अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत्। असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत् प्रेत्य नो इह॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said This Shishupala was born with three eyes and four hands in the dynasty of the kings of Chedi. As soon as he was born, he screamed and brayed like an ass.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच चेदिराजकुले जातस्त्र्यक्ष एष चतुर्भुजः। रासभारावसदृशं ररास च ननाद च॥'}

{'en': 'His father and mother along with all their relatives were struck with fear (on seeing this fearful phenomenon). seeing these evil omens, they resolved to abandon him.', 'sn': 'तेनास्य मातापितरौ त्रेसतुस्तौ सबान्धवौ। वैकृतं तस्य तौ दृष्ट्वा त्यागायाकुरुतां मतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'But at that time an invisible voice (thus) said to the king and his wife with their ministers and priest, all of whose hearts were paralysed by anxiety.', 'sn': 'ततः सभार्यं नृपतिं सामात्यं सपुरोहितम्। चिन्तासम्मूढहृदयं वागुवाचाशरीरिणी॥'}

{'en': 'The Voice said. O king, this your son, who has been (just) born, will become fortunate and superior in strength. Therefore you have no fear from him. Cherish this child without (any) anxiety.', 'sn': 'एष ते नृपतेः पुत्रः श्रीमाञ्जातो बलाधिकः। तस्मादस्मान्न भेतव्यमव्यगः पाहि वै शिशुम्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, he will not die. His time is not yet come. He that will kill him with weapons has also been born.', 'sn': 'न च वै तस्य मृत्युर्वै न कालः प्रत्युपस्थितः। मृत्युहन्तास्य शस्त्रेण स चोत्पन्नो नराधिप।॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said. Having heard these words, the mother becoming anxious by affection for her son, spoke thus to the invisible being.', 'sn': 'संश्रुत्योदाहृतं वाक्यं भूतमन्तर्हितं ततः। पुत्रस्नेहाभिसंतप्ता जननी वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': '"I bow with joined hands to him that has uttered these words regarding my son. Let him (the invisible being), whether he is an exalted god or any other being, tell me another word. I desire to hear who will be the slayer of this my son".', 'sn': 'येनेदमीरितं वाक्यं ममैतं तनयं प्रति। प्राञ्जलिस्तं नमस्यामि ब्रवीतु स पुनर्वचः॥ याथातथ्येन भगवान् देवो वा यदि वेतरः। श्रोतुमिच्छामि पुत्रस्य कोऽस्य मृत्युभविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'The invisible being then again said, "He, upon whose lap this child being taken, his extra arms will fall down on the ground like a pair of five headed snakes, and observing whom his third eyes on the forehead will disappear, will be his slayer." Having heard of the child\'s three eyes and five arms and also of the words of the invisible being.', 'sn': 'अन्तर्भूतं ततो भूतमुवाचेदं पुनर्वचः। यस्योत्सङ्गे गृहीतस्य भुजावभ्यधिकावुभौ॥ पतिष्यतः क्षितितले पञ्चशीर्षाविवोरगौ। तृतीयमेतद् बालस्य ललाटस्थं तु लोचनम्॥ निमज्जिष्यति यं दृष्ट्वा सोऽस्य मृत्युभविष्यति। त्र्यक्षं चतुर्भुजं श्रुत्वा तथा च समुदाहृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'All the kings of the world came to see him. The (Chedi) king worshipped the monarchs that came as each deserved.', 'sn': 'पृथिव्यां पार्थिवाः सर्वे अभ्यागच्छन् दिदृक्षवः। तान् पूजयित्वा सम्प्राप्तान् यथार्ह स महीपतिः॥'}

{'en': 'And gave his child upon their laps one after the other. Thus the child was placed on the laps of one thousand kings one after the other. But what was heard (from the invisible being) did not come to pass. having heard this (about the child) at Dvaravati, the two greatly powerful heroes.', 'sn': 'एकैकस्य नृपस्याङ्के पुत्रमारोपयत् तदा। एवं राजसहस्राणां पृथक्त्वेन यथाक्रमम्॥ शिशुरङ्कसमारूढो न तत् प्राप निदर्शनम्। एतदेव तु संश्रुत्य द्वारवत्यां महाबलौ॥'}

{'en': 'The Yadu princes, Sankarashans (Valadeva) and Janarddana (Krishna) went to the capital of the Chedi (king) to see their aunt, the princess of the Yadu race (the queen of the Chedi king).', 'sn': 'ततश्चेदिपुरं प्राप्तौ संकर्षणजनार्दनौ। यादवी यादवीं द्रष्टुं स्वसारं तौ पितुस्तदा॥'}

{'en': "Saluting every body according to his rank and saluting also the king and the queen and inquiring after every body's welfare, Rama and Keshava (Balaram and Krishna) took their seats.", 'sn': 'अभिवाद्य यथान्यायं यथाश्रेष्ठं नृपं च ताम्। कुशलानामयं पृष्ट्वा निषण्णौ रामकेशवौ।॥'}

{'en': 'When those two heroes were duly worshipped, the queen with great pleasure and joy herself placed the child on the lap of Damodara (Krishna).', 'sn': 'साभ्यर्च्य तौ तदा वीरौ प्रीत्या चाभ्यधिकं ततः। पुत्रं दामोदरोत्सङ्गे देवी संन्यदधात् स्वयम्॥'}

{'en': 'As soon as the child was placed on his lap, his extra arms fell down and the eye on his forehead disappeared.', 'sn': 'न्यस्तमात्रस्य तस्याङ्के भुजावभ्यधिकावुभौ। पेततुस्तच्च नयनं न्यमज्जत ललाटजम्॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing this, the queen became alarmed and aggrieved, she begged Krishna to grant her a boon. (She said), O mighty armed hero, I am afflicted with fear; grant me a boon.', 'sn': 'तद् दृष्ट्वा व्यथिता जस्ता वरं कृष्णमयाचत। दद व मे वरं कृष्ण भयार्ताया महाभुज॥'}

{'en': 'You are the assuager of all men afflicted with grief; you are the dispeller of every body\'s fear". Having been thus addressed, the : descendant of Yadu, Krishna replied.', 'sn': 'त्वं वार्तानां समाश्वासो भीतानामभयप्रदः। एवमुक्तस्ततः कृष्णः सोऽब्रवीद् यदुनन्दनः॥'}

{'en': '"O lady, do not be alarmed. O virtuous queen, you have no fear from me. O aunt, what boon shall I give you? What shall I do?', 'sn': 'मा भैस्त्वं देवि धर्मज्ञे न मत्तोऽस्ति भयं तव। ददामि कं वरं च करवाणि पितृष्वसः॥'}

{'en': 'Whether I am able or not, I shall do what you will say." Having been thus addressed, she thus spoke to the descendant of Yadu, Krishna.', 'sn': 'शक्यं वा यदि वाशक्यं करिष्यामि वचस्तव। एवमुक्ता ततः कृष्णमब्रवीद् यदुनन्दनम्॥'}

{'en': '"O greatly powerful hero, O best of the Yadu race, you will have to pardon for my sake the offence committed by Shishupala. O lord, know, this is the boon I ask”.', 'sn': 'शिशुपालस्यापराधान् क्षमेथास्त्वं महाबला मत्कृते यदुशार्दूल विद्ध्येनं मे वरं प्रभो॥'}

{'en': 'Krishna Said O Aunt, even when he will deserve to be killed, in such one hundred (occasions of) offences of this (Shishupala), I will pardon him. Do not be (therefore) aggrieved.', 'sn': 'श्रीकृष्ण उवाच अपराधशतं क्षाम्यं मया ह्यस्य पितृष्वसः। पुत्रस्य ते वधार्हस्य मा त्वं शोके मनः कृथाः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said. O Bhima, such is this wretch Shishupala, a king with a wicked heart. Being proud for the boon granted by Govinda (Krishna), he now calls you to battle.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच एवमेष नृपः पापः शिशुपालः सुमन्दधीः। त्वां समाह्वयते वीर गोविन्दवरदर्पितः॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Here the Pandavas and the Kurus, after finishing their sports and pleasure, returned to Hastinapur without Bhima.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततस्ते कौरवाः सर्वे विना भीमं च पाण्डवाः। वृत्तक्रीडाविहारास्तु प्रतस्थुर्गजसाह्वयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Some on horses, some on elephants and some preferring cars and other conveyances. They said, “Bhima must have gone before us." The wicked Duryodhana was glad not to see Bhima; and we entered the city with his brothers (in joy).', 'sn': 'स्थैर्गजैस्तथा चाश्चर्यानैश्चान्यैरनेकशः। ब्रुवन्तो भीमसेनस्तु यातो ह्यग्रत एव नः॥ ततो दुर्योधनः पापस्तत्रापश्यन् वृकोदरम्। भ्रातृभिः सहितो हृष्टां नगरं प्रविवेश ह॥'}

{'en': 'The virtuous minded Yudhisthira, himself being unacquainted with vice and wickedness considered others to be as honest as he himself was.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिरस्तु धर्मात्मा ह्यविदन् पापमात्मनि। स्वेनानुमानेन परं साधं समनुपश्यति॥'}

{'en': 'The son of Pritha, (Yudhisthira), full of filial love, went to his mother, Kunti and making obeisance to her he said, “Has Bhima come here?', 'sn': 'सोऽभ्युपेत्य तदा पार्थो मातरं भ्रातृवत्सलः। अभिवाद्याब्रवीत् कुन्तीमम्ब भीम इहागतः॥'}

{'en': 'O good mother, I do not see him here. Where has he gone? We sought for him long in the gardens and the woods. But we did not find Vrikodara any where. We thought in our mind that he had preceded us.', 'sn': 'क्व गतो भविता मातर्नेह पश्यामि तं शुभे। उद्यानानि वनं चैव विचितानि समन्ततः॥ तदर्थं न च तं वीरं दृष्टवन्तो वृकोदरम्। मन्यमानस्ततः सर्वे यातो नः पूर्वमेव सः॥'}

{'en': 'O illustrious lady, we have come here, our hearts being great anxiety. Coming here, where has he gone? Have you sent him any where?', 'sn': 'आगताः स्म महाभागे व्याकुलेनान्तरात्मना। इहागम्य क्व नु गतस्त्वया वा प्रेषितः क्व नु॥'}
{'en': 'O illustrious lady, O great one, tell me, I am full of doubts respecting the mighty hero, Bhima.', 'sn': 'कथयस्व महाबाहुं भीमसेनं यशस्विनि। न हि मे शुध्यते भावस्तं वीरं प्रति शोभने।॥'}

{'en': 'He was asleep and has not come, I believe Bhima is killed." Having been thus addressed by the intelligent son of Dharma (Yudhisthira), Kunti. Cried out "Alas! alas!" She then said to Yudhisthira in alarm, O son, I have not seen Bhima; he has not come to me.', 'sn': 'यतः प्रसुप्तं मन्येऽहं भीमं नेति हतस्तु सः। इत्युक्ता च ततः कुन्ती धर्मराजेन धीमता॥ हा हेति कृत्वा सम्भ्रान्ता प्रत्युवाच युधिष्ठिरम्। न पुत्र भीमं पश्यामि न मामभ्येत्यसाविति॥'}

{'en': 'Go soon with your brothers and make a careful search for him.” Having said this in sorrowful heart to her eldest son. Kunti summoned Kshatta (Vidura) and spoke to him thus, "O illustrious Kshatta, I do not see Bhimasena. Where is he gone!', 'sn': 'शीघ्रमन्वेषणे यत्नं कुरु तस्यानुजैः सह। इत्युक्त्वा तनयं ज्येष्ठं हृदयेन विदूयता॥ क्षत्तारमानाय्य तदा कुन्ती वचनमब्रवीत्। क्व गतो भगवन् क्षत्तर्भीमसेनो न दृश्यते॥'}

{'en': 'The others with all their brothers have returned from the gardens; only my mighty arined Bhima has not come.', 'sn': 'उद्यानान्निर्गताः सर्वे भ्रातरो भ्रातभिः सह। तत्रैकस्तु महाबाहुर्भीमो नाभ्येति मामिह॥'}

{'en': 'He is always in the evil look of Duryodhana. The Kurus are all wicked, narrow minded, covetous for sovereignty and impudent.', 'sn': 'न च प्रीणयते चक्षुः सदा दुर्योधनस्य सः। क्रूरोऽसौ दुर्मतिः क्षुद्रो राज्यलुब्धोऽनपत्रपः॥'}
{'en': 'They might have killed him in anger. Therefore, my mind is affected with anxiety and my heart burns.', 'sn': 'निहन्यादपि तं वीरं जातमन्युः सुयोधनः। तेन मे व्याकुलं चित्तं हृदयं दह्यतीव च॥'}

{'en': 'Vidura said : O blessed lady, do not say so. Protect the others (your sons) from the Kurus. It abused, the wicked minded (Duryodhana) may kill the rest (of your sons).', 'sn': 'विदुर उवाच मैवं वदस्व कल्याणि शेषसंरक्षणं कुरु। प्रत्यादिष्टो हि दुष्टात्मा शेषेऽपि प्रहरेत् तव॥'}

{'en': 'The great Rishi say that your sons would be long lived. (Therefore) that son (Bhima) will surely return and gladden your heart.', 'sn': 'दीर्घायुषस्तव सुता यथोवाच महामुनिः। आगमिष्यति ते पुत्रः प्रीति चोत्पादयिष्यति॥ तु'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Having said this, the learned Vidura went (back) to his house. Kunti with her sons lived in her house in (great) anxiety.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्त्वा ययौ विद्वान् विदुरः स्वं निवेशनम्। कुन्ती चिन्तापरा भूत्वा सहासीना सुतैर्गृहे॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandava (Bhima) awoke from his sleep on the eight days and he left himself strong beyond measure by digesting that Rasa (ambrosia).', 'sn': 'ततोऽष्टमे दिवसे प्रत्यबुध्यत पाण्डवः। तस्मिंस्तदा रसे जीर्णे सोऽप्रमेयबलो बली।॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing the Pandava (Bhima) awake the snakes consoled and cheered him and they spoke to him thus.', 'sn': 'तं दृष्ट्वा प्रतिबुध्यन्तं पाण्डवं ते भुजङ्गमाः। सान्त्वयामासुरव्यग्रा वचनं चेदमब्रुवन्॥'}

{'en': 'O mighty armed hero, the strength giving Rasa (liquor) which you have drunk will give you the strength of ten thousand elephants and you will be invincible in battle.', 'sn': 'यत् ते पीतो महाबाहो रसोऽयं वीर्यसम्भृतः। तस्मान्नागायुतबलो रणेऽधृष्यो भविष्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Kuru race, bathe in this sacred and auspicious water and return home. Your brothers are disconsolate for your absence.', 'sn': 'गच्छाद्य त्वं च स्वगृहं स्नातो दिव्यैरिमै लैः। भ्रातरस्तेऽनुतप्यन्ति त्वां विना कुरुपुङ्गव॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the mighty armed (hero) became purified by a bath and decked himself with white garments and with white flowery garlands. He ate the Paramanya offered to him by the powerful Nagas. Then being adored and blessed by the Naga hero, the Pandava (Bhima), decked with various celestial ornaments, rose from the nether regions.', 'sn': 'ततः स्नातो महाबाहुः शुचिः शुल्काम्बस्रजः। ततो नागस्य भवने कृतकौतुकमङ्गलः॥ ओषधीभिर्विषघ्नीभिः सुरभीभिर्विशेषतः। भुक्तवान् परमान्नं च नागैर्दत्तं महाबलः॥'}

{'en': 'That chastiser of foes (Bhima) rose from the abode of the Nagas in delightful heart. The lotus eyed (hero), being upraised by the Nagas from the water, was placed in the self same gardens, where he had been sporting. They then vanished in his own sight.', 'sn': 'पूजितो भुजगैर्वीरं आशीभिश्चाभिनन्दितः। दिव्याभरणसंछन्नो नागानामन्त्र्य पाण्डवः॥ उदतिष्ठत् प्रहृष्टात्मा नागलोकादरिंदमः। उत्क्षिप्तः स तु नागेन जलाज्जलरुहेक्षणः॥ तस्मिन्नेव वनोद्देशे स्थापितः कुरुनन्दनः। ते चान्तर्दधिरे नागाः पाण्डवस्यैव पश्यतः॥'}
{'en': 'The powerful Bhima, the son of Kunti, being thus arisen, ran to his mother with all speed.', 'sn': 'तत उत्थाय कौन्तयो भीमसेनो महाबलः। आजगाम महाबाहुर्मातुरन्तिकमञ्जसा॥'}
{'en': 'Saluting her and his eldest brother, that chastiser of foes smelt the heads of his younger brothers.', 'sn': 'ततोऽभिवाद्य जननी ज्येष्ठं भ्रातरमेव च। कनीयसः समानाय शिरःस्वरिविमर्दनः॥'}

{'en': 'He was embraced by his mother and by every one of those best of men. In filial love for one another they then exclaimed, “What joy! What great joy!"', 'sn': 'तैश्चापि सम्परिष्वक्तः सह मात्रा नरर्षभैः। अन्योन्यगतसौहार्दाद् दिष्ट्या दिष्ट्येति चाब्रुवन्॥'}
{'en': 'Everything about the villainy of Duryodhana was told to his brothers by the greatly powerful Bhima.', 'sn': 'ततस्तत् सर्वमाचष्ट दुर्योधनविचेष्टितम्। भ्रातृणां भीमसेनश्च महाबलपराक्रमः॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandava (Bhima) told them in detail all about the lucky and unlucky incidents that befell him in the region of the Nagas.', 'sn': 'नागलोके च यद् वृत्तं गुणदोषमशेषतः। तच्च सर्वमशेषेण कथयामास पाण्डवः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, king Yudhisthira spoke to Bhima these words of great import, “Keep your silence. Do not speak it out to any one in any way.', 'sn': 'ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा भीममाह वचोऽर्थवत्। तूष्णीं भव न ते जल्प्यमिदं कार्यं कथंचन॥'}

{'en': 'sons of Kunti, you should protect one another with great care from this day.” having said this, the mighty armed Dharmaraja Yudhisthira.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा महाबाहुर्धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः। भ्रातृभिः सहितः सर्वैरप्रमत्तोऽभवत् तदा॥'}

{'en': 'With all his brothers, became very vigilant from that day. And the virtuous minded Vidura gave the sons of Pritha (the Pandavas) good counsels.', 'sn': 'सारथिं चास्य दयितमपहस्तेन जनिवान्। धर्मात्मा विदुरस्तेषां पार्थानां प्रददौ मतिम्॥'}

{'en': "Some time after, Duryodhana again mixed (with Bhima's food) poison which was fresh, virulent, fearful, hair stirring and deadly.", 'sn': 'भोजने भीमसेन्स्य पुनः प्राक्षेपयद् विषम्। कालकूटं नवं तीक्ष्णं सम्भृतं लोमहर्षणम्॥'}

{'en': 'The son of the Vaishya women (their cousin Yuyutsu), being desirous of doing good to the sons of Pritha, informed them of it; but Vrikodara (Bhima) ate it and digested it.', 'sn': 'वैश्यापुत्रस्तदाचष्ट पार्थानां हितकाम्यया। तच्चापि भुक्त्वाजरयदविकारं वृकोदरः॥'}

{'en': 'Through that poison was greatly virulent, though it was intended for killing Bhima, it produced no effects on Bhima; he digested it.', 'sn': 'विकारं न ह्यजनयत् सुतीक्ष्णमपि तद् विषम्। भीमसंहनने भीमे अजीर्यत वृकोदरे॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, Duryodhana, Karna and the son of Subala (Shakuni) adopted numerous other means to kill that Pandava (Bhima).', 'sn': 'एवं दुर्योधनः कर्णः शकुनिश्चापि सौबलः। अनेकैरभ्युपायैस्ताञ्जिघांसन्ति स्म पाण्डवान्॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandavas, though they were aware of all this, did express no indignation as advised by Vidura.', 'sn': 'पाण्डवाश्चापि तत् सर्वं प्रत्यजानन्नमर्षिताः। उद्भावनमकुर्वन्तो विदुरस्य मते स्थिताः॥'}

{'en': "King Dhritrasthra to search Kripacharya born of race of Gautama, who was originated from arrows for giving the education of their Kumar's engaged in playing and impertinent. Accepting them as a preceptor they handed over Kumar's of Kuru race to him. They started the teaching of Dhanurveda (archery). were", 'sn': 'कुमारान् क्रीडमानांस्तान् दृष्ट्वा राजातिदुर्मदान्। गुरुं शिक्षार्थमन्विष्य गौतमं तान् न्यवेदयत्॥ शरस्तम्बे समुद्भूतं वेदशास्त्रार्थपारगम्। अधिजग्मुश्च कुरवो धनुर्वेदं कृपात् तु ते॥'}

{'en': "Janamejaya said On the eye the great battle (between the Kurus and the Pandus) Rama, with Keshava's permission, had left Dwaraka accompanied by many of the Vrishnis.", 'sn': 'जनमेजय उवाच पूर्वमेव यदा रामस्तस्मिन् युद्ध उपस्थिते। आमन्त्र्य केशवं यातो वृष्णिभिः सहितः प्रभुः॥'}

{'en': 'He had said to Keshava-"I will help neither the son of Dhritarashtra nor the sons of Pandu, but will go wherever I like."', 'sn': 'साहाय्यं धार्तराष्ट्रस्य न च कर्तास्मि केशव। न चैव पाण्डुपुत्राणां गमिष्यामि यथागतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having said so, Rama that subduer of enemies, had gone away. O Brahmana, tell me everything about his return.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा तदा रामो यातः क्षत्रनिबर्हणः। तस्य चागमनं भूयो ब्रह्मशंसितुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'Tell me in full how Rama came there and how he witnessed the battle. Indeed you are a skillful narrator.', 'sn': 'आख्याहि मे विस्तरशः कथं राम उपस्थितः। कथं च दृष्ट्वान् युद्धं कुशलो ह्यसि सत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said After the great Pandavas had taken up their post at Upaplavya, they sent Krishna to Dhritarashtra for the object of peace, O mighty-armed one and for the behoof of all creatures.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच उपप्लव्ये निविष्टेषु पाण्डवेषु महात्मसु। प्रेषितो धृतराष्ट्रस्य समीपं मधुसूदनः॥ शमं प्रति महाबाहो हितार्थं सर्वदेहिनाम्।'}
{'en': 'Having gone to Hastinapura and met Dhritarashtra, Keshava spoke whole-some and sincere words.', 'sn': 'स गत्वा हास्तिनपुरं धृतराष्ट्र समेत्य च॥ उक्त्वान् वचनं तथ्यं हितं चैव विशेषतः।'}

{'en': 'The king, however, as I have told you before did not pay heed to his advice. Unable to secure peace, the mighty-armed Krishna, The foremost of men, returned, O king, to Upaplavya.', 'sn': 'न च तत् कृतवान् राजा यथा ख्यातं हि तत् पुरा॥ अनवाप्य शमं तज्ञ कृष्णः पुरुषसत्तमः। आगच्छत महाबाहुरुपप्लव्यं जनाधिप॥'}

{'en': "Dismissed by Dhritarashtra's son Krishna came back and upon the failure of his mission, O foremost of kings, said to the Pandavas.", 'sn': 'ततः प्रत्यागतः कृष्णो धार्तराष्ट्रविसर्जितः। अक्रियायां नरव्याघ्र पाण्डवानिदमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Urged by fate, the Kauravas have disregarded my words. Come, O sons of Pandu, with me, under the constellation Pushya.', 'sn': 'न कुर्वन्ति वचो मह्यं कुरवः कालनोदिताः। निर्गच्छध्वं पाण्डवेयाः पुष्येण सहिता मया॥'}

{'en': 'After this, while the troops of both parties were being collected and arrayed, the great son of Rohini, that foremost of all powerful persons, said to his brother Krishna.', 'sn': 'ततो विभज्यमानेषु बलेषु बलिनां वरः। प्रोवाच भ्रातरं कृष्णं रौहिणेयो महामनाः॥'}

{'en': '"O mighty-armed one, O slayer of Madhu, let us help the Kurus.” Krishna, however, did not pay heed to those words of his.', 'sn': 'तेषामपि महाबाहो साहाय्यं मधुसूदन। क्रियतामिति तत् कृष्णो नास्य चक्रे वचस्तदा॥'}

{'en': "Enraged at this, that illustrious son of Yadu's race, viz., the wielder of the plough, then started on a pilgrimage of the Sarasvati.", 'sn': 'ततो मन्युपरीतात्मा जगाम यदुनन्दनः। तीर्थयात्रां हलधरः सरस्वत्यां महायशाः॥'}

{'en': 'Accompanied by all the Yadavas, he set out under the conjunction of the asterism called Maitra. The Bhoja chief (Kritavarman), however, took the side O Duryodhana. Accompanied by Yuyudhana, Vasudeva took that of the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'मैत्रनक्षत्रयोगे स्म सहित: सर्वयादवैः। आश्रयामास भोजस्तु दुर्योधनमरिंदमः॥ युयुधानेन सहितो वासुदेवस्तु पाण्डवान्।'}

{'en': 'After the heroic son of Rohini had started under the constellation Pushya, the slayer of Madhu, placing the Pandavas in his van, went against the Kurus.', 'sn': 'रौहिणेये गते शूरे पुष्येण मधुसूदनः॥ पाण्डवेयान् पुरस्कृत्य ययावभिमुखः कुरून्।'}

{'en': 'While proceeding, Rama ordered his servants on the way, saying-"Bring all the necessary articles of use for a pilgrimage. Bring the sacred fire that is at Dwaraka and our priests.', 'sn': 'गच्छन्नेव पथिस्थस्तु रामः प्रेष्यानुवाच ह॥ सम्भारांस्तीर्थयात्रायां सर्वोपकरणानि च। आनयध्वं द्वारकायामग्नीन् वै याजकांस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'Bring gold, silver, kine, robes, horses, elephants, cars, mules, camels and other beasts of burden.', 'sn': 'सुवर्णं रजतं चैव धेनूर्वासांसि वाजिनः। कुञ्जरांश्च रथांश्चैव खरोष्ट्रं वाहनानि च॥'}

{'en': 'Being all these necessaries for a sojourn to the sacred waters and proceed quickly towards the Sarasvati.', 'sn': 'क्षिप्रमानीयतां सर्वं तीर्थहेतोः परिच्छदम्। प्रतिस्रोतः सरस्वत्या गच्छध्वं शीघ्रगामिनः॥'}

{'en': "Bring also some priests for the performance of a special rite and hundreds and hundreds of best Brahmanas.” Having given these orders to the servants, powerful Baladeva started on a pilgrimage at that time of great danger to the Kurus. Setting out towards the Sarasvati, he visited all the sacred shrines along her course, accompanied by priests, friends and many leading Brahmanas, as also with cars and elephants and horses and servants, O best of Bharata's race and with many vehicles drawn by kine and mules and camels.", 'sn': 'ऋत्विजश्चानयध्वं वै शतशश्च द्विजर्षभान्। एवं संदिश्य तु प्रेष्यान् बलदेवो महाबलः॥ तीर्थयात्रां ययौ राजन् कुरूणां वैशसे तदा। सरस्वती प्रतिस्रोतः समन्तादभिजग्मिवान्॥ ऋत्विग्भिश्च सुहृद्धिश्च तथान्यैर्द्विजसत्तमैः। स्थैर्गजैस्तताश्चैश्च प्रेष्यैश्च भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'Various sorts of necessaries of life were distributed profusely in various countries amongst the weary and worn, children and the old, in response, O king, to their prayers.', 'sn': 'गोखरोष्ट्रप्रयुक्तैश्च यानैश्च बहुभिर्वृतः। श्रान्तानां कान्तवपुषां शिशूनां विपुलायुषाम्॥'}

{'en': "Everywhere, O king, Brahmanas were sumptuously fed with whatever they wanted. At the command of Rohini's son, men, at different stages of the journey, stocked sufficient food and drink.", 'sn': 'देशे देशे तु देयानि दानानि विविधानि च। अर्चायै चार्थिना राजन् क्लृप्तानि बहुशस्तथा।२४॥ तानि यानीह देशेषु प्रतीक्षन्ति स्म भारत। बुभुक्षितानामर्थाय क्लृप्तमन्नं समन्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Costly garments and bedsteads and coverlets were distributed amongst the Brahmanas desirous of ease and comfort. Whatever a Brahmana or Kshatriya wanted, it was given to him.', 'sn': 'यो यो यत्र द्विजो भोज्यं भोक्तुं कामयते तदा। तस्य तस्य तु तत्रैवमुपजह्वस्तदा नृप॥ तत्र तत्र स्थिता राजन् रौहिणेयस्य शासनात्। भक्ष्यपेयस्य कुर्वन्ति राशींस्तत्र समन्ततः॥'}

{'en': "The party thus proceeded with great happiness and lived happily. Balarama's suite gave away vehicles to persons desirous of making journeys, drinks to them that were thirsty and rich food to them that were hungry, as also raiments and ornaments, O best of Bharata's race, to many.", 'sn': 'वासांसि च महार्हाणि पर्यङ्कास्तरणानि च। पूजार्थं तत्र क्लृप्तानि विप्राणं सुखमिच्छताम्॥ यत्र यः स्वपते विप्रो यो वा जागर्ति भारत। तत्र तत्र तु तस्यैव सर्वं क्लृप्तमदृश्यत॥ यथासुखं जन: सर्वो याति तिष्ठति वै तदा। यातुकामस्य यानानि पानानि तृषितस्य च॥ बुभुक्षितस्य चान्नानि स्वादूनि भरतर्षभ। उपज रास्तत्र वस्त्राण्याभरणानि च।॥'}

{'en': 'The road, O king, along which the party proceeded, looked resplendent, was comfortable for all and resembled heaven itself.', 'sn': 'स पन्थाः प्रवभौ राजन् सर्वस्यैव सुखावहः। स्वर्गोपमस्तदा वीर नराणां तत्र गच्छताम्।'}

{'en': 'There were rejoicings everywhere and rich food was procurable everywhere. There were shops and stalls and various objects were kept there for sale. The entire way was thronged with human beings. And it was decorated with various kinds of trees and creatures and various kinds of gems.', 'sn': 'नित्यप्रमुदितोपतेः स्वादुभक्ष्यः शुभान्वितः॥ विपण्यापणपण्यानां नानाजनशतैर्वृतः। नानाद्रुमलतोपेतो नानारत्नविभूषितः॥'}

{'en': 'The great Baladeva, observing rigid vows, distributed amongst the Brahmanas profuse wealth and plentiful sacrificial presents, O king, at various sacred spots.', 'sn': 'ददौ द्विजेभ्यः क्रतुदक्षिणाश्च यदुप्रवीरो हलभृत् प्रतीतः॥ ततो महात्मा नियमे स्थितात्मा पुण्येषु तीर्थेषु वसूनि राजन्।'}

{'en': "That chief of Yadu's race also distributed thousands of milch kine covered with excellent cloths and having their horns coated with gold, many horses born in different countries, many vehicles and many beautiful slaves.", 'sn': 'दोग्ध्रीश्च धेनूश्च सहस्रशो वै सुवाससः काञ्चनबद्धशृङ्गीः। हयांश्च नानाविधदेशजातान् यानानि दासांश्च शुभान् द्विजेभ्यः॥'}

{'en': 'Balarama also distributed to the foremost of the Brahmanas, the gems, garlands, diamonds, pure gold and silver and utensil made of iron copper.', 'sn': 'प्यग्र्यं सुवर्ण रजतं सुसुद्धम्। अयस्मयं ताम्रमयं च भाण्डं ददौ द्विजातिप्रवरेषु रामः॥'}

{'en': 'Thus did the great Rama distribute wealth in various sacred shrines on the Sarasvati. In course of his travels, that noble hero of matchless power at last came to Kurukshetra.', 'sn': 'एवं स वित्तं प्रददौ महात्मा सरस्वतीतीर्थवरेषु भूरि। स्तत: कुरुक्षेत्रमुदारवृत्तिः॥'}

{'en': 'Janamejaya said Describe to me, O foremost of men, the characteristics, the origin and the merits of the several Tirthas on the Sarasvati and the rites to be performed while going there.', 'sn': 'जनमेजय उवाच सारस्वतानां तीर्थानां गुणोत्पात्त वदस्व मे। फलं च द्विपदां श्रेष्ठ कर्मनिर्वृत्तिमेव च॥'}

{'en': 'Tell me these, in their order, O illustrious man. My curiosity is not to be satisfied, O foremost of all persons conversant with the knowledge of Brahman.', 'sn': 'यथाक्रमेण भगवंस्तीर्थानामनुपूर्वशः। ब्रह्मन् ब्रह्मविदां श्रेष्ठ परं कौतूहलं हि मे॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said The account of the characteristics and origin of all these Tirthas, O king, is very lengthy. I shall, however, describe them to you. Listen to that sacred account, O king.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच तीर्थानां च फलं राजन् गुणोत्पत्तिं च सर्वशः। मयोच्यमानं वै पुण्यं शृणु राजेन्द्र कृत्स्नशः॥'}

{'en': 'Accompanied by his priests and friends, Baladeva first went to the Tirthas called Prabhasa. There, the Lord of the asterism (viz., Soma), who had been suffering from phthisis, was freed from his disease. Regaining energy there, O king, be now lights up the universe. And because that foremost of Tirthas on Earth had formerly invested Soma again with effulgence, it is, therefore, called Prabhasa.', 'sn': 'पूर्वं महाराज यदुप्रवीर ऋत्विकसुहृद् विप्रगणैश्च सार्धम्। पुण्यं प्रभासं समुपाजगाम यत्रोडुराड् यक्ष्मणा विश्यमानः॥ विमुक्तशापः पुनराप्य तेजः सर्वं जगद् भासयते नरेन्द्र। एवं तु तीर्थप्रवरं पृथिव्यां प्रभासनात् तस्य ततः प्रभासः॥'}

{'en': 'Janamejaya said "For what was the worshipful Soma afflicted with phthisis? How also did he bathe in that tirtha? How did he, having bathed in that sacred water, regain his lost power? Describe it to me fully, O great Muni.', 'sn': 'जनमेजय उवाच कथं तु भगवान् सोमो यक्ष्मणा समगृह्यत। कथं च तीर्थप्रवरे तस्मिंश्चन्द्रो न्यमन्जत॥ कथमाप्लुत्य तस्मिंस्तु पुनराप्यायितः शशी। एतन्मे सर्वमाचक्ष्व विस्तरेण महामुने॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said Daksha had twenty seven daughters, O king. There he gave away (in marriage) unto Soma.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच दक्षस्य तनयास्तात प्रादुरासन् विशाम्पते। स सप्तविंशति कन्या दक्षः सोमाय वै ददौ॥'}

{'en': 'Connected with the several constellations, those wives, O king, of Soma of glorious deeds, served to help men in calculating time.', 'sn': 'नक्षत्रयोगनिरताः संख्यानार्थं च ताभवन्। पल्यो वै तस्य राजेन्द्र सोमस्य शुभकर्मणः॥'}

{'en': 'Endued with large eyes, all of them were peerless in beauty in the world. In beauty however, Rohini excelled them all.', 'sn': 'तास्तु सर्वा विशालाक्ष्यो रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि। अत्यात्यत तासां तु रोहिणी रूपसम्पदा॥'}

{'en': 'The worshipful Soma took great fancy for her. She was very much liked by him and therefore, he enjoyed the pleasures of her company alone.', 'sn': 'ततस्तस्यां स भगवान् प्रीतें चक्रे निशाकरः। साऽस्य हृद्या बभूवाथ तस्मात् तां बुभुजे सदा॥'}

{'en': 'Formerly, O king, Soma lived long with Rohini exclusively. For this, those other wives of his, the constellations, became displeased with that high-souled one.', 'sn': 'पुरा हि सोमो राजेन्द्र रोहिण्यामवसत् परम्। ततस्ताः कुपिताः सर्वा नक्षत्राख्या महात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'Going to their father Daksha, that Lord of creation, they said to him-"Soma does not live with us. He always lives with Rohini only.', 'sn': 'ता गत्वा पितरं प्राहुः प्रजापतिमतन्द्रिताः। सोमो वसति नास्मासु रोहिणी भजते सदा॥'}
{'en': 'All of us, therefore, O Lord of creatures, shall live in your house practising austere penances."', 'sn': 'ता वयं सहिताः सर्वास्त्वत्सकाशे प्रजेश्वर। वत्स्यामो नियताहारस्तपश्चरणतत्पराः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing those words of theirs, Daksha saw Soma and said to him, ""Treat all your wives equally. Do not commit a great sin."', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा तासां तु वचनं दक्षः सोममथाब्रवीत्। समं वर्तस्व भार्यासु मा त्वाऽधर्मो महान् स्पृशेत्।। ५२'}

{'en': 'And Daksha then said to those daughters of his-"Go, all of you, to Shashin. At my command, he, surnamed Chandramas, will treat you all equally,"', 'sn': 'तास्तु सर्वाऽब्रवीद् दक्षो गच्छध्वं शशिनोऽन्तिकम्। समं वत्स्यति सर्वासु चन्द्रमा मम शासनात्॥'}

{'en': 'Dismissed by him, they then proceeded to the house of him having cool rays. Still the worshipful Soma, O king, behaved as before, for pleased with Rohini alone, he always lived in her company.', 'sn': 'विसृष्टास्तास्तथा जग्मुः शीतांशुभवनं तदा। तथापि सोमो भगवान् पुनरेव महीपते॥ रोहिणी निवसत्येव प्रीयमाणो मुहुर्मुहुः।'}

{'en': 'His other wives then once more came to the abode of their father and said to him-"Serving you, we will live under your protection. Soma does not live with us and does not obey your commands."', 'sn': 'ततस्ताः सहिताः सर्वा भूयः पितरमब्रुवन्॥ तव शुश्रूषणे युक्ता वत्स्यामो हि तवान्तिके। सोमो वसति नास्मासु नाकरोद् वचनं तव॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing those words of theirs, Daksha once more said to Soma-"Treat all your wives equally. Let me not, O Virochana, curse you."', 'sn': 'तासां तद् वचनं श्रुत्वा दक्षः सोममथाब्रवीत्। समं वर्तस्व भार्यासु मा त्वां शप्स्ये विरोचन॥'}

{'en': 'Disregarding, however, the behest of Daksha, the worshipful Soma continued to live with Rohini alone. At this, his other wives became once more angry.', 'sn': 'अनादृत्य तु तद् वाक्यं दक्षस्य भगवाशशी। रोहिण्या सार्धमवसत् ततस्ताः कुपिताः पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'Going to their father, they bowed to him by lowering their heads and said-"Soma does not live with us. Give us shelter.', 'sn': 'गत्वा च पितरं प्राहुः प्रणम्य शिरसा तदा। सोमो वसति नास्मासु तस्मान्नः शरणं भव॥'}

{'en': 'The worshipful Chandramas always lives with Rohini exclusively. He does not value your words and does not wish to love us. Therefore, save us so that Soma may accept us all.', 'sn': 'रोहिण्यामेव भगवान् सदा वसति चन्द्रमाः। न त्वद्वचो गणयति नास्मासु स्नेहमिच्छति॥ तस्मान्नस्त्राहि सर्वा वै यथानः सोम आविशेत्।'}

{'en': 'Hearing those words, the worshipful Daksha, O king, became angry and imprecated the curse of phthisis upon Some. Thus did that disease affect the king of stars.', 'sn': 'तच्छ्रुत्वा भगवान् क्रुद्धो यक्ष्माणां पृथिवीपते॥ ससर्ज रोषात् सोमाय त चोडुपतिमाविशत्।'}

{'en': 'Afflicted with phthisis, the moon began to waste away day by day. He tried much to get rid of that disease by celebrating various sacrifices, O king. The Moon, however, could not free hiinself from that curse. On the other hand, hi daily grew lean and emaciated.', 'sn': 'स यक्ष्मणाभिभूतासमाक्षीयताहरहः शशी॥ यत्नं चाप्यकरोद् राजन् मोक्षार्थं तस्य यक्ष्मणः। इष्टवेभिर्महाराज विविधाभिर्निशाकरः॥ न चामुच्यत शापाद् वै क्षयं चैवाभ्यगच्छत्।'}

{'en': 'On account, of the wasting of Soma the deciduous herbs failed to grow, Their juices dried up they became tasteless and all of them lost their virtues.', 'sn': 'ततः सोमे ओषध्यो न प्रजज्ञिरे॥ निरास्वादरसाः सर्वा हतवीर्याश्च सर्वशः।'}

{'en': 'And on account of the absence of the deciduous herbs, living creatures also began to die. Indeed, owing to the wasting of Soma, all creatures grew emaciated.', 'sn': 'ओषधीनां क्षये जाते प्राणिनामपि संक्षयः॥ कृशाश्चासन् प्रजाः सर्वाः क्षीयमाणे निशाकरे।'}

{'en': 'Then all the celestials, approaching Soma, O king, asked him, saying-"Why is it that your form is not so beautiful and resplendent as before? Tell us whence has originated this great calamity.', 'sn': 'ततो देवाः समागम्य सोममूचुर्महीपते॥ किमिदं भवतो रूपमीदृशं न प्रकाशते। कारणं ब्रूहि नः सर्वं येनेदं ते महद् भयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing your answer, we shall do what is needed for removing your fear.” Thus addressed the god, having the hare for his mark, replied to them and informed them of the cause of the curse and of the phthisis with which he was attacked.', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा तु वचनं त्वत्तो विधास्यामस्ततो वयम्। एवमुक्तः प्रत्युवाच सर्वांस्ताशशलक्षणः॥ शापस्य लक्षणं चैव यक्ष्माणं च तथाऽऽत्मनः। देवास्तथा वचः श्रुत्वा गत्वा दक्षमथाब्रुवन्॥'}

{'en': 'Having heard those words the celestials repaired to Daksha and said-"Be pleased O worship one, with Soma. Withdrew your this curse.', 'sn': 'प्रसीद भगवन् सोमे शापोऽयं विनिवर्त्यताम्। असौ हि चन्द्रमाः क्षीणः किञ्चिच्छेषो हि लक्ष्यते॥७०'}

{'en': 'The Moon is very emaciated. Only a small portion of his body is seen. On account of his wasting, O Lord of the celestials, all creatures also are wasting. Creepers and herbs of various sorts are also wasting.', 'sn': 'क्षयाचैवास्य देवेश प्रजाश्चैव गताः क्षयम्। वीरुदोषधयश्चैव बीजानि विविधानि च॥'}

{'en': 'By their waste we ourselves also are suffering emaciation. Without us, what will this some universe be. Knowing this, O lord of the universe, it behoves you to be pleased with Soma."', 'sn': 'तेषां क्षये क्षयोऽस्माकं विनाऽस्मभिर्जगच किम्। इति ज्ञात्वा लोकगुरो प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed, Daksha, that Lord of creatures, said:-"It is impossible to make my words prove otherwise.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तस्ततो देवान् प्राह वाक्यं प्रजापतिः। नैतच्छक्यं मम वचो व्यावर्तयितुमन्यथा॥'}

{'en': 'By contrivance, however, O celestials, by words may be withdrawn. Let the moon treat his wives equally.', 'sn': 'हेतुना तु महाभाग निवर्तिष्यति केनचित्। समं वर्ततु सर्वासु शशी भार्यासु नित्यशः॥'}

{'en': 'Having bathed also in that foremost of tirthas on the Sarasvati, the hare-embalmed god shall regain his strength. These words of mine are true.', 'sn': 'सरस्वत्या वरे तीर्थे उन्मजशशलक्षणः। पुनर्वर्धिष्यते देवास्तद् वै सत्यं वचो मम॥'}

{'en': 'For half the month Soma shall decrease every day and for half the month following he will increase daily. These words of mine are true.', 'sn': 'मासार्धं च क्षयं सोमो नित्यमेव गमिष्यति। मासार्धं तु सदा वृद्धिं सत्यमेतद् वचो मम॥'}

{'en': 'Proceeding to the western ocean at the spot where the Sarasvati joins the ocean that vast repository of waters, let him worship that God of gods Mahadeva there. He will then regain his from and beauty."', 'sn': 'समुद्रं पश्चिमं गत्वा सरस्वत्यब्धिसङ्गमम्। आराधयतु देवेशं ततः कान्तिमवाप्स्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Thus commanded by the Rishi Daksha, Soma then proceeded to the Sarasvati. He reached the greatest of tirthas called Prabhasa belonging to the Sarasvati.', 'sn': 'सरस्वती ततः सोमः स जगामर्षिशासनात्। प्रभासं प्रथमं तीर्थं सरस्वत्या जगाम ह॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing there on the day of the new moon, that god of great energy and great effulgence women regained his cool rays and began again to lleum the universe.', 'sn': 'अमावास्यां महातेजास्तत्रोन्मजन् महाद्युतिः। लोकान् प्रभासयामास शीतंशुत्वमवाप च॥'}

{'en': 'All the creatures also, O king, having gone to Prabhasa, returned with Soma amongst them to where Daksha was.', 'sn': 'देवास्तु सर्वे राजेन्द्र प्रभासं प्राप्य पुष्कलम्। सोमेन सहिता भूत्वा दक्षस्य प्रमुखेऽभवन्॥'}

{'en': 'Receiving them properly that Lord of creatures then sent them away. Plcased with Soma, the worshipful Daksha once more addressed him, saying-"Do not, O son, disregard and never disregard Brahmanas. Go and obey my commands."', 'sn': 'ततः प्रजापतिः सर्वा विससर्जाथ देवताः। सोमं च भगवान् प्रीतो भूयो वचनमब्रवीत्॥ मावमंस्थाः स्त्रियः पुत्र मा च विप्रान् कदाचन। गच्छ युक्तः सदा भूत्वा कुरु वै शासनं मम॥'}
{'en': 'Dismissed by him, Soma returned to his own abode. All creatures began to live joyously as before.', 'sn': 'स विसृष्टो महाराज जगामाथ स्वमालयम्। प्रजाश्च मुदिता भूत्वा पुनस्तस्थुर्यथा पुरा॥'}

{'en': 'I have thus told you everything about how the Moon had been cursed and how also Prabhasa became the best of all tirthas.', 'sn': 'एवं ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथा शप्तो निशाकरः। प्रभासं च यथा तीर्थं तीर्थानां प्रवरं महत्॥'}

{'en': 'On everyday of the new moon, O king, the god, having the hare for his mark, bathes in the excellent tirtha of Prabhasa and regains his form and beauty.', 'sn': 'अमावास्यां महाराज नित्यशः शशलक्षणः। स्नात्वा ह्याप्यायते श्रीमान् प्रभासे तीर्थ उत्तमे॥'}

{'en': 'O lord of Earth, that tirtha is known by the name of Prabhasa, because bathing there the moon regained his great (Prabha) effulgence.', 'sn': 'अतक्षेतत् प्रजानन्ति प्रभासमिति भूमिप। प्रभां हि परमां लेभे तस्मिन्नुन्मज्ज्य चन्द्रमाः॥'}

{'en': 'After this, the mighty and illustrious Baladeva proceeded to Chamasodbheda, that is to that tirtha which is called by that name.', 'sn': 'ततस्तु चमसोद्भेदमच्युतस्त्वगमद् बली। चमसोद्भेद इत्येवं यं जनाः कथयन्त्युत॥'}

{'en': 'Distributing many precious presents at that place, the hero, having the plough for his weapon, passed one night there and performed his absolutions duly.', 'sn': 'तत्र दत्त्वा च दानानि विशिष्टानि हलायुधः। उषित्वा रजनीमेकां स्नात्वा च विधिवत्तदा॥'}

{'en': 'The elder brother of Keshava then speedily repaired to Udapana. Although the Sarasvati is not visible there, yet persons endued with ascetic success, no account of their obtaining great merits and sanctity of that spot and also of the coolness of the herbs and of the land there, know that the river has an invisible current, O king, underneath the earth there.', 'sn': 'उदपानमथागच्छत्त्वरावान् केशवाग्रजः। आद्यं स्वस्त्ययनं चैव यत्रावाप्य महत् फलम्॥ स्निग्धत्वादोषधीनां च भूमेश्च जनमेजय। जानान्ति सिद्धा राजेन्द्र नष्टामपि सरस्वतीम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thus accosted by Vidura, king, Dhritarashtra became highly please, O monarch, with the act of Yudhishthira and Jishnu.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच विदुरेणैवमुक्तस्तु धृतराष्ट्रो जनाधिपः। प्रीतिमानभवद् राजन् राज्ञो जिष्णोश्च कर्मणि॥'}

{'en': 'Inviting then, after proper examination, superior Rishis, for the sake of Bhishma, as also of his sons and friends, and causing a large quantity of food and drink to be prepared, and cars and other vehicles and clothes, and gold and jewels and gems, and slaves both male and female, and goals and sheep, and blankets and rich articles to be collected, and villages and fields, and other kinds of wealth to be kept ready, as also elephants and horses decked with ornaments, and many beautiful maidens who were the best of their sex, that foremost of kings gave them away for the behoof of the dead, naming each of them in due order as the gifts were made. Naming Drona, Bhishma, Somadatta, Valhika, and king Duryodhana, and each one of his other sons, and all his well wishers with Jayadratha as the first, those gifts were made in due order.', 'sn': 'ततोऽभिरूपान् भीष्माय ब्राह्मणानृषिसत्तमान्। पुत्रार्थे सुहृदश्चैव स समीक्ष्य सहस्रशः॥ कारयित्वान्नपानानि यानान्याच्छादनानि च। सुवर्णमणिरत्नानि दासीदासमजाविकम्॥ कम्बलानि च रत्नानि ग्रामान् क्षेत्रं तथा धनम्। सालङ्कारान् गजानश्वान् कन्याश्चैव वरस्त्रियः॥ उद्दिश्योद्दिश्य सर्वेभ्यो ददौ स नृपसत्तमः। द्रोणं संकीर्त्य भीष्मं च सोमदत्तं च बाह्निकम्॥ दुर्योधनं च राजानं पुत्रांश्चैव पृथक् पृथक्। जयद्रथपुरोगांश्च सुहृदश्चापि सर्वशः॥'}

{'en': 'With the approval of Yudhishthira, that, Shraddha-sacrifice became marked by large gifts of wealth and profuse presents of jewels and gems and other kinds of riches.', 'sn': 'स श्राद्धयज्ञो ववृते बहुशो धनदक्षिणः। अनेकधनरत्नौघो युधिष्ठिरमते तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Teller sand scribes on that occasion, under the orders of Yudhishthira, ceaselessiy asked the old king, Do you command, O king, what gifts should be made to these, All things are ready here-As soon as the king spoke, they gave away what he directed.', 'sn': 'अनिशं यत्र पुरुषा गणका लेखकास्तदा। युधिष्ठिरस्य वचनादपृच्छन्त स्म तं नृपम्॥ आज्ञापय किमेतेभ्यः प्रदायं दीयतामिति। तदुपस्थितमेवात्र वचनान्ते ददुस्तदा॥'}

{'en': 'A thousand was given to him that was to receive a hundred and ten thousand was given to him that was to receive a thousand, at the command of the royal son of Kunti.', 'sn': 'शतदेये दशशतं सहस्र चायुतं तथा। दीयते वचनाद् राज्ञः कुन्तीपुत्रस्य धीमतः॥'}

{'en': 'Like the clouds refreshing the crops with their downpours, that royal cloud pleased the Brahinanas by downpours of riches.', 'sn': 'एवं स वसुधाराभिर्वर्षमाणो नृपाम्बुदः। तर्पयामास विप्रांस्तान् वर्षन् सस्यमिवाम्बुद॥'}

{'en': 'After all those gifts had been distributed, the king, O you of great intelligence, then deluged the assembled guests of all the four castes with repeated surges of food and drink of various tastes.', 'sn': 'ततोऽनन्तरमेवात्र सर्ववर्णान् महामते। अन्नपानरसौघेण प्लावयामास पार्थिवः॥'}

{'en': 'Indeed, the Dhritarashtra-ocean, swelling high, with jewels and gems for its waters, rich with the villages and fields and other foremost of gifts making its verdant islands, heaps of various kinds of precious articles for its rich caves, elephants and horses for its alligators and whirlpools, the sound of Mridangas for its deep roars, and clothes and wealth and precious stones for its waves, deluged the Earth.', 'sn': 'स वस्त्रधनरत्नौधे मृदङ्गनिनदो महान्। गवाश्चमकरावर्तो नानारत्नमहाकरः॥ ग्रामाग्रहारद्वीपाढ्यो मणिहेमजलार्णवः। जगत् सम्प्लावयामास धृतराष्ट्रोडुपोद्धतः॥'}

{'en': 'It was thus, O king, that that monarch made gifts for the behoof, in the other world, of his sons and grandsons and departed manes as also of himself and Gandhari.', 'sn': 'एवं स पुत्रपौत्राणां पितृणामात्मनस्तथा। गान्धार्याश्च महाराज प्रददावौर्ध्व देहिकम्॥'}
{'en': 'At last when he became tired with the work of making such profuse gifts, that great GiftSacrifice ended.', 'sn': 'परिश्रान्तो यदासीत् स ददद् दानान्यनेकशः। निवर्तयामास तदा दानयज्ञं नराधिपः॥'}

{'en': "Thus did that king of Kuru's race celebrate his Gift-Sacrifice. Actors and mimes continually danced and sang on the occasion and contributed to the pleasure of all the guests. Food and drink of various tastes were given away in profusion.", 'sn': 'एवं स राजा कौरव्य चक्रे दानमहाक्रतुम्। नटनर्तकलास्याढ्यां बह्वन्नरसदक्षिणम्॥'}

{'en': "Making gifts in this way for ten days, the royal son of Ambika, O chief of Bharatas' race, became liberated from the debts he owed to his sons and grandson. became liberated from the debts he owed to his sons and grandson.", 'sn': 'दशाहमेवं दानानि दत्त्वा राजाम्बिकासुतः। बभूव पुत्रपौत्राणामनृणो भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Thereafter king king Duryodhana, having regained his senses, once more opposed the invincible Bhima with a shower of arrows.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच ततो दुर्योधनो राजा मोहात् प्रत्यागतस्तदा। शरवर्षेः पुनर्भीमं प्रत्यवारयदच्युतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Once more uniting together, your sons, all mighty car-warrior, encountering Bhima in battle, begin to fight with him in all earnestness.', 'sn': 'एकीभूतास्ततश्चैव तव पुत्रा महारथाः। समेत्य समरे भीमं योधयामासुरुद्यताः॥'}

{'en': 'The mighty-armed Bhimasena also approaching his chariot mounted on it, and proceeded to that pare of the filed where your sons were.', 'sn': 'भीमसेनोऽपि समरे सम्प्राप्य स्वरथं पुनः। समारुह्य महाबाहुर्ययौ येन तवात्मजः॥'}

{'en': 'Taking up a wonderfully tough bow endued with great energy, capable of depriving the enemy of his life, and diversely variegated, he (Bhima) began to pierce your sons with innumerable shafts in that battle.', 'sn': 'प्रगृह्य च महावेगं परासुकरणं दृढम्। सज्जं शरासनं संख्ये शरैर्विव्याध ते सुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then king Duryodhana shortly wounded the mighty Bhima in his very vital parts with a Naracha of exceeding sharpness.', 'sn': 'ततो दुर्योधनो राजा भीमसेनं महाबलम्। नाराचेन सुतीक्ष्णेन भृशं मर्मण्यताडयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thus deeply pierced by your son, that fierce bow-man, with eyes red in rage and out of fury drawing his bow-string fiercely.', 'sn': 'सोऽतिविद्धो महेष्वासस्तव पुत्रेण धन्विना। क्रोधसंरक्तनयनो वेगेनाक्षिप्य कार्मुकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Pierced Duryodhana on this two arms and breast, with three arrows; but O king, thus struck the latter wavered not, like a monarch of mountains.', 'sn': 'दुर्योधनं त्रिभिर्वाह्वोरुरसि चार्पयत्। स तत शुशुभे राजा शिखरैगिरिराडिव॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding those two enraged heroes strike one another in battle, the younger brothers of Duryodhana, all of whom were ready to lay down lives their in battle.', 'sn': 'तौ दृष्ट्वा समरे विनिघ्नन्तौ परस्परम्। दुर्योधनानुजाः सर्वे शूराः संत्यक्तजीविताः॥'}

{'en': 'Bearing in mind their pre-concerted plan of afflicting Bhima of fierce deeds, began with an earnest determination, to strike him (from all sides).', 'sn': 'संस्मृत्य मन्त्रितं पूर्वं निग्रहे भीमकर्मणः। निश्चयं परमं कृत्वा निग्रहीतुं प्रचक्रमुः॥'}

{'en': 'Then the highly powerful Bhima beholding them make towards himself in battle, O monarch, rushed against them like an elephants encountering his compeers.', 'sn': 'तानापतत एवाजौ भीमसेनो महाबलः। प्रत्युद्ययौ महाराज गजः प्रतिगजानिव॥'}

{'en': 'Then excited to fury, that hero endued with great fame and energy, afflicted your son Chitrasena, O monarch, with a long shaft.', 'sn': 'भृशं क्रुद्धश्च तेजस्वी नाराचेन समार्पयत्। चित्रसेनं महाराज तव पुत्रं महायशाः॥'}

{'en': 'Then in that conflict, O king, the descendant of the Bharata race smote your other sons with diverse kinds of arrows furnished with golden wings and charged with great impetus.', 'sn': 'तथेतरांस्तव सुतांस्तनाडयामास भारत। शरैर्बहुविधैः संख्ये रुक्मपुत्रैः सुतेजनैः॥'}

{'en': 'Then those twelve mighty car-warrior including Abhimanyu and others, arranging their troops in proper order,', 'sn': 'तत: संस्थाप्य समरे तान्यनीकानि सर्वशः। अभिमन्युप्रभृतयस्ते द्वादश महारथाः॥'}

{'en': 'And being dispatched by the very virtuous king Yudhishthira to follow behind Bhima, encounter, O mighty monarch, your princely sons, all excellent car-warrior.', 'sn': 'प्रेषिता धर्मराजेन भीमसेनपदानुगाः। प्रतिजग्मुर्महाराज तव पुत्रान् महाबलान्॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding those warriors on that chariots resemble the sun or the fire itself in effulgence, beholding all those fierce bow-men of burning effulgence and exceeding beauty,', 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वा रथस्थांस्ताशूरान् सूर्याग्निसमतेजसः। सर्वानेव महेष्वासान् भ्राजमानाश्रिया वृतान्॥'}

{'en': 'Shine resplendent in that conflict being decorated with diadems of gold-your sons all endued with great strength abandoned fighting with Bhima. But the son of Kunti was unable to brook the sight of their leaving the combat alive.', 'sn': 'महाहवे दीप्यमानान् सुवर्णमुकुटोज्ज्वलान्। तत्यजुः समरे भीमं तव पुत्रा महाबलाः॥ तान् नामृष्यत कौन्तेयो जीवमाना गता इति।'}

{'en': 'Dhritarastra said What, O Sanjaya, did my shameless sons do when they beheld the grandson of Sini proceed towards Arjuna, crushing as he advanced my troops?', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच समप्रमृद्य महत् सैन्यं यान्तं शैनेयमर्जुनम्। निह्रींका मम ते पुत्राः किमकुर्वत संजय॥'}

{'en': "How indeed did those dying wretches set their heart on fight, when Sini's grandson who is equal to Savyasachin himself appeared before them?", 'sn': 'कथं वेषां तदा युद्धे धृतिरासीन्मुमूर्षताम्। शैनेयचरितं दृष्ट्वा यादृशं सव्यसाचिनः॥'}

{'en': 'What indeed, did the Kshatriyas defeated in battle do? How indeed did the illustrious Satyaki penetrate through their ranks?', 'sn': 'किं नु वक्ष्यन्ति ते क्षात्रं सैन्यमद्ये पराजिताः। कथं नु सात्यकिर्युद्धे व्यतिक्रान्तो महायशाः॥'}

{'en': 'O Sanjaya, tell me also, how could the grandson of Sini proceed to battle when all my sons were alive and fighting?', 'sn': 'कथं च मम पुत्राणां जीवतां तत्र संजय। शैनेयोऽभिययौ युद्धे तन्ममाचक्ष्व संजय॥'}

{'en': 'What I have heard from you, O son, appears to be exceedingly wonderful viz., the battle between the one and the many the latter counting many mighty car-warrior among them.', 'sn': 'अत्यद्भुतमिदं तात त्वत्सकाशाच्छ्रणोम्यहम्। एकस्य बहुभिः सार्धे शत्रुबिस्तैर्महारथैः॥'}

{'en': 'O Suta, I think Destiny is adverse to the interests of my sons, in as much as they are now being slaughtered by that mighty carwarrior of the Satvata race.', 'sn': 'विपरीतमहं मन्ये मन्दभाग्यं सुतं प्रति। यत्रावध्यन्त समरे सात्वतेन महारथाः॥'}

{'en': 'Even all my troops united together were not competent enough to withstand the enraged Yuyudhana; not to speak of the sons of Pandu.', 'sn': 'एकस्य हि न पर्याप्तं यत्सैन्यं तस्य संजय। क्रुद्धस्य ययुधानस्य सर्वे तिष्ठन्तु पाण्डवाः॥'}

{'en': 'Like a lion slaying other inferior beasts Satyaki is slaughtering my sons, having first vanquished in battle Drona that warrior accomplished in weapons and versed in all modes of warfare.', 'sn': 'निर्जित्य समरे द्रोणं कृतिनं चित्रयोधिनम्। यथा पशुगणान् सिंहस्तद्धद्धन्ता सुतान् मम॥'}

{'en': 'Countless heroes headed by Kirtavaiman himself, fighting heedfully, were not able to slay Satyaki in battle; so it is certain that the latter will vanquish my sons single-headed.', 'sn': 'कृतवर्मादिभिः शूरैर्यत्तैर्बहुभिराहवे। युयुधानो न शकितो हन्तुं यत् पुरुषर्षभः॥'}

{'en': 'Even Phalguna himself did not fight in the manner in which the illustrious grandson of Sini has fought.', 'sn': 'नैतदीदृशकं युद्धं कृतवांस्तत्र फाल्गुनः। यादृशं कृतवान् युद्धं शिनेर्नप्ता महायशाः॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said All this has been brought about by your wicked policy and by the vile deeds of Duryodhana o king. O Bharata, now hear attentively what I am going to say to you.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच तव दुर्मन्त्रिते राजन् दुर्योधनकृतेन च। शृणुष्वावहितोभूत्वा यत् ते वक्ष्यामि भारत॥'}
{'en': 'At the command of your son, all those warriors then taking tremendous vows to fight', 'sn': 'पुनः संन्यवर्तन्त कृत्वा संशप्तकान् मिथः। परां युद्धे मतिं क्रूरां तव पुत्रस्य शासनात्॥'}
{'en': 'to the last, rallied and resolved upon fighting fierce.', 'sn': 'ते'}

{'en': 'Three thousand bowmen, commanded by Duryodhana himself and supported by a numerous body of Sakas, Kambojas, Valhikas, Yavanas, Paradas.', 'sn': 'त्रीणि सादिसहस्राणि दुर्योधनपुरोगमाः। शककाम्बोजबाह्रीका यवनाः पारदास्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'Kulindas, Tanganas, Amvartas, Pisachas, Barbaras and mountaineers, Oking, all inspired with rage and armed with stones.', 'sn': 'कुलिन्दास्तङ्गणाम्बष्ठा पैशाचाश्च सबर्बराः। पर्वतीयाश्च राजेन्द्र क्रुद्धा: पाषाणपाणयः॥'}

{'en': "Rushed against Sini's grandson like flights of insects falling upon a blazing fire. Five hundred other warriors united together, O king, then also assailed Satyaki.", 'sn': 'अभ्यद्रवन्त शैनेयं शलभाः पावकं यथा। युक्ताश्च पर्वतीयानां रथाः पाषाणयोधिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Another large division consisting of a thousand chariots, a hundred mighty carwarriors, a thousand elephants, two thousand horses and innumerable foots soldiers, also assailed the grandson of Sini.', 'sn': 'शूराः पञ्चशता राजन् शैनेयं समुपाद्रवन्। ततो रथसहस्रेण महारथशतेन च।॥ द्विरदानां सहस्रेण द्विसाहनैश्च वाजिभिः। शरवर्षाणि मुञ्चन्तो विविधानि महारथाः॥'}
{'en': "Then, O Bharata, Dushasana, urged those troops saying, slay him' and encompassed Satyaki there with.", 'sn': 'अभ्यद्रवन्त शैनेयमसंख्येयाश्च पत्तगः। तांश्च संचोदयन् सर्वान् नतैनमिति भारत॥'}

{'en': "Then we beheld the marvellous character of the prowess of Sini's grandson, in as much as single handed as he was he fearlessly fought on with the odds against him.", 'sn': 'दुःशासनो महाराज सात्यकिं पर्यवारयत्। तत्राद्भुतमपश्याम शैनेयचरितं महत्॥'}
{'en': 'He then continually went on slaying the divisions of car-warriors elephants and horsemen and the robbers.', 'sn': 'यदेको बहुभिः सार्धमसम्भ्रान्तमयुध्यत। अवधीच रथानीकं द्विरदानां च तद् बलम्॥'}

{'en': 'Like the autumnal sky bespangled with stars, the field of battle then became covered with car wheels broken and smashed by means of his mighty weapons with innumerable Akshas and beautiful car-shafts crushed to pieces with mangled elephants and broken standards with coats of mail and bucklers scattered all about and O sire, with garlands and ornaments and attires and Anukarshas.', 'sn': 'सादिनश्चैव तान् सर्वान् दस्यूनपि च सर्वशः। तत्र चक्रैर्विमथितैर्भग्नैश्च परमायुधैः॥ अक्षैश्च बहुधा भग्नैरीषादण्डकबन्धुरैः। कुञ्जरैर्मथितैश्चापि ध्वजैश्च विनिपातितः॥ वर्मभिश्च तथानीकैर्व्यवकीर्णा वसुंधरा। स्रग्भिराभरणैर्वस्त्रैरनुकपैश्च मारिष॥'}

{'en': 'Many best elephants prodigious mountainous and of the Anjanors, of the Vamana breed, O Bharata or of the Supratika Mahapadmat or Airavata or other breeds, many excellent tuskers, O king, lay prostrate on the ground, deprived of life. Satyaki then slew, O king, many foremost of steeds of the Vanaya, the mountain, the Kamboja and the Valhika breeds. The grandson of Sini also slaughtered foot soldiers there, in hundreds and thousands, born in various realms and belonging to various nationalities. Whilst those troops were being thus carnaged, Dushasana addressing the or', 'sn': 'संछन्ना वसुधा तत्र द्यौर्यहैरिव भारत। गिरिरूपधराश्चापि पतिताः कुञ्जरोत्तमाः॥ अञ्जनस्य कुले जाता वामनस्य च भारत। सुप्रतीककुले ज्ञाता महापद्मकुले तथा॥ एरावतकुले चैव तथान्येषु कुलेषु च। जाता दन्तिवरा राजशेरते बहवो हताः॥ वनाजान् पर्वतीयान् काम्बोजान् बालिकानपि। तथा हयवरान् राजन् निजघ्ने तत्र सात्यकिः॥ नानादेशसमुत्थांश्च नानाजातींश्च दन्तिनः। निजम्ने तत्र शैनेयः शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः॥'}

{'en': "'Ye heroes, ignorant of the rules of fighting, fight on.” Why do you retreat? But seeing them break away in spite of all his commands yo!'r son Dushasana.", 'sn': 'तेषु प्रकाल्यमानेषु दस्यून् दुःशासनोऽब्ररीत्। निवर्तध्वमधर्मज्ञा युध्यध्वं किं सृतेन वः॥'}

{'en': 'Urged on the heroic mountaineers skilled in fighting with stones saying-"You are all skillful in fighting. The Kauravas also are all ignorant of this mode of war-fare.', 'sn': 'तांश्चातिभग्नान् सम्प्रेक्ष्य पुत्रो दुःशासनस्तव। पाषाणयोधिनः शूरान् पर्वतीयानचोदयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Do you slay then this hero who, desirous as he is of battle, is unacquainted with your manner of fighting. The Kauravas also are all ignorant of this mode of battle.', 'sn': 'अश्मयुद्धेषु कुशला नैतजानाति सात्यकिः। अश्मयुद्धमजानन्तं नतैनं युद्धकार्मुकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Rush upon Satyaki and fear not for he will not be able to reach you in battle. Thereupon all those mountain kings, all accomplished in fighting with stones.', 'sn': 'तथैव कुरवः सर्वे नाश्मयुद्धविशारदाः। अभिद्रवत माभैष्ट न वः प्राप्स्यति सात्यकिः॥'}

{'en': 'Rushed upon the grandson of Sini like so many counsellors rushing in the train of a king. Then all those denizens of the mountains, armed with hollicks looking like the heads of the elephants.', 'sn': 'ते पर्वतीया राजानः सर्वे पाषाणयोधिनः। अभ्यद्रवन्त शैनेयं राजानमिव मन्त्रिणः॥'}

{'en': 'Stood before Yuyudhana in that battle ready to strike others desirous of compassing the slaughter of the Satvata hero with their missiles.', 'sn': 'ततो गजशिरःप्रख्यैरुपलैः शैलवासिनः। उद्यतैर्युयुधानस्य पुरतस्तस्थुराहवे॥'}

{'en': 'They obstructed all the points of the compass, urged as they were by your son. Then as they rushed desirous of fighting with their stones.', 'sn': 'क्षेपणीयैस्तथाप्यन्ये सात्वतस्य वधैषिणः। चोदितास्तव पुत्रेण सर्वतो रुरुधुर्दिशः॥'}

{'en': 'Satyaki sped at them sharp arrows fixing them on his bow string. That awful shower of stones then discharged by the Mountaineers.', 'sn': 'तेषामापततामेव शिलायुद्धं चिकीर्षताम्। सात्यकिः प्रतिसंधाय निशितान् प्राहिणोच्छरान्॥'}

{'en': 'The foremost scion of the Sini race baffled with his Narachas resembling venomous reptiles. Then with those lustrous fragments of stones looking like a flight of fire flies.', 'sn': 'तामश्मवृष्टिं तुमुलां पर्वतीयैः समीरिताम्। चिच्छेदोरगसंकाशैर्नाराचैः शिनिपुङ्गवः॥'}

{'en': 'Many of our soldiers were slaughtered; and O sire, cries of alas and Oh were heard in all directions. Then with heavy stones uplifted, five hundred heroic warriors.', 'sn': 'तैरश्मचूर्णैर्दीप्यद्भिः खद्योतानामिव व्रजैः। प्राय: सैन्यान्यहन्यन्त हाहाभूतानि मारिष॥'}
{'en': 'Fell down, O king with their arms severed. Again a thousand warriors and other hundred thousand warriors.', 'sn': 'ततः पञ्चशतं शूराः समुद्यतमहाशिलाः। निकृत्तबाहवो राजन् निपेतुर्धरणीतले॥'}

{'en': 'Encounterirg Satyaki fell down with their arms bearing stones lopped off. Then many heroic warriors, accomplished in fighting with stones, began to fall down, with their purposes unsettled.', 'sn': 'पुनर्दशशताश्चान्ये शतसाहस्त्रिणस्तथा। सोपलैर्बाहुभिश्छिन्नैः पेतुरप्राप्य सात्यकिम्॥'}

{'en': 'Stayaki then slew them by thousands and that appeared indeed wonderful. Then again many of them, returning to the charge, hurled at Satyaki showers of stones.', 'sn': 'पाषाणयोधिनः शूरान् यतमानावस्थितान्। न्यवधीद् बहुसाहस्त्रांस्तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'With swords and lances in their grasp, many Daradar, Tanjanas, Thasus, Lampakas and Pulindas, hurled their weapons at Satyaki.', 'sn': 'ततः पुनात्तमुखास्तेऽश्मवृष्टीः समन्ततः। अयोहस्ताः शूलहस्ता दरदास्तङ्गणाः खसाः॥'}

{'en': 'But the latter well accomplished in the use of weapons cut all of them in pieces with his Narachns. Then as the stones were being broken in the air by sharp arrows.', 'sn': 'लम्पाकाश्च कुलिन्दाश्च चिक्षिपुस्तांश्च सात्यकिः। नाराचैः प्रतिचिच्छेद प्रतिपत्तिविशारदः॥'}

{'en': 'The sound, that was created, caused many car-warriors, horses, elephants and footsoldiers to fly away. Pelted in all directions by fragments of stones, men, elephants and horses.', 'sn': 'अद्रीणां भिद्यमानानामन्तरिक्षे शितैः शरैः। शब्देन प्राद्वन् संख्ये रक्षाश्वगजपत्तयः॥'}

{'en': 'Were unable to stand in the field of battle, in as much as they felt as if bit by bees. The survivors, bathed in blood and with their heads and frontal globes shattered.', 'sn': 'अश्मचूर्णैरवाकीर्णा मनुष्यगजवाजिनः। नाशक्नुवन्नस्थातुं भ्रमरैरिव दंशिताः॥'}

{'en': 'Of the elephant hosts, then began to break away leaning the car of Yuyudhana. Then the noise that your troops created, O sire.', 'sn': 'हतशिष्टाः सरुधिरा भिन्नमस्तकपिण्डिकाः। कुञ्जरा वर्जयामासुसुयुधानरथं तथा॥'}

{'en': "Afflicted as they were with the shafts of that descendent of Madhu's race, was tremendous like that of the Ocean in a Parvadayi. Then hearing the cry and that tremendous din, Drona, addressing his charioteer, said", 'sn': 'ततः शब्दः समभवत् तव सैन्यस्य मारिष। माधवेनार्धमानस्य सागरस्येव पर्वणि॥'}

{'en': '"O charioteer this mighty car-warrior, of the Satvata race inflamed with wrath, has shattered the host in many places and is now careering like the Destroyer in the field of battle.', 'sn': 'तं शब्दं तुमुलं श्रुत्वा द्रोणो यन्तारमब्रवीत्। क्रुद्धः सात्वतानां महारथः॥'}

{'en': 'O charioteer, drive my car to the spot whence this noise is coming. Surely Yuyudhana has now encountered these heroes that fight with the stones.', 'sn': 'दारयन् बहुधा सैन्यं रणे चरति कालवत्। यत्रैष शब्दस्तुमुलस्तत्र सूत रथं नय॥'}

{'en': 'Yonder the car-warriors are leaving Satyaki being borne away by their flying steeds. Behold some are falling down on the spot with their bodies mangled.', 'sn': 'एष सूते रणे पाषाणयोधिभिर्नूनं युयुधानः समागतः। तथा हि रथिनः सर्वे ह्रियन्ते विद्रुतैर्हयैः॥'}

{'en': "Their drivers are not able to restrain their wild horses.” The charioteer hearing these words of Bharadvaja's son.", 'sn': 'विशस्त्रकवचा रुग्णास्तत्र तत्र पतन्ति च। न शक्नुवन्ति यन्तारः संयन्तुं तुमुले हयान्॥'}

{'en': 'Replied unto Drona that foremost of all wielders of weapons saying-"O long-lived one, behold the army of the Kauravas routed in all directions.', 'sn': 'इत्येतद् वचनं श्रुत्वा भारद्वाजस्य सारथिः। प्रत्युवाच ततो द्रोणं सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Behold the warriors rush in all directions deserting their ranks! But in fact you behold those heroic Panchalas and Pandavas.', 'sn': 'सैन्यं द्रवति चायुष्मन् कौरवेयं समन्ततः। पश्य रोधान् रणेभग्नान् धावतो वै ततस्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Advance desirous of encountering yourself. O subduer of foes, now behave yourself in the manner one should behave on such occasions.', 'sn': 'इमे च संहताः शूराः पञ्चाला: पाण्डवैः सह। त्वामेव हि जिघांसन्त आद्रवन्ति समन्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Shall we proceed or stay here? Satyaki has gone far ahead of us." While the charioteer was thus speaking to the son of Bharadvaja, O sire.', 'sn': 'अत्र कार्य समाधत्स्व प्राप्तकालमरिंदम। स्थाने वा गमने वापि दूरं यातश्च सात्यकिः॥'}

{'en': 'The grandson of Sini suddenly came to view, engaged in siaughtering a large number of car-warriors. Those soldiers of yours while being thus slaughtered by Yuyudhana in battle.', 'sn': 'तथैवं वदतस्तस्य भारद्वाजस्य सारथेः। प्रत्यदृश्यत शैनेयो निघ्नन् बहुविधान् रथान्॥'}

{'en': "They fled away from Yuyudhana's chariot towards the spot where Drona's division was placed. Those other car-warriors accompanied by Dushasana, all struck with panic, also rushed to the place where Drona's chariot was seen.", 'sn': 'ते वध्यमानाः समरे युयुधानेन तावकाः। युयुधानरथं त्यक्त्वा द्रोणानकाय दुद्रुवुः॥ यैस्तु दुःशासनः सार्ध रथैः पूर्व न्यवर्तत। ते भीतास्त्वभ्यधावन्त सर्वे द्रोणरथं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana said Having crossed that impassable fortress (of the world) which has purposes for its gadflies and mosquitoes, grief and joy for its cold and heat, heedlessness for its blinding darkness, cupidity and diseases for its reptiles, wealth for its own danger on the road, and lust and anger its robbers. I have entered the extensive forest (of Brahma).', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण उवाच संकल्पदंशमशकं शोकहर्षहिमातपम्। मोहान्धकारतिमिरं लोभव्याधिसरीसृपम्॥ विषयैकात्ययाध्वानं कामक्रोधविरोधकम्। तदतीत्य महादुर्ग प्रविष्टोऽस्मि महद् वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'The wife of the Brahmana said Where is that foremost, O you of great wisdom? What are its trces? What are its rivers? What its mountains and hills? How far is that forest?', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण्युवाच क्व तद् वनं महाप्राज्ञ के वृक्षाः सरितश्च काः। गिरयः पर्वताश्चैव कियत्यध्वनि तद् वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana said There exists nothing that is separate from it. There is nothing more delightful than it. There is nothing that is un-separated from it. There is nothing more afflicting than it.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण उवाच नैतदस्ति पृथग्भाव: किंचिदन्यत् ततः सुखम्। नैतदस्त्यपृथग्भावः किंचिद् दुःखतरं ततः॥'}

{'en': 'There is nothing smaller than that. There is nothing huger than that. There is nothing minuter than that. There is no happiness that can resemble it.', 'sn': 'तस्माद्धस्वतरं नास्ति न ततोऽस्ति महत्तरम्। नास्ति तस्मात् सूक्ष्मतरं नास्त्यन्यत् तत्समं सुखम्॥'}

{'en': 'Twice-born persons. entering into it, at once get over both joy and sorrow. They (then) never stand in fear of any creature, nor does any creature stand in fear of them.', 'sn': 'न तत्राविश्य शोचन्ति न प्रहष्यन्ति च द्विजाः। न च बिभ्यति केषांचित् तेभ्यो बिभ्यति केचन॥'}

{'en': 'In that forest are seven large trees, seven fruits, and seven guests. There are seven hermitages, (forms of) Yoga concentration, and seven (forms) of initiation. This is a description of that forest.', 'sn': 'तस्मिन् वने सप्त यहादुमाश्च फलानि सप्तातिथयश्च सप्त। सप्ताश्रमाः सप्त समाधयश्च दीक्षाश्च सप्तैतदरण्यरूपम्।।७।'}

{'en': 'The trees which stand filling that forest yield excellent flowers and fruits of five colours. seven', 'sn': 'पञ्चवर्णानि दिव्यानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च। सृजन्तः पादपास्तत्र व्याप्य तिष्ठन्ति तद् वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'The trees which stand there filling that forest, yield flowers and fruits which are of excellent colours and which are, besides of two kinds.', 'sn': 'सुवर्णानि द्विवर्णानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च। सृजन्तः पादपास्तत्र व्याप्य तिष्ठन्ति तद् वनम्॥'}
{'en': 'The trees which stand there filling that forest, yield flowers and fruits of two colours.', 'sn': 'सुरभीणि द्विवर्णानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च। सृजन्तः पादपास्तत्र व्याप्य तिष्ठन्ति तद् वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'The trees which stand there filling that forest, yield fragrant flowers and fruits of one colour.', 'sn': 'सुरभीण्येकवर्णानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च। सृजन्तः पादपास्तत्र व्याप्य तिष्ठन्ति तद् वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'The two trces which stand filling that forest, produce many flowers and fruits which are of unmanifest colours.', 'sn': 'बहून्यव्यक्तवर्णानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च। विसृजन्तौ महावृक्षौ तद् वनं व्याप्य तिष्ठतः॥'}

{'en': 'There is one fire here, possessed of a good mind. That is connected with Brahmana. The five senses are the fuel here. The seven forms of Libcration originating from them are the seven forms of Initiation. The qualities are the fruits, and the guests eat those fruits.', 'sn': 'एको वह्निः सुमना ब्राह्मणोऽत्र पञ्चेन्द्रियाणि समिधश्चात्र सन्ति। तेभ्यो मोक्षाः सप्त फलन्ति दीक्षा गुणाः फलान्यतिथयः फलाशाः॥'}

{'en': 'There, in various places, the great Rishis accept hospitality. When they, having been adored become annihilated, then another forest shines forth.', 'sn': 'आतिथ्यं प्रतिगृह्णन्ति तत्र तत्र महर्षयः। अर्चितेषु प्रलीनेषु तेष्वन्यद् रोचते वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'In that forest, Intelligence is the tree; Liberation is the fruit. Tranquillity is the shade of which it is possessed. It has knowledge for its resting house, contentment for its water, and the Kshetrajna for its sun.', 'sn': 'प्रज्ञाक्षं मोक्षफलं शान्तिच्छायासमन्वितम्। ज्ञानाश्रयं तृप्तितोयमन्तःक्षेत्रज्ञभास्करम्॥'}
{'en': 'Its end cannot be determined upwards, downwards, or horizontally.', 'sn': 'येऽधिगच्छन्ति तं सन्त स्तेषां नास्ति भयं पुनः। ऊर्वे चाधश्च तिर्यक् च तस्य नान्तोऽधिगम्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Seven females always live there, with faces downwards, endued with effulgence, and the cause of generation. They take up all the different tastes from all creatures, cven as inconstancy sucks up truth.', 'sn': 'स्त्ववाङ्मुखा भानुमत्यो जनित्र्यः। अर्ध्वं रसानाददते प्रजाभ्यः। सर्वान् यथा सत्यमनित्यता च॥'}

{'en': 'In that itself live, and from that emerge, the seven Rishis who are crowned with ascetic success, having Vasishtha for their foremost.', 'sn': 'तत्रैव प्रतितिष्ठन्ति पुनस्तत्रोपयन्ति च। सप्त सप्तर्षयः सिद्धा वसिष्ठप्रमुखैः सह॥'}

{'en': 'Glory, effulgence, greatness, enlightenment; victory, perfection, and energy, these seven always follow this same like rays following the sun.', 'sn': 'यशो वर्थो भगश्चैव विजयः सिद्धतेजसः। एवमेवानुवर्तन्ते सप्त ज्योतींषि भास्करम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hills and mountains also exist there, in a body; and rivers and steams carrying waters in their course, waters that are born of Brahma.', 'sn': 'गिरयः पर्वताश्चैव सन्ति तत्र समासतः। नद्यश्च सरितो वारि वहन्त्यो ब्रह्मसम्भवम्॥'}

{'en': 'And there is a confluence also of rivers in the secluded spot for sacrifice. Thence those who are contented with their own souls proceed to the Grandfather.', 'sn': 'नदीनां सङ्गमश्चैव वैताने समुपह्वरे। स्वात्मतृप्ता यतो यान्ति साक्षादेव पितामहम्॥'}

{'en': 'They whose wishes have been reduced, whose wishes have been directed to excellent vows, and whose sins have been consumed by penances, merging themselves in their souls, succeed in attain to Brahma.', 'sn': 'कृशाशाः सुव्रताशाश्च तपसा दग्धकिल्बिषा:। आत्मन्यात्मानमाविश्य ब्रह्माणं समुपासते॥'}

{'en': 'Tranquillity is lauded by those who are conversant with the forest of knowledge. Keeping that forest in view, they take birth so as not to lose courage.', 'sn': 'शममप्यत्र शंसन्ति विद्यारण्यविदो जनाः। तदारण्यमभिप्रेत्य यथाधीरभिजायत॥'}

{'en': 'Such is that sacred forest that is understood by Brahmanas, and understanding it, they live as directed by the Kshetrajna.', 'sn': 'एतदेवेदृशं पुण्यमरण्यं ब्राह्मणा विदुः। विदित्वा चानुतिष्ठन्ति क्षेत्रज्ञेनानुदर्शिना॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said “O Rama, slay Bhishma, “having been thus addressed, my lord, he said to that weeping girl who urged him again and again.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच एवमुक्तस्तदा रामो जहि भीष्ममिति प्रभो। उवाच रुदती कन्यां चोदयन्तीं पुनः पुनः॥'}

{'en': '"O princess of Kashi, I do not take up arms from my own desire, O you of fair complexion, except at the bidding of those conversant with the Vedas; what else shall I do for you?', 'sn': 'काश्ये न कामं गृह्णामि शस्त्रं वै वरवर्णिनि। ऋते ब्रह्मविदां हेतोः किमन्यत् करवाणि ते॥'}

{'en': 'O Princess, both Bhishma and Shalva act up to my words and I shall accomplish this work, Do not grieve.', 'sn': 'वाचा भीष्मश्च शाल्वश्च मम राज्ञि वसानुगौ। भविष्यतोऽनवद्याङ्गि तत् करिष्यामि मा शुचः॥'}

{'en': 'But I shall not on any account take up arms except at the bidding of regenerate persons; for this is the vow I have made.', 'sn': 'न तु शस्त्रं ग्रहीष्यामि कथंचिदपि भाविनि। ऋते नियोगाद् विप्राणामेष मे समयः कृतः॥'}

{'en': 'Amba said By some means or other, my distress has its origin in Bhishma; slay him therefore without delay, my lord.', 'sn': 'अम्बोवाच मम दुःखं भगवता व्यपनेयं यतस्ततः। तच्च भीष्मप्रसूतं मे तं जहीश्वर मा चिरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Rama said O princess of Kashi, I tell you again that thought Bhishma is worthy of your worship, he will, at my word, take up both your feet on his head.', 'sn': 'राम उवाच काशिकन्ये पुनर्बंहि भीष्मस्ते चरणावुभौ। शिरसा वन्दना.ऽपि ग्रहीयष्यति गिरा मम॥'}

{'en': 'Amba said Kill Bhishma in battle, O Rama, for he roars like an Asura, after challenging him to fight if you desire, what is pleasing to me, O Rama; besides it is proper that you should perform what you have promised.', 'sn': 'अम्बोवाच जहि भीष्मं रणे राम गर्जन्तमसुरं यथा। समाहूतो रणे राम मम चेदिच्छसि प्रियम्। प्रतिश्रुतं च यदपि तत् सत्यं कर्तुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said While the two, Amba and Rama, were thus conversing together, the Rishi, of extremely virtuous soul, said these words:', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच तयोः संवदतोरेवं राजन् रामाम्बयोस्तदा। ऋषिः परमधर्मात्मा इदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'This is not proper for you, O you of long arms, to abandon a girl who has taken refuge with you. If, O Rama, Bhishma being challenged by you in fight,', 'sn': 'शरणागतां महाबाहो कन्यां न त्यक्तुमर्हसि। यदि भीष्मो रणे राम समाहूतस्त्वया मृधे॥'}

{'en': 'Either says “I am vanquished" or acts !p to your words then the object of this lady will be fulfilled, O delighter of the Bhrigu race.', 'sn': 'निर्जितोऽस्मीति वा ब्रूयात् कुर्याद् वा वचनं तव। कृतमस्या भवेत् कार्यं कन्याया भृगुनन्दन॥'}

{'en': 'And your promise, my lord, will be redeemed, At the time (of war with the Kshatriyas), this was your promise, O Rama, O great sage.', 'sn': 'वाक्यं सत्यं च ते वीर भविष्यति कृतं विभो। इयं चापि प्रतिज्ञा ते तदा राम महामुने॥'}

{'en': 'Having conquered all the Kshatriyas at the time you made this promise to the Brahmanas. "If a Brahmana or a Kshatriya or a Vaishya or a Shudra in battle,', 'sn': 'जित्वा वै क्षत्रियान् सर्वान् ब्राह्मणेषु प्रतिश्रुता। ब्राह्मणः क्षत्रियो वैश्यः शूद्रश्चैव रणे यदि॥'}

{'en': 'Becomes the destroyer of a Brahmana I shall slay him" O you of Bhrigu\'s race, Then, who out of fear will take refuge with me,', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मद्विड भविता तं वै हनिष्यामीति भार्गव। शरणार्थं प्रपन्नानां भीतानां शरणार्थिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'I shall never be able to abandon by any means so long I have some alive, even if a Kshatriyas comes to war with me.', 'sn': 'न शक्ष्यामि परित्यागं कर्तुं जीवन् कथंचन। यश्च कृत्स्नं रणे क्षत्रं विजेष्यति समागतम्॥'}

{'en': '"I shall slay that one, of blazing self though he be" O you of Bhrigu\'s race. O Rama, that Bhishma, the supporter of the Kuru race, is even such, Fight with him in battle therefore, O Rama.', 'sn': 'दीप्तात्मानमहं तं च हनिष्यामीति भार्गव। स एवं विजयी राम भीष्मः कुरुकुलोद्वहः। तेन युध्यस्व संग्रामे समेत्य भृगुनन्दन।॥'}
