{'en': 'Rama said I remember the promise that I made before, O you best among the Rishis, but in this instance I shall act in such a way that I may gain my object by peaceful means.', 'sn': 'राम उवाच स्मराम्यहं पूर्वकृतां प्रतिज्ञामृषिसत्तम। तथैव च चरिष्यामि यथा साम्नैव लप्स्यते॥'}

{'en': 'This work, aimed at by the princess of Kashis, is indeed great, Taking this lady, I shall go myself there where he is.', 'sn': 'कार्यमेतन्महद् ब्रह्मन् काशिकन्यामनोगतम्। गमिष्यामि स्वयं तत्र कन्यामादाय यत्र सः॥'}

{'en': 'If Bhishma, proud of his feats in war, does not act up to my commands I shall certainly slay that arrogant one.', 'sn': 'यदि भीष्मो रणश्लाघी न करिष्यति मे वचः। हनिष्याम्येनमुद्रिक्तमिति मे निश्चिता मतिः॥'}

{'en': 'The arrows, shot forth by me, do not stick in the body of living creatures (but pass clearly through them); it is known to you in the with the Kshatriyas.', 'sn': 'न हि बाणा मयोत्सृष्टाः सज्जन्तीह शरीरिणाम्। कायेषु विदितं तुभ्यं पुरा क्षत्रियसंगरे॥'}

{'en': 'Rama saying this, along with those conversant with Brahma, those great devotees rose up intending to depart.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा ततो रामः सह तैर्ब्रह्मवादिभिः। प्रयाणाय मतिं कृत्वा समुत्तस्थौ महातपाः॥'}

{'en': 'Then those devotees, staying there for the night, performed their Homa and other ceremonies and went away with the desire of taking my life.', 'sn': 'ततस्ते तामुषित्वा तु रजनीं तत्र तापसाः। हुताग्नयो जप्तजप्याः प्रतस्थुर्मज्जिघांसया॥'}

{'en': 'Then did Rama depart accompanied by those utters of Brahma, making for Kurukshetra, O great king, and taking that girl with him.', 'sn': 'अभ्यगच्छत् ततो रामः सह तैब्रह्मवादिभिः। कुरुक्षेत्रं महाराज कन्यया सह भारत॥'}

{'en': 'All of them, namely those great-souled ascetics with that foremost among the race of Bhrigu at their head, having reached the river Sarasvati, encamped there.', 'sn': 'न्यविशन्त ततः सर्वे परिगृह्य सरस्वतीम्। तापसास्ते महात्मानो भृगुश्रेष्ठपुरस्कृताः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said On the third day of their encampment, the one of great vows sent me words: "I am come, do what is agreeable to me.”', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच ततस्तृतीये दिवसे संदिदेश व्यवस्थितः। कुरु प्रियं स मे राजन् प्राप्तोऽस्मीति महाव्रतः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing of the arrival of that one endued with great strength at the boundary of my kingdom I went to that lord, the ocean of energy, with great cheerfulness,', 'sn': 'तमागतमहं श्रुत्वा विषयान्तं महाबलम्। अभ्यगच्छं जवेनाशु प्रीत्या तेजोनिधिं प्रभुम्॥'}

{'en': 'With a cow before me and surrounded by Brahmanas, priests and preceptors who were equal to the gods themselves.', 'sn': 'गां पुरस्कृत्य राजेन्द्रं ब्राह्मणैः परिवारितः। ऋत्विभिर्देवकल्पैश्च तथैव च पुरोहितैः॥'}
{'en': 'The son of Jamadagni, endued with luster, seeking me, accepted that worship and said these words,', 'sn': 'स मामभिगतं दृष्ट्वा जामदग्न्यः प्रतापवान्। प्रतिजग्राह तां पूजां वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Rama said I Bhishma, in what frame of mind was the daughter of the king of Kashis led away by you though you wanted her not; and why was she again sent away.', 'sn': 'राम उवाच भीष्म कां बुद्धिमास्थाय काशिराजसुता तदा। अकामेन त्वयाऽऽनीता पुनश्चैव विसर्जिता॥'}

{'en': 'By you has this lady of spotless fame been robbed of virtue; for touched by you as she has been, for whom would it be proper to marry her?', 'sn': 'विभ्रंशिता त्वया हीयं धर्मादास्ते यशस्विनी। परामृष्टां त्वया हीमां को हि गन्तुमिहार्हति॥'}

{'en': 'Having been once led away by you she has been rejected by Shalva; therefore do at my words accept her, O Bharata.', 'sn': 'प्रत्याख्याता हि शाल्वेन त्वयाऽऽनीतेति भारत। तस्मादिमा मन्नियोगात् प्रतिगृह्णीष्व भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Let this princess fulfill her object, О best among men, and it is not proper, O king, that she should be disgraced by you, O sinless one.', 'sn': 'स्वधर्मं पुरुषव्याघ्र राजपुत्री लभत्वियम्। न युक्तस्त्ववमानोऽयं राज्ञां कर्तुं त्वयानघ॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing him absent-minded on her account I said, “I cannot again offer her to my brother by any means, O Brahmana,"', 'sn': 'ततस्तं वै विमनसमुदीक्ष्याहमथाब्रुवम्। नाहमेनां पुनर्दद्यां ब्रह्मन् भ्रात्रे कथंचन॥'}

{'en': 'To me she said before, I belong to Shalva, you of the Bhrigu race, and permitted by me went towards his capital.', 'sn': 'शाल्वस्याहमिति प्राह पुरा मामेव भार्गव। मया चैवाभ्यनुज्ञाता गतेयं नगरं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'Not out of fear, nor out of pity, nor out of avarice and nor out of a desire to gain my object shall I abandon the duties of the Kshatriya order, such has been the vow made by me.', 'sn': 'न भयान्नाप्यनुक्रोशान्नार्थलोभान्न काम्यया। क्षात्रं धर्ममहं जह्यामिति मे व्रतमाहितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then did Rama say to me with eyes expanded with wrath:-“If you do not act up to my words, O best among men,', 'sn': 'अथ मामब्रवीद् रामः क्रोधपर्याकुलेक्षणः। न करिष्यसि चेदेतद् वाक्यं मे नरपुङ्गव॥'}

{'en': 'I shall slay you along with your ministers;" he said thus to me again and again with eyes expanded with anger.', 'sn': 'हनिष्यामि सहामात्यं त्वामद्येति पुनः पुनः। संरम्भादब्रवीद् रामः क्रोधपर्याकुलेक्षणः॥'}

{'en': 'I again and again entreated that best among the Bhrigu race with sweet words, O chastiser among foes, but could not calm him down.', 'sn': 'तमहं गीीरिष्टाभि पुनः पुनररिंदम। अयाचं भृगुशार्दूलं न चैव प्रशशाम सः॥'}

{'en': 'I then bowing my head to him said again to the best among the Brahmanas; "What is the reason of your proclaiming war with me?', 'sn': 'प्रणम्य तमहं मूर्धा भूयो ब्राह्मणसत्तमम्। अब्रूवं कारणं किं तद् यत् त्वं युद्धं मयेच्छसि॥'}

{'en': 'In my childhood had you taught me the use of four kinds of arms, and I am thus your pupil, O you of Bhrigu race."', 'sn': 'इष्वस्त्रं मम बालस्य भवतैव चतुर्विधम्। उपदिष्टं महाबाहो शिष्योऽस्मि तव भार्गव॥'}

{'en': 'Then did Rama say to me with eyes red with anger, “You know me to be your preceptor, O Bhishma, and yet you will not accept this lady,', 'sn': 'ततो मामब्रवीद् रामः क्रोधसंरक्तलोचनः। जानी मां गुरुं भीष्म गृह्णासीमां न चैव ह॥'}

{'en': "The daughter of the king of the Kashis for my gratification, O son of Kuru, endued with great intelligence. There is no other way of gratifying me, O delighter of Kuru's race.", 'sn': 'सुतां काश्यस्य कौरव्य मत्प्रियार्थं महामते। न हि ते विद्यते शान्तिरन्यथा कुरुनन्दन॥'}

{'en': 'Accept this lady, O you of long arms, and perpetuate your family. Being severed from the path of rectitude by yourself she gets no husband."', 'sn': 'गृहाणेमां महाबाहो रक्षस्व कुलमात्मनः। त्वया विभ्रंशिता हीयं भर्तारं नाधिगच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'I said to Rama, the conqueror of hostile cites who was speaking thus: “This will not be, O regenerate Rishi, what is the use of labouring towards it.', 'sn': 'तथा ब्रूवन्तं तमहं रामं पुरपुरंजयम्। नैतदेवं पुनर्भावि ब्रह्मर्षे किं श्रमेण ते॥'}

{'en': 'O son of Jamadagni, considering that you were my preceptor in days of old I sought to gratify you before, my lord.', 'sn': 'गुरुत्वं त्वयि सम्प्रेक्ष्य जामदग्न्य पुरातनम्। प्रसादये त्वां भगवस्त्यक्तैषा तु पुरा मया॥'}

{'en': 'Who will permit a woman, who sighs for another and who is therefore like a poisonous snake, to remain in his house knowing the great evils thereof.', 'sn': 'को जातु परभावां हि नारी व्यालीमव स्थिताम्। वासयेत गृहे जानन् स्त्रीणां दोषो महात्ययः॥'}

{'en': 'O you of great vows, I shall not for fear of Vasava even forsake my duties; either be gratified with me or do what you please without loss of time.', 'sn': 'न भयाद् वासवस्यापि धर्म जह्यां महाव्रत। प्रसीद मा वा यद्वा ते कार्यं तत्कुरु मा चिरम्॥'}

{'en': 'My lord of pure heart, even this Sloka is heard in the Puranas, sung by Maruta endued with a large soul.', 'sn': 'अयं चापि विशुद्धात्मन् पुराणे श्रूयते विभो। मरुत्तेन महाबुद्धे गीतः श्लोको महात्मना॥'}

{'en': 'The abandonment of a preceptor is provided when he is vain or has swerved from the right path or who does not know what his duties are.', 'sn': 'गुरोरप्यवलिप्तस्य कार्याकार्यमजानतः। उत्पथप्रतिपन्नस्य परित्यागो विधीयते॥'}

{'en': 'I respected you very much so long because you were my preceptor; but since you do not know the duties of a preceptor, therefore shall I fight with you.', 'sn': 'स त्व गुरुरिति प्रेम्णा मया सम्मानितो भृशम्। गुरुवृत्तिं न जीनीघे तस्माद योत्स्यामि वै त्वया॥'}

{'en': 'I shall not slay a preceptor in battle, especially as he is a Brahmana and you have been forgiven by me since you are old in devotion.', 'sn': 'गुरुं न हन्यां समरे ब्राह्मणं च विशेषतः। विशेषतस्तपोवृद्धमेवं क्षान्तं मया तव॥'}

{'en': 'One, who seeing a Brahmana, ready to fight like a friend of the Kshatriyas, wrathfully slays him who flies not from the fled,', 'sn': 'उद्यतेषुमथो दृष्ट्वा ब्राह्मणं क्षत्रबन्धुवत्। यो हन्यात् समरे क्रुद्धं युध्यन्तमपलायिनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Is not guilty of slaying a Brahmana, such has been authoritatively laid down in the holy books, O you whose only wealth is asceticism, I am a Kshatriya observing the duties of my order.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्महत्या न तस्य स्यादिति धर्मेषू निश्चयः। क्षत्रियाणां स्थितो धर्मं क्षत्रियोऽस्मि तपोधन॥'}

{'en': 'Such a one as myself who treats such according to his merit does not act unrighteously and does not come by evils.', 'sn': 'यो यथा वर्तते यस्मिंस्तस्मिन्नेव प्रवयर्तयन्। नाधर्मं समवाप्नोति न चाश्रेयश्च विन्दति॥'}

{'en': 'When one, able to discriminate the propriety of time and place and knowing both virtue and worldly good, is doubtful of his course, he should without hesitation do that which is virtuous.', 'sn': 'अर्थं वा यदि वा धर्म समर्थो देशकालवित्। अर्थसंशयमापन्नः श्रेयान्निः संशयो नरः॥'}

{'en': 'Since you act unrighteously towards me in a matter connected with profit, I shall certainly fight with you in a great battle.', 'sn': 'यस्मात् संशयितेऽप्यर्थेऽयथान्यायं प्रवर्तसे। तस्माद् योत्स्यामि सहितस्त्वया राम महाहवे॥'}

{'en': 'Behold the strength of my arms and superhuman prowess and what I am capable of, under such circumstances.', 'sn': 'पश्य मे बाहुवीर्यं विक्रमं चातिमानुषम्। एवं गतेऽपि तु मया यच्छक्यं भृगुनन्दन।॥'}

{'en': 'I shall do what I can and O regenerate one, I shall fight with you in Kurukshetra; and since you are desirous to fight, be prepared for battle.', 'sn': 'तत् करिष्ये कुरुक्षेत्रे योत्स्ये विप्र त्वया सह। द्वन्द्वे राम यथेष्टं मे सज्जीभव महाद्युते॥'}

{'en': 'Go, O you who are fond of war, and return to the field of Kurukshetra and I shall go there to fight with you, O you whose only wealth is devotion.', 'sn': 'तत्र त्वं निहतो राम मया शरशतार्दितः। प्राप्स्यसे निर्जिताँल्लोकान् शस्त्रपूतो महारणे॥'}

{'en': 'Being slain by a hundred arrows shot by me, you will obtain those regions earned by your asceticism, being sanctified by my weapons in the battle.', 'sn': 'स गच्छ विनिवर्तस्व कुरुक्षेत्रं रणप्रिय। तत्रैष्यामि महाबाहो युद्धाय त्वांत पोधन॥'}

{'en': "Where in days of days of old, you sanctified the name of your fathers, even there shall I sanctify you, O you of Bhrigu's race.", 'sn': 'अपि तत्र त्वया राम कृतं शौचं पुरा पितुः। तत्राहमपि हत्वा त्वां शौचं कर्ताऽस्मि भार्गव॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore come there quickly, O you who are hard to vanquish in battle and I shall destroy your boast of days of old, which is even now referred to by Brahmanas,', 'sn': 'तत्र राम समागच्छ त्वरितं युद्धदुर्मदा व्यपनेष्यामि ते दर्थं पौराणं ब्राह्मणब्रुव॥ राम बहुशः'}

{'en': 'The boast that you have indulged in for a long time past, namely the entire body of Kshatriyas have been conquered by me alone, listen to the cause thereof.', 'sn': 'यच्चापि कत्थसे परिवत्सरे। निर्जिताः क्षत्रिया लोके मयैकेनेति तच्छृणु॥'}

{'en': 'At that time Bhishma was not born not even a Kshatriya like myself, energetic beings were created afterwards, you consumed only straw.', 'sn': 'न तदा जातवान् भीष्मः क्षत्रियो वापि मद्विधः। पश्चाज्जातानि तेजांसि तृणेषु ज्वलितं त्वया।॥'}

{'en': 'He, who will remove your boasts of velour and desire for war, is now born. He is myself, Bhishma, the subjugator of hostile cities and I shall destroy your pride in battle. There is no doubt about it.', 'sn': 'यस्ते युद्धमयं दधैं कामं च व्यपनाशयेत्। सोऽहं जातो महाबाहो भीष्मः परपुरंजयः। व्यपनेष्यामि ते दर्प युद्धे राम न संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Then did Rama say to me with a laugh, O Bharata:-It is fortunate, O Bhishma that you want to fight with me in battle.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच ततो मामब्रवीद् रामः प्रहसन्निव भारत। दिष्ट्या भीष्म मया साधू योद्धुमिच्छसि संगरे॥'}

{'en': 'I shall now go, O son of Kuru, to Kurukshetra with you. I shall do what you say. Go there, O chastiser of foes.', 'sn': 'अयं गच्छामि कौरव्य कुरुक्षेत्रं त्वया सह। भाषितं ते करिष्यामि तत्रागच्छ परंतप॥'}

{'en': 'There will your mother Jahnavi see yourself slain by my hundred arrows, O Bhishma, and be made the food of vultures and other birds of prey.', 'sn': 'तत्र त्वां निहतं माता मया शरशताचितम्। जाह्नवी पश्यतां भीष्म गृध्रकङ्कबलाशनम्॥'}

{'en': 'O ruler of the earth, let your mothe worshipped by Siddhas and Charanas seeing yourself slain by me, weep today.', 'sn': 'कृपणं त्वामभिप्रेक्ष्य सिद्धचारणसेविता। मया विनिहतं देवी रोदतामद्य पार्थिव॥'}

{'en': 'Your mother of great parts, the daughter of Bhagiratha that gave birth to you, fool that you are, and affected by the desire of fight, is however undeserving of such a sight.', 'sn': 'अतदर्हा महाभागा भगीरथसुताऽधा। या त्वामजीजनन्मन्दं युद्धकामुकमातुरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Come and let us go together, O Bhishma, who are hard to vanquish in battle and desirous of war; take, O son of Kuru, your chariots etc. O foremost among the Bharatas,', 'sn': 'एहि गच्छ मया भीष्म युद्धकामुद दुर्मद। गृहाण सर्वं कौरव्य रथादि भरतर्षभ॥'}
{'en': 'To Rama the conquered of enemies towns who thus said then I bowed my head and said "Be it so."', 'sn': 'इति ब्रवाणां तमहं रामं परपुरंजयम्। प्रणम्य शिरसा राममेवमस्त्वित्यथाब्रुवम्॥'}

{'en': 'Rama, saying this, went to Kurukshetra with the desire of war and I too entering the city submitted every thing to Satyavati.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा ययौ रामः कुरुक्षेत्रं युयुत्सया। प्रविश्य नगरं चाहं सत्यवत्यै न्यवेदयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then after performing propitiatory rites and being blessed by my mother and asking the twice born to bless me,', 'sn': 'ततः कृतस्वस्त्ययनो मात्रा च प्रतिनन्दितः। द्विजातीन् वाच्य पुण्याहं स्वस्ति चैव महाद्युते॥'}

{'en': 'I mounted a beautiful chariot made of silver and drawn by white horses, beautiful to look at, furnished with good seats, and covered with tiger skins.', 'sn': 'रथमास्थाय रुचिरं राजतं पाण्डुरैर्हयैः। सूपस्करं स्वधिष्ठानं वैयाघ्रपरिवारणम्॥'}

{'en': 'It was also furnished with great weapons and all other necessary things and guided by a charioteer of good birth well versed in the art of the management of horses,', 'sn': 'उपपन्नं महाशस्त्रैः सर्वोपकरणान्वितम्। तत्कुलीनेन वीरेण हयशास्त्रविदाणे॥'}

{'en': 'Careful and well trained in battle and who had seen many deeds of bravery. I too, with my body covered with a white coat of mail,', 'sn': 'यत्तुं सूतेन शिष्टेन बहुशो दृष्टकर्मणा। दंशितः पाण्डुरेणाहं कवचेन वपुष्मता॥'}
{'en': 'And taking a white bow, went out, O best among the Bharatas with a white umbrella held over my head.', 'sn': 'पाण्डुरं कार्मुकं गृह्य प्राया भरतसत्तम। पाण्डुरेणातपत्रेण ध्रियमाणेन मूर्धनि॥'}

{'en': 'I was also fanned by white fans, O ruler of men. I was clad with white garments, white head dress and all my ornaments were white.', 'sn': 'पाण्डुरैश्चापि व्यजनैर्वीज्यमानो नराधिप। शुक्लवासाः सितोष्णीषः सर्वशुक्लविभूषणः॥'}

{'en': 'I went out of the city called after the elephant, being eulogized with prayers for my victory and approached the site of battle namely Kurukshetra.', 'sn': 'स्तूयमानो जयाशीभिनिष्क्रम्य गजसाह्वयात्। कुरुक्षेत्रं रणक्षेत्रमुपायां भरतर्षभ॥'}
{'en': 'Those horses fleet as the mind or the wind, urged by that charioteer, took me, O king, to the great battle.', 'sn': 'ते हयाश्चोदितास्तेन सूतेन परमाहवे। अवहन् मां भृशं राजन् मनोमारुतरंहसः॥'}

{'en': 'Myself as also that Rama endued with luster having reached Kurukshetra was each desirous of showing our prowess.', 'sn': 'गत्वाहं तत् कुरुक्षेत्रं स च रामः प्रतापवान्। युद्धाय सहसा राजन् पराक्रान्तौ परस्परम्॥'}
{'en': 'Coming within the sight of that excellent ascetic Rama, I took my good conch and loudly blew it.', 'sn': 'ततः संदर्शनेऽतिष्ठं रामस्यातितपस्विनः। प्रगृह्य शङ्खप्रवरं ततः प्राधममुत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'At the time, O king, there were ascetics and other dwellers of the forest as well as groups of gods with Indra at their head to see that fight.', 'sn': 'ततस्तत्र द्विजा राजंस्तापसाश्च वनौकसः। अपश्यन्त रणं दिव्यं देवाः सेन्द्रगणास्तदा॥'}
{'en': 'There were seen at the time divine garlands and divine music and masses of clouds.', 'sn': 'ततो दिव्यानि माल्यानि प्रादुरासंस्ततस्ततः। वादित्राणि च दिव्यानि मेघवृन्दानि चैव ह॥'}

{'en': "Then did all the devotees, the followers of the scion of Bhrigu's race, become the spectators and surround us.", 'sn': 'ततस्ते तापसाः सर्वे भार्गवस्यानुयायिनः। प्रेक्षकाः समपद्यन्त परिवार्य रणाजिरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then did my divine mother, doing good to all creatures, in her own form say to me, O king, "what is this desired by you?', 'sn': 'ततो मामब्रवीद् देवी सर्वभूतहितैषिणी। माता स्वरूपिणी राजन् किमिदं ते चिकीर्षितम्॥'}

{'en': 'O supporter of the Kuru race, going to the son of Jamadagni I shall beg of him again and again saying: Do not fight with Bhishma.', 'sn': 'गत्वाहं जामदग्न्यं तु प्रयाचिष्ये कुरूद्वह। भीष्मेण सह मा योत्सी: शिष्येणेति पुनः पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'Do not, my son fight thus with a Brahmana, O ruler of the earth, do not fight with the son of Jamadagni;" it was thus that she reproved me.', 'sn': 'मा मैवं पुत्र निर्बन्धं कुरु विप्रेण पार्थिव। जामदग्न्येन समरे योद्धमित्येव भद्यत्॥'}

{'en': 'He has strength similar to that of Hara and he is the exterminator of the Kshatriya race, Rama with whom you desire to fight is well known to you.', 'sn': 'किन्न वै क्षत्रियहणो हरतुल्यपराक्रमः। विदितः पुत्रः रामस्ते यतस्तं योद्भुमिच्छसि॥'}

{'en': 'Then did I say to that goddess after bowing to her and clasping my hands all that had happened in the election of husband, O foremost among the Bharatas.', 'sn': 'ततोऽहमब्रुवं देवीमभिवाद्य कृताञ्जलिः। सर्वं तद् भरतश्रेष्ठ यथावृत्तं स्वयंवरे॥'}

{'en': 'I told her also the way Rama had been spoken to by me, O chief among kings, and the old doings of the daughter of the king of the Kashis.', 'sn': 'यथा च रामो राजेन्द्र मया पूर्वं प्रचोदितः। काशिराजसुतायाश्च यथा कर्म पुरातनम्॥'}

{'en': "Then my mother, the great river, going to Rama and trying to entreat that Rishi, that scion of Bhrigu's race for my sake,", 'sn': 'ततः सा राममभ्येत्य जननी मे महानदी। मदर्षं तमृर्षि वीक्ष्य क्षमयामास भार्गवम्॥'}

{'en': 'Said these words: “Do not fight with Bhishma for he is your pupil” and he too said to her who was beseeching him. “Turn back the purpose of Bhishma. I am here because he does not perform what I desire."', 'sn': 'भीष्मेण सह मा योत्सीः शिष्येणेति वचोऽब्रवीत्। स च तामाह याचन्तीं भीष्ममेव निवर्तय। न च मे कुरुते काममित्यहं तमुपागमम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said Then did Ganga, out of affection for her son, come again to Bhishma but he with eyes expanded with wrath did not attend to her words.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततो गङ्गा सुतस्नेहाद् भीष्मं पुनरुपागमत्। न चास्याश्चाकरोद् वाक्यं क्रोधपर्याकुलेक्षणः॥'}

{'en': 'Then did the great devotee of virtuous soul, the foremost of the race of Bhrigu present himself to his view and that best among the twice born summoned him to fight.', 'sn': 'अथादृश्यत धर्मात्मा भृगुश्रेष्ठो महातपाः। आह्वयामास च तदा युद्धाय द्विजसत्तमः॥'}

{'en': 'Markandeya said: The planets with their satellites, the Rishis and the mothers, Agni and numerrous other blazing countries and many other fearful dwellers of heaven waited on Mahasena with the mothers. The illustrious lord of the celestial, wishing to win victory and believing success to be difficult to be attained mounted his elephant. Airavata; and attended by the other celestial advanced towards Skanda.', 'sn': 'मार्कण्डेय उवाच ग्रहाः सोपग्रहाश्चैव ऋषयो मातरस्तथा। हुताशनमुखाश्चैव दृप्ताः पारिषदां गणाः॥ एते चान्ये च बहवो घोरास्त्रिदिववासिनः। परिवार्य महासेनं स्थिता मातृगणैः सह॥ संदिग्धं विजयं दृष्ट्वा विजयेप्सुः सुरेश्वरः। आरुखैरावतस्कन्धं प्रययौ दैवतैः सह॥'}

{'en': 'Surrounded by all the celestial and armed with thunder, the mighty Indra with the object of killing Mahasena quickly marched with the fearful celestial army of great effulgence. They sounded their shrill war cry. Furnished with various sorts of war materials, armed with various armours and with numerous bows the warriors rode on various animals. When Mahasena saw the gloriously attired and brilliantly adorned Shakra advancing with the determination of killing him; he to advanced to meet him. O son of Pritha, the mighty Vasava, the lord of the celestial, then uttered a loud shout to encourage his warriors. Marching quickly to kill that son of Agni and being praised by the Tredasas and the great Rishis, he at last reached the abode of Kartikeya.', 'sn': 'आदाय वलां बलवान् सर्वैर्देवगणैर्वृतः। विजिघांसुर्महासेनमिन्द्रस्तूर्णतरं ययौ॥ उग्रं तं च महानादं देवानीकं महाप्रभम्। विचित्रध्वजसंनाहं नानावाहनकार्मुकम्॥ प्रवराम्बरसंवीतं श्रिया जुष्टमलङ्कृतम्। विजिघांसुं तमायान्तं कुमारः शक्रमन्वयात्॥ विनदन् पार्थ देवेशो द्रुतं याति महाबलः। संहर्षयन् देवसेनां जिघांसुः पावकात्मजम्॥ सम्पूज्यमानस्त्रिदशैस्तथैव परमर्षिभिः। समीपमथ सम्प्राप्तः कार्तिकेयस्य वासवः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the lord of the celestial with the celestial sent forth lion-like roars. Having heard that roar, Guha also roared like the Ocean.', 'sn': 'सिंहनादं ततश्चक्रे देवेशः सहितः सुरैः। गुहोऽपि शब्दं तं श्रुत्वा व्यनदत् सागरो यथा!॥'}

{'en': 'On hearing that noise, the celestial army was agitated like the great ocean-and it was stunned and it remained fixed in one place.', 'sn': 'तस्य शब्देन महता समुद्भूतोदधिप्रभम्। बभ्राम तत्र तत्रैव देवसैन्यमचेतनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having seen the celestial come near him with the intention of killing him, that son of Agni was filled with anger and set forth rising flames of fire from within his mouth.', 'sn': 'जिघांसूनुपसम्प्राप्तान् देवान् दृष्ट्वा स पावकिः। विससर्ज मुखात् क्रुद्धः प्रवृद्धाः पावकार्चिषः॥'}

{'en': 'Those flames made the celestial army struggle on the ground. Their heads, their bodies, their arms and their riding animals were all burnt in that conflagration; they all appeared like stars displaced from their proper spheres. Thus afflicted they all abandoned the wielder of thunder and took protection of the son of Agni. Thus they secured peace. Being thus forsaken by the celestial, Indra hurled his thunder on Skanda.', 'sn': 'अदहद् देवसैन्यानि वेपमानानि भूतले। ते प्रदीप्तशिरोदेहाः प्रदीप्तायुधवानहाः॥ प्रच्युताः सहसा भान्ति व्यस्तास्तारागणा इव। दह्यमानाः प्रपन्नास्ते शरणं पावकात्मजम्॥ देवा वलाधरं त्यक्त्वा ततः शान्तिमुपागताः। त्यक्तो देवैस्ततः स्कन्दे वलां शक्रो न्यपातयत्॥'}

{'en': 'O great king, it pierced the right side of Skanda and it severed that side of that highsouled being.', 'sn': 'तद्विसृष्टं जघानाशु पार्श्व स्कन्दस्य दक्षिणम्। विभेद च महाराज पार्श्व तस्य महात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'Being (thus) struck by the thunder, there rose another being from the body of Skanda. He was a gold-complexioned youth with a mace in his hand and celestial ear-rings in his ears.', 'sn': 'वलाप्रहारात् स्कन्दस्य संजात: पुरुषोऽपरः। युवा काञ्चनसंनाहः शक्तिधृग् दिव्यकुण्डलः॥'}

{'en': 'Because he was born on account of the piercing of the thunder-bolt, he was named Vishakha. Seeing that another being looking like the fearful and all destroying Agni had arisen, he (Indra) was alarmed and with joined hands he sought the protection of Skanda. That high-souled deity asked him to abandon all fear. The celestial were then filled with joy and their musicians then began to play.', 'sn': 'यद्वलाविशनाज्जातो विशाखस्तेन सोऽभवत्। संजातमधरं दृष्ट्वा कालानलसमद्युतिम्॥ भयादिन्द्रस्तु तं स्कन्दं प्राञ्जलिः शरणं गतः। तस्याभयं ददौ स्कन्दः सह सैन्यस्य सत्तमः। ततः प्रहृष्टास्त्रिदशा वादित्राण्यभ्यवादयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Uma said O Holy one, O you who had torn off the cyes of Bhaga and the teeth of Pushan, O destroyer of the sacrifice of Daksha, O threecyed deity, I have a great doubt.', 'sn': 'उमोवाच भगवन् भगनेत्रन पूष्णो दन्तिनिपातन। दक्षक्रतुहर त्र्यक्ष संशयो मे महानयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Forinerly, the illustrious self-create created the four castes. Through the evil result of what deeds does a Vaishya became a Shudra?', 'sn': 'चातुर्वण्र्यं भगवता पूर्वं सृष्टं स्वयम्भुवा। केन कर्मविपाकेन वैश्यो गच्छति शूद्रताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Through, what acts does a Kshatriya become a Vaishya and a Brahmana becomes a Kshatriya? By what means may such degradation of castes bc warded off?', 'sn': 'वैश्यो वा क्षत्रियः केन द्विजो वा क्षत्रियो भवेत्। प्रतिलोमः कथं देव शक्यो धर्मो निवर्तितुम्॥'}

{'en': "Through what deeds' does a Brahmana take birth in his next life, in the Shudra caste? Through what acts, O powerful deity, does a Kshatriya also come down to the status of a Shudra?", 'sn': 'केन वा कर्मणा विप्रः शूद्रयोनौ प्रजायते। क्षत्रियः शूद्रतामेति केन वा कर्मणा विभो॥'}

{'en': 'O sinless one, O lord of all created beings, do you, O illustrious one, remove this doubt of mine. How, again can the three castes naturally succeed in acquiring the status Brahmanahood?', 'sn': 'एतन्मे संशयं देव तवद भूतपतेऽनघ। त्रयो वर्णाः प्रकृत्येह कथं ब्राह्मण्यमाप्नुयुः॥'}

{'en': 'The Illustrious One said The status of a Brahmana, O goddess is highly difficult to attain. O auspicious lady, one becomes a Brahmana through creation or birth. Similarly the Kshatriya, the Vaishya, and the Shudra, all becomes so through original creation. This is my opinion.', 'sn': 'श्रीमहेश्वर उवाच ब्राह्मण्यं देवि दुष्प्रापं निसर्गाद् ब्राह्मणः शुभे। क्षत्रियो वैश्यशूद्रौ वा निसर्गादिति मे मतिः॥'}

{'en': 'He, however, that is born a Brahmana goes down from his status through his own evil deeds. Hence, the Brahmana, after having acquired the status of the first order, should always protect it.', 'sn': 'कर्मणा दुष्कृतेनेह स्थानाद् भ्रश्यति वै द्विजः। ज्येष्ठं वर्णमनुप्राप्य तस्माद् रक्षेद् वै द्विजः॥'}

{'en': 'If one who is a Kshatriya or Vaishya performs those duties which are assigned to the Brahmana, after the manner of a Brahmana, he becomes a Brahman.', 'sn': 'स्थितो ब्राह्मणधर्मेण ब्राह्मण्यमुपजीवति। क्षत्रियो वाथ वैश्यो वा ब्रह्मभूयं स गच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'That Brahmana who renounces the duties of his order for following those of the Kshatriya, is considered as one who has fallen away from the status of a Brahmana and who has become a Kshatriya.', 'sn': 'यस्तु विप्रत्वमुत्सृज्य क्षात्रं धर्मं निषेवते। ब्राह्मण्यात् स परिभ्रष्टः क्षत्रयोनौ प्रजायते॥'}

{'en': 'That little-witted Brahmana, who, moved by cupidity and folly, follows the practices assigned to Vaishyas, forgetful of his position as a Brahmana that is highly difficult to attain, comes to be considered as one who has become a Vaishya. Likewise, one who is a Vaishya by birth may, by following the practices of a Shudra, become a Shudra. Indeed, a Brahmana falling away from the duties of his own order. may go down to the status of even a Shudra.', 'sn': 'वैश्यकर्म च यो विप्रो लोभमोहव्यपाश्रयः। ब्राह्मण्यं दुर्लभं प्राप्य करोत्यमल्पमतिः सदा॥ स द्विजो वैश्यतामेति वैश्यो वा शूद्रतामियात्। स्वधर्मात् प्रच्युतो विप्रस्ततः शूद्रत्वमाप्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'Such a Brahmana, degraded from the order of his birth and outcasted, without attaining to the region of Brahman, sinks into Hell, and in his next birth becomes born as a Shudra.', 'sn': 'तत्रासौ निरयं प्राप्तो वर्णभ्रष्टो बहिष्कृतः। ब्रह्मलोकात् परिभ्रष्टः शूद्रः समुपजायते॥'}

{'en': 'A highly blessed Kshatriya or a Vaishya, who renounces the duties of his order, and follows the practices of a Shudra, falls away from his own order and becomes a person of mixed caste. It is in this way that a Brahmana, or a Kshatriya, or a Vaishya, comes by the position of a Shudra.', 'sn': 'क्षत्रियो वा महाभागे वैश्यो वा धर्मचारिणि। स्वानि कर्माण्यपाहाय शूद्रकर्म निषेवते॥ स्वस्थानात् स परिभ्रष्टो वर्णसंकरतां गतः। ब्राह्मणः क्षत्रियो वैश्यः शूद्रत्वं याति तादृशः॥'}

{'en': 'That man who has acquired clearness of vision through practice of the duties of his own casic, who is gifted with knowledge and science, who is pure (in body and inind), who knows every duty and is devoted to the practice of all his duties, is sure to enjoy the rewards of virtue.', 'sn': 'यस्तु बुद्धः स्वधर्मेण ज्ञानविज्ञानवाशुचिः। धर्मज्ञो धर्मनिरतः स धर्मफलमश्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'I shall now recite to you, O goddess, a saying uttered by Brahman on this subject. The virtuous and those who are desirous of acquiring mcrit always pursue with firmness the culture of the soul.', 'sn': 'इदं चैवापरं देवि ब्रह्मणा समुदाहृतम्। अध्यात्मं नैष्टिकं सद्भिर्धर्मकामैनिषेव्यते॥'}

{'en': 'The food that comes from cruel and fierce persons is censurable. So also is the food that has been cooked for serving a large number of persons. The same is said of the food that is cooked for the first Shraddha of a dead person. So also is the food that is sullied for the usual faults and the food that is supplied by a Shudra. These should never be taken by a Brahmana at any time.', 'sn': 'उग्रानं गर्हितं देवि गणान्नं श्राद्धसूतकम्। दुष्टानं नैव भोक्तव्यं शूद्रान्नं नैव कर्हिचित्॥'}

{'en': 'The food of a Shudra, O goddess, is always disapproved of by the great deities. This, I think, is the authority enunciated by the Grandfather with his own mouth.', 'sn': 'शूद्रान्नं गर्हितं देवि सदा देवैर्महात्मभिः। पितामहमुखोत्सृष्टं प्रमाणमिति मे मतिः॥'}

{'en': "If a Brahmana, who has set up the sacred fire and who performs sacrifices, were to die with any portion of a Shudra's food remaining undigested in his stomach, he is sure to be born a Shudra.", 'sn': 'शूद्रान्नेनावशेषेण जठरे या म्रियेद् द्विजः। आहिताग्निस्तथा यज्वा स शूद्रगतिभाग् भवेत्॥'}

{'en': "On account of those remains of a Shudra's food in his stomach, he falls away from the position of a Brahmana. Such a Brahmana becomes surely a Shudra.", 'sn': 'तेन शूद्रानशेषेण ब्रह्मस्थानादपाकृतः। ब्राह्मणः शूद्रतामेति नास्ति तत्र विचारणा॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana in his next life comes by the position of that order upon whose food he lives through life or with the undigested portion of whose food in his stomach he dies.', 'sn': 'यस्यान्नेनावशेषेण जठरे यो म्रियेद् द्विजः। तां तां योनि व्रजेद् विप्रो यस्यान्नमुपजीवति॥'}

{'en': 'That man who having acquired the sacred position of a Brahmana which is so difficult to acquire, disregards it and eats forbidden food, falls away from his high status.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मणत्वं शुभं प्राप्य दुर्लभं योऽवमन्यते। अभोज्यान्नानि चाश्नाति स द्विजत्वात् पतेत वै॥'}

{'en': 'That Brahmana who drinks alcohol, who becomes guilty of Brahmanicide or mean in his conduct, or a thief, or who breaks his vows, or becomes impure, or unmindful of his Vedic studies, or sinful, or characterised by cupidity, or guilty of cunning, or a cheat, or who does not observe vows, or who marries a Shudra woman, or who derives his livelihood by pandering to the lusts of other people, or who sells the Soma plant, or who serves a person of a low caste, falls away from his status of Brahman-hood.', 'sn': 'सुरापो ब्रह्महा क्षुद्रश्चोरो भग्नवतोऽशुचिः। स्वाध्यायवर्जित: पापो लुब्धो नैकृतिकः शठः॥ अव्रती वृषलीभर्ता कुण्डाशी सोमविक्रयी। निहीनसेवी विप्रो हि पतति ब्रह्मयोनितः॥'}

{'en': 'That Brahmana who violates the bed of his preceptor, or who takes a pleasure in speaking ill of him, falls away from the status of Brahmanahood even if he knows Brahma.', 'sn': 'गुरुतल्पी गुरुद्रोही गुरुकुत्सारतिश्च यः। ब्रह्मविच्चापि पतति ब्राह्मणो ब्रह्मयोनितः॥'}

{'en': 'By these good deeds again, O goddess, when performed, a Shudra becomes Brahmana, and Vaishya becomes Kshatriya.', 'sn': 'एभिस्तु कर्मभिर्देवि शुभैराचरितैस्तथा। शूद्रो ब्राह्मणतां याति वैश्यः क्षत्रियतां व्रजेत्॥'}

{'en': 'The Shudra should perform all the duties sanctioned for him, properly and according to the ordinance. He should always serve, with obedience and humility, persons of the three others castes and serve them with care.', 'sn': 'शूद्रकर्माणि सर्वाणि यथान्यायं यथाविधि। शुश्रूषां परिचर्यां च ज्येष्ठे वर्णे प्रयत्नतः॥'}

{'en': 'Always following the path of virtue, the Shudra should cheerfully do all this. He should honour the celestials and twiceborn persons. He should observe the vow of hospitality to all persons.', 'sn': 'कुर्यादविमनाः शूद्रः सततं सत्पथे स्थितः। देवद्विजातिसत्कर्ता सर्वातिथ्यकृतव्रतः॥'}

{'en': 'With senses kept under control and becoming abstemious in food, he should never approach his wife except in her season. He should ever search after persons who are holy and pure. As regards food, he should eat that which remains after the needs of all persons have been fulfilled.', 'sn': 'ऋतुकालाभिगामी च नियतो नियताशनः चोक्षश्चोक्षजनान्वेषी शेषान्नकृतभोजनः॥'}

{'en': 'If, indeed, the Shudra wishes to be a Vaishya (in his next life), he should also abstain from meat of animals not killed in sacrifices. If a Vaishya wishes to be a Brahmana (in his next life), he should perform these duties. He should be truthful in speech, and shorn of pride or arrogance. He should be above all pairs of opposites. He should observe the duties of peace and tranquility.', 'sn': 'वृथामांसं न भुञ्जीत शूद्रो वैश्यत्वमृच्छति। ऋतवागनहंवादी निर्द्वन्द्वः शमकोविदः॥'}

{'en': 'He should worship the celestials in sacrifices, attend with devotion to the study and recitation of the Vedas, and become pure in body and mind. He should keep his senses under control, honour the Brahmanas, and seek the behoof of all the orders. Living like a householder and eating only twice a day at the appointed hours, he should satisfy his hunger with only such food as reinains after all the members of his family with dependants and guests have been fed. He should be abstemious in food, and act without being actuated by the desire of reward. He should be free from egotism. He should worship the deities in the Agnihotra and pour libations according to the ordinance. Performing the duties of hospitality towards all persons, he should, as already said, cat the food that remains after serving all others for whom it has been cooked. He should, according to the ordinances laid down, adore the three fires. Such a Vaishya of pure conduct is born in his next life in a high Kshatriya family.', 'sn': 'यजते नित्ययज्ञैश्च स्वाध्यायपरमः शुचिः। दान्तो ब्राह्मणसत्कर्ता सर्ववर्णबुभूषकः॥ गृहस्थव्रतमातिष्ठन् द्विकालकृतभोजनः। शेषाशी विजिताहारो निष्कामो निरहंवदः॥ अग्निहोत्रमुपासंश्च जुह्वानश्च यथाविधि। सर्वातिथ्यमुपातिष्ठशेषान्नकृतभोजनः॥ त्रेताग्निमन्त्रविहितो वैश्यो भवति वै द्विजः। स वैश्यः क्षत्रियकुले शुचौ महति जायते॥'}

{'en': 'If a Vaishya, after having taken birth as a Kshatriya, performs the usual purificatory rites, becomes invested with the sacred thread, and betakes himself of the observance of vows, he becomes, in his next life, an honoured Brahmana.', 'sn': 'स वैश्यः क्षत्रियो जातो जन्मप्रभृति संस्कृतः। उपनीतो व्रतपरो द्विजो भवति सत्कृतः॥'}

{'en': 'Indeed, after his birth as a Kshatriya, he should make presents, worship the deities in great sacrifices with profuse presents, study the Vedas, and desirous of attaining to Heaven, should adore the three fires.', 'sn': 'ददाति यजते यज्ञैः समृद्धैराप्तदक्षिणैः। अधीत्य स्वर्गमन्विच्छंस्त्रेताग्निशरणः सदा॥'}

{'en': 'He should interfere for removing the sorrows of the distressed, and should always rightcously cherish and protect his subjects. He should be truthful, and do all true works, and seek happiness in conduct like this.', 'sn': 'आर्तहस्तप्रदो नित्यं प्रजा धर्मेण पालयन्। सत्यः सत्यानि कुरुते नित्यं यः सुखदर्शनः॥'}

{'en': 'He should administer proper punishments, without laying aside the rod of punishment for good. He should induce men to do righteous deeds. Guided by considerations of policy, he should take a sixth of the produce of the fields.', 'sn': 'धर्मदण्डो न निर्दण्डो धर्मकार्यानुशासकः। यन्त्रितः कार्यकरणैः षड्भागकृतलक्षणः॥'}

{'en': 'He should never indulge in sexual pleasure, but live cheerfully and independently, wellconversant with the science of Wealth or Profit. Of righteous soul, he should seek his married with only in her season.', 'sn': 'ग्राम्यधर्मे न सेवेते स्वच्छन्देनार्थकोविदः। ऋतुकाले तु धर्मात्मा पत्नीमुपशयेत् सदा॥'}

{'en': 'He should always observe fasts, keep his soul under restraint, devote himself to the study of the Vedas, and be pure in body and mind, He should sleep on blades of Kusha grass spread out in his fired chamber.', 'sn': 'सदोपवासी नियतः स्वाध्यायनिरतः शुचिः। बर्हिष्कान्तरिते नित्यं शयानोऽग्निगृहे सदा॥'}

{'en': 'He should pursue the three-fold objects of life, and be always cheerful. He should always say "it is ready” to Shudras desirous of food.', 'sn': 'सर्वातिथ्यं त्रिवर्गस्य कुर्वाण: सुमनाः सदा। शूद्राणां चान्नकामानां नित्यं सिद्धमिति ब्रुवन्॥'}

{'en': 'He should never wish for anything from motives of gain or pleasure. He should adore the ancestors and gods and guests.', 'sn': 'अर्थाद् वा यदि वा कामान्न किंचिदुपलक्षयेत्। पितृदेवातिथिकृते साधनं कुरुते च यः॥'}

{'en': 'In his own house he should live the life of a mendicant. He should duly worship the deities in his Agnihotra, morning, noon, and evening every day, by pouring libations according to the ordinance.', 'sn': 'स्ववेश्ननि यथान्यायमुपास्ते भक्ष्यमेव च। त्रिकालमग्निहोत्रं च जुह्वानो वै यथाविधि॥'}

{'en': 'With his face turned towards the enemy, he should renounce his life-breaths in battle fought for the behoof of kine and Brahmanas. Or he may enter the three fires sanctified with Mantras and renounce his body. By doing all this he is born in his next life as a Brahmana.', 'sn': 'गोब्राह्मणहितार्थाय रणे चाभिमुखो हतः। त्रेताग्निमन्त्रपूतात्मा समाविश्य द्विजो भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Gifted with knowledge and science, purified from all dross, and fully conversant with the Vedas, a pious Kshatriya, by his own deeds, becomes, a Brahmana.', 'sn': 'ज्ञानविज्ञानसम्पन्नः संस्कृतो वेदपारगः। विप्रो भवति धर्मात्मा क्षत्रियः स्वेन कर्मणा॥'}

{'en': 'It is with the help of these deeds, goddess, that a person who has originated from a dreaded caste, viz., a Shudra, may become a Brahmana purged off of all sins and possessed of Vedic learning.', 'sn': 'एतैः कर्मफलैर्देवि न्यूनजातिकुलोद्धवः। शूद्रोऽप्यागमसम्पन्नो द्विजो भवति संस्कृतः॥'}

{'en': 'One who is a Brahmana, when he becomes wicked in conduct and observes no distinction about food, falls away from the status of Brahmanahood and becomes a Shudra.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मणो वाप्यसवृत्तः सर्वसंकरभोजनः। ब्राह्मण्यं स समुत्सृज्य शूद्रो भवति तादृशः॥'}

{'en': 'Even a Shudra, O goddess, who has purified his soul by pure deeds and who has controlled all his senses, deserves to be waited upon and served with respect as a Brahmana. This has been said by the SelfCreate Brahman himself.', 'sn': 'कर्मभिः शुचिभिर्देवि शुद्धात्मा विजितेन्द्रियः। शूद्रोऽपि द्विजवत् सेव्य इति ब्रह्माब्रवीत् स्वयम्॥४८'}

{'en': 'When a pious nature and pious deeds are seen in even a Shudra, he should, according to my opinion, be held supcrior to a person of the three twiceborn classes.', 'sn': 'स्वभावः कर्म च शुभं यत्र शूद्रेऽपि तिष्ठति। विशिष्टः स द्विजाते विज्ञेय इति मे मतिः॥'}

{'en': 'Neither birth, nor the purificatory rites, nor learning, nor offspring, can be considered as grounds for conferring upon one the dignity of a twiceborn person Indeed, conduct is the only ground.', 'sn': 'न योनि पि संस्कारो न श्रुतं न च संततिः। कारणानि द्विजत्वस्य वृत्तमेव तु कारणम्॥'}

{'en': 'All Brahmanas in this world are Brahmanas on account of conduct. A Shudra, if he is of good conduct, is considered as equal to a B-ahmana.', 'sn': 'सर्वोऽयं ब्राह्मणौ लोके वृत्तेन तु विधीयते। वृत्ते स्थितस्तु शूद्रोऽपि ब्राह्मणत्वं नियच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'The position of Brahma, O auspicious lady, is equal wherever it exists. This is my opinion. He, indeed, is a Brahmana in whom the dignity of Brahman exists, that condition which is bereft of qualities and which has no stain attached to it.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मः स्वभावः सुश्रोणि समः सर्वत्र मे मतिः। निर्गुणं निर्मलं ब्रह्म यत्र तिष्ठति स द्विजः॥'}

{'en': 'The boongiving Brahman, while he created all creatures, himself said that the division of human beings into the four orders as dependant on birth is only for purposes of classification.', 'sn': 'एते योनिफला देवि स्थानभागनिदर्शकाः। स्वयं च वरदेनोक्ता ब्रह्मणा सृजता प्रजाः॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana is a great field in this world, a field having feet, for it moves from place to place. He who plants seeds in that field, O beautiful lady, reaps the corps in the next world.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मणोऽपि महत् क्षेत्रं लोके चरति पादवत्। यत् तत्र बीजं वपति सा कृषिः प्रेत्य भाविनि॥'}

{'en': 'That Brahmana who wishes to secure his own good, should always live upon the remains of the food that may remain in his house after satisfying the need of all others. He should always follow the path of virtue. Indeed, he should tread along the path of Brahma.', 'sn': 'विघसाशिना सदा भाव्यं सत्पथालम्बिना तथा। ब्राह्मं हि मार्गमाक्रम्य वर्तितव्यं बुभूषता॥'}

{'en': 'He should live, engaged in the study of the Samhitas, and remaining at home he should perform all the duties of a householder. He should always be given to the study of the Vedas, but be should never derive the means of livelihood from such study.', 'sn': 'संहिताध्यायिना भाव्यं गृहे वै गृहमेधिना। नित्यं स्वाध्यायिना भाव्यं च चाध्ययनजीविना॥'}

{'en': 'That Brahmana who always acts thus, following the path of virtue, adoring his sacred fire, and engaged in the study of the Vedas, comes to be considered as Brahma.', 'sn': 'एवंभूतो हि यो विप्रः सत्पथं सत्पथे स्थितः। आहिताग्निरधीयानो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते॥'}

{'en': 'Having acquired the position of a Brahinana, it should always be protected with care, O you of sweet smiles, by avoiding the stain of contact with persons born in inferior castes, by abstaining from the acceptance of gifts, and by other acts laid down in the scriptures.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण्यं देवि सम्प्राप्य रक्षितव्यं यतात्मना। योनिप्रतिग्रहादानैः कर्मभिश्च शुचिस्मिते॥'}

{'en': 'I have thus told you a mystery, viz., the manner in which a Shudra may become a Brahmana, or that by which a Brahmana falls away from his own pure position and becomes a Shudra, stain of contact with persons born in inferior castes, by abstaining from the acceptance of gifts, and by other acts laid down in the scriptures.', 'sn': 'एतत् ते गुह्यमाख्यातं यथा शूद्रो भवेद् द्विजः। ब्राह्मणो वा च्युतो धर्माद् यथा शूद्रत्वमाप्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'I have thus told you a mystery, viz., the manner in which a Shudra may become a Brahmana, or that by which a Brahmana falls away from his own pure position and becomes a Shudra,', 'sn': 'एतत् ते गुह्यमाख्यातं यथा शूद्रो भवेद् द्विजः। ब्राह्मणो वा च्युतो धर्माद् यथा शूद्रत्वमाप्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Thereupon the high-souled Bhishma, thus deeply pierced by the dagger-like words of your son and overwhelmed with grief, spoke not even a single disagreeable word to your son.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच वाक्शल्यैस्तव पुत्रेण सोऽतिविद्धो महामनाः। दुःखेन महताऽऽविष्टो नोवाचाप्रियमण्वपि॥'}

{'en': "Thus mutilated with those 'worldly daggers' and sighing like a snake, and meditating for a while, and possessed with rage and sorrow,", 'sn': 'स ध्यात्वा सुचिरं कालं दुःखरोषसमन्वितः। श्वसमानो यथा नागः प्रणुन्नो वाक्शलाकया।॥'}

{'en': 'And raising, out of wrath, his two eyes, as if, O Bharata, desirous of consuming the universe with the celestial, the Gandharvas, and the Asuras, that foremost of those learned in the ways of the world (viz., Bhishma),', 'sn': 'उद्धृत्य चक्षुषी कोपानिर्दहन्निव भारत। सदेवासुरगन्धर्व लोकं लोकविदां वरः॥'}

{'en': 'Coolly addressed these words to your son "Why, O Duryodhana, are you piercing me with these harrowing words of yours\'', 'sn': 'अब्रवीत् तव पुत्रं स सामपूर्वमिदं वचः। किं त्वं दुर्योधनैवं मां वाक्शल्यैरपकृन्तसि॥'}

{'en': 'Me who ever endeavoring to the best of my abilities to accomplish what will be for your benefit, me who am ready to lay down my very life in battle, for doing good to you?', 'sn': 'घटमानं यथाशक्ति कुर्वाणं च तव प्रियम्। जुह्वानं समरे प्राणांस्तव वै प्रियकाम्यया॥'}

{'en': 'Is not this sufficient indication (of his invincibility) that heroic son of Pandavas and (Arjuna), gratified Agni by allowing it to consume the Khandava foremost, after having vanquished his opponents in battle?', 'sn': 'यदा तु पाण्डवः शूरः खाण्डवेऽग्निमतर्पयत्। पराजित्य रणे शक्रं पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'When, O mighty-armed hero, that son of Pandu released, with force, you captured by the Gandharvas, that indeed, is indication enough (of his prowess)', 'sn': 'यदा च त्वां महाबाहो गन्धर्वैर्हतमोजसा। अमोचयत् पाण्डुसुतः पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': "On that occasion when your uterine brothers of great heroism, as also, O lord, Radha's son of Suta race had fled forsaking you, the rescue effected by Arjuna is indeed indication enough of his prowess.", 'sn': 'द्रवमाणेषु शूरेषु सोदरेषु तव प्रभो सूतपुत्रे च राधेये पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम्॥'}
{'en': 'That in the kingdom of Virata, singlehanded, he encountered our assembled host is indication enough.', 'sn': 'यच्च नः सहितान् सर्वान् विराटनगरे तदा। एक एव समुद्यातः पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': "That vanquishing the wrathful Drona and myself in battle, he succeeded in taking off our raiment's, is indication enough.", 'sn': 'द्रोणं च युधि संरब्धं मां च निर्जित्य संयुगे। वासांसि स समादत्त पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': "That he conquered the great bowman, the son of Drona as also the son of Sharadvata on the occasion of the capture of the capture of Virata's kine, is indeed indication enough.", 'sn': 'तथा द्रौणि महेष्वासं शारद्वतमथापि च। गोग्रहे जितवान् पूर्वं पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'That conquering Karna ever bragging of his manliness, he gave robes to Uttara is a sufficient indication.', 'sn': 'विजित्य च यदा कर्णं सदा पुरुषमानिनम्। उत्तरायै ददौ वस्त्रं पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'That the son of Pritha vanquished in battle the Nivatakavacha brothers difficult of vanquishment by Indra himself is indication enough of his velour.', 'sn': 'निवातकवचान् युद्धे वासवेनापि दुर्जयान्। जितवान् समरे पार्थः पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम्॥'}

{'en': 'What man is capable of conquering the mighty son of Pandu, who is protected by the Protector of the worlds, the wielder of the conch, discus and the mace divine.', 'sn': 'को हि शक्तो रणे जेतुं पाण्डवं रभसं तदा। यस्य गोप्ता जगद्गोप्ता शङ्खचक्रगदाधरः॥'}

{'en': 'The son of Vasudeva is of infinite prowess, and is the Destroyer of this creation. He is the Lord of all, the God of Gods, the Supreme Soul and Eternal.', 'sn': 'वासुदेवोऽनन्तशक्तिः सृष्टिसंहारकारकः। सर्वेश्वरो देवदेवः परमात्मा सनातनः॥'}

{'en': 'Diversely, O king, has He been described by Narada and other illustrious sages. But through your folly, O Suyodhana, you do not seem to recognise what you should do and what you should not.', 'sn': 'उक्तोऽसि बहुशो राजन् नारदाद्यैर्महर्षिभिः। त्वं तु मोहान्न जानीषे वाच्यावाच्यं सुयोधन॥'}

{'en': 'A man on the brink of death sees everything to be made of gold; so also, O son of Gandhari, you see everything to be invested with a yellow hue.', 'sn': 'मुमूर्षुर्हि नरः सर्वान् वृक्षान् पश्यति काञ्चनान्। तथा त्वमपि गान्धारे विपरीतानि पश्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'You have yourself sowed implacably enmity between yourself on the one side and the Pandavas and Srinjayas on the other. Let us now see you fight with them in battle. Display your manliness.', 'sn': 'स्वयं वैरं महत् कृत्वा पाण्डवैः सह संजयैः। युद्ध्यस्व तानन रणे पश्यामः पुरुषो भव॥'}

{'en': 'I, however, O foremost of men, shall slay the assembled Panchalas and Somakas excepting only Shikhandin.', 'sn': 'अहं तु सोमकान् सर्वान् पञ्चालांश्च समागतान्। निहनिष्ये नरव्याघ्र वर्जयित्वा शिखण्डिनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Either slain by them in battle, I shall go to the mansion of Death or slaying them I shall afford delight to you.', 'sn': 'तैर्वाऽहं निहत: संख्ये गमिष्ये यमसादनम्। तान् वा निहत्य समरे प्रीतिं दास्याम्यहं तव॥'}

{'en': 'In the palace of Draupada, Shikhandin was first born as a woman; then through the virtue of a boon he became a male being. This one is the Shikhandin of old.', 'sn': 'पूर्वं हि स्त्री समुत्पन्ना शिखण्डी राजवेश्मनि। वरदानात् पुमाञ्जातः सैषा वै स्त्री शिखण्डिनी॥'}

{'en': 'Even if I were to loose my life, O Bharata, I shall not slay him. This now is the same Shikhandin whom the creator made a female.', 'sn': 'तमहं न हनिष्यामि प्राणत्यागेऽपि भारत! याऽसौ प्रानिर्मिता धात्रा सैषा वै स्त्री शिखण्डिनी।।'}

{'en': 'Pass the night in tranquil sleep, O son of Gandhari; tomorrow I shall fight a terrible fight, of which men shall speak so long as the earth will endure."', 'sn': 'सुखं स्वपिहि गान्धारे श्वोऽपि कर्ता महारणम्। यं जनाः कथयिष्यन्ति यावत् स्थास्यति मेदिनी॥'}

{'en': 'This spoken to, your son, O ruler of men, came out and saluting the reverend signor, with his head, he (your son) replied to his own tent.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तस्तव सुतो निर्जगाम जनेश्वर। अभिवाद्य गुरुं मूर्धा प्रययौ स्वं निवेशनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereafter the king reaching his own tent, and ordering his illustrious officers to retire, that destroyer of foes entered his own camp.', 'sn': 'आगम्य तु ततो राजा विसृज्य च महाजनम्। प्रविवेश ततस्तूर्णं क्षयं शत्रुक्षयङ्करः॥'}

{'en': 'There in his tent that ruler of men passed the night. When the night had passed away, the king, rising at the break of day,', 'sn': 'प्रविष्टः स निशां तां च गमयामास पार्थिवः। प्रभातायां च शर्वर्यां प्रातरुत्थाय तान् नृपः॥'}

{'en': "Ordered, his royal warriors saying 'Arrange the forces in battle-order. Today, waxing irascible in battle, Bhishma shall slay the Somakas.'", 'sn': 'राज्ञः समाज्ञापयत सेनां योजयतेति हा अद्य भीष्मो रणे क्रुद्धोनिहनिष्यति सोमकान्॥'}

{'en': 'Having heard those copious lamentation of Duryodhana in the night, and regarding them, O king, as commands to himself,', 'sn': 'दुर्योधनस्य तच्छ्रुत्वा रात्रौ विलपितं बहु। मन्यमानः स तं राजन् प्रत्यादेशमिवात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'The son of Shantanu was greatly depressed; and he censored the life of dependency and reflected for a long time, desirous of encountering Arjuna in battle.', 'sn': 'निर्वेदं परमं गत्वा विनिन्द्य परवश्यताम्। दीर्घ दध्यौ शान्तनवो योद्धकामोऽर्जुनं रणे॥'}

{'en': 'Coming to know from outward expressions what the son of Ganga had been thinking of, Duryodhana, O mighty monarch ordered Dushasana saying.', 'sn': 'इङ्गित्तेन तु तज्ज्ञात्वा गाङ्गेयेन विचिन्तितम्। दुर्योधनो महाराज दुःशासनमचोदयत्।॥'}

{'en': '"O Dushasana, without delay draw up our chariots for protecting Bhishma. Urge to battle all our two and twenty divisions.', 'sn': 'दुःशासन रथास्तूर्णं युज्यन्तां भीष्मरक्षिणः। द्वाविंशतिमनीकानि सर्वाण्येवाभिचोदय॥'}

{'en': 'Even that for which we have been longing all these yards, have now come to pass, viz., the slaughter of the Pandavas with all their troops and the acquisition of the kingdom by ourselves.', 'sn': 'इदं हि समनुप्राप्तं वर्षपूगाभिचिन्तितम्। पाण्डवानां ससैन्यानां वधो राज्यस्य चागमः॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore, I now consider our highest duty to be the protection of Bhishma. Protected and assisted by us, he will slay the Parthas in battle.', 'sn': 'तत्र कार्यतमं मन्ये भीष्मस्यैवाभिरक्षणम्। स नो गुप्तः सहायः स्याद्वन्यात् पार्थांश्च सयुगे॥'}

{'en': "That pure-souled one had said 'I will not slay Shikhandin; for this one was a female before, O king, so I should avoid him in battie.", 'sn': 'अब्रवीद्धि विशुद्धात्मा नाहं हन्यां शिखण्डिनम्। स्त्रीपूर्वको ह्यसौ राजस्तस्माद् वयॊ मया रणे॥'}

{'en': 'All the world know, that to compass the pleasure of my father, O mighty armed one, I formerly relinquished a swelling kingdom and the company of woman.', 'sn': 'लोकस्तद् वेद यदहं पितुः प्रियचिकीर्षया। राज्यं स्फीतं महाबाहो स्त्रियश्च त्यक्तवान् पुरा॥ श्रुतः।'}

{'en': 'Therefore, O foremost of men, I will not slay in battle females or those who were females before. I tell this truly.', 'sn': 'नैवं ग्राहं स्त्रियं जातु न स्त्रीपूर्वं कथंचन। हन्यां युधि नरश्रेष्ठ सत्यमेतद् ब्रवीमि ते॥'}

{'en': 'Before the commencement of the battle I have told you, and you have heard that this Shikhandin was born formerly as a female and was called Shikhandin.', 'sn': 'अयं स्त्रीपूर्वको राजच्छिखण्डी यदि ते उद्योगे कथितं यत्तत् तथा जाता शिखण्डिनी॥'}

{'en': 'Born as a female child she has come to be a man. If now I am to fight with him I will sped my shafts towards him on no account.', 'sn': 'कन्या भूत्वा पुमाञ्जातः स च मां योधयिष्यति। तस्याहं प्रमुखे बाणान् न मुञ्चेयं कथंचन॥'}

{'en': "I will, O sire, slay all other Kshatriyas in battle, who, desirous of victory to the Pandavas, shall happen to encounter me in the van of the battle.'", 'sn': 'युद्धे हि क्षत्रियांस्तात पाण्डवानां जयैषिणः। सर्वानन्यान् हनिष्यामि सम्प्राप्तान रणमूर्धनि॥'}

{'en': "Thus did that foremost of the Bharatas, accomplished in the Vedas, namely the son of Ganga address me. So I consider our foremost duty to be the protection of Ganga's son to the best of our abilities.", 'sn': 'एवं मां भरतश्रेष्ठ गाङ्गेयः प्राह शास्त्रवित्। तत्र सर्वात्मना मन्ये गाङ्गेयस्यैव पालनम्॥'}

{'en': "If left unprotected, in a great forest, even a wolf can slay a lion. We should not allow Ganga's son to be slain by Shikhandi like a lion slain by a wolf.", 'sn': 'अरक्ष्यमाणं हि वृको हन्यात् सिंहं महाहवे। मा वृकेणेव गांगेयं घातयेम शिखण्डिना॥'}

{'en': 'Our maternal uncle Shakuni, Shalya, Kripa, Drona, and Vivingshati, should protect, putting forth their best energies, the son of Ganga. If he is duly protected, victory indubitably will be ours."', 'sn': 'मातुल: शकुनिः शल्यः कृपो द्रोणो विविंशतिः। यत्ता रक्षन्तु गाङ्गेय तस्मिन् गुप्ते ध्रुवो जयः॥ ।'}

{'en': 'Hearing these words of Duryodhana, all those warriors surrounded on all sides with a host of cars, the son of Ganga.', 'sn': 'एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु ते सर्वे दुर्योधनवचस्तदा। सर्वतो रथवंशेन गाङ्गेयं पर्यवारयन्॥'}

{'en': "Then your sons, surrounding Ganga's son, proceeded to battle shaking the earth and the heavens and agitating the Pandavas.", 'sn': 'पुत्राश्च तव गाङ्गेय परिवार्य युयुर्मुदा। कम्पयन्तो भुवं द्यां च क्षोभयन्तश्च पाण्डवान्॥'}

{'en': 'The mighty car-warriors of the Kurus, clad in Armour, and supported by those cars and many elephants formed themselves in battlearray encircling Bhishma.', 'sn': 'ते रथैः सुसम्प्रयुक्तैर्दन्तिभिश्च महारथाः। परिवार्य रणे भीष्मं दंशिताः समवस्थिताः॥'}

{'en': 'Protecting that mighty car-warrior Bhishma, they stood like the celestial protecting the wielder of the thunder-bolt in the battle between themselves and the Asuras.', 'sn': 'यथा देवासुरे युद्धे त्रिदशा वज्रधारिणम्। सर्वे ते स्म व्यतिष्ठन्ति रक्षन्तस्तं महारथम्॥'}

{'en': "Thereafter king Duryodhana addressing his brothers once more said “Yudhamanyu protects the left wheel of Arjuna's chariot and Uttamaujas protects the right. Thus protected, Arjuna protects Shikhandin. O Dushasana, so arrange, that Shikhandin, thus protected by Arjuna, may not slay Bhishma left unprotected by ourselves.” Hearing the words of his brothers, your son Dushasana,", 'sn': 'ततो दुर्योधनो राजा पुनर्घातरमब्रवीत्। सव्यं चक्रं युधामनुरुत्तमौजाश्च दक्षिणम्॥ गोप्तारावर्जुनस्यैतावर्जुनोऽपि शिखण्डिनः। रक्ष्माणः स पार्थेन तथास्माभिर्विवर्जितः॥ यथा भीष्मं न नो हन्याद् दुःशासन तथा कुरु। भ्रातुस्तद् वचनं श्रुत्वा पुत्रो दुःशासनस्तव॥'}

{'en': 'Placing Bhishma at the van proceeded to battle, surrounded by the troops. Beholding Bhishma thoroughly encompassed by a host of cars,', 'sn': 'भीष्मं प्रमुखतः कृत्वा प्रययौ सह सेनया। भीष्मं तु रथवंशेन दृष्ट्वा समभिसंवृतम्।।५०।'}

{'en': 'Arjuna, the foremost of car-warrior said to Dhrishtadyumna; Let, O Prince of the Panchalas, Shikhandin, that foremost of men be placed face to face with Bhishma. I myself will be his protector, O Prince.', 'sn': 'अर्जुनो रथिनां श्रेष्ठो धृष्टद्युम्नमुवाच ह। शिखण्डिनं नरव्याघ्नं भीष्मस्य प्रमुखे नृप। स्थापयस्वाद्य पाञ्चाल्य तस्य गोप्ताहमित्युत॥'}

{'en': 'Uma said O Holy One, O lord of all beings, O you adored of deities and Asuras equally, tell me what are the duties and derelictions of men. Indeed, O powerful one, remove my doubts.', 'sn': 'उमोवाच भगवन् सर्वभूतेश देवासुरनमस्कृत। धर्माधर्मी नृणां देव ब्रूहि मेऽसंशयं विभो॥'}

{'en': 'It is by these three, viz., thought, word, and deed, that men become fettered with bonds. It is by the same three that they become freed from these fetters.', 'sn': 'कर्मणा मनसा वाचा त्रिविधं हि नरः सदा। बध्यते बन्धनैः पाशैर्मुच्यतेऽप्यथवा पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'By following what conduct, Ogod, indeed, by what kind of acts, by what behaviour and qualities and words, do men succeed in ascending to Heaven?', 'sn': 'केन शीलेन वृत्तेन कर्मणा कीदृशेन वा। समाचारैर्गुणैः कैर्वा स्वर्गे यान्तीह मानवाः॥'}

{'en': 'The God of Gods said O goddess, you are well conversant with the true meaning of duties. You are ever devoted to Virtue and Self-control. The question you have asked me is fraught with the benefit of all creatures. It increases the intelligence of all persons. Do you, therefore, listen to the answer.', 'sn': 'श्रीमहेश्वर उवाच देवि धर्मार्थतत्त्वज्ञे धर्मनित्ये दमे रते। सर्वप्राणिहितः प्रश्नः श्रूयतां बुद्धिवर्धनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those persons who are devoted to the Religion of Truth, who are righteous and destitute of the indications of the several modes of life, and who enjoy the wealth acquired by fair means, succeeds in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'सत्यधर्मरताः सन्तः सर्वलिङ्गविवर्जिताः। धर्मलब्धार्थभोक्तारस्ते नरा: स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those men who are freed froin all doubts, who are gifted with omniscience, and who have eyes for seeing all things, are never fettered by either virtue or sin. Those men who are shorn of all attachments, can never be fettered by the chains of action.', 'sn': 'नाधर्मेण न धर्मेण बध्यन्ते छिन्नसंशयाः। प्रलयोत्पत्तितत्त्वज्ञाः सर्वज्ञाः सर्वदर्शिनः॥ वीतरागा विमुच्यन्ते पुरुषाः कर्मबन्धनैः।'}

{'en': 'They who never injure others in thoughts, word, or deed, and who never attach themselves to anything, can never be fettered by deeds.', 'sn': 'कर्मणा मनसा वाचा ये न हिंसन्ति किंचन॥ येन सज्जन्ति कस्मिंश्चित् ते न बद्ध्यन्ति कर्मभिः।'}

{'en': 'They who abstain from kiiling any creature, who are gifted with righteous conduct, who have mercy, who treat friends and foes equally, and who are self-controlled, can never be fettered by acts.', 'sn': 'प्राणातिपाताद् विरताः शीलवन्तो दयान्विताः॥ तुल्यद्वेष्यप्रिया दान्ता मुच्यन्ते कर्मबन्धनैः।'}

{'en': 'Those men who are gifted with mercy towards all beings, who succeed in creating the confidence of all living creatures, and who men have shaken off malice in their conduct, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'सर्वभूतदयावन्तो विश्वास्याः सर्वजन्तुषु॥ त्यक्तहिंसासमाचारास्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः।'}

{'en': "Those men who have no no desire to appropriate others' properties, who never associate with the spouses of others, and who enjoy only such wealth as has been acquired by fair means, succeed in ascending to Heaven.", 'sn': 'परस्वे निर्ममा नित्यं परदारविवर्जकाः॥ धर्मलब्धान्नभोक्तारस्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः।'}

{'en': 'Those men who treat the wives of other people as their own mothers and sisters and daughters, succeed in attaining to Heaven.', 'sn': 'भातृवत् स्वसृवच्चैव नित्यं दुहितृवच्च ये॥ परदारेषु वर्तन्ते ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः।'}

{'en': "Those who abstain from misappropriating others' things, who are perfectly contented with what they themselves possess, and who live depending upon their own destiny, succeed in ascending to Heaven.", 'sn': 'स्तैन्यान्निवृत्ताः सततं संतुष्टाः स्वधनेन च॥ स्वभाग्यान्युपजीवन्ति ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः।'}

{'en': "Those men who never know other peoples' wives, who are masters of their senses, and who are given to righteous conduct, succeed in ascending to Heaven.", 'sn': 'स्वदारनिरता ये च ऋतुकालाभिगामिनः॥ अग्राम्यसुखभोगाश्च ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः।'}

{'en': 'This is the path, created by the gods, that the pious should follow. This is the path, freed from passion and aversion, sanctioned for the pious to follow.', 'sn': 'परदारेषु ये नित्यं चरित्रावृतलोचनाः॥ जितेन्द्रियाः शीलपरास्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः।'}

{'en': 'Those men who are devoted to their own wives and who seek them in only their seasons, and who do not indulge in sexual pleasure, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'एष देवकृतो मार्गः सेवितव्यः सदा नरैः॥ अकघायकृतश्चैव मार्ग: सेव्यः सदा वुधैः।'}

{'en': 'For the sake of multiplying their merit or for acquiring their means of livelihood, the wise should follow charity, penances and purity of both body and mind. Those who wish to ascend to Heaven, should follow in this tract and not any other.', 'sn': 'दानधर्मतपोयुक्तः शीलशौचदयात्मकः॥ वृत्त्यर्थं धर्महेतोर्वा सेवितव्यः सदा नरैः। स्वर्गवासमभीप्सद्भिर्न सेव्यस्त्वत उत्तरः॥'}

{'en': 'Uma said Tell me, O illustrious-god, O sinless lord of all creatures, what are those words by which one becomes fettered and what are those words by speaking which one may be freed from fetters.', 'sn': 'उमोवाच वाचा तु बद्ध्यते येन मुच्यतेऽप्यथवा पुनः। तानि कर्माणि मे देव वद भूतपतेऽनघ॥'}

{'en': 'Maheshvara said Those men who never tell falschood for either themselves or for others, or in jest or for exciting laughter, succeed in ascending Heaven.', 'sn': 'श्रीमहेश्वर उवाच आत्महेतोः परार्थं वा नर्महास्याश्रयात् तथा। ये मृषा न वदन्तीह ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'They who never tell lies for acquiring their livelihood or for acquiring merit or through mere caprice, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'वृत्त्यर्थं धर्महेतोर्वा कामकारात् तथैव च। अनृतं ये न भाषन्ते ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'They who utter words which are smooth and sweet and faultless, and who with sincerity welcome all whom they meet with, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'श्लक्ष्णां वाणी निराबाधां मधुरां पापवर्जिताम्। स्वागतेनाभिभाषन्ते ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'They who never utter words which are harsh, bitter and cruel, and who are free from deceitfulness and evil of every kind, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'परुषं ये न भाषन्ते कटुकं निष्ठुरं तथा। अपैशुन्यरताः सन्तस्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those men who never utter deceitful words which create disunion between friends and who always speak what is true and what promotes good feelings, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'पिशुनां न प्रभाषन्ते मित्रभेदकरी गिरम्। ऋतं मैत्रं तु भाषन्ते ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those men who avoid harsh words and abstains from quarrels with others, who are equal in their conduct to all creatures, and who have governed their souls, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'ये वर्जयन्ति पुरुषं परद्रोहं च मानवाः। सर्वभूतसमा दान्तास्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'They who abstain from evil speech or sinful conversation, who avoid disagreeable speeches, and who utter only auspicious and agreeable words, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'शठप्रलापाद् विरता विरुद्धपरिवर्जकाः। सौम्यप्रलापिनो नित्यं ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'They who never utter, under anger, such words as cut others to the quick, and who, even when under the influence of anger, speak words what are peaceful and agreeable, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'न कोपाद् व्याहरन्ते ये वाचं हृदयदारणीम्। सान्त्वं वदन्ति क्रुद्धाऽपि ते नरा: स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'This religion, O goddess of speech, should always be followed by men. It is auspicious and characterised by Truth. The wise should always avoid untruth.', 'sn': 'एष वाणीकृतो देवि धर्मः सेव्यः सदा नरैः। शुभः सत्यगुणो नित्यं वर्जनीयो मृषा बुधैः॥'}

{'en': 'Uma said Tell me, O god of gods, O holder of Pinaka, O you who are highly blessed, what those thoughts are by which a person may be fettered.', 'sn': 'उमोवाच मनसा बद्ध्यते येन कर्मणा पुरुषः सदा। तन्मे ब्रूहि महाभाग देवदेव पिनाकधृत्॥'}

{'en': 'Maheshvara said Gifted with merit that originates from mental acts, O goddess, one ascends to Heaven. Listen to me, O auspicious one, as I recite to you what those acts are.', 'sn': 'श्रीमहेश्वर उवाच मानसेनेह धर्मेण संयुक्ताः पुरुषाः सदा। स्वर्गं गच्छन्ति कल्याणि तन्मे कीर्तयतः शृणु॥'}

{'en': 'Listen to me, Oyou of sweet face, how also a mind of illregulated features, becomes fettered by illregulated or evil thoughts.', 'sn': 'दुष्प्रणीतेन मनसा दुष्प्रणीततरा कृतिः। मनो बद्ध्यति येनेह शृणु वाक्यं शुभानने।॥'}

{'en': 'Those men who do not seek, even mentally, to take other peoples things even when they lie in a lone forest, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'अरण्ये विजने न्यस्तं परस्वं दृश्यते यदा। मनसापि न हिंसन्ति ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': "Those who not others' belongings, even when they see it lying in a house or a village that has been deserted, ascend to Heaven.", 'sn': 'ग्रामे गृहे वा ये द्रव्यं पारक्यं विजने स्थितम्। नाभिनन्दन्ति वै नित्यं ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those men who do not seek, even mentally, to associate with the married wives of others, even when they see them in deserted places and under the influence of desire, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'तथैव परदारान् ये कामवृत्तान् रहोगतान्। मनसापि न हिंसन्ति ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those men who, meeting with friends or enemies behave in the same friendly way towards all, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'शत्रु मित्रं च ये नित्यं तुल्येन मनसा नराः। भजन्ति मैत्रा: संगम्य ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those men who are possessed of learning and mercy, who are pure in body and mind, men care who are firm in truth, and who are contented with what belongs to them, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'श्रुतवन्तो दयावन्तः शुचयः सत्यसंगराः। स्वैरथैः परिसंतुष्टास्ते नरा: स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those men who do not bear illwell to any creature, who do not stand in need of labour for their livelihood, who bear friendly hearts towards all beings, and who entertain mercy towards all, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'अवैरा ये त्वनायासा मैत्रीचित्तरताः सदा। सर्वभूतदयावन्तस्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those men who have faith, who have mercy, who are holy, who scek the company of holy men, and who know the distinctions between right and wrong, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'श्रद्धावन्तो दयावन्तश्चोक्षाश्चोक्षजनप्रियाः। धर्माधर्मविदो नित्यं ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}
{'en': 'Those men, O goddess, who know the consequences of good and bad deeds, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'शुभानामशुभानां च कर्मणां फलसंचये। विपाकज्ञाश्च ये देवि ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Those men who are just in all their dealings, who have desirable accomplishinents, who are devoted to the deities and the Brahmanas, and who are persevering in doing all good acts, succeed in ascending to Heaven.', 'sn': 'न्यायोपेता गुणोपेता देवद्विजपराः सदा। समुत्थानमनुप्राप्तास्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'All these me, O goddess, succeed in ascending to Heaven through the meritorious results of their deeds. What else do you wish to hear?', 'sn': 'शुभैः कर्मफलैर्देवि मयैते परिकीर्तिताः। स्वर्गमार्गपरा भूयः किं त्वं श्रोतुमिहेच्छसि॥'}

{'en': 'Uma said I have a great doubt, O Maheshvara, on a subject about human beings. You should explain it to me carefully.', 'sn': 'उमोवाच महान् मे संशयः कश्चन्मान् प्रति महेश्वर। तस्मात् त्वं नैपुणेनाद्य मम व्याख्यातुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'By what deeds does a man succeed, O powerful deity, in acquiring a long life? By what penances also does one acquire a long life?', 'sn': 'केनायुर्लभते दीर्घ कर्मणा पुरुषः प्रभो। तपसा वापि देवेश केनायुर्लभते महत्॥'}

{'en': 'By what acts does one become shortlived on Earth? O you who are perfectly stainless, you should tell me what are the consequences of acts.', 'sn': 'क्षीणायुः केन भवति कर्मणा भुवि मानवः। विपाकं कर्मणां देव वक्तुमर्हस्यनिन्दित॥'}

{'en': 'Some have great good fortune and some suffer from misfortune. Some are possessed of noble, and some are of ignoble, birth.', 'sn': 'अपरे च महाभाग्या मन्दभाग्यास्तथापरे। अकुलीनास्तथा चान्ये कुलीनाश्च तथापरे॥'}

{'en': 'Some have such repulsive features as if they are made of wood, while others look very handsome at even the first sight.', 'sn': 'दुर्दर्शाः केचिदाभान्ति नरा: काष्ठमया इव। प्रियदर्शास्तथा चान्ये दर्शनादेव मानवाः॥'}

{'en': 'Some appear to have no wisdom, while others are possessed of it. Some, again, are seen gifted with high intelligence and wisdom, enlightened by knowledge and science.', 'sn': 'दुष्प्रज्ञाः केचिदाभान्ति केचिदाभान्ति पण्डिताः। महाप्राज्ञास्तथैवान्ये ज्ञानविज्ञानभाविनः॥'}

{'en': 'Some have to suffer little pain, while others there are that are loaded with heavy calamities. Such diverse sights are seen of men. O illustrious one, you should tell me the reason of all this!', 'sn': 'अल्पाबाधास्तथा केचिन्महाबाधास्तथापरे। दृश्यन्ते पुरुषा देव तन्मे व्याख्यातुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'The God of Gods said Indeed, O goddess, I shall describe to you the fruits of acts. It is by them that all human beings in this world enjoy or suffer the consequences of their acts.', 'sn': 'श्रीमहेश्वर उवाच हन्त तेऽहं प्रवक्ष्यामि देवि कर्मफलोदयम्। मर्त्यलोके नरः सर्वो येन स्वफलमश्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'That man who assumes a dreadful aspect for the purpose of taking the lives of other creatures, who arms himself with strong sticks for injuring other creatures, who is seen with uplifted weapons, who kills living creatures, who is shorn of mercy, who always causes tribulation to living beings, who refuses to grant protection to even worms and ants, who is cruel, one who is such, O goddess, sinks in Hell. One who has an opposite disposition and who is righteous in deeds, becomes born as a handsome man.', 'sn': 'प्राणातिपाते यो रौद्रो दण्डहस्तोद्यतः सदा। नित्यमुद्यतशस्त्रश्च हन्ति भूतगणान् नरः॥ निर्दयः सर्वभूतानां नित्यमुद्वेगकारकः। अपि कीटपिपीलानामशरण्यः सुनिघृणः॥ एवंभूतो नरो देवि निरयं प्रतिपद्यते। विपरीतस्तु धर्मात्मा रूपवानभिजायते॥'}

{'en': 'The man who is cruel, goes to Hell, while he who is merciful, ascends to Hcaven. The man who goes to Hell, has to suffer great misery.', 'sn': 'पापेन कर्मणा देवि वध्यो हिंसारतिर्नरः। अप्रियः सर्वभूतानां हीनायुरुपजायते॥'}
{'en': 'One who, having sunk in Hell, rises therefrom, takes birth as a shortlived man.', 'sn': 'निरयं याति हिंसात्मा याति स्वर्गमहिंसकः। यातनां निरये रौद्रां स कृच्छ्रां लभते नरः॥'}

{'en': 'That man who is given to slaughter and injury, O goddess, becomes, through his sinful deeds, liable to destruction. Such a person becomes disagreeable to all creatures and shortlived. That man who belongs to what is called the White class, who abstains from the destruction of living crcatures, who has thrown away all weapons, and never inflicts any punishment on any body, who never injures any creature, who never causes anybody to kill creatures for him, who never kills or strikes even when struck or attempted to be killed, who never sanctions or approves an act of destruction, who is gifted with mercy towards all creatures who treats others as his own self, such a superior man, O goddess, succeeds in acquiring to the dignity of a celestial. Filled with joy, such a man enjoys various kinds of luxurious articles.', 'sn': 'यः कश्चिन्निरयात् तस्मात् समुत्तरति कर्हिचित्। मानुष्यं लभते चापि हीनायुस्तत्र जायते॥ पापेन कर्मणा देवि बद्धो हिंसारतिर्नरः। अप्रियः सर्वभूतानां हीनायुरुपजायते॥ यस्तु शुक्लाभिजातीयः प्राणिघातविवर्जकः। निक्षिप्तशस्त्रो निर्दण्डो न हिंसति कदाचन॥ न घातयति ना हन्ति नंन्त नैवानुमोदते। सर्वभूतेषु सस्नेहो यथाऽऽत्मनि तथापरे॥ ईदृशः पुरुषोत्कर्षो देवि देवत्वमश्नुते। उपपन्नान् सुखान् भोगानुपाश्नाति मुदा युतः॥'}
{'en': 'If such a person is ever born in the world of men, he becomes longlived and enjoys great happiness.', 'sn': 'अथ चेन्मानुषे लोके कदाचिदुपपद्यते। तत्र दीर्घायुरुत्पन्न: स नरः सुखमेधते॥'}

{'en': 'This is the way of those who are uf righteous conduct and righteous deeds, and who are blessed with longevity, the way that was marked out by the SelfCreate Brahman himself and which is marked by abstention from the destruction of living creatures.', 'sn': 'एष दीर्घायुषां मार्गः सुवृत्तानां सुकर्मिणाम्। प्राणिहिंसाविमोक्षेण ब्रह्मणा समुदीरितः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Thus addressed by his father, Shuka, highly praising these instructions of the great Rishi, began to ask the following questions regarding the import of duties which brings on Liberation.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच इत्युक्तोऽभिप्रशस्यैतत् परमर्षस्तु शासनम्। मोक्षधर्मार्थसंयुक्तमिदं प्रष्टुं प्रचक्रमे॥'}

{'en': 'Shuka said By what means does a wise man well-read in the Vedas, observant of sacrifices, and shorn of malice attains to Brahma which is incapable of being apprehended by either direct evidence or inference, and incapable of being described by the Vedas.', 'sn': 'शुक उवाच प्रज्ञावाश्रोत्रियो यज्वा कृतप्रज्ञोऽनसूयकः। अनागतामनैतिचं कथं ब्रह्माधिगच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'Asked by me, tell me by what means can Brahma be known. Is it by penance, by Brahmacharya, by renunciation of everything, by intelligence, by help of the Sankhya philosophy, or by the Yoga?', 'sn': 'तवयस ब्रह्मचर्येण सर्वत्यागेन मेधया। सांख्ये वा यदि वा योग एतत् पृष्टो वदस्व मे॥'}

{'en': 'What are the means and what sort of singleness of purpose may inen acquire regarding both, viz., the mind and the senses? You should explain all this to me!', 'sn': 'मनसश्चेन्द्रियाणां च यथैकाम्यमवाप्यते। येनोपायेन पुरुषैस्तत् त्वं व्याख्यातुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'Vyasa said No man achieves success by any other means save the acquisition of knowledge, the practice of penances, the control of the senses, and renunciation of everything.', 'sn': 'व्यास उवाच नान्यत्र विद्यातपसोर्नान्यत्रेन्द्रियनिग्रहात्। नान्यत्र सर्वसंत्यागात् सिद्धिं विन्दति कश्चन॥'}

{'en': 'The great elements (five in number) represent the first creation of the Self-create. They have been very largely put in embodied creatures living in the world of life.', 'sn': 'महाभूतानि सर्वाणि पूर्वसृष्टिः स्वयम्भुवः। भूयिष्ठं प्राणभृदग्नामे निविष्टानि शरीरिषु॥'}

{'en': 'The bodies of all embodied creatures are originated from earth. Their humours originate from water. Their eyes originate from light. Prana, Apana (and other vital breaths), depend on the wind. And, lastly, all unoccupied apertures within them originate from Space.', 'sn': 'भूमेदेहो जलात् स्नेहो ज्योतिषश्चक्षुषी स्मृते। प्राणापानाश्रयो वायु: खेष्वाकाशं शरीरिणाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vishnu is in the feet (of living creatures). Indra is in their arms. Within the stomach lies Agni, desirous of eating. The points of the horizon are in the ears, the organ of hearing. Speech, which is the goddess of learning, is in the tongue.', 'sn': 'क्रान्ते विष्णुर्बले शक्रः कोष्ठेऽग्निर्भोक्तुमिच्छति। कर्णयोः प्रदिशः श्रोत्रं जिह्वायां वाक् सरस्वती॥'}

{'en': 'The ears, skin, eyes, tongue, and nose forming the fifth, are the senses of knowledge. These exist for apprehending their respective objects.', 'sn': 'कर्णी त्वक् चक्षुषी जिह्वार नासिका चैव पञ्चमी। दर्शनीयेन्द्रियोक्तानि द्वाराण्याहारसिद्धये॥'}

{'en': 'Sound, touch, from, taste, and scent for the fifth, are the objects of the (five) senses. These should always be considered as distinct from the senses.', 'sn': 'शब्दः स्पर्शस्तथा रूपं रसो गन्धश्च पञ्चमः। इन्द्रियार्थान् पृथग्विद्यादिन्द्रियेभ्यस्तु नित्यदा॥'}

{'en': 'Like the charioteer driving his well trained horses along the paths he likes, the mind, imoves the senses. The mind, in its turn, is inoved by the Understanding sitting in the heart.', 'sn': 'इन्द्रियाणि मनोयुङ्क्ते वश्यान् यन्तेव वाजिनः। पनश्चापि सदा युङ्क्ते भूतात्मा हृदयाश्रितः॥'}

{'en': 'The mind is the lord of all these senses employing them in their functions and guiding controlling them. Likewise, the Understanding is the lord of the mind.', 'sn': 'इन्द्रियाणां तथैवैषां सर्वेषामीश्वरं मनः। नियमे च विसर्गे च भूतात्मा मानसस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'The senses, the objects of the senses, the attributes of the objects of Nature, understanding, mind, the vital our and individual soul dwell in the bodies of all embodied creatures.', 'sn': 'इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थाश्च स्वभावश्चेतना मनः। प्राणापानौ च जीवश्च नित्यं देहेषु देहिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'The body within which the Understanding lives, has no real existence. The body, therefore, is not the seat of the Understanding. Nature (Prakriti), endued with three qualities, is the refuge of the Understanding which exists only in the form of a sound. The Soul also is not the refuge of the Understanding. It is Desire which creates the Understanding. Desire, however, never creates the three qualities.', 'sn': 'आश्रयो नास्ति सत्त्वस्य गुणाः शब्दो न चेतना। सत्त्वं हि तेजः सृजति न गुणान् वै कथंचन॥'}

{'en': 'The wise man, capable of controlling his senses, sees the seventeenth, viz., the Soul as surrounded by six and ten qualities, in his own Understanding by the help of the mind.', 'sn': 'एवं सप्तदशं देहे वृतं षोडशभिर्गुणैः। मनीषी मनसा विप्रः पश्यत्यात्मानमात्मनि॥'}

{'en': "The Soul cannot be seen with the help of the eye, or with that of all the senses. Getting over all, the Soul can be seen by only the light of the mind's lamp.", 'sn': 'न ह्ययं चक्षुषा दृश्यो न च सर्वैरपीन्द्रियैः। मनसा तु प्रदीपेन महानात्मा प्रकाशते॥'}

{'en': 'Shorn of the properties of sound and touch and form, without taste and smell, indestructible and without a body and without senses, it is nevertheless seen within the body.', 'sn': 'अशब्दस्पर्शरूपं तदरसागन्धमव्ययम्। अशरीरं शरीरेषु निरीक्षेत निरिन्द्रियम्॥'}

{'en': "Unmanifest and supreme, it lives in all mortal frames, Guided by the preceptor and the Vedas, he who sees it hereafter becomes Brahma's self.", 'sn': 'अव्यक्तं सर्वदेहेषु मर्येषु परमाश्रितम्। योऽनुपश्यति स प्रेत्य कल्पते ब्रह्मभूयसे॥'}

{'en': 'The wise see impartially a Brahmana gifted with knowledge and disciples, a cow, an elephant, a dog, and a Chandala.', 'sn': 'विद्याभिजनसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि। शुचि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः॥'}
{'en': 'Transcending all things, the Soul lives in all creatures, mobile and immobile.', 'sn': 'स हि सर्वेषु भूतेषु जङ्गमेषु ध्रुवेषु च। वसत्येको महानात्मा येन सर्वमिदं ततम्॥'}

{'en': 'When a living creature sees his own Soul in all things, and all things in his own Soul, he is said to attain to Brahma.', 'sn': 'सर्वभूतेषु चात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि। यदा पश्यति भूतात्मा ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा॥'}

{'en': "One occupies the Supreme Soul proportionate to what is occupied in one's own soul by Vedic sound. He who can always realise the identity of all things with his own self, forsooth, acquires immortality.", 'sn': 'यावानात्मनि वेदात्मा तावानात्मा परात्मनि। य एवं सततं वेद सोऽमृतत्वाय कल्पते॥'}

{'en': 'Even the gods are stupefied in the path of that trackless man who forms the soul of all creatures, who is engaged in the well being of all creatures and who wishes to attain to the final refuge (of all things).', 'sn': 'सर्वभूतात्मभूतस्य विभोर्भूतहितस्य च। देवाऽपि मार्गे मुह्यन्ति अपदस्य पदैषिणः॥'}

{'en': 'Indeed, the road which is followed by men of knowledge is as invisible as that of birds in the sky or of fish in water.', 'sn': 'शकुन्तानामिवाकाशे मत्स्यानामिव चोदके। यथा गतिर्न दृश्येत तथा ज्ञानविदां गतिः॥'}

{'en': 'Time, by its own power, cooks all entities within itself. No one, however, knows That in which Time, again, is itself cooked.', 'sn': 'काल: पचति भूतानि सर्वाण्येवात्मनात्मनि। यस्मिस्तु पच्यते कालस्तं वेदेह न कश्चन॥'}

{'en': 'That does not take place above, or in the middle or below, or in transverse or in any Other direction. That is no tangible thing and cannot be found in any placc.', 'sn': 'न तदूर्ध्वं न तिर्यक् च नाधो न च पुनः पुनः । न मध्ये प्रतिगृह्णीते नैव किंचित् कुतश्चन॥'}

{'en': 'All these worlds exists within That. There is nothing in these worlds which exists out of That. Even if one goes on ceaselessly with the motion of arrow shot off the bow-string, even if one goes on with the speed of the mind itself, one would not still get at the end of that which is the cause of all this. There is nothing grosser than that.', 'sn': 'सर्वेऽन्तःस्था इमे लोका बाह्ममेषां न किंचन। यद्यजस्रं समागच्छेद् यथा बाणो गुणच्युतः॥ नैवान्तं कारणस्येयाद् यद्यपि स्यान्मनोजवः। तस्मात् सूक्ष्मात् सूक्ष्मतरं नास्ति स्थूलतरं ततः॥'}

{'en': 'His hands and feet are everywhere. His cyes, head, and face are everywhere. His ears are everywhere in the universe. He exists Occupying all things.', 'sn': 'सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत् सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम्। सर्वतःश्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति॥'}

{'en': 'That is minuter than the minutest, and is the heart of all things. Though existing, that is still imperceptible.', 'sn': 'तदेवाणोरणुतरं तन्महद्भ्यो महत्तरम्। तदन्तःसर्वभूतानां ध्रुवं तिष्ठन्न दृश्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Indestructible and destructible,-these are the dual forms of the (Supreme) Self.
