The existence it shows in all mobile and immobile entities is destructible; while the existence in shows in Chaitanya is celestial, immortal, and indestructible.', 'sn': 'अक्षरं च क्षरं चैव द्वैधीभावोऽयमात्मनः। क्षरः सर्वेषु भूतेष दिव्यं तमृतमक्षरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Though the master of all existent beings both mobile and immobile, though inactive and shorn of attributes, it enters nevertheless the well-known house of nine doors and becomes engaged in action.', 'sn': 'नवद्वारं पुरं गत्वा हंसो हि नियतो वशी। ईशः सर्वस्य भूतस्य स्थावरस्य चरस्य च॥'}

{'en': 'Wise men who can see the other shore hold that the Supreme Soul becomes endued with the attribute of action on account of motion, pleasure and pain, variety of form, and the nine well-known possessions.', 'sn': 'हानिभङ्गविकल्पानां नवानां संचयेन च। शरीराणामजस्याहुहँसत्वं पारदर्शिनः॥'}

{'en': 'That indestructible Soul which is said to be endued with the attribute or action is nothing else than the indestructible Soul which is said to be inactive. A learned person, by attaining to that indestructible essence, gives up for ever both life and birth.', 'sn': 'हंसोक्तं चाक्षरं चैव कूटस्थं यत् तदक्षरम्। तद् विद्वानक्षरं प्राप्य जहाति प्राणजन्मनी॥'}

{'en': 'Nakula said Words of different degrees of worth have been said by the just king, O Madhava, who knows what righteousness is and who is benevolent; and they have all been heard by you.', 'sn': 'नकुल उवाच उक्तं बहुविधं वाक्यं धर्मराजेन माधव। धर्मज्ञेन वदान्येन श्रुतं चैव हि तत् त्वया॥'}

{'en': 'Bhimasena, having ascertained the wishes of the king, has dwelt on peace as well as on his own strength of arms, O Madhava.', 'sn': 'मतमाज्ञाय राज्ञश्च भीमसेनेन माधव। संशमो बाहुवीर्यं च ख्यापितं माधवात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'In the same way what has been said by Falguna has been heard by you; and your own opinions, O hero have been expressed by you.', 'sn': 'तथैव फाल्गुनेनापि यदुक्तं तत् त्वया श्रुतम्। आत्मनश्च मतं वीरं कथितं भवता सकृत्॥'}

{'en': 'Shutting your mind to all this and hearing what the intentions of the enemy are, do that what you consider to be opportune, O foremost among men.', 'sn': 'सर्वमेतदतिक्रम्य श्रुत्वा परमतं भवान्। यत् प्राप्तकालं मन्येथास्ततं कुर्याः पुरुषोत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Different conclusions are arrived at in different matters, O Keshava, but with a view to success, O chastiser of your enemies, a thing ought to be done by man at the right moment.', 'sn': 'तस्मिंस्तस्मिन् निमित्तं हि मतं भवति केशव। प्राप्तकाल मनुष्येण क्षमं कार्यमरिन्दम॥'}

{'en': 'An object, settled on in a particular way, again becomes different, when the conditions are changed; therefore man cannot stick to the same opinions in this world, O you foremost among men.', 'sn': 'अन्यथा चिन्तितो ह्यर्थः पुनर्भवति सोऽन्यथा। अनित्यमतयो लोके नराः पुरुषसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'While residing in the wood, we were of a different inclination; and while in concealment we came to be of other inclination. But now when we are out of concealment, when we can expose ourselves to the view of others, our inclinations are again changed.', 'sn': 'अन्यथा बुद्धया ह्यासन्नस्मासु वनवासिषु। अदृश्येष्वन्यथा कृष्ण दृश्येषु पुनरन्यथा॥'}

{'en': 'O you of the Vrishni race, the love of kingdom, which now exists among us, did not exist to the same degree when we wandered in the woods.', 'sn': 'अस्माकमपि वार्ष्णेय वने विचरतां तदा। न तथा प्रणयो राज्ये यथा सम्प्रति वर्तते॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing that, we are returned from our exile in the woods, O hero. These seven Akshauhinis have gathered round us through your grace, OJanardana.', 'sn': 'निवृत्तवनवासान् नः श्रुत्वा वीर समागताः। अक्षौहिण्यो हि सप्तेमास्त्वत्प्रसादाज्जनार्दन॥'}

{'en': 'What man is there who, seeing these tigers among men of inconceivable strength and prowess and ready for battle with all their arms, will not be struck with fear?', 'sn': 'इमान् हि पुरुषव्याघ्रानचिन्त्यबलपौरुषान्। आत्तशस्त्रान् रणे दृष्ट्वा न व्यथेदिह कः पुमान्॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore do you in the midst of the Kurus speak words fraught with mildness, so that the foolish Suyodhana may not be struck with fear; and then (when these have failed) use threats.', 'sn': 'स भवान् कुरुमध्ये तं सान्त्वपूर्वं भयोत्तरम्। ब्रूयाद् वाक्यं यथा मन्दो न व्यथेत सुयोधनः॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira, Bhimasena, Vibhatsu, Aparajita, Sahadeva, myself Rama and yourself, O Keshava, Satyaki, Virat of great strength with his son, Drupada with his minister and Dhrishtadyumna, O Madhava, the king of Kashi of great strength and Dhrishtaketu, the lord of the Chedis-what earthly mortal is there of flesh and blood, who fight against these in battle.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिरं भीमसेनं बीभत्सुं चापराजितम्। सहदेवं च मां चैव त्वां च रामं च केशव।॥ सात्यकिं च महावीर्यं विराटं च सहात्मजम्। दुपदं च सहामात्यं धृष्टद्युम्नं च माधव॥ काशिराजं च विक्रान्तं धृष्टकेतुं च चेदिपम्। मांसशोणितभृन्मर्त्यः प्रतियुध्येत को युधि॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore you will the moment you go there, accomplish without doubt the only object desired by the virtuous king, O you of long arms. are', 'sn': 'स भवान् गमनादेव साधयिष्यत्यसंशयम्। इष्टमर्थं महाबाहो धर्मराजस्य केवलम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vidura, Bhishma and Drona with Bahlika are capable of understanding yourself and of speaking words of wisdom of wisdom which beneficial at the same time.', 'sn': 'विदुरश्चैव भीष्मश्च द्रोणश्च सहबाह्निकः। श्रेयः समर्था विज्ञातुमुच्यमानास्त्वयानघ॥'}

{'en': 'And they too will lead Dhritarashtra, the lord of men and that Suyodhana of wicked nature with his ministers to do as you bid.', 'sn': 'ते चैनमनुनेष्यन्ति धृतराष्ट्रं जनाधिपम्। तं च पापसमाचारं सहामात्यं सुयोधनम्॥'}

{'en': 'When you, O Janardana, speak and Vidura hears on subjects conducive to their interests; what subject is there in the world which you cannot turn smooth and clear.', 'sn': 'श्रोता चार्थस्य विदुरस्त्वं च वक्ता जनार्दन। कमिवार्थं निवर्तन्तं स्थापयेतां न वर्मनि॥'}

{'en': 'Brihadashva said: As the bird course through the sky, so he (king Nala) speedily crossed the rivers, mountains, woods and lakes.', 'sn': 'बृहदश्व उवाच स नदी: पर्वतांश्चैव वनानि च सरांसि च। अचिरेणातिचक्राम खेचरः खे चरनिव॥'}

{'en': 'While the car was thus coursing, the conqueror of hostile towns, the king Vangasura, saw his sheet drop down upon the ground.', 'sn': 'तथा प्रयाते तु रथे तदा भाङ्गासुरिर्नृपः। उत्तरीयमधोऽपश्यद् भ्रष्टं परपुरजयः॥'}

{'en': 'When the garinent had thus dropped down, then the lofty-minded king instantly expressed to Nala his desire to recover it. O you of profound intelligence, do you restrain these horses of great swiftness, until Varshneya bring me back my upper garment here.', 'sn': 'ततः स त्वरमाणस्तु पटे निपतिते तदा। ग्रहीष्यामीति तं राजा नलमाह महामनाः॥ निगृहणेष्व महाबुद्धे हयानेतान् महाजवान्। वार्ष्णेयो यावदेनं मे पटमानयतामिह॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, Nala said to him in reply, “Your garment had dropped down far away; that is, we had advanced about eight miles from that place. It is, therefore, impossible to recover it.”', 'sn': 'नलस्तं प्रत्युवाचाथ दूरे भ्रष्टः पटस्तवा योजनं समतिक्रान्तो नाहर्तुं शक्यते पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'O monarch, having been thus addressed by Nala, the royal son of Vangasura came near a tree, called Vibhitaka with fruits, in the wood.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तो नलेनाथ तदा भाङ्गासुरिर्नृपः। आससाद वने राजन् फलवन्तं बिभीतकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding the tree, the king instantly said to Bahuka: “O charioteer, do you also see my great power of calculation.', 'sn': 'तं दृष्ट्वा बाहुकं राजा त्वरमाणोऽभ्यभाषत। ममापि सूत पश्य त्वं संख्याने परमं बलम्॥'}

{'en': 'All men do not know all things; in fact, there is none, who is acquainted with all the branches of knowledge. In one person, the knowledge in its entirety, is not centered.', 'sn': 'सर्वः सर्वं न जानाति सर्वज्ञो नास्ति कश्चन। नैकत्र परिनिष्ठास्ति ज्ञानस्य पुरुषे क्वचित्॥'}

{'en': 'O Bahuka, the leaves and fruits that have fallen from the tree (respectively) exceed the leaves and fruits, that are on the tree itself, by one hundred and one. O Bahuka, these two branches of the tree contain five millions of leaves. Examine the two branches and all their boughs and their fruits will number two thousand and ninety-five."', 'sn': 'वृक्षेऽस्मिन् यानि पर्णानि फलान्यपि च बाहुक। पतितान्यपि यान्यत्र तत्रैकमधिकं शतम्॥ एकपत्राधिकं चात्र फलमेकं च बाहुका पञ्चकोट्योऽथ पत्राणां द्वयोरपि च शाखयोः॥ प्रचिनुगुह्यस्य शाखे द्वे याश्चाप्यन्याः प्रशाखिकाः। आभ्यां फलसहस्रे द्वे पञ्चोनं शतमेव च॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon Bahuka stopped the car and addressed the king, “O monarch, O the chastiser of foes, you are saying to me what is beyond my power of perception. O king, I will make this matter perceptible (by my sense) by cutting down the tree Vibhitaka; and when I will really count, there nothing will remain to be supposed. O foremost of kings, I will hew down the tree Vibhitaka in your presence. I do not know whether what you say will really come to pass or not.', 'sn': 'ततो रथमवस्थाप्य राजानं बाहुकोऽब्रवीत्। परोक्षमिव मे राजन् कत्थसे शत्रुकर्शन॥ प्रत्यक्षमेतत् कर्तास्मि शातयित्वा विभीतकम्। अथात्र गणिते राजन् विद्यते न परोक्षता॥ प्रत्यक्षं ते महाराज शातयिष्ये बिभीतकम्। अहं हि नाभिजानामि भवेदेवं न वेति वा॥'}

{'en': 'O ruler of men, I will number the fruits of the tree, while you will see it. Let Varshneya pull up the reins of the horses for a moment."', 'sn': 'संख्यास्यामि फलान्यस्य पश्यतस्ते जनाधिप। मुहूर्तमपि वार्ष्णेयो रश्मीन् यच्छतु वाजिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'The monarch asked the charioteer not to lose any time. But Bahuka, with great humility, answered him, saying, "Do you wait for a moment; or, if you are in a hurry, go then with Varshneya, as your charioteer. The way goes smooth and straight."', 'sn': 'तमब्रवीनृपः सूतं नायं कालो विलम्बितुम्। बाहुकस्त्वब्रवीदेनं परं यत्नं समास्थितः॥ प्रतीक्षस्व मुहूर्तं त्वमथवा त्वरते भवान्। एष याति शिवः पन्था याहि वार्ष्णेयसारथिः॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of the Kuru race, king Rituparna, having comforted Bahuka, addressed him, saying: "O Bahuka, there is none else in this world, who is like you, as a charioteer.', 'sn': 'अब्रवीदूतुपर्णस्तु सान्त्वयन् कुरुनन्दन। त्वमेव यन्ता नान्योऽस्ति पृथिव्यामपि बाहुक॥'}

{'en': 'O you versed in the equestrian science, I desire to go to the country of the Vidharbhas with your assistance. May I obtain your protection. It is necessary for you not to cause any obstacle.', 'sn': 'त्वत्कृते यातुमिच्छामि विदर्भान् हयकोविदा शरणं त्वां प्रपन्नोऽस्मि न विघ्नं कर्तुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'O Bahuka, I shall fulfill your desire, (that is, whatever you will tell me) if you take me today to the country of the Vidharbhas and make me see the sun-rise."', 'sn': 'कामं च ते करिष्यामि यन्मां वक्ष्यसि बाहुक। विदर्भान् यदि यात्वाद्य सूर्यं दर्शयितासि मे॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon Bahuka answered him, saying: "Having counted the (leaves and fruits of) Vibhitaka tree. I shall go to the country of the Vidharbhas. Act up to my words."', 'sn': 'अथाब्रवीद् बाहुकस्तं संख्याय मे बिभीतकम्। ततो विदर्भान् यास्यामि कुरुष्वैवं वचो मम॥'}

{'en': 'Surely the king most unwillingly said to him count. (He also said), “O unblameable one, O you versed in the knowledge of horses, having counted (the leaves and fruits of) one portion of this branch, you will be satisfied of the truth of my affirmation." He (Nala) then dismounted from the car with all haste and cut down the tree.', 'sn': 'अकाम इव तं राजा गणयस्वेत्युवाच ह। एकदेशं च शाखायाः समादिष्टं मयानघ॥ गणयस्वाश्वतत्त्वज्ञ ततस्त्वं प्रीतिमावह। सोऽवतीर्य रथात् तूर्णं शातयामास तं दुमम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then again he numbered all the fruits; and found out the truth of what the king had said; and, thus struck with astonishment, he addressed the monarch, saying,', 'sn': 'ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो राजानमिदमब्रवीत्। गणयित्वा यथोक्तानि तावन्त्येव फलानि तु॥'}

{'en': '"O king, this is most wonderful. I found your high proficiency (in calculation), O monarch, I desire to be informed of your art, by (virtue of) which you have known all this." Thereupon the prince, as he was most desirous to go speedily, said to him this" "Do you know that I am conversant with the play at dice and versed in calculation as well."', 'sn': 'अत्यद्भुतमिदं राजन् दृष्टवानस्मि ते बलम्। श्रोतुमिच्छामि तां विद्यां ययैतज्ज्ञायते नृप॥ तमुवाच ततो राजा त्वरितो गमने नृप। विद्ध्यक्षहदयज्ञं मां संख्याने च विशारदम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then Bahuka said to him" "O foremost of men, do you impart this art to me and take from me my knowledge, regarding the management of horses."', 'sn': 'बाहुकस्तमुवाचाथ देहि विद्यामिमां मम। मत्तोऽपि चाश्चहृदयं गृहाण पुरुषर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon king Rituparna, for the reason of the great importance of his business and also for his extreme desire to acquire the knowledge of horses, agreed to what Bahuka had said.', 'sn': 'ऋतुपर्णस्ततो राजा बाहुकं कार्यगौरवात्। हयज्ञानस्य लोभाच्च तं तथेत्यब्रवीद् वचः॥'}

{'en': '"As you have asked, do you take from me my great skill at dice. O Bahuka, let my knowledge of horses remain with you in trust. Thus saying, king Rituparna gave Nala his knowledge of the play at dice.', 'sn': 'यथोक्तं त्वं गृहाणेदमक्षाणां हृदयं परम्। निक्षेपो मेऽश्वहृदयं त्वयि तिष्ठतु बाहुका एवमुक्त्वा ददौ विद्यामृतुपर्णो नलाय वै॥'}

{'en': 'When he (Nala) thus acquired the knowledge of this art of playing at dice Kali came out of his body; while he continued to vomit from his mouth the most virulent poison of Karkotaka. Then that fire of curse (by Damayanti), by which Kali had greatly been afflicted, also came out of his body. In fact, the king, like one of unregenerate soul, had long remained repressed by him (Kali).', 'sn': 'तस्याक्षहृदयज्ञस्य शरीरानि:सृतः कलिः। कर्कोटकविषं तीक्ष्णं मुखात् सततमुद्वमन्॥ कलेस्तस्य तदार्तस्य शापाग्निः स विनिःसृतः। स तेन कर्शिता राजा दीर्घकालमनात्मवान्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon Kali, with his soul freed from the poison, assumed his own form. Then Nala, the prince of the Nishadhas, became angry and was intent upon cursing him.', 'sn': 'ततो विषविमुक्तात्मा स्वं रूपमकरोत् कलिः। तं शप्तुमैच्छत् कुपितो निषधाधिपतिर्नलः॥'}

{'en': 'Kali became frightened; and, trembling with fear, folded his hands; and said to him this: “O king, restrain your anger and, in return, I will impart you great fame.', 'sn': 'तमुवाच कलि तो वेपमानः कृताञ्जलिः। कोपं संयच्छ नृपते कीर्तिं दास्यामि ते पराम्॥'}

{'en': 'The mother of Indrasena cursed ine in wrath long ago, that is, at the time when she had been left by you. From that time forward I have greatly been oppressed (by that curse).', 'sn': 'इन्द्रसेनस्य जननी कुपिता माशपत् पुरा। यदा त्वया परित्यक्ता ततोऽहं भृशपीडितः॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of kings, O unconquered one, burning day and night in the poison of the prince of the snakes, I most miserably resided within you.', 'sn': 'अवसं त्वयि राजेन्द्र सुदुःखमपराजित। विषेण नागराजस्य दह्यमानो दिवानिशम्॥'}

{'en': 'I place myself under your protection. Do you listen to these my words. Should you not curse me, who am seeking your protection and greatly terrified by you, then the men of this world, attentively repeating your story, will never have any fear on my account.” Having been thus said, king Nala suppressed his own wrath.', 'sn': 'शरणं त्वां प्रपन्नोऽस्मि शृणु चेदं वचो मम! ये च त्वां मनुजा लोके कीर्तयिष्यन्त्यतन्द्रिताः। मत्प्रसूतं भयं तेषां न कदाचिद् भविष्यति॥ भयार्तं शरणं यातं यदि मां त्वं न शप्स्यसे। एवमुक्तो नलो राजा न्ययच्छत् कोपमात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon Kali became terrified and instantly entered into the three Vibhitaka. While Kali, thus conversing with the king of the Nishadhas, was invisible to others.', 'sn': 'ततो भीतः कलिः क्षिप्रं प्रविवेश बिभीतकम्। कलिस्त्वन्यैस्तदादृश्यः कथयन् नैषधेन वै॥'}

{'en': 'Thenceforth the king became freed from all afflictions; and, having numbered the fruits of the tree, he was filled with great joy and was endued with great energy. Then the mighty one mounted on the car; and, urging the swift steeds, proceeded onwards.', 'sn': 'ततो गतज्वरो राजा नैषधः परवीरहा। सम्प्रणष्टे कलौ राजा संख्यायास्य फलान्युत॥ मुदा परमया युक्तस्तेजसाथ परेण वै। रथमारुह्य तेजस्वी प्रययौ जवनैर्हयैः॥'}

{'en': 'Having been possessed by Kali, the Vibhitaka tree grew worthless. Highly satisfied at the very core of his heart, Nala urged the excellent horses which, like the birds, mounted again and again into the air. Thus the glorious monarch proceeded in the direction of the country of the Vidharbhas.', 'sn': 'बिभीतकश्चाप्रशस्तः संवृत्तः कलिसंश्रयात्। हयोत्तमानुत्पततो द्विजानिव पुनः पुनः॥ नलः संचोदयामास प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना। विदर्भाभिमुखो राजा प्रययौ स महायशाः॥'}

{'en': 'When Nala went a long way off, Kali too returned home. Thus prince Nala, having been left by Kali, became delivered from all afflictions. But, O monarch, that ruler of the earth did not regain his native form.', 'sn': 'नले त समतिक्रान्ते कलिरप्यगमद् गृहम्। ततो गतज्वरो राजा नलोऽभूत् पृथिवीपतिः। विमुक्तः कलिना राजन् रूपमात्रवियोजितः॥'}

{'en': 'Pulastya said: O king of kings, one should then go to Kurukshetra, adored by all and at the sight of which sins of all creatures are destroyed.', 'sn': 'पुलस्त्य उवाच ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र कुरुक्षेत्रमभिष्टुतम्। पापेभ्यो यत्र मुच्यन्ते दर्शनात् सर्वजन्तवः॥'}

{'en': 'He who always says, “I shall go to Kurukshetra, I shall live in Kurukshetra" is cleansed off all his sins.', 'sn': 'कुरुक्षेत्रं गमिष्यामि कुरुक्षेत्रे वसाम्यहम्। य एवं सततं ब्रूयात् सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'The very dust of Kurukshetra carried by the wind leads even the man of sinful deeds to the highest state.', 'sn': 'पांसवोऽपि कुरुक्षेत्रे वायुना समुदीरिताः। अपि दुष्कृतकर्माणं नयन्ति परमां गतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'He who lives in Kurukshetra which is situated south of the Sarasvati and the north of the Drishadvati (really) lives in heaven.', 'sn': 'दक्षिणेन सरस्वत्या दृषद्वत्युत्तरेण च। ये वसन्ति कुरुक्षेत्रे ते वसन्ति त्रिविष्टपे॥'}

{'en': 'O hero ever stcady in battle and should live there for a month where flows the Sarasvati. Brahma and other celestials, the Rishis, the Siddhas, the Charans.', 'sn': 'तत्र मासं वसेद्धीरः सरस्वत्यां युधिष्ठिर। यत्र ब्रह्मादयो देवा ऋषयः सिद्धचारणाः॥'}

{'en': 'The Gandharvas, the Apsaras the Yakshas, the Nagas, O ruler of earth, O descendant of Bharata, all often go to that greatly sacred Brahmakshetra.', 'sn': 'गन्धर्वाप्सरसो यक्षाः पन्नगाश्च महीपते। ब्रह्मक्षेत्रं महापुण्यमभिगच्छन्ति भारत॥'}

{'en': 'O hero steady in battle, even the sins of him who only mentally desires to go to Kurukshetra are all destroyed; and he goes to the region of Brahma.', 'sn': 'मनसाप्यभिकामस्य कुरुक्षेत्रं युधिष्ठिर। पापानि विप्रणश्यन्ति ब्रह्मलोकं च गच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'O perpetuator of the Kuru race, he who goes to Kurukshetra with due respect, obtains the fruits of Rajasuya and Ashvamedha sacrifices,', 'sn': 'गत्वा हि श्रद्धया युक्तः कुरुक्षेत्रं कुरूद्वह। फलं प्राप्नोति च तदा राजसूयाश्वमेधयोः॥'}

{'en': 'Then saluting the greatly powerful gatekeeper, the Yaksha, Mankanaka, one obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'ततो मङ्खनकं नाम द्वारपालं महाबलम्। यक्षं समभिवाद्यैव गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'O virtuous man, O king of kings, one should then go to the excellent region of Vishnu, called Satata, where Hari is always present.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेतधर्मज्ञ विष्णो: स्थानमनुत्तमम्। सततं नाम राजेन्द्र यत्र संनिहितो हरिः॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing there and bowing to Hari, the creator of the three worlds, one obtains the fruits of Ashvamedha sacrifice and goes to the region of Vishnu. Then one should go to the Tirtha named Pariplava, celebrated all over the three worlds. O descendant of Bharata, he obtains greater fruits than those of the Agnishtoma and Atiratha (sacrifices).', 'sn': 'तत्र स्नात्वा च नत्वा च त्रिलोकप्रभवं हरिम्। अश्वमेधमवाप्नोति विष्णुलोकं च गच्छति॥ ततः पारिप्लवं गच्छेत् तीर्थं त्रैलोक्यविश्रुतम्। अग्निष्टोमातिरात्राभ्यां फलं प्राप्नोति भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Then going to the Tirtha, called Prithivi one obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine. O ruler of men, going to the Salukini, the pilgrim, bathing there in the Dasashvamedha obtains the fruits of ten Ashvamedha sacrifice. Then going to the excellent Tirtha of the Nagas, called Sarpadevi. One obtains fruits of the Agnishtoma (sacrifice) and goes to the region of the Nagas. O virtuous man, one should then go to the gate-keeper, Tarantuka. Living there for only one night, one obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine. Then going to the five rivers with regulated diet and subdued soul and bathing in the Koti Tirtha, one obtains the fruits of Ashvamedha sacrifice. Going to the Tirtha called Ashvins one acquires personal beauty.', 'sn': 'पृथिवीतीर्थमासाद्य गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्। ततः शालूकिनी गत्वा तीर्थसेवी नराधिप।॥ दशाश्वमेधे स्नात्वा च तदेव फलमाप्नुयात्। सर्पदेवीं समासाद्य नागानां तीर्थमुत्तमम्॥ अग्निष्टोममवाप्नोति नागलोकं च विन्दति। ततो गच्छेतधर्मज्ञ द्वारपालं तरन्तुकम्॥ तत्रोष्य रजनीमेकां गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्। ततः पञ्चनदं गत्वा नियतो नियताशनः॥ कोटितीर्थमुपस्पृश्य हयमेधफलं लभेत्। अश्विनोस्तीर्थमासाद्य रूपवानभिजायते॥'}

{'en': 'O virtuous man, one should then go to the excellent Tirtha, called Varaha, where Vishnu formerly in his boar form lived. O foremost of men, bathing there one obtains the fruits of Agnishtoma.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेतधर्मज्ञ वाराहं तीर्थमुत्तमम्। विष्णुर्वाराहरूपेण पूर्वं यत्र स्थितोऽभवत्॥ तत्र स्नात्वा नरश्रेष्ठ अग्निष्टोमफलं लभेत्।'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, one should then go to the Soma Tirtha, situated in Jayanti, Bathing in it a man obtains the fruits of the Rajasuya sacrifice.', 'sn': 'ततो जयन्त्यां राजेन्द्र सोमतीर्थं समाविशेत्॥ स्नात्वा फलमवाप्नोति राजसूयस्य मानवः।'}

{'en': 'Bathing in Ekahansa a man obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine. O ruler of men, going to Kritashocha, the pilgrim obtains the lotus-eyed deity (Vishnu) and becomes pure in soul.', 'sn': 'एकहंसे नरः स्नात्वाः गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्॥ कृताशौचं समासाद्य तीर्थसेवी नराधिप। पुण्डरीकमवाप्नोति कृतशौतो भवेच्च सः॥'}

{'en': 'Then going to the region of the illustrious Sihanu (Shiva, called Manjabata and living there for one night, one acquires the state of Ganapathya.', 'sn': 'ततो मुञ्जवटं नाम स्थाणोः स्थानं महात्मनः। उपोष्य रजनीमेकां गाणपत्यमवाप्नुयात्॥'}

{'en': "O great king, there is the celebrated Tirtha called Yakshini; O king of kings, going and bathing in that Tirtha one's all desires are fulfilled.", 'sn': 'तत्रैव च महाराज यक्षिणी लोकविश्रुताम्। स्नात्वाभिगम्य राजेन्द्र सर्वान् कामानवाप्नुयात्॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, it is known as the gate of Kurukshetra. The pilgrim with subdued soul should walk round it. It was created by the illustrious son of Jamadagni, Rama. It is equal to the Pushkara. O king, bathing in it and worshipping the Pitris and the celestials, he becomes successful in everything and obtains the fruits of Ashvamedha sacrifice. Then the pilgrim should go with subdued soul to Ramahrada.', 'sn': 'कुरुक्षेत्रस्य तद् द्वारं विश्रुतं भरतर्षभ। प्रदक्षिणमुपावृत्य तीर्थसेवी समाहितः॥ सम्मितं पुष्कराणां च स्नात्वार्य पितृदेवताः। जामदग्न्येन रामेण कृतं तत् सुमहात्मना॥ कृतकृत्यो भवेद् राजन्नश्वमेधं च विन्दति। ततो रामह्रदान गच्छेत् तीर्थसेवी समाहितः॥'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, the greatly effulgent and heroic Rama, exterminating the Kastrayas dug five lakes.', 'sn': 'तत्र रामेण राजेन्द्र तरसा दीप्ततेजसा। क्षत्रमुत्साद्य वीरेण ह्रदाः पञ्च निवेशिताः॥'}

{'en': 'foremost of men, we have heard that he filled them with their blood. He offered that (blood) as oblations to all his sires and grandsires.', 'sn': 'पूरयित्वा नरव्याघ्र रुधिरेणेति विश्रुतम्। पितरस्तर्पिताः सर्वे तथैव प्रपितामहाः॥'}
{'en': 'O ruler of men, thereupon the Pitris, being passed with him, thus spoke to Rama.', 'sn': 'ततस्ते पितर: प्रीता राममूचुर्नराधिप।'}

{'en': 'The Pitris said: O greatly exalted Rama, O Rama, O descendant of Bhrigu, we are pleased. O lord, with your filial piety and with your great prowess. O greatly effulgent one, be blessed. Ask the boon you desire to get.', 'sn': 'पितर ऊचुः राम राम महाभाग प्रीताः स्म तव भार्गव॥ अनया पितृभक्त्या च विक्रमेण च ते विभो। वरं वृणीष्व भद्रं ते किमिच्छसि महाद्युते॥'}

{'en': 'Pulastya said : O king, having been thus addressed, that foremost of smiters, Rama, thus spoke with joined hands to the Pitris who were in the sky. If you are pleased with me and if I have deserved your favour, I desire to get this favour from the Pitris that I may again derive pleasure in asceticism.', 'sn': 'पुलस्त्य उवाच एवमुक्तः स राजेन्द्र रामः प्रहरतां वरः। अब्रवीत् प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं पितॄन् स गगने स्थितान्॥ भवन्तो यदि मे प्रीता यद्यनुचाह्यता मयि। पितृप्रसादमिच्छेयं तप आप्यायनं पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'With your power let the sin I have incurred by exterminating the Kashtriyas from wrath be all destroyed. Let also my these lakes becomes Tirthas, celebrated all over the earth.', 'sn': 'यच्च रोषाभिभूतेन क्षत्रमुत्सादितं मया। ततश्च पापान्मुच्येयं युष्माकं तेजसाप्यहम्॥ ह्रदाश्च तीर्थभूता मे भवेयुर्भुवि विश्रुताः।'}

{'en': 'Having heard these blessed words of Rama, the Pitris. Becoming highly pleased and filled with joy, thus replied to Rama, “Let your asceticism increase for your great filial piety.', 'sn': 'एतच्छ्रुत्वा शुभं वाक्यं रामस्य पितरस्तदा॥ प्रत्यूचुः परमप्रीता राम हर्षसमन्विताः। तपस्ते वर्धतां भूयः पितृभक्त्या विशेषतः॥'}

{'en': 'You have exterminated the Kashtriyas from wrath, but you are already freed from that sin, for they have fallen for their own (mis) deeds.', 'sn': 'यच्च रोषाभिभूतेन क्षत्रमुत्सादितं त्वया। ततश्च पापान्मुक्तस्त्वं पतितास्ते स्वकर्मभिः॥'}

{'en': 'Without the least doubt your these lakes w. be Tirthas, he who will bathe in these lakes and offer oblations to the Pitris. Will make his Pitris pleased with him. They will grant him the desired objects so difficult to be obtained in this world and lead him to the celestials region."', 'sn': 'ह्रदाश्च तव तीर्थत्वं गमिष्यन्ति न संशयः। ह्रदेषु तेषु यः स्नात्वा पितृन् संतर्पयिष्यति॥ पितरस्तस्य वै प्रीता दास्यन्ति भुवि दुर्लभम्। ईप्सितं च मन:कामं स्वर्गलोकं च शाश्वतम्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, having granted this boon, the Pitris saluted Rama, the descendant of Bhrigu and disappeared then and there.', 'sn': 'एवं दत्त्वा वरान् राजन् रामस्य पितरस्तदा। आमन्त्र्य भार्गवं प्रीत्या तत्रैवान्तर्हितास्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'It was thus the lakes of the illustrious descendant of Bhrigu became sacred. Leading the life of a Brahmachari and observing sacred vows, if one bathes in these lakes of Rama and worships Rama, O king of kings, he obtains the fruits of giving away much wealth. O perpetuator of the Kuru race, going to Vanshamulaka, the pilgrim.', 'sn': 'एवं रामहदाः पुण्या भार्गवस्य महात्मनः। स्नात्वा हृदेषु रामस्य ब्रह्मचारी शुभवतः॥ राममभ्यर्च्य राजेन्द्र लभेद् बहुसुवर्णकम्। वंशमूलकमासाद्य तीर्थसेवी कुरूद्वह॥'}

{'en': 'Saves his own race by bathing in Vanshamulaka. O best of the Bharata race, going to Kayashodhana and bathing in that Tirtha one purifies his body without the least doubt. Acquiring a purified body, one goes to the excellent regions of bliss.', 'sn': 'स्ववंशमुद्धरेद् राजन् स्नात्वा वै वंशमूलके। कायशोधनमासाद्य तीर्थं भरतसत्तम॥ शरीरशुद्धिः स्नातस्य तस्मिंस्तीर्थे न संशयः। शुद्धदेहच संयाति शुभाँल्लोकाननुत्तमान्॥'}

{'en': 'O virtuous man, one should then go to that Tirtha, called Lokodvara which is celebrated all over the three worlds and where greatly effulgent Vishnu had formerly created the world. O king, going to the Lokodvara Tirtha, celebrated over the three worlds and bathing in that foremost of Tirthas one acquires many worlds for himself.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेतधर्मज्ञ तीर्थं त्रैलोक्यविश्रुतम्। लोका यत्रोद्धताः पूर्वं विष्णुना प्रभविष्णुना॥ लोकोद्धारं समासाद्य तीर्थं त्रैलोक्यपूजितम्। स्नात्वा तीर्थवरे राजैल्लोकानुद्धरते स्वकान्॥'}

{'en': 'Going with subdued mind to the Tirtha called Sri and bathing in it and worshipping the Pitris and the celestials there, one obtains great affluence.', 'sn': 'श्रीतीर्थं च समामाद्य स्नात्वा नियतमानसः। अर्चयित्वा पितॄन् देवान् विन्दते श्रियमुत्तमाम्॥'}

{'en': "Leading the life of a Brahmachari and having one's soul subdued, he who goes to the Tirtha, called Kapila and bathes in it and worships the Pitris and the celestials, that man, obtains the fruit of giving away one thousand Kapila kine.", 'sn': 'कपिलातीर्थमासाद्य ब्रह्मचारी समाहितः। तत्र स्नात्वार्चयित्वा च पितृन् स्वान् दैवतान्यपि॥ कपिलानां सहस्रस्य फलं विन्दति मानवः।'}

{'en': 'Going with subdued soul to the Tirtha, called Surya and bathing in it. And worshipping the Pitris and the celestials with fasting, one obtains the fruits of Agnishtoma and goes to he region of Surya.', 'sn': 'सूर्यतीर्थं समासाद्य स्नात्वा नियमानसः॥ अर्चयित्वा पितॄन् देवानुपवासपरायणः। अग्निष्टोममवाप्नोति सूर्यलोकं च गच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'Going in due order to the Gobhavana and bathing in it, the pilgrim obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'गवां भवनमासाद्य तीर्थसेवी यथाक्रमम्। तत्राभिषेकं कुर्वाणो गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'O perpetuator of the Kuru race, going to Tirth called Shankhini and bathing in the Divitirtha man acquires great prowess.', 'sn': 'शङ्खिनीतीर्थमासाद्य तीर्थसेवी कुरूद्वह। देव्यास्तीर्थे नरः स्नात्वा लभते रूपमुत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, one should then go to the gatc-keeper, Arantuka, which is in the Sarasvati and which belongs to the illustrious chief of the Yakshas (Kubera). O king, bathing one in it, a man obtains the fruits of Agnishtoma (sacrifice).', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र द्वारपालमरन्तुकम्। तच्च तीर्थं सरस्वत्यां यक्षेन्द्रस्य महात्मनः॥ तत्र स्नात्वा नरो राजन्नग्निष्टोमफलं लभेत्।'}

{'en': 'O virtuous king, one should then go to Brahmavarta. Bathing in the Brahmavarta a man, obtains the regions of Brahma.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र ब्रह्मावर्तं नरोत्तमः॥ ब्रह्मावर्ते नरः स्नात्वा ब्रह्मलोकमवाप्नुयात्।'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, one should then go to the excellent Tirthas called Su. There the Pitris are always present with the celestials. Bathing there and worshipping the Pitris and the celestials, obtains thc fruits of Ashvamedha (sacrifice) and goes to the region of Brahma.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र सुतीर्थकमनुत्तमम्॥ तत्र संनिहिता नित्यं पितरो दैवतैः सह। तत्राभिषेकं कुर्वीत पितृदेवार्चने रतः॥ अश्वमेधमवाप्नोति पितृलोकं च गच्छति।'}
{'en': 'O virtuous man, it is therefore that Sutirtha situated in Ambumati is so very excellent.', 'sn': 'ततोऽम्बुमत्यांधर्मज्ञ सुतीर्थकमनुत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, bathing in the Tirtha of Kashishvara, one is freed from all diseases; and he is adored in the region of Brahma.', 'sn': 'काशीश्वरस्य तीर्थेषु स्नात्वा भरतसत्तम। सर्वव्याधिविनिर्मुक्तो ब्रह्मलोके महीयते॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, O king, there is also Matri Tirtha, bathing in which one obtains large progeny and great prosperity.', 'sn': 'मातृतीर्थं च तत्रैव यत्र स्नातस्य भारत। प्रजा विवर्धते राजन्नतन्वीं श्रियमश्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'O great king, one should then go with regulated diet and subdued soul to Sitavana. There is one thing there which is not to be seen anywhere else.', 'sn': 'ततः सीतवनं गच्छेन्नियतो नियताशनः। तीर्थं तत्र महाराज महदन्यत्र दुर्लभम्॥'}

{'en': "O ruler of men, man obtains virtue by only going there. O descendant of Bharata, shaving there one's hair, a man becomes sanctified.", 'sn': 'पुनाति गमनादेव दृष्टमेकं नराधिप। केशानभ्युक्ष्य वै तस्मिन् पूतो भवति भारत॥'}

{'en': 'O great king, in that spot there is a Tirtha called Shvaillomapaha. O foremost of men, learned Brahmanas who always visit Tirthas. Get great pleasure by bathing in it. O best of the Bharata race, shaving their heads at the Shvaillomapaha Tirtha, the excellent Brahmanas acquire holiness by Pranayama; and becoming pure-souled they obtain the highest state.', 'sn': 'तीर्थं तत्र महाराज श्वाविल्लोमापहं स्मृतम्। यत्र विप्रा नरव्याघ्र विद्वांसस्तीर्थतत्पराः॥ प्रीतिं गच्छन्ति परमां स्नात्वा भरतसत्तम। वाविल्लोमापनयने तीर्थे भरतसत्तम॥ प्राणायामैर्निर्हरन्ति स्वलोमानि द्विजोत्तमाः। पूतात्मानश्च राजेन्द्र प्रयान्ति परमां गतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'O ruler of earth, O foremost of men, there is in that spot another Tirtha called Dashashvamedha. Bathing in it, one obtains the highest state.', 'sn': 'दशाश्वमेधिकं चैव तस्मिंस्तीर्थे महीपते। तत्र स्नात्वा नरव्याघ्र गच्छेत परमां गतिम्॥'}

{'en': "O king of kings, one should then go to Manusha, celebrated all over the world, O king, where some black deer, pierced by the arrows of a hunter. Jumped into its water and were transformed into human beings. Bathing in that Tirtha with leading the life of a Brahmachari and having one's soul subdued.", 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र मानुषं लोकविश्रुतम्। यत्र कृष्णमृगा राजन् व्याधेन शरपीडितः॥ विगाह्य तस्मिन् सरसि मानुषत्वमुपागताः। तस्पिस्तीर्थे नरः स्नात्वा ब्रह्मचारी समाहितः॥'}

{'en': 'One is freed from all sins; and becoming pure souled he is adored in the region of Brahma. O ruler of men, in the east of Manusha, only a kosa from it. There is a celebrated river named Apaga which is ever frequented by the Siddhas. The man who offers there Shyamaka food. To the celestials and the Pitris secures great virtuous merit. One Brahmana svd there is equal to million of Brahmanas fed.', 'sn': 'सर्वपापविशुद्धात्मा स्वर्गलोके महीयते। मानुषस्य तु पूर्वेण क्रोशमात्रे महीपते॥ आपगा नाम विख्याता नदी सिद्धनिषेविता। श्यामाकं भोजने तत्र यः प्रयच्छन्ति मानवः॥ देवान् पितृन् समुद्दिश्य तस्यधर्मफलं महत्। एकस्मिन् भोजिते विप्रे कोटिर्भवति भोजिता॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing in it and worshipping the Pitris and the celestials and living there only for a night, one obtains the fruit of Agnishtoma (sacrifice).', 'sn': 'तत्र स्नात्वार्चयित्वा च पितॄन् वै दैवतानि च। उषित्वा रजनीमेकामग्निष्टोमफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, O descendant of Bharata, one should then go to that excellent region of Brahma which is celebrated on earth by the name of Brahmodumbara.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र ब्रह्मणः स्थानमुत्तमम्। ब्रह्मोदुम्बरमित्येव प्रकाशं भुवि भारत॥'}

{'en': "O foremost of men, bathing in the lakes of the seven Rishis and also in the Kedara of the high-souled Kapila. With pure mind and subdued soul and going to Brahma, one's all sins are destroyed; and his soul being made pure, he goes to the region of Brahma. Going the inaccessible (Tirtha) Kedara of Kapisthala and having his sins all burnt by asceticism, obtains the power of disappearance at will.", 'sn': 'तत्र सप्तर्षिकुण्डेषु स्नातस्य नरपुङ्गव। केदारे चैव राजेन्द्र कपिलस्य महात्मनः॥ ब्रह्माणमधिगम्याथ शुचिः प्रयतमानसः। सर्वपापविशुद्धात्मा ब्रह्मलोकं प्रपद्यते॥ कपिलस्य च केदारं समासाद्य सुदुर्लभम्। अन्तर्धानमवाप्नोति तपसा दग्धकिल्बिषः॥'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, one should then go to Saraka, celebrated over the three worlds. Seeing there Vrishadhvaja (Mahadeva) on the fourteenth day of the black fortnight. One obtains all that he desires and goes to the celestials region. to one', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र सरकं लोकविश्रुतम्। कृष्णपक्षे चतुर्दश्यामभिगम्य वृषध्वजम्॥ लभेत सर्वकामान् हि स्वर्गलोकं च गच्छति।'}
{'en': 'O descendant of Kuru, thirty millions of Tirthas are in Saraka.', 'sn': 'तिस्रः कोट्यस्तु तीर्थानां सरके कुरुनन्दन॥'}

{'en': 'And in Rudrakoti and also in the wells and lakes that are there. O ruler of earth, O best of the Bharata race, there is also the Tirtha called Ilaspada. Bathing in it and worshipping there the Pitris and the celestials, one does not meet with any calamity. He obtains the fruits of Vajapeya (sacrifice).', 'sn': 'रुद्रकोट्यां तथा कूपे ह्रदेषु च महीपते। इलास्पदं च तत्रैव तीर्थं भरतसत्तम॥ तत्र स्नात्वार्चयित्वा च दैवतानि पितृनथ। न दुर्गतिमवाप्नोति वाजपेयं च विन्दति॥'}

{'en': 'O ruler of earth, O descendant of Bharata, bathing in Kindana and Kinjapya, one obtains the fruits of measureless gifts and of infinite recitation of prayers.', 'sn': 'किंदाने च नरः स्नात्वा किंजप्ये च महीपते। अप्रमेयमवाणोति दानं जप्यं च भारत॥'}

{'en': "Bathing in Kalasa with devotion and with one's passions subdued, a man obtains the fruits of Agnishtoma sacrifice.", 'sn': 'कलश्यां वार्युपस्पृश्य श्रद्दधानो जितेन्द्रियः। अग्निष्टोमस्य यज्ञस्य फलं प्राप्नोति मानवः॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Kurus, in the east of Saraka is the sacred Tirtha of the illustrious Narada, known by the name of Ambajanma.', 'sn': 'सरकस्य तु पूर्वेण नारदस्य महात्मनः। तीर्थं कुरुकुलश्रेष्ठ अम्बाजन्मेति विश्रुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, a man, bathing in that Tirtha, obtains excellent regions (after death) at the command of Narada.', 'sn': 'तत्र तीर्थे नरः स्नात्वा प्राणानुत्सृज्य भारत। नारदेनाभ्यनुज्ञातो लोकान् प्राप्नोत्यनुत्तमान्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, one should go on the tenth of the white fortnight to Pundarika. Bathing there, a man obtains the fruits of Pundarika sacrifice.', 'sn': 'शुक्लपक्षे दशम्यां च पुण्डीरकं समाविशेत्। तत्र स्नात्वा नरो राजन् पुण्डरीकफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'One should then go to Trivistapa, celebrated all over the three worlds. There flows the sacred and the sin-destroying Vaitarani river.', 'sn': 'ततस्त्रिविष्टपं गच्छेत् त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतम्। तत्र वैतरणी पुण्या नदी पापप्रणाशिनी॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing in it and worshipping there the wielder of trident, Vrishadhvaja (Shiva), one obtains the highest state, all his sins being destroyed and his soul being purified.', 'sn': 'तत्र स्नात्वार्चयित्वा च शूलपाणिं वृषध्वजम्। सर्वपापविशुद्धात्मा गच्छेत परमां गतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, one should then go to the excellent Tirtha of Falaki. O king, there the celestials are always present in Falakivana. And they undergo there great asceticism for many years together. Bathing then in the Drishadvati and worshipping the celestials, a man obtains fruits superior to those of both the Agnishtoma and Atiratha (sacrifices). O descendant of Bharata, bathing in the Tirtha called Sarvadeva a man obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine. O king of kings, Bathing in the Panikhata and worshipping there the celestials, a mano descendant of Bharata, obtains fruits superior to those of Agnishtoma and Atiratha. He also obtains the fruits of Rajasuya and goes to the region of the Rishis.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र फलकीवनमुत्तमम्। तत्र देवाः सदा राजन् फलकीवनमाश्रिताः॥ तपश्चरन्ति विपुलं बहु वर्षसहस्रकम्। दृषद्वत्यां नरः स्नात्वा तर्पयित्वा च देवताः॥ अग्निष्टोमातिरात्राभ्यां फलं विन्दति भारत। तीर्थे च सर्वदेवानां स्नात्वा भरतसत्तम॥ गोसहस्रस्य राजेन्द्र फलं विन्दति मानवः। पाणिखाते नरः स्नात्वा तर्पयित्वा च देवताः॥ अग्निष्टोमातिरात्राभ्यां फलं विन्दति भारत। राजसूयमवाप्नोति ऋषिलोकं च विन्दति॥'}

{'en': 'virtuous man, one should then go to the excellent Tirtha, called Mishraka. O king of kings, in that Tirtha of the illustrious Mishrita. It has been heard by us that the Vyasa for the sake of the Brahmans mixed up all the Tirthas. The man who bathes in Mishraka bathes in all the Tirthas.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र मिश्रकं तीर्थमुत्तमम्। तत्र तीर्थानि राजेन्द्र मिश्रितानि महात्मना॥ व्यासेन नृपशार्दूल द्विजार्थमिति नः श्रुतम्। सर्वतीर्थेषु स स्नाति मिश्रके स्नाति यो नरः॥'}

{'en': 'One should then go with regulated diet and subdued soul to Vyasavana. Bathing there in the Mancjava one obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'ततो व्यासवनं गच्छेत्रियतो नियताशनः। मनोजवे नरः स्नात्वा गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Going to the Devi Tirtha in Madhuvati, the man who bathes with purity and worships the Pitris and the celestials. Obtains at the command of the celestials the fruit of giving away one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'गत्वा मधुवटीं चैव देव्यास्तीर्थे नरः शुचिः। तत्र स्नात्वार्चयित्वा च पितॄन् देवांश्च पूरुषः॥ स देव्या समनुज्ञातो गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्।'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, he who at the confluence of the Kaushiki and the Drishadvati bathes with regulated diet is freed from all sins.', 'sn': 'कौशिक्याः संगमे यस्तु दृषद्वत्याश्च भारत॥ स्नाति वै नियताहारः सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते।'}

{'en': 'One should then go to the Tirtha named Vyasasthali where the wise Vyasa. Afflicted as he was with the grief for the death of his son, determined to give up his being and where, O king of kings, he was cheered up by the celestials. Going to (Vyasa) sthali one obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'ततो व्यासस्थली नाम तत्र व्यासेनधीमता॥ पुत्रशोकाभितप्तेन देहत्यागे कृता मतिः। ततो देवैस्तु राजेन्द्र पुनरुत्थापितस्तदा॥ अभिगत्वा स्थलीं तस्य गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्।'}

{'en': 'Going to the well, called Kindatta, he who throws into it one Prastha of sesamum, O perpetuator of the Kuru race, obtains the highest success and he is freed from all his debts. Bathing in the Vedi Tirtha,, one obtains the fruit of giving away one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'किंदत्तं कूपमासाद्य तिलप्रस्थं प्रदाय च॥ गच्छेत परमां सिद्धिमृणैर्मुक्तः कुरूद्वह। वेदीतीर्थे नरः स्नात्वा गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'There are two celebrated Tirthas called Ahan and Sudina. O foremost of men, bathing there one goes to the regions of Surya.', 'sn': 'अहश्च सुदिनं चैव द्वे तीर्थे लोकविश्रुते। तयोः स्नात्वा नरव्याघ्र सूर्यलोकमवाप्नुयात्॥१००।'}

{'en': 'One should then go to Mrigadhuma, celebrated all over the there worlds. O best of kings, one should bathe there in the Ganges.', 'sn': 'मृगधूमं ततो गच्छेत् त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतम्। तत्राभिषेकं कुर्वीत गङ्गायां नृपसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Worshipping there Mahadeva, one obtains the fruits of Ashvamedha. Bathing in the Devi Tirtha, a man obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'अर्चयित्वा महादेवमश्वमेधफलं लभेत्। देव्यास्तीर्थे नरः स्नात्वा गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'One should then go to Vamanaka, celebrated over the three worlds. Bathing there in the Vishnupada and worshipping Vamana. One, being free from all his sins and his soul being purified goes to the region of Vishnu. Bathing in the Kulampuna one purifies his own race.', 'sn': 'ततो वामनकं गच्छेत् त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतम्। तत्र विष्णुपदे स्नात्वा अर्चयित्वा च वामनम्॥ सर्वपापविशुद्धात्मा विष्णुलोकं स गच्छति। कुलम्पुने नरः स्नात्वा पुनाति स्वकुलं ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Going to the lake of Pavana, which is a excellent Tirtha called Maruta and bathing there, O foremost of men, one is adored in the regions of Vayu.', 'sn': 'पवनस्य ह्रदे स्नात्वा मरुतां तीर्थमुत्तमम्। तत्र स्नात्वा नरव्याघ्र विष्णुलोके महीयते॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing in the lake of the immortals and worshipping the lord of the immortals, one is adored in the celestials region through the prowess of the immortals.', 'sn': 'अमराणां ह्रदे स्नात्वा समभ्यामराधिपम्। अमराणां प्रभावेण स्वर्गलोके महीयते॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing according to the ordinance in the Shalisurya of Shalihotra, O king of kings, one obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'शालिहोत्रस्य तीर्थे च शालिसूर्ये यथाविधि। स्नात्वा नरवरश्रेष्ठ गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, bathing in the Tirtha called Srikunja in the Sarasvati, one obtains the fruits of Agnishtoma sacrifice.', 'sn': 'श्रीकुझं च सरस्वत्यास्तीर्थं भरतसत्तम। तत्र स्नात्वा नरश्रेष्ठ अग्निष्टोमफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'O perpetuator of the Kuru race, then going to the Naimishakunja, the ascetic Rishis had in the days of yore left Naimisha. And going to a visit of Tirthas, they went to Kurukshetra. O best of the Bharata race, there on the banks of the Sarasvati, a grove was made.', 'sn': 'ततो नैमिषकुझं च समासाद्य कुरूद्वह। ऋषयः किल राजेन्द्र नैमिषेयास्तपस्विनः॥ तीर्थयात्रां पुरस्कृत्य कुरक्षेत्रं गताः पुरा। ततः कुञ्जः सरस्वत्याः कृतो भरतसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'It served as a resting place for them and it was very delightful to all of them. Bathing in that Kunja, a man obtains the fruits of Agnishtoma sacrifice.', 'sn': 'ऋषीणामवकाशः स्याद् यथा तुष्टिकरो महान्। तस्मिन् कुञ्जे नरः स्नात्वा अग्निष्टोमफलं लभेत्।१११।।'}

{'en': 'O virtuous man, one should then go to the excellent Tirtha, called Kanya. Bathing in the Kanya Tirtha a man obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेतधर्मज्ञ कन्यातीर्थमनुत्तमम्। कन्यातीर्थे नरः स्नात्वा गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, one should then go to the excellent Tirtha, called Brahma. Bathing there, the other three orders obtain the states of Brahmana. And if a Brahman bathes there, he becomes pure-souled and obtains the highest refuge.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र ब्रह्मणस्तीर्थमुत्तमम्। तत्र वर्णावरः स्नात्वा ब्राह्मण्यं लभते नरः॥ ब्राह्मणश्च विशुद्धात्मा गच्छेत परमां गतिम्।'}

{'en': 'O foremost of men, one should then go to the excellent Tirtha, called Soma. O king, bathing there, a man goes to the regions of Soma.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेन्नरश्रेष्ठ सोमतीर्थमनुत्तमम्॥ तत्र स्नात्वा नरो राजन् सोमलोकमवाप्नुयात्।'}

{'en': 'O ruler of men, one should then go to the Tirtha, called Sapta-Sarasvata. Where the celebrated great Rishi Mankanaka obtained success in asticism. O king, we have heard that in the days of yore Mankanaka cut his hand with kusha grass and from his that wound vegetable juice flowed out (instead of blood). O king, seeing that vegetable juice, he began to dance in joy.', 'sn': 'सप्तसारस्वतं तीर्थं ततो गच्छेन्नराधिप॥ यत्र मङ्कणकः सिद्धो महर्षिर्लोकविश्रुतः। पुरा मङ्कणको राजन् कुशाचेणेति नः श्रुतम्॥ क्षतः किल करे राजंस्तस्य शाकरसोऽस्रवत्। स वै शाकरसं दृष्ट्वा हर्षाविष्टः प्रनृत्तवान्॥'}
{'en': 'When he thus began to dance, all the mobile and immobile creatures began to dance.', 'sn': 'ततस्तस्मिन् प्रनृत्ते तु स्थावरं जंगमं च यत्। प्रनृत्तमुभयं वीर तेजसा तस्य मोहितम्॥'}

{'en': 'O ruler of men, O king, then Brahma and other celestials and the ascetic Rishis all went to Mahadeva and represented to him all about the Rishi.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मादिभिः सुरै राजऋषिभिश्च तपोधनैः। विज्ञप्तो वै महादेव ऋषेरथ नराधिप॥'}

{'en': '(They said), “O deity, you should do that by which the Rishi may not dance." Coming to the dancing Rishi who was senseless in joy, the deity thus spoke to him in order to do good to the celestials.', 'sn': 'नायं नृत्येद् यथा देव तथा त्वं कर्तुमर्हसि। तं प्रनृत्तं समासाद्य हर्षाविष्टेन चेतसा। सुराणां हितकामार्थमृषि देवोऽभ्यभाषत॥'}

{'en': 'Shiva said: O great Rishi, O virtuous man, why are you dancing? O foremost of Rishis, why are you so much delighted?', 'sn': 'भो भो महर्षेधर्मज्ञ किमर्थं नृत्यते भवान्। हर्षस्थानं किमर्थं वा तवाद्य मुनिपुङ्गव॥'}

{'en': 'The Rishis said: O foremost of Brahmanas, I am an ascetic ever steady in the path of virtue. O Brahmana, do you not see that vegetable-juice is flowing from the wound of my hand? Seeing which i am dancing in great joy.', 'sn': 'ऋषिरुवाच तपस्विनोधर्मपथे स्थितस्य द्विजसत्तम। किं न पश्यसि मे ब्रह्मन् कराच्छाकरसं स्रुतम्॥ यं दृष्ट्वा सम्प्रनृत्तोऽहं हर्षेण महतान्वितः।'}
{'en': 'To that Rishi who was blinded by emotion, the deity smilingly thus spoke,', 'sn': 'तं प्रहस्याब्रवीद् देव ऋषि रागेण मोहितम्॥'}

{'en': '"O Brahmana, I am not at all astonished. Behold me." O foremost of men, O sinless king, having thus addressed him, Mahadeva pressed his thumb by the tip of his own finger. O king, then from that wound came out ashes white as snow.', 'sn': 'अहं तु विस्मयं विप्र न गच्छामीति पश्य माम्। एवमुक्त्वा नरश्रेष्ठ महादेवेनधीमता॥ अङ्गुल्यचेण राजेन्द्र स्वाङ्गुष्ठस्ताडितोऽनघ। ततो भस्म क्षताद् राजन् निर्गतं हिमसंनिभम्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, seeing this the Rishi became filled with shame and fell at his feet. Believing that there was nothing better and greater than the Rudra, (he thus adored him).', 'sn': 'तद् दृष्ट्वा वीडितो राजन् स मुनिः पादयोर्गतः। नान्यद् देवात् परं मेने रुद्रात् परतरं महत्॥'}

{'en': '“O wielder of trident, you are the refuge of the celestials and the Asuras, may of the whole universe. You have created the three worlds with their mobile and immobile creatures.', 'sn': 'सुरासुरस्य जगतो गतिस्त्यमसि शूलधृक्। त्वया सर्वमिदं सृष्टं त्रैलोक्यं सचराचरम्॥'}

{'en': 'It is you again who swallow everything at the end of the Yuga. You are incapable of being known by the celestials, what to speak of me!', 'sn': 'त्वमेव सर्वान् चससि पुनरेव युगक्षये। देवैरपि न शक्यस्त्वं परिज्ञातुं कुतो मया॥'}

{'en': 'O sinless one, the celestials with Brahma are displayed in you. You are everything, the creator himself and the ordainer of the world,', 'sn': 'त्वयि सर्वे प्रदृश्यन्ते सुरा ब्रह्मादयोऽनघ। सर्वस्त्वमसि लोकानां कर्ता कारयिता च ह॥'}

{'en': 'It is through your favour that the celestials sport without anxiety or fear.” Having thus adored Mahadeva, the Rishi thus spoke to him;', 'sn': 'त्वत्प्रसादात् सुराः सर्वे मोदन्तीहाकुतोभयाः। एवं स्तुत्वा महादेवभूषिर्वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': '“O god of gods, grant me your grace, so that my asceticism may not diminish.” Thereupon the deity, becoming glad in heart, thus spoke to that Brahmana Rishi,', 'sn': 'त्वत्प्रसादान् महादेव तपो मे न क्षरेत वै। ततो देवः प्रहृष्टात्मा ब्रह्मर्षिमिदमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': '“O Brahmana, let your asceticism increase thousand-fold through my grace. O great Rishi, I shall live with you in your hermitage.', 'sn': 'तपस्ते वर्धतां विप्र मत्प्रसादात् सहस्रधा। आश्रमे चेह वत्स्यामि त्वया सह महामुने॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing in Sapta-Sarasvata, those that will worship me will obtain everything however difficult to get here and hereafter.', 'sn': 'सप्तसारस्वते स्नात्वा अर्चयिष्यन्ति ये तु माम्। न तेषां दुर्लभं किंचिदिहलोके परत्र च॥'}

{'en': 'They will, without doubt, attain to the Sarasvata region.” Having said this, Mahadeva disappeared then and there.', 'sn': 'सारस्वतं च ते लोकं गमिष्यन्ति न संशयः। एवमुक्त्वा महादेवस्तत्रैवान्तरधीयत॥'}

{'en': 'One should then go to Asanasha, celebrated all over the world, where Brahma and other celestials and ascetic Rishis.', 'sn': 'ततस्त्वौशनसं गच्छेत् त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतम्। यत्र ब्रह्मादयो देवा ऋषयश्च तपोधनाः॥'}

{'en': 'And the illustrious Kartikeya, O descendant of Bharata, impelled by the desire to do good to the descendant of Bhrigu, are ever present during the three Sandhyas.', 'sn': 'कार्तिकेयश्च भगवांस्त्रिसंध्यं किल भारत। सांनिध्यमकरोन्नित्यं भार्गवप्रियकाम्यया॥'}

{'en': "O foremost of men, bathing in the Tirtha called Kapalamochana which cleanses off one's sins, one is freed from all his sins.", 'sn': 'कपालमोचनं तीर्थं सर्वपापप्रमोचनम्। तत्र स्नात्वा नरव्याघ्र सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'O best of men, one should then go to the Tirtha called Agni. Bathing there, one goes to the region of Agni and saves his own race.', 'sn': 'अग्नितीर्थं ततो गच्छेत् तत्र स्नात्वा नरर्षभ। अग्निलोकमवाप्नोति कुलं चैव समुद्धरेत्॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, there is a Tirtha of Vishvamitra. O best of men, bathing there, one obtains the status of a Brahmana.', 'sn': 'विश्वामित्रस्य तत्रैव तीर्थं भरतसत्तम। तत्र स्नात्वा नरश्रेष्ठ ब्राह्मण्यमधिगच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'Going to the Brahmayoni with purity and with subdued soul and, O best of men, bathing there one goes to the region of Brahma. There is no doubt that, he thus sanctifies his seven generations upwards and downwards.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मयोनि समासाद्य शुचिः प्रयतमानसः। तत्र स्नात्वा नरव्याघ्र ब्रह्मलोकं प्रपद्यते॥ पुनात्यासप्तमं चैव कुलं नास्त्यत्र संशयः।'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, one should then go to the Tirtha, celebrated all over the world, which is known by the name of Prithudaka belonging to Kartikeya. O king, by bathing there and worshipping the Pitris and the celestials.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत् राजेन्द्र तीर्थं त्रैलोक्यविश्रुतम्॥ पृथूदकमिति ख्यातं कार्तिककेयस्य वै नृप। तत्राभिषेकं कुर्वीत पितृदेवार्चने रतः॥'}

{'en': 'Whatever bad acts one, whether a man or a woman, has committed willingly unwittingly, impelled by human motives. O descendant of Bharata, are all destroyed. He obtains the fruits of Ashvamedha (sacrifice) and also goes to heaven. or', 'sn': 'अज्ञानाज्ज्ञानतो वापि स्त्रिया वा पुरुषेण वा। यत् किंचिदशुभं कर्म कृतं मानुषबुद्धिना॥ तत् सर्वं नश्यते तत्र स्नातमात्रस्य भारत। अश्वमेधफलं चास्य स्वर्गलोकं च गच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'The learned men say that Kurukshetra is holy, holier than Kurukshetra is the Sarasvati, holier than the Sarasvati are all the Tirthas put together and holier than all the Tirthas is the Prithudaka.', 'sn': 'पुण्यमाहुः कुरुक्षेत्रं कुरुक्षेत्रात् सरस्वती। सरस्वत्याश्च तीर्थानि तीर्थेभ्यश्च पृथूदकम्॥'}

{'en': 'He, who by the recitation of prayers casts off his body at Prithadaka which is the best of all the Tirthas, becomes an immortal.', 'sn': 'उत्तमं सर्वतीर्थानां यस्त्यजेदात्मनस्तनुम्। पृथूदके जप्यपरो नैव श्वो मरणं तपेत्॥'}

{'en': 'It has been sung by Sanatkumara and the illustrious Vyasa. O king, it is in the Vedas also, that one should go to the Prithudaka with subdued soul.', 'sn': 'गीतं सनत्कुमारेण व्यासेन च महात्मना। एवं स नियतं राजन्नभिगच्छेत् पृथूदकम्॥'}

{'en': 'O perpetuator of the Kuru race, no Tirtha is superior to Prithudaka. There is no doubt that, that Tirtha is purifying, holy and sindestroying.', 'sn': 'पृथूदकात् तीर्थतमं नान्यत् तीर्थं कुरूद्वह। तन्मेध्यं तत् पवित्रं च पावनं च न संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of men, O best of the Bharata race, bathing in the Prithudaka (even) sinful men go to heaven. Thus say all wise men.', 'sn': 'तत्र स्नात्वा दिवं यान्ति येऽपि पापकृतो नराः। पृथूदके नरश्रेष्ठ एवमाहुर्मनीषिणः॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, O king, there is another Tirtha called Madhusrava. Bathing there, a man obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'मधुस्रवं च तत्रैव तीर्थं भरतसत्तम। तत्र स्नात्वा नरो राजन् गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, one should then go in due order to the celebrated and sacred Tirtha where the Sarasvati and the Aruna are united together.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र तीर्थं मेध्यं यथाक्रमम्। सरस्वत्यरुणायाश्च संगमं लोकविश्रुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'The man who bathes there fasting for three nights, is cleansed of even the sin of killing a Brahmana. He obtains the fruits greater than those of Agnishtoma and the Atiratha (sacrifices). O best of the Bharata race, he saves his ancestors seven generations upwards and downwards.', 'sn': 'त्रिरात्रोपोषितः स्नात्वा मुच्यते ब्रह्महत्यया। अग्निष्टोमातिरात्राभ्यां फलं विन्दति मानवः॥ आसप्तमं कुलं चैव पुनाति भरतर्षभ।'}

{'en': 'O perpetuator of the Kuru race, there is another Tirtha, called Ardhakila. Darbhi created it in the days of yore from compassion for the Brahmans. By vows, by taking the sacred thread, by lasts. By rites and by Mantras, one certainly becomes a Brahman. ) foremost of inen, it has been seen by the ancients that by bathing there, men learned and are endued with the fruits of observing the VOWS.', 'sn': 'अर्धकीलं च तत्रैव तीर्थं कुरुकुलोद्वह॥ विप्राणामनुकम्पार्थं दर्भिणा निर्मितं पुरा। व्रतोपनयनाभ्यां चाप्युपवासेन वाप्युत॥ क्रियामन्त्रैश्च संयुक्तो ब्राह्मणः स्यान्न संशयः। क्रियामन्त्रविहीनोऽपि तत्र स्नात्वा नरर्षभा चीर्णव्रतो भवेद् विद्वान् दृष्टमेतत् पुरातनैः॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of men, Darbhi had brought there also the four oceans. Bathing in them one does not meet with any calamity. He obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'समुद्राश्चापि चत्वारः समानीताश्च दर्भिणा। तेषु सातो नरश्रेष्ठ न दुर्गतिमवाप्नुयात्॥ फलानि गोसहस्राणां चतुर्णां विन्दते च सः।'}

{'en': 'O virtuous man, one should then go to the two celebrated Tirtha called Sata-Sahasrakam and Sahasraha. Bathing in them one obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine. Fasts and gifts there multiply themselves thousandfold.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेतधर्मज्ञ तीर्थं शतसहस्रकम्॥ साहस्रकं च तत्रैव द्वे तीर्थे लोकविश्रुते। उभयोहि नरः स्नात्वा गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्॥ दानं वाप्युपवासो वा सहस्रगुणितं भवेत्।'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, one should then go to the excellent Tirtha called Renuka. Bathing there and being engaged there in worshipping the celestials and the Pitris, one becomes puresouled. His sins being all destroyed, he obtains the fruits of Agnishtoma.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र रेणुकातीर्थमुत्तमम्॥ तीर्थाभिषेकं कुर्वीत पितृदेवार्चने रतः। सर्वपापविशुद्धात्मा अग्निष्टोमफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing there in the Tirtha called Vimochana with passions and senses subdued, one is cleansed of all his sins derived from receiving gifts.', 'sn': 'विमोचनमुपस्पृश्य जितमन्युर्जितेन्द्रियः। प्रतिग्रहकृतैर्दोषैः सर्वैः स परिमुच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Then going to Panchavati with passions controlled and with Brahmacharya life, one becomes greatly virtuous and is adored in the region of the virtuous.', 'sn': 'ततः पञ्चवटीं गत्वा ब्रह्मचारी जितेन्द्रियः। पुण्येन महता युक्तः सतां लोके महीयते॥'}

{'en': 'There the lord of Yoga, Vrishdhvaja, Sthanu himself is always is present. Going there he who worships the lord of the celestials obtains success.', 'sn': 'यत्र योगेश्वरः स्थाणुः स्वयमेव वृषध्वजः। तमर्चयित्वा देवेशं गमनादेव सिध्यति॥'}

{'en': 'One should then go to the Tirtha, called Taijasa, belonging to Varuna blazing in its own effulgence. There Brahma and the other celestials installed Guha in the command of the celestials army. O perpetuator of the Kuru race, in the east of Taijasa, there is a Tirtha called Kuru.', 'sn': 'तैजसं वारुणं तीर्थं दीप्यमानं स्वतेजसा। यत्र ब्रह्मादिभिर्देवैर्ऋषिभिश्च तपोधनैः॥ सैनापत्येन देवानामभिषिक्तो गुहस्तदा। तैजसस्य तु पूर्वेण कुरुतीर्थं कुरूद्वह॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing in the Kuru-Tirtha with passions controlled and with life of a Brahmachari, his soul being purified and his sins being all destroyed, one goes to the region of Brahma.', 'sn': 'कुरुतीर्थे नरः स्नात्वा ब्रह्मचारी जितेन्द्रियः। सर्वपापविशुद्धात्मा ब्रह्मलोकं प्रपद्यते॥'}

{'en': 'One should then go with regulated diet and subdued soul to Svarga-dvara. He obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine and goes to the region of Brahma.', 'sn': 'स्वर्गद्वारं ततो गच्छेन्नियतो नियताशनः। स्वर्गलोकमवाप्नोति ब्रह्मलोकं च गच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'O ruler of men, then the pilgrim should go to Anaraka. O king, bathing there one never meets with any difficulty. O ruler of earth, O foremost of men, there Brahma himself accompanied by the celestials with Narayana at their head is always present.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेदनरकं तीर्थसेवी नराधिप। तत्र स्नात्वा नरो राजन् न दुर्गतिमवाप्नुयात्॥ तत्र ब्रह्मा स्वयं नित्यं देवैः सह महीपते। अन्वास्ते पुरुषव्याघ्र नारायणपुरोगमैः॥'}

{'en': 'O king of kings, O perpetuator of the Kuru race, the wife of Rudra is also present there. He who beholds that goddess never meets with any calamity.', 'sn': 'सांनिध्यं तत्र राजेन्द्र रुद्रपल्याः कुरूद्वह। अभिगम्य च तां देवीं न दुर्गतिमवाप्नुयात्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, there is (an image) of the husband of Uma, the lord of the universe. He who sees that great god is cleansed of all his sins.', 'sn': 'तत्रैव च महाराज विश्वेश्वरमुमापतिम्। अभिगम्य महादेवं मुच्यते सर्वकिल्बिषैः॥'}

{'en': 'O chastiser of foes, O great king, seeing the lotus-navelled Narayana, one blazes forth and goes to the region of Vishnu. O foremost of men! having taken bath in tirths of celestials men become free from all grieves and endued with enlightenment like the moon.', 'sn': 'नारायण चाभिगम्य पद्मनाभमरिदम। राजमानो महाराज विष्णुलोकं च गच्छति॥ तीर्थेषु सर्वदेवानां स्नातः स पुरुषर्षभ। सर्वदुःखैः परित्यक्तो द्योतते शशिवन्नरः॥'}

{'en': 'O king, then the pilgrim should go to the Tirtha, called Sashtipura. Walking round it, he obtains the fruits of giving away one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'ततः स्वस्तिपुरं गच्छेत् तीर्थसेवी नराधिप। प्रदक्षिणमुपावृत्य गोसहस्रफलं लभेत्॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, going to the Tirtha, called Pavana and worshipping the Pitris and the celestials, one obtains the fruits of Agnishtoma sacrifice.', 'sn': 'पावनं तीर्थमासाद्य तर्पयेत् पितृदेवताः। अग्निष्टोमस्य यज्ञस्य फलं प्राप्नोति भारत॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, O ruler of earth, there is Gangahrada and another well (Tirtha); in that well thirty millions of Tirthas are present.', 'sn': 'गङ्गाह्रदश्च ततैव कूपश्च भरतर्षभ। तिस्रः कोट्यस्तु तीर्थानां तस्मिन् कूपे महीपते॥'}

{'en': 'O king, bathing there, a man goes to the celestials region. Bathing in Apaga and worshipping Maheshvara. A man obtains the state of Ganapatya and saves his race.', 'sn': 'तत्र स्नात्वा नरो राजन् स्वर्गलोकं प्रपद्यते। आफगायां नरः स्नात्वा अर्चयित्वा महेश्वरम्॥ गाणपत्यमवाप्नोति कुलं चैव समुद्धरेत्।'}

{'en': 'One should then go to the Tirtha called Sthanuvata, celebrated all over the three worlds. Bathing there a man goes to the celestials region.', 'sn': 'ततः स्थाणुवटं गच्छेत् त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतम्॥ तत्रा स्नात्वा स्थितो रात्रि रुद्रलोकमवाप्नुयात्।'}

{'en': 'O king, One should then go Badaripachana, the herinitage of Vasishtha. A man, fasting there for three nights, should eat Badari (Jujubes). He who lives on Badari for twelve years. And, O ruler of men, he who fasts there for three nights, obtains equal merits. O king, going to Rudra-marga, the pilgrim is adored in the region of Indra by fasting one day and night. to', 'sn': 'बदरीपाचनं गच्छेद् वसिष्ठस्याश्रमं ततः॥ बदरी भक्षयेत् तत्र त्रिरात्रोपोषितो नरः। सम्यग् द्वादशवर्षाणि बदरी भक्षयेत् तु यः॥ त्रिरात्रोपोषितस्तेन भवेत् तुल्यो नराधिप। रुद्रमार्ग समासाद्य तीर्थसेवी नराधिप॥ अहोरात्रोपवासेन शक्रलोके महीयते।'}

{'en': 'Going to Ikaratra, he who lives there for one night with regulated vows and truthfulness, becomes adored in the region of Brahma.', 'sn': 'एकरात्रं समासाद्य एकरात्रोषितो नरः॥ नियतः सत्यवादी च ब्रह्मलोके महीयते।'}

{'en': 'Where there is the hermitage of Aditya, the illustrious deity of great effulgence, (there is also another Tirtha). Bathing in it and worshipping there the god of light a man, goes to the region of Soma and saves his race.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेत राजेन्द्र तीर्थं त्रैलोक्यविश्रुतम्॥ आदित्यस्याश्रमो यत्र तेजोराशेर्महात्मनः। तस्मिंस्तीर्थे नरः स्नात्वा पूजयित्वा विभावसुम्॥ आदित्यलोकं व्रजति कुलं चैव समुद्धरेत्।'}
{'en': 'O ruler of men, bathing in the Soma Tirtha, the pilgrim goes to the region of Soma without any doubt.', 'sn': 'सोमतीर्थे नरः स्नात्वा तीर्थसेवी नराधिप॥ सोमलोकमवाप्नोति नरो नास्त्यत्र संशयः।'}

{'en': "O virtuous man, one should then go to the illustrious Dadhichi's sacred Tirtha called Pavana, celebrated all over the world. Here was born that ocean of asceticism, Angiras, of the Sarasvata race.", 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेतधर्मज्ञ दधीचस्य महात्मनः॥ तीर्थं पुण्यतमं राजन् पावनं लोकविश्रुतम्। यत्र सारस्वतो यातः सोऽङ्गिरास्तपसो निधिः॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing in that Tirtha, a man obtains the fruits of Ashvamedha sacrifice and he without any doubt obtains the region of Sarasvati.', 'sn': 'तस्मिंस्तीर्थे नरः स्नात्वा वाजिमेधफलं लभेत्। सारस्वतीं गतिं चैव लभते नात्र संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'One should then go with regulated vows and with the life of Brahmacharya to Kanyasrama. O king, living there three nights with regulated diet and subdued soul. One obtains one hundred celestials damsels and goes to the region of Brahma.', 'sn': 'ततः कन्याश्रमं गच्छेन्नियतो ब्रह्मचर्यवान्। त्रिरात्रोपोषितो राजन् नियतो नियताशनः॥ लभेत् कन्याशतं दिव्यं स्वर्गलोकं च गच्छति।'}
{'en': 'O virtuous one, one should then go to the Tirtha called Sannihati.', 'sn': 'ततो गच्छेतधर्मज्ञ तीर्थं संनिहतीमपि॥'}
{'en': 'Brahma and other celestials and ascetic Rishis go there every month and earn great virtue.', 'sn': 'तत्र ब्रह्मादयो देवा ऋषयश्च तपोधनाः। मासि मासि समायान्ति पुण्येन महतान्विताः॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing in Sannihati during a solar eclipse, one obtains the fruits of Ashvamedha sacrifice and of other sacrifices that are everlasting.', 'sn': 'संनिहत्यामुपस्पृश्य राहुग्रस्ते दिवाकरे। अश्वमेधशतं तेन तत्रेष्टं शाश्वतं भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Whatever Tirtha exists on earth or in the sky, all the rivers, lakes, ponds, springs, large and small tanks and all other Tirtha sacred to particular gods, O ruler of men, all come here without doubt on the day of new moon, And they certainly mix with Sannihati every month. It is therefore that this Tirtha is known by the name of Sannihati.', 'sn': 'पृथिव्यां यानि तीर्थानि अन्तरिक्षचराणि च। नद्यो ह्रदास्तडागाश्च सर्वप्रस्रवणानि च॥ उदपानानि वाप्यश्च तीर्थान्यायतनानि च। नि:संशयममावास्यां समेष्यन्ति नराधिप॥ मासि मासि नरव्याघ्र संनिहत्यां च संशयः। तीर्थसंनिहनादेव संनिहत्येति विश्रुता॥'}

{'en': 'He who bathes there and drinks its water is adored in the celestials region. In a solar ecclipse on the new moon. He who performs Sraddha ceremony here after having bathed obtains the fruits of the performance of one thousand horse-sacrifices. Whatever sins a man or a woman commits are without doubt all destroyed as soon as one bathes and performs Sraddha ceremony in this Tirtha. He also goes to the region of Brahma on a lotus coloured car.', 'sn': 'तत्र स्नात्वा च पीत्वा च स्वर्गलोके महीयते। अमावस्यां तु तत्रैव राहुग्रस्ते दिवाकरे॥ यः श्राद्धं कुरुते मर्त्यस्तस्य पुण्यफलं शृणु। अश्वमेधसहस्रस्य सम्यगिष्टस्य यत् फलम्॥ स्नात एव समाप्नोति कृत्वा श्राद्धं च मानवः। यत् किंचिद् दुष्कृतं कर्म स्त्रिया वा पुरुषेण वा।१९८॥ स्नातमात्रस्य तत् सर्वं नश्यते नात्र संशयः। पावर्णेन यानेन ब्रह्मलोकं प्रपद्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing then in Koti Tirtha after having worshipped the Yaksha door-keeper, Machakruka, one obtains the fruits of giving away gold in abundance.', 'sn': 'अभिवाद्य ततो यक्षं द्वारपालं मचक्रुकम्। कोटितीर्थमुपस्पृश्य लभेद् बहुसुवर्णकम्॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, there is a Tirtha called Gangahrada. O virtuous man, bathing there with subdued soul and with Brahmacharya life, a man obtains the fruits of Rajasuya and Ashavamedha sacrifice.', 'sn': 'गङ्गाह्रदश्च तत्रैव तीर्थं भरतसत्तम। तत्र स्नायीतधर्मज्ञ ब्रह्मचारी समाहितः॥ राजसूयाश्वमेधाभ्यां फलं विन्दति मानवः।'}

{'en': 'On earth the Tirtha called Naimisha and in the sky the Tirtha called Pushkara (are great). But in all the three worlds Kurukshetra is the greatest. Even the dust of Kurukshetra carried by wind takes away the sinful men to the highest state. In the north (of it) flows the Drishadvati and in the south the Sarasvati.', 'sn': 'पृथिव्यां नैमिषं तीर्थमन्तरिक्षे च पुष्करम्॥ त्रयाणामपि लोकानां कुरुक्षेत्रं विशिष्यते। पांसवोऽपि कुरुक्षेत्राद् वायुना समुदीरिताः॥ अपि दुष्कृतकर्माणं नयन्ति परमां गतिम्। दक्षिणेन सरस्वत्या उत्तरेण दृषद्वतीम्॥ ये वसन्ति कुरुक्षेत्रे ते वसन्ति त्रिविष्टपे।'}

{'en': 'He who lives in this region really lives in heaven. "I will go to Kurukshetra, I will live in Kurukshetra,” he who utters these words even once becomes cleansed of all his sins.', 'sn': 'कुरुक्षेत्रे गमिष्यामि कुरुक्षेत्रे वसाम्यहम्॥ अप्येकां वाचमुत्सृज्य सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते।'}

{'en': 'The sacred Kurukshetra which is adored by the celestials is considered the sacrificial altar of the gods. Those mortals that live there have nothing to make them miserable at any time.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मवेदी कुरुक्षेत्रं पुण्यं ब्रह्मर्षिसेवितम्॥ तस्मिन् वसन्ति ये मा न ते शोच्याः कथंचन।२०७॥'}

{'en': 'The region that lies between Tarnatuka and Arantuka and the lakes of Rama and Machakruka is (called Kurukshetra). It is also called Samantapanchaka. It is said to be the northern sacrificial altar of the Grandsire (Brahma).', 'sn': 'तरन्तुकारन्तुकयोर्यदन्तरं रामह्रदानां च मचक्रुकस्य च। एतत् कुरुक्षेत्रसमन्तपञ्चक पितामहस्योत्तरवेदिरुच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said When the great king Vasu was so wholly devoted to Narayana, why then did he drop down from heaven and why again had he to sink beneath the surface of Earth?', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच यदा भगवतोऽत्यर्थमासीद् राजा महान् वसुः। किमर्थं स परिभ्रष्टो विवेश विवरं भुवः॥'}
{'en': 'Regarding it is cited an old discourse, O Bharata, between the Rishis and the gods.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। ऋषीणां चैव संवादं त्रिदशानां च भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Once on a time, addressing many foremost of Brahmanas the gods said to them that sacrifices should be performed by offering up Ajas as victims. The word Aja means the goat and no other animal.', 'sn': 'अजेन यष्टव्यमिति प्राहुर्देवा द्विजोत्तमान्। स च च्छागोऽप्यजो ज्ञेयो नान्यः पशुरिति स्थितिः॥'}

{'en': 'The Rishis said The Veda declares that in sacrifices the offerings should consist of seeds. Seeds are called Ajas. You should not kill goats.', 'sn': 'ऋषय ऊचुः बीजैर्यज्ञेषु यष्टव्यमिति वै वैदिकी श्रुतिः। अजसंज्ञानि बीजानि च्छागं नो हन्तुमर्हथ॥'}

{'en': 'O gods, that cannot be the religion of good and pious people in which the destruction of animals is sanctioned. This, again, is the golden age. How can animals be killed in this epoch of righteousness?', 'sn': 'नैष धर्मः सतां देवा यत्र वध्येत वै पशुः। इदं कृतयुगं श्रेष्ठं कथं वध्येत वै पशुः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said While this conversation was going on between the Rishis and the gods, that foremost of kings, viz., Vasu, was seen to come that way. Gifted with great prosperity, the king was coming through the sky, accompanied by his troops and vehicles and animals.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच तेषां संवदतामेवमृषीणां विबुधैः सह। मार्गागतो नृपश्रेष्ठस्तं देशं प्राप्तवान् वसुः॥ अन्तरिक्षचरः श्रीमान् समग्रबलवाहनः।'}

{'en': 'Seeing king Vasu coming there through the skies, the Brahmanas addressing the gods, said,-This one will dispell our doubts.', 'sn': 'तं दृष्ट्वा सहसाऽऽयान्तं वसुं ते त्वन्तरिक्षगम्॥ ऊचुर्द्विजातयो देवानेष च्छेत्स्यति संशयम्।'}

{'en': 'He celebrates sacrifices. He is liberal in making gifts. He always seeks the well being of all creatures. How, indeed, will the great Vasu speak otherwise.', 'sn': 'यज्वा दानपतिः श्रेष्ठः सर्वभूतहितप्रियः॥ कथंस्विदन्यथा ब्रूयादेष वाक्यं महान् वसुः।'}

{'en': 'Having thus spoken each other, the gods and the Rishis quickly approached king Vasu and asked him, saying,-0 king, with what should one celebrate sacrifices?', 'sn': 'एवं ते संविदं कृत्वा विबुधा ऋषयस्तथा॥ अपृच्छन् सहिताभ्येत्य वसु राजानमन्तिकात्।'}

{'en': 'Should one sacrifice with the goat or with herbs and plants? Do you remove this doubt of ours! We select you as our judge in this matter.', 'sn': 'भो राजन् केन यष्टव्यमजेनाहोस्विदौषधैः॥ एतन्नः संशयं छिन्धि प्रमाणं नो भवान् मतः।'}

{'en': 'Thus accosted by them, Vasu joined his hands in humility and said to them,-Tell me truly, ye foremost of Brahmanas, what opinion is held by you individually in this matter?', 'sn': 'स तान् कृताञ्जलिर्भूत्वा परिपप्रच्छ वै वसुः॥ कस्य वै को मतः कामो ब्रूत सत्यं द्विजोत्तमाः।'}

{'en': 'The Rishis said The opinion held by us, O king, is that sacrifices should be celebrated with grain! The gods, however, hold that sacrifices should be celebrated with animals. Do you judge between us and tell us which of these opinions is correct.', 'sn': 'ऋषय ऊचुः धान्यैर्यष्टव्यमित्येव पक्षोऽस्माकं नराधिप।।१२। देवानां तु पशुः पक्षो मतो राजन् वदस्व नः।'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Learning the opinion of the gods, Vasu, moved by partiality for them, said that sacrifices should be celebrated with animals.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच देवानां तु मतं ज्ञात्वा वसुना पक्षसंश्रयात्॥ छागेनाजेन यष्टव्यमेवमुक्तं वचस्तदा।'}

{'en': 'At this answer, all the Rishis, effulgent like the Sun, became very angry. Addressing Vasu who was seated on his car and who had supported the deities, they said to him,-Since you have unfairly sided with the gods, do you fall down from heaven! From this day, O king, you shall lose the power of passing through the sky! Through our curse, you shall sink deep below the surface of the Earth.', 'sn': 'कुपितास्ते ततः सर्वे मुनयः सूर्यवर्चसः॥ ऊचुर्वसुं विमानस्थं देवपक्षार्थवादिनम्। सुरपक्षो गृहीतस्ते यस्मात् तस्माद् दिवः पत॥ अद्यप्रभृति ते राजन्नाकाशे विहता गतिः। असाच्छापाभिघातेन महीं भित्त्वा प्रवेक्ष्यसि॥ (विरुद्धं वेदसूत्राणामुक्तं यदि भवेन्नृप। वयं विरुद्धवचना यदि तत्र पतामहे।।)'}

{'en': "After the Rishis had said these words, king Uparichara immediately dropped down, O king, and went down a hole in the Earth. At the command, however,. of Narayana, Vasu's memory did not leave him.", 'sn': 'ततस्तस्मिन् मुहूर्तेऽथ राजोपरिचरस्तदा। अधो वै सम्बभूवाशु भूमेर्विवरगो नृप॥'}

{'en': 'To the good fortune of Vasu, the gods, pained at the curse imprecated on him by the Brahmanas, began to think anxiously as to how that curse might be removed.', 'sn': 'स्मृतिस्त्वेनं न हि जहौ तदा नारायणाज्ञया। देवास्तु सहिताः सर्वे वसोः शापविमोक्षणम्॥'}

{'en': 'They said, This great king has been cursed for our sake. We, dwellers of heaven, should unite together for doing what is good to him in return for what he has done to us.', 'sn': 'चिन्तयामासुरव्यग्राः सुकृतं हि नृपस्य तत्। अनेनास्मत्कृते राज्ञा शापः प्राप्तो महात्मना॥'}

{'en': 'Having speedily determined this in their minds with the help of reflection, the gods went where king Uparichara was. Arrived before him, they addressed his, saying,-You are devoted to the great God of the Brahmanas (viz., Narayana)! That great Lord of both the gods and the Asuras, pleased with you, will save you from the curse that has been imprecated upon you.', 'sn': 'अस्य प्रतिप्रियं कार्यं सहितै! दिवौकसः। इति बुद्ध्या व्यवस्याशु गत्वा निश्चयमीश्वराः॥ ऊचुः संहष्टमनसो राजोपरिचरं तदा। ब्रह्मण्यदेवभक्तस्त्वं सुरासुरगुरुर्हरिः॥ कामं स तव तुष्टात्मा कुर्याच्छापविमोक्षणम्।'}

{'en': 'It is proper, however, that the great Brahmanas should be honoured. Verily, O best of kings, their penances should bear fruits.', 'sn': 'मानना तु द्विजातीनां कर्तव्या वै महात्मनाम्॥ अवश्यं तपसा तेषां फलितव्यं नृपोत्तम।'}

{'en': 'Indeed, you have already fallen down from the sky on the Earth! We wish, however, O best of kings, to show you a favour. As long as you, O sinless one, will live in this hole, so long you will receive (due sustenance).', 'sn': 'यतस्त्वं सहसा भ्रष्ट आकाशान्मेदिनीतलम्॥ एकं त्वनुग्रहं तुभ्यं दद्मो वै दद्मो वै नृपसत्तमा यावत् त्वं शापदोषेण कालमासिष्यसेऽनघ।॥'}

{'en': 'You will get those streaks of clarified butter which Brahmanas with concentrated minds pour in sacrifices along with sacred Mantras, and which are called by the name of Vasudhara! Indeed, weakness or distress shall hot affect you.', 'sn': 'भूमेर्विवरगो भूत्वा तावत् त्वं कालमाप्स्यसि। यज्ञेषु सुहुतां विप्रैर्वसोर्धारां समाहितैः॥ प्राप्स्यसेऽस्मदनुध्यानान्मा च त्वां ग्लानिरस्पृशत्।'}

{'en': 'While living, O king of kings, in the hole of the Earth, neither hunger nor thirst shall assail you for you will drink those streaks of clarified butter called Vasudhara. Your energy also shall continue unabated. By virtue of this our boon that we grant you, the God of gods, viz., Narayana, will be pleased with you, and He will take you hence to the region of Brahman.', 'sn': 'न क्षुत्पिपासे राजेन्द्र भूमेश्छिद्रे भविष्यतः॥ वसोर्धाराभिपीतत्वात् तेजसाऽऽप्यायितेन च। स देवोऽस्मद्वरात् प्रीतो ब्रह्मलोकं हि नेष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Having granted these boons to the king, the dwellers of heaven, as also all those Rishis having penances for wealth, returned each to his respective place.', 'sn': 'एवं दत्त्वा वरं राज्ञे सर्वे ते च दिवौकसः। गताः स्वभवनं देवा ऋषयश्च तपोधनाः॥'}

{'en': "Then Vasu, O Bharata, began to worship the Creator of the universe and to recite silently those sacred Mantras that had come out of Narayana's mouth in days of yore.", 'sn': 'चक्रे वसुस्ततः पूजां विष्वक्सेनाय भारत। जप्यं जगौ च सततं नारायणमुखोद्गतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Although living in a pit of the Earth, the king still adored Hari, the Lord of all the gods in the well-known five-sacrifices that are celebrating five times every day, O destroyer of enemies.', 'sn': 'तत्रापि पञ्चभिर्यज्ञैः पञ्चकालानरिंदम। अयजद्धरिं सुरपतिं भूमेर्विवरगोऽपि सन्॥'}

{'en': 'On account of these adorations of his, Narayana, otherwise called Hari, became highly gratified with him who thus showed himself to be entirely devoted to Him. Who entirely depended upon Him as his sole refuge, and who had completely mastered his senses.', 'sn': 'ततोऽस्य तुष्टो भगवान् भक्त्या नारायणो हरिः। अनन्यभक्तस्य सतस्तत्परस्य जितात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'The illustrious Vishnu, that giver of boons, then addressed the fleet Garuda, that foremost of birds, who waited upon Him as his servant, and said these desirable words.', 'sn': 'वरदो भगवान् विष्णुः समीपस्थं द्विजोत्तमम्। गरुत्मन्तं महावेगमाबभाषेप्सितं तदा॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of birds, O you who are highly blessed, listen to what I say. There is a great king named Vasu who is of righteous soul and rigid vows! Through the anger of the Brahmanas, he has dropped into a pit of the Earth.', 'sn': 'द्विजोत्तम महाभाग पश्यतां वचनान्मम। सम्राट् राजा वसुर्नाम धर्मात्मा संशितव्रतः॥ ब्राह्मणानां प्रकोपेन प्रविष्टो वसुधातलम्।'}
{'en': 'The Brahmanas have been sufficiently honoured. Do you go to that king now.', 'sn': 'मानितास्ते तु विप्रेन्द्रास्त्वं तु गच्छ द्विजोत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'At my behest, O Garuda, go to that foremost of kings, viz., Uparichara, who is now living in a hole of the Earth and incapable of any longer passing through the sky, and bring him up forthwith into the sky.', 'sn': 'भूमेर्विवरसंगुप्तं गरुडेह ममाज्ञया। अधश्चरं नृपश्रेष्ठं खेचरं कुरु मा चिरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing these words of Vishnu, Garuda, spreading his wings and going with the speed of the wind, entered that pit in the Earth in which king Vasu was residing.', 'sn': 'गरुत्मानथ विक्षिप्य पक्षौ मारुतवेगवान्। विवेश विवरं भूमेर्यत्रास्ते पार्थिवो वसुः॥'}

{'en': 'All on a sudden taking the king up, the son of Vinata soared into the sky and there released the king from his beaks.', 'sn': 'तत एनं समुत्क्षिप्य सहसा विनतासुतः। उत्पपात नभस्तूर्णं तत्र चैनममुञ्चत॥'}

{'en': 'At that moment, king Uparichara once more acquired his divine form and re-entered the region of Brahman.', 'sn': 'अस्मिन् मुहूर्ते संजज्ञे राजोपरिचरः पुनः। सशरीरो गतश्चैव ब्रह्मलोकं नृपोत्तमः॥'}

{'en': 'It was the way, O son of Kunti, that that great king first dropped down through the curse of the Brahmanas for a faulty speech, and once more got up to heaven at the behest of the great God (Vishnu).', 'sn': 'एवं तेनापि कौन्तेय वाग्दोषाद् देवताज्ञया। प्राप्ता गतिरवस्तात् तु द्विजशापान्महात्मना॥'}

{'en': 'Only the powerful Lord Hari, that foremost of all Beings, was devoutly adored by him. It was for this devout worship that the king succeeded very soon in freeing himself from the curse imprecated upon him by the Brahmanas and in regaining the blessed regions of Brahman.', 'sn': 'केवलं पुरुषस्तेन सेवितो हरिरीश्वरः। ततः शीघ्रं जहौ शापं ब्रह्मलोकमवाप च॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said I have thus told you everything regarding the origin of the spiritual sons of Brahman. Listen to me with rapt attention, for I shall now describe to you how the celestial Rishi Narada had proceeded in days of yore to White Island."', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच एतत् ते सर्वमाख्यातं सम्भूता मानवा यथा। नारदोऽपि यथा श्वेतं द्वीपं स गतवानृषिः। तत् ते सर्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि शृणुष्वैकमना नृप।॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said Thus addressed by Arjuna of curly hair, the Kuru king, son of Kunti, remained silent. Then Dvaipayana (Vyasa) said.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्तस्तु कौन्तेयो गुडाकेशेन पाण्डवः। नोवाच किंचित् कौरव्यस्ततो द्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Vyasa said The words of Arjuna, O amiable Yudhishthira, are true. The highest religion as sanctioned by the scriptures, consists in the duties of a householder.', 'sn': 'व्यास उवाच बीभत्सोर्वचनं सौम्य सत्यमेतद् युधिष्ठिर। शास्त्रदृष्टः परो धर्मः स्थितो गार्हस्थ्यमाश्रितः॥'}

{'en': 'You are acquainted with all duties. Do you then duly practise the duties prescribed for you (viz., the duties of a householder.) A life of retirement in the forest forgetting the duties of a householder, has not been laid down for you.', 'sn': 'स्वधर्मं चर धर्मज्ञ यथाशास्त्रं यथाविधि। न हि गार्हस्थयमुत्सृज्य तवारण्यं विधीयते॥'}

{'en': 'The gods, Pitris, guests, and servants all depend (for their maintenance) upon householder. Do you then support all these, O king.', 'sn': 'गृहस्थं हि सदा देवाः पितरोऽतिथयस्तथा। भृत्याश्चैवोपजीवन्ति तान् भरस्व महीपते॥'}

{'en': 'Birds and animals and various other creatures, O king, supported by a are householders. He, therefore, who belongs to that mode of life, is superior to all.', 'sn': 'वयांसि पशवश्चैव भूतानि च जनाधिप। गृहस्थैरेव धार्यन्ते तस्माच्छेरूष्ठो गृहाश्रमी॥'}

{'en': 'The life of a householder is the inost difficult of all the four modes of life. Do you practise that mode of life then, O Partha, which is difficult of being practised by persons of uncontrolled senses.', 'sn': 'सोऽयं चतुर्णामेतेषामाश्रमाणां दुराचरः। तं चराद्य विधि पार्थ दुश्चरं दुर्बलेन्द्रियैः'}

{'en': 'You have mastered all the Vedas. You have earned great ascetic merit. You should, therefore, bear like an ox the burden of your ancestral kingdom.', 'sn': 'वेदज्ञानं च ते कृत्स्नं तपश्चाचरितं महत्। पितृपैतामहं राज्यं धुर्यवद् वोढुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'Penances, sacrifices, forgiveness, learning, mendicancy, restraint of senses, contemplation, living in solitude, contentment, and knowledge (of Brahma), should, O king, be practised by Brahmanas to the best of their ability for the attainment of success.', 'sn': 'तपो यज्ञस्तथा विद्या भक्ष्यमिन्द्रियसंयमः। ध्यानमेकान्तशीलत्वं तुर्ज्ञािनं च शक्तितः॥ ब्राह्मणानां महाराज चेष्टा संसिद्धिकारिका।'}

{'en': 'I shall now tell you the duties of Kshatriyas. They are not unknown to you.
