Sacrifice, learning, activity, ambition, holding, the rod of chastisement, dreadfulness, protection of subjects, knowledge of the Vedas, practise of all kinds of penances, enances, good conduct, acquisition of wealth, and gifts to deserving person, these, o king, when performed properly by the Kshatriyas, secure for them both this world and the next, as heard by us.', 'sn': 'क्षत्रियाणां तु वक्ष्यामि तवापि विदितं पुनः॥ यज्ञो विद्या समुत्थानमसंतोषः श्रियं प्रति। दण्डधारणमुग्रत्वं प्रजानां परिपालनम्॥ वेदज्ञानं तथा कृत्स्नं तपः सुचरितं तथा। द्रविणोपार्जनं भूरि पात्रे च प्रतिपादनम्॥ एतानि राज्ञां कर्माणि सुकृतानि विशाम्पते। इमं लोकममुं चैव साधयन्तीति नः श्रुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Of them, O son of Kunti, wielding the rod of chastisement has been declared to be the foremost. A Kshatriya must always have strength, and upon strength depends chastisement.', 'sn': 'एषां ज्यायस्तु कौन्तेय दण्डधारणमुच्यते। बलं हि क्षत्रिये नित्यं बले दण्डः समाहितः॥'}

{'en': 'Those I have mentioned are, O king, the principle duties for Kshatriyas and lead greatly to their success. Brihaspati, in this matter, sang this verse :', 'sn': 'एता विद्याः क्षत्रियाणां राजन् संसिद्धिकारिकाः। अपि गाथामिमां चापि बृहस्पतिरगायत॥'}

{'en': 'Like a snake devouring a mouse, the Earth devours a king who is inclined to peace and a Brahmana who is greatly addicted to a life of domesticity!', 'sn': 'भूमिरेतौ निगिरति सर्पो बिलशयानिव। राजानं चाविरोद्धारं ब्राह्मणं चाप्रवासिनम्।१५।।'}

{'en': 'It is heard again that the royal sage Sudyumna, only by wielding the rod of chastisement, gained the highest success, like Daksha himself, the son of Prachetas.', 'sn': 'सुद्युम्नश्चापि राजर्षिः श्रूयते दण्डधारणात्। प्राप्तवान् परमां सिद्धिं दक्षः प्राचेतसो यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said O holy sage, by what acts did king Sudyumna gain the highest success? (I wish to hear the king.)', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच भगवन् कर्मणा केन सुद्युम्नो वसुधाधिपः। संसिद्धिं परमां प्राप्तः श्रोतुमिच्छामि तं नृपम्॥'}

{'en': "Vyasa said 'In this matter is also cited this old history. There were two brothers, viz., Shankha and Likhita of rigid vows.", 'sn': 'व्यास उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। शङ्खच लिखितश्चास्तां भ्रातरौ संशितव्रतौ॥'}

{'en': 'The two brothers had two separate beautiful houses. Situate by the bank of the river called Vahuda, both of those houses were decorated with trees always bearing flowers and fruits.', 'sn': 'तयोरावसथावास्तां रमणीयौ पृथक् पृथक्। नित्यपुष्पफलैर्वृक्षरुपेतौ बाहुदामनु॥'}

{'en': 'Once on a time Likhita come to the house of his brother Shankha. At that time, however, Shankha had left his asylum with no fixed purpose.', 'sn': 'ततः कदाचिल्लिखितः शङ्खस्याश्रममागतः। यदृच्छयाथशङ्खोऽपि निष्क्रान्तोऽभवदाश्रमात्॥'}
{'en': 'Arrived at the asylum of his brother, Shankha, Likhita plucked many ripe fruits.', 'sn': 'सोऽभिगम्याश्रमं भ्रातुः शङ्खस्य लिखितस्तदा। फलानि पातयामास सम्यक्परिणतान्युत॥'}

{'en': 'Getting them the Rishi Likhita began to eat them without feeling any pinch of conscience. While thus eating Shankha returned to his hermitage.', 'sn': 'तान्युपादाय विस्रब्यो भक्षयामास स द्विजः। तस्मिंश्च भक्षयत्येव शङ्खोऽप्याश्रममागतः॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing him eating, Shankha addressed his brother, saying,-Whence have these fruits been got and for why are you eating them?', 'sn': 'भक्षयन्तं तु तं दृष्ट्वा शङ्खो भ्रातरमब्रवीत्। कुतः फलान्यवाप्तानि हेतुना केन खादसि॥'}

{'en': 'Approaching his elder brother and saluting him, Likhita smilingly replied, saying,—I have taken them even from this hermitage.', 'sn': 'सोऽब्रवीद् भ्रातरं ज्येष्ठमुपसृत्याभिवाद्य च। इत एव गृहीतानि मयेति प्रहसन्निव॥'}

{'en': 'Filled with great anger, Shankha said to him,—You have committed theft by taking yourself these fruits.', 'sn': 'तमब्रवीत् तथा शङ्खस्तीव्ररोषसमन्वितः। स्तेयं त्वया कृतमिदं फलान्याददता स्वयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Go to the king confess what you have done. Tell him,-O best of kings, I have committed the offence of taking what was not given to me.', 'sn': 'गच्छ राजानमासाद्य स्वकर्म कथयस्व वै। अदत्तादानमेवं हि कृतं पार्थिवसत्तम॥'}
{'en': 'Knowing me for a thief and following your duty of order, do you punish me O king, like a thief.', 'sn': 'स्तेनं मां त्वं विदित्वा च स्वधर्ममनुपालय। शीघ्रं धारय चौरस्य मम दण्डं नराधिप॥'}

{'en': 'Thus commanded by his brother, the highly blessed Likhita of rigid vows proceeded to king Sudyumna.', 'sn': 'इत्युक्तस्तस्य वचनात् सुद्युम्नं स नराधिपम्। अभ्यगच्छन्महाबाहो लिखितः संशितव्रतः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing from his gate-keepers that Likhita had come, king Sudyumna, with his counsellors, went out (for receiving him.)', 'sn': 'सुद्युम्नस्त्वन्तपालेभ्यः : श्रुत्वा लिखितमागतम्। अभ्यगच्छत् सहामात्यः पद्भ्यामेव जनेश्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'Meeting with him, the king addressed that best of all persons conversant with duties, saying,-Tell me, O reverend sir, why you have Know it is already accomplished.-Thus accosted, that Rishi said to Sudyumna,-Do you promise first that you will do it. You should then, after hearing me, fulfil that promise.', 'sn': 'तमब्रवीत् समागम्य स राजा धर्मवित्तमम्। किमागमनमाचक्ष्व भगवन् कृतमेव तत्॥ एवमुक्तः स विप्रर्षिः सुद्युम्नमिदमब्रवीत्। प्रतिश्रुत्य करिष्येति श्रुत्वा तत् कर्तुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of men, I ate some fruits that had not given me by my elder brother. Do you, o king, punish me for it forthwith, Sudyumna answered,-If the king be considered to wield the rod of chastisement, he come. should be regarded, O foremost of Brahmanas, as equally competent to pardon.', 'sn': 'सुद्युम्न उवाच अनिसृष्टानि गुरुणा फलानि मनुजर्षभ। भक्षितानि महाराज तत्र मां शाधि मा चिरम्॥ प्रमाणं चेन्मतो राजा भवतो दण्डधारणे। अनुज्ञायामपि तथा हेतुः स्याद् ब्राह्मणर्षभ।॥'}

{'en': "Purged in sin, you of high vows, consider yourself as pardoned. Tell me now what else do you wish. I shall certainly accomplish those your commands.'", 'sn': 'स भवानभ्यनुज्ञातः शुचिकर्मा महाव्रतः। ब्रूहि कामानतोऽन्यांस्त्वं करिष्यामि हि ते वचः॥'}

{'en': '“Thus honoured by the great king, the Rishi Likhita, however, did not ask for any other favour.', 'sn': 'व्यास उवाच संछन्द्यमानो ब्रह्मषिः पार्थिवेन महात्मना। नान्यं स वरयामास तस्माद् दण्डादृते वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then that king caused the two hands of the high-souled Likhita to be cut off, whereupon the latter, bearing the punishment, went away.', 'sn': 'ततः स पृथिवीपालो लिखितस्य महात्मनः। करौ प्रच्छेदयामास धृतदण्डो जगाम सः॥'}

{'en': "Returning to his brother Shankha, Likhita, in great agony said,-'You should now pardon this wretched man who has been duly punished (for what he did)'.", 'sn': 'स गत्वा भ्रातरं शङ्खमार्तरूपोऽब्रवीदिदम्। धृतदण्डस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्भवांस्तत् क्षन्तुमर्हति॥'}

{'en': 'Shankha said "I am not angry with you nor have you injured me, O foremost of all persons conversant with duties. Your virtue, however, had deteriorated. I have saved you from that plight.', 'sn': 'शङ्ख उवाच न कुप्ये तव धर्मज्ञ न त्वं दूषयसे ममा सुनिर्मलं कुलं ब्रह्मन्नस्मिञ्जगति विश्रुतम्। धर्मस्तु ते व्यतक्रान्तस्ततस्ते निष्कृतिः कृताः॥'}

{'en': 'Proceed forthwith to the river Vahuda and please duly, with oblations of water, the gods, Rishis, and the Pitris, and never again think of sin.', 'sn': 'त्वं गत्वा बाहुदां शीघ्रं तर्पयस्व यथाविधि। देवानृषीन् पिढेश्चैवं मा चाधर्मे मनः कृथाः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing these words of Shankha, Likhita performed his ablutions in the sacred river and began to perform the water-rite.', 'sn': 'तस्य तद् वचनं श्रुत्वा शङ्खस्य लिखितस्तदा। अवगाह्यापगां पुण्यामुदकार्थं प्रचक्रमे॥'}

{'en': 'Thereat, two hands, like two lotuses, appeared at the extremities of his stumps. Stricken with wonder he returned to his brother and showed him the two hands.', 'sn': 'प्रादुरास्तां ततस्तस्य करौ जलजसंनिभौ। ततः स विस्मितो भ्रातुर्दर्शयामास तौ करौ॥'}

{'en': 'Shankha said All this has been done by me through my penances! Do not be surprised at it. Providence is the instrument here.', 'sn': 'शङ्ख उवाच ततस्तमब्रवीच्छङ्खस्तपसेदं कृतं मया। मा च तेऽत्र विशङ्काभूद् दैवमत्र विधीयते॥'}

{'en': 'Likhita answered: O you of great splendour, why did you not purify me at first, when, O best of Rishis, such was the power of your penances?', 'sn': 'लिखित उवाच किं तु नाहं त्वया पूतः पूर्वमेव महाद्युते। यस्य ते तपसो वीर्यमीदृशं द्विजसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Shankha said I should not have acted otherwise. I am not your punisher. The king has been himself purified as also yourself, along with the Pitris.', 'sn': 'शङ्ख उवाच एवमेतन्मया कार्यं नाहं दण्डधरस्तव। स च पूतो नरपतिस्त्वं चापि पितृभिः सह॥'}

{'en': 'Vyasa said That king, O eldest son of Pandu, became great by this act and obtained the greatest success like the lord Daksha himself.', 'sn': 'व्यास उवाच स राजा पाण्डवश्रेष्ठ श्रेयान् वै तेन कर्मणा। प्राप्तवान् परमां सिद्धिं दक्षः प्राचेतसो यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Such is the duty of Kshatriyas, viz., the ruling of subjects. Any other, O king, would be considered as a wrong path for them. Do not grieve.', 'sn': 'एष धर्मः क्षत्रियाणां प्रजानां परिपालनम्। उत्पथोऽन्यो महाराज मा स्म शोके मनः कृथाः॥'}

{'en': 'O best of all persons conversant with duty, listen to the wholesome words of this your brother. Holding the rod of chastisement, O king, is the duty of kings and not the shaving of the head. more', 'sn': 'भ्रातुरस्य हितं वाक्यं शृणु धर्मज्ञ सत्तम। दण्ड एव हि राजेन्द्र क्षत्रधर्मो न मुण्डनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Kunti said O holy one, you are my father-in-law and, therefore, my deity of deities. You are my god of gods. Hear my words of truth.', 'sn': 'कुन्त्युवाच भगवश्वशुरो मेऽसि दैवतस्यापि दैवतम्। स मे देवातिदेवस्त्वं शृणु सत्या गिरं मम॥'}

{'en': "A twice-born ascetic named Durvasas, who is full of anger, came to my father's house for begging alms. I succeeded in pleasing him by the purity of my conduct and of my minds as also by refusing to notice the many wrongs he did. I did not yield to anger although there was much in his conduct quite capable of exciting that passion.", 'sn': 'तपस्वी कोपनो विप्रो दुर्वासा नाम मे पितुः। भिक्षामुपातो भोक्तुं तमहं पर्यतोषयम्॥ शौचेन त्वागसस्त्यागैः शुद्धेन मनसा तथा। कोपस्थानेष्वपि महत्स्वकुष्यन्न कदाचन।॥'}

{'en': "Served with care, the great ascetic became highly pleased with me and disposed to grant me a boon. 'You must accept the boon I shall give,' were his words to me.", 'sn': 'स प्रीतो वरदो मेऽभूत् कृतकृत्यो महामुनिः। अवश्यं ते गृहीतव्यमिति मां सोऽब्रवीद् वचः॥'}

{'en': "Fearing his curse, I answered him saying, 'So be it.' The Rishi once more said to me, '0 blessed damsel, O you of beautiful face, you will become the mother of Dharma. Those deities whom you will summon will obey you,", 'sn': 'ततः शापभयाद् विप्रमवोचं पुनरेव तम्। एवमस्त्विति च प्राह पुनरेव स मे द्विजः॥ धर्मस्य जननी भद्रे भवित्री त्वं शुभानने। वशे स्थास्यन्ति ते देवा यांस्त्वमावाहयिष्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'Having said these words, the twice-born one vanished away from my sight. I becamefilled with wonder. The Mantra, however, which the Rishi gave has lived in my memory at all times.', 'sn': 'इत्युक्त्वान्तर्हितो विप्रस्ततोऽहं विस्मिताभवम्। न च सर्वास्ववस्थासु रमृतिर्मे विप्रणश्यति॥'}

{'en': 'One day, sitting with my chamber I saw the sun rising. Desiring to bring the maker of day before me, I recollected the words of the Rishi.', 'sn': 'अथ हर्म्यतलस्थाहं रविमुद्यन्तमीक्षती। संस्मृत्य तदृषेर्वाक्यं स्पृहयन्ती दिवानिशम्॥'}

{'en': 'Without any consciousness of the fault I committed, I called the deity from mere childishness. The deity, of a thousand rays, before me.', 'sn': 'स्थिताऽहं बालभावेन तत्र दोषमबुद्ध्यती। अथ देवः सहस्रांशुमत्समीपगतोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'He divided himself in two parts. With one portion he was in the sky, and with the other he stood on the Earth before me. With one he hearted the worlds and with another he came to came me.', 'sn': 'द्विधा कृत्वाऽऽत्मनो देहं भूमौ च गगनेऽपि च। तताप लोकानेकेन द्वितीयेनागमत् स माम्॥'}

{'en': "He told me, while I was trembling at his sight, these words:-Do you ask a boon of me.' Bowing to him with my head I asked him to leave me.", 'sn': 'स मामुवाच वेपन्तीं वरं मत्तो वृणीष्व ह। गम्यतामिति तं चाहं प्रणम्य शिरसाऽवदम्॥'}

{'en': "He replied to me, saying, 'I cannot bear the idea of coming to you fruitlessly, I shall consume you as also that Brahmana who gave you the Mantra as a boon.", 'sn': 'स मामुवाच तिग्मांशुवृथाऽऽह्वानं न मे क्षमम्। धक्ष्यामि त्वां च विप्रं च येन दत्तो वरस्तव॥'}

{'en': "I wished to protect, from Surya's curse, the Brahmana who had done no evil. I, therefore, said, 'Let me have a son like you, O god.'", 'sn': 'तमहं रक्षती विप्रं शापादनपकारिणम्। पुत्रो मे त्वत्समो देव भवेदिति ततोऽब्रवम्॥'}

{'en': "The deity o. thousand rays then entered me with his energy and stupefied me completely. He then said to me, 'You will have a son, and then returned to the firmament.", 'sn': 'ततो मां तेजसाऽऽविश्य मोहयित्वा च भानुमान् । उवाच भविता पुत्रस्तवेत्यभ्यगमद् दिवम्॥'}

{'en': 'I continued to live in the inner apartments and desirous of saving the honour of my father, I cast into the waters my infant son named Karna who thus came into the world secretly.', 'sn': 'ततोऽहमन्तर्भवने पितुर्वृत्तान्तरक्षिणी। गूढोत्पन्नं सुतं बालं जले कर्णमवासृजम्॥'}

{'en': 'Forsooth, through the grace of that god, I once more became a virgin, Otwice-born one, even as the Rishi Durvasas he said to me.', 'sn': 'नूनं तस्येव देवस्य प्रसादात् पुनरेव तु। कन्याऽहमभवं विप्र यथा प्राह स मामृषिः॥'}

{'en': 'Foolish that I am, although he knew me for his mother when he grew up, yet I did not try to acknowledge him. This burns me, O Rishi, as is well-known to you.', 'sn': 'स मया मूढया पुत्रो ज्ञायमानोऽप्युपेक्षितः। तन्मां दहति विप्रर्षे यथा सुविदितं तव॥'}

{'en': 'Whether it is sinful or not so, I have told you the truth. You should. O holy one, satisfy the craving I feel for seeing that son of mine.', 'sn': 'यदि पापमपापं वा तवैतद् विवृतं मया। तन्मे दहन्तं भगवन् व्यपनेतुं त्वमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': "O foremost of ascetics, let this king also, O sinless one, obtain the fruition today of that desire of his which he cherishes in his bosom and which has become known to you.'", 'sn': 'यच्चास्य राज्ञो विदितं हृदिस्थं भवतोऽनघ। तं चायं लभतां काममद्यैव मुनिसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'are Thus addressed by Kunti, Vyasa, that foremost of all persons, said to her in reply, "Blessed be you, all that you have said to me will happen.', 'sn': 'इत्युक्तः प्रत्युवाचेदं व्यासो वेदविदां वरः। साधु सर्वमिदं भाव्यमेवमेतद् यथाऽऽत्य माम्॥'}

{'en': 'You are not a biame at all. You were restored to virginity. The deities are possessed of (Yoga) power. They are able enter human bodies.', 'sn': 'अपराधश्च ते नास्ति कन्याभावं गता ह्यसि। देवाश्चैश्चर्यवन्तो वै शरीराण्याविशन्ति वै॥'}

{'en': 'There many deities. They beget (offspring) by thought alone. By word, by sight, by touch, and by sexual union, also, they beget children. These are the five methods.', 'sn': 'सन्ति देवनिकायाश्च संकल्पाज्जनयन्ति ये। वाचा दृष्ट्या तथा स्पर्शात् संघर्षेणेति पञ्चधा।॥'}

{'en': 'You belong to the order of humanity. You have no fault. Know this, O Kunti! Let the fever of your heart be removed.', 'sn': 'मनुष्यधर्मो दैवेन धर्मेण हि न दुष्यति। इति कुन्ति विजानीहि व्येतु ते मानसो ज्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'Everything is becoming for those who are mighty. Everything is pure for those that are mighty. Everything is meritorious for those that are mighty. Everything is their own for those who are mighty.', 'sn': 'सर्वं बलवतां पथ्यं सर्वं बलवतां शुचि। सर्वं बलवतां धर्मः सर्वं बलवतां स्वकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Keshava, that slayer of heroes of the enemies, hearing the words of Karna said these words laughingly.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच कर्णस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा केशवः परवीरहा। उवाच प्रहसन् वाक्यं स्मितपूर्वमिदं यथा॥'}

{'en': '"Desire you not then to gain this kingdom by the means I have indicated, O Karna? Desire you not to rule this earth given by me to you.', 'sn': 'श्रीभगवानुवाच अपि त्वां न लभेत् कर्ण राज्यलम्भोपपादनम्। मया दत्तां हि पृथिवीं न प्रशासितुमिच्छसि॥'}

{'en': 'The sure success of the Pandavas will follow in this case, there is no doubt of it; the fierce triumphal banner, of the son of Pandu who has the figure of the monkey on his banner, is already hoisted.', 'sn': 'ध्रुवो जयः पाण्डवानामितीदं न संशयः कश्चन विद्यतेऽत्र। जयध्वयो दृश्यते पाण्डवस्य समुच्छ्रितो वानरराज उग्रः॥'}

{'en': 'It rises up into the air, endued with celestial illusion by Bhaumana for in the banner are seen many fierce celestial creatures indicating victory.', 'sn': 'दिव्या मयाया विहिता भौमनेन समुच्छ्रिता इन्द्रकेतुप्रकाशा। दिव्यानि भूतानि जयावहानि दृश्यन्ति चैवात्र भयानकानि॥'}

{'en': 'It is not impeded by hills or trees and it occupies the space of a Yojana upwards as also all around; this prosperous banner banner of Dhananjaya, O Karna, is hosted up and looks like fire itself.', 'sn': 'न सज्जते शैलवनस्पतिभ्य ऊर्ध्वं तिर्यगयोजनमात्ररूपः। श्रीमान् ध्वजः कर्ण धनंजयस्य समुच्छ्रितः पावकतुल्यरूपः॥'}

{'en': 'When you will see in the battle Arjuna, driving on a chariot drawn by white horses and driven by Krishna, making use of the Aindra weapon, as also the weapons of Agni and Marut.', 'sn': 'यदा द्रक्ष्यसि संग्रामे श्वेताश्रं कृष्णसारथिम्। ऐन्द्रमस्त्रं विकुर्वाणमुभे चाप्यग्निमारुते॥'}

{'en': 'And when you will hear the twang of the Gandiva bow piercing as it were the sky like the thunder, then will the Treta, Krita and Dvapara Yugas pass away.', 'sn': 'गाण्डीवस्य च निर्घोषं विस्फूर्जितमिवाशनेः। न तदा भविता त्रेता न कृतं द्वापरं न च॥'}

{'en': 'When you will see Yudhishthira the son of Kunti in battle, endued with Japa and Homa and engaged in protecting his own vast army.', 'sn': 'यदा द्रक्ष्यसि संग्रामे कुन्तीपुत्रं युधिष्ठिरम्। जपहोमसमायुक्तं स्वां रक्षन्तं महाचमूम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hard to be vanquished like Aditya and trembling the army of his enemy, then will the Treta, Krita, and Dvapara Yuga pass away.', 'sn': 'आदित्यमिव दुर्धर्षं तपन्तं शत्रुवाहिनीम्। न तदा भविता त्रेता न कृतं द्वापरं न च॥'}

{'en': 'When you will see Bhimasena of great strength in the field dancing in this great battle drinking the blood of Dushasana,', 'sn': 'यदा द्रक्ष्यसि संग्रामे भीमसेनं महाबलम्। दुःशासनस्य रुधिरं पीत्वा नृत्यन्तमाहवे॥'}

{'en': 'Like an infuriated elephant with his temples rent after vanquishing an opponent then will the Treta, Krita and Dvapara Yugas pass away.', 'sn': 'प्रभिन्नमिव मातङ्गं प्रतिद्विरदघातिनम्। न तदा भविता त्रेता न कृतं द्वापरं न च॥'}

{'en': 'When you will see in the battle Drona, and the son of Shantanu and Kripa, Suyodhana, the king of the Sindhus and Jayadratha,', 'sn': 'यदा द्रक्ष्यसि संग्रामे द्रोणं शान्तनवं कृपम्। सुयोधनं च राजानं सैन्धवं च जयद्रथम्॥'}
{'en': 'Rushing to the fight with great impetuosity opposed by Savyasachin Yugas pass away.', 'sn': 'युद्धायापततस्तूर्णं वारितान् सव्यसाचिना। न तदा भविता त्रेता न कृतं द्वापरं न च॥'}

{'en': 'When you will see in the battle the two sons of Madri endued with great strength making a havoc in the army of the sons of Dhritarashtra like two elephants.', 'sn': 'यदा द्रक्ष्यसि संग्रामे माद्रीपुत्रौ महाबलौ। वाहिनीं धार्तराष्ट्राणां क्षोभयन्तौ गजाविव॥'}

{'en': 'Those car-warriors driving on engaged in the throwing of weapons then will the Treta, Kripa and Dvapara Yugas cease to exist.', 'sn': 'विगाढे शस्त्रसम्पाते परवीररथारुजौ। न तदा भविता त्रेता न कृतं द्वापरं न च॥'}

{'en': 'Going from here, O Karna, tell Drona, the son of Shantanu and Kripa that the present month is a charming one with plenty of food, drink and fuel. a car', 'sn': 'ब्रूयाः कर्ण इतो गत्वा द्रोणं शान्तनवं कृपम्। सौम्योऽयं वर्तते मासः सुप्रापयवसेन्धनः॥'}

{'en': 'All plants and herbs are luxuriant in their growth now, the trees are laden with fruits and there are flies; the ponds are free from mire and their water pleasant to drink and neither hot nor cold, for it is a pleasant time.', 'sn': 'सौषधिवनस्फीतः फलवानल्पमक्षिकः। निष्पको रसवत्तोयो नात्युष्णशिशिरः सुखः॥'}

{'en': 'In seven days will there be full moon and on that day let us engage in fight; for this is the day favorite to Shakra.', 'sn': 'सप्तमाच्चापि दिवसादमावास्या भविष्यति। संग्रामो युज्यतां तस्यां तामाहुः शक्रदेवताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then speak also to all the kings who are assembled to fight what you desire. I shall fulfill your wishes in every way.', 'sn': 'तथा राज्ञो वदेः सर्वान् ये युद्धायाभ्युपागताः। यद् वो मनीषितं तद् वै सर्वं सम्पादयाम्यहम्॥'}

{'en': 'The king and princes, who are under the leadership of Duryodhana, will meet, by coming in contact with weapons, with death and attain to very excellent salvation.', 'sn': 'राजानो राजपुत्राश्च दुर्योधनवशानुगाः। प्राप्य शस्त्रेण निधनं प्राप्स्यन्ति गतिमुत्तमाम्॥'}

{'en': "Sanjaya said O descendant of Bharata, when the night passed away, the illustrious Bhishma with his wrath excited followed by a very large numbers of troops, going at the head of the Kuru army charged the enemy's troops.", 'sn': 'संजय उवाच मनीकिनीनां प्रमुखे महात्मा। ययौ सपत्नान् प्रति जातकोपो वृतः समग्रेण बलेन भीष्मः॥'}

{'en': 'Drona, and Duryodhana, Balhika, Durmarshans, Chitrasena, the mighty Jayadratha and other royal heroes backed by a large number of troops accompanied him.', 'sn': 'तं द्रोणदुर्योधनबालिकाश्च तथैव दुर्मर्षणचित्रसेनौ। नृपास्तथाऽन्ये प्रययुः समन्तात्॥'}

{'en': 'Surrounded by these great and mighty carwarriors all possessing great prowess and energy, O king, he shone in the midst of those foremost of royal heroes like the lord of the celestial in the midst of the celestial.', 'sn': 'स तैर्महद्भिश्च महारथैश्च तेजस्विभिर्वीर्यवद्धिश्च राजन्। वृतः स देवैरिव वज्रपाणिः॥'}

{'en': 'The magnificent standards on the backs of the elephants stationed in front of the various divisions of the army waved in the air and looked highly beautiful with yellow, black and brown colours.', 'sn': 'तस्मिन्ननीकप्रमुखे विषक्ता दोधूयमानाश्च महापताकाः। सुरक्तपीतासितपाण्डुराभा महागजस्कन्धगता विरेजुः॥'}

{'en': 'That great army with the royal son of Shantanu (Bhishma) at its head and with other great car-warriors and with elephants and horses, looked as resplendent as a mass of clouds charged with lightning or as the sky with gathering clouds in the season of rains.', 'sn': 'सा वाहिनी शान्तनवेन गुप्ता महारथैर्वारणवाजिभिश्च। बभौ सविद्युत्स्तनयिलुकल्पा जलागमै द्यौरिव जातमेघा॥'}

{'en': "Then like the fearful current of the oceangoing Ganga, that great Kuru army, protected by Shantanu's son rushed with great force towards Arjuna.", 'sn': 'ततो रणायाभिमुखी प्रयाता प्रत्यर्जुनं शान्तनवाभिगुप्ता। सेना महोग्रा सहसा कुरूणां वेगो यथा भीम इवापगायाः॥'}

{'en': 'With various kinds of forces possessing great strength and also with innumerable elephants, horses and foot soldiers and carwarriors, the Vyuha invade by the apebannered hero (Arjuna) looked from the distance like a great mass of clouds.', 'sn': 'तं व्यालनानाविधगूढसारं गजाश्वपादातरथौघपक्षम्। व्यूहं महामेघसमं महात्मा ददर्श दूरात् कपिराजकेतुः॥'}

{'en': "That illustrious hero, that foremost of men, standing on his car furnished with his standard and yoked with white steeds went against the enemy's army supported by a large force.", 'sn': 'विनिर्ययौ केतुमता रथेन नरर्षभः श्वेतहयेन वीरः। वरूथिना सैन्यमुखे महात्मा वधे धृतः सर्वसपत्नयूनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing that ape-bannered hero accompanied by that foremost of the Yadu race, all the Kurus with your sons were filled with dismay.', 'sn': 'सूपस्करं सोत्तरबन्धुरेषं यत्तं यदूनामृषभेण संख्ये। कपिध्वजं प्रेक्ष्य विषेदुराजौ सहैव पुत्रैस्तव कौरवेयाः॥'}

{'en': 'Your troops saw that best of Vyuhas which was protected by that great car-warriors of the world Kiritin (Arjuna). It had thousands of weapons up-raised and on each of its concerns stood four thousand elephants.', 'sn': 'प्रकर्षता गुप्तमुदायुधेन किरीटिना लोकमहारथेन। श्चतुश्चतुळलसहस्रकर्णम्॥'}

{'en': 'This Vyuha of today was like the one which was formed on the day previous by that foremost of Kurus, king Dharamraja Yudhishthira and the like of which had never been seen or heard to before by any man.', 'sn': 'यथा हि पूर्वेऽहनि धर्मराज्ञा व्यूहः कृतः कौरवसत्तमेन। तथा न भूतो भुवि मानुषेषु न दृष्टपूर्वो न च संश्रुतश्च॥'}

{'en': 'Then thousands of drums were loudly beat on the field of battle. There rose from every quareer sounds of conchs and trumpets and lion-like shouts.', 'sn': 'ततो यथादेशमुपेत्य तस्थुः पाञ्चालमुख्याः सह चेदिमुख्यैः। ततः समादेशसमाहतानि भेरीसहस्राणि विनेदुराजौ॥'}

{'en': 'Then bows of loud twang, drawn by heroic warriors, with arrows fixed on the bow brings and the sounds of conchs rose above the uproar made by drums and cymbals.', 'sn': 'शङ्खस्वनास्तूर्यरथस्वनाश्च सर्वेष्वनीकेषु ससिंहनादाः। ततः सबाणानि महास्वनानि विस्फार्यमाणानि धनूंषि वीरैः॥'}

{'en': 'The entire sky was filled with the sounds of conchs dust filled every place with that dust the atmosphere appeared as if a canopy had been over-spread. Having seen that canopy, all the brave warriors rushed to the battle.', 'sn': 'क्षणेन भेरीपणवप्रणादानन्तर्दधुः शङ्खमहास्वनाश्च। तच्छङ्खशब्दावृतमन्तरिक्षमुद्भूतबीमाद्भुतरेणुजालम्॥'}

{'en': 'Car-warriors struck with car-warriors were cut down with their charioteers, horses, car and standards. Elephants struck by elephants and foot soldiers struck by foot soldiers all fell (on the filled of battle).', 'sn': 'मालोक्य वीराः सहसाभिपेतुः। रथी रथेनाभिहतः ससूतः पपात साश्वः सरथः सकेतुः॥'}

{'en': 'Impetuous horsemen struck down by impetuous horsemen fell with fearful countenances. All appeared to be exceedingly wonderful.', 'sn': 'गजो गजेनाभिहतः पपात पदातिना चाभिहतः पदातिः। ?रीकृतान्यद्भुतदर्शनानि। प्रासैश्च खड्डैश्च समाहतानि सदश्ववृन्दानि सदश्ववृन्दैः॥'}

{'en': 'Excellent shields adorned with golden stars and possessed of the effulgence of the sun, broken by battle axes, lances and swords dropped on the field of battle.', 'sn': 'सुवर्णतारागणभूषितानि सूर्यप्रभाभानि शरावराणि। विदार्यमाणानि परश्वधैश्च प्रासैश्च खड्डैश्च निपेतुरुक्म्॥'}

{'en': 'Many car-warriors, mangled and bruised by the tasks and the powerful trunks of elephants fell down with their charioteers, many foremost of car-warriors, struck by the foremost of carwarriors fell on the earth.', 'sn': 'गजैविषाणैर्वरहस्तरुग्णाः केचित् ससूता रथिनः प्रपेतुः। गजर्षभाश्चापि रथर्षभेण निपातिता बाणहताः पृथिव्याम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having heard the wails of horsemen and foot soldiers, struck with the tusks and other limbs of elephants or crushed by their huge animals fell down on the field of battle.', 'sn': 'गजौघवेगोद्धतसादितानां श्रुत्वा विषेदुः सहसा मनुष्याः। आस्विनं सादिपदातियूनां विषाणगात्रावरताडितानाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then when horsemen and foot soldiers were falling fast, and elephants, horses and cars were flying away in fear, Bhishma surrounded by many great car-warriors got a sight of the ape-mannered warrior (Arjuna).', 'sn': 'सम्भ्रान्तनागाश्वरथे मुहूर्ते महाक्षये सादिपदातियूनाम्। महारथैः सम्परिवार्यमाणो ददर्श भीष्मः कपिराजकेतुम्॥'}

{'en': 'The plmyra-bannered hero, the son of Shantanu, who had five palmyras on his standard, then rushed upon the diadem decked warrior (Arjuna) whose car was yoked with excellent steeds with possessed wonderful energy and which blazed like the lighting.', 'sn': 'तं पञ्चतालोच्छ्रिततालकेतुः सदश्ववेगाद्भुतवीर्ययानः। महास्त्रबाणाशनिदीप्तिमन्तं किरीटिनं शान्तनवोऽभ्यधावत्॥'}

{'en': "O king, thus against that son of Indra who was like Indra himself rushed many warriors headed by Drona, Kripa, Shalya, Vivingshati, Duryodhana and also Somadatta's son.", 'sn': 'मिन्द्रात्मजं द्रोणमुखा विमः। कृपश्च शल्यश्च विविंशतिश्च दुर्योधनः सौमदत्तिश्च राजन्॥'}

{'en': 'Then the heroic son of Arjuna Abhimanyu learned in all the weapons and clad in a handsome golden armour, rushed out of the ranks of attacked all your warriors.', 'sn': 'ततो रथानां प्रमुखादुपेत्य सर्वास्त्रवित् काञ्चनचित्रवर्मा। स्तानर्जुनस्यात्मसुतोऽभिमन्युः॥'}

{'en': 'That son of Arjuna baffled the weapons of all the mighty warriors. He looked effulgent as the exalted Agni on the sacrificial alter when invoked with high Mantras.', 'sn': 'मसह्यकर्मा विनिहत्य कार्ष्णिः। बभौ महामन्त्रहुतार्चिमाली भगवानिवाग्निः॥ सदोगतः सन्'}

{'en': 'Then the greatly powerful Bhishma created a river in that field of battle. Its water was made by the blood of foes. But he quickly avoided the son of Subhadra and charged the great car-warrior Pareha.', 'sn': 'ततः स तूर्णं रुधिरोदफेनां कृत्वा नदीमाशु रणे रिपूणाम्। जगाम सौभद्रमतीत्य भीष्मो महारथं पार्थमदीनसत्त्वः॥'}

{'en': 'Then Arjuna, adorned with diadem and garlands, with his wonderful Gandiva in his hand, the twang of which resembled the roars of clouds, shot showers of arrows and baffled the showers of arrows (shot by Bhishma).', 'sn': 'ततः प्रहस्याद्भुतविक्रमेण गाण्डीवमुक्तेन शिलाशितेना विपाठजालेन महास्त्रजालं विनाशयामास किरीटमाली॥'}

{'en': 'That illustrious ape-bannered hero then poured upon Bhishma that foremost of all wielders of arms a shower of sharp arrows and broad-headed polished shafts.', 'sn': 'सक्तकर्मा कपिराजकेतुः। भीष्मं महात्माभिववर्ष तूर्णं शरौघजालैर्विमलैश्च भल्लैः॥'}

{'en': 'Your troops then saw that shower of arrow, shot by that great ape-bannered hero, opposed and dispersed by Bhishma, as the sun dispels darkness.', 'sn': 'तथैव भीष्माहतमन्तरिक्ष महास्त्रजालं कपिराजकेतोः। विशीर्यमाणं ददृशुस्त्वदीया दिवाकरेणेव तमोऽभिभूतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then the Kurus, the Srinjayas, and all other people saw the single combat between those two foremost of men, Bhishma and Arjuna both distinguished by the fearful twang of their bows.', 'sn': 'मदीनवत् सत्पुरुषोत्तमाभ्याम्। ददर्श लोकः कुरुसुंजयाच तद् द्वैरथं भीष्मधनंजयाभ्याम्॥'}

{'en': 'O Holy One, you should tell me the meanings of those various names uttering which the great Rishi Vyasa with his disciples sang the praises of the illustrious killer of Madhu. I wish to hear those names of Hari, that Supreme Lord of all creatures. Indeed, by hearing of those names, I shall be sanctified and cleansed like the bright autumnal moon.', 'sn': 'जनमेजय उवाच अस्तौषीद् यैरिमं व्यासः स शिष्यो मधुसूदनम्। नामभिर्विविधैरेषां निरुक्तं भगवन् मम॥ वक्तुमर्हसि शुश्रूषोः प्रजापतिपतेर्हरेः। श्रुत्वा भवेयं यत् पूतः शरच्चन्द्र इवामलः॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said, Listen, O king, to what the meanings are of the various names, due to attributes and acts, of Hari as the powerful Hari himself of cheerful soul explained them to Phalguna.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच शृणु राजन यथाऽऽचष्ट फाल्गुनस्य हरिः प्रभुः। प्रसन्नात्माऽऽत्मनो नाम्नां निरुक्तं गुणकर्मजम्॥'}

{'en': 'That killer of hostile heroes, viz., Phalguna, had at one time asked Keshava, enquiring after the meanings of the some of the names by which the great Keshava is worshipped.', 'sn': 'नामभिः कीर्तितैस्तस्य केशवस्य महात्मनः। पृष्टवान् केशवं राजन् फाल्गुनः परवीरहा॥'}

{'en': 'O Holy One, O supreme ordainer of the Past and the Future, O Creator of all Beings, O Immutable one, O Refuge of all the worlds, O Lord of the universe, O Remover of the fears of all persons.', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच भगवन् भूतभव्येश सर्वभूतसृगव्यय। लोकधाम जगन्नाथ लोकानामभयप्रद॥'}

{'en': 'I wish to hear from you in detail, O Keshava, the meanings of all those names of yours, O God, which have been mentioned by the great Rishis in the Vedas and the Puranas on account of various acts of yours! None else than you, O Lord, is capable to explain the mcanings of those names.', 'sn': 'यानि नामानि ते देव कीर्तितानि महर्षिभिः। वेदेषु सपुराणेषु यानि गुह्यानि कर्मभिः॥ तेषां निरुक्तं त्वत्तोऽहं श्रोतुमिच्छामि केशव। न ह्यन्यो वर्ण येन्नाम्नां निरुक्तं त्वामृते प्रभो॥'}

{'en': 'The Holy One said, In the Rigveda, in the Yajurveda, in the Atharvans and the Samans, in the Puranas and the Upanishads, as also in the works on Astrology, O Arjuna, in the Sankhya treatises, in the Yoga Scriptures, and in the treatises also on the Science of Life, many are the names that have been mentioned by the great Rishis. Some of those names refer to my attributes and some of them refer to my deeds. Do you hear, with rapt attention, O Sinless One, what the meaning is of each of those names referring to my acts.', 'sn': 'श्रीभगवानुवाच ऋग्वेदे सयजुर्वेदे तथैवाथर्वसामसु। पुराणे सोपनिषदे तथैव ज्यौतिषेऽर्जुन॥ सांख्ये च योगशास्त्रे च आयुर्वेदे तथैव च। बहूनि मम नामानि कीर्तितानि महर्षिभिः॥ गौणानि तत्र नामानि कर्मजानि च कानिचित्। निरुक्तं कर्मजानां त्वं शृणुष्व प्रयतोऽनघ॥'}

{'en': 'As I recite them to you. It is said that in days of yore you formed half my body. Salutations to Him of great glory. Him, viz., that is the Supreme Soul of all embodied creatures.', 'sn': 'कथ्यमानं मया तात त्वं हि मेऽर्धं स्मृतः पुरा। नमोऽतियशसे तस्मै देहिनां परमात्मने॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to Narayana, to Him that is at one with the universe, to .Him who is above the three qualities, to Him, that is again, the Soul of those qualities. From His grace has originated Brahman, and from His anger has arisen Rudra.', 'sn': 'नारायणाय विश्वाय निर्गुणाय गुणात्मने। यस्य प्रसादजो ब्रह्मा रुद्रश्च क्रोधसम्भवः॥'}

{'en': 'He is the source whence have originated all mobile and immobile creatures. O foremost of all persons gifted with Sattva (Goodness), the attribute of Sattva consists of eighteen qualities. That attribute is Supreme Nature having for her soul the Sky and Earth and succeeding by her creative forces in keeping up the universe.', 'sn': 'योऽसौ योनिर्हि सर्वस्य स्थावरस्य चरस्य च। अष्टादशगुणं यत् तत् सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतां वर॥ प्रकृतिः सा परा मह्यं रोदसी योगधारिणी।'}

{'en': 'That Nature is at one with the fruit of all acts. She is also the pure Chit. She is immortal, and invincible, and is called the Soul of the universe. From her proceed all the changes of both Creation and Destruction,', 'sn': 'ऋता सत्यामराजय्या लोकानामात्मसंज्ञिता॥ तस्मात् सर्वाः प्रवर्तन्ते सर्गप्रलयविक्रियाः।'}

{'en': 'Divested of sex, She or He is the penances that people practise. He is both the sacrifice that is performed and the sacrificer who celebrates the sacrifice. He is the ancient and the infinite Purusha. He is otherwise called Aniruddha and is the source of the Creation and the Destruction of the universe.', 'sn': 'तपो यज्ञश्च यष्टा च पुराणः पुरुषो विराट्॥ अनिरुद्ध इति प्रोक्तो लोकानां प्रभवाप्ययः।'}

{'en': "When Brahmana's night was passed, through the grace of that Being of great energy, a lotus made its appearance first, you having eyes like lotus petals.", 'sn': 'ब्राह्मे रात्रिक्षये प्राप्ते तस्य ह्यमिततेजसः॥ प्रसादात् प्रादुरभवत् पद्मं पद्मनिभेक्षण।'}

{'en': "Within that lotus was born Brahman, originating from Aniruddha's grace. Towards the evening of Brahman's day, Aniruddha became filled with anger, and as a consequence of this, there originated from his forehead a son called Rudra gifted with the power of destroying everything. These two, viz., Brahman and Rudra, are the foremost of all the gods, having originated respectively from the Cheerfulness and the Anger (of Aniruddha).", 'sn': 'ततो ब्रह्मा समभवत् स तस्यैव प्रसादजः॥ अह्नः क्षये ललाटाच्च सुतो देवस्य वै तथा। क्रोधाविष्टस्य संजज्ञे रुद्रः संहारकारकः॥ एतौ द्वौ विबुधश्रेष्ठौ प्रसादक्रोधजावुभौ।'}

{'en': "Acting according to Aniruddha's directions, these two gods Create and Destroy. Although capable of granting boons to all creatures, they are, however, in their own work, (viz., Creation and Destruction), merely instruments in the hands of Aniruddha.", 'sn': 'तदादेशितपन्थानौ सृष्टिसंहारकारकौ॥ निमित्तमात्रं तावत्र सर्वप्राणिवरप्रदौ।'}

{'en': 'Rudra is otherwise called Kaparddin. He has matted locks on his head, some times shows a bald head. He loves to live in the midst of crematoriums which form his home. He practises the austerest vows. He is a Yogin of mighty power and energy.', 'sn': 'कपर्दी जटिला मुण्डः श्मशान गृहसेवकः॥ उग्रव्रतचरो रुद्रो योगी परमदारुणः।'}

{'en': "He is the destroyer of Daksha's sacrifice and the tearer of Bhaga's eyes. O son of Pandu, Rudra should be known to have always Narayana for his Soul.", 'sn': 'दक्षक्रतुहरश्चैव भगनेत्रहरस्तथा।॥ नारायणात्मको ज्ञेयः पाण्डवेय युगे युगे।'}

{'en': 'If that god of gods, viz., Mahesvara, be adored, then, O Partha, is the powerful Narayana also adored.', 'sn': 'तस्मिन् हि पूज्यमाने वै देवदेवे महेश्वरे॥ सम्पूजितो भवेत् पार्थ देवो नारायणः प्रभुः।'}

{'en': 'I am the Soul, O son of Pandu, of all the worlds, of all the universe. Rudra again, is my Soul. It is for this that I always worship him.', 'sn': 'अहमात्मा हि लोकानां विश्वेषां पाण्डुनन्दन॥ तस्मादात्मानमेवाग्रे रुद्रं सम्पूजयाम्यहम्।'}
{'en': 'If I do not worship the auspicious and boon-giving Ishana, nobody would then worship my own self.', 'sn': 'यद्यहं नार्चयेयं वै ईशानं वरदं शिवम्॥ आत्मानं नार्चयेत् कश्चिदिति मे भावितात्मनः।'}

{'en': 'The ordinances I set are followed by all the worlds. Those ordinances should always be worshipped, and it is, therefore, that I worship them.', 'sn': 'मया प्रमाणं हि कृतं लोकः समनुवर्तते॥ प्रमाणानि हि पूज्यानि ततस्तं पूजयाम्यहम्।'}

{'en': 'He who knows Rudra knows myself, and he who knows myself, knows Rudra. He who follows Rudra follows me. Rudra is Narayana. Both are one; and one is shown in two different forms.', 'sn': 'यस्तं वेत्ति स मां वेत्ति योऽनु तं स हि मामनु॥ रुद्रो नारायणश्चैव सत्त्वमेकं द्विधाकृतम्।'}

{'en': 'Rudra and Narayana, forming one person, pervade all displayed things and cause them to act. No one else than Rudra is capable to grant me a boon, O son of Pandu.', 'sn': 'लोके चरति कौन्तेय व्यक्तिस्थं सर्वकर्मसु॥ न हि मे केनचिद् देयो वरः पाण्डवनन्दन।'}

{'en': 'Having settled this in my mind, I worshipped in days of yore the ancient and powerful Rudra, for getting the boon of a son. In worshipping Rudra thus, I worshipped my own self.', 'sn': 'इति संचिन्त्य मनसा पुराणं रुद्रमीश्वरम्॥ पुत्रार्थमाराधितवानहमात्मानमात्मना।'}
{'en': 'Vishnu never bows his head to any god except his own self. It is therefore that I worship Rudra.', 'sn': 'न हि विष्णुः प्रणमति कस्मैचिद् विबुधाय च॥ ऋते आत्मानमेवेति ततो रुद्रं भजाम्यहम्।'}

{'en': 'All the gods, including Brahman and Indra and the gods and the great Rishis, worship Narayana, that foremost of gods, otherwise called by the name of Hari.', 'sn': 'सब्रह्मकाः सरुद्राश्च सेन्द्रा देवाः सहर्षिभिः॥ अर्चयन्ति सुरश्रेष्ठं देवं नारायणं हरिम्।'}

{'en': 'Vishnu is the foremost of all Beings past, present, or future, and as such should always be worshipped with respect.', 'sn': 'भविष्यतां वर्ततां च भूतानां चैव भारत॥ सर्वेषामग्रणीविष्णः सेव्यः पूज्यश्च नित्यशः।'}

{'en': 'Do you bow your head to Vishnu. Do you bow your head to Him who gives protection to all. Do you bow,, O son of Kunti, to that great boon-giving god, that foremost of gods, who eats the offerings made to him in sacrifices.', 'sn': 'नमस्व हव्यदं विष्णुं तथा शरणदं नम॥ वरदं नमस्व कौन्तेय हव्यकव्यभुजं नम। चतुर्विधा मन जना भक्ता एव हि मे श्रुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'I have heard that there are four kinds of worshippers. Among them all, they that are devoted to me wholly and do not worship any other god, are the foremost. I am the end they seek, and though engaged in deeds, they never seek the fruits thereof.', 'sn': 'तेषामेकान्तिनः श्रेष्ठा ये चैवानन्यदेवताः। अहमेव गतिस्तेषां निराशी: कर्मकारिणाम्॥'}

{'en': 'The three remaining classes of my worshippers are those who seek the fruits of their acts. They acquire regions of great happiness, but then they have to drop down therefrom upon the exhaustion of their merits. Those amongst my worshippers, therefore, who are fully awakened obtain what is foremost.', 'sn': 'ये च शिष्टास्त्रयो भक्ताः फलकामा हि ते मताः। सर्वे च्यवनधर्मास्ते प्रतिबुद्धस्तु श्रेष्ठभाक्॥'}

{'en': 'Those who are awakened and whose conduct shows such enlightenment, may be engaged in worshipping Brahman or Mahadeva or the other gods who live in heaven, but they succeed at least in getting to myself.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्माणं शितिकण्ठं च याश्चान्या देवताः स्मृताः। प्रबुद्धचर्याः सेवन्तो मामेवैष्यन्ति यत् परम्॥'}

{'en': 'I have thus told you, O Partha, what the destinations are between my worshippers. Yourself, O son of Kunti, and myself are known as Nara and Narayana. Both of us have taken human bodies only for the purpose of lightening the load of the Earth.', 'sn': 'भक्तं प्रति विशेषस्ते एष पार्थानुकीर्तितः। त्वं चैवाहं च कौन्तेय नरनारायणौ स्मृतौ॥ भारावतरणार्थं तु प्रविष्टौ मानुषीं तनुम्।'}

{'en': 'I know the different sorts of Yoga that rest on the Soul. I know who I am and whence I am, O Bharata. I know the Religion of Renunciation, and all that contributes to the prosperity of creatures.', 'sn': 'जानाम्यध्यात्मयोगांश्च योऽहं यस्माच्च भारत॥ निवृत्तिलक्षणो धर्मस्तथाऽऽभ्युदयिकोऽपि च।'}

{'en': 'Eternal as I am, I am the one sole Refuge of all men. The waters have been called by the name of Nara, for they originated from Him called Nara. And since the waters, in former times, were my refuge, I am, therefore, called by the name of Narayana.', 'sn': 'नराणामयनं ख्यातमहमेकः सनातनः॥ आपो नारा इति प्रोक्ता आपो वै नरसूनवः। अयनं मम तत् पूर्वमतो नारायणो ह्यहम्॥'}

{'en': 'Taking the form of the Sun I cover the universe, with my rays. And because I am the home of all creatures, therefore, am I called by the name of Vasudeva.', 'sn': 'छादयामि जगद् विश्वं भूत्वा सूर्य इवांशुभिः। सर्वभूताधिवासश्च वासुदेवस्ततो ह्यहम्॥'}

{'en': 'I am the end of all creatures and their father, O Bharata. I pervade the entire sky and the Earth. O Partha. and my splendour transcends every other splendour.', 'sn': 'गतिश्च सर्वभूतानां प्रजनश्चापि भारत। व्याप्ता मे रोदसी पार्थ कान्तिश्चाभ्यधिका मम॥'}

{'en': 'I am He, O Bharata, whom all creatures wish to attain to at the end. And because I overwhelm all the universe, I am called by the name of Vishnu.', 'sn': 'अधिभूतानि चान्तेषु तदिच्छंश्चास्मि भारत। क्रमणाच्चाप्यहं पार्थ विष्णुरित्यभिसंज्ञितः॥'}

{'en': 'Desirous of acquiring success through control of their senses, people seek to obtain to me who am heaven and Earth and the sky between the two. For this am I called Damodara.', 'sn': 'दमात् सिद्धिं परीप्सन्तो मां जनाः कामयन्ति ह। दिवं चोर्वी च मध्यं च तस्माद् दामोदरो ह्यहम्॥'}

{'en': 'The word Prishni includes food, the Vedas, water, and nectar. These four are always in my stomach. Hence am I called Prishnigarbha.', 'sn': 'पृश्निरित्युच्यते चान्नं वेद आपोऽमृतं तथा। ममैतानि सदा गर्भः पृश्निगर्भस्ततो ह्यहम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Rishis have said that once on a time when the Rishi Trita was thrown into a well by Ekata and Dvita, the distressed Trita invoked me, saying,-O Prishnigarbha, do you save the fallen Trita.', 'sn': 'ऋषयः प्राहुरेवं मां त्रितं कूपनिपातितम्। पृश्निगर्भ त्रितं पाहीत्येकतद्वितपातितम्॥'}

{'en': 'That foremost of Rishis, viz., Trita, the spiritual son of Brahma, having called on me thus, was saved from the pit.', 'sn': 'ततः स ब्रह्मणः पुत्र आद्यो ह्यषिवरस्त्रितः। उत्ततारोदपानाद् वै पृश्निगर्भानुकीर्तनात्॥'}

{'en': 'The rays that come out of the Sun who gives heat to the world, from the blazing fire, and from the Moon, form my hair. Hence do foremost of learned Brahmanas call me by the name of Keshava.', 'sn': 'सूर्यस्य तपतो लोकानग्नेः सोमस्य चाप्युत। अंशवो यत् प्रकाशन्ते ममैते केशसंज्ञिताः॥ सर्वज्ञाः केशवं तस्मान्मामाहुर्द्विजसत्तमाः।'}

{'en': "The great Utathya having impregnated his wife disappeared from her side through an illusion of the gods. The younger brother Brihaspati then appeared before that great one's wife.", 'sn': 'स्वपल्यामाहितो गर्भ उतथ्येन महात्मना॥ उतथ्येऽन्तर्हिते चैव कदाचिद्देवमायया। बृहस्पतिस्थाविन्दत्पत्नीं तस्य महात्मनः॥'}

{'en': "To that foremost of Rishis who had gone there for holding sexual intercourse, the child in the womb of Utathya's wife, O son of Kunti, whose body had already been formed to the five principal elements, said,-O giver of boons, I have already entered into this womb. You should not attack my mother!-Hearing these words of the unborn child, Brihaspati became filled with anger and imprecated a curse on him, saying,-Since you obstruct me thus when I have come there from desire of the pleasures of sexual union, therefore shall you, through my curse, be visited by blindness.", 'sn': 'ततौ वै तमृषिश्रेष्ठं मैथुनोपगतं तथा। उवाच गर्भ: कौन्तेय पञ्चभूतसमन्वितः॥ पूर्वागतोऽहं नरद नार्हस्यम्बां प्रबाधितुम्। एतबृहस्पतिः श्रुत्वा चुक्रोध च शशाप च॥ मैथुनायागतो यस्मात्त्वयाऽहं विनिवारितः। तस्मादन्धो यास्यसि त्वं मच्छापान्नात्र संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'Through this curse of the foremost of Rishis, the child of Utathya was born blind and remained so for a long time. It was, therefore, that that Rishi, in days of yore, passed by the name of Dirghatamas.', 'sn': 'स शापदृष्टिमुख्यस्य दीर्घ तम उपेयिवान्। स हि दीर्घतमा नाम नाम्ना ह्यासीदृषिः पुरा'}

{'en': 'He, however, acquired the four Vedas with their eternal limbs and subsidiary parts. After that-he frequently invoked me by this secret name of mine. Indeed, according to the ordinance as laid down he repeatedly called me by the name of Keshava.', 'sn': 'वेदानवाप्य चतुरः सांगोपांगासनातनान्। प्रयोजयामास तदा नाम गुह्यमिदं मम।।५५'}

{'en': 'Through the merit he acquired by uttering this name repeatedly, he became cured of his blindness and then passed by the name of Gotama.', 'sn': 'आनुपूर्येण विधिना केशवेति पुनः पुनः। स चक्षुष्मान्समभवद्गोतमश्चाभवत्पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'This name of mine, therefore, O Arjuna, is productive of boons to them who utter it among all the gods and the great Rishis.', 'sn': 'एवं हि वरदं नाम केशवेति ममार्जुन। देवानामथ सर्वेषामृषीणां च महात्मनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'The god of fire and Soma, blending together, become transfused into one and the same substance. It is, therefore, that the entire universe of mobile and immobile creatures is said to be pervaded by those two gods.', 'sn': 'अग्नि: सोमेन संयुक्त एकयोनित्वमागतः। अग्नीषोममयं तस्माज्जगत् कृत्स्नं चराचरम्॥'}

{'en': 'In the Puranas, Agni and Soma are spoken of at possessing natures that had one and the same result. The gods also are said to have Agni for their mouth. It is on account of these two beings gifted with natures leading to the same result that they are said to be deserving of each other and upholders of the universe."', 'sn': 'अपि हि पुराणे भवति एकयोन्यात्मकाव ग्नीषोमौ देवाश्चाग्निमुखा इति एकयोनित्वाच्च परस्परमर्हन्तो लोकान् धारयन्त इति॥'}

{'en': 'Indra said Kshatriya duties, O king, which are so very potent, which embrace the exercise of all other duties, and which are the highest of all duties, should be observed by persons that are like you so high-souled and seek the well-being of the world. If those duties are not properly satisfied all creatures would be ruined.', 'sn': 'इन्द्र उवाच एवंवीर्यः सर्वधर्मोपपन्न क्षात्रः श्रेष्ठः सर्वधर्मेषु धर्मः। पाल्यो युष्माभिर्लोकहितैरुदारै विपर्यये स्यादभवः प्रजानाम्॥'}

{'en': 'The king, cherishing mercy for all creatures, should consider these as the highest of his duties, viz., reclaiming the land for cultivation and fertilizing it, celebration of great sacrifices for purifying himself, aversion for begging, and protection of subjects.', 'sn': 'भूसंस्कारं राजसंस्कारयोर्ग मभैक्ष्यचर्यां पालनं च प्रजानाम्। विद्याद् राजा सर्वभूतानुकम्पी देहत्यागं चाहवे धर्ममग्न्यम्॥'}

{'en': 'Making gifts is said by the sages to be the greatest of virtues. Of all kinds of gifts again, that of the body in battle, is the highest. You have seen with your own eyes how the kings, ever following Kshatriya duties, having duly waited upon their preceptors and acquired great learning, at last sacrifice their bodies, while fighting with one another. The Kshatriya, desirous of earning religious merit, should after following the Brahmacharya mode, live like a house-holder which is always meritorious.', 'sn': 'त्यागं श्रेष्ठं मुनयो वै वदन्ति सर्वश्रेष्ठं यच्छरीरं त्यजन्तः। नित्यं युक्ता राजधर्मेषु सर्वे प्रत्यक्षं ते भूमिपाला यथैव॥ बहुश्रुत्वा गुरुशुश्रूषया चा परस्परं संहननाद् वदन्ति। नित्यं धर्मं क्षत्रियो ब्रह्मचारी चरेदेको ह्याश्रमं धर्मकामः॥'}

{'en': 'While settling the question of right (between) his subjects, he should be perfectly impartial. For making the various orders follow their respective duties, for the protection they give to all, for the various contrivances and means and the prowess and exertion Kshatriya duties, which embrace all other duties, are said to be the highest. The other orders are able to follow their respective duties for kingly duties. Therefore the former depend upon the latter regarding the merit they produce.', 'sn': 'सामान्यार्थे व्यवहारे प्रवृत्ते प्रियाप्रिये वर्जयन्नेव यत्नात्। चातुर्वर्ण्यस्थापनात् पालनाच्च तैस्तैर्योगैर्नियमैरौरसैश्च॥ सर्वोद्योगैराश्रमं धर्ममाहुः क्षात्रं श्रेष्ठं सर्वधर्मोपपन्नम्। स्वं स्वं धर्मं येन चरन्ति वर्णा स्तांस्तान्धर्मानन्यथार्थान् वदन्ति॥'}

{'en': 'Those men, who disobey all healthy checks and who are too much attached to the worldly objects, are regarded as brutes. They are constrained to act justly by the exercise of kingly duties. Those duties, therefore, are said to be the highest of all.', 'sn': 'निर्मर्यादान् नित्यमर्थे निविर्श नाहुस्तांस्तान् वै पशुभूतान्मनुष्यान्। यथा नीतिं गमयत्यर्थयोर्गा च्छ्रेयस्तस्मादाश्रमात् क्षत्रधर्मः॥'}

{'en': 'That course of conduct which has been laid down for Brahmanas who follow the three Vedas, and those modes of life that have been laid down for Brahmanas, should, first, of all be observed by every Brahmana. If a Brahmana acts otherwise, he should be punished like a Shudra,', 'sn': 'विद्यानां या गतिर्ब्राह्मणानां ये चैवोक्ताश्चाश्रमा ब्राह्मणानाम्। एतत् कर्म ब्राह्मणस्याहुरग्रर्य मन्यत् कुर्वञ्छूद्रवच्छस्त्रवध्यः॥'}

{'en': 'The duties of the four modes of life and the rituals laid down in the Vedas, O king, should always be followed by a Brahmana; he has no other duties.', 'sn': 'चातुराश्रम्यधर्माश्च वेदधर्माश्च पार्थिवा ब्राह्मणेनानुगन्तव्या नान्यो विद्यात् कदाचन॥'}

{'en': 'A Kshatriya should never maintain a Brahmana acting otherwise. His religious merit increases for his acts. A Brahmana, indeed, is like Dharma.', 'sn': 'अन्यथा वर्तमानस्य नासौ वृत्तिः प्रकल्प्यते। कर्मणा वर्धते धर्मो यथाधर्मस्तथैव सः॥'}

{'en': 'That Brahmana who does works that are not sanctioned for him, deserves no respect. If not engaged in his proper acts, he should not be trusted.', 'sn': 'यो विकर्मस्थितो विप्रो न स सम्मानमर्हति। कर्म स्वं नोपयुञ्जानमविश्वास्यं हि तं विदुः॥'}

{'en': 'These are the duties of the various orders. Kshatriyas should look after them so that their observance may be improved. These are the duties of Kshatriyas. For these reasons also, kingly duties and no others, are the highest of all. They are, as I believe, the duties of heroes, and the heroes are foremost in following them.', 'sn': 'एते धर्माः सर्ववर्णेषु लीना उत्क्रष्टव्याः क्षत्रियैरेष धर्मः। तस्माज्येष्ठा राजधर्मा न चान्ये वीर्यज्येष्ठा वीरधर्मा मता मे॥'}

{'en': 'What duties should be practised by the Yavanas, the Kiratas, the Gandharas, the Chinas, the Shavaras, the Barbaras, the Shakas, the Tusharas, the Kankas, the Palhavas, the Andhras, the Madrakas, the Paundras, the Pulindas, the Ramathas, the Kambojas, the several castes that have originated from Brahmanas and Kshatriyas, the Vaishyas, and the Shudras, that live in the dominions of Aryan kings? What are those duties again which kings like ourselves should compel the iribes living by robbery to follow.', 'sn': 'मान्धातोवाच यवनाः किराता गान्धाराचीनाः शबरबर्बराः। शकास्तुषाराः कङ्काश्च परवाश्चान्ध्रमद्रकाः॥ पौण्ड्राः पुलिन्दा रमठा: काम्बोजाश्चैव सर्वशः। ब्रह्मक्षत्रप्रसूताश्च वैश्याः शूद्राश्च मानवाः॥ कथं धर्माचरिष्यन्ति सर्वे विषयवासिनः। मद्विधैश्च कथं स्थाप्याः सर्वे वै दस्युजीविनः॥'}

{'en': 'I wish to hear all this, O illustrious god, instruct me. O chief of all the gods, you are the friend of us Kshatriyas.', 'sn': 'मान्धातोवाच एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं भगवंस्तद् ब्रवीहि मे। त्वं बन्धुभूतो ह्यस्माकं क्षत्रियाणां सुरेश्वर॥'}

{'en': 'Indra said All the robber tribes should serve their parents, their preceptors and other elders and hermits living in the forest.', 'sn': 'इन्द्र उवाच मातापित्रोर्हि शुश्रूषा कर्तव्या सर्वदस्युभिः। आचार्य गुरुशुश्रूषा तथैवाश्रमवासिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'All the robber tribes should also serve their kings. The duties and rites laid down in the Vedas should also be followed by them.', 'sn': 'भूमिपानां च शुश्रूषा कर्तव्या सर्वदस्युभिः। वेदधर्मक्रियाश्चैव तेषां धर्मो विधीयते॥'}

{'en': 'They should celebrate sacrifices in honour of the departed manes, dig wells, for the public give water to thirsty travellers, distribute beds and other presents amongst Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'पितृयज्ञास्तथा कूपाः प्रपाश्च शयनानि च। दानानि च यथाकालं द्विजेभ्यो विसृजेत् सदा॥'}

{'en': 'Abstention from injury, truth, control of anger, supporting Brahmanas and relatives by giving them their dues, maintenance of wives and children, purity, peacefulness, making presents to Brahmanas at all sorts of sacrifices are duties to be followed by every person of this tribe who seeks his own prosperity. Such a person should also celebrate all kinds of Pakayajnas with rich presents of food and wealth.', 'sn': 'अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधो वृत्तिदायानुपालनम्। भरणं पुत्रदाराणां शौचमद्रोह एव च॥ दक्षिणा सर्वयज्ञानां दातव्या भूतिमिच्छता। पाकयज्ञा महाश्चि दातव्याः सर्वदस्युभिः॥'}

{'en': 'These and similar duties, O sinless one, were laid down in days of yore for person of this class. All these acts, which have been laid down for all others, should be done by the robbers also, O king.', 'sn': 'एतान्येवंप्रकाराणि विहितानि पुरानघ। सर्वलोकस्य कर्माणि कर्तव्यानीह पार्थिव॥'}

{'en': 'Mandhatri said In this world, such wicked men may be seen living in disguise among all the four castes and in all the four modes of life.', 'sn': 'मान्धातोवाच दृश्यन्ते मानुषे लोके सर्ववर्णेषु दस्यवः। लिङ्गान्तरे वर्तमाना आश्रमेषु चतुर्ध्वपि॥'}

{'en': 'Indra said When the kingly duties are lost as well as the science of punishment, all creatures become exceedingly exercised, O sinless one, for the oppression of kings.', 'sn': 'इन्द्र उवाच विनष्टायां दण्डनीत्यां राजधर्मे निराकृते। सम्प्रमुह्यन्ति भूतानि राजदौरात्म्यतोऽनघ॥'}

{'en': 'After the termination of the Krita age, a confusion will set in regarding the various modes of life, and numberless mendicants will appear with sectarial marks of various sorts.', 'sn': 'असंख्याता भविष्यन्ति भिक्षवो लिङ्गिनस्तथा। आश्रमाणां विकल्पाश्च निवृत्तेऽस्मिन् कृते युगे॥'}

{'en': 'Disregarding the Puranas and the great truths of religion, men, urged by lust and anger, will wend wrong ways.', 'sn': 'अशृण्वानाः पुराणानां धर्माणां परमा गतीः। उत्पथं प्रतिपत्स्यन्ते काममन्युसमीरिताः॥'}

{'en': 'When sinful men are restrained by highsouled persons with the help of the science of punishment, then religion, which reigns supreme over everything and is eternal and which is the source of all good, becomes firmly established.', 'sn': 'यदा निवर्त्यते पापो दण्डनीत्या महात्मभिः। तदा धर्मो न चलते सद्भूतः शाश्वतः परः॥'}

{'en': 'The gifts, and libations, and offerings to the departed manes of the man who disregards the king who is superior to every one, become useless.', 'sn': 'सर्वलोकगुरुं चैव राजानं योऽवमन्यते। न तस्य दत्तं न हुतं न श्राद्धं फलते क्वचित्॥'}
{'en': 'The very gods do not disobey a virtuous king who is truly a personification of god.', 'sn': 'मानुषाणामधिपतिं देवभूतं सनातनम्। देवापि नावमन्यन्ते धर्मकामं नरेश्वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having created the universe, the divine Lord of all creatures meant the Kshatriya to rule men making them follow their duties.', 'sn': 'प्रजापतिर्हि भगवान् सर्वं चैवासृजज्जगत्। स प्रवृत्तिनिवृत्त्यर्थं धर्माणां क्षत्रमिच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'I respect and worship that person who hclped by his understanding, watches the course of the duties performed by men. Upon such supervision depend Kshatriya duties.', 'sn': 'प्रवृत्तस्य हि धर्मस्य बुद्ध्या यः स्मरते गतिम्। स मे मान्यश्च पूज्यश्च तत्र क्षत्रं प्रतिष्ठितम्॥'}

{'en': "Bhishma continued 'Having said these words, the divine and powerful Narayana, in the forın of Indra, accompanied by the Maruts, repaired to his eternal abode of endless felicity.", 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच एवमुक्त्वा स भगवान् मरुद्गणवृतः प्रभुः। जगाम भवनं विष्णोरक्षरं शाश्वतं पदम्॥'}

{'en': 'When, O sinless one, duties were thus followed in days of yore what man of cleansed soul and learning is there that would disregard the Kshatriya?', 'sn': 'एवं प्रवर्तिते धर्मे पुरा सुचरितेऽनघ। कः क्षत्रमवमन्येत चेतनावान् बहुश्रुतः॥'}
{'en': 'Like blind men lost on the way creatures, acting unrighteously, meet with ruin.', 'sn': 'अन्यायेन प्रवृत्तानि निवृत्तानि तथैव च। अन्तरा विलयं यान्ति यथा पथि विचक्षुषः॥'}

{'en': "O foremost of men, do you follow those duties which were first promulgated and which the ancients had followed. I know, O sinless one, that you are quite competent to do this.'", 'sn': 'आदौ प्रवर्तिते चक्रे तथैवादिपरायणे। वर्तस्व पुरुषव्याघ्र संविजानामि तेऽनघ॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said: There was a chief among the Yadus, named Shura, who was the father of Vasudeva. His daughter was named Pritha, she was matchless in beauty on earth.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच शूरो नाम यदुश्रेष्ठो वसुदेवपिताभवत्। तस्य कन्या पृथा नाम रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of the Bharata race, that truthful man (Shura) give his first born child to the son of his paternal aunt, his childless cousin and favour seeking friend, the high-souled Kuntibhoja, according to a promise given before.', 'sn': 'पितृष्वस्रीयाय स तामनपत्याय भारत। अग्यमग्रे प्रतिज्ञाय स्वस्यापत्य स सत्यवाक्॥ अग्रजामथ तां कन्यां शूरोऽनुग्रहकांक्षिणे। प्रददौ कुन्तिभोजाय सखा सख्ये महात्मने।॥'}

{'en': "She (Pritha) was appointed as her (adoptive) father's house to look after the hospitality to the Brahmanas and guests. One day by careful attentions she gratified the terrible Brahmana of rigid vows, known by the name of Durvasa, learned in the mystery of religion.", 'sn': 'सा नियुक्ता पितुर्गेह देवतातिथिपूजने। उग्रं पर्यचरत् तत्र ब्राह्मणं संशितव्रतम्॥ निगूढनिश्चयं धर्मे यं तं दुर्वाससं विदुः। तमुग्रं संशितात्मानं सर्वयत्नैरतोषयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Anticipating the future difficulty of her getting sons, he (Durvasa) taught her a Mantra for invoking any of the celestials (she liked for growing her children). The Rishi then said to her.', 'sn': 'तस्यै स प्रददौ मन्त्रमापद्धर्मान्ववेक्षया। अभिचाराभिसंयुक्तमब्रवीच्चैव तां मुनिः॥'}

{'en': '“Through the effulgence of those celestial whom you will invoke by this Mantra, offspring will be certainly begotten on you”.', 'sn': 'यं यं देवं त्वमेतेन मन्त्रेणावाहयिष्यसि। तस्य तस्य प्रसादेन तव पुत्रो भविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Having been thus told by the Brahmana, (Durvasa) the illustrious Kunti (Pritha), being curious, invoked in her maidenhood the god Arka (Sun).', 'sn': 'तथोक्ता सा तु विप्रेण कुन्ती कौतुहलान्विता। कन्या सती देवमर्कमाजुहाव यशस्विनी॥'}

{'en': 'She immediately saw (before her) that effulgent deity (Sun), that beholder of everything in the world. Seeing the wonderful sight, that maiden of fruitless feature was very much surprised.', 'sn': 'सा ददर्श तमायान्तं भास्करं लोकभावनम्। विस्मिता चानवद्याङ्गी दृष्ट्वा तन्महदद्भुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'The deity Vivasvan (Sun), coming to her said, “O black-eyed lady, here I am. Tell me what I can do for you."', 'sn': 'तां समासाद्य देवस्तु विवस्वानिदमब्रवीत्। अयमस्म्यसितापाङ्गि ब्रूहि किं करवाणि ते॥'}

{'en': 'Kunti said: O slayer of foes, a certain Brahmana gave। me this science (Mantra). O Lord, I have invoked you, only to see the efficacy of the Mantra.', 'sn': 'कुन्त्युवाच कश्चिन्मे ब्राह्मणः प्रादाद्वरं विद्यां च शत्रुहन्। तद्विजिज्ञासयाऽऽह्वानं कृतवत्यस्मि ते विभो॥'}

{'en': 'For my this fault, I bow down my head to you to ask for your grace. A woman, however guilty, deserves protection.”', 'sn': 'एतस्मिन्नपराधे त्वां शिरसाहं प्रसादये। योषितो हि सदा रक्ष्याः स्वापराद्धापि नित्यशः॥'}

{'en': 'The Sun said: I know Durvasa has given you this boon. Cast off your fears and allow me your embrace.', 'sn': 'सूर्य उवाच वेदाहं सर्वमेवैतद्यदुर्वासा वरं ददौ। संत्यज्य भयमेवेह क्रियतां संगमो मम॥'}

{'en': 'O amiable girl, my approach is infallible; it must be fruitful. O timid maiden, if my coming be for nothing, it will be certainly a transgression of yours.”', 'sn': 'अमोघं दर्शनं मह्यमाहूतश्चास्मि ते शुभे। वृथाह्यानेऽपि ते भीरु दोषः स्यान्नात्र संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Vivasvat thus spoke to her many things to allay her fears. O descendant of the Bharata race, the illustrious and beautiful girl, as she was a maid.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्ता बहुविधं सान्त्वपूर्वं विवस्वता। सा तु नैच्छद्वरारोहा कन्याहमिति भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Did not grant his request from modesty and from the fear of her relatives. O best of the Bharata race, Arka again addressed her thus.', 'sn': 'बन्धुपक्षभयादीता लज्जया च यशस्विनी। तामर्कः पुनरेवेदमब्रवीद्भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': '"O princess, there will be no sin in gratifying me." Having said this to the daughter of Kuntibhoja, that illustrious deity.', 'sn': 'मत्प्रसादान ते राज्ञि भविता दोष इत्युत। एवमुक्त्वा स भगवान्कुन्तिराजसुतां तदा॥'}

{'en': 'That illuminator of the universe, Tapana (Sun) received her embraces. Thereupon was born a hero, known all over the world by the name of Karna, the foremost of all wielders of arms, encased in a natural armour, blessed with good fortune and endued with celestial beauty and all auspicious marks and with a face brightened by ear-rings.', 'sn': 'प्रकाशकर्ता तपनः संबभूव तया सह। आमुक्तकवचः श्रीमान्देवगर्भः श्रियान्वितः॥ सहजं कवचं बिभ्रत्कुण्डलो द्योतिताननः। अजायत सुतः कर्णः सर्वलोकेषु विश्रुतः॥'}
{'en': 'The greatly effulgent Tapana, then giving Pritha her maiden-hood, again went to heaven.', 'sn': 'प्रादाच्च तस्यै कन्यात्वं पुनः स परमद्युतिः। दत्वा च तपतां श्रेष्ठो दिवमाचक्रमे ततः॥'}

{'en': 'The princess of the Vrishni race (Pritha) became affected with sorrow to see the birth of the child. She intently reflected on the course she should adopt.', 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वा कुमारं जातं सा वार्ष्णेयी दीनमानसा। एकाग्रं चिन्तयामास किं कृत्वा सुकृतं भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'She resolved to conceal her frailty from the fear of her friends and relatives. Kunti threw her that powerful son into water.', 'sn': 'गृहमानापचारं सा बन्धुपक्षभयात्तदा। उत्ससर्ज कुमारं तं जले कुन्ती महाबलम्॥'}

{'en': 'The illustrious husband of Radha took up that child thrown into the water. That son of Suta, (the husband of Radha), with his wife brought him up as their son.', 'sn': 'तमुत्सृष्टं जले गर्भं राधाभर्ता महायशाः। पुत्रत्वे कल्पयामास सभार्यः सूतनन्दनः॥'}
{'en': 'They gave that son the name of Vasusena, because he was born with wealth, (a natural armour and ear-rings).', 'sn': 'नामधेयं च चक्राते तस्य बालस्य तावुभौ। वसुना सह जातोऽयं वसुषेणो भवत्विति॥'}

{'en': 'He grew up very strong and became expert in all weapons. Possessed of great energy, he worshipped the Sun until his back was scorched by its rays.', 'sn': 'स वर्धमानो बलवान्सर्वास्त्रेषुद्यतोऽभवत्। आ पृष्ठतापादादित्यमुपातिष्ठत वीर्यवान्॥'}

{'en': 'When he was thus engaged in his worship, there was nothing on earth that the heroic and intelligent Vasusena would not give to Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'तस्मिन्काले तु जपतस्तस्य वीरस्य धीमतः। नादेयं ब्राह्मणेष्वासीत्किंचिदृसु महीतले॥'}

{'en': 'Indra, assuming the form of a Brahmana, came to him for alms. Ever engaged to do good to Arjuna, he asked for the armour.', 'sn': 'तमिन्द्रो ब्राह्मणो भूत्वा भिक्षार्थी समुपागमत्। कुण्डले प्रार्थयामास कवचं च महाद्युतिः॥'}

{'en': 'Taking off the natural armour from his body, Karna with joined hands gave it to Indra in the form of a Brahmana.', 'sn': 'स्वशरीरात् समुत्कृत्य कवचं स्वं निसर्गजम्। कर्णस्तु कुण्डले छित्त्वा प्रायच्छत् स कृताञ्जलिः।।'}

{'en': 'The king of the celestials received the gift and he was exceedingly pleased with his liberality. The lord of the celestials gave him a weapon, saying.', 'sn': 'प्रतिगृह्य तु देवेशस्तुष्टस्तेनास्य कर्मणा। ददौ शक्तिं सुरपतिर्वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह॥'}

{'en': '"Among the celestials, the Asuras, the Gandharvas, the Nagas and the Rakshasas, whoever you will desire to conquer he will certainly be killed by this weapon.', 'sn': 'देवासुरमनुष्याणां गन्धर्वोरंगरक्षसाम्। यमेकं जेतुमिच्छेथाः सोऽन्या न भविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'The son of Surya was known by the name of Vasushena, but after his cutting off his natural armour, he was called Karna (cutter).', 'sn': 'प्राङ्नाम तस्य कथितं वसुषेण इति क्षितौ। को वैकर्तनश्चैव कर्मणा तेन सोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said “Secing Duryodhana struck down in battle by Bhimasena, what, O Sanjaya did the Pandavas and the Srinjayas do?"', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच हतं दुर्योधनं दृष्ट्वा भीमसेनेन संयुगे। पाण्डवाः सृञ्जयाश्चैव किमकुर्वत संजय॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said “Seeing Duryodhana killed by Bhimasena in battle, O king, like a wild elephant slain by a lion the Pandavas with Krishna were filled with joy upon the fall of the Kuru king. The Panchalas and the Shrinjayas also waved their upper garments in the air) and sent up leonine roars. Even the Earth could not bear those rejoicing warriors.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच हतं दुर्योधनं दृष्ट्वा भीमसेनेन संयुगे। सिंहेनेव महाराज मत्तं वनगजं यथा॥ प्रहृष्टमनसस्तत्र कृष्णेन सह पाण्डवाः। पञ्चाला सृञ्जयाश्चैव निहते कुरुनन्दने॥ आविद्ध्यन्नुत्तरीयाणि सिंहनादांश्च नेदिरे। नैतान् हर्षसमाविष्टानियं सेहे वसुंधरा॥'}

{'en': 'Some stretched their bows; others drew their bowstrings. Some blew their huge conchs; other beat their drums.', 'sn': 'धनूंष्यन्ते व्याक्षिपन्त ज्याश्चाप्यन्ये तथाऽक्षिपन्। दध्मुरन्ये महाशङ्खानन्ये जघ्नुश्च दुन्दुभीन्॥'}

{'en': "Some sported and juinped about others laughed aloud. Many heroes repeatedly said these words to Bhimasena— 'Highly difficult and great has been the feat that you have performed to-day in batile, by having struck down thc Kuru king, himself a great warrior, with your macc! This slaughter of your enemy is considered like that of Vritra by Indra himself!", 'sn': 'चिक्रीडुश्च तथैवान्ये जहसुश्च तवाहिताः। अब्रुवंश्चासकृद् वीरा भीमसेनमिदं वचः॥ दुष्करं भवता कर्म रणेऽद्य सुमहत् कृतम्। कौरवेन्द्रं रणे हत्वा गदयाऽतिकृतश्रमम्॥ इन्द्रेणेव हि वृत्रस्य वधं परमसंयुगे। त्वया कृतममन्यन्त शत्रोर्वधमिमं जनाः॥'}

{'en': 'Who else, but you, O Vrikodara, could kill the heroic Duryodhana while moving about in various ways and performing various manoeuvres.', 'sn': 'चरन्तं विविधान् मार्गान् मण्डलानि च सर्वशः। दुर्योधनमिमं शूरं कोऽन्यो हन्याद् वृकोदरात्॥'}

{'en': 'You have brought these hostilities, to a close which none could do! This feat of yours is incapable of being done by any other warrior!', 'sn': 'वैरस्य च गतः पारं त्वमिहान्यैः सुदुर्गमम्। अशक्यमेतदन्येन सम्पादयितुमीदृशम्॥'}

{'en': 'By good luck, you have, O hero, like an infuriate elephant, crushed with your foot the head of Duryodhana on the field of battle!', 'sn': 'कुञ्जरेणेव मत्तेन वीर संग्राममूर्धनि। दुर्योधनशिरो दिष्ट्या पादेन मृदितं त्वया॥'}
{'en': 'By good luck, O sinless one, you have quaffed the blood of Dussasana on the field of battle!', 'sn': 'सिंहेन महिषस्येव कृत्वा सङ्गरमुत्तमम्। दुःशासनस्य रुधिरं दिष्ट्या पीतं त्वयानघ॥'}

{'en': 'By good luck, you have by your own energy, placed your foot on the head of all those that had injured the just king Yudhishthira!', 'sn': 'ये विप्रकुर्वन् राजान् धर्मात्मानं युधिष्ठिरम्। मूर्ध्नि तेषां कृतः पादो दिष्ट्या ते स्वेन कर्मणा॥'}

{'en': 'For your having defeated the foes and having slain Duryodhana, by good luck, O Bhima, your fame has extended over the whole world.', 'sn': 'अमित्राणामधिष्ठानाद् वधाद् दुर्योधनस्य च। भीम दिष्ट्या पृथिव्यां ते प्रथितं सुमहद् यशः॥'}

{'en': 'Bards and eulogists praised Shakra after the fall of Vritra as we are now applauding you, O Bharata, after the fall of your foes.', 'sn': 'एवं नूनं हते वृत्रे शक्रं नन्दन्ति बन्दिनः। तथा त्वां निहतामित्रं वयं नन्दाम भारत॥'}

{'en': "Know O Bharata, that the joy we felt upon the fall of Duryodhana has not yet decreased the least.' The assembled eulogists on that occasion addressed to Bhimasena these words,", 'sn': 'दुर्योधनवधे यानि रोमाणि हृषितानि नः। अद्यापि न विकृष्यन्ते तानि तद् विद्धि भारत॥ इत्यब्रुवन् भीमसेनं वातिकास्तत्र सङ्गताः।'}

{'en': 'Whilst, viz., Panchalas and the Pandavas, all filled with joy were thus expressing themselves, the slayer of Madhu addressed them, saying-Ye kings, it is not becoming to kill a slain fe with such cruel words repeatedly. This wicked man has already been slain.', 'sn': 'तान् हृष्टान् पुरुषव्याघ्रान् पञ्चालान् पाण्डवैः सह।। १७ ब्रुवतोऽसदृशं तत्र प्रोवाच मधुसूदनः। न न्याय्यं निहतं शत्रु भूयो हन्तुं नराधिपाः॥ असकृद् वाग्भिरुयाभिनिहतो होष मन्दधीः।'}

{'en': 'This sinful, shameless, and covetous wretch, surrounded by sinful counsellors and ever malignant of the advice of wise friends, encountered his death even then when he refused, though repeatedly urged to the contrary by Vidura, Drona, Kripa and Sanjaya, to give to the sons of Pandu their paternal share in the kingdom which thcy had begged of him.', 'sn': 'तदैवैष हतः पापो यदैव निरपत्रपः॥ लुब्धः पापसहायश्च सुहृदां शासनातिगः। बहुशो विदुरद्रोणकृपगाङ्गेयसंजयैः॥ पाण्डुभ्यः प्रार्थ्यमानोऽपि पित्र्यमंशं न दत्तवान्।'}

{'en': 'This wretch is not to be regarded either as a friend or an enemy! What use in using harsh words to him who has now become a piece of wood.', 'sn': 'नैष योग्योऽद्य मित्रं वा शत्रुर्वा पुरुषाधमः॥ किमनेनातिभुग्नेन वाग्भिः काष्ठसधर्मणा।'}

{'en': 'Get your cars quickly, you kings, for we should leave this place! By good luck, this sinful wretch has been killed with his counsellors and kinsmen and friends. Thus chastised by Krishna, king Duryodhana, O king, gave way to wrath and endeavoured to rise.', 'sn': 'रथेष्वारोहत क्षिप्रं गच्छामो वसुधाधिपाः॥ दिष्ट्या हतोऽयं पापात्मा सामात्यज्ञातिबान्धवः। इति श्रुत्वा त्वधिक्षेपं कृष्णाद् दुर्योधनो नृपः॥ अमर्षवशमापन्न उदतिष्ठद् विशाम्पते। स्फिग्देशेनोपविष्टः स दो• विष्टभ्य मेदिनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sitting on his haunches and supporting himself on his two arms, he contracted his eyebrows and looked angrily at Vasudeva.', 'sn': 'दृष्टिं भूसङ्कटां कृत्वा वासुदेवो न्यपातयत्। अोन्नतशरीरस्य रूपमासीनृपस्य तु॥'}

{'en': 'Duryodhana whose body was half raised, looked like a poisonous snake, O Bharata, shorn of its tail.', 'sn': 'क्रुद्धस्याशीविषस्येव च्छिन्नपुच्छस्य भारत। प्राणान्तकरिणी घोरां वेदनामप्यचिन्तयन्॥'}

{'en': "Forgetting his poignant and unbearable pains, Duryodhana began to assail Vasudeva with keen and bitter words. 'O son of Kansa's slave, it seems you have no shame, for you have forgotten that I have been struck down most unfairly, according to the rules of inacefighting? It was you who unfairly caused this act by reminding Bhima about the breaking of my thighs. Do you think I did not mark it when Arjuna (under your advice) hinted to it to Bhima?", 'sn': 'दुर्योधनो वासुदेवं वाग्भिरुग्राभिरार्दयत्। कंसदासस्य दायाद न ते लज्जाऽस्त्यनेन वै॥ अधर्मेण गदायुद्धे यदहं विनिपातितः। ऊरू भिन्धीति भीमस्य स्मृति मिथ्या प्रयच्छता॥ किं न विज्ञातमेतन्मे यदर्जुनमवोचथाः।'}

{'en': 'Having caused the destruction of thousands of kings, who always fought fairly through various kinds of unfair means, do you not feel any shame or abhorrence for those acts?', 'sn': 'घातयित्वा महीपालानृजुयुद्धान् सहस्रशः॥ जिलैरुपायैर्बहुभिर्न ते लज्जा न ते घृणा।'}

{'en': 'Having daily bought about a great carnage of heroic warriors, you at last caused the grandshire to be slain by placing Shikhandin to the front.', 'sn': 'अहन्यहनि शूराणां कुर्वाणः कदनं महत्॥ शिखण्डिनं पुरस्कृत्य घातितस्ते पितामहः।'}

{'en': 'Having again caused an elephant of the same name of Ashvatthama to be killed, O you of vicious principle, you made the preceptor lay aside his weapons. Do you think that this is not known to me?', 'sn': 'अश्वत्थाम्नः सनामानं हत्वा नागं सुदुते॥ आचार्यो न्यासितः शस्त्रं किं तन्न विदितं मया।'}

{'en': 'While again that brave hero was about to be killed by this cruel Dhristadyumna, you did not dissuade the latter!', 'sn': 'स चानेन नृशंसेन धृष्टद्युम्नेन वीर्यवान्॥ पात्यमानस्वया दृष्टो न चैनं त्वमवारयः।'}

{'en': 'The dart that had been begged (of Shakra as a boon) by Karna for the destruction of Arjuna, was baffled by you through Ghatotkacha! Who is there that is more sinful than you?', 'sn': 'वधार्थं पाण्डपुत्रस्य याचितां शक्तिमेव च॥ घटोत्कचे व्यंसयतः कस्त्वत्तः पापकृत्तमः।'}

{'en': 'Likewise powerful Bhurishravas, with one of his arms cut off and while observing the Praya vow, was caused to be slain by you through the great Satyaki.', 'sn': 'छिन्नहस्तः प्रायगतस्तथा भूरिश्रवा बली॥ त्वयाऽभिसृष्टेन हतः शैनेयेन महात्मना।'}

{'en': 'Karna had done a great feat for defeating Partha. You frustrated the object of Ashvasena, the son of that prince of snakes (viz., Takshaka).', 'sn': 'कुर्वाणश्चोत्तमं कर्म कर्णः पार्थजिगीषया॥ व्यंसनेनाश्वसेनस्य पन्नगेन्द्रस्य वै पुनः।'}

{'en': "When again the wheel of Karna's car sank in mire and Karna was assisted with calamity and almost defeated on that account, and-when, he became anxious to free his wheel—you caused that Karna to be then slain!", 'sn': 'पुनश्च पतिते चक्रे व्यसनार्तः पराजितः॥ पातितः समरे कर्णश्चक्रव्यग्रोऽग्रणीनृणाम्।'}

{'en': 'If he had fought me and Karna and Bhisma and Drona by fair means, victory then, forsooth, would never had been yours.', 'sn': 'यदि मां चापि कर्णं च भीष्मद्रोणौ च संयुतौ॥ ऋजुना प्रतियुध्येथा न ते स्याद् विजयो ध्रुवम्।'}

{'en': "By adopting the most wily and unfair means you have caused the death of many kings observant of the duties of their order and of ourselves as well.'", 'sn': 'त्वया पुनरनार्येण जिह्ममार्गेण पार्थिवाः॥ स्वधर्ममनुतिष्ठन्तो वयं चान्ये च घातिताः।'}

{'en': 'Vasudeva said You, O son of Gandhari, have been killed with your brothers, sons, kinsmen, friends, and followers, for the sinful path you followed.', 'sn': 'वासुदेव उवाच हतस्त्वमसि गान्धारे सभ्रातृसुतबान्धवः॥ सगणः ससुहचैव पापं मार्गमनुष्ठितः।'}

{'en': 'Through your deeds those two heroes, viz., Bhishma and Drona, have been killed. Karna has been slain for having followed your conduct !', 'sn': 'तवैव दुष्कृतैर्वीरौ भीष्मद्रोणौ निपातितौ॥ कर्णश्च निहतः संख्ये तव शीलानुवर्तकः।'}

{'en': 'Requested by me, O fool, you did not, from avarice, give the Pandavas their paternal share, under the advice of Shakuni.', 'sn': 'याच्यमानं मया मूढ पित्र्यमंशं न दित्ससि॥ पाण्डवेभ्यः स्वराज्यं च लोभाच्छकुनिनिश्चयात्।'}

{'en': 'You gave poison to Bhimasena! You, O wicked man, tried to burn all the Pandavas with their mother at the palace of lace!', 'sn': 'विषं ते भीमसेनाय दत्तं सर्वे च पाण्डवाः॥ प्रदीपिता जतुगृहे मात्रा सह सुदुर्मते।'}

{'en': 'While gambling, you insulted the daughter of Yajnasena, while in her season, in the midst of assembly! Shameless as you are, you should have been killed there and then!', 'sn': 'सभायां याज्ञसेनी च कृष्टा द्यूते रजस्वला॥ तदैव तावद् दुष्टात्मन् वध्यस्त्वं निरपत्रप।'}

{'en': "Through Subala's son an expert in dice, you unfairly defeated the virtuous Yudhishthira who was unskilled in gambling! For that are killed.", 'sn': 'अनक्षज्ञं च धर्मज्ञं सौबलेनाक्षवेदिना॥ निकृत्या यत् पराजैषीस्तस्मादसि हतो रणे।'}

{'en': 'Through the sinful Jayadratha again, Krishna was on another occasion insulted when the Pandavas, her lords, had gone out a thunting towards the hermitage of Trinavindu! you', 'sn': 'जयद्रथेन पापेन यत् कृष्णा केशिता वने॥ यातेषु मृगयां चैव तृणबिन्दोरथाश्रमम्।'}

{'en': 'Causing Abhimanyu, who was a child and alone, to be surrounded by many, you did kill that hero. For this sin, O sinful wretch, you are slain!', 'sn': 'अभिमन्युश्च यद् बाल एको बहुभिराहवे॥ त्वद्दोषैनिहतः पाप तस्मादसि हतो रणे।'}

{'en': 'All those sinful deeds which you attribute to us have in reality been perpetrated by you in consequence of your sinful nature!', 'sn': 'यान्यकार्याणि चास्माकं कृतानीति प्रभाषसे॥ वैगुण्येन तवात्यर्थं सर्वं हि तदनुष्ठितम्।'}

{'en': 'You had never listened to the advice of Brihaspati and Ushanas! You had never respected the old! You had never heard the beneficial words!', 'sn': 'बृहस्पतेरुशनसो नोपदेशः श्रुतस्त्वया॥ वृद्धा नोपासिताश्चैव हितं वाक्यं न ते श्रुतम्।'}

{'en': 'Possessed by ungovernable covetousness and thirst of gain, you committed many unrighteous acts. Suffer now the consequences thereof.', 'sn': 'लोभेनातिबलेन त्वं तृष्णया च वशीकृतः॥ कृतवानस्यकार्याणि विपाकस्तस्य भुज्यताम्।'}

{'en': 'Duryodhana said I have made various studies, made presents according to the ordinance, governed the wide Earth with her seas, and trumpeted over the heads of my fees. Who is there so fortunate as myself?', 'sn': 'दुर्योधन उवाच अधीतं विधिवद् दत्तं भूः प्रशास्ता ससागरा॥ मूर्ध्नि स्थितममित्राणां को नु स्वन्ततरो पया।'}

{'en': 'That end again which is sought by Kshatriya observant of the duties of their own order, viz., death in battle, I have also met with mine. Who, therefore, is so fortunate as myself?', 'sn': 'यदिष्टं क्षत्रबन्धूनां स्वधर्ममनुपश्यताम्॥ तदिदं निधनं प्राप्तं को नु स्वन्ततरो मया।'}

{'en': 'I have enjoyed pleasures, such as were worthy of the very gods and such as could with difficulty, be obtained by other kings. I have attained the highest prosperity. Who then is so fortunate as myself?', 'sn': 'देवार्हा मानुषा भोगाः प्राप्ता असुलभा नृपैः॥ ऐश्वर्यं चोत्तमं प्राप्त: को नु स्वन्ततरो मया।'}

{'en': 'With all my well-wishers, and my younger brothers, I am going to heaven! As regards yourselves, with your baffled purposes and racked with grief, live you in this unhappy world.', 'sn': 'ससुहृत् सानुगश्चैव स्वर्गं गन्ताहमच्युत॥ यूयं निहतसंकल्पाः शोचन्तो वर्तयिष्यथ॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya continued After the intelligent king of the Kurus, have said these words, a thick shower of fragrant flowers dropped from the sky. The Gandharvas beat many charming musical instruments. The Apsaras in a chorus sang the glory of king Duryodhana. The Siddhas cried-Praise to king Duryodhana! Sweet and delicious breezes mildly blew on all sides. All the quarters became clear and the firmament looked blue as the lapis lazuli.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच अस्य वाक्यस्य निधने कुरुराजस्य धीमतः॥ अपतत् सुमहद् वर्षं पुष्पाणां पुण्यगन्धिनाम्। अवादयन्त गन्धर्वा वादिनं सुमनोहरम्॥ जगुश्चाप्सरसो राज्ञो यशःसम्बद्धमेव च। सिद्धाश्च मुमुचुर्वाचः साधु साध्विति पार्थिव॥ ववौ च सुरभिर्वायुः पुण्यगन्धो मृदुः सुखः। व्यराजंश्च दिशः सर्वा नभो वैदूर्यसंनिभम्॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding these good signs, and this worship offered to Duryodhana, the Pandavas, with Vasudeva at their head, were put to shame.', 'sn': 'अयद्भुतानि ते दृष्ट्वा वासुदेवपुरोगमाः। दुर्योधनस्य पूजां तु दृष्ट्वा व्रीडामुपागमन्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing the invisible voice the Bhishma and Drona and Karna and Bhurishravas were killed unfairly, they were afflicted with remorse and wept in grief.', 'sn': 'हतांश्चाधर्मतः श्रुत्वा शोकार्ताः शुशुचुर्हि ते। भीष्मं द्रोणं तथा कर्णं भूरिश्रवसमेव च॥'}

{'en': "Seeing the Pandavas stricken with anxiety and grief. Krishna addressed them in a voice deep as that of the clouds or the drum, saying-''All of them were great car-warriors and quick hands in weapons! If you had displayed all your prowess, even then you could never have killed them in battle by a fair fight.", 'sn': 'तांस्तु चिन्तापरान् दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवान् दीनचेतसः। प्रोवाचेदं वचः कृष्णो मेघदुन्दुभिनिःस्वनः॥ नैष शक्योऽतिशीघ्रास्त्रस्ते च सर्वे महारथाः। ऋजुयुद्धेन विक्रान्ता हन्तुं युष्माभिराहवे॥'}

{'en': 'King Duryodhana also could never be killed in a fair fight! The same is the case with all those powerful car-warriors led led by Bhishma.', 'sn': 'नैष शक्यः कदाचित् तु हन्तु धर्मेण पार्थिवः। ते वा भीष्ममुखाः सर्वे महेष्वासा महारथाः॥'}

{'en': 'For doing you good, I repeatedly applied my illusory powers and caused them to be killed by various means in battle.', 'sn': 'मयानेकैरूपायैस्तु मायायोगेन चासकृत्। हतास्ते सर्व एवाजौ भवतां हितमिच्छता॥'}

{'en': 'If I had note adopted such deceitful ways in battle, you would never have been victorious, nor could have gained kingdom or wealth.', 'sn': 'यदि नैवंविधं जातु कुर्यां जिह्ममहं रणे। कुतो वो विजयो भूयः कुतो राज्यं कुतो धनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Those four were very great warriors and regarded as Atirathas in the world. The very Regents of the Earth could not kill them in fair fight.', 'sn': 'ते हि सर्वे महात्मानश्चत्वारोऽतिरथा भुवि। न शक्या धर्मतो हन्तुं लोकपालैरपि स्वयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Likewise, the son of Diritarashtra, when armed with the mace, could not be killed in fair fight by Yama himself, armed with his bludgeon.', 'sn': 'तथैवायं गदापाणिर्धार्तराष्ट्रो गतकमः। न शक्यो धर्मतो हन्तुं कालेनापीह दण्डिना॥'}

{'en': "Ye should not mind that this enemy of yours has been killed deceitfully. When the number of one's enemics becomes great, then destruction should be brought about by wily ways.", 'sn': 'न च वो हृदि कर्तव्यं यदयं घातितो रिपुः। मिथ्यावध्यास्तथोपायैर्बहवः शत्रवोऽधिकाः॥'}
{'en': 'The gods themselves, in killing the Asuras, have followed by the celestials, may be followed by all.', 'sn': 'पूर्वैरनुगतो मार्गो देवैरसुरघातिभिः। सद्धिश्चानुगतः पन्थाः स सर्वैरनुगम्यते॥'}

{'en': "We have been crowned with success. It is evening. We had better retire to our tents. Let us all, you kings, take rest, with our horses and elephants and cars!'", 'sn': 'कृतकृत्याश्च सायाह्ने निवासं रोचयामहे। साश्चनागरथाः सर्वे विश्रमामो नराधिपाः॥'}
