{'en': 'Hearing these words of Vasudeva, the Pandavas and the Panchalas filled with joy, roared like a number of lions.', 'sn': 'वासुदेववचः श्रुत्वा तदानीं पाण्डवैः सह। पञ्चाला भृशसंहृष्टा विनेदुः सिंहसंघवत्॥'}

{'en': "All of them blew their conchs and Madhava himself blew his Panchajanya, seeing Duryodhana struck down in battle.'", 'sn': 'ततः प्राध्यापयशङ्खान् पाञ्चजन्यं च माधवः। हृष्टा दुर्योधनं दृष्ट्वा निहतं पुरुषर्षभ।७१॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said After the (Kuru) army had been gathered Shalya, the king of the Mlechchhas, filled with rage, rushed against the large army of the Pandavas, riding on a gigantic clephant, with temporal juice trickling, looking like a hill, elated with pride, resembling Airavata himself and capable of crushing large numbers of foes.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच संनिवृत्ते जनौघे तु शाल्वो म्लेच्छगणाधिपः। अभ्यवर्तत संक्रुद्धः पाण्डवानां महद् बलम्॥ आस्थाय सुमहानागं प्रभिन्नं पर्वतोपमम्। दृप्तमरावतप्रख्यममित्रगणमर्दनम्॥'}

{'en': "Shalya's animal was of a good breed, was always adored by Dhritarashtra's sons and was properly equipped and properly trained for battle, O king, by persons well conversant with the science of elephant training. Riding on that elephant, that foremost of kings looked like the morning sun at the close of summer.", 'sn': 'योऽसौ महान्भद्रकुलप्रसूतः सुपूजिते धार्तराष्ट्रेण नित्यम्। सुकल्पितः शास्त्रविनिश्चयज्ञैः सदोपवाह्यः समरेषु राजन्॥'}

{'en': "Riding that best of elephants, O king, he went against the Pandavas and began to strike them on all sides with keen and dreadful arrows resembling Indra's thunder in force.", 'sn': 'तमास्थितो राजवरो बभूव यथोदयस्थः सविता क्षपान्ते। भ्युद्ययौ पाण्डुसुतान्समेतान्॥'}

{'en': 'While he discharged his arrows in that battle and killed the hostile warriors neither the Kauravas nor the Pandavas could mark any defect in him, even as the Daityas, O king, could not notice any in Vasava, the wielder of the thunder, in the days of yore while he killed them.', 'sn': 'महेन्द्रवज्रप्रतिमैः सुघोरैः। ततः शरान् वै सृजतो महारणे योधांश्च राजन् नयतो यमालयम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandavas, the Somakes and the Srinjayas, saw one elephant look like a thousand elephants moving around them as the enemies of the gods had in days of yore seen the elephant of Indra in battle.', 'sn': 'नास्यान्तरं ददृशुः स्वे परे वा यथा पुरा वज्रधरस्य दैत्याः। दैत्याः पुरा वासवस्येव राजन्॥ ते पाण्डवाः सोमकाः सृञ्जयाश्च तमेकनागं ददृशुः समन्तात्। सहस्रशो वै विचरन्तमेकं यथा महेन्द्रस्य गजं समीपे॥'}

{'en': 'The army so driven by thai elephant seemed as if trapped from all sides. It could not stay for moments in the battle-field on account of sheer fright. All soldiers started crushing in hue and cry over mutual pull and push.', 'sn': 'संद्राव्यमाणं तु बलं परेषां परीतकल्पं विबभौ समन्ततः। नैवावतस्थे समरे भृशं भयाद् विमृद्यमानं तु परस्परं तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Agitated by that animal, the hostile army looked life-less. Unable to stand in battle, they then fled away in great fear, crushing one another. Then the huge army of the Pandavas, routed by king Shalya, suddenly fled on all sides unable to stand the vigor of that elephant.', 'sn': 'ततः प्रभग्ना सहसा महाचमू: सा पाण्डवी तेन नराधिपेन। दिशश्चतस्रः सहसा विधाविता गजेन्द्रवेगं तमपारयन्ती॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing the Pandava army routed and flying away quickly all your leading warriors worshipped king Shalya and blew their moonwhite conchs.', 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वा च तां वेगवतीं प्रभग्नां सर्वे त्वदीया युधि योधमुख्याः। अपूजयस्ते तु नराधिपं तं दध्मुश्च शङ्खाशशिसंनिकाशान्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing the war-cries of the Kauravas uttered in joy and the blare of their conchs, the commander of the Pandava and the Srinjaya forces, viz., the Panchala prince Dhrishtadyumna could not, from wrath, bear it.', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा निनादं त्वथ कौरवाणां हर्षाद् विमुक्तं सह शङ्खशब्दैः। सेनापतिः पाण्डवसृञ्जयानां पाञ्चालपुत्रो ममृषे न कोपात्॥'}

{'en': 'The illustrious Dhrishtadyumna then quickly proceeded for defeating that elephant, as the Asura Jainbha had proceed against Airavata, the carrier of Indra, while he fought with Indra.', 'sn': 'ततस्तु तं वै द्विरदं महात्मा प्रत्युद्ययौ त्वरमाणो जयाय। जम्भो यथा शक्रसमागमे वै नागेन्द्रमैरावणमिन्द्रवाह्यम्॥'}

{'en': "Beholding the king of the Pandavas proceed against him, Shalya, the foremost of kings, quickly urged his elephant, O king, for the destruction of Drupada's son.", 'sn': 'तमापतन्तं सहसा तु दृष्ट्वा पाञ्चालपुत्रं युधि राजसिंहः। तं वै द्विपं प्रेषयामास तूर्णं वधाय राजन् दुपदात्मजस्य॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing the animal approaching the latter struck it with three best arrows, polished, keen, blazing, powerful and resembling fire itself in effulgence and force.', 'sn': 'मविध्यदग्निप्रतिमैः पृषत्कैः कर्मारधौतैर्निशितैर्व्वलद्भि ाराचमुख्यैस्त्रिभिरुपवेगैः॥'}

{'en': 'Then that illustrious hero struck the animal on the trunk with five other whetted and best arrows. Struck therewith, that prince of elephants, turning away from the battle, ran quickly away.', 'sn': 'ततोऽपरान् पञ्चशतान् महात्मा नाराचमुख्यान् विससर्ज कुम्भे। स तैस्तु विद्धः परमद्विपो रणे तदा परावृत्य भृशं प्रदुद्रुवे॥'}

{'en': 'Suddenly checking that foremost of elephants which had been greatly wounded and compelled to retreat Shalya, however, caused it to turn back and with hooks and keen lances urged it forward against the car of the Panchala king, pointing it out to the infuriate animal.', 'sn': 'तं नागराजं सहसा प्रणुन्नं विद्राव्यमाणं विनिवर्त्य शाल्वः। तोत्राङ्कुशैः प्रेषयामास तूर्णं पाञ्चालराजस्य रथं प्रदिश्य॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding the animal rushing forcibly at him, the heroic Dhrishtadyumna, taking up a mace, quickly leaped down on the Earth from his car, his limbs benumbed with fear.', 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वाऽऽपतन्तं सहसा तु नागं धृष्टद्युम्नः स्वरथाच्छ्रीघ्रमेव। गदां प्रगृह्योग्रजवेन वीरो भूमिं प्रपन्नो भयविह्वलाङ्गः॥'}

{'en': 'That huge elephant, meanwhile, suddenly crushing that gold-decked car with its horses and driver, raised it up in the air with his trunk and then dashed it down on the Earth.', 'sn': 'स तं रथं हेमविभूषिताङ्गं साश्वं ससूतं सहसा विमृद्या उत्क्षिप्य हस्तेन नदन् महाद्विपो विपोथयामास वसुन्धरातले॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding the driver of Panchala king thus crushed by that best of elephants. Bhima and Shikhandin and the grandson of Shini rushed with great force against that animal.', 'sn': 'पाञ्चालराजस्य सुतं च दृष्ट्वा तदार्दितं नागवरेण तेना तमभ्यधावत् सहसा जवेन भीमः शिखण्डी च शिनेश्च नप्ता॥'}

{'en': 'With their arrows they quickly restrained that animal. Thus restrained by them in battle, the elephant began to tremble.', 'sn': 'शरैश्च वेगं सहसा निगृह्य तस्याभितो व्यापततो गजस्य। स संगृहीतो रथिभिर्गजो वै चचाल तैर्वार्यमाणाश्च संख्ये॥'}

{'en': 'Meanwhile king Shalya began to discharge arrows like the Sun shedding his rays on all sides. Struck with those arrows, the (Pandava) car-warriors began to fly away.', 'sn': 'ततः पृषत्कान् प्रववर्ष राजा सूर्यो यथा रश्मिजालं समन्तात्। तैराशुगैर्वध्यमाना रथौधाः प्रदुद्रुवुः सहितास्तत्र तत्र॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding that feat of Shalya, the Panchalas, the Srinjayas and the Matsyas. O king, bewailed aloud in that battle. All those foremost of men however, surrounded the animal entirely.', 'sn': 'तत् कर्म शाल्वस्य समीक्ष्य सर्वे पाञ्चालपुत्रा नृप सृञ्जयाश्च। हाहाकारैर्नादयन्ति स्म युद्धे द्विपं समन्ताद् रुरुधुनराग्र्याः॥'}

{'en': 'Then, taking up his mace resembling the crest of a mountain, the brave Panchalas appeared there. Fearlessly, O king, that hero, that striker of foes, rushed quickly against the clephant.', 'sn': 'पाञ्चालपुत्रस्त्वरितस्तु शूरो गदां प्रगृह्याचलशृङ्गकल्पाम्। ससम्भ्रमं भारत शत्रुघाती जवेन वीरोऽनुससार नागम्॥'}

{'en': 'The active prince of the Panchala, approaching, began to strike with his mace that animal which was huge as a hill and which shed temporal juice like a mass of pouring clouds.', 'sn': 'ततस्तु नागं धरणीधराभं मदं स्रवन्तं जलदप्रकाशम्। गदां समाविद्ध्य भृशं जघान पाञ्चालराजस्य सुतस्तरस्वी॥ तु तदा गजेन्द्रे'}

{'en': 'Its trunk cut open, the animal cried aloud; and vomiting enough blood, the animal, huge as a hill, suddenly dropped down as a mountain falling down during an earthquake.', 'sn': 'स भिन्नकुम्भः सहसा विनद्य मुखात् प्रभूतं क्षतजं विमुञ्चन्। पपात नागो धरणीधराभः क्षितिप्रकम्पाञ्चलितो यथाऽद्भिः॥'}

{'en': "While that best of elephants was falling down and while your son's ariny were bewailing at the spectacle, that best of warriors among the Shinis cut off the head of king Shalya with a sharp and broad-headed arrow.", 'sn': 'निपात्यमाने हाहाकृते तव पुत्रस्य सैन्ये। स शाल्वराजस्य शिनिप्रवीरो जहार भल्लेन शिरः शितेन॥'}

{'en': 'His head having been sundered by the Satwata hero, Shalya dropped down on the Earth along with his best of elephants, like a mountain summit suddenly clapped by the thunder-bolt discharged by the best of the celestials.', 'sn': 'हृतोत्तमाङ्गो युधि सात्वतेन पपात भूमौ सह नागराज्ञा। यथाद्रिशृङ्गं सुमहत् प्रणुन्नं वज्रेण देवाधिपचोदितेन॥'}

{'en': 'Utanka said Do you, O Keshava, tell ine that faultless spiritual science. Having heard your discourse I shall ordain what is for your good or imprecate a curse to you O Janardana!', 'sn': 'उत्तङ्क उवाच ब्रूहि केशव तत्वेन त्वमध्यात्ममनिन्दितम्। श्रुत्वा श्रेयोऽभिधास्यामि शापं वा ते जनार्दन॥'}

{'en': 'Vasudeva said Know that the three qualities of Ignorance, Darkness and Goodness exist, depending on me as their refuge. So also, O twice-born one, know that the Rudras and the Vasus have originated from me.', 'sn': 'वासुदेव उवाच तमो रजश्च सत्वं च विद्धि भावान् मदाश्रयान्। तथा रुदान् वसून् वापि विद्धि मत्प्रभवान् द्विज॥'}

{'en': 'In me are all creatures, and in all creatures do I exist know this. Let no doubt arise in your mind about this.', 'sn': 'मयि सर्वाणि भूतानि सर्वभूतेषु चाप्यहम्। स्थित इत्यभिजानीहि मा तेऽभूदत्र संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'So also, O twice-born one, know that all the tribes of the Daityas, all the Yakshas, Gandharvas, Rakshasas, Nagas, Apsaras, have originated from me.', 'sn': 'तथा दैत्यगणान् सर्वान् यक्षगन्धर्वराक्षसान्। नागानप्सरसश्चैव विद्धि मत्प्रभवान् द्विज॥'}

{'en': 'Whatever has been called existent and nonexistent, whatever is manifest, and notmanifest, whatever is destructible and indestructible, all have me for their soul.', 'sn': 'सदसच्चैव यत् प्राहुरव्यक्तं व्यक्तमेव च। अक्षरं च क्षरं चैव सर्वमेतन्मदात्मकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Those fourfold courses of duty which, O ascetic, are known to attach to the (four) modes of life, and all the Vedic duties, have me for their soul.', 'sn': 'ये चाश्रमेषु वै धर्माश्चतुर्धा विदिता मुने। वैदिकानि च सर्वाणि विद्धि सर्वं मदात्मकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Whatever is non-existent, whatever is existent and non-existent, and whatever is above that which is existent and not existent, all these which form the universe-are from me. There is nothing higher (or beyond) me who am the eternal god of gods.', 'sn': 'असच्च सदसच्चैव यद् विश्वं सदसत् परम्। मत्तः परतरं नास्ति देवदेवात् सनातनात्॥'}

{'en': "O perpetuator of Bhrigu's race, know that all the Veda beginning with the original syllable) One are at one with me. Know, O son of Bhrigu's race, that I am the sacrificial stake; I am the Soma (drunk in sacrifices); I am the Charu (cooked in sacrifices for being offered to the deities); I am the Homa (that is performed); I am those deeds which sacrificers perform for pleasing the celestials; I am even the pourer of the sacrificial libation; and I am the Havi or libation that is poured. I am the Adhvaryu. I am the Kalpaka; and I am the highly sanctified sacrificial Havi. It is me whom the Udgatri, in the great sacrifice, hymns by the sound of his songs. In all rites of expiation, O Brahmana, the utters of auspicious Mantras and bencdictions fraught with peace sing my praises who am the artificer, o foremost of twice-born ones, of the universe.", 'sn': 'ओङ्कारप्रमुखान् वेदान् विद्धि मां त्वं भृगूद्वह। यूपं सोमं चरुं होमं त्रिदशाप्यायनं मखे॥ होतारमपि हव्यं च विद्धि मां भृगुनन्दन। अध्वर्युः कल्पकश्चापि हविः परमसंस्कृतम्॥ उद्गाता चापि मां स्तौति गीतघोषैर्महाध्वरे। प्रायश्चित्तेषु मां ब्रह्मशान्तिमङ्गलवाचकाः॥ स्तुवन्ति विश्वकर्माणं सततं द्विजसत्तम।'}

{'en': 'Know, O best of twice-born persons, that Dharma is my eldest-born offspring, originated from my mind, O learned Brahmana, whose essence is for all creatures.', 'sn': 'मम विद्धि सुतं धर्ममग्रजं द्विजसत्तम॥ मानसं दयितं विप्र सर्वभूतदयात्मकम्।'}

{'en': 'Constantly changing myself, I take birth in various wombs. O best of men, for upholding that son of mine, with the help of men now existing in or departed from the world. Indeed, I do this for protecting Virtue and for establishing it.', 'sn': 'तत्राहं वर्तमानैश्च निवृत्तैश्चैव मानवैः॥ बह्वीः संसरमाणो वै योनीर्वामि सत्तम। धर्मसंरक्षणार्थाय धर्मसंस्थापनाय च॥'}

{'en': "In those forms that I assume for the purpose, I am known, O son of Bhrigu's race, in the three worlds as Vishnu and Brahman and Shakra. I am the origin and I am the destruction of all things.", 'sn': 'तैस्तैर्वेषैश्च रूपैश्च त्रिषु लोकेषु भार्गव। अहं विष्णुरहं ब्रह्मा शक्रोऽथ प्रभवाप्ययः॥'}

{'en': 'I am the creator of al existent objects and I am their destroyer. Knowing no change myself, I am the destroyer of all those creatures that live in sinfulness.', 'sn': 'भूतग्रामस्य सर्वस्य स्रष्टा संहार एव च। अधर्मे वर्तमानानां सर्वेषामहमच्युतः॥'}

{'en': 'In every cycle I have to repair the causeway of Virtue, entering into various kinds of wombs from desire of doing good to my creatures.', 'sn': 'धर्मस्य सेतुं बनामि चलिते चलिते युगे। तास्ता योनीः प्रविश्याहं प्रजानां हितकाम्यया।॥'}

{'en': "When, O son of Bhrigu's race, I live in the order of the celestials, I then indeed, act in i every respect as a celestial.", 'sn': 'यदा त्वहं देवयोनौ वर्तामि भृगुनन्दना तदाहं देववत् सर्वमाचरामि न संशयः॥'}

{'en': "When I live in the order of the Gandharvas, I then, O son of Bhrigu's race, act in every . respect as a Gandharva.", 'sn': 'यदा गन्धर्वयोनौ वा वर्तामि भृगुनन्दना तदा गन्धर्ववत् सर्वमाचरामि न संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'When I live in the order of the Nagas I then act as a Naga, and when I live in the order of Yakshas or that of Rakshasas, I act after the manner of that order.', 'sn': 'नागयोनौ यदा चैव तथा वर्तामि नागवत्। यक्षराक्षसयोन्योस्तु यथावद् विचराम्यहम्॥ ।'}

{'en': 'Born now in the order of men I must act a human being. I appealed to them (the Kauravas) most piteously. But stupefied as they were and deprived of their senses, they refused to take my words.', 'sn': 'मानुष्ये वर्तमाने तु कृपणं याचिता मया। न च ते जानसम्मोहा वचोऽगृहन्त मे हितम्॥'}

{'en': 'I frightened them, filled with anger referring to some great fear. But once more I showed themselves my usual human forin.', 'sn': 'भयं च महदुद्दिश्य त्रासिताः कुरवो मया। क्रुद्धेन भूत्वा तु पुनर्यथावदनुदर्शिताः॥'}

{'en': 'Possessed as they were of unrighteousness, and assailed by the virtue of liine, all of them have been righteously killed in battle, and have, forsooth, gone to the celestial region.', 'sn': 'तेऽधर्मेणेहं संयुक्ताः परीताः कालधर्मणा। धर्मेण निहता युद्धे गताः स्वर्गं न संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandavas also, O best of Brahmanas have acquired great fame. I have these told you all that you had asked me.', 'sn': 'लोकेषु पाण्डवाश्चैव गताः ख्याति द्विजोत्तम। एतत् ते सर्वमाख्यातं यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Thus addressed by the famous son of Gotama, the king Duryodhana, breathing hard, remained silent, O king.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच एवमुक्तस्ततो राजा गौतमेन तपस्विना। निःश्वस्य दीर्घमुष्णं च तूष्णीमासीद् विशाम्पते॥'}

{'en': "Having thought for a little while, the great son of Dhritarashtra, that scorcher of foes, then said these words to Sharadvat's son Kripa-", 'sn': 'ततो मुहूर्तं स ध्यात्वा धार्तराष्ट्रो महामनाः। कृपं शारद्वतं वाक्यमित्युवाच परंतपः॥'}

{'en': '"You have said to me whatever a friend should say. You have also, whilst fighting, done everything for ine, without caring for your very life.', 'sn': 'यत् किञ्चित् सुहृदा वाच्यं तत् सर्वं श्रावितो ह्यहम्। कृतं च भवता सर्वं प्राणान् संत्यज्य युध्यता॥'}

{'en': 'People have seen you enter into the midst of the Pandavas army and fight with the mighty and energetic car-warriors of the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'गाहमानमनीकानि युध्यमानं महारथैः। पाण्डवैरतितेजोभिर्लोकस्त्वामनुदृष्टवान्॥'}

{'en': 'What a friend should say has been said by you. Your words, however, do not please me like medicine that pleases not the person who is no the verge of death.', 'sn': 'सुहृदां यदिदं वाक्यं भवता श्रावितो ह्यहम्। न मां प्रीणाति तत्सर्वं मुमूर्षोरिव भेषजम्॥'}

{'en': 'These beneficial and excellent words, pregnant with reason, which you, O mightyarmed one, have said, do not scem acceptable to me, O foremost of Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'हेतुकारणसंयुक्तं हितं वचनमुत्तमम्। उच्यमानं महाबाहो न मे विप्राय रोचते॥'}

{'en': 'Deprived by us of his kingdom on a former occasion, why will the son of Pandu trust us? That great king was once defeated by us at dice. Why will we again believe my words?', 'sn': 'राज्याद् विनिकृतोऽस्माभिः कथं सोऽस्मासु विश्वसेत्। अक्षयूते च नृपतिर्जितोऽस्माभिर्महाधनः॥'}

{'en': 'So also, Krishna, ever engaged in the good of the Parthas, when he came to us as an emissary, was cheated by us. Our act was exceedingly unfair. Why then, will Hrishikesha trust my words?', 'sn': 'स कथं मम वाक्यानि श्रद्दध्याद् भूय एव तु। तथा दौत्येन सम्प्राप्तः कृष्णः पार्थहिते रतः॥'}

{'en': 'The princess Krishna, while standing in the midst of the assembly, wept piteously. Krishna will never forget that act of ours, nor, the deprivation of Yudhishthira by us of his kingdom.', 'sn': 'प्रलब्धश्च हृषीकेशस्तच कर्माविचारितम्। स च मे वचनं ब्रह्मन् कथमेवाभिमन्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Formerly it was heard by us that the two Krishnas are of the same mind and are firmly attached to each other. Today, O lord, we have seen it with our eyes.', 'sn': 'विललाप च यत् कृष्ण सभामध्ये समेयुषी। न तन्मर्षयते कृष्णो न राज्यहरणं तथा॥'}

{'en': "Having heard of the death of his sister's son, Keshava passes his nights in sorrow. We have offended him highly. Why will he forgive us then?", 'sn': 'एकप्राणावुभौ कृष्णावन्योन्यमभिसंश्रितौ। पुरा यच्छ्रुतमेवासीदद्य पश्यामि तत् प्रभो॥ स्वस्रीयं निहतं श्रुत्वा दुःखं स्वपिति केशवः। कृतागसो वयं तस्य स मदर्थं कथं क्षमेत्॥'}

{'en': "Arjuna also, in consequence of Abhimanyu's death, has become very miserable. Even if requested, why will he try for iny good?", 'sn': 'आभिमन्योर्विनाशेन न शर्म लभतेऽर्जुनः। स कथं मद्धिते यत्नं प्रकरिष्यति याचितः॥'}

{'en': 'The second son of Pandu, Bhimascna, is highly powerful. He has taken a terrible vow. He will break but not bend.', 'sn': 'मध्यमः पाण्डवस्तीक्ष्णो भीमसेनो महाबलः। प्रतिज्ञातं च तेनोग्रं भज्येतापि न संनमेत्॥'}

{'en': 'The heroic twins, cherishing hostility against us, when clad in mail and armed with their swords, resemble a pair of Yamas.', 'sn': 'उभौ तौ बद्धनिस्त्रिंशावुभौ चाबद्धकङ्कटौ। कृतवैराबुभौ वीरौ यमावपि यमोपमौ॥'}

{'en': 'Dhrishtadyumna and Shikhandin have taken up their swords against me. Why will those two, O best of Brahmanas, try for my good?', 'sn': 'धृष्टद्युम्न: शिखण्डी च कृतवैरौ मया सहा तौ कथं मद्धिते यत्नं कुर्यातां द्विजसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Clad in onc piece of cloth and in her scason, the princess Krishna was treated cruelly by Dushasana in the midst of the assembly and before all.', 'sn': 'दुःशासनेन यत् कृष्ण एकवस्त्रा रजस्वलाः। परिक्लिष्टा सभामध्ये सर्वलोकस्य पश्यतः॥'}

{'en': 'Those scorchers of focs, the Pandavas, who still remember the naked Draupadi greatly distressed, can never be dissuaded from batile.', 'sn': 'तथा विवसनां दीनां स्मरत्वद्यापि पाण्डवाः। न निवारयितुं शक्याः संग्रामात्ते परंतपाः॥'}

{'en': 'Then again, Krishna, the daughter of Drupada, is, with great difficulty, practising the austerest of penances for my destruction and the success of her husbands and sleeps every day on the bare ground, intending to do so till the end of the hostilities is got at.', 'sn': 'यदा च द्रौपदी क्लिष्टा मद्विनाशाय दुःखिता। स्थण्डिले नित्यदा शेते यावद् वैरस्य यातनम्।॥ उग्रं तेपे तपः कृष्णा भर्तृणामर्थसिद्धये।'}

{'en': 'Casting off honour and pride, the sister of Vasudeva, Subhadra, is always serving Draupadi like a waiting woman.', 'sn': 'निक्षिप्य मानं दर्प च वासुदेवसहोदरा॥ कृष्णायाः प्रेष्यवद् भूत्वा शुश्रूषां कुरुते सदा।'}

{'en': 'Everything, therefore, is on fire. That fire can never be extinguished. Peace with them is impossible on account of the death of Abhimanyu.', 'sn': 'इति सर्वं समुन्नद्धं न निर्वाति कथञ्चन॥ अभिमन्योर्विनाशेन स संधेयः कथं मया।'}

{'en': 'Having reigned as the sovereign of this Earth bounded by the ocean, how shall I be able to enjoy, by the favor of the Pandavas, a kingdom in peace?', 'sn': 'कथं च राजा भुक्त्वेमां पृथिवीं सागराम्बराम्॥ पाण्डवानां प्रसादेन भोक्ष्ये राज्यमहं कथम्।'}

{'en': 'Having spread rays like the sun upon the heads of all the kings, how shall I walk behind Yudhishthira as slave?', 'sn': 'उपर्युपरि राज्ञां वै ज्वलित्वा भास्करो यथा॥ युधिष्ठिरं कथं पश्यादनुयास्यामि दासवत्।'}

{'en': 'Having enjoyed all luxuries and shown cat mercy, how shall I lead a miserable life now with wretched men as my companions?', 'sn': 'कथं भुक्त्वा स्वयं भोगान् दत्त्वा दायांश्च युप्कलान्॥ कृपणं वर्तयिष्यामि कृपणैः सह जीविकाम्।'}

{'en': 'I do not disapprove those mild and wholesome words you have spoken. I, however do not think that this is the time for peace.', 'sn': 'नाभ्यसूयामि ते वाक्यमुक्तं स्निग्धं हितं त्वया॥ न तु सन्धिमहं मन्ये प्राप्तकालं कथञ्चन।'}

{'en': 'A righteous fight is, O scorcher of foes, is regarded by me to be a good policy. This is not the time for acting like a eunuch. On the other hand, this is the time for fighting.', 'sn': 'सुनीतमनुपश्यामि सुयुद्धेन परंतप॥ नायं कीबयितुं कालः संयोद्धं काल एव नः।'}

{'en': 'I have celebrated many sacrifices. I have given away presents to Brahmanas. I have achieved all my wishes. I have listened to the recitation of the Vedas. I have saved the heads of my foes.', 'sn': 'इष्टं मे बुहभिर्यज्ञैर्दत्ता विप्रेषु दक्षिणाः॥ प्राप्ता: कामाः श्रुता वेदाः शत्रूणां मूर्ध्नि च स्थितम्।'}

{'en': 'My servants have all been well cared for by me. I have relieved people in distress. I dare not, O foremost of men, speak such humble words to the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'भृत्या मे सुभृतास्तात दीनश्चाभ्युद्धतो जनः॥ नोत्सहेऽद्य द्विजश्रेष्ठ पाण्डवान् वक्तुमीदृशम्।'}

{'en': 'I have conquered foreign kingdoms. I have properly guverned by own kingdom. I have enjoyed various luxuries. I have pursued religion, profit and desire. I have paid off my debt to the departed manes and to Kshatriya duty.', 'sn': 'जितानि परराष्ट्रानि स्वराष्ट्रमनुपालितम्॥ भुक्ताश्च विविधा भोगास्त्रिवर्ग: सेवितो मया। पितॄणां गतमानृण्यं क्षत्रधर्मस्य चोभयोः॥'}

{'en': 'Indeed, there is no happiness on this earth. What becomes of kingdom and what of good name? Fame is all that one should acquire here. That fame can be acquired by battle and by no other means.', 'sn': 'न ध्रुवं सुखमस्तीति कुतो राष्ट्रं कुतो यशः। इह कीर्तिर्विधातव्या सा च युद्धेन नान्यथा॥'}
{'en': "The death a Kshatriya meets with at home is blamcable. Death on one's bed at home is highly sinful.", 'sn': 'गृहे यत् क्षत्रियस्यापि निधनं तद् विगर्हितम्। अधर्मः सुमहानेष यच्छय्यामरणं गृहे॥'}

{'en': 'The man, who casts off his body in the forest or in battle after having performed sacrifices, attains great glory.', 'sn': 'अरण्ये यो विमुच्येत संग्रामे वा तनुं नरः। ऋतूनादृत्य महतो महिमानं स गच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'He is no man who dies miserably crying in agony, afflicted by disease and decay in the midst of crying kinsmen.', 'sn': 'कृपणं विलपन्ना” जरयाभिपरिप्लुतः। म्रियते रुद्रतां मध्ये ज्ञातीनां न स पूरुषः॥'}

{'en': 'Abandoning various objects of enjoyment, I shall now, by a righteous battle, repair to the regions of Shakra, obtaining the companionship of those that have attained to the highest end. Forsooth, that is the habitation of pious heroes, who never retreat from battle, who are intelligence and devoted to truth and who celebrate sacrifices, who took bath in the current of weapons, they always reside in the heaven The various divisions of Apsaras, forsooth, look with joy at such heroes when engaged in battle. Forsooth, the Pitris behold them adored in the assembly of the gods and rejoicing in heaven, in the company of Apsaras.', 'sn': 'त्यक्त्वा तु विविधान् भोगान् प्राप्तानां परमां गतिम्। अपीदानीं सुयुद्धेन गच्छेयं यत्सलोकताम्॥ शूराणामार्यवृत्तानां संग्रामेष्वनिवर्तिनाम्। धीमतां सत्यसंघानां सर्वेषां ऋतुयाजिनाम्॥ शस्त्रावभृथपूतानां ध्रुवं वासस्त्रिविष्टपे। मुदा नूनं प्रपश्यन्ति युद्धे ह्यप्सरसां गणाः॥ पश्यन्ति नूनं पितरः पूजितान् सुरसंसदि। अप्सरोभिः परिवृतान् मोदमानांस्त्रिविष्टपे॥'}

{'en': 'We will now ascend the path that is trod by the celestials and by heroes who never retreat from battle, the path followed by our venerable grandfather, by the highly intelligent preceptor, by Jayadratha, by Karna and by Dushasana.', 'sn': 'पन्थानममरैर्यान्तं शूरैश्चैवानिवर्तिभिः। अपि तत्संगतं मार्ग वयमध्यारुहेमहि॥ पितामहेन वृद्धेन तथाऽऽचार्येण धीमता। जयद्रथेन कर्णेन तथा दुःशासनेन च॥'}

{'en': 'Many brave kings, who tried their best for me in this battle, have been killed. Wounded with shafts and their limbs bathed in blood, they lie now on the nacked Earth.', 'sn': 'घटमाना मदर्थेऽस्मिन् हताः शूरा जनाधिपाः। शेरते लोहिताक्ताङ्गा संग्रामे शरविक्षतः॥'}

{'en': "Courageous and masters of weapons, those kings, who had performed sacrifices according to the scriptures, having given their lives in the discharge of their duties, have now become the inhabitants of Indra's region.", 'sn': 'उत्तमास्त्रविदः शूरा यथोक्तक्रतुयाजिनः। त्यक्त्वा प्राणान् यथान्यायमिन्द्रसास्वधिष्ठिताः॥'}

{'en': 'They have gone there. The road will once more become difficult on account of a number of heroes that will hurry along it for reaching that happy region.', 'sn': 'तैः स्वयं रचितो मार्गो दुर्गमो हि पुनर्भवेत्। सम्पतद्भिर्महावेगैर्यास्यद्भिरिह सद्गतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'Recollect with gratitude the deeds of those heroes that have died for me. I desire to satisfy my debt, instead of thinking of the kingdom.', 'sn': 'ये मदर्थे हता शूरास्तेषां कृतमनुस्मरन्। ऋणं तत् प्रतियुञ्जानो न राज्ये मन आदधे॥'}

{'en': 'If, having caused my friends and brothers and grandsires to be killed, I save my own life, people will undoubtedly blame me.', 'sn': 'घातयित्वा वयस्यांश्च भ्रातृनथ पितामहान्। जीवितं यदि रक्षेयं लोको मां गर्हयेद् ध्रुवम्॥'}

{'en': 'It will be useless for me to enjoy the kingdom, destitute of kinsmen and friends and well-wishers and submitting to the son of Pandu.', 'sn': 'कीदृशं च भवेद् राज्यं मम हीनस्य बन्धुभिः। सखिभिश्च विशेषेण प्रणिपत्य च पाण्डवम्॥'}

{'en': 'I, who was the master of the universe, will now acquire heaven by fair fight. It will not be otherwise.', 'sn': 'सोऽहमेतादृशं कृत्वा जगतोऽस्य पराभवम्। सुयुद्धेन ततः स्वर्गं प्राप्स्यामि न तदन्यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed by Duryodhana, all the Kshatriyas praised that speech and cheered the king, saying-Well, Well!', 'sn': 'एवं दुर्योधनेनोक्तं सर्वे सम्पूज्य तद्वचः। साधु साध्विति राजानं क्षत्रियाः सम्बभाषिरे॥'}

{'en': 'Without at all grieving for their defeat and firmly bent upon displaying their prowess, all of them, prepared for fight, became enthusiastic.', 'sn': 'पराजयमशोचन्तः कृतचित्ताश्च विक्रमे। सर्वे सुनिश्चिता योद्धमुदग्रमनसोऽभवन्॥'}

{'en': 'Having given their horses to the syces, the Kauravas, delighting at the prospect of battle, lived (for the night) at a spot little less than two Yojanas in distance from the field.', 'sn': 'ततो वाहान् समाश्वस्य सर्वे युद्धाभिनन्दिनः। ऊने द्वियोजने गत्वा प्रत्यतिष्ठन्त कौरवाः॥'}

{'en': 'Having reached the Sarasvati of red waters on the sacred and beautiful table-land at the foot of the Himalaya, they bathed in that water and satisfied their thirst with it. Excited by your son, they halted there.', 'sn': 'आकाशे विद्रुमे पुण्ये प्रस्थे हिमवतः शुभे। अरुणां सरस्वतीं प्राप्य पपुः सस्नुश्च ते जलम्॥ तव पुत्रकृतोत्साहाः पर्यवर्तन्त ते ततः।'}
{'en': 'Once more rallying themselves, all the Kshatriyas, O king, urged by destiny waited there.', 'sn': 'पर्यवस्थाप्य चात्मानमन्योन्येन पुनस्तदा। सर्वे राजन् न्यवर्तन्त क्षत्रियाः कालचोदिताः॥'}

{'en': 'Karna said: O Duryodhana, in my opinion your reasoning are not well-founded. O perpetuator of the Kuru race, no machinations will succeed against the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'कर्ण उवाच दुर्योधन तव प्रज्ञा न सम्यगिति मे मतिः। न ह्युपायेन ते शक्याः पाण्डवाः कुरुवर्धन॥'}

{'en': 'O hero, you have formerly tried to accomplish your wishes by various subtlc means, but you have not been successful in killing them.', 'sn': 'पूर्वमेव हि ते सूक्ष्मैरुपायैर्यतितास्त्वया। निग्रहीतुं तदा वीर न चैव शकितास्त्वया।॥'}

{'en': 'O. king, they were then living near you, they were then mere children, they were then without allies and friends, still you could nor injure them.', 'sn': 'इहैव वर्तमानास्ते समीपे तव पार्थिव। अजातपक्षाः शिशवः शकिता नैव बाधितुम्॥'}

{'en': 'They are now living at a distance, they are now grown up and they are now stronger by securing allies. It is my firm belief that you will not be able to injure them now with any subtle machinations.', 'sn': 'जातपक्षा विदेशस्था विवृद्धाः सर्वशोऽद्य ते। नोपायसाध्याः कौन्तेया ममैषा मतिरच्युत॥'}

{'en': 'They are aided by Fate. When they are desirous of regaining the place of their fathers and grandfathers, we can never succeed to injure them by any means of ours.', 'sn': 'न च ते व्यसनैर्योक्तुं शक्या दिष्टकृतेन च। शकिताश्चेप्सवश्चैव पितृपैतामहं पदम्॥'}

{'en': 'It is impossible to create disunion amongst them. They can never be disunited who have taken a common wife.', 'sn': 'परस्परेण भेदश्च नाधातुं तेषु शक्यते। एकस्यां ये रताः पन्यां न भिद्यन्ते परस्परम्॥'}

{'en': 'We can never succeed in estranging Krishna (Draupadi) from them by any spies. she choose them as her husband when they were in adversity, they are now in prosperity.', 'sn': 'न चापि कृष्णा शक्येत तेभ्यो भेदयितुं परैः। परियूनान् वृतवती किमुताद्य मृजावतः॥'}

{'en': 'Women generally desire to have many husbands, Krishna has got it; she can never be estranged from them.', 'sn': 'ईप्सितश्च गुणः स्त्रीणामेकस्या बहुभर्तृता। तं च प्राप्तवती कृष्णा न सा भेदयितुं क्षमा॥'}

{'en': 'The Panchala king is honest and virtuous, he is not covetous for wealth. Even if we offer him our whole kingdom, he will certainly not abandon the sons of Kunti.', 'sn': 'आर्यव्रतश्च पाञ्चाल्यो न स राजा धनप्रियः। न संत्यक्ष्यति कौन्तेयान् राज्यदानैरपि ध्रुवम्॥'}

{'en': 'His son is also well-accomplished and has become attached to the Pandavas; therefore, I think by no subtle machinations that are in your power, you will be able to injure them.', 'sn': 'यथास्य पुत्रो गुणवाननुरक्तश्च पाण्डवान्। तस्मान्नो पायसाध्यांस्तानहं मन्ये कथंचन॥'}

{'en': 'O best of men, this is what is good and advisable for us to-day, namely, O king, to attack and smite them till the Pandavas are exterminated. O sire, consent to this. As long as our party is strong and that of the Panchalas weak, so long let us strike them without scruple.', 'sn': 'इदं त्वद्य क्षमं कर्तुमस्माकं पुरुषर्षभ। यावन्न कृतमूलास्ते पाण्डवेया विशाम्पते॥ तावत् प्रहरणीयास्ते तत् तुभ्यं तात रोचताम्। अस्मत्पक्षो महान् यावद् यावत् पाञ्चालको लघुः। तावत् प्रहरणं तेषां क्रियतां मा विचारय॥'}

{'en': 'O son of Gandhari, O king, as long as their innumerable conveyances, their friends and relatives, do not gather together, so long continue to display your prowess.', 'sn': 'वाहनानि प्रभूतानि मित्राणि च कुलानि च। यावन्न तेषां गान्धारे तावद् विक्रम पार्थिव॥'}

{'en': 'O king, as long as the Panchala king with his greatly powerful son does not resolve to fight with us, so long display your prowess.', 'sn': 'यावच्च राजा पाञ्चाल्यो नोद्यमे कुरुते मनः। सह पुत्रैर्महावीर्य स्तावद् विक्रम पार्थिव॥'}

{'en': 'As long as Vasudeva, Krishna, does not march with the Yadava hosts into the city of the Panchala king in order to restore the Pandavas to their kingdom, so long display your prowess.', 'sn': 'यावन्नायाति वार्ष्णेयः कर्षन् यादववाहिनीम्। राज्यार्थे पाण्डवेयानां पाञ्चाल्यसदनं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'Wealth, articles of enjoyments, kingdom, nay their is nothing which Krishna may not sacrifice for the Pandavas,', 'sn': 'वसूनि विविधान् भोगान् राज्यमेव च केवलम्। नात्याज्यमस्ति कृष्णस्य पाण्डवार्थं कथंचन॥'}

{'en': 'The whole earth was acquired by the illustrious Bharata by his prowess. Indra has obtained the sovereignty of three worlds by prowess alone.', 'sn': 'विक्रमेण मही प्राप्ता भरतेन महात्मना। विक्रमेण च लोकांस्त्रीञ्जितवान् पाकशासनः॥'}

{'en': 'O king, prowess is always admired in a Kshatriya. O best of kings, prowess is the cardinal virtue of the heroes.', 'sn': 'विक्रमं च प्रशंसन्ति क्षत्रियस्य विशाम्पते। स्वको हि धर्मः शूराणां विक्रमः पार्थिवर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'O king, therefore, without any further delay let us with our large army of four kinds of troops vanquish Drupada and bring here the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'ते बलेन वयं राजन् महता चतुरङ्गिणा। प्रमथ्य दुपदं शीघ्रमानयामेह पाण्डवान्॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandavas cannot be defeated by any policy of conciliation, of gift, of wealth, of bribery or of disunion. Therefore, vanquish them by your prowess.', 'sn': 'न हि साम्ना न दानेन न भेदेन च पाण्डवाः। शक्याः साधयितुं तस्माद् विक्रमेणैव ताञ्जहि॥'}

{'en': 'O king, after defeating them by your prowess, rule over the wide world. I do not see any other means of becoming successful in our object.', 'sn': 'तान् विक्रमेण जित्वेमामखिलां भुक्ष्व मेदिनीम्। अतो नान्यं प्रपश्यामि कार्योपायं जनाधिप॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Hearing what the son of Radha (Karna) said, the powerful Dhritarashtra gave him high praise and he then spoke to him thus-', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच श्रुत्वा तु राधेयवचो धृतराष्ट्रः प्रतापवान्। अभिपूज्य ततः पश्चादिदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': '"O son of Suta, you are gifted with great wisdom and you are highly accomplished in arms. Such words breathing the spirit of heroism are surely worthy of you.', 'sn': 'उपपन्नं महाप्राज्ञे कृतास्त्रे सूतनन्दने। त्वयि विक्रमसम्पन्नमिदं वचनमीदृशम्॥'}

{'en': 'But let Bhishma, Drona and Vidura and also you two, consult together and then adopt that means which may lead to our good."', 'sn': 'भूय एव तु भीष्मश्च द्रोणो विदुरएव च। युवां च कुरुतं बुद्धिं भवेद् या नः सुखोदया॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, the greatly illustrious king Dhritarashtra summoned to him all those councillors and consulted with them.', 'sn': 'तत आनाय्य तान् सर्वान् मन्त्रिणः सुमहायशाः। धृतराष्ट्रो महाराज मन्त्रयामास वै तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Seeing his five handsome sons before him in the great forest on the charming mountain slope, Pandu left that the old strength of his arms had come back.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच दर्शनीयांस्ततः पुत्रान् पाण्डुः पञ्च महावने। तान् पश्यन् पर्वते रम्ये स्वबाहुबलमाश्रितः॥'}

{'en': 'One day in the season of spring which maddens all creatures, the king (Pandu) with his wife (Madri) roamed in the woods where every tree was blossomed.', 'sn': 'सुपुष्पितवने काले कदाचिन्मधुमाधवे। भूतसम्मोहने राजा सभार्यो व्यचरद् वनम्॥'}

{'en': 'He saw Palashas, Tilakas, Mangoes, Champakas, Paribhadrakas and Karnikaras Kesharas, Atimuktas. There were also many other trees bent down with the weight of their flowers and fruits. There were many lakes overgrown with lotuses. Seeing all this, Pandu felt the influence of (the god of) love in his mind.', 'sn': 'पलाशैस्तिलकैश्चतैश्चम्पकैः पारिभद्रकैः। अन्यैश्च बहुभिवृक्षैः फलपुष्पसमृद्धिभिः॥ जलस्थानैश्च विविधैः पद्मिनीभिश्च शोभितम्। पाण्डोर्वनं तत् सम्प्रेक्ष्य प्रजज्ञे हृदि मन्मथः॥'}

{'en': 'In a delightful heart he roamed there like a celestial, followed by (his wife) Madri, who was robed in a semi-transparent cloth.', 'sn': 'प्रहृष्टमनसं तत्र विचरन्तं यथामरम्। तं मात्यनुजगामैका वसनं बिभ्रती शुभम्॥ समीक्षमाणः स तु तां वयःस्थां तनुवाससम्। तस्य कामः प्रववृधै गहनेऽग्निरिवोद्गतः॥'}

{'en': 'The king could not suppress his desire on seeing his lotus eyed wife and he was completely overcome by it in that solitude of the wood.', 'sn': 'रहस्येकां तु तां दृष्ट्वा राजा राजीवलोचनाम्। न शशाक नियन्तुं तं कामं कामवशीकृतः॥'}

{'en': 'The king then sized her by force, but Madri, trembling in fear, resisted him to the best of her power.', 'sn': 'तत एनां बलाद् राजा निजग्राह रहो गताम्। वार्यमाणस्तया देव्या विस्फुरन्त्या यथाबलम्॥'}

{'en': 'He (the king) was then overcome by desire; he did not remember the course (of the Rishi); he embraced Madri by force. O descendant of Kuru, unrestrained by the fear of curse and impelled by fate, the king, being overpowered by passion, forcibly sought the embraces of his wife, as if to put an end to his life.', 'sn': 'स तु कामपरीतात्मा तं शापं नान्वबुध्यत। माद्री मैथुनधर्मेण सोऽन्वगच्छद् बलादिव॥ जीवितान्ताय कौरव्य मन्मथस्य वशं गतः। शापजं भयमुत्सृज्य विधिना सम्प्रचोदितः॥'}

{'en': 'His reason, being clouded by the destroyer himself, after intoxicating his senses was itself lost with his life.', 'sn': 'तस्य कामात्मनो बुद्धिः साक्षात् कालेन मोहिता। सम्प्रमथ्येन्द्रियग्रामं प्रणष्टा सह चेतसा॥'}

{'en': 'The descendant of Kuru, virtuous minded Pandu succumbed to the inevitable influence of Time while united with his wife.', 'sn': 'स तया सह संगम्य भार्यया कुरुनन्दनः। पाण्डुः परमधर्मात्मा युयुजे कालधर्मणा॥'}
{'en': 'Then Madri, embracing the senseless (dead) king, began repeatedly to utter words of lament.', 'sn': 'ततो माद्री समालिङ्गय राजानं गतचेतसम्। मुमोच दुःखजं शब्दं पुनः पुनरतीव हि॥'}

{'en': 'Kunti with her sons and the sons of Madri, the Pandavas, came there where the king lay in that state.', 'sn': 'सह पुत्रैस्ततः कुन्ती माद्रीपुत्रौ च पाण्डवौ। आजग्मुः सहितास्तत्र यत्र राजा तथागतः॥'}

{'en': 'O king, Madri then crying piteously said to Kunti, “Come here alone and let the children stay there."', 'sn': 'ततो मायब्रवीद् राजन्नार्ता कुन्तीमिदं वचः। एकैव त्वमिहागच्छ तिष्ठन्त्वयैव दारकाः॥'}

{'en': 'Having heard her these words, Kunti bade the children to remain there came running and crying, "Woe to me!"', 'sn': 'तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्यास्तत्रैवाधाय दारकान्। हताहमिति विक्रुश्य सहसैवाजगाम सा॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing both Pandu and Madri lying prostrate on the ground, she bewailed in grief and affliction, saying-', 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वा पाण्डं च माद्रीं च शयानौ धरणीतले। कुन्ती शोकपरीताङ्गी विललाप सुदुःखिता॥'}

{'en': '“Thus self controlled hero was always watched by me with care. How did he embrace you, knowing the curse of the Rishi.”', 'sn': 'रक्ष्यमाणो मया नित्यं वीरः सततमात्मवान्। कथं त्वामत्यतिक्रान्तः शापं जानन् वनौकसः॥'}
{'en': 'O Madri, this king ought to have been protected by you; but why did you tempt the king in solitude?', 'sn': 'ननु नाम त्वया माद्रि रक्षितव्यो नराधिपः। सा कथं लोभितवती विजने त्वं नराधिपम्॥'}
{'en': 'He was always melancholy, thinking the curse of the Rishi. How did he become marry with you in solitude?', 'sn': 'कथं दीनस्य सततं त्वामासाद्य रहोगताम्। तं विचिन्तयतः शापं प्रहर्षः समजायत॥'}

{'en': '"O princess of Valhika, greater fortunate you are than I. You have seen the face of the king in gladness and joy."', 'sn': 'धन्या त्वमसि बाह्रीकि मत्तो भाग्यतरा तथा। दृष्टवत्यसि यद् वक्त्रं प्रहृष्टस्य महीपतेः॥'}

{'en': "Madri said : Sister, with tears in my eyes, I resisted the king, but he could not control himself, as if he was bent upon making the Rishi's curse true.", 'sn': 'मान्युवाच विलपन्त्या मया देवि वार्यमाणेन चासकृत्। आत्मा न वारितोऽनेन सत्यं दिष्टं चिकीर्षणा॥'}

{'en': 'Kunti said : I am the eldest of his wedded wives; the chief religious merit is mine. O Madri, therefore, prevent me not from what must come to pass. I must follow our lord to the region of the dead. Rise up, give me the body and you rear the children.', 'sn': 'कुन्त्युवाच अहं ज्येष्ठा धर्मपत्नी ज्येष्ठं धर्मफलं मम। अवश्यम्भाविनो भावान्मा मां माद्रि निवर्तय॥ अन्विष्यामीह भर्तारमहं प्रेतवशं गतम्। उत्तिष्ठ त्वं विसृज्यैनमिमान् पालय दारकान्॥ अवाप्य पुत्राँल्लोब्धात्मा वीरपत्नीत्वमर्थये।'}

{'en': 'Madri said: I am still clasping our lord and here not allowed him to go away. Therefore, I shall follow him. I am not as yet satiated you are my eldest sister, give me permission (to go).', 'sn': 'मान्युवाच अहमेवानुयास्यामि भर्तारमपलायिनम्। न हि तृप्तास्मि कामानां ज्येष्ठा मामनुमन्यताम्॥'}

{'en': 'This best of the Bharata race came to me with the desire of having intercourse. His desire was not satiated, should I not go to the region of the Yama to gratify him?', 'sn': 'मां चाभिगम्य क्षीणोऽयं कामाद् भरतसत्तमः। तमुच्छिन्द्यामस्य कामं कथं नु यमसादने॥'}

{'en': 'O revered sister, if I survive you, it is certain I shall not be able to rear up your and my own children (with equality) and thus sin will touch me.', 'sn': 'न चाप्यहं वर्तयन्ती निर्विशेषं सुतेषु ते। वृत्तिमार्ये चरिष्यामि स्पृशेदेनस्तथा च माम्॥'}

{'en': 'O Kunti, you will be able to bring up my sons as if they are yours. The king, in seeking me with desire, has gone to the region of the dead.', 'sn': 'तस्मान्मे सुतयोः कुन्ति वर्तितव्यं स्वपुत्रवत्। मां च कामयमानोऽयं राजा प्रेतवशं गतः॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore, my body should be burned with that of the king. O revered abater, do not refuse me your permission to what is agreeable to me.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच राज्ञः शरीरेण सह मामपीदं कलेवरम्। दग्धव्यं सुप्रतिच्छन्नमेतदार्ये प्रियं कुरु॥'}

{'en': 'You will certainly bring up the children carefully. It would be doing the greatest good to me. I do not find anything more to tell you.', 'sn': 'दारकेष्वप्रमत्ता च भवेथाश्च हिता ममा अतोऽन्यन्न प्रपश्यामि संदेष्टव्यं हि किंचन॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Having said this, the daughter of the king of Madra, the lawfully wedded wife of that best of men Pandu, ascended the funeral pyre of her lord.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच इत्युक्त्वा तं चिताग्निस्थं धर्मपत्नी नरर्षभम्। मद्रराजसुता तूर्णमन्वारोहद् यशस्विनी॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said Then did the son of Shantanu, Bhishma, say to the wrathful Duryodhana, hearing the words of Keshava, O you best among the Bharata.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततः शान्तनवो भीष्मो दुर्योधनममर्षणम्। केशवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा प्रोवाच भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': '“By Krishna has been spoken the words of a friend wishing for peace; listen to that my dear son, and do not follow the lead if vindictiveness.', 'sn': 'कृष्णेन वाक्यमुक्तोऽसि सुहृदां शममिच्छता। अन्वपद्यस्व तत् तात मा मन्युवशमन्वगाः॥'}

{'en': 'By not acting up to the words of the great souled Keshava, will you not be able to obtain prosperity nor happiness nor your good.', 'sn': 'अकृत्वा वचनं तात केशवस्य महात्मनः। श्रेयो न जातु न सुखं न कल्याणमवाप्स्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'The one of long arms, Keshava, has told you, my dear son, what will lead to virtue and to the obtainment of earthly good; and may you obtain that object, О king; do not destroy these living creatures.', 'sn': 'धर्म्यमर्थ्य महाबाहुराह त्वां तात केशवः। तदर्थमभिपद्यस्व मा राजन् नीनशः प्रजाः॥'}

{'en': 'Do not by your wicked deeds cause to break down this blazing prosperity of the Bharatas, among all kings while Dhritarashtra is alive.', 'sn': 'ज्वलितां त्वमिमां लक्ष्मी भारती सर्वराजसु। जीवतो धृतराष्ट्रस्य दौरात्म्याद् भ्रंशयिष्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'Yourself with your ministers and with your sons, brothers and friends will be deprived of lives by your way-wardness and obstinacy.', 'sn': 'आत्मानं च सहामात्यं सपुत्रभ्रातृबान्धवम्। अहमित्यनया बुद्ध्या जीविताद् भ्रंशयिष्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'By acting against the beneficial advice leading to the obtainment of earthly benefit of Keshava as also of your father and the wise Vidura, O foremost among the Bharatas,', 'sn': 'अतिक्रामन् केशवस्य तथ्यं वचनमर्थवत्। पितुश्च भरतश्रेष्ठ विदुरस्य च धीमतः॥'}

{'en': 'Do not bring about the extermination of your race; do not act like a wicked man of evil intellect and do not follow a wrong course. Do not drown your father and your mother in a sea of grief."', 'sn': 'मा कुलघ्नः कुपुरुषो दुर्मतिः कापथं गमः। मातरं पितरं चैव मा मज्जीः शोकसागरे॥'}

{'en': 'Then did Drona say these words to Duryodhana there who was under the influence of wrath and breathing hard again and again.', 'sn': 'अथ द्रोणोऽब्रवीत् तत्र दुर्योधनमिदं वचः। अमर्षवशमापन्नं निःश्वसन्तं पुनः पुनः॥'}

{'en': '“Keshava said words to you which are pregnant with virtue and profit, my dear son,; so did Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, O ruler of men, accept them.', 'sn': 'धर्मार्थयुक्तं वचनमाह त्वां तात केशवः। तथा भीष्मः शान्तनवस्तज्जुषस्व नराधिप॥'}

{'en': 'The two are wise, have intelligence, have their souls under control, know what leads to are, as virtue and to worldly good and they are vastly learned; they have told you beneficial words; O ruler of men, accept them.', 'sn': 'प्राज्ञौ मेधाविनौ दान्तावर्थकामौ बहुश्रुतौ। आहतुस्त्वां हितं वाक्यं तज्जुषस्व नराधिप।॥'}

{'en': 'Follow, O greatly wise man, what the two, Krishna and Bhishma have said; do not from perverted understanding insult Madhava, O chastiser of foes.', 'sn': 'अनुतिष्ठ महाप्राज्ञ कृष्णभीष्मौ यदूचतुः। माधवं बुद्धिमोहेन माऽवमंस्थाः परंतप॥'}

{'en': 'Those, who are now encouraging and supporting you, will hardly do any thing when the time comes; and they rather will throw the (act of bearing) hostilities on the shoulders of others.', 'sn': 'ये त्वां प्रोत्साहयन्त्येते नैते कृत्याय कर्हिचित्। वैरं परेषां ग्रीवायां प्रतिमोक्ष्यन्ति संयुगे।॥'}

{'en': 'Do not slay all these living creatures as also your sons and brothers; the side on which Vasudeva and Arjuna know unconquerable and invisible.', 'sn': 'मा जीधनः प्रजाः सर्वाः पुत्रान् भ्रातृस्तथैव च। वासुदेवार्जुनौ यत्र विद्ध्यजेयानलं हि तान्॥'}

{'en': 'This is truly the opinion of your friend Krishna, and if you do not accept that, my dear son, you will grieve for it in the end, O Bharata,', 'sn': 'एतच्चैव मतं सत्यं सुहृदोः कृष्णभीष्मयोः। यदि नादास्यसे तात पश्चात् तप्स्यसि भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Arjuna is still mightier than what the son of Jamadagni has described him to be; Krishna, the son of Devaki, is hard to vanquished even by gods, O best among the Bharatas, what is the use of telling you what is conducive to your happiness and ought therefore to be desired for by you.', 'sn': 'यथोक्तं जामदग्न्येन भूयानेष ततोऽर्जुनः। कृष्णो हि देवकीपुत्रो देवैरपि सुदुःसहः। किं ते सुखप्रियेणेह प्रोक्तेन भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'All this is described to you; do as you like; I do not wish to address you more, O best among the Bharatas.', 'sn': 'एतत् ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु। न हि त्वामुत्सहे वक्तुं भूयो भरतसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said At the end of that speech did Kshattri Vidura also speak words looking at the wrathful son of Dhritarashtra, Duryodhana.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच तस्मिनं वाक्यान्तरे वाक्यं क्षत्तापि विदुरोऽब्रवीत्। दुर्योधनमभिप्रेक्ष्य धार्तराष्ट्रममर्षणम्॥'}

{'en': "'Duryodhana, I do not grieve for you, O best among the Bharatas; I grieve for these two old people namely your father and Gandhari (your mother).", 'sn': 'दुर्योधन न शोचामि त्वामहं भरतर्षभ। इमौ तु वृद्धौ शोचामि गान्धारी पितरं च ते॥'}

{'en': 'Having yourself of wicked heart as their protector, they will wander about without any one (in a short time) with their friends slain and with ministers killed, like those born of eggs deprived of their wings.', 'sn': 'यावनाथौ चरिष्येते त्वया नाथेन दुर्हदा। हतमित्रौ हतामात्यौ लूनपक्षाविवाण्डजौ॥'}

{'en': 'Grieving, they will wander about as beggars on the earth, having begotten such a wicked and vicious man, the exterminator of his race.', 'sn': 'भिक्षुको विचरिष्येते शोचन्तौ पृथिवीमिमाम्। कुलघ्नमीदृशं पापं जनयित्वा कुपूरुषम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then the king Dhritarashtra said to Duryodhana who was seated along with his brothers and surrounded by other kings,', 'sn': 'अथ दुर्योधनं राजा धृतराष्ट्रोऽभ्यभाषत। आसीनं भ्रातृभिः सार्धं राजभिः परिवारितम्॥'}

{'en': '"O Duryodhana, listen to this alive given by the great-souled Shouri; accept his words which are true, most beneficial, and conducive to our salvation.', 'sn': 'दुर्योधन निबोधेदं शौरिणोक्तं महात्मना। आदत्स्व शिवमत्यन्तं योगक्षेमवदव्ययम्॥'}

{'en': 'By the help of namely of Krishna of unblamable acts, we, of all other kings, shall obtain all desirable', 'sn': 'अनेन हि सहायेन कृष्णेनाक्लिष्टकर्मणा। इष्टान् सर्वानभिप्रायान् प्राप्स्याम: सर्वराजसु॥'}

{'en': 'being well united with Keshava, my dear son, go to Yudhishthira and make arrangements for a ceremony for the good of the Bharatas (the Pandavas and Kurus united together).', 'sn': 'सुसंहतः केशवेन तात गच्छ युधिष्ठिरम्। चर स्वस्त्ययनं कृत्स्नं भरतानामनामयम्॥'}

{'en': 'By the help if Vasudeva, make peace (with the Pandavas); I think the proper time has now arrived; O Dhritarashtra, do not disobey me.', 'sn': 'वासुदेवेन तीर्थेन तात गच्छस्व संशमम्। कालप्राप्तमिदं मन्ये मा त्वं दुर्योधनातिगाः॥'}

{'en': 'If you abandon peace which is begged from you for the accomplishment of your own good, then will victory never be yours."', 'sn': 'शमं चेद् याचमानं त्वं प्रत्याख्यास्यसि केशवम्। त्वदर्थमभिजल्पन्तं न तवास्त्यपराभवः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said ‘Drawing the bowstring, destruction of enemies, agriculture, trade, tending cattle and serving others for money are not proper for a Brahmana.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच ज्याकर्षणं शत्रुनिबर्हणं च कृषिर्वणिज्या पशुपालनं च। शुश्रूषणं चापि तथार्थहेतोरकार्यमेतत् परमं द्विजस्य॥श'}

{'en': 'An intelligent Brahmana, living as a householder, should duly perform the six Vedic acts. The retirement of a Brahmana into the woods, after having duly performed all the duties of the domestic mode of life, is highly spoken of.', 'sn': 'सेव्यं तु ब्रह्म षट्कर्म गृहस्थेन मनीषिणा। कृतकृत्यस्य चारण्ये वासो विप्रस्य शस्यते॥'}

{'en': 'A Brahmana should avoid service of the king, money obtained by agriculture, sustenance derived from the trade, all kinds of wily conduct, knowing any but his married wives and usury.', 'sn': 'राजप्रेष्यं कृषिधनं जीवनं च वणिक्पथा। कौटिल्यं कौलटेयं च कुसीदं च विवर्जयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'That wretch of a Brahmana, who neglects to satisfy his duties and whose conduct becomes wicked becomes, O king, a Shudra. The Brahmana, who marries a Shudra woman, who becomes vile in conduct or a dancer or a village servant or performs other unbecoming acts, becomes a Shudra.', 'sn': 'शूद्रो राजन्भवति ब्रह्मबन्धु १श्चारित्रो यश्च धर्मादपेतः। वृषलीपतिः पिशुनो नर्तनश्च राजप्रेष्यो यश्च भवेद् विकर्मा॥'}

{'en': 'Whether he recites the Vedas or not o king, if he does such improper acts, he is reduced to the position of a Shudra and on occasions of feeding he should be given a place amongst Shudras.', 'sn': 'जपन्वेदानजपंश्चापि राजन् समः शूरैर्दासवच्चापि भोज्यः। एते सर्वे शूद्रसमा भवन्ति राजन्नेतान्वर्जयेद्देवकृत्ये॥'}

{'en': 'Such Brahmanas become equal to Shudra, O king, and should be discarded at the time of worshipping the gods.', 'sn': 'निर्मर्यादे चाशुचौ क्रूरवृत्ती हिंसात्मके त्यक्तधर्मस्ववृत्ते। हव्यं कव्यं यानि चान्यानि राजन्। देयान्यदेयानि भवन्ति चास्मै।॥'}

{'en': 'Whatever presents of food dedicated to the departed manes are made to Brahmanas, who have transgressed all restraints or become impure in conduct or addicted to wicked callings and cruel acts or who have neglected their legitimate duties, yield on merit (to the giver.) Therefore, O king, self-control, purity and simplicity have been laid down as the duties of a Brahmana. Besides these, O king, all the four modes of life were prescribed by Brahman for him.', 'sn': 'तस्माद्धर्मो विहितो ब्राह्मणस्य दमः शौचमार्जवं चापि राजन्। तथा विप्रस्याश्रमाः सर्व एव पुरा राजन् ब्राह्मणा वै निसृष्टाः॥'}

{'en': 'He, who is self-controlled, has drunk the Soma in sacrifices, is of good conduct, has mercy for all creatures and patience to bear everything, has no desire of improving his position by acquisition of wealth, is frank and simple, mild, shorn of cruelty, and forgiving, is truly a Brahmana, and not he who is of sinful deeds.', 'sn': 'यः स्याद्दान्तः सोमपश्चार्यशीलः सानुक्रोशः सर्वसहो निराशीः। ऋजुर्मूदुरनृशंसः क्षमावान् स वै विप्रो नेतरः पापकर्मा॥'}

{'en': 'Men, desirous of acquiring virtue, seek the help, O king, of Sudras, Vaishyas, and Kshatriyas. If, therefore, the members of these (three) castes do not adopt peaceful duties, Vishnu, O son of Pandu, never extends his favour to them.', 'sn': 'शूद्रं वैश्यं राजपुत्रं च रार्ज ल्लोकाः सर्वे संश्रिता धर्मकामाः। तस्माद् वर्णाशान्तिधर्मेष्वसक्तान् मत्वा विष्णुर्नेच्छति पाण्डुपुत्र॥'}

{'en': 'If Vishnu be not pleased, the happiness of all men in heaven, the merit arising from the duties prescribed by the four orders, the injunctions of the Vedas, all kinds of sacrifices, and all other religions acts of men, and all the duties of the various modes of life, become lost.', 'sn': 'लोके चेदं सर्वलोकस्य न ा च्चातुर्वण्र्यं वेदवादाश्च न स्युः। सर्वाश्चज्याः सर्वलोकक्रियाश्च सद्यः सर्वे चाश्रमस्थान वै स्युः॥'}

{'en': 'Listen now, O son of Pandu, to those duties which should be practised in the four modes of life. These should be known to the Kshatriya who wishes the members of the three (other) orders in his kingdom) to strictly follow the respective duties of those modes.', 'sn': 'यश्च त्रयाणां वर्णानामिच्छेदाश्रमसेवनम्। चातुराश्रम्यदृशंश्च धर्मांस्तान्धृणु पाण्डव॥'}

{'en': 'For a Shudra who wishes to hear (such scriptures as are not forbidden in his case), who has performed his duties, who has procreated a son, between whom and the superior orders there is not much difference for the purity of his conduct, all the modes of life have been laid down save the observance of universal peacefulness and self-control.', 'sn': 'शुश्रूषोः कृतकार्यस्य कृतसंतानकर्मणः। अभ्यनुज्ञातराजस्य शूद्रस्य जगतीपते॥ अल्पान्तरगतस्यापि दशधर्मगतस्य वा। आश्रमा विहिताः सर्वे वर्जयित्वा निराशिषम्॥'}

{'en': 'For a Shudra practising all these duties, as also for a Vaishya, O king, and a Kshatriya, the Bhikshu mode of life has been sanctioned.', 'sn': 'भैक्ष्यचर्यां ततः प्राहुस्तस्य तद्धर्मचारिणः। तथा वैश्यस्य राजेन्द्र राजपुत्रस्य चैव हि॥'}

{'en': "Having performed the duties of his order, and having also served the king, an aged Vaisya with the king's permission, may adopt another mode of life.", 'sn': 'कृतकृत्यो वयोऽतीतो राज्ञः कृतपरिश्रमः। वैश्यो गच्छदनुज्ञातो नृपेणाश्रमसंश्रयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having studied the Vedas duly and the works describing the duties of kings, O sinless one, having procreated children and performed similar other acts, having drunk the Soma and governed and protected all his subjects piously, O foremost of speakers, having celebrated a Rajasuya, the horse sacrifice, and other great sacrifices, having invited learned Brahmanas for reciting the scriptures and made presents to them according to their merits, having obtained victories small or great in battle, having placed on his throne his own begotten son or some Kshatriya of good birth for the protection of his subjects, having worshipped the departed manes by performing with due rites the sacrifice prescribed for honouring them, having attentively adored the gods by performing sacrifices and the Rishis by studying the Vedas, the Kshatriya, who in old age seeks another mode of life, may, O king, adopt it by leaving the preceding one and by the means be is sure to acquire (ascetic) success.', 'sn': 'वेदानधीत्य धर्मेण राजशास्त्राणि चानघ । संतानादीनि कर्माणि कृत्वा सोमं निषेव्य च॥ पालयित्वा प्रजाः सर्वा धर्मेण वदतां वरः। राजसूयाश्वमेधादीन् मखानन्यांस्तथैव च॥ आनयित्वा यथापाठं विप्रेभ्यो दत्तदक्षिणः। संग्रामे विजयं प्राप्य तथाल्पं यदि वा बहु॥ स्थापयित्वा प्रजापालं पुत्रं राज्ये च पाण्डव। अन्यगोत्रं प्रशस्तं वा क्षत्रियं क्षत्रियर्षभ॥ अर्चयित्वा पितृन् सम्यक् पितृयज्ञैर्यथाविधि। देवान् यज्ञैर्ऋषीन् वेदैरर्चयित्वा तु यत्नतः॥ अन्तकाले च सम्प्राप्ते य इच्छेदाश्रमान्तरम्। सोऽनुपूर्व्याश्रमान् राजन् गत्वा सिद्धिमवाप्नुयात्॥'}

{'en': 'A Kshatriya, for leading the life of a Rishi, O king, may take the Bhikshu mode of life; but he should never do so for enjoying the pleasure of the world. Having abandoned the life of a house-holder, he may adopt the life of mendicancy by begging what would barely maintain his life.', 'sn': 'राजषित्वेन राजेन्द्र भैक्ष्यचर्यां न सेवया। अपेतगृहधर्मोऽपि चरेज्जीवितकाम्यया॥'}

{'en': 'A life of mendicancy is not compulsory for the three orders (viz., Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras), O giver of profuse presents. This mode of life, is open to all the four castes because they can adopt it if they choose.', 'sn': 'न चैतन्नैष्ठिकं कर्म त्रयाणां भूरिदक्षिण। चतुर्णां राजशार्दूल प्राहुराश्रमवासिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Amongst men, the highest duties are those which are practised by Kshatriyas. The whole world is subject to the power of their arms. All the duties, principal and minor of the three other castes, depend upon the duties of the Kshatriya. The Vedas declare this.', 'sn': 'बाह्वायत्तं क्षत्रियैर्मानवानां लोकश्रेष्ठं धर्ममासेवमानैः। सर्वे धर्माः सोपधर्मास्त्रयाणां राज्ञो धर्मादिति वेदाच्छणोमि॥'}

{'en': 'As the foot-prints of all the other animals are covered by those of the elephant, so all the duties of the other castes, under every circumstances, are covered by those of the Kshatriya.', 'sn': 'यथा राजन् हस्तिपदे पदानि संलीयन्ते सर्वसत्त्वोद्भवानि। एवं धर्मान् राजधर्मेषु सर्वान् सर्वावस्थान् सम्प्रलीनान् निबोध॥'}

{'en': 'Men, well-read in the scriptures say that the duties of the other three castes give but limited relief or protection, yield petty rewards. The learned have said that the duties of the Kshatriya afford great relief and yield great rewards.', 'sn': 'अल्पाश्रयानल्पफलान् वदन्ति धर्मानन्यान् धर्मविदो मनुष्याः। महाश्रयं बहुकल्याणरूपं क्षात्रं धर्मं नेतरं प्राहुरार्याः॥'}

{'en': 'The royal duties are the foremost of all duties. All the castes are protected by them. Every sort of Renunciation is included in kingly duties, o king, and Renunciation has been declared to be an eternal virtue and the foremost of all. on', 'sn': 'सर्वे धर्मा राजधर्मप्रधानाः सर्वे वर्णाः पाल्यमाना भवन्ति। सर्वस्त्यागो राजधर्मेषु रार्ज स्त्यागं धर्मं चाहुरग्र्यं पुराणम्॥'}

{'en': 'If the science of punishment disappears, the Vedas will be lost. All these scriptures also describing the duties of men become lost. Indeed, if these ancient duties the Kshatriyas be abandoned, all the duties of all the modes of life, become lost.', 'sn': 'मज्जेत् त्रयी दण्डनीतौ हतायां सर्वे धर्माः प्रक्षयेयुर्विबुद्धाः। सर्वे धर्माश्चाश्रमाणां हताः स्युः क्षात्रे त्यक्ते राजधर्मे पुराणे॥'}

{'en': 'All sorts of renunciation are in kingly duties; all kinds of initiation are in them; all sorts of learning are connected with them; and all sorts of worldly conduct are in them.', 'sn': 'सर्वे त्यागा राजधर्मेषु दृशः सर्वा दीक्षा राजधर्मेषु चोक्ताः। सर्वा विद्या राजधर्मेषु युक्ताः सर्वे लोका राजधर्मे प्रविष्टाः॥'}

{'en': 'As animals, killed by the vulgar, become the instrument of destroying the virtue and the religious acts of the destroyer so all other duties, if deprived of the protection offered by kingly duties, become subject to attack and destruction, and men, full of anxiety, neglect the practices laid down for them.', 'sn': 'यथा जीवाः प्राकृतैर्वध्यमाना धर्मश्रुतानामुपपीडनाय। एवं धर्मा राजधर्मवियुक्ताः। संचिन्वन्तो नाद्रियन्ते स्वधर्मम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said After Bhishma had fled away from the battle-field, the illustrious Duryodhana, hoisting up his flag, approached Arjuna with bow in hand, and sending up a loud roar.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच भीष्मे तु संग्रामशिरो विहाय पलायमाने धृतराष्ट्रपुत्रः। उत्सृज्य केतुं विनदन् महात्मा धनुर्विगृह्यार्जुनमाससाद॥'}

{'en': 'Then with a dart shot from the bow drawn to the ear, he wounded, on the forehead, Dhananjaya of fierce energy, and a terrible bowman ranging in the midst of the enemies.', 'sn': 'स भीमधन्वानमुदप्रवीर्यं धनंजयं शत्रुगणे चरन्तम्। आकर्णपूर्णायतचोदितेन विव्याध भल्लेन ललाटमध्ये।।'}

{'en': 'And wounded with a sharp golden arrow on his forehead, that illustrious hero shone like a hill with a single peak.', 'sn': 'स तेन बाणेन समर्पितेन जाम्बूनदाग्रेण सुसंहितेन। रराज राजन् महनीयकर्मा यथैकपर्वा रुचिरैकशृङ्गः॥३'}

{'en': 'Severed by his arrow warm life-blood gushed out of the wound. And piercing his forehead, that golden shaft appeared beautiful.', 'sn': 'अथास्य बाणेन विदारितस्य प्रादुर्बभूवासृगजस्रमुष्णम्। स तस्य जाम्बूनदपुडचित्रो भित्त्वा ललाटं सुविराजते स्म॥'}

{'en': 'Duryodhana of fierce energy, attacked Partha, and Partha attacked him. Thus two foremost of men, born in the family of Ajamidha, struck each other in the battle.', 'sn': 'दुर्योधनश्चापि तमुग्रतेजाः पार्थश्च दुर्योधनमेकवीरः। अन्योन्यमाजौ पुरुषप्रवीरौ समौ समाजग्मतुराजमीढौ॥'}

{'en': 'Then supported by four cars, Vikarna rushed on an infuriated elephant, huge as a mountain, against Jishnu, the son of Kunti.', 'sn': 'ततः प्रभिन्नेन महागजेन महीधराभेन पुनर्विकर्णः। रथैश्चतुर्भिर्गजपादरक्षैः कुन्तीसुतं जिष्णुमथाभ्यधावत्॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing him come quickly, Dhananjaya struck that elephant-chief on the head, between the temples, with a fierce iron shaft, discharged from the bow drawn to the ear.', 'sn': 'तमापतन्तं त्वरितं गजेन्द्र धनंजयः कुम्भविभागमध्ये। आकर्णपूर्णेन महायसेन बाणेन विव्याध महाजवेन॥'}

{'en': 'Like thunderbolt, hurled by Indra, smiting a hill, the arrow, with vulture wings, shot by Partha, penetrated up to the very feathers into the huge elephant.', 'sn': 'पार्थेन सृष्टः स तु गापत्र आपुलदेशात् प्रविवेश नागम्। विदार्य शैलप्रवरं प्रकाशं यथाशनिः पर्वतमिन्द्रसृष्टः॥'}

{'en': 'Struck by the arrow that elephant-chief, greatly pained began to tremble; and being cxhausted, it fell down on the earth like a nountain summit clapped by a thunderbolt.', 'sn': 'शरप्रतप्तः स तु नागराज: प्रवेपिताङ्गो व्यथितान्तरात्मा। संसीदमानो निपपात मह्यां वज्राहतं शृङ्गमिवाचलस्य॥'}

{'en': 'All on a sudden, getting down in great fear from the car, Vikarana ran full eight hundred paces and got on the car of Vivinshati.', 'sn': 'निपातिते दन्तिवरे पृथिव्यां त्रासाद् विकर्णः सहसावतीर्य। तूर्णं पदान्यष्टशतानि गत्वा विविंशते: स्यन्दनमासरोह॥'}

{'en': 'Having killed with that thunderbolt shaft, that elephant, huge as a hill, and resembling a mass of clouds the son of Pritha struck Duryodhana on the breast, with another arrow of the same kind.', 'sn': 'निहत्य नागं तु शरेण तेन वज्रोपमेनाद्रिवराम्बुदाभम्। तथाविधेनैव शरेण पार्थो दुर्योधनं वक्षसि निर्बिभेद॥'}

{'en': 'The elephant and the king having thus been both wounded and Vikarana having fled away with the followers, other warriors, smitten with the shafts discharged from the Gandiva, fled from the field in panic.', 'sn': 'ततो गजे राजनि चैव भिन्ने भग्ने विकर्णे च सपादरक्षे। स्ते योधमुख्याः सहसापजग्मुः॥'}

{'en': 'Having seen the elephant slain by Partha, and all other heroes running away, Duryodhana, the foremost of Kurus, turning his chariot, immediately fled where Partha was not.', 'sn': 'दृष्ट्वैव पार्थेन हतं च नागं योधांश्च सर्वान् द्रवतो निशम्य। रथं समावृत्य कुरुप्रवीरो रणात् प्रदुद्राव यतो न पार्थः॥'}

{'en': 'While Duryodhana was thus taking to his heels, in great terror, pierced by that arrow, and throwing up blood, Kiritin, still eager for battle and capable of withstanding every enemy, censured him.', 'sn': 'तं भीमरूपं त्वरितं द्रवन्तं दुर्योधनं शत्रुसहोऽभिषगात्। प्रास्फोटयद् योद्धमनाः किरीटी बाणेन विद्धं रुधिरं वमन्तम्॥'}

{'en': 'Arjuna said Renouncing your great fame and glory, why do you take to your heels? Why are not your trumpet blown in the same way as when you started from your kingdom.', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच विहाय कीर्ति विपुलं यशश्च युद्धात् परावृत्य पलायसे किम्। न तेऽद्य तूर्याणि समाहतानि तथैव राज्यादवरोपितस्या॥'}

{'en': 'I am the obedient servant of Yudhishthira. I am the third son of Pritha, standing here for battle. Turning back, show me your face. Remember the conduct of kings, O son of Dhritarashtra.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिस्यास्मि निदेशकारी पार्थस्तृतीयो युधि संस्थितोऽस्मि। तदर्थमावृत्य मुखं प्रयच्छ नरेन्द्रवृत्तं स्मर धार्तराष्ट्र॥'}

{'en': 'The name Duryodhana, given to you, is thus made meaningless. Where is your persistence in battle-time. Your run away leaving the battle-field.', 'sn': 'मोघं तवेदं भुवि नामधेयं दुर्योधनेतीह कृतं पुरस्तात्। न हीह दुर्योधनता तवास्ति पलायमानस्य रणं विहाया।१७।।'}

{'en': 'O Duryodhana! As no guard is seen either in front or back of you. Hence, O chivalrous man! Immediately depart from the battle-field and save your life before you die in the hands of Arjuna.', 'sn': 'न ते पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतो वा पश्यामि दुर्योधन रक्षितारम्। अपेहि युद्धात् पुरुषप्रवीर प्राणान् प्रियान् पाण्डवतोऽद्य रक्ष॥'}

{'en': "Bhishma said 'All immobile and mobile beings, divided into four classes, have been described to be of unmanifest birth and unmanifest death. Existing only in the unmanifest Soul, the Mind is said to possess the attributes of the unmanifest.", 'sn': 'गुरुरुवाच चतुर्विधानि भूतानि स्थावराणि चराणि च। अव्यक्तप्रभवान्याहुरव्यक्तनिधनानि च। अव्यक्तलक्षणं विद्यादव्यक्तात्मात्मकं मनः॥'}

{'en': 'As a vast tree lies within a small unblown Ashvatha flower and is seen only when it comes out, so birth takes place from what is unmanifest.', 'sn': 'यथाश्वत्थकणीकायामन्तर्भूतो महाद्रुमः। निष्पन्नो दृश्यते व्यक्तमव्यक्तात् सम्भवस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'A piece of iron, which is inanimate runs towards a piece of loadstone. Likewise, inclinations and propensities due to natural instincts, and all else, run towards the Soul in a 11cw lifc.', 'sn': 'अभिद्रवत्ययस्कान्तमयो निश्चेतनं यथा। स्वभावहेतुजा भावा यद्वदन्यदपीदृशम्॥'}

{'en': 'Indeed, as those propensities bom of Darkness and Ignorance, and inactive in their nature, are united with the Soul when re-born, similarly, those other inclinations and aspirations of the Soul that have their look directed towards Brahma become united with it, coming to it directly from Brahima itself.', 'sn': 'तद्वदव्यक्तजा भावाः कर्तुः कारणलक्षणाः। अचेतनाश्चेतयितुः कारणादभिसंहता॥'}

{'en': 'Neither earth, nor sky, nor heaven, nor things, nor the vital airs, nor virtue and vice, nor anything else, existed before, except the Intelligence-Soul. Nor have they any necessary connection with even the Intelligence-Soul corrupted by Darkness.', 'sn': 'न भून खं द्यौर्भूतानि नर्षयो न सुरासुराः। नान्यदासीदृते जीवमासेदुर्न तु संहतम्॥'}

{'en': "The Soul is eternal. It is indestructible. It is in every creature. It is the cause of the Mind. It is without qualities. This universe before us is due to Darkness or Ignorance. The Soul's apprehensions of form, etc., are due to past desires.", 'sn': 'पूर्वं नित्यं सर्वगतं मनोहेतुमलक्षणम्। अज्ञानकर्म निर्दिष्टमेतत् कारणलक्षणम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Soul, when it becomes endued with desires, engages in acts. On account of that condition, this vast wheel of existence revolves with beginning and without end.', 'sn': 'तत्कारणैर्हि संयुक्त कार्यसंग्रहकारकम्। येनैतद् वर्तते चक्रमनादिनिधनं महत्॥'}

{'en': 'The Understanding, is the nave of that wheel. The body with the senses, forms its spokes. The perceptions and acts are its circumference. Urged by on the quality of Darkness, the Soul presides over it.', 'sn': 'अव्यक्तनाभं व्यक्तारं विकारपरिमण्डलम्। श्रेत्रज्ञाधिष्ठितं चक्रं स्निग्धाक्षं वर्तते ध्रुवम्॥'}

{'en': 'Like oilmen pressing oilseeds pressing oilseeds in their machine, the consequences born of Darkness, assailing the universe which is moistened by Darkness, press or grind it in that wheel.', 'sn': 'स्निग्धत्वात् लिवत् सर्वं चक्रेऽस्मिन् पीड्यते जगत्। तिलपीडैरिवाक्रम्य भोगैरज्ञानसम्भवैः॥'}

{'en': 'In that succession of births, the individual Soul, seized by the idea of Ego in consequence of desire, performs acts. In the union of cause and effect, those acts again become fresh causes.', 'sn': 'कर्म तत् कुरुते तर्षादहंकारपरिग्रहात्। कार्यकारणसंयोगे स हेतुरुपपादितः॥'}

{'en': 'Effects do not enter into causes. Nor do causes enter into effects. Time is the instrumental in the production of effects.', 'sn': 'नाभ्येति कारणं कार्यं न कार्य कारणं तथा। कार्याणां तूपकरणे कालो भवति हेतुमान्॥'}

{'en': 'The primordial essences, and their changes endued with causes, exist unitedly, on account of their being always presided over by the Soul.', 'sn': 'हेतुयुक्ताः प्रकृतयो विकाराश्च परस्परम्। अन्योन्यमभिवर्तन्ते पुरुषाधिष्ठिताः सदा॥'}

{'en': 'Like dust following the wind that moves it, the individual Soul, shorn of body, but endued still with inclinations born of Darkness and Ignorance with principles of causes formed by pristine deeds, moves on, following the direction of the Supreme Soul.', 'sn': 'राजसैस्तामसैर्भावैर्युतो हेतुबलान्वितः। क्षेत्रज्ञमेवानुयाति पांसुर्वातेरितो यथा॥'}

{'en': 'The Soul, however, is never affected by those inclinations and propensities. Nor are these affected by the Soul that is superior to them. The wind, which is naturally pure, is never sullied by the dust it carries.', 'sn': 'न च तैः स्पृश्यते भावैर्न ते तेन महात्मना। सरजस्कोऽरजस्कश्च नैव वायुर्भवेद् यथा॥'}

{'en': 'As the wind is separate from the dust it carries away, so, the wise man should know, is the connection between life and the Soul. No one should think that the Soul, on account of its seeming union with the body and the senses and the other inclinations and beliefs and unbeliefs, is really endued therewith as its necessary and absolute qualities. On the other hand, the Soul should be considered as existing in its own nature.', 'sn': 'तथैतदन्तरं विद्यात् सत्त्वक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्बुधः। अभ्यासात् स तथा युक्तो न गच्छेत् प्रकृति पुनः।।'}

{'en': "Thus did the divine Rishi remove the doubt that had taken possession of his disciple's mind. Inspite of all this, people depend upon means consisting of acts and scriptural rites for removing misery and acquiring happiness.", 'sn': 'संदेहमेतमुत्पन्नमच्छिनद् भगवानृषिः। तथा वार्ता समीक्षेत कृतलक्षणसम्मिताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Seeds that are burnt by fire do not put forth sprouts. Likewise, if everything that produces misery be consumed by the fire of true knowledge, the Soul is freed from the obligation of re-birth in the world.', 'sn': 'बीजान्यग्न्युपदग्धानि न रोहन्ति यथा पुनः। ज्ञानदग्धैस्तथा क्लेशै त्मा सम्पद्यते पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Then, upon the expiration of the great cycle, when the celestial priest Brihaspati was born in the family of Angiras, all the gods became very happy.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच ततोऽतीते महाकल्पे उत्पन्नेऽङ्गिरसः सुते। बभूवुर्निर्वृता देवा जाते देवपुरोहिते॥'}

{'en': 'The words Vrihat, Brahma, and Mahat all carry the same significance. The celestial priest, O king, came to be called Brihaspati because he was gifted with all these accomplishments.', 'sn': 'बृहद् ब्रह्म महच्चेति शब्दाः पर्यायवाचकाः। एभिः समन्वितो राजन् गुणैर्विद्वान् बृहस्पतिः॥'}

{'en': 'King Uparichara, otherwise called Vasu, became a disciple of Brihaspati and soon became the greatest of his disciples. Admitted as such, he began of study from his preceptor that science which was composed by the seven Rishis who were known by the name of Chitrashikhandins.', 'sn': 'तस्य शिष्यो बभूवाग्यो राजोपरिचरो वसुः। अधीतवांस्तदा शास्त्रं सम्यक् चित्रशिखण्डिजम्॥'}

{'en': 'With soul purified by sacrifices and other religious rites, he governed the Earth like Indra ruling the Heaven.', 'sn': 'स राजा भावितः पूर्वं दैवेन विधिना वसुः। पालयामास पृथिवीं दिवमाखण्डलो यथा॥'}

{'en': 'The illustrious king celebrated a great Horse-sacrifice in which his preceptor Brihaspati became the priest offering libation.', 'sn': 'तस्य यज्ञो महानासीदश्वमेधो महात्मनः। बृहस्पतिरुपाध्यायस्तत्र होता बभूव ह॥'}

{'en': 'The sons of Prajapati themselves, viz., Ekata, Dvita, and Trita became the priests watching the proceedings. There were others also who became Sadasyas in that sacrifice, viz., Dhanusha, Rajvya, Arvavasu, Paravasu, the Rishi Medhatithi, the great Rishi Tandya, the blessed Rishi Shanti, Vedashiras the foremost of Rishis, viz., Kapila, who was the father of Shalihotra, the first Kalpa, Tittiri the elder brother of Vaishampayana, Kanwa, and Devahotra, forming in all sixteen,', 'sn': 'प्रजापतिसुताश्चात्र सदस्याश्चाभवंस्त्रयः। एकतश्च द्वितश्चैव त्रितश्चैव महर्षयः॥ धनुषाख्योऽथ रैभ्यश्च अर्वावसुपरावसू। ऋषिर्मेधातिथिश्चैव ताण्ड्यश्चैव महानृषिः॥ ऋषिः शान्तिर्महाभागस्तथा वेदशिराश्च यः। ऋषिश्रेष्ठश्च कपिल: शालिहोत्रपिता स्मृतः॥ आद्यः कठस्तैत्तिरिश्च वैषम्पायनपूर्वजः। कण्वोऽथ देवहोत्रश्च एते षोडश कीर्तिताः॥'}

{'en': 'In that great sacrifice, O king, all the necessary articles were collected. No animals were killed in it. The king had ordained it so.', 'sn': 'सम्भूताः सर्वसम्भारास्तस्मिन् राजन् महाक्रतौ। न तत्र पशुघातोऽभूत् स राजैवं स्थितोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'He was full of mercy. Of pure and liberal mind, he had renounced all desire, and was well-conversant with all rites. The necessary articles of that sacrifice were the productions of the forest.', 'sn': 'अहिंस्रः शुचिरक्षुद्रो निराशीः कर्मसंस्तुतः। आरण्यकपदोद्भूता भागास्तत्रोपकल्पिताः॥'}

{'en': 'The ancient God of gods (viz., Hari), became highly pleased with the king on account of that sacrifice. Incapable of being seen by any one else, the great God appeared before his worshipper.', 'sn': 'प्रीतस्ततोऽस्य भगवान् देवदेवः पुरातनः। साक्षात् तं दर्शयामास सोऽदृश्योऽन्येन केनचित्॥'}

{'en': 'Accepting by taking its scent, the share offered to him he himself took up the Purodasha (clarified butter with cakes of powdered barley). The great God took up the offerings without being seen by any one.', 'sn': 'स्वयं भागमुपाघ्राय पुरोडाशं गृहीतवान्। अदृश्येन हृतो भागो देवेन हरिमेधसा॥'}

{'en': 'At this, Brihaspati became angry. Taking up the ladle he hurled it violently at the sky, and began to shed tears in anger.', 'sn': 'बृहस्पतिस्ततः क्रुद्धः स्रुचमुद्यम्य वेगितः। आकाशं जन् स्रुचः पातै रोषादश्रूण्यवर्तयत्॥'}

{'en': "Addressing king Uparichara he said,-Here, I place this as Narayana's share of the sacrificial offerings! Forsooth, he shall take it before my eyes.", 'sn': 'उवाच चोपरिचरं मया भागोऽयमुद्यतः। ग्राह्यः स्वयं हि देवेन मत्प्रत्यक्षं न संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said In the great sacrifice of Uparichara, all the gods appeared in their respective forms for partaking of the sacrificial offerings and were seen by all. Why is it that the powerful Hari only acted otherwise by invisibly taking his share?', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच उद्यता यज्ञभागा हि साक्षात् प्राप्ताः सुरैरिह। किमर्थमिह न प्राप्तो दर्शनं स हरिविभुः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said When Brihaspati yielded to anger, the great king Vasu and all his Sadasyas sought to pacify the great Rishi.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच ततः स तं समुद्भूतं भूमिपालो महान् वसुः। प्रसादयामास मुनि सदस्यास्ते च सर्वशः॥'}

{'en': 'With cool heads, all of them said to Brihaspati,-You should not yield to anger. In this golden age, this anger to which you have yielded should not be the characteristic of any one.', 'sn': 'ऊचुश्चैनमसम्भ्रान्ता न रोषं कर्तुमर्हसि। नैष धर्मः कृतयुगे यस्त्वं रोषमचीकृथाः॥'}

{'en': 'The great god for whom the share of the sacrificial offerings was designed by you, is himself free from anger! He is incapable of being seen either by ourselves or by you, O Brihaspati.', 'sn': 'अरोषणो ह्यसौ देवो यस्य भागोऽयमुद्यतः। न शक्यः स त्वया द्रष्टुमस्माभिर्वा बृहस्पते॥'}

{'en': 'Only he can see Him to whom He becomes gracious!—Then the Rishis Ekata, Dvita, and Trita, who were all conversant with the science of morality and duties compiled by the seven Rishis, addressed that assembly and began the following narration.', 'sn': 'यस्य प्रसादं कुरुते स वैतं द्रष्टुमर्हति। एकतद्वितत्रिताश्चोचुस्ततश्चित्रशिखण्डिनः॥'}

{'en': 'We are the sons of Brahman, begotten by his will. Once on a time we went to the north for the acquisition of our highest good.', 'sn': 'वयं हि ब्रह्मणः पुत्रा मानसाः परिकीर्तिताः। गताः निःश्रेयसार्थं हि कदाचिद् दिशमुत्तराम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having practised penances for thousands of years and acquired a great ascetic merit, we again stood on only one foot like fixed rods of wood.', 'sn': 'तप्त्वा वर्षसहस्राणि चरित्वा तप उत्तमम्। एकपादाः स्थिताः सम्यक् काष्ठभूताः समाहिताः॥'}

{'en': 'The country where we practised these austerest of penances, lies to the north of the mountains of Meru and on the shores of the ocean of milk.', 'sn': 'मेरोरुत्तरभागे तु क्षीरोदस्यानुकूलतः। स देशो यत्र नस्तप्तं तपः परमदारुणम्॥'}

{'en': 'The object we had in mind was how to see the divine Narayana in his own form. Upon the termination of our penances and after we had performed the final ablutions, we heard an incorporeal voice, O powerful Brihaspati, deep like that of the clouds and exceedingly melodious and filling the heart with joy.', 'sn': 'कथं पश्येम हि वयं देवं नारायणात्मकम्। वरेण्यं वरदं तं वै देवदेवं सनातनम्॥ कथं पश्येम हि वयं देवं नारायणं त्विति। अथ व्रतस्यावभृथे वागुवाचाशरीरिणी॥ स्निग्धगम्भीरया वाचा प्रहर्षणकरी विभो।'}

{'en': 'The voice said You Brahmanas, you have performed well these penances with cheerful souls! Devoted to Narayana, you try to know how you may succeed in seeing that god of great power.', 'sn': 'सुतप्तं वस्तपो विप्राः प्रसन्नेनान्तरात्मना॥ यूयं जिज्ञासवो भक्ताः कथं द्रक्ष्यथ तं विभुम्।'}

{'en': 'On the northern shores of the ocean of milk there is an island called White Island. The men that dwell in that island have complexions as white as the rays of the Moon and that are devoted to Narayana.', 'sn': 'क्षीरोदधेरुत्तरतः श्वेतद्वीपो महाप्रभः॥ तत्र नारायणपरा मानवाश्चन्द्रवर्चसः।'}

{'en': 'Worshippers of that foremost of all Beings, they are devoted to Him with their whole minds. They all enter that eternal and illustrious god of a thousand rays.', 'sn': 'एकान्तभावोपगतास्ते भक्ताः पुरुषोत्तमम्॥ ते सहस्रार्चिषं देवं प्रविशन्ति सनातनम्।'}

{'en': 'They are shorn of senses. They do not live on any sort of food. Their eyes are winkless. Their bodies always emit a sweet smell. Indeed, the inhabitants of White Island believe and adore only one God. Go there, ye ascetics, for there I have revealed myself.', 'sn': 'अनिन्द्रिया निराहारा अनिष्पन्दाः सुगन्धिनः॥ एकान्तिनस्ते पुरुषाः श्वेतद्वीपनिवासिनः। गच्छध्वं तत्र मुनयस्तत्रात्मा मे प्रकाशितः॥'}
{'en': 'All of us, hearing these invisible words, proceeded by the way said to the country described.', 'sn': 'अथ श्रुत्वा वयं सर्वे वाचं तामशरीरिणीम्। यथाख्यातेन मार्गेण तं देशं प्रतिपेदिरे॥'}

{'en': 'Eagerly desirous of seeing Him and our hearts full of Him, we reached that large island called White Island. Arrived there, we could see nothing. Indeed our vision was blinded by the energy of the great god and accordingly we could not see Him.', 'sn': 'प्राप्य श्वेतं महाद्वीपं तच्चित्तास्तद्दिदृक्षवः। ततोऽस्मदृष्टिविषयस्तदा प्रतिहतोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'At this, the idea, due to the grace of the great God Himself, sprung in our minds that one who had not practised sufficient penances could not soon see Narayana.', 'sn': 'न च पश्याम पुरुषं तत्तेजोहृतदर्शनाः। ततो नः प्रादुरभवद् विज्ञानं देवयोगजम्॥'}

{'en': 'Under the influence of this idea we once more began to practise some severe austerities, suited to the time and place, for a hundred years. Upon the termination of our vows, we saw a number of men of auspicious marks.', 'sn': 'न किलातप्ततपसा शक्यते द्रष्टुमञ्जसा। ततः पुनर्वर्षशतं तप्त्वा तात्कालिकं महत्॥ व्रतावसाने च शुभान् नरान् ददृशिरे वयम्।'}

{'en': 'All of them were white and looked like the Moon and were erdued with every sort of blessedness. Their hands were always joined in prayer. The faces of some were turned towards the North and of some to East. They were engaged in silently meditating on Brahma.', 'sn': 'श्वेतांश्चन्द्रप्रतीकाशान् सर्वलक्षणलक्षितान्॥ नित्याञ्जलिकृतान् ब्रह्म जपतः प्रागुदङ्मुखान्।'}

{'en': 'The recitation performed by those great persons was a mental Yapa. On account of their hearts, having been entirely fixed upon Him, Hari became highly gratified with them.', 'sn': 'मानसो नाम स जपो जप्यते तैर्महात्मभिः॥ तेनैकाग्रमनस्त्वेन प्रीतो भवति वै हरिः।'}

{'en': 'The effulgence that came out of the persons of those men resembled, O foremost of ascetics, the splendours which the sun assumed when the time comes for the dissolution of the universe.', 'sn': 'याभवन्मुनिशार्दूल भाः सूर्यस्य युगक्षये॥ एकैकस्य प्रभा तादृक् साभवन्मानवस्य ह।'}

{'en': 'Indeed, we thought that that Island was the seat of all Energy. All the denizens were perfectly equal in energy. There was no superiority or inferiority there among them.', 'sn': 'तेजोनिवासः स द्वीप इति वै मेनिरे वयम्॥ न तत्राभ्यधिकः कश्चित् सर्वे ते समतेजसः।'}

{'en': 'We then suddenly saw once more a light arise that seemed to be the concentrated effulgence of a thousand Sons, O Brihaspati.', 'sn': 'अथ सूर्यसहस्रस्य प्रभां युगपदुत्थिताम्॥ सहसा दृष्टवन्तः स्म पुनरेव बृहस्पते।'}

{'en': 'The denizens in a body, ran towards that light, with hands joined in reverential attitude, full of joy, and uttering the one word Salutation.', 'sn': 'सहिताश्चाभ्यधावन्त ततस्ते मानवा दुतम्॥ कृताञ्जलिपुटा हृष्टा नम इत्येव वादिनः।'}

{'en': 'We then heard a very loud noise uttered by all of them together. It appeared that those men were engaged in offering a sacrifice to the great God.', 'sn': 'ततो हि वदतां तेषामश्रौष्म विपुलं ध्वनिम्॥ बलिः किलोपहियते तस्य देवस्य तैनरैः।'}
