{'en': 'As regards ourselves, we were suddenly deprived of our senses by his Energy. Shorn of vision and strength and all the senses, we could not behold or feel anything.', 'sn': 'वयं तु तेजसा तस्य सहसा हृतचेतसः॥ न किंचिदपि पश्यामो हतचक्षुर्बलेन्द्रियाः।'}

{'en': 'We only heard a loud sound uttered by the collected denizens. It said,-Victory to you, O you have eyes like lotus petals! Salutation to you, O Creator of the universe.', 'sn': 'एकस्तु शब्दो विततः श्रुतोऽसमाभिरुदीरितः॥ जितं ते पुण्डरीकाक्ष नमस्ते विश्वभावन।'}

{'en': 'Salutation to you, O Hrishikesha, O foremost of Beings, O First-born! This was the sound we heard, uttered distinctly and in accordance with the rules of orthoepy.', 'sn': 'नमस्तेऽस्तु हृषीकेश महापुरुषपूर्वज॥ इति शब्दः श्रुतोऽस्माभिः शिक्षाक्षरसमन्वितः।'}

{'en': 'Meanwhile, a fragrant and pure breeze blew, carrying perfumes of celestial flowers, and of certain herbs and plants that were necessary on the occasion.', 'sn': 'एतस्मिन्नन्तरे वायुः सर्वगन्धवहः शुचिः॥ दिव्यान्युवाह पुष्पाणि कर्मण्याश्चौषधीस्तथा।'}

{'en': 'Those men, gifted with great devotion, having hearts full of reverence, conversant with the ordinances laid down in the Pancharatra, were then adoring the great god with mind, word, and deed.', 'sn': 'तैरिष्टः पञ्चकालज्ञैर्हरिरेकान्तिभिर्नरै॥ भक्त्या परमया युक्तैर्मनोवाक्कर्मभिस्तदा।'}

{'en': 'Forsooth, Hari appeared in that place whence the sound we heard originated. As regards ourselves, stupefied by His illusion, we could not behold Him.', 'sn': 'नूनं तत्रागतो देवो यथा तैर्वागुदीरिता॥ वयं त्वेनं न पश्यामो मोहितास्तस्य मायया।'}

{'en': "After the breeze has ceased and the sacrifice had been over, our hearts became stricken with anxiety, O foremost one of Angiras's race.", 'sn': 'मारुते संनिवृत्ते च बलौ च प्रतिपादिते॥ चिन्ताव्याकुलितात्मानो जाता: स्मोऽङ्गिरसां वर।'}

{'en': 'As we stood among those thousands of men all of whom were of pure birth, no one honoured us with a glance or a nod.', 'sn': 'मानवानां सहस्रेषु तेषु वै शुद्धयोनिषु॥ अस्मान् न कश्चिन्मनसा चक्षुषा वाप्यपूजयत्।'}

{'en': 'Those ascetics, all of whom were cheerful and filled with devotion and who were all are practising the Brahma-frame of mind, showed no feeling for us.', 'sn': 'तेऽपि स्वस्था मुनिगणा एकभावमनुव्रताः॥ नास्मासु दधिरे भावं ब्रह्मभावमनुष्ठिताः।'}

{'en': 'We had been greatly tired. Our penances had einaciated us. At that time, a bodiless Being addressed us from the sky and said to us', 'sn': 'ततोऽस्मान् सुपरिश्रान्तां स्तपसा चातिकर्शितान्॥ उवाच स्वस्थं किमपि भूतं तत्राशरीरकम्।'}

{'en': 'These white men, who are divested of all external senses, competent to see (Narayana). Only those foremost of twice-born persons whom these white men honoured with their looks, can see the great God.', 'sn': 'देव उवाच दृष्टा वः पुरुषाः श्वेताः सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जिताः॥ दृष्टो भवति देवेश एभिर्दृष्टैद्विजोत्तमैः।'}

{'en': 'Go hence, ye Munis, to the place from where you have come! That great Deity is incapable of being ever seen by one who has no devotion.', 'sn': 'गच्छध्वं मुनयः सर्वे यथागतभितोऽचिरात्॥ न स शक्यस्त्वभक्तेन द्रष्टुं देवः कथंचन।'}

{'en': 'Incapable of being seen on account of his dazzling effulgence, that illustrious Deity can be seen only by those person who succeed, in course of long time, in devoting themselves wholly and solely to Him. O foremost of twiceborn ones, you have a great duty to perform.', 'sn': 'कामं कालेन महता एकान्तित्वमुपागतः॥ शक्यो द्रष्टुं स भगवान् प्रभामण्डलदुर्दशः। महत् कार्यं च कर्तव्यं युष्माभिर्द्विजसत्तमाः॥'}

{'en': 'After the expiration of this the golden age, when the Treta age comes in course of the Vivasvat cycle, a great calamity will befall the world. You Munis, you shall then have to help the gods.', 'sn': 'इतः कृतयुगेऽतीते विपर्यासं गतेऽपि च। वैवस्वतेऽन्तरे विप्राः प्राप्ते त्रेतायुगे पुनः॥ सुराणां कार्यसिद्ध्यर्थं सहाया वै भविष्यथा'}

{'en': 'no Having heard this wonderful words that were sweet as nectar, we soon returned to the place we desired, through the favour of that great Deity.', 'sn': 'ततस्तदद्भुतं वाक्यं निशम्यैवामृतोपमम्॥ तस्य प्रसादात् प्राप्ताः स्मो देशमीप्सितमञ्जसा।'}

{'en': 'When with the help of even such austere penances of offerings devoutly given in sacrifices, we could not see the great Deity, how, indeed, can you except to see Him so easily?', 'sn': 'एवं सुतपसा चैव हव्यकव्यैस्तथैव च॥ देवोऽस्माभिर्न दृष्टः स कथं त्वं द्रष्टुमर्हसि।'}

{'en': 'Narayana is a Great Being. he is the Creator of the universe. He is worshipped in sacrifices with offerings of clarified butter and other food dedicated with the help of Vedic Mantras. He has no beginning and end. He is Unmanifest. Both the gods and the Danavas adore Him.', 'sn': 'नारायणो महद्भूतं विश्वसृग्धव्यकव्यभुक॥ अनादिनिधनोऽव्यक्तो देवदानवपूजितः।'}

{'en': 'Induced by these words spoken by Ekata and approved by his companions, viz., Dvita and Trita, and solicited also by the other Sadasyas, the great Brihaspati terminated that sacrifice after duly offering the accustomed adorations to the gods.', 'sn': 'एवमेकतवाक्येन द्वितत्रितमतेन च॥ अनुनीतः सदस्यैश्च बृहस्पतिरुदारधीः। समापयत् ततो यज्ञं दैवतं समपूजयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Having completed his great sacrifice, king Uparichara, also, began to rule his subjects piously. At last, renouncing his body, he ascended to heaven. After sometime, through the curse of the Brahmanas, he dropped down from those happy regions and sank deep into the bowels of the Earth.', 'sn': 'समाप्तयज्ञो राजापि प्रजां पालितवान् वसुः। ब्रह्मशापाद् दिवो भ्रष्टः प्रविवेश महीं ततः॥'}

{'en': 'King Vasu, O foremost of kings, was always devoted to the true religion. Although sunk deep into the bowels of the Earth, his devotion to virtue did not decrease.', 'sn': 'स राजा राजशार्दूल सत्यधर्मपरायणः। अन्तर्भूमिगतश्चैव सततं धर्मवत्सलः॥'}

{'en': "Ever devoted to Narayana, and ever reciting sacred Mantras having Narayana for their god, he once more ascended to heaven through Narayana's favour.", 'sn': 'नारायणपरो भूत्वा नारायणजपं जपन्। तस्यैव च प्रसादेन पुनरेवोत्थितस्तु सः॥'}

{'en': 'Getting up from the bowels of the Earth, king Vasu, on account of the very highest end that he attained, proceeded to a spot which is even higher than the region of Brahman himself.”', 'sn': 'महीतलाद् गतः स्थानं ब्रह्मणः समनन्तरम्। परां गतिमनुप्राप्त इति नैष्ठिकमञ्जसा॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Then Agni in despair and his malady (uncured) came to the grandsire in anger.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच स तु नैराश्यमापन्नः सदा ग्लानिसमन्वितः। पितामहमुपागच्छत् संक्रुद्धो हव्यवाहनः॥'}

{'en': 'He told Brahma all that had happened. The illustrious one, then reflecting for a moment, spoke thus to him,', 'sn': 'तच्च सर्वं यथान्यायं ब्रह्मणे संन्यवेदयत्। उवाच चैनं भगवान् मुहूर्तं स विचिन्त्य तु॥'}

{'en': '“O sinless one, I see a means by which you may consume Khandava today. O Agni! wait for some time, then you will consume.', 'sn': 'उपायः परिदृष्टो मे यथा त्वं धक्ष्यसेऽनघ। कालं च कंचित् क्षमतां ततस्त्वं धक्ष्यसेऽनल॥'}
{'en': 'O Fire! Nara and Narayana will assist you. Accompanied by both of them you will burn Khandava.', 'sn': 'भविष्यतः सहायौ ते नरनारायणौ तदा। ताभ्यां त्वं सहितो दावं धक्ष्यसे हव्यवाहन॥'}

{'en': "Agni said to Brahma 'so it be'. Thereafter knowing the incernation of Nara and Narayana he remembered the words of Brahma and he went to him.", 'sn': 'एवमस्त्विति तं वह्निर्ब्रह्माणं प्रत्यभाषत। सम्भूतौ तौ विदित्वा तु नरनारायणावृषी॥ कालस्य महतो राजंस्तस्य वाक्यं तस्य वाक्यं स्वयम्भुवः। अनुस्मृत्य जगामाथ पुनरेव पितामहम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then Brahma addressed him that I see a mcans by which you may consume Khandava today even before the very sight of the husband of Sachi (Indra).', 'sn': 'अब्रवीच्च तदा ब्रह्मा यथा त्वं धक्ष्यसेऽनल। खाण्डवं दावमद्यैव मिषतोऽस्य शचीपतेः॥'}

{'en': 'O Vibhavasu, the two old dcities Nara and Narayana have become incarnates in the world of men to accomplish the purposes of the dwellers of heaven (the celestial).', 'sn': 'नरनारायणौ यौ तौ पूर्वदेवौ विभावसो। सम्प्राप्तौ मानुषे लोके कार्यार्थं हि दिवौकसाम्॥'}

{'en': 'They are called on earth Vasudeva (Krishna) and Arjuna. They are now staying near the Khandava (forest). Ask those two (heroes) to help you in consuming the Khandava. You will then be able to consume it, even if it be protected by the celestial.', 'sn': 'अर्जुनं वासुदेवं च यौ तौ लोकोऽभिमन्यते। तावेतौ सहितावेहि खाण्डवस्य समीपतः॥ तौ त्वं याचस्व साहाय्ये दाहार्थं खाण्डवस्य च। ततो धक्ष्यसि तं दावं रक्षितं त्रिदशैरपि॥'}

{'en': 'They will certainly prevent the dwellers of the Khandava to escape; and they will thwart Indra also. I have not the least doubt in this."', 'sn': 'तौ तु सत्त्वानि सर्वाणि यत्नतो वारयिष्यतः। देवराजं च सहितौ तत्र मे नास्ति संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'Having heard his words, Agni speedily came to Krishna and Arjuna. What he said to those illustrious pair, I have already told you. O best of kings, hearing these words of Agni who desired to consume the foes of Pandava against the wishes of Indra, Vivatsu (Arjuna) said to him these words will suited to the occasion.', 'sn': 'एकच्छ्रुत्वा तु वचनं त्वरितो हव्यवाहनः। कृष्णपार्थावुपागम्य यमर्थं त्वभ्यभाषत॥ अब्रवीनृपशार्दूल तत्कालसदृशं वचः। दिधएं खाण्डवं दावमकामस्य शतक्रतोः॥ तं ते कथितवानस्मि पूर्वमेव नृपोत्तम। तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तवग्नेर्बीभत्सुर्जातवेदसम्॥'}

{'en': '"I have numberless excellent celestial weapons with which I can fight even with many wielders of thunder(Indra).', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच उत्तमास्त्राणि मे सन्ति दिव्यानि च बहूनि च। यैरहं शक्नुयां योद्धुमपि वज्रधरान् बहून्॥'}

{'en': 'But, O illustrious one, I have no bow suited to the strength of my arms and capable of bearing the might I put fourth in battle.', 'sn': 'धनुर्मे नास्ति भगवन् बाहुवीर्येण सम्मितम्। कुर्वतः समरे यत्नं वेगं यद् विषहेन्मम॥'}

{'en': 'In consequence of the great lightness of my hands, I require arrows that will be inexhaustible (in the quiver). My car also is hardly able to bear the load of arrows that I desire to keep by me.', 'sn': 'शरैश्च मेऽर्थो बहुभिरक्षयैः क्षिप्रमस्यतः। न हि वोढुं रथः शक्तः शरान् मम यथेप्सितान्॥'}

{'en': 'I desire to have (some) celestial horses of pure white colour, possessing the speed of the wind and (I also desire to have) a car, possessing the splendour of the sun; the clatter of its wheels should resemble the roars of clouds.', 'sn': 'अश्वांश्च दिव्यानिच्छेयं पाण्डुरान् वातरंहसः। रथं च मेघनिर्घोषं सूर्यप्रतिमतेजसम्॥'}

{'en': "Then there is no weapon suited to Krishna's prowess. He requires weapon like the one with which Mahadeva (Shiva) kills Nagas and Pishachas in the battle.", 'sn': 'तथा कृष्णस्य वीर्येण नायुधं विद्यते समम्। येन नागान् पिशाचांश्च निहन्यान्माधवो रणे॥'}

{'en': 'O illustrious one, you should give us the means by which we may gain success; and we can prevent Indra from pouring rains on that extensive forest.', 'sn': 'उपायं कर्मसिद्धौ च भगवन् वक्तुमर्हसि। निवारयेयं येनेन्द्रं वर्षमाणं महावने॥'}

{'en': 'O Agni, we are ready to do what is possible to be done by manliness and prowess. O illustrious one, but you should give us the proper means.', 'sn': 'पौरुषेण तु यत् कार्यं तत् कर्तारौ स्व पावक। करणानि समर्थानि भगवन् दातुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'Markandeya said : Now hear another story. One day when the king Yayati, the son of Nahusa, was sitting on his throne surrounded by the citizens, a Brahmana came there for the purpose of begging) wealth for his preceptor. And he thus spoke, "O king, I beg wealth for my preceptor according to the pledge (I gave him).', 'sn': 'मार्कण्डेय उवाच इदमन्य यतां ययाति हुषो राजा राज्यस्थः पौरजनावृत आसांचक्रे गुर्वथीं ब्राह्मण उपेत्याब्रवीद् भो राजन् गुर्वर्थं भिक्षेयं समयादिति॥'}
{'en': 'The king said: O exalted one, tell me what was your pledge.', 'sn': 'राजोवाच ब्रवीतु भगवान् समयमिति॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana said: O king, in this world when a man asks for alms, men the him who asks for it. I ask you therefore (to tell me) with what feelings you will give me what I ask and on which I have set my heart.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण उवाच विद्वेषणं परमं जीवलोके कुर्यान्नरः पार्थिव याच्यमानः। तं त्वां पृच्छामि कथं तु राजन् दद्याद् भवान् दयितं च मेऽद्य॥'}

{'en': 'The king said: Having given away anything, I never boast of it; I never also listen to the prayers for things which cannot be given. But I (always) hear the prayers for things that can be given. Giving away, I always become happy.', 'sn': 'राजोवाच न चानुकीर्तयेदद्य दत्त्वा अयाच्यमर्थं न च संशृणोमि। प्राप्यमर्थं च संश्रुत्य तं चापि दत्त्वा सुसुखी भवामि॥'}

{'en': 'I shall give you one thousand kine; the Brahmana who asks me for a gift is always very dear to me. I am never angry with a man who asks of me and I am never sorry for having given away.', 'sn': 'ददामि ते रोहिणीनां सहस्रं प्रियो हि मे ब्राह्मणो याचमानः। न मे मनः कुप्यति याचमाने दत्तं न शोचामि कदाचिदर्थम्॥'}

{'en': 'Markandeya said : Having said this. the king gave one thousand kine to the Brahmanas and the Brahmana also obtained one thousand kine.', 'sn': 'इत्युक्त्वा ब्राह्मणाय राजा गोसहस्रं ददौ। प्राप्तवांश्च गवां सहस्रं ब्राह्मण इति॥'}

{'en': 'Brihadashva said: O son of Kunti, the prince of the Nishadhas, having lived there for about a month, obtained permission of Bhima and went, with a small number of attendants, to the country of the Nishadhas.', 'sn': 'बृहदश्व उवाच स मासमुष्य कौन्तेय भीममामन्त्र्य नैषधः। पुरादल्पपरीवारो जगाम निषधान् प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'That agile and lofty-minded monarch, who was swelled with rage, entered the country of the Nishadhas speedily, with a single white car, sixteen elephants, fifty horse and six hundred infantry and thereby he trembled the whole earth.', 'sn': 'रथेनैकेन शुभ्रेण दन्तिभिः परिषोडशैः। पञ्चाशद्भिर्हयैश्चैव षट्शतैश्च पदातिभिः॥ स कम्पयन्निव महीं त्वरमाणो महीपतिः। प्रविवेशाथ संरब्धस्तरसैव महामनाः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the heroic son of Virasena, advancing towards Pushkara (his brother), expressed his intention to play at dice; because he again earned vast wealth. Nal Said, "O Pushkara, let Damayanti and everything else, that I have, by my stake; and let your kingdom be yours. Let the game at dice begin again; for this is my firm resolution. Be you happy. Let us stake all that we possess, as well as our lives.', 'sn': 'ततः पुष्करमासाद्य वीरसेनसुतो नलः। उवाच दीव्याव पुनर्बहुवित्तं मयार्जितम्॥ दमयन्ती च यच्चान्यन्मम किंचन विद्यते। एष वै मम संन्यासस्तव राज्यं तु पुष्कर॥ पुनः प्रवर्ततां द्यूतमिति मे निश्चिता मतिः। एकपाणेन भद्रं ते प्राणयोश्च पणावहे॥'}

{'en': "To stake back other's possessions, that is, wealth and kingdom, that are already won, is said to be the chief virtue.", 'sn': 'जित्वा परस्वमाहृत्य राज्यं वा यदि वा बसु। प्रतिपाणः प्रदातव्यः परमोधर्म उच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'If you do not like the game at dice, do you then engage yourself in the play at weapons. Really, O king, let us have peace by fighting out a duel.', 'sn': 'न चेद् वाञ्छसि त्वं युद्धद्यूतं प्रवर्तताम्। द्वैरथेनास्तु वै शान्तिस्तव वा मम वा नृप॥'}

{'en': 'The sages have laid down their authority by saying, that the ancestral kingdom should be obtained under any circumstance or by any means.', 'sn': 'वंशभोज्यमिदं राज्यमर्थितव्यं यथा तथा। येन केनाप्युपायेन वृद्धानामिति शासनम्॥'}

{'en': 'O Pushkara, do you choose today one of these two; that is, do you either game at dice or bend the bow in battle.', 'sn': 'द्वयोरेकतरे बुद्धिः क्रियतामद्य पुष्कर। कैतवेनाक्षवत्यां तु युद्धे वा नाम्यतांधनुः॥'}

{'en': 'Brihadashva said: Having been thus addressed by the prince of the Nishadhas, Pushkara, with the assurance of his own success, answered the king smilingly.', 'sn': 'नैषधेनैवमुक्तस्तु पुष्करः प्रहसन्निवा ध्रुवमात्मजयं मत्वा प्रत्याह पृथिवीपतिम्॥'}

{'en': '“O Naishadha, by good fortune you have acquired the vast wealth, in order to stake it back again. Most fortunately the adversity of Damayanti has come to an end.', 'sn': 'दिष्ट्या त्वयार्जितं वित्तं प्रतिपाणाय नैषध। दिष्ट्या च दुष्कृतं कर्म दमयन्त्याः क्षयं गतम्॥'}

{'en': 'O monarch, O mighty-armed one, that you are still living with your wife, is owing to your good luck. Indeed, the daughter of king Bhima, decked in ornaments, will attend me with all the wealth, that I will gain from you, even as the Apsaras wait upon Shakra in heaven. O prince of the Nishadhas, do I, therefore, recollect you and expect you always.', 'sn': 'दिष्ट्या च ध्रियसे राजन् सदारोऽद्य महाभुज। धनेनानेन वै भैमी जितेन समलंकृता।॥ देवनेन मम मामुपस्थास्यति व्यक्तं दिवि शक्रमिवाप्सराः। नित्यशो हि स्मरामि त्वां प्रतीक्षेऽपि च नैषध॥'}

{'en': 'To play at dicc with those that are not my relatives, gives me no pleasure. Having this day obtained the hand of Damayanti, who is most beautiful and possessed of blameless features, I shall think myself very lucky, for she is, as ever, the darling of my heart.”', 'sn': 'प्रीतिर्न भवत्यसुहृद्गणैः। जित्वा त्वद्य वरारोहां दमयन्तीमनिन्दिताम्॥ कृतकृत्यो भविष्यामि सा हि मे नित्यशो हृदि।'}

{'en': 'Having heard these expressions of that infatuated braggart, king Nala became filled with rage and desired to sever his head by the sword. King Nala smilingly, though his eyes were red with anger, addressed him, saying,', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा तु तस्य ता वाचो बह्वबद्धप्रलापिनः॥ इयेष स शिरश्छेत्तुं खड्नेन कुपितो नलः। स्मयंस्तु रोषताम्राक्षस्तमुवाच नलो नृपः॥'}

{'en': '"Let us begin the play. Why do you speak thus now? You will speak in any way you like, after you shali have defeated me at dice.” Thereupon the gambling began between Pushkara and Nala. Pushkara, who had even staked his own life, was defeated at a single throw by Nala; and thus he lost all his wealth and treasures.', 'sn': 'पणावः किं व्याहरसे जितो न व्याहरिष्यसि। ततः प्रावर्तत द्यूतं पुष्करस्य नलस्य च॥ एकपाणेन वीरेण लेन स पराजितः। स रत्नकोशनिचयैः प्राणेन पणितोऽपि च॥'}

{'en': 'The king, having defeated Pushkara, laughingly saidto him: "This entire kingdom is now undisputedly mine. The thorns (the enemies) are all destroyed. O worst of kings, now you are not able even to have a look of Vaidharbhi. O foolish one, you are now reduced to her slave with your family.', 'sn': 'जित्वा च पुष्करं राजा प्रहसन्निदमब्रवीत्। मम सर्वमिदं राज्यमव्यग्रं हतकण्टकम्॥ वैदर्भी न त्वया शक्या राजापसद वीक्षितुम्। तस्यास्त्वं सपरीवारो मूढ दासत्वमागतः॥'}

{'en': 'That formerly I was defeated by you, was not wrought by you. That act was done by Kali; and it was not you, that did so. O stupid one, this you do not understand.', 'sn': 'न त्वया तत् कृतं कर्म येनाहं विजितः पुरा। कलिना तत् कृतं कर्म त्वं च मूढ न बुध्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'I will never attribute the faults, committed by others, to you. Indeed, do you live happily. I grant you your life.', 'sn': 'नाहं परकृतं दोषं त्वय्याधास्ये कथंचन। यथासुखं वै जीव त्वं प्राणानवसृजामि ते॥'}

{'en': 'As before, I give you your portion of the whole kingdom. O hero, the amount of my love for you is doubtlessly the same as before.', 'sn': 'तथैव सर्वसम्भारं स्वमंशं वितरामि ते। तथैव च मम प्रतिस्त्वयि वीर न संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'O Pushkara, the fraternal love, that I entertain for you, will never decrease. You are my brother. Do you live for a hundred years.', 'sn': 'सौहार्द चापि मे त्वत्तो न कदाचित् प्रहास्यति। पुष्कर त्वं हि मे भ्राता संजीव शरदः शतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having thus accosted his brother, Nala of undaunted courage embraced him repeatedly and asked him to go to his own city.', 'sn': 'एवं नल: सान्त्वयित्वा भ्रातरं सत्यविक्रमः। स्वपुरं प्रेषयामास परिष्वज्य पुनः पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'O king, having been thus consoled by the prince of the Nishadhas, Pushkara then, with folded hands, saluted and answered that virtuous prince, saying, “O prince, let your fame be immortal; and do you live at peace for hundred years, for you have give to me both life and shelter."', 'sn': 'सान्त्वितो नैषाधेनैवं पुष्करं प्रत्युवाच तम्। पुण्यश्लोकं तदा राजन्नभिवाद्य कृताञ्जलिः॥ कीर्तिरस्तु तवाक्षय्या जीव वर्षशतं सुखी। यो मे वितरसि प्राणानधिष्ठानं च पार्थिव॥'}

{'en': 'O monarch, having been thus honoured by the king (his brother, Nala). Pushkara, gratified at heart, then repaired to his own city attended by his relatives, after he has passed about a month with his brother. O foremost of men, also attended by a great force and humble servants, Pushkara went away; and he looked like the resplendent sun in appearance.', 'sn': 'स तथा सत्कृतो राज्ञा मासमुष्य तदा नृप। प्रययौ पुष्करो हृष्टः स्वपुरं स्वजनावृतः॥ महत्या सेनया साधू विनीतैः परिचारकैः। भ्राजमान इवादित्यो वपुषा पुरुषर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'After having settled Pushkara and enriched and delivered him from all anxieties, the blessed prince entered his own palace, most gorgeously decorated.', 'sn': 'प्रस्थाप्य पुष्करं राजा वित्तवन्तमनामयम्। प्रविवेश पुरं श्रीमानत्यर्थमुपशोभिताम्॥'}

{'en': 'After having entered the palace, the prince of the Nishadhas consoled all the citizens, who, as well as the subjects from the country, again, greatly expressed their satisfaction,', 'sn': 'प्रविश्य सान्वयामास पौरांश्च निषधाधिपः। पौरा जानपदाश्चापि सम्प्रहृष्टतनूरुहाः॥'}

{'en': 'All the officers of government, headed by their minister, addressed him with folded hands, saying, "O king, really we are all glad today both in the city and the country, even as the gods themselves, after having obtained their chief of a hundred sacrifices for worship."', 'sn': 'ऊचुः प्राञ्जलयः सर्वे सामात्यप्रमुखा जनाः। अद्य स्म निर्वृता राजन् पुरे जनपदेऽपि च। उपासितुं पुन: प्राप्ता देवा इव शतक्रतुम्॥'}

{'en': 'Brihadashva said : Having heard all these, Damayanti became afflicted with sorrow; and, suspecting that le must be Nala, addressed Keshini, saying,', 'sn': 'बृहदश्व उवाच दमयन्ती तु तच्छ्रुत्वा भृशं शोकपरायणा। शङ्कमाना नलं तं वै केशिनीमिदमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': '"O Keshini, do you go again and scrutinize the conduct of Bahuka; and keeping yourself in silence at his side, behold all his bevaviours.', 'sn': 'गच्छ केशिनि भूयस्त्वं परीक्षां कुरु बाहुके। अब्रुवाणा समीपस्था चरितान्यस्य लक्षय॥'}

{'en': 'O beautiful one, find out the cause, whenever he does anything; and marks well whenever he performs anything skillful.', 'sn': 'यदा च किंचित् कुर्यात् स कारणं तत्र भामिनि। तत्र संचेष्टमानस्य लक्षयन्ती विचेष्टितम्॥'}

{'en': 'O Keshini, whenever he may ask fire or water, you will not be in a hurry to give it; and thus obstruct him.', 'sn': 'न चास्य प्रतिबन्धेन देयोऽग्निरपि केशिनि। याचते न जलं देयं सर्वथा त्वरमाणया॥'}

{'en': '"Seeing all these, do you let me know his conduct, as also what human or super-human will be seen in Bahuka. Do you also report to me what else you will see in him."', 'sn': 'एतत् सर्वं समीक्ष्य त्वं चरितं मे निवेदया निमित्तं यत् त्वया दृष्टं बाहुके दैवमानुषम्॥ यच्चान्यदपि पश्येथास्तच्चाख्येयं त्वया मम।'}

{'en': 'Thus spoken by Damayanti, Keshini went away. Having learnt the behaviours of that person, who was versed in the knowledge of horses, Keshini returned.', 'sn': 'दमयन्त्यैवमुक्ता सा जगामाथ च केशिनी॥ निशम्याथ हयज्ञस्य लिङ्गानि पुनरागमत्।'}

{'en': 'She reported to Damayanti the whole history, mentioning what human superhuman she saw in Bahuka.', 'sn': 'सा तत् सर्वं यथावृत्तं दमयन्त्यै न्यवेदयत्। निमित्तं यत् तया दृष्टं बाहुके दैवमानुषम्॥'}

{'en': "Keshini said: O Damayanti, I have never heard or seen before any person of his character, having so great a 'power over the elements.'", 'sn': 'केशिन्युवाच दृढं शुच्युपचारोऽसौ न मया भानुषः क्वचित्। दृष्टपूर्वः श्रुतो वापि दमयन्ति तथाविधः॥'}

{'en': 'Whenever he comes to a narrow hole, he never stoops low; rather the hole opens wide at his touch; and he easily passes through it.', 'sn': 'ह्रस्वमासाद्य संचारं नासौ विनमते क्वचित्। तं तु दृष्ट्वा यथासंगमुत्सर्पति यथासुखम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thus a small hole grows largely wide at his coming. There were sent by the king (Bhima) various sorts of food, as also flesh of many animals, for Rituparna. There were also many vessels sent for washing the flesh.', 'sn': 'संकटेऽप्यस्य सुमहान् विवरो जायतेऽधिकः। ऋतुपर्णस्य चार्थाय भोजनीयमनेकशः॥ प्रेषितं तत्र राज्ञा तु मांसं चैव प्रभूतवत्। तस्य प्रक्षालनार्थाय कुम्भास्तत्रोपकल्पिताः॥'}

{'en': 'Those vessels, whenever looked at by him (Bahuka), became at once filled with water. Thereupon Bahuka washed them and set himself to cooking. Then again he grasped a handful of grass and held it to the sun, where suddenly fire blazed up.', 'sn': 'ते तेनावेक्षिताः कुम्भाः पूर्णा एवाभवंस्ततः। ततः प्रक्षालनं कृत्वा समधिश्रित्य बाहुकः॥ तृणमुष्टिं समादाय सवितुस्तं समादधत्। अथ प्रज्वलितस्तत्र सहसा हव्यवाहनः॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding that greatest wonder, I was struck with astonishment and have come hither. Also another great wonder was marked by me in him.', 'sn': 'तदद्भुततमं दृष्ट्वा विस्मिताहमिहागता। अन्यच्च तस्मिन् सुमहदाश्चर्यं लक्षितं मया।॥'}

{'en': 'O beautiful one, although he touched fire, still he was not burnt. The water, falling at his command, flowed rapidly.', 'sn': 'यदग्निमपि संस्पृश्य नैवासौ दह्यते शुभे। छन्देन चोदकं तस्य वहत्यावर्जितं दुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'I have marked another wonder, which was extraordinarily great, that he took some flowers in his hands and pressed them slowly. Although these flowers were pressed by him with the hands, yet they, instead of losing their original forms, became more fragrant and beautiful than before. Observing those marks of wonder, I have hastily come here.', 'sn': 'अतीव चान्यत् सुमहदाश्चर्यं दृष्टवत्यहम्। यत् स पुष्पाण्युपादाय हस्ताभ्यां ममृदे शनैः॥ मृद्यमानानि पाणिभ्यां तेन पुष्पाणि नान्यथा। भूय एव सुगन्धीनि हृषितानि भवन्ति हि। एतान्यद्भुतलिङ्गानि दृष्ट्वाहं दुतमागता॥'}

{'en': 'Brihadashva said : Having heard of those wonderful behaviours of that righteous one and having known him by his acts, Damayanti considered that Nala was obtained.', 'sn': 'बृहदश्व उवाच दमयन्ती तु तच्छ्रुत्वा पुण्यश्लोकस्य चेष्टितम्। अमन्यत नलं प्राप्तं कर्मचेष्टाभिसूचितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Again, by these marks suspecting Bahuka to be her husband, Damayanti wept and again addressed Keshini in a sweet speech, "O handsome one, do you go again and fetch here from the kitchen, without the knowledge of Bahuka, some meat cooked by him." The beneficent lady instantly went to Bahuka; and immediately returned, taking some hot meat therefrom.', 'sn': 'सा शङ्कमाना भर्तारं बाहुकं पुनरिङ्गितैः। केशिनीं श्लक्ष्णया वाचा रुदती पुनरब्रवीत्॥ पुनर्गच्छ प्रमत्तस्य बाहुकस्योपसंस्कृतम्। महानसाद् द्रुतं मांसमानयस्वेह भाविनि॥ सा गत्वा बाहुकस्याचे तन्मांसमपकृष्य च। अत्युष्णमेव त्वरिता तत्क्षणात् प्रियकारिणी॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of the Kuru race, thereupon Keshini gave the meat to Damayanti, who had, during the past days, very often tasted meat boiled by Nala.', 'sn': 'दमयन्त्यै ततः प्रादात् केशिनी कुरुनन्दन। सो चिता नलसिद्धस्य मांसस्य बहुशः पुरा॥'}

{'en': 'Thus tasting the meat brought by her female servant, she decided the charioteer to be Nala himself; and, inuch aggrieved, she wept bitterly. Overtaken by great calamity, she then washed her face. O Bharata, thereafter she sent her two children with Keshini. Bahuka recognised Indrasena with her brother. Thereupon the monarch (in the guise of Bahuka) came up speedily and, embracing his children, placed them on his lap. Then again, embracing his children, who were like the children of the celestials, Bahuka became filled with the greatest misery and wept bitterly in a soft voice. Thus having cxprcsscd his mental derangement over and over again, the prince of the Nishadhas left the children all on a sudden and spoke Keshini there words,', 'sn': 'प्राश्य मत्वा नलं सूतं प्राक्रोशद् भृशदुःखिता। वैक्लव्यं परमं गत्वा प्रक्षाल्य च मुखं ततः॥ मिथुनं प्रेषयामास केशिन्या सह भारत। इन्द्रसेनां सह भ्रात्रा समभिज्ञाय बाहुकः॥ अभिद्रुत्य ततो राजा परिष्वज्याङ्कमानयत्। बाहुकस्तु समासाद्य सुतौ सुरसुतोपमौ॥ भृशं दुःखपरीतात्मा सुस्वरं प्ररुरोद ह। नैषधो दर्शयित्वा तु विकारमसकृत् तदा। उत्सृज्य सहसा पुत्रौ केशिनीमिदमब्रवीत्॥'}
{'en': '"O beauteous one, these twins are like iny own children. Hence seeing them suddenly, I shed tears.', 'sn': 'इदं च सदृशं भद्रे मिथुनं मम पुत्रयोः। अतो दृष्ट्वैव सहसा बाष्पमुत्सृष्टवानहम्॥'}

{'en': 'If you come to me very often, people may think evil; because we are men of other country. So, O handsome one, do you go away hence with ease."', 'sn': 'बहुशः सम्पतन्तीं त्वां जनः संकेतदोषतः। वयं च देशातिथयो गच्छ भद्रे यथासुखम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Then that Lord of eyes like lotus-petals, having entered into the matchless mansion of Arjuna, touched water and on the smooth and auspicious floor.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच ततोऽर्जुनस्य भवनं प्रविश्याप्रतिमं विभुः। स्पृष्ट्वाम्भः पुण्डरीकाक्षः स्थण्डिले शुभलक्षणे॥'}

{'en': 'Spread an auspicious bed made of Kushamass of the hue of lapises. Thereafter, with garlands of flowers, fried paddy and perfumes and other auspicious articles.', 'sn': 'संतस्तार शुभां शय्यां दभैदूर्यसंनिभैः। ततो माल्येन विधिवल्लजैर्गन्धैः सुमङ्गलैः॥'}

{'en': 'He decorated that bed and then kept around it many excellent weapons. Then when Partha also had touched water, obedient and humble servants.', 'sn': 'अलंचकार तां शय्यां परिवार्यायुधोत्तमैः। ततः स्पृष्टोदके पार्थे विनीताः परिचारकाः॥'}

{'en': "Performed the usual nightly ceremony of offering victims to the three-eyed Mahadeva. Thereafter with a delighted heart, Pritha's son, with perfumes and garlands.", 'sn': 'दर्शयन्तोऽन्तिके चकुर्नैशं त्रैयम्बकं बलिम्। ततः प्रीतमनाः पार्थो गन्धमाल्यैश्च माधवम्॥'}

{'en': 'Adorned Madhava and then offered him the nightly offering. The Govinda with a smile thus spoke to Phalguna.', 'sn': 'अलंकृत्योपहारं तं नैशं तस्मै न्यवेदयत्। स्मयमानस्तु गोविन्दः फाल्गुनं प्रत्यभाषत॥'}

{'en': '“O son of Pritha, lay yourself down for sleep; good betide you, I go in search of your welfare.” Then placing at the door well-armed sentinels and door-keepers.', 'sn': 'सुप्यतां पाथ्र भद्रं ते कल्याणाय व्रजाम्यहम्। स्थापयित्वा ततो द्वा:स्थान् गोप्तुंश्चात्तायुधान् नरान्॥६'}

{'en': 'The auspicious Krishna followed by Daruka, entered his own tent. Then he laid himself down on his milk-white bed and brooded over the diverse measures (to be adopted on the morrow).', 'sn': 'दारुवानुगतः श्रीमान् विवेश शिबिरं स्वकम्। शिश्ये च शयने शुभ्रे बहुकृत्यं विचिन्तयन्॥'}

{'en': "Then that illustrious one of eyes resembling lotus-petals, for Partha's sake, began to reflect on various measures that would drive away the one latter's grief and sorrow and increase his energy and effulgence.", 'sn': 'पार्थाय सर्वे भगवान् शोकदुःखापहं विधिम्। व्यदधात् पुण्डरीकाक्षस्तेजोद्युतिविवर्धनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then that of soul engaged in meditation, that foremost lord of all, viz., Vishnu of wide-spread renown, who always performed what was agreeable to Jishnu, had recourse to Yoga-meditation, for benefiting Arjuna.', 'sn': 'योगमास्थाय युक्तात्मा सर्वेषामीश्वरेश्वरः। श्रेयस्कामः पृथुयशा विष्णुर्जिष्णुप्रियंकरः॥'}

{'en': 'During that night none enjoyed sleep in the camp of the Pandavas. During that night, O ruler of men, wakefulness possessed every body.', 'sn': 'न पाण्डवानां शिबिरे कश्चित् सुष्वाप तां निशाम्। प्रजागरः सर्वजनं ह्याविवेश विशाम्पते॥'}

{'en': '“The wielder of the Gandiva bow, the highsouled Arjuna, being afflicted sore with grief on account of the death of his son, has rashly vowed the slaughter of the king of the Sindhus.', 'sn': 'पुत्रशोकाभितप्तेन प्रतिज्ञातो महात्मना। सहसा सिन्धुराजस्य वधो गाण्डीवधन्वना॥'}

{'en': 'How indeed shall the mighty-armed son of Vasava, that slayer of hostile heroes, fulfill his vow?" Even thus did they then think.', 'sn': 'तत् कथं नु महाबाहुर्वासविः परवीरहा। प्रतिज्ञां सफलां कुर्यादिति ते समचिन्तयन्॥'}

{'en': '"The vow which the high-souled son of Pandu has made, is a very difficult one. King Jayadratha is endued with great energy. may Arjuna successfully observe his vow!', 'sn': 'कष्टं हीदं व्यवसितं पाण्डवेन महात्मना। पुत्रशोकाभितप्तेन प्रतिज्ञा महती कृता॥'}

{'en': "Indeed Arjuna has made a tremendous resolve, being highly afflicted with the grief on account of his son's death. The brothers (of Duryodhana) are very powerful and his army is numerous.", 'sn': 'सच राजा महावीर्यः पारयत्वर्जुनः स ताम्। भ्रातरश्चापि विक्रान्ता बहुलानि बलानि च॥'}

{'en': 'The son of Dhritarashtra (Duryodhana) has also employed them all in the protection of his (Jayadratha). May Dhananjaya return safe, having slain the ruler of the Sindhus!', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्रेण सर्वे तस्मे निवेदितम्। स हत्वा सैन्धवं संख्ये पुनरेतु धनंजयः॥'}

{'en': 'Let Arjuna fulfill his vow and vanquish his enemies. If tomorrow he fails to slay the Sindhu king, he will enter the blazing fire.', 'sn': 'जित्वा रिपुगणांश्चैव पारयत्वर्जुनो व्रतम्। श्वोऽहत्वा सिन्धुराजं वै धूमकेतुं प्रवेक्ष्यति॥'}

{'en': "Pritha's son Dhananjaya will never venture to falsify his vow. Oh, what will be the condition of king Yudhishthira, the son of Dharma, if Dhananjaya dies!", 'sn': 'न ह्यसावनृतं कर्तुमलं पार्थो धनंजयः। धर्मपुत्र कथं राजा भविष्यति मृतेऽर्जुने॥'}

{'en': "Indeed Pandu's son (Yudhishthira) has grafted all his hopes of victory on Arjuna. If we have acquired any religious merit, if we have ever given away things in charity, if we have burnt offerings on the fire.", 'sn': 'तस्मिन् हि विजयः कृत्स्नः पाण्डवेन समाहितः। यदि नोऽस्ति कृतं किञ्चिद् यदि दत्तं हुतं यदि॥'}

{'en': 'Then through the fruits of all those acts of ours, let Savyasachin (Arjuna) obtain victory." Thus, when they were talking to one another of the victory of Arjuna on the morrow, O lord.', 'sn': 'फलेन तस्य सर्वस्य सव्यसाची जयत्वरीन्। एवं कथयतां तेषां जयमाशंसतां प्रभो॥'}

{'en': 'O monarch, that live-long night at last passed away. During that night Janardana, having awaked.', 'sn': 'कृच्छ्रेण महता राजन् रजनी व्यत्यवर्तत। तस्यां रजन्यां मध्ये तु प्रतिबुद्धो जनार्दनः॥'}

{'en': 'And remembering the vow Pritha\'s son had made, thus addressed Daruka-"Afflicted with sorrow for the death of his dear-loved son, Arjuna has vowed.', 'sn': 'स्मृत्वा प्रतिज्ञां पार्थस्य दारुकं प्रत्यभाषत।। अर्जुनेन प्रतिज्ञातमार्तेन हतबन्धुना॥'}

{'en': "O Daruka, saying Before tomorrow's sun sets, I will slay Jayadratha-having heard of this vow, Duryodhana will surely hold counsel with his counsellors.", 'sn': 'जयद्रथं वधिष्यामि श्वोभूत इति दारुक। तत्तु दुर्योधनः श्रुत्वा मन्त्रिभिर्मन्त्रयिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'As to how Partha might be prevented from slaying Jayadratha in battle. His several Akshauhinis will also protect the latter;', 'sn': 'यथा जयद्रथं पार्थो न हन्यादिति संयुगे। अक्षौहिण्योहिताः सर्वारक्षिष्यन्ति जयद्रथम्॥'}

{'en': 'As also Drona and his son, both accomplished in the use of all sorts of weapons, will protect him. That matchless hero, the thousand-eyed Indra himself, that humiliator of the pride of Daityas and Danavas.', 'sn': 'द्रोणश्च सह पुत्रेण सर्वास्त्रविधिपारगः। एको वीरः सहस्राक्षो दैत्यदानवदर्पहा॥'}

{'en': "Even he will not venture to slay Jayadratha, if he is protected by Drona in battle. I, therefore, will do that in the morrow by which Kunti's son Arjuna.", 'sn': 'सोऽपि तं नोतसहेताजौ हन्तुं द्रोणेन रक्षितम्। सोऽहं श्वस्तत् करिष्यामि यथा कुन्तीसुतोऽर्जुनः।।२५'}

{'en': 'May slay Jayadratha before the sun goes down below the horizon. My wives, my friends, my kinsmen, my relatives.', 'sn': 'अप्राप्तेऽस्तं दिनकरे हनिष्यति जयद्रथम्। न हि दारा न मित्राणि ज्ञातयो न च बान्धवाः॥'}

{'en': "None among these is so dear to me as is Kunti's son Arjuna. O Daruka, bereft of Arjuna, for even a moment, this world.", 'sn': 'कश्चिदन्यः प्रियतरः कुन्तीपुत्रान्ममार्जुनात्। अनर्जुनमिमं लोकं मुहूर्तमपि दारुक॥'}

{'en': 'I will not be able to look at. And therefore, it shall not be so. Vanquishing them all, with their horses and elephants.', 'sn': 'उदीक्षितुं न शक्तोऽहं भविता न च तत् तथा। अहं विजित्य तान् सर्वान् सहसा सहयद्विपान्॥'}

{'en': 'I will slay them all with Karna and Duryodhana, for the sake of Arjuna. Tomorrow the three worlds will behold my prowess in the dreadful battle.', 'sn': 'अर्जुनार्थे हनिष्यामि सकर्णान् ससुयोधनान्। श्वो निरीक्षन्तु मे वीर्ये त्रयो लोका महाहवे॥'}

{'en': "When, O Daruka, I shall put forth my prowess for Arjuna's sake. Tomorrow thousands of kings and hundreds of princes.", 'sn': 'धनंजयार्थे समरे पराक्रान्तस्य दारुक। श्वो नरेन्द्रसहस्राणि राजपुत्रशतानि च॥'}

{'en': 'With their steeds, cars and elephants, will, O Daruka, turn hastily away from the battle. Tomorrow Daruka, you shall see the army of kings crushed with my discus.', 'sn': 'साश्वद्विपरथान्याजौ विद्रविष्यामि दारुका श्वस्तां चक्रप्रमथितां द्रक्ष्यसे नृपवाहिनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'And overthrown by my enraged self, for the sake of Arjuna. Tomorrow the celestials, the Gandharvas, the Pisachas, the reptiles and the Rakshasas.', 'sn': 'मया क्रुद्धेन समरे पाण्डवार्थे निपातिताम्। श्वः सदेवाः सगन्धर्वाः पिशाचोरगराक्षसाः॥'}

{'en': 'Will all know me to be the true friend of Savyasachin. He that injures him (Arjuna) injures me; and he that follows him follows me also.', 'sn': 'ज्ञास्यन्ति लोकाः सर्वे मां सुहृदं सव्यसाचिनः। यस्तं द्वेष्टि स मां द्वेष्टि यस्तं चानु स मामनु॥'}

{'en': 'With the help of your intelligence, do you identify Arjuna to be the half of my ownself. When the day dawns, O Daruka, equipping my best of chariots according to the rules of military science, you must bring it and follow me carefully. My mace Kaumodaki of celestial discus and my bow and arrows.', 'sn': 'इति संकल्प्यतां बुद्ध्या शरीरार्द्ध ममार्जुनः। यथा त्वं मे प्रभातायामस्यां निशि रथोत्तमम्॥ कल्पयित्वा यथाशास्त्रमादाय व्रज संयतः। गदा कौमोदकी दिव्यां शक्तिं चक्रं धनुः शरान्॥'}
{'en': 'make, my', 'sn': 'आरोप्य वै रथे सूत सर्वोपकरणानि च। स्थानं च कल्पयित्वाऽथ रथोपस्थे ध्वजस्य मे॥ वैनतेयस्य वीरस्य समरे रथशोभिनः। छत्रं जाम्बूनदैर्जालैरर्कज्वलनसप्रभैः॥'}

{'en': 'And many other implements of war-placing all these, O Suta, on my chariot and leaving room thereon for my standard and for heroic Garuda that adorns my car and yoking thereto my excellent steeds named Balahaka, Meghapuspa, Shaivya, Sugriva, having incased them in caparisons of gold of the effulgence of the solar orb and the fire and yourself donning your coat of mail, stay on it carefully. Having heard the shrille blast resembling the Rishabha note, of my conch Panchajanya, you will quickly come to me. In the course of a single day, O Daruka, I shall drive away the rage and the various woes of my cousin, the son of my paternal aunt. By every means, I shall so exert in battle, so that Vibhastu in battle.', 'sn': 'विश्वकर्मकृतैर्दिव्यैरश्वानपि विभूषितान्। बलाहकं मेघपुष्पं शैव्यं सुग्रीवमेव च॥ युक्तान् वाजिवरान् यत्तः कवचीतिष्ठ दारुका पाञ्चजन्यस्य निर्घोषमार्षभेणैव पूरितम्॥ श्रुत्वा च भैरवं नादमुपेयास्त्वं जवेन माम्। एकाह्राहममर्षं च सर्वदुःखानि चैव ह॥'}

{'en': 'May slay Jayadratha even before the very eyes of the Dhritarastras. All those for whose death Vibhatsu will strive, I tell your truly, will be slain and O charioteer, he will succeed in obtaining victory.', 'sn': 'भ्रातुः पैतृष्वसेयस्य व्यपनेष्यामि दारुक। सर्वोपायैर्यतिष्यामि हनिष्यति बीभत्सुराहवे॥ पश्यतां धार्तराष्ट्राणां हनिष्यति जयद्रथम्। यस्य यस्य च बीभत्सुर्वधे यत्नं करिष्यति। आशंसे सारसे तत्र भविताऽस्य ध्रुवो जयः॥'}

{'en': 'Daruka said Victory is sure to him and whence can defeat come to him, whose charioteership you, O foremost men, have accepted.', 'sn': 'दारुक उवाच जय एव ध्रुवस्तस्य कुत एव पराजयः। यस्य त्वं पुरुषव्याघ्र सारथ्यमुपजग्मिवान्॥'}

{'en': 'I shall do what you will bid me do. This night will end ushering in a morning, that will bring victory for Vijaya.', 'sn': 'एवं चैतत् करिष्यामि यथा मामनुशाससि। सुप्रभातामिमां रात्रिं जयाय विजयस्य हि॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said 0 best of the Bharata race, then king Yudhishthira, after placing his troops duly in battle-array against the army of Bhishma, thus spoke.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा स्वां सेनां समनोदयत्। प्रतिव्यूहन्ननीकानि भीष्मस्य भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandavas have now placed their troops in counter-array in the way laid down in the Shastras. O sinless ones, fight with fairness with the desire of obtaining the highest heaven.', 'sn': 'यथोद्दिष्टान्यनीकानि प्रत्यव्यूहन्त पाण्डवाः। स्वर्ग परममिच्छन्तः सुयुद्धेन कुरूद्वहाः॥'}

{'en': 'In the centre stood Shikhandin and his men protected by Arjuna. Dhrishtadyumna was in the front protected by Bhima.', 'sn': 'मध्ये शिखण्डिनोऽनीकं रक्षितं सव्यसाचिना। धृष्टद्युन्नश्चरन्नग्रे भीमसेनेन पालितः॥'}

{'en': 'O king, the southern division of the army was protected by that great bowman, the handsome Yuyudhana, that foremost of the Satvata heroes, who was equal to Indra himself.', 'sn': 'अनीकं दक्षिणं राजन् युयुधानेन पालितम्। श्रीमता सात्वदाचयेण शक्रेणेव धनुष्मता॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira was on a car which was worthy of carrying Indra himself. It was adorned with an excellent standard decked with gold and gems. It was furnished with golden traces. He stood in the midst of his elephant corps.', 'sn': 'महेन्द्रयानप्रतिम रथं तु सोपस्करं हाटकरत्नचित्रम्। युधिष्ठिरः काञ्चनभाण्डयोक्त्रं समास्थितो नागपुरस्य मध्ये॥'}

{'en': 'His milk-white umbrella, with ivory handle, held over his head, looked exceedingly beautiful. Many great Rishis walked round the king uttering the words of praise.', 'sn': 'समुच्छ्रितं दन्तशलाकमस्य सुपाण्डुरं छत्रमतीव भाति। प्रदक्षिणं चैनमुपाचरन्त महर्षयः संस्तुतिभिर्महेन्द्रम्॥'}

{'en': 'Many priests, Brahmanas, Rishis, Siddhas, as they walked round him, chanted hymns in his praise. They wished him the destruction of his enemies by the help of Tapas and mantras, efficacious drugs and various propitiatory ceremonies.', 'sn': 'पुरोहिताः शत्रुवधं वदन्तो ब्रह्मर्षिसिद्धाः श्रुतवन्त एनम्। जप्यैश्च मन्त्रैश्च महौषधीभिः समन्ततः स्वस्त्ययनं ब्रुवन्तः॥'}

{'en': 'The illustrious Kuru chief then gave away to the Brahmanas kine, fruits, flowers, golden coins and cloths. He marched like Indra, the chief of the celestial.', 'sn': 'ततः स वस्त्राणि तथैव गाश्च फलानि पुष्पाणि तथैव निष्कान्। कुरूत्तमो ब्राह्मणसान्महात्मा कुर्वन् ययौ शक्र इवामरेशः॥'}

{'en': "Arjuna's car, furnished with hundreds of bells, decked with gold, fitted with excellent wheels, endued with the effulgence of fire and yoked with best steeds, looked as brilliant as one thousand suns.", 'sn': 'सहस्रसूर्यः शतकिङ्किणीकः पराय॑जाम्बूनदहेमचित्रः। रथोऽर्जुनस्याग्निरिवार्चिमाली विभ्राजते श्वेतहयः सुचक्रः॥'}

{'en': 'On this (grand) car, which was driven by Keshava (Krishna) stood the ape-bannered hero with Gandiva (bow) and arrows in his hand, a great bow man whose equal there is none of earth or none will be.', 'sn': 'तमास्थितः केशवसंगृहीतं कपिध्वजो गाण्डिवबाणपाणिः। धनुर्धरो यस्य समः पृथिव्यां न विद्यते नो भविता कदाचित्॥'}

{'en': 'He who assumes the most terrible appearance for crushing your sons, he who without any weapon but only with his bare arms pounds to dust men, horses and elephants, that mighty armed Bhimasena that Vrikodara, accompanied by the twins (Nakula and Sahadeva) protected the (Pandava) warriors. Seeing the invincible Vrikodara like a fearful lion of sportive gait, like a proud leader of a herd of elephants, like the great Indra himself, your soldiers, with their strength weakened by fear, began to tremble like elephants sunk in mud.', 'sn': 'उद्वर्तयिष्यंस्तव पुत्रसेनामतीव रौद्रं स बिभर्ति रूपम्। अनायुधो यः सुभुजो भुजाभ्यां नराश्वनागान् युधि भस्म कुर्यात्॥ सहितो यमाभ्यां वृकोदरो वीररथस्य गोप्ता। तं तत्र सिंहर्षभमत्तखेलं लोके महेन्द्रप्रतिमानकल्पम्॥ समीक्ष्य सेनाग्रगतं दुरासदं संविव्यथुः पङ्कगता यथा द्विपाः। वृकोदरं वारणराजदएँ योधास्त्वदीया भयविग्नसत्त्वाः॥ स भीमसेनः'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, then Janardana (Krishna) thus spoke to that invincible hero Gudakesha standing in the midst of his troops.', 'sn': 'अनीकमध्ये तिष्ठन्तं राजपुत्रं दुरासदम्। अब्रवीद् भरतश्रेष्ठः गुडाकेशं जनार्दनः॥'}

{'en': 'He who scorches us with his wrath, he who stays in the midst of his force, he who will attack our troops like a lion, he who has performed three hundred Ashvamedha sacrifices, that banner of the Kuru race, that Bhishma, is yonder.', 'sn': 'वासुदेव उवाच य एष रोषात् प्रतपन् बलस्थो यो नः सेनां सिह इवेक्षते च। येनाहृतास्त्रिशतं वाजिमेधाः॥'}

{'en': 'Innumerable troops cover him on all sides as the clouds cover the bright luminary, the sun. O best of men, killing the troops, fight with that foremost chief of Bharata race.', 'sn': 'एतान्यनीकानि महानुभावं गृहन्ति मेघा इव रश्मिमन्तम्। एतानि हत्वा पुरुषप्रवीर काङ्क्षस्व युद्धं भरतर्षभेण॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said You are my eldest son, born of my eldest wife. Therefore, O son, be not jealous of the Pandavas, He who is jealous is always unhappy and suffer the death pangs.', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच त्वं वै ज्येष्ठो ज्यैष्ठिनेयः पुत्र मा पाण्डवान् द्विषः। द्वेष्टा ह्यसुखमादत्ते यथैव निधनं तथा॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, Yudhishthira does not know what deception is; he possesses wealth equal to yours; he has your friends for his; and he is not jealous of you. Why then are you jealous of him?', 'sn': 'अव्युत्पन्नं समानार्थं तुल्यमित्रं युधिष्ठिरम्। अद्विषन्तं कथं द्विष्यात् त्वादृशो भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'O prince, you are equal to Yudhishthira in friends and allies. Why should you then out of folly covet the property of your cousin? Be not so. Cease to be jealous. Do not grieve.', 'sn': 'तुल्याभिजनवीर्यश्च कथं भ्रातुः श्रियं नृप। पुत्र कामयसे मोहान्मैवं भूः शाम्य मा शुचः॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, if you desire to possess the dignity of performing a sacrifice, let Ritvijas arrange for you the great sacrifice, called Saptatantu.', 'sn': 'अथ यज्ञविभूतिं तां काङ्क्षसे भरतर्षभ। ऋत्विजस्तव तन्वन्तु सप्ततन्तुं महाध्वरम्॥'}
{'en': 'The kings will then gladly bring (for you) much wealth and many gems and ornaments.', 'sn': 'आहरिष्यन्ति राजानस्तवापि विपुलं धनम्। प्रीत्या च बहुमानाच्च रत्नान्याभरणानि च।॥'}

{'en': "O son, to covet other's property is exceedingly mean. He, who is contended and is engaged in the practices of his own order, enjoys happiness.", 'sn': 'अनार्याचरितं तात परस्वस्पृहणं भृशम्। स्वसंतुष्टः स्वधर्मस्थो यः स वै सुखमेधते॥'}

{'en': "Not to try to get the wealth of others, to perseveres in one's own affairs and to protect what has been earned, these are the indications of true greatness.", 'sn': 'अव्यापारः परार्थेषु नित्योद्योगः स्वकर्मसु। रक्षणं समुपात्तानामेतद् वैभवलक्षणम्॥'}

{'en': 'He who is unmoved in calamity, is skilled in his own business, is ever exerting, vigilant, and humble will always meet with prosperity.', 'sn': 'विपत्तिष्वव्यथो दक्षो नित्यमुत्थानवान् नरः। अप्रमत्तो विनीतात्मा नित्यं भद्राणि पश्यति॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandavas are like your arms; do not chop off your those arms. do not plunge yourself into internal dissensions coveting the wealth of your brothers.', 'sn': 'बाहूनिवैतान् मा छेत्सीः पाण्डुपुत्रास्तथैव ते। भ्रातृणां तद्धनार्थं वै मित्रद्रोहं च मा कुरु॥'}

{'en': "O prince, do not be jealous of the Pandavas. Your wealth is equal to that of your cousins. To quarrel with one's own friends is a great sin. They who are your grandsires are their grandsires also.", 'sn': 'स्तथैव ते भ्रातृधनं समग्रम्। मित्रद्रोहे तात महानधर्मः पितामहा ये तव तेऽपि तेषाम्॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, give away (wealth) in charity on the occasions of sacrifices; gratify every dear object of your desire; sport freely in the company of women, and enjoy peace.', 'sn': 'अन्तर्वेद्यां ददद् वित्तं कामाननुभवन् प्रियान्। क्रीडन् स्त्रीभिर्निरातङ्कः प्रशाम्य भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said In my opinion Sudakshina, of Kamboja, is equal to one Ratha and he will fight in the battle with the enemy desiring the success of your objects.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच सुदक्षिणस्तु काम्बोजो रथ एकगुणो मतः तवार्थसिद्धिमाकाङ्क्षन् योत्स्यते समरे परैः॥'}

{'en': 'The prowess of this best among car warriors excited on your behalf, O best among kings, the Kurus in battle with see equal to that of Indra himself.', 'sn': 'एतस्य रथसिंहस्य तवार्थं राजसत्तम। पराक्रमं यथेन्द्रस्य द्रक्ष्यन्ति कुरवो युधि॥'}

{'en': 'The best of car warriors under him are strikers with fierce force. The Kambojas, o great king, will cover like the land like a swarm of locusts.', 'sn': 'एतस्य रथवंशे हि तिग्मवेगप्रहारिणः। काम्बोजानां महाराज शलभानामिवायतिः॥'}

{'en': 'Nil of Mahishmati clad in a blue coat of mail is a Ratha of your army and with the car warriors under him he will work havoc among the enemy.', 'sn': 'नीलो माहिष्मतीवासो नीलवर्मा रथस्तव। रथवंशेन कदनं शत्रूणां वै करिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'My child, in former days, he was made an enemy by Sahadeva, and he will ever fight on your behalf, O you delighter of the Kuru race.', 'sn': 'कृतवैरः पुरा चैव सहदेवेन मारिष। योत्स्यते सततं राजंस्तवार्थं कुरुनन्दन॥'}

{'en': 'In my opinion Vindu and Anuvindu, the princes of Avanti, accomplished in battle and of firm strength and prowess are two of the best Rathas.', 'sn': 'विन्दानुविन्दावावन्त्यौ संमतौ रथसत्तमौ। कृतिनौ समरे तात दृढवीर्यपराक्रमौ॥'}

{'en': 'These two best among men will consume the army of enemy with maces, bearded darts, swords, muskets and long shafts hurled from their hands.', 'sn': 'एतौ तौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ रिपुसैन्यं प्रधक्ष्यतः। गदाप्रासासिनाराचैस्तोमरैश्च करच्युतैः॥'}

{'en': 'Desirous of war they will act in battle each like Yama like two sporting elephants moving in the midst of a herd, O king.', 'sn': 'युद्धाभिकामौ समरे क्रीडन्ताविव यूथपौ। यूथमध्ये महाराज विचरन्तौ कृतान्तवत्॥'}

{'en': 'In my opinion, the five Trigarta brothers are Rathas and they were made enemies by the sons of Pritha while in the city of Virata.', 'sn': 'त्रिगर्ता भ्रातरः पञ्च रथोदारा मता मम। कृतवैराश्च पार्थस्ते विराटनगरे तदा॥'}

{'en': 'In the battle, they will agitate the army of the son of Pritha like Makaras agitating the Ganga swollen with its waves.', 'sn': 'मकरा इव राजेन्द्र समुद्धततरङ्गिणीम्। गङ्गा विक्षोभयिष्यन्ति पार्थानां युधि वाहिनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'They are Rathas, O chief among kings, at whose head is Satyaratha and they will fight in the battle remembering the former wrongs.', 'sn': 'ते रथाः पञ्च राजेन्द्र येषां सत्यरथो मुखम्। एते योत्स्यन्ति संग्रामे संस्मरन्तः पुराकृतम्॥'}

{'en': "They were injured by Bhima's younger brother Arjuna, the son of Pandu, O king, when on a car drawn by white steeds, O Bharata, he went out to conquer all the quarters.", 'sn': 'व्यलीकं पाण्डवेयेन भीमसेनानुजेन ह। दिशो विजयता राजन् श्वेतवाहेन भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Having encountered many car warriors, chiefs of bowmen and leaders of Kshatriyas on the side of Parthas they will forsooth kill them', 'sn': 'ते हनिष्यन्ति पार्थानां तानासाद्य महारथान्। वरान् वरान् महेष्वासान् क्षत्रियाणां धुरन्धरान्॥'}

{'en': 'Your son Lakshmana and the son of Dushasana, both these foremost among men can never fly back from the battle.', 'sn': 'लक्ष्मणस्तव पुत्रश्च तथा दुःशासनस्य च। उभौ तौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ संग्रामेष्वपलायिनौ॥'}

{'en': 'The two young and delicate princes are of light hand and know all the details of fighting and are in every way fit to be leaders.', 'sn': 'तरुणौ सुकुमारौ च राजपुत्रौ तरस्विनौ। युद्धानां च विशेषज्ञौ प्रणेतारौ च सर्वशः॥'}

{'en': 'These two, O foremost among the Kurus, i am of opinion, are Rathas, and the heroes attached as they are to the duties of the Kshatriya will perform noble deeds.', 'sn': 'रथौ तौ कुरुशार्दूल मतौ मे रथसत्तमौ। क्षत्रधर्मरतौ वीरौ महत् कर्म करिष्यतः॥'}

{'en': 'That foremost among men, Dandadhara, O great king, is a Ratha and he will fight in your battle protected by his own army.', 'sn': 'दण्डधारौ महाराज रथ एको नरर्षभ। योत्स्यते तव संग्रामे स्वेन सैन्येन पालितः॥'}

{'en': 'Brihadbala, too, O king, the prince of the Shalyas, is one of the best among car warriors and is a Ratha, in my opinion, of great impetuosity and prowess.', 'sn': 'बृहद्बलस्तथा राजा कौसल्यो रथसत्तमः। रथो मम मतस्तात महावेगपराक्रमः॥'}

{'en': 'He will fight in the battle delighting his own friends, a wielder of terrible weapons as he is and a mighty bowman devoted to the good of the son of Dhritarashtra.', 'sn': 'एष योत्स्यति संग्रामे स्वान् बन्धून् सम्प्रहर्षयन्। उग्रायुधो महेष्वासो धार्तराष्ट्रहिते रतः॥'}

{'en': 'Kripa, the son of Sharadvata, Oking, is the general of the commanders of the Rathas, and careless of his dear life he will consume your enemies.', 'sn': 'कृपः शारद्वतो राजन् रथयूथपयूथपः। प्रियान् प्राणान् परित्यज्य प्रधक्ष्यति रिपूंस्तव॥'}

{'en': 'The son of the great Rishi Gautama, or the preceptor Sharadvata, born on a clump of health, is invincible as the war god Kartikeya himself.', 'sn': 'गौतमस्य महर्षर्य आचार्यस्य शरद्वतः। कार्तिकेय इवाजेयः शरस्तम्बात् सुतोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'Destroying this army strong in numbers and furnished with diverse weapons and bows he will roll in the battle like blazing fire.', 'sn': 'एष सेना: सुबहुला विविधायुधकार्मुकाः। अग्निवत् समरे तात चरिष्यति विनिर्दहन्॥'}

{'en': 'Brihadashva said: After Varshneya had gone away, his kingdom and what else of wealth he possessed, were won by Pushkara from Nala of good fame, who was engaged at dice.', 'sn': 'बृहदश्व उवाच ततस्तु याते वार्ष्णेये पुण्यश्लोकस्य दीव्यतः। पुष्करेण हृतं राज्यं यच्चान्यद् वसु किंचन॥'}

{'en': "O king! Pushkara said to Nala whose kingdom had been won from him, with a (sinister) smile:-'Let our game at dice commence anew, but what else to stake you have got now?'", 'sn': 'हृतराज्यं नलं राजन् प्रहसन् पुष्करोऽब्रवीत्। द्यूतं प्रवर्ततां भूयः प्रतिपाणोऽस्ति कस्तव॥'}

{'en': 'Damayanti alone is left to you; everything else has been won by me. Well if you think it right hold Damayanti as your stake now?', 'sn': 'शिष्टा ते दमयन्त्येका सर्वमन्यज्जितं मया। दमयन्त्याः पणः साधु वर्ततां यदि मन्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'Thus spoken to by Pushkara Nala of holy fame felt as if his heart would burst in grief. Neither did he speak a syllable to him.', 'sn': 'पुष्करेणैवमुक्तस्य पुण्यश्लोकस्य मन्युना। व्यदीर्यतेव हृदयं न चैनं किंचिदब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereafter Nala of high renown, possessed with extreme anguish, looking at Pushkara, began to take all the ornaments off every part of his body. Then wearing a single piece of cloth, with his person uncovered enhancing the gricſ of his friends and forsaking his vast wealth the king went out.', 'sn': 'ततः पुष्करमालोक्य नलः परममन्युमान्। उत्सृज्य सर्वगात्रेभ्यो भूषणानि महायशाः॥ एकवासा ह्यसंवीतः सुहृच्छोकविवर्धनः। निश्चक्राम ततो राजा त्यक्त्वा सुविपुलां श्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'Also Damayanti, attired in a single piece of cloth, followed the departing king behind. With her the king of Naishadha, passed three nights outside the precincts of the town.', 'sn': 'दमयन्त्येकवस्त्राथ गच्छन्तं पृष्ठतोऽन्वगात्। स तया बाह्यतः सार्धं त्रिरात्रं नैषधोऽवसत्॥'}

{'en': 'O mighty king in the meantime Pushkara had it proclaimed within the city, that any body that should regardfully (hospitably) behave towards Nala would become his victim.', 'sn': 'पुष्करस्तु महाराज घोषयामास वै पुरे। नले यः सम्यगातिष्ठेत् स गच्छेद् वध्यतां मम॥'}

{'en': 'O Yudhishthira! in consequence of this proclamation of Pushkara and his malice towards Nala, the citizens offered no respectful conduct towards him.', 'sn': 'पुष्करस्य तु वाक्येन तस्य विद्वेषणेन च। पौरा न तस्य सत्कारं कृतवन्तो युधिष्ठिर॥'}

{'en': "Thus unregarded, though worthy of their (citizen's) regards, that king stayed three nights outside the precincts of the city living, all the while solely on water.", 'sn': 'स तथा नगराभ्याशे सत्कारार्हो न सत्कृतः। त्रिरात्रमुषितो राजा जलमात्रेण वर्तयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Oppressed with hunger, the king started from the vicinity of the city with the object of collecting fruits and roots while Damayanti followed him (closely).', 'sn': 'पीड्यमानः क्षुधा तत्र फलमूलानि कर्षयन्। प्रातिष्ठत ततो राजा दमयन्ती तमन्वगात्॥'}

{'en': 'Afflicted sore with (the pangs of) hunger, after the lapse of many days, Nala saw some birds, the colour of whose plumage resembled that of gold.', 'sn': 'क्षुधया पीड्यमानस्तु नलो बहुतिथेऽहनि। अपश्यच्छकुनान् कांश्चिद्धिरण्यसदृशच्छदान्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the powerful ruler of the Nishadhas, thought (within himself)-My food today will consist of these and afterwards their plumage shall be my wealth.', 'sn': 'स चिन्तयामास तदा निषधाधिपतिर्बली। अस्ति भक्ष्यो ममाद्यायं वसु चेदं भविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Then he covered them with the piece of cloth he was wearing. Taking on their back that piece of cloth belonging to him, those rangers of the sky flew to the heavens.', 'sn': 'ततस्तान् परिधानेन वाससा स समावृणोत्। तस्य तद् वस्त्रामादाय सर्वे जग्मुर्विहायसा॥'}

{'en': 'When rising up (to the sky) the birds of the earth seeing Nala sorrowful and seated on the car with his person nude and countenance down towards the ground, addressed these words to him.', 'sn': 'उत्पदन्तः खगा वाक्यमेतदाहुस्ततो नलम्। दृष्ट्वा दिग्वाससं भूमौ स्थितं दीनमधोमुखम्॥'}

{'en': "'O greatly foolish one! we are even those dice. We had come hither desirous of robbing your cloth. For surely we feel no pleasure, even if you depart wearing your cloth.'", 'sn': 'वयमक्षाः सुदुर्बुद्धे तव वासो जिहीर्षवः। आगता न हि नः प्रीतिः सवाससि गते त्वयि॥'}

{'en': 'O king! then Nala of holy fame beholding the dice depart and himself naked, thus spoke of Damayanti. O unblameable lady! they, in consequence of whose wrath I have been deprived of my (royal) fortune and being distressed and oppressed with hunger I cannot procure my livelihood, they through whose (malign) influence the citizens of Naishadha paid me no regard, O timid one! those very dice have assumed the form of birds and are even now fiying away with my cloth.', 'sn': 'तान् समीपगतानक्षानात्मानं च विवाससम्। पुण्यश्लोकस्तदा राजन् दमयन्तीमथाब्रवीत्॥ येषां प्रकोपादैश्वर्यात् प्रच्युतोऽहमनिन्दिते। प्राणयात्रां न विन्देयं दुःखितः क्षुधयान्वितः॥ येषां कृते न सत्कारमकुर्वन् मयि नैषधाः। इमे ते शकुना भूत्वा वासो भीरु हरन्ति मे॥'}

{'en': 'I, your husband, have met with a great catastrophe. I am afflicted with sorrow and am devoid of my consciousness. Listen to my words, which (when acted upon) shall conduce to your good.', 'sn': 'वैषम्यं परमं प्राप्तो दुःखितो गतचेतनः। भर्ता तेऽहं निबोधेदं वचनं हितमात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'These various roads before you, passing by the (city of) Avanti and crossing the Rikshavat mountain lead to the Deccan.', 'sn': 'एते गच्छन्ति बहवः पन्थानो दक्षिणापथम्। अवन्तीमृक्षवन्तं च समतिक्रम्य पर्वतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Yonder is the mighty range of mountains known under the name of Vindhya; there is the river Payashini flowing toward the sea and you lie the hermitages of the illustrious sages replete with many kinds of fruits and roots. This road leads to Vidharbha, the other one proceeds towards the country of the Kosalas; beyond them in the southern direction lies the Deccan.', 'sn': 'एष विन्ध्यो महाशैलः पयोष्णी च समुद्रगा। आश्रमाश्च महर्षीणां बहुमूलफलान्विताः॥ एष पन्था विदर्भाणामसौ गच्छति कोसलान्। अतः परं च देशोऽयं दक्षिणे दक्षिणापथः॥'}

{'en': "Brihdashva said: O descendant of Bharata's race! addressing the daughter of Bhima, king Nala sorely afflicted with grief, carefully spoke these words to Damayanti, over and over again.", 'sn': 'बृहदश्व उवाच एतद् वाक्यं नलो राजा दमयन्तीं समाहितः। उवाचासकृदातॊ हि भैमीमुद्दिश्य भारत।॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon distressed with sorrow and in a voice choked with the vapour of grief, Damayanti spoke to Nala these piteous words.', 'sn': 'ततः सा बाष्पकलया वाचा दुःखेन कर्शिता। उवाच दमयन्ती तं नैषधं करुणं वचः॥'}

{'en': 'Damayanti said : O ruler of the earth! on continuous thinking of your intention, my heart trembles and all my limbs are sinking. How can I depart leaving you in this lonely forest, deprived of your kingdom despoiled of your wealth, yourself not covered even with a single piece of cloth and afflicted with hunger and toil?', 'sn': 'उद्वेजते मे हृदयं सीदन्त्यङ्गानि सर्वशः। तव पार्थिव संकल्पं चिन्तयन्त्याः पुनः पुनः॥ हृतराज्यं हृतद्रव्यं विवस्त्रं क्षुच्छ्रमान्वितम्। कथमुत्सृज्य गच्छेयमहं त्वां निर्जने वने।॥'}

{'en': 'O illustrious sovereign! when fatigued with toil and oppressed with hunger in the midst of this dreary wilderness, you shall remember your former happiness, then shall I solace you in your troubles.', 'sn': 'श्रान्तस्य ते क्षुधार्तस्य चिन्तयानस्य तत् सुखम्। वने घोरे महाराज नाशयिष्याम्यहं क्लमम्॥'}

{'en': "'In all descriptions of misery there is no medicine similar to a wife, this is the opinion of all the physicians, I tell the forsooth.", 'sn': 'न च भार्यासमं किंचिद् विद्यते भिषजां मतम्। औषधं सर्वदुःखेषु सत्यमेतद् ब्रवीमि ते॥'}

{'en': 'Nala said: O you of delicate loins! O Damayanti, what you have said, is indeed true; to a man aggrieved there is no friend equal to a wife that serves as a remedy.', 'sn': 'नल उवाच एवमेतद् यथाऽऽत्य त्वं दमयन्ति सुमध्यमे। नास्ति भार्यासमं मित्रं नरस्यार्तस्य भेषजम्॥'}

{'en': 'O timid one! why are you afraid? I do not intend to forsake you; O faultless one, I can part with myself, but not with you.', 'sn': 'न चाहं त्यक्त कामस्त्वां किमलं भीरु शङ्कसे। त्यजेयमहमात्मानं न चैव त्वामनिन्दिते॥'}

{'en': 'Damayanti said : O great monarch! if you seek not to desert me, why then do you instruct, (point out to) me, about the road that leads to the dominion of the Vidharbhas?', 'sn': 'दमयन्त्युवाच यदि मां त्वं महाराज न विहातुमिहेच्छसि। तत् किमर्थं विदर्भाणां पन्थाः समुपदिश्यते॥'}

{'en': 'O protector of your subjects! I know also that you cannot leave me. But, O ruler of the earth! you may renounce me, as your mind (reason) is spoiled (distracted) by Kali.', 'sn': 'अवैमि चाहं नृपते न तु मां त्यक्तुमर्हसि। चेतसा त्वपकृष्टेन मां त्यजेथा महीपते।॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of men! you are repeatedly instructing me about the road. O divine one! it is in this way that you are adding to my sorrow.', 'sn': 'पन्थानं हि ममाभीक्ष्णमाख्यासि च नरोत्तम। अतो निमित्तं शोकं मे वर्धयस्यमरोपम॥'}

{'en': 'If it be your wish that I should go back to my kinsmen, then if it list you, we both together shall repair to the kingdom of Vidharbha.', 'sn': 'यदि चायमभिप्रायस्तव ज्ञातीन् व्रजेदिति। सहितावेव गच्छावो विदर्भान् यदि मन्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'O bestower of honor! there, the king of the Vidharbhas shall worship you. Thus held in great respect by him, you shall live in happiness in our residence.', 'sn': 'विदर्भराजस्तत्र त्वां पूजयिष्यति मानद। तेन त्वं पूजितो राजन् सुखं वत्स्यसि नो गृहे॥'}

{'en': "Vaishampayana said : Thereupon all the artizans, the principal counsellors and the highly wise Vidura thus spoke to Dhritarashtra's son.", 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततस्तु शिल्पिनः सर्वे अमात्यप्रवराश्च ये। विदुरश्च महाप्राज्ञो धार्तराष्ट्र न्यवेदयन्॥'}

{'en': '“O king, all the preparations for the excellent sacrifice have been made. O descendant of Bharata, the (proper) time (to perform it) has also come. The greatly valuable golden plough has also been made."', 'sn': 'सज्ज क्रतुवरं राजन् प्राप्तकालं च भारत। सौवर्णं च कृतं सर्वं लागलं च महाधनम्॥'}

{'en': "O king, having heard this, that foremost of kings, Dhritarashtra's son commanded that foremost of sacrifices to be commenced. Then commenced that sacrifice sanctified by mantras and abounding in food. The son of Gandhari was duly installed according to the ordinance.", 'sn': 'एतच्छ्रुत्वा नृपश्रेष्ठो धार्तराष्ट्रो विशाम्पते। आज्ञापयामास नृपः क्रतुराजप्रवर्तनम्॥ ततः प्रववृते यज्ञः प्रभूतार्थः सुसंस्कृतः। दीक्षितश्चापि गान्धारिर्यथाशास्त्रं यथाक्रमम्॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra, the high-souled Vidura, Bhishma, Drona, Kripa and Karna and the illustrious Gandhari all were filled with great delight.', 'sn': 'प्रहृष्टो धृतराष्ट्रश्च विदुरश्च महायशाः। भीष्मो द्रोणः कृपः कर्णो गान्धारी च यशस्विनी॥'}
{'en': 'O king of kings, swift messengers were sent to invite the kings and the Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'निमन्त्रणार्थं दूतांश्च प्रेषयामास शीघ्रगान्। पार्थिवानां च राजेन्द्र ब्राह्मणानां तथैव च॥'}

{'en': 'Ascending swift cars, they went to the directions assigned to them. Then to one messenger at the point of starting thus spoke Dushashana.', 'sn': 'ते प्रयाता यथोद्दिष्टा दूतास्त्वरितवाहनाः। तत्र कंचित् प्रयातं तु दूतं दुःशासनोऽब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': '"Go soon to the forest of Dvaitavana and in that forest duly invite the Brahmanas and those wicked men, the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'गच्छ द्वैतवनं शीघ्रं पाण्डवान् पापपूरुषान्। निमन्त्रय यथान्यायं विप्रांस्तस्मिन् वने तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon he went there and bowing down his head to all the Pandavas said "O great king, the foremost of kings that Veda of the Kurus, Duryodhana is performing a sacrifice after having acquired immense wealth by his own prowess. Brahmanas from all quarters are going to it.', 'sn': 'स गत्वा पाण्डवान् सर्वानुवाचाभिप्रणम्य च। दुर्योधनो महाराज यजते नृपसत्तमः॥ स्ववीयर्जितमर्थौघमवाप्य कुरुसत्तमः। तत्र गच्छन्ति राजानो ब्राह्मणाश्च ततस्ततः॥'}

{'en': '"O king, I have been sent here by that illustrious Kuru king, the lord of men Dhritarashtra\'s son to invite you. You should therefore see that charming sacrifice of that king."', 'sn': 'अहं तु प्रेषितो राजन् कौरवेण महात्मना। आमन्त्रयति वो राजा धार्तराष्ट्रो जनेश्वरः॥ मनोऽभिलषितं राज्ञस्तं क्रतुं द्रष्टुमर्हथ।'}

{'en': "Having heard the words of the messenger that foremost of monarchs king Yudhishthira, thus spoke to him, “By good fortune, king Duryodhana, that enhancer of his forefather's glory, is performing this foremost of sacrifices.", 'sn': 'ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा तच्छ्रुत्वा दूतभाषितम्॥ अब्रवीनृपशार्दूलो दिष्ट्या राजा सुयोधनः। यजते क्रतुमुख्येन पूर्वेषां कीर्तिवर्धनः॥'}

{'en': 'We shall certainly go there, but we cannot do now. We shall have to live in the forest for thirteen years according to our pledge.”', 'sn': 'वयमप्युपयास्यामो न त्विदानी कथंचन। समयः परिपाल्यो नो यावद् वर्षं त्रयोदशम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing the words of Dharmaraja (Yudhishthira) Bhima thus spoke, "the king Dharmaraja Yudhishthira will then go when he will put him (Duryodhana) into the fire kindled by weapon. Speaks these words to Duryodhana “when at the end of the thirteenth year that lord of men, the Pandavas, will in the sacrifice of battle pour upon the sons of Dhritarashtra, the Ghee of his anger, then will I come.”', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वैतद् धर्मराजस्य भीमो वचनमब्रवीत्। तदा तु नृपतिर्गन्ता धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः॥ अस्त्रशस्त्रप्रदीप्तेऽग्नौ यदा तं पातयिष्यति। वर्षात् त्रयोदशादूर्ध्वं रणसत्रे नराधिपः॥ यदा क्रोधहविर्मोक्ता धार्तराष्ट्रेषु पाण्डवः। आगन्ताहं तदास्मीति वाच्यस्ते स सुयोधनः॥'}

{'en': "O king, the other Pandavas did not say anything unpleasant. The messenger on his return told everything to Dhritarashtra's son.", 'sn': 'शेषास्तु पाण्डवा राजन् नैवोचुः किंचिदप्रियम्। दूतश्चापि यथावृत्तं धार्तराष्ट्र न्यवेदयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Then there came to the city of Dhritarashtra many foremost of men, the rulers of various countries and also many highly virtuous Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'अथाजग्मुर्नरश्रेष्ठा नानाजनपदेश्वराः। ब्राह्मणाश्च महाभाग धार्तराष्ट्रपुरं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'Duly received in accordance the ordinance, these lords of men felt much delight and they were all well-pleased. to', 'sn': 'ते त्वर्चिता यथाशास्त्रं यथाविधि यथाक्रमम्। मुदा परमया युक्ताः प्रीताश्चापि नरेश्वराः॥'}

{'en': 'O king of kings that foremost of kings, Dhritarashtra, surrounded by all the Kurus felt the greatest joy and he thus spoke to Vidura.,', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्रोऽपि राजेन्द्र संवृतः सर्वकौरवैः। हर्षेण महता युक्तो विदुरं प्रत्यभाषत॥'}

{'en': '"O Khatva, soon act thus that all men present in this sacrifice may with food served to them be refreshed and satisfied.', 'sn': 'यथा सुखी जनः सर्व: क्षत्तः स्यादन्नसंयुतः। तुष्येत् तु यज्ञसदने तथा क्षिप्रं विधीयताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then the learned and the virtuous Vidura cheerfully entertained all the orders of men with foods and drinks and also with fragrant garland and various kinds of dresses.', 'sn': 'विदुरस्तु तदाज्ञाय सर्ववर्णानरिंदम। यथा प्रमाणतो विद्वान् पूजयामास धर्मवित्॥ भक्ष्यपेयान्नपानेन माल्यैश्चापि सुगन्धिभिः। वासोभिर्विविधैश्चैव योजयामास हृष्टवत्॥'}

{'en': "Having built many pavilions that hero and the foremost of kings, duly entertained the monarchs and the Brahmanas by thousands. He bestowed upon them wealth of various kinds and then bade them farewell. having dismissed all the kings, surrounded by his brothers. He (Duryodhana) entered Hastinapur in company with Karna and Subala's son (Shakuni).", 'sn': 'कृत्वा ह्यावसथान् वीरो यथाशास्त्रं यथाक्रमम्। सान्त्वयित्वा च राजेन्द्रो दत्त्वा च विविधं वसु।॥ विसर्जयामास नृपान् ब्राह्मणांश्च सहस्रशः। विसृज्य च नृपान् सर्वान् भ्रातृभिः परिवारितः॥ विवेश हास्तिनपुरं सहितः कर्णसौबलैः॥'}

{'en': "Sanjaya said O Sire, O descendant of Bharata, seeing that great and fearful Vyuha, formed by the immeasurably powerful Pandava, your son (Duryodhana) came to the preceptor, Kripa, Shalya, Somadatta's son, Vikarna, Ashvathama and all his brothers headed by Dushasana, and also all other mighty heroes, assembled there for battle, spoke these words giving great pleasures to all, “You are armed with various kinds of weapons, you are learned in the Shastras. O great car-warriors, each of you singly is capable of destroying the Pandavas with all their troops.", 'sn': 'संजय उवाच क्रौञ्चं दृष्ट्वा ततो व्यूहमभेद्यं तनयस्तव। रक्ष्यमाणं महाघोरं पार्थेनामिततेजसा।।शा आचार्यमुपसंगम्य कृपं शल्यं च पार्थिव। सौमदत्तिं विकर्णं च सोऽश्वत्थामानमेव च॥ दुःशासनादीन् भ्रातृ॑श्च सर्वानेव च भारत। अन्यांश्च सुबहूशूरान् युद्धाय समुपागतान्॥ प्राहेदं वचनं काले हर्षयंस्तनयस्तव। नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वै युद्धविशारदाः॥ एकैकशः समर्था हि यूयं सर्वे महारथाः।'}

{'en': 'How easy it is for you then (to destroy them) when you are united. Our army protected by Bhishma is unlimited and their army protected by Bhima is limited.', 'sn': 'पाण्डुपुत्रान् रणे हन्तुं ससैन्यान् किमु संहताः॥ अपर्याप्तं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम्। पर्याप्तमिदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Let the Samsthanas, the Shurasenas, the Vetarikas, the Kukuras, the Rechakas, the Trigartas, the Madrakas, the Yavanas, with Shatrunjaya and Dushasana, and with also that great hero Vikarna, Nanda, Upananda, and Chitrasena, with the Paribhadrakas protect Bhishma with their respective troops”.', 'sn': 'संस्थानाः शूरसेनाश्च वेत्रिकाः कुकुरास्तथा। आरोचकास्त्रिगर्ताश्च मद्रका यवनास्तथा॥ शत्रुजयेन सहितास्तथा दुःशासनेन च। विकर्णेन च वीरेण तथा नन्दोपनन्दकैः॥ चित्रसेनेन सहिताः सहिताः पारिभद्रकैः। भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु सहसैन्यपुरस्कृताः॥'}

{'en': 'O Sire, then Bhishma, Drona and your sons formed a great Vyuha to resist that of the sons of Pritha.', 'sn': 'ततो भीष्मश्च द्रोणश्च तव पुत्राश्च मारिष अव्यूहन्त महाव्यूहं पाण्डूनां प्रतिबाधकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then, like the lord of the celestial (Indra), Bhishma surrounded by innumerable troops, advanced at the head of a mighty army,', 'sn': 'भीष्मः सैन्येन महता समन्तात् परिवारितः। ययौ प्रकर्षन् महतीं वाहिनीं सुरराडिव॥'}

{'en': 'O king, that great bowman, that greatly powerful son of Bharadvaja (Drona) followed him with the Kuntalas, the Dasharnas, the Magadhas, the Vidarbhas, the Mekalas, the Karnas, and the Paravarnas, the Gandharvas, the Sindhusauviras, the Shibis, and the Vasati with their all combatants, Shakuni with all his troops protected the son of Bharadvaja.', 'sn': 'तमन्वयान्महेष्वासो भारद्वाजः प्रतापवान्। कुन्तलैश्च दशार्ङ्गश्च मागधैश्च विशाम्पते॥ विदर्भमैकलैश्चैव कर्णप्रावरणैरपि। सहिताः सर्वसैन्येन भीष्ममाहवशोभिनम्॥ गान्धाराः सिन्धुसौवीराः शिवयोऽथवसातयः। शकुनिश्च स्वसैन्येन भारद्वाजमपालयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Then king Duryodhana with all his brothers accompanied by the Ashvatakas, the Vikarnas, the Ambashta, the Kosalas, the Daradas, the Shaka, the Kshudrakas and the Malavas, Cheerfully advanced against the Pandava army.', 'sn': 'ततो दुर्योधनो राजा सहितः सर्वसोदरैः। अश्वातकैविकर्णैश्च तथा चाम्बष्ठकोसलैः॥ दरदैश्च शकैश्चैव तथा क्षुद्रकमालवैः। अभ्यरक्षत संहष्टः सौबलेयस्य वाहिनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'O sire, Bhurishrava, Shala and Shalya, Bhagadatta, Vinda and Anuvinda of Avanti protected the left wing.', 'sn': 'भूरिश्रवाः शलः शल्यो भगदत्तश्च मारिषः। विन्दानुविन्दावावन्त्यौ वामं पार्श्वमपालयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Somadatta, Susharma, the ruler of Kambojas, Sudakshina, Shrutayus and Achyutayu protected the right wing.', 'sn': 'सौमदत्तिः सुशर्मा च काम्बोजश्च सुदक्षिणः। श्रुतायुश्चाच्युतायुश्च दक्षिणं पक्षमास्थिताः॥'}
{'en': 'Ashvathama, Kripa, the Satvata hero Kritvarma, with large number of troops protected the rear.', 'sn': 'अश्वत्थामा कृपश्चैव कृतवर्मा च सात्वतः। महत्या सेनया साधु सेनापृष्ठे व्यवस्थिताः॥'}
{'en': 'Behind them stood many chiefs, Ketumata, Vasudana and the powerful prince of Kashi.', 'sn': 'पृष्ठगोपास्तु तस्यासन् नानादेश्या जनेश्वराः। केतुमान् वसुदानश्च पुत्रः काश्यस्य चाभिभूः॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, then all your troops, when they were cheerfully waiting for like roars.', 'sn': 'ततस्ते तावकाः सर्वे हृष्टा युद्धाय भारत। दध्मुः शङ्खान् मुदा युक्ताः सिंहनादांस्तथोन्नदन्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing these shouts, the greatly powerful and the venerable Kuru grandsire uttered a lion-like roar and then blew his conch in great delight.', 'sn': 'तेषां श्रुत्वा तु हृष्टानां वृद्धः कुरुपितामहः। सिंहनादं विनद्योच्चैः शङ्ख दध्मौ प्रतापवान्॥'}

{'en': 'Their conchs, drums, Peshis and cymbals were sounded by all, which created a fearful din all over the field of battle.', 'sn': 'ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पेश्यश्च विविधाः परे। आनकाश्चाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'Krishna and Arjuna riding on the same car yoked with (four) white horses, blew their excellent conchs adorned with gold and jewel.', 'sn': 'ततः श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ। प्रदध्मतुः शङ्खवरौ हेमरत्नपरिष्कृतौ॥'}

{'en': 'Hrishikesha (Krishna) blew the conch called Panchajanya and Dhananjaya Devadatta. That doer of fearful deeds, Vrikodara (Bhima) blew his huge conch, called Paundra.', 'sn': 'पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनंजयः। पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्ख भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः॥'}

{'en': 'The son of Kunti, Yudhishthira, blew the conch called Anantavijaya, Nakula and Sahadeva blew Sughosha and Manipushpaka.', 'sn': 'अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः। नकुलः सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ॥'}

{'en': 'The king of Kashi, and Shaivya and Shikhandin, the great car-warrior Dhrishtadyumna and Virata and the great carwarrior Satyaki and the great bowman the Panchala king, and also the five sons of Draupadi, all blew their large conches and sent forth lion-like roars.', 'sn': 'काशिराजश्च शैब्यश्च शिखण्डी च महारथः। धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्च महारथः॥ पाञ्चाल्याश्च महेष्वासा द्रौपद्याः पञ्च चात्मजाः। सर्वे दध्मुर्महाशङ्खान् सिंहनादांश्च नेदिरे॥'}

{'en': 'That great uproar, thus uttered by those heroes resounded through the sky. O great king, thus again the Kurus and the Pandavas advanced against each other with the intention of fighting a great battle. hinTrn-0', 'sn': 'स घोषः सुमहांस्तत्र वीरैस्तैः समुदीरितः। नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलो व्यनुनादयत्॥ एवमेते महाराज प्रहृष्टाः कुरुपाण्डवाः। पुनयुद्धाय संजग्मुस्तापयानाः परस्परम्॥'}

{'en': 'Markandeya said: One day the celestials resolved that they should go to the earth and try the virtue of the ruler of earth, Shivi. Saying “very well” Agni and Indra went (to earth).', 'sn': 'मार्कण्डेय उवाच देवानां कथा संजाता महीतलं गत्वा महीपति शिबिमौशीनरं साध्वेनं शिबिं जिज्ञास्याम इति। एवं भो इत्युक्त्वा अग्नीन्द्रावुपतिष्ठेताम्॥'}
{'en': 'Agni, assuming the form of a region flew away from Indra who pursued him in the form of a hawk.', 'sn': 'अग्निः कपोतरूपेण तमभ्यधावदामिषार्थमिन्द्रः श्येनरूपेणः॥'}
{'en': 'The pigeon fell on the lap of the king Shivi who was seated on a costly seat.', 'sn': 'अथ कपोतो राज्ञो दिव्यासनासीनस्योत्सङ्गं न्यपतत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the priest thus spoke to the king," Afraid of the hawk, this pigeon has come to you for his life with the intention of saving it.', 'sn': 'अथ पुरोहितो राजानमब्रवीत्। प्राणरक्षार्थं श्येनाद् भीतो भवन्तं प्राणार्थी प्रपद्यते॥'}

{'en': "The learned men have said that the fall of pigeon on one's lap forebodes a great danger. The king who understands men should save himself by giving away wealth.”", 'sn': 'वसु ददातु अन्तवान् पार्थिवोऽस्य निष्कृतिं कुर्याद् घोरं कपोतस्य निपातमाहुः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the pigeon thus spoke to the king. "Afraid of the hawk and desirous of saving my life, I have come to you for the safety of my life. I am a Rishi. Assuming now the form of a pigeon I have come to you to seek the protection of my life. I consider you my life.', 'sn': 'अथ कपोतो राजानमब्रवीत्। प्राणरक्षार्थं श्येनाद् भीतो भवन्तं प्राणार्थी प्रपद्ये अङ्गैरङ्गानि प्राप्यार्थी मुनिर्भूत्वा प्राणांस्त्वां प्रपद्ये॥'}

{'en': 'Know me as one who is learned in the Vedas, as one leading the life of a Brahmachari, as one who possesses selfcontrol and asceticism. Know me also as one who have never spoken a harsh word to his preceptor, as one possessed of every virtue and as one that is sinless.', 'sn': 'स्वाध्यायेन कर्शितं ब्रह्मचारिणं मां विद्धि। तपसा दमेन युक्तमाचार्यस्याप्रतिकूलभाषिणम्। एवं युक्तमपापं मां विद्धिा॥'}

{'en': 'I recite the Vedas, I know their prosody, I have studied all the Vedas letter per letter. I am not a pigeon. Therefore do not given me up to the hawk. Giving up a learned and a noble man is never a good gift."', 'sn': 'गदामि वेदान् विचिनोमि छन्दः सर्वे वेदा अक्षरशो मे अधीताः। न साधु दानं श्रोत्रियस्य प्रदान मा प्रादाः श्येनाय न कपोतोऽस्मि॥'}
{'en': 'Thereupon the hawk spoke Thus to the king.', 'sn': 'अथ श्येनो राजानमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Creatures are not at once born in their own order. You may have been in a former birth begotten by this pigeon. O king, it is not proper for you to interfere with my food by protecting this pigeon.', 'sn': 'पर्यायेण वसतिर्वा भवेषु सर्गे जातः पूर्वमस्मात् कपोतात्। त्वमाददानोऽथ कपोतमेनं मा त्वं राजन् विघ्नकर्ता भवेथाः॥'}

{'en': 'The King said : Has any one seen before that birds speak the pure speech of man? knowing what the pigeon says and also what the hawk says, what is good for us to do?', 'sn': 'राजोवाच केनेदृशी जातु परा हि दृष्टा वागुच्यमाना शकुनेन संस्कृता। यां वै कपोतो वदते यां च श्येन उभौ विदित्वा कथमस्तु साधु॥'}

{'en': 'He, who gives up a frightened creature seeking protection of his enemies, does not get protection when he is in need of it. The clouds do not shower seasonably for him and the seeds, though sown, do not grow for him.', 'sn': 'नास्य वर्षं वर्षति वर्षकाले नास्य बीजं रोहति काल उप्तम्। भीतं प्रपन्नं यो हि ददाति शत्रवे न त्राणं लभेत् त्राणमिच्छन् स काले॥'}

{'en': 'He, who gives up an afflicted creature seeking protection of its enemies, sees his offspring die in childhood. The forefathers of such a man can never live in heaven. The very celestial decline to accept his havya, the libation of ghi poured by him into the fire).', 'sn': 'जाता ह्रस्वा प्रजा प्रमीयते सदा न वासं पितरोऽस्य कुर्वते। भीतं प्रपन्नं यो हि ददाति शत्रवे नास्य देवाः प्रतिगृहणन्ति हव्यम्॥'}

{'en': 'He who gives up an afflicted creature seeking protection of his enemies is struck by the thunderbolt hurled by the celestial with Indra at their head. Being a very narrowminded person, the food he eats is unsanctified and he soon falls from the celestial pigeon.', 'sn': 'मोघमन्नं विन्दति चाप्रचेताः स्वर्गाल्लोकाद् भ्रश्यति शीघ्रमेव। भीतं प्रपनं यो हि ददाति शत्रवे सेन्द्रा देवाः प्रहरन्त्यस्य वज्रम्॥'}

{'en': 'O hawk, let Shivis put before you a bull cooked with rice in the place of this pigeon. Let them carry meat in abundance to the place where you like (to take them).', 'sn': 'उक्षाणं पक्त्वा सह ओदनेन अस्मात् कपोतात् प्रति ते नयन्तु। यस्मिन् देशे स्मसेऽतीव श्येन तत्र मांसं शिबयस्ते वहन्तु॥'}

{'en': 'The Hawk said : O king, I do not ask for a bull or any other meat or meat more than what is in that pigeon. He (the pigeon) is my food today ordained by the gods. Therefore give him up to me.', 'sn': 'श्येन उवाच नोक्षाणं राजन् पार्थयेयं न चान्यदस्मान्मांसमधिकं वा कपोतात्। देवैर्दत्तः सोध्यं ममैष भक्षस्तन्मे ददस्व शकुनानामभावात्॥'}

{'en': 'The king said: Let my men see and carefully carry the bull to you with its every limb entire. Let that bull be the ransom for this frightened creature. Do not kill this pigeon.', 'sn': 'राजोवाच उक्षाणं वेहतमनूनं नयन्तु ते पश्यन्तु पुरुषा ममैव। भयाहितस्य दायं ममान्तिकात् त्वां प्रत्याम्नायं तु त्वं ह्येन मा हिंसीः॥'}

{'en': 'O hawk, I will give up my own life, but I will not give up this pigeon. Do you not see this creature looks like a sacrifice with the Soma juice? O blessed one, do not take so much trouble for it; I will never give up this pigeon.', 'sn': 'त्यजे प्राणान् नैव दद्यां कपोतं सौम्यो ह्ययं किं न जानासि श्येन। यथा क्लेशं मा कुरुष्वेह सौम्य नाहं कपोतमर्पयिष्ये कथंचित्॥'}

{'en': 'O hawk, if it pleases you order me to do something which may be agreeable to you and for doing which the Shivi people may praise me and bless me in joy. I promise that I shall do whatever you will tell me to do.', 'sn': 'यथा मां वै साधुवादैः प्रसन्नाः प्रशंसेयुः शिबयः कर्मणा तु। यथा श्येन प्रियमेव कुर्यां प्रशाधि मां यद् वदेस्तत् करोमि॥'}

{'en': 'The Hawk said : O king, if you give me as much flesh as would be equal in weight to this pigeon, flesh cutting off from your right thigh, then can the pigeon be saved by you, then would you do what would be agreeable to me and what the Shivi people would speak in high terms of praise.', 'sn': 'श्येन उवाच ऊरोदक्षिणादुत्कृत्य स्वपिशितं तावद् राजन् यावन्मांसं कपोतेन समम्। तथा तस्मात् साधु त्रातः कपोतः प्रशंसेयुश्च शिबयः कृतं च प्रियं स्यान्ममेति॥'}
