{'en': 'Thereupon he cut off a piece of flesh from his right thigh and weighed it with the pigeon, but the pigeon weighed heavier.', 'sn': 'अथ दक्षिणादूरोरुत्कृत्य स्वमांसपेशीं तुलया धारयत्। गुरुतर एव कपोत आसीत्॥'}

{'en': 'He cut off another piece of flesh, but still the pigeon weighed heavier. Then he cut off pieces of flesh from all parts of his body and placed them on the scale, but the pigeon still weighed heavier.', 'sn': 'पुनरन्यमुच्चकर्त गुरुतर एव कपोतः। एवं सर्व समधिकृत्य शरीरं तुलायामारोपयामासा तत् तथापि गुरुतर एव कपोत आसीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the king himself got on the scale; he did not feel the least grief for it. Seeing this the hawk then and there disappeared exclaiming "saved”. Thereupon the king said,', 'sn': 'अथ राजा स्वयमेव तुलामारुरोह। न च व्यलीकमासीद् राज्ञ एतद् वृत्तान्तं दृष्ट्वा त्रात इत्युक्त्वा प्रालीयत श्येनोऽथ राजा अब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': '"O bird, O pigeon, I ask you, let the Shivi people know who this hawk is. None except the lord of creation can do what he did. O exalted one, reply to my question.', 'sn': 'कपोतं विद्युः शिबयस्त्वां कपोत पृच्छामि ते शकुने को नु श्येनः। नानीश्वर ईदृशं जातु कुर्यादेतं प्रश्नं भगवन् मे विचक्ष्व॥'}

{'en': 'The Pigeon said: O son of Suratha, I am the smoke-bannered deity, Vaishvanara (Fire). The hawk is the husband of Sachi, the wielder of thunder (Indra). You are the foremost of men, we came to try you.', 'sn': 'कपोत उवाच वैश्वानरोऽहं ज्वलनोधूमकेतुरथैव श्येनो वज्रहस्तः शचीपतिः। साधु ज्ञातुं त्वामृषभं सौरथेय नौ जिज्ञासया त्वत्सकाशं प्रपन्नौ॥'}

{'en': 'O king, these pieces of flesh that you have cut off from your body with your sword to save me, have made gashes in your body. I shall make these marks auspicious. They will be handsome, golden-coloured and sweet-scented.', 'sn': 'यामेतां पेशीं मम निष्क्रयाय प्रादाद् भवानसिनोत्कृत्य राजन्। एतद् वो लक्ष्म शिवं करोमि हिरण्यवर्णं रुचिरं पुण्यगन्धम्॥'}

{'en': 'Earning great fame and being respected by ! the celestial, you will long rule over these men. A son will be born to you from your side who will be named Kapotaraman.', 'sn': 'एतासां प्रजानां पालयिता यशस्वी सुरर्षीणामथ सम्मतो भृशम्। एतस्मात् पार्थात् पुरुषो जनिष्यति कपोतरोमेति च तस्य नाम॥'}

{'en': 'You will get out of your own body this son named Kapotaraman. You will see him become the foremost heroes of the Saurathas blazing in fame and possessing exceeding bravery and great beauty.', 'sn': 'कपोतरोमाणं शिबिनौद्भिदं पुत्रं प्राप्स्यसि नृप वृषसंहननं यशोदीप्यमानं द्रष्टासि शूरमृषभं सौरथानाम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana said You go for dragging the one-wheeled car of Vivasvat according to your turn. You should describe to me anything wonderful that you may have seen in those regions through which you pass.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मणः उवाच विवस्वतो गच्छति पर्ययेण वोढुं भवांस्तं रथमेकचक्रम्। आश्चर्यभूतं यदि तत्र किंचिद् दृष्टं त्वया शंसितुमर्हसि त्वम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Naga said, The divine Sun is the refuge or home of numberless wonders. All the creatures that inhabit the three worlds have sprung from the Sun.', 'sn': 'नाग उवाच आश्चर्याणामनेकानां प्रतिष्ठा भगवान् रविः। यतो भूताः प्रवर्तन्ते सर्वे त्रैलोक्यसम्मताः॥'}

{'en': 'Numberless Munis, crowned with ascetic success, together with all the gods, live in the rays of the Sun like birds perching on the branches of trees.', 'sn': 'यस्य रश्मिसहस्रेषु शाखास्विव विहंगमाः। वसन्त्याश्रित्य मुनयः संसिद्धा दैवतैः सह॥'}

{'en': 'What, again, can be more wonderful than this that the powerful Wind, emanating from the Sun, takes refuge in his rays and thence yawns over universe?', 'sn': 'यतो वायुर्विनिःसृत्य सूर्यरश्म्याश्रितो महान्। विजृम्भत्यम्बरे तत्र किमाश्चार्यमतः परम्॥'}

{'en': 'What can be more wonderful than this, O twice-born Rishi, that the Sun, dividing the Wind into many parts from desire of doing good to all creatures, creates rain that falls in the rain sea on?', 'sn': 'विभज्य तं तु विप्रर्षे प्रजानां हितकाम्यया। तोयं सृजति वर्षासु किमाश्चर्यमत: परम्॥'}

{'en': 'What can be more wonderful than this the Supreme Soul, from within the solar disc, himself bathed in burning effulgence, looks upon the universe?', 'sn': 'यस्य मण्डलमध्यस्थो महात्मा परमत्विषा। दीप्तः समीक्षते लोकान् किमाश्चर्यमतः परम्॥'}

{'en': 'What can be more wonderful than this that the Sun has a black ray which, changes itself into clouds charged with rain and pours showers of rain when the season comes?', 'sn': 'शुक्रो नामासितः पादो यश्च वारिधरोऽम्बरे। तोयं सृजति वर्षासु किमाश्चर्यमतः परम्॥'}

{'en': 'What can be more wonderful than this that drinking up for eight months the rain he pours down he pours it down again in the rainy season.', 'sn': 'योऽष्टमासांस्तु शुचिना किरणेनोक्षितं पयः। प्रत्यादत्ते पुनः काले किमाश्चर्यमतः परम्॥'}

{'en': 'In certain rays of the Sun, the Soul of the universe said to live. From Him is the seed of all things, and it is He that supports the earth with all her mobile and immobile creatures.', 'sn': 'यस्य तेजोविशेषेषु स्वयमात्मा प्रतिष्ठितः। यतो बीजं मही चेयं धार्यते सचराचरा॥'}

{'en': 'What can be more wonderful, O Brahmana, than this, that the foremost of Purushas, eternal and mighty-armed, endued with great effulgence, eternal, and without beginning and without end, lives in the Sun?', 'sn': 'यत्र देवो महाबाहुः शाश्वतः पुरुषोत्तमः। अनादिनिधनो विप्र किमाश्चर्यमतः परम्॥'}

{'en': 'Listen, however, to one thing I shall tell you now. It is the wonder of wonders. I have seen it in the clear sky, on account of my nearless to the Sun.', 'sn': 'आश्चर्याणामिवाश्चर्यमिदमेकं तु मे शृणु। विमले यन्मया दृष्टमम्बरे सूर्यसंश्रयात्॥'}

{'en': 'In former times, one day at the hour of noon, while the Sun was shining in all his glory and giving heat to everything we saw a Being coming towards the Sun, who seemed to shine with effulgence that was equal to that of the Sun himself.', 'sn': 'पुरा मध्याह्नसमये लोकांस्तपति भास्करे। प्रतदित्यप्रतीकाशः सर्वतः समदृश्यत्॥'}

{'en': 'Making all the worlds shine up with his glory and filling them with his energy, he came, as I have already told you towards the Sun, rending the sky, as it were, for passing through it.', 'sn': 'स लोकांस्तेजसा सर्वान् स्वभासा निर्विभासयन्। आदित्याभिमुखोऽभ्येति गगनं पाटयन्निव॥'}

{'en': 'The rays that came out of his body seemed to resemble the blazing effulgence of libations of clarified butter poured into the sacrificial fire. On account of his energy and splendour he could not he looked at. His form seemed to be indescribable. Indeed, he appeared to us to be like a second Sun.', 'sn': 'हुताहुतिरिव ज्योतिर्व्याप्य तेजोमरीचिभिः। अनिर्देश्येन रूपेण द्वितीय इव भास्करः॥'}

{'en': 'As soon as he came near the Sun extended his two hands. For honouring the Sun in return, he also extended his right-hand.', 'sn': 'तस्याभिगमनप्राप्ती हस्तौ दत्तौ विवस्वता। तेनापि दक्षिणो हस्तो दत्तः प्रत्यर्चितार्थिना॥'}

{'en': "The latter the then, piercing through the sky, entered into the Sun's disc. Mingling then with the Sun's energy, he seemed to be changed into the Sun's self.", 'sn': 'ततो भित्त्वैव गगनं प्रविष्टो रश्मिमण्डलम्। एकीभूतं च तत् तेजः क्षणेनादित्यतां गतम्॥'}

{'en': 'When the two energies thus met together, we were so confounded that we could not any longer make out which was which. Indeed, we could not make out who was the Sun whom we bore on his car, and who was Being that we had seen coming through the sky.', 'sn': 'तत्र नः संशयो जातस्तयोस्तेजः समागमे। अनयोः को भवेत् सूर्यो रथस्थो योऽयमागतः॥'}

{'en': 'Filled with confusion, we then addressed the Sun, saying,-O illustrious one, who is this Being who has mixed himself with you and has been charged into your second self.', 'sn': 'ते वयं जातसंदेहाः पर्यपृच्छामहे रविम्। क एष दिवमाक्रम्य गतः सूर्य इवापरः॥'}

{'en': "Yudhishthira said O foremost one of Bharata's race, do you describe to me all the deities of the household mode and tell me all that a man should do in order to acquire prosperity in this world.", 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच गार्हस्थ्यं धर्ममखिलं प्रब्रूहि भरतर्षभ। ऋद्धिमाप्नोति किं कृत्वा मनुष्य इह पार्थिव॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said O Bharata, I shall, in this connection, recite to you the old story of Vasudeva and the goddess Earth.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अत्र ते वर्तयिष्यामि पृरावृत्तं जनाधिप। वासुदेवस्य संवादं पृथिव्याश्चैव भारत॥'}

{'en': "The powerful Vasudeva, O excellent prince of Bharata's race, after singing the praises of the goddess Earth, accosted her about this very subject that you have required about.", 'sn': 'संस्तुत्य पृथिवीं देवीं वासुदेवः प्रतापवान्। पप्रच्छ भरतश्रेष्ठ मां त्वं यत् पृच्छसेऽद्य वै॥'}

{'en': 'Vasudeva said Having adopted the domestic mode of life, what acts should I, or one like me, do and how are such acts to yield success. man', 'sn': 'वासुदेव उवाच गार्हस्थ्यं धर्ममाश्रित्य मया वा मद्विधेन वा। किमवश्यं धरे कार्यं किं वा कृत्वा कृतं भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'The Goddess Earth said O Madhava, the Rishis, the celestials the departed Manes, and men should be adored, and sacrifices should be performed by a householder.', 'sn': 'पृथ्वी उवाच ऋषयः पितरो देवा मनुष्याश्चैव माधव। इज्याश्चैवार्चनीयाश्च यथा चैव निबोध मे॥'}

{'en': 'Do you also learn this from me that the celestials are always pleased with sacrifices, and are pleased with hospitality. Therefore, the householder should please them with such objects as they desire.', 'sn': 'सदा यज्ञेन देवाश्च सदाऽऽतिथ्येन मानुषाः। छन्दतश्च यथा नित्यमर्हान् भुञ्जीत नित्यशः॥'}

{'en': 'By such acts, O destroyer of Madhu Rishis also are pleased. The householders, abstaining from food, should daily attend to his sacred fire and to his sacrificial offerings.', 'sn': 'तेन पषिगणाः प्रीता भवन्ति मधुसूदन। नित्यमग्निं परिचरेदभुक्त्वा बलिकर्म च॥'}

{'en': 'The celestials, O destroyer of Madhu, are pleased with such deeds. The householder should daily offer oblations of food and water, or of fruits, roots and water, for the satisfaction of the departed Manes, and give boiled food to the Vishvedevas, and oblations of clarified butter to Agni, Soma, and Dhanvantari.', 'sn': 'कुर्यात् तथैव देवा वै प्रीयन्ते मधुसूदन। कुर्यादहरहः श्राद्धमन्नाद्येनोदकेन च॥ पयोमूलफलैर्वापि पितॄणां प्रीतिमाहरन्। सिद्धान्नाद् वैश्वदेवं वै कुर्यादग्नौ यथाविधि॥ अग्नीषोमं वैश्वदेवं धान्वन्तर्यमनन्तरम्। प्रजानां पतये चैव पृथग्योमो विधीयते॥'}

{'en': 'He should offer separate and distinct oblations of Prajapati. He should make sacrificial offerings duly; to Yama in the South, to Varuna in the West, to Soma in the North, to Prajapati within the homestead, to Dhanvantari in the North East, and to Indra in the East.', 'sn': 'तथैव चानुपूर्वेण बलिकर्म प्रयोजयेत्। दक्षिणायां यमायेति प्रतीच्यां वरुणाय च॥ सोमाय चाप्युदीच्यां वै वास्तुमध्ये प्रजापतेः। धन्वन्तरे:प्रागुदीच्यां प्राच्यां शक्राय माधव॥'}

{'en': "He should offer food to men at the entrance of his house. These, O Madhava, are known as the Bali offerings. The Bali should be offered to the Maruts and the deities in the interior of one's house.", 'sn': 'मनुष्येभ्य इति प्राहुर्बलिं द्वारि गृहस्य वै। मरुद्भ्यो दैवतेभ्यश्च बलिमन्तर्गृहे हरेत्॥'}

{'en': 'To the Vishvedevas it should be offered in open air, and to the Rakshasas and evil spirits the offerings should be made at night.', 'sn': 'तथैव विश्वेदेवेभ्यो बलिमाकाशतो हरेत्। निशाचरेभ्यो भूतेभ्यो बलिं नक्तं तथा हरेत्॥'}

{'en': 'After making these offerings, the householder should make offerings to Brahmanas, and if no Brahmana be present, the first portion of the food should be thrown into the fire.', 'sn': 'एवं कृत्वा बलिं सम्यग् दद्याद् भिक्षां द्विजाय वै। अलाभे ब्राह्मणस्याग्नावग्रमुद्धृत्य निक्षिपेत्॥'}

{'en': 'When a man wishes to offers Shraddha to his ancestors, he should, when the Shraddha ceremony is donc, please his ancestors and then make the Bali offerings duly.', 'sn': 'यदा श्राद्धं पितृभ्योऽपि दातुमिच्छेत मानवः। तदा पश्चात् प्रकुर्वीत निवृत्ते श्राद्धकर्मणि॥'}

{'en': 'He should then make offerings to the Vishwedevas. He should next invite Brahmanas, and then properly entertain guests arrived at his house, with food.', 'sn': 'पितॄन् संतर्पयित्वा तु बलिं कुर्याद् विधानतः। वैश्वदेवं ततः कुर्यात् पश्चाद् ब्राह्मणवाचनम्॥'}

{'en': 'By this act, O prince, are guests pleased. He who does not live in the house long, or, having come, goes away after a short time, is called guest.', 'sn': 'ततोऽन्नेन विशेषेण भोजयेदतिथीनपि। अर्चापूर्व महाराज ततः प्रीणाति मानवान्॥'}

{'en': 'To his preceptor, to his father, to his friend and to a guest, a householder should say, I have got this in my house to offer you today! And he should offer it accordingly every day.', 'sn': 'अनित्यं हि स्थितो यस्मात् तस्मादतिथिरुच्यते। आचार्यस्य पितुश्चैव सख्युराप्तस्य चातिथेः॥ इदमस्ति गृहे मह्यमिति नित्यं निवेदयेत्।'}

{'en': 'The house holder should do whatever they would order him to do. This is the established custom. The householder, O Krishna should take his food the last of all, after having offered food to all of them.', 'sn': 'ते यद् वदेयुस्तत् कुर्यादिति धर्मो विधीयते॥ गृहस्थः पुरुषः कृष्ण शिष्टाशी च सदा भवेत्।'}

{'en': 'The householder should adore with offerings of honey, etc., his king his priest, his preceptor, and his fatherinlaw, as also Snataka Brahmanas even if they were to live in his house for whole year.', 'sn': 'राजत्विजं स्नातकं च गुरुं श्वशुरमेव च।॥ अर्चयेन्मधुपर्केण परिसंवत्सरोषितान्।'}

{'en': 'In the morning as well as in the evening, food should be offered on the ground to dogs, the cooks for dogs and birds. This is called the Vaishvedeva offerings.', 'sn': 'श्वभ्यश्च श्वपचेभ्यश्च वयोभ्यश्चावपेद् भुवि। वैश्वदेवं हि नामैतत् सायंप्रातर्विधीयते॥'}

{'en': 'The householder, who performs these ceremonies with mind shorn of passion, obtains the blessings of the Rishis in this world, and after death acquires the heavenly regions.', 'sn': 'एतांस्तु धर्मान् गार्हस्थ्यान् यः कुर्यादनसूयकः। स इहर्षिवरान् प्राण्य प्रेत्य लोके महीयते॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Having heard all this from the goddess Earth, the powerful Vasudeva acted accordingly. Do you also act in the same way.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच इति भूमेर्वचः श्रुत्वा वासुदेवः प्रतापवान्। तथा चकार सततं त्वमप्येवं सदाचर॥'}

{'en': 'By performing these duties of a householder. O king, you shall acquire fame in this world and Heaven after death?', 'sn': 'एतद् गृहस्थधर्मं त्वं चेष्टमानो जनाधिप। इहलोके यशः प्राप्य प्रेत्य स्वर्गमवाप्स्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'Bhima said: woman even The Rakshasas revenge themselves on their enemy by alluring deceptions. Therefore, O Hidimba, go to the way that your brother has gone.', 'sn': 'भीमसेन उवाच स्मरन्ति वैरं रक्षांसि मायामाश्रित्य मोहिनीम्। हिडिम्बे व्रज पन्थानं त्वमिमं भ्रातृसेवितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhisthira said: O best of men, O Bhima do not kill a in anger. O Pandava, the attainment of virtue is a higher duty than the protection of body.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच क्रुद्धोऽपि पुरुषव्याघ्र भीम मा स्म स्त्रियं वधीः। शरीरगुप्त्यभ्यधिकं धर्मं गोपाय पाण्डव॥'}

{'en': 'You have killed the greatly powerful (Rakshasas) who came with the purpose of killing us. She is (but) his sister, what can she do to us, even if she is angry?', 'sn': 'वधाभिप्रायमायान्तमधीस्त्वं महाबलम्। रक्षसस्तस्य भगिनी किं न: क्रुद्धा करिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Thereupon, Hidimba respectfully saluting Kunti and Yudhisthira with joined hands, spoke to Kunti thus, “O respected lady, you know the pangs that women suffer from the god of love. O blessed lady, I have received those (pangs) by Bhima.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच हिडिम्बा तु ततः कुन्तीमभिवाद्य कृताञ्जलिः। युधिष्ठिरं तु कौन्तेयमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥ आर्ये जानासि यद् दुःखमिह स्त्रीणामनङ्गजम्। तदिदं मामनुप्राप्तं भीमसेनकृतं शुभे॥'}

{'en': 'I have suffered these great pangs and I wait for the time (when it will be assuaged). That time has now come, when I expect that my happiness would come.', 'sn': 'सोढं तत् परमं दुःखं मया कालप्रतीक्षया। सोऽयमभ्यागतः कालो भविता मे सुखोदयः॥'}

{'en': 'O blessed lady, leaving my friends relatives and religion, I have chosen this best of men, this son of yours, as my husband.', 'sn': 'मा ह्युयत्सृज्य सुहृदः स्वधर्म स्वजनं तथा। वृतोऽयं पुरुषव्याघ्रस्तव पुत्रः पतिः शुभे॥'}

{'en': 'O illustrious lady, if forsaken by this hero and yourself I shall not live any longer, I tell you this truly.', 'sn': 'वीरेणाहं तथानेन त्वया चापि यशस्विनि। प्रत्याख्याता न जीवामि सत्यमेतद् ब्रवीमि ते॥'}

{'en': 'O greatly beautiful lady, you should show compassion towards me, considering me foolish or very obedient to you.', 'sn': 'तदर्हसि कृपां कर्तुं मयि त्वं वरवर्णिनि। मत्वा मूढेति तन्मा त्वं भक्ता वानुगतेति वा॥'}

{'en': 'O greatly fortunate lady, unite me with my husband, your son. Let me go away at pleasure (wherever I like), taking this celestial like (hero). Trust me, O blessed lady, I shall bring him back to you all.', 'sn': 'भानेन महाभागे संयोजय सुतेन ह। तमुपादाय गच्छेयं यथेष्टं देवरूपिणम्। पुनश्चैवानयिष्यामि विस्रम्भं कुरु मे शुभे॥'}

{'en': 'Whenever you will think of me I will immediately come to you and carry you wherever you will command. I shall rescue you from danger over even and uneven grounds. I shall carry you on my back whenever you will desire to proceed with speed. Be gracious to me and make Bhimasena accept me.', 'sn': 'अहं हि मनसा ध्याता सर्वान् नेष्यामि वः सदा। वृजिनात् तारयिष्यामि दुर्गेषु विषमेषु च॥ पृष्ठेन वो वहिष्यामि शीघ्रं गतिमभीप्सतः। यूयं प्रसादं कुरुत भीमसेनो भजेत माम्॥'}

{'en': 'It is consonant with the precepts of religion that one should protect his life by any means. He, who seeks to do it, should not scruple about the means.', 'sn': 'आपदस्तरणे प्राणान् धारयेद् येन तेन वा। सर्वमावृत्य कर्तव्यं तं धर्ममनुवर्तता॥'}

{'en': 'He who keeps his virtue (even) in distress in the foremost of all virtuous men. Distress is the greatest danger to virtue and virtuous men.', 'sn': 'आपत्सु यो धारयति धर्म धर्मविदुत्तमः। व्यसनं ह्येव धर्मस्य धर्मिणामापदुच्यते॥'}

{'en': "'It is virtue that protect life and therefore virtue is called the giver of life. The means by which virtue is secured be censurable.'", 'sn': 'पुण्यं प्राणान् धारयति पुण्यं प्राणदमुच्यते। येन येनाचरेद् धर्मं तस्मिन् गर्दा न विद्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhisthira said: Hidimba, there is no doubt of that what you say is true. O lady of slender waist, you must act as you have said (you want to do).', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच एवमेतद् यथाऽऽत्थ त्वं हिडिम्बे नात्र संशयः। स्थातव्यं तु त्वया सत्ये यथा ब्रूयां सुमध्यमे॥'}

{'en': 'O blessed lady, when Bhimasena will finished ablutions, twilight prayer and the usual propitiatory rites you will then be adored by him till the sun sets.', 'sn': 'स्नातं कृताछिकं भद्रे कृतकौतुकमङ्गलम्। भीमसेनं भजेथास्त्वं प्रागस्तगमनाद् रवेः॥'}

{'en': 'O lady of mind like speed, sport with him at pleasure during the day. You must always bring Bhimasena back every night. can never', 'sn': 'अहस्सु विहरानेन यथाकामं मनोजवा। अयं त्वानयितव्यस्ते भीमसेनः सदा निशि॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Having promised to do it by saying, “Be it so", Bhima said (to Hidimba), “O Rakshasi, listen to the agreement that I make with you.', 'sn': '॥ वैशम्पायन उवाच तथेति तत् प्रतिज्ञाय भीमसेनोऽब्रवीदिदम्। शृणु राक्षसि सत्येन समयं ते वदाम्यहम्॥'}

{'en': 'O blessed lady, O lady of slender waist, I shall go (and stay) with you, so long you do not obtain a son."', 'sn': 'यावत् कालेन भवति पुत्रस्योत्पादन शुभे। तावत् कालं गमिष्यामि त्वया सह सुमध्यमे॥'}

{'en': 'Having promised this by saying, “Be it so," the Rakshasi Hidimba took Bhima upon her body and went up to the sky.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच तथेति तत् प्रतिज्ञाय हिडिम्बा राक्षसी तदा। भीमसेनमुपादाय सोर्ध्वमाचक्रमे ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Assuming the handsomest form, decked with all ornaments and pouring forth at times sweet music, she sported with the Pandava (Bhima) on the mountain peaks of picturesque scenery and in regions sacred to the celestial, abounding with beasts and birds. Also in forests and mountain fastness, overgrown with blossoming trees, in beautiful lake; resplendent with lotuses and lilies. On island of rivers, on the pebbled banks of streamlets, in sylvan streamlets with beautiful banks and also in mountain streams. In beautiful woods with blossoming trees, in the Himalayan bowers and in various mountains caves. In the crystal water of the lakes, smiling with lotuses, on the shores of the sea shinning with gold and pearls. In beautiful towns and fine gardens, in woods sacred to the gods and on the breast of hills. In the land of the Guhyakas and the hermitages of the ascetics on the banks of the Manasa lake, abounding with fruits and flowers of every season. Assuming the handsome form, she sported with the Pandava (Bhima). The lady with the mind like speed sported with Bhima in these places.', 'sn': 'शैलशृङ्गेषु रम्येषु देवतायतनेषु च। मृगपक्षिविघुष्टेषु रमणीयेषु सर्वदा॥ कृत्वा च परमं रूपं सर्वाभरणभूषिता। संजल्पन्ती सुमधुरं रमयामास पाण्डवम्॥ तथैव वनदुर्गेषु पुष्पितदुमवल्लिषु। सरस्सु रमणीयेषु पद्मोत्पलयुतेषु च॥ नदीद्वीपप्रदेशेषु वैदूर्यसिकतासु च। सुतीर्थवनतोयासु तथा गिरिनदीषु च॥ काननेषु विचित्रेषु पुष्पितद्रुमवल्लिषु। हिमवद्गिरिकुञ्जेषु गुहासु विविधासु च॥ प्रफुल्लशतपत्रेषु सरस्खमलवारिषु। सागरस्य प्रदेशेषु मणिहेमचितेषु च॥ पल्वलेषु च रम्येषु महाशालवनेषु च। देवारण्येषु पुण्येषु तथा पर्वतसानुषु॥ गुह्यकानां निवासेषु तापसायतनेषु च। सर्वर्तुफलरम्येषु मानसेषु सरस्सु च॥ बिभ्रती परमं रूपं रमयामास पाण्डवम्। रमयन्ती तथा भीमं तत्र तत्र मनोजवा॥'}

{'en': 'She then gave birth by Bhima a greatly strong son of terrible eyes and large mouth, of ears like arrows and of appearance fearful.', 'sn': 'प्रजज्ञे राक्षसी पुत्रं भीमसंनान्महाबलम्। विरूपाक्षं महावक्त्रं शरूकर्णं विभीषणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Of roaring voice, of lips brown as copper, of teeth sharp and keen. He was mighty armed, greatly energetic, exceedingly powerful and a great car warrior. Having long nose, broad chest, frightfully swelling calves, celerity of motion and excessive strength, he had nothing human in him, though born of a man. He excelled all the Pishachas and other such creatures and also the Rakshasas.', 'sn': 'भीमनादं सुताम्राष्ठं तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रं महाबलम्। महेष्वासं महावीर्यं महासत्त्वं महाभुजम्॥ महाजवं महाकायं महामायमरिंदमम्। दीर्घघोणं महोरस्कं विकटोबद्धपिण्डिकम्॥ अमानुषं मानुषजं भीमवेगं महाबलम्। यः पिशाचनतीत्यान्यान् बभूवातीव राक्षसान्॥'}

{'en': 'He grew up to be a youth when he was a boy and that mighty hero soon acquainted high proficiency in all arms and weapons known amongst mankind.', 'sn': 'बालोऽपि यौवनं प्राप्तो मानुषेषु विशाम्पते। सर्वास्त्रेषु परं वीरः प्रकर्षमगमद् बली॥'}

{'en': 'The Rakshasas women give birth on the very day they conceive; they are capable of assuming any form at will and they change their forms (at will).', 'sn': 'सद्यो हि गर्भान् राक्षस्यो लभन्ते प्रसवन्ति च। कामरूपधराश्चैव भवन्ति बहुरूपिकाः॥'}

{'en': 'That bad featured child, that mighty bowman, soon after his birth, bowed down to his mother and also to his father and touched their feet. They then named him.', 'sn': 'प्रणम्य विकचः पादावगृहणात् स पितुस्तदा। मातुश्च परमेष्वासस्तौ च नामास्य चक्रतुः॥'}

{'en': 'His mother said, "This child\'s head is like a Ghata (water pot)." They then gave him the name of Ghatotkacha.', 'sn': 'घटो हास्योत्कच इति माता तं प्रत्यभाषत। अब्रवीत् तेन नामास्य घटोत्कच इति स्म ह॥'}

{'en': 'Ghatotkacha was (very much) attached to the Pandavas. he became a great favourite with them, almost one of them.', 'sn': 'अनुरक्तश्च तानासीत् पाण्डवान् स घटोत्कच। तेषां च दयितो नित्यमात्मनित्यो बभूव ह॥'}

{'en': 'Knowing that the period of her stay with the (Pandava) had come to an end, Hidimba making another agreement with them went away wherever she like.', 'sn': 'संवाससमयो जीर्ण इत्याभाष्य ततस्तु तान्। हिडिम्बा समयं कृत्वा स्वां गतिं प्रत्यपद्यत॥'}

{'en': 'Thereafter giant Ghatotkacha bowed down to the Pandavas with Kunti, and told them, O sinless great men, you may tell me what I have to do. Thus addressed by him, Kunti spoke to the scn of Bhima.', 'sn': 'घटोत्कचो महाकायः पाण्डवान् पृथया सह। अभिवाद्य यथान्यायमब्रवीच्च प्रभाष्य तान्॥ किं करोम्यहमार्याणां निःशङ्कं वदतानघाः। तं ब्रुवन्तं भैमसेनि कुन्ती वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'You are born in the race of Kuru and are the same as Bhima. You are the eldest son of five. O son! help us.', 'sn': 'त्वं कुरूणां कुले जातः साक्षाद् भीमसमो ह्यसि। ज्येष्ठः पुत्रोऽसि पञ्चानां साहाय्यं कुरु पुत्रक॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Thus addressed by Kunti, he replied respectfully-Just as there are in this world Ravana and Meghanada who were very strong, so also I am gigantic and valorous among the men of this world; in fact I am greater than any.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच पृथयाप्येवमुक्तस्तु प्रणम्यैव वचोऽब्रवीत्। यथा हि रावणो लोके इन्द्रजिच्च महाबलः। वर्मवीर्यसमो लोके विशिष्टश्चाभवं नृषु॥'}

{'en': 'That best Rakshasas, Ghatotkacha, promising to come when required for business, went away towards the north.', 'sn': 'कृत्यकाल उपस्थास्ये पितृनिति घटोत्कचः। आमन्त्र्य रक्षसां श्रेष्ठः प्रतस्थे चोत्तरां दिशम्॥'}

{'en': 'That great car warrior (Ghatotkacha) was created by the illustrious Indra as a proper antagonist of Karna of matchless power in consequence of the weapon (he gave him).', 'sn': 'स हि सृष्टो मघवता शक्तिहेतोर्महात्मना। कर्णस्याप्रतिवीर्यस्य प्रतियोद्धा महारथः॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said O descendant of Kuru, O great king, I shall tell you what is heard of the island in the north. Hear.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच उत्तरेषु च कौरव्य द्वीपेषु श्रूयते कथा। एवं तत्र महाराज ब्रुवतश्च निबोध मे॥'}

{'en': 'There is that ocean the water of which is Ghee. Next to it is the ocean, the water of which is curd. Next is the ocean, the water of which is wine, and then comes a ocean of water.', 'sn': 'घृततोय: समुद्रोऽत्र दधिमण्डोदकोऽपरः। सुरोदः सागरश्चैव तथान्यो जलसागरः॥'}

{'en': 'O king, the island are double in area of one another as they proceed further towards the north. O king, they are surrounded by these oceans.', 'sn': 'परस्परेण द्विगुणा: सर्वे द्वीपा नराधिप। पर्वताश्च महाराज समुद्रैः परिवारिताः॥'}

{'en': 'In the middle island, there is a large mountain called Goura which is made of red arsenic. O king, on the western island, there is a mountain, called Krishna; it is a favourite abode of Narayana.', 'sn': 'गौरस्तु मध्यमे द्वीपे गिरिर्मान:शिलो महान्। पर्वतः पश्चिमे कृष्णो नारायणसखो नृप॥'}

{'en': 'There Keshava protects celestial gems. From that place, when gracious, he bestows happiness on creatures.', 'sn': 'तत्र रत्नानि दिव्यानि स्वयं रक्षति केशवः। प्रसन्नश्चाभवत् तत्र प्रजानां व्यदधत् सुखम्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, along with the kingdoms in these islands, Kusha grass in Kushadvipa and the Salami tree is Shalmalikadvipa are worshipped.', 'sn': 'कुशस्तम्बः कुशद्वीपे मध्ये जनपदैः सह। सम्पूज्यते शाल्पलिश्च द्वीपे शाल्मलिके नृप॥'}

{'en': 'O king, in the Krauncha island the mountain called Maha Krauncha which is a mine of all kinds of gems is always worshipped by all the four orders of men.', 'sn': 'क्रौञ्चद्वीपे महाक्रोञ्चो गिरी रत्नचयाकरः। सम्पूज्यते महाराज चातुर्वर्येन नित्यदा॥'}

{'en': 'O king, there is the mountain called Gomanta which is huge in size and which consists of all kinds of metals. On its summit lives Narayana Hari with those they have obtained salvation, graced with prosperity and possessed of eyes like lotus. O great king, in Kushadvipa there is another mountain abounding in corals.', 'sn': 'गोमन्तः पर्वतो राजन् सुमहान् सर्वधातुकः। यत्र नित्यं निवसति श्रीमान् कमललोचनः॥ मोक्षिभिः संगतो नित्यं प्रभुर्नारायणो हरिः। कुशद्वीपे तु राजेन्द्र पर्वतो विद्रुमैश्चितः॥'}

{'en': 'It is called after the island, this mountain is made of gold and it is inaccessible. O descendant of Kuru, there is another greatly effulgert mountain called Kumuda.', 'sn': 'स्वनाम नामा दुर्धर्षो द्वितीयो हेमपर्वतः। द्युतिमान् नाम कौरव्य तृतीयः कुमुदो गिरिः॥'}

{'en': 'The fourth mountain there is called Pushpavati, the fifth Kusheshaya, the sixty Harigiri. These are the six chief mountains.', 'sn': 'चतुर्थः पुष्पवान् नाम पञ्चमस्तु कुशेशयः। षष्ठो हरिगिरि म षडेते पर्वतोत्तमाः॥'}

{'en': 'The intervening spaces between one another of these six mountains increases in the ratio of one to two, as they proceed further and further towards the north. This first Varsha is called Audbhida, the second is Venumandala.', 'sn': 'तेषामन्तरविष्कम्भो द्विगुणः सर्वभागशः। औद्भिदं प्रथम वर्षं द्वितीयं वेणुमण्डलम्॥'}

{'en': 'The third is Suratha, the fourth is Kambala, the fifth is called Dhritimat, and the sixth is named Prabhakara.', 'sn': 'तृतीयं सुरथाकारं चतुर्थं कम्बलं स्मृतम्। धृतिमत् पञ्चमं वर्ष षष्ठं वर्ष प्रभाकरम्॥'}

{'en': 'The seventh is called Kapila. These are the Seven successive Varshas. The celestial and the Gandharvas and other creatures of the universe take pleasure to sport in them. The dwellers of these Varshas never die. O king, there is not any robber or any Mlecchha race there.', 'sn': 'सप्तमं कापिलं वर्ष सप्तैते वर्षलम्भकाः। एतेषु देवगन्धर्वाः प्रजाश्च जगतीश्वरः॥ विहरन्ते रमन्ते च न तेषु म्रियते जनः। न तेषु दस्यवः सन्ति प्लेच्छजात्योऽपि वा नृप।।१५।'}

{'en': 'O king, all the dwellers are generally white in complexion. They are very delicate. O ruler of men, I shall describe all that has been heard by me. O king, hear with attention. O great king, there is a great mountain called Krauncha in the Krauncha island.', 'sn': 'गौरप्रायो जनः सर्वः सुकुमारश्च पार्थिव।. अवशिष्टेषु सर्वेषु वक्ष्यामि मनुजेश्वर॥ यथाश्रुतं महाराज तदव्यग्रमनाः शृणु। क्रौञ्चद्वीपे महाराज क्रौञ्चो नाम महागिरिः॥'}

{'en': 'Next to Krauncha is Vamanaka, next to Vamanaka is Andhakaraka, next to Andhakaraka is that foremost of all mountains which is called Mainaka.', 'sn': 'क्रौञ्चात् परो वामनको वामनादन्धकारकः। अन्धकारात् परो राजन् मैनाकः पर्वतोत्तमः॥'}

{'en': 'O king, next to Mainaka is that best of mountains called Govinda, next to Govinda is the Nibida mountain. O perpetuator of the Kuru race, the intervening spaces between one another of these mountains increase in the ratio of one to two. I shall speak of the countries that are situated there. Hear as I tell of them.', 'sn': 'मैनाकात् परतो राजन् गोविन्दो गिरिरुत्तमः। गोविन्दात् परतो राजन् निबिडो नाम पर्वतः॥ परस्तु द्विगुणस्तेषां विष्कम्भो वंशवर्धन। देशांस्तत्र प्रवक्ष्यामि तन्मे निगदतः शृणु।॥'}

{'en': 'The country near Krauncha is called Kushala, that near Vainana is Manonuga that next to Manonuga, O perpetuator of the Kuru race, is called Ushna.', 'sn': 'क्रौञ्चस्य कुशलो देशो वामनस्य मनोनुगः। मनोनुगात् परश्चोष्णो देशः कुरुकुलोद्वह॥'}
{'en': 'Next to Ushna is Pravaraka, next to Pravarka is Andhakaraka, next to Andhakaraka is named Munidesha,', 'sn': 'उष्णात् परः प्रावरकः प्रावारादन्धकारकः। अन्धकारकदेशात् तु मुनिदेशः परः स्मृतः॥'}

{'en': 'Next to Munidesha is Dundubhisvana frequented by the Siddhas and the Charanas. O king, the people of this regions are white.', 'sn': 'मुनिदेशात् परश्चैव प्रोच्यते दुन्दुभिस्वनः। सिद्धचारणसंकीर्णो गौरप्रायो जनाधिप॥'}

{'en': 'O king, all these countries are inhabited by the celestial and the Gandharvas. In Pushkara (island) there is a mountain called Pushkara, full of gems and jewels.', 'sn': 'एते देशा महाराज देवगन्धर्वसेविताः। पुष्करे पुष्करो नाम पर्वतो मणिरत्नवान्॥'}

{'en': 'There dwells the divine creator of the worlds himself. All the celestial and great Rishis always worship bim.', 'sn': 'तत्र नित्यं प्रभवति स्वयं देवः प्रजापतिः। तं पर्युपासते नित्यं देवाः सर्वे महर्षयः॥'}

{'en': 'With gratifying words and respectful adoration. o king, various gems from Jambudvipa are used there.', 'sn': 'वाग्भिर्मनोऽनुकूलाभिः पूजयन्तो जनाधिप। जम्बूद्वीपात् प्रवर्तन्ते रत्नानि विविधान्युत॥'}

{'en': 'O king, in all these islands Brahmacharya, truth, self-control, also health and length of life are in the ratio of one to two as the island are more and more remote northwards. O king, O descendant of Bharata, the land in all these islands is but one country.', 'sn': 'द्वीपेषु तेषु सर्वेषु प्रजानां कुरुसत्तम। ब्रह्मचर्येण सत्येन प्रजानां हि दमेन च॥ आरोग्यायुःप्रमाणाभ्यां द्विगुणं द्विगुणं ततः। एको जनपदो राजन् द्वीपेष्वेतेषु भारत।'}

{'en': 'For it is said to be the one country in which is scen but one religion. The supreme lord of creation himself, lifting up the rod of chastisement always lives there and protects! these islands. O king,. he is their ruler, he is their source of happiness, he is their father, he is their grandfather.', 'sn': 'उक्ता जनपदा येषु धर्मश्चैकः प्रदृश्यते॥ ईश्वरो दण्डपुद्यम्य स्वयमेव प्रजापतिः। द्वीपानेतान् महाराज रक्षस्तिष्ठति नित्यदा॥ स राजा स शिवो राजन् स पिता प्रपितामहः।'}

{'en': 'O foremost of men, it is he who protects there all mobile and immobile creatures. O descendant of Kuru, cooked food comes there of itself and all creatures eat it every day. O mighty-armed hero, next to these regions is seen the region named Shyama.', 'sn': 'गोपायति नरश्रेष्ठ प्रजाः सजडपण्डिताः॥ भोजनं चात्र कौरव्य प्रजाः स्वयमुपस्थितम्। सिद्धमेव महाबाहो तद्धि भुञ्जन्ति नित्यदा॥ ततः परं समा नाम दृश्यते लोकसंस्थितिः।'}

{'en': 'It is like a star in shape having four corners. O king, it has thirty three Mandalas. ) descendant of Kuru, there live four great clephants adored by all, o best among the Bharata race, they are Vamana, Airavata, Supratika with rent temples and also another.', 'sn': 'चतुरस्र महाराज त्रयस्त्रिंशत् तु मण्डलम्॥ तत्र तिष्ठन्ति कौरव्य चत्वारो लोकसम्मताः। दिग्गजा भरतश्रेष्ठ वामनरावतादयः॥ सुप्रतीकस्तथा राजन् प्रभिन्नकरटामुखः!'}

{'en': 'I cannot venture to calculate the proportions of these four elephants. Their length, breadth and thickness have ever remained umascertained.', 'sn': 'तस्याहं परिमाणं तु न संख्यातुमिहोत्सहे॥ असंख्यातः स नित्यं हि तिर्यगूर्ध्वमधस्तथा।'}

{'en': 'O king, winds blow in these regions irregularly from all directions. These winds are scized by these elephants with the tips of their trunks, which are like to lotus in complexion, which are very bright and which they are capable of drawing up in this way. As soon as they scize them, they let them out.', 'sn': 'तत्र वै वायवो वान्ति दिग्भ्यः सर्वाभ्य एव हि॥ असम्बद्धा महाराज तान् निगृह्णन्ति ते गजाः। पुष्करैः पद्मसंकाशैविकसद्भिर्महाप्रभैः॥ शतधा पुनरेवाशु ते तान् मुञ्चन्ति नित्यशः।'}

{'en': 'O king, having been thus let out by these clephants, these winds come over to this earth, and for their coming creatures breathe and live.', 'sn': 'श्वसद्भिर्मुच्यमानास्तु दिग्गजैरिह मारुताः॥ आगच्छन्ति महाराज ततस्तिष्ठन्ति वै प्रजाः।'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said O Sanjaya, you have told me in detail about the first subject. You have also told me the position of the islands. O Sanjaya tell me now the rest.', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच परो वै विस्तरोऽत्यर्थं त्वया संजय कार्तितः॥ दर्शितं द्वीपसंस्थानमुत्तरं ब्रूहि संजय।'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said O great king, I have described to you all the islands. O Kuru chief, now hear what I say about the heavily bodies and about Svarbhanu.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच उक्ता द्वीपा महाराज ग्रहं वै शृणु तत्त्वतः॥ स्वर्भानोः कौरवश्रेष्ठ यावदेव प्रमाणतः।'}

{'en': 'O king, it is hcard by us that the planet Svarbhanu is a globe. Its diameter is twelve thousand Yojanas.', 'sn': 'परिमण्डलो महाराज स्वर्भानुः श्रूयते ग्रहः॥ योजनानां सहस्राणि विष्कम्भो द्वादशास्य वै।'}

{'en': 'And because because it is very large, its circumference is forty two thousand Yojanas. O sinless one, thus say the learned men of old.', 'sn': 'परिणाहेन षट्त्रिंशद् विपुलत्वेन चानघ॥ पष्टिमाहुः शतान्यस्य बुधाः पौराणिकास्तथा।'}

{'en': 'O king, the diameter of the moon is said to be cleven thousand Yojanas. O Kuru chief, the circumference of our this famous planet of cool rays is said to be thirty-cight thousand and nine hundred Yojanas. O descendant of Kuru, we have heard that the diameter of the beneficent, fast-going and light-giving sun is ten thousand and Yojanas, and O king, its circumference is thirty-five thousand cight hundred miles, O sinless one, O descendant of Bharata, these are all the calculations of Arka.', 'sn': 'चन्द्रमास्तु सहस्राणि राजन्नेकादश स्मृतः॥ विष्कम्भेण कुरुश्रेष्ठ त्रयस्त्रिंशत् तु मण्डलम्। एकोनषष्टिविष्कम्भं शीतरश्मेर्महात्मनः॥ सूर्यस्त्वष्टौ सहस्राणि द्वे चान्ये कुरुनन्दन। विष्कम्भेण ततो राजन् मण्डलं त्रिंशता समम्॥ अष्टपञ्चाशतं राजन् विपुलत्वेन चानघ। श्रूयते परमोदारः पतगोऽसौ विभावसुः॥ एतत् प्रमाणमर्कस्य निर्दिष्टमिह भारत।'}

{'en': 'The planet Rahu on account of its great bulk covers both the sun and the moon in due tiine (during eclipses). I tell you all this in brief.', 'sn': 'स राहुश्छादयत्येतौ यथाकालं महत्तया॥ चन्द्रादित्यौ महाराज संक्षेपोऽयमुदाहृतः।'}

{'en': 'O great king, with the help of the eye of science, I have told you all that you asked me. Be blessed.', 'sn': 'इत्येतत् ते महाराज पृच्छतः शास्त्रचक्षुषा॥ सर्वमुक्तं यथातत्त्वं तस्माच्छममवाप्नुहि।'}

{'en': 'I shall now tell you of the construction of the universe as narrated in the Shastras. Therefore, O descendant of Kuru, pacify your son Duryodhana.', 'sn': 'यथोद्दिष्टं मया प्रोक्तं सनिर्माणमिदं जगत्॥ तस्मादाश्वस कौरव्य पुत्रं दुर्योधनं प्रति।'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, hearing this delightful Bhumi Parva, a Kshatriya obtains prosperity, the fruition of all his desires and approbation of the pious.', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वेदं भरतश्रेष्ठ भूमिपर्व मनोनुगम्॥ श्रीमान् भवति राजन्यः सिद्धार्थः साधुसम्मतः।'}

{'en': 'The king who hears this on the full-moon or the new-incon day and observes the vows with care, obtains long life, fame, and prowess. His ancestral manes become pleased. You have now heard of all the merits that flow from this Bharata Varsha in which we live.', 'sn': 'आयुर्बलं च कीर्तिश्च तस्य तेजश्च वर्धते॥ यः शृणोति महीपाल पर्वणीदं यतव्रतः। प्रीयन्ते पितरस्तस्य तथैव च पितामहाः॥ इदं तु भारतं वर्षं यत्र वर्तामहे वयम्। पूर्वैः प्रवर्तितं पुण्यं तत् सर्वं श्रुतवानसि॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Regarding it is also cited the old discourse between him of a hundred sacrifices and the Asura Namuchi,OYudhisthira.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अत्रैवोदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। शतक्रतोश्च संवादं नमुचेश्च युधिष्ठिर॥'}

{'en': 'When the Asura Namuchi, who knew well the birth and the death of all creatures was sitting, shorn of prosperity but undisturbed at heart like the huge ocean in perfect stillness, Purandara addressed him these words-..', 'sn': 'श्रिया विहीनमासीनमक्षोभ्यमिव सागरम्। भवाभवज्ञं भूतानामित्युवाच पुरंदरः॥'}

{'en': "Namuchi said *Fallen off from your place, fettered with cords, brought under the influence of your enemies, and shorn of prosperity, do you, O Namuchi, grieve or live cheerfully.'", 'sn': 'नमुचि रुवाच बद्धः पाशैश्चयुतः स्थानाद् द्विषतां वशमागतः। श्रिया विहीनो नमुचे शोचस्याहो न शोचसि॥'}

{'en': "‘By indulging in such sorrow as cannot be avoided one only wastes his body any cheering his enemies. Then, again, no one can lighten another's sorrow by putting any portion of it upon oneself. For these reasons, O Shakra, I do not grieve. All this that you see has one end.", 'sn': 'अनिवार्येण शोकेन शरीरं चोपतप्यते। अमित्राश्च प्रहष्यन्ति शोके नास्ति सहायता॥'}

{'en': 'Indulgence in sorrow mars personal beauty, prosperity, life, and virtue itself, O king of the gods.', 'sn': 'तस्माच्छक न शोचामि सर्वं ह्येवेदमन्तवत्। संतापाद् भ्रश्यते रूपं संतापाद् भ्रश्यते श्रियः॥'}

{'en': 'Forsooth, suppressing that sorrow which comes upon oneself and which is begotten by a weak mind, one endued with true knowledge should reflect in his mind of that which yields the highest good not which lives in the heart itself.', 'sn': 'संतापाद भ्रश्यते चायुर्धर्मश्चैव सुरेश्वर। विनीय खलु तद् दुःखमागतं वैमनस्यजम्॥ ध्यातव्यं मनसा हृद्यं कल्याणं संविजानता।'}

{'en': "When one sets his mind upon what is for one's highest good, forsooth, the result that all his objects are accomplished.", 'sn': 'यदा यदा हि पुरुषः कल्याणे कुरुते मनः। तदा तस्य प्रसिध्यन्ति सर्वार्था नात्र संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'There is One Ordainer, and no second. His sway extends the embryo. Controlled by the great Ordainer I go on as He moves me on, like water running along a downward path.', 'sn': 'एकः शास्ता न द्वितीयोऽस्ति शास्ता गर्भे शयानं पुरुषं शास्ति शास्ता। तेनायुयुक्तः प्रवणादिवोदकं यथा नियुक्तोऽस्मि तथा वहामि॥'}

{'en': 'Knowing what is existence and what liberation, and understanding also that the latter is superior to the former, I do not, however, try to attain to it. Doing virtuous and sinful acts I go on as He moves me on.', 'sn': 'भवाभवौ त्वभिजानन् गरीयो ज्ञानाच्छ्रेयो न तु करोमि। आशासु धासु परासु कुर्वन् यथा नियुक्तोऽस्मि तथा वहामि॥'}
{'en': 'One gets those things that are ordained to be got. That which is to happen actually takes place.', 'sn': 'यथा यथास्य प्राप्तव्यं प्राप्नोत्येव तथा तथा। भवितव्यं यथा यच्च भवत्येव तथा तथा॥'}

{'en': 'Over even One has repeatedly to live in such wombs in which one is placed by the Ordainer. He has no choice in the matter.', 'sn': 'यत्र यत्रैव संयुक्तो धात्रा गर्भे पुनः पुनः। तत्र तत्रैव वसति न यत्र स्वयमिच्छति॥'}

{'en': 'That person never feels himself stupefied, who when placed in any particular condition, accepts it as that which he was ordained to be placed in.', 'sn': 'भावो योऽयमनुप्राप्तो भवितव्यमिदं मम। इति यस्य सदा भावो न स मुह्येत् कदाचन॥'}

{'en': 'Men are affected by pleasure and pain that come by turns in Time. There is no personal agency in this matter. In this lies sorrow.', 'sn': 'पर्यायैर्हन्यमानानामभियोक्तो न विद्यते। दुःखमेतत् तु यद् द्वेष्टा कर्ताहमिति मन्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Who is there amongst Rishis, gods, great Asuras, persons fully conversant with the three Vedas, and hermits living in the forest, whom calamities do not approach? Those, however, who know well, the Soul and not-Soul never fear calamities.', 'sn': 'ऋषींश्च देवांश्च महासुरांश्च त्रैविद्यवृद्धांश्च वने मुनींश्च। कानापदो नोपनमन्ति लोके परावरज्ञास्तु न सम्भ्रमन्ति॥'}

{'en': 'The wise person, naturally standing immovable like Himavat, never yields to anger; never allows himself to be addicted to the objects of the senses; never suffers pain in sorrow or rejoices in happiness. When overwhelmed with even great afflictions, such a person never grieves.', 'sn': 'न पण्डितः क्रुद्ध्यति नाभिपद्यते न चापि संसीदति न प्रहष्यति। न चार्थकृच्छ्रव्यसनेषु शोचते स्थितः प्रकृत्या हिमवानिवाचलः॥'}

{'en': 'That person is, indeed, a great man whom even great success cannot gladden and even great calamities cannot stupefy, and who bears pleasure and pain, and that which is between them both, with an unaffected mind.', 'sn': 'यमर्थसिद्धिः परमा न मोहयेत् तथैव काले व्यसनं न मोहयेत्। सुखं च दुःखं च तथैव मध्यम निषेवते यः स धुरंधरो नरः॥'}

{'en': 'A person should always be cheerful and not sorry into whatever condition he may fall, thus should a person remove his increasing sorrow which is born in his mind and that is (if not removed) sure to give pain.', 'sn': 'यां यामवस्थां पुरुषोऽधिगच्छेत् तस्यां रमेतापरितप्यमानः। एवं प्रवृद्धं प्रणुदन्मनोज संतापनीयं सकलं शरीरात्॥'}

{'en': 'That concourse of learned men engaged in the discussion of the ethics of both the Shrutis and the Smritis is not a good assembly,-indeed, that does not deserve to be called so,-entering which a wicked man is not stricken with fear. That men is the foremost of his sex, who having made a proper enquiry after righteousness acts according to the conclusions to which he arrives.', 'sn': 'न तत्सदः सत्परिवत् सभा च सा प्राप्य यां न कुरुते सदा भयम्। धर्मतत्त्वमवगाह्य बुद्धिमान् योऽभ्युपैति स धुरंधरः पुमान्॥'}

{'en': 'The acts of a wise man are not easily understood. A wise man is never stupefied when afflictions overtake him. Even if he falls away from his position like Gautama in his old age, on account of the direst calamity, he does not allow himself to be stupefied.', 'sn': 'प्राज्ञस्य कर्माणि दुरन्वयानि न वै प्राज्ञो मुह्यति मोहकाले। स्तावत् कृच्छ्रामापदं प्राप्य वृद्धः॥'}

{'en': 'Can a person by Mantras, strength, energy, wisdom, prowess, behaviour, conduct, or wealth, acquire that which has not been ordained to be acquired by him? What sorrow then is there if a person cannot acquire that which he seeks at heart.', 'sn': 'न मन्त्रबलवीर्येण प्रज्ञया पौरुषेण च। न शीलेन न वृत्तेन तथा नैवार्थसम्पदा। अलभ्यं लभते मर्त्यस्तत्र का परिदेवना॥'}

{'en': 'Before I was born, the ordainers had ordained that I am to do and suffer. I am fulfilling what was thus ordained for me. What then can death do to me.', 'sn': 'यदेवमनुजातस्य धातार विदधुः पुरा। तदेवानुचरिष्यामि किं ते मृत्युः करिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'One gets only what has been ordained. One goes whence he was ordained to go. Those sorrows and joys only are obtained that are ordained so.', 'sn': 'लब्धव्यान्येव लभते गन्तव्यान्येव गच्छति। प्राप्तव्यान्येव चाप्नोति दुःखानि च सुखानि च॥'}

{'en': 'That man who, knowing this well, does not allow himself to be stupefied, and who is contented with both happiness and misery, is considered as the foremost of his sex.', 'sn': 'एतद् विदित्वा कात्र्येन यो न मुह्यति मानवः। कुशली सर्वदुःखेषु स वै सर्वधनो नरः॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said The helpless Uttara, desirous of getting back her child, having thus bewailed, dropped down in sorrow on the earth like demented creature.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच सैवं विलय करुणं सोन्मादेव तपस्विनी। उत्तरा न्यपतद् भूमौ कृपणा पुत्रगृद्धिनी॥'}

{'en': 'Sceing the princess fallen on the earth deprived of her son and with her body uncovered, Kunti as also all the (other) Bharata-ladies, deeply afflicted, began to weep aloud.', 'sn': 'तां तु दृष्ट्वा निपतितां हतपुत्रपरिच्छदाम्। चुक्रोश कुन्ती दुःखार्ता सर्वाश्च भरतस्त्रियः॥'}

{'en': 'Resounding with the voice of lamentation the palace of the Pandavas, O king, was soon converted into a house of sorrow where nobody could remain.', 'sn': 'मुहूर्तमिव राजेन्द्र पाण्डवानां निवेशनम्। अप्रेक्षणीयमभवदार्तस्वनविनादितम्॥'}

{'en': "Greatly stricken with grief on account of her son, Virata's daughter, O king, seemed to be struck down for sometime by sorrow and cheerlessness.", 'sn': 'सा मुहूर्ते च राजेन्द्र पुत्रशोकाभिपीडिता। कश्मलाभिहता वीर वैराटी त्वभवत् तदा॥'}

{'en': "Regaining consciousness, O chief of Bharata's race, Uttara took up her child on her lap and said these words.", 'sn': 'प्रतिलभ्य तु सा संज्ञामुत्तरा भरतर्षभ। अङ्कमारोष्य तं पुत्रमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': "You are the child of one who knew every duty. Are you not conscious then of the sin you commit, since you do not salute this foremost one of the Vrishni's race?", 'sn': 'धर्मज्ञस्य सुतः स त्वमधर्मे नावबुध्यसे। यस्त्वं वृध्णिप्रवीरस्य कुरुषे नाभिवादनम्॥'}

{'en': 'O son, going to your father tell him these words of mine, viz., It is difficult for living creatures to die before their time comes, because through refit of you, my husband, and now deprived of my child also, I am yet alive when I should die, unendued as I am with everything auspicious and everything valuable.', 'sn': 'पुत्र गत्वा मम वचो ब्रूयास्त्वं पितरं त्विदम्। दुर्मरं प्राणिनां वीर कालेऽप्राप्ते कथंचन॥ याहं त्वया विनायेह पत्या पुत्रेण चैव ह। मर्तव्ये सति जीवामि हतस्वस्तिरकिंचना॥'}

{'en': 'O mighty-armed one, with the permission of king Yudhishthira the just. I shall swallow some dreadful poison or cast myself on the burning fire.', 'sn': 'अथवा धर्मराज्ञाहमनुज्ञाता महाभुज। भक्षयिष्ये विषं घोरं प्रवेक्ष्ये वा हुताशनम्॥'}

{'en': 'O father, difficult of destruction is my heart since, though I am deprived of husband and child, that heart of mine does not brcak into a thousand pieces.', 'sn': 'अथवा दुर्मरं तात यदिदं मे सहस्रधा। पतिपुत्रविहीनाया हृदयं न विदीर्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Rise, O son, and see this your afflicted great grandmother! She is deeply stricken with grief, bathed in tears, exceedingly cheerless, and plunged in an ocean of sorrow.', 'sn': 'उत्तिष्ठ पुत्र पश्येमां दुःखिता प्रपितामहीम्। आर्तामुपप्लुतां दीनां निमग्नां शोकसागरे॥'}

{'en': 'See the reverend princess of Panchala, and the helpless princess of the Sattata race! Look at myself, exceedingly afflicted with grief, and resembling a deer pierced by a hunter.', 'sn': 'आर्यांच पश्य पाञ्चालीं सात्वती च तपस्विनीम्। मां च पश्य सुदुःखार्तो व्याधविद्धां मृगीमिव॥'}

{'en': 'Rise, O child, and look at the face of this king, who is gifted with great wisdom, and possessed of eyes like lotus-petals and resembling your father of restless glances.', 'sn': 'उत्तिष्ठ पश्य वदनं लोकनाथस्य धीमतः। पुण्डरीकपलाशाक्षं पुरेव चपलेक्षणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing Uttara, whey bewailed thus, fallen on the earth, all those ladies, raising her, caused her to sit up.', 'sn': 'एवं विप्रलपन्तीं तु दृष्ट्वा निपतितां पुनः। उत्तरां तां स्त्रियः सर्वाः पुनरुत्थापयंस्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Having sat up, the daughter of the king of the Matsyas, summoning her patience, joined her hands in respect and touched the earth with her head for saluting Keshava having eyes like lotus petals.', 'sn': 'उत्थाय च पुनधैर्यात् तदा मत्स्यपतेः सुता। प्राञ्जलिः पुण्डरीकाक्षं भूमावेवाभ्यवादयत्॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing those heart-rending lamentations of hers, that foremost of persons touched water and withdrew the (force of the Brahmaweapon.', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा स तस्या विपुलं विलापं पुरुषर्षभः। उपस्पृश्य ततः कृष्णो ब्रह्मास्त्रं प्रत्यसंहरत्॥'}

{'en': "That hero of undecaying glory, belonging to the race of the Dasharhas, promised to revive the child. Then he of pure soul, said these words in the hearing of the whole universe, 'O Uttara, I never utter a falsehood. My words will prove true. I shall revive this child before all creatures.", 'sn': 'प्रतिजज्ञे च दाशार्हस्तत्य जीवितमच्युतः। अब्रवीच्च विशुद्धात्मा सर्वे विश्रावयञ्जगत्॥ न ब्रवीम्युत्तरे मिथ्या सत्यमेतद् भविष्यति। एष संजीवयाम्येनं पश्यतां सर्वदेहिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Never before have I uttered a falschood even in just. Never have I turned back from battle. (By the merit of those deeds) let this child revive.', 'sn': 'नोक्तपूर्वं मया मिथ्या स्वैरेष्वपि कदाचन। न च युद्धात् परावृत्तस्तथा संजीवतामयम्॥'}

{'en': "As virtue is dear to me, as Brahmanas are especially dear to me, let Abhimanyu's son, who is born dead, revive.", 'sn': 'यथा मे दयितो धर्मो ब्राह्मणश्च विशेषतः। अभिमन्योः सुतो जातो मृतो जीवत्वयं तथा॥'}

{'en': 'Never has a misunderstanding arisen between me and my friend Vijaya. Let this dead child revive by that truth.', 'sn': 'यथाहं नाभिजानामि विजये तु कदाचन। विराधं तेन सत्येन मृतो जीवत्वयं शिशुः॥'}
{'en': 'As truth and virtue are always established in me, let this dead child of Abhimanyu revive.', 'sn': 'यथा सत्यं च धर्मश्च मयि नित्यं प्रतिष्ठितौ। तथा मृतः शिशुरयं जीवतादभिमन्युजः॥'}
{'en': 'As Kansa and Keshi have been righteously killed by me, let this child revive today by that truth.', 'sn': 'यथा कंसश्च केशी च धर्मेण निहतौ मया। तेन सत्येन बालोऽयं पुनः संजीवतामयम्॥'}

{'en': "After these words uttered by Vasudeva, that child, O foremost one of Bharata's family, became animal and began gradually to move, O king. were", 'sn': 'इत्युक्तो वासुदेवेन स बालो भरतर्षभ। शनैः शनैर्महाराज प्रास्पन्दत सचेतनः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said “Thinking of Liberation, Shuka approached his father, and possessed as he was of humility and desirous of acquiring his highest good, he saluted his great preceptor and said,-You are well-versed in the Religion of Liberation. Do you, O illustrious one, describe it to me, so that I may enjoy supreme tranquillity of mind, O powerful one.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच स मोक्षमनुचिन्त्यैव शुकः पितरमभ्यगात्। प्राहाभिवाद्य च गुरुं श्रेयोऽर्थी विनयान्वितः॥ मोक्षधर्मेषु कुशलो भगवान् प्रब्रवीतु मे। यथा मे मनसः शान्तिः परमा सम्भवेत् प्रभो॥'}

{'en': "Hearing these words of his son, the great Rishi said to him,-Do you study, O son, the Religion' of Liberation and all the various duties of life.", 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा पुत्रस्य तु वचः परमर्षिरुवाच तम्। अधीष्व पुत्र मोक्षं वै धर्मांच विविधानपि॥'}

{'en': 'At the command of his father, Shuka, that foremost of all righteous men, mastered all the books on Yoga, O Bharata, as also the Science of Kapila.', 'sn': 'पितुर्नियोगाज्जग्राह शुको धर्मभृतां वरः। योगशास्त्रं च निखिलं कापिलं चैव भारत॥'}

{'en': 'When Vyasa saw his son to be endued with the resplendence of the Vedas, and the energy of Brahman, and fully conversant with the Religion of Liberation, he addressed him, saying,-Go you to Janaka the king of Mithila. The king of Mithila will tell you everything for your Liberation.', 'sn': 'स तं ब्राह्मया श्रिया युक्तं ब्रह्मतुल्यपराक्रमम्। मेने पुत्रं यदा व्यासो मोक्षधर्मविशारदम्॥ उवाच गच्छेति तदा जनकं मिथिलेश्वरम्। स ते वक्ष्यति मोक्षार्थं निखिलं मिथिलेश्वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Bearing the command of his father, O king, Shuka, proceeded to Mithila for enquiring of its king about the truth of duties and the Refuge of Liberation.', 'sn': 'पितुर्नियोगमादाय जगाम मिथिलां नृप। प्रष्टुं धर्मस्य निष्ठां वै मोक्षस्य च परायणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Before he started, his father further told him,-Do you go there be that path which ordinary human beings follow. Do not have recourses to your Yoga-power for proceeding through the skies. At this Shuka was not at all surprised.', 'sn': 'उक्तश्च मानुषेण त्वं पथा गच्छेत्यविस्मितः। न प्रभावेण गन्तव्यमन्तरिक्षचरेण वै॥'}

{'en': 'He was further told that he should proceed there with simplicity and not from desire of pleasure.-Along your way do not seek for friends and wives, since friends and wives are causes of attachment to the world.', 'sn': 'आर्जवेणैव गन्तव्यं न सुखान्वेषिणा तथा। नान्वेष्टव्या विशेषास्तु विशेषा हि प्रसङ्गिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Although the king of Mithila is one in whose sacrifices we officiate, still you should not indulge in any feeling of superiority while living with him. You should live under his direction and in obedience to him. He will remove your doubts.', 'sn': 'अहंकारो न कर्तव्यो याज्ये तस्मिन् नराधिपे। स्थातव्यं च वशे तस्य स ते छेत्स्यति संशयम्॥'}

{'en': 'That king is well versed in all duties and well acquainted with the Scriptures on Liberation. He is one for whom I officiate in sacrifices. You should, unhesitatingly, do what he orders.', 'sn': 'स धर्मकुशलो राजा मोक्षशास्त्रविशारदः। याज्यो मम स यद् ब्रूयात् तत् कार्यमविशङ्कया॥'}

{'en': 'Thus instructed, the pious Shuka proceeded to Mithila on foot although he was able to go through the skies over the whole Earth with her seas.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तः स धर्मात्मा जगाम मिथिलां मुनिः। पद्भ्यां शक्तोऽन्तरिक्षण क्रान्तुं पृथ्वी ससागराम्॥'}

{'en': 'Crossing many hills and mountains, many rivers, many waters and lakes, and many woods and forests full of beasts of prey and other animals, crossing the two insular continents of Meru and Hari successively and next the continent of Himavat, he came at last to the continent known by the name of Bharata.', 'sn': 'स गिरीश्चाप्यतिक्रम्य नदीतीर्थसरांसि च। बहुव्यालमृगाकीर्णा ह्यटवीश्च वनानि च॥ मेरोहरेश्च द्वे वर्षे वर्ष हैमवतं ततः। क्रमेणैवं व्यतिक्रम्य भारतं वर्षमासदत्॥'}
{'en': 'Having seen many countries inhabited by Chins and Huns, the great ascetic at last reached Aryavarta.', 'sn': 'स देशान् विविधान् पश्यंश्चीनहूणनिषेवितान्। आर्यावर्तमिमं देशमाजगाम महामुनिः॥'}

{'en': 'In obedience to the commands of his father and bearing them constantly in his mind, he gradually passed along his way on the Earth like a bird passing through the air.', 'sn': 'पितुर्वचनमाज्ञाय तमेवार्थं विचिन्तयन्। अध्वानं सोऽतिचक्राम खेचरः खे चरन्निवा१६॥'}

{'en': 'Passing through many charming towns and populous cities, he saw various kinds of wealth without waiting to observe them.', 'sn': 'पत्तनानि च रम्याणि स्फीतानि नगराणि च। रत्नानि च विचित्राणि पश्यन्नपि न पश्यति॥'}
{'en': 'On his way he passed through many charming gardens and planes and many sacred waters.', 'sn': 'उद्यानानि च रम्याणि तथैवायतनानि च। पुण्यानि चैव रत्नानि सोऽत्यकामदथाध्वगः॥'}

{'en': 'Before much time had passed he reached the country of the Videhas that was protected by the virtuous and great Janaka.', 'sn': 'सोऽचिरेणैव कालेन विदेहानाससाद ह। रक्षितान् धर्मराजेन जनकेन महात्मना॥'}

{'en': 'There he saw many populous villages, and many kinds of food and drink and viands and houses of cowherds swelling with men and inany herbs of cattle.', 'sn': 'तत्र ग्रामान् बहून पश्यन् बबनरसभोजनान्। पल्लीघोषान् समृद्धांश्च बहुगोकुलसंकुलान्॥'}

{'en': 'He saw many fields abounding with paddy and barley and other grain, and many lakes and waters inhabited by swans and cranes and adorned with beautiful lotuses.', 'sn': 'स्फीतांश्च शालियवसैहँससारससेवितान्। पद्मिनीभिश्च शतशः श्रीमतीभिरलङ्कृतान्॥'}

{'en': 'Passing through the Videha country full of rich people, he arrived at the delightful gardens of Mithila rich with many sorts to trees.', 'sn': 'स विदेहानतिक्रम्य समृद्धजनसेवितान्। मिथिलोपवनं रम्यमाससाद समृद्धिमत्॥'}

{'en': 'Abounding with elephants and horses and cars, and peopled by men and women, he passed through them without caring to see the things that were presented to his eye.', 'sn': 'हस्त्यश्वरथसंकीर्णं नरनारीसमाकुलम्। पश्यन्नपश्यन्निव तत् समतिकामदच्युतः॥'}

{'en': 'Bearing that caution in his mind and continually thinking of it, Shuka of cheerful soul and taking delight in internal survey only, reached Mithila at last.', 'sn': 'मनसा तं वहन् भारं तमेवार्थं विचिन्तयन्। आत्मारामः प्रसन्नात्मा मिथिलामाससाद ह॥'}

{'en': "Arrived at the gate, he sent word through the guards, he reached the king's palace and entered it without any-hesitation. The gatekeepers prevented him with harsh words.", 'sn': 'तस्या द्वारं समासाद्य निःशङ्कः प्रविवेश हा तापि द्वारपालास्तमुग्रवाचा न्यषेधयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereat, Shuka, without any anger, stopped and waited. Neither the sun nor the long distance he had walked had tried him in the least. Neither hunger, nor thirst, nor the exertion he had made, had weakened him. The heat of the Sun had not scorched or pained or distressed him in any way.', 'sn': 'तथैव च शुकस्तत्र निर्मन्युः समतिष्ठत। चातपाध्वसंतप्तः क्षुत्पिपासाश्रमान्वितः॥ प्रताम्यति ग्लायति वा नापैति च तथाऽऽतपात्।'}

{'en': 'Among those porters there was one who felt mercy for him, seeing him staying there like the midday Sun in his effulgence.', 'sn': 'तेषां तु द्वारपालानामेकः शोकसमन्वितः॥ मध्यं गतमिवादित्यं दृष्ट्वा शुकमवस्थितम्।'}

{'en': 'Adoring him in due form and saluting him properly, with joined hands he conducted him to the first chamber of the palace.', 'sn': 'पूजयित्वा यथान्यायमभिवाद्य कृताञ्जलिः॥ प्रावेशयत् ततः कक्ष्यां द्वितीयां राजवेश्मनः।'}

{'en': "Seated there, Shuka, O son, began to think of Liberation only. Gifted with equality he considered impartially a shaded spot and one exposed to the Sun's rays.", 'sn': 'तत्रासीनः शुकस्तात मोक्षमेवान्वचिन्तयत्॥ छायायामातपे चैव समदर्शी महाद्युतिः।'}

{'en': "Soon after, the king's minister, coming to that place with joined hands, conducted him to the second chamber of the palace.", 'sn': 'तं मुहूर्तादिवागम्य राज्ञो मन्त्री कृताञ्जलिः॥ प्रावेशयत्ततः कक्ष्यां तृतीयां राजवेश्मनः।'}

{'en': 'That chamber led to a spacious garden which formed a part of the inner apartments of the palace. It looked like a second Chaitraratha. Beautiful pools of water were here and there at regular intervals. Delightful trees, all of which were in their flowering season, were in that garden.', 'sn': 'तत्रान्तःपुरसम्बद्धं महच्चैत्ररथोपमम्॥ सुविभक्तजलाक्रीडं रम्यं पुष्पितपादपम्।'}

{'en': 'Bevies of damsels, of celestial beauty, were in attendance. The minister led Suka from the second chamber to that charming spot. commanding those ladies to give the ascetic a seat, the minister left him there.', 'sn': 'शुकं प्रावेशयन्मन्त्री प्रमदावनमुत्तमम्॥ स तस्यासनमादिश्य निश्चक्राम ततः पुनः।'}

{'en': 'Those well-dressed well-dressed damels were of beautiful features, possessed to excellent hips, young in years, clad in red dresses of fine texture, and decked with many ornaments of burnished gold.', 'sn': 'तं चारुवेषाः सुश्रोण्यस्तरुण्यः प्रियदर्शनाः॥ सूक्ष्मरक्ताम्बरधरास्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणाः।'}

{'en': 'They well-skilled in sweet conversation and maddening revelry, and consummate mistresses of the arts of dancing and singing. Always opening their lips with smiles, they were like the very Apsaras in beauty.', 'sn': 'संलापोल्लापकुशला नृत्यगीतविशारदाः॥ स्मितपूर्वाभिभाषिण्यो रूपेणाप्सरसां समाः।'}

{'en': 'Well-skilled in all the acts of dalliance, capable of reading the thoughts of men upon whom they wait, endued with every accomplishment, fifty damsels, of a very high order and of east virtue, surrounded the ascetic.', 'sn': 'कामोपचारकुशला भावज्ञाः सर्वकोविदाः॥ परं पञ्चाशतं नार्यो वारमुख्याः समाद्रवन्।'}

{'en': 'Presenting him with water for washing his feet, and adoring him respectfully with the were offer of usual articles, they pleased him with excellent viands agreeable to the season.', 'sn': 'पाद्यादीनि प्रतिग्राह्य पूजया परयार्चयन्॥ कालोपपन्नेन तदा स्वाद्वन्नेनाभ्यतर्पयन्।'}

{'en': 'After he had eaten, those damsels then, one after another, singly conducted him through the grounds, showing him every objection of interest, O Bharata.', 'sn': 'तस्य भुक्तवतस्तात तदन्तःपुरकाननम्॥ सुरम्यं दर्शयामासुरेकैकश्येन भारत।'}

{'en': 'Sporting and laughing and singing, those ladies conversant with the thoughts of all men, entertained that ascetic of noble soul.', 'sn': 'क्रीडन्त्यश्च हसन्त्यश्च गायन्त्यश्चापिताः शुभम्॥ उदारसत्त्वं सत्त्वज्ञाः स्त्रियः पर्यचरंस्तथा।'}

{'en': 'The pure-souled ascetic born in the firesticks, performing all his duties unhesitatingly, having all his senses under complete control, and a thorough master of his anger, was neither pleased nor angered at all this.', 'sn': 'आरणेयस्तु शुद्धात्मा निःसंदेहः स्वकर्मकृत्॥ वश्येन्द्रियो जितक्रोधो न हृष्यति न कुप्यति।'}

{'en': 'Then those foremost of beautiful women offered him an excellent seat. Washing his feet and other limbs, Shuka said his evening prayers, sat on that excellent seat, and began to think of the object for which he had come there.', 'sn': 'तस्मै शय्यासनं दिव्यं देवाह रत्नभूषितम्॥ स्पास्तरणसंकीर्णं ददुस्ता: परमस्त्रियः। पादशौचं तु कृत्वैव शुकः संध्यामुपास्य च॥ निषसादासने पुण्ये तमेवार्थं विचिन्तयन्।'}

{'en': 'In the first part of the night, he gave himself of Yoga. The powerful ascetic, passed the middle part of the night in sleep.', 'sn': 'पूर्वरात्रे तु तत्रासौ भूत्वा ध्यानपरायणः॥ मध्यरात्रे यथान्यायं निद्रामाहारयत् प्रभुः।'}

{'en': 'Very soon waking up from his sleep, he performed the necessary rites of cleansing his body, and though surrounded by those beautiful ladies, he once again devoted himself to Yoga.', 'sn': 'ततो मुहूर्तादुत्थाय कृत्वा शौचमनन्तरम्॥ स्त्रीभिः परिवृतो धीमान् ध्यानमेवान्वपद्यत॥'}

{'en': 'It was in this way, O Bharata, that the son of the Island-born Krishna passed the latter part of that day and the whole of that night in the mansion of king Janaka.', 'sn': 'अनेन विधिना काणि स्तदहःशेषमच्युतः। तां च रात्रिं नृपकुले वर्तयामास भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said The illustrious son of Somadatta piercing each of those mighty bow men, the sons of Draupadi with five shafts, again pierced them with seven.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच द्रौपदेयान् महेष्वासान् सौमदत्तिर्महायशाः। एकैकं पञ्चभिर्विद्ध्वा पुनर्विव्याध सप्तभिः॥'}

{'en': 'Thus deeply afflicted by that fierce warrior, the sons of Draupadi, o king, became confounded and knew not what to do in that fight.', 'sn': 'ते पीडिता भृशं तेन रौद्रेण सहसा विभो। प्रमूढा नैव विविदुर्मधे कृत्यं स्म किंचन॥'}

{'en': "Thereafter that crusher of foes, namely Nakula's son Shatanika piercing that best of men viz., Somadatta's son with two arrows, became filled with joy and uttered a loud roar.", 'sn': 'नाकुलिश्च शतानीकः सौमदत्तिं नरर्षभम्। द्वाभ्यां विद्धवानदद्धृष्टः शराभ्यां शत्रुकर्शनः॥'}

{'en': 'The rest of the brothers, then exerting their best in battle, pierced the irate son of Somadatta, each with ten straight-flyings arrows.', 'sn': 'तथेतरे रणे यत्तास्त्रिभिस्त्रिभिरजिह्मगैः। विव्यधुः समरे तूर्णं सौमदत्तिममर्षणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, O mighty monarch, the illustrious son of Somadatta sped at them five arrows and with each of those struck each of the brothers on the chest.', 'sn': 'स तान् प्रति महाराज पञ्च चिक्षेप सायकान्। एकैकं हृदि चाजघ्ने एकैकेन महायशाः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon those five brothers pierced by the arrows of that high-souled one, surrounding the hero, wounded him soon with their arrows.', 'sn': 'ततस्ते भ्रातरः पञ्च शरैर्विद्धा महात्मना। परिवार्य रणे वीरं विव्यधुः सायकै शम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then the son of Arjuna filled with rage dispatched the four horses of him to the region of Death with four whetted shafts.', 'sn': 'आर्जुनिस्तु हयांस्तस्य चतुर्भिनिशितैः शरैः। प्रेषयामास संक्रुद्धो यमस्य सदनं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'The son of Bhimasena cutting of the bow of the illustrious son of Somadatta, uttered a fierce roar and pierced the latter with numerous sharp arrows.', 'sn': 'भैमसेनिर्धनुश्छित्त्वा सौमदत्तेर्महात्मनः। ननाद बलवन्नादं विव्याध च शितैः शरैः॥'}

{'en': "The son of Yudhishthira felled his standard having at first cut it off, so also Nakula's son felled his charioteer from its place on the chariot.", 'sn': 'यौधिष्ठिरिध्वजं तस्य छित्त्वा भूमावपातयत्। नाकुलिश्चाथ यन्तारं रथनीडादपाहरत्॥'}

{'en': "Sahadeva's, son, then knowing him to be already vanquished by his brothers, cut-off, ) king, his head with a razor-headed arrow. Once more slaying four hundred warriors, he pierced Bhima with winged shafts. Then thus deepły pierced by that Rakshasa, the highly puissant Bhima.", 'sn': 'साहदेविसतु तं ज्ञात्वा भ्रातृभिर्विमुखीकृतम्। क्षुरप्रेण शिरो राजन् निचकर्त महात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'Then that head fell down on ground beautifying the field of battle-head that was adorned with gold and that equalled in effulgence the newly-risen sun.', 'sn': 'तच्छिरो न्यपतद् भूमौ तपनीयविभूषितम्। भ्राजयत् तं रणोद्देशं बालसूर्यसमप्रभम्॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding the illustrious son of Somadatta slain and his head roll on the ground, your troops, O king, greatly frightened, began to fly in all directions.', 'sn': 'सौमदत्तेः शिरो दृष्ट्वा निहतं तन्महात्मनः। वित्रस्तास्तावका राजन् प्रदुद्रुवुरनेकधा॥'}

{'en': 'Alambusha filled with rage, fought on with the highly powerful Bhimasena, like the son of Ravana fighting with Lakshmana.', 'sn': 'अलम्बुषस्तु समरे भीमसेनं महाबलम्। योधयामास संक्रुद्धो लक्ष्मणं रावणिर्यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding then that man and that Rakshasa engaged in fighting with each other, all creatures were filled with delight and wonder simultancously.', 'sn': 'सम्प्रयुद्धौ रणे दृष्ट्वा तावुभौ नरराक्षसौ। विस्मयः सर्वभूतानां प्रहर्षः समजायत॥'}

{'en': 'Then, O king, with nine shafts of depressed knots, Bhima smilingly pierced, O king, that wrathful son of Rishyshringa, that foremost of Rakshasas.', 'sn': 'आर्ण्यशृङ्गिं ततो भीमो नवभिर्निशितैः शरैः। विव्याध प्रहसन राजन् राक्षसेन्द्रममर्षणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereat the Rakshasa, thus pierced, uttering aloud fierce roars in that battle, rushed, supported by all his followers, upon Bhima.', 'sn': 'तद् रक्षः समरे विद्धं कृत्वा नाद भयावहम्। अभ्यद्रवत् ततो भीमं ये च तस्य पदानुगाः॥'}

{'en': 'That Rakshasa then piercing Bhima with five arrows of depressed knots, quickly slew three hundred car-warriors engaged supporting Bhima.', 'sn': 'स भीमं पञ्चभिर्विद्ध्वा शरैः संनतपर्वभिः भैमान् परिजघानाशु रथास्त्रिशतमाहवे॥'}

{'en': 'Once more slaying four hunderd warriors, he pierced Bhima with winged shafts. Then thus deeply peirced by that Rakshasa, the highly puissant Bhima.', 'sn': 'पुनश्चतु:शतान् हत्वा भीमं विव्याध पत्रिणा। सोऽतिविद्धस्तथा भीमो राक्षसेन महाबलः॥'}

{'en': 'Squatted down on the terrace of his car, being overwhelmed with a swoon. Regaining his senses, the son of Maruta, overwhelmed with rage.', 'sn': 'निपयात रथोपस्ये मूर्छयाभिपरिप्लुतः। प्रतिलभ्य ततः संज्ञा मारुतिः क्रोधमूर्छितः॥'}

{'en': 'Stretched his dreadful and excellent bow capable of bearing a great strain and then he wounded Alambusha on all parts of his body with sharp shafts', 'sn': 'विकृष्य कार्मुकं घोरं भारसाधनमुत्तमम्। अलम्बुषं शरैस्तीक्ष्णैरर्दयामास सर्वतः॥'}

{'en': 'Thus pierced with many shafts that Rakshasa resembling a heap of antimony looked beautiful, O king like a Kinshuka tree decorated with flowers.', 'sn': 'स विद्धो बहुभिर्वाणैर्नीलाञ्जनचयोपमः। शुशुभे सर्वतो राजन् प्रफुल्ल इव किशुकः॥'}

{'en': "Thus struck in that battle with arrows shot from Bhima's bow and recollecting the slaughter of his brother by that illustrious son of Pandu, the Rakshasa.", 'sn': 'स वध्यमानः समरे भीमचापच्युतैः शरैः। स्मरन् भ्रातृवधं चैव पाण्डवेन महात्मना॥'}

{'en': 'Caused his appearance to be dreadful and addressing Bhimasena spoke these words "Stay, O son of Pritha, on the field of battle and bchold today the prowess I am endued with.', 'sn': 'घोरं रूपमथो कृत्वा भीमसेनमभाषत। तिष्ठेदानी रणे पार्थ पश्य मेऽद्य पराक्रमम्॥'}

{'en': "O you of perverted understanding, I had a brother by name Baka who was the foremost of the Rakshasas and endued with great prowess. He was slain by you; but that transpired out of my sight.'", 'sn': 'बको नाम सुदुर्बुद्धे राक्षसप्रवरो बली। परोक्षं मम तद् वृत्तं यद् भ्राता मे हतस्त्वया॥'}

{'en': 'Having thus spoken to Bhima, he became invisible then and there; and then he covered the former with a thick shower of arrows.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा ततो भीममन्तर्धानं गतस्तदा। महता शरवर्षेण भृशं तं समवाकिरत्॥'}

{'en': 'Bhima also O king filled the welkin with arrows of depressed knots, when that Rakshasa became invisible in battle.', 'sn': 'भीमस्तु समरे राजन्नदृश्ये राक्षसे तदा। आकाशं पूरयामास शरैः संनतपर्वभिः॥'}

{'en': 'Thus wounded by Bhima, the Rakshasa soon got inside his chariot; and soon again he entered into the bowels of the earth and soon again becoming little, flew into the sky.', 'sn': 'स वध्यमानो भीमेन निमेषाद् रथमास्थितः। जगाम धरणीं चैव क्षुद्रः ख सहसागमत्॥'}

{'en': 'He assumed forms countless and large and small. Sometimes assuming subtle, sometimes a gross and sometimes a huge form, he began to roar like the clouds.', 'sn': 'उच्चावचानि रूपाणि चकार सुबहूनि च। अणुवृहत्पुनः स्थूलोनादान् मुञ्चन्निवाम्बुदः॥'}

{'en': 'He spoke diverse kinds of words and uttered speeches everywhere. From the welkin then fell thousands of arrowy showers.', 'sn': 'उच्चावचास्तथा वाचे व्याजहार समन्ततः। निपेतुर्गगनाच्चैव शरधाराः सहस्रशः॥'}

{'en': 'As also darts, Kunapas lances, pikes axes, spears, rockets, spiked maces, short javelins, battle-axes, rocks, scimitars treacle and swords and thunder bolts. That dreadful shower of weapons created by that Rakshasa.', 'sn': 'शक्तयः कणपाः प्रासाः शूलपट्टिशतोमराः। शतभ्यः परिघाश्चैव भिन्दिपालाः परश्वधाः॥ शिलाः खड्गा गुडाश्चैव ऋष्टीर्वजाणि चैव ह। सा राक्षसविसृष्टा तु शस्त्रवृष्टिः सुदारुणा॥'}

{'en': "Slaughtered the soldiers of Pandu's son on the field of battle. In consequence of showers of weapons, many elephants of the Pandava host were killed.", 'sn': 'जघान पाण्डुपुत्रस्य सैनिकान् रणमूर्धनि। तेन पाण्डवसैन्यानां सूदिता युधि वारणाः॥'}

{'en': 'As also numerous steeds and foot-soldiers, O king. Slain by the shafts of the Rakshasa, many car-warriors were dislodged from their seats in the car.', 'sn': 'हयाश्च बहवो राजन् पत्तयश्च तथा पुनः। रथेभ्यो रथिन: पेतुस्तस्य नुन्नाः स्म सायकैः॥'}

{'en': 'The Rakshasa then caused a river to flow on the field of battle, the waters of which were constituted by blood and eddies by cars; which abounded in alligators constituted by the elephants, which has the umbrellas of carwarriors for its swans and the flesh and marrow of animals for its mire; which was infested with snakes formed by the severed arms of human beings; which was frequented by many Rakshasas and other cannibals; and O king, which carried with its currents numerous Chedis, Panchalas and Srinjayas.', 'sn': 'शोणितोदां रथावर्ती हस्तिग्राहसमाकुलाम्। छत्रहंसां कर्दमिनी बाहुपन्नगसंकुलाम्॥ नदी प्रावर्तयामास रक्षोगणसमाकुलाम्। वहन्ती बहुधा राजश्चेदिपाञ्चालसृञ्जयान्॥'}

{'en': '0 monarch, seeing him careering dauntlessly on the field of battle and beholding his prowess, the Pandava became filled with anxious thought.', 'sn': 'तं तथा समरे राजन् विचरन्तमभीतवत्। पाण्डवा भृशसंविग्नाः प्रापश्यंस्तस्य विक्रमम्॥'}

{'en': 'The soldiers of your army were then filled with delight; the musical instruments were then struck up emitting fierce and deep sound, making the hair to stand erect.', 'sn': 'तावकानां तु सैन्यानां प्रहर्षः समजायत। वादित्रनिनदश्चोग्रः सुमहान् रोमहर्षणः ३७॥'}

{'en': 'Then hearing that mighty uproar of delight caused by your troops, the son of Pandu (Bhima) did hot tolerate it, even like a snake not tolerating the sound of the palm-stroke.', 'sn': 'तं श्रुत्वा निनदं घोरं तव सैन्यस्य पाण्डवः। नामृष्यत यथा नागस्तलशब्दं समीरितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then with his eyes coppery in rage and consuming the foe like fire itself, the son of Maruta invoked the Tvashtra weapon like the god Tvashtri himself.', 'sn': 'ततः क्रोधाभिताम्राक्षो निर्दहन्निव पावकः। संदधे त्वाष्ट्रमस्त्रं स स्वयं त्वष्टेव मारुतिः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon a thousand shafts started into existence from all sides. Great was the carnage that was then created in your troops by those arrows of Bhima.', 'sn': 'ततः शरसहस्राणि प्रादुरासन् समन्ततः। तैः शरैस्तव सैन्यस्य विद्रवः सुमहानभूत्॥'}

{'en': 'That weapon discharged by Bhimasena in battle, nullifying the mighty illusion of the Rakshasa, began to afflict the Rakshasa himself.', 'sn': 'तदस्त्रं प्रेरितं तेन भीमसेनेन संयुगे। राक्षसस्य महामायां हत्वा राक्षसमार्दयत्॥'}

{'en': "Thus that Rakshasa wounded by Bhimasena in all parts of his body, fled towards Drona's division, abandoning his antagonist.", 'sn': 'स वध्यमानो बहुधा भीमसेनेन राक्षसः। संत्यज्य समरे भीमं द्रोणानीकमुपाद्रवत्॥'}

{'en': 'Then, O king, when that foremost of the Rakshasas had been worsted by the illustrious Bhimasena, the Pandavas filled the quarters with the echoes of their war-cries.', 'sn': 'तस्मिंस्तु निर्जिते राजन् राक्षसेन्द्रे महात्मना। अनादयन् सिंहनादैः पाण्डवाः सर्वतो दिशम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then filled with delight, they applauded the mighty son of Maruta the Marutas themselves applauded Shakra after he had vanquished Pralhada in battle. as', 'sn': 'अपूजयन् मारुतिं च संहृष्टास्ते महाबलम्। प्रह्रादं समरे जित्वा यथा शक्रं मरुद्गणाः॥'}

{'en': 'Dhritarashtra said : I desire to act exactly as you desire, but I do not wish to show my mental thoughts to Vidura even by my demeanour.', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र उवाच अहमप्येवमेवैतच्चिकीर्षामि यथा युवाम्। विवेक्तुं नाहमिच्छामि त्वाकारं विदुरं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore, I was highly applauding them, (the Pandavas), so that Vidura may not know my real desire even by a sign.', 'sn': 'ततस्तेषां गुणानेव कीर्तयामि विशेषतः। नावबुध्येत विदुरो ममाभिप्रायमिङ्गितैः॥'}

{'en': 'O Duryodhana, as this is the (proper) time, tell me, therefore, what is in your mind and also, in the mind of the son of Radha (Karna.)', 'sn': 'यच्च त्वं मन्यसे प्राप्तं तद् ब्रवीहि सुयोधन। राधेय मन्यसे यच्च प्राप्तकालं वदाशु मे॥'}

{'en': 'Duryodhana said : Let us by the help of trusted and skillful Brahmanas privately create dissensions amongst the Pandavas, a quarrel between the sons of Kunti and those of Madri.', 'sn': 'दुर्योधन उवाच अद्य तान् कुशलैर्विप्रैः सुगुप्तैराप्तकारिभिः। कुन्तीपुत्रान् भेदयामो माद्रीपुत्रौ च पाण्डवौ॥'}

{'en': 'Or let the king Drupada with his sons and ail his ministers of state be tempted by the presents of large wealth, so that they may abandon the cause of the son of Kunti, Yudhishthira. Or let them (our spies) speak to each of them separately the inconvenience of this place (Hastinapur) and induce them to live there (in Panchala.) Thus separated from the Kurus, they may live permanently there.', 'sn': 'अथवा द्रुपदो राजा महद्भिर्वित्तसंचयैः। पुत्राश्चास्य प्रलोभ्यन्ताममात्याश्चैव सर्वशः॥ परित्यजेद् यथा राजा कुन्तीपुत्रं युधिष्ठिरम्। अथ तत्रैव वा तेषां निवासं रोचयन्तु ते॥ इहैषां दोषवद्वासं वर्णयन्तु पृथक् पृथक्। ते भिद्यमानास्तत्रैव मनः कुर्वन्तु पाण्डवाः॥'}

{'en': 'O let some clever men, full of resources, sow the seed of disunion among the sons of Pritha and make them jealous of one another.', 'sn': 'अथवा कुशलाः केचिदुपायनिपुणा नराः। इतरेतरतः पार्थान् भेदयन्त्वनुरागतः॥'}

{'en': 'Or let them incite Krishna (Draupadi) against her husbands; as she has many husbands, it will not at all be difficult. Let some make the Pandavas dissatisfied with her, so that she may be displeased with them.', 'sn': 'व्युत्थापयन्तु वा कृष्णां बहुत्वात् सुकरं हि तत्। अथवा पाण्डवांस्तस्यां भेदयन्तु ततश्च ताम्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, let some clever spies, full of resources, go there and secretly bring about the death of Bhimasena, he is the strongest of them all.', 'sn': 'भीमसेनस्य वा राजन्नुपायकुशलैनरैः। मृत्युर्विधीयतां छन्नैः स हि तेषां बलाधिकः॥'}

{'en': 'Relying on him the son of Kunti formerly disregarded us. He is fierce, brave and the main-stay of the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'तमाश्रित्य हि कौन्तेयः पुरा चास्मान् न मन्यते। स हि तीक्ष्णाश्च शूरश्च तेषां चैव परायणम्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, on his death all the others (the Pandavas) will be deprived of strength and energy. Deprived of him, who is their mainstay, they will not attempt to regain their kingdom.', 'sn': 'तस्मिंस्त्वभिहते राजन् हतोत्साहा हतौजसः। यतिष्यन्ते न राज्याय स हि तेषां व्यपाश्रयः॥'}

{'en': 'If Arjuna is supported from behind by Vrikodara (Bhima), he is invincible in battle. But if Bhima is not there, he (Arjuna) is not a match for even the forth part of the son of Radha (Karna).', 'sn': 'अजेयो ह्यर्जुनः संख्ये पृष्ठगोपे वृकोदरे। तमृते फाल्गुनो युद्धे राधेयस्य न पादभाक्॥'}

{'en': 'In consequence of the death of Bhimasena, they (the Pandavas) would know themselves weak and ourselves strong; and they will not attempt to recover the kingdom.', 'sn': 'जानानास्तु दौर्बल्यं भीमसेनमृते महत्। अस्मान् बलवतो ज्ञात्वा न यतिष्यन्ति दुर्बलाः॥ ते'}

{'en': 'O king, if coming here, they prove themselves docile and obedient to us, we would then try to repress them according to the Shastras (Political science).', 'sn': 'इहागतेषु वा तेषु निदेशवशवर्तिषु। प्रवर्तिष्यामहे राजन् यथाशास्त्रं निबर्हणम्॥'}

{'en': 'We may tempt them with handsome girls; and on sceing which Krishna (Draupadi) will surely be annoyed with the sons of Kunti.', 'sn': 'अथवा दर्शनीयाभिः प्रमदाभिर्विलोभ्यताम्। एकैकस्तत्र कौन्तेयस्ततः कृष्णा विरज्यताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Or, O son of Radha, send messengers to bring them here, so that getting them here, we might kill them by some means or other.', 'sn': 'प्रेष्यतां चैव राधेयस्तेषामागमनाय वै। तैस्तैः प्रकारैः संनीय पात्यन्तामाप्तकारिभिः॥'}

{'en': 'O father, employ any of these means which appear to you faultless. Time passes away, we should not make any further delay. So long their confidence in that best of kings Drupada is not established, we may succeed, but not after (when it has been established).', 'sn': 'एतेषामप्युपायानां यस्ते निर्दोषवान् मतः। तस्य प्रयोगमातिष्ठ पुरा कालोऽतिवर्तते॥ यावद्ध्यकृतविश्वासा दुपदे पार्थिवर्षभे। तावदेव हि ते शक्या न शक्यास्तु ततः परम्॥'}

{'en': 'O father, these are my views for their suppression. Judge whether they are good or bad. What, O son of Radha (Karna), do you think?', 'sn': 'एषा मम मतिस्तात निग्रहाय प्रवर्तते। साध्वी वा यदि वासाध्वी किं वा राधेय मन्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said: The king Haihayas was killed by (Parashu) Rama, the son of Jamadagni, with his battle axe from his anger at the death of his father. Cutting off one thousand arms of Arjuna (Haihayas), he achieved a most difficult feat in the world.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच जामदग्न्येन रामेण पितृर्वधममृध्यता। राजा परशुना पूर्वं हैहयाधिपतिर्हतः॥ शतानि दश बाहूनां निकृत्तान्यर्जुनस्य वै। लोकस्याचरितो धर्मस्तेनाति किल दुश्चरः॥'}

{'en': 'He set out on his car to conquer the world; and taking up his bow, he hurled his mighty weapons to exterminate the Kshatriyas. In olden time the illustrious descendant of the Bhrigu race, exterminated the Kshatriya race for twenty one times with his swift arrows.', 'sn': 'पुनश्च धनुरादाय महास्त्राणि प्रमुञ्चता। निर्दग्धं क्षत्रमसकृद्रथेन जयता महीम्॥ एवमुचावचैरस्त्रैर्भार्गवेण महात्मना। त्रिःसप्तकृत्वः पृथिवी कृता निःक्षत्रिया पुरा॥'}

{'en': 'When the earth was thus in olden time made Kshatriya-less by that great Rishi, the Kshatriya women raised children by the Brahmanas, learned in the Vedas. They went to the Brahmanas not lustfully, but from virtuous motives. It is said in the Vedas that the son so raised belongs to him that had married the mother.', 'sn': 'एवं निःक्षत्रिये लोके कृते तेन महर्षिणा। ततः संभूय सर्वाभिः क्षत्रियाभिः समन्ततः॥ उत्पादितान्यपत्यानि ब्राह्मणैर्वेदपारगैः। पाणिग्राहस्य तनय इति वेदेषु निश्चितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having established Dharma in mind those Brahmanas reached there. In this world we have seen rebirth of Kshatriyas.', 'sn': 'धर्मं मनसि संस्थाप्य ब्राह्मणांस्ताः समभ्ययुः। लोकेऽप्याचरितो दृष्टः क्षत्रियाणां पुनर्भवः॥'}

{'en': 'Thus it was that the Kshatriya race was again brought into existence all over the world. There is an old history in connection with this matter and I shall narrate it to you.', 'sn': 'ततः पुनः समुदितं क्षत्रं समभवत्तदा। इमं चैवात्र वक्ष्येऽहमितिहासं पुरातनम्॥'}

{'en': "There was in the time of yore, a wise Rishi, named Utathya. He had a wife, name Mamata whom he dearly loved.
