One day Utathya's younger brother, the priest of the celestials, the greatly effulgent Brihaspati, proposed to Mamata.", 'sn': 'अथोतथ्य इति ख्यात आसीद्धीमानृषिः पुरा। ममता नाम तस्यासीद्धार्या परमसंमता॥ उतथ्यस्य यवीयांस्तु पुरोधास्त्रिदिवौकसाम्। बृहस्पतिर्ब्रहत्तेजा ममतामन्वपद्यत॥'}

{'en': "Mamata said to her Devara (husband's younger brother), that best of eloquent men, “I am pregnant by your elder brother; therefore you should not seek me now.", 'sn': 'उवाच ममता तं तु देवरं वदतां वरम्। अन्तर्वन्ती त्वहं भ्रात्रा ज्येष्ठेनारम्यतामिति॥'}

{'en': 'O illustrious Brihaspati, the child, who is now in my womb, has studied there the Vedas with six Angas. Your seed is also infallible. How is it possible for two children to live there at the same time? Therefore, you should not desire me to-day.”', 'sn': 'अयं च मे महाभाग कुक्षावेव बृहस्पते। औतथ्यो वेदमत्रापि षडङ्गं प्रत्यधीयत॥ अमोघरेतास्त्वं चापि द्वयोर्नास्त्यत्र संभवः। तस्मादेवंगते त्वद्य उपारमितुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'Having been thus addressed by her, Brihaspati, though greatly intelligent, could not suppress his desire.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तस्तदा सम्यग्बृहस्पतिरुदारधीः। कामात्मानं तदात्मानं न शशाक नियच्छितुम्॥'}

{'en': '(Slokas 14 to 21 are not translated for obvious reasons.)', 'sn': 'स बभूव ततः कामी तया सार्धमकामया। उत्सृजन्तं तु तं रेतः स गर्भस्थोऽभ्यभाषत॥ भोस्तात मा गमः कामं द्वयोर्नास्तीह संभवः। अल्पावकाशो भगवन्पूर्वं चाहमिहागतः॥ अमोधरेताश्च भवान्न पीडां कर्तुमर्हति। अश्रुत्वैव तु तद्वाक्यं गर्भस्थस्य बृहस्पतिः॥ जगाम मैथुनायैव ममतां चारुलोचनाम्। शुक्रोत्सर्गं ततो बुद्ध्वा तस्या गर्भगतो मुनिः॥ पद्ध्यामारोधयन्मार्ग शुक्रस्य च बृहस्पतेः। स्थानमप्राप्तमथ तच्छुक्रं प्रतिहतं तदा॥ पपात सहसा भूमौ ततः क्रुद्धो बृहस्पतिः। तं दृष्ट्वा पतितं शुक्रं शशाप स रुषान्वितः॥ उतथ्यपुत्रं गर्भस्थं निर्भय॑ भगवानृषिः। यन्मां त्वमीदृशे काले सर्वभूतेप्सिते सति॥'}

{'en': "From the curse of the Rishi Brihaspati, Utathy's son, as illustrious and as effulgent as Brihaspati, was born blind; and he was named Dirghatamas. The born-blind, Veda-knowing and greatly wise Rishi obtained for his wife by his learning a young and handsome Brahmana maiden, named Pradveshi.", 'sn': 'एवमात्थ वचस्तस्मात्तमो दीर्घ प्रवेक्ष्यसि। स वै दीर्घतमा नाम शापादृषिरजायत।॥ बृहस्पतेर्वृहत्कीर्तेर्वृहस्पतिरिवौजसा। जात्यन्धे वेदवित्प्राज्ञः पत्नी लेभे स विद्यया॥ तरुणी रूपसंपन्नां प्रद्वेषीं नाम ब्राह्मणीम्। स पुत्राञ्जनयामास गौतमादीन्महायशाः॥'}

{'en': "He begot on her Gautama and other sons in order to keep up the illustrious line of Utathya's race. But Gautama and others were all covetous and fools. The virtuous-minded, high souled and learned in the Vedas and Vedangas. (Dirghatamas) learnt from Surabhi's son the practices of the cow race and he began publicly to commit the vice.", 'sn': 'ऋषेरुतथ्यस्य तदा संतानकुलवृद्धये। धर्मात्मा च महात्मा च वेदवेदाङ्गपारगः॥ गोधर्मं सौरभेयाच सोऽधीत्य निखिलं मुनिः। प्रावर्तत तदा कर्तुं श्रद्धावांस्तमशङ्कया।॥'}

{'en': 'The excellent Rishis, the dwellers of the same hermitage, became indignant to see him transgress all propriety. They said, “This man transgresses all propriety. He deserves not to live in the hermitage. We shall all renounce this sinful wretch."', 'sn': 'ततो वितथमर्यादं तं दृष्ट्वा मुनिसत्तमाः। क्रुद्धा मोहाभिभूतास्ते सर्वे तत्राश्रमौकसः॥ अहोऽयं भिन्नमर्यादो नाश्रमे वस्तुमर्हति। तस्मादेनं वयं सर्वे पापात्मानं त्यजामहे॥'}

{'en': 'They said many things else regarding the Rishi Dirghatamas. His wife also, having (already) obtained sons, was not pleased with him.', 'sn': 'इत्यन्योऽन्यं समाभाष्य ते दीर्घतमसं मुनिम्। पुत्रलाभा च सा पत्नी न तुतोष पतिं तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Pradveshi said : The husband then addressing his wife Pradveshi said, "Why are you dissatisfied with me?" The husband is called Bhatri, because he supports his wife; he is called Pati, because he protects her, but you are neither to me. O great ascetic, as you are blind from your birth, it is I who have supported you and your children. But I shall do it no longer.', 'sn': 'प्रद्वेष्युवाच प्रद्विषन्तीं पतिर्भार्यां किं मां द्वेक्षीति चाब्रवीत्। भार्याया भरणाद्भर्ती पालनाच पतिः स्मृतः॥ अहं त्वद्भरणाशक्ता जात्यधं ससुतं तदा। नित्यकालं श्रमेणार्ता न भरेयं महातपः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said: Having heard her words, the Rishi became angry and he said to his wife Pradveshi and her sons "Take me to the Kshatriyas (kings) and you will then be rich."', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा ऋषिः कोपसमन्वितः। प्रत्युवाच ततः पत्नी प्रद्वेषीं ससुतां तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Pradveshi said : O Brahmana, I do not desire to possess the wealth, earned by you, which would always be the cause of misery. O best of Brahmanas, do what you like; I shall not support you as I did before.', 'sn': 'पुरा यथा। वै॥ प्रद्वेष्युवाच नियतां क्षत्रियकुले धनार्थश्च भविष्यति। त्वया दत्तं धनं विप्र नेच्छेयं दुःखकारणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Dirghatamas said : From this day I make this rule among men that every woman shall stick to one husband only all through her life. Whether the husband is dead, or whether he is alive, she must not have connection with another man. She, who will have it, will be considered as fallen. A woman without a husband will always be liable to be sinful. Even if she is wealthy, she will not be able to enjoy it truly. Calumny and evil report will always follow her.', 'sn': 'दीर्घतमा उवाच यथेष्टं कुरु विप्रेन्द्र न भरेयं अद्यप्रभृति मर्यादा मया लोके प्रतिष्ठिता॥ एक एव पतिर्नार्या यावजीवं परायणम्। मृते जीवति वा तस्मिन्नापरं प्राप्नुयान्नरम्॥ अभिगम्य परं नारी पतिष्यति न संशयः। आपतीनां तु नारीणामद्यप्रभृति पातकम्॥ यद्यस्ति चेद्धनं सर्वे वृथाभोगा भवन्तु ताः। अकीर्तिः परिवादाश्च नित्यं तासां भवन्तु'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said: Having heard these words, the Brahmana lady became exceedingly angry and said, “O sons, throw him into the Ganges.”', 'sn': 'इति तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा ब्राह्मणी भृशकोपिता। गङ्गायां नीयतामेष पुत्रा इत्येवमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Her avaricious and foolish sons, Gautama and his brothers, exclaimed, “Why should we support this blind old man?” Thus thinking, those wicked men tied him on a raft and threw him into the Ganges. They then returned home.', 'sn': 'लोभमोहाभिभूतास्ते पुत्रास्तं गौतमादयः। बध्वोडुपे परिक्षिप्य गङ्गायां समवासृजन्॥ कस्मादन्धश्च वृद्धश्च भर्तव्योऽयमिति स्म ते। चिन्तयित्वा ततः क्रूराः प्रतिजग्मुरथो गृहान्॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana, drifting along the stream on that raft, passed through the territories of many kings. One day a king, named Bali, learned in all the precepts of religion, saw him (the blind Rishi) drifting along the stream and approaching near him.', 'sn': 'सोऽनुस्रोतस्तदा विप्रः प्लवमानो यदृच्छया। जगाम सुबहून्देशानन्धस्तेनोडुपेन ह॥ तं तु राजा बलि म सर्वधर्मविदां वरः। अपश्यन्मजनगतः स्रोतसाभ्याशमागतम्॥'}

{'en': 'O best of the Bharata race, the virtuousminded Bali, whose strength was truth, knowing who he was, took him up (from the stream) for the purpose of raising up offspring. He said. "O illustrious man, I have to raise up a few sons on my wife. Therefore, beget on her some virtuous and wise sons.\'', 'sn': 'जग्राह चैनं धर्मात्मा बलिः सत्यपराक्रमः। ज्ञात्वा चैवं स वव्रेऽथ पुत्रार्थं भरतर्षभ।॥ सन्तानार्थं महाभाग भार्यासु मम मानद। पुत्रा-धर्मार्थकुशलानुत्पादयितुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed, the greatly effulgent Rishi said to him, “Be it so.” Thereupon, that king sent his wife Sudeshna to him.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तः स तेजस्वी तं तथेत्युक्तवानृषिः। तस्मै स राजा स्वां भार्यां सुदेष्णां प्राहिणोत्तदा॥'}

{'en': 'That lady, knowing him to be blind and old, did not go to him. She sent to him her old nurse. The virtuous-minded Rishi begot on that Shudra woman eleven sons.', 'sn': 'अन्धं वृद्धं च तं मत्वा न सा देवी जगाम ह। स्वां तु धात्रेयिकां तस्मै वृद्धाय प्राहिणोत्तदा॥ तस्यां काक्षीवदादीन्स शूद्रयोनावृषिस्तदा। जनयामास धर्मात्मा पुत्रानेकादशैव तु॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of the Bharata race, seeing all those sons, Kakshivata being their eldest, who studied all the Vedas, the king one day asked the Rishi, "Are these sons mine?”', 'sn': 'काक्षीवदादीन्पुत्रांस्तान्दृष्ट्वा सर्वानधीयतः। उवाच तमृषि राजा ममेम इति भारत॥'}

{'en': 'The great Rishi said to him, "No, they are mine. I have begotten Kakshivat and others on a Shudra woman.', 'sn': 'नेत्युवाच महर्षिस्तं ममेम इति चाब्रवीत्। शूद्रयोनौ मया हीमे जाता: काक्षीवदादयः॥'}

{'en': 'Your queen, Sudeshna, finding me old and blind, the foolish woman, insulted me (by not coming herself) and sent her nurse to me.', 'sn': 'अन्धं वृद्धं च मां दृष्ट्वा सुदेष्णा महिषी तव। अवमन्य ददौ मूढा शूद्रां धात्रेयिका मम॥'}

{'en': 'He (the king) then gratified the excellent Rishi and sent his wife, Sudeshna, again to him.', 'sn': 'ततः प्रसादयामास पुनस्तमृषिसत्तमम्। बलिः सुदेष्णाः स्वां भार्यां तस्मै स प्राहिणोत्पुनः।।५१'}

{'en': "Dhirghatama touched that lady's body and told her, “You will give birth to sons, as effulgent as the sun.", 'sn': 'तां स दीर्घतमाङ्गेषु स्पृष्ट्वा देवीमथाब्रवीत्। भविष्यन्ति कुमारास्ते तेजसादित्यवर्चसः॥'}

{'en': 'Namely, Anga, Vanga, Kalinga Pundra and Sunga. Five countries will be named on earth after their names,', 'sn': 'अङ्गो वङ्गः कलिङ्गश्च पुण्ड्रः सुह्यश्च ते सुताः। तेषां देशा: समाख्याताः स्वनाम कथिता भुवि॥'}

{'en': 'From Anga a country will be called Anga, from Banga one Banga, from Kalinga one Kalinga, from Pundra one Pundra and from Suhma one Sahma. It was thus the line of Bali was perpetuated by the Rishi.', 'sn': 'अङ्गस्याङ्गोऽभवद्देशो वङ्गो वङ्गस्य च स्मृतः। कलिङ्गविषयश्चैव कलिङ्गस्य च स स्मृतः॥ पुण्ड्रस्य पुण्ड्राः प्रख्याताः सुह्माः सुह्मस्य च स्मृताः। एवं बले: पुरा वंशः प्रख्यातो वै महर्षिजः॥'}

{'en': 'It was thus that many virtuous, greatly energetic and exceedingly strong bow-men, Kshatriyas, were born from the Brahmanas. Hearing this, O mother, do as you like in this matter. Q', 'sn': 'एवमन्ये महेष्वासा ब्राह्मणैः क्षत्रिया भुवि। जाता: परमधर्मज्ञां वीर्यवन्तो महाबलाः। एतच्छ्रुत्वा त्वमप्यत्र मात: कुरु यथेप्सितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Taking up another very strong bow the king of the Madras struck Yudhishthira and roared like a lion.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच अथान्यद् धनुरादाय बलवान् वेगवत्तरम्। युधिष्ठिरं मद्रपतिर्भित्वा सिंह इवानदत्॥'}

{'en': 'Then that best of Kshatriyas, of great cnergy, poured upon all the Kshatriyas showers of arrows even like Indra pouring rain in torrents.', 'sn': 'ततः स शववर्षेण पर्जन्य इव वृष्टिमान्। अभ्यवर्षदमेयात्मा क्षत्रियान् क्षत्रियर्षभः॥'}

{'en': 'Piercing Satyaki with ten arrows and Bhima with three and Sahadeva with as many, he assailed Yudhishthira greatly.', 'sn': 'सात्यकि दशभिर्विद्ध्वा भीमसेनं त्रिभिः शरैः। सहदेव त्रिभिर्विद्ध्वा युधिष्ठिरमपीडयत्॥'}

{'en': 'And he assailed all the other great bowmen with their horses and cars and elephants with many arrows like hunters assailing elephants with burning rods.', 'sn': 'तांस्तानन्यान् महेष्वासान् साश्वान् सरथकूबरान्। अर्दयामास विशिखैरुल्काभिरिव कुञ्जरान्॥'}

{'en': 'That foremost of car-warriors destroyed elephants and elephant-riders, horses and horse-men and cars and car-warriors,', 'sn': 'कुञ्जरान् कुञ्जरारोहानश्वानश्वप्रयायिनः। रथांश्च रथिनः सार्धं जघान रथिनां वरः॥'}

{'en': 'And he cut off the arms of combatants holding weapons and the standards of cars and filled the earth with (slain) warriors like the sacrificial altar with blades of Kusha grass.', 'sn': 'बाहूंश्चिच्छेद तरसा सायुधान् केतनानि च। चकार च महीं योधैस्तीर्णां वेदी कुशैरिव॥'}

{'en': 'Then the Pandus, the Panchalas and the Somakas, encompassed angrily that hero who was thus killing their soldiers like alldestroying Death.', 'sn': 'तथा तमरिसैन्यानि घ्नन्तं मृत्युमिवान्तकम्। परिवत्रु शं क्रुद्धाः पाण्डुपाञ्चालसोमकाः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhimasena and the grandson of Shini and those two foremost of men, the two sons of Madri surrounded that hero while he was fighting with the highly powerful (Pandava) king. Ana all of them challenged him to battle.', 'sn': 'तं भीमसेनश्च शिनेश्च नप्ता मात्र्याश्च पुत्रौ पुरुषप्रवीरौ। समागतं भीमबलेन राज्ञा पर्याप्तमन्योन्यमथाह्वयन्त॥'}

{'en': 'Then those heroes, O king, having obtained the king of the Madras, that best of warriors in battle, opposed that first of men in that encounter and began to strike him with powerful winged arrows.', 'sn': 'ततस्तु शूराः समरे नरेन्द्र नरेश्वरं प्राप्य युधां वरिष्ठम्। आवार्य चैनं समरे नृवीरा जघ्नुः शरैः पत्रिभिरुग्रवेगैः॥'}

{'en': 'Protected by Bhimasena and the two sons of Madri and Krishna the royal son of Dharma struck the king of the Madras on the chest with powerful winged arrows.', 'sn': 'संरक्षितो भीमसेनेन राजा माद्रीसुताभ्यामथ माधवेन। मद्राधिपं पत्रिभिरुपवेगैः स्तनान्तरे धर्मसुतो निजघ्ने॥'}

{'en': "Then beholding the king of the Madras greatly wounded with arrows in that battle, the car-warriors and other combatants of your army, clad in mail and armed with weapons, surrounded him on all sides at Duryodhana's behest.", 'sn': 'ततो रणे तावकानां स्थौधाः समीक्ष्य मद्राधिपतिं शरार्तम्। पार्यवः प्रवरास्ते सुसज्जा दुर्योधनस्यानुमते पुरस्तात्॥'}

{'en': 'They king of the Madras at this time quickly struck Yudhishthira with seven arrows in that battle. The great son of Pritha. O king, in return, struck his foe with nine arrows in that dreadful battle.', 'sn': 'ततो द्रुतं मद्रजनाधिपो रणे युधिष्ठिरं सप्तभिरभ्यविद्ध्यत्। विव्याध राजंस्तुमुले महात्मा॥'}

{'en': 'Those two great car-warriors, viz., Shalya and Yudhishthira, began to cover each other with arrows bathed in oil and shot off bows drawn to their ears.', 'sn': 'आकर्णपूर्णायतसम्प्रयुक्तैः शरैस्तदा संयति तैलधौतैः। अन्योन्यमाच्छादयतां महारथौ मद्राधिपश्चापि युधिष्ठिरश्च॥'}

{'en': "Those two best of kings, both gifted with great strength, both incapable of being defeated by foes and both foremost of car-warriors looking at each other's loop-holes, quickly and deeply struck each other's shafts.", 'sn': 'ततस्तु तूर्णं समरे महारथौ परस्परस्यान्तरमीक्षमाणौ। शरैर्भृशं विव्यधतुर्नपोत्तमौ महाबलौ शत्रुभिरप्रधृष्यौ॥'}

{'en': "The loud noise of their bows, bowstrings and palms, resembled that of Indra's thunder as those great car-warriors showered upon each other innumerable arrows.", 'sn': 'तयोर्धनातलनिःस्वनो महान् महेन्द्रवज्राशनितुल्यनि:स्वनः। परस्परं बाणगणैर्महात्मनोः प्रवर्षतोर्मद्रपपाण्डुवीरयोः॥'}

{'en': 'They moved about in the field of battle like two young tigers in the deep forest fighting for a piece of meat. Elated with the pride of prowess, they wounded each other like a couple of infuriate elephants of powerful tusks.', 'sn': 'तौ चेरतुर्व्याघ्रशिशुप्रकाशौ महावनेष्वामिषगृद्धिनाविव। विषाणिनौ नागवराविवोभौ ततक्षतुः संयति जातदो॥'}

{'en': 'Displaying his vigor, then the illustrious king of the Madras struck the heroic Yudhishthira of terrible might in the chest with an arrow effulgent like the fire or the sun.', 'sn': 'ततस्तु मद्राधिपतिर्महात्मा युधिष्ठिरं भीमबलं प्रसह्या विव्याध वीरं हृदयेऽतिवेगं शरेण सूर्याग्निसमप्रभेण॥'}

{'en': 'Deeply struck, O king, that best of Kurus, the illustrious Yudhishthira, then struck the king of the Madras with a well aimed arrow and was filled with joy.', 'sn': 'ततोऽतिविद्धोऽथ युधिष्ठिरोऽपि सुसम्प्रयुक्तेन शरेण राजन्। जघान मद्राधिपतिं महात्मा मुदं च लेभे ऋषभः कुरूणाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Regaining his consciousness within a moment that foremost of kings viz., Shalya, powerful like Indra with eyes reddened in wrath, quickly struck the son of Pritha with a hundred arrows.', 'sn': 'ततो मुहूर्तादिव पार्थिवेन्द्रो लब्ध्वा संज्ञां क्रोधसंरक्तनेत्रः। शतेन पार्थं त्वरितो जघान सहस्रनेत्रप्रतिमप्रभावः॥'}

{'en': "At this the illustrious son of Dharma, filled with rage, quickly struck Shalya's chest an then, without losing a moment, struck his golden mail with six arrows.", 'sn': 'त्वरंस्ततो धर्मसुतो महात्मा शल्यस्य कोपान्नवभिः पृषत्कैः। भित्वा झुरस्तपनीयं च वर्म जघान षड्भिस्त्वपरैः पृषत्कैः॥'}

{'en': 'Filled with joy, the 1. ing of the Madras then, drawing his bow and having discharged many arrows, at last cut off, with a pair of razorfaced shafts, the bow of his royal foe.', 'sn': 'ततस्तु मद्राधिपतिः प्रकृष्टं धनुविंकृष्य व्यसृजत् पृषत्कान्। श्चिच्छेद चापं कुरुपुङ्गवस्य॥'}

{'en': 'The illustrious Yudhishthira then, taking a new and more powerful bow in that battle, struck Shalya with many keen pointed arrows from all sides like Indra striking the Asura Namuchi.', 'sn': 'नवं ततोऽन्यत् समरे प्रगृह्य राजा धनुर्घोरतरं महात्मा। शल्यं विव्याध शरैः समन्ताद् यथा महेन्द्रो नमुचिं शिताप्रैः॥'}

{'en': 'Cutting off the golden coats of mail of both Bhima and king Yudhishthira with nine arrows, the illustrious Shalya then struck the arins of both of them.', 'sn': '(मस्य राज्ञश्च युधिष्ठिरस्य। निकृत्य रोक्मे पटुवर्मणी तयो विडदारयामास भुजौ महात्मा।॥'}

{'en': "With another razor-faced arrow effulgent like the fire of the sun, he then cut off the bow of Yudhishthira. At this time Kripa, with six arrows, killed the king's driver who fell down in front of the car.", 'sn': 'ततोऽपरेण ज्वलनार्कतेजसा क्षुरेण राज्ञो धनुरुन्ममाथा कृपश्च तस्यैव जघान सूतं षड्भिः शरैः सोऽभिमुखः पपात॥'}

{'en': 'The king of the Madras then killed with four arrows the four horses of Yudhishthira. Having slain the horses of the king, the great Shalya then began to kill the soldiers of the royal son of Dharma.', 'sn': 'मद्राधिपश्चापि युधिष्ठिरस्य शरैश्चतुर्भिर्निजघान वाहान्। वाहांश्च हत्वा व्यकरोन्महात्मा योधक्षयं धर्मसुतस्य राज्ञः॥'}

{'en': 'When the (Pandava) king had been reduced to that plight, the great Bhimasena, quickly cutting off the bow of the Madra king with an arrow of great force, struck the king himself with a couple of arrows,', 'sn': 'तथा कृते राजनि भीमसेनो मद्राधिपस्याथ ततो महात्मा। छित्त्वा धनुर्वेगवता शरेण द्वाभ्यामविध्यत् सुभृशं नरेन्द्रम्॥'}

{'en': "With another arrow he cut off the head of Shalya's driver from his trunk the middle of which was encased in mail. Beside himself with anger, Bhimasena next killed without a moment's delay, the four horses of his enemy.", 'sn': 'तथापरेणास्य जहार यन्तुः कायाच्छिरः संहननीयमध्यात्। जधान चाश्वांश्चतुरः सुशीघ्रं तथा भृशं कुपितो भीमसेनः॥'}

{'en': 'That foremost of all bowmen, viz., Bhima, then covered with a hundred arrows that hero who, gifted with great energy, was moving about alone in the field. Sahadeva, the son of Madri, did the same. Beholding Shalya stupefied with those arrows, Bhima cut off his armour with other arrows.', 'sn': 'मेकं चरन्तं समरेऽतिवेगम्। भीमः शतेन व्यकिरच्छराणां माद्रीपुत्रः सहदेवस्तथैव॥ तैः सायकैर्मोहितं वीक्ष्य शल्यं भीमः शरैरस्य चकर्त वर्म।'}

{'en': "His armour having been cut off by Bhimasena, the great king of Madras, taking up a sword and a shield adorned with a thousand stars, leaped down from his car and rushed towards the son of Kunti. Cutting off the shaft of Nakula's car, the powerful Shalya rushed towards Yudhishthira.", 'sn': 'स भीमसेनेन निकृत्तवर्मा मद्राधिपश्चर्म सहस्रतारम्॥ प्रगृह्य खड्गं च रथान्महात्मा प्रस्कन्ध कुन्तीसुतमभ्यधावत्। छित्त्वा रथेषां नकुलस्य सोऽथ युधिष्ठिरं भीमबलोऽभ्यधावत्॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding him rushing with great force towards the king even like the Destroyer himself rushing in anger, Dhristadyumna and Sikhandin and the (five) sons of Draupadi and the grandson of Sini suddenly advanced towards him.', 'sn': 'तं चापि राजानमथोत्पतन्तं क्रुद्धं यथैवान्तकमापतन्तम्। धृष्टद्युम्नो द्रौपदेयाः शिखण्डी शिनेश्च नप्ता सहसा परीयुः॥'}

{'en': 'Then the illustrious Bhima cut off the ten arrows the matchless shield of that hero. With another broad-headed arrow he cut off the sword also of that warrior. Filled with joy at this, he cried aloud in the midst of the army.', 'sn': 'अथास्य चर्माप्रतिमं न्यकृन्त भीमो महात्मा नवभिः पृषत्कैः। खड्गं च भल्लैर्निचकर्त मुष्टौ नदन् प्रहृष्टस्तव सैन्यमध्ये॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding that feat of Bhima, all the foremost car-warriors among the Pandavas were filled with joy. Laughing aloud, they uttered terrible roars and blew their moonwhite conchs.', 'sn': 'स्ते पाण्डवानां प्रवरां रथौघाः। नादं च चक्रुर्भृशमुत्स्मयन्तः शङ्खांश्च दध्मुः शसिसंनिकाशान्॥'}

{'en': 'At that terrible noise the army, protected by your warriors, were depressed, covered with sweat, bathed in blood, exceedingly melancholy and dispirited.', 'sn': 'तेनाथ शब्देन विभीषणेन तथाभितप्तं बलमप्रधृष्यम्। कांदिग्भूतं रुधिरेणोक्षिताङ्गं विसंज्ञकल्पं च तदा विषण्णम्॥'}

{'en': 'Assailed by those foremost of Pandava warriors headed by Bhimasena, the king of the Madras proceeded towards Yudhishthira, like a lion going to catch a deer.', 'sn': 'स मद्रराजः सहसा विकीर्णो भीमाग्रगैः पाण्डवयोधमुख्यैः। युधिष्ठिरस्याभिमुखं जवेन सिंहो यथा मृगहेतोः प्रयातः॥'}

{'en': 'Deprived of his car and horses, king Yudhishthira, looked like a blazing fire for the anger with which he was then excited. Beholding the king of the Madras before him, he rushed towards that foe with great force.', 'sn': 'स धर्मराजो निहताश्वसूतः क्रोधेन दीप्तो ज्वलनप्रकाशः। दृष्ट्वा च मद्राधिपतिं स्म तूर्णं समभ्यधावत् तमरिं बलेन॥'}

{'en': 'Recollecting the words of Govinda, he quickly set his heart on the destruction of Shalya. Indeed, king Yudhishthira, staying on his steedless and driverless car, waited to take up a dart.', 'sn': 'गोविन्दवाक्यं त्वरितं विचिन्त्य दधे मतिं शल्यविनाशनाय। स धर्मराजो निहताश्वसूतो रथे तिष्ठशक्तिमेवाभ्यकाक्षत्॥'}

{'en': "Beholding that feat of Shalya and thinking that the person who had been allotted to him as his share was not yet killed the son of Pandu firmly made up his mind to do what Indra's younger brother had advised him to do.", 'sn': 'तचापि शल्यस्य निशम्य कर्म महात्मनो भागमथाविशिष्टम्। कृत्वा मनः शल्यवधे महात्मा यथोक्तमिन्द्रावरजस्य चक्रे॥'}

{'en': 'King Yudhishthira took up a dart whose handle was made of gold and set with gems and which was bright like gold. Rolling his wide open eyes, he looked at the king of Madras, his heart filled with anger.', 'sn': 'स धर्मराजो मणिहेमदण्डां जग्राह शक्तिं कनकप्रकाशाम्। नेत्रे च दीप्ते सहसा विवृत्य मद्राधिपं क्रुद्धमना निरैक्षत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thus looked at, O god among men, by that king of pure and sinless soul the king of the Madras was not reduced to ashes. This was indeed wonderful, O monarch.', 'sn': 'निरीक्षितोऽसौ नरदेव राज्ञा पूतात्मना निहतकल्मषेण। आसीन यह भस्मसान्मद्रराज स्ततद्भुतं मे प्रतिभाति राजन्॥'}

{'en': 'The chief of the Kurus then hurled with great force at the king of the Madras that blazing dart of beautiful and fierce handle set with gems and corals.', 'sn': 'ततस्तु शक्तिं रुचिरोग्रदण्डां मणिप्रवेकोज्ज्वलितां प्रदीप्ताम्। चिक्षेप वेगात् सुभृशं महात्मा मद्राधिपाय प्रवरः कुरूणाम्॥'}

{'en': 'All the Kauravas beheld that blazing dart sending forth scintillations of fire as it passed through the sky after having been discharged with great force, like a large meteor dropping from the sky at the end of the cycle.', 'sn': 'दीप्तामथैनां प्रहितां बलेन सविस्फुलिङ्गां सहसा पतन्तीम्। प्रेक्षन्त सर्वे कुरवः समेता दिवो युगान्ते महतीमिवोल्काम्॥'}

{'en': "King Yudhishthira, in that battle, carefully discharged that dart which resembled the Death-night armed with the dreadful noose or the dreadful mother of Yama himself and which like the Brahmana's curse, was of sure effect.", 'sn': 'तां कालरात्रीमिव पाशहस्तां यमस्य धात्रीमिव चोग्ररूपाम्। स ब्रह्मदण्डप्रतिमाममोघां ससर्ज यत्तो युधि धर्मराजः॥'}

{'en': 'Carefully the sons of Pandu had always worshipped that weapon with scents, garland, seats and the best food and drinks. That weapon seemed to born like the Samvartaka fire and was as dreadful as a rite performed according to the Atharvan of Angirasa.', 'sn': 'रभ्यर्चिता पाण्डुसुतैः प्रयत्नात्। सांवर्तकग्निप्रतिमां ज्वलन्ती कृत्यामथर्वाङ्गिरसीमिवोग्राम्॥'}

{'en': 'Made by Tashtri the celestial architect for the use of Shiva it destroyed the vital airs and the bodies of all foes. It could destroy by its force the earth, the sky and all the reservoirs of water and animals of every description.', 'sn': 'ईशानहेतोः प्रतिनिर्मितां तां त्वष्ट्रा रिपूणामसुदेहभक्ष्याम्। भूम्यन्तरिक्षादिजलाशयानि प्रसह्य भूतानि निहन्तुमीशाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Adorned with bells, flags, gems, diamonds, lapis lazuli and equipt with a golden handle, the celestial Architect himself had made it with great care after having practised many vows. This fatal weapon was destructive of all haters of Brahma.', 'sn': 'घण्टापताकामणिवज्रनाला वैदूर्यचित्रां तपनीयदण्डाम्। त्वष्ट्रा प्रयत्नान्नियमेन क्लृप्तां ब्रह्मद्विषामन्तकरीममोघाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having inspired it with many mantras and impregnated it with terrible velocity by the exercise of great power and care, king Yudhishthira hurled it by the best path for the destruction of the king of the Madras.', 'sn': 'बलप्रयत्नादधिरूढवेगां मन्त्रैश्च घोरैरभिमन्त्र्य यत्नात्। ससर्ज मार्गेण च तां परेण वधाय मद्राधिपतेस्तदानीम्॥'}

{'en': 'Saying in a loud voice the words-"you are killed, O wretch”-the king hurled it, even as Rudra had, in days of yore, shot his arrow for the destruction of the Asura Andhaka, extending his strong arm adorned with a beautiful hand and dancing in anger.', 'sn': 'हतोऽसि पापेत्यभिगर्जमानो रुद्रोऽन्धकायान्तकरं यथेषुम्। प्रसार्य बाहुं सुदृढं सुपाणिं क्रोधेन नृत्यन्निव धर्मराजः॥'}

{'en': 'Shalya cried aloud and tried to catch that excellent dart of great energy hurled by Yudhishthira with all his strength even as a fire laps forth for catching the clarified butter poured over it.', 'sn': 'तां सर्वशक्त्या प्रहितां सुशक्तिं युधिष्ठिरेणाप्रतिवार्यवीर्यम्। प्रतिग्रहायाभिननर्द शल्यः सम्यग्धुतामग्निरिवाज्यधाराम्॥'}

{'en': 'Cutting through his very vitals and his fair and broad chest, that dart entered the Earth as easily as it would water without the slightest obstruction and carrying away the world-wide reputation of Shalya.', 'sn': 'मुरो विशालं च तथैव भित्त्वा। विवेश गां तोयमिवाप्रसक्ता यशो विशालं नृपतेर्दहन्ती॥'}

{'en': 'Covered with the blood that came out of his nostrils, cyes, ears and mouth and that which flowed from his wound, he looked like the huge Krauncha mountain when it was pierced by Skanda.', 'sn': 'नासाक्षिकर्णास्यविनिःसृतेन प्रक्यन्दता च व्रणसम्भवेन। संसिक्तगात्रो रुधिरेण सोऽभूत् क्रौञ्चो यथा स्कन्दहतो महाद्रिः॥'}

{'en': "His armour having been cut off by Yudhishthira the illustrious Shalya, strong as Indra's elephant, stretching his arms, dropped down on the Earth, like a mountain summit clapped by a thunder-bolt.", 'sn': 'प्रसार्य वाहू च रथाद् गतो गां संछिन्नवर्मा कुरुनन्दनेन। महेन्द्रवाहप्रतिमो महात्मा वज्राहतं शृङ्गमिवाचलस्य॥'}

{'en': "Stretching his arms, the king of the Madras fell down on the Earth, with his face directed towards king Yudhishthira like Indra's pole dropped down on the ground.", 'sn': 'बाहू प्रसार्यभिमुखो धर्मराजस्य मद्रराट्। ततो निपतितो भूमाविन्द्रध्वज इवोच्छ्रितः॥ स तथा भिन्नसर्वाङ्गो रुधिरेण समुक्षितः।'}

{'en': 'Like a dear wife advancing to reserve her dear husband about to fall on her breast, the Earth as if, out of affection, rose a little for receiving that best of men as he fell down with wounded limbs covered with blood.', 'sn': 'प्रत्युद्गत इव प्रेम्णा भूम्या स नरपुङ्गवः॥ प्रियया कान्तया कान्तः पतमान इवोरसि।'}

{'en': "Having enjoyed long the Earth like a dear wife, the powerful Shalya, now to sleep on the Earth's breast, embraced her.", 'sn': 'चिरं भुक्त्वा वसुमती प्रियां कान्तामिव प्रभुः॥ सर्वैरङ्गैः समानिश्लष्य प्रसुप्त इव चाभवत्।'}

{'en': "Slain by Dharma's son in a fair fight, Shalya shone like fire lying extinguished on the sacrificial altar.", 'sn': 'धर्म्य धर्मात्मना युद्धे निहतो धर्मसूनुना॥ सम्यग्घुत इव स्विष्टः प्रशान्तोऽग्निरिवाध्वरे।'}

{'en': 'Though deprived of his weapons and standard and though his heart had been cut and slain still his body was not shorn of beauty.', 'sn': 'शक्त्या विभिन्नह्रदयं विप्रविद्धायुधध्वजम्॥ संशान्तमपि मद्रेशं लक्ष्मी व विमुञ्चति।'}

{'en': "Taking up his bow resplendent like Indra's bow then Yudhishthira began to destroy his foes in that battle like Garuda killing snakes. With the greatest speed he began to cut off the bodies of his enemies with the keen arrows.", 'sn': 'ततो युधिष्ठिरश्चापमादायेन्द्रधनुष्प्रभम्॥ व्यधमद् द्विषतः संख्ये खगराडिव पन्नगान्। देहान् सुनिशितैर्भल्लै रिपूणां नाशयन् क्षणात्॥'}

{'en': 'Your troops were entirely covered with the showers of arrows that the son of Pritha then shot. Possessed with fear and with eyes shut, they began to strike one another. With their bodies bathed in blood they were deprived of their offensive and defensive arins and divested of their vital-breaths.', 'sn': 'ततः पार्थस्य बाणौघेरावृताः सैनिकास्तव। निमीलिताक्षाः क्षिण्वन्तो भृशमन्योन्यमर्दिताः॥ क्षरन्तो रुधिरं देहैर्विपन्नायुधजीविताः।'}

{'en': 'Upon the fall of Shalya, the youthful younger brother of the king of the Madras who equal his brother in every accomplishment and who was a great carwarrior, proceeded against Yudhishthira.', 'sn': 'ततः शल्ये निपतिते मद्रराजानुजो युवा॥ भ्रातुस्तुल्यो गणैः सर्वै रथी पाण्डवमभ्ययात्।'}

{'en': 'Invincible in battle and desirous of satisfying the last dues of his brother, that foremost of men struck speedily the Pandava with many arrows.', 'sn': 'विव्याध च नरश्रेष्ठो नाराचैर्बहुभिस्त्वरन्॥ हतस्यापचितिं भ्रातुश्चिकीर्षुर्युद्धदुर्मदः।'}

{'en': 'King Yudhishthira immediately struck him with six arrows. He then cut off the bow and the standard of his antagonist with two razorfaced arrows.', 'sn': 'तं विव्याधशुगैः षड्भिर्धर्मराजस्त्वरनिव॥ कार्मुकं चास्य चिच्छेद क्षुराभ्यां ध्वजमेव च।'}

{'en': 'Then with a blazing and keen arrow of great power and broad heat, he cut off the head of his foe who stood before him. was to', 'sn': 'ततोऽस्य दीप्यमानेन सुदृढेन शितेन च॥ प्रमुखे वर्तमानस्य भल्लेनापाहरच्छिरः।'}

{'en': 'That head adorned with ear-rings was seen to fall down from the car like a denizen of heaven falling down on the exhaustion of his virtues.', 'sn': 'सकुण्डलं तद् ददृशे पतमानं शिरो रथात्॥ पुण्यक्षयमनुप्राप्य पतन् स्वर्गादिव च्युतः।'}

{'en': 'Beholding his headless trunk, bathed in blood, fallen down from his car, the Kaurava troops were dispersed.', 'sn': 'तस्यापकृत्तशीर्षं तु शरीरं पतितं रथात्॥ रुधिरेणावसिक्ताङ्गं दृष्ट्वा सैन्यमभज्यत।'}

{'en': 'Indeed, upon the destruction of the younger brother of the Madras clad in beautiful armour, the Kurus bewailed and fled away quickly.', 'sn': 'विचित्रकवचे तस्मिन् हते मद्रनृपानुजे॥ हाहाकारं प्रकुर्वाणाः कुरवोऽभिप्रदुद्रुवः।'}

{'en': "Beholding Shalya's younger brother killed your troops, hopeless of their lives; were pursued by the fear of the Pandavas and fled, coated with dust.", 'sn': 'शल्यानुजं हतं दृष्ट्वा तावकास्त्यक्तजीविताः॥ वित्रेसुः पाण्डवभयाद् रजोध्वस्तास्तदा भृशम्।'}

{'en': "Then Shini's grandson Satyaki, O foremost of Bharatas, shooting his arrows, proceeded against the frightened Kauravas in the course of their fight.", 'sn': 'तांस्तथा भज्यमानांस्तु कौरवान् भरतर्षभ॥ शिनेर्नप्ता किरन् बाणैरभ्यवर्तत सात्यकिः।'}

{'en': "The Hridika's son, O king, quickly and fearlessly opposed that invincible warrior, that irresistible and powerful bowman, as he proceeded against them.", 'sn': 'तमायान्तं महेष्वासं दुष्प्रसह्य दुरासदम्॥ हार्दिक्यस्तवरितो राजन् प्रत्यगृह्णादभीतवत्।'}

{'en': "Those two illustrious and invincible Vrishni heroes, Hridika's son and Satyaki, encountered each other like two enraged lions.", 'sn': 'तौ समेतौ महात्मानौ वार्ष्णेयौ वरवाजिनौ॥ हार्दिक्यः सात्यकिश्चैव सिंहाविव बलोत्कटौ।'}

{'en': 'Both effulgent like the sun, they covered each other with burning arrows resplendent like the rays of the sun.', 'sn': 'इषुभिर्विमलाभासैश्छादयन्तौ परस्परम्॥ अर्चिभिरिव सूर्यस्व दिवाकरसमप्रभौ।'}

{'en': 'The arrows of those two Vrishni chiefs, shot off their bows, appeared like swiftlycoursing insects in the sky.', 'sn': 'चापमार्गबलोद्धतान् मार्गणान् वृष्णिसिंहयोः॥ आकाशगानपश्याम पतङ्गानिव शीघ्रगान्।'}

{'en': 'Piercing Satyaki with ten arrows and his horses with three, the son of Hridika cut off his bow with a straight arrow.', 'sn': 'सात्यकि दशभिविद्ध्वा हयांश्चास्य त्रिभिः शरैः॥७४ चापमेकेन चिच्छेद हार्दिक्यो नतपर्वणा।'}

{'en': 'Casting off his bow which was thus cut off, that heroe, quickly took up another that was stronger than the first.', 'sn': 'तन्निकृत्तं धनुः श्रेष्ठमपास्य शिनिपुङ्गवः॥ अन्यदादत्त वेगेन वेगवत्तरमायुधम्।'}

{'en': 'Having taken up that best of bows, that first of bowmen struck the son of Hridika with ten arrows on the chest.', 'sn': 'तदादाय धनुः श्रेष्ठं वरिष्ठः सर्वधन्विनाम्॥ हार्दिक्यं दशभिर्बाणैः प्रत्यविध्यत् स्तनान्तरे।'}

{'en': 'Then cutting off his car and the shaft of that car with many well-aimed arrows, Satyaki quickly killed the horses of his antagonist and his two Parshni drivers.', 'sn': 'ततो रथं युगेषां च च्छित्त्वा भल्लैः सुसंयतैः॥ अश्वांस्तस्यावधीत् तूर्णमूभौ च पार्ष्णिसारथी।'}

{'en': "O Lord, Saradvat, seeing Hridika's son made carless, the valiant Kripa then, the son Saradvat of speedily carried him away, on his car.", 'sn': 'ततस्तं विरथं दृष्ट्वा कृपः शारद्वतः प्रभो॥ अपोवाह ततः क्षिप्रं रथमारोप्य वीर्यवान्।'}

{'en': 'The king of the Madras being slain and upon Kritavarma having been made carless, the entire arıny of Duryodhana fled away from the battle field.', 'sn': 'मद्रराजे हते राजन् विरथे कृतवर्मणि॥ दुर्योधनबलं सर्वं पुनरासीत् पराङ्मुखम्।'}

{'en': 'At this time the army was covered with a cloud of dust. We could not perceive anything. The major portion, however, of your army were killed. They, who remained alive, took to their heels from the battle-field.', 'sn': 'तत् परे नान्वबुध्यन्त सैन्येन रजसा वृते॥ बलं तु हतभूयिष्ठं तत् तदाऽऽसीत् पराङ्मुखम्।'}

{'en': 'Soon it was seen that the cloud of dust was suppressed, O foremost of men, on account of the streams of blood that flowed on all sides.', 'sn': 'ततो मुहूर्तात् तेऽपश्यन् रजो भीमं समुत्थितम्॥ विविधैः शोणितस्रावैः प्रशान्तं पुरुषर्षभ।'}
{'en': 'Then seeing his army routed Duryodhana, alone, resisted all the Parthas advancing furiously.', 'sn': 'ततो दुर्योधनो दृष्ट्वा भग्नं स्वबलमन्तिकात्॥ जवेनापततः पार्थानेकः सर्वानवारयत्।'}

{'en': 'Beholding the Pandavas on their cars as also Dhrishtadyumna the son of Prishata and the invincible Satyaki, the Kuru king struck them with sharp arrows.', 'sn': 'पाण्डवान् सरथान् दृष्ट्वा धृष्टद्युम्नं च पार्षतम्॥ आनर्तं च दुराधर्षं शितैर्बाणैरवारयत्। तं परे नाभ्यवर्तन्त मा मृत्युमिवागतम्॥'}

{'en': 'The enemy (at that time) could not approach him, like mortals fearing to approach the Death standing before thein. Meanwhile the son of Hridika, riding upon another car, advanced there.', 'sn': 'अथान्यं रथमास्थाय हार्दिक्योऽपि न्यवर्तत। ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा त्वरमाणो महारथः॥'}

{'en': 'The great car-warrior Yudhishthira then quickly killed the four horses of Kritavarman with four arrows and struck the son of Gotama with six broad-headed powerful arrows.', 'sn': 'चतुर्भिनिजघानाश्वान् पत्रिभिः कृतवर्मणः। विव्याध गौतमं चापि षड्भिर्भल्लैः सुतेजनैः॥'}

{'en': "Then Ashvatthaman, taking upon his car, the son of Hridika who had been deprived of his horses by the (Pandava) king, took him away from Yudhishthira's presence.", 'sn': 'अश्वत्थामा ततो राज्ञा हताश्वं विरथीकृतम्। तमपोवाह हार्दिक्यं स्वरथेन युधिष्ठिरात्॥'}

{'en': 'The son of Sharadvata struck Yudhishthira in return with eight arrows and his horses also with cight keen arrows.', 'sn': 'ततः शारद्वतः षड्भिः प्रत्यविद्ध्यद् युधिष्ठिरम्। विव्याध चाश्वान्निशितैस्तस्याष्टाभिः शिलीमुखैः॥'}
{'en': 'Thus, O king, the battle raged on all sides on account of the evil policy of yourself and your soni, O Bharata.', 'sn': 'एवमेतन्महाराज युद्धशेषमवर्तत। तव दुर्मत्रिते राजन् सह पुत्रस्य भारत॥'}

{'en': "After the destruction of that foremost of bow men on the field of battle by that foremost of Kuru's race, the Parthas, beholding Shalya slain, in a body filled with great joy, blew their conchs.", 'sn': 'तस्मिन् महेष्वासधरे विशस्ते संग्राममध्ये कुरुपुङ्गवेन। पार्थाः समेताः परमप्रहृष्टाः शङ्खान् प्रदधुमुर्हतमीक्ष्य शल्यम्॥'}

{'en': 'And all of them praised Yudhishthira in that battle, even as the celestials, in days of yore, had praised Indra after the destruction of Vritra. And they beat and blew various kinds of musical instruments, making the Earth resound on all sides.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिरं च प्रशशंसुराजौ पुरा कृते वृत्रवधे यथेन्द्रम्। चक्रुश्च नानाविधवाद्यशब्दान् निनादयन्तो वसुधा समेताः॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Thus when the troops had been excellently disposed of in that array, Osire and when Bheris were sounded and Mridangas struck up.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच ततो व्यूढेष्वनीकेषु समुत्कृष्टेषु मारिष। ताड्यमानासु भेरीषु मृदङ्गेषु नदत्सु च॥'}

{'en': 'When the soldiers uttered loud war-cries and musical instruments emitted tremendous din, when conchs were blown and horripilating roars were heard.', 'sn': 'अनीकानां च संह्रादे वादित्राणां च निःस्वने। प्रध्यापितेषु शोषु संनादे लोमहर्षणे॥'}

{'en': 'When the field slowly became over-spread with Bharata heroes desirous of battle and when the hour known as Roudra arrived, Savyasachin (Arjuna) made his appearance on the field of battle.', 'sn': 'अभिहारयत्सु शनकैर्भरतेषु युयुत्सुषु। रौद्रे मुहूर्ते सम्प्राप्ते सव्यसाची व्यदृश्यत॥'}
{'en': "Then, O Bharata, many thousands of ravens and crows flew sportively in front of Arjuna's car.", 'sn': 'बलानां वायसानां च पुरस्तात् सव्यसाचिनः । बहुलानि सहस्रणि प्राक्रीडंस्तत्र भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Various animals of fearful yells and jackals of dreadful appearance, began to how in our right as we proceeded to battle.', 'sn': 'मृगाश्च घोरसंनादः शिवाश्चाशिवदर्शनाः। दक्षिणेन प्रयातानामस्माकं प्राणदंस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'Thousands of meteors, with harsh sounds and blazing tails, began to drop down; on the dreadful occasion, the whole Earth began to quake and tremble.', 'sn': 'सनिर्घाता ज्वलन्त्यश्च पेतुरुल्काः सहस्रशः। चचाल च मही कृत्स्ना भये घोरे समुत्थिते॥'}

{'en': "Dry winds accompanied by deep sounds and driving pebbles and gravel, began to blow when Kunti's son made his appearance before the commencement of the battle.", 'sn': 'विष्वग्वाताः सनिर्घाता रूक्षाः शर्करकर्षिणः। ववुरायाति कौन्तेये संग्रामे समुपस्थिते॥'}

{'en': 'Then Shatanika the son of Nakula and Dhristadyumna the son of Prishata, these two warriors endued with great wisdom began to array in order the numerous divisions of the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'नाकुलिश्च शतानीको धृष्टद्युम्नश्च पाण्डवानामनीकानि प्राज्ञौ तौ व्यूहतुस्तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Supported by a thousand cars, a hundred elephants, three thousand horses and ten thousand foot-soldiers and covering a part of the field measuring fifteen hundred bows, your son Durmarshana stationed himself in the very', 'sn': 'ततो रथसहस्रेण द्विरदानां शतेन च। त्रिभिरश्वसहस्त्रैश्च पदातीनां शतैः शतैः॥ पार्षतः। अध्यर्धमात्रे धनुषां सहस्रे तनयस्तव। अग्रतः सर्वसैन्यानां स्थित्वा दुर्मर्षणोऽब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Like the banks resisting the waves of the swelling main, even I myself will this day hold in check the wielder of the Gandiva bow, that slayer of foes, that hero who is irrepressible in battle.', 'sn': 'अद्य गाण्डीवधन्वानं तपन्तं युद्धदुर्मदम्। अहमावारयिष्यामि वेलेव मकरालयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Today let people see the irate and indomitable Dhananjaya collide with me, even like a mass of stone against another story mass.', 'sn': 'अद्य पश्यन्तु संग्रामे धनंजयममर्षणम्। विषक्तं मयि दुर्धर्षमश्मकूटमिवाश्मनि॥'}

{'en': 'Stay, O you car-warriors that long to join in the fray! Single-handed, will I fight with the assembled Pandavas, for enhancing my glory and my fame', 'sn': 'तिष्ठध्वं स्थनो यूयं संग्राममभिकाक्षिणः। युध्यामि संहतानेतान् यशो मानं च वर्धयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Having thus (spoken, O mighty monarch, that illustrious site of generous intellect, that fierce bowmen, stood, king, being surrounded by many excellent car-warriors.', 'sn': 'एवं ब्रुवन्महाराज महात्मा स महामतिः। महेष्वासैर्वतो राजन् महेष्वासो व्यवस्थितः॥'}

{'en': "Then, ikt, the enraged Destroyer or like Vasata arnted with the thunderbolt or like the unbearate'r god of Death wielding his bludgeon and lét loose by time.", 'sn': 'ततोऽन्तक इव क्रुद्धः सवज्र इव वासवः। दण्डपाणिगि मह्यो मृत्युः कालेन चोदितः॥'}

{'en': 'Or like Siva with trident and unruffled or like Varuna armed with the noose or like the blazing fire appearing at the end of a Yuga for consuming the creation.', 'sn': 'शूलपाणिरिवाक्षोभ्यो वरुणः पाशवानिव। युगान्कांग्नरिवार्चिष्मान् प्रधक्ष्यन् वै पुनः प्रजाः॥'}

{'en': 'That slayer of the Nivatakavachas, inflamed with rage and swelling with his energies, the ever victorious Jaya attached to truth and intent on accomplishing his great vow.', 'sn': 'क्रोधामर्षबलोद्भूतो निवातकवचान्तकः। जयो जेता स्थितः सत्ये पारयिष्यन् महाव्रतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Cased in mail and armed with a sword, graced with a golden diadem, decorated with garlands of white flowers and attired in white garments, his arms decked with charming Angadas and ears with resplendent ear-rings.', 'sn': 'आमुक्तकवचः खड्गी जाम्बूनदकिरीटभृत्। शुभ्रमाल्याम्बरधरः स्वगदश्चारुकुण्डलः॥'}

{'en': 'Riding on his own best of chariots, the embodied Nara accompanied by Narayana, shaking his Gandiva bow in battle appeared shining and dazzling like the risen sun.', 'sn': 'रथप्रवरमास्थाय नरो नारायणानुगः। विधुन्वन् गाण्डिवं संख्ये बभौ सूर्य इवोदितः॥'}

{'en': 'Then Dhananjaya endued with great might, O king, stopping his chariot before the van of his troops where the thickest downpour of arrows was expected blew his conch.', 'sn': 'सोऽग्रानीकस्य महत इषुपाते धनंजयः। व्यवस्थाप्य रथं राजशङ्ख दध्मौ प्रतापवान्॥'}

{'en': "Thereupon the undaunted Krishna also, O sire, with Pritha's son, blew with force that most excellent conch of his, known as the Panchajanya.", 'sn': 'अथकृष्णोऽप्यसम्भ्रान्तः पार्थेन सह मारिष। प्राध्यापयत् पाञ्चजन्यं शङ्ख प्रवरमोजसा॥'}

{'en': 'Then at that blare of the conchs, O ruler of men, the soldiers of your army had the hair of their body erect and they trembled and were confounded.', 'sn': 'तयोः शङ्खपणादेन तव सैन्ये विशाम्पते। आसन् संहृष्टरोमाणः कम्पिता गतचेतसः॥'}

{'en': 'At the blare of their conchs, your troops took right even as creatures become frightened at the rumbling of the thunder.', 'sn': 'यथा त्रस्यन्ति भूतानि सर्वाण्यशनिनिः स्वनात्। तथा शङ्खप्रणादेन वित्रेसुस्तव सैनिकाः॥'}
{'en': 'All the beasts discharged urine and excreta. Your whole army with its animals seized with anxiety.', 'sn': 'प्रसुस्रवुः शकृन्मूत्रं वाहनानि च सर्वशः। एवं सवाहनं सर्वमाविग्नमभवद् बलम्॥'}

{'en': 'O sire, O monarch, in consequence of the blare of those two conchs, all men were deprived of their strength. And some of our array the were filled with fear and some lost their consciousness.', 'sn': 'सीदन्ति स्म नरा राजशङ्खशब्देन मारिष। विसंज्ञाश्चाभवन् केचित् केचिद् राजन् वितत्रसु॥'}

{'en': "Then frightening your soldiers, the ape of Arjuna's banner with other creatures thereon, opening its mouth, uttered a terrible roar.", 'sn': 'ततः कपिमहानादं सह भूतैर्ध्वजालयैः। अकरोद्ध व्यादितास्यश्च भीषयंस्तव सैनिकान्॥'}

{'en': 'Then conchs, horns, cymbals and Anakas, were sounded and blown for inspiring energy into your troops.', 'sn': 'ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च मृदङ्गाश्चानकैः सह। पुनरेवाभ्यहन्यन्त तव सैन्यप्रहर्षणाः॥'}

{'en': 'Then din thus produced, became mixed up with the din produced by various musical instruments, by the shouts of warriors and by the slappings of their armpits, by the war-cries of the great car-warriors, as they challenged one another.', 'sn': 'नानावादित्रसंहादैः श्वैडितास्फोटिताकुलैः। सिंहनादैः समुत्कुष्टैः समाधूतैर्महारथैः॥'}

{'en': 'Thus when that tremendous din arose there din that enhanced the fear of the cowards the son of Pakashasani became filled with joy; and addressing the descendant of the Dasarha race, he then thus spoke.', 'sn': 'तस्मिंस्तु तुमुले शब्दे भीरूणां भयवर्धने। अतीव हृष्टो दाशार्हमब्रवीत् पाकशासनिः॥'}

{'en': 'Janamejaya said How, O Brahmana, was the Horse-sacrifice of the Prajapati Daksha, the son of Prachetas, destroyed during the time of Vaivasvata Manu?', 'sn': 'जनमेजय उवाच प्राचेतसस्य दक्षस्य कथं वैवस्वतेऽन्तरे। विनाशमगमद् ब्रह्मन् हयमेधः प्रजापतेः॥'}

{'en': 'Understanding that the goddess Uma had become filled with ire and grief, the powerful Mahadeva, who is the soul of all things, yielded to anger. How, again, through his grace, was Daksha enabled to gather again the divided limbs of that Sacrifice? I wish to know all this, Tell me all this, O Brahmana, truely as it took place.', 'sn': 'देव्या मन्युकृतं मत्वा क्रुद्धः सर्वात्मकः प्रभुः। प्रसादात् तस्य दक्षेण स यज्ञः संधित: कथम्। एतद् वेदितुमिच्छेयं तन्मे ब्रूहि यथातथम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said, In days of yore Daksha made arrangements for celebrating a Sacrifice on the breast of Himavat in that sacred region inhabited by Rishis and Siddhas where the Ganges comes out of the mountains.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच पुरा हिमवतः पृष्ठे दक्षो वै यज्ञमाहरत्। गङ्गाद्वारे शुभे देशे ऋषिसिद्धनिषेविते॥'}

{'en': 'Over-grown with trees and creepers of various sorts, that place abounded with Gandharvas and Apsaras. Sorrounded by numbers of Rishis, Daksha, that best of virtuous men, that progenitor of creatures, was attended by the denizens of the Earth, the sky, and the celestial region, with their hands joined together in respect.', 'sn': 'गन्धर्वाप्सरसाकीर्णे नानादुमलतावृते। ऋषिसङ्घः परिवृतं दक्षं धर्मभृतां वरम्॥ पृथिव्यामन्तरिक्षे च ये च स्वर्लोकवासिनः। सर्वे प्राञ्जलयो भूत्वा उपतस्थुः प्रजापतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'The gods, the Danavas, the Gandharvas, the Pishachas, the Nagas, the Rakshasas, the two Gandharvas named Haha and Huhu, Tumvuru and Narada, Vishvavasu, Vishvasena, The Gandharvas and the Apsaras, the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Saddhyas, the Maruts, all came there with Indra for sharing in the Sacrifices. The Drinkers of heat, the drinkers of Soma, the drinkers of smoke, the drinkers of sacrificial juice, the Rishis, and the departed manes, came there with the Brahmanas. These, and many other living creatures belonging to the four orders, viz., viviparous and oviparous and fifth-born and vegetable, were invited to that Sacrifice. The gods also, with their wives respectfully invited thereto, came on their celestial cars and seated thereon shone like burning fires.', 'sn': 'देवदानवगन्धर्वाः पिशाचोरगराक्षसाः। हाहाहूहूच गन्धर्वो तुम्बुरु रदस्तथा॥ विश्वावसुर्विश्वसेनो गन्धर्वाप्सरसस्तथा। आदित्या वसवो रुद्राः साध्याः सह मरुद्गणैः॥ इन्द्रेण सहिताः सर्वे आगता यज्ञभागिनः। उष्मपाः सोमपाश्चैव धूमपा आज्यपास्तथा॥ ऋषयः पितरश्चैव आगता ब्रह्मणा सह। एते चान्ये च बहवो भूतग्रामाश्चतुर्विधाः॥ जरायुजाण्डजाश्चैव सहसा स्वेदजोद्भिजैः। आहूता मन्त्रिताः सर्वे देवाश्च सह पत्निभिः॥ विराजन्ते विमानस्था दीप्यमाना इवाग्नयः।'}

{'en': "Seeing them, the Rishi Dadhichi became filled with grief and anger and said,—'This is neither a Sacrifice nor a meritorious rite of religion, since Rudra is not worshipped in it.", 'sn': 'तान् दृष्ट्वा मन्युनाऽऽविष्टो दधीचिर्वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥ नायं यज्ञो न वा धर्मो यत्र रुद्रो न इज्यते।'}

{'en': 'You are certainly exposing yourselves to death and chains! Alas, how unfavourable is the time! Stupefied by mistake you do not see that destruction awaits you! A terrible calamity will overtake you in course of this great Sacrifice! You are blind to it.', 'sn': 'वधबन्धं प्रपन्ना वै किं नु कालस्य पर्ययः॥ किंनु मोहान्न पश्यन्ति विनाशं पर्युपस्थितम्। उपस्थितं महाघोरं न बुध्यन्ति महाध्वरे॥'}

{'en': 'Having said these words, that great Yogin saw the future with eyes of contemplation. He saw Mahadeva, and his divine consort, viz., that giver of excellent boons, with the great Narada sitting beside the goddess. Conversant with Yoga, Dadhichi became highly pleased, having ascertained what was about to take place.', 'sn': 'इत्युक्तवा स महायोगी पश्यति ध्यानचक्षुषा। स पश्यति महादेवं देवीं च वरदां शुभाम्॥ नारदं च महात्मानं तस्या देव्याः समीपतः। संतोषं परमं लेभे इति निश्चित्य योगवित्॥'}

{'en': 'All the gods and others that had come there held the same opinion, regarding the omission to invite the Lord of all creatures. Dadhichi alone, desirous of leaving that place then said,—By adoring one who should not be adored, and by refusing to adore him who should be adored, a man incurs the sin of homicide for ever.', 'sn': 'एकमन्त्रास्तु ते सर्वे येनेशो न निमन्त्रितः। तस्माद् देशादपक्रम्य दधीचिर्वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥ अपूज्यपूजनाच्चैव पूज्यानां चाप्यपूजनात्। नृघातकसमं पापं शश्वत् प्राप्नोति मानवः॥'}

{'en': 'I have never before spoken an untruth, and an untruth I shall never speak. Here in the midst of the gods and the Rishis I say the truth.', 'sn': 'अनृतं नोक्तपूर्वं मे न च वक्ष्ये कदाचन। देवतानामृषीणां च मध्ये सत्यं ब्रवीम्यहम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Protector of all creatures, the Creator of the universe, the Lord of all, the powerful master, the taker of sacrificial offerings, will soon come to this Sacrifice and you all shall behold him.', 'sn': 'आगतं पशुभर्तारं स्रष्टारं जगतः पतिम्। अध्वरे ह्यग्रभोक्तारं सर्वेषां पश्यत प्रभुम्॥'}

{'en': 'Dhaksha said-We have many Rudras armed with lances and having matted locks on their heads. They are eleven in number. I know them all, but I do not know who this Maheshvara is.', 'sn': 'दक्ष उवाच सन्ति नो बहवो रुद्राः शूलहस्ताः कपर्दिनः। एकादशस्थानगता नाहं वेद्मि महेश्वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Dadhichi said This seems to be the advice of all that are here, namely, that Maheshvara should not be invited. As, however, I do not see any god that can be said to be superior to him, I am sure that this proposed Sacrifice of Daksha will surely be destroyed. a', 'sn': 'दधीचिरुवाच सर्वेषामेव मन्त्रोऽयं येनासौ न निमन्त्रितः। यथाहं शंकरादूर्ध्वं नान्यं पश्यामि दैवतम्। तथा दक्षस्य विपुलो यज्ञोऽयं न भविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Daksha said Here, in this golden vessel, intended for the Lord of all Sacrifices is the sacrificial offering sanctified by Mantras and according to the ordinance. I wish to make this offering to Vishnu who is peerless. He is powerful and the Master of all, and to Him should sacrifices be offered.', 'sn': 'दक्ष उवाच एतन्मखेशाय सुवर्णपात्रे हविः समस्तं विधिमन्त्रपूतम्। विष्णोर्नयाम्यप्रतिमस्य भागं प्रभुर्विभुश्चाहवनीय एषः॥'}

{'en': 'Uma said What are those gifts, what those vows, and what those penances, that I should practise by means of which my illustrious consort may be able to get a half or a third share of the offerings in sacrifices. are', 'sn': 'देव्युवाच किं नाम दानं नियमं तपो वा कुर्यामहं येन पतिर्ममाद्या लभेत भागं भगवानचिन्त्यो ह्यधु तथा भागमथो तृतीयम्॥'}

{'en': 'To his wife who was moved with grief and who repeated these words the illustrious Mahadeva said with a delighted face. You do not know me, O goddess! You do not know, 0 you of delicate limbs, and low belly, what words are proper to be said to Lord of Sacrifices.', 'sn': 'एवं ब्रुवाणां भगवान्स पत्नी प्रहृष्टरूपः क्षुभितामुवाच। न वेत्सि मां देवि कृशोदराङ्गि किं नाम युक्तं वचनं मखेशे॥'}

{'en': 'O lady having large eyes, I know that it is only the sinful, who shorn of contemplation, that do not understand me. It is through your power of illusion that the gods headed by Indra and the three worlds all become stupefied.', 'sn': 'अहं विजानामि विशालनेत्रे ध्यानेन हीना न विदन्त्यसन्तः। तवाद्य मोहेन च सेन्द्रदेवा लोकास्त्रयः सर्वत एव मूढाः॥'}

{'en': 'It is to me that the chaunters offer their praises in Sacrifices. It is to me that the Samansingers sing their Rathantaras. It is to me that Brahmanas knowing the Vedas celebrate their Sacrifices. And it is to me that the Addharyus offer the shares of sacrificial offerings.', 'sn': 'मामध्वरे शंसितारः स्तुवन्ति रथन्तरं सामगाश्चोपगान्ति। मां ब्राह्मणा ब्रह्मविदो यजन्ते ममाध्वर्यवः कल्पयन्ते च भागम्॥'}

{'en': 'The goddess said Persons of even ordinary powers applaud themselves and brag before their wives. There is no doubt in this.', 'sn': 'देव्युवाच सुप्राकृतोऽपि पुरुषः सर्वः स्त्रीजनसंसदि। स्तौति गवार्यते चापि स्वमात्मानं न संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'O Queen of all the gods, I do not certainly speak highly of my own self. See now, O lady of slender waist, what I do. Look at the Being that I will create, O you of the fairest complexion, for destroying this Sacrifice, O my beautiful wife!', 'sn': 'श्रीभगवानुवाच नात्मानं स्तौमि देवेशि पश्य मे तनुमध्यमे। यं वक्ष्यामि वरारोहे यागार्थे वरवर्णिनि॥'}

{'en': "Having said these words to his wife Uma, who was dearer to him than his own life, the powerful Mahadeva created from his mouth a dreadful Being whose very sight could make one's hair stand erect.", 'sn': 'इत्युक्त्वा भगवान् पत्नीमुमां प्राणैरपि प्रियाम्। सोऽसृजद् भगवान् वक्त्राद् भूतं घोरं प्रहर्षणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Maheshvara answered him, telling,-Go and destroy the Sacrifice of Daksha. Thus commanded, that Being of leonine powers who had come out from the mouth of Mahadeva wished to destroy the Sacrifice of Daksha, without displaying all his energy and without the help of anyone else, for removing the anger of Uma.', 'sn': 'तमुवाचाक्षिप मखं दक्षस्येति महेश्वरः। ततो वक्त्राद् विमुक्तेन सिंहेनैकेन लीलया।॥ देव्या मन्युव्यपोहार्थं हतो दक्षस्य वै क्रतुः।'}

{'en': "Urged by her anger, the wife of Maheshvara, herself assuming a dreadful form known by the name of Mahakali, proceeded in the company of that Being who had come out from Mahadeva's mouth, for beholding with her own eyes the acts of destruction which was her own. That powerful Being, then started having gained the permission of Mahadeva and having bowed his head to him.", 'sn': 'मन्युना च महाभीमा महाकाली महेश्वरी॥ आत्मनः कर्मसाक्षित्वे तेन सार्धं सहानुगा। देवस्थानुमतं मत्वा प्रणम्य शिरसा ततः॥'}

{'en': "name In energy, strength, and form, he took after Maheshvara himself who had created him. Indeed, he was the living embodiment of (Mahadeva's) anger.", 'sn': 'आत्मनः सदृशः शौर्याद् बलरूपसमन्वितः। स एव भगवान् क्रोधः प्रतिरूपसमन्वितः॥'}

{'en': "Of great might, energy, courage and prowess, he passed by the of Virabhadra—that dispeller of the goddess's anger. He then created from the pores of his body a large number of spirits known by the name of Raumyas.", 'sn': 'अनन्तबलवीर्यश्च अनन्तबलपौरुषः। वीरभद्र इति ख्यातो देव्या मन्युप्रमार्जकः॥ सोऽसृजद् रोमकूपेभ्यो रौम्यान् नाम गणेश्वरान्।'}

{'en': 'Those dreadful spirits, endued with terrible energy and prowess and resembling Rudra himself, rushed with the force of thunder to that place where Daksha was making preparations for his sacrifice, moved by the desire of destroying it. Having hundreds and thousands in number.', 'sn': 'रुद्रतुल्या गणा रौद्रा रुद्रवीर्यपराक्रमाः॥ ते निपेतुस्ततस्तूर्णं दक्षयज्ञविहिंसया। भीमरूपा महाकायाः शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः॥'}

{'en': 'They filled the sky with their confused cries and shrieks. That noise filled the dwellers of heaven with fear.', 'sn': 'ततः कलकिलाशब्दैराकाशं पूरयन्निव। तेन शब्देन महता त्रस्तास्तत्र दिवौकसः॥'}

{'en': 'The very mountains were riven and the Earth shook. Whirlwinds began to blow. The Ocean rose in a surge.', 'sn': 'पर्वताश्च व्यशीर्यन्त चकम्पे च वसुंधरा। मारुताश्चैव घूर्णन्ते चुक्षुभे वरुणालयः॥'}

{'en': 'The fires that were lighted refused to blaze up. The Sun became dimmed. The Planets, the stars, and constellations, and the Moon, no longer shone.', 'sn': 'अग्नयो नैव दीप्यन्ते नैव दीप्यति भास्करः। ग्रहा नैव प्रकाशन्ते नक्षत्राणि न चन्द्रमाः॥'}

{'en': 'The Rishis, the gods, and human beings, looked pale. A universal darkness covered the Earth and sky. The insulted Rudras began to put fire to everything.', 'sn': 'ऋषयो न प्रकाशन्ते न देवा न.च मानुषाः। एवं तु तिमिरीभूतं निर्दहन्त्यपमानिताः॥'}

{'en': 'Some amongst them of terrible form began to smite and strike. Some tore up the sacrificial stakes. Some began to grind and others to crush.', 'sn': 'प्रहरन्त्यपरे घोरा यूपानुत्पाटयन्ति च। प्रमर्दन्ति तथा चान्ये विमर्दन्ति तथा परे॥'}

{'en': 'Gifted with the speed of wind or thought, some began to rush close and far. Some began to break the sacrificial vessels and the divine ornaments. The scattered fragments covered the ground like stars bespangling the firmament.', 'sn': 'आधावन्ति प्रधावन्ति वायुवेगा मनोजवाः। चूर्ण्यन्ते यज्ञपात्राणि दिव्यान्याभरणानि च॥ विशीर्यमाणा दृश्यन्ते तारा इव नभस्तले।'}

{'en': 'Heaps of excellent dishes, of bottles of drink, and of edibles there were that looked like mountains. Rivers of milk ran on all sides, with clarified butter and porridge for their mire, creamy curds for their water, and crystallised sugar for their sands. Those rivers had all the six tastes. There were lakes of treacle that looked highly beautiful.', 'sn': 'दिव्यान्नपानभक्ष्याणां राशयः पर्वतोपमाः॥ क्षीरनद्योऽथ दृश्यन्ते घृतपायसकर्दमाः। दधिमण्डोदका दिव्याः खण्डशर्करवालुकाः॥ षड् रसान् निवहन्त्येता गुडकुल्या मनोरमाः।'}

{'en': "Meat of various sorts, of the best quality, and other edibles of various sorts, and many excellent sorts of drink, and several other sorts of food that might be licked and sucked, began to be eaten by those spirits with various mouths. And they began to cast off and scatter those food in all directions. On account of Rudra's anger, every one of those gigantic Beings appeared like the all-destructive cyclefire.", 'sn': 'उच्चावचानि मांसानि भक्ष्याणि विविधानि च॥ पानकानि च दिव्यानि लेडचोष्याणि यानि च। भुञ्जते विविधैर्वक्त्रैविलुम्पन्त्याक्षिपन्ति च॥ रुद्रकोपान्महाकाया: कालाग्निसदृशोपमाः।'}

{'en': 'Agitating the celestial troops they made them tremble with fear and fly away on all sides. Those dreadful spirits sported with one another, and seizing the celestial damsels shoved and hurled them on all sides.', 'sn': 'क्षोभयन् सुरसैन्यानि भीषयन्तः समन्ततः॥ क्रीडन्ति विविधाकाराश्चिक्षिपुः सुरयोषितः।'}

{'en': "Of terrific deeds, those Reings, urged on by Rudra's anger very soon burnt, that Sacrifice although it was protected with great care by all the gods.", 'sn': 'रुद्रकोधात् प्रयत्नेन सर्वदेवैः सुरक्षितम्॥ तं यज्ञमदहच्छीघ्रं रुद्रकर्मा सभन्ततः।'}

{'en': 'They sent up loud roars which filled every living creature with fear. Having torn off the head of Sacrifice they began to cry aloud in joy.', 'sn': 'चकार भैरवं नादं सर्वभूतभवंकरम्॥ छित्त्वा शिरो वै यज्ञस्य ननाद च मुमोद च।'}

{'en': 'Then the gods headed by Brahman, and that progenitor of creatures, viz., Daksha, joining their hands in reverence, addressed that powerful Being, saying,-"Tell us, who you are."', 'sn': 'ततो ब्रह्मादयो देवा दक्षश्चैव प्रजापतिः॥ ऊचुः प्राज्जलयः सर्वे कथ्यतां को भवानिति।'}

{'en': "Virabhadra said I am neither Rudra nor his consort the goddess Uma. Nor have I come here for partaking of the food. Knowing the fact of Uma's anger, the powerful Lord who is the soul of all creatures has yielded to anger.", 'sn': 'वीरभद्र उवाच नाहं रुद्रो न वा देवी नैव भोक्तुमिहागतः॥ देव्या मन्युकृतं मत्वा क्रुद्धः सर्वात्मकः प्रभुः।'}

{'en': 'I have not come here for seeing these foremost of Brahmanas. I have not come here impelled by curiosity. Know that I have come here for destroying this Sacrifice of yours.', 'sn': 'द्रष्टुं वा नैव विप्रेन्द्रान् नैव कौतूहलेन वा॥ तव यज्ञविघातार्थं सम्प्राप्तं विद्धि मामिह।'}

{'en': 'I am known by the name of Virabhadra and I have originated from the anger of Rudra. This lady who is called Bhadrakali, has originated from the anger of the goddess. We have both been sent by that god of gods, and we have accordingly come here.', 'sn': 'वीरभद्र इति ख्यातो रुद्रकोपाद् विनिःसृतः॥ भद्रकालीति विख्याता देव्याः कोपाद् विनिःसृता। प्रेषितौ देवदेवेन यज्ञान्तिकमिहागतौ॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of Brahmanas, seek the protection of that Lord of the gods, he consort of Uma! It is better to incur even the anger of that foremost of gods than to obtain boons from any god.', 'sn': 'शरणं गच्छ विप्रेन्द्र देवदेवमुमापतिम्। वरं क्रोधोऽपि देवस्य वरदानं न चान्यतः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing the words of Virabhadra, Daksha, that foremost of all pious men, bewed down unto Maheshvara and sought to please him by uttering the following hymn.', 'sn': 'वीरभद्रवचः श्रुत्वा दक्षो धर्मभृतां वरः। तोषयामास स्तोत्रेण प्रणिपत्य महेश्वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'I throw myself at the feet of the effulgent Ishana, who is Eternal, Immutable, and Indestructible; who is the foremost of all gods, who has a high soul, who is the Lord of all the universe.', 'sn': 'प्रपद्ये देवमीशानं शाश्वतं ध्रुवमव्ययम्। महादेवं महात्मानं विश्वस्य जगतः पतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'His praises having thus been hymned, the great god, Mahadeva, suspending the two vital airs-Prana and Apana—by shutting his mouth properly, and casting his eyes graciously on all sides, appeared there. Having many eyes, that conqueror of all enemies, that Lord of even the gods of all gods, suddenly arose from within the pit in which was kept the sacrificial fire.', 'sn': 'प्राणापानौ संनिरुध्य वक्त्रस्थानेन यत्नतः। विचार्य सर्वतो दृष्टिं बहुदृष्टिरमित्रजित्॥ सहसा देवदेवेशो ह्यग्निकुण्डात् समुत्थितः।'}

{'en': "Endued with the effulgence of a thousand Suns, and loO king like another Samvartaka, the great god smiled gently (at Daksha) and addressing him, said 'What, O Brahmana, shall I do for you?'", 'sn': 'बिभ्रत्सूर्यसहस्रस्य तेजः संवर्तकोपमः॥ स्मितं कृत्वाब्रवीद् वाक्यं ब्रूहि किं करवाणि ते।'}

{'en': 'At this time, the preceptor of all the gods worshipped Mahadeva with the Vedic verses contained in the Moksha sections. Then that progenitor of all creatures, viz., Daksha, joining his hands in respect, filled with dread and fear, highly moved and with face and eyes bathed in tears, addressed the great god in the', 'sn': 'श्राविते च मखाध्याये देवानां गुरुणा ततः॥ तुमवाचाञ्जलिं कृत्वा दक्षो देवं प्रजापतिः भीतशङ्कितवित्रस्तः सबाष्पवदनेक्षणः॥'}

{'en': "Daksha said am If the great god has been pleased with me,-if, indeed, I have become an object of favour with him,-if I worthy of kindness,-if the great lord of all creatures is ready to grant me boons, then let all these articles of mine that have been burnt, eaten, drunk, swallowed, destroyed, broken, and polluted,-let all these articles, collected in many long years, and with great care and exertion, prove useless! Let these articles be of use to me! Even this is the boon I pray for! The illustrious Hara, the tearer of Bhaga's eyes, said to him,-'Let it be as you say!' these were the words of that illustrious progenitor of all creatures, that god of three eyes, that protector of virtue.", 'sn': 'यदि प्रसन्नो भगवान् यदि चाहं भवत्प्रियः। यदि वाहमनुग्राह्यो यदि वा वरदो मम॥ यद् दग्धं भक्षितं पीतशितं यच्च नाशितम्। चूर्णीकृतापविद्धं च यज्ञसम्भारमीदृशम्॥ दीर्घकालेन महता प्रयत्नेन सुसंचितम्। तन्न मिथ्या भवेन्मह्यं वरमेतमहं वृणे॥ तथास्त्वित्याह भगवान् भगनेत्रहरो हरः। धर्माध्यक्षो विरूपाक्षस्त्र्यक्षो देवः प्रजापतिः॥'}

{'en': 'Having gained that boon from Bhava, Daksha knelt down to him and adored that god having the bull for his emblem uttering his thousand and eight names.', 'sn': 'जानुभ्यामवनीं गत्वा दक्षो लब्ध्वा भवाद् वरम्। नाम्नामष्टसहस्रेण स्तुतवान् वृषभध्वजम्॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said You should, O sire, tell me those names by which Daksha, that progenitor of creatures, worshipped the great god, O sinless one, a respectful curiosity urges me to hear them.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच यैर्नामधेयैः स्तुतवान् दक्षो देवं प्रजापतिः। वक्तुमर्हसि मे तात श्रोतुं श्रद्धा ममानघ॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Hear, O Bharata, what the names, both secret and public, are of that god of gods, that god of extraordinary feats, that ascetic of secret VOWS.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच श्रूयतां देवदेवस्य नामान्यद्भुतकर्मणः। गूढव्रतस्य गुह्यानि प्रकाशानि च भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Daksha said-I bow to you, O lord of all the gods of gods, to the destroyer of the forces of the Asuras! You are the paralyser of the strength of the king of gods himself! You are worshipped by both gods and Danavas.', 'sn': 'नमस्ते देवदेवेश देवारिबलसूदन। देवेन्द्रबलविष्टम्भ देवदानवपूजित॥'}

{'en': 'You are thousand-eyed, you are fierceeyed, and you are three-eyed! You are the friend of the king of the Yakshas, your hands and feet extend in all directions to all places. Your eyes also and head, mouth are on all sides.', 'sn': 'सहस्राक्ष विरूपाक्ष त्र्यक्ष यक्षाधिपप्रिय। सर्वत:पाणिपादान्त सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखा॥'}

{'en': 'Your ears too are everywhere in the universe and you are yourself everywhere, O Lord! You are shaft-eared you are large-eared, and you are pot-eared! You are the receptacle of the Ocean.', 'sn': 'सर्वतःश्रुतिमॅल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठसि। शङ्खकर्ण महाकर्ण कुम्भकर्णार्णवालय॥'}

{'en': 'Your ears are like those of the elephant, or of the bull, or like extended palms. Adoration to you. You have a hundred stomachs, a hundred revolutions, and a hundred tongues. I bow to you.', 'sn': 'गजेन्द्रकर्ण गोकर्ण पाणिकर्ण नमोऽस्तु ते। शतोदर शतावर्त शतजिह्व नमोऽस्तु ते॥'}

{'en': 'The utterers of the Gayatri sing your praises in ultering the Gayatri, and the worshippers of the Sun worship you in adoring the Sun. The Rishis consider you as Brahman, as Indra, and as the sky above.', 'sn': 'गायन्ति त्वा गायत्रिणोऽर्चन्त्यर्कमर्किणः। ब्रह्माणं त्वां शतक्रतुमूर्ध्वं खमिव मेनिरे॥'}

{'en': 'O you of mighty forin, the Ocean and the Sky are your two forms. All the gods live in your two forms. All the gods live in your form as kine dwell within the fold.', 'sn': 'मूर्ती हि ते महामूर्ते समुद्राम्बरसंनिभा सर्वा वै देवता ह्यस्मिन् गावो गोष्ठ इवासते॥'}
{'en': 'In your body I see Soma, Agni, the king of the Waters, Aditya, Vishnu, Brahman, and Brihaspati.', 'sn': 'भवच्छरीरे पश्यामि सोममग्नि जलेश्वरम्। आदित्यमथ वै विष्णुं ब्रह्माणं च बृहस्पतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'You, O illustrious one, are Cause and Effect and Action and Instrument of everything unreal and real, and you are Creation and Destruction.', 'sn': 'भगवान् कारणं कार्य क्रिया करणमेव च। असतश्च सतश्चैव तथैव प्रभवाप्ययौ॥'}

{'en': 'I bow to you who are called Bhava, Sharva, and Rudra. I bow to you who are the giver of boons. I bow always to you who are the Lord of all creatures. Salutations to you who are the slayer of Andhaka.', 'sn': 'नमो भवाय शर्वाय रुद्राय वरदाय च। पशूनां पतये नित्यं नमोऽस्त्वन्धकघातिने॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who have three matted locks, to you who have three heads, to you who are armed with an excellent trident; to you who have three eyes and who are, therefore, called Tryamvaka and Trinetra! Salutations to you who are the destroyer of the triple city!', 'sn': 'त्रिजटाय त्रिशीर्षाय त्रिशूलवरपाणिने। त्र्यम्बकाय त्रिनेत्राय त्रिपुरनाय वै नमः॥'}

{'en': "Salutations to you who are called Chanda, and Kunda; you who are the (universal) egg and also the bearer of the (universal) egg; to you who are the holder of the ascetic's stick, to you who have ears everywhere, and to you who are called Dandimunda:", 'sn': 'नमश्चण्डाय कुण्डाय अण्डायाण्डधराय च। दण्डिने समकर्णाय दण्डिमुण्डाय वै नमः॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you whose teeth and hair are turned upwards, to you who are stainless and white, and who are stretched all over the universe; to you who are red, to you who are tawny and to you who have a blue throat,', 'sn': 'नमोर्ध्वदंष्ट्रकेशाय शुक्लायावतताय च। विलोहिताय धूम्राय नीलग्रीवाय वै नमः॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are of incomparable form, who are of dreadful form, and who are highly auspicious! To you who are the sun, who have a garland of suns round your neck and who have standards and flags bearing the device of the sun.', 'sn': 'नमोऽस्त्वप्रतिरूपाय विरूपाय शिवाय च। सूर्याय सूर्यमालाय सूर्यध्वजपताकिने॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are the Lord of spirits and ghosts, to you who are bullnecked, and who are armed with the bow; to you who crush all enemies, to you who are the personification of chastisement, and to you who are clad in leaves and rags.', 'sn': 'नमः प्रमथनाथाय वृषस्कन्धाय धन्विने। शबूंदमाय दण्डाय पर्णचीरपटाय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who have gold in your stomach. To you who are accoutered in golden mail, to you who are gold-created, to you who are the lord of all the gold in the world.', 'sn': 'नमो हिरण्यगर्भाय हिरण्यकवचाय च। हिरण्यकृतचूडाय हिरण्यपतये नमः॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who have been worshipped, who are worthy of adorations, and who are still being adored; to you who are all things, who devour all things, and who are the soul of all things.', 'sn': 'नमः स्तुताय स्तुत्याय स्तूयमानाय वै नमः। सर्वाय सर्वभक्षाय सर्वभूतान्तरात्मने॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are the Hotri (in sacrifices), who are the (Vedic) Mantras uttered (in sacrifices), and who own white flags and standards. Salutations to you who are the navel of the universe, who are both cause and effect in the form of the five primal elements, and who are the coverer of all covers.', 'sn': 'नमो हो।ऽथ मन्त्राय शुक्लध्वजपताकिने। नमो नाभाय नाभ्याय नमः कटकटाय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations called Krishanasha, who are of thin limbs, and who are thin. Salutations to you who are always cheerful and who are the personification of sounds and voices.', 'sn': 'नमोऽस्तु कृशनासाय कृशाङ्गाय कृशाय च। संहृष्टाय विहृष्टाय नमः किलकिलाय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are about to be stretched on the Earth, who are already stretched, and who stand erect. Salutations to you who are fixed, who are running, who are bald, and who have matted locks on your head.', 'sn': 'नमोऽस्तु शयमानाय शयितायोत्थिताय च। स्थिताय धावमानाय मुण्डाय जटिलाय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutation to you who are fond of dancing a:d who beat puffed cheeks converting the in it! into a druin. Salutations to you who are ind of lotuses that blow in rivers, and who are to you you who are always fond of singing and playing on musical instruments.', 'sn': 'नमो नर्तनशीलाय मुखवादित्रवादिने। नाद्योपहारलुब्धाय गीतवादित्रशालिने॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are the eldest-born, who are the foremost of all creatures, and who are the crusher of the Asura Vala. Salutations to you who are the Master of Time, who are the personification of Kalpa; who are the embodiment of all kinds of destruction great and small.', 'sn': 'नमो ज्येष्ठाय श्रेष्ठाय बलप्रमथनाय च। कालनाथाय कल्याय क्षयायोपक्षयाय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who laugh dreadfully and as loud as the beat of a drum, and who practise dreadful vows! Salutations for ever to you who are fierce, and who have ten arms.', 'sn': 'भीमदुन्दुभिहासाय भीमव्रतधराय च। उग्राय च नमो नित्यं नमोऽस्तु दशबाहवे॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are armed with bones and who are fond of the ashes of funeral pyres. Salutation to you who are dreadful, who are horrible to look at, and who are an observer of dreadful, vows and practises.', 'sn': 'नमः कपालहस्ताय चितिभस्मप्रियाय च। विभीषणाय भीष्माय भीमव्रतधराय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who have an ugly mouth, who have a tongue resembling a scimitar and who have large teeth. Salutations to you who are fond of both cooked and uncooked meat, and who consider the gourded Vina as highly dear.', 'sn': 'नमो विकृतवक्त्राय खगजिह्वाय दंष्ट्रिणे। पक्वाममांसलुब्धाय तुम्बीवीणाप्रियाय च॥'}

{'en': "Salutations to you who make rain, who help the cause of virtue, who are identifiable with the form of Nandi, and who Righteousness's self! Salutations to you who are ever moving like wind and the other forces, who are the controller of all things, and who are always engaged in coO king all creatures. are", 'sn': 'नमो वृषाय वृष्याय गोवृषाय वृषाय च। कटंकटाय दण्डाय नमः पचपचाय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are the foremost of all creatures, who are supperior, and who are the giver of boons. Salutation to you who have the best of garlands, the best of scents, and the best of dresses, and that givest the best of boons to the best of creatures.', 'sn': 'नमः सर्ववरिष्ठाय वराय वरदाय च। वरमाल्यगन्धवस्त्राय वरातिवरदे नमः॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are attached, who are freed from all attachments, who are of the form of Yoga-contemplation, and who are bedecked with a garland of Akshas. Salutations to you who are united as cause and disunited as effects, and who are the forın of shadow and of light.', 'sn': 'नमो रक्तविरक्ताय भावनायाक्षमालिने। सम्भिन्नाय विभिन्नाय छायायातपनाय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are amiable, and who are rightful, and who are exceedingly so. Salutations to you who are auspicious, who are tranquil, and who are most tranquil.', 'sn': 'अघोरघोररूपाय घोरघोरतराय च। नमः शिवाय शान्ताय नमः शान्ततमाय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who have one leg and many eyes, and only one head; to you who are fierce, to you who are satisfied with little offerings, and you who are fond of equity.', 'sn': 'एकपाद्बहुनेत्राय एकशीर्णे नमोऽस्तु ते। रुद्राय क्षुद्रलुब्धाय संविभागप्रियाय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are the maker of the universe, and who are ever united with the attribute of tranquillity. Salutations to you who carry a bell frightening the enemies, who are of the form of the jungle made by a bell, and who are of the form of sound when it is not perceptible by the ear.', 'sn': 'पञ्चालाय सिताङ्गाय नमः शमशमाय च। नमश्चण्डिकघण्टाय घण्टायाघण्टघण्टिने॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are like a thousand bells jingled together, and who are fond of a garland of bells, who are like the sound that the vital airs make, who are of the form of all scents and of the confused noise of boiling liquids.', 'sn': 'सहस्राध्मातघण्टाय घण्टामालाप्रियाय च। प्राणघण्टाय गन्धाय नमः कलकलाय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are above three Huns, and who are fond of two Huns. Salutations to you who are greatly tranquil, and who live under the shade of mountain trees.', 'sn': 'हूंहूंहूंकारपाराय हूंहूंकारप्रियाय च। नमः शमशमे नित्यं गिरिवृक्षालयाय च॥१००।'}

{'en': 'You are fond of the heart-flesh of all creatures, who purify all sins and who are of the form of sacrificial offerings. Salutations to you who are of the form of Sacrifice, who are the Sacrificer himself, who are the Brahmana into whose mouth is poured the sacrificial butter, and who are the fire into which is poured the butter inspired with Mantras.', 'sn': 'गर्भमांससृगालाय तारकाय तराय च। नमो यज्ञाय यजिने हुताय प्रहुताय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are of the form of (sacrificial) priests, who have your senses under control, who are made of the quality of Goodness, and who have also the quality of Darkness. Salutations to you who are of the form of the banks of Rivers, of Rivers themselves, and of the lord of all Rivers (viz., the Ocean).', 'sn': 'यज्ञवाहाय दान्ताय तप्यायातपनाय च। नमस्तटाय तट्याय तटानां पतये नमः॥'}

{'en': "Salutations to you who are the giver of food, who are the lord of all food, and who are at one whith him who takes food! Salutations to you who have a thousand heads and a thousand feet; to you who have a thousand tridents uplifted in your hands, and a thousand cyes! Saluatations to you who are how are of the form of the rising Sun, and who are of the form of a child, who are the protector of attendants all of whom are like children, and who are, besides, of the form of children's toys. Salutations to you who are old, who are covetous, who are already agitated, and who are about to be agitated.", 'sn': 'अन्नदायानपतये नमस्त्वन्नभुजे तथा। नमः सहस्रशीर्षाय सहस्रचरणाय च।१०३।। सहस्रोद्यतशूलाय सहस्रनयनाय च। नमो बालार्कवर्णाय बालरूपधराय च।१०४॥ बालानुचरगोप्ताय बालक्रीडनकाय च। नमो वृद्धाय लुब्धाय क्षुब्धाय क्षोभणाय च॥ .'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who have locks of hair carrying the current of the Ganges, and who have locks of hair resembling blades of Munja grass! Salutations to you who are pleased with the six acts, and who are given to the performance of the three acts.', 'sn': 'तरङ्गाङ्कितकेशाय मुञ्जकेशाय वै नमः। नमः षट्कर्मतुष्टाय त्रिकर्मनिरताय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who have allotted the duties of the various modes of life. Salutations to you who should be praised in sounds, who are of the form of sorrow, and who are of the form of deep and confused noise.', 'sn': 'वर्णाश्रमाणां विधिवत् पृथक्कर्मनिवर्तिने। नमो घुष्याय घोषाय नमः कलकलाय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who have eyes both white and tawny, as also dark and red. Salutations to you who have conquered your vital airs, who are of the form of weapons, who rivet all things, and who are greatly lean.', 'sn': 'श्वेतपिङ्गलनेत्राय कृष्णरक्तेक्षणाय च। प्राणभग्नाय दण्डाय स्फोटनाय कृशाय च॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who always describe Religion, Pleasure, Profit, and Liberation. Salutations to you who are a Sankhya, who are the foremost of Sankhyas, and who are the promulgator of the Sankhya Yoga.', 'sn': 'धर्मकामार्थमोक्षाणां कथनीयकथाय च। सांख्याय सांख्यमुख्याय सांख्ययोगप्रवर्तिने॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who have a car and who are without a car. Salutations to you who have the junction of four roads for your car; to you who have the skin of a black deer for your upper garments, and who have a snake for the sacred thread.', 'sn': 'नमो रथ्यविरथ्याय चतुष्पथरथाय च। कृष्णाजिनोत्तरीयाय व्यालयज्ञोपवीतिने॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are Ishana, who are of body as hard as adamant, and who are of green locks. Salutations to you who have three eyes, who are the husband of Ambika, who are manifest, and who are Unmanifest.', 'sn': 'ईशान वज्रसंघात हरिकेश नमोऽस्तु ते। त्र्यम्बकाम्बिकनाथाय व्यक्ताव्यक्त नमोऽस्तु ते॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are Desire, are the Giver of all desires, who are the Killer of all desires, and who are the discriminator between the pleased and the not pleased. Salutations to you who are all things, the Giver of all things, and the Destroyer of all things. Salutations to you who are the colour which appear in the evening sky.', 'sn': 'काम कामद कामन तृप्तातृप्तविचारिणे। सर्व सर्वद सर्वघ्न संध्याराग नमोऽस्तु ते॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are of great strength, who are of mighty arms, who are a mighty Being, and who are of great effulgence. Salutations to you who look like a huge mass of clouds, and who are the embodiment of eternity. Salutations to you who are of welldeveloped body, who are of emaciated limbs, who bear, matted locks on your head, and who are clad in barks of trees and skins of animals.', 'sn': 'महाबल महाबाहो महासत्त्व महाद्युते। महामेघचयप्रख्य महाकाल नमोऽस्तु ते॥ स्थूल जीर्णाङ्ग जटिले वल्कलाजिनधारिणे।'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who have matted locks as effulgent as the Sun or the Fire, and who have barks and skins for your raiment. Salutations to you who are endued with the effulgence of a thousand Suns, and who are ever engaged in penances.', 'sn': 'दीप्तसूर्याग्निजटिले वल्कलाजिनवाससे। सहस्रसूर्यप्रतिम तपोनित्य नमोऽस्तु ते॥'}

{'en': 'Salutations to you who are the excitement of Fever and who have matted locks drenched with the waters of the Ganges having hundreds of eddies. Salutations to you who again and again revolve the Moon, the Yugas, and the clouds.', 'sn': 'उन्मादन शतावर्त गङ्गातोयामूर्धज। चन्द्रावर्त युगावर्त मेघावर्त नमोऽस्तु ते॥'}

{'en': 'You are food, you are he who eats that food, you are the giver of food, you are the grower of food, and you are the maker of food. Salutations to you who cook food and who cat cooked food, and who are both wind and fire.', 'sn': 'त्वमन्नमनभोक्ता च अन्नदोऽन्नभुगेव च। अन्नस्रष्टा च पक्ता च पक्वभुक्पवनोऽनलः॥'}

{'en': 'O Lord of all the lords of the gods, you are the four orders of living creatures, viz., the viviparous, the oviparous, the filth-born, and vegetables.', 'sn': 'जरायुजाण्डजाश्चैव स्वेदजाश्च तथोद्भिजाः। त्वमेव देवदेवेश भूतग्रामश्चतुर्विधः॥'}

{'en': 'You are the Creator of the mobile and the immobile universe, and you their Destroyer. O foremost of all persons conversant with Brahma, they who know Brahma consider you as Brahma.', 'sn': 'चराचरस्य स्रष्टा त्वं प्रतिहर्ता तथैव च। त्वामाहुर्ब्रह्मविदुषो ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदां वर॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmavadins say that you are the Supreme root of Mind, and the Refuge upon which Ether, Air, and Light rest. You are the Richs and the Samans, and the syllable OM.', 'sn': 'मनसः परमा योनिः खं वायुर्योतिषां निधिः। ऋक्सामानि तथोङ्कारमाहुस्त्वां ब्रह्मवादिनः॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of all goods, those Brahmavadins who sing the Samans always sing you when they utter the syllables HayiHayi, Huva-Hayi, and Huva-Hoyi.', 'sn': 'हायिहायिहुवाहायिहावुहायि तथासकृत्। गायन्ति त्वां सुरश्रेष्ठ सामगा ब्रह्मवादिनः॥'}

{'en': 'You are made up the Yajushes, of the Richs, and of the offerings poured on the sacrificial fire. The hymns of the Vedas and the Upanishads worship you.', 'sn': 'यजुर्मयो ऋङ्मयश्च त्वमाहुतिमयस्तथा। पठ्यसे स्तुतिभिश्चैव वेदोपनिषदां गणैः॥'}

{'en': 'You are the Brahmanas and the Kshatriyas, the Vaishyas, and the Shudras, and the other castes formed by inter-mixture. You are the masses of clouds which appear in the sky; you are Lightning; and you are the roar of thunder.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मणाः क्षत्रिया वैश्याः शूद्रा वर्णावराश्च ये। त्वमेव मेघसंघाश्च विद्युत्स्तनितगर्जितः॥'}

{'en': 'You are the year, you are the seasons, you are the month, and you are the fortnight. You are Yuga, you are the time represented by a twinkle of the eye, you are Kashtha, you are the constellations, you are the Planets, you are Kala.', 'sn': 'संवत्सरस्त्वमृतवो मासो मासार्धमेव च। युगं निमेषाः काष्ठास्त्वं नक्षत्राणि ग्रहाः कलाः॥'}
