{'en': 'You are the tops of all tress, you are the highest summits of all mountains. You are the tiger among the lower animals, you are Garuda among birds, and you are Ananta among snakes.', 'sn': 'वृक्षाणां ककुदोऽसि त्वं गिरीणां शिखराणि च। व्याघ्रो मृगाणां पततां तार्योऽनन्तश्च भोगिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'You are the ocean of milk among all oceans, and you the bow among instruments for hurling weapons. You are the thunder among weapons, and you are Truth among vows.', 'sn': 'क्षीरोदो हृदधीनां च यन्त्राणां धनुरेव च। वज्रः प्रहरणानां च व्रतानां सत्यमेव च॥'}

{'en': 'You are Aversion and you are Desire: you are attachment and you are stupefaction of judgement): you are Forgiving and you are Unforgiveness. You are Exertion, and you are Patience: you are Cupidity: you are Lust and you are Anger: you are Victory and you are Defeat.', 'sn': 'त्वमेव द्वेष इच्छा च रागो मोहः क्षमाक्षमे। व्यवसायो धृतिर्लोभः कामक्रोधौ जयाजयौ॥'}

{'en': 'are You are armed with mace, and you are armed with arrow: you are armed with the bow, and you carry the Khattanga and the Jharjhara in your hands. You are he who cuts down and pierces and smites. You are he who leads (all creatures) and he who gives them pain and grief.', 'sn': 'त्वं गदी त्वं शरी चापी खट्वाङ्गी झर्झरी तथा। छेत्ता भेत्ता प्रहर्ता त्वं नेता मन्ता पिता मतः॥'}

{'en': 'You are Righteousness marked by ten virtues; you are Wealth or Profit of every sort; and you are Pleasure! You are Ganga, you are the Oceans, you are the Rivers, you are the lakes, and you are the tanks.', 'sn': 'दशलक्षणसंयुक्तो धर्मोऽर्थः काम एव च। गङ्गा समुद्राः सरितः पल्वलानि सरांसि च॥'}

{'en': 'You are the thin creepers, you are the thicker creepers. you are all kinds of grass, and you are the deciduous herbs. You are all the lower animals and you are the birds. You are the origin of all objects and acts, and you are that season which yields fruits and flowers. You are the beginning and you are the end of the Vedas; you are the Gayatri, and you are OM.', 'sn': 'लता वल्यस्तृणौषध्यः पशवो मृगपक्षिणः। द्रव्यकर्मसमारम्भः कालः पुष्पफलप्रदः॥ आदिश्चान्तश्च देवानां गायत्र्योङ्कार एव च।'}

{'en': 'You are Green, you are Red, you are Blue, you are Dark, You are of Bloody colour, you are of the colour of the Sun. You are Tawny, you are Brown, and you are Dark-blue.', 'sn': 'हरितो रोहितो नीलः कृष्णो रक्तस्तथारुणः। कदुश्च कपिलश्चैव कपोतो मेचकस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'You are colourless, you are of the best colour, you are the maker of colours, and you are peerless. You are of the name of Gold, and you are fond of Gold.', 'sn': 'अवर्णश्च सुवर्णश्च वर्णकारो घनोपमः। सुवर्णनामा च तथा सुवर्णप्रिय एव च॥'}

{'en': 'You are Indra, you are Yama, you are the Giver of boons, you are the Lord of riches, and you are Agni. You are the Eclipse, you are the Fire called Chitrabhanu, you are Rahu, and you are the Sun.', 'sn': 'त्वमिन्द्रश्च यमश्चैव वरुणो धनदोऽनलः। उपप्लवचित्रभानुः स्वर्भानुर्भानुरेव च॥'}

{'en': 'You are the fire upon which sacrificial butter is poured. You are he who pours the butter. You are He in honour of whom the butter is poured, you are the butter itself that is poured, and you are the powerful Lord of all. You are those sections of the Brahmanas who are called Trisuparna; you are all the Vedas; and you are the sections called Shatarudriya in the Yajushes.', 'sn': 'होत्रं होता च होम्यं च हुतं चैव तथा प्रभुः। त्रिसौपर्णं तथा ब्रह्म यजुषां शतरुद्रियम्॥'}

{'en': "You are the holiest of holies, and the auspicious of all auspicious things. You quicken the inanimate body. You are the Chit that lives in the human body. Invested with qualities, you are liable to Destructions. You are individual soul, that is He who is never liable to destruction when uninvested with attributes. You are full yet you are liable to decay and death in the form of the body which is individual soul's encasement.", 'sn': 'पवित्रं च पवित्राणां मङ्गलानां च मङ्गलम्। गिरिको हिंडुको वृक्षो जीवः पुद्गल एव च॥'}

{'en': 'You are the breath of life, and you are quality of Goodness, you are Darkness, you are Ignorance, and you are not subject to mistake. You are the vital airs called Prana, Apana, Samana, Udana, and Vyana.', 'sn': 'प्राणः सत्त्वं रजश्चैव तमश्चाप्रमदस्तथा। प्राणोऽपानः समानश्च उदानो व्यान एव च॥'}

{'en': 'You are the opening of the eye and the shutting of the eye. You are Sneezing and you are Yawning. You are of red eyes which are ever turned inwards. You are of large mouth and large stomach.', 'sn': 'उन्मेषश्च निमेषश्च क्षुतं जृम्भितमेव च। लोहितान्तर्गता दृष्टिर्महावक्त्रो महोदरः॥'}

{'en': 'The hairs of your body are like needles. Your beard is green. Your hair is turned upwards. You are swifter than the swiftest. You are master of the principals of music both vocal and instrumental, and fond of both and instrumental music.', 'sn': 'सूचीरोमा हरिश्मश्रुर्ध्वकेशश्चलाचलः। गीतवादित्रतत्त्वज्ञो गीतवादनकप्रियः॥'}

{'en': 'You are a fish moving in the waters, and you are a fish caught in the net. You are full, you are fond of sports, and you are of the form of all quarrels and disputes. You are Time, you are bad time, you are premature time, and you are over-mature time.', 'sn': 'मत्स्यो जलचरो जाल्योऽकलः केलिकल: कलिः। अकालश्चातिकालश्च दुष्कालः काल एव च॥'}

{'en': 'You are the killing, you are the razor, and you are what is killed. You are the auxiliary and you are the adversary, and you are destroyer of both auxiliaries and adversaries. You are the time when clouds appear, you are of large teeth, and you are Samvartaka and Valahaka.', 'sn': 'मृत्युः क्षुरश्च कृत्यश्च पक्षोऽपक्षक्षयंकरः। मेघकालो महादंष्ट्रः संवर्तकबलाहकः॥'}

{'en': 'You are manifest in a shining form. You are concealed for being invested with illusion. You are He who links creatures with the fruits of their acts. You have a bell in your hand. You sport with all mobile and immobile things. You are the cause of all causes. You are Brahma, you are Swaha; you are the holder of the rod, your head is bald, and you are he who has his words, deeds, and thoughts under restraint.', 'sn': 'घण्टोऽघण्टो घटी घण्टी चरुचेली मिलीमिली। ब्रह्मकायिकमग्नीनां दण्डी मुण्डस्त्रिदण्डधृक्॥'}

{'en': 'You are the four cycles, you are the four Vedas, you are he from whom the four fires have emanated. You are the ordainer of all the duties of the four modes of life. You are the maker of the four Orders.', 'sn': 'चतुर्युगश्चतुर्वेदश्चातुर्होत्रप्रवर्तकः। चातुराश्रम्यनेता च चातुर्वर्ण्यकरश्च यः॥'}

{'en': 'You are always fond of dice. You are cunning. You are the king of the Various clans of spirits, and their ruler. You are bedecked with red garlands and dressed in red robes. You sleep on the mountain-breast, and you are fond of the red colour.', 'sn': 'सदा चाक्षप्रियो धूर्तो गणाध्यक्षो गणाधिपः। रक्तमाल्याम्बरधरो गिरिशो गिरिकप्रियः॥'}

{'en': 'You are the artisan: You are the foremost of artists; and it is you from whom all arts have originated. You are the tearer of the eyes of Bhaga; you are Fierce, and you are the destroyer of the teeth of Pushan.', 'sn': 'शिल्पिकः शिल्पिनां श्रेष्ठः सर्वशिल्पप्रवर्तकः। भगनेत्राङ्कशश्चण्डः पूष्णो दन्तविनाशनः॥'}

{'en': "You are Swaha, you are Svadha, you are Vashat, you are Salutation's form, and you are the words 'Namas-Namas' uttered by all worshippers. Others know not your observances and penances. You are Pranava; you are the sky bespangled with countless of stars.", 'sn': 'स्वाहा स्वधा वषट्कारो नमस्कारो नमो नमः। गूढवतो गुह्यतपास्तारकस्तारकामयः॥'}

{'en': 'You Dhatri, and Vidhatri, and Sandhatri, Vidhatri, and the refuge of all things in the form of the Supreme cause, and you are independent of all Refuge. You are conversant with Brahma, you are Penance, you are Truth, you are the Soul of Brahmacharya, and you are Simplicity.', 'sn': 'धाता विधाता संधाता विधाता धारणोऽधरः। ब्रह्मा तपश्च सत्यं च ब्रह्मचर्यमथार्जवम्॥'}

{'en': 'You are the soul of all creatures, and you are the Creator of all creatures, you are absolute Existence, and you are the Cause whence the Past, the Present, and Cause whence the Past, the Present, and the Future, have originated. You are Earth, you are sky, and you are Heaven. You are Eternal, you are Self-controlled, and you are the great god. are', 'sn': 'भूतात्मा भूतकृद्भूतो भूतभव्यभवोद्भवः। भूर्भुवः स्वरितश्चैव ध्रुवो दान्तो महेश्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'You are initiated, and you are not initiated. You are forgiving; you are unforgiving; and you are the chastiser of the rebellions. You are the lunar month, you are the cycle, you are Destruction, and you are Creation.', 'sn': 'दीक्षितोऽदीक्षितः क्षान्तो दुर्दान्तोऽदान्तनाशनः। चन्द्रावतॊ युगावर्तः संवर्तः सम्प्रवर्तकः॥'}

{'en': 'You are Lust, you are the seminal fluid, you are subtile, you are gross, and you are fond of garlands made of Karnikara flowers. You have a face like that of Nandi, you have a terrible face, you have a beautiful face, you have an ugly face, and you are without a face.', 'sn': 'कामो बिन्दुरणुः स्थूल: कर्णिकारस्रजप्रियः। नन्दीमुखो भीममुखः सुमुखो दुर्मुखोऽमुखः॥'}

{'en': 'You have four faces, you have many faces, and you have a fiery face when engaged in battles. You are Narayana, you are unattached to all things like a bird, you are Ananta, and you are Virat.', 'sn': 'चतुर्मुखो बहुमुखो रणेष्वग्निमुखस्तथा। हिरण्यगर्भः शकुनिर्महोरगपतिविराट॥'}

{'en': 'You are the destroyer of sin, you are called Mahaparshva, you are Chandadhara, and you are the king of the spirits. You lowed like a cow, you were the protector of kine, and you have the king of bulls or your attendant.', 'sn': 'अधर्महा महापावश्चण्डधारो गणाधिपः। गोनो गोप्रतारश्च गोवृषेश्वरवाहनः॥'}

{'en': 'You are the protector of the three worlds, you are Govinda, you are the director of the senses, and you are incapable of being apprehended by the senses. You are the foremost of all creatures, you are fixed, you are immobile, you tremble not, you are of the form of trembling.', 'sn': 'त्रैलोक्यगोप्ता गोविन्दो गोमार्गोऽमार्ग एव च। श्रेष्ठः स्थिरश्च स्थाणुश्च निष्कम्पः कम्प एव च॥'}

{'en': 'You are incapable of being resisted, you are the destroyer of all poisons, you are incapable of being borne, and you are incapable of being excelled, you cannot be made to tremble, you cannot be measured, you cannot be defeated, you are victory.', 'sn': 'दुर्वारणो दुर्विषहो दुःसहो दुरतिक्रमः। दुर्धर्षो दुष्प्रकम्पश्च दुर्विषो दुर्जयो जयः॥'}

{'en': 'You are of quick speed, you are the Moon, you are Yama, you suffer ungrudgingly, cold, heat, hunger, weakness and disease. You are all mental agonies, you are all physical diseases, you are the curer of all diseases, and you are those diseases themselves which you cure.', 'sn': 'शशः शशाङ्कः शमनः शीतोष्णक्षुज्जराधिकृत्। आधयो व्याधयश्चैव व्याधहा व्याधिरेव च॥'}

{'en': 'You are the destroyer of my Sacrifice which had tried to escape in the form of a deer. You are the coming in and going out of all diseases. You have a high crest. You have eyes like lotus-petals, You live in the midst of lotuses.', 'sn': 'मम यज्ञमृगव्याधो व्याधीनामागमो गमः। शिखण्डी पुण्डरीकाक्षः पुण्डरीकवनालयः॥'}

{'en': "You carry the ascetic's staff in your hands. You have the three Vedas for your three eyes. Your chastisements are fierce and severe. You are the destroyer of the egg. You are the drinker of both poison and fire, you are the foremost of all gods, you are drinker of Soma, you are the lord of the Maruts.", 'sn': 'दण्डधारस्त्र्यम्बकश्च उग्रदण्डोऽण्डनाशनः। विषाग्निपाः सुरश्रेष्ठः सोमपास्त्वं मरुत्पतिः॥'}

{'en': 'You are the drinker of Ambrosia. You are the Lord of the universe. You shine in effulgence, and you are the Lord of all the shining ones. You guard against poison and death, and you drink milk and Soma. You are the foremost of the protectors of those that have fallen off from heaven, and you protect Brahman himself.', 'sn': 'अमृतपास्त्वं जगन्नाथ देवदेव गणेश्वरः। विषाग्निपा मृत्युपाश्च क्षीरपाः सोमपास्तथा। मधुश्च्युतानामग्रपास्त्वमेव तुषिताद्यपाः॥'}

{'en': 'Gold is your seminal fluid. You are male, you are female, you are neuter. You are an infant, you are a youth, you are old in years with your teeth gone, you are the foremost of Nagas, you are Shakra, you are the Destroyer of the universe, and you are its Creator.', 'sn': 'हिरण्यरेताः पुरुषस्त्वमेव त्वं स्त्री पुमांस्त्वं च नपुंसकं च। स्त्वं नागेन्द्र शक्रस्त्वं विश्वकृद्धिश्वकर्ता॥'}

{'en': 'You are Prajapati, and you are worshipped by the Patriarchs, you are the supporter of the universe, you have the universe for your form, you are gifted with great energy, and you have faces turned towards all directions. The Sun and the Moon are your two eyes, and the Grandfather is your heart. You are the Ocean. The goodess of learning is your speech, Fire and Wind are your might. You are Day and Night. You are all acts including the opening and the shutting of the eye.', 'sn': 'विश्वकृद् विश्वकृतां वरेण्यस्त्वं विश्ववाहो विश्वरूपस्तेजस्वी विश्वतोमुखः। चन्द्रादित्यौ चक्षुषी ते हृदयं च पितामहः॥ महोदधिः सरस्वती वाग् बलमनलोऽनिल: अहोरात्रं निमेषोन्मेषकर्म॥'}

{'en': 'Neither Brahman, nor Govinda, nor the ancient Rishis, can understand your greatness, O auspicious god.', 'sn': 'न ब्रह्मा न च गोविन्दः पौराणा ऋषयो न ते। माहात्म्यं वेदितुं शक्ता याथातथ्येन ते शिव॥'}

{'en': 'Your subtle forms cannot be seen by us. Rescue me and, O, protect me as the father protects his own begotten son.', 'sn': 'या मूर्तयः सुसूक्ष्मास्ते न मां यान्ति दर्शनम्। त्राहि मां सततं रक्ष पिता पुत्रमिवौरसम्॥'}

{'en': 'O protect me! I deserve your protection! I bow to you, O sinless One! You, O illustrious one, are full of mercy for your devotees. I am always devoted to you.', 'sn': 'रक्ष मां रक्षणीयोऽहं तवानघ नमोऽस्तु ते। भक्तानुकम्पी भगवान् भक्तश्चाहं सदा त्वयि॥'}

{'en': 'Let him be always my protector who stays alone on the other side of the ocean, in a form while it is difficult to apprehend, and overwhelming many thousands of persons.', 'sn': 'यः सहस्राण्यनेकानि पुंसामावृत्य दुर्दशः। तिष्ठत्येकः समुद्रान्ते स मे गोप्तास्तु नित्यशः॥'}

{'en': 'I bow to the Soul of Yoga who is seen in the form of an effulgent Light by persons that have their senses under restraint, who are endued with the quality of Goodness, who have regulated their breaths, and who who have conquered sleep.', 'sn': 'यं विनिद्रा जितश्वासाः सत्त्वस्थाः संयतेन्द्रियाः। ज्योतिः पश्यन्ति युञ्जानास्तस्मै योगात्मने नमः॥'}

{'en': "I bow to him who has matted locks, who carries the ascetic's staff in his hand, who has a body having a long abdomen, who has a water bowl tied to his back, and who is the Soul of Brahman.", 'sn': 'जटिले दण्डिने नित्यं लम्बोदरशरीरिणे। कमण्डलुनिषङ्गाय तस्मै ब्रह्मात्मने नमः॥'}

{'en': 'I salute Him who is the soul of water, in whose hair are the clouds, in the joints of whose body are the rivers, and in whose stomach are the four oceans.', 'sn': 'यस्य केशेषु जीमूता नद्यः सर्वाङ्गसंधिषु। कुक्षौ समुद्राश्चत्वारस्तस्मै तोयात्मने नमः॥'}

{'en': 'I seek the protection of Him who, when the end of the cycle sets in, devours all creatures and lies down on the wide sheet of water that covers the universe.', 'sn': 'सम्भक्ष्य सर्वभूतानि युगान्ते पर्युपस्थिते। यः शेते जलमध्यस्थस्तं प्रपद्येऽम्बुशायिनम्॥'}

{'en': "Let him who entering Rahu's mouth drinks Soma in the night and who becoming Svarbhanu devours the Sun also, protect me.", 'sn': 'प्रविश्य वदनं राहोर्यः सोमं पिबते निशि। ग्रसत्यर्कं च स्वर्भानुभूत्वा मां सोऽभिरक्षतु॥'}

{'en': "The gods who are mere infants and who have all originated from you after Brahman's creation, enjoy their respective shares. Let them enjoy those offerings made with Svaha and Svadha, and let them enjoy pleasure from those presents. I salute them.", 'sn': 'ये चानुपतिता गर्भा यथा भागानुपासते। नमस्तेभ्यः स्वधा स्वाहा प्राप्नुवन्तु मुदन्तु ते॥'}

{'en': 'Let those Beings who are tiny like the thumb and who live in all bodies, always protect and please men.', 'sn': 'येऽङ्गुष्ठमात्राः पुरुषा देहस्था: सर्वदेहिनाम्। रक्षन्तु ते हि मां नित्यं नित्यं चाप्याययन्तु माम्॥'}

{'en': 'I always salute those Beings who living within embodied creatures make the latter cry in grief, and who gladden them without themselves being glad.', 'sn': 'ये न रोदन्ति देहस्था देहिनो रोदयन्ति च। हर्षयन्ति न हृष्यन्ति नमस्तेभ्योऽस्तु नित्यशः॥'}

{'en': 'I always salute those Rudra who live in rives, in oceans in hills and mountains, in mountain-caves in the roots of trees, in cowpens, in dreary forests, in the injunction of roads, in roads, in open squares, in banks, in elephant-sheds, in stables, in car-sheds, in deserted gardens and houses, in the five principal elements, and in the cardinal and subsidiary points. I salute then again and again who live in the space amidst the Sun and Moon, as also in rays of the Sun and the Moon and them who live in the nether regions, and them who have followed the path of Renunciation and other superior practices for the sake of the Supreme.', 'sn': 'ये नदीषु समुद्रेषु पर्वतेषु गुहासु च। वृक्षालेषु गोष्ठेषु कान्तारे गहनेषु च॥ चतुष्पथेषु रथ्यासु चत्वरेषु तटेषु च। हस्त्यश्वरथशालासु जीर्णोद्यानालयेषु च॥ येषु पञ्चसु भूतेषु दिशासु विदिशासु च। चन्द्रार्कयोर्मध्यगता ये च चन्द्रार्करश्मिषु॥ रसातलगता ये च ये च तस्मै परं गताः। नमस्तेभ्यो नमस्तेभ्यो नमस्तेभ्योऽस्तुनित्यशः॥'}

{'en': 'I always salute them who are without number and measure, and who have no form, those Rudras, who are gifted with infinite attributes.', 'sn': 'येषां न विद्यते संख्या प्रमाणं रूपमेव च। असंख्येयगुणा रुद्रा नमस्तेभ्योऽस्तु नित्यशः॥'}

{'en': 'Since you, O Rudra, are the Creator of all creatures, since, O Hara, you are the Master of all creatures, and since you are the indwelling spirit of all creatures, therefore, you were not invited by me.', 'sn': 'सर्वभूतकरो यस्मात् सर्वभूतपतिर्हरः। सर्वभूतान्तरात्मा च तेन त्वं न निमन्त्रितः॥'}

{'en': 'Since you are He who is worshipped in all sacrifices with profuse gifts, and since it is you who are the Creator of all things, therefore, I did not invite you.', 'sn': 'त्वमेव हीज्यसे यस्माद् यज्ञैर्विविधदक्षिणैः। त्वमेव कर्ता सर्वस्य तेन त्वं न निमन्त्रितः॥'}
{'en': 'Or, perhaps, O god, overpowered by your subtle illusion I failed to invite you.', 'sn': 'अथवा मायया देव सूक्ष्मया तव मोहितः। एतस्मात् कारणाद् वापि तेन त्वं न निमिन्त्रितः॥'}

{'en': 'Be propitiated with me, blessed be yourself, O Bhava, with me possessed by the quality of darkness. My Mind, my Understanding, and my intellect all live in you, O god!-', 'sn': 'प्रसीद मम भद्रं ते भव भावगतस्य मे। त्वयि मे हृदयं देव त्वयि बुद्धिर्मनस्त्वयि॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing these adorations, that Lord of all creatures, viz., Mahadeva, stopped. Indeed, highly pleased, the illustrious god addressed Daksha, saying,-0 Daksha of excellent vows, I have been pleased with these adorations of yours. You need not swell the chorus of my adoration any longer! You shall have my companionship.', 'sn': 'स्तुत्वैवं स महादेवं विरराम प्रजापतिः। भगवानपि सुप्रीतः पुनर्दक्षमभाषत॥ परितुष्टोऽस्मि ते दक्ष स्तवनानेन सुव्रत। बहुनात्र किमुक्तेन मत्समीपे भविष्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'Through my grace, O progenitor of creatures, you will acquire the fruit of a thousand horse-sacrifices, and a hundred Vajapeyas.', 'sn': 'अश्वमेधसहस्रस्य वाजपेयशतस्य च। प्रजापते मत्प्रसादात् फलभागी भविष्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'Once more, Mahadeva, that thorough adept in speech, addressed Daksha and said to him these words fraught with great consolation:-Be you the foremost of all creatures in the world.', 'sn': 'अथैनमब्रवीद् वाक्यं लोकस्याधिपतिर्भवः। आश्वासनकरं वाक्यं वाक्यविद्वाक्य सम्मतम्॥'}

{'en': 'You should not, O Daksha, entertain any feelings of grief for these injuries put on your Sacrifice. It has been seen that in former cycles too I had to destroy your Sacrifice.', 'sn': 'दक्ष दक्ष न कर्तव्यो मन्युर्विजमिमं प्रति। अहं यज्ञहरस्तुभ्यं दृष्टमेतत् पुरातनम्॥'}

{'en': 'O you of excellent vows, I shall grant you again some more boons. Take them from me. Removing this cheerlessness that overspreads your face, hear me with rapt attention.', 'sn': 'भूयश्च ते वरं दद्मि तं त्वं गृह्णीष्व सुव्रत। प्रसन्नवदनो भूत्वा तदिहैकमनाः शृणु॥'}

{'en': 'With the help of reasonable arguments, the gods and the Danavas have formed from the Vedas consisting of six branches and from the philosophers of Sankhya and Yoga a creed by virtue of which they have practised the austerest penances for many long years.', 'sn': 'वेदात् षडङ्गादुद्धृत्य सांख्ययोगाच्च युक्तितः। तपः सुतप्तं विपुलं दुश्चरं देवदानवैः॥'}

{'en': 'The religion, however, which I have formed is peerless, and productive of benefits on every side. Men in all modes of life can practise it. It brings on Liberation. It may be acquired in many years or through merit by persons who have controlled their senses. It is shrouded in mystery. Those who have no wisdom consider it as censurable.', 'sn': 'अपूर्वं सर्वतोभद्रं सर्वतोमुखमव्ययम्। अब्दैर्दशाहसंयुक्तं गूढमप्राज्ञनिन्दितम्॥'}

{'en': 'It is opposed to the duties sanctioned for the four orders of men and the four modes of life. and agrees with those duties in only a few particulars. Those who are well-skilled in the science of conclusion can understand its fitness; and they who have gone above all the modes of life can adopt it.', 'sn': 'वर्णाश्रमकृतैर्धविपरीतं क्वचित्समम्। गतान्तरध्यवसितमत्याश्रममिदं व्रतम्॥'}

{'en': 'In days of yore, O Daksha, this auspicious religion called Pashupata had been found out by me. The proper observance of that religion produces great benefits.', 'sn': 'मया पाशुपतं दक्ष शुभमुत्पादितं पुरा। तस्य चीर्णस्य तत् सम्यक् फलं भवति पुष्कलम्।'}

{'en': 'May you get those, O highly blessed one! Renounce this fever of your heart!-Having said these words, Mahadeva, with his consort (Uma) and with all his attendants disappeared from the view of Daksha of great prowess.', 'sn': 'तच्चास्तु ते महाभाग त्यज्यतां मानसो ज्वरः॥ एवमुक्त्वा महादेवः सपत्नीकः सहानुगः।'}

{'en': 'He who would recite this hymn that was first sung by Daksha or who would listen to it when sung by another, would never suffer from the smallest evil and would gain a long life.', 'sn': 'अदर्शनमनुप्राप्तो दक्षस्यामितविक्रमः॥ दक्षप्रोक्तं स्तवमिमं कीर्तयेद यः शृणोति वा।'}

{'en': 'Indeed, as Shiva is the foremost of all the gods, so is this hymn, consonant with the Shrutis, is the foremost of all hymns.', 'sn': 'नाशुभं प्राप्नुयात् किंचिद् दीर्घमायुरवाप्नुयात्॥ यथा सर्वेषु देवेषु वरिष्ठो भगवाञ्छिवः।'}

{'en': 'Persons seeking fame, kingdom, happiness, pleasure, profit and riches, and learning, should listen with devout feelings to the recital of this hymn.', 'sn': 'तथा स्तवो वरिष्ठोऽयं स्तवानां ब्रह्मसम्मितः॥ यशोराज्यसुखैश्चर्यकामार्थधनकाङ्गिभिः। श्रोतव्यो भक्तिमास्थाय विद्याकामैश्च यत्नतः॥'}

{'en': 'One suffering from disease, one distressed by pain, one plunged into melancholy, one assailed by thieves or by fear and one under the displeasure of the king about his charge, becomes freed from fear by reciting this hymn.', 'sn': 'व्याधितो दुःखितो दीनश्चोरग्रस्तो भयार्दितः। राजकार्याभियुक्तो वा मुच्यते महतो भयात्॥'}

{'en': 'By listening or reciting this hymn, one, even in this earthly body of his, acquires equality with the spirits who are the attendants of Mahadeva. One gains energy and fame, and becomes purged of all sin.', 'sn': 'अनेनैव तु देहेन गणानां समतां व्रजेत्। तेजसा यशसा चैव युक्तो भवति निर्मलः॥'}

{'en': 'Neither Rakshasas, nor Pishachas, nor ghosts, nor Vinayakas make disturbances in the house where this hymn is recited.', 'sn': 'न राक्षसाः पिशाचा वा न भूता न विनायकाः। विनं कुर्युगुहे तस्य यत्रायं पठ्यते स्तवः॥'}

{'en': 'That woman,. again, who listens to this hymn with pious faith, observing the practices of Brahmacharya, gains worship as a goddess in the family of her father and that of her husband.', 'sn': 'शृणुयाच्चैव या नारी तद्भक्ता ब्रह्मचारिणी। पितृपक्षे भर्तृपक्षे पूज्या भवति देववत्॥'}

{'en': 'All the acts of that person become always successful who listens or recites with rapt attention to the whole of this hymn.', 'sn': 'शृणुयाद् यः स्तवं कृत्स्नं कीर्तयेद् वा समाहितः। तस्य सर्वाणि कर्माणि सिद्धिं गच्छन्त्य भीक्ष्णशः।।१९९'}

{'en': 'On account of the recitation of this wishes one cherishes in his mind and all the wishes he speaks out become successful.', 'sn': 'मनसा चिन्तितं यच्च यच्च वाचानुकीर्तितम्। सर्वं सम्पद्यते तस्य स्तवस्यास्यानुकीर्तनात्॥'}

{'en': 'That man gains all objects of enjoyment and pleasure and all things that are desired by him, who, practising self-control, makes, according to proper rites, offerings to Mahadeva, Guha, Uma, and Nandi, and thereafter utters forthwith their names, in proper order and with devotion.', 'sn': 'देवस्य च गुहस्यापि देव्या नन्दीश्वरस्य च। बलिं सुविहितं कृत्वा दमेन नियमेन च॥ ततस्तु युक्तो गृह्णयानामान्याशु यथाक्रमम्। ईप्सितालँभते सोऽर्थान् भोगान् कामांश्च मानवः।।२०२'}

{'en': 'Such a man, after death, ascends to heaven, and is never born among the intermediate animals or birds. This was said by the powerful Vyasa the son of Parashara."', 'sn': 'मृतश्च स्वर्गमाप्नोति तिर्यक्षु च न जायते। इत्याह भगवान् व्यासः पराशरसुतः प्रभुः॥'}

{'en': 'Shaunaka said: O son of Suta, what was the fault of Indra and what was his carelessness? How was Garuda born owing to the penances of the Valakhilyas?', 'sn': 'शौनक उवाच कोऽपराधो महेन्द्रस्य कः प्रमादश्च सूतज। तपसा वालखिल्यानां संभूतो गरुडः कथम्॥'}

{'en': 'Why had Kashyapa, a Brahmana, the king of the birds for his son? Why was he invincible of all creatures and indestructible of all?', 'sn': 'कश्यपस्य द्विजातेश्च कथं वै पक्षिराट् सुतः। अधृष्यः सर्वभूतानामवध्यश्चाभवत्कथम्॥'}

{'en': 'Why was that bird capable of going every where and mastering any misuse of strength at will? I am willing to hear all this, if they are narrated in the Puranas.', 'sn': 'कथं च कामचारी स कामवीर्यश्च खेचरः। एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं पुराणे यदि पठ्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Sauti said: What you ask me is narrated in the Puranas. O Brahmana, listen to them. I shall briefly narrated them all.', 'sn': 'सौतिरुवाच विषयोऽयं पुराणस्य यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि। शृणु मे वदतः सर्वमेतत्संक्षेपतो द्विजः॥'}

{'en': 'When Prajapati Kashyapa from the desire of begetting offspring was engaged in a sacrifice, the Rishis, the Devas and the Gandharvas all gave him help.', 'sn': 'यजतः पुत्रकामस्य कश्यपस्य प्रजापतेः। साहाय्यमृषयो देवा गन्धर्वाश्च ददुः किल॥'}

{'en': 'Indra with Valakhilya Rishis and other celestial were appointed by Kashyapa to bring fuel for the sacrifice.', 'sn': 'तत्रेध्मानयने शक्रो नियुक्तः कश्यपेन ह। मुनयो बालखिल्याश्च ये चान्ये देवतागणाः॥'}

{'en': 'And Lord Indra, taking up according to his great strength a weight which was mountainlike, brought it without any fatigue.', 'sn': 'शक्रस्तु वीर्यसदृशमिध्मभारं गिरिप्रभम्। समुद्यम्यानयामास नातिकृच्छादिव प्रभुः॥'}

{'en': 'He saw on the way some Rishis, as small in size as the thumb, carrying together one single stalk of Palasa leaf.', 'sn': 'अथापश्यदृषीन्ह्रस्वानङ्गुष्ठोदरवर्मणः। पलाशवर्तिकामेकां वहतः संहतान्पथि॥'}

{'en': 'They were exceedingly lean for want of food and they were much distressed when they fell into an indentation in the road caused by the hoop of a cow.', 'sn': 'प्रलीनान्स्वेष्विवाङ्गेषु निराहारांस्तपोधनान्। क्लिश्यमानान्मन्दबलान्गोष्पदे संप्लुतोदके॥'}

{'en': 'Purandara (Indra), madly proud of his strength, saw them with surprise and laughing at them in derision, passed them, crossing over their heads and thus grossly insulting them.', 'sn': 'तान्सर्वान्विस्मयाविष्टो वीर्योन्मत्तः पुरन्दरः। अवहस्याभ्यगाच्छीघ्रं लम्बयित्वावमन्य च॥'}

{'en': 'On this the Rishis became exceedingly angry and were filled with sorrow. They began a great act which was a terror to Indra.', 'sn': 'तेऽथ रोषसमाविष्टाः सुभृशं जातमन्यवः। आरेभिरे महत्कर्म तदा शक्रभयंकरम्॥'}

{'en': "Hear, Sir, desiring what these excellent Rishi's poured ghee in the sacrificial fire loudly reciting Mantras, saying,", 'sn': 'जुहुवुस्ते सुतपसो विधिवज्जातवेदसम्। मन्त्रैरुच्चावचैर्विप्रा येन कामेन तच्छृणु॥'}

{'en': '“There will be another Indra of all the celestials, capable of going everywhere at will mustering any measure of strength at will and imparting fear to the present Indra.', 'sn': 'कामवीर्यः कामगमो देवराजभयप्रदः। इन्द्रोऽन्यः सर्वदेवानां भवेदिति यतव्रताः॥'}

{'en': 'By the fruit of our penances, let there be born a hero, who is hundred times stronger and valorous than Indra, fleet as the mind and frightful to present Indra."', 'sn': 'इन्द्राच्छतगुणः शौर्ये वीर्ये चैव मनोजवः। तपसो नः फलेनाद्य दारुणः संभवत्विति॥'}

{'en': 'The Lord of the celestials Shatakratu, becoming very much alarmed, went to ask the protection of the great ascetic, the selfcontrolled Rishi Kashyapa.', 'sn': 'तबुध्वा भृशसंतप्तो देवराज: शतक्रतुः। जगाम शरणं तत्र कश्यपं संशितव्रतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Prajapati Kashyapa, having heard every thing from Indra, went to the Valakhilyas and asked whether their act had been successful.', 'sn': 'तच्छ्रुत्वा देवराजस्य कश्यपोऽथ प्रजापतिः। वालखिल्यानुपागम्य कर्मसिद्धिमपृच्छत॥'}

{'en': 'Thus addressed, those truthful Rishis said, “Yes, it is done.” Then Prajapati Kashyapa pacified them and said,', 'sn': 'एवमस्त्विति तं चापि प्रत्यूचुः सत्यवादिनः। तान्कश्यप उवाचेदं सान्त्वपूर्वं प्रजापतिः॥'}

{'en': '“The present Indra has been appointed the lord of the three worlds by Brahma. O Rishis you are also trying to create another Indra.', 'sn': 'अयमिन्द्रस्त्रिभुवने नियोगाद्ब्रह्मणः कृतः। इन्द्रार्थे च भवन्तोऽपि यत्नवन्तस्तपोधनाः॥'}

{'en': 'O excellent men, you should not make the words of Brahma untrue and I too do not wish to make your desire futile.', 'sn': 'न मिथ्या ब्रह्मणो वाक्यं कर्तुमर्हथ सत्तमाः। भवतां हि न मिथ्याऽयं संकल्पो वै चिकीर्षितः॥'}

{'en': 'Let there be an Indra of the winged creatures, endued with great strength. Be gracious to Indra who is suppliant to you."', 'sn': 'भवत्वेष पतत्त्रीणामिंद्रोऽतिबलसत्त्ववान्। प्रसादः क्रियतामस्य देवराजस्य याचतः॥'}

{'en': 'Having been thus addressed by Kashyapa, the Valakhilya Rishis saluted the great Prajapati and spoke thus,', 'sn': 'एवमुक्ताः कश्यपेन वालखिल्यास्तपोधनाः। प्रत्यूचुरभिसंपूज्य मुनिश्रेष्ठं प्रजापतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Valakhilyas said : O Prajapati, our this action (penance) is for creating an Indra. It is also meant for a son being born to you.', 'sn': 'वालखिल्या ऊचुः इन्द्रार्थोऽयं समारम्भः सर्वेषां नः प्रजापते। अपत्यार्थं समारम्भो भवतश्चायमीप्सितः॥'}

{'en': 'Let this successful act be accepted by you; and in this matter, do whatsoever you think good and proper.', 'sn': 'तदिदं सफलं कर्म त्वयैव प्रतिगृह्यताम्। तथा चैवं विधत्स्वात्र यथा श्रेयोऽनुपश्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'Sauti said: At this time, the good and illustrious daughter of Daksha, named Vinata, being desirous of having an offspring an having purified herself by bathing after her season of impurity, came to her husband and Kashyapa spoke to her thus.', 'sn': 'सौतिरुवाच एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु देवी दाक्षायणी शुभा। विनता नाम कल्याणी पुत्रकामा यशस्विनी॥ तपस्तप्त्वा व्रतपरा स्नाता पुंसवने शुचिः। उपचक्राम भर्तारं तामुवाचाथ कश्यपः॥'}

{'en': '“O Lady, the sacrifice, commenced by me, has borne fruit. What you have desired to get, you will get. Two heroic sons will be born in you who will be the lords of the three worlds.', 'sn': 'आरम्भः सफलो देवि भविता यस्त्वयेप्सितः। जनयिष्यसि पुत्रौ द्वौ वीरौ त्रिभुवनेश्वरौ॥'}

{'en': 'Owing to the penances of the Valakhilyas and by virtue of the desire with which I had began my sacrifice, those sons will be of exceeding good fortune and they will be worshipped by the three worlds.', 'sn': 'तपसा वालखिल्यानां मम संकल्पजौ तथा। भविष्यतो महाभागौ पुत्रौ त्रैलोक्यपूजितौ॥'}
{'en': 'The illustrious Kashyapa again spoke to her, "Carefully bear these auspicious seeds.', 'sn': 'उवाच चैनां भगवान्कश्यपः पुनरेव ह। धार्यतामप्रमादेन गर्भोऽयं सुमहोदयः॥'}

{'en': 'These two will be the lords of all the winged creatures. They will be birds, capable of assuming any form at will and they will be great heroes, respected by all the worlds."', 'sn': 'एतौ सर्वपतत्त्रीणमिन्द्रत्वं कारयिष्यतः। लोकसंभावितौ वीरौ कामरूपौ विहंगमौ॥'}

{'en': 'The Prajapati then addressed Indra thus, "You will have two brothers of great power and strength, who will be your helps.', 'sn': 'शतक्रतुमथोवाच प्रीयमाणः प्रजापतिः। त्वत्सहायौ महावीर्यो भ्रातरौ ते भविष्यतः॥'}

{'en': 'O Purandara, by them will no injury be done to you. Let your sorrow cease. O Indra, you will remain as the only one Indra in the world.', 'sn': 'नैताभ्यां भविता दोषः सकाशात्ते पुरंदर। व्येतु ते शक्र संतापस्त्वमेवेन्द्रो भविष्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'But let not the utterers of Brahma, Brahmanas be ever slighted by you. Let not those, whose words are like the thunderbolt, be again insulted by you."', 'sn': 'न चाप्येवं त्वया भूयः क्षेप्तव्या ब्रह्मवादिनः। न चावमान्या दोत्ते वाग्वज्रा भृशकोपनाः॥'}

{'en': 'Having been thus addressed Indra, his fear being dispelled, went to heaven; and Vinata was much pleased, because her desire was accomplished.', 'sn': 'एवमुक्तो जगामेन्द्रो निर्विशङ्कस्त्रिविष्टपम्। विनता चापि सिद्धार्था बभूव मुदिता तथा॥'}

{'en': 'She gave birth to two sons, Aruna and Garuda and the undeveloped-bodied Aruna became the fore-runner (charioteer) of the sun.', 'sn': 'जनयामास पुत्रौ द्वावरुणं गरुडं तथा। विकलाङ्गोरुणस्तत्र भास्करस्य पुरस्सरः॥'}
{'en': 'Garuda became the king of the birds. O descendent of Bhrigu, listen to his great deeds.', 'sn': 'पतत्त्रीणां च गरुडमिन्द्रत्वेनाभ्यषिञ्चत। तस्यैतत्कर्म सुमहच्छ्रयतां भृगुनन्दन॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana said Regarding it, О blessed lady, is cited the ancient story of what kind the institution is of the five sacrificing priests.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। सुभगे पञ्चहोतृणां विधानमिह यादृशम्॥'}

{'en': 'The learned know this to be a great principle that Prana and Apana and Udana and Şamana and Vyana are the five sacrificing priests.', 'sn': 'प्राणापानावुदानश्च समानो व्यान एव च। पञ्चहोतूंस्तथैतान् वै परं भावं विदुर्बुधाः॥'}

{'en': "The Brahmana's wife said I naturally believed that there are seven sacrificing priests. Let the great principle be declared to me as to how, indeed, the number is five of the sacrificing priests.", 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण्युवाच स्वभावात् सप्तहोतार इति मे पूर्विका मतिः। यथा वै पञ्चहोतारः परो भावस्तदुच्यताम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana said The wind nursed y Prana afterwards takes birth in Apana. The wind nursed in Apana then becomes developed into Vyana.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण उवाच प्राणेन सम्भृतो वायुरपानो जायते ततः। अपाने सम्भृते वायुस्ततो व्यानः प्रवर्तते॥'}

{'en': 'Nursed by Vyana, the wind is then developed into Udana. Nursed in Udana, the wind is then generated as Samana.', 'sn': 'व्यानेन सम्भृतो वायुस्ततोदानः प्रवर्तते। उदाने सम्भृतो वायुः समानो नाम जायते॥'}

{'en': 'Those good beings formerly asked the first born Grandfather, saying, Do you say who amongst us is the foremost. He alone will be our chief.', 'sn': 'तेऽपृच्छन्त पुरा सन्तः पूर्वजातं पितामहम्। यो नः श्रेष्ठस्तमाचक्ष्व स नः श्रेष्ठो भविष्यतिः॥'}

{'en': 'Brahman said He upon whose extinction all the vital airs become extinct in the bodies of living creatures, he upon whose moving they move, is, indeed, the foremost. Do you go where you like.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मोवाच यस्मिन् प्रलीने प्रलयं व्रजन्ति सर्वे प्राणाः प्राणभृतां शरीरे। यस्मिन् प्रचीर्णे च पुनश्चरन्ति स वै श्रेष्ठो गच्छत यत्र कामः॥'}

{'en': 'Prana said Upon my extinction all the vital airs become extinct in the bodies of living creatures. Upon my moving they once more move. I am the foremost. Sce, I go into extinction.', 'sn': 'प्राण उवाच मयि प्रलीने प्रलयं व्रजन्ति सर्वे प्राणाः प्राणभृतां शरीरे। मयि प्रचीर्णे च पुनश्चरन्ति श्रेष्ठो ह्यहं पश्यत मां प्रलीनम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahniana said Prana then became extinct and once more moved about. Then Saman and Udana also, O blessed one, said these words, You do not live here, pervading all this, as we do. You are not the foremost amongst us, O Prana! (Only) Apana is under your dominion! Prana then moved about, and to him Apana spoke.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण उवाच प्राणः प्रालीयत तत: पुनश्च प्रचचार ह। समानश्चाप्युदानश्च वचोऽव्रतां पुनः शुभे॥ न त्वं सर्वमिदं व्याप्य तिष्ठसीह यथा वयम्। न त्वं श्रेष्ठो हि नः प्राण अपानो हि वशे तव। प्रचचार पुनः प्राणस्तमपानोऽभ्यभाषत॥'}

{'en': 'When I become extinct, all the vital airs become extinct in the bodies of living creatures. When I move about, they again move about. I am, therefore, the foremost, See, I go into extinction.', 'sn': 'अपान उवाच पयि प्रलीने प्रलयं व्रजन्ति सर्वे प्राणाः प्राणभृतां शरीरे। मयि प्रचीर्णे च पुनश्चरन्ति श्रेष्ठो ह्यहं पश्यत मां प्रलीनम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana said To Apana who said so, both Vyana and Udana said, O Apana, you are not the foremost (Only) Prana is under your dominion.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण उवाच व्यानश्च तमुदानश्च भाषमाणमथोचतुः। अपान न त्वं श्रेष्ठोऽसि प्राणो हि वशगस्तव॥'}

{'en': 'Then Apana began to move about, Vyana once more addressed him, saying I am the foremost of all. Listen, for what reason.', 'sn': 'अपानः प्रचचाराथ व्यानस्तं पुनरब्रवीत्। श्रेष्ठोऽहमस्मि सर्वेषां श्रूयतां येन हेतुना॥'}

{'en': 'When I become extinct, all the vital airs become extinct in the bodies of living creatures. When I move about, they once more move about. I am (therefore) the foremost. Sce, I go into extinction.', 'sn': 'मयि प्रलीने प्रलयं व्रजन्ति सर्वे प्राणाः प्राणभृतां शरीरे। मयि प्रचीर्णे च पुनश्चरन्ति श्रेष्ठो ह्यहं पश्यत मां प्रलीनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then Vyana became extinct and once more began to move about. At this, Prana and Apana and Udana and Samana Addressed him, saying. You are not the foremost among us, O Vyana! (Only) Samana is under your dominion. Vyana then began to move about and Saman said to him, I am the foremost of you all! Listen, for what reason. When I become extinct, all the vital airs become extinct in the bodies of living creatures. When I begin to move about, they once more move about. Hence, I am the forcmost. See, I become extinct.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण उवाच प्रालीयत ततो व्यान: पुनश्च प्रचचार ह। प्राणापानावुदानश्च समानश्च तमब्रुवन्। न त्वं श्रेष्ठोऽसि नो व्यान समानस्तु वशे तव॥ प्रचचार पुनर्व्यानः समानः पुनरब्रवीत्। श्रेष्ठोऽहमस्मि सर्वेषां श्रूयतां येन हेतुना॥ मयि प्रलीने प्रलयं व्रजन्ति सर्वे प्राणाः प्राणभृतां शरीरे। मयि प्रचीर्णे च पुनश्चरन्ति श्रेष्ठो ह्यहं पश्यत मां प्रलीनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then Samana began to inovc about. To him Udana said, I am the foremost of all the vital airs. Listen, for what reason.', 'sn': 'समानः प्रचचाराथ उदानस्तमुवाच ह। श्रेष्ठाऽहमस्मि सर्वेषां श्रूयतां येन हेतुना॥'}

{'en': 'When I become extinct, all the vital airs become extinct in the bodies of living creatures. When I move about they once more move about. Hence, I am the foremost. Behold I become extinct.', 'sn': 'मयि प्रलीने प्रलयं व्रजन्ति सर्वे प्राणा: प्राणभृतां शरीरे। मयि प्रचीर्णे च पुनश्चरन्ति श्रेष्ठो ह्यहं पश्यत मां प्रलीनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then Udana, after having become extinct, began to once more move about. Prana and Apana and Samana and Vyana said to him, O Udana, you are not the foremost one among us. (Only) Vyana is under your dominion.', 'sn': 'ततः प्रालीयतोदान: पुनश्च प्रचचार ह। प्राणापानौ समानश्च व्यानश्चैव तमब्रुवन्।। उदान न त्वं श्रेष्ठोऽसि व्यान एव वशे तव।॥'}

{'en': 'The Brahmana said To them assembled together, the Lord of creatures, Brahman, said, You are all foremost and not foremost. You are all gified with the attributes of one another.', 'sn': 'व्राह्मण उवाच ततस्तानब्रवीद् ब्रह्मा समवेतान् प्रजापतिः। सर्वे श्रेष्ठा न वा श्रेष्ठाः सर्वे चान्योन्यधर्मिणः॥'}

{'en': 'All are foremost in their own spheres, and all possess the attributes of one another! The Lord of all creatures, thus said to them, that were assembled together.', 'sn': 'सर्वे स्वविषये श्रेष्ठाः सर्वे चान्योन्यधर्मिणः। इति तानब्रवीत् सर्वान् समवेतान् प्रजापति॥'}

{'en': 'There is one that is unmoving, and one that is moving. On account of special attributes, there are five vital airs. My own self is one. That one accumulates into many forms.', 'sn': 'एकः स्थिरश्चास्थिरश्च विशेषात् पञ्च वायवः। एक एव ममैवात्मा बहुधाप्युपचीयते॥'}

{'en': 'Becoming friendly to one another, and pleasing one another, depart in depart in peace. Blessings to you, do you up hold one another.', 'sn': 'परस्परस्य सुहृदो भावयन्तः परस्परम्। स्वस्ति ब्रजत भद्रं वो धारयध्वं परस्परम्॥'}

{'en': "Vaishampayana said : When the two Kuru princes (Bhima and Arjuna) went towards the potter's house, the Panchala prince Dhrishtaduymna followed them.", 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच धृष्टद्युमस्तु पाञ्चाल्यः पृष्ठतः कुरुनन्दनौ। अन्वगच्छत् तदा यान्तौ भार्गवस्य निवेशने॥'}

{'en': 'Having sent away all his attendants, he concealed himself unknown to the Pandavas in a place somewhere near the house of the potter.', 'sn': 'सोऽज्ञायमानः पुरुषानवधाय समन्ततः। स्वयमारान्निलीनोऽभूद् भार्गवस्य निवेशने॥'}

{'en': 'That grinder of foes, Bhima and Jishnu (Arjuna) and the high-souled twins returned in the evening from their begging tour; and they cheerfully offered everything to Yudhishthira.', 'sn': 'सायं च भीमस्तु रिपुप्रमाथी जिष्णुर्यमौ चापि महानुभावौ। भैक्षं चरित्वा तु युधिष्ठिराय निवेदयाञ्चकुरदीनसत्त्वाः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon the kind Kunti thus spoke to the daughter of the Panchala king, "O amiable girl, first take a portion of this (food) and offer it to the gods and give it away to the Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'ततस्तु कुन्ती दुपदात्मजां तामुवाच काले वचनं वदान्या। त्वमग्रमादाय कुरुष्व भद्रे बलिं च विप्राय च देहि भिक्षाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Feed (also) those that are hungry and give it to those that are our guests. Divide the rest into two portions. O amiable girl, give the half to Bhima, for this strong youth with fair complexion, a man like a king of elephants, this hero always eats much. Divide the other half into six equal parts, four for these youths (Yudhishthira, Arjuna, Nakula and Sahadeva) one for myself and the other for you.', 'sn': 'ये चान्नमिच्छन्ति ददस्व तेभ्यः परिश्रिता ये परितो मनुष्याः। मधु चतुर्धा मम चात्मनश्च॥ अर्धं तु भीमाय च देहि भद्रे य एष नागर्षभतुल्यरूपः। गौरो युवा संहननोपपन्न एषो हि वीरो बहुभुक् सदैव॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Having these excellent words of her mother-in-law, the chaste princess, then cheerfully did all that she was directed to do. And they then all partook of the food.', 'sn': 'सा हृष्टरूपेव तु राजपुत्री। तस्या वचः साधु विशङ्कमाना। यथावदुक्तं प्रचकार साध्वी ते चापि सर्वे बुभुजस्तदन्नम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then the son of Madri, the ascetic Sahadeva, spread on the ground a bed of Kusha grass; thereupon those heroes all spread on it their deer-skins and then they laid themselves down to sleep.', 'sn': 'कुशैस्तु भूमौ शयनं चकार माद्रीपुत्रः सहदेवस्तरस्वी। यथा स्वकीयान्यजिनानि सर्वे संस्तीर्य वीराः सुषुपुर्धरण्याम्॥'}

{'en': 'The foremost of Kuru princes laid themselves down with their heads towards the south. Kunti laid herself down along the line of their heads and Krishna (Draupadi) along that of their feet.', 'sn': 'अगस्त्यशास्तामभितो दिशं तु शिरांसि तेषां कुरुसत्तमानाम्। कुन्ती पुरस्तात् तु बभूव तेषां पादान्तरे चाथ बभूव कृष्णा॥'}

{'en': 'Through she lay on Kusha grass and in the ground, like the nether pillow of the sons of Pandu, yet she felt no grief in her heart or any disrespect for those best of the Kurus.', 'sn': 'अशेत भूमौ सह पाण्डुपुत्रैः पादोपधानीव कृता कुशेषु। न तत्र दुःखं मनसापि तस्या न चावमेने कुरुपुङ्गवांस्तान्॥'}

{'en': 'son Then those heroes began to talk to one another on celestials weapons, cars, elephants, swords, arrows and battle axes. Their conversations were varied and were exceedingly interesting.', 'sn': 'ते तत्र शूराः कथयान्बभूवुः कथा विचित्राः पृतनाधिकाराः। अस्त्राणि दिव्यानि रथांश्च नागान् खङ्गान् गदाश्चापि परश्वधांश्च॥'}

{'en': 'The of the Panchala king (Dhrishtaduymna) heard all that they said in their conversations; and all the men saw Krishna (Draupadi) in that state.', 'sn': 'तेषां कथास्ताः परिकीर्त्यमानाः पाञ्चालराजस्य सुतस्तदानीम्। शुश्राव कृष्णां च तदा विषण्णां ते चापि सर्वे ददृशुर्मनुष्याः॥'}

{'en': '(As soon as morning came), the prince Dhrishtaduymna set out in great haste towards the palace in order to report to the king Drupada in detail what he had heard in the night as talked by those heroes among one another.', 'sn': 'धृष्टद्युम्नो राजपुत्रस्तु सर्वं वृत्तं तेषां कथितं चैव रात्रौ। सर्वं राज्ञे दुपदायाखिलेन निवेदयिष्यंस्त्वरितो जगाम॥'}

{'en': 'The Panchala king was sad, because he did not know that those that had taken away his daughter were the Pandavas. The illustrious (king) asked Dhrishtaduymna in his return, "Where has Krishna gone? By whom has she been taken away?', 'sn': 'स्तान् पाण्डवानप्रतिविन्दमानः। धृष्टद्युम्नं पर्यपृच्छन्महात्मा क्व सा गता केन नीता च कृष्णा॥'}

{'en': 'Has any Shudra, or any man of low birth, or any tribute paying Vaishya placed his dirty feet on my head (by taking her away)? Has the garland of flowers been thrown away on a burning place for dead bodies?', 'sn': 'कचिन्न शूद्रेण न हीनजेन वैश्येन वा करदेनोपपन्ना। कच्चित् पदं मूर्ध्नि न परूदिग्धं कच्चिन्न माला पतिता श्मशाने॥'}

{'en': 'O son, has any Kshatriya of high birth, or any one of the superior order (Brahmana) obtained my daughter? Has a man of low birth placed his left foot on my head by winning Krishna?', 'sn': 'वदस्व तत्त्वेन कच्चित् सवर्णप्रवरो मनुष्य उद्रिक्तवर्णोऽप्युत एव कच्चित्। कच्चिन्न वामो मम मूर्ध्नि पादः कृष्णाभिमर्शेन कृतोऽद्य पुत्र॥'}

{'en': 'I shall not be sorry, but shall be very much pleased if my daughter has been united with that best of men, Partha. O illustrious one, tell me truly who has today taken away my daughter?', 'sn': 'कश्चिन्न तप्स्ये परमप्रतीतः। संयुज्य पार्थेन नरर्षभेण महानुभाव कोऽसौ विजेता दुहितुर्ममाद्य॥'}

{'en': 'Are the sons of that foremost of the Kurus, Vichitravirya\'s son (Pandu), alive? Was he Partha who took up the bow and shot the mark?"', 'sn': 'विचित्रवीर्यस्य सुतस्य कच्चित्। कुरुप्रवीरस्य ध्रियन्ति पुत्राः। कच्चित् तु पार्थेन यवीयसाद्य धनुर्गृहीतं निहतं च लक्ष्यम्॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said Man, it is said, is gifted with a period of life extending for a hundred years, and with great energy and power. Why then, O grandfather, do human beings die even in their youth?', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच शतायुरुक्तः पुरुषः शतवीर्यश्च जायते। कस्मान्नियन्ते पुरुषा बाला अपि पितामह॥'}

{'en': 'By what does a man become longlived, and by what is his life shortened? Through what does a man acquire the fame that depends upon great deeds? Through what does one acquire wealth and prosperity?', 'sn': 'आयुष्मान् केन भवति अल्पायुर्वाऽपि मानवः। केन वा लभते कीर्ति केन वा लभते श्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'Is it by penances, or celibacy or silent recitation of sacred Mantras, or drugs? Is it by his deeds, or mind, or speech? Do you explain to me this, O grandfather.', 'sn': 'तपसा ब्रह्मचर्येण जपहोमैस्तथौषधैः। कर्मणा मनसा वाचा तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said I shall tell you what you ask me. In fact, I shall tell you what the reason is for which one becomes short lived, and what the reason is for which one becomes longlived.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अत्र तेऽहं प्रवक्ष्यामि यन्मां त्वमनुपृच्छसि। अल्पायुर्येन भवति दीर्घायुर्वाऽपि मानवः॥'}

{'en': 'I shall also explain to you the reason for which one succeeds in winning the fame that depends on great deeds, and the reason for which one succeeds in acquiring riches and prosperity. Indeed, I shall enlighten you about the manner in which one must live in order to be possessed of what is good for him. one own', 'sn': 'येन वा लभते कीर्तिं येन वा लभते श्रियम्। यथा वर्तयन् पुरुषः श्रेयसा सम्प्रयुज्यते॥'}

{'en': 'It is by conduct that one acquires a long life, and it is by conduct that one acquires riches and prosperity. Indeed, it is by conduct that one acquires the fame that depends upon great deeds both in this world and in the next.', 'sn': 'आचाराल्लभते ह्यायुराचराल्लभते श्रियम्। आचारात् कीर्तिमाप्नोति पुरुषः प्रेत्य चेह च॥'}

{'en': 'The man whose conduct is improper or wicked never acquires a long life. All creatures fear such a man and are oppressed by him.', 'sn': 'दुराचारो हि पुरुषो नेहायुर्विन्दते महत्। त्रसन्ति यस्माद् भूतानि तथा परिभवन्ति च॥'}

{'en': 'If, therefore, wishes his advancement and prosperity, one should, in this world, follow the path of rightcousness and conduct himself properly. Good conduct succeeds in removing the inauspiciousness and misery of even one that is sinful.', 'sn': 'तस्मात् कुर्यादिहाचारं यदीच्छेद् भूतिमात्मनः। अपि पापशरीरस्य आचारो हन्त्यलक्षणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Virtue is singled out by conduct. The good and virtuous are so on account of the conduct they follow. The marks, again, of good conduct are afforded by the deeds of those that are good Or righteous.', 'sn': 'आचारलक्षणो धर्मः सन्तश्चारित्रलक्षणाः। साधूनां च यथावृत्तमेतदाचारलक्षणम्॥'}

{'en': 'People regard that who righteously and who does good acts even if they only hear of him without actually seeing him.', 'sn': 'अप्यदृष्टं श्रवादेव पुरुषं धर्मचारिणम्। भूतिकर्माणि कुर्वाणं तं जनाः कुर्वते प्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'The atheists they who are destitute of all acts, they who are disobedient to preceptors and violate the injunctions of the scriptures, they who are unacquainted with and, therefore, unobservant of duties, and they who are wicked of conduct, become shortlived. man acts', 'sn': 'ये नास्तिका निष्क्रियाश्च गुरुशास्त्राभिलंघिनः। अधर्मज्ञा दुराचारारते भवन्ति गतायुधः॥'}

{'en': 'They who are of improper conduct, they who violate all restraints, they who are unscrupulous about sexual congress, become shortlived here and have to go to Hell hereafter.', 'sn': 'विशीला भिन्नमर्यादा नित्यं संकीर्णमैथुनाः। अल्पायुषो भवन्तीह नरा निरयगामिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Even those men live for a hundred years who, though destitute of all accomplishments, follow propriety and righteousness of conduct and become endued with faith and freed from malice.', 'sn': 'सर्वलक्षणहीनोऽपि समुदाचारवान् नरः। श्रद्वधानोऽनसूयुश्च शतं वर्षाणि जीवति॥'}

{'en': 'He who is free from anger, who is truthful in speech, who never does any injury to any creature in the universe, who is shorn of malice and crookedness and insincerity, succeeds in living for a hundred years.', 'sn': 'अक्रोधनः सत्यवादी भूतानामविहिसंकः। अनसूयुरजिह्मश्च शतं वर्षाणि जीवति॥'}

{'en': 'He who always breaks little clods of carth, or tears up the grass that grows under his feet, or cuts off his nails with his teeth, or is always impure, or very restless, never succeeds in living long.', 'sn': 'लोष्ठमर्दी तृणच्छेदी नखखादी च यो नरः। नित्योच्छिष्ट: संकुसुको नेहायुर्विन्दते महत्॥'}

{'en': 'One should wake up from sleep at the hour known as the Brahma Muhurta and then think of both religion and worldly profit. Getting up from bed, one should then wash his face and mouth, and joining his hands in an attitude of respect, then say the morning prayers.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्म मुहूर्ते बुध्येत धर्मार्थो चानुचिन्तयेत्। उत्थायाचम्य तिष्ठेत पूर्वो संध्यां कृताञ्जलिः॥'}

{'en': 'In this way, one should when evening sets in say his evening prayers also, controlling speech the while. One should never look at the rising sun, nor at the setting sun.', 'sn': 'एवमेवापरां संध्या समुपासीत वाग्यतः। नेक्षेतादित्यमुद्यन्तं नास्तं यान्तं कदाचन॥'}

{'en': "Nor should one look at the sun when he is in eclipse; nor at his image in the water, nor at midday when he is at the meridian. The Rishis, on account of their worshipping the two twilight's, with great regularity succeeded in acquiring longevity.", 'sn': 'नोपसृष्टं न वारिस्थं न मध्यं नभसो गतम्। ऋषयो नित्यसंध्यत्वाद् दीर्घमायुरवाप्नुवन्॥'}

{'en': "Hence one should controlling speech, say his prayers regularly at the two twilight's. As regards those Brahmanas who do not say their prayers at the two twilight's, a righteous king should set them to perform such deeds as are ordained for the Shudras. Persons of every caste should never have sexual congress with other people's wives.", 'sn': 'तस्मात् तिष्ठेत् सदा पूर्वो पश्चिमां चैव वाग्यतः। ये न पूर्वामुपासन्ते द्विजाः संध्यां न पाश्चिमाम्॥ सर्वोस्तान् धार्मिको राजा शूद्रकर्माणि कारयेत्। परदारा न गन्तव्या सर्ववर्णेषु कर्हिचित्॥'}
{'en': "There is nothing that shortens life so: cffcctually as sexual union with other people's wives.", 'sn': 'न हीदृशमनायुष्यं लोके किंचन विद्यते। यादृशं पुरुषस्येह परदारोपसेवनम्॥'}

{'en': 'The adulterer shall have to live in Hell for as many thousand years as the number of pores on the bodies of the women with whom he may cominit the offence.', 'sn': 'यावन्तो रोमकूपाः स्युः स्त्रीणां गात्रेषु निर्मिताः। तावद् वर्षसहस्राणि नरकं पर्युपासते॥'}

{'en': "One should dress one's hair, apply collyrium to one's eyes, and wash one's teeth, as also worship the celestials in the forenoon.", 'sn': 'प्रसाधनं च केशानामञ्जनं दन्तधावनम्। पूर्वाह्न एव कार्याणि देवतानां च पूजनम्॥'}

{'en': "One should not gaze at urine or faeces, or tread on it or touch it with one's feet. One should not see out on a journey at early dawn, or at midday, or in the evening twilight, or with a companion that is unknown, or with a Shudra, or alone. While passing along a road, one should standing aside, always give way to a Brahmana, to kine, to kings, to an old man, to one that is loaded with a burthen, to a woman big with child, or to one that is weak. When one meets a large tree that is known, one should walk round it. One should also, when coming upon the crossing of four roads, walk round it before pursuing his journey. At midday, or at midnight, or at night in general, or at the two twilight's, one should not proceed the crossings of the four roads. One should never wear sandals or clothes that have been worn by another.", 'sn': 'पुरीषमूत्रे नोदीक्षेन्नाधितिष्ठेत् कदाचन। नातिकल्यं नातिसायं न च मध्यन्दिने स्थिते॥ नाज्ञातैः सह गच्छेत नैको न वृषलैः सह। पन्था देयो ब्राह्मणाय गोभ्यो राजभ्य एव च॥ वृद्धाय भारतप्ताय गर्भिण्यै दुर्बलाय च। प्रदक्षिणं च कुर्वीत परिज्ञातान् वनस्पतीन्॥ चतुष्पथान् प्रकुर्वीत सर्वानेव प्रदक्षिणान्। मध्यन्दिने निशाकाले अर्धरात्रे च सर्वदा॥ चतुष्पथं न सेवेत उभे संध्ये तथैव च। उपानही च वस्त्रं च धृतमन्यैर्न धारयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'One should always observe the vow of celibacy, and should never cross his legs. One should observe the vow of celibacy on the day of the new moon, as also, on that of the full moon, as also on the eighth lunar day of both fortnights. One should never cat the flesh of animals not killed in sacrifices. One should never eat the flesh of the back of an animal. One should avoid censuring and calumniating others, as also all kinds of deceitful conduct.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्मचारी च नित्यं स्यात् पादं पादेन नाक्रमेत्। अमावास्यां पौर्णमास्यां चतुर्दश्यां च सर्वशः॥ अष्टम्यां सर्वपक्षाणां ब्रह्मचारी सदा भवेत्। आक्रोशं परिवादं च पैशुन्यं च विवर्जयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'One should never cut others with wordy arrows. Indeed, one should never utter any cruel speech. One should never accept anything in gift from a person who is low and vulgar. One should never utter such words as pain other people or as are inauspicious or as are sinful.', 'sn': 'नारुन्तुदः स्यान्न नृशंसवादी न हीनतः परमभ्याददीत। ययास्य वाचा पर उद्विजेत न तां वदेद् रुशती पापलोक्याम्॥'}

{'en': 'Wordy arrows fall from the mouth. Pierced therewith, the victim grieves day and night. The wise man should never shoot them for cutting the vitals of other people.', 'sn': 'वाक्सायका वदनान्निष्पतन्ति यैराहतः शोचति रात्र्यहानि। परस्य वा मर्मसु ये पतन्ति तान् पण्डितो नावसृजेत् परेषु॥'}

{'en': 'A forest, pierced with arrows or cut down with the axe, grows again. The man, however, who is pierced with words unwisely spoken, becomes the victim of wounds that fester and bring on death.', 'sn': 'रोहते सायकैर्विद्धं वनं परशुना हतम्। वाचा दुरुक्तं बीभत्सं न संरोहति वाक्क्षतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Barbed arrows and Nalikas and broadheaded arrows are capable of being extracted from the body. Wordy arrows, however, are incapable of being extracted, for they lie einbedded in the very heart.', 'sn': 'कर्णिनालीकनाराचान् निर्हरन्ति शरीरतः। वाक्शल्यस्तु न निहर्तुं शक्यो हृदिशयो हि सः॥३४'}

{'en': 'One should not taunt a person who is defective of a limb or who has a limb in excess. or one who is shorn of learning, or one who is niserable, or one who is ugly or poor, or one who is shorn of strength.', 'sn': 'हीनाङ्गानतिरिक्ताङ्गान् विद्याहीनान् विगर्हितान्। रूपद्रविणहीनांश्च सत्त्वहीनांश्च नाक्षिपेत्॥'}

{'en': 'One should avoid atheism, vilifying the Vedas, censuring the celestials, malice, pride, arrogance, and harshness.', 'sn': 'नास्तिक्यं वेदनिन्दां च देवतानां च कुत्सनम्। द्वेषस्तम्भोऽभिमानं च तैक्ष्ण्यं च परिवर्जयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'One should not angrily, take up the rod of punishment for laying it upon another. Only the son or the pupil, it has been said, can be mildly reprimanded for purposes of instruction.', 'sn': 'परस्य दण्डं नोद्यच्छेत् क्रद्धो नैनं निपातयेत्। अन्यत्र पुत्राच्छिष्याच्च शिक्षार्थं ताडनं स्मृतम्॥'}

{'en': "One should not vilify Brahmanas; nor should point at the stars with one's fingers. If asked, one should not say what the lunation is on a particular day. By telling it, his life becomes shortened.", 'sn': 'न ब्राह्मणान् परिवदेन्नक्षत्राणि न निर्दिशेत्। तिथिं पक्षस्य न ब्रूयात् तथास्यायुर्न रिष्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Having answered calls of nature or having walked over a road, one should wash his feet. One should also wash his feet before sitting to recite the Vedas or to eat any food.', 'sn': 'कृत्वा मूत्रपुरीषे तु रथ्यामाक्रम्य वा पुनः। पादप्रक्षालनं कुर्यात् स्वाध्याये भोजने तथा॥'}

{'en': "These are the three things which are considered as pure and sacred by the celestials and as such fit for the Brahmana's use, viz., that whose impurity is unknown, that which has been washed in water, and that which has been well spoken of.", 'sn': 'त्रीणि देवाः पवित्राणि ब्राह्मणानामकल्पयन्। अदृष्टमद्भिर्निर्णिक्तं यच्च वाचा प्रशस्यते॥'}

{'en': "Samayava, Krishana, meat, Shashakuli, and Payasa should never be cooked for one's ownself. Whenever cooked, these should be offered to the celestials.", 'sn': 'संयावं कृसरं मांसं शष्कुलीं पायसं तथा। आत्मार्थं न प्रकर्तव्यं देवार्थं तु प्रकल्पयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'One should attend every day to his sacred fire. One should every day give alms. One should, controlling speech the while, clean his teeth with the tooth-stick.', 'sn': 'नित्यमग्निं परिचरेद् भिक्षां दद्याच्च नित्यदा। वाग्यतो दन्तकाष्ठं च नित्यमेव समाचरेत्॥'}

{'en': 'One should never be in bed when the sun is up. If one fails any day to be up with the sun, he should then perform an expiation. Rising from bed, one should first salute his parents, and preceptors, or other elders worthy of respect. By so doing one acquires a long life. The toothstick should be thrown off when done with, and a new one should be used every day.', 'sn': 'न चाभ्युदितशायी स्यात् प्रायश्चित्ती तथा भवेत्। मातापितरमुत्थाय पूर्वमेवाभिवादयेत्॥ आचार्यमथवाप्यन्यं तथायुर्विन्दते महत्। वर्जयेद् दन्तकाष्ठानि वर्जनीयानि नित्यशः॥'}

{'en': 'One should eat food which is not forbidden in the scriptures, abstaining from food of every kind on days of the new moon and the full moon. One should, with senses controlled, answer calls of nature, facing the north.', 'sn': 'भक्षयेच्छास्त्रदृष्टानि पर्वस्वपि विवर्जयेत्। उदङ्मुखश्च सततं शौचं कुर्यात् समाहितः॥'}

{'en': 'One should not adore the celestials without having first washed his teeth. Without also adoring the celestials first, one should never repair to any person except his preceptor or one who is old in years or one who is righteous or one who is wise. Wise men should never see themselves in an unnolished or dirty mirror.', 'sn': 'अकृत्वा देवपूजां च नाचरेद् दन्तधावनम्। अकृत्वा देवपूजां च नाभिगच्छेत् कदाचन। अन्यत्र तु गुरुं वृद्धं धार्मिकं वा विचक्षणम्॥ अवलोक्यो न चादर्शो मलिनो बुद्धिमत्तरैः।'}
{'en': 'One should never know a woman that is unknown or with one that is big with child.', 'sn': 'न चाज्ञातां स्त्रियं गच्छेद् गर्भिणी वा कदाचन॥ उदक्शिरा न स्वपेत तथा प्रत्यक्शिरा न च।'}

{'en': 'One should never sleep with head turned towards the north or the west. One should not lie down upon a broken bedstead.', 'sn': 'प्राक्शिरास्तु स्वपेद् विद्वानथवा दक्षिणाशिराः॥ न भग्ने नावशीर्णे च शयने प्रस्वपीत च।'}

{'en': 'One should not sleep on a bed without having examined it first with the help of a light. Nor should one sleep on a bed with another by his side. One should never sleep in a transverse direction. One should never make agreement with atheists or do anything in conjunction with them. an one', 'sn': 'नान्तर्धाने न संयुक्ते न च तिर्यक् कदाचन॥ न चापि गच्छेत् कार्येण समयाद् वापि नास्तिकैः।'}

{'en': 'One should never drag a seat with the foot and sit on it. One should never bathe in a nude state nor at night.', 'sn': 'आसनं तु पदाऽऽकृष्य न प्रसज्जेत् तथा नरः॥ न नग्न: कर्हिचित् स्नायान्न निशायां कदाचन।'}

{'en': 'An intelligent person should never allow his limbs to be rubbed or pressed after bathing. One should never smear unguents upon his body without having first gone through bath. Having bathed, one should never wave his cloth in the air.', 'sn': 'स्नात्वा च नावमृज्येत गात्राणि सुविचक्षणः॥ न चानुलिम्पेदस्नात्वा स्नात्वा वासो न निधुनेत्।'}

{'en': 'One should not wear wet clothes every day. One should never take off his body the garlands of flowers one may wear, Nor should wear such garlands over his outer garments.', 'sn': 'न चैवार्द्राणि वासांसि नित्यं सेवेत मानवः॥ सजश्च नावकृष्येत न बहिर्धारयीत च।'}

{'en': 'One should never even talk with a woman during the period of her menses. One should not answer a call of nature on a field or at place too near an inhabited village.', 'sn': 'उदक्यया च सम्भाषां न कुर्वीत कदाचन॥ नोत्सृजेत पुरीषं च क्षेत्रे ग्रामस्य चान्तिके।'}

{'en': 'One should never answer a call of nature on a piece of water. One should first wash his mouth, thrice with water before eating any food.', 'sn': 'उभे मूत्रपुरीषे तु नाप्से कुर्यात् कदाचन॥ अन्नं बुभुक्षमाणस्तु त्रिर्मुखेन स्पृशेदपः।'}

{'en': 'Having finished his meals, one should wash his mouth thrice with water and twice again. One should eat, with face turned east wards, his food, controlling speech the while and without censuring the food that is caten.', 'sn': 'भुक्त्वा चान्नं तथैव त्रिर्द्धिः पुनः परिमार्जयेत्॥ प्राङ्मुखो नित्यमश्रीयाद् वाग्यतोऽन्नमकुत्सयन्।'}

{'en': 'One should always leave a residue of the food that is placed before one for eating. Having finished his meals, one should mentally touch fire. If one eats with face turned eastwards, he becomes longlived. By eating with face turned south wards, one acquires great fame.', 'sn': 'प्रस्कन्दयेच्च मनसा भुक्त्वा चाग्निमुपस्पृशेत्॥ आयुष्यं प्राङ्मुखो भुडक्ते यशस्य दक्षिणामुखः।'}

{'en': "By eating with face turned westwards, one acquires great riches. By eating with face turned northwards, one becomes truthful in specch. Having finished his meals, one should wash all the upper holes of one's body with water.", 'sn': 'धन्यं पश्चान्मुखे भुङ्क्ते ऋतं भुङ्क्ते उदङ्मुखः॥ अग्निमालभ्य तोयेन सर्वान् प्राणानुपस्पृशेत्।'}

{'en': 'Likewise, all the limbs, the navel, and the palms of the hands should be washed with water. One should never sit upon husk of corn or upon hair, or upon ashes, or upon bones.', 'sn': 'गात्राणि चैव सर्वाणि नाभिं पाणितले तथा॥ नाधितिष्ठेत् तुषं जातु केशभस्मकपालिकाः।'}

{'en': 'One should, never use the water that has been used by another for bathing. One should always perform the Homa for propitiating the celestials, and recite the Savitri Mantras.', 'sn': 'अन्यस्य चाप्यवस्नातं दूरतः परिवर्जयेत्॥ शान्तिहोमांश्च कुर्वीत सावित्राणि च धारयेत्।'}

{'en': 'One should always eat in a seated posture. One should never eat while walking. One should never answer a call of nature standing. One should never answer a call of nature on ashes or in a cowpen.', 'sn': 'निषण्णश्चापि खादेत न तु गच्छन् कदाचन॥ मूत्रं नोत्तिष्ठता कार्यं न भस्मनि न गोव्रजे।'}

{'en': "One should wash his feet before sitting to one's meals. One should never sit or lie down for slecp with wet feet. One who sits to his meals after having washed his feet, lives for a century.", 'sn': 'आर्द्रपादस्तु भुञ्जीत नार्द्रपादस्तु संविशेत्॥ आर्द्रपादस्तु भुजानो वर्षाणां जीवते शतम्।'}

{'en': 'One should never touch these three things, while one is in an impure state, viz., fire, a cow and a Brahmana. By observing this rule one lives long.', 'sn': 'त्रीणि तेजांसि नोच्छिष्ट आलभेत कदाचन॥ अग्निं गां ब्राह्मणं चैव तथा ह्यायुर्न रिष्यते।'}

{'en': "One should not, while he is in an impure state, cast one's eyes on these three things, viz., the sun, the moon and the stars.", 'sn': 'त्रीणि तेजांसि नोच्छिष्ट उदीक्षेत कदाचन॥ सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ चैव नक्षत्राणि च सर्वशः।'}

{'en': 'The lifebreaths of a young man go up wards, when an old and venerable person comes to his house. He gets them back by standing up and properly saluting the guest.', 'sn': 'ऊर्ध्वं प्राणा ह्युत्क्रामन्ति यूनः स्थविर आयति॥ प्रत्युत्थानाभिवादाभ्यां पुनस्तान् प्रतिपद्यते।'}

{'en': 'Old men should always be saluted. One should, upon seeing them, offer seats with his own hand. After the old man has taken his seat, a person should sit and remain with hands joined in respect. When an old man goes along the road, one should always follow him instead of walking ahead.', 'sn': 'अभिवादयीत वृद्धांश्च दद्याच्चैवासनं स्वयम्॥ कृताञ्जलिरुपासीत गच्छन्तं पृष्ठतोऽन्वियात्।'}

{'en': 'One should never sit on a torn or broken seat. One should, without using it any longer, throw away a broken vessel of white brass. One should, never eat without a piece of upper garinent covering his body. One should never bathe in a nude state.', 'sn': 'न चासीतासने भिन्ने भिन्नकांस्यं च वर्जयेत्॥ नैकवस्त्रेण भोक्तव्यं न नग्नः स्नातुमर्हति।'}

{'en': "One should never sleep in a naked state. One should never even touch the remnants of other people's dishes and plates. One should never, while he is in an impure state, touch another's head, for it is said in the scriptures that the vital airs are all concentrated in the head.", 'sn': 'स्वप्तव्यं नैव नग्नेन न चोच्छिष्टोऽपि संविशेत्॥ उच्छिष्टो न स्पृशेच्छीर्षं सर्वे प्राणास्तदाश्रयाः।'}

{'en': 'One should never strike another on the heads or seize another by the hair. One should prol join his hand together for scratching his head.', 'sn': 'केशग्रहं प्रहारांश्च शिरस्येतान् विवर्जयेत्॥ न संहताभ्यां पाणिभ्यां कण्डूयेदात्मनः शिरः।'}

{'en': "One should not, while bathing, repeatedly dip his head in water. By so doing one shortens one's life. One who has bathed by dipping the head in water should not, afterwards put oil to any part of his body.", 'sn': 'न चाभीक्ष्णं शिरःस्नायात् तथा यायुर्न रिष्यते॥ शिरःस्नातस्तु तैलैश्च नाङ्गं किंचिदपि स्पृशेत्।'}

{'en': 'One should never take his mcals without cating some sesame. One should never teach (the Vedas or any scriptures) at a time when he is impure. Nor should onc study while is impure.', 'sn': 'तिलसृष्टं न चाश्नीयात् तथास्यायुर्न रिष्यते॥ नाध्यापयेत् तथोच्छिष्टो नाधीयीत कदाचन।'}

{'en': 'When a storm rises or a bad smell spreads itself in the atmosphere, he should never think of the Vedas. Persons knowing ancient history recite a Gatha sung by Yama in days of yore. He who runs while impure or studies the Veda under similar circumstances, indeed, that twice born Brahman who studies the Veda at forbidden times loses his Veda and shortens his life.', 'sn': 'वाते च पूतिगन्धे च मनसापि न चित्नयेत्॥ अत्र गाथा यमोद्गीताः कीर्तयन्ति पुराविदः। आयुरस्य निकृन्तामि प्रजास्तस्याददे तथा॥ उच्छिष्टो यः प्राद्रवति स्वाध्यायं चाधिगच्छति। यश्चानध्यायकालेऽपि मोहादभ्यस्यति द्विजः॥ तस्य वेदः प्रणश्येत आयुश्च परिहीयते।'}

{'en': 'Hence, one should never study the Veda with rapt altention at forbidden times. They who answer a call of nature, with face towards the sun or towards a burning fire, or towards a cow, or towards a twice born person, or on the road, become shortlived. At day time both calls of nature should be answered with face turned towards the north.', 'sn': 'तस्माद् युक्तो ह्यनध्याये नाधीयीत कदाचन॥ प्रत्यादित्यं प्रत्यनलं प्रति गां च प्रति द्विजान्। ये मेहन्ति च पन्थानं ते भवन्ति गतायुषः॥ उभे मूत्रपुरीषे तु दिवा कुर्यादुदङ्मुखः।'}

{'en': 'At night, those calls should be answered facing the south. By so doing one does not shorten his life. One who wishes to live long should never disregard or insult any of these three, however weak or emaciated they may appear to be, viz., the Brahmana, the Kshatriya, and the snake. All three are gifted with dreadful poison. The snake, of angry, burns the victim with only a look of its eye.', 'sn': 'दक्षिणाभिमुखो रात्रौ तथा ह्यायुर्न रिष्यते॥ त्रीन् कृशान् नावजानीयाद् दीर्घमायुर्जिजीविषुः। ब्राह्मणं क्षत्रियं सर्प सर्वे ह्याशीविषास्त्रयः॥ दहत्याशीविषः क्रद्धो यावत् पश्यति चक्षुषा।'}

{'en': 'The Kshatriya also, if angry, burns the object of his anger, as soon as he sees him, with his energy. The Brahmana, stronger than any of these two, destroys, not only the object of his anger but his entire family as well, not by looks alone but by thought also.', 'sn': 'क्षत्रियोऽपि दहेत् क्रूद्धो यावत् स्पृशति तेजसा॥ ब्राह्मणस्तु कुलं हन्याद् ध्यानेनावेक्षितेन च।'}

{'en': 'A wise man should, therefore, tend these three carefully. One should never engage in any disputation with his preceptor.', 'sn': 'तस्मादेतत् त्रयं यत्नादुपसेवेत पण्डितः॥ गुरुणा चैव निर्बधो न कर्तव्यः कदाचन।'}

{'en': 'O Yudhishthira, if the preceptor becomes angry, he should always be pacified with due honors. If the preceptor is entirely in the wrong, still one should follow and honour him.', 'sn': 'अनुमान्यः प्रसाद्यश्च गुरुः क्रद्धो युधिष्ठिर॥ सम्यङ्गमिथ्या प्रवृत्तेऽपि वर्तितव्यं गुराविह।'}

{'en': 'Forsooth, calumnious sayings against the preceptor always consume the lives of those who utter them. One should always answer a call of nature at a spot far distant from his dwelling place. One should wash his feet at a distance from his dwelling place.', 'sn': 'गुरुनिन्दा दहत्यायुर्मनुष्याणां न संशयः॥ दूरादावसथान्मूत्रं दूरात् पादावसेचनम्।'}

{'en': 'One should always throw the remnants of his dishes and plates at a spot distant from his dwelling place. Indeed, he who wishes for his own behoof should do all this. One should not wear garlands of red flowers. Indeed, the wise should wear garlands of white flowers.', 'sn': 'उच्छिष्टोत्सर्जनं चैव दूरे कार्यं हितैषिणा॥ रक्तमाल्यं न धार्य स्याच्छुक्लं धार्य तु पण्डितैः।'}

{'en': 'Rejecting the lotus and the lily, O you of great might, one may bear on his head, however, a flower that is red, even if it be an aquatic one.', 'sn': 'वर्जयित्वा तु कमलं तथा कुवलयं प्रभो॥ रक्तं शिरसि धार्य तु तथा वानेयमित्यपि।'}

{'en': 'A garland of gold can never become impure. After one has bathed, O king, he should use perfumes mixed with water.', 'sn': 'काञ्चनीयापि माला या न सा दुष्यति कर्हिचित्।।८४ स्नातस्य वर्णकं नित्यमाई दद्याद् विशाम्पते।'}

{'en': 'One should never wear his upper garment for covering the lower limbs or the lower garments for covering the upper ones. Nor should one wear clothes used by another. One should not, again, wear a piece of cloth that has not its fringes.', 'sn': 'विपर्ययं न कुर्वीत वाससो बुद्धिमान् नरः॥ तथा नान्यधृतं धार्य न चापदशमेव च।'}

{'en': 'When one goes to bed, O king, he should wear a different piece of cloth. When passing along a road, one should wear a different piece of cloth. So also, when adoring the celestials, one should wear a different piece of cloth.', 'sn': 'अन्यदेव भवेद् वासः शयनीये नरोत्तम॥ अन्यद् रथ्यासु देवानामायामन्यदेव हि।'}

{'en': 'The intelligent man should smear his limbs with unguents made of Priyangu, sandal wood, Bilva, Tagara, and Keshara.', 'sn': 'प्रियङ्गुचन्दनाभ्यां च बिल्वेन तगरेण च॥ पृथगेवानुलिम्पेत केसरेण च बुद्धिमान्।'}

{'en': 'In observing a fast, one should purify himself by a bath, and adorn his body with ornaments and unguents. One should always abstain from sexual union on days of the full moon and the new moon.', 'sn': 'उपवासं च कुर्वीत स्नातः शुचिरलंकृतः॥ पर्वकालेषु सर्वेषु ब्रह्मचारी सदा भवेत्।'}

{'en': 'One should never, O king, eat off the same plate with another even if he be of his own or equal rank. Nor should one ever eat any food that has been prepared by a woman in her menses.', 'sn': 'समानमेकपात्रे तु भुजेन्नान्नं जनेश्वर॥ नालीढया परिहतं भक्षयीत कदाचन।'}

{'en': 'One should never eat any food or drink any liquid whose essence has been taken off. Nor should one eat anything without giving a part thereof to persons who wistfully gaze at the food that one happens to take. The intelligent man should never sit near an impure person. Nor should one sit near persons who are foremost in virtue.', 'sn': 'तथा नोद्धृतसाराणि प्रेक्ष्यते नाप्रदाय च॥ न संनिकृष्टे मेधावी नाशुचेर्न च सत्सु च।'}

{'en': 'All food that is forbidden in religious rites should never be taken even on other occasions. The fruits of the Ficus religiosa and the Ficus Bengalensis as also the leaves of the Crotolaria Juncea, and the fruits of the Ficus glomerata, should never be eaten by one who seeks his own good. The flesh of goats, of kine, and the peacock, should never be eaten. One should also abstain from dried flesh and all flesh that is stale. The intelligent man should never eat any salt, taking it up with his hand.', 'sn': 'प्रतिषिद्धान्नधर्मेषु भक्ष्यान् भुञ्जीत पृष्ठतः॥ पिप्पलं च वटं चैव शणशाकं तथैव च। उदुम्बरं न खादेच्च भवार्थी पुरुषोत्तमः॥ न पाणौ लवणं विद्वान् प्राश्नीयान्न च रात्रिषु।'}

{'en': 'Nor should he eat curds and flour of fried barley at night. One should abstain also from flesh of animals not killed in sacrifices. One should, with rapt attention, eat once on the morning and once in the evening, abstaining entirely from all food in the interval.', 'sn': 'दधिसक्तून् न भुञ्जीत वृथा मासं च वर्जयेत्॥ सायंप्रातश्च भुञ्जीत नान्तराले समाहितः।'}

{'en': 'One should never eat any food in which he may find out a hair. Nor should one eat at the Shraddha of an enemy. One should eat silently; one should never eat without covering his body with an upper garment, and without sitting down.', 'sn': 'वालेन तु न भुञ्जीत परश्राद्धं तथैव च॥ वाग्यतो नैकवस्त्रश्च नासंविष्टः कदाचन।'}

{'en': 'One should never eat any food placing it on the naked ground. One should never eat except in a sitting posture. One should never make any noise while eating. The intelligent man should first offer water and then food to one who has become his guest, and after liaving served the guest thus, should then take his meals himself. He who sits down to dinner in a line with friends and himself eats any food without giving thereof to his friends, is said to eat dreadful poison. As regards water and Payasa and flour of fried barley and curds and clarified butter and honey, one should never, after drinking or eating these, offer the residue thereof to others. One should never, O King, eat any foot hesitatingly.', 'sn': 'भूमौ सदैव नाश्नीयान्नानासीनो न शब्दवत्॥ तोयपूर्वं प्रदायान्नमतिथिभ्यो विशाम्पते। पश्चाद् भुजीत मेधावी न चाप्यन्यमना नरः॥ समानमेकपक्त्यां तु भोज्यमनं नरेश्वर। विषं हालाहलं भुङ्क्ते योऽप्रदाय सुहृज्जने॥ पानीयं पायसं सक्तून् दधिसर्पिमधून्यपि। निरस्य शेषमन्येषां न प्रदेयं तु कस्यचित्॥ भुजानो मनुजव्याघ्र चैव शङ्कां समाचरेत्।'}

{'en': "One seeking one's own good, should never drink curds finishing his meal. After the meal is finished, one should wash his mouth and face with the (right) hand only, and taking a little water should then dip the toe of the right food in it.", 'sn': 'दधि चाप्यनुपानं वै न कर्तव्यं भवार्थिना॥ आचम्य चैकहस्तेन परिप्लाव्यं तथोदकम्।'}

{'en': 'After washing, one should touch the crown of his head with the (right) hand. With rapt attention, one should next touch fire.', 'sn': 'अङ्गुष्ठं चरणस्याथ दक्षिणस्यावसेचयेत्॥ पाणिं मूर्ध्नि समाधाय स्पृष्ट्वा चाग्निं समाहितः।'}

{'en': 'The man who knows how to observe all these ordinances carefully carefully succeeds in acquiring the foremost place among kinsmen. One should, after finishing his meals, wash his nose and eyes and ears and navel and both hands with water.', 'sn': 'ज्ञातिश्रेष्ठ्यमवाप्नोति प्रयोगकुशलो नरः॥ अद्भिःप्राणान् समालभ्य नाभिं पाणितले तथा।'}

{'en': 'One should not, however, keep his hands wet. Between the tip and the root of the thumb is situate the sacred Tirtha known by the name of Brahma.', 'sn': 'स्पृशंश्चैव प्रतिष्ठेत च चाप्याट्टैण पाणिना॥ अङ्गुष्ठस्यान्तराले च ब्राह्यं तीर्थमुदाहृतम्।'}

{'en': 'On the back of the little finger, it is said, is situate the Devatirtha. The intervening space between the thumb and the forefinger, Bharata, should be used for performing the Pitri rites, after touching water according to the ordinance. One should never vilify other people. Nor should one ever utter anything that is disagreeable.', 'sn': 'कनिष्ठिकायाः पश्चात् तु देवतीर्थमिहोच्यते॥ अङ्गुष्ठस्य च यन्मध्यं प्रदेशिन्याश्च भारत। तेन पित्र्याणि कुर्वीत स्पृष्ट्वापो न्यायतः सदा॥ परापवादं न ब्रूयानाप्रियं च कदाचन।'}

{'en': 'The man who desires his own good, should never seek to bring on himself the wrath of others. One should never seek to talk with an outcaste. The very sight of such a personi should be shunned.', 'sn': 'न मन्युः कश्चिदुत्पाद्यः पुरुषेण भवार्थिना॥ पतितैस्तु कथां नेच्छेद् दर्शनं च विवर्जयेत्।'}

{'en': 'One should never come in contact with degraded person. By avoiding such contact one succeeds in acquiring a long life. One should never indulge in sexual intercourse at day time. Nor should one know a maiden, or a harlot nor a barren woman.', 'sn': 'संसर्ग च न गच्छेत तथाऽऽयुर्विन्दते महत्॥ न दिवा मैथुनं गच्छेन्न कन्यां न च बन्धकीम्।'}

{'en': 'One should never know a woman who has not bathed after the expiry of her menses. By avoiding such acts one succeeds in acquiring a long life. After washing the several limbs directed, in view of religious acts, one should wash his lips thrice, and once more twice. By doing this, one becomes purified and fit for religious rites. The several organs of sense should each be washed once, and water should also be sprinkled over the entire body.', 'sn': 'न चास्नातां स्त्रियं गच्छेत् तथायुर्विन्दते महत्॥ स्वे स्वे तीर्थे समाचम्य कार्ये समुपकल्पिते। त्रिः पीत्वाऽऽपो द्विः प्रमृज्य कृतशौचो भवेन्नरः।। इन्द्रियाणि सकृत्स्पृश्य त्रिरभ्युक्ष्य च मानवः।'}

{'en': "Having done this, one should perforin the adoration of the departed Manes and celestials, according to the ordinances of Vedas. Listen to me, O you of Kuru's race, as I tell you what purification is cleansing and beneficial for a Brahmana. Before beginning to eat and after finishing the meal, and in all deeds requiring purification, the Brahmana should rinse his mouth with water placed on the limb called the Brahmatirtha.", 'sn': 'कुर्वीत पित्र्यं दैवं च वेददृष्टेन कर्मणा॥ ब्राह्मणार्थे च यच्छौचं तच्च मे शृणु कौरव। पवित्रं च हितं चैव भोजनाद्यंन्तयोस्तथा॥ सर्वशौचेषु ब्राह्मण तीर्थेन समुपस्पृशेत् निष्ठीव्य तु'}

{'en': "After ejecting any matter from the throat or spitting, one should wash his mouth before he can become pure. A kinsman who happens to be old, or a friend who happens to be poor, should be accommodated in one's house and his comforts looked after as if he were a member of the family. By doing this, one succeeds in winning both fame and longevity. To keep pigeons as also parrots both male and female, in one's house is highly blessed.", 'sn': 'तथा क्षुत्त्वा स्पृश्यापो हि शुचिर्भवेत्॥ वृद्धो ज्ञातिस्तथा मित्रं दरिद्रो यो भवेदपि। गृहे वासयितव्यास्ते धन्यमायुष्यमेव च॥ गृहे पारावता धन्याः शुकाश्च सहसारिकाः।'}

{'en': "If these live in one's house, they succeed in removing calamity. The same is the case with cockroaches. If fireflies and vultures and woodpigeons and bees enter a house and live in it, acts of propitiating the celestials should be performed. These are creatures of evil omen, as also ospreys. One should never give out the secrets of great men; one should never have sexual union with a forbidden woman. Nor should one ever have such union with the consort of a king or with women who are the friends of qucens.", 'sn': 'गृहेष्वेते न पापाय तथा वै तैलपायिकाः॥ उद्वीपकाश्च गृध्राश्च कपोता भ्रमरास्तथा। निवेशेयुर्यदा तत्र शान्तिमेव तदाऽऽचरेत्। अमङ्गल्यानि चैतानि तथाक्रोशो महात्मनाम्॥ महात्मनोऽतिगुह्यानि न वक्तव्यानि कर्हिचित्। अगम्याश्च न गच्छेत राज्ञः पत्नी सखीस्तथा॥'}

{'en': "One should never make friends with physicians, or with children, or with persons who are old, or with one's servants, O Yudhishthira. One should always provide for friends, for Brahmanas and for such as seek his protection. By doing this, O king, one acquires a long life. A wise man should live in such a house as has been constructed with the help of a Brahmana and an engineer skilled in his calling, if, indeed, O king, he seeks for his own behoof. One should not, O king, sleep at the evening twilight.
