Nor should one study at such hour for acquiring any any branch of knowledge.", 'sn': 'वैद्यानां बालवृद्धानां भृत्यानां च युधिष्ठिर। बन्धूनां ब्राह्मपानां च तथा गारणिकस्य च॥ सम्बन्धिनां च राजेन्द्र तथाऽऽयुर्विन्दते महत्। ब्राह्मणस्थपतिभ्यां च निर्मितं यन्निवेशनम्॥ तदावसेत् सदा प्राज्ञो भवार्थी मनुजेश्वर। संध्यायां न स्वपेद् राजन् विद्यां न च समाचरेत्।।'}

{'en': 'An intelligent man should never eat also at such an hour. By acting thus, one acquires a long life. One should never perform any act in honour of the departed Manes at night time. One should not adorn his body after finishing his meals.', 'sn': 'न भुञ्जीत च मेधावी तथायुर्विन्दते महत्। नक्तं न कुर्यात् पित्र्याणि भुक्त्वा चैव प्रसाधनम्।।११९'}

{'en': 'One should not bathe at night, if he seeks his own aggrandisement. One should also, O Bharata, always abstain from the flour of fried barley at night.', 'sn': 'पानीयस्य क्रिया नक्तं न कार्या भूतिमिच्छता। वर्जनीयाश्चैव नित्यं सक्तवो निशि भारत॥'}

{'en': 'The residue of food and drink, as also the flowers with which one has adored the celestials, should never be used. Inviting a guest at night, one should never, with excessive courtesy, compel him to eat to his fill. Nor should one cat to his fill, at night.', 'sn': 'शेषाणि चैव पानानि पानीयं चापि भोजने। सौहित्यं न च कर्तव्यं रात्रौ न च समाचरेत्॥'}

{'en': 'One should not kill a bird (for eating it), especially after having fed it, A wise man should espouse a maiden born in a high family, gifted with auspicious marks, and of full age. Begetting children upon her and thus perpetuating his race by that means, one should make over his sons to a good preceptor for being educated generally, O Bharata, as also in the especial customs of the family, O monarch. The daughters that one may beget should be married to youths of respectable families, who are again possessed of intelligence.', 'sn': 'द्विजच्छेदं न कुर्वीत भुक्त्वा न च समाचरेत्। महाकुले प्रसूतां च प्रशस्ता लक्षणैस्तथा॥ वयःस्थां च महाप्राज्ञः कन्यामावोढुमर्हति। अपत्यमुत्पाद्य ततः प्रतिष्ठाप्य कुलं तथा॥ पुत्राः प्रदेया ज्ञानेषु कुलधर्मेषु भारत। कन्या चोत्पाद्य दातव्या कुलपुत्राय धीमते॥'}

{'en': 'Sons should also be settled and a portion of the family inheritance given to them, O Bharata, as their provision. One should bathe by dipping his head in water before he sits down to perform any act in honour of the departed Manes or the deities.', 'sn': 'पुत्रा निवेश्याश्च कुलाद् भृत्या लभ्याश्च भारत। शिरःस्नातोऽथ कुर्वीत दैवं पित्र्यमथापि च॥'}

{'en': 'One should never perform a Shraddha under the constellation of his nativity. No Shraddha should be performed under any of the Bhadrapadas (prior or later), nor under the constellation Krittika, O Bharata.', 'sn': 'नक्षत्रे न च कुर्वीत यस्मिन् जातो भवेन्नरः। न प्रोष्ठपदयोः कार्यं तथाग्नेये च भारत॥'}

{'en': 'The Shraddha should never be performed under any of those constellations that are considered as dreadful (such as Ashlesha, etc.,) and any of those that upon calculation, seem to be hostile. Indeed, in this matter, all these constellations should be avoided which are forbidden in astrology.', 'sn': 'दारुणेषु च सर्वेषु प्रत्यरिं च विवर्जयेत्। ज्योतिषे यानि चोक्तानि तानि सर्वाणि वर्जयेत्।।१२७'}

{'en': 'One should sit facing either the east or the north while being shaved by a barber. By so doing, O great king, one succeeds in living long.', 'sn': 'प्राङ्मुख: श्मश्रुकर्माणि कारयेत् सुसमाहितः। उदङ्मुखो वा राजेन्द्र तथायुर्विन्दते महत्॥'}

{'en': "One should neither 'vilify others reproach himself for, O chief of the Bharatas, it is said that calumny is sinful whether of others or of oneself.", 'sn': 'परिवादं न च ब्रूयात् परेषामात्मनस्तथा। परिवादो धर्माय प्रोच्यते भरतर्षभ॥'}

{'en': "In marrying, one should avoid a woman who is deficient of any limb. A maiden too, if such, should also be avoided. A woman of the same Pravars should also be avoided; as also one who is ill-formed in body; as also one who has been born in the race to which one's mother belongs. nor", 'sn': 'वर्जयेद् व्यंगिनीं नारी तथा कन्यां नरोत्तमा समा? व्यंगितां चैव मातुः स्वकुलजां तथा॥'}

{'en': 'A wise man should never know a woman who is old, or one who has given up the domestic mode of life for entering the forest mode, or one who is faithful to her husband or one whose organs of generation are not healthy or well-formed.', 'sn': 'वृद्धां प्रव्रजितां चैव तथैव च पतिव्रताम्। तथा निकृष्टवर्णां च वर्णोत्कृष्टां च वर्जयेत्॥ अयोनि च वियोनि च न गच्छेत विचक्षणः।'}

{'en': 'You should not marry a woman who is of a yellow colour, or one who is attacked with leprosy, or onc born in a family in which there has been epilepsy, or one that is low in birth and habits, or one that is born in a family in which the disease called leprosy has appeared, or one belonging by birth to a family in which there are early deaths. Only that maiden who is gifted with auspicious indications, and who is accomplished for all sorts of qualifications, who is agrecable and beautiful, should be married. One should marry, O Yudhishthira, in a family who is higher or at least equal to his OW1l.', 'sn': 'पिङ्गलां कुष्ठिनीं नारी न त्वमुद्दोढुमर्हसि॥ अपस्मारिकुले जातां निहीनां चापि वर्जयेत्। श्वित्रिणां च कुले जातां क्षयिणां मनुजेश्वर॥ लक्षणैरन्विता या च प्रशस्ता या च लक्षणैः। मनोज्ञां दर्शनीयां च तां भवान् वोढुमर्हति॥ महाकुले निवेष्टव्यं सदृशे वा युधिष्ठिर।'}

{'en': 'One who is desirous of his own prosperity, should never marry a woman who is of an inferior caste or who has fallen away from the caste of her birth. Carefully lighting up the fire, one should perform all those acts which have been ordained and declared in the Vedas or by the Brahinanas. One should never seek to injure women. Wives should always be protected.', 'sn': 'अवरा पतिता चैव न ग्राह्या भूतिमिच्छता॥ अग्नीनुत्पाद्य यत्नेन क्रियाः सुविहिताश्च याः। वेदे च ब्राह्मणैः प्रोक्तास्ताश्च सर्वाः समाचरेत्।।१३६ न चेा स्त्रीषु कर्तव्या रक्ष्या दाराश्च सर्वशः।'}

{'en': 'Malice always shortens life. Hence, one should always abstain from entertaining malice. Sleep at day time shortens life. To sleep after the sunrise shortens life.', 'sn': 'अनायुष्या भवेदीर्ध्या तस्मादीलुं विवर्जयेत्॥ अनायुष्यं दिवा स्वप्नं तथाभ्युदितशायिता।'}

{'en': "They who sleep at any of the twilight's, or at nightfall, or who go to sleep in, a state of impurity, have their lives shortened. Adultery always shortens life. One should not remain in a state of impurity after shaving.", 'sn': 'प्रगे निशामाशु तथा नैवोच्छिष्टाः स्वपन्ति वै॥ पारदार्यमनायुष्यं नापितोच्छिष्टता तथा।'}

{'en': 'One should, O Bharata, carefully abstain from reading or reciting the Vedas, and eating, and bathing at eventide. When the evening twilight sets in one should collect his senses for meditation, without doing any act. One should, O king, bathe and then adore the Brahinanas.', 'sn': 'यत्नतो वै न कर्तव्यमभ्यासश्चैव भारत॥ संध्यायां च न भुञ्जीत न स्नायेन्न तथा पठेत्। प्रयतश्च भवेत् तस्यां न च किंचित् समाचरेत्॥ ब्राह्मणान् पूजयेच्चापि तथा स्नात्वा नराधिप।'}

{'en': 'Indeed, one should bathe before adoring the celestials and reverentially saluting the preceptor. One should never go to a sacrifice unless invited. Indeed, one may go there without an invitation, if he wishes to only see how the sacrifice is conducted. If one goes to a sacrifice without an invitation and if one does not on that account, receive proper adoration from the sacrificer, his life becomes shortened. One should never go alone on a journey to foreign parts. Nor should one ever go alone to any place at night.', 'sn': 'देवांश्च प्रणमेत् स्नातो गुरुश्चाप्यभिवादयेत्॥ अनिमन्त्रितो न गच्छेत यज्ञं गच्छेत दर्शकः। अनर्चिते ह्यनायुष्यं गमनं तत्र भारत॥ न चैकेन परिव्रज्यं न गन्तव्यं तथा निशि।'}

{'en': 'Before evening sets in, one should return to his house and remain within it. One should always obey the commands of his parents and preceptor, without at all judging whether those commands are good or not. One should, O king, attend carefully of the Vedas and the military science.', 'sn': 'अनागतायां संध्यायां पश्चिमायां गृहे वसेत्॥ मातुः पितुर्गुरूणां च कार्यमेवानुशासनम्। हितं चाप्यहितं चापि न विचार्यं नरर्षभ॥ धनुर्वेदे च वेदे च यत्नः कार्यो नराधिप।'}

{'en': 'Do then, O king, carefully attend to the practice of riding an elephant, a horse and a warchariot. The man who attends to these with care, succeeds in acquiring happiness.', 'sn': 'हस्तिपृष्ठेऽश्वपृष्ठे च रथचर्यासु चैव ह॥ यत्नवान् भव राजेन्द्र यत्नवान् सुखमेधते।'}

{'en': 'Such a king succeeds in becoming unconquerable by enemies, and govern his servants and kinsmen without any of them being able to subjugate him. The king who attains to such a position and who carefully attends to the duty of protecting his subjects, has never to incur any loss.', 'sn': 'अप्रधृष्यश्च शत्रूणां भृत्यानां स्वजनस्य च॥ प्रजापालनयुक्तश्च न क्षतिं लभते क्वचित्।'}

{'en': 'You should, O king, be proficient in logic, as also the science of words, the science of music and the four and the sixty branches of knowledge known by the name of Kala.', 'sn': 'युक्तिशास्त्रं च ते ज्ञेयं शब्दशास्त्रं च भारत॥ गान्धर्वशास्त्रं च कला: परिज्ञेया नराधिप।'}

{'en': 'One should every day hear the Puranas and the histories and all the other narratives that cxist, as also the biographies of all great men.', 'sn': 'पुराणमितिहासाश्च तथाख्याऽऽनानि यानि च॥ महात्मनां च चरितं श्रोतव्यं नित्यमेव ते।'}

{'en': "When one's wife is in her season, one should never know her, nor even summon her for conversation. A wise man may take her into his company on the fourth day after the bath of purification.", 'sn': 'पत्नी रजस्वला या च नाभिगच्छन्न चाह्वयेत्॥ स्नातां चतुर्थे दिवसे रात्रौ गच्छेद् विचक्षणः।'}

{'en': 'If one holds sexual union on the fifth day from the first appearance of the cataminal flow he gets a daughter. By holding it on the sixth day, he gets a son. A wise man should, in the matter of sexual intercourse attend to this rule.', 'sn': 'पञ्चमे दिवसे नारी षष्ठेऽहनि पुमान् भवेत्॥ एतेन विधिना पत्नीमुपगच्छेत पण्डितः।'}

{'en': 'Kinsmen and relatives by marriage and friends should all be treated with respect. One should, to the best of his power, worship the celestials in sacrifices, giving away various kinds of articles as sacrificial presents.', 'sn': 'ज्ञातिसम्बन्धिमित्राणि पूजनीयानि सर्वशः॥ यष्टव्यं च यथाशक्ति यज्ञैर्विविधदक्षिणैः।'}

{'en': 'After the period laid down for the domestic mode of life, one should, O king, become a hermit. I have thus told you briefly all the characteristics of persons who succeed in living long.', 'sn': 'अत उर्ध्वमरण्यं च सेवितव्यं नराधिप॥ एष ते लक्षणोद्देश आयुष्याणां प्रकीर्तितः।'}

{'en': 'What I have not told you should be heard by you from the mouths of persons well-versed in the three Vedas, O Yudhishthira. You should know that conduct is the root of prosperity. Conduct increases fame.', 'sn': 'शेषस्त्रविद्यवृद्धेभ्यः प्रत्याहार्यो युधिष्ठिर॥ आचारो भूतिजनन आचारः कीर्तिवर्धनः।'}

{'en': 'It is conduct which prolongs life. It is conduct which destroys all calamitics and evils. Conduct has been said to be superior 10 all the branches of knowledge.', 'sn': 'आचाराद् वर्धते ह्यायुराचारो हन्त्यलक्षणम्॥ आगमानां हि सर्वेषामाचारः श्रेष्ठ उच्यते।'}

{'en': 'It is conduct which begets virtue, and it is virtue which prolongs life. Conduct gives fame, long life, and Heaven. Conduct is the most efficacious rite of propitiating the celestials. The self-create Brahman himself has said that one should show mercy to all orders of men.', 'sn': 'आचारप्रभवो धर्मो धर्मादायुर्विवर्धते॥ एतद् यशस्यमायुष्यं स्वयं स्वस्त्ययनं महत्। अनुकम्प्य सर्ववर्णान् ब्रह्मणा समुदाहृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said O grandfather, O you of great wisdom, I have one great doubt which perplexes me! You should, O king, remove it! You are a promoter of our family.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच पितामह महाप्राज्ञ संशयो मे महानयम्। संछेत्तव्यस्त्वया राजन् भवान् कुलकरो हि नः॥'}

{'en': 'You have described to us the slanderous speeches uttered by wicked men of bad conduct. I desire, however, to question you further.', 'sn': 'पुरुषाणामयं तात दुर्वृत्तानां दुरात्मनाम्। कथितो वाक्यसंचारस्ततो विज्ञापयामि ते॥'}

{'en': 'That which is beneficial to a kingdom, that which yields happiness to the family of kings, that which yields good and advancement in the future and the present, that which is good regarding food, drink and the body, are topics upon which I wish you to dwell.', 'sn': 'यद्धितं राज्यतन्त्रस्य कुलस्य च सुखोदयम्। आयत्यां च तदात्वे च क्षेमवृद्धिकरं च यत्॥ पुत्रपौत्राभिरामं च राष्ट्रवृद्धिकरं च यत्। अन्नपाने शरीरे च हितं यत्तद् ब्रवीहि मे॥'}

{'en': 'How should a king, who has been put on the throne occupy it, surrounded by friends, ministers and servants, please his subjects?', 'sn': 'अभिषिक्तो हि यो राजा राष्ट्रस्थो मित्रसंवृतः। ससुहृत्समुपेतो वा स कथं रजयेत् प्रजाः॥'}

{'en': "That king, who, taken away by his natural propensities and proclivities, become devoted to evil companions, and flatters wicked men for his being under the influence of his senses, find all servants of good birth and blood displeased with him. Such a king never gets those objects the accomplishment of which depends upon one's having a number of good servants about him.", 'sn': 'यो ह्यसत्प्रग्रहरतिः स्नेहरागबलात्कृतः। इन्द्रियाणामनीशत्वादसज्जनबुभूषकः॥ तस्य भृत्या विगुणतां यान्ति सर्वे कुलोद्गताः। न च भृत्यफलैरथैः स राजा सम्प्रयुज्यते॥'}

{'en': 'You, who are equal to Brihaspati himself in intelligence, should describe to me these duties of kings which are difficult to be ascertained and thereby resolve my doubt.', 'sn': 'एतन्मे संशयस्यास्य राजधर्मान् सुदुर्विदान्। बृहस्पतिसमो बुद्ध्या भवान् शंसितुमर्हति॥'}

{'en': 'You, O foremost of men, are ever engaged in encompassing the good of our family. For this reason you always describe to us on the duties of the kings. Endued with great wisdom, Vidura also gives always valuable instruction.', 'sn': 'शंसिता पुरुषव्याघ्र त्वन्नः कुलहिते रतः। क्षत्ता चैको महाप्राज्ञो यो नः शंसति सर्वदा॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing instructions from you which are productive of good to our family and kingdom, I shall be able to live happily like a person pleased with having drunk the immortal nectar.', 'sn': 'त्वत्तः कुलहितं वाक्यं श्रुत्वा राज्यहितोदयम्। अमृतस्याव्ययस्येव तृप्तः स्वप्स्याम्यहं सुखम्॥'}

{'en': 'What classes of servants are to be considered as inferior and what as possessing all accomplishments? Helped by what class of servants or by servants of what kind of birth, should a king rule?', 'sn': 'कीदृशाः संनिकर्षस्था भृत्याः सर्वगुणान्विताः। कीदृशैः किं कुलीनैर्वा सह यात्रा विधीयते॥'}

{'en': 'If the king choose to act alone and without servants, he can never protect his people. All persons, however, of high birth wish for the acquisition of sovereignty? us', 'sn': 'न ह्येको भृत्यरहितो राजा भवति रक्षिता। राज्यं चेदं जनः सर्वस्तत्कुलीनोऽभिकाङ्क्षति॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said The king, O Bharata, cannot along govern his kingdom. Without servants to help him, he cannot accomplish any object. Even if he gains any object, he cannot retain it.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच न च प्रशास्तुं राज्यं हि शक्यमेकेन भारत। असहायवता तात नैवार्थाः केचिदप्युत॥ लब्धुं लब्धा ह्यपि सदा रक्षितुं भरतर्षभ।'}

{'en': 'That king, whose servants are all gifted with knowledge and wisdom, who always seek the well being of their master, and who are of high birth and quiet disposition, enjoys the happiness of sovereignty.', 'sn': 'यस्य भृत्यजन: सर्वो ज्ञानविज्ञानकोविदः॥ हितैषी कुलजः स्निग्धः स राज्यफलमश्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'That king, whose ministers are all born in respectable families, incapable of being alienated from him, who always live with him, who always give advice to their master, who are endued with wisdom and goodness, who have a knowledge of all things, who can provide for future events and contingencies, who have a good knowledge of the virtues of time, and who never regret for the past, succeeds in enjoying the happiness of sovereignty.', 'sn': 'मन्त्रिणो यस्य कुलजा असंहार्याः सहोषिताः। नृपतेर्मतिदाः सन्तः सम्बन्धज्ञानकोविदाः॥ अनागतविधातार: कालज्ञानविशारदाः। अतिक्रान्तमशोचन्तः स राज्यफलम श्नुते॥'}

{'en': "That king, whose servants partake of his sorrows and joys, who always do what he likes, who always try to accomplish their maser's objects, and all of whom are faithful, enjoys the happiness of sovereignty.", 'sn': 'समदुःखसुखा यस्य सहायाः प्रियकारिणः। अर्थचिन्तापराः सत्याः स राज्यफलमश्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'That king, whose subjects are always happy and magnanimous, and who always went to path of the righteous, enjoys the happiness of sovereignty.', 'sn': 'जनपदः संनिकर्षगतः सदा। अक्षुद्रः सत्पथालम्बी स राजा राज्यभाग्भवेत्॥ यस्य नार्तो'}

{'en': 'He is the best of kings, the various sources of whose revenue are managed and supervised by contented and trustworthy men who know fully the means of multiplying the finances.', 'sn': 'कोशाख्यपटलं यस्य कोशवृद्धिकरैर्नरैः। आप्तैस्तुष्टैश्च सततं चीयते स नृपोत्तमः॥'}

{'en': 'That king acquires great riches and merit whose repositories and barns are looked after by trustworthy, devoted, and uncovetous and scrupulous servants always always bent upon gathering.', 'sn': 'कोष्ठागारमसंहावैराप्तैः संचयतत्परैः। पात्रभूतैरलुब्धैश्च पाल्यमानं गुणी भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'That king in whose city justice is administered properly which leads to the fining the plaintiff or the defendant, if his case is untrue, and in which criminal laws are administered after the manner of Shankha and Likhita, acquires the merit of sovereignty.', 'sn': 'व्यवहारश्च नगरे यस्य कर्मफलोदयः। दृश्यते शंखलिखितः स धर्मफलभाङ् नृपः॥'}

{'en': 'That king, who wins over subjects by kindness, who is master of the duties of kings, and who is mindful of six cardinal objects, acquires the merit of sovereignty.', 'sn': 'संगृहीतमनुष्यश्च यो राजा राजधर्मवित्। षड्वर्गं प्रतिगृह्णाति स धर्मफलमश्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'You should, O grandfather, describe to me what is freed from duty and its reverse, what is freed from every doubt, what is above birth and death, as also virtue and sin, what is auspiciousness, what is eternal fearlessness, what is Eternal and Indestructible, and Immutable, what is always Pure, and what is ever free from exertion.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच धर्माधर्मविमुक्तं यद् विमुक्तं सर्वसंशयात्। जन्ममृत्युविमुक्तं च विमुक्तं पुण्यपापयोः॥ यच्छिवं नित्यमभयं नित्यमक्षरमव्ययम्। शुचि नित्यमनायासं तद् भवान् वक्तुमर्हति॥'}

{'en': "Bhishma said O Bharata, referring to this matter I shall recite to you the old discourse between Yajnavalkya and Janaka. Once on a time the famous king Daivarati of Janaka's race, truthfully understanding the meaning of all questions, put this question to Yajnavalkya, that foremost of Rishis.", 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अत्र ते वर्तयिष्यामि इतिहासं पुरातनम्। याज्ञवल्क्यस्य संवादं जनकस्य च भारत॥ याज्ञवल्क्यमृषिश्रेष्ठं दैवरातिर्महायशाः। पप्रच्छ जनको राजा प्रश्न प्रश्नविदां वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Janaka said ( regenerate Rishi, how many kinds of senses are there? How many kinds also are there of Nature? What is the Unmanifest and highest Brahma? What is higher than Brahmana? What is Birth and what Death? What are the limits of Age? You should, O foremost of Brahmanas, describe all these subjects to me who seek your favour.', 'sn': 'जनक उवाच कतीन्द्रियाणि विप्रर्षे कति प्रकृतयः स्मृताः। किमव्यक्तं परं ब्रह्म तस्माच्च परतस्तु किम्॥ प्रभवं चाप्ययं चैव कालसंख्यां तथैव च। वक्तुमर्हसि विप्रेन्द्र त्वदनुग्रहकाङ्क्षिणः॥'}

{'en': 'I am ignorant while you are an Ocean of knowledge. Hence, I ask you. Verily, I wish to hear you describe all these subject.', 'sn': 'अज्ञानात् परिपृच्छामि त्वं हि ज्ञानमयोनिधिः। तदहं श्रोतुमिच्छामि सर्वमेतदसंशयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Hear, O king, what I say in answer to these questions of yours. I shall give you the high knowledge which Yogins prize, and especially that which is possessed by the Sankhyas.', 'sn': 'याज्ञवल्क्य उवाच श्रूयतामवनीपाल यदेतदनुपृच्छसि। योगानां परमं ज्ञानं सांख्यानां च विशेषतः॥'}

{'en': 'Nothing is unknown to you. Still you ask me. One, however, who is questioned, should answer. This is the eternal practice.', 'sn': 'न तवाविदितं किंचिन्मां तु जिज्ञासते भवान्। पृष्टेन चापि वक्तव्यमेष धर्मः सनातनः॥'}

{'en': 'Eight principles have been called by the name of Nature, while sixteen have been called changes. Of Manifest, there are seven. These are of views of those persons who are conversant with the spiritual science.', 'sn': 'अष्टौ प्रकृतयः प्रोक्ता विकाराश्चापि षोडश। तत्र तु प्रकृतीरष्टौ प्राहुरध्यात्मचिन्तकाः॥'}

{'en': "The Unmanifest, Greatness, Consciousness and the five subtile elements of Earth, Wind, Ether, water, and Light, these eight are known by the name of Nature. Listen now to the enumeration of those called changes. They are the ear, the skin, the eye, the tongue' and the nose; and sound, touch, form, taste, and scent, as also speech, the two arins, the two feet, the lower duct (within the body), and the organ of pleasure.", 'sn': 'अव्यक्तं च महान्तं च तथाहङ्कार एव च। पृथिवी वायुराकाशमापो ज्योतिश्च पञ्चमम्॥ एताः प्रकृतयस्त्वष्टौ विकारानपि मे शृणु। श्रोत्रं त्वक्चैव चक्षुश्च जिह्वा घ्राणं च पञ्चमम्॥ शब्दः स्पर्शच रूपं च रसो गन्धस्तथैव च। वाक् च हस्तौ च पादौ च पायुर्मेद्रं तथैव च॥'}

{'en': 'The ten commencing with sound, and originating from the five great principles, are called Vishesha. The five senses of knowledge are called Savishesha, O king of Mithila.', 'sn': 'एते विशेषा राजेन्द्र महाभूतेषु पञ्चसु। बुद्धीन्द्रियाण्यथैतानि सविशेषाणि मैथिल॥'}

{'en': 'Persons conversant with the spiritual science consider the Mind as the sixteenth. This is agreeable to your own views as also to those of other learned men well acquainted with the truths about principles.', 'sn': 'मनः षोडशकं प्राहुरध्यात्मगतिचिन्तकाः। त्वं चैवान्ये च विद्वांसस्तत्त्वबुद्धिविशारदाः॥'}

{'en': 'From the Unmanifest, O king, originates the Greatness. The learned say this to be the first creation relating to Nature.', 'sn': 'अव्यक्ताच्च महानात्मा समुत्पद्यति पार्थिव। प्रथमं सर्गमित्येतदाहुः प्राधानिकं बुधाः॥'}

{'en': 'From Greatness, O king of men, originates Consciousness. This has been designated the second creation having the Understanding for its essence.', 'sn': 'महतश्चाप्यहङ्कार उत्पन्नो हि नराधिप। द्वितीयं सर्गमित्याहुरेतद् बुद्ध्यात्मकं स्मृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'From Consciousness has originated the Mind which is the essence of sound and the others that are the qualities of ether and the rest. This is the third creation, relating to Consciousness.', 'sn': 'अहङ्काराच्च सम्भूतं मनो भूतगुणात्मकम्। तृतीयः सर्ग इत्येष आहङ्कारिक उच्यते॥'}
{'en': 'From Mind have originated the great elements, O king! This is the fourth creation called mental.', 'sn': 'मनसस्तु समुद्भूता महाभूता नराधिप। चतुर्थं सर्गमित्येतन्मानसं विद्धि मे मतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Persons conversant with the principal elements hold that Sound and Touch and Form and Taste and Scent are the fifth creation, relating to the Great elements.', 'sn': 'शब्दः स्पर्शश्च रूपं च रसो गन्धस्तथैव च। पञ्चमं सर्गमित्याहुभौतिकं भूतचिन्तकाः॥'}

{'en': 'The creation of the Ear, the Skin, the Eye, the Tongue, and the Scent, forms the sixth and is considered as having for its essence multiplicity of thought.', 'sn': 'चक्षुश्च जिह्वा घ्राणं च पञ्चमम्। सर्गं तु षष्ठमित्याहुर्बहुचिन्तात्मकं स्मृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'The senses that come after the Ear and the others then originate, O king. This is called seventh creation and relates to the senses of knowledge.', 'sn': 'अधः श्रोत्रेन्द्रियग्राम उत्पद्यति नराधिप। सप्तमं सर्गमित्याहुरेतदैन्द्रियकं स्मृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then, O king, come the vital air that rises upwards and those that go downwards. This is the eighth creation and called Arjjva (straight).', 'sn': 'श्रोत्रं त्व त्वक् चैव ऊर्ध्वं स्रोतस्तथा तिर्यगुत्पद्यति नराधिप। अष्टमं सर्गमित्याहुरेतदार्जवकं स्मृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then come those vital airs which move transversely in the lower parts of the body and also that called Apana passing downwards. This, the ninth creation, is also called Arjjava, O king.', 'sn': 'तिर्यस्रोतस्त्वधःस्रोत उत्पद्यति नराधिप। नवमं सर्गमित्याहुरेतदार्जवकं बुधाः॥'}

{'en': 'These nine kinds of creation, and these principles, O king, which are twenty-four in number, are described to you according to what has been laid down in the scriptures.', 'sn': 'एतानि नव सर्गाणि तत्त्वानि च नराधिप। चतुर्विंशतिरुक्तानि यथाश्रुतिनिदर्शनात्॥'}

{'en': 'After this, O king, listen to me as I tell you the durations of time as said by the learned regarding these principles or attributes.', 'sn': 'अत ऊर्ध्वं महाराज गुणस्यैतस्य तत्त्वतः। महात्मभिरनुप्रोक्तां कालसंख्यां निबोध मे॥'}

{'en': 'Arjuna said: Then, O Bharata, furnished with arms, all the Nivatakavacha flew in a body towards me furiously in battle,', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच ततो निवातकवचाः सर्वे वेगेन भारत। अभ्यद्रवन् मां सहिताः प्रगृहीतायुधा रणे।॥'}

{'en': 'Those mighty car-warriors obstructing the course of the car and uttering loud yells and surrounding me on all sides, enveloped me with downpours of arrows.', 'sn': 'आच्छाद्य स्थपन्थानमुत्क्रोशन्तो महारथाः। आवृत्य सर्वतस्ते मां शरवर्षैरवाकिरन्।॥'}
{'en': 'Then other demons, of great strength armed with spears and Pattishas, hurled at me spears and Bhushundis.', 'sn': 'ततोऽपरे महावीर्याः शूलपट्टिशपाणयः। शूलानि च भुशुण्डीश्च मुमुचुर्दानवा मयि॥'}
{'en': 'That continuous discharge of spears together with maces and clubs fell upon my car.', 'sn': 'तच्छूलवर्ष सुमहद् गदाशक्तिसमाकुलम्। अनिशं सृज्यमानं तैरपतन्मद्रथोपरि॥'}

{'en': 'Other dreadful and terrible-looking Nivatakavachas, dexterous in hurling (weapons) and armed with sharpened weapons and bows, rushed at me in fight.', 'sn': 'अन्ये मामभ्यधावन्त निवातकवचा युधि। शितशस्त्रायुधा रौद्राः कालरूपाः प्रहारिणः॥'}

{'en': 'I (on my part) in the encounter, discharging several fleet arrows coursing straight, from the Gandiva, pierced each of them with ten (shafts).', 'sn': 'तानहं विविधैर्बाणैर्वेगवद्भिरजिह्मगैः। गाण्डीवमुक्तैरभ्यनमेकैकं दशभिर्मधे॥'}

{'en': '(And) I drove them back by those arrows of mine sharpened on stones. Then those horses being swiftly driven by Matali,', 'sn': 'ते कृता विमुखाः सर्वे मत्प्रयुक्तैः शिलाशितैः। ततो मातलिना तूर्णं हयास्ते सम्प्रचोदिताः॥'}

{'en': 'Careered through several courses with the spread of the wind and being dexterously guided by Matali, trampled upon the sons of Diti.', 'sn': 'मार्गान् बहुविधांस्तत्र विचेरुर्वातरंहसः। सुसंयता मातलिना प्रामनन्त दितेः सुतान्॥'}

{'en': '(And) Though that mighty car was yoked with hundreds of horses, yet being skillfully driven by Matali, as they began to move, it seemed as if they were a few only.', 'sn': 'शतं शतास्ते हरयस्तस्मिन् युक्ता महारथे। शान्ता मातलिना यत्ता व्यचरन्नल्पका इव॥'}

{'en': 'By the press of their hoofs and by the thundering noise of the car-wheels and by the discharge of my arrows hundreds of demons fell dead.', 'sn': 'तेषां चरणपातेन स्थनेमिस्वनेन च। मम बाणनिपातैश्च हतास्ते शतशोऽसुराः॥'}

{'en': 'Others, holding their bows in their hands, even when deprived of life and their charioteers being slain, were carried (hither and thither) by the horses.', 'sn': 'गतासवस्तथैवान्ये प्रगृहीतशरासनाः। हतसारथयस्तत्र व्यकृष्यन्त तुरंगमैः॥'}

{'en': '(And) all those dexterous in striking, obstructing all sides and directions, became engaged in the fight with various weapons, at which my mind was distressed.', 'sn': 'ते दिशो विदिशः सर्वे प्रतिरुध्य प्रहारिणः। अभ्यघ्नन् विविधैः शस्त्रैस्ततो मे व्यथितं मनः॥'}
{'en': 'Then the prowess of Matali appeared highly wonderful to me in that he guided the swift steeds with ease.', 'sn': 'ततोऽहं मातलेौर्यमपश्यं परमाद्भुतम्। अश्वांस्तथा वेगवतो यदयत्नादधारयत्॥'}

{'en': 'O king, then, in the fight, I cut off the Danavas by hundreds and thousands who were furnished with arms, by various swift weapons.', 'sn': 'ततोऽहं लघुभिश्चित्रैरस्त्रैस्तानसुरान् रणे। चिच्छेद सायुधान् राजन् शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः॥'}

{'en': 'O destroyer of foes, the heroic charioteer of Shakra, Matali, seeing me thus course there (on the field of battle) exerting my utmost, became well pleased (with me).', 'sn': 'एवं मे चरतस्तत्र सर्वयत्नेन शत्रुहन्। प्रीतिमानभवद् वीरो मातलिः शक्रसारथिः॥'}

{'en': 'Then, some (of the Danavas) crushed by the horses and the car, met with destruction and some gave up fighting; while others, in the encounter, challenged by us and afflicted with arrows, opposed me by heavy downpour of shafts.', 'sn': 'वध्यमानास्ततस्तैस्तु हयैस्तेन रथेन च। अगमन् प्रक्षयं केचित्र्यवर्तन्त तथा परे॥ स्पर्धमाना इवास्माभिर्निवातकवचा रणे। शरवर्षेः शरार्तं मां महद्भिः प्रत्यवारयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon, I began to consume them with hundreds and thousands of ornamented swift arrows inspired with Mantras relating to the weapon of Brahma.', 'sn': 'ततोऽहं लघुभिश्चित्रैर्ब्रह्मास्त्रपरिमन्त्रितैः। व्यधर्म सायकैराशु शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः॥'}

{'en': 'Then those mighty demons sore pressed by me and fired with anger, afflicted me with simultaneous discharge of clubs, darts and swords.', 'sn': 'ततः सम्पीडयमानास्ते क्रोधाविष्टा महारथाः। अपीडयन् मां सहिताः शरशूलासिवृष्टिभिः॥'}

{'en': 'O Bharata, I then, took up that favourite weapon of the lord of the gods, named, Madhava, possessed of exceedingly fiery energy.', 'sn': 'ततोऽहमस्त्रमातिष्ठं परमं तिग्मतैजसम्। दयितं देवराजस्य माधवं नाम भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Then by the power of that weapon, I cut, to a hundred pieces, the swords, tridents and thousands of Tomaras hurled by them.', 'sn': 'ततः खङ्गास्त्रिशूलांश्च तोमरांश्च सहस्रशः। अस्त्रवीर्येण शतधा तैर्मुक्तानहमच्छिदम्॥'}
{'en': 'Having destroyed their weapons, wrathfully pierced each of them with ten arrows.', 'sn': 'छित्त्वा प्रहरणान्येषां ततस्तानपि सर्वशः। प्रत्यविध्यमहं रोषाद् दशभिर्दशभिः शरैः॥'}

{'en': 'And the fact that on the battle field mighty arrows like (thick flights of black bees), were discharged from the Gandiva, was admired by Matali.', 'sn': 'गाण्डीवाद्धि तदा संख्ये यथा भ्रमरपक्तयः। निष्पतन्ति महाबाणास्तन्मातलिरपूजयत्॥'}

{'en': 'And the skillfulness with which displaying prowess, I cut off, with my shafts, their arrows which completely surrounded me, drew admiration from Matali.', 'sn': 'तेषामपि तु बाणास्ते तन्मातलिरपूजयत्। अवाकिरन् मां बलवत् तानहं व्यधमं शरैः॥'}
{'en': 'Being struck, those Nivatakavachas again completely surrounded me with a mighty discharge of arrows.', 'sn': 'वध्यमानास्ततस्ते तु निवातकवचाः पुनः। शरवर्षैर्महद्भिर्मां समन्तात् पर्यवारयन्॥'}

{'en': 'Having arrested the career of their shafts by excellent, fleet and blazing weapons inspired with mantras, capable of destroying (other) weapons, I pierced them by thousands.', 'sn': 'शरवेगानिहत्याहमस्त्रैरस्त्रैविघातिभिः। ज्वलद्भिः परमैः शी।स्तानविध्यं सहस्रशः॥'}

{'en': 'Like waters running down from the summit of mountains, in the rainy season, blood began to flow from their mangled bodies.', 'sn': 'तेषां छिन्नानि गात्राणि विसृजन्ति स्म शोणितम्। प्रावृषीवाभिवृष्टानि शृङ्गाण्यथधराभृताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Smitten by mighty, fleet and straightcoursing arrows having the touch of the thunderbolt hurled by Indra, those Danavas became greatly agitated.', 'sn': 'इन्द्राशनिसमस्पर्शर्वेगवद्भिरजिह्मगैः। मद्बाणैर्वध्यमानास्ते समुद्विग्नाः स्म दानवाः॥'}

{'en': 'Their bodies were cut to a hundred pieces and their weapons lost their energy. Then those Nivatakavachas began fighting with me by the help of illusion.', 'sn': 'शतधा भिन्नदेहास्ते क्षीणप्रहरणौजसः। ततो निवातकवचा मामयुध्यन्त मायया॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : The high-minded Pandavas while residing in the forest of Dvaita that great forest was filled with Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच वसत्सु वै द्वैतवने पाण्डवेषु महात्मसु। अनुकीर्णं महारण्यं ब्राह्मणैः समपद्यत॥'}

{'en': 'Resounding always and all over with the recitations of the Veda, the lake of the forest became as holy as the region of Brahma.', 'sn': 'ईर्यमाणेन सततं ब्रह्मघोषेण सर्वशः। ब्रह्मलोकसमं पुण्यमासीद् द्वैतवनं सरः॥'}

{'en': 'The sounds of Yajus, Riks, Saman and other words uttered by the Brahmanas, were exceedingly charming.', 'sn': 'यजुषामृचां साम्नां च गद्यानां चैव सर्वशः। आसीदुच्चार्यमाणानां नि:स्वनो हृदयङ्गमः॥'}

{'en': 'The Vedic recitations of the high-minded Brahmanas, mingling with twang of the bows of the sons of Pritha brought about a delightful union of the Brahmana and Kshatriya customs.', 'sn': 'ज्याघोषश्चैव पार्थानां ब्रह्मघोषश्चधीमताम्। संसृष्टं ब्रह्मणा क्षत्रं भूय एव व्यरोचत्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon one evening (the Rishi) Baka of the Dalvya family addressed the son of Kunti, the pious king Yudhishthira seated in the midst of the Rishis.', 'sn': 'अथाब्रवीद् बको दालभ्योधर्मराज युधिष्ठिरम्। सध्यां कौन्तेयमासीनमृषिभिः परिवारितम्॥'}

{'en': '“Behold, O Partha, O Kuru chief, in this forest Dvaita the hour of the ascetic Brahmanas for performing Homa when the (sacred) fires have all been enkindled.', 'sn': 'पश्य द्वैतवने पार्थ ब्राह्मणानां तपस्विनाम्। होमवेलां कुरुश्रेष्ठ सम्प्रज्वलितपावकाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Being protected by you, they of firm vows, are observing their religious rites in this sacred (forest). Bhrigu and Angiras together with Vasishtha and Kashyapa, the renowned sons of Agastya, the offspring of Atri, all of excellent vows, in face, all the leading Brahmanas of the world are united with you.', 'sn': 'चरन्तिधर्मं पुण्येऽस्मिंस्त्वया गुप्ताधृतव्रताः। भृगवोऽङ्गिरसश्चैव वासिष्ठाः काश्यपैः सह॥ आगस्त्याश्च महाभागा आत्रेयाश्चोत्तमव्रताः। सर्वस्य जगतः श्रेष्ठा ब्राह्मणाः संगतास्त्वया।॥'}

{'en': 'O son of Pritha, O son of Kunti, O descendant of Kuru, hear along with your brothers what I speak to you.', 'sn': 'इदं तु वचनं पार्थ शृणुष्व गदतो मम। भ्रातृभिः सह कौन्तेय यत् त्वा वक्ष्यामि कौरव॥'}

{'en': 'Brahima-energy combined with Kshatriyaenergy, Brahma-prowess united with Kshatriya-prowess, when rendered strong, might consume the enemies as fire united with the wind consumes the forest.', 'sn': 'ब्रह्म क्षत्रेण संसृष्टं क्षत्रं च ब्रह्मणा सह। उदीर्णे दहतः शत्रून् वनानीवाग्निमारुतौ॥'}

{'en': 'O my son, O king, one should never be without a Brahmana, if he wished to conquer this world and the next for long. Having got a Brahmana, well-versed in religion and worldly affairs and cleansed of passion and folly a king destroys his enemies.', 'sn': 'दिच्छन्निमं लोकममुं च जेतुम्। विनीतधर्मार्थमपेतमोहं लब्ध्वा द्विजं नुदति नृपः सपत्नान्॥'}

{'en': 'Having governed his subjects, the King Bali performed those duties that lead to salvation and did not know of any other means in this world than the Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'चरन् नैःश्रेयसंधर्म प्रजापालनकारितम्। नाध्यगच्छद् बलिलकि तीर्थमन्यत्र वै द्विजात्॥'}

{'en': "It was for this, that all the desires of the Asura (Bali) Virochana's son, were satisfied and his wealth was even inexhaustible. Having obtained (the entire) carth through the instrumentality of the Brahmanas, he met with destruction when he began to oppress (people).", 'sn': 'वैरोचनेः श्रीरपि चाक्षयाऽऽसीत्। लब्वा महीं ब्राह्मणसम्प्रयोगात् तेष्वाचरन् दुष्टमथो व्यनश्यत्॥'}

{'en': 'The earth with her wealth, never worships him for long, as her lord, who is without a Brahmana. The earth however surrounded by the sea worships him who is governed by a Brahmana and is instructed by him regarding his duties.', 'sn': 'वर्णं द्वितीयं भजते चिराय। समुद्रनेमिनमते तु तस्मै यं ब्राह्मणः शास्ति नयैर्विनीतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Like an elephant without a driver in battle, the strength of a Kshatriya, without a Brahmana, decreases.', 'sn': 'कुञ्जरस्येव संग्रामे परिगृह्याङ्कुशग्रहम्। ब्राह्मणैर्विप्रहीणस्य क्षत्रस्य क्षीयते बलम्॥'}

{'en': 'Incomparable is the sight of a Brahmana and the might of a Kshatriyas; when they proceed in unision the whole world is delighted.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मण्यनुपमा दृष्टिः क्षात्रमप्रतिमं बलम्। तौ यदा चरतः सार्धं तदा लोकः प्रसीदति॥'}

{'en': 'As fire rendered stronger by the win destroys straw and woo, so kings united with Brahmanas destroy (all their) enemies.', 'sn': 'यथा हि सुमहानग्निः कक्षं दहति सानिलः। तथा दहति राजन्यो ब्राह्मणेन समं रिपुम्॥'}

{'en': 'An intelligent man, for acquiring what he has not got and for multiplying what he has got, should take the advice of the Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मणेष्वेव मेधावी बुद्धिपर्येषणं चरेत्। अलब्धस्य च लाभाय लब्धस्य परिवृद्धये॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore for obtaining what you have not got and multiplying what you have got and for spending that on proper objects and persons, do keep with you a Brahmana of fame, wise, experienced and well-versed in the knowledge of the Vedas.', 'sn': 'अलब्धलाभाय च लब्धवृद्धये यथार्हतीर्थप्रतिपादनाय यशस्विनं वेदविदं विपश्चितं बहुश्रुतं ब्राह्मणमेव वासय॥'}

{'en': 'O Yudhishthira, you have always highly respected the Brahmanas, it is for this that your reputation shines brilliantly in the three worlds.', 'sn': 'ब्राह्मणेषूत्तमा वृत्तिस्तव नित्यं युधिष्ठिर। तेन ते सर्वलोकेषु दीप्यते प्रथितं यशः॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Then all the Brahinanas, who were with Yudhishthira, adored Baka of Dalvya family; and hearing him eulogize Yudhishthira they were greatly delighted.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततस्ते ब्राह्मणाः सर्वे बकं दाल्भ्यमपूजयन्। युधिष्ठिरे स्तूयमाने भूयः सुमनसोऽभवन्॥'}

{'en': 'Dvaipayana, Narada, Jamadagni, Pithushrava, Indradyumna, Bhalaki, Kritachetas, Sahasrapat, Karnasravas, Munja, Lavanashva, Kashyapa, Harita, Sthulakarna, Agnivishya, Saunaka, Kritavak, Suvak, Vrihadashya, Vibhavasu, Urdharetas, Vrishamitra, Suhotra, Hotravahana, all these and many other Brahmanas of firm vows worshipped Yudhishthira like celestials sages worshipping Purandara in the celestials region.', 'sn': 'द्वैपायनो नारदश्च जामदग्न्यः पृथुश्रवाः। इन्द्रद्युम्नो भालुकिश्च कृतचेताः सहस्रपात्॥ कर्णश्रवाश्च मुञ्जश्च लवणाश्वश्च काश्यपः। हारीतः स्थूणकर्णश्च अग्निवेश्योऽथ शौनकः॥ कृतवाक् च सुवाक् चैव बृहदश्वो विभावसुः। ऊर्ध्वरेतो वृषामित्रः सुहोत्रो होत्रवाहनः॥ एते चान्ये च बहवो ब्राह्मणाः संशितव्रतः। अजातशत्रुमानचुः पुरंदरमिवर्षयः॥'}

{'en': 'Kunti said In this connection is cited the old story of the conversation between Vidula and her son, O chastiser of foes.', 'sn': 'कुन्त्युवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। विदुलायाश्च संवादं पुत्रस्य च परंतप॥'}

{'en': 'It is proper that you should tell (Yudhishthira) the words of that story or anything better than that. There was a lady born in a noble family who had great renown and was wrathful.', 'sn': 'अत्र श्रेयश्च भूयश्च यथावद् वक्तुमर्हसि। यशस्विनी मन्युमती कुले जाता विभावरी॥'}

{'en': 'She was attached to the duties of a Kshatriya princess and her name was Vidula, She possessed great foresight and had senses under control; her name was known to all kings and she was very learned for hearing speeches of eminent men.', 'sn': 'क्षत्रधर्मरता दान्ता विदुला दीर्घदर्शिनी। विश्रुता राजसंसत्सु श्रुतवाक्या बहुश्रुता।॥'}

{'en': 'The princess Vidula thus censured her own son who, being defeated by the king of the Sindhus, was lying down with a sorrowful heart.', 'sn': 'विदुला नाम राजन्या जगहें पुत्रमौरसम्। निर्जितं सिन्धुराजेन शयानं दीनचेतसम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vidula said I have begotten a son who does not delight me but on the other hand increases the joys of our enemies. By me nor by your father have you been begotten. Where have you come from?', 'sn': 'विदुलोवाच अनन्दन मया जात द्विषतां हर्षवर्धन। न मया त्वं न पित्रा च जातः क्वाभ्यागतो ह्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'Being the reverse of wrathful you cannot be reckoned among men and your features possess no signs of prowess. Throughout your life you are in despair; for your sake, and your welfare, bear the burden of life manfully.', 'sn': 'निर्मन्युश्चाप्यसंख्येयः पुरुषः क्लीबसाधनः। यावज्जीवं निराशोऽसि कल्याणाय धुरं वह॥'}

{'en': 'Do not think lightly of your own soul and do not let it be satisfied with a little; having set your mind on very great desirable objects, be not afraid and abandon your misgivings.', 'sn': 'माऽऽत्मानमवमन्यस्व मैनमल्पेन बीभरः। मनः कृत्वा सुकल्याणं मा भैस्त्वं प्रतिसंहर॥'}

{'en': 'Rise, O coward, do not remain inactive in this way being defeated, thereby increasing the joys of our enemies, affording cause for grief to your friends and regardless of everything.', 'sn': 'उत्तिष्ठ हे कापुरुष मा शेष्वैवं पराजितः। अमित्रान् नन्दयन् सर्वान् निर्मानो बन्धुशोकदः॥'}

{'en': 'Bad (small) rivers are filled with a handful water and douses are satisfied with little and a coward is ever well satisfied, for a little satisfies him.', 'sn': 'सुपूरा वै कुनदिका सुपूरो मूषिकाञ्जलिः। सुसंतोषः कापुरुषः स्वल्पकेनैव तुष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Rather die in the act of rooting out the fangs of a snake than roam about like a dog and exercise your prowess even at the risk of life.', 'sn': 'अप्यहेरारुजन् दंष्ट्रामाश्वेव निधनं व्रजा अपि वा संशयं प्राप्य जीवितेऽपि पराक्रमः॥'}

{'en': 'Or be on the look out for the holes of your enemies like a hawk roaming about in the sky or you show your prowess and fight without any doubts in your mind.', 'sn': 'अप्यरेः श्येनवच्छिद्रं पश्येस्त्वं विपरिक्रमन्। विवदन् वाथवा तूष्णीं व्योम्नि वापरिशङ्कितः॥'}

{'en': 'Why are you lying down like a dead body being struck with thunder? Rise, O coward, and do not lie down defeated by your enemies.', 'sn': 'त्वमेवं प्रेतवच्छेघे कस्माद् वज्रहतो यथा। उत्तिष्ठ हे कापुरुष मा स्वाप्सीः शत्रुनिर्जितः॥'}

{'en': 'Do not vanish away into darkness so miserably; let yourself be heard about by your deeds; do not stand in the second rank, nor in the third nor in the last but stand proudly first.', 'sn': 'मास्तं गमस्त्वं कृपणो विश्रूयस्व स्वकर्मणा। मा मध्ये मा जघन्ये त्वं माऽधो भूस्तिष्ठ गर्जितः॥'}

{'en': 'Blaze up even for a moment like a piece of Tindula wood and do not like the fire of husk smoke away fireless out of your desire of life.', 'sn': 'अलातं तिन्दुकस्येव मुहूर्तमपि विज्वल। मा तुषाग्निरिवान—िमायस्व जिजीविषुः॥'}

{'en': 'A momentary blaze is better than smoking for a long time; let not there be born in a royal house a prince who is too harsh or who is too soft-minded.', 'sn': 'मुहूर्तं ज्वलितं श्रेयो न च धूमायितं चिरम्। मा ह स्म कस्यचिद् गेहे जनि राज्ञः खरो मृदुः॥'}

{'en': 'Doing the deed of men and achieving every feat that is really great in a field of battle a man satisfied the duties of his order and has no reason to find fault with himself.', 'sn': 'कृत्वा मानुष्यकं कर्म सृत्वाजिं यावदुत्तमम्। धर्मस्यानृण्यमाप्नोति न चात्मानं विगर्हते॥'}

{'en': 'A wise man grieves not whether he is successful or not in his object; on the contrary he commences what ought to be done under the altered circumstances without caring for his life.', 'sn': 'अलब्वा यदि वा लब्ध्वा नानुशोचति पण्डितः। आनन्तर्यं चारभते न प्राणानां धनायते॥'}

{'en': 'Show forth your own power or meet with your sure end only playing at your back (making it a secondary consideration) why do you live my son?', 'sn': 'उद्भावयस्व वीर्यं वा तां वा गच्छ ध्रुवां गतिम्। धर्म पुत्राग्रतः कृत्वा किंनिमित्तं हि जीवसि॥'}

{'en': 'The fruits of the sacrificial rites performed by you, O coward, and all your renown are all destroyed; the roots of your enjoyment are all cut up; for what reason do you live on?', 'sn': 'इष्टापूर्तं हि ते क्लीब कीर्तिश्च सकला हता। विच्छिन्नं भोगमूलं ते किंनिमित्तं हि जीवसि॥'}

{'en': 'When about to fall down (in wrestling) an enemy should be held by the thing and made to fall down also even when cut up to the roots, one should not grieve.', 'sn': 'शत्रुर्निमज्जता ग्राह्यो जवायां प्रपतिष्यता। विपरिच्छिन्नमूलोऽपि न विषीदेत् कथंचन॥'}

{'en': 'Remembering the exertion made by horses of good breed in moving heavy weight know what in your own manliness lies and bring together all you sense of honour and energy.', 'sn': 'उद्यम्य धुरमुत्कर्षेदाजानेयकृतं स्मरन्। कुरु सत्त्वं च मानं च विद्धि पौरुषमात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'Raise up the race that has been sunk in infamy by your own doings. The man, whose great and wonderful feats men do not talk about.', 'sn': 'उद्भावय कुलं मग्नं त्वत्कृते स्वयमेव हि। यस्य वृत्तं न जल्पन्ति मानवा महदद्भुतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Goes only to increase the common heard; he is neither a woman nor a man; he chose fame is not spoken about in gifts, devolution and truth', 'sn': 'राशिवर्धनमात्रं स नैव स्त्री न पुनः पुमान्। दाने तपसि सत्ये च यस्य नोच्चरितं यशः॥'}

{'en': 'And in learning and attainment of wealth is but the excretion of his mother. Whereas learning, devotion, in prosperity or prowess.', 'sn': 'विद्यायामर्थलाभे वा मातुरुच्चार एव सः। श्रुतेन तपसा वापि श्रिया वा विक्रमेण वा॥'}

{'en': 'The man who suppress another or in deeds is a man indeed. It is not proper that you should adopt a life which is idle and wretched,', 'sn': 'जनान् योऽभिभवत्यन्यान् कर्मणा हि स वै पुमान्। न त्वेव जाल्पी कापाली वृत्तिमेषितुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'Compassionate leading to infamy and miserable which is suitable only for a coward; in such a case enemies rejoice over such a weak man.', 'sn': 'नृशंस्यामयशस्यां च दुःखां कापुरुषोचिताम्। यमेनमभिनन्देयुरमित्राः पुरुषं कृशम्॥'}

{'en': 'Held in contempt and destitute of seats and robes; they express surprise and gratification at small earnings, are means, have no courage and are low.', 'sn': 'लोकस्य समवज्ञातं निहीनासनवाससम्। अहो लाभकर हीनमल्पजीवनमल्पकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Friends derive no happiness from gaining such a friend; being exiled from a kingdom we shall die destitute of the means of earning our livelihood,', 'sn': 'नेदृशं बन्धुमासाद्य बान्धवः सुखमेधते। अवृत्त्यैव विपत्स्यामो वयं राष्ट्रात् प्रवासिताः॥'}

{'en': 'Deprived of all desires and enjoyments, turned out from our place and having nothing at all. Misbehaving among a race of honest men and the destroyer of the fame of his race and family.', 'sn': 'सर्वकामरसैींनाः स्थानभ्रष्टा अकिंचनाः। अवल्गुकारिणं सत्सु कुलवंशस्य नाशनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Kali himself in the shape of yourself, my son Sanjaya, has been brought forth, by me who has no wealth in him no energy, no prowess, and is the delighted of his enemies.', 'sn': 'कलिं पुत्रप्रवादेन संजय त्वामजीजनम्। निरमर्षं निरुत्साहं निर्वीर्यमरिनन्दनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Let no woman bring forth such a son; do not smoke away but blaze up and exercising your prowess slay your enemies.', 'sn': 'मा स्म सीमन्तिनी काचिज्जनयेत् पुत्रमीदृशम्। मा धूमाय ज्वलात्यन्तमाक्रम्य जहि शात्रवान्॥'}

{'en': 'Blaze over the heads of enemies for a moment or even for a small bit of time; those are indeed men who are wrathful and who exercise no forgiveness.', 'sn': 'ज्वल मूर्धन्यमित्राणां मुहूर्तमपि वा क्षणम्। एतावानेव पुरुषो यदमर्षी यदक्षमी॥'}

{'en': 'One, destitute of wrath and given to the exercise of forgiveness, is neither a woman nor a man; satisfaction destroys prosperity so does softness of heart.', 'sn': 'क्षमावान् निरमर्षश्च नैव स्त्री न पुनः पुमान्। संतोषो वै श्रियं हन्ति तथानुक्रोश एव च॥'}

{'en': 'And so do these two namely want of exertion and fear; one without exertion never attains to greatness; free your soul, by your own exertions of these defects which lead to ruin.', 'sn': 'अनुत्थानभये चोभे निरीहो नाश्नुते महत्। एभ्यो निकृतिपापेभ्यः प्रमुञ्चात्मानमात्मना॥'}

{'en': 'Making your heart one of steel, hunt for the recovery of your lost wealth; one is called a man (Purusha) for he vanquishes the enemy (Param).', 'sn': 'आयसं हृदयं कृत्वा मृगयस्व पुनः स्वकम्। परं विषहते यस्मात् तस्मात् पुरुष उच्यते॥'}

{'en': 'He is said to bear the false name of Purusha) who leads in this world the life of a woman. A hero of mighty strength and acting like a powerful lion,', 'sn': 'तमाहुर्व्यर्थनामानं स्त्रीवद् य इह जीवति। शूरस्योर्जितसत्त्वस्य सिंहविक्रान्तचारिणः॥'}

{'en': 'May be subject to the influence of his fate but even in such a case his subjects rejoice; for he who leaving his own happiness hunts for the prosperity (of his kingdom) very contributes to the rejoicing of his ministers. soon', 'sn': 'दिष्टभावं गतस्यापि विषये मोदते प्रजा। य आत्मनः प्रियसुखे हित्वा मृगयते श्रियम्॥ अमात्यानामथो हर्षमादधात्यचिरेण सः॥'}

{'en': 'The son said If you do not behold me, what is this entire earth to you; what will your ornaments do for you, and what is the use of enjoyments and what even of life itself.', 'sn': 'पुत्र उवाच किं नु ते मामपश्यन्त्याः पृथिव्या अपि सर्वया। किमाभरणकृत्यं ते किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा॥'}

{'en': 'The mother said The world which is (reserved) for the poor and miserable, may our enemies attain to; and may our well-wishers roam about in the earth which is (reserved) for respected souls.', 'sn': 'मातोवाच किमद्यकानां ये लोका द्विषन्तस्तानवाप्नुयुः। ये त्वादृतात्मनां लोकाः सुहृदस्तान् ब्रजन्तु नः॥'}

{'en': 'Do not follow the life of those who are devoid of attendants, who subsist on the food given by others (by way of charity); who are miserable and who are devoid of strength and prowess.', 'sn': 'भृत्यैविहीयमानानां परपिण्डोपजीविनाम्। कृपणानामसत्त्वानां मा वृत्तिमनुवर्तिथाः॥'}

{'en': 'May the Brahmanas and your wellwishers, my son, live depend on you as living creatures depend on the clouds (rain) and as the gods depend on the performer of a hundred sacrifices.', 'sn': 'अनु त्वां तात जीवन्तु ब्राह्मणाः सुहृदस्तथा। पर्जन्यमिव भूतानि देवा इव शतक्रतुम्॥'}

{'en': 'The man, depending on whom all living creatures depend, O Sanjaya as (birds) on a tree with ripe fruits, has his life rendered useful.', 'sn': 'यमाजीवन्ति पुरुषं सर्वभूतानि संजय। पक्वं दुममिवासाद्य तस्य जीवितमर्थवत्॥'}

{'en': 'The hero, by whose prowess his friends attain to happiness like the gods attaining to happiness through Shakra has his life blessed.', 'sn': 'यस्य शूरस्य विक्रान्तैरेधन्ते बान्धवाः सुखम्। त्रिदशा इव शक्रस्य साधु तस्येह जीवितम्॥'}

{'en': 'That son of Manu, who lives on the strength of his arms, gets renown in this world and a blissful one here after.', 'sn': 'स्वबाहुबलमाश्रित्य योऽभ्युज्जीवति मानवः। स लोके लभते कीर्ति परत्र च शुभां गतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Then king Duryodhana, Shakuni the son of Subala, your son Dushasana and the invincible son of Suta,', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच ततो दुर्योधनो राजा शकुनिश्चापि सौबलः। दुःशासनश्च पुत्रस्ते सूतपुत्रश्च दुर्जयः॥'}

{'en': "These assembled together, O monarch, began to consult as to 'how could the sons of Pandu with their partisans be conquered in battle.'", 'sn': 'समागम्य महाराज मन्त्रं चक्रुर्विवक्षितम्। कथं पाण्डुसुताः संख्ये जेतव्याः सगणा इति॥'}

{'en': 'Thereafter king Duryodhana, addressing the son of Suta and the highly powerful son of Subala, spoke to all his counselors thus', 'sn': 'ततो दुर्योधनो राजा सर्वांस्तानाह मन्त्रिणः। सूतपुत्रं समाभाष्य सौबलं च महाबलम्॥'}

{'en': '“Even Drona, Bhishma, Kripa, Shalya, and the son of Somadatta cannot withstand the sons of Pritha in battle. I know not what the cause may be.', 'sn': 'द्रोणो भीष्मः कृपः शल्यः सौमदत्तिश्च संयुगे। न पार्थान् प्रतिबाधन्ते न जाने तच्च कारणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thus unslain, they (the Pandavas) are every day reducing my troops in great number. Therefore, O Karna, I am becoming weaker in strength, and my store of weapons is also being exhausted.', 'sn': 'अवध्यमानास्ते चापि क्षपयन्ति बलं मम। सोऽस्मि क्षीणबलः कर्ण क्षीणशस्त्रश्च संयुगे॥ निकृतः पाण्डवैः शूरैरवध्यैर्दैवतैरपि।'}

{'en': "I am deceived by the warlike Pandavas, who cannot even be slain by the celestial themselves. I am doubtful of the means as to how to smile them down in battle.” To these words of the ruler of men, O king, Suta's son replied", 'sn': 'सोऽहं संशयमापन्नः प्रहरिष्ये कथं रणे॥ तमब्रवीन्महाराजं सूतपुत्रो नराधिपम्।'}

{'en': 'Karna said "Grieve not, O foremost of the Bharatas, I will compass your pleasure. Let Bhishma the son of Shantanu be speedily withdrawn from the battle.', 'sn': 'कर्ण उवाच मा शोच भरतश्रेष्ठ करिष्येऽहं प्रियं तव।॥ भीष्मः शान्तवस्तूर्णमपयातु महारणात्।'}

{'en': 'When, O scion of the Bharata race, the son of Ganga shall cease to fight, and when he shall lay aside his weapons, I will slay the sons of Pritha together with all the Somakas,', 'sn': 'निवृत्ते युधि गाङ्गेये न्यस्तशस्त्रे च भारत॥ अहं पार्थान् हनिष्यामि सहितान् सर्वसोमकैः।'}

{'en': 'In the battle even before the eyes of Bhishma himself. O king, I pledge my troth for this. Bhishma always uses the Pandavas leniently.', 'sn': 'पश्यतो युधि भीष्मस्य शपे सत्येन ते नृप॥ पाण्डवेषु दयां नित्यं स हि भीष्मः करोति वै।'}

{'en': 'Bhishma also is incapable of conquering these mighty car-warriors (the Pandavas) in battle. Moreover Bhishma is proud in battle and is very fond of battle.', 'sn': 'अशक्तश्च रणे भीष्मो जेतुमेतान् महारथान्।॥ अभिमानी रणे भीष्मो नित्यं चापि रणप्रियः।'}

{'en': 'How could he, O sire, then conquer the Pandavas who have mustered a mighty force. Therefore, without the least delay, haying yourself towards the tent of Bhishma.', 'sn': 'स कथं पाण्डवान् युद्धे जेष्यते तातं संगतान्॥ स त्वं शीघ्रमितो गत्वा भीष्मस्य शिबिरं प्रति।'}

{'en': 'Persuade that venerable and old hero to lay aside weapons. Thus when Bhishma will lay aside his weapons, you shall see the Pandavas slain.', 'sn': 'अनुमान्य गुरुं वृद्धं शस्त्रं न्यासय भारत॥ न्यस्तशस्त्रे ततो भीष्मे निहतान् पश्य पाण्डवान्।'}

{'en': 'With all their kinsmen and allies, by my single self in battle" Sanjaya said Thus spoke spoken to by Karna, your son Duryodhana,', 'sn': 'मयैकेन रणे राजन् ससुहृद्गणबान्धवान्॥ एवमुक्तस्तु कर्णेन पुत्रो दुर्योधनस्तव। अब्रवीद् भ्रातरं तत्र दुःशासनमिदं वचः॥'}

{'en': "Then said these words addressing his brother Dushasana 'Look to it O Dushasana, that all my retinue may without delay be dressed and ready'. Having thus spoken, O king, to Dushasana, that ruler of men addressed Karna saying:", 'sn': 'अनुयात्रं यथा सर्वं सज्जीभवति सर्वशः। दुःशासन तथा क्षिप्रं सर्वमेवोपपादय॥ एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन् कर्णमाह जनेश्वरः। अनुमान्य रणे भीष्ममेषोऽहं द्विपदां वरम्॥'}

{'en': '“Having persuaded that foremost of men, Bhishma to withdraw himself from the battle, I shall soon come back to you, O redresser of foes.', 'sn': 'आगमिष्ये ततः क्षिप्रं त्वत्सकाशमरिंदम्। अपक्रान्ते ततो भीष्मे प्रहरिष्यसि संयुगे॥'}

{'en': 'When Bhishma will be withdrawn from the fight, you shall slay the Pandavas in battle." Then, O ruler of men your son, without any more loss of time, set out,', 'sn': 'निष्पपात ततस्तूर्णं पुत्रस्तव विशाम्पते। सहितो भ्रातृभिस्तैस्तु देवैरिव शतक्रतुः॥'}

{'en': 'Accompanied by his brothers, and loO king like Indra surrounded by the celestial. Thereafter, his brother Dushasana, helped that foremost of kings equal to a tiger in strength, to mount on his steed. Decked with bracelets, with a diadem on his head, and O king, his arms graced with other ornaments,', 'sn': 'ततस्तं नृपशार्दूलं शार्दूलसमविक्रमम्। आरोहयद्धयं तूर्णं भ्राता दुःशासनस्तदा॥ अङ्गदी बद्धमुकुटो हस्ताभरणवान् नृप। धार्तराष्ट्रो महाराज विबभौ स पथि व्रजन्॥'}

{'en': "That son of yours, O monarch, shone brightly as he went towards Bhishma's tent. Smeared with fragrant sandal paste of the colour of Vandi flowers and of the effulgence of gold, and vested in dirtless raiment's, and proceeding with the playful gait of the lion, O king, Duryodhana appeared beautiful like the bright rayed orb of day in the skies. As that foremost of men (Duryodhana) proceeded towards the tent of Bhishma,", 'sn': 'भण्डीपुष्पनिकाशेन तपनीयनिभेन च। अनुलिप्तः पराद्ध्यन चन्दनेन सुगन्धिना॥ अरजोऽम्बरसंवीतः सिंहखेलगतिर्नृप। शुशुभे विमलार्चिष्मान् नभसीव दिवाकरः॥ तं प्रयान्तं नरव्याघ्रं भीष्मस्य शिबिरं प्रति। अनुजग्मुर्महेष्वासाः सर्वलोकस्य धन्विनः॥'}

{'en': 'Numerous fierce bowmen of worldwide fame with bows in hand, as also his brothers all mighty bowmen, followed him like the celestial following Vasava.', 'sn': 'भ्रातरश्च महेष्वासास्त्रिदशा इव वासवम्। हयानन्ये समारुह्य गजानन्ये च भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Mounted on other horses, elephants and chariots, other foremost of men, O Bharata, surrounded him on all sides.', 'sn': 'रथानन्ये नरश्रेष्ठं परिवः समन्ततः। आत्तशस्त्राश्च सुहृदो रक्षणार्थं महीपतेः॥'}

{'en': 'Many of his friends bearing weapons came there for protecting the king, and accompanying Indra in heaven.', 'sn': 'प्रादुर्बभूवुः सहिताः शक्रस्येवामरा दिवि। स पूज्यमानः कुरुभिः कौरवाणां महाबलः॥'}

{'en': 'Thus honored by the Kurus, that highly puissant king of the Kurus repaired to the son of Ganga of illustrious fame.', 'sn': 'प्रययौ सदनं राजा गाङ्गेयस्य यशस्विनः। अन्वीयमानः सततं सोदरैः परिवारितः॥'}

{'en': "Followed and surrounded by his uterine brother, he proceeded, raising his right arm sinewy like the trunk of the elephant and capable of crushing all his foes, and therewith accepting the homage's offered by men on all sides with their raised and folder palms.", 'sn': 'दक्षिणं दक्षिणं काले सम्भृत्य स्वभुजं तदा। हस्तिहस्तोपमं शैक्षं सर्वशत्रुनिबर्हणम्॥ प्रगृह्णन्नञ्जलीन् नृणामुद्यतान् सर्वतो दिशः। शुश्राव मधुरा वाचो नानादेशनिवासिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'He heard sweet words uttered by the assembled inhabitants of various countries. moon That illustrious one was applauded and eulogised by the bards and minstrels.', 'sn': 'संस्तूयमानः सूतैश्च मागधैश्च महायशाः। पूजयानश्च तान् सर्वान् सर्वलोकेश्वरेश्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'That lord paramount of all men honorea all these men in return. Many high-souled persons then surrounded him on all sides with golden lamps, lighted and fed with fragrant oil. Thus surrounded by those lighted lamps made of gold, king Duryodhana,', 'sn': 'प्रदीपैः काञ्चनैस्त गन्धतैलावसेचितैः। परिवर्महाराज प्रज्वलद्भिः समन्ततः॥ स तैः परिवृतो राजा प्रदीपैः काञ्चनैर्व्वलन्। शुशुभे चन्द्रमा युक्तो दीप्तैरिव महाग्रहैः॥'}

{'en': 'Shone resplendent like the surrounded by blazing mighty planets. Then attendants, graced with golden turbans, and bearing canes and Jharjharas in their hands,', 'sn': 'काञ्चनोष्णीषिणस्तत्र वेत्रझर्झरपाणयः। प्रोत्सारयन्तः शनकैस्तं जनं सर्वतो दिशम्॥'}

{'en': 'Gradually cleared the crowd that surrounded the king on all sides. Thereafter, the king, reaching the beautiful tent of Bhishma.', 'sn': 'सम्प्राप्य तु ततो राजा भीष्मस्य सदनं शुभम्। अवतीर्य हयाच्चापि भीष्मं प्राप्य जनेश्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'And then descending from his horse, that ruler of men approached Bhishma. Thereafter doing obeisance to Bhishma, he seated himself on a beautiful seat,', 'sn': 'अभिवाद्य ततो भीष्मं निषण्णः परमासने। काञ्चने सर्वतोभद्रे स्पास्तरणसंवृते॥'}

{'en': 'Made of gold, of exquisite workmanship and over-spread with an excellent coverlet. Then he thus spoke to Bhishma, with his palms folded, his voice choked in grief and his eyes bathed in tears.', 'sn': 'उवाच प्राञ्जलिर्भीष्मं बाष्पकण्ठोऽश्रुलोचनः। त्वां वयं हि समाश्रित्य संयुगे शत्रुसूदन॥'}

{'en': '"Reliving upon you, O slayer of foes, we are even capable of vanquishing in battle the celestials and the Asuras united together, with Indra at their head,', 'sn': 'उत्सहेम रणे जेतुं सेन्द्रानपि सुरासुरान्। किमु पाण्डुसुतान् वीरान् ससुहृद्गणबान्धवान्॥'}

{'en': 'What to speak of the sons of Pandu though they may be warlike and supported by their friends, allies and kinsmen. Therefore, O son of Ganga, O lord, it behold you to be merciful on me.', 'sn': 'तस्मादर्हसि गाङ्गेय कृपां कर्तुं मयि प्रभो। जहि पाण्डुसुतान् वीरान् महेन्द्र इव दानवान्॥'}

{'en': "Do you slay the heroic sons of Pandu like the great Indra slaying the Danavas. 'O monarch, I shall slaughter all the Somakas,", 'sn': 'अहं सर्वान् महाराज निहनिष्यामि सोमकान्। पञ्चालान् केकयैः सार्धं करूषांश्चेति भारत॥'}

{'en': "The Panchalas, the Kauravas, O Bharata.' These were your words to me, verify them by slaying the assembled sons of Pritha,", 'sn': 'त्वद्वचः सत्यमेवास्तु जहि पार्थान् समागतान्। सोमकांश्च महेष्वासान् सत्यवाग् भव भारत॥'}

{'en': 'As also the Somakas, all fierce bowmen. Prove, O Bharata, the truth of your words. But if out of mercy, or out of your hatred, O lord,', 'sn': 'दयया यदि वा राजन् द्वेष्यभावान्मम प्रभो। मन्दभाग्यतया वापि मम रक्षसि पाण्डवान्॥'}

{'en': 'For my unfortunate self, you are inclined to spare the sons of Pandu, then permit Karna, that ornament of battle, to join the fight.', 'sn': 'अनुजानीहि समरे कर्णमाहवशोभिनम्। स जेष्यति रणे पार्थान् ससुहृद्गणबान्धवान्॥'}

{'en': 'He will conquer the sons of Pritha together with all their friends, allies and kinsmen." Having thus spoken, your royal son dreadful prowess. airunn', 'sn': 'स एवमुक्त्वा नृपतिः पुत्रो दुर्योधनस्तव। नोवाच वचनं किञ्चिद् भीष्मं सत्यपराक्रमम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said The Pandavas were unable to look at Bhishma burning like the solar disc, when inflamed with wrath he rushed to the thick of the) fight.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच भीष्मं तु समरे क्रुद्धं प्रतपन्तं समन्ततः। न शेकुः पाण्डवा दुष्टुं तपन्तमिव भास्करम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereafter the whole army, by the order of the son of Dharma, rushed against the son of Ganga when the latter was wounding them with whetted shafts.', 'sn': 'ततः सर्वाणि सैन्यानि धर्मपुत्रस्य शासनात्। अभ्यद्रवन्त गाङ्गेयं मर्दयन्तं शितैः शरैः॥'}

{'en': 'But Bhishma ever proud in battle, began to fell with his shafts, the Somakas, the Srinjayas and the Panchalas, all mighty wielders of the bow.', 'sn': 'स तु भीष्मोरणश्लाघी सोमकान् सहसंजयान्। पञ्चालांश्च महेष्वासान् पातयामास सायकैः॥'}

{'en': 'Through thus slaughtered by Bhishma, the Panchalas with the Somakas impetuously rushed against Bhishma, abandoning all fear of death.', 'sn': 'ते वध्यमाना भीष्मेण पञ्चाला: भीष्ममेवाभ्ययुस्तूर्णं त्यक्त्वा मृत्युकृतं भयम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then that foremost of car-warriors namely Bhishma the son of Shantanu, in that battle, O king, cut off the arms and heads of all those combatants.', 'sn': 'स तेषां रथिनां वीरो भीष्मः शान्तनवो युधि। चिच्छेद सहसा राजन् बाहूनथ शिरांसि च॥'}

{'en': 'Your sire Devavrata deprived car-warriors of their car; and the heads of horse-soldiers fell fast as they rode on their chargers.', 'sn': 'सोमकैः सह। विरथान् रथिनश्चक्रे पिता देवव्रतस्तव। पतितान्युत्तमाङ्गानि हयेभ्यो हयसादिनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'We also beheld, O mighty monarch elephants deprived of their riders and fallen on the filled like so many hills and also paralyzed by the weapons of Bhishma.', 'sn': 'निर्मनुष्यांश्च मातङ्गाशयानान् पर्वतोपमान्। अपश्याम महाराज भीष्मास्त्रेण प्रमोहितान्॥'}

{'en': 'Not a single person of the Pandava host remained there on the field of battle, except, O ruler of men that foremost of car-warriors namely Bhimasena endued with great prowess.', 'sn': 'न तत्रासीत् पुमान् कश्चित् पाण्डवानां विशाम्पते। अन्यत्र रथिनां श्रेष्ठाद् भीमसेनान्महाबलात्॥'}

{'en': 'Encountering Bhishma in battle, Bhima began to resist the former; a dreadful, fierce and deafening uproar arose among all the troops when Bhima and Bhishma thus encountered each another. Thereupon the Pandavas greatly delighted roared out their war-cries.', 'sn': 'स हि भीष्मं समासाद्य ताडयामास संयुगे। ततो निष्टानको घोरो भीष्मभीमसमागमे॥ बभूव सर्वसैन्यानां घोररूपो भयानकः। तथैव पाण्डवाः हृष्टाः सिंहनादमथानदन्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon king Duryodhana surrounded by his uterine brothers, protected Bhishma when that battle destructive of creatures was raging furiously.', 'sn': 'ततो दुर्योधनो राजा सोदर्यैः परिवारितः। भीष्मं जुगोप समरे वर्तमाने जनक्षये॥'}

{'en': 'Then that foremost of car-warriors Bhima, slew the charioteer of Bhishma; thereupon the steeds having none to check them ran away dragging the chariot.', 'sn': 'भीमस्तु सारथिं हत्वा भीष्मस्य रथिनां वरः। प्रद्रुताश्वे रथे तस्मिन् द्रवमाणे समन्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Then that slayer of enemies, Bhima, with an arrow of the shape of horse-shoe and of exceeding sharpness, cut off quickly the head of Sunabha; and the latter fell down on the ground.', 'sn': 'सुनाभस्य शरेणाशु शिरश्चिच्छेद भारत। क्षुरप्रेण सुतीक्ष्णेन स हतो न्यपतद् भुवि॥'}

{'en': 'When that mighty car-warrior that fierce bowman namely your son Sunabha was slain in battle, O Sire, his other seven uterine brothers, all brave heroic, could not brook it in battle.', 'sn': 'हते तस्मिन् महाराज तव पुत्रे महारथे। नामृष्यन्त रणे शूराः सोदराः सप्त संयुगे॥'}

{'en': 'Adityaketu, Bahvashin, Kundadhara, Mahodara, Aparajita, Panditaka, and Vishalaksha, all difficult of being conquered in battle,', 'sn': 'आदित्यकेतुर्बह्वाशी कुण्डधारो महोदरः। अपराजितः पण्डितको विशालाक्षः सुदुर्जयः॥'}

{'en': 'These seven grinders of foes, clad in coats of mail and owning wonderful armours and weapons, rushed to battle against the son of Pandu, desirous of fighting with him.', 'sn': 'पाण्डवं चित्रसंनाहा विचित्रकवचध्वजाः। अभ्यद्रवन्त संग्रामे योद्धकामारिमर्दनाः॥'}

{'en': 'Then in that battle, Mahendra pierced Bhima with nine winged shafts resembling the thunder bolt itself, like the slayer of Vritra piercing Namuchi (in the days of yore).', 'sn': 'महोदरस्तु समरे भीमं विव्याध पत्रिभिः। नवभिर्वज्रसंकाशैनमुचिं वृत्रहा यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Adityaketu pierced Bhima with seventy shafts, Bahvashin with five, Kundadhara with ninety and Vishalaksha with seven.', 'sn': 'आदित्यकेतुः सप्तत्या बह्वाशी चापि पञ्चभिः। नवत्या कुण्डधारच विशालाक्षश्च पञ्चभिः॥'}

{'en': 'That conqueror of foes, namely Aparajita himself, O mighty monarch, that mighty carwarrior, pierced the highly powerful Bhimasena, with innumerable shafts.', 'sn': 'अपराजितो महाराज पराजिष्णुर्महारथम्। शरैर्बहुभिरान द् भीमसेनं महाबलम्॥'}

{'en': 'Panditaka pierced Bhima with three shafts in that battle. But Bhima did not tolerate these wounds inflicted by his enemies in that battle.', 'sn': 'रणे पण्डितकश्चैनं त्रिभिर्बाणैः समार्पयत्। स तन्न ममृषे भीमः शत्रुभिर्वधमाहवे॥'}

{'en': 'Then that grinder of foes (Bhima) pressing his bow with his left hand, with a straight knotted shaft cut off in that battle, the head of,', 'sn': 'धनुः प्रपड्य वामेन करेणामित्रकर्शनः। शिरश्चिच्छेद समरे शरेणानतपर्वणा॥'}

{'en': 'Your son Aparajita, graced with a well formed nose. When he was thus conquered by Bhima, his head fell down on the ground.', 'sn': 'अपराजितस्य सुनसं तव पुत्रस्य संयुगे। पराजितस्य भीमेन निपपात शिरो महीम्॥'}

{'en': 'Then the former, with another broad headed shaft, dispatched the mighty car-warrior Kundadhara to the region of Dead even before the very eyes of the troops.', 'sn': 'अथापरेण भल्लेन कुण्डधारं महारथम्। प्राहिणोन्मृत्युलोकाय सर्वलोकस्य पश्यतः॥'}

{'en': 'Then that one of immeasurable soul (Bhima), placing on his bow-string another shaft, sped it, O Bharata, against Panditaka in that battle.', 'sn': 'ततः पुनरमेयात्मा प्रसंधाय शिलीमुखम्। प्रेषयामास समरे पण्डितं प्रति भारत॥'}

{'en': 'That shaft slaying Panditaka penetrated into the earth, even as a serpent urged by fate, enters the earth having bitten a person whose hour has come.', 'sn': 'स शरः पण्डितं हत्वा विवेश धरणीतलम्। यथा नरं निहत्याशु भुजग: कालचोदितः॥'}

{'en': 'Thereafter that generous-hearted hero, O ruler of earth remembering the woe he (with his brothers) had to undergo, cutting off with three shafts the head of Vishalaksha felled it on the ground.', 'sn': 'विशालाक्षशिरश्छित्त्वा पातयामास भूतले। त्रिभिः शरैरदीनात्मा स्मरन् क्लेशं पुरातनम्॥'}

{'en': 'He also pierced the mighty car-warrior Mahendra with a long shaft between his breasts, and O king, (thus stricken), the latter fell down dead on the ground.', 'sn': 'महोदरं महेष्वासं नाराचेन स्तनान्तरे। विव्याध समरे राजन् स हतो न्यपतद् भुवि॥'}

{'en': "Severing the umbrella of Adityaketu with a shaft, Bhima cut down the former's head, O Bharata, with a broad-headed arrow of exceeding sharpness.", 'sn': 'आदित्यकेतोः केतुं च छित्त्वा बाणेन संयुगे। भल्लेन भृशतीक्ष्णेन शिरश्चिच्छेद भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Thereafter inflamed with rage, with a straight knotted shaft Bhima dispatched Bahvashin to the abode of Death.', 'sn': 'बह्वाशिनं ततो भीमः शरेणानतपर्वणा। प्रेषयामास संक्रुद्धो यमस्य सदनं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'Then O ruler of men, the rest of your sons fled away in all directions, considering that the words he had uttered in the assembly hall to be true.', 'sn': 'प्रदुद्रुवुस्ततस्तेऽन्य पुत्रास्तव विशाम्पते। मन्यमाना हि तत् सत्यं सभायां तस्य भाषितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon king Duryodhana, afflicted with the calamity that had befallen hill brothers, commanded his troops saying "Slay this Bhima."', 'sn': 'ततो दुर्योधनो राजा भ्रातृव्यसनकर्शितः। अब्रवीत् तावकान् योधान् भीमोऽयं युधि वध्यताम्।।३१।'}

{'en': 'Thus, O ruler of men, your sons, excellent bowmen, beholding their brothers slain, remembered the words,', 'sn': 'एवमेते महेष्वासाः पुत्रास्तव विशाम्पते। भ्रातृन् संदृश्य निहतान् प्रास्मरंस्ते हि तद् वच॥'}

{'en': 'Salutary and whole some, that the wonderfully wise Kshatriya had said. Those words of that true speaking one has now been realised,', 'sn': 'यदुक्तवान् महाप्राज्ञः क्षत्ता हितमनामयम्। तदिदं समनुप्राप्तं वचनं दिव्यदर्शिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Words, beneficial and true, to which you paid no heed in past days, being possessed by covetousness and folly, as also, O lord of wealth, by the affection for your sons.', 'sn': 'लोभमोहसमाविष्टः पुत्रप्रीत्या जनाधिप। न बुध्यसे पुरा यत् तत् तथ्यमुक्तं वचो महत्॥'}

{'en': 'From the in thich that hero (Bhima) of longaiiii, . . .....nungine Kauravas, it may be asserted that mighty son of Pandu has surely taken his birth for the destruction of your sons.', 'sn': 'तथैव च वधार्थाय पुत्राणां पाण्डवो बली। नूनं जातो महाबाहुर्यथा हन्ति स्म कौरवान्॥'}

{'en': 'Thereafter king Duryodhana possessed with overwhelming grief, approached Bhishma, and O Sire, began to lament before him in great sorrow.', 'sn': 'ततो दुर्योधनो राजा भीष्ममासाद्य संयुगे। दुःखेन महताऽऽविष्टो विललाप सुदुःखितः॥'}

{'en': '“My heroic brothers have all been slain in battle by Bhimasena; and other soldiers, through striving their best of resist him, are all being slain and slaughtered.', 'sn': 'निहता भ्रातरः शूरा भीमसेनेन मे युधि। यतमानास्तथान्येऽपि हन्यन्ते सर्वसैनिकाः॥'}

{'en': 'Though you are always in our midst, yet always neglect us. Alas! what a wrong course have I taken! Behold my evil Destiny!”', 'sn': 'भवांश्च मध्यस्थतया नित्यमस्मानुपेक्षते। सोऽहं कुपथमारूढः पश्य दैवमिदं मम॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Hearing this, your father Devavrata, inflamed with rage, said these words in Suyodhana, with his eyes overflowing with tears.', 'sn': 'एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचः क्रूरं पिता देवव्रतस्तव। दुर्योधनमिदं वाक्यमब्रवीत् साश्रुलोचनः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Even this had been said before by myself, by Drona, by Vidura and by the illustrious lady Gandhari. But then, O Sire, you did not pay any heed to it.', 'sn': 'उक्तमेतन्मया पूर्वं द्रोणेन विदुरेण च। गान्धार्या च यशस्विन्या तत् त्वं तात न बुद्धवान्॥'}

{'en': 'O Grinder of foes, I have made arrangements with you that, neither myself nor the preceptor Drona shall survive this war.', 'sn': 'समयश्च मया पूर्वं कृतो वै शत्रुकर्शन। नाहं युधि नियोक्तव्यो नाप्याचार्यः कथंचन॥'}

{'en': 'I tell you truly that, every one of ihe host of Dhritarashtra whom Bhima will deer in battle, he will slay in fight.', 'sn': 'यं यं हि धार्तराष्ट्राणां भीमो द्रक्ष्यति संयुगे। हनिष्यति रणे नित्यं सत्यमेतद् ब्रवीमि ते॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore, O king, with all your patience, and forming a firm resolution for battle, do you fight with the sons of Pritha, loO king upon paradise as your final goal.', 'sn': 'स त्वं राजन् स्थिरो भूत्वा रणे कृत्वा दृढां मतिम्। योधयस्व रणे पार्थान् स्वर्गं परायणम्॥'}

{'en': 'The sons of Pandu cannot be vanquished even by the celestial headed by Indra himself. Therefore, o Bharata, forming a firm determination for fight, do you fight on (with the Pandavas).', 'sn': 'न शक्याः पाण्डवा जेतुं सेन्ट्रैरपि सुरासुरैः। तस्माद् युद्धे स्थिरां कृत्वा मतिं युद्ध्यस्व भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Lomasha said : O king, once on a time, the (two) celestials the Ashvins saw Sukanya, when she had bathed and when she had no clothes on her person. Having seen that charming damsel who resembled a daughter of the celestials king, the horse-born Ashvins came to her and thus spoke to her.', 'sn': 'लोमश उवाच कस्यचित् त्वथ कालस्य त्रिदशावश्विनौ नृप। कृताभिषेकां विवृतां सुकन्यां तामपश्यताम्॥ तां दृष्ट्वा दर्शनीयाङ्गी देवराजसुतामिव। ऊचतुः समभिदुत्य नासत्यावश्विनाविदम्॥'}

{'en': '"O lady of tapering thighs, whose daughter are you? What are you doing in this forest? O blessed one, O beautiful damsel, we desire to know this. Therefore tell us."', 'sn': 'कस्य त्वमसि वामोरु वनेऽस्मिन् किं करोषि च। इच्छाव भद्रे ज्ञातुं त्वां तत्त्वमाख्याहि शोभने॥'}

{'en': 'Thereupon Sukanya filled with bashfulness thus spoke to those foremost of celestials," "I am the daughter of Sharyati and I am the wife of Chyavana."', 'sn': 'ततः सुकन्या सुव्रीडा तावुवाच सुरोत्तमौ। शर्यातितनयां वित्तं भार्यां मा च्यवनस्य च॥'}

{'en': 'Ashvins then again spoke to her with smiles, “O auspicious one, why has your gather bestowed you on a man who is verging on death? O timid one, you shine in this forest like the flashing lightning. O beautiful lady, we have never seen any one like you even in the celestials region.', 'sn': 'अथाश्विनौ प्रहस्यैतामबूतां पुनरेव तु। कथं त्वमसि कल्याणि पित्रा दत्ता गताध्वने।॥ भ्राजसेऽस्मिन् वने भीरु विद्युत्सौदामनी यथा। न देवेष्वपि तुल्यां हि त्वया पश्याव भाविनि॥'}

{'en': 'O blessed one, unadorned with ornaments and unclad in beautiful robes as you are, you beautify the forest more by your unadorned beauty.', 'sn': 'अनाभरणसम्पन्ना परमाम्बरवर्जिता। शोभयस्यधिकं भद्रे वनमपप्यनलंकृता॥'}

{'en': 'O lady of faultless limbs, you cannot (however) look so beautiful besmeared as you are with mud and dirt as you would if adorned with ornaments and clad in gorgeous costume.', 'sn': 'सर्वाभरणसम्पन्ना परमाम्बरधारिणी। शोभसे त्वनवद्याङ्गि न त्वेवं मलपकिनी॥'}

{'en': 'O auspicious one, becoming such why do you serve a decrepit old husband, one that has become incapable of realising pleasure,', 'sn': 'कस्मादेवंविधा भूत्वा जराजर्जरितं पतिम्। त्वमुपास्से ह कल्याणि कामभोगबहिष्कृतम्॥'}

{'en': 'O lady of sweet smiles, one who is in incapable of protecting and supporting u? Therefore abandoning Chyavana, accept one of us as your husband.', 'sn': 'असमर्थं परित्राणे पोषणे तु शुचिस्मिते। सा त्वं च्यवनमुत्सृज्य वरयस्वैकमावयोः॥'}

{'en': 'Making up your mind, invite your husband (from among us two). Do not spend your youth uselessly.” Having been thus addressed, Sukanya thus spoke to the celestials,', 'sn': 'पत्यर्थं देवगर्भाभे मा वृथा यौवनं कृथाः। एवमुक्ता सुकन्यापि सुरौ ताविदमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': '“I am devoted to my husband Chyavana. Do not entertain any doubts about it.” To her again they spoke thus, “We two are the celestials physicians. We shall make your husband young and handsome. Then from among us three, you shall select one of us as your husband. O blessed one, promising this, bring your husband here."', 'sn': 'रताहं च्यवने पत्यौ मेवं मां पर्यशङ्कतम्। तावदूतां पुनस्त्वेनामावां देवभिषग्वरौ॥ युवानं रूपसम्पन्नं करिष्याव: पति तव। ततस्तस्यावयोश्चैव वृणीष्वान्यतमं पतिम्॥ एतेन समयेनैनमामन्त्रय पति शुभे।'}

{'en': 'O king, she went at their word to Bhrigu\'s son and told the son of Bhrigu what the two celestials had said. Having heard this, Chyavana said, "Do it."', 'sn': 'सा तयोर्वचनाद् राजन्नुपसंगम्य भार्गवम्॥ उवाच वाक्यं यत् ताभ्यामुक्तं भृगुसुतं प्रति। तच्छ्रुत्वा च्यवनो भार्यामुवाच क्रियतामिति॥'}

{'en': 'They then thus spoke to that princess, “Let your husband enter into water. Thereupon Chyavana with the desire of becoming handsome soon entered the water.', 'sn': 'ऊचतू राजपुत्रीं तां पतिस्तव विशत्वपः। ततोऽम्भश्च्यवनः शीघ्रं रूपार्थी प्रविवेश ह॥'}

{'en': 'O king, the two Ashvins also entered into the lake. A few minutes after they all came out from the lake, becoming exceedingly beautiful, young and wearing brilliant car-rings, all assuming the same appearance delightful to the heart.', 'sn': 'अश्विनावपि तद् राजन् सरः प्राविशता तदा। ततो मुहूर्तादुत्तीर्णाः सर्वे ते सरसस्तदा।॥ दिव्यरूपधराः सर्वे युवानो मृष्टकुण्डलाः। तुल्यवेषधराश्चैव मनसः प्रीतिवर्धनाः॥'}

{'en': 'They then all said to her “O blessed lady, O fortunate one, O beautiful damsel, chose one of us as your husband.', 'sn': 'तेऽब्रुवन् सहिताः सर्वे वृणीष्वान्यतमं शुभे। अस्माकमीप्सितं भद्रं पतित्वे वरवर्णिनि॥'}

{'en': 'O beautiful featured lady, select him for your husband who may be liked by you.” But seeing then all of the same appearance, she paused and pondered. At last she ascertained who was her husband and selected him. Having obtained his wife and the beauty that he desired, Chyavana, of exceeding prowess, cheerfully spoke these words to the horse-born deities. “Since being an old man I have obtained from you youth and beauty and also my wife, I shall make you two the drinkers of the Soma juice even in the presence of the king of the celestials."', 'sn': 'यत्र वाप्यभिकामासि तं वृणीष्व सुशोभने। सा समीक्ष्य तु तान्सर्वांस्तुल्यरूपधरान् स्थितान्।।२०। निश्चित्य मनसा बुद्ध्या देवी ववे स्वकं पतिम्। लब्ध्वा तु च्यवनो भार्यां वयो रूपं च वाञ्छितम्॥ हृष्टोऽब्रवीन्महातेजास्तौ नासत्याविदं वचः। यथाहं रूपसम्पन्नो वयसा च समन्वितः॥ कृतोभवद्भ्यां वृद्धः सन् भार्यां च प्राप्तवानिमाम्। तस्माद् युवां करिष्यामि प्रीत्याहं सोमपीथिनौ। मिषतो देवराजस्य सत्यमेतद् ब्रवीमि वाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having heard this, the two (Ashvins) cheerfully went to heaven. Chyavana and Sukanya also passed happily their days like (two) celestials.', 'sn': 'तच्छ्रुत्वा हृष्टमनसौ दिवं तौ प्रतिजग्मतुः। च्यवनश्च सुकन्या च सुराविव विजह्रतुः॥'}

{'en': 'How did Agni and Soma, in days of yore, attain to uniformity with regard to their original nature? Thus doubt has arisen in my mind. Do you remove it, O slayer of Madhu.', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच अग्नीषोमौ कथं पूर्वमेकयोनी प्रवर्तितौ। एष मे संशयो जातस्तं छिन्धि मधुसूदन॥'}

{'en': 'I shall recite to you, O son of Pandu, an ancient story of events arising from my own energy. Do you listen to it with concentrated mind.', 'sn': 'श्रीभगवानुवाच हन्त ते वर्तयिष्यामि पुराणं पाण्डुनन्दन। आत्मतेजोद्भवं पार्थ शृणुष्वैकमना मम॥'}

{'en': 'When four thousand divine cycles elapse, the dissolution of the universe sets in. The Manifest disappear into the Unmanifest. All creatures, mobile and immobile, meet with destruction. Fire, Earth, Wind, all disappear. Darkness covers the universe which becomes one endless expanse of water.', 'sn': 'सम्प्रक्षालनकालेऽतिक्रान्ते चतुर्युगसहस्रान्ते अव्यक्ते सर्वभूते प्रलये सर्वभूतस्था वरजङ्गमे ज्योतिर्धरणिवायुरहितेऽन्धे तमसि जलैकार्णवे लोके॥'}

{'en': 'When that infinite expanse of water only exists like Brahma without a second, it is neither day nor night. Neither aught nor naught exists; neither manifest nor unmanifest.', 'sn': 'आप इत्येवं ब्रह्मभूतसंज्ञकेऽद्वितीये प्रतिष्ठिते॥ न वै रात्र्यां न दिवसे न सति नासति न व्यक्ते न चाप्यव्यक्ते व्यवस्थिते॥'}

{'en': "When such is the state of the universe, the foremost of Beings, viz., the Eternal and Immutable Hari originates from Ignorance, that combination of the qualities belonging to Narayana, that is indestructible and immortal, that is without senses, that is inconceivable and unborn, that is Truth's self fraught with mercy, that is endued with the form of existence which the rays of the gem called Chintamani have, that causes various kinds of inclinations to flow in diverse directions, that is divested of the principles of hostility and decay, and morality and decay, that is formless and all-pervading, and that is endued with the principle of universal Creation and of Eternity without beginning, middle, or end. There is authority for this assertion.", 'sn': 'एवमस्यां व्यवस्थायां नारायणगुणाश्रयादजरामरादनिन्द्रियादग्राह्यादसम्भवात् सत्यादहिंस्राल्ललामाद् विविधप्रवृत्तिविशेषाद वैरादक्षयादमरादजरादमूर्तितः सर्वव्यापिनः सर्वकर्तुः शाश्वतस्तस्मात् पुरुषः प्रादुर्भूतो हरिरव्ययः॥ निदर्शनमपि ह्यत्र भवति॥'}

{'en': 'The Shruti declares,-Day was not. Night was not. Aught was not. Naught was not. In the beginning there was only Ignorance. She was of the form of the universe, and she is the night of Narayana of universal form. This is the meaning of the word of Tamas.', 'sn': 'नासीदहो न रात्रिरासीन्न सदासीन्नासदासीत् तम एव पुरस्तादभवद् विश्वरूपम्। सा विश्वरूपस्य रजनी हि एवमस्यार्थोऽनुभाष्या॥'}

{'en': 'From that Purusha thus born of Tamas and having Brahma for his parent, came into existence the Being called Brahman. Brahman, wishing to create creatures caused Agni and Soma to originate from his own own eyes. Afterwards when creatures were to be created, the ceated persons came out in their due order as Brahmanas and Kshatriyas. He who came into being as Soma was none else than Brahma; and they that were born as Brahmanas were all Soma in sooth. He who came into Being as Agni was none else than Kshatriya. The Brahmanas became gifted with greater energy than the Kshatriyas. If you enquire about the reason thereof, the answer is that this superiority of the Brahmanas to the Kshatriyas is an attribute which is manifest to the whole world. It occurred as follows. The Brahmanas represent the eldest creation amonst men. None were created before who were superior to the Brahmanas. He who offers food into the mouth of a Brahmana is considered as pouring libations into a burning fire. I say that having arranged things thus, the creation of creatures was accomplished by Brahman. Having established all created beings in their respective positions, he keeps us the three worlds.
