{'en': 'The act recommended to be followed by wise men competent to foresee the evil effects of actions have consequences other than those foreseen, like the winds from heaven (the direction taken by which no one can predict).', 'sn': 'अन्यथा परिदृष्टानि कविभिर्दोषदर्शिभिः। अन्यथा परिवर्तन्ते वेगा इव नभस्वतः॥'}

{'en': 'The acts performed by a man well advised, well controlled and done in a way not injurious to any body has contrary effect by the dispensations of Providence.', 'sn': 'सुमन्त्रितं सुनीतं च न्यायतश्चोपपादितम्। कृतं मानुष्यकं कर्भ दैवेनापि विस्थ्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Then, again, the dispensation of the gods, that are not the results of any particular actions, are neutralized by the actions of men; as for instance cold, heat and rain and hunger and thirst, O Bharata.', 'sn': 'दैवमप्यकृतं कर्म पौरुषेण विहन्यते। शीतमुष्णं तथा वर्षं क्षुत्पिपासे च भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Over and above the actions that a man is destined to perform, he can do away with others as well at his will; which the Shastras testify.', 'sn': 'यदन्यद् दिष्टभावस्य पुरुषस्य स्वयं कृतम्। तस्मादनुपरोधश्च विद्यते तत्र लक्षणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Since, O son of Pandu, there is no other way for than action. A man should engage in acts with this knowledge; and the result will be brought about by both preordainment and action.', 'sn': 'लोकस्य नान्यतो वृत्तिः पाण्डवान्यत्र कर्मणः। एवंबुद्धिः प्रवर्तेत फलं स्यादुभयान्वये॥'}

{'en': 'He who engages in action with this knowledge is not annoyed at failure; nor is he elated with success.', 'sn': 'य एवं कृतबुद्धिः स कर्मस्वेव प्रवर्तते। नासिद्धो व्यथते तस्य न सिद्धौ हर्षमश्नुते॥'}

{'en': 'In this sense, O Bhimasena, did I speak; and I did not mean that in a battle with the enemy; success would be absolutely theirs.', 'sn': 'तत्रेयमनुमात्रा मे भीमसेन विवक्षिता। नैकान्तसिद्धिर्वक्तव्या शत्रुभिः सह संयुगे॥'}

{'en': "I am speaking all this to you; as when a man's intellect is confused, he should not be wholly devoid of cheerfulness; nor yield wholly to sadness or dullness.", 'sn': 'नातिप्रहीणरश्मिः स्यात् तथा भावविपर्यये। विषादमछेद् ग्लानि वाप्येतमर्थं ब्रवीमि ते॥'}

{'en': 'At the dawn of day, going near Dhritarashtra, O son of Pandu, shall I try to effect peace without a sacrifice of your interests.', 'sn': 'श्वोभूते धृतराष्ट्रस्य समीपं प्राप्य पाण्डव। यतिष्ये प्रशमं कर्तुं युष्मदर्थमहापयन्॥'}

{'en': 'If they consent to peace, then unending fame will be mine; while your desires will be fulfilled and advantage will accrue to them.', 'sn': 'शमं चेत् ते करिष्यन्ति ततोऽनन्तं यशोमम। भवतां च कृतः कामस्तेषां च श्रेय उत्तमम्॥'}

{'en': 'If however they stick to their resolve and not listen to my advice, in that case there will be a terrible war among the sons of Kuru.', 'sn': 'ते चेदभिनिवेक्ष्यन्ते नाभ्युपैष्यन्ति मे वचः। कुरवो युद्धमेवात्र घोरं कर्म भविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'In this battle, O 0 Bhimasena, the responsibility of guiding the car of war rests on you; while Arjuna will draw the car, on which will be seated other persons.', 'sn': 'अस्मिन् युद्धे भीमसेन त्वयि भारः समाहितः। धूरर्जुनेन धार्या स्याद् वोढव्य इतरो जनः॥'}

{'en': "The war taking place, I shall drive Vibhatsu's car; for such is the desire of Dhananjaya and not because I myself am desirous of fight.", 'sn': 'अहं हि यन्ता बीभत्सोर्भविता संयुगे सति। धनंजयस्यैष कामो न हि युद्धं न कामये॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore did I, fearful of the direction your inclination might follow from your words which were like those of an eunuch, rekindle your energy, O Vrikodara.', 'sn': 'तस्मादाशङ्कमानोऽहं वृकोदर मतिं तवा गदतः क्लीबया वाचा तेजस्ते समदीदिपम्॥'}

{'en': 'Shaunaka said: Your father read the whole of the Puranas in the days of yore. O Son of Lomaharshana, have you also made them your study?', 'sn': 'शौनक उवाच पुराणमखिलं तात पिता तेऽधीतवान्पुरा। कच्चित्त्वमपि तत्सर्वमधीषे लौमहर्षणे॥'}

{'en': 'There are in the Puranas interesting stories and the history of the first generations of the wise men. We have heard them all recited by your father.', 'sn': 'पुराणे हि कथा दिव्या आदिवंशाश्च धीमताम्। कथ्यन्ते ये पुराऽस्माभिः श्रुतपूर्वाः पितुस्तव।॥'}

{'en': 'I am desirous of hearing the history of the Bhrigu race. Tell us that history. We are all attention to listen to you.', 'sn': 'चैव ततो मया। तत्र वंशमहं पूर्वं श्रोतुमिच्छामि भार्गवम्। कथयस्व कथामेतां कल्याः स्म श्रवणे तव॥'}

{'en': 'Sauti said : That which was formerly studied by the noble Brahmanas, which was studied and narrated by Vaishampayana and others.', 'sn': 'सौतिरुवाच यदधीतं पुरा सम्यक् द्विजश्रेष्ठैर्महात्मभिः। वैशंपायनविप्रायैस्तैश्चापि कथितं यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Which was also studied by my father, has been acquired by me. Hear with all attention, O descendant of the Bhrigu race, the history of your race, respected by Indra and all the celestials, all the Rishis and the Marutas. In this great race the great and blessed Rishi Bhrigu was born.', 'sn': 'यदधीतं च पित्रा मे सम्यक् तावच्छृणुष्व यो देवैः सेन्द्रैःसर्षिमरुद्गणैः॥ पूजितः प्रवरो वंशो भार्गवो भृगुनन्दन। इमं वंशमहं पूर्वं भार्गवं ते महामुने॥'}

{'en': "I shall properly relate, O great Rishi, the history of this race, as it is in the Puranas. We are told that great Bhrigu was begotten by selfexisting Brahma from the fire at Varuna's sacrifice. Bhrigu had a beloved son, named Chyavana.", 'sn': 'निगदामि यथायुक्तं पुराणाश्रयसंयुतम्। भृगुर्महर्षिर्भगवान् ब्रह्मणा वै स्वयंभुवा॥ वरुणस्य क्रतौ जातः पावकादिति नः श्रुतम्। भृगोः सुदयितः पुत्रश्च्यवनो नाम भार्गवः॥'}
{'en': 'Chyavana had a virtuous son, named Pramati. He had a son, named Ruru by Ghritachi.', 'sn': 'च्यवनस्य च दायादः प्रमतिर्नाम धार्मिकः। प्रमतेरप्यभूत्पुत्रो घृताच्यां रुरुरित्युत॥'}

{'en': 'Ruru had a son by his wife Pramadvara. O Shaunaka, he was your grandfather; he was very virtuous and greatly learned in the Vedas.', 'sn': 'रुरोरपि सुतो जज्ञे शुनको वेदपारगः। प्रमद्वरायां धर्मात्मा तव पूर्वपितामहः॥'}

{'en': 'He was devoted to asceticism, had great repute, was learned in the Shruti, truthful, virtuous, well-regulated in his meals and was the most eminent amongst the learned in the Vedas.', 'sn': 'तपस्वी च यशस्वी च श्रुतवान् ब्रह्मवित्तमः। धार्मिकः सत्यवादी च नियतो नियताशनः॥'}

{'en': 'Shaunaka said : O Son of Suta, why was the illustrious son of Bhrigu named Chyavana? I ask you, tell me all about it.', 'sn': 'शौनक उवाच सूतपुत्र यथा तस्य भार्गवस्य महात्मनः। च्यवनत्वं परिख्यातं तन्ममाचक्ष्व पृच्छतः॥'}

{'en': 'Sauti replied : Bhrigu had a very beloved wife, (named Puloma) who became quick with child by him.', 'sn': 'सौतिरुवाच भृगोः सुदयिता भार्या पुलोमेत्यभिविश्रुता। तस्यां समभवद्गर्भो भृगुवीर्यसमुद्भवः॥'}

{'en': "When the virtuous and chaste Pauloma was in that condition, one day the greatly famous and virtuous Bhrigu, leaving her at home, went to perform his ablutions. And it was then that a Rakshasa, named Puloma, came to the Rishi's hermitage.", 'sn': 'तस्मिन् गर्भेऽथ संभूते पुलोमायां भृगूद्वह। समये समशीलिन्यां धर्मपत्न्यां यशस्विनः॥ अभिषेकाय निष्क्रान्ते भृगौ धर्मभृतां वरे। आश्रमं तस्य रक्षोऽथ पुलोमाभ्याजगाम ह॥'}

{'en': 'He, having entered into the hermitage, saw the irreproachable wife of Bhrigu. Seeing her he was filled with lust and lost his reason.', 'sn': 'तं प्रविश्याश्रमं दृष्ट्वा भृगोर्भार्यामनिन्दिताम्। हृच्छयेन समाविष्टो विचेताः समपद्यत॥'}
{'en': 'Seeing that a guest had come, beautiful Puloma, entertained him with roots and fruits of the wood.', 'sn': 'अभ्यागतं तु तद्रक्षः पुलोमा चारुदर्शना। न्यमन्त्रयत वन्येन फलमूलादिना तदा॥'}

{'en': 'O Rishi, the Rakshasa, having seen her, burnt in lust. He was very much delighted and he determined to carry away the irreproachable lady.', 'sn': 'तां तु रक्षस्तदा ब्रह्मन् हृच्छयेनाभिपीडितम्। दृष्ट्वा हृष्टमभूद्राजन् जिहीर्षुस्तामनिन्दिताम्॥'}

{'en': 'He said, “My desire is fulfilled.” So saying he seized that beautiful lady and carried her away. And in fact that lady of captivating smiles, was formerly betrothed to the Rakshasa by her father.', 'sn': 'जातमित्यब्रवीत्कार्यं जिहीर्षुर्मुदितः शुभाम्। सा हि पूर्वं वृता तेन पुलोम्ना तु शुचिस्मिता॥'}

{'en': 'But he afterwards gave her away to the Rishi Bhrigu in due rites. Since then, O descendant of the Bhrigu race, this wound rankled deep in the heart of the Rakshasa.', 'sn': 'तां तु प्रादात्पिता पश्चाद् भृगवे शास्त्रवत्तदा। तस्य तत्किल्बिषं नित्यं हृदि वर्तति भार्गव॥'}

{'en': 'He thought this very good opportunity to carry the lady away. Then he entered into the room of the holy fire where it was brightly burning.', 'sn': 'इदमन्तरमित्येवं हर्तुं चक्रे मनस्तदा। अथाग्निशरणेऽपश्यज्ज्वलन्तं जातवेदसम्॥'}
{'en': 'The Rakshasa asked the burning fire, “O Agni! tell me whose rightful wife this lady is.', 'sn': 'तमपृच्छत्ततो रक्षः पावकं ज्वलितं तदा। शंस मे कस्य भार्येयमग्ने पृच्छे ऋतेन वै॥'}

{'en': 'You, O Agni, is the mouth of celestials, tell me, I ask you. This beautiful lady was formerly betrothed to me;', 'sn': 'मुखं त्वमसि देवानां वद पावक पृच्छते। मया हीयं वृता पूर्वं भार्यार्थे वरवर्णिनी॥'}

{'en': 'was a But her vile father subsequently gave her to Bhrigu. (Tell me truly) if she can be truly called the wife of Bhrigu.', 'sn': 'पश्चादिमां पिता प्रादाद्धगवेऽनृतकारकः। सेयं यदि वरारोहा भृगोर्भार्या रहोगता॥'}

{'en': 'As I have found her alone in the hermitage, I am determined to carry her away by force. My heart burns with rage when I think that Bhrigu has obtained this beautiful woman who was betrothed to me.', 'sn': 'तथा सत्यं समाख्याहि जिहीर्षाम्याश्रमादिमाम्। समन्युस्तत्र हृदयं प्रदहन्निव तिष्ठति। मत्पूर्वाभार्यां यदिमां भृगुराप सुमध्यमाम्॥'}

{'en': "Thus did the Rakshasa ask the flaming fire again and again, whether the lady was Bhrigu's wife.", 'sn': 'सौतिरुवाच एवं रक्षस्तमामन्त्र्य ज्वलितं जातवेदसम्। शङ्कमानं भृगोर्भार्यां पुन:पुनरपृच्छत॥'}

{'en': '“O Agni, you always dwell in every creature as the witness of their piety and impiety. Answer my question truthfully.', 'sn': 'त्वमग्ने! सर्वभूतानामन्तश्चरसि नित्यदा। साक्षिवत्पुण्यपापेषु सत्यं ब्रूहि कवे वचः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhrigu has appropriated her who was chosen by me as my wife. Tell me truly therefore, whether she is not truly my wife by first choice.', 'sn': 'मत्पूर्वाऽपहता भार्या भृगुणाऽनृतकारिणा। सेयं यदि तथा मे त्वं सत्यमाख्यातुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing from you whether she is Bhrigu\'s wife or not, I shall carry her away from the hermitage even in your presence. Therefore, answer me truthfully."', 'sn': 'श्रुत्वा त्वत्तो भृगोर्भार्यां हरिष्याम्याश्रमादिमाम्। जातवेदः पश्यतस्ते वद सत्यां गिरं मम॥'}

{'en': "Sauti said: Having heard his words, the seven flamed Deity felt himself very much in difficulty. He was afraid to tell an untruth and was equally afraid of Bhrigu's curse. He at last slowly said.", 'sn': 'सौतिरुवाच तस्यैतद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सप्ताचिर्दुःखितोऽभवत्। भीतोऽनृताच्च शापाच्च भृगोरित्यब्रवीच्छनैः॥'}

{'en': 'Agni said : "O Rakshasa, it is true that this Puloma was first betrothed to you, but she was not taken by you with (the necessary) holy rites and invocations.', 'sn': 'अग्निरुवाच त्वया वृता पुलोमेयं पूर्वं दानवनन्दन। किं त्वियं विधिना पूर्वं मन्त्रवन वृता त्वया॥'}
{'en': 'And her father gave this famous Puloma to Bhrigu in gift. He did not give her to you.', 'sn': 'पित्रा तु भृगवे दत्ता पुलोमेयं यशस्विनी। ददाति न पिता तुभ्यं वरलोभान्महायशाः॥'}
{'en': 'O Rakshasa, she was duly taken by Bhrigu as his wife in my presence with all the Vedic rites.', 'sn': 'अथेमां वेददृष्टेन कर्मणा विधिपूर्वकम्। भार्यामृषि गुः प्राप मां पुरस्कृत्य दानव॥'}
{'en': 'This is she, I cannot tell a falsehood. O best of Rakshasa, falsehood is never respected in this world.', 'sn': 'सेयमित्यवगच्छामि नानृतं वक्तुमुत्सहे। नानृतं हि सदा लोके पूज्यते दानवोत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Narada said This excellent and spacious city is known by the name of Hiranyapura. It is the city of the Daityas and the Danavas, who practice a hundred different illusions,', 'sn': 'नारद उवाच हिरण्यपुरमित्येतत् ख्यात् पुरवरं महत्। दैत्यानां दानवानां च मायाशतविचारिणाम्॥'}

{'en': 'It having been built with no little care by the divine architect (Vishvakarama) and planned by Maya (Danava) was placed in these nether regions-the Patalam.', 'sn': 'अनल्पेन प्रयत्नेन निर्मितं विश्वकर्मणा। मयेन मनसा सृष्टं पातालतलमाश्रितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Here the Danavas, endued with great spirit and energy, practicing a thousand kind of different illusions, inhabit. They were, in the days of old, heroes who had received the grant of boons.', 'sn': 'अत्र मायासहस्राणि विकुर्वाणा महौजसः। दानवा निवसन्ति स्म शूरा दत्तवराः पुरा॥'}

{'en': 'By Shakra, by Yama or by Varuna or by any body clse they were incapable of being brought inder subjugation; as also by the Lord of wealth (Kubera).', 'sn': 'नैते शक्रेण नान्येन यमेन वरुणेन वा। शक्यन्ते वशमानेतुं तथैव धनदेन च।।४!'}

{'en': 'The Asuras, known as Kalakhanjas who have their origin in the feet of Vishnu and the Rakshasas, known as Yatudhanas who have their origin in the feet of Brahma, gifted with teeth and of fearful impetus and endued with strength equal to the force of the wind and with the heroism of illusion, live here, O Matali.', 'sn': 'असुराः कालखञ्जाश्च तथा विष्णुपदोद्भवाः॥ नैर्ऋता यातुधानाश्च ब्रह्मपादोद्भवाश्च ये॥ दंष्ट्रिणो भीमवेगाश्च वातवेगपराक्रमाः। मायावीर्योपसम्पन्ना निवसन्त्यत्र मातले॥'}

{'en': 'The Danavas named Nivatkavachas, who are hard to be vanquished in battle (also live here.) You know how Shakra is not able to cope with them.', 'sn': 'निवातकवचा नाम दानवा युद्धदुर्मदाः। जानासि च यथा शक्रो नैताशक्नोति बाधितुम्॥'}

{'en': 'Yourself and your son Gomukha, O Matali and the king of the gods, the lord of Sachi, with his son, have been repulsed by them.', 'sn': 'बहुशो मातले त्वं च तव पुत्रश्च गोमुखः। निर्भग्नो देवराजश्च सहपुत्रः शचीपतिः॥'}

{'en': 'See these mansions, O Matali, made of gold and silver and embroidered with suitable workmanship filled up according to their scientific principles.', 'sn': 'पश्य वेश्मानि रौक्माणि मातले राजतानि च। कर्मणा विधियुक्तेन युक्तान्युपगतानि च॥'}

{'en': 'Decorated with Vaidurya-gems and with corals and with the species of white marble, called Arka and with the shining gems, called Vajrasara,', 'sn': 'वैदूर्यमणिचित्राणि प्रवालरुचिराणि च। अर्कस्फटिकशुभ्राणि वज्रसारोज्ज्वलानि च।॥'}

{'en': 'They shine as if, made of bricks and set with Padmaraga gems, and they look as if made of stones or of wood.', 'sn': 'पार्थिवानीव चाभान्ति पद्मरागमयानि च। शैलानीव च दृश्यन्ते दारवाणीव चाप्युत॥'}

{'en': 'They are lustrous like the rays of the sun; and are blazing like the fire and set with cluster of gems and precious stones; they are high and stand close to one another.', 'sn': 'सूर्यरूपाणि चाभान्ति दीप्ताग्निसदृशानि च। मणिजालविचित्राणि प्रांशूनि निबिडानि च॥'}

{'en': 'All these are incapable of being described with reference to their beauty, to with reference to the materials they are made of. They are erected with many advantages and comforts; and they have answered these objects very well. They are of a large size.', 'sn': 'नैतानि शक्यं निर्देष्टुं रूपतो द्रव्यतस्तथा। गुणतश्चैव सिंद्धानि प्रमाणगुणवन्ति च॥'}

{'en': 'Look at the sporting grounds of the Daityas; and look at the resting places and beds, as also these vessels and seats set with gems and of great value.', 'sn': 'आक्रीडान् पश्य दैत्यानां तथैव शयनान्युत। रत्लवन्ति महार्हाणि भाजनान्यासनानि च॥'}

{'en': 'Look at these walls which are like masses of clouds; and these fountains of water and also the trees producing flowers and fruits at their will, which can also be removed from one place to another at their pleasure.', 'sn': 'जलदाभांस्तथा शैलांस्तोयप्रस्रवणानि च। कामपुष्पफलांश्चापि पादपान् कामचारिणः॥'}

{'en': 'See, O Matali, in these regions if there is a bridegroom who is to your liking or else we shall go to another direction of this earth.', 'sn': 'मातले कश्चिदत्रापि रुचिरस्ते वरो भवेत्। अथवान्यां दिशं भूमेर्गच्छाव यदि मन्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'Matali then said to him who spoke thus, "O celestial Rishi, I cannot do what would not be to the liking of the dwellers of the heaven.', 'sn': 'मातलिस्त्वब्रवीदेनं भाषमाणं तथाविधम्। देवर्षे नैव मे कार्य विप्रियं त्रिदिवौकसाम्॥'}

{'en': 'The gods and the Danavas, though brothers, are in open enmity with each other and how can I approve of an alliance with the enemies.', 'sn': 'नित्यानुषक्तवैरा हि भ्रातरो देवदानवाः। परपक्षण सम्बन्धं रोचयिष्याम्यहं कथम्॥'}

{'en': 'It is better that we should go elsewhere. It is not proper that we should seek among the Danavas. I know your nature and know that you desire to sow discord."', 'sn': 'अन्यत्र साधु गच्छाव द्रष्टुं नार्हामि दानवान्। जानामि तव चात्मानं हिंसात्मकमनं तथा॥'}

{'en': 'Markandeya said : Skanda was adorned with a golden armlet and garland; he wore a crest and crown of gold; his eyes were gold coloured and they were very bright.', 'sn': 'मार्कण्डेय उवाच उपविष्टं तु तं स्कन्दं हिरण्यकवचस्रजम्। हिरण्यचूडमुकुटं हिरण्याक्षं महाप्रभम्॥'}

{'en': 'He had sharp teeth, he was clad in a red garment, he looked very handsome, he had a most charming appearance, he possessed all good characteristics, he was the favorite of the three worlds.', 'sn': 'लोहिताम्बरसंवीतं तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्र मनोरमम्। सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्नं त्रैलोक्यस्यापि सुप्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'He was a giver of boons, he was brave and youthful and he was adorned with ear-rings. When he was resting, the goddess of wealth, looking like a lotus and assuming a body, came to him.', 'sn': 'ततस्तं वरदं शूरं युवानं मृष्टकुण्डलम्। अभजत् पद्मरूपा श्रीः स्वयमेव शरीरिणी॥'}

{'en': 'When he became thus possessed of the goddess of wealth, that illustrious and delicate being looked like the full moon.', 'sn': 'श्रिया जुष्टः पृषुयशाः स कुमारवरस्तदा। निषण्णो दृश्यते भूतैः पौर्णमास्यां यथा शशी॥'}

{'en': 'The high-souled Brahmanas worshipped that greatly powerful one and the great Rishis spoke thus to Skanda.', 'sn': 'अपूजयन् महात्मानो ब्राह्मणास्तं महाबलम्। इदमाहुस्तदा चैव स्कन्दं तत्र महर्षयः॥'}

{'en': 'The Rishis said: O golden egg-born one, may prosperity come to you. May you be the cause of doing good to the world. Though you have been born in six nights, all the worlds have come to your subjection.', 'sn': 'ऋषय ऊचुः हिरण्यगर्भ भद्रं ते लोकानां शङ्करो भव। त्वया षड्राजजातेन सर्वे लोका वशीकृताः॥'}

{'en': 'O foremost of celestials, you have removed all their fears, therefore become the Indra of the three worlds and thus remove their cause of apprehension.', 'sn': 'अभयं च पुनर्दत्तं त्वयैवैषां सुरोत्तमा तस्मादिन्द्रो भवानस्तु त्रैलोक्यस्याभयंकरः॥'}

{'en': 'Skanda said: O great ascetics, what Indra does with all this worlds? How does that lord of the celestials unceasingly protect the hosts of gods?', 'sn': 'स्कन्द उवाच किमिन्द्रः सर्वलोकानां करोतीह तपोधनाः। कथं देवगणांश्चैव पाति नित्यं सुरेश्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'The Rishis said: Indra gives strength, power, effspring and happiness to all beings. When propetiated that lord of the celestials bestows on all creatures all the objects of their desire.', 'sn': 'ऋषय ऊचुः इन्द्रो दधाति भूतानां बलं तेजः प्रजाः सुखम्। तुष्टः प्रयच्छति तथा सर्वान् कामान् सुरेश्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'He destroys the wicked and fulfill the desires of the righteous. That destroyer of Bala assigns to all creatures their various duties. He officiates for the sun and the moon in places where there is no sun and the moon. When occasion requires he acts for fire, air, earth and water. These are the duties of Indra. His capacities are immense. You, too, are greatly powerful; therefore, O hero, become our Indra.', 'sn': 'दुर्वृत्तानां संहरति व्रतस्थानां प्रयच्छति। अनुशास्ति च भूतानि कार्येषु बलसूदनः॥ असूर्ये च भवेत् सूर्यस्तथाचन्द्रे च चन्द्रमाः। भवत्यग्निश्च वायुश्च पृथिव्यापश्च कारणैः॥ एतदिन्द्रेण कर्तव्यमिन्द्रे हि विपुलं बलम्। त्वं च वीर बली श्रेष्ठस्तस्मादिन्द्रो भवस्व नः॥'}

{'en': 'Indra said: O mighty armed one, O excellent being, make us happy by becoming the lord of all of us. You are worthy of the honour; therefore we shall instal you this very day.', 'sn': 'शक्र उवाच भवस्वेन्द्रो महाबाहो सर्वेषां नः सुखावहः। अभिषिच्यस्व चैवाद्य प्राप्तरूपोऽसि सत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Skanda said: O Indra, continue to rule over the three worlds with self-possession and with a desire for (new) conquests. I shall remain your humble servant. I do not desire to get your sovereignity.', 'sn': 'स्कन्द उवाच शाधि त्वमेव त्रैलोक्यमव्यचो विजये रतः। अहं ते किङ्करः शक्र न ममेन्द्रत्वमीप्सितम्॥'}

{'en': 'Indra said: O hero, your prowess is wonderful. Therefore vanquish the enemies of the celestials. People have been greatly astonished to see your unirivalled prowess.', 'sn': 'शक्र उवाच बलं तवाद्भुतं वीर त्वं देवानामरीन् जहि। अवज्ञास्यन्ति मां लोका वीर्येण तव विस्मिताः॥'}

{'en': 'I have been bereft of my prowess. Defeated as I am by you, if I am now to act as Indra, I will not be able to command the respect of all creatures. Every one would be busy to bring about disunion, then O lord, they would be the partisans of one or other of us.', 'sn': 'इन्द्रत्वे तु स्थितं वीर बलहीनं पराजितम्। आवयोश्च मिथो भेदे प्रयतिष्यन्त्यतन्द्रिताः॥ भेदिते च त्वयि विभो लोको द्वैधमुपेष्यति। द्विधाभूतेषु लोकेषु निश्चितेष्वावयोस्तथा॥'}

{'en': "O greatly powerful one, when they will form themselves into two distinct factions, war as before would be the result of that disunion. In that war you will undoubtedly be able to defeat me at your pleasure and then to become the lord of all the worlds. Don't think on this subject.", 'sn': 'विचहः सम्प्रवर्तेत भूतभेदान्महाबल। तत्र त्वं मां रणे तात यथाश्रद्धं विजेष्यसि॥ तस्मादिन्द्रो भवानेव भविता मा विचारय।'}

{'en': 'Skanda said: O Indra, you are my king as well as that of the three worlds. May prosperity come to you. Tell me if I can obey any of your commands.', 'sn': 'स्कन्द उवाच त्वमेव राजा भद्रं ते त्रैलोक्यस्य ममैव च।॥ करोमि किं च ते शक्र शासनं तद् ब्रवीहि मे।'}

{'en': 'Indra said: O greatly powerful one, O Skanda, at your command I shall continue to act as Indra. If you have said this deliberately and earnestly then hear me how you can gratify your desire to serve me. Become the generallissimo of the celestial army.', 'sn': 'इन्द्र उवाच अहमिन्द्रो भविष्यामि तव वाक्यान्महाबल।॥ यदि सत्यमिदं वाक्यं निश्चयाद् भाषितं त्वया। यदि वा शासनं स्कन्द कर्तुमिच्छसि मे शृणु॥ अभिषिच्यस्व देवानां सैनापत्ये महाबला'}

{'en': 'Skand said: Instal me (then) as the generallisimo (of the celestial army) for the destruction of the Danavas, for the good of the celestials and for the well-being of Brahmanas and kine.', 'sn': 'स्कन्द उवाच दानवानां विनाशाय देवानामर्थसिद्धये॥ गोब्राह्मणहितार्थाय सैनापत्येऽभिषिञ्च माम्।'}

{'en': 'Markandeya said : Thus having been installed by Indra and all the other celestials and honoured by the great Rishis, he looked exceedingly grand. The golden umbrella (held over his head) looked like a halo of blazing fire.', 'sn': 'मार्कण्डेय उवाच सोऽभिषिक्तो मघवता सर्वैर्देवगणैः सह॥ अतीव शुशुभे तत्र पूज्यमानो महर्षिभिः। तत्र तत् काञ्चनं छत्रं ध्रियमाणं व्यरोचत॥ यथैव सुसमिद्धस्य पावकस्यात्ममण्डलम्।'}

{'en': 'O foremost of men, that illustrious deity, the vanquisher of Tripura (Indra) Lord Shiva with his wife came there and put round his neck the celestial garland of gold mady by Vishwakarma.', 'sn': 'विश्वकर्मकृता चास्य दिव्या माला हिरण्मयी॥ आबद्धा त्रिपुरघ्नेन स्वयमेव यशस्विना। आगम्य मनुजव्याघ्र सह देव्या परंतप॥'}

{'en': 'That exalted god Vrishadhvaja (Siva) honoured him with a joyous heart. That deity is called Rudra by the Brahmanas and therefore Skanda is called the son of Rudra.', 'sn': 'अर्चयामास सुप्रीतो भगवान् गोवृषध्वजः। रुद्रमग्निं द्विजाः प्राहू रुद्रसूनुस्ततस्तु सः॥'}

{'en': 'The semen ejaculated by Rudra converted in the form of a white mountain. The constalations Krittikas etc. had transmitted the was fire semen at that white mountain made of Rudras semen.', 'sn': 'रुद्रेण शुक्रमुत्सृष्टं तच्छ्वेत: पर्वतोऽभवत्। पावकस्येन्द्रियं श्वेते कृत्तिकाभिः कृतं नगे॥'}

{'en': 'As Rudra was seen by all the dwellers of heaven to honour Guha (Skanda), the foremost of all accomplished beings is for this reason called the son of Rudra.', 'sn': 'पूज्यमानं तु रुद्रेण दृष्ट्वा सर्वे दिवौकसः। रुद्रसूनुं ततः प्राहुर्गुहं गुणवतां वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'The child had his birth from the action of Rudra entering into the constitution of the deity of fire and for this reasort Skanda is called the son of Rudra.', 'sn': 'अनुप्रविश्य रुद्रेण वह्नि जातो ह्ययं शिशुः। तत्र जातस्ततः स्कन्दो रुद्रसूनुस्ततोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'O descendant of Bharata, as Rudra, that fire god, (Skanda) Svaha and the six wives (of the seven Rishis) were the cause of the birth of the great deity Skanda, so was he for that reason called the son of Rudra.', 'sn': 'रुद्रस्य वह्नः स्वाहायाः षण्णां स्त्रीणां च भारत। जातः स्कन्दः सुरश्रेष्ठो रुद्रसूनुस्ततोऽभवत्॥'}

{'en': 'That son of the deity of fire was clad in a pair of red cloths. He thus looked like the sun peeing from behind a mass of red clouds.', 'sn': 'अरजे वाससी रक्त वसानः पावकात्मजः। भाति दीप्तवपुः श्रीमान् रक्ताभ्राभ्यामिवांशुमान्।॥'}

{'en': 'The red cock given to him by the fire god became his sign. When sitting on the flag-staff of his car it looked like the very image of the all destroying fire.', 'sn': 'कुक्कुटश्चाग्निना दत्तस्तस्य केतुरलंकृतः। रथे समुच्छ्रितो भाति कालाग्निरिव लोहितः॥'}

{'en': 'The presiding deity of the power which gives voctory to the celestials, which is the direction of all exertions of all creatures and which constitutes their glory, then came to him.', 'sn': 'या चेष्टा सर्वभूतानां प्रभा शान्तिर्बलं तथा। अचतस्तस्य सा शक्तिर्देवानां जयवर्धिनी॥'}

{'en': 'A mystreious charm entered into his constitution, the charm which manifests its power on the battle field. Beauty, strength, piety, power, might, truthfulness, rectitude, devotion to Brahmanas, freedom from illusion or perplexity, protection of followers, destruction of foes and care of all creatures, these, O lord of men, are the onborn virtues of Skanda.', 'sn': 'विवेश कवचं चास्य शरीरे सहजं तथा। युध्यमानस्य देवस्य प्रादुर्भवति तत् सदा॥ शक्तिधर्मो बलं तेजः कान्तत्वं सत्यमुन्नतिः। ब्रह्मण्यत्वमसम्मोहो भक्तानां परिरक्षणम्॥ निकृन्तनं च शत्रूणां लोकानां चाभिरक्षणम्। स्कन्देन सह जातानि सर्वाण्येव जनाधिप॥'}

{'en': 'Thus installed by all the celestial, he looked pleased and complacient. Dressed in his best style, he looked as beautiful as the full moon.', 'sn': 'एवं देवगणैः सर्वैः सोऽभिषिक्तः स्वलंकृतः। बभौ प्रतीत: सुमनाः परिपूर्णेन्दुमण्डल डलः॥'}

{'en': 'The much esteemed incantation of the Vedic hymns, the music of the celestial musicians, the songs of the celestial and the Gandharvas then rose on all sides.', 'sn': 'इष्टैः स्वाध्यायघोषैश्च देवतूर्यवरैरपि। देवगन्धर्वगीतैश्च सर्वैरप्सरसां गणैः॥'}

{'en': 'Surrounded by the well dressed Apsaras, by many gay and happy looking Pishachas and by the celestial, that son of Agni sported in all his grandeur. To the dwellers of heaven, the installed Skanda looked like the sun rising after the darkness has passed away. Then thousands of the celestial forces.', 'sn': 'एतैश्चान्यैश्च बहुभिस्तुष्टैर्हष्टैः स्वलंकृतैः। सुसंवृतः पिशाचानां गणैर्देवगणैस्तथा॥ क्रीडन् भाति तदा देवैरभिषिक्तश्च पावकिः। अभिषिक्तं महासेनमपश्यन्त दिवौकसः॥ विनिहत्य तमः सूर्यं यथेहाभ्युदितं तथा। अथैनमभ्ययुः सर्वा देवसेनाः सहस्रशः॥'}

{'en': 'Saying “You are our lord”, came to him from all directions. That exalted one, surrounded by all creatures and praised and with honoured by them, encouraged them in return. Satakratu (Indra) also, after having installed Skanda as the generallissimo of the celestial army.', 'sn': 'अस्माकं त्वं पतिरिति ब्रुवाणा: सर्वतो दिशः। ताः समासाद्य भगवान् सर्वभूतगणैर्वृतः॥ अर्चितस्तु स्तुतश्चैव सान्त्वयामास ता अपि। शतक्रतुश्चाभिषिच्य स्कन्दं सेनापति तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Remembered Devasena whom he had once rescued. "This one has undoubtedly been destined by Brahma himself to be the husband of that lady," thus reflecting, the slayer of Vala (Indra) brought her adorned all ornaments; and he then thus spoke to Skanda, “O foremost of the celestial, even before your birth this lady was destined to be your wife by the Self-create (Brahma); therefore with due rites and Mantras accept her hand, her right hand which is like a lotus." Having been thus addressed, he accepted her hands in due rites.', 'sn': 'सस्मार तां देवसेनां या सा तेन विमोक्षिता। अयं तस्याः पतिर्नूनं विहितो ब्रह्मणा स्वयम्॥ विचिन्त्येत्यानयामास देवसेनां ह्यलंकृताम्। स्कन्दं प्रोवाच बलभिदियं कन्या सुरोत्तम॥ अजाते त्वयि निर्दिष्टा त्व पत्नी स्वयम्भुवा। तस्मात् त्वमस्या विधिवत् पाणि मन्त्रपुरस्कृतम्॥ गृहाण दक्षिणं देव्याः पाणिना पद्मवर्चसा। एवमुक्तः स जचाह तस्याः पाणिं यथाविधि॥'}

{'en': 'Brihaspati learned in Mantras performed all necessary prayers and oblations. Thus Devasena became known amongst men as the wife of Skanda.', 'sn': 'बृहस्पतिर्मन्त्रविद्धि जजाप च जुहाव च। एवं स्कन्दस्य महिषीं देवसेनां विदुर्जनाः॥'}

{'en': 'She was also called by the Brahmanas as Shashti, Lakshmi, Asha, Sukhaprada, Sinivali, Kuhu, Sadvritti and Aprajita.', 'sn': 'षष्ठी यां ब्राह्मणाः प्राहुर्लक्ष्मीमाशां सुखप्रदाम्। सिनीवाली कुहूं चैव सवृत्तिमपराजिताम्॥'}

{'en': 'When Skanda was married to Devasena, the goddess of wealth in her embodied form waited upon him with diligence. As Skanda attained celebrity on the fifth lunar day, it was called Sripanchami; and as he obtained his object in the sixth, that day was considered to be a great tihi.', 'sn': 'यदा स्कन्दः पतिर्लब्धः शाश्वतो देवसेनया। तदा तमाश्रयल्लक्ष्मीः स्वयं देवी शरीरिणी॥ श्रीजुष्टः पञ्चमी स्कन्दस्तस्माच्छ्रीपञ्चमी स्मृता। षष्ठ्यां कृतार्थोऽभूद्यस्मात्तस्मात् षष्ठी महातिथिः॥'}

{'en': 'Having saluted Narayana and Nara the best of mal beings, as also Sarasvati the Goddess of learning, let us cry success.', 'sn': 'नारायणं नमस्कृत्य नरं चैव नरोत्तमम्। देवी सरस्वती व्यासं ततो जयमुदीरयेत्।।'}

{'en': "Janamejaya said Having heard of that fighting with iron bolts between the heroes of the Vrishni and the Andhaka races, and having been informed also Krishna's departure from this world, what did the Pandavas do?", 'sn': 'जनमेजय उवाच एवं वृष्ण्यन्धककुले श्रुत्वा मौसलमाहवम्। पाण्डवाः किमकुर्वन्त तथा कृष्णे दिवं गते॥'}

{'en': "Vaishampayana said, Having heard the particulars of the great destruction of the Vrishnis, the Kaurava king was determined on leaving the world. He addressed Arjuna saying—'O you of great intelligence, it is time which cooks every creature (in is cauldron), I thing that what has taken place is due to the cords of Time (with which he binds us all). You should also see it.'", 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच श्रुत्वैवं कौरवो राजा वृष्णीनां कदनं महत्। प्रस्थाने मतिमाधाय वाक्यमर्जुनमब्रवीत्॥ काल: पचति भूतानि सर्वाण्येव महामते। कालपाशमहं मन्ये त्वमपि द्रष्टुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': "Thus addressed by his brother, the son of Kunti only repeated the word, “Time, Time!' and fully endorsed the view of his eldest brother endured with great intelligence.", 'sn': 'इत्युक्तः स तु कौन्तेयः कालः काल इति ब्रुवन्। अन्वपद्यत तद् वाक्यं भ्रातुर्येष्ठस्य धीमतः॥'}

{'en': 'Knowing the resolution of Arjuna, Bhimasena and the twins fully endorsed the words which Arjuna had said.', 'sn': 'अर्जुनस्य मतं ज्ञात्वा भीमसेनो यमौ तथा। अन्वपद्यन्त तद् वाक्यं यदुक्तं सव्यसाचिना॥'}

{'en': 'Determined upon retiring from the world for acquiring merit, they brought Yuyutsu before them. Yudhishthira made over the kingdom to the son of his uncle by his Vaishya wife.', 'sn': 'ततो युयुत्सुमानाय्य प्रव्रजन् धर्मकाम्यया। राज्यं परिददौ सर्वं वैश्यापुत्रे युधिष्ठिरः॥'}

{'en': "Installing Parikshit also on their throne, as king, the eldest brother of the Pandavas, filled with sorrow, addressed Subhadra, saying, 'This son of your son will be the king of the Kurus. The survivor of the Yadus, viz., Vajra, has been made a king.", 'sn': 'अभिषिच्य स्वराज्ये च राजानं च परिक्षितम्। दुःखार्तश्चाब्रवीद् राजा सुभद्रा पाण्डवाग्रजः॥ एष पुत्रस्य पुत्रस्ते कुरुराजो भविष्यति। यदूनां परिशेषश्च वज्रो राजा कृतश्च ह॥'}

{'en': 'Parikshit will rule in Hastinapur, while the Yadava prince, Vajra, will rule in Shakraprastha. You should protect him, Never set you heart on sin,', 'sn': 'परिक्षिद्धास्तिनपुरे शक्रप्रस्थे च यादवः। वज्रो राजा त्वया रक्ष्यो मा चाधर्मे मनः कृथाः॥'}

{'en': 'Having said these words, king Yudhishthira, the just, alone with his brothers, promptly offered oblations of water to Vasudevas of great intelligence, as also his old maternal uncle, and Rama add others. He then duly performed the Shraddhas of all those kinsmen.', 'sn': 'इत्युक्त्वा धर्मराजः स वासुदेवस्य धीमतः। मातुलस्य च वृद्धस्य रामादीनां तथैव च॥ भ्रातृभिः सह धर्मात्मा कृत्वोदकमतन्द्रितः श्राद्धान्युद्दिश्य सर्वेषां चकार विधिवत् तदा॥'}

{'en': 'The king, in honour of Hari, and naming him repeatedly, fed the Dvaipayana Vyasa, and Narada, and Markandeya having penances for wealth, and Yajnavalkya of Bharadvaja race, with many delicious food.', 'sn': 'द्वैपायनं नारदं च मार्कण्डेयं तपोधनम्। भारद्वाजं याज्ञवल्क्यं हरिमुद्दिश्य यत्नवान्॥'}

{'en': "In honour of Krishna, he also gave away many jewels and gems, and presses and clothes, and villages and horses and cars, and female salves by hundreds and thousands to foremost of Brahmanas. Calling the citizens, Kripa was installed as the preceptor and Parikshit was made over to him as his disciple, O chief of Bharata's race! Then Yudhishthira once more summoned all his subjects.", 'sn': 'अभोजयत् स्वादु भोज्यं कीर्तयित्वा च शाङ्गिणम्। ददौ रत्नानि वासांसि ग्रामानश्वान् रथांस्तथा॥ स्त्रियश्च द्विजमुख्येभ्यस्तदा शतसहस्रशः। कृपमभ्यर्च्य च गुरुमथ पौरपुरस्कृतम्॥ शिष्यं परिक्षितं तस्मै ददौ भरतसत्तमः। ततस्तु प्रकृतीः सर्वाः समानाय्य युधिष्ठिरः॥'}

{'en': "The royal sage informed them of his desire. The citizens and the villagers hearing it kings' words became stricken with anxiety and disapproved of them. “This should never be done'—said they to the king.", 'sn': 'सर्वमाचष्ट राजर्षिश्चिकीर्षितमथात्मनः। ते श्रुत्वैव वचस्तस्य पौरजानपदा जनाः॥ भृशमुद्विग्नमनमो नाभ्यनन्दन्त तद्वचः। नैवं कर्तव्यमिति ते तदोचुस्तं जनाधिपम्॥'}

{'en': 'The king, knowing the changes brought about by time, did not listen to their advice. were Possessed of righteous soul, he persuaded the people to submit his views.', 'sn': 'न च राजा तथाकार्षीत् कालपर्यायधर्मवित्। ततोऽनुमान्य धर्मात्मा पौरजानपदं जनम्॥'}

{'en': "He them made up his mind he leave the world. His brothers also formed the same resolution. Then Dharma's son Yudhishthira, the king of the Kurus, renouncing his ornaments, wore barks of trees Bhima and Arjuna and the twines, and the illustrious Draupadi similarly clad them salves in barks of trees, O sing. Having caused the preliminary rites of religion, O chief of Bharata's race which to bless them in the accomplishment of their design, those foremost of men renounced their sacred fires to the water. Seeing the preaches in that guise the ladies wept aloud.", 'sn': 'गमनाय मतिं चक्रे भ्रातरशास्य ते तदा। ततः स राजा कौरव्यो धर्मपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः॥ उत्सृज्याभरणान्यङ्गाज्जगृहे वल्कलान्युत। भीमार्जुनयमाश्चैव द्रौपदी च यशस्विनी॥ तथैव जगृहु: सर्वे वल्कलानि नराधिप। विधिवत् कारयित्वेष्टिं नैष्ठिकी भरतर्षभ॥ समुत्सृज्याप्सु सर्वेऽग्नीन् प्रतस्थुर्नरपुङ्गवाः। तत: प्ररुरुदुः सर्वाः स्त्रियो दृष्ट्वा नरोत्तमान्॥'}

{'en': 'They seemed to look as they had looked formerly when with Draupadi forming the sixth in number they had left the capital after their defect at dice. All the brothers, however, were infinitely delighted at the prospect of their retirement.', 'sn': 'प्रस्थितान् द्रौपदीषष्ठान् पुरा द्यूतजितान् यथा। हर्षोऽभवच्च सर्वेषां भ्रातॄणां गमनं प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'Ascertaining the desire of Yudhishthira and seeing the destruction of the Vrishnis, no other course of action could satisfy them then. The five brothers, with Draupadi forming the sixth, and a dog forming the seventh, started on their Journey. Thus did king Yudhishthira depart, himself heading a party of seven, from the city of Hastinapur. The citizens and they royal ladies followed them for some distance.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिरमतं ज्ञात्वा वृष्णिक्षयमवेक्ष्य च। भ्रातरः पञ्च कृष्णा च षष्ठी श्वा चैव सप्तमः॥ आत्मना सप्तमो राजा निर्ययौ गजसाह्वयात्। पौरेरनुगतो दूरं सर्वैरन्तःपुरैस्तथा।॥'}

{'en': 'None of them, however, could venture to address the king for persuading him so give up his intention. The citizens then returned.', 'sn': 'न चैनमशकत् कश्चिन्निवर्तस्वेति भाषितुम्। न्यवर्तन्त ततः सर्वे नरा नगरवासिनः॥'}

{'en': "Kripa and, others stood around Yuyutsu as their centre, Ulupi the daughter of the Naga chief, O you of Kuru's race, entered the waters of Ganga.", 'sn': 'कृपप्रभृतयश्चैव युयुत्सुं पर्यवारयन्। विवेश गङ्गां कौरव्य उलूपी भुजगात्मजा।॥'}

{'en': 'The princess Chitrangada started for the capital of Manipur. The other ladies who were the grandmothers of Parikshit gathered around him.', 'sn': 'चित्राङ्गदा ययौ चापि मणिपूरपुरं प्रति। शिष्टाः परिक्षितं त्वन्या मातरः पर्यवारयन्॥'}

{'en': "Meanwhile the great Pandavas, O you of Kuru's race, and the illustrious Draupadi, having observed the preminary fast, started with their faces towards he est.", 'sn': 'पाण्डवाश्च महात्मानो द्रौपदी च यशस्विनी। कृतोपवासाः कौरव्य प्रययुः प्रामुखस्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing themselves on Yoga those great ones, resolved to observe the religion of Renunciation, passed through various countries and teached various rivers and seas.', 'sn': 'योगयुक्ता महात्मानस्त्यागधर्ममुपेयुषः। अभिजग्मुर्बहून् देशान् सरितः सागरांस्तथा॥'}

{'en': "Yudhishthira proceeded first Behind him was Bhima;. next walked Arjuna; after him were the twins in the order of their birth; behind them all, O foremost one of Bharata's race, went Draupadi, that first of women, endued with great beauty, of dark Complexion, and having eyes like lotus petals.", 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिरो ययावग्रे भीमस्तु तदनन्तरम्। अर्जुनस्तस्य चान्वेव यमौ चापि यथाक्रमम्॥ पृष्ठतस्तु वरारोहा श्यामा पद्मदलेक्षणा। द्रौपदी योषितां श्रेष्ठा ययौ भरतसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'While the Pandavas started for the forest a dog followed them, Proceeding on, those heroes reached the sea of red waters.', 'sn': 'श्वा चैवानुययावेकः प्रस्थितान् पाण्डवान् वनम्। क्रमेण ते ययुर्वीरा लौहित्यं सलिलार्णवम्॥'}

{'en': 'Dhananjaya had not thrown off is celestial bow Gandiva nor his couple of inexhaustible quivers, actuated, O king by the cupidity for valuable things.', 'sn': 'गाण्डीवं तु धनुर्दिव्यं न मुमोच धनञ्जयः। रत्नलोभान्महाराज ते चाक्षय्ये महेषुधी॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandavas there saw the God of Fire standing before them like hill. Closing their way, the god stood there in his embodied form.', 'sn': 'अग्निं ते ददृशुस्तत्र स्थितं शैलमिवाग्रतः। मार्गमावृत्य तिष्ठन्तं साक्षात्पुरुषविग्रहम्॥'}

{'en': "The deity of seven flames then addressed the Pandavas, saving—'O heroic sons of Pandu, known me as the God of Fire.", 'sn': 'ततो देवः स सप्तार्चिः पाण्डवानिदमब्रवीत्। भो भोः पाण्डुसुता वीराः पावकं मां निबोधत॥'}

{'en': 'O mighty-armed Yudhishthira, O Bhimasena who are a scorcher of enemies, O Arjuna, and O twines of great courage, listen to what I say!', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर महाबाहो भीमसेन परंतप। अर्जुनाश्विसुतौ वीरौ निबोधत वचो मम॥'}

{'en': "Oforemost ones of Kuru's race, I am the God of Fire. The forest of Khandava was burnt by me, through the power of Arjuna and of Narayana himself.", 'sn': 'अहमग्निः कुरुश्रेष्ठा मया दग्धं च खाण्डवम्। अर्जुनस्य प्रभावेण तथा नारायणस्य च॥'}

{'en': 'Let your brother Phalguna proceed to the forest after casting off Gandiva, that great weapon. He has no longer any necessity for it.', 'sn': 'अयं वः फाल्गुनो भ्राता गाण्डीवं परमायुधम्। परित्यज्य वने यातु नानेनार्थोऽस्ति कश्चन॥'}

{'en': 'That precious discus, which was with the great Krishna, has disappeared (from the world).. When the time again comes, it will return into and his hands.', 'sn': 'चक्ररत्नं तु यत् कृष्णे स्थितमासीन्महात्मनि। गतं तच्च पुनर्हस्ते कालेनैष्यति तस्य ह॥'}

{'en': 'This foremost of hows viz., Gandiva, was procured by me from Varuna for the us of Partha. let it be made over to Varuna himself.', 'sn': 'वरुणादाहृतं पूर्वं मयैतत् पार्थकारणात्। गाण्डीवं धनुषां श्रेष्ठं वरुणायैव दीयताम्॥'}

{'en': 'At this, all the brothers requested Dhananjaya to do what the god said. He then threw into the waters (of the sea) both the bow and the couple of inexhaustible quivers.', 'sn': 'ततस्ते भ्रातरः सर्वं धनञ्जयमचोदयन्। स जले प्राक्षिपच्चैतत्तथाक्षय्ये महेषुधी॥'}

{'en': "After this, O chief of Bharata's race the God of Fire disappeared then and these the heroic sons of Pandu next went out with their faces turned towards the South.", 'sn': 'ततोऽग्निर्भरतश्रेष्ठ तत्रैवान्तरधीयत। ययुश्च पाण्डवा वीरास्ततस्ते दक्षिणामुखाः॥'}
{'en': "Then, by the northern coast of the salt sea, those princes of Bharata's race, went to the south west.", 'sn': 'ततस्ते तूत्तरेणैव तीरेण लवणाम्भसः। जग्मुर्भरतशार्दूल दिशं दक्षिणपश्चिमाम्॥'}
{'en': 'Turning next towards the west, they saw the city of Dwraka covered by the ocean.', 'sn': 'ततः पुनः समावृत्ता पश्चिमां दिशमेव ते। ददृशुभरकां चापि सागरेण परिप्लुताम्॥'}

{'en': 'Turning next to the north, those foremost ones went on observant of Yoga, they were desirous of going round the whole earth.', 'sn': 'उदीची पुनरावृत्य ययुर्भरतसत्तमाः। प्रादक्षिण्यं चिकीर्षन्तः पृथिव्या योगधर्मिणः॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said If any person, desirous of accomplishing acts of charity and sacrifices, fails to find (the necessary) wealth, and thirst of wealth gets the better of him, what course should he pursue to obtain happiness?', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच ईहमानः समारम्भान् यदि नासादयेद् धनम्। धनतृष्णाभिभूतश्च किं कुर्वन् सुखमाप्नुयात्॥'}

{'en': 'He who makes no difference between two opposite agents, viz., pleasure and pain, honour and insult, etc., who never troubles himself for the gratification of his desire for worldly possessions, who observes veracity of speech, who has freed himself from all kinds of attachment, and who has renounced his desire for action, is, O Bharata, a happy man.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच सर्वसाम्यमनायासं सत्यवाक्यं च भारत। निर्वेदश्चाविधित्सा च यस्य स्यात् स सुखी नरः॥'}

{'en': 'The ancients say these are the five means by which perfect tranquility or emancipation could be obtained. These are called Heaven. These are Religion. These form the highest happiness.', 'sn': 'एतान्येव पदान्याहुः पञ्च वृद्धाः प्रशान्तये। एष स्वर्गश्च धर्मश्च सुखं चानुत्तमं मतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Regarding it is cited the old story of what Manki had sung, when freed from attachments. Hear it, O Yudhishthira.', 'sn': 'अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। निर्वेदान्मङ्किना गीतं तन्निबोध युधिष्ठिर॥'}

{'en': 'Manki, desirous of wealth, found that he was doomed to an unending series of disappointinents. With a little remnant of his property hc purchased at last a couple of young bulls with a yoke for training them (to pastoral labour).', 'sn': 'ईहमानो धनं मङ्किर्भग्नेहश्च पुनः पुनः। केनचिद्धनशेषेण क्रीतवान् दम्यगोयुगम्॥'}

{'en': 'One day the two bulls, properly yoked, were taken out for training (in the fields). Shying at the sight of a camel which was lying down on the road, the animals suddenly ran towards the camel, and fell upon its neck. Enraged at finding the bulls fall upon its neck, the camel, possessed of great speed, got up and ran with full speed, bearing away the two helpless creatures dangling on either side of its neck.', 'sn': 'सुसम्बद्धौ तु तौ दम्यौ दमनायाभिनिःसृतौ। आसीनमुष्ट्रं मध्येन सहसैवाभ्यधावताम्॥ तयोः सम्प्राप्तयोरुष्ट्रः स्कन्धदेशममर्षणः। उत्थायोक्षिप्य तौ दम्यौ प्रससार महाजवः॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding his two bulls thus carried away by the strong camel, and seeing that they were: on the point of death, Manki began to say,-If it is not ordained by destiny, wealth can never be obtained even by a clever man strenuously and confidently striving and skilfully doing all that is necessary towards the accomplishment of his object.', 'sn': 'ह्रियमाणौ तु तौ दम्यौ तेनोष्ट्रेण प्रमाथिना। नियमाणौ च सम्प्रेक्ष्य मङ्किस्तत्राब्रवीदिदम्॥ न चैवाविहितं शक्यं दक्षणापीहितुं धनम्। युक्तेन श्रद्धया सम्यगीहां समनुतिष्ठता॥'}

{'en': 'I had, all along, tried by all manner and means, and with great devotion, to acquire riches. But all this misfortune to my property is due to Destiny.', 'sn': 'कृतस्य पूर्वं चानथैर्युक्तस्याप्यनुतिष्ठतः। इमं पश्यत संगत्या मम दैवमहपप्लवम्॥'}

{'en': 'My bulls are carried away, rising and falling, as the camel is running in the uneven course. This event seems to be an accident like the one brought about by the crow to a ripe fruit while perching on a palmyra free.', 'sn': 'उद्यम्योद्यम्य मे दम्यौ विषमेणैव गच्छतः। उत्क्षिप्य काकतालीयमुत्पथेनैव धावतः॥'}

{'en': "Alas, those dear bulls of mine are dangling on the camel's neck like a couple of gems! This is the result of Destiny alone. Exertion is of no avail in what is due to Chance.", 'sn': 'मणी वोष्ट्रस्य लम्बेते प्रियौ वत्सतरौ मम। शुद्धं हि दैव्मेवेदं हठेनैवास्ति पौरुषम्॥'}

{'en': 'Or, if the existence of anything like Exertion (as a resulting factor) be admitted, a little more scrutiny would find that Destiny is at the bottom.', 'sn': 'यदि वाप्युपपद्येत पौरुषं नाम कर्हिचित् अन्विष्यमाणं तदपि दैवमेवावतिष्ठते॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore, he who is desirous of happiness, should renounce all attachment. He who is indifferent to worldly surroundings, has renounced all desires for acquiring wealth, can sleep happily.', 'sn': 'तस्मानिर्वेद एवेह गन्तव्यः सुखमिच्छता। सुखं स्वपिति निर्विण्णो निराशश्चार्थसाधने॥'}

{'en': "He, it was well-said by Shuka while going to the great forest from his father's house, renouncing everything.", 'sn': 'अहो सम्यक् शुकेनोक्तं सर्वतः परिमुच्यता। प्रतिष्ठता महारण्यं जनकस्य निवेशनात्॥'}

{'en': 'Amongst these two, viz., one who obtains the fruition of all his desires, and one who renounces all desires, the latter, who casts off everything is superior to the first who obtains the fruition of all his desires.', 'sn': 'यः कामानाप्नुयात् सर्वान् यश्चैतान् केवलांस्त्यजेत्। प्रापणात् सर्वकामानां परित्यागो विशिष्यते॥'}

{'en': 'No one could ever attain to the end of desire. Only he who is destitute of knowledge and judgement feels and avidity for protecting his body and life.', 'sn': 'नान्तं सर्वविधित्सानां गतपूर्वोऽस्ति कश्चन। शरीरे जीविते चैव तृष्णा मन्दस्य वर्धते॥'}

{'en': 'Renounce all desire for action. O my Soul which has become a prey of cupidity, adopt tranquillity by freeling yourself from all worldly attachments. Repeatedly have you been cheated (by phantomis of hope). How is it that you do not still free yourself from attachments?', 'sn': 'निवर्तस्व विधित्साभ्यः शाम्य निर्विद्य कामुक असकृच्चासि निकृतो न च निर्विद्यसे ततः॥'}

{'en': 'If I am not one who deserves to be crushed by you, if I am one with whom you should play in delight, then, O my wealth-coveting Soul, do not induce me towards cupidity.', 'sn': 'यदि नाहं विनाश्यस्ते यद्येवं रमसे मया। मा मां योजय लोभेन वृथा त्वं वित्तकामुक॥'}

{'en': 'You have now and again lost your hoarded wealth! O my wealth-covering and foolish Soul, when will you succeed in getting rid of your desire for wealth?', 'sn': 'संचितं संचितं द्रव्यं नष्टं तव पुनः पुनः। कदाचिन्मोक्ष्यसे मूढ धनेहां धनकामुक॥'}

{'en': 'Shame on my foolishness. I have become a toy of yours. It is thus that one becomes a slave of others.', 'sn': 'अहो न मम बालिश्यं योऽहं क्रीडनकस्तव। किं नैवं जातु पुरुषः परेषां प्रेष्यतामियात्॥'}

{'en': 'No one born on Earth did ever attain to the end of desire, and no one who will be born hereafter will succeed in attaining to it. Renouncing all acts, I have at last been roused from sleep. I am now awake.', 'sn': 'न पूर्वे नापरे जातु कामानामन्तमाप्नुवन्। त्यक्त्वा सर्वसमारम्भान् प्रतिबुद्धोऽस्मि जागृमि॥'}

{'en': 'Without doubt, O Desire, your heart is hard like that of an adamant, since though affected by a hundred reverses, you do not break into as many fragments.', 'sn': 'नूनं ते हृदयं काम वज्रसारमयं दृढम्। यदनर्थशताविष्टं शतधा न विदीर्यते॥'}

{'en': 'I know you, O Desire, and all those things that are dear to you. Seeking what is dear to you, I shall feel happiness in my own Self.', 'sn': 'जानामि काम त्वां चैव यच्च किंचित् प्रियं तव। तवाहं प्रियमन्विच्छन्नात्मन्युपलभे सुखम्॥'}

{'en': 'O desire, I know your origin. You originate from Will. I shall, therefore, avoid Will. You will then be rooted out.', 'sn': 'काम जानामि ते मूलं संकल्पात् किल जायसे। न त्वां संकल्पयिष्यामि समूलो न भविष्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'The desire for wealth can never yield happiness. If acquired, the acquirer feels great anxiety. If lost after acquisition it is felt like death. Again acquisition itself, is very uncertain.', 'sn': 'ईहा धनस्य न सुखं लब्ध्वा चिन्ता च भूयसी। लब्धनाशे यथा मृत्युर्लब्धं भवति वा न वा॥'}

{'en': "Wealth cannot be secured by even the surrender of one's person. What can be more painful than this? When acquired, one is never gratified with its quantity, but one continues to hanker after it.", 'sn': 'परित्यागे न लभते ततो दुःखतरं नु किम्। न च तुष्यति लब्धेन भूय एव च मार्गति॥'}

{'en': "Like the sweet water of the Ganges, riches only enhances one's hankering. It is my destruction. I am now awakened. Do you, O desire, leave me.", 'sn': 'अनुतर्षुल एवार्थः स्वादु गाङ्गमिवोदकम्। मद्विलापनमेतत्तु प्रतिबुद्धोऽस्मि संत्यज॥'}

{'en': 'May that desire which resides in this my body,-this compound of (five), elements,-go wherever it likes and live happily wherever it likes.', 'sn': 'य इमं मामकं देहं भूतग्रामः समाश्रितः। स यात्वितो यथाकामं वसतां वा यथासुखम्॥'}

{'en': 'I do not like you all who are not of the Soul, for you bring on Desire and Cupidity! Forsaking all of you I shall seek refuge with the quality of Goodness.', 'sn': 'न युष्मास्विह मे प्रीतिः कामलोभानुसारिषु। तस्मादुत्सृज्य कामान् वै सत्त्वमेवाश्रयाम्यहम्॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing all creatures in my own body and my own mind, and devoting my reason to Yoga, my life to the instructions of the wise, and soul to Brahma, I shall happily rove through the world, without attachment and without calamities of any kind, so that you may not be able to plunge me again into such sorrows.', 'sn': 'सर्वभूतान्यहं देहे पश्यन् मनसि चात्मनः। योगे बुद्धिं श्रुते सत्त्वं मनो ब्रह्मणि धारयन्॥ विहरिष्याम्यनासक्तः सुखी लोकान् निरामयः। यया मां त्वं पुन:वं दुःखेषु प्रणिधास्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'If I continue to be unruffled by you, O desire, I shall necessarily be without a path (by which to effect my salvation). You O desire, are always the parent of thirst, of sorrow, and of fatigue and toil.', 'sn': 'त्वया हि मे प्रणुन्नस्य गतिरन्या न विद्यते। तृष्णाशोकश्रमाणां हि त्वं काम प्रभवः सदा॥'}

{'en': 'I consider the sorrow that one feels at the loss of wealth is proportionately greater than what one feels under any other adverse circumstance. Relatives and friends forsake him who has lost his wealth.', 'sn': 'धननाशेऽधिकं दुःखं मन्ये सर्वमहत्तरम्। ज्ञातयो ह्यवमन्यन्ते मित्राणि च धनाच्च्युतम्॥'}

{'en': 'With all sorts of humiliation numbering by thousands, there are many other faults in property which are even much more painful. On the other hand, the very small happiness that resides in wealth is mingled with pain and sorrow.', 'sn': 'अवज्ञानसहौस्तु दोषाः कष्टतराऽधने। धने सुखकला या तु सापि दुःखैर्विधीयते॥'}

{'en': 'Robbers kill, in the sight of all, the person who has riches, or torment him with all sorts of severity, or put him into fright now and again.', 'sn': 'धनमस्येति पुरुषं पुरो निमन्ति दस्यवः। क्लिश्यन्ति विविधैर्दण्डैनित्यमुद्वेजयन्ति च॥'}

{'en': 'At last, after a long time, I have realised that the desire for wealth is attended with sorrow. Whatever the object, O desire, upon which you set your heart, you force me to follow it! You are without judgement. You are a fool. You are difficult of being satisfied. You can never be contented. You burn like fire.', 'sn': 'अर्थलोलुपता दुःखमिति बुद्धं चिरान्मया। यद् यदालम्बसे काम तत्तदेवानुरुध्यसे।॥ अतत्त्वज्ञोऽसि बालश्च दुस्तोषोऽपूरणोऽनलः।'}

{'en': 'You do not enquire when following the object you pursue, whether it is easy or difficult of attainment. Like the nether region you cannot be filled to the brim. You wish to cast into grief. From this day, O desire, I am incapable of living with you.', 'sn': 'नैव त्वं वेत्थ सुलभं नैव त्वं वेत्थ दुर्लभम्॥ पाताल इव दुष्पूरो मां दुःखैर्योक्तुमिच्छसि। नाहमद्य समावेष्टुं शक्यः काम पुनस्त्वया॥'}

{'en': 'I who was disappointed, at first, at the loss of my property, have now attained to the high state of perfect freedom from attachments. At this moment I no longer think of you and your train. I', 'sn': 'निर्वेदमहमासाद्य द्रव्यनाशाद् यदृच्छया। निर्वृत्तिं परमां प्राप्य नाद्य कामान् विचिन्तये॥'}

{'en': 'I had, before this, felt great misery on your account. I do not (now) regard myself as devoid of intelligence. Having taken to Renunciation on account of the loss of my property, I now can .rest, being freed from every kind of fever.', 'sn': 'अतिक्लेशान् सहामीह नाहं बुद्ध्याम्बुद्धिमान्। निकृतो धननाशेन शय सर्वाङ्गविज्वरः॥'}

{'en': 'I cast you off, O Desire, with all the passions of my heart. You shall not, again, find any place in me nor shall you sport with me.', 'sn': 'परित्यजामि काम त्वा हित्वा सर्वमनोगती:। न त्वं मया पुनः काम वत्स्यसे न च रंस्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'I shall forgive them who will slander or speak ill of me. I shall not harm even when I am injured. If anybody from aversion speaks disparagingly of me, without caring for those disagrccable words shall greet him courteously. With a contented heart and with an easy mind, I shall always live upon what I may obtain for myself.', 'sn': 'क्षमिष्ये क्षिपमाणानां न हिसिष्ये विहिंसितः। द्वेष्ययुक्तः प्रियं वक्ष्यासम्यनादृत्य तदप्रियम्॥'}

{'en': 'I shall not gratify those wishes of yours which are inimical to me. Indifference to worldly concerns, renunciation, contentment, tranquillity, veracity, self-control, forgiveness, and universal mercy, have now come to be my qualifications.', 'sn': 'तृप्तः स्वस्थेन्द्रियो नित्यं यथालब्धेन वर्तयन्। न सकामं करिष्यामि त्वामहं शत्रुमात्मनः॥ निर्वेदं निर्वृतिं तृप्तिं शान्ति सत्यं दमं क्षमाम्। सर्वभूतदयां चैव विद्धि मां समुपागतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore, let Desire, Cupidity, Thirst, and Miserliness, bid me aided. I have now taken to the path of Goodness.', 'sn': 'तस्मात् कामश्च लोभश्च तृष्णा कार्पण्यमेव च। त्यजन्तु मां प्रतिष्ठन्तं सत्त्वस्थो ह्यस्मि साम्प्रतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having renounced Desire and Cupidity, my happiness has now been great. I shall no longer surrender myself to the influence of Cupidity, nor shall I undergo the pangs of misery like a person of impure soul.', 'sn': 'प्रहाय कामं लोभं च सुखं प्राप्तोऽस्मि साम्प्रतम्। नाद्य लोभवशं प्राप्तो दुःखं प्राप्स्याम्यनात्मवान्॥'}

{'en': 'Inasmuch as one renounces his desires so sure is he to reap his deserts. Truly he who surrenders himself to Desire always undergoes the pangs of misery.', 'sn': 'यद् यत् त्यजति कामानां तत् सुखस्याभिपूर्यते। कामस्य वशगो नित्यं दुःखमेव प्रपद्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Whatever passions arising from Desire are cast off by a person, all come under the category of Passion. Sorrow and shamelessness, as also discontent, all owe their origin to Desire and Wealth.', 'sn': 'कामानुबन्धं नुदते यत् किंचित् पुरुषो रजः। कामक्राधोद्भवं दुःखमहाररतिरव च॥'}

{'en': 'As in the hot summery a person plunges himself into a cool lake, I have now merged myself into Brahma. I have renounced work. I have extricated myself from grief. Unalloyed happiness has now come to my share.', 'sn': 'एष ब्रह्मप्रतिष्ठोऽहं ग्रीष्मे शीतमिव ह्रदम्। शाम्यामि परिनिर्वामि सुखं मामेति केवलम्॥'}

{'en': 'The happiness which results from the fruition of Desire, or the serene happiness which one enjoys in heaven, is not equal to a sixteenth part of that which springs from renunciation of all kinds of thirst.', 'sn': 'यच्च कामसुखं लोके यच्च दिव्यं महत्सुखम्। तृष्णाक्षयसुखस्यैते नार्हतः षोडशी कलाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Laying axe at the root of desire, which with the body makes an aggregate of seven, and which is a bitter foe, I have made my way to the immortal city of Brahma and there shall I pass my days in happiness like a king.', 'sn': 'आत्मना सप्तमं कामं हत्वा शत्रुमिवोत्तमम्। : प्राप्यावध्यं ब्रह्मपुरं राजेव स्यामहं सुखी॥'}

{'en': 'Putting his faith upon such, intelligence, Manki succeeded in freeing himself from attachments, by his self-renunciation and obtained the blissful region of Brahma.', 'sn': 'एतां बुद्धिं समास्थाय मङ्किनिर्वेदमागतः। सर्वान् कामान् परित्यज्य प्राप्य ब्रह्म महत्सुखम्॥'}

{'en': 'Forsooth, on account of the loss of his two bulls, Manki attained to immortality. In fact, because he laid the axe at the very roots of desire, he succeeded, through that means to obtain for himself supreme happiness.', 'sn': 'दम्यनाशकृते मङ्किरमृतत्वं किलागमत्। अच्छिनत् काममूलं स तेन प्राप महत्सुखम्॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said O you who are an adept in the mystery a human conduct, tell me what course of person should pursue to succeed in this world, freed from grief. And how should he behave himself to gain his end?', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच केन वृत्तेन वृत्तज्ञ वीतशोकश्चरेन्महीम्। किञ्च कुर्वन्नरो लोके प्राप्नोति गतिमुत्तमाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Regarding it is cited the old story of the discourse between Prahlada and the sage Ajagara.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। प्रह्लादस्य च संवादं मुनेराजगरस्य च।॥'}

{'en': 'Once on a time king Prahlada endued with great intelligence, enquired of a wandering Brahmana of great intelligence and of a purified and tranquil soul.', 'sn': 'चरन्तं ब्राह्मणं कञ्चित् कल्पचित्तमनामयम्। पप्रच्छ राजा प्रह्लादो बुद्धिमान् बुद्धिसम्मतम्॥'}

{'en': 'Prahlada said Shorn of desire, with a purified soul, of humans disposition, and given to the practices of self-restraint, without desire of action, free from malice, agreeable in speech, endued with dignity and intelligence and wisdom, you live (in simplicity) like a child.', 'sn': 'प्रह्लाद उवाच स्वस्थः शक्तो मृदुर्दान्तो निर्विधित्सोऽनसूयकः। सुवाक् प्रगल्भो मेधावी प्राज्ञश्चरसि बालवत्॥'}

{'en': 'You never covet for any kind of gain, nor are you overpowered with any kind of loss. You are always cheerful, O Brahmana, and do not seem to have any liking for anything in the world.', 'sn': 'नैव प्रार्थयसे लाभं नालाभेष्वनुशोचसि। नित्यतृप्त इव ब्रह्मन् न किञ्चिदिव मन्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'While all other creatures are being carried away in the stream of desire and passion, you are perfectly indifferent to all works of Religion, Profit and Pleasure. You seem to be in a state of quietude, having nothing to disturb the perfect equanimity of your soul.', 'sn': 'स्रोतसा ह्रियमाणासु प्रजासु विमना इव। धर्मकामार्थकार्येषु कूटस्थ इव लक्ष्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'Regardless of all sensuous enjoyments, you move like an emancipated self, only witnessing everything, (but never taking part in anything).', 'sn': 'नानुतिष्ठसि धर्मार्थो न कामे चापि वर्तसे। इन्द्रियार्थाननादृत्य मुक्तश्चरसि साक्षिवत्॥'}

{'en': 'O sage, what is your wisdom, what your learning, and what your behaviour (through which all this has become possible)? Tell me this without delay, if, O Brahmana, you think it will conduce to my well-being.', 'sn': 'का नु प्रज्ञा श्रुतं वा किं वृत्तिर्वा का नु ते मुने। क्षिप्रमाचक्ष्व मे ब्रह्मन् श्रेयो यदिह मन्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'Thus questioned by by Prahlada, that intelligent Brahmana who was well-conversant with the duties of the world, answered him in words of melodious sounds and of great significance.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अनुयुक्तः स मेधावी लोकधर्मविधानवित्। उवाच श्लक्ष्णया वाचा प्रह्लादमनपार्थया॥'}

{'en': 'Behold, O Prahlada, the origin of creatures, their growth, decay, and death, cannot be ascribed 10 any intelligible cause. It is for this reason that I do not give way to either joy or SOITOW.', 'sn': 'पश्य प्रह्लाद भूतानामुत्पत्तिमनिमित्ततः। ह्रासं वृद्धिं विनाशं च न प्रहृष्ये न च व्यथे।॥'}

{'en': 'All the propensities (for action) in the universe may be seen to come from the innate nature of the creatures. All things (in the universe are dependent on their respective nature. Hence I am not delighted with anything.', 'sn': 'स्वभावादेव संदृश्या वर्तमानाः प्रवृत्तयः। स्वभावनिरताः सर्वाः परितुष्येन केनचित्॥'}

{'en': 'Behold, O Prahlada, all kinds of union are subject to severance. All acquisitions are certain to end in destruction. Hence I never set my heart upon the acquisition of any object.', 'sn': 'पश्य प्रह्लाद् संयोगान् विप्रोगपरायणान्। संचयांश्च विनाशान्तान् न क्वचिद् विदधे मनः॥'}

{'en': 'All things possessed of attributes are sure to come to an end. What remains there for å person then to do who (like me) is familiar with both the origin and the end of things.', 'sn': 'अन्तवन्ति च भूतानि गुणयुक्तानि पश्यतः। उत्पत्तिनिधनज्ञस्य किं कार्यमवशिष्यते॥'}
{'en': 'The end is noticeable of all aquatic creatures of large or small bodied in this ocean.', 'sn': 'जलजानामपि ह्यन्तं पर्यायेणोपलक्षये। महतामपि कायानां सूक्ष्माणां च महोदधौ॥'}

{'en': 'I see also the death, which is manifest, O chief of Asuras, of all things, mobile and immobile, belonging to the earth.', 'sn': 'जङ्गमस्थावराणां च भूतानामसुराधिप। पार्थिवानामपि व्यक्तं मृत्यु पश्यामि सर्वशः॥'}

{'en': 'O best of Danavas, death comes in season even to the strongest of winged creatures which float in the air.', 'sn': 'अन्तरिक्षचराणां च दानवोत्तम पक्षिणाम्। उत्तिष्ठते यथाकालं मृत्युर्बलवतामपि॥'}

{'en': 'I see again that the luminous bodies, large and small, which range the firmament, fall down when their time comes.', 'sn': 'दिवि संवरमाणानि ह्रस्वानि च महान्ति च। ज्योतीष्यपि यथाकालं पतमानानि लक्षये।१७॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing all created things to be ihus subject to death, endued with knowledge, and thinking all things to be possessed of the same nature, I sleep in comfort with no thought to disturb me.', 'sn': 'इति भूतानि सम्पश्यन्ननुषक्तानि मृत्युना। सर्वसामान्यगो विद्वान् कृतकृत्यः सुखं स्वपे॥'}

{'en': 'If I get without trouble a heavy meal I waver not to enjoy it. On the other hand, I am used to pass many days together without tasting anything.', 'sn': 'सुमहान्तमपि ग्रास ग्रसे लब्धं यदृच्छया। शये पुनरभुजानो दिवसानि बहून्यपि॥'}

{'en': 'Sometimes people feed me with luxurious edibles in profusion, sometimes with a small quantity, sometimes even with less, and sometimes I get no food at all.', 'sn': 'आशयन्त्यपि मामन्नं पुनर्बहुगुणं बहु। पुनरल्पं पुन:स्तोकं पुनर्नवोपपद्यते॥'}

{'en': 'I sometimes eat only a portion of a grain; sometimes the dry sesame cakes from which the oil has been expressed. I sometimes eat rice and meat and other food of the richest kind.', 'sn': 'कणं कदाचित् खादामि पिण्याकमपि च ग्रसे। भक्षसे शालिमांसानि भक्षांश्चोच्चावचान् पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'Sometimes I sleep on an elevated bedstead of the best kind; sometimes I sleep on the naked Earth; sometimes I lay myself down on a comfortable bed made within a fine palace or a beautiful mansion.', 'sn': 'शये कदाचित् पर्यङ्के भूमावपि पुनः शये। प्रासादे चापि मे शय्या कदाचिदुपपद्यते॥'}

{'en': 'Sometimes I am clad in rages, sometimes in sackcloth, sometimes in raiments of fine texture, sometimes in deer-skins, sometimes in richest robes.', 'sn': 'धारयामि च चीराणि शाणक्षौमाजिनानि च। महार्हाणि च वासांसि धारयाम्यहमेकदा॥'}

{'en': 'I never reject such enjoyments as are not inconsistent with virtue and as can be secured without effort. I do not at the same time, stir myself for gaining objects difficult of acquisition.', 'sn': 'न संनिपतितं धर्म्यमुपभोगं यदृच्छया। प्रत्याचक्षे न चाप्येनमनुरुध्ये सुदुर्लभम्॥'}

{'en': 'The rigid vow I have betaken to, is called Ajagara. That vow can secure immortality. It is auspicious and griefless. It is peerless and pure. It is in harmony with the advises of the sages. It is disregarded by persons of weak intellect who never practise it. With pure heart I conduct myself in accordance with to it.', 'sn': 'अचलमनिधनं शिवं विशोकं शुचिमतुलं विदुषां मते प्रविष्टम्। व्रतमिदमाजगरं शुचिश्चरामि॥'}

{'en': 'My mind never swerves from this vow. I have not swerved from the practices of my order. I am abstemious in everything. I know the past and the present. Shorn of fear and anger and cupidity and errors of judgement, I practise this vow with a pure heart.', 'sn': 'अचलितमतिरच्युतः स्वधर्मात् परिमितसंसरणः परावरज्ञः। विगतभयकषायलोभमोहो व्रतमिदमाजगरं शुचिश्चरामि॥'}

{'en': 'There are no interdictions in respect of good and drink and other objects of enjoyment for one practising this vow. As everything is dependent on destiny, there is no observance of the consideration of time and place for one like us. The vow I practise contributes to true happiness of the heart. It is never followed by those that are wicked. I observe it with a pure heart.', 'sn': 'अनियतफलभक्ष्यभोज्यपेयं विधिपरिणामविभक्तदेशकालम्। व्रतामिदमाजगरं शुचिश्चरामि॥'}

{'en': 'Led by cupidity, men pursue different kinds of wealth. If foiled in the attempt, brokenhearted and dispirited the become. Thinking properly upon all this by the help of my intelligence which has penetrated the truths of things, I practise this vow with pure heart.', 'sn': 'इदमिदमिति तृष्णयाभिभूतं जनमनवाप्तधनं विषीदमानम्। निपुणमनुनिशम्य तत्त्वबुद्ध्या व्रतमिदमाजगरं शुचिश्चरामि।२८।।'}

{'en': 'I have seen persons in distress seeking, for the acquisition of wealth, the shelter of both good and bad men. Devoted to tranquillity and with my passions under control, I observe this vow with a pure heart.', 'sn': 'बहुविधमनुदृश्य चार्थहेतोः कृपणामिहार्यमनार्यमाश्रयन्तम्। उपशमरुचिरात्मवान् प्रशान्तो व्रतमिदमाजगरं शुचिश्चरामि॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing by the help of truth, that happiness and misery, profit and loss, attachment, and renunciation, life and death are all ordained by destiny, I observe this vow with a pure heart.', 'sn': 'सुखमसुखमलाभमर्थलाभं रतिमरतिं मरणं च जीवितं च। विधिनियतमवेक्ष्य तत्त्वतोऽहं व्रतमिदमाजगरं शुचिश्चरामि॥'}

{'en': 'Shorn of fear and attachment and errors of judgement and pride, and possessed of wisdom, intelligence, and understanding, and devoted to tranquillity, and hearing that large snakes, without stirring out enjoy the fruit that comes to them of itself, I follow their practice with a pure heart.', 'sn': 'अपगतभयरागमोहदो धृतिमतिबुद्धिसमन्वितः प्रशान्तः। उपगतफलभोगिनो निशम्य व्रतमिदमाजगरं शुचिश्चरामि॥'}

{'en': 'Without restrictions of any kind in respect of bed and food, endued by my nature with Self-restraint, abstemiousness, pure vows, truth and purity of conduct, and without any desire to store (for future use) the rewards of action, I observe, this vow with a delighted and pure heart.', 'sn': 'अनियतशयनासनः प्रकृत्या दमनियमव्रतसत्वशौचयुक्तः अपगतफलसंचयः प्रहृष्टो व्रतमिदमाजगरं शुचिश्चरामि॥'}

{'en': 'All causes of grief have fled from me on account of my having ridden over desire. Having received an accession of light, I observe this Vow with a pure heart, for controlling my soul which is thirsty and uncontrolled but which is capable of depending upon itself.', 'sn': 'रुपगतबुद्धिरवेक्ष्य चात्मसंस्थम्। तृषितमनियतं मनो नियन्तुं व्रतमिदमाजगरं शुचिश्चरामि॥'}

{'en': 'Without paying any attention to the matters, towards which my heart, mind and words would like to lead me, and knowing that the happiness which these afford is both hard of being acquired and transitory, in duration, I follow this vow with a pure heart.', 'sn': 'हृदयमनुरुध्य वाङ्मनो वा प्रियसुखदुर्लभतामनित्यतां च। तदुभयमुपलक्षयन्निवाह व्रतमिदमाजगरं शुचिश्चरामि॥'}

{'en': 'Learned and highly intelligent men, desirous of giving a publicity to their own feats, have while supporting their own theories and censuring those of others, indulged in vague expressions in delivering themselves on the topic which is beyond the scope of argumentation.', 'sn': 'बहुकथितमिदं हि बुद्धिमद्भिः कविभिरपि प्रथयद्भिरात्मकीर्तिम्। इदमिदमिति तत्र तत्र हन्त स्वपरमतैर्गहनं प्रतर्कषद्भिः॥'}

{'en': 'Foolish men cannot properly understand this vow. I, however, see that it kills Ignorance. To safeguard against this immortality and various sorts of evil. I travel among men, having controlled all shortcomings and having freed myself from thirst thirst after material enjoyments.', 'sn': 'तदिदमनुनिशम्य विप्रपातं पृथगभिपन्नमिहाबुधैर्मनुष्यैः। अनवसितमनन्तदोषपारं नृषु विहरामि विनीतदोषतृष्णः॥'}

{'en': "That great person who, having freed himself from attachments and got rid of fear, cupidity, foolishness, and anger, follows this Ajagara vow, or indulges in this sport, as it may be called, surely spends his time in great happiness.'", 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अजगरचरितं व्रतं महात्मा य इह नरोऽनुचरेद्विनीतरागः। अपगतभयलोभमोहमन्युः स खलु सुखी विचरेदिमं विहारम्॥'}

{'en': 'Arjuna said The excellent and mysterious words, relating to the Supreme Self and the individual Self, which you have spoken to me, have removed my delusion.', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसंज्ञितम्। यत् त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम॥'}

{'en': 'O lotus-eyed one, I have heard elaborately from you the mystery of production and dissolution of things, and also about your inexhaustible greatness.', 'sn': 'भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया। त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम्॥'}

{'en': 'O great Lord, what you have said yourself is even so (perfectly true). I desire to see, O best of beings, your divine form.', 'sn': 'एवमेतद् यथाऽऽत्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर। दुष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'If, O Lord, you think that I am competent to see that form, then, O Lord of mystic powers, show me your inexhaustible form.', 'sn': 'मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया दुष्टुमिति प्रभो। योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम्॥'}

{'en': 'The great One said Behold, Partha, my forms by hundreds and thousands. They are various divine, and different in colour and form.', 'sn': 'श्रीभगवानुवाच पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः। नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च॥'}

{'en': 'Behold the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Ashvins and the Maruts. Behold, 0 Bharata, innumerable wonders, not seen by you before.', 'sn': 'पश्यादित्यान् वसून् रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा। बहून्दृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याच्चर्याणि भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Behold, Gudakesha, the entire universe of movable and immovable and whatever else you wish to see, all collected together in my this body.', 'sn': 'इहैकस्थं जगत् कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम्। मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद् द्रष्टुमिच्छसि॥'}

{'en': 'But you are not fit to see Me with your these eyes. Therefore, I give you divine sight. Behold now my great mystic nature.', 'sn': 'न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा। दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya continued O great king, having said this, the mighly lord of mystic powers, Hari, revealed to Partha his great divine form.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन् महायोगेश्वरो हरिः। दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम्॥'}

{'en': 'With many mouths and eyes, with many wonderful aspects, with many celestial ornaments, with many upraised celestial weapons.', 'sn': 'अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम्। अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम्॥'}

{'en': 'Adorned with celestial garlands and robes, embalmed with celestial fragrance, and full of every wonder; it is resplendent and infinite with faces turned on all sides.', 'sn': 'दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम्। सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम्॥'}

{'en': 'If splendor of one thousand suns burst forth all at once in the sky, that would be something like the splendor of that great one.', 'sn': 'दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद् युगपदुत्थिता। यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद् भासस्तस्य महात्मनः॥'}

{'en': 'Then the son of Pandu (Arjuna) saw the entire universe, divided and subdivided into many parts, but all collected together in the body of that God of all gods.', 'sn': 'तत्रैकस्थं जगत् कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा। अपश्यद् देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Then filled with amazement, Dhananjaya, with his hairs standing on end, his head lowly bowed down and his hands joined together, addressed the great God thus:', 'sn': 'ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनंजयः। प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत॥'}

{'en': 'Arjuna said I behold, O Great God, all the celestial and all the varied hosts of creatures. I behold Brahma seated on his lotus-seat; I behold all the great Rishis and divine Nagas.', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहे सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसंघान्। ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थमृषीश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान्॥'}

{'en': 'O you of infinite forms, I behold you on every side with innumerable arms, bellies, mouths, and eyes. O Lord of the universe, O you of universal form I do see neither your end, nor middle, nor the beginning.', 'sn': 'अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम्। नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप॥'}

{'en': 'I behold you immeasurable, you whom it is difficult to look at. I behold you bearing your diadem, mace and discus glowing on all sides, possessing a mass of energy, and being subdued with the effulgence of the blazing fire of the sun.', 'sn': 'किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं च तेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तम्। पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ताद् दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम्॥'}

{'en': 'You are imperishable and the Supreme object of this universe. You are undecaying and the guardian of everlasting virtue. I find you the eternal great Being.', 'sn': 'त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम्। त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे॥'}

{'en': 'I behold you without beginning, middle and end. I behold you possessing infinite prowess and innumerable arms, having the sun and the moon as your two eyes, and the blazing fire as your mouth; I behold you heating the universe with your own great energy.', 'sn': 'अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्य मनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम्। पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम्॥'}

{'en': 'The space between heaven and earth and all the points of the horizon are pervaded by you alone. The three worlds tremble, O supreme Self, at the sight of your this marvelous and fierce form.', 'sn': 'द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि व्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वाः। दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदं लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन्॥'}

{'en': 'Hosts of celestial enter into you, some perhaps being afraid pray with joined hands, saying Hail to thee. Hosts of great Rishis and Siddhyas praise you with innumerable hymns of praise.', 'sn': 'अमी हि त्वां सुरसंघा विशन्ति केचिद् भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति। स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसंघाः स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः॥'}

{'en': 'The Rudras, the Adityas, the Vasus, the Sadhyas, the Visvas, the Ashvins, the Maruts, the Ushmapas, the Gandharvas, the Yakshas, the Asuras, and hosts of Siddhyas see you; and they are all amazed.', 'sn': 'रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्या विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च। गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसंघा वीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे॥'}

{'en': 'O mighty-armed, all creatures frightened, and I am seeing also your mighty form with many mouths and eyes, with innumerable arms, things, feet and bellies, and terrible on account of many tusks.', 'sn': 'रूपं महत् ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रं महाबाहो बहुबाहुरुपादम्। बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालं दृष्ट्वा लोकाः परव्यथितास्तथाऽहम्॥'}

{'en': 'I can no longer command courage or enjoy peace of mind, seeing your mighty forin which are is touching the very skies, which is fiery radiant, many winged, widely open mouthed and with large and blazing eyes.', 'sn': 'नभःस्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्ण व्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम्। दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा धृति न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing your mouth terrible with tusks and fearful as the all-destroying Fire at the final end of the Yuga, I cannot recognize the points of the horizon or command my peace of mind.', 'sn': 'दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि दृष्ट्वैव कालनलसंनिभानि। दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास॥'}

{'en': "All the son of Dhritarashtra, together with the host of kings, Bhishma Drona and Suta's son, Karna, with even the principle warriors of our side.", 'sn': 'अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसंधैः। भीष्मो द्रोणः सूतपुत्रस्तथासौ सहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यैः॥'}

{'en': 'Are quickly entering your terrible mouths, rendered more terrible by they tusks. Some, with their heads crushed, stick at the interstices of your teeth', 'sn': 'वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्ति दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि। केचिद् विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु संदृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गैः॥'}

{'en': 'As many currents of waters, flowing through different channels, roll rapidly into the ocean, so these heroes of the world enter into your blazing mouth.', 'sn': 'यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगाः समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति। तथा तवामी नरलोकवीरा विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति॥'}

{'en': 'As insects for their own destruction rush in increasing speed into the blazing fire, so these men, with unceasing speed enter into your mouth for their own destruction.', 'sn': 'यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गा विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः। स्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः॥'}

{'en': 'Devouring all these men from every side, you lick them with your flaming mouths. O Vishnu, your fcarful splendor, filling the whole universe with your great energy, heat everything.', 'sn': 'ल्लोकान् समग्रान् वदनैर्व्वलदिः। तेजोभिरापूर्यं जगत् समग्रं भासस्तवोचाः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो॥'}

{'en': 'Tell me who are you with this fearful form. I bow down my head to you; be gracious to me, O chief of the gods. I desire to know you, Primeval One; for I do not understand your actions.', 'sn': 'आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद। विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यं न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम्॥'}

{'en': 'The Great One said I am (now) the full manifestation of Death, the Destroyer of the worlds. All these warriors, standing in different divisions, will cease to be, even if you do not kill them.', 'sn': 'श्रीभगवानुवाच कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो लोकान् समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः। ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः।।३२'}

{'en': 'Therefore, arise and gain glory Vanquishing the foe, enjoy this great kingdom. All these men are already slain by me. Be my instrument only.', 'sn': 'तस्मात् त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व जित्वाशत्रून् भुइक्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम्। मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन्॥'}

{'en': 'Kill Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna and all these brave warriors, they are already killed by me. Do not be dismayed. Fight, you will conquer your foes in battle.', 'sn': 'द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान्। मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा युध्यस्व तेजासि रणे सपत्नान्।।३४'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Hearing these words the diadem decked Arjuna, trembling, and with joined hands, bowed to Krishna. Making his salutations, overwhelmed with fear, he once more with choked voice said to him.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी। मनस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं सगद्गद भीतभीतः प्रणम्य॥'}

{'en': 'Arjuna said It is quite natural, O Hrishikesha, that the universe is delighted and charmed in singing your praise, and Rakshasas are scattered away in fear and hosts of Siddhyas are bowing (at your feet).', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या जगत् प्रहष्यत्यनुरज्यते च। रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसंघा:॥'}

{'en': 'And why should they not bow down to you, O Supreme Self, for you are greater than Brahma, you are the primal Cause. O Infinite One, O God of the gods, O Refuge of the universe, you are indestructible, you are that which is and that which is not, and that which is beyond both the existent and non-existence.', 'sn': 'कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन् महात्मन् गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकत्रै। अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत्॥'}

{'en': 'You are the First God, the Ancient Being; you are the Supreme Refuge of the world. You are the Knower and the Object to be known; you are the highest abode. O Infinite One, the whole universe is pervaded by you.', 'sn': 'स्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम्। वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप॥'}

{'en': 'You are Vayu, Yama, Agni, Varuna, Chandra, Prajapati and Grandsire. I bow down my head to you a thousand times. Again and yet again I bow down my head to you.', 'sn': 'वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशाङ्कः प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च। नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्व: पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते॥'}

{'en': 'My salutation to you in front; my salutation to your from behind. O you All, my salutation to you from every side. You are all, your cnergy infinite, your prowess immeasurable; you embrace all.', 'sn': 'नमः पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्ते नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व। अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वं सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः॥'}
