{'en': 'O Krishna, O Yadava, O friend, O undecaying One, O Infinite one, I beg your pardon for whatever has been said carelessly by me, and whatever disrespect has been shown to you not knowing your greatness, and considering you friend from want of judgment or from love, either out of mirth or on occasions of play lying, sitting or at meals, while alone or in the presence of others.', 'sn': 'सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति। अजानता महिमानं तवेदं मया प्रमादात् प्रणयेन वाऽपि॥ यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि विहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु। एकोऽथवाऽप्यच्युत तत्समक्षं तत् क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम्॥'}

{'en': 'You are the Father of the universe, of movable and immovable; you are the great Master deserving of all worship. There is none equal to you. How can there be one greater than you whose power is matchless in these worlds.', 'sn': 'पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान्। न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिकः कुतोऽन्यो लोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव॥'}

{'en': "Therefore, O Lord, O adorable One, bowing to you, prostrating before you, I ask your grace. You should overlook my faults, O God,, as father does his son's a friend his friend's a lover his lover's.", 'sn': 'तस्मात् प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायं प्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम्। पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः प्रियः प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम्॥'}

{'en': 'Seeing your this form unseen before, I have been delighted, but my mind has been frightened. Show me your ordinary form. O God. Be gracious, O Lord of the gods, O Refuge of the universe', 'sn': 'अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषीतोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा भयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे। तदेव मे दर्शय देवरूपं प्रसीद देवेश जगनिवास॥'}

{'en': 'I desire to see you as before, with diadem, discus and mace. O you of thousand arms, O you of universal form, be of that four armed form.', 'sn': 'मिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव। तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रवाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते॥'}

{'en': 'The great One said Being pleased with you, O Arjuna, I have by my mystic powers, shown to you this my Supreme form, glorious, universal, infinite and Primeval, which has been seen by none before, except now by you.', 'sn': 'श्रीभगवानुवाच मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदं रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात्। तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यं यन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम्॥'}

{'en': 'Except by you only, O Kuru warrior, I cannot be seen in this form by any one in this word, not even by the study of the Vedas, or by sacrifices, gifts, actions or severest penances.', 'sn': 'न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुयैः एवंरूपः शक्य अहं नृलोके द्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर॥'}

{'en': 'Have no fear or perplexity of mind at seeing my this fearful form. Freed from fear, with a joyful heart, behold my other form.', 'sn': 'मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम्। व्यपेतभी: प्रीतमनाः पुनस्त्वं तदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Having said all this to Arjuna, Vasudeva once more showed him his own ordinary form. The high-souled One, once more assuming his gentle form, comforted Arjuna who was much agitated.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वा स्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूयः। आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनं भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा॥'}

{'en': 'Arjuna said Seeing your this gentle human form, o Janardana, I have come to my right mind and to my normal state.', 'sn': 'अर्जुन उवाच दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन। इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेताः प्रकृतिं गतः॥'}

{'en': "The great one said 'The form of mine, which you have (just now) seen, is difficult to be seen. Even the celestial are always eager to see my this great form.", 'sn': 'श्रीभगवानुवाच सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम। देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाक्षिणः॥'}

{'en': 'Not by the study of the Vedas, not by penances, gifts or sacrifices, can I be seen in this form of mine which you have seen.', 'sn': 'नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया। शक्य एवंविधो दुष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा।॥'}

{'en': 'But by exclusive devotion to me, O Arjuna, O chastiser of foes, I can, in this form, be known, truly seen and attained to.', 'sn': 'भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन। ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परंतप॥'}

{'en': 'O Arjuna, he who does everything for Me, who has only Me for his supreme objects, who has only Me for his supreme objects, who is freed from all attachments and who is without enmity towards any beings, comes to Me.', 'sn': 'मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः। निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said: Thereupon on beholding Bhimasena and Arjuna, the Kshatriyas, inflated, sent up a terrible shout in that forest.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततो घोरतरः शब्दो वन समभवत् तदा। भीमसेनार्जुनौ दृष्ट्वा क्षत्रियाणाममर्षिणाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Beholding the standards of those foremost of Kurus the wicked-minded king Jayadratha, losing all heart, said to Yajnaseni, who was seated on the car and was shining in her effulgence.', 'sn': 'तेषां ध्वजाचाण्यभिवीक्ष्य राजा स्वयं दुरात्मा नरपुङ्गवानाम्। जयद्रथो याज्ञसेनीमुवाच रथे स्थितां भानुमती हतौजाः॥'}

{'en': '"Five great heroes are coming, O Krishna, me-thinks they are your husbands; as you know them well, O you of fair hairs, point out which of them rides which car?', 'sn': 'आयान्तीमे पञ्च रथा महान्तो मन्ये च कृष्णे पतयस्तवैते। सा जानती ख्यापय नः सुकेशि परं परं पाण्डवानां रथस्थम्॥'}

{'en': 'Draupadi said : "Having committed such an henious deed that will shorter your life, of what use, O fool, it will be now to know the names of those great heroes; as my heroic husbands have come, none of you shall be left alive in battle.', 'sn': 'द्रौपद्युवाच रनायुष्यं कर्म कृत्वातिघोरम्। एते वीराः पतयो मे समेता न वः शेषः कश्चिदिहास्ति युद्धे॥'}

{'en': 'Still, as you, being on the point of death, have asked me, I shall relate it for such is the duty; seeing Dharmaraja with his younger brothers I have not the slightest anxiety or fear from you.', 'sn': 'आख्यातव्यं त्वेव सर्वं मुमूर्षोर्मया तुभ्यं पृष्टया धर्म एषः। न मे व्यथा विद्यते त्वद्भयं वा सम्पश्यन्त्याः सानुजं धर्मराजम्॥'}

{'en': '(He) at whose flag-staff, two beautiful and sonorous tabors, Nanda and Upananda are always played upon, knows very well the propriety of his own acts. Successful men always follow him.', 'sn': 'यस्य ध्वजाचे नदतो मृदङ्गो नन्दोपनन्दौ मधुरौ युक्तरूपौ। एतं स्वधर्मार्थविनिश्चयज्ञं सदा जनाः कृत्यवन्तोऽनुयान्ति॥'}

{'en': 'He has a complexion like the colour of pure gold, high nose, large eyes and is of a thin make; people call my husband Yudhishthira, the son of Dharına and the foremost of Kurus.', 'sn': 'य एष जाम्बूनदशुद्धगौरः प्रचण्डघोणस्तनुरायताक्षः। एतं कुरुश्रेष्ठतमं वदन्ति युधिष्ठिरं धर्मसुतं पति मे॥'}

{'en': 'That pious, heroic man gives life even to his enemy who seeks his shelter; therefore, O fool, leaving off your weapons and with folded hands, run quickly to him for your own safety.', 'sn': 'अप्येष शत्रोः शरणागतस्य दद्यात् प्राणान् धर्मचारी नृवीरः। परेह्येनं मूढ जवेन भूतये त्वमात्मनः प्राञ्जलिन्यस्तशस्त्रः॥'}

{'en': 'The one, whom you see seated on the car, with long arms and tall as the Shala tree biting his lips, contracting his forehead so as to bring his two eye-brows close together, is my husband by name Vrikodara.', 'sn': 'अथाप्येनं पश्यसि यं रथस्थं महाभुजं शालमिव प्रवृद्धम्। संदष्टौष्ठं भृकुटीसंहतभ्रवं वृकोदरो नाम पतिर्ममैषः॥'}

{'en': "Plump, strong, well-trained and powerful horses of best breed draw that heroe's chariot; his actions are super-human; he is known on earth by the name of Bhima.", 'sn': 'आजानेया बलिनः साधु दान्ता महाबलाः शूरमुदावहन्ति। एतस्य कर्माण्यतिमानुषाणि भीमेति शब्दोऽस्य गतः पृथिव्याम्॥'}

{'en': 'Those who offend him are never allowed to live; he never forgets his enemy; on come pretext or other he takes revenge; and even after that he is not pacified.', 'sn': 'नास्यापराद्धाः शेषमवाप्नुवन्ति नायं वैरं विस्मरते कदाचित्। वैरस्यान्तं संविधायोपयाति पश्चाच्छान्तिं न च गच्छत्यतीव॥'}

{'en': 'That foremost of bow-men, intelligent, illustrious, self-controlled and reverencing the old and heroic among men, is the brother and disciple of Yudhishthira. He is my husband by name Dhananjaya.', 'sn': 'धनुर्धरात्र्यो धृतिमान् यशस्वी जितेन्द्रियो वृद्धसेवी नृवीरः। भ्राता च शिष्यश्च युधिष्ठिरस्य धनंजयो नाम पतिर्ममैषः॥'}

{'en': 'He never relinquishes virtue out of fear, lust or anger; he never commits a cruel decd; that son of Kunti has the energy of fire, can withstand every enemy and represses his foes.', 'sn': 'यो वै न कामान्न भयान्न लोभात् त्यजेद् धर्मं न नृशंसं च कुर्यात्। स एष वैश्वानरतुल्यतेजाः कुन्तीसुतः शत्रुसहः प्रमाथी॥'}

{'en': 'The other youth, proficient in Dharma and Artha, who always removes the fear of the afraid, who is gifted with high wisdom, who is protected by all the sons of Pandu, who is dearer to them even than their life, for his unflinching devotion, is my husband, the heroic Nakula.', 'sn': 'यः सर्वधर्मार्थविनिश्चयज्ञो भयार्तानां भयहर्ता मनीषी। यस्योत्तमं रूपमाहुः पृथिव्यां यं पाण्डवाः परिरक्षन्ति सर्वे॥ प्राणैर्गरीयांसमनुव्रतं वै स एष वीरो नकुलः पतिर्म।'}

{'en': 'That intelligent and great one, having Sahadeva for the second, is light-handed and an expert in the use of swords. O stupid man, you shall see to day his exploits in battle like those of Indra in the army of Daityas. Heroic, well-skilled in weapon, intelligent, wise, ever satisfying the king, the son of Dharma,', 'sn': 'यः खड्गयोधी लघुचित्रहस्तो महांश्च धीमान् सहदेवोऽद्वितीयः॥ यस्याद्य कर्म द्रक्ष्यसे मूढसत्त्व शतक्रतोर्वा दैत्यसेनासु संख्ये। शूरः कृतास्त्रो मतिमान् मनस्वी प्रियङ्करो धर्मसुतस्य राज्ञः॥'}

{'en': 'Effulgent like the rays of the moon, the favourite and the youngest born of the Pandavas, equal to whom in intelligence no man exists or in eloquence in the midst of the assembly of the wise.', 'sn': 'य एष चन्द्रार्कसमानतेजा जघन्यजः पाण्डवानां प्रियश्च। बुद्ध्या समो यस्य नरो न विद्यते वक्ता तथा सत्सु विनिश्चयज्ञः॥'}

{'en': 'Heroic, ever wrathful, intelligent and wise, Sahadeva is my husband. He would rather rush into fire or give up his life than say anything against religion and morals. That high-minded one always abides by the duties of the Kshatriyas, is dearer than her life to Kunti and heroic among men.', 'sn': 'स एष शूरो नित्यममर्षणपश्च धीमान् प्राज्ञः सहदेवः पतिर्म। त्यजेत् प्राणान् प्रविशेद्धव्यवाह न त्वेवैष व्याहरेद् धर्मबाह्यम्॥ सदा मनस्वी क्षत्रधर्मे रतश्च कुन्त्याः प्राणैरिष्टतमो नृवीरः।'}

{'en': 'When the sons of Pandu will kill your heroes in battle you will see your army in the wretched condition of a ship on the sea wrecked with its freight of jewels on the back of a whale.', 'sn': 'विशीर्यन्तीं नावमिवार्णवान्ते रत्नाभिपूर्णां मकरस्य पृष्ठे॥ सेनां तवेमां हतसर्वयोधां विक्षोभितां द्रक्ष्यसि पाण्डुपुत्रैः।'}

{'en': 'I have thus described to you the prowess of the Pandavas, foolishly disregarding whom you have acted so. If you can escape unhurt from them you will then obtain a new lease of life.', 'sn': 'इत्येते वै कथिताः पाण्डुपुत्रा यांस्त्वं मोहादवमन्य प्रवृत्तः। यद्येतेभ्यो मुच्यसेऽरिष्टदेहः पुनर्जन्म प्राप्स्यसे जीव एव॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said : Then those five sons of Pritha, cach like Indra himself, growing angry and leaving the terrified foot-soldiers only who were begging for mercy, attacked furiously on all sides the charioteers darkening the very air with a thick shower of shafts they discharged.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच स्त्यक्त्वा त्रस्तान् प्राञ्जलींस्तान् पदातीन्। रथानीकं शरवर्षान्धकारं चक्रुः क्रुद्धाः सर्वतः संनिगृह्य॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Achala and Vrishaka are two Rathas on your side who are hard to vanquish; both the brothers, united together, will destroy your enemies.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अचलो वृषकश्चैव सहितौ भ्रातरावुभौ। रथौ तव दुराधर्षी शत्रून् विध्वंसयिष्यतः॥'}

{'en': 'These two best among men are mighty, inveterate in their hatred and smiters (of enemies); they are the foremost among the Gandharis, young, handsome and endued with great strength.', 'sn': 'बलवन्तौ नरव्याघ्रौ दृढक्रोधौ प्रहारिणौ। गान्धारमुख्यौ तरुणौ दर्शनीयौ महाबलौ॥'}

{'en': 'But this one who is ever your dear friend, who vaunts of bravery in battle and who encourages you, O king in your dispute with the Pandavas,', 'sn': 'सखा ते दयितो नित्यं य एष रणकर्कशः। उत्साहयति राजंस्त्वां विग्रहे पाण्डवैः सह॥'}

{'en': 'This man vain and mean, Karna, the son of Vikartana, who is your adviser guide and friend, and who has been placed in too elevated a position by you,', 'sn': 'परुषः कत्थनो नीचः कर्णो वैकर्तनस्तव। मन्त्री नेता च बन्धुश्च मानी चात्यन्तमुच्छ्रितः॥'}

{'en': 'This Karna is neither a Rathi nor an Atiratha in battle. Though ever generous he has been deprived of his celestial earrings. All this is owing to the curse of Rama (his preceptor) and the words of a Brahmana.', 'sn': 'एष कर्णो न चाप्यतिरथो रणे। वियुक्तः कवचेनैष सहजेन विचेतनः॥ कुण्डलाभ्यां च दिव्याभ्यां वियुक्तः सततं घृणी। अभिशापाच्च रामस्य ब्राह्मणस्य च भाषणात्॥'}

{'en': 'Owing to his being without his natural coat of mail he a Ratha in my opinion; and having once come across Falguna he will not escape him with life.', 'sn': 'करणानां वियोगाच्च तेन मेऽर्धरथो मतः। नैष फाल्गुनमासाद्य पुनर्जीवन् विमोक्ष्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'Then did Drona, the foremost among all wielders, of say as a rejoinder: "It is so; what you say is never false.', 'sn': 'ततोऽब्रवीत् पुनर्दोणः सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरः। एवमेतद् यथाऽऽत्य त्वं न मिथ्यास्ति कदाचन॥'}

{'en': 'In each battle is he boastful and in each he is seen to be backward. Karna is kind and also becomes confounded; he is therefore in my opinion, to half a Ratha."', 'sn': 'नैव रथः रणे रणेऽभिमानी च विमुखश्चापि दृश्यते। घृणी कर्णः प्रमादी च तेन मेऽर्धरथो मतः॥'}

{'en': 'Hearing this, the son of Radha, expanding his eyes in wrath, said to Bhishma piercing him with his hook of words.', 'sn': 'एतच्चछ्रुत्वा तु राधेयः क्रोधादुत्फाल्य लोचने। उवाच भीष्मं राधेयस्तुदन् वाग्भिः प्रतोदवत्॥१०'}

{'en': '"O grandfather, at your pleasure, do you pierce me by your arrows of words; at every step do you thus treat me out of your aversion for me, though I have committed no sin.', 'sn': 'पितामह यथेष्टं मां वाक्शरैरुपकृन्तसि। अनागसं सदा द्वेषादेवमेव पदे पदे॥'}

{'en': 'I tolerate all his however for the sake of Duryodhana,; you deem me to be behind others (in fight) and a coward.', 'sn': 'मर्षयामि च तत् सर्वं दुर्योधनकृतेन वै। त्वं तु मां मन्यसे मन्दं यथा कापुरुषं तथा॥'}

{'en': 'In my opinion you too are only half a Ratha, there is no doubt about this. O son of Ganga, I do not speak an untruth when I say that you are an enemy of the entire universe.', 'sn': 'भवानर्धरथो मह्यं मतो वै नात्र संशयः। सर्वस्य जगतश्चैव गाङ्गेयो न मृषा वदेत्॥'}

{'en': 'You are ever devoted to what is to the injury of the Kurus, But the king knows it not. Who else is there who would seek to sap the energy of these kings that are equal and create discord among them,', 'sn': 'कुरूणामहितो नित्यं न च राजाऽवबुध्यते। को हि नाम समानेषु राजसूदारकर्मसु॥'}

{'en': 'As you desire to do owing to your hatred towards these that endued with accomplishments. Neither age, nor wealth, nor friends,', 'sn': 'तेजोवधमिमं कुर्याद् विभेदयिषुराहवे। यथा त्वं गुणविद्वेषादपरागं चिकीर्षसि॥'}

{'en': 'are Can entitle a Kshatriya to be included in the category of Maharathas, O Kaurava. It is well-know a Kshatriya is superior by virtue of his strength and that the twice-born are superior by virtue of their learning.', 'sn': 'न हायनैर्न पलितैर्न वित्तैर्न च बन्धुभिः। महारथत्वं संख्यातुं शक्यं क्षत्रस्य कौरव॥'}

{'en': 'It is also well-known that Vaishyas are superior by virtue of their wealth and that Sudras are superiors by virtue of their years. Speak for yourself then, as you please, your list of Rathas and Atirathas.', 'sn': 'बलज्येष्ठं स्मृतं क्षत्रं मन्त्रज्येष्ठा द्विजातयः। धनज्येष्ठाः स्मृता वैश्याः शूद्रास्तु वयसाधिकाः॥'}

{'en': 'Actuated by desire and hatred and acting from ignorance you have enumerated the heroes. O Duryodhana of long arms, it is for you to judge properly. May you fare well.', 'sn': 'यथेच्छकं स्वयं ब्रूया रथानतिरथांस्तथा। कामद्वेषसमायुक्तो मोहात् प्रकुरुते भवान्॥'}

{'en': 'Abandon this wicked Bhishma of unrighteous nature for, O ruler of men, discord once being in your own army it will be difficult to bring union again.', 'sn': 'दुर्योधन महाबाहो साधु सम्यगवेक्ष्यताम्। त्यज्यतां दुष्टभावोऽयं भीष्मः किल्बिषकृत् तव॥'}

{'en': 'This remark applies to your main army, judge then about the subsidiary forces which have been raised from several sources.', 'sn': 'भिन्ना हि सेना नृपते दुःसंधेया भवत्युत। मौला हि पुरुषव्याघ्र किमु नानासमुत्थिताः॥'}

{'en': 'This discord has entered among warriors, already, 0 Bharata; in our very presence he saps our energies.', 'sn': 'एषां द्वैधं समुत्पन्नं योधानां युधि भारत। तेजोवधो नः क्रियते प्रत्यक्षेण विशेषतः॥'}

{'en': 'How vast is the difference between the task of estimating the might of Rathas and Bhishma of little intellect. I will meet the armies of the Pandavas.', 'sn': 'रथानां क्क च विज्ञानं क्व च भीष्मोऽल्पचेतनः। अहमावारयिष्यामि पाण्डवानामनीकिनीम्॥'}

{'en': 'Standing against me who are infallible they will be routed in ten directions, the Pandavas with the Panchalas, like bulls meeting with a tiger.', 'sn': 'आसाद्य माममोधेषु गमिष्यन्ति दिशो दश। पाण्डवाः सहपञ्चालाः शार्दूलं वृषभा इव॥'}

{'en': 'How vast is the difference between real fight, the clash of weapons, good advice, uttered in sweet sounding words on one side and Bhishma who is past the prime of life, of wicked soul and who is urged by fate.', 'sn': 'क्व च युद्धं विमर्दो वा मन्त्रे सुव्याहतानि च। क्व च भीष्मो गतवया मन्दात्मा कालचोदितः॥'}

{'en': 'Alone he even boasts to fight with the entire universe, and endued with false vision he does not regard any other man as a human being.', 'sn': 'एकाकी स्पर्धते नित्यं सर्वेण जगत सह। न चान्यं पुरुषं कंचिन्मन्यते मोघदर्शनः॥'}

{'en': 'Certainly, it has been laid down in our holy books that the words of the aged should be listened to, but it does not apply to those who are very old for they are held to be boys.', 'sn': 'श्रोतव्यं खलु वृद्धानामिति शास्त्रनिदर्शनम्। न त्वेव ह्यतिवृद्धानां पुनर्बाला हि ते मताः॥'}

{'en': 'Alone I shall slay the army of the sons of Pandu in a fair fight. The fame however of this will go to Bhishma, O best among kings.', 'sn': 'अहमेको हनिष्यामि पाण्डवानामनीकिनीम्। सुयुद्धे राजशार्दूल यशो भीष्मं गमिष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'By you, O ruler of men, has Bhishma been appointed the commander and all fame goes to the leader and never to an individual soldier.', 'sn': 'कृतः सेनापतिस्त्वेष त्वया भीष्मो नराधिप। सेनापतौ यशो गन्ता न तु योधान् कथंचन॥'}

{'en': 'O king, never shall I fight as long as the son of Ganga is alive. When Bhishma is killed I shall fight with all the car-warriors."', 'sn': 'नाहं जीवति गाङ्गेये योत्स्ये राजन् कथंचन। हते भीष्मे तु योद्धास्मि सर्वैरेव महारथैः॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said The great burden (the impending fight) vast as the ocean is ready to fall on me, a calamity which I had foreseen for a series of years,', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच समुद्यतोऽयं भारो मे सुमहान् सागरोपमः। धार्तराष्ट्रस्य संग्रामे वर्षपूगाभिचिन्तितः॥'}

{'en': 'Now is come that time, that fight the result of which makes our hairs stand on end. It is not my concern to create dispute among ourselves. It is for this that you now live, O you born of a Suta.', 'sn': 'तस्मिन्नभ्यागते काले प्रतप्ते लोमहर्षणे। मिथो भेदो न मे कार्यस्तेन जीवसि सूतज॥'}

{'en': 'For though I am now aged and you but young I shall rend asunder your desire for battle and that of your own life, O you born of a Suta.', 'sn': 'न ह्यहं त्वद्य विक्रम्य स्थविरोऽपि शिशोस्तव। युद्धश्रद्धामहं छिन्द्यां जीवितस्य च सूतज॥'}

{'en': 'The weapons hurled at me by Rama the son of Jamadagni did not pain me, What can you do to me then?', 'sn': 'जामदग्न्येन रामेण महास्त्राणि विमुञ्चता। न मे व्यथा कृता काचित् त्वं तु मे किं करिष्यसि॥३३'}

{'en': "Good men do not approve of this praise of one's own might. I speak thus (on this occasion) for I have lost my temper O vile one; the stain of your family.", 'sn': 'कामं नैतत् प्रशंसन्ति सन्तः स्वबलसंस्तवम्। वक्ष्यामि तु त्वां संतप्तो निहीनकुलपांसन।॥'}

{'en': 'In the election of a bridegroom by the daughters of Kashiraja, I, after defeating all the rulers of the earth united together, took away those girls by force.', 'sn': 'समेतं पार्थिवं क्षत्रं काशिराजस्वयंवरे। निर्जित्यैकरथेनैव याः कन्यास्तरसा हृताः॥'}

{'en': 'Thousands of such kings, well known names too, along with their armies, were stopped in the battle by me alone.', 'sn': 'ईदृशानां सहस्राणि विशिष्टानामथो पुनः। मयैकेन निरस्तानि ससैन्यानि रणाजिरे॥'}

{'en': 'Having come across yourself, an illustrated man, the Kurus have come upon a great disaster; try to mete out destruction and be a man.', 'sn': 'त्वां प्राप्य वैरपुरुषं कुरूणामनयो महान्। उपस्थितो विनाशाय यतस्व पुरुषो भव॥'}

{'en': 'In the battle, fight with son of Pritha, whom you are now challenging and I sha\'l see how you escape out of that fight, O you of exceedingly wicked intelligence."', 'sn': 'युद्ध्यस्व समरे पार्थं येन विस्पर्धसे सहा द्रक्ष्यामि त्वां विनिर्मुक्तमस्माद् युद्धात् सुदुर्मते॥'}

{'en': 'Then did the royal son of Dhritarashtra, endued with fame say to him, Look to me, O son of Ganga; the task which has devolved on you is great.', 'sn': 'तमुवाच ततो राजा धार्तराष्ट्रः प्रतापवान्। मां समीक्षस्व गाङ्गेय कार्यं हि महदुद्यतम्॥'}
{'en': 'Think with your entire heart of my interests; both of you will do great deeds for me.', 'sn': 'चिन्त्यतामिदमेकाग्रं मम निःश्रेयसं परम्। उभावपि भवन्तौ मे महत् कर्म करिष्यतः॥'}

{'en': 'Again do I desire to hear about the best of the car-warriors of the enemy, those who are Atirathas in that side and those that can lead numbers of chariots.', 'sn': 'भूयश्च श्रोतुमिच्छामि परेषां रथसत्तमान्। ये चैवातिरथास्तत्र ये चैव रथयूथपाः॥'}

{'en': 'O son of Kuru, I desire to hear of the strength and weakness of the enemies for the fight is to take place at the dawn of night.”', 'sn': 'बलाबलममित्राणां श्रोतुमिच्छामि कौरव। प्रभातायां रजन्यां वै इदं युद्धं भविष्यति॥'}

{'en': 'Gandhari said Behold that irresistible king of Kambojas, that bull-necked hero lying in the dust, O Madhava, though worthy of sleeping comfortable on Kamboja blankets.', 'sn': 'गान्धार्युवाच काम्बोजं पश्य दुर्धर्षं काम्बोजास्तरणोचितम्। शयानमृषभस्कन्धं हतं पांसुषु माधव॥'}

{'en': 'Stricken with great sorrow, his wife is weeping bitterly at sight of his arms covered with blood, which, however, formerly used to be smeared with sandal-paste.', 'sn': 'यस्य क्षतजसंदिग्घौ बाहू चन्दनभूषितौ। अवेक्ष्य करुणं भार्या विलपत्यतिदुःखिता॥'}

{'en': 'Indeed, the beautiful lady exclaims,-Even now adorned with beautiful palms and fingers, these two arins of yours resemble a couple of spiked maces, entering into whose clasp joy never felt me for a moment.', 'sn': 'इमौ तौ परिघप्रख्यौ बाहू शुभतलाङ्गुली। ययोर्विवरमापन्नां न रतिर्मा पुराजहात्॥'}

{'en': 'How shall I fare, O king, when I am deprived of you.-Possessing a sweet voice, the Kamvoja queen is weeping helplessly and trembling with emotion.', 'sn': 'कां गतिं तु गमिष्यामि त्वया हीना जनेश्वर। हतबन्धुरनाथा च वेपन्ती मधुरस्वरा॥'}

{'en': 'Look at that bevy of fair ladies there. Although tired with toil and worn out with heat, yet beauty does not leave them like the beauty of the garlands worn by the celestials although exposed to the Sun.', 'sn': 'आतपे लाम्यमानानां विविधानामिव स्रजाम्। कान्तानामपि नारीणां श्रीर्जहाति न वै तनूः॥'}

{'en': 'Behold, O destroyer of Madhu, the heroic king of the Kalingas lying there on the ground, with his mighty arms bedecked with a couple of Angadas.', 'sn': 'शयानमभितः शूरं कालिङ्गं मधुसूदन। पश्य दीप्ताङ्गदयुगप्रतिनद्धमहाभुजम्॥'}

{'en': 'Behold, O Janarddana, those Magadha ladies crying and standing around Jayastsena the king of the Magadhas.', 'sn': 'मागधानामधिपति जयत्सेनं जनार्दन। आवार्यं सर्वतः पत्न्यः प्ररुदत्यः सुविह्वलाः॥'}

{'en': 'The charming and sweet cries of those large-eyed and sweet-voiced damsels, O Krishna, are stupefying my heart greatly.', 'sn': 'आसामायतनेत्राणां सुस्वराणां जनार्दन। मनःश्रुतिहरो नादो मनो मोहयतीव मे॥'}

{'en': 'Having all their ornaments displaced, crying, and stricken with sorrow, alas, those ladies of Magadha, worthy of sleeping on costly beds, are now lying down on the naked earth.', 'sn': 'प्रकीर्णवस्त्राभरणा रुदत्यः शोककर्शिताः। स्वास्तीर्णशयनेपिता मागध्यः शेरते भुवि॥'}

{'en': 'Surrounding their lord, the king of the Kosalas, viz., prince Vrihadvala, those other ladies are crying aloud.', 'sn': 'कोसलानामधिपतिं राजपुत्रं बृहद्बलम्। भर्तारं परिवार्यताः पृथक् प्ररुदिताः स्त्रियः॥'}

{'en': 'Engaged in taking out from his person the with which it was pierced by Abhimanyu with the full force of his arms, those ladies are again and again losing their consciousness.', 'sn': 'अस्य गात्रगतान् बाणान् कार्णिबाहुबलार्पितान्। उद्धरन्त्यसुखाविष्टा मूर्छमानाः पुनः पुनः॥'}

{'en': 'The faces of those beautiful damsels, O Madhava, exhausted with toil and scorched by thc rays of the Sun, are appearing like faded lotuses.', 'sn': 'आसां सर्वानवद्यानामातपेन परिश्रमात्। प्रम्लाननलिनाभानि भान्ति वक्त्राणि माधव॥'}

{'en': 'arrows There, the brave sons of Dhrishtadyurnna, young in age, and bedecked with garlands of gold and beautiful Angadas, are lying, killed by Drona.', 'sn': 'द्रोणेन निहताः शूराः शेरते रुचिराङ्गदाः। धृष्टद्युम्नसुताः सर्वे शिशवो हेममालिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Like insects on a burning fire, they have all been consumed by falling upon Drona whose car was the chamber of fire, having the bow for its flames and arrows and darts and maces for its fuel.', 'sn': 'रथाग्न्यगारं चापार्चिःशरशक्तिगदेन्धनम्। द्रोणमासाद्य निर्दग्धाः शलभा इव पावकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Likewise, the five brave Kekaya brothers, adorned with beautiful Angadas, are lying on effort killed by Drona and with their faces turned towards that hero.', 'sn': 'तथैव निहताः शूराः शेरते रुचिराङ्गदाः। द्रोणेनाभिमुखाः सर्वे भ्रातरः पञ्च केकयाः॥'}

{'en': 'Their coats of mail, stinging like molten gold, and their tall standards and cars and garlands all made of gold, are shedding a bright lustre on the Earth like so many burning fires.', 'sn': 'तप्तकाञ्चनवर्माणस्तालध्वजरथव्रजाः। भासयन्ति महीं भासा ज्वलिता इव पावकाः॥'}

{'en': 'Look, O Madhava, at king Drupada overthrown in battle by Drona, like mighty elephant in the forest killed by a huge lion.', 'sn': 'द्रोणेन दुपदं संख्ये पश्य माधव पातितम्। महाद्विपमिवारण्ये सिंहेन महता हतम्॥'}

{'en': 'The bright and white umbrella, of the king of the Panchalas, shines, O lotus-eyed one, like the moon in the autumnal sky.', 'sn': 'पाञ्चालराज्ञो विमलं पुण्डरीकाक्ष पाण्डुरम्। आतपत्रं समाभाति शरदीव निशाकरः॥'}

{'en': 'Having burnt his body on the funeral pyre, the daughter-in-law and the wives of the old king, stricken with sorrow, are proceeding, keeping the pyre to their right.', 'sn': 'एतास्तु द्रुपदं वृद्धं स्नुषा भार्याश्च दुःखिताः। दग्ध्वा गच्छन्ति पाञ्चाल्यं राजानमपसव्यतः॥'}

{'en': 'There, those ladies, beside themselves with sorrow, are removing the brave and great bowman, viz., Dhrishtaketu, that foremost of the Chedis, killed by Drona.', 'sn': 'धृष्टकेतुं महात्मानं चेदिपुङ्गवमङ्गनाः। द्रोणेन निहतं शूरं हरन्ति हतचेतसः॥'}

{'en': 'Having counteracted many weapons of Drona, this destroyer of foes, O slayer of Madhu, this great bowman lies there, dead, like a tree uprooted by the wind.', 'sn': 'द्रोणास्त्रमभिहत्यैष विमर्दे मधुसूदन। महेष्वासो हतः शेते नद्या हत इव दुमः॥'}

{'en': 'After having slain thousands of enemies, that brave king of the Chedis, that mighty carwarrior, viz., Dhrishtaketu lies, himself deprived of life.', 'sn': 'एष चेदिपतिः शूरो धृष्टकेतुर्महारथः। शेते विनिहतः संख्ये हत्वा शत्रून् सहस्रशः॥'}

{'en': 'There, O Hrishikesha, the wives of the king of the Chedis are sitting around his body still decked with beautiful hairs and ear-rings, though torn by carnivorous birds.', 'sn': 'वितुद्यमानं विहगैस्तं भार्याः पर्युपासिताः। चेदिराजं हृषीकेश हतं सबलबान्धवम्॥'}

{'en': 'Placing upon their laps and prostrate form of the heroic Dhrishtaketu of Dasharha race, those foremost of ladies, are crying in sorrow.', 'sn': 'दाशा_पुत्रजं वीरं शयानं सत्यविक्रमम्। आरोप्याङ्के रुदन्त्येताश्चेदिराजवराङ्गनाः॥'}

{'en': 'Behold, O Hrishikesha, the son of that Dhrishtaketu, having fair locks and excellent car-rings, cut in battle by Drona with his arrows.', 'sn': 'अस्य पुत्रं हृषीकेश सुवक्त्रं चारुकुण्डलम्। द्रोणेन समरे पश्य निकृतं बहुधा शरैः॥'}

{'en': 'He never deserted his father while the latter fought with his enemies. Mark, O destroyer of Madhu, he does not, even in death, leave the side of that heroic father.', 'sn': 'पितरं नूनमाजिस्थं युद्ध्यमानं परैः सह। नाजहात् पितरं वीरमद्यापि मधुसूदन॥'}

{'en': 'Thus. also, my grandson, that slayer of hostile heroes, viz., the mighty-armed Lakshmana, has followed his father Duryodhana.', 'sn': 'एवं ममापि पुत्रस्य पुत्रः पितरमन्वगात्। दुर्योधनं महाबाहो लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा॥'}

{'en': 'Look, O Keshava, at the two brothers of Avanti, viz., Vinda and Anuvinda, lying their on the fled, like two blossoming Shala trees in the spring uprooted by the wind.', 'sn': 'विन्दानुविन्दावावन्त्यौ पतितौ पश्य माधव। हिमान्ते पुष्पितौ शालौ मरुता गलिताविव॥ ये'}

{'en': 'Clad in golden armour and bedecked with golden Angadas, they are still armed with swords and bows. Having eyes like those of a bull, and decked with shining garlands, both of them are lying on the field.', 'sn': 'काञ्चनाङ्गदवर्माणौ बाणखड्गधनुर्धरौ। ऋषभप्रतिरूपाक्षौ शयानौ विमलस्रजौ॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandavas, O Krishna, as well as yourself, are surely unslayable, since they are you have escaped from Drona, Bhishma, Karna the son of Vikartana, Kripa, Duryodhana, the of son Drona, the mighty car-warrior Jayadratha, Somadatta, Vikarna, and from the brave Kritavarman.', 'sn': 'अवध्याः पाण्डवाः कृष्ण सर्व एव त्वया सह। मुक्ता द्रोणभीष्माभ्यां कर्णाद् वैकर्तनात् कृपात्॥३० दुर्योधनाद् द्रोणसुतात् सैन्धवाच्च जयद्रथात्। सोमदत्ताद् विकर्णाच शूराच कृतवर्मणः॥'}

{'en': 'Mark the reverses created by Time. Those leading warriors who could slay the very celestials by force of their arms have themselves been killed.', 'sn': 'ये हन्युः शस्त्रवेगेन देवानपि नरर्षभाः। त इमे निहताः संख्ये पश्य कालस्य पर्ययम्॥'}

{'en': 'forsooth, O Madhava, there is nothing difficult for destiny to bring about, since these leading men, these heroes, have been killed by Kshatriya warriors!', 'sn': 'नातिभारोऽस्ति दैवस्य ध्रुवं माधव कश्चन। यदिमे निहताः शूराः क्षत्रियैः क्षत्रियर्षभाः॥'}

{'en': 'I considered by energetic sons as slain even then, O Krishna, when you came back unsuccessful to Upaplavya!', 'sn': 'तदैव निहताः कृष्ण मम पुत्रास्तरस्विनः। यदैवाकृतकामस्त्वमुपप्लव्यं गतः पुनः॥'}
{'en': "Shantanu's son and wise Vidura told me then, — withdraw your love for your children.", 'sn': 'शान्तनोश्चैव पुत्रेण प्राज्ञेन विदुरेण च। तदैवोक्तास्मि मा स्नेहं कुरुष्वात्मसुतेष्विति॥'}

{'en': "The interviews of those persons could never be useless. Soon, O Janarddana, have my sons been reduced to ashes!'", 'sn': 'तयोहि दर्शनं नैतन्मिथ्या भवितुमर्हति। अचिरेणैव मे पुत्रा भस्मीभूता जनार्दन॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said “Having said so, Gandhari, beside herself with grief, dropped down on the Earth. Losing her fortitude, she became overwhelmed with grief.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच इत्युक्त्वा न्यपतद् भूमौ गान्धारी शोकमूर्छिता। दुःखोपहतविज्ञाना धैर्यमुत्सृज्य भारत॥'}

{'en': 'Filled with anger and sorrow at the death of her sons, Gandhari, with agitated heart, attributed every fault to Keshava.', 'sn': 'ततः कोपपरीताङ्गी पुत्रशोकपरिप्लुता। जगाम शौरि दोषेण गान्धारी व्यथितेन्द्रिया॥'}

{'en': 'Gandhari said The Pandavas and the Dhartarashtra, O Krishna, have both been consumed. Whilst they were thus being rotted out, O Janarddana, why were you indifferent to them.', 'sn': 'गान्धार्युवाच पाण्डवा धार्तराष्ट्राश्च दग्धाः कृष्ण परस्परम्। उपेक्षिता विनश्यन्तस्त्वया कस्माज्जनार्दन॥'}

{'en': 'You could prevent the slaughter, for you have a large following and a vast army. You had eloquence, and you had the power of making peace.', 'sn': 'शक्तेन बहुभृत्येन विपुले तिष्ठता बले। उभयत्र समर्थेन श्रुतवाक्येन चैव ह॥'}

{'en': 'Since deliberately, O slayer of Madhu, you were indifferent to this universal destruction therefore, O mighty-armed one, you should feel the consequences of this act.', 'sn': 'इच्छतोपेक्षितो नाशः कुरूणां मधुसूदन। यस्मात् त्वया महाबाहो फलं तस्मादवाप्नुहि॥'}

{'en': 'By the little merit I have acquired by serving dutifully by husband, by that merit so, difficult to attain, I shall curse you, O holder of the discus and the race.', 'sn': 'पतिशुश्रूषया यन्मे तपः किंचिदुपार्जितम्। तेन त्वां दुरवापेन शप्स्ये चक्रगदाधर॥'}

{'en': 'Since you were indifferent to the Kurus and the Pandavas whilst they killed each other, therefore, O Govinda, you will be the destroyer of your own kinsmen.', 'sn': 'यस्मात् परस्परं अन्तो ज्ञातयः कुरुपाण्डवाः। उपेक्षितास्ते गोविन्द तस्माज्ज्ञातीन् वधिष्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'On the thirty-sixty year froin this, O destroyer of Madhu, you will, after bringing about the death of your kinsmen and friends and sons, perish by disgustful means within the forest.', 'sn': 'त्वमप्युपस्थिते वर्षे षट्त्रिंशे मधुसूदन। हतज्ञातिर्हतामात्यो हतपुत्रो वनेचरः॥ अनाथवदविज्ञातो लोकेष्वनभिलक्षितः। कुत्सितेनाभ्युपायेन निधनं समवाप्स्यसि॥'}

{'en': 'The ladies of your family, deprived of sons, kinsmen, and friends, shall weep and cry even as these ladies of the Bharata family.', 'sn': 'तवाप्येवं हतसुता निहतज्ञातिबान्धवाः। स्त्रियः परिपतिष्यन्ति यथैता भरतस्त्रियः॥'}

{'en': "Vaishampayana continued Hearing these words, the great Krishna, addressing the worshipful Gandhari, said to her these words, smilingly,-'There is none in the world, save myself, who can exterminate the Vrishnis. I know this well. I am trying to bring it about. In imprecating this curse, O you of excellent vows, you have helped me in the accomplishment of that work.", 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं घोरं वासुदेवो महामनाः। उवाच देवीं गान्धारीमीषदभ्युत्स्मयन्निव॥ जानेऽहमेतदप्येवं चीर्णं चरसि क्षत्रिये। दैवादेव विनश्यन्ति वृष्णयो नात्र संशयः॥'}

{'en': 'The Vrishnis and incapable of being killed by others, whether human beings or gods or Danavas. The Yadavas, therefore, shall be killed by one another.', 'sn': 'संहर्ता वृष्णिचक्रस्य नान्यो मद् विद्यते शुभे। अवध्यास्ते नरैरन्यैरपि वा देवदानवैः॥ परस्परकृतं नाशमतः प्राप्स्यन्ति यादवाः।'}

{'en': 'After the Dasharha hero had said so, the Pandavas became stupefied. Stricken, with anxiety, all of them became hopeless of life.” After the Dasharha hero had said so, the Pandavas became stupefied. Stricken, with anxiety, all of them became hopeless of life.”', 'sn': 'इत्युक्तवति दाशार्हे पाण्डवास्रस्तचेतसः। बभूवु शसंविग्ना निराशाश्चापि जीविते॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said Then having duly honoured the citizens and the inhabitants of the province, the royal son of Kunti dismissed them to their respective homes.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच ततः कुन्तीसुतो राजा पौरजानपदं जनम्। पूजयित्वा यथान्यायमनुजज्ञे गृहान् प्रति॥'}

{'en': 'The Pandava king then consoled those women, who had lost their heroic husbands and sons in the battle, with profuse gifts of wealth.', 'sn': 'सान्त्वयामास नारीश्च हतवीरा हतेश्वराः। विपुलैरर्थदानैः स तदा पाण्डुसुतो नृपः॥'}

{'en': 'Having recovered his kingdom, Yudhishthira caused himself to be duly installed on the throne. That foremost of men then assured all his subjects by various deeds of good will.', 'sn': 'सोऽभिषिक्तो महाप्राज्ञः प्राप्य राज्यं युधिष्ठिरः। अवस्थाप्य नरश्रेष्ठः सर्वाः स्वप्रकृतीस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'That foremost of righteous men set himself to acquire the substantial blessings of the Brahmanas, of the foremost inilitary officers, and the leading citizens.', 'sn': 'द्विजेम्यो गुणमुख्येभ्यो नैगमेभयश्च सर्वशः। प्रतिगृह्याशिषो मुख्यास्तथा धर्मभृतां वरः॥'}

{'en': 'Having passed fifty nights in the capital, the blessed monarch recollected the time indicated by his grandfather as the hour of his departure from this world.', 'sn': 'उषित्वा शर्वरी: श्रीमान् पञ्चाशनगरोत्तमे। समय कौवाग्यस्य सस्मार पुरुषर्षभः॥'}

{'en': 'Accompanied by a number of priests he then left the city of Hastinapur having seen that the sun ceasing to go southwards, had begun to proceed in his northward course.', 'sn': 'स निर्ययौ गजपुराद् याजकैः परिवारितः। दृष्ट्वा निवृत्तमादित्यं प्रवृतं चोत्तरायणम्॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, took with bin a large quantity of clarified butter and floral garlands and scents and silken cloths and excellent sandal wood and Aquilaria Agallocha and dark cloewood, for cremating the body of Bhishma. Various kinds of rich garlands and gems also were among those stores.', 'sn': 'धृतं माल्यं च गन्धांश्च क्षौमाणि च युधिष्ठिरः। चन्दानागुरुमुख्यानि तथा कालीयकान्यपि॥ प्रस्थाप्य पूर्वं कौन्तेयो भीष्मसंस्करणाय वै। माल्यानि च वराहा॑णि रतानि विविधानि च॥'}

{'en': 'Placing Dhritarashtra at the head and queen Gandhari celebrated for her virtues, and his own mother Kunti and all his brothers also the highly intelligent Yudhishthira, accompanied by Krishna and wise Vidura, as also by Yuyutsu and Yuyudhana, and by his other relatives and followers forming a large train, proceeded, his praises sung the while by culogists and bards. The sacrificial fires of Bhishma were also borne in the procession.', 'sn': 'धृतराष्ट्र पुरस्कृत्य गान्धारी च यशस्विनीम्। मातरं च पृथां धीमान् भ्रातृ॑श्च पुरुषर्षभान्॥ जनार्दनेनानुगतो विदुरेण च धीमता। युयुत्सुना च कौरव्यो युयुधानेन वा विभो॥ महता राजभोगेन पारिबहेण संवृतः। स्तूयमानो महातेजा भीष्मस्याग्नाननुव्रजन्॥'}

{'en': 'Thus accompanied, the king started from his city like a second king of the celestials. Soon he came upon the spot where the son of Shantanu was still lying on his bed of arrows.', 'sn': 'निश्चकाम पुरात् तस्माद् यथा देवपतिस्तथा। आससाद कुरुक्षेत्र ततः शान्तनवं नृपः॥'}

{'en': 'He saw his grandfather waited upon with reverence by Parasharas intelligent, son Vyasa, by Narada, O royal sage, by Devala and Asita, and also by the surviving unslain kings assembled from various parts of the country. Indeed, the king saw that his great grandfather, as he lay on his heroic bed, was guarded on all sides by the warriors appointed for that duty. Getting down from his car, king Yudhishthira, with his brothers, saluted his grandfather, that chastiser of all enemies. They also saluted the Rishis with the Island-born Vyasa at their head. They were saluted in return by them.', 'sn': 'उपास्यमानं व्यासेन पाराशर्येण धीमता। नारदेन च राजर्षे देवलेनासितेन य॥ हतशिष्टैर्नृपैश्चान्यैर्नानादेशसमागतः। रक्षिभिश्च महात्मानं रक्ष्यमाणं समन्ततः॥ शयानं वीरशयने ददर्श नृपतिस्ततः। ततो रथादवातीर्य भ्रातृभिः सह धर्मराट्॥ अभवाद्याथ कौन्तेयः पितामहमरिंदम। द्वैपायनादीन् विप्रांश्च तैश्च प्रत्यभिनन्दितः॥'}

{'en': 'Accompanied by his priests each of whom resembled the grandfather Brahman himself, as also by his brothers, Yudhishthira, of undecaying glory, then approach that spot whereon Bhishma lay on his bed of arrows surrounded by those reverend Rishis.', 'sn': 'ऋत्विग्भिर्ब्रह्मकल्पैश्च भ्रातृभिः सह धर्मजः। आसाद्य शरतल्पस्थमृषिभिः परिवारितम्॥'}

{'en': "Then king Yudhishthira the just with all his brothers, addressed that foremost one of Kuru's race, the son of the River Ganga, as he lay on that bed of his saying, I am Yudhishthira, O king. Salutations to thee, O son of the River Janhavi. If you hearest me still, O tell me what I am to do for thee.", 'sn': 'अब्रवीद् भरतश्रेष्ठं धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः। भ्रातृभिः सह कौरव्यः शयानं निम्नगासुतम्॥ युधिष्ठिरोऽहं नृपते नमस्ते जाह्नवीसुत। शृणोषि चेन्महाबाहो ब्रूहि किं करवाणि ते॥'}

{'en': 'Carrying with me thy sacrificial fires, I have come here, O king and wait upon thec at the hour appointed. Preceptors of all branches of learning, Brahmanas, Ritvijas, all iny brothers, thy son the king Dhritarashtra of great energy, are all here with my counsellors as also Vasudeva of great prowess.', 'sn': 'प्राप्तोऽस्मि समये राजन्नग्नीनादाय ते विभो। आचार्यान् ब्राह्मणांश्चैव ऋत्विजो भ्रातरश्च मे॥ पुत्रश्व ते महातेजा धृतराष्ट्रो जनेश्वरः। उपस्थितः सहामात्यो वासुदेवश्व वीर्यवान्॥'}

{'en': "The remnant of unslain warriors, and all the denizens of Kurujangala, are also here, Opening the eyes, O chief of Kuru's race, do you see them.", 'sn': 'हतशिष्टाश्व राजानः सर्वं च कुरुजांगलाः। तान् पश्य नरशार्दूल समुन्मीलय लोचने॥'}

{'en': 'Whatever should be done on this occasion have all been arranged and provided for by me. Indeed, at this hour which you hadst spoken of, all things have been kept in readiness.', 'sn': 'यच्चेह किंचित् कर्तव्ये तत्सर्वं प्रापितं मया। यथोक्तं भवता काले सर्वमेव च तत् कृतम्॥'}

{'en': "Vaishampayana said Thus addressed by the highly intelligent Kunti's son the son, of Ganga opened his eyes and all the Bharatas assembled there and stood around him.", 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्तस्तु गाङ्गेयः कुन्तीपुत्रेण धीमता। ददर्श भारतान् सर्वान् स्थितान् सम्परिवार्य ह॥'}

{'en': 'The mighty Bhishma then, taking the strong hand of Yudhishthira, addressed hiin, in a voice deep as that of the clouds.', 'sn': 'ततश्व तं बली भीष्मः प्रगृह्म विपुलं भुजम्। उद्यन्मेघस्वरो वाग्मी काले वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'By good luck, O son of Kunti, you have come here with all your counsellors, O Yudhishthira. The thousandrayed maker of day, the holy Sun, has begun his northward course.', 'sn': 'दिष्ट्या प्राप्तोऽसि कौन्तेय सहामात्यो युधिष्ठिर। परिवृत्तो हि भगवान् सहस्रांशुर्दिवाकरः॥'}

{'en': 'I have been lying on my bed here for fiftycight nights. Stretched these on shai ppointed arrows, I have felt this period to be as long as if it was a century.', 'sn': 'अष्टपञ्चाशतं राज्यः शयानस्याद्य मे गताः। शरेषु निशिताग्रेषु यथा वर्षशत तथा॥'}

{'en': 'O Yuthishthira, the lunar month of Magha has come. This is, again, the lighted fortnight and a fourth part of it ought by this (according to my calculations) be over.', 'sn': 'माघोऽयं समनुप्राप्तो मासः सौम्यो युधिष्ठिर। त्रिभागशेषः पक्षोऽयं शुक्लो भवितुमर्हति॥'}

{'en': "Having said so to Yudhishthira the son of Dharma, Ganga's son Bhishma then saluted Dhritarashtra and said to him as follows.", 'sn': 'एवमुक्त्वा तु गाङ्गेयो धर्मपुत्रं युधिष्ठिरम्। धृतराष्ट्रमथामन्ञ्य काले वचनमब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said O king, you know well the duties. All your doubts, again, relating to the science of wealth, have been well solved. You have served many learned Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच राजन् विदितधर्मोऽसि सुनिर्णीतार्थसंशयः। बहुश्रुता हि ते विप्रा बहवः पर्युपासिताः॥'}

{'en': 'You know the subtile sciences connected with the Vedas, all the duties of religion, O king, and the whole of the four Vedas.', 'sn': 'वेदशास्राणि सर्वाणि धर्मोश्च मनुजेश्वर। वेदांश्च चतुरः सर्वान् निखिलेनानुबुद्ध्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'You should not grieve, therefore, O son of Kuru. That which was preordained has come to pass. It could not be otherwise. You have heard the mysteries relating to the deities from the lips of the Islandborn Rishi himself.', 'sn': 'न शोचितव्यं कौरव्य भवितव्यं हि तत् तथा। श्रुतं देवरहस्यं ते कृष्णद्वैपायनादपि॥'}

{'en': 'Yuthishthira and his brothers are morally as much your sons as are the sons of Pandu. Following the duties of religion, cherish and protect them. In their turn, they are always devoted to the service of their elders.', 'sn': 'यथा पाण्डोः सुता राजंस्तथैव तव धर्मतः। तान् पालय स्थितो धर्मे गुरुशुश्रूषणे रतान्॥'}

{'en': 'King Yudhishthira, the just, is pure souled. He will always be obedient to you. I know that he is given to the virtue of mercy or abstention from injury. He is devoted to his elders and preceptors.', 'sn': 'धर्मराजो हि शुद्धात्मा निदेशे स्थास्यते तव। आनृशंस्यपरं ह्येनं जानामि गुरुवत्सलम्॥'}

{'en': 'Your sons wore all wickedsouled. They were full of anger and cupidity. Overwhelmed by envy they were all of wicked conduct. You should not grieve for them.', 'sn': 'तब पुत्रा दुरात्मानः क्रोधलोभपरायणाः। ईर्ष्याभिभूता दुर्वृत्तास्तान् न शोचितुमर्हसि॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said Having said this much to Dhritarashtra of great wisdom, the Kuru chief then addressed Vasudeva of great arms.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं धृतराष्ट्र मनीषिणम्। वासुदेवं महाबाहुमभ्यभाषत कौरवः॥'}

{'en': 'O holy one, O god of all gods O you adored by all the deities and Asuras, O you who didst cover the three worlds with three steps of thine, I bow unto thee, O wielder of the conch, the discus, and the mace.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच भगवन् देवदेवेश सुरासुरनमस्कृत। त्रिविक्रम नमस्तुभ्यं शङ्खचक्रगदाधर॥'}

{'en': 'You are Vasudeva, you are of golden body, you are the one Purusha (or active agent), you are the creator (of the universe), You are of huge proportions. You are sentiency. You are subtle. You are the Supreme and Eternal Soul.', 'sn': 'वासुदेवो हिरण्यात्मा पुरुषः सविता विराट्। जीवभूतोऽनुरूपस्त्वं परमात्मा सनातन॥'}

{'en': 'Do you, O lotuseyed one, save me, O foremost of all beings. Do you give me to permission, O Krishna, to depart from this world, O you who are supreme happiness, O foremost of all beings. You should always protect the sons of Pandu. You are, indeed, already their sole refuge.', 'sn': 'त्रायस्व पुण्डरीकाक्ष पुरुषोत्तम नित्यशः। अनुजानीहि मां कृष्ण वैकुण्ठ पुरुषोत्तम॥ रक्ष्याश्च ते पाण्डवेया भवान् येषां परायणम्।'}

{'en': 'Formerly, I spoke the foolish Duryodhana of wicked understanding that there is Virtue where Krishna is, and that there is victory where Virtue is.', 'sn': 'उक्तवानस्मि दुर्बुद्धिं मन्दं दुर्योधनं तदा॥ यतः कृष्णस्ततो धर्मो यतो धर्मस्ततो जयः।'}

{'en': "I further advised him that depending on Vasudeva as his refuge, he should make peace with the Pandavas, Indeed, I repeatedly told him, “This is the fittest time for you to make peace.'", 'sn': 'वासुदेवेन तीर्थेन पुत्र संशाम्य पाण्डवैः॥ संधानस्य परः कालस्तवेति च पुनः पुनः।'}

{'en': 'The foolish and wicked Duryodhana however did not do what I said. Having caused a great havoc on Earth, at last, he himself gave up his life.', 'sn': 'न च मे तद् वचो मूढः कृतवान् स सुमन्दधीः। घातयित्वेह पृथिवीं ततः स निधनं गतः॥'}

{'en': 'I know thee, O illustrious one, to be that ancient and best of Rishis who lived for many years in the company of Nara, in hermitage of Badari.', 'sn': 'त्वां तु जानाम्यहं देवं पुराणमृषिसत्तमम्। नरेण सहितं देव वदर्यां सुचिरोषितम्॥'}

{'en': 'The celestial Rishi Narada told me this, as also Vyasa of austere penances. Even they have said to me that, Thyself and Arjuna are the old Rishis Narayana and Nara born among men.', 'sn': 'तथा मे नारदः प्राह व्यासश्च सुमहातपाः। नरनारायणावेतौ सम्भूतौ मनुजेष्विति॥'}

{'en': 'Do you, O Krishna, grant me leave. I shall renounce my body. Permitted by thec, I shall attain to the highest end.', 'sn': 'स मां त्वमनुजानीहि कृष्ण मोक्ष्ये कलेवरम्। त्वयाह समनुज्ञातो गच्छेयं परमां गतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vasudeva said I give you leave, O Bhishma, O king, to attain to the status of the Vasus. O you of great splendour, you have not been guilty of a single sin, in this world.', 'sn': 'वासुदेव उवाच अनुज्ञानामि भीष्म त्वां वसून् प्राप्नुहि पार्थिव। न तेऽस्ति वृजिनं किंचिदिहलोके महाद्युते॥'}

{'en': 'O royal sage, you are devoted to your father. You are, therefore, like a second Markandeya. It is, therefore, that death depends upon your pleasure like a slave.', 'sn': 'पितृभक्तोऽसि राजर्षे मार्कण्डेय इवापरः। तेन मृत्युस्तव वशे स्थितो भृत्य इवानतः॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said Having said these words, the son of Ganga once more addressed the Pandavas headed by Dhritarashtra, and other friends and wellwishers of his.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्तस्तु गाङ्गेयः पाण्डवानिदमब्रवीत्। धृतराष्ट्रमुखांश्चपि सर्वोश्च सुहृदस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'I wish to renounce my life. You should give me leave. You should strive for attaching to truth. Truth forms the highest power.', 'sn': 'प्राणानुत्स्रष्टुमिच्छामि तत्रानुज्ञातुमर्हथ। सत्येषु यतितव्यं वः सत्यं हि परमं बलम्॥'}

{'en': 'You should always live with Brahmanas of righteous conduct, devoted to penances, ever abstaining from cruel conduct, and who have their souls under restraint.', 'sn': 'आनृशंस्यपरैर्भाव्यं सदैव नियतात्मभिः। ब्रह्मण्यैर्धर्मशीलैश्च तपोनित्यैश्च भारताः॥'}

{'en': 'Having said these words to his friends and embraced them all, the intelligent Bhishma once more addressed Yudhishthira, saying, "O king, worship all Brahmanas, especially those who are gifted with wisdom, them who are preceptors, those who are priests capable of assisting at sacrifices.', 'sn': 'इत्युक्त्वा सुहृदः सर्वान् सम्परिष्वज्य चैव हा पुनरेवाब्रवीद् धीमान् युधिष्ठिरमिदं वचः॥ ब्राह्मणाश्चैव ते नित्यं प्राज्ञाश्चैव विशेषतः। आचार्या ऋत्विजश्चैव पूजनीया जनाधिप॥'}

{'en': "Yudhishthira said 'Why, O foremost of Bharata's race, have the Brahmanas declared that the king, that ruler of men, is a god.", 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच किमाहुर्दैवतं विप्रा राजानं भरतर्षभ। मनुष्याणामधिपतिं तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Regarding it is cited the old story, O Bharata, of the discourse of Brihaspati and Vasumanas..', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। बृहस्पतिं वसुमना यथा पप्रच्छ भारत।॥'}

{'en': 'There was a highly intelligent king of Koshala, named Vasumanas. On a certain occasion he questioned the great wise sage Brihaspati.', 'sn': 'राजा वसुमना नाम कौसल्यो धीमतां वरः। महर्षि किल पप्रच्छ कृतप्रज्ञं बृहस्पतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'Always humble, king Vasumanas ever devoted to well-being of all, having observed the proper humilities, and having gone round the great sage and bowed to him duly enquired of the virtuous Brihaspati about the institutes of a kingdom, actuated by the desire of securing the happiness of men.', 'sn': 'सर्वं वैनयिकं कृत्वा विनयज्ञो बृहस्पतिम्। दक्षिणानन्तरो भूत्वा प्रणम्य विधिपूर्वकम्॥ विधिं पप्रच्छ राज्यस्य सर्वलोकहिते रतः। प्रजानां सुखमन्विच्छन् धर्मशीलं बृहस्पतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'Vasumanas said By what means do creatures grow and by what are they destroyed? (you of great wisdom, by worshipping whom do they succeed in acquiring eternal happiness. Thus questioned by the highly powerful Koshala king Brihaspati of great wisdom described to him coolly about the regard which should be paid to kings.', 'sn': 'वसुमना उवाच केन भूतानि वर्धन्ते क्षयं गच्छन्ति केन वा। कमर्चन्तो महाप्राज्ञ सुखमव्ययमाप्नुयुः॥ एवं पृष्टो महाप्राज्ञः कौसल्येनामितौजसा। राजसत्कारमव्यग्रं शशंसास्मै बृहस्पतिः॥'}

{'en': 'Brihaspati said The duties of all men, you of great wisdom, originate from the king. It is through fear of the king only that men do not devour one another.', 'sn': 'बृहस्पतिरुवाच राजमूलो महाप्राज्ञ धर्मो लोकस्य लक्ष्यते। प्रजा राजभयादेव न खादन्ति परस्परम्॥'}

{'en': 'It is the king who establishes peace on Earth through due observances of duties by checking all disregard for healthy restraints and all kinds of lust. Acquiring this he shines in glory.', 'sn': 'राजा ह्येवाखिलं लोकं समुदीर्णं समुत्सुकम्। प्रसादयति धर्मेण प्रसाद्य च विराजते॥'}

{'en': 'As, o king, all creatures cannot see one another and sink in utter darkness if the sun and the moon do not rise, as fishes in shallow water and birds in a safe place dart and move about as they please (for a time) and repeatedly attack and grind one another with force and then are destroyed so men sink in utter darkness and meet with destruction if they have no king to protect them like a herd of cattle without the herdsman to take care of them.', 'sn': 'यथा ह्यनुदये राजन् भूतानि शशिसूर्ययोः। अन्धे तमसि मज्जेयुरपश्यन्तः परस्परम्॥ यथा ह्यनुदके मत्स्या निराक्रन्दे विहङ्गमाः। विहरेयुर्यथाकामं विहिंसन्तः पुनः पुनः॥ विमथ्यातिक्रमेरंश्च विषह्यापि परस्परम्। अभावमचिरेणैव गच्छेयुर्नात्र संशयः॥ एवमेव विना राज्ञा विनश्येयुरिमाः प्रजाः। अन्धे तमसि मज्जेयुरगोपाः पशवो यथा॥'}

{'en': 'If the king did not observe the duty of protection, the strong would by would by force misappropriate the properties of the weak, and if the latter refuse to surrender to them easily their very lives would be taken,', 'sn': 'हरेयुर्बलवन्तोऽपि दुर्बलानां परिग्रहान् हन्युक्यच्छमानांश्च यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Nobody then, about any of his belongings would be able to say — This is mine.-Wives, sons, food, and other kinds of property, would cease to exist.', 'sn': 'ममेदमिति लोकेऽस्मिन् न भवेत् सम्परिग्रहः। न दारा न च पुत्रः स्यान्न धेनं न परिग्रहः।'}

{'en': 'Ruin would befall everything if the king did not observe the duty of protection. Wicked men would by force appropriate the cars, dresses, ornaments, precious stones and other kinds of property belonging to others, if the king did not protect.', 'sn': 'विष्वग्लोपः प्रवर्तेत यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥ ममेदमिति लोकेऽस्मिन् न भवेत् सम्परिग्रहः। यानं वस्त्रमलङ्कारान् रत्नानि विविधानि च।'}

{'en': 'In the absence of protection by the king, various kinds of weapons would fall upon righteous persons and unrighteousness would prevail everywhere.', 'sn': 'हरेयुः सहसा पापा यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥ पतेद् बहुविधं शस्त्रं बहुधा धर्मचारिषु।'}

{'en': "In the absence of king's protection men would disobey or even injure their very parents if aged, their very preceptors, guests and elders.", 'sn': 'अधर्मः प्रगृहीतः स्याद् यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥ मातरं पितरं वृद्धमाचार्यमतिथिं गुरुम्।'}

{'en': 'If the king did not protect, all persons possessing wealth would have to meet with death, imprisonment and persecution and the very idea of property would be lost.', 'sn': 'क्लि श्नीयुरपि हिंस्युर्वा यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥ वधबन्धपिरक्लेशो नित्यमर्थवतां भवेत्।'}

{'en': 'If the king did not protect, everything would be destroyed untimely and every part of the country would be laid waste by robbers, and everybody would fall into dreadful hell.', 'sn': 'ममत्वं च न विन्देयुर्यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥ अन्ताश्चाकाल एव स्युर्लोकोऽयं दस्युसाद् भवेत्।'}

{'en': 'If the king did not protect, all restrictions about marriage and intercourse would disappear; all matters of agriculture and trade would fall into confusion; morality and the three Vedas would disappear.', 'sn': 'पतेयुर्नरकं घोरं यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥ न योनिदोषो वर्तेत न कृषिर्न वणिक्पथः। मज्जेद् धर्मस्त्रयी न स्याद् यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Sacrifices, duly finished with presents according to the ordinance, would no longer be celebrated and no marriage would take place; society itself would cease to exist, if the king did not observe the duty of protection.', 'sn': 'न यज्ञाः सम्प्रवर्तेयुर्विधिवत् स्वाप्तदक्षिणाः। न विवाहाः समाजो वा यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'The bulls would not know cows and milk jars would not be churned, and men living by rearing kine would be ruined, if the king did not exercise the duty of protection.', 'sn': 'न वृषा: सम्प्रवर्तेरन् न मध्येरंश्च गर्गराः। घोषाः प्रणाशं गच्छेयुर्यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥'}

{'en': "In the absence of king's protection, all things, filled with fear and anxiety and becoming senseless and uttering cries of misery would be ruined in no time.", 'sn': 'त्रस्तमुद्विग्नहृदयं हाहाभूतमचेतनम्। क्षणेन विनशेत् सर्वं यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'No sacrifices extending for a year and finished with presents according to the ordinance would take place if the king did not observe the duty of protection.', 'sn': 'न संवत्सरसत्राणि तिष्ठेयुरकुतोभयाः। विधिवद् दक्षिणावन्ति यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥'}

{'en': "In the absence of king's protection Brahmanas would never study the four Vedas or practise austerities or be purified by knowledge and rigid vows.", 'sn': 'ब्राह्मणाश्चतुरो वेदान् नाधीयोरंस्तपस्विनः। विद्यास्नाता व्रतस्नाता यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥'}

{'en': "In the absence of king's protection the destroyer of a person guilty of Brahmanicide would not get any reward; rather the person. Guilty of Brahmanicide, would would not be punished. an", 'sn': 'न लभेद् धर्मसंश्लेषं हतविप्रहतो जनः। हर्ता स्वस्थेन्द्रियो गच्छेद् यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥'}

{'en': "In the absence of king's protection, men would take away other people's wealth from their very hands, and all healthy restrictions would be abolished, and everybody, stricken with, fear would seek safety in flight.", 'sn': 'हस्ताद्धस्तं परिमुषेद् भिद्येरन् सर्वसेतवः। भयार्त विद्रवेत् सर्वं यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥'}

{'en': "In the absence of king's protection, all kinds of injustice would commence; intermixture of castes would occur; and famine would devastate the kingdom.", 'sn': 'अनयाः सम्प्रवर्तेरन् भवेद् वै वर्णसंकरः। दुर्भिक्षमाविशेद् राष्ट्रं यदि राजा न पालयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Again by virtue of royal protection, men can everywhere sleep fearlessly at their ease without shutting their houses and doors with bolts and bars.', 'sn': 'विवृत्य हि यथाकामं गृहद्वाराणि शेरते। मनुष्या रक्षिता राज्ञा समन्तादकुतोभयाः।॥'}

{'en': 'Nobody would stand the evil words of others far less assaults, if the king did not righteously protect the Earth.', 'sn': 'नाक्रुष्टं सहते कश्चित् कुतो वा हस्तलाघवम्। यदि राजा न सम्यग् गां रक्षयत्यपि धार्मिकः॥'}

{'en': 'If the king observes the duty of protection, women adorned with ornaments may fearlessly walk about everywhere without male relatives to guard them.', 'sn': 'स्त्रियश्चपुरुषा मार्ग सर्वालङ्कारभूषिताः। निर्भयाः प्रतिपद्यन्ते यदि रक्षति भूमिपः॥'}

{'en': 'Men become righteous and without injuring serve one another because the king observes the duty of protection.', 'sn': 'धर्ममेव प्रपद्यन्ते न हिंसन्ति परस्परम्। अनुगृह्णन्ति चान्योन्यं यदा रक्षति भूमिपः॥'}

{'en': 'By virtue of royal protection the members of the three castes can celebrate high sacrifices and engage themselves in the acquisition of learning with attention.', 'sn': 'यजन्ते च महायज्ञैस्त्रयो वर्णाः पृथग्विधैः। युक्ताश्चाधीयते विद्यां यदा रक्षति भूमिपः॥'}

{'en': 'The world depends upon agriculture and trade and is protected by the Vedas. All these again are duly protected by the king exercising his principal duty.', 'sn': 'वार्तामूलो ह्ययं लोकस्त्रय्या वै धार्य ते सदा। तत् सर्वं वर्तते सम्यग् यदा रक्षति भूमिपः॥'}

{'en': 'Since the king, taking a heavy burden upon himself, protects his subjects with the help of a mighty force, it is therefore that the people are able to live in happiness.', 'sn': 'यदा राजा धुरं श्रेष्ठामादाय वहति प्रजाः। महता बलयोगेन तदा लोकः प्रसीदति॥'}

{'en': 'Who is there who will not worship him on whose existence depends the existence of the people and by whose destruction the people are destroyed?', 'sn': 'यस्याभावेन भूतानामभावः स्यात् समन्ततः। भावे च भावो नित्यं स्यात् कस्तं न प्रतिपूजयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'That person who does what is agreeable and beneficial to the king and who participates in the burden of kingly duties which fill every caste with fear, conquers both this and the other world.', 'sn': 'तस्य यो वहते भारं सर्वलोकभयावहम्। तिष्ठन् प्रियहिते राज्ञ उभौ लोकाविमौ जयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'That man who even thinks of injuring the king, forsooth meets with grief here and goes to hell hereafter.', 'sn': 'यस्तस्य पुरुषः पापं मनसाप्यनुचिन्तयेत्। असंशयमिह क्लिष्टः प्रेत्यापि नरकं व्रजेत्॥'}
{'en': 'No one should obey the king by taking him for a man, for he is in sooth a great god in human form.', 'sn': 'न हि जात्ववमन्तव्यो मनुष्य इति भूमिपः। महती देवता ह्येषा नररूपेण तिष्ठति॥'}

{'en': 'The king puts on five different forms according to five different occasions. He energy the becomes Agni, Aditya, Mrityu, Vaishravana, and Yama.', 'sn': 'कुरुते पञ्चरूपाणि कालयुक्तानि यः सदा। भवत्यग्निस्तथाऽऽदित्यो मृत्युर्वैश्रवणो यमः॥'}

{'en': 'When the king, imposed on by falsehood, consumes with his dreadful offenders before him, he is said to put on the form of Agni.', 'sn': 'यदा ह्यासीदत: पापान् दहत्युग्रेण तेजसा। मिथ्योपचरितो राजा तदा भवति पावकः॥'}

{'en': 'When he marks through his spies the acts of all persons and does what is for the general behoof, he is said to put on the form of Aditya.', 'sn': 'यदा पश्यति चारेण सर्वभूतानि भूमिपः। क्षेमं च कृत्वा व्रजति तदा भवति भास्करः॥'}

{'en': 'When he kills in anger hundreds of wicked men with their sons, grandsons, and relatives, he is then said to put on the form of the Destroyer.', 'sn': 'अशुचीश्च यदा क्रुद्धः क्षिणोति शतशो नरान्। सपुत्रपौत्रान् सामात्यांस्तदा भवति सोऽन्तकः॥'}

{'en': 'When he suppresses the the wicked by punishing them severely and favours the righteous by giving them rewards, he is then said to put on the form of Yama.', 'sn': 'यदा त्वधार्मिकान् सर्वांस्तीक्ष्णैर्दण्डैनियच्छति। धार्मिकांश्चानुगृह्णाति भवत्यथ यमस्तदा॥'}

{'en': 'When he pleases with profuse gifts of riches those who have done him valuable services, and takes away the riches and precious stones of those who have offended him, indeed, when he confers wealth upon some and takes it away from others, he is then, O king, said to put on the form of Kubera on Earth.', 'sn': 'यदा तु धनधाराभिस्तर्पयत्युपकारिणः। आच्छिनत्ति न रत्नानि विविधान्यपकारिणाम्॥ श्रियं ददाति कस्मैचित् कस्माच्चिदपकर्षति। तदा वैश्रवणो राजा लोके भवति भूमिपः॥'}

{'en': "No person which is clever, who is capable of work, who wishes to acquire virtue, and who is shorn of malice, should ever spread evil reports about the king. No person, by acting against the king, can ever make himself happy, even if he be the king's son or brother or companion or one whom the king considers as his second self. Fire, increased by the wind, blazing forth, may leave a residue.", 'sn': 'नास्यापवादे स्थातव्यं दक्षेणाक्लिश्कर्मणा। धर्म्यमाकाङ्क्षता लोकमीश्वरस्यानसूयता॥ न हि राज्ञः प्रतीपानि कुर्वन् सुखमवाप्नुयात्। पुत्रो भ्राता वयस्यो वा यद्यप्यात्मसमो भवेत्॥'}

{'en': 'The anger of the king, however, leaves not anything to the person who happens to incur it. Everything that belongs to the king should be avoided from a distance.', 'sn': 'कुर्यात् कृष्णगतिः : शेषं ज्वलितोऽनिलसारथिः। न तु राजाभिपन्नस्य शेषं क्वचन विद्यते॥'}

{'en': "One should turn away from the king's property as he would from death itself. A person, by taking what belongs to the king, soon meets with destruction like a deer upon touching poison.", 'sn': 'तस्य सर्वाणि रक्ष्याणि दूरतः परिवर्जयेत्। मृत्योरिव जुगुप्सेत राजस्वहरणान्नरः॥'}
{'en': 'An intelligent man should protect as his own what belongs to the king.', 'sn': 'नश्येदभिमृशन् सद्यो मृगः कूटमिव स्पृशन्। आत्मस्वमिव रक्षेत राजस्वमिह बुद्धिमान्॥'}
{'en': 'Those, who take wealth belonging to the king, sink senseless into a deep hell of eternal darkness and infamy.', 'sn': 'महान्तं नरकं घोरमप्रतिष्ठमचेतनम्। पतन्ति चिररात्राय राजवित्तापहारिणः॥'}

{'en': "Who is there who will not adore the king who is described by terms,–'delighter of the people,' 'bestower of happiness, possessor of prosperity, the best of all, healer of injuries, master of Earth,' and protector of men?", 'sn': 'राजा भोजो विराट् सम्राट क्षत्रियो भूपतिर्नृपः। य एभिः स्तूयते शब्दैः कस्तं नार्चितुमर्हति॥'}

{'en': 'That man, therefore, who seeks his own prosperity, who satisfies all healthy restraints, who has his soul under control, who has subdued his passions, who is gifted with intelligence and memory, and who is a clever (business man), should always be attached to the king.', 'sn': 'तस्माद् बुभूषुर्नियतो जितात्मा नियतेन्द्रियः। मेधावी स्मृतिमान् दक्षः संश्रयेत महीपतिम्॥'}

{'en': 'The king should duly honour the minister who is grateful, wise, large-hearted loyal, a master of his senses, virtuous, and observant of the dictates of policy.', 'sn': 'कृतज्ञं प्राज्ञमक्षुद्रं दृढभक्तिं जितेन्द्रियम्। धर्मनित्यं स्थितं नीत्यं मन्त्रिणं पूजयेन्नृपः॥'}

{'en': 'The king should entertain the man who is loyal, grateful, virtuous, self-controlled, brave, noble, and competent to complete works without the help of others.', 'sn': 'दृढभक्तिं कृतप्रज्ञं धर्मज्ञं संयतेन्द्रियम्। शूरमक्षुद्रकर्माणं निषिद्धजनमाश्रयेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Knowledge makes men proud. The king makes men humble. The man who is assailed by the king can never enjoy happiness. On the other hand, the man who gets royal favours becomes happy.', 'sn': 'राजा प्रगल्भं कुरुते मनुष्यं राजा कृशं वै कुरुते मनुष्यम्। राजाभिपन्नस्य कुतः सुखानि राजाभ्युपेतं सुखिनं करोति॥'}

{'en': 'The king is the heart of his people; he is their great refuge; he is their glory; and he is their greatest happiness. Those men, O king, who are attached to the king, can conquer both this and the next world.', 'sn': 'राजा प्रजानां हृदयं गरीये गतिः प्रतिष्ठा सुखमुत्तमं च। समाश्रिता लोकमिमं परं च जयन्ति सम्यक् पुरुषा नरेन्द्र॥'}

{'en': 'Having governed the Earth with the help of the qualities of self-control, truth, and friendship, and having worshipped the deities by great sacrifices, the king, acquiring great glory, acquires an eternal abode in heaven.', 'sn': 'नराधिपश्चाप्यनुशिष्य मेदिनी दमेन सत्येन च सौहृदेन। महद्भिरिष्ट्वा क्रतुभिर्महायर्शा स्त्रिविष्टपे स्थानमुपैति शाश्वतम्॥'}

{'en': "That best of kings viz., the heroic Vasumanas, king of Koshala, thus instructed by Brihaspati the son of Angiras, began thenceforth to protect his subjects.'", 'sn': 'स एवमुक्तोऽङ्गिरसा कौसल्यो राजसत्तमः। प्रयत्नात् कृतवान् वीरः प्रजानां परिपालनम्॥'}

{'en': 'Yudhishthira said Tell me, O grandfather, whence and how happiness and misery approach the rich, and the poor, but who follow different practices and rites.', 'sn': 'युधिष्ठिर उवाच धनिनश्चाधना ये च वर्तयन्ते स्वतन्त्रणः। सुखदुःखागमस्तेषां कः कथं वा पितामह॥'}

{'en': 'Bhishma said Regarding it is cited the old history of what was sung by Champaka who had acquired tranquility and liberation for himself.', 'sn': 'भीष्म उवाच अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम्। शम्पाकेनेह मुक्तेन गीतं शान्तिगतेन च॥'}

{'en': 'In days of yore a certain Brahmana made iniserable by a bad wife, bad dress, and hunger, and practising the vow of renunciation, sang me these verses.', 'sn': 'अब्रवीन्मां पुरा कश्चिद् ब्राह्मणस्त्यागमाश्रितः। क्लिश्यमानः कुदारेण कुचैलेन बुभुक्षया।॥'}

{'en': 'Various sorts of sorrow and happiness overtake, from the day of birth, the person who is born on the Earth.', 'sn': 'उत्पन्नमिह लोके वै जन्मप्रभृति मानवम्। विविधामन्युपवर्तन्ते दुःखानि च सुखानि च।॥'}

{'en': 'If he could ascribe either of them to the work of Destiny, he would then be indifferent w either happiness or misery as they fall to his share,', 'sn': 'तयोरेकतरे मार्गे यदेनमभिसन्नयेत्। न सुखं प्राप्य संहष्येन्नासुखं प्राप्य संज्वरेत्॥'}

{'en': 'Though your mind is freed of desire, yet you bear a heavy burden. You do not strive to accomplish your own good. Are you not successful in subduing your mind?', 'sn': 'न वै चरसि यच्छ्रेय आत्मनो वा यदीशिषे। अकामात्मापि हि सदा धुरमुद्यम्य चैव ह॥'}

{'en': 'Having renounced home and coveted wealth, if you go about, you shall then know what is real happiness. One who is shorn of everything, sleeps soundly and rises happily.', 'sn': 'अकिंचनः परिपतन् सुखमास्वादयिष्यसि। अकिंचनः सुखं शेते समुत्तिष्ठति चैव ह॥'}

{'en': 'Abject poverty, in this world, is the road to happiness. It is the safest way, it leads to the source of all blessings, and the path is not beset with any peril. Persons cherishing desire, cannot reach this goal (but those who have ridden over their desire, can easily do so.', 'sn': 'आकिंचन्यं सुखं लोके पथ्यं शिवमनामयम्। अनमित्रपथो ह्येष दुर्लभः सुलभो मतः॥'}

{'en': 'Stretching my eyes on every part of the three worlds, I do not find the person who can be equal to a poor man of unblemished character and who is indifferent to worldly things.', 'sn': 'अकिंचनस्य शुद्धस्य उपपन्नस्य सर्वतः। अवेक्षमाणस्त्रील्लोकान् न तुल्यमिह लक्षये॥'}

{'en': 'I weighed poverty and sovereignty in the balance, and found sovereignty wanting, and poverty to all appearances possessed greater merits then sovereignty.', 'sn': 'आकिंचन्यं च राज्यं च तुलया समतोलयम्। अत्यरिच्यत दारियं राज्यादपि गुणाधिकम्॥'}

{'en': 'Between poverty and sovereignty there is this great difference, viz., that the sovereign of vast possessions is always troubled with painful anxiety and seems to be an easy prey of death.', 'sn': 'आकिंचन्ये च राज्ये च विशेषः सुमहानयम्। नित्योद्विग्नो हि धनवान् मृत्योरास्यगतो यथा॥'}

{'en': 'Regarding, however, the poor man who has no wealth to call his own, nor any hopes to entertain, and as such has emancipated himself, neither fire, nor foe, nor death, nor thieves, can override him.', 'sn': 'नैवस्याग्निर्न चारिष्टो न मृत्युनं च दस्यवः। प्रभवन्ति धनत्यागाद् विमुक्तस्य निराशिषः॥'}

{'en': 'The very gods praise such a man who wnders about according to his will who lies down on the naked Earth with his arm for a pillow, and who possesses a tranquil soul.', 'sn': 'तं वै सदा कामचरमनुपस्तीर्णशायिनम्। बाहूपधानं शाम्यन्तं प्रशंसन्ति दिवौकसः॥'}

{'en': 'The man of wealth, affected by anger and lust, stains himself with his sinful heart. He casts sidelong glances and makes dry specches. He becomes sinful and his countenance loses its luster with his wry face.', 'sn': 'धनवान् क्रोधलोभाभ्यामाविष्टो नष्टचेतनः। तिर्यगीक्षः शुष्कमुखः पापको भृकुटीमुखः॥'}

{'en': 'Biting his lips, and worked up with passion, he gives vent to harsh and cruel words. If such a man desires to make even a gift of the whole world, who is there that would like to look at him even.', 'sn': 'निर्दशनधरोष्ठं च क्रुद्धो दारुणभाषिता। कस्तमिच्छेत् परिद्रष्टुं दातुमिच्छति चेन्महीम्॥'}

{'en': 'Continuous Prosperity stupefies a person of weak intellect. Like the wind driving off the autumnal clouds, it drives off his judgement. Association with Prosperity induces him to think,-~-I am beautiful. I am wealthy.', 'sn': 'श्रिया ह्यभीक्ष्णं संवासो मोहयत्यविचक्षणम्। सा तस्य चित्तं हरति शारदाभ्रमिवानिलः॥ अथैनं रूपमानश्च धनमानश्च विन्दति।'}

{'en': 'I am high-born! I am successful in my undertakings! I am no ordinary individual!...For these three reasons, his heart becomes intoxicated.', 'sn': 'अभिजातोऽस्मि सिद्धोऽस्मि नास्मि केवलमानुषः॥ इत्येभिः कारणैस्तस्य त्रिभिश्चित्तं प्रमाद्यति।'}

{'en': "He makes a waste of the possessions left by his ancestors by following the bent of his heart cager for worldly enjoyments. And then when reduced to want he does not regard the appropriation of other's wealth as sinful.", 'sn': 'सम्प्रसक्तमना भोगान् विसृज्य पितृसंचितान्। परिक्षीणः परस्वानामादानं साधु मन्यते॥'}

{'en': "At this stage when he outstrips all barriers and becomes reckless of conduct as regards his appropriation of other's possessions from every side the rulers of men checks and afflict him like sportsmen afflicting a deer with their sharp arrows which they espied in the woods.", 'sn': 'तमतिक्रान्तमर्यादमाददानं ततस्ततः। प्रतिषेधन्ति राजानो लुब्धा मृगामिवेषुभिः॥'}

{'en': 'Such a man is then overwhelmed with many other afflictions of a like nature that originate in fire and weapons.', 'sn': 'एवमेतानि दुःखानि तानि तानीह मानवम्। विविधान्युपपद्यन्ते गात्रसंस्पर्शजान्यपि॥'}

{'en': 'Therefore, becoming indifferent to all worldly attachments i.e., for children and wives) together with all fleeting phantons (as the physical body, etc.,) one should , helped by his intelligence, treat himself with proper medicine for the cure of those painful afflictions.', 'sn': 'तेषां परमदुः :खानां बुद्ध्या भैषज्यमाचरेत्। लोकधर्ममवज्ञाय ध्रुणावामध्रुवैः सह॥'}

{'en': 'Without Renunciation one can never be happiness. Without Renunciation one never be successful in gaining what is his highest good. Without Renunciation one can never be at his ease even in sleep. Therefore, renouncing every thing, makc happiness your can Own.', 'sn': 'नात्यक्त्वा सुखमाप्नोति नात्यक्त्वा विन्दते परम्। नात्यक्त्वा चाभयः शेते त्यक्त्वा सर्वं सुखी भव॥'}

{'en': 'A Brahmana, told me all this, at Hastinapur, in times gone by, about what Champaka had sung. I hold Renunciation, therefore, as the foremost of things.', 'sn': 'इत्येद्धास्तिनपुरे ब्राह्मणेनोपवर्णितम्। शम्पाकेन पुरा मह्यं तस्मात् त्यागः परो मतः॥'}

{'en': 'Sanjaya said Thereafter that illustrious scion of the Vrishni race, the high-souled and intelligent Satyaki, having slain Sudarsana in battle, addressing charioteer thus spoke.', 'sn': 'संजय उवाच ततः स सात्यकिर्थीमान् महात्मावृष्णिपुङ्गवः। सुदर्शनं निहत्याजौ यन्तारं पुनरब्रवीत्॥'}

{'en': "Having crossed the almost uncrossable ocean of Drona's division abounding with chariots and steeds and elephants-ocean of which the waves are constituted by arrows and darts, fishes by swords and scimitars and alligators by the maccs; which roars with the whizz of arrows and the clash of diverse weapons, an ocean that is fierce and destructive of life and resounds with the din created by diverse musical instruments; of which the touch is disagreeable and unbearable to warriors longing to have victory and of which the banks infested by flesh-eaters represented by the forces of Jalasandha, I consider that the remaining of the array yet to be crossed, can be crossed with great ease, like a stream-let of shallow water. Therefore do you dauntlessly drive the steeds forwards.", 'sn': 'रथाश्वनागकलिलं शरशक्त्यूमिमालिनम्। खङ्गमत्स्यं गदाग्राहं शूरायुधमहास्वनम्॥ प्राणापहारिणं रौद्रं वादिवोत्क्रुष्टनादितम्। योधानामसुखस्पर्शे दुर्धर्षमजयैषिणाम्॥ तीर्णाः स्म दुस्तरं तात द्रोणानीकमहार्णवम्। जलसंधबलेनाजौ पुरुषादैरिवावृतम्॥ अतोऽन्यत् पृतनाशेषं मन्ये कुनदिकामिव। तर्तव्यामल्पसलिलां चोदयाश्वानसम्भ्रमम्॥'}

{'en': "I think I am now within a hand's distance from Savyasachin. Having vanquished in are battle, the indomitable Drona together with his followers.", 'sn': 'हस्तप्राप्तमहं मन्ये साम्प्रतं सव्यसाचिनम्। निर्जित्य दुर्घरं द्रोणं सपदानुगमाहवे॥'}

{'en': 'As also that best of all warriors namely, the son of Hridika, I think I have already reached Dhananjaya. Though I see these numerous divisions of troops before me, fear does not assail my heart.', 'sn': 'हार्दिक्यं योधवर्ये च मन्ये प्राप्तं धनंजयम्। न हि मे जायते त्रासो दृष्ट्वा सैन्यान्यनेकशः॥'}

{'en': 'For a raging forests conflagration shrinks not at the sight of numerous heaps of dried grass. Behold the ground through which the diadem-decked Arjuna, that best of the Pandavas has passed.', 'sn': 'वढेरिव प्रदीप्तस्य वने शुष्कतृणोलपे। पश्य पाण्डवमुख्येन यातां भूमि किरीटिना॥'}

{'en': 'Rendered uneven by the slain foot-soldiers, horses, car-warriors and elephants. Yonder the Kaurava array is giving way being routed by that high-souled warrior.', 'sn': 'पत्त्यश्वरथनागौघैः पतितैर्विषमीकृताम्। द्रवते तद् यथा सैन्यं तेन भग्नं महात्मना॥'}
{'en': 'O charioteer, behold a thick tawny cloud of dust raised by the flying cars, elephants and steeds.', 'sn': 'रथैविपरिधावद्भिर्गजैरश्चैश्च सारथे। कौशेयारुणसंकाशमेतदुद्भूयते रजः॥'}

{'en': 'I think myself to be very near to that one of white steeds whose charioteer in Krishna, inasmuch as I hear the twang of the bow Gandiva wielded by that one of infinite prowess.', 'sn': 'अभ्याशस्थमहं मन्ये श्वेताश्वं कृष्णासारथिम्। स एष श्रूयते शब्दो गाण्डीवस्यामितौजसः॥'}

{'en': 'From the omens that are revealing themselves to me, I can judge that Arjuna will slay the ruler of the Sindhus before the sun today goes below the horizon.', 'sn': 'यादृशानि निमित्तानि मम प्रादुर्भवन्ति वै। अनस्तंगत आदित्ये हन्ता सैन्धवमर्जुनः॥'}

{'en': 'Without exhausting their strength, drive the steeds slowly to the spot where the hostile ranks are staying, that is, to the spot where yonder warriors headed by Duryodhana, their hands cased in leathern fences', 'sn': 'शनैर्विश्रम्भयन्नश्वान् याहि यत्रारिवाहिनी। यौते सतलत्राणाः सुयोधनपुरोगमाः॥'}

{'en': 'And yonder Kambojas of dreadful deeds, cased in mail and difficult of defeat in battle and these Yavanas armed with bows and arrows and accomplished in smiting.', 'sn': 'दंशिताः क्रूरकर्माणः काम्बोजा युद्धदुर्मदाः। शरबाणासनधरा यवनाश्च प्रहारिणः॥'}

{'en': 'And yonder Sakas and Kiratas and Daradas and Barbaras and Tamraliptakas and numerous other Mlechchas armed with diverse weapons are staying.', 'sn': 'शकाः किराता दरदा बर्बरास्ताम्रलिप्तकाः। अन्ये च बहवो म्लेच्छा विविधायुधपामयः॥'}

{'en': 'To the spot (I repeat) where yonder warriors headed by Duryodhana, their hands defended by leathern gloves, are standing with their faces turned towards me and inspired with the resolution of encountering me.', 'sn': 'यौते सतलत्राणाः सुयोधनपुरोगमाः। मामेवाभिमुखाः सर्वे तिष्ठन्ति समरार्थिनः॥'}

{'en': 'Consider me, O charioteer as already passed through this dreadful strong-hold, having slain in battle all these warriors and cars, elephants, horses and foot-soldiers that are among them.', 'sn': 'एतान् सरथनागाश्वान् निहत्याजौ सपत्तिनः। इदं दुर्गे महाघोरं तीर्णमेवोपधारय॥'}

{'en': 'The Charioteer said O scion of the Vrishni race, fear I have none, O you of prowess incapable of being withstood! If you had before you the enraged son of Yamadagni.', 'sn': 'सूत उवाच न सम्भ्रमो मे वार्ष्णेय विद्यते सत्यविक्रम। यद्यपि स्यात् तव क्रुद्धो जामदग्न्योऽग्रतः स्थितः॥'}

{'en': 'Or Drona that foremost of car-warriors or Kripa or the ruler of the Madras himself, even then fear would not enter my heart, O you of mighty arms, as long as I am under the shadow of your protection.', 'sn': 'द्रोणो वा रथिनां श्रेष्ठः कृपो मद्रेश्वरोऽपि वा। तथापि सम्भ्रमो न स्यात् त्वामाश्रित्य महाभुज॥'}

{'en': 'O slayer of hostile heroes, numerous Kambojas covered in coats of mail, of dreadful deeds and difficult of defeat in battle, have already been worsted by you;', 'sn': 'त्वया सुबहवो युद्धे निर्जिताः शत्रुसूदन। दंशिताः क्रूरकर्माणः काम्बोजा युद्धदुर्मदाः॥'}

{'en': 'As also numerous Yavanas armed with bow and arrows and accomplished in smiting, including Sakas, Kiratas, Daradas Barbars, Tamraliptakas.', 'sn': 'शरबाणासनधरा यवनाश्च प्रहारिणः। शकाः किराता दरदा बर्बरास्ताम्रलिप्तकाः॥'}
{'en': 'And many other Miechchas, armed with various weapons. Never did I feel fear in any battle.', 'sn': 'अन्ये च बहवो म्लेच्छा विविधायुधपाणयः। न च मे सम्भ्रमः कश्चिद् भूतपूर्वः कथंचन॥'}

{'en': "O you of great courage, why shall I then experience any fear in this battle, which is like the vestige of a cow's hoof. O long-lived one, by which track shall I carry you to the spot where Dhananjaya is?", 'sn': 'किमुतैतत् समासाद्य धीरसंयुगगोष्पदम्। आयुष्मन् कतरेण त्वां प्रापयामि धनंजयम्॥'}

{'en': 'On whom have you been angry, O you of the Vrishni race? Who are they for whom death is waiting? Who are they that are destined to repair to the mansion of death today?', 'sn': 'केषां क्रुद्धोऽसि वार्ष्णेय केषां मृत्युरुपस्थितः। केषां संयमनीमद्य गन्तुमुत्सहते मनः॥'}

{'en': 'Who are they that will fly away from the field of battle beholding you endowed with such prowess, resembling the Destroyer himself as he appears at the end of the Yuga and putting forth that prowess of yours? O you of mighty arms who are they whoin king Vaivasvat, has remembered today?', 'sn': 'के त्वां युधि पराक्रान्तं कालान्तकयमोपमम्। दृष्ट्वा विक्रमसम्पन्नं विद्रविष्यन्ति संयुगे॥ केषां वैवस्वतो राजा स्मरतेऽद्य महाभुज।'}

{'en': 'Satyaki said I will slay these warriors with sharpened shafts like Vasava slaying the Danavas. Slaying the Kambojas, I will fulfill my vow. Carry me thither.', 'sn': 'सात्यकिरुवाच मुण्डानेतान् हनिष्यामि दानवानिव वासवः॥ प्रतिज्ञा पारयिष्यानि काम्बोजानेव मां वह।'}

{'en': 'The Gandharvas and various clans of Apsaras are to be seen there, O king, passing their days happily.', 'sn': 'तत्रादृश्यन्त गन्धर्वास्तथैवाप्सरसां गणाः॥ समेत्य सहिता राजन् यथाप्राप्तं यथासुखम्।'}

{'en': 'There all the creepers are covered with flowers.
