{'en': 'There many Gandharvas, headed by Vishvavasu and possessed of ascetic merit, pass their time in dance and singing many sweet songs.', 'sn': 'विश्वावसुमुखास्तत्र गन्धर्वास्तपसान्विताः॥ नृत्यवादित्रगीतं च कुर्वन्ति सुमनोरमम्।'}

{'en': 'Giving away various kinds of riches to the Brahmanas, as also goat and sheep and kine and mules and camels and gold and silver.', 'sn': 'तत्र दत्त्वा हलधरो विप्रेभ्यो विविधं वसु॥ अजाविकं गोखरोष्ट्रं सुवर्णं रजतं तथा।'}

{'en': "And feeding many Brahmanas and satisfying them with many rich gifts as desired by them, Baladeva, of Madhu's race, left that place accompanied by many Brahmanas and praised by them.", 'sn': 'भोजयित्वा द्विजान् कामैः संतर्घ्य च महाधनैः॥ प्रययौ सहितो विप्रैः स्तूयमानश्च माधवः।'}

{'en': 'Leaving that tirtha the favourite haunt of the Gandharvas, that mighty-armed chastiser of foes, having but one ear-ring, then went to the famous tirtha called Gargashrota.', 'sn': 'तस्माद् गन्धर्वतीर्थाच महाबाहुररिंदमः॥ गर्गस्रोतो महातीर्थमाजगामैककुण्डली।'}

{'en': 'There, in that sacred tirtha of the Sarasvati, the illustrious and old Garga, having a soul cleansed by ascetic penances, O Janamejaya, had mastered the knowledge of time and its course, of the deviations of luminous bodies (in the sky) and of all auspicious and inauspicious portents.', 'sn': 'तत्र गर्गेण वृद्धेन तपसा भावितात्मना॥ कालज्ञानगतिश्चैव ज्योतिषां च व्यतिक्रमः। उत्पाता दारुणाश्चैव शुभाश्च जनमेजय॥ सरस्वत्या शुभे तीर्थे विदिता वै महात्मना।'}

{'en': 'That tirtha was called after his name Gargashrota. There, ( king, highly blessed Rishis of firm vows always waited upon Garga, O lord, for acquiring a knowledge of time.', 'sn': 'तस्य नाम्ना च तत् तीर्थं गर्गस्रोत इति स्मृतम्॥ तत्र गर्गं महाभागमृषयः सुव्रता नृप। उपासांचक्रिरे नित्यं कालज्ञानं प्रति प्रभो॥'}

{'en': 'Besmeared with white sandal-paste O king, Baladeva, going to that tirtha, duly distributed wealth amongst many ascetics of pure souls.', 'sn': 'तत्र गत्वा महाराज बलः श्वेतानुलेपनः। विधिवद्धि धनं दत्त्वा मुनीनां भावितात्मनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Having distributed also many sorts of rich food amongst the Brahmanas, that illustrious one, clad in blue robes, then went to the tirtha called Shankha.', 'sn': 'उच्चावचांस्तथा भक्ष्यान् विप्रेभ्यो विप्रदाय सः। नीलवासास्तदागच्छच्छङ्घतीर्थं महायशाः॥'}

Having given away many milch cows, vessels of copper and iron and diverse sorts of other vessels, that foremost Yadu's race, viz., Baladeva, having the plough for his weapon, worshipped the Brahmanas and was adored by them in return. He then, O king, went to the Dvaita lake.", 'sn': 'ततस्तथ सरस्वत्याः पावनं लोकविश्रुतम्। तस्मिंश्च यदुशार्दूलो दत्त्वा तीर्थे पयस्विनीः॥ ताम्रायसानि भाण्डानि वस्त्राणि विविधानि च। पूजयित्वा द्विजांश्चैव पूजितश्च तपोधनैः॥'}

{'en': 'Arrived there, Vala saw various ascetics dressed diversely. Bathing in its waters, he adored the Brahmanas.', 'sn': 'पुण्यं द्वैतवनं राजन्नाजगाम हलायुधः। तत्र गत्वा मुनीन् दृष्ट्वा नानावेषधरान् बलः॥'}

{'en': 'Having distributed profusely amongst the Brahmanas various articles of enjoyment Baladeva then, O king, went on along the southern bank of the Sarasvati.', 'sn': 'आप्लुत्य सलिले चापि पूजयामास वै द्विजान्। तथैव दत्त्वा विप्रेभ्यः परिभोगान् सुपुष्कलान्।॥ ततः प्रायाद् बलो राजन् दक्षिणेन सरस्वतीम्।'}

{'en': 'The mighty-armed and illustrious Rama, of pure soul and unmitigated glory, then proceeded to the tirtha called Nagadhanvana.', 'sn': 'गत्वा चैवं महाबाहुर्नातिदूरे महायशाः॥ धर्मात्मा नागधन्वानं तीर्थमागमदच्युतः।'}

{'en': 'Abounding with snakes, O king, it was the abode of the highly effulgent Vasuki, the king of serpents. There four and then ten thousand Rishis also lived permanently.', 'sn': 'यत्र पन्नगराजस्य वासुकेः संनिवेशनम्॥ महाद्युतेर्महाराज बहुभिः पन्नगैर्वृतम्। ऋषीणां हि सहस्राणि यत्र नित्यं चतुर्दश॥'}

{'en': "Having come there in days of yore the celestials had, according to due rites, installed the great snake Vasuki as king of all the snakes. There is no fear of snakes in that place Oyou of Kuru's race.", 'sn': 'यत्र देवाः समागम्य वासुकिं पन्नगोत्तमम्। सर्वपन्नगराजानमभ्यषिञ्चन् यथाविधि॥ पन्नगेभ्यो भयं तत्र विद्यते न स्म पौरव।'}

{'en': 'Duly distributing many valuable articles there amongst the Brahmanas Baladeva then set out with face towards the east and reached, one after another, hundreds and thousands of celebrated tirthas situated all around.', 'sn': 'तत्रापि विधिवद् दत्त्वा विप्रेभ्यो रत्नसंचयान्॥ प्रायात् प्राची दिशं तत्र तत्र तीर्थान्यनेकशः। सहस्रशतसंख्यानि प्रथितानि पदे पदे॥'}

{'en': 'Bathing in all those tirthas and observing fasts and other vows as sanctioned by the Rishis and given away immense riches and saluting all the ascetics who lived there, Baladeva once more set out, along the way pointed out to him by those ascetics for reaching that spot where the Sarasvati turns in an eastward direction like torrents of rain bent by the velocity of the storm. The river took that course for seeing the great Rishis dwelling in the forest of Naimisha.', 'sn': 'आप्लुत्य तत्र तीर्थेषु यथोक्तं तत्र चर्षिभिः। कृत्वोपवासनियमं दत्त्वा दानानि सर्वशः॥ अभिवाद्य मुनीस्तान् वै तत्र तीर्थनिवासिनः। उद्दिष्टमार्गः प्रययौ यत्र भूयः सरस्वती॥ प्राङमुखं वै निववतै वृष्टिर्वातहता यथा। ऋषीणां नैमिषयाणामवेक्षार्थं महात्मनाम्॥'}

{'en': 'Always smeared with white sandal-paste, Vala, having the plough for his weapon, seeing that great river change her course, was O king, filled with wonder.', 'sn': 'निवृत्तां तां सरिच्छेष्टां तत्र दृष्ट्वा तु लागली। बभूव विस्मितो राजन् बल: श्वेतानुलेपनः॥'}

{'en': 'Janamejaya said "Why O Brahmana, did the Sarasvati bend her course there towards the east. O best of Adhvaryus, you should tell me everything regarding this.', 'sn': 'जनमेजय उवाच कस्मात् सरस्वती ब्रह्मन् निवृत्ता प्राडमुखीभवत्। व्याख्यातमेतदिच्छामि सर्वमध्वर्युसत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'Why was that delighter of the Yadus filled with wonder? Why, indeed did that best of rivers thus change her course."', 'sn': 'कस्मिंश्चित् कारणे तत्र विस्मितो यदुनन्दनः। निवृत्ता हेतुना केन कथमेव सरिद्वरा॥'}

{'en': 'Vaishampayana said "Formerly, in the Satya Yuga, O king, the ascetics living in Naimisha were engaged in a great sacrifice extending for twelve years.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच पूर्वं कृतयुगे राजन् नैमिषेयास्तपस्विनः। वर्तमाने सुविपुले सत्रे द्वादशवार्षिके॥'}

{'en': "Many Rishis, O king, came to that sacrifice. Passing their time according to proper rites, in the celebration of that sacrifice, those great Rishis, after the termination of that twelve year's sacrifice at Naimisha, set out in large numbers for seeing the various sacred shrines.", 'sn': 'ऋषयो बहवो राजंस्तत् सत्रमभिपेदिरे। उषित्वा च महाभागास्तस्मिन् सत्रे यथाविधि॥ निवृत्ते नैमिषेये वै सत्रे द्वादशवार्षिके। आजग्मुर्ऋषयस्तत्र बहवस्तीर्थकारणात्॥'}

{'en': 'On account of the number of the Rishis, O king, the tirthas on the southern banks of the Sarasvati all looked like towns and cities.', 'sn': 'ऋषीणां बहुलत्वात्तु सरस्वत्या विशाम्पते। तीर्थानि नगरायन्ते कूले वै दक्षिणे तदा॥'}

{'en': 'Those foremost of Brahmanas, O foremost of men, being anxious to enjoy the merits of tirthas, took up thcir abodes on the bank of the river up to Samantapanchaka.', 'sn': 'समन्तपञ्चकं यावत्तावत्ते द्विजसत्तमाः। तीर्थलोभान्नरव्याघ्र नद्यास्तीरं समाश्रिताः॥'}

{'en': 'The whole region was as if filled with loud Vedic recitations of those Rishis of pure souls, all engaged in pouring libations of sacrificial fires.', 'sn': 'जुह्वतां तत्र तेषां तु मुनीनां भावितात्मनाम्। स्वाध्यायेनातिमहता बभूवुः पूरिता दिशः॥'}

{'en': 'That best of rivers shone highly beautiful with those burning homa fires all around, over which those great ascetics poured libations of clarified butter.', 'sn': 'अग्निहोत्रैस्तस्ततेषां क्रियमाणैर्महात्मनाम्। अशोभत सरिच्छेष्टा दीप्यमानैः समन्ततः॥'}

{'en': 'Valakhilyas and Ashmarkuttas, Dantolukhalinas, Samprakshyanas and other ascetics, as also those living on air and those living on water and those living on dry leaves of trees and various others who practised diverse kinds of vows and those that lived on bare and hard earth, all came to that spot in the vicinity of the Sarasvati. And they rendered that foremost of rivers highly beautiful like the celestials beautifying with their presence the heavenly rivers called Mandakini.', 'sn': 'वालखिल्या महाराज अश्मकुट्टाश्च तापसाः। दन्तोलूखलिनश्चान्ये प्रसंख्यानास्तथा परे॥ वायुभक्षा जलाहाराः पर्णभक्षाश्च तापसाः। नानानियमयुक्ताश्च तथा स्थण्डिलशायिनः॥ आसन् वै मुनयस्तत्र सरस्वत्याः समीपतः। शोभयन्तः सरिच्छेष्ठां गङ्गामिव दिवौकसः॥'}

{'en': 'Hundreds of Rishis, all given to the observance of sacrifices, came there. Those observers of great vows could not find sufficient accommodation on the banks of the Sarasvati.', 'sn': 'शतशश्च समापेतुर्ऋषयः सत्रयाजिनः। तेऽवकाशं न ददृशुः सरस्वत्या महाव्रताः॥'}

{'en': 'Measuring small plots of land with their sacred threads, they celebrated Agnihotras and other rites.', 'sn': 'ततो यज्ञोपवीतैस्ते तत्तीर्थं निर्मिमाय वै। जुहुवुश्चाग्निहोत्रांश्च चक्रुश्च विविधाः क्रियाः॥'}

{'en': 'The river Sarasvati saw, O king, those Rishis filled with despair and anxiety for want of a commodious tirtha wherein to perform their rites.', 'sn': 'ततस्तमऋषिसंघातं निराशं चिन्तयान्वितम्। दर्शयामास राजेन्द्र तेषामर्थे सरस्वती॥'}

{'en': 'Accordingly that best of streams came there, having made sufficient accommodation on her bank for those Rishis, out of compassion for them, O Janamejaya.', 'sn': 'ततः कुञ्जान् बहून कृत्वा संनिवृत्ता सरस्वती। ऋषीणां पुण्यतपसां कारुण्याजनमेजय॥'}

{'en': 'Having thus, O king, changed her course for their sake, the Sarasvati, that best of rivers, once more flowed in a westerly direction, to make the arrival of the Rishis there successful. O king, the great river accomplished there this wonderful feat.', 'sn': 'ततो निवृत्य राजेन्द्र तेषामर्थे सरस्वती। भूयः प्रतीच्यभिमुखी प्रसुस्राव सरिद्वरा॥ अमोघा गमनं कृत्वा तेषां भूयो व्रजाम्यहम्। इत्युद्भुतं महचक्रे तदा राजन् महानदी॥'}

{'en': 'Thus those reservoirs of water, O king, where formed in Naimisha. There, Kurukshetra, O Kuru chief, do you celebrate grand sacrifices and rites. Beholding those innumerable reservoirs of water and seeing that best of rivers change her course, the highsouled Rama was filled with wonder.', 'sn': 'एवं स कुञ्जो राजन् वै नैमिषीय इति स्मृतः। कुरुश्रेष्ठ कुरुक्षेत्रे कुरुष्व महतीं क्रियाम्॥ तत्र कुञ्जान् बहून दृष्ट्वा निवृत्तां च सरस्वतीम्। बभूव विस्मयस्तत्र रामस्याथ महात्मनः॥'}

{'en': "Bathing in those tirthas duly and distributing wealth and various other articles of enjoyment ainongst the Brahmanas, that delighter of Yadu's race also gave away various kinds of food and desirable articles to them. Adored by those Rishis, Vala, O king, left that foremost of all tirthas on the Sarasvati, at (viz., Sapta-Sarasvat). Numerous birds also lived there. And it abounded with Vadari, Inguda, Kacmaryya, Plahsha, Ashvattha, Vibhitaka, Kakkola, Palasha, Karira, Pilu and various other kinds of trees that grow on the banks of the Sarasvati.", 'sn': 'उपस्पृश्य तु तत्रापि विधिवद् यदुनन्दनः। दत्त्वा दायान् द्विजातिभ्यो भाण्डानि विविधानि च॥५९ भक्ष्यं भोज्यं च विविधं ब्राह्मणेभ्यः प्रदाय च। ततः प्रायाद् बलो राजन् पूज्यमानो द्विजातिभिः॥ सरस्वतीतीर्थवरं नानाद्विजगणायुतम्। बलरेङगुदकाश्मर्यप्लक्षाश्वत्थबिभीतकैः॥ कङ्कोलैश्च पलाशैश्च करीरैः पीलुभिस्तथा। सरस्वतीतीर्थरुहैस्तरुभिर्विविधैस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'And it was adorned with forests of Karushakas, Vilvas Vilvas and Amratakas and Atimuktas and Kashandas and Parijatas.', 'sn': 'करूषकवरैश्चैव बिल्वैराम्रातकैस्तथा। अतिमुक्तकषण्डैश्च पारिजातैश्च शोभितम्॥'}

{'en': 'It abounded with forests of Plantains pleasant to view and most charming. And it was haunted by various ascetics, some living on air, some water, some on fruits, some on leaves, some on raw raise again which they husked with the aid only of stones and some that were called Vaneyas. And it was filled with the chauntings of the Vedas and abounded with diverse kinds of animals.', 'sn': 'कदलीवनभूयिष्ठं दृष्टिकान्तं मनोहरम्। वाय्वम्बुफलपर्णादैर्दन्तोलूखलिकैरपि॥ तथाश्मकुट्टैर्वानेयैर्मुनिभिर्बहुभिर्वृतम्। स्वाध्यायघोषसंघुष्टं मृगयूथशताकुलम्॥'}

{'en': 'And it was the favourite abode of men shorn of malice and devoted to righteousness. Baladeva, having the plough for his weapon, arrived at that tirtha, called the Sapta-Sarasvat, where the great ascetic Mankanaka had his penances successfully practised.', 'sn': 'अहिंस्रैर्धर्मपरमैनूभिपत्यर्थसेवितम्। सप्तसारस्वतं तीर्थमाजगाम हलायुधः॥ यत्र मकुणक: सिद्धस्तपस्तेपे महामुनिः॥'}

{'en': 'Having regained the kingdom, the highly pure and wise king Yudhishthira, after the ceremony of installation had been over, joining his hands together, addressed the louts-eyed Krishna of Dasharha\'s race, saying,-"Through your grace, O Krishna through your policy, might, intelligence and prowess, O foremost of the Yadus, I have regained this ancestral kingdom of mine. O you having lotus-eyes, I repeatedly bow to you, O chastiser of foes.', 'sn': 'वैशम्पायन उवाच अभिषिक्तो महाप्राज्ञो राज्यं प्राप्त युधिष्ठिरः। दाशार्ह पुण्डरीकाक्षमुवाच प्राञ्जलिः शुचिः॥ तव कृष्ण प्रसादेन नयेन च बलेन च। बुद्ध्या च यदुशार्दूल तथा विक्रमणेन च॥ पुनः प्राप्तमिदं राज्यं पितृपैतामहं मया। नमस्ते पुण्डरीकाक्ष पुनः पुनररिन्दम॥'}

{'en': 'You have been called the One only Being. You are the refuge of all worshippers. The Rishis worship you under various names.', 'sn': 'त्वामेकमाहुः पुरुषं त्वामाहुः सात्वतां पतिम्। नामभिस्त्वां बहुविधैः स्तुवन्ति प्रयता द्विजाः॥'}

{'en': 'Salutation to you, O Creator of the Universe. You are the soul of the Universe. You are the soul of the Universe and the Universe has originated from you. You are Vishnu, you are Jishnu, you are Hari, you are Krishna, you are Vaikuntha, and you are the greatest of all beings.', 'sn': 'विश्वकर्मन् नमस्तेऽस्तु विश्वात्मन् विश्वसम्भव। विष्णो जिष्णो हरे कृष्ण वैकुण्ठ पुरुषोत्तम॥'}

{'en': 'You have, as said in the Puranas, taken your birth seven times in the womb of Aditi. You also took birth in the womb of Prishni. The learned say that you are the three Yugas.', 'sn': 'अदित्याः सप्तधा त्वं तु पुराणो गर्भतां गतः। पृश्निगर्भस्त्वमेवैकस्त्रियुगं त्वां वदन्त्यपि॥'}

{'en': 'All your deeds are sacred. You are the master of our senses. You are the great Lord worshipped in sacrifices. You are called the great swan. You are three-eyed Shambhu. You are One, though known as Vibhu and Damodara.', 'sn': 'शुचिश्रवा हृषीकेशो घृताहिँस उच्यते। त्रिचक्षुः शम्भुरेकस्त्वं विभुर्दामोदरोऽपि च॥'}

{'en': 'You are the great Boar you are Fire, you are the Sun, you have the emblem of bull on your banner, and you have Garuda also for your emblem. You are the grinder of inimical armies, you are the Being who perineates every form in the universe, and you are of irresistible power.', 'sn': 'वराहोऽग्निवृहद्भानुवृषभस्तार्क्ष्यलक्षणः। अनीकसाहः पुरुषः शिपिविष्ट उरुक्रमः॥'}

{'en': 'You are the foremost of all things, you are dreadful, you are the commander of food, and you are Guha (the celestial commander-inchief). You yourself never suffer deterioration, you cause your enemies to fade and waste. You are the Brahmana of pure blood, and you are the issues of intermarriage. You are great.', 'sn': 'वरिष्ठ उग्रसेनानी: सत्यो वाजसनिर्गुहः। अच्युतश्च्यावनोऽरीणां संस्कृतो विकृतिवृषः॥'}

{'en': 'You move in the sky, you are called Vrishadarbha and Vrishakapi. You are Ocean, you are without attributes, you have three huinps, you have three abodes, and you create human forms of Earth, coming down from heaven.', 'sn': 'कृष्णधर्मस्त्वमेवादिवृषदर्भो वृषाकपिः। सिन्धुर्विधर्मस्त्रिककुप् त्रिधामा त्रिदिवाञ्च्युतः॥'}

{'en': 'You are Emperor, you are superior to Emperor, and even superior to him. You are King of the gods, and you are the root of Universe. You are all-powerful you are existence in every form, you are formless, you are Krishna, and you are fire.', 'sn': 'सम्राड् विराट् स्वराट् चैव सुरराजो भवोद्भवः। विभुर्भूरतिभूः कृष्णः कृष्णवर्मा त्वमेव च ॥'}

{'en': 'You are the Creator, you are the father of the celestial physicians, you are (the sage) Kapila, and you are the Dwarf. You are Sacrifice embodied, you are Dhruva, you are called Yajnasena.', 'sn': 'स्विष्टकृद् भिषगावर्तः कपिलस्त्वं च वामनः। यज्ञो ध्रुवः पतङ्गश्च यज्ञसेनस्त्वमुच्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'You are Shikhandin, you are Nahusha, and you are Babhru. You are the constellation Punarvasu residing in the sky. You are of iwany colour, you are the sacrifice of Uktha, you are Sushena, you are the drum.', 'sn': 'शिखण्डी नहुषो बभ्रुर्दिवःस्पृक् त्वं पुनर्वसुः। सुबभू रुक्मयज्ञश्च सुषेणो दुन्दुभिस्तथा॥'}

{'en': 'are The track of your car-wheels is light. You are the lotus of Prosperity, you are the cloud Pushkara, and you are adorned with garlands. You are rich, you are powerful you are the most subtile, and you are described in the Vedas.', 'sn': 'गभस्तिनेमिः श्रीपद्यः पुष्करः पुष्पधारणः। ऋभुर्विभुः सर्वसूक्ष्मश्चारित्रं चैव पठ्यसे॥'}

{'en': 'You are the great sea, you are Brahman, you are the sacred refuge, and you know the residences of all. You called Hiranyagarbha, you are the sacred mantras swadha and svaha, you are Keshava.', 'sn': 'अम्भोनिधिस्त्वं ब्रह्मा त्वं पवित्रं धाम धामवित्। हिरण्यगर्भ त्वामाहुः स्वधा स्वाहा च केशव॥'}

{'en': 'You are the cause of all, and you are its dissolution. In the beginning you created the universe. This universe is under your sway, O Creator of the universe. Salutations to you, O wielder of Sharanga bow, discus, and sword.', 'sn': 'योनिस्त्वमस्य प्रलयश्च कृष्ण त्वमेवेदं सृजसे विश्वमग्रे। विश्वं चेदं त्वद्वशे विश्वयोने नमोऽस्तु ते शाईचक्रासिपाणे॥'}

{'en': 'Thus hymned by king Yudhishthira in the midst of the assembly, the lotus-eyed Krishna became pleased. That foremost one of the Yadavas then began to cheer up the eldest son of Pandu with many sweet speeches.', 'sn': 'एवं स्तुतो धर्मराजेन कृष्णः सभामध्ये प्रीतिमान् पुष्कराक्षः। तमभ्यनन्दद् भारतं पुष्कलार्भि र्वाग्भिर्येष्ठं पाण्डवं यादवाय्यः॥'}
